hebrew_text: שְׁנַיִם אוֹחֲזִין בְּטַלִּית, זֶה אוֹמֵר: ״אֲנִי מְצָאתִיהָ״, וְזֶה אוֹמֵר: ״אֲנִי מְצָאתִיהָ״. זֶה אוֹמֵר: ״כּוּלָּהּ שֶׁלִּי״, וְזֶה אוֹמֵר: ״כּוּלָּהּ שֶׁלִּי״. זֶה יִשָּׁבַע שֶׁאֵין לוֹ בָּהּ פָּחוֹת מֵחֶצְיָהּ, וְזֶה יִשָּׁבַע שֶׁאֵין לוֹ בָּהּ פָּחוֹת מֵחֶצְיָהּ – וְיַחְלוֹקוּ.
human_translation: two holding a garment, this says: I found it, and that says: I found it; this says: All of it is mine, and that says: All of it is mine; This takes an oath that he does not have less than half of it, and that takes an oath that he does not have less than half of it, and they divide
llm_translation: Two people holding onto a garment, one says, "I found it," and the other says, "I found it." One says, "It is all mine," and the other says, "It is all mine." One swears that there is not less than half of it in his possession, and the other swears that there is not less than half of it in his possession - and they shall divide it.

hebrew_text: זֶה אוֹמֵר: ״כּוּלָּהּ שֶׁלִּי״, וְזֶה אוֹמֵר: ״חֶצְיָהּ שֶׁלִּי״, הָאוֹמֵר כּוּלָּהּ שֶׁלִּי – יִשָּׁבַע שֶׁאֵין לוֹ בָּהּ פָּחוֹת מִשְּׁלֹשָׁה חֲלָקִים, וְהָאוֹמֵר חֶצְיָהּ שֶׁלִּי – יִשָּׁבַע שֶׁאֵין לוֹ בָּהּ פָּחוֹת מֵרְבִיעַ. זֶה נוֹטֵל שְׁלֹשָׁה חֲלָקִים, וְזֶה נוֹטֵל רְבִיעַ.
human_translation: this says: All of it is mine, and that says: Half of it is mine, the one who says: All of it is mine, takes an oath that he does not have less than three parts, of it, and the one who says: Half of it is mine, takes an oath that he does not have less than one-quarter of it. This takes three parts, and that takes one-quarter.
llm_translation: This one says: "It is all mine," and this one says: "Half of it is mine." One who says, "It is all mine" - he must swear that he does not have less than three parts of it, and one who says, "Half of it is mine" - he must swear that he does not have less than a quarter of it. This one takes three parts, and this one takes a quarter.

hebrew_text: הָיוּ שְׁנַיִם רוֹכְבִין עַל גַּבֵּי בְּהֵמָה, אוֹ שֶׁהָיָה אֶחָד רוֹכֵב וְאֶחָד מַנְהִיג, זֶה אוֹמֵר: כּוּלָּהּ שֶׁלִּי, וְזֶה אוֹמֵר: כּוּלָּהּ שֶׁלִּי – זֶה יִשָּׁבַע שֶׁאֵין לוֹ בָּהּ פָּחוֹת מֵחֶצְיָהּ, וְזֶה יִשָּׁבַע שֶׁאֵין לוֹ בָּהּ פָּחוֹת מֵחֶצְיָהּ, וְיַחְלוֹקוּ.
human_translation: two were sitting on an animal, or one was sitting and one was leading this says: All of it is mine, and that says: All of it is mine, This takes an oath that he does not have less than half of it, and that takes an oath that he does not have less than half of it, and they divide
llm_translation: Two were riding on the back of an animal, or if one was riding and one was leading, this one says: "It is all mine," and this one says: "It is all mine" - this one must swear that he does not have less than half of it, and this one must swear that he does not have less than half of it, and they shall divide it.

hebrew_text: בִּזְמַן שֶׁהֵם מוֹדִים אוֹ שֶׁיֵּשׁ לָהֶן עֵדִים – חוֹלְקִין בְּלֹא שְׁבוּעָה.
human_translation: When they admit or when they have witnesses they divide without an oath,
llm_translation: At the time when they admit or when they have witnesses - they divide without an oath.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ לְמָה לִי לְמִתְנָא זֶה אוֹמֵר אֲנִי מְצָאתִיהָ וְזֶה אוֹמֵר אֲנִי מְצָאתִיהָ, זֶה אוֹמֵר כּוּלָּהּ שֶׁלִּי וְזֶה אוֹמֵר כּוּלָּהּ שֶׁלִּי? לִיתְנֵי חֲדָא! חֲדָא קָתָנֵי: זֶה אוֹמֵר אֲנִי מְצָאתִיהָ וְכוּלָּהּ שֶׁלִּי, וְזֶה אוֹמֵר אֲנִי מְצָאתִיהָ וְכוּלָּהּ שֶׁלִּי.
human_translation: Why do I to teach This says: I found it, and that says: I found it; This says: All of it is mine, and that says: All of it is mine? Let teach one it teaches one This says: I found it and all of it is mine, and that says: I found it and all of it is mine.
llm_translation: Gemara: Why do I need this Mishnah? One says, "I found it," and the other says, "I found it." One says, "It is all mine," and the other says, "It is all mine?" Let one of them concede! One concedes: One says, "I found it, and it is all mine," and the other says, "I found it, and it is all mine."

hebrew_text: וְלִיתְנֵי ״אֲנִי מְצָאתִיהָ״, וַאֲנָא יָדַעְנָא דְּכוּלָּהּ שֶׁלִּי! אִי תְּנָא ״אֲנִי מְצָאתִיהָ״, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: מַאי ״מְצָאתִיהָ״ – רְאִיתִיהָ. אַף עַל גַּב דְּלָא אֲתַאי לִידֵיהּ – בִּרְאִיָּה בְּעָלְמָא קָנֵי, תְּנָא: ״כּוּלָּהּ שֶׁלִּי״ – דְּבִרְאִיָּה לָא קָנֵי.
human_translation: But let teach I found it, and I would know that All of it is mine. If would teach I found it, I would say what found it? saw it. even though it did not reach his possession, he acquired through mere sight. teaches All of it is mine, that does not acquire through sight
llm_translation: And it should have taught "I found it," and I know that it is all mine! If it had taught "I found it," I would have said: What is "I found it" - I saw it. Even though it did not come into her possession - seeing in the world is acquiring. It was taught: "It is all mine" - verbal declaration does not acquire.

hebrew_text: וּמִי מָצֵית אָמְרַתְּ מַאי ״מְצָאתִיהָ״ – רְאִיתִיהָ, וְהָא אָמַר רַבְנַאי ״וּמְצָאתָהּ״ – דַּאֲתַאי לִידֵיהּ מַשְׁמַע.
human_translation: But how can you say what found it, saw it? But didn’t Rabbenai say “and you have found it” indicates that it came into his possession?
llm_translation: "And who found you say what 'I have found her' - you saw her, and this is what Rabnai said 'and you found her' - that it came to his hands meaning."

hebrew_text: אִין ״וּמְצָאתָהּ״ דִּקְרָא – דַּאֲתָא לִידֵיהּ מַשְׁמַע, וּמִיהוּ תַּנָּא לִישָּׁנָא דְעָלְמָא נָקֵט, וּמִדְּחָזֵי לֵיהּ אָמַר: אֲנָא אַשְׁכַּחִית, וְאַף עַל גַּב דְּלָא אֲתַאי לִידֵיהּ בִּרְאִיָּה בְּעָלְמָא קָנֵי, תָּנֵי: ״כּוּלָּהּ שֶׁלִּי״ – דְּבִרְאִיָּה בְּעָלְמָא לָא קָנֵי לַהּ.
human_translation: Indeed, “and you have found it” in the verse indicates that it came into his possession. But tanna employed colloquial language once sees he says: I found it, even if it did not come into his possession, he acquired through mere sight. teaches All of it is mine, that does not acquire through sight
llm_translation: The term "and you shall find it" in the verse - it implies that it comes to his hand, but if he taught it to someone else in the world, and he sees it, he says: I have found it, and even though it did not come to his hand in actual possession in the world, he teaches: "It is all mine" - in actual possession in the world, it does not acquire it for him.

hebrew_text: וְלִיתְנֵי ״כּוּלָּהּ שֶׁלִּי״ וְלָא בָּעֵי ״אֲנִי מְצָאתִיהָ״! אִי תָּנֵי ״כּוּלָּהּ שֶׁלִּי״ הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: בְּעָלְמָא דְּקָתָנֵי ״מְצָאתִיהָ״ בִּרְאִיָּה בְּעָלְמָא קָנֵי, תְּנָא ״אֲנִי מְצָאתִיהָ״ וַהֲדַר תְּנָא ״כּוּלָּהּ שֶׁלִּי״ דְּמִמִּשְׁנָה יַתִּירָה אַשְׁמְעִינַן דִּרְאִיָּה לָא קָנֵי.
human_translation: But let him teach All of it is mine, and not need I found it. If taught All of it is mine, I would say in general, when teaches found it, acquires through mere sight. taught found it, and then taught All of it is mine, as the superfluous mishna he teaches us that one does not acquire sight
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "And let him teach 'It is all mine' and not 'I have found it'! If he teaches 'It is all mine,' I would say: In the world where 'I have found it' is taught, acquisition is through sight; if a Tanna teaches 'I have found it,' and then another Tanna teaches 'It is all mine,' since it is an additional teaching from the Mishnah, we would hear that acquisition is not through sight."

hebrew_text: וּמִי מָצֵית אָמְרַתְּ חֲדָא קָתָנֵי? וְהָא ״זֶה״ וְ״זֶה״ קָתָנֵי: ״זֶה אוֹמֵר אֲנִי מְצָאתִיהָ וְזֶה אוֹמֵר אֲנִי מְצָאתִיהָ, זֶה אוֹמֵר כּוּלָּהּ שֶׁלִּי״ וְכוּ׳.
human_translation: But how can you say is teaching one But doesn’t teach: This and This This says: I found it, and that says: I found it; This says: All of it is mine,
llm_translation: And who found saying one Mishnah? And this "this" and "this" Mishnah: "This one says I found it, and this one says I found it, this one says it is all mine" and so on.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא, וְאִיתֵּימָא רַב שִׁימִי בַּר אָשֵׁי, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ כְּדִי: רֵישָׁא בִּמְצִיאָה, וְסֵיפָא בְּמִקָּח וּמִמְכָּר.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said, and some say Rav Shimi bar Ashi, and some say an unattributed [ kedi ] The first clause, to a found item, And the latter clause, to buying and selling,
llm_translation: Rav Papa said, and some say it was Rav Shimei bar Ashi, and they said to him as follows: the beginning is in finding, and the end is in buying and selling.

hebrew_text: וּצְרִיכָא:
human_translation: And necessary
llm_translation: And the question is:

hebrew_text: דְּאִי תְּנָא מְצִיאָה הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: מְצִיאָה הוּא דִּרְמוֹ רַבָּנַן שְׁבוּעָה עֲלֵיהּ מִשּׁוּם דְּמוֹרֵי וְאָמַר, חַבְרַאי לָאו מִידֵּי חָסַר בָּהּ, אֵיזִל אֶתְפִּיס וְאִתְפְּלֵיג בַּהֲדֵיהּ! אֲבָל מִקָּח וּמִמְכָּר, דְּלֵיכָּא לְמֵימַר הָכִי – אֵימָא לָא.
human_translation: As had taught a found item I would say it is a found item that the Sages imposed an oath upon him, as one can rationalize and say: The other is not losing anything it, I will go seize and divide with him. But buying and selling, where that cannot be said, say not
llm_translation: If a Tanna had stated: "Metsi'ah is the opinion of the Rabbis," I would say: "Metsi'ah is the opinion of the Rabbis because they swear concerning it due to the fact that they are experts and say, 'My colleague did not lose it by his own fault, let him go and seize it and divide it with him!' But as for buying and selling, since one cannot say this, I would say: No.

hebrew_text: וְאִי תְּנָא מִקָּח וּמִמְכָּר, הוּא דִּרְמוֹ רַבָּנַן שְׁבוּעָה עֲלֵיהּ מִשּׁוּם דְּמוֹרֵי וְאָמַר: חַבְרַאי דְּמֵי קָא יָהֵיב וַאֲנָא דְּמֵי קָא יָהֵיבְנָא, הַשְׁתָּא דִּצְרִיכָא לְדִידִי אֶשְׁקְלֵיהּ אֲנָא, וְחַבְרַאי לֵיזִיל לִטְרַח לִיזְבַּן, אֲבָל מְצִיאָה, דְּלֵיכָּא לְמֵימַר הָכִי – אֵימָא לָא. צְרִיכָא.
human_translation: And had taught buying and selling it is that the Sages imposed an oath upon him, because he could rationalize saying The other gave money and I gave money now that I need for myself, I will take it and let the other one go to the trouble to buy But a found item, where that cannot be said, say not necessary.
llm_translation: If one teaches laws of buying and selling, it is the opinion of the Rabbis that an oath is imposed upon him because he is considered a teacher. And he says: "My colleague gave me money, and I gave him money." Now that I need to weigh it for myself, and my colleague goes to the trouble to buy it, but if it is found that there is no need to say so - I will say no. It is necessary.

hebrew_text: מִקָּח וּמִמְכָּר, וְלִחְזֵי זוּזֵי מִמַּאן נָקֵט? לָא צְרִיכָא דְּנָקֵט מִתַּרְוַיְיהוּ, מֵחַד מִדַּעְתֵּיהּ וּמֵחַד בְּעַל כָּרְחֵיהּ, וְלָא יָדַעְנָא מִי הוּא מִדַּעְתֵּיהּ, וּמִי הוּא בְּעַל כָּרְחֵיהּ.
human_translation: buying and selling? But let us see from whom took the money. No, necessary where he took from both of them. willingly from one and against his will from one and I do not know who is willingly, and who is against his will.
llm_translation: Purchase and sale, and to see whose coins are rejected? It is not necessary that they are rejected from both, from one due to his knowledge and from one due to his free will, and we do not know who is rejected due to his knowledge, and who is rejected due to his free will.

hebrew_text: לֵימָא מַתְנִיתִין דְּלָא כְּבֶן נַנָּס, דְּאִי בֶּן נַנָּס, הָאָמַר:
human_translation: Let us say that the mishna is not in accordance with ben Nannas, as, if ben Nannas, doesn’t he say
llm_translation: Let us say the Mishnah that is not like Ben Nanas, for if it were like Ben Nanas, he would say:

hebrew_text: כֵּיצַד אֵלּוּ וָאֵלּוּ בָּאִין לִידֵי שְׁבוּעַת שָׁוְא?
human_translation: How these and those come to an oath in vain?
llm_translation: How are these and these liable to incur a false oath?

hebrew_text: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא בֶּן נַנָּס, הָתָם וַדַּאי אִיכָּא שְׁבוּעַת שָׁוְא. הָכָא אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר דְּלֵיכָּא שְׁבוּעַת שָׁוְא, אֵימוֹר דְּתַרְוַיְיהוּ בַּהֲדֵי הֲדָדֵי אַגְבְּהוּהָ.
human_translation: even you to say ben Nannas. There, an oath is certainly vain, Here, there is to say that there is no oath vain. Say that they both lifted together,
llm_translation: Even if you say it is Ben Nanos, there certainly is a false oath there. Here, where there is no false oath, say that both of them should be elevated together.

hebrew_text: לֵימָא מַתְנִיתִין דְּלָא כְּסוֹמְכוֹס, דְּאִי כְּסוֹמְכוֹס, הָאָמַר: מָמוֹן הַמּוּטָּל בְּסָפֵק – חוֹלְקִין בְּלֹא שְׁבוּעָה.
human_translation: Let us say that the mishna is not in accordance with Sumakhos, as, if in accordance with Sumakhos, doesn’t he say property of uncertain ownership, divide without an oath.
llm_translation: Let us say the Mishnah that is not like Kosmokos, for if it were like Kosmokos, he said: Money that is in doubt - they divide without an oath.

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא מַאי, רַבָּנַן? הָא אָמְרִי הַמּוֹצִיא מֵחֲבֵרוֹ עָלָיו הָרְאָיָה!
human_translation: Rather, what the Rabbis, Don’t they say the burden of proof rests upon the claimant?
llm_translation: And rather what, sages? This one said: "One who brings forth from his fellow, the burden of proof is upon him!"

hebrew_text: הַאי מַאי, אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא רַבָּנַן: הָתָם דְּלָא תָּפְסִי תַּרְוַיְיהוּ אֲמַרוּ רַבָּנַן הַמּוֹצִיא מֵחֲבֵירוֹ עָלָיו הָרְאָיָה, הָכָא דְּתַרְוַיְיהוּ תָּפְסִי [פָּלְגִי] לַהּ בִּשְׁבוּעָה.
human_translation: What is this Granted, if you say the Rabbis, There, where both are not grasping the Rabbis say the burden of proof rests upon the claimant Here, where both are grasping they divide it with an oath.
llm_translation: This, what? If you say, "In truth, the Rabbis: There, where they did not grasp their argument, the Rabbis said, 'One who extracts from his fellow, the burden of proof is upon him.' Here, where they grasped their argument, they divided it with an oath."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ סוֹמְכוֹס, הַשְׁתָּא וּמָה הָתָם דְּלָא תָּפְסִי תַּרְוַיְיהוּ – חוֹלְקִין בְּלֹא שְׁבוּעָה, הָכָא דְּתַרְוַיְיהוּ תָּפְסִי לַהּ – לֹא כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן!
human_translation: But if you say Sumakhos, Now, if there, where they are not both grasping they divide without an oath, here, where they are both grasping not all the more so
llm_translation: Rather, if you say "Sukkos," now, but what is the difference there that they do not agree - they disagree without an oath, here, where they agree - not to mention!

hebrew_text: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא סוֹמְכוֹס: כִּי אָמַר סוֹמְכוֹס שֶׁמָּא וְשֶׁמָּא, אֲבָל בָּרִי וּבָרִי – לָא אָמַר.
human_translation: You even say Sumakhos. When Sumakhos states an uncertain and an uncertain But a certain and a certain does not say
llm_translation: Even if you say "Somchos," for Somchos said "perhaps" and "perhaps," but with certainty - he did not say.

hebrew_text: וּלְרַבָּה בַּר רַב הוּנָא, דְּאָמַר: אָמַר סוֹמְכוֹס אֲפִילּוּ בָּרִי וּבָרִי, מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר?
human_translation: And according to Rabba bar Rav Huna, who said Sumakhos says even a certain and a certain what is there to say
llm_translation: And for Rabbah bar Rav Huna, as he said: Somchos said, even if it is a bar and a bar, what is there to say?

hebrew_text: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא סוֹמְכוֹס, כִּי אָמַר סוֹמְכוֹס – הֵיכָא דְּאִיכָּא דְּרָרָא דְמָמוֹנָא, אֲבָל הֵיכָא דְּלֵיכָּא דְּרָרָא דְמָמוֹנָא – לָא.
human_translation: You may even say Sumakhos. When Sumakhos says where have a financial association But where do not have a financial association
llm_translation: Even if you say "Somakhos," because it was said "Somakhos" - where there is a free person of means, but where there is not a free person of means - no.

hebrew_text: וְלָאו קַל וָחוֹמֶר הוּא? וּמָה הָתָם דְּאִיכָּא דְּרָרָא דְמָמוֹנָא לְמָר, וְאִיכָּא דְּרָרָא דְמָמוֹנָא לְמָר,
human_translation: But is it not an a fortiori If there, where Master has a financial association and Master has a financial association
llm_translation: And is it not a fortiori reasoning? But what is the case there? Where there is a free gift of money to the master, and where there is a free gift of money to the master,

hebrew_text: וְאִיכָּא לְמֵימַר כּוּלָּהּ לְמָר, וְאִיכָּא לְמֵימַר כּוּלָּהּ לְמָר, אָמַר סוֹמְכוֹס: מָמוֹן הַמּוּטָּל בְּסָפֵק חוֹלְקִין בְּלֹא שְׁבוּעָה, הָכָא, דְּלֵיכָּא דְּרָרָא דְמָמוֹנָא, דְּאִיכָּא לְמֵימַר דְּתַרְוַיְיהוּ הִיא, לֹא כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן!
human_translation: and there is to say it entirely to one and there is to say it entirely to one, Sumakhos says property of uncertain ownership they divide without an oath, here, where no financial association as there is to say that it both of them, all the more so not
llm_translation: And there is to say, the entirety to the master, and there is to say, the entirety to the master, Somchos said: Money that is in doubt, they divide without an oath. Here, where there is no clear ownership of the money, there is to say that both parties have a claim, all the more so!

hebrew_text: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא סוֹמְכוֹס, שְׁבוּעָה זוֹ מִדְּרַבָּנַן הִיא כִּדְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: שְׁבוּעָה זוֹ תַּקָּנַת חֲכָמִים הִיא, שֶׁלֹּא יְהֵא כׇּל אֶחָד וְאֶחָד הוֹלֵךְ וְתוֹקֵף בְּטַלִּיתוֹ שֶׁל חֲבֵירוֹ וְאוֹמֵר: שֶׁלִּי הוּא.
human_translation: You may even say Sumakhos: This oath is by rabbinic in accordance with of Rabbi Yoḥanan. As Rabbi Yoḥanan says: This oath, is an ordinance by the Sages so that everyone will not go and seize the garment of another and say: It is mine.
llm_translation: Even if you say "Somakhos," this oath is in accordance with the Rabbis, as Rabbi Yohanan said: This oath is the enactment of the Sages, that no one should go and seize his fellow's cloak and say, "It is mine."

hebrew_text: לֵימָא מַתְנִיתִין דְּלָא כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי, דְּאִי כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי – הָא אָמַר: אִם כֵּן מָה הִפְסִיד רַמַּאי? אֶלָּא הַכֹּל יְהֵא מוּנָּח עַד שֶׁיָּבֹא אֵלִיָּהוּ.
human_translation: Let us say that the mishna not in accordance with Rabbi Yosei. As, if in accordance with Rabbi Yosei, doesn’t he say If so, what did swindler lose? Rather, the entire will be placed until Elijah comes.
llm_translation: Let us say the Mishnah that is not like Rabbi Yosei, for if it were like Rabbi Yosei - he said: If so, what did Rama'i lose? Rather, everything should be left until Elijah comes.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מַאי רַבָּנַן – כֵּיוָן דְּאָמְרִי רַבָּנַן: ״הַשְּׁאָר יְהֵא מוּנָּח עַד שֶׁיָּבֹא אֵלִיָּהוּ״, הָא נָמֵי כִּשְׁאָר דָּמֵי, דִּסְפֵיקָא הִיא!
human_translation: Rather, what the Rabbis, Since the Rabbis say The remainder is placed until Elijah comes, this is also comparable to the remainder as it is uncertain
llm_translation: Rather, what is the opinion of the Rabbis? Since the Rabbis say: "The remainder shall be left until Elijah comes," it is similar to the remainder of blood, for it is a doubt!

hebrew_text: הַאי מַאי? אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא רַבָּנַן, הָתָם דְּוַדַּאי הַאי מָנֶה דְּחַד מִינַּיְיהוּ הוּא אָמְרִי רַבָּנַן: יְהֵא מוּנָּח עַד שֶׁיָּבֹא אֵלִיָּהוּ. הָכָא דְּאִיכָּא לְמֵימַר דְּתַרְוַיְיהוּ הוּא, אָמְרִי רַבָּנַן: פָּלְגִי בִּשְׁבוּעָה.
human_translation: What this Granted, if you say the Rabbis there, where these one hundred dinars certainly belong to one of them the Rabbis say it is placed until Elijah comes, here, where there is to say that it belongs to both of them, the Rabbis say they divide with an oath.
llm_translation: This what? If you say, "In truth, the Rabbis," there, for sure this type of count of one of them, the Rabbis say: "Let it be set aside until Elijah comes." Here, where it can be said that both of them are, the Rabbis say: "Split it in half a week."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הִיא, הַשְׁתָּא וּמָה הָתָם דִּבְוַדַּאי אִיכָּא מָנֶה לְמָר וְאִיכָּא מָנֶה לְמָר, אֲמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי יְהֵא מוּנָּח עַד שֶׁיָּבֹא אֵלִיָּהוּ, הָכָא דְּאִיכָּא לְמֵימַר דְּחַד מִינַּיְיהוּ הוּא – לֹא כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן!
human_translation: But if you say is Rabbi Yosei, Now if there, where it is certain that there are one hundred dinars to one and there are one hundred dinars to one, Rabbi Yosei says is placed until Elijah comes, here, where there is to say that it belongs to one of them, all the more so not
llm_translation: Rather, if you say it is the opinion of Rabbi Yosei, now, but there, where it is certain that there is a portion for the Master and there is a portion for the Master, Rabbi Yosei said, "Let it be set aside until Elijah comes." Here, where it can be said that one of them is - not to mention all the more so!

hebrew_text: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא רַבִּי יוֹסֵי, הָתָם – וַדַּאי אִיכָּא רַמַּאי, הָכָא מִי יֵימַר דְּאִיכָּא רַמַּאי? אֵימָא תַּרְוַיְיהוּ בַּהֲדֵי הֲדָדֵי אַגְבְּהוּהָ.
human_translation: You may even say Rabbi Yosei: There, there is certainly a swindler here, who is to say that there is a swindler? Say both of them lifted at the same time,
llm_translation: Even if you say it was Rabbi Yosei, there - and certainly there are Romaim, here who will say there are Romaim? Say both of them together in the presence of each other, I will elevate them.

hebrew_text: אִי נָמֵי: הָתָם קָנֵיס לֵיהּ רַבִּי יוֹסֵי לְרַמַּאי כִּי הֵיכִי דְּלוֹדֵי, הָכָא מַאי פְּסֵידָא אִית לֵיהּ דְּלוֹדֵי.
human_translation: Alternatively, There, Rabbi Yosei penalizes swindler so that he will admit Here, what loss incur that admit
llm_translation: אִי נָמֵי: הָתָם קָנֵיס לֵיהּ רַבִּי יוֹסֵי לְרַמַּאי כִּי הֵיכִי דְּלוֹדֵי, הָכָא מַאי פְּסֵידָא אִית לֵיהּ דְּלוֹדֵי. If you wish: There, Rabbi Yosei acquired it for a Ramai, how did he acquire it? Here, what loss is there that he should acquire it?

hebrew_text: תִּינַח מְצִיאָה, מִקָּח וּמִמְכָּר מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר? אֶלָּא מְחַוַּורְתָּא כִּדְשַׁנִּין מֵעִיקָּרָא.
human_translation: works out well a found item buying and selling, what is there to say? Rather, is clearly as we explained initially.
llm_translation: "If one finds an object, what is the law regarding its acquisition and sale? Rather, it is a matter of common sense, as we say from the outset."

hebrew_text: בֵּין לְרַבָּנַן וּבֵין לְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי, הָתָם גַּבֵּי חֶנְוָנִי עַל פִּנְקָסוֹ דְּקָתָנֵי: זֶה נִשְׁבָּע וְנוֹטֵל, וְזֶה נִשְׁבָּע וְנוֹטֵל.
human_translation: Both according to the Rabbis and according to Rabbi Yosei, there, with regard to a storekeeper on his ledger, As teaches this takes an oath and receives and that takes an oath and takes
llm_translation: Between the sages and Rabbi Yosei, there, regarding the case of Chenvani on his ledger, it was taught: This one swears and collects, and this one swears and collects.

hebrew_text: מַאי שְׁנָא דְּלָא אָמְרִינַן נַפְּקֵיהּ לְמָמוֹנָא מִבַּעַל הַבַּיִת, וִיהֵא מוּנָּח עַד שֶׁיָּבֹא אֵלִיָּהוּ, דְּהָא בְּוַדַּאי אִיכָּא רַמַּאי!
human_translation: What is different that we do not say: Appropriate the money from the employer, and it is placed until Elijah comes? because there is certainly a swindler
llm_translation: What is the difference that we do not say it is taken out for money from the homeowner, and it should be left until Elijah comes, for there are certainly deceitful people!

hebrew_text: אָמְרִי הָתָם, הַיְינוּ טַעְמָא דְּאָמַר לֵיהּ חֶנְוָנִי לְבַעַל הַבַּיִת: אֲנָא שְׁלִיחוּתָא דִידָךְ קָא עָבְדִינָא, מַאי אִית לִי גַּבֵּי שָׂכִיר, אַף עַל גַּב דְּקָא מִשְׁתְּבַע לִי, לָא מְהֵימַן לִי בִּשְׁבוּעָה, אַתְּ הֶאֱמַנְתֵּיהּ, דְּלָא אֲמַרְתְּ לִי בְּסָהֲדֵי הַב לֵיהּ.
human_translation: say There, this is the reason Because the storekeeper can say to the employer: I carried out your agency What do I have with the hired laborer? Even if he takes an oath to me not trustworthy to me by oath. You trusted him, as you did not say to me: Give him in witnesses.
llm_translation: They said there: This is the reason that Chanvani said to the homeowner: "I am acting as your agent, what do I have regarding a hired laborer, even though he is swearing to me, I do not trust him with an oath, you have believed him, for you did not say to me with the witnesses of the house."

hebrew_text: וְשָׂכִיר נָמֵי אָמַר לֵיהּ לְבַעַל הַבַּיִת: אֲנָא עֲבַדִי עֲבִידְתָּא גַּבָּךְ, מַאי אִית לִי גַּבֵּי חֶנְוָנִי, אַף עַל גַּב דְּמִשְׁתְּבַע לִי לָא מְהֵימָן לִי. הִלְכָּךְ, תַּרְוַיְיהוּ מִשְׁתַּבְעִי וְשָׁקְלִי מִבַּעַל הַבַּיִת.
human_translation: And hired laborer can also say to the employer: I worked for you. What do I have with the storekeeper? Even if he takes an oath to me not trustworthy to me Therefore, both take an oath and take from the employer.
llm_translation: The text in English: "And the hired laborer said to the homeowner: 'I have done your work, what do I have regarding the wages?' Even though he demanded payment from me, he did not trust me. Therefore, both of them should swear and the homeowner should pay him."

hebrew_text: תָּנֵי רַבִּי חִיָּיא: מָנֶה לִי בְּיָדְךָ, וְהַלָּה אוֹמֵר: אֵין לְךָ בְּיָדִי כְּלוּם, וְהָעֵדִים מְעִידִים אוֹתוֹ שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ חֲמִשִּׁים זוּז – נוֹתֵן לוֹ חֲמִשִּׁים זוּז, וְיִשָּׁבַע עַל הַשְּׁאָר.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya taught I one hundred dinars [ maneh ] in your possession and the other says: Nothing of yours in my possession, and the witnesses testify that he has fifty dinars he gives him fifty dinars and takes an oath about the remainder,
llm_translation: It was taught by Rabbi Chiya: "Give me what is in your hand," and the defendant says, "You have nothing in my hand." And the witnesses testify that he has fifty zuz - he gives him fifty zuz, and he swears on the rest.

hebrew_text: שֶׁלֹּא תְּהֵא הוֹדָאַת פִּיו גְּדוֹלָה מֵהַעֲדָאַת עֵדִים, מִקַּל וָחוֹמֶר.
human_translation: via an a fortiori As the admission of one’s mouth should not greater than the testimony of witnesses.
llm_translation: Let not the admission of his mouth be greater than the testimony of witnesses, from a fortiori argument.

hebrew_text: וְתַנָּא תּוּנָא: שְׁנַיִם אוֹחֲזִין בְּטַלִּית זֶה אוֹמֵר אֲנִי מְצָאתִיהָ וְכוּ׳. וְהָא הָכָא כֵּיוָן דְּתָפֵיס, אֲנַן סָהֲדִי דְּמַאי דְּתָפֵיס הַאי דִּידֵיהּ הוּא, וּמַאי דְּתָפֵיס הַאי דִּידֵיהּ הוּא, וְקָתָנֵי: יִשָּׁבַע!
human_translation: And tanna taught two holding a garment, this says: I found it, And here, since is holding it is clear to us that what this one’s grasp is his, and what that one’s grasp is his. And teaches takes an oath.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And it was taught in a Baraita: Two people are holding onto a cloak. This one says, "I found it," and so forth. But here, since he is holding onto it, we testify that what he is holding onto is his. And what he is holding onto is his, and it teaches: "He shall swear!"

hebrew_text: מַאי ״שֶׁלֹּא תְּהֵא הוֹדָאַת פִּיו גְּדוֹלָה מֵהַעֲדָאַת עֵדִים מִקַּל וָחוֹמֶר״? שֶׁלֹּא תֹּאמַר הוֹדָאַת פִּיו הוּא דְּרַמְיָא רַחֲמָנָא שְׁבוּעָה עֲלֵיהּ כִּדְרַבָּה.
human_translation: what a fortiori As the admission of one’s mouth should not greater than the testimony of witnesses? that you will not say it is the admission of one’s mouth that the Merciful One imposes an oath upon him, in accordance with of Rabba.
llm_translation: What is "that his confession should not be greater than the testimony of witnesses from a fortiori argument"? Do not say that his confession is like a divine oath, as Rabba explained.

hebrew_text: דְּאָמַר רַבָּה: מִפְּנֵי מָה אָמְרָה תּוֹרָה מוֹדֶה מִקְצָת הַטַּעֲנָה יִשָּׁבַע? חֲזָקָה אֵין אָדָם מֵעִיז פָּנָיו בִּפְנֵי בַּעַל חוֹבוֹ, וְהַאי בְּכוּלֵּיהּ בָּעֵי דְּנִכְפְּרֵיהּ, וְהָא דְּלָא כַּפְרֵיהּ – מִשּׁוּם דְּאֵין אָדָם מֵעִיז פָּנָיו
human_translation: As Rabba says: For what did the Torah say admits to part of the claim must take an oath? a presumption a person does not exhibit insolence in the presence of his creditor, And this wants to deny all of and this that he does not deny it because a person does not exhibit insolence.
llm_translation: Rabah said: For what reason did the Torah say that one who partially admits to a claim must take an oath? Because it is a strong presumption that a person does not brazenly confront his creditor, and in this case, where he seeks to be atoned, and in the case where he does not seek atonement – it is because a person does not brazenly confront.

hebrew_text: וְהַאי בְּכוּלֵּיהּ בָּעֵי דְּלוֹדֵי לֵיהּ. וְהַאי דְּלָא אוֹדִי – אִשְׁתְּמוֹטֵי הוּא דְּקָא מִישְׁתְּמֵט מִינֵּיהּ, סָבַר: עַד דְּהָווּ לִי זוּזִי וּפָרַעְנָא לֵיהּ, וְאָמַר רַחֲמָנָא: רְמִי שְׁבוּעָה עֲלֵיהּ כִּי הֵיכִי דְּלוֹדֵי לֵיהּ בְּכוּלֵּיהּ,
human_translation: And this wants to admit to with regard to all of and this that he denies He was evading thought: until I have money, and I will pay And the Merciful One states: Impose an oath on him, in order that he will admit to him with regard to all of
llm_translation: This one in all requires that he should lodge with him. And this one who does not acknowledge - it is he who is being removed from his place, he thinks: until I have my wages and my reward, and the Merciful One said: impose an oath upon him so that he should lodge with him in all.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל הַעֲדָאַת עֵדִים, דְּלֵיכָּא לְמֵימַר הָכִי – אֵימָא לָא. קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן קַל וָחוֹמֶר.
human_translation: But the testimony of witnesses as one cannot say this say no teaches us an a fortiori
llm_translation: Witness testimony, for there is no need to say so - I might say no. It is teaching us a fortiori argument.

hebrew_text: וּמַאי קַל וָחוֹמֶר? וּמָה פִּיו שֶׁאֵין מְחַיְּיבוֹ מָמוֹן – מְחַיְּיבוֹ שְׁבוּעָה, עֵדִים שֶׁמְּחַיְּיבִין אוֹתוֹ מָמוֹן – אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁמְּחַיְּיבִין אוֹתוֹ שְׁבוּעָה?
human_translation: And what a fortiori If his mouth, which does not render him liable money obligates him an oath, witnesses, which does render him liable money, is it not logical that it should obligate him an oath
llm_translation: And what is the inference from minor to major? Just as his mouth, which does not obligate him to pay money - obligates him to an oath, witnesses who obligate him to pay money - do not obligate him to take an oath?

hebrew_text: וּפִיו אֵין מְחַיְּיבוֹ מָמוֹן?! וְהָא הוֹדָאַת בַּעַל דִּין כְּמֵאָה עֵדִים דָּמֵי!
human_translation: But does his mouth not render him liable money? But isn’t the admission of a litigant similar to one hundred witnesses?
llm_translation: "And his mouth does not obligate him to pay money?! But the admission of a litigant is equivalent to a hundred witnesses!"

hebrew_text: מַאי ״מָמוֹן״ – קְנָס. וּמָה פִּיו שֶׁאֵין מְחַיְּיבוֹ קְנָס, מְחַיְּיבוֹ שְׁבוּעָה! עֵדִים שֶׁמְּחַיְּיבִין אוֹתוֹ קְנָס, אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁמְּחַיְּיבִין אוֹתוֹ שְׁבוּעָה!
human_translation: What money a fine [ kenas ]. If mouth, which does not render him liable a fine, renders him liable an oath witnesses, which does render him liable a fine, is it not logical that it should render him liable an oath
llm_translation: What is "money" - a fine. And what his mouth does not obligate him to a fine, obligates him to an oath! Witnesses who obligate him to a fine, do not obligate him to an oath!

hebrew_text: מָה לְפִיו – שֶׁכֵּן מְחַיְּיבוֹ קׇרְבָּן, תֹּאמַר בְּעֵדִים שֶׁאֵין מְחַיְּיבִין אוֹתוֹ קׇרְבָּן!
human_translation: What about mouth? in that it renders him liable an offering. Would you say with regard to witnesses, which, does not obligate him an offering
llm_translation: "What is his mouth" - that is how he obligates him to bring a sacrifice, you would say in the case of witnesses who do not obligate him to bring that sacrifice!

hebrew_text: הָא לָא קַשְׁיָא: רַבִּי חִיָּיא כְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר סְבִירָא לֵיהּ, דְּאָמַר: עֵדִים מְחַיְּיבִין אוֹתוֹ קׇרְבָּן מִקַּל וָחוֹמֶר.
human_translation: This not difficult. Rabbi Ḥiyya holds in accordance with the opinion of Rabbi Meir, who says witnesses renders him liable an offering, an a fortiori
llm_translation: Here is the English word-for-word translation of the Talmudic text: "The matter is not difficult: Rabbi Chiya is like Rabbi Meir, he holds, for he said: Witnesses obligate him in that offering from a fortiori argument."

hebrew_text: דִּתְנַן: אָמְרוּ לוֹ שְׁנַיִם ״אָכַלְתָּ חֵלֶב״, וְהוּא אוֹמֵר ״לֹא אָכַלְתִּי״, רַבִּי מֵאִיר מְחַיֵּיב, וַחֲכָמִים פּוֹטְרִים.
human_translation: As we learned two say to You ate fat, and he says: I did not eat Rabbi Meir deems liable and the Rabbis deem exempt
llm_translation: We learned in a Mishnah: If two witnesses say to him, "You ate forbidden fat," and he says, "I did not eat," Rabbi Meir obligates him, but the Sages exempt him.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי מֵאִיר: אִם הֱבִיאוּהוּ שְׁנַיִם לִידֵי מִיתָה חֲמוּרָה, לֹא יְבִיאוּהוּ לִידֵי קׇרְבָּן הַקַּל? אָמְרוּ לוֹ: מָה אִם יִרְצֶה לוֹמַר ״מֵזִיד הָיִיתִי״ – יִפָּטֵר.
human_translation: Rabbi Meir said If two cause to death a severe can they not cause to the light an offering? said to him: What if he want to say: I intentionally? exempt?
llm_translation: Rabbi Meir said: If they brought him the accused by two witnesses to a severe death penalty, should they not bring him to be liable by two witnesses for a lighter offering? They said to him: What if he wishes to say, "I acted intentionally"? He shall be exempt.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: מָה לְפִיו – שֶׁכֵּן מְחַיְּיבוֹ אָשָׁם! אָשָׁם הַיְינוּ קׇרְבָּן.
human_translation: Rather, what about mouth? in that it renders liable a guilt-offering. A guilt-offering is offering,
llm_translation: Rather: What according to him - that so he obligates him a guilt-offering! Guilt-offering that is a sacrifice.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: מָה לְפִיו – שֶׁכֵּן מְחַיְּיבוֹ חוֹמֶשׁ. הָא לָא קַשְׁיָא, רַבִּי חִיָּיא כְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר סְבִירָא לֵיהּ, כִּי הֵיכִי דִּמְחַיֵּיב לֵיהּ קׇרְבָּן מִקַּל וָחוֹמֶר – מְחַיֵּיב לֵיהּ חוֹמֶשׁ מִקַּל וָחוֹמֶר.
human_translation: Rather, what about mouth? in that it renders liable one-fifth This not difficult; Rabbi Ḥiyya holds in accordance with the opinion of Rabbi Meir. Just as renders liable an offering due to an a fortiori renders liable one-fifth, via an a fortiori
llm_translation: Rather: what according to him - that so he obligates him a fifth. The question is not difficult, Rabbi Chiya holds like Rabbi Meir is of the opinion, that in the way that he obligates him a sacrifice from a lenient and stringent case - he obligates him a fifth from a lenient and stringent case.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: מָה לְפִיו – שֶׁכֵּן אֵינוֹ בְּהַכְחָשָׁה וּבַהֲזָמָה, תֹּאמַר בְּעֵדִים שֶׁיֶּשְׁנָן בְּהַכְחָשָׁה וּבַהֲזָמָה.
human_translation: Rather, what about mouth? in that it is not to contradiction or to conspiring Would you say with regard to witnesses, who are to contradiction and to conspiring
llm_translation: Rather: what according to him - that so he is not in falsehood and in conspiracy, you will say with witnesses that they are in falsehood and in conspiracy.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָתְיָא מֵעֵד אֶחָד: וּמָה עֵד אֶחָד שֶׁאֵין מְחַיְּיבוֹ מָמוֹן, מְחַיְּיבוֹ שְׁבוּעָה – עֵדִים שֶׁמְּחַיְּיבִין אוֹתוֹ מָמוֹן, אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁמְּחַיְּיבִין אוֹתוֹ שְׁבוּעָה!
human_translation: Rather, derived from one witness. If one witness, which does not render liable money, obligates him an oath is it not logical that witnesses, which render liable money, obligates him an oath?
llm_translation: Rather, it comes from one witness: And what is the testimony of one witness that does not obligate him to pay money, but obligates him to take an oath? Witnesses who obligate him to pay money, it is not the case that they obligate him to take an oath!

hebrew_text: מָה לְעֵד אֶחָד שֶׁכֵּן עַל מָה שֶׁהוּא מֵעִיד הוּא נִשְׁבָּע,
human_translation: What about one witness? in that takes an oath with regard to the matter concerning which he testifies,
llm_translation: What for one witness that so too on what he testifies he swears.

hebrew_text: תֹּאמַר בְּעֵדִים, שֶׁעַל מַה שֶּׁכָּפַר הוּא נִשְׁבָּע.
human_translation: Would you say with regard to witnesses, which takes an oath with regard to that he denies,
llm_translation: You shall say with witnesses, for what he atoned he shall swear.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: אָתֵי מִגִּלְגּוּל שְׁבוּעָה דְּעֵד אֶחָד.
human_translation: Rather, Rav Pappa said: is derived from the extension of an oath of one witness
llm_translation: Rather, Rav Papa said: Comes from the cycle of seven years of witness one.

hebrew_text: מָה לְגִלְגּוּל שְׁבוּעָה דְּעֵד אֶחָד, שֶׁכֵּן שְׁבוּעָה גּוֹרֶרֶת שְׁבוּעָה, תֹּאמַר בְּעֵדִים – דְּמָמוֹן קָא מְחַיְּיבִי!
human_translation: What about the extension of an oath of one witness? in that oath leads to oath. Would you say in witnesses, whose renders liable money?
llm_translation: What is the case of a revolving oath of one witness, for so does an oath draw another oath, you will say with witnesses - it is money that they are obligating!

hebrew_text: פִּיו יוֹכִיחַ. מָה לְפִיו שֶׁכֵּן אֵינוֹ בְּהַכְחָשָׁה – עֵד אֶחָד יוֹכִיחַ שֶׁיֶּשְׁנוֹ בְּהַכְחָשָׁה וּמְחַיְּיבוֹ שְׁבוּעָה.
human_translation: mouth can prove What about mouth, in that it is not to contradiction; one witness can prove that is to contradiction renders liable an oath.
llm_translation: His mouth will argue. What is meant by "his mouth"? It is not through denial - one witness can argue that he is denying and obligate him to take an oath.

hebrew_text: מָה לְעֵד אֶחָד, שֶׁכֵּן עַל מַה שֶּׁמֵּעִיד הוּא נִשְׁבָּע, תֹּאמַר בְּעֵדִים – שֶׁעַל מַה שֶּׁכָּפַר הוּא נִשְׁבָּע! פִּיו יוֹכִיחַ.
human_translation: what about one witness? in that takes an oath with regard to he testifies. Would you say with regard to witnesses, which takes an oath with regard to that he denies? mouth can prove
llm_translation: What is the case of one witness, that he swears on what he testifies, you will say with witnesses - that on what he atones he swears! His mouth will prove it.

hebrew_text: וְחָזַר הַדִּין: לֹא רְאִי זֶה כִּרְאִי זֶה, וְלֹא רְאִי זֶה כִּרְאִי זֶה. הַצַּד הַשָּׁוֶה שֶׁבָּהֶן שֶׁעַל יְדֵי טַעֲנָה וּכְפִירָה הֵן בָּאִין, וְנִשְׁבָּע. אַף אֲנִי אָבִיא עֵדִים, שֶׁעַל יְדֵי טַעֲנָה וּכְפִירָה הֵם בָּאִין – וְנִשְׁבָּע.
human_translation: And the derivation has reverted The aspect of this is not like the aspect of that and the aspect of that is not like the aspect of this Their common denominator is that come with a claim and denial, and take an oath. I will also include witnesses which comes with a claim and denial. And take an oath.
llm_translation: The judgment returned: not seen this like seen this, and not seen this like seen this. The equal side in them that through claim and denial they come, and swear. Even I will bring witnesses, that through claim and denial they come - and swear.

hebrew_text: מָה לְהַצַּד הַשָּׁוֶה שֶׁבָּהֶן, שֶׁכֵּן לֹא הוּחְזַק כַּפְרָן. תֹּאמַר בְּעֵדִים שֶׁכֵּן הוּחְזַק כַּפְרָן.
human_translation: What about their common denominator, in that does not assume the presumptive status of one who denies Would you say with regard to witnesses where assumes the presumptive status of one who denies
llm_translation: What is the case of the equal parties, that they are not established as partners. You may say with regard to witnesses, that they are established as partners.

hebrew_text: וּבְעֵדִים מִי הוּחְזַק כַּפְרָן! וְהָאָמַר רַב אִידִי בַּר אָבִין אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: הַכּוֹפֵר בְּמִלְוֶה – כָּשֵׁר לְעֵדוּת. בְּפִיקָּדוֹן – פָּסוּל לְעֵדוּת.
human_translation: But in witnesses, does he assume the presumptive status of one who denies But doesn’t Rav Idi bar Avin say Rav Ḥisda says: One who denies a loan is fit to bear witness a deposit disqualified from bearing witness
llm_translation: "And with witnesses, who is considered like a guarantor! And Rav Idi bar Avin said in the name of Rav Hisda: One who acts as a guarantor in a loan - valid for testimony. In a deposit - invalid for testimony."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא פָּרֵיךְ הָכִי: מָה לְהַצַּד הַשָּׁוֶה שֶׁבָּהֶן – שֶׁכֵּן אֵינָן בְּתוֹרַת הֲזָמָה, תֹּאמַר בְּעֵדִים שֶׁיֶּשְׁנָן בְּתוֹרַת הֲזָמָה!
human_translation: Rather, refute like this: What about their common denominator, in that are not to the halakhot of conspiring Would you say with regard to witnesses, who are subject to the halakhot of conspiring
llm_translation: Rather, the question is thus: What about the side that is equal in both – that they are not in the law of conspiracy? You will say with regard to witnesses that are in the law of conspiracy!

hebrew_text: הָא לָא קַשְׁיָא: רַבִּי חִיָּיא תּוֹרַת הֲזָמָה לָא פָּרֵיךְ.
human_translation: This not difficult, Rabbi Ḥiyya does not refute the halakhot of conspiring
llm_translation: Here is the English translation of the Talmudic text: The matter is not difficult: Rabbi Chiya did not expound the law of disqualification.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא דְּקָאָמַר וְתַנָּא תּוּנָא מִי דָּמֵי? הָתָם לְמַלְוֶה אִית לֵיהּ סָהֲדֵי, לְלֹוֶה לֵית לֵיהּ סָהֲדֵי דְּלָא מַסֵּיק לֵיהּ וְלָא מִידֵּי, דְּאִי הֲווֹ לֵיהּ סָהֲדֵי לְלֹוֶה דְּלָא מַסֵּיק לֵיהּ וְלָא מִידֵּי – לָא בָּעֵי רַבִּי חִיָּיא לְאִשְׁתְּבוֹעֵי, הָכָא כִּי הֵיכִי דַּאֲנַן סָהֲדֵי בְּהַאי – אֲנַן סָהֲדֵי בְּהַאי, וַאֲפִילּוּ הָכִי מִשְׁתַּבְעִי!
human_translation: But which stated And the tanna taught Is comparable There, the creditor has witnesses the debtor does not have witnesses that he does not owe anything. As, if the debtor had witnesses that he does not owe anything, Rabbi Ḥiyya would not require him to take an oath. here, just as it is clear to us that this is it clear to us that that Yet nevertheless, take an oath.
llm_translation: Rather, what he is saying is: And a Tanna, who is similar? There, for the lender, there are witnesses; for the borrower, there are no witnesses who can testify for him, and not from his own mouth. For if there were witnesses for the borrower who cannot testify for him and not from his own mouth, Rabbi Chiya does not require the borrower to swear. Here, how so that we are witnesses in this matter - we are witnesses in this matter, and even so, he must swear!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא כִּי אִיתְּמַר ״וְתַנָּא תּוּנָא״ – אַאִידַּךְ דְּרַבִּי חִיָּיא אִיתְּמַר, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא: ״מָנֶה לִי בְּיָדְךָ״ וְהַלָּה אוֹמֵר: ״אֵין לְךָ בְּיָדִי אֶלָּא חֲמִישִּׁים זוּז, וְהֵילָךְ״ – חַיָּיב.
human_translation: Rather, when was stated: And the tanna taught it was stated with regard to another of Rabbi Ḥiyya. As Rabbi Ḥiyya says: I one hundred dinars in your possession, and the other says You have only fifty dinars in my possession, and here you are, is obligated
llm_translation: Rather, when it was stated, "and a Tanna taught," - the other one, Rabbi Chiya, was stated, who said Rabbi Chiya: "Appoint for me in your hand," and the other one says: "You have in my hand only fifty zuz, and go" - he is liable.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא – ״הֵילָךְ״ נָמֵי כְּמוֹדֶה מִקְצָת הַטְּעָנָה דָּמֵי.
human_translation: What is the reason? Here you are, is also like one who admits to part of the claim.
llm_translation: What is the reason - "heilach" is considered similar to admitting part of the claim.

hebrew_text: וְתַנָּא תּוּנָא: שְׁנַיִם אוֹחֲזִין בְּטַלִּית.
human_translation: And the tanna taught two holding a garment.
llm_translation: And it was taught in a Baraita: Two people may hold onto a garment.

hebrew_text: וְהָא הָכָא, כֵּיוָן דְּתָפֵיס – אֲנַן סָהֲדֵי דְּמַאי דְּתָפֵיס הֵילָךְ הוּא, וְקָתָנֵי: יִשָּׁבַע.
human_translation: And here, since grasps it is clear to us that what one grasps is Here you are, And teaches he takes an oath.
llm_translation: And here, since he grasps - we testify that what he grasps is his. And it is taught: he shall swear.

hebrew_text: וְרַב שֵׁשֶׁת אָמַר ״הֵילָךְ פָּטוּר״. מַאי טַעְמָא? כֵּיוָן דְּאָמַר לֵיהּ ״הֵילָךְ״, הָנֵי זוּזִי דְּקָא מוֹדֵי בְּגַוַּיְיהוּ – כְּמַאן דְּנָקֵיט לְהוּ מַלְוֶה דָּמֵי. בְּאִינָךְ חֲמִשִּׁים הָא לָא מוֹדֵי, הִלְכָּךְ לֵיכָּא הוֹדָאַת מִקְצָת הַטְּעָנָה.
human_translation: And Rav Sheshet says: Here you are, exempt What is the reason? Since he said to him: Here you are, those dinars that he admitted are as if the creditor has them with regard to the other fifty did not admit Therefore, there is no admission to part of the claim.
llm_translation: Rav Sheshet said, "He who walks is exempt." What is the reason? Since he said to him, "walk," those coins that they admit to their guilt - like one who takes a loan of money. If it is not fifty, they do not admit, therefore there is no partial admission of the claim.

hebrew_text: וּלְרַב שֵׁשֶׁת קַשְׁיָא מַתְנִיתִין! אָמַר לְךָ רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: מַתְנִיתִין תַּקָּנַת חֲכָמִים הִיא.
human_translation: But according to Rav Sheshet, the mishna is difficult, Rav Sheshet said to you: the mishna is a rabbinic ordinance,
llm_translation: And for Rav Sheshet, difficult Mishnayot! Rav Sheshet said to you: Mishnayot are an enactment of the sages.

hebrew_text: וְאִידַּךְ? אִין תַּקָּנַת חֲכָמִים הִיא. וּמִיהוּ, אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא מִדְּאוֹרָיְיתָא ״הֵילָךְ״ חַיָּיב – מְתַקְּנִי רַבָּנַן שְׁבוּעָה כְּעֵין דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא, אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ מִדְּאוֹרָיְיתָא ״הֵילָךְ״ פָּטוּר – מְתַקְּנִי רַבָּנַן שְׁבוּעָה דְּלֵיתָא דִּכְווֹתַהּ בִּדְאוֹרָיְיתָא?
human_translation: And the other Indeed, it is a rabbinic ordinance. However, granted, if you say by Torah law Here you are, obligated the Sages instituted oath similar to by Torah But if you say by Torah Here you are, exempt would the Sages institute an oath that has no corresponding in Torah law?
llm_translation: And the other? It is not the enactment of the sages. But, if you say regarding a monetary matter from the Torah "he shall go" - the Rabbis enact a rabbinic oath similar to a Torah oath. However, if you say from the Torah "he shall not go" - the Rabbis enact a rabbinic oath that is not like a Torah oath.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי:
human_translation: raises an objection
llm_translation: Challenger:

hebrew_text: סְלָעִים, דִּינָרִין. מַלְוֶה אוֹמֵר חָמֵשׁ, וְלֹוֶה אוֹמֵר שָׁלֹשׁ. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: הוֹאִיל וְהוֹדָה מִקְצָת הַטְּעָנָה – יִשָּׁבַע. רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא כְּמֵשִׁיב אֲבֵידָה, וּפָטוּר.
human_translation: sela’im , dinars, creditor says: five and the debtor says: three, Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: Since admitted to part of the claim, he takes an oath. Rabbi Akiva says: he is merely the equivalent of one returning a lost item, and exempt
llm_translation: Rocks, dinars. The lender says five, and the borrower says three. Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: Since he partially admitted to the claim - he must take an oath. Rabbi Akiva says: It is only like returning a lost object, and he is exempt.

hebrew_text: קָתָנֵי מִיהַת: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר, הוֹאִיל וְהוֹדָה מִקְצָת הַטְּעָנָה – יִשָּׁבַע. טַעְמָא דְּאָמַר שָׁלֹשׁ, הָא שְׁתַּיִם פָּטוּר, וְהַאי שְׁטָר דְּקָמוֹדֵי בֵּיהּ הֵילָךְ הוּא, וּשְׁמַע מִינַּהּ הֵילָךְ פָּטוּר!
human_translation: In any event, teaches Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: Since admitted to part of the claim, he takes an oath. the reason because he said three but two, exempt And this note, to which he admits, is Here you are. And conclude from it Here you are, exempt
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says, since he partially admitted to the claim, he must take an oath. The reason he said three claims is that if he admits to two, he is exempt, and this document that stands before him is a proof, and if he heard part of it, he is exempt!

hebrew_text: לָא, לְעוֹלָם אֵימָא לָךְ שְׁתַּיִם חַיָּיב, וְהַאי דְּקָתָנֵי שָׁלֹשׁ, לְאַפּוֹקֵי מִדְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, דְּאָמַר: מֵשִׁיב אֲבֵידָה הָוֵי וּפָטוּר, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן דְּמוֹדֶה מִקְצָת הַטְּעָנָה הָוֵי, וְחַיָּיב.
human_translation: No, actually I will say to you two obligated and that teaches three to exclude of Rabbi Akiva, who says he is the equivalent of one returning a lost item, and is exempt. teaches us that he is considered one who admits to part of the claim, and is obligated
llm_translation: Not, forever I will say to you two obligated, and this that it teaches three, to oppose from Rabbi Akiva, that he said: One who returns a lost object, is and exempt, it implies to us that one who admits to part of the claim is obligated.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: הוֹאִיל וְהוֹדָה מִקְצָת הַטְּעָנָה יִשָּׁבַע, ״אַף זֶה יִשָּׁבַע״ מִבְּעֵי לֵיהּ!
human_translation: If so, Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: Since admitted to part of the claim, he takes an oath, should have Even this takes an oath,
llm_translation: So it is: Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: Since he admitted to part of the claim, he must take an oath, "He shall also take an oath" - he requires it!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: לְעוֹלָם שְׁתַּיִם פָּטוּר, וְהֵילָךְ חַיָּיב. וְשָׁאנֵי הָכָא, דְּקָא מְסַיַּיע לֵיהּ שְׁטָרָא.
human_translation: Rather, Actually, two exempt but Here you are, obligated And here, is different, as the note supports him,
llm_translation: Rather: always two exempt, and the other one liable. And the difference here, for it is assisting him a document.

hebrew_text: אִי נָמֵי: מִשּׁוּם דְּהָוֵה לֵיהּ שְׁטָר שִׁעְבּוּד קַרְקָעוֹת, וְאֵין נִשְׁבָּעִין עַל כְּפִירַת שִׁעְבּוּד קַרְקָעוֹת.
human_translation: Alternatively, Because note a lien on land, and one does not take an oath with regard to denial of a lien on land.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Iy nama: mi'shum dehavah lei shtar shibud karka'ot, ve'ein nishbain al kefirat shibud karka'ot." English translation: "If so: because he has a document of land ownership, and they do not swear on the denial of land ownership."

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּמוֹתֵיב מִסֵּיפָא, רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא כְּמֵשִׁיב אֲבֵידָה וּפָטוּר. טַעְמָא דְּאָמַר שָׁלֹשׁ, הָא שְׁתַּיִם חַיָּיב. וְהָא שְׁטָר, כֵּיוָן דְּקָא מוֹדֵי בֵּיהּ כְּ״הֵילָךְ״ דָּמֵי, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ ״הֵילָךְ״ חַיָּיב!
human_translation: There are who raise an objection from the latter clause Rabbi Akiva says: He is merely the equivalent of one returning a lost item and exempt The reason that he said three But two, obligated And this note, to which he admits, is Here you are. Learn from it Here you are, obligated
llm_translation: There is one who sits and asks from the latter part, Rabbi Akiva says: It is only like one who returns a lost object and is exempt. The reason he said three, if two he is liable. And the document, since they admit to it as "he walked," infer from it "he walked" he is liable!

hebrew_text: לָא, לְעוֹלָם אֵימָא לָךְ שְׁתַּיִם נָמֵי פָּטוּר, וְהַאי דְּקָתָנֵי שָׁלֹשׁ, לְאַפּוֹקֵי מִדְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר, דְּאָמַר מוֹדֶה מִקְצָת הַטַּעֲנָה הָוֵי – וְחַיָּיב, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן דְּמֵשִׁיב אֲבֵידָה הָוֵי – וּפָטוּר.
human_translation: No, actually I will say to you two also exempt and that teaches three is to exclude of Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar, who says he is one who admits to part of the claim and is obligated teaches us that is one returning a lost item, and is exempt
llm_translation: Not, forever say to you two, are exempt, and this that it teaches three, to oppose Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar, who said: One who admits to part of the claim is liable. It is implied to us that if one returns a lost item, he is exempt.

hebrew_text: הָכִי נָמֵי מִסְתַּבְּרָא. דְּאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ: שְׁתַּיִם חַיָּיב, בְּשָׁלֹשׁ הֵיכִי פָּטַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, הַאי אִעָרוֹמֵי קָא מַעֲרִים! סָבַר: אִי אָמֵינָא שְׁתַּיִם בָּעֵינָא אִשְׁתְּבוֹעֵי, אֵימָא שָׁלֹשׁ דְּאֶהְוֵי כְּמֵשִׁיב אֲבֵידָה, וְאִיפָּטֵר. אֶלָּא שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: שְׁתַּיִם נָמֵי פָּטוּר.
human_translation: So too, it is reasonable as, if it enters your mind two obligated how does Rabbi Akiva deem him exempt in three this is employing artifice, thinking: If I say two, I will be required to take an oath. I will say three so that I will be equivalent to one returning a lost item and will be exempt Rather, learn from two also exempt
llm_translation: So it was established. For if you say: he is liable for two, how did Rabbi Akiva exempt him with three? This naked person is causing a commotion! He thought: if I say two, I would need to bring a sin offering, perhaps three would be like one who returns a lost item, and he would be exempt. Rather, learn from it: with two, indeed he is exempt.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא קַשְׁיָא לְרַבִּי חִיָּיא! שָׁאנֵי הָתָם דְּקָא מְסַיַּיע לֵיהּ שְׁטָרָא. אִי נָמֵי מִשּׁוּם דְּהָוֵה לֵיהּ שְׁטָר שִׁעְבּוּד קַרְקָעוֹת, וְאֵין נִשְׁבָּעִין עַל כְּפִירַת שִׁעְבּוּד קַרְקָעוֹת.
human_translation: But a difficulty to Rabbi Ḥiyya, there is different, as the note supports him. Alternatively, because note a lien on land, and one does not take an oath with regard to denial of a lien on land.
llm_translation: Rather, a difficulty for Rabbi Chiya! It is different there because he is assisting him with a document. Alternatively, it is because he has a document of real estate transactions, and one does not swear on the denial of real estate transactions.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב מַר זוּטְרָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב נַחְמָן: טְעָנוֹ כֵּלִים וְקַרְקָעוֹת, הוֹדָה בַּכֵּלִים וְכָפַר בַּקַּרְקָעוֹת, הוֹדָה בַּקַּרְקָעוֹת וְכָפַר בַּכֵּלִים – פָּטוּר. הוֹדָה מִקְצָת קַרְקָעוֹת – פָּטוּר, מִקְצָת כֵּלִים – חַיָּיב.
human_translation: Mar Zutra, son of Rav Naḥman, raises an objection claimed vessels and land, admitted to vessels but denied land, he admitted to land but denied vessels, exempt he admitted part of the land, exempt. some of the vessels, obligated
llm_translation: The Master Zutra, son of Rav Nachman, raised an objection: If one admits to utensils and to earthenware vessels, he is liable for the utensils and atones for the earthenware vessels; if he admits to the earthenware vessels and atones for the utensils - he is exempt. If he admits to some of the earthenware vessels - he is exempt, if he admits to some of the utensils - he is liable.

hebrew_text: טַעְמָא דְּכֵלִים וְקַרְקָעוֹת, דְּקַרְקַע לָאו בַּת שְׁבוּעָה הִיא, הָא כֵּלִים וְכֵלִים דּוּמְיָא דְּכֵלִים וְקַרְקָעוֹת חַיָּיב. הֵיכִי דָּמֵי? לָאו דְּאָמַר לֵיהּ הֵילָךְ, וּשְׁמַע מִינַּהּ הֵילָךְ חַיָּיב!
human_translation: The reason because vessels and land, as land is not subject to an oath. But vessels and vessels, similar to vessels and land, obligated What are the circumstances not where he said to him: Here you are? And learn from Here you are, obligated
llm_translation: The reason for earthenware vessels and floors, since a floor is not a "daughter of a week," but vessels, and similar vessels to vessels and floors are obligated. How so? Not that he said to him "go," and he heard from it "go" is obligated!

hebrew_text: לָא, לְעוֹלָם אֵימָא לָךְ כֵּלִים וְכֵלִים נָמֵי פָּטוּר, וְהָא דְּקָתָנֵי כֵּלִים וְקַרְקָעוֹת, הָא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן: הוֹדָה בְּמִקְצָת כֵּלִים – חַיָּיב אַף עַל הַקַּרְקָעוֹת.
human_translation: No, actually I will say to you vessels and vessels also exempt. And that teaches vessels and land teaches us this he admitted some of the vessels, also obligated with regard to the land
llm_translation: Not, forever I will say to you, vessels and vessels similar exempt, and this that it was taught vessels and floors, this teaches to us: admission in some vessels - liable even on the floors.

hebrew_text: מַאי קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן – זוֹקְקִין? תְּנֵינָא: זוֹקְקִין הַנְּכָסִים שֶׁאֵין לָהֶן אַחְרָיוּת אֶת הַנְּכָסִים שֶׁיֵּשׁ לָהֶן אַחְרָיוּת לִישָּׁבַע עֲלֵיהֶם.
human_translation: What teaching us? binding? we learned the property that does not serve as a guarantee, binds the property that serves as a guarantee, to take an oath with regard to it
llm_translation: What is implied to us? Are we talking about creditors? We learned: Creditors who have no collateral on the assets they have collateral on, may swear regarding them.

hebrew_text: הָכָא עִיקָּר, הָתָם אַגַּב גְּרָרָא נַסְבַהּ.
human_translation: here, main there, cites it incidentally,
llm_translation: Here the main point is there, there because of the drag it was carried.

hebrew_text: וּלְמַאן דְּאָמַר הֵילָךְ פָּטוּר, אַמַּאי אִיצְטְרִיךְ קְרָא לְמַעוֹטֵי קַרְקַע מִשְּׁבוּעָה? הָא כׇּל קַרְקַע הֵילָךְ הוּא.
human_translation: But according to the one who says that Here you are, exempt why was necessary verse to exclude land from an oath But all land Here you are,
llm_translation: And for the one who says walking is exempt, why does he need a verse to exclude land from an oath? Isn't all land considered walking?

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָךְ: אִיצְטְרִיךְ קְרָא הֵיכָא דְּחָפַר בָּהּ בּוֹרוֹת שִׁיחִין וּמְעָרוֹת.
human_translation: said to you: The verse was necessary where dug pits, ditches, and caves in
llm_translation: He said to you: "You need a verse where he dug pits, ditches, and caves."

hebrew_text: אִי נָמֵי, הֵיכָא דִּטְעָנוֹ כֵּלִים וְקַרְקָעוֹת, וְהוֹדָה בַּכֵּלִים וְכָפַר בַּקַּרְקָעוֹת.
human_translation: Alternatively, where claimed vessels and land, and admitted to the vessels and denied the land.
llm_translation: If so, where he loaded vessels and unloaded earth, and admitted regarding the vessels and atoned regarding the earth.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע, דְּתָנֵי רָמֵי בַּר חָמָא: אַרְבָּעָה שׁוֹמְרִין צְרִיכִין כְּפִירָה בְּמִקְצָת וְהוֹדָאָה בְּמִקְצָת. שׁוֹמֵר חִנָּם, וְהַשּׁוֹאֵל, נוֹשֵׂא שָׂכָר, וְהַשּׂוֹכֵר.
human_translation: Come hear as Rami bar Ḥama teaches four bailees require denial of part and admission of part an unpaid bailee, and a borrower, a paid bailee, and a renter,
llm_translation: Come and hear, as it was taught by Ramei bar Hama: Four guardians require covering partially and acknowledgment partially. A gratuitous guardian, a borrower, a paid watchman, and a renter.

hebrew_text: הֵיכִי דָּמֵי? לָאו דַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ: הֵילָךְ!
human_translation: What are the circumstances Is it not said to Here you are,
llm_translation: "How are the laws of bloodshed? Not that he said to him: Go!"

hebrew_text: לָא, דַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ: שָׁלֹשׁ פָּרוֹת מָסַרְתִּי לָךְ וּמֵתוּ כּוּלְּהוּ בִּפְשִׁיעָה. וְאָמַר לֵיהּ אִיהוּ: חֲדָא – לָא הָיוּ דְבָרִים מֵעוֹלָם, וַחֲדָא – מֵתָה בְּאוֹנֶס, וַחֲדָא – מֵתָה בִּפְשִׁיעָה דִּבְעֵינָא שַׁלּוֹמֵי לָךְ. דְּלָאו ״הֵילָךְ״ הוּא.
human_translation: No, where said to I gave you three cows and they all died due to negligence. And said to him: one matter never happened. And one died due to accident, And one died due to negligence, which I need to pay you. it is not Here you are,
llm_translation: Not that, for he said to him: "Three cows I entrusted to you, and all of them died through negligence." And he said to him: "One - they were never there at all, and one - she died by force, and one - she died through negligence, for I require peace from you." For it is not "helek."

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע, דְּתָנֵי אֲבוּהּ דְּרַבִּי אַפְטוֹרִיקִי לִדְרַבִּי חִיָּיא קַמַּיְיתָא: מָנֶה לִי בְּיָדְךָ, וְהַלָּה אוֹמֵר: אֵין לְךָ בְּיָדִי כְּלוּם, וְהָעֵדִים מְעִידִים אוֹתוֹ שֶׁיֵּשׁ בְּיָדוֹ חֲמִשִּׁים זוּז, יָכוֹל יִשָּׁבַע עַל הַשְּׁאָר –
human_translation: Come hear to the first of Rabbi Ḥiyya, as the father of Rabbi Aptoriki taught I one hundred dinars in your possession, and the other says: Nothing yours in my possession, and the witnesses testify that he has fifty dinars in his possession might he should take an oath about the remainder.
llm_translation: Come and hear, as it was taught in the school of Rabbi Avuh to Rabbi Ḥiyya Qammaita: "Give me in your hand," and the other says, "You have nothing in my hand," and the witnesses testify that he has fifty zuz in his hand, he can swear on the rest –

hebrew_text: תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״עַל כׇּל אֲבֵידָה אֲשֶׁר יֹאמַר כִּי הוּא זֶה״. עַל הוֹדָאַת פִּיו אַתָּה מְחַיְּיבוֹ, וְאִי אַתָּה מְחַיְּיבוֹ עַל הַעֲדָאַת עֵדִים!
human_translation: the verse states for any lost item about which one shall say: This is it, you obligate on the admission his mouth, but you do not obligate him on the testimony of witnesses.
llm_translation: The Talmud teaches: "Regarding any lost item that one claims, 'This is it.' On the admission of his mouth you obligate him, but if you do not obligate him based on the testimony of witnesses!"

hebrew_text: מַתְנִיתָא קָא רָמֵית עֲלֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי חִיָּיא?! רַבִּי חִיָּיא תַּנָּא הוּא וּפָלֵיג.
human_translation: Are you raising an objection to Rabbi Ḥiyya a baraita ? Rabbi Ḥiyya is a tanna , and dispute
llm_translation: Mishnah: You raised a contradiction against Rabbi Chiya?! Rabbi Chiya is a Tanna and he disputes.

hebrew_text: וְהָא קְרָא קָאָמַר! הָהוּא לְמוֹדֶה מִקְצָת הַטַּעֲנָה.
human_translation: But doesn’t cite a verse? that one who admits to part of the claim
llm_translation: And this is what the verse is saying! That one who admits to part of the claim.

hebrew_text: וַאֲבוּהּ דְּרַבִּי אַפְטוֹרִיקִי אָמַר לָךְ, כְּתִיב ״הוּא״ וּכְתִיב ״זֶה״, חַד לְמוֹדֶה מִקְצָת הַטַּעֲנָה, וְחַד לְהַעֲדָאַת עֵדִים דְּפָטוּר.
human_translation: And Rabbi Aptoriki’s father said to you “this” is written and “it” is written, one to one who admits to part of the claim and one to that testimony of witnesses, exempt
llm_translation: The father of Rabbi Aptoriki said to you, it is written "he" and it is written "this," one for admitting part of the claim, and one for the testimony of witnesses who are exempt.

hebrew_text: וְאִידָּךְ: חַד לְמוֹדֶה מִקְצָת הַטַּעֲנָה, וְחַד לְמוֹדֶה מִמִּין הַטַּעֲנָה.
human_translation: And the other one to one who admits to part of the claim and one to admits of type the claim.
llm_translation: And the other opinion is: one who admits to some of the claim, and one who admits to the type of claim.

hebrew_text: וְאִידַּךְ מוֹדֶה מִמִּין הַטַּעֲנָה לֵית לֵיהּ, וְסָבַר לֵיהּ כְּרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל, דִּתְנַן: טְעָנוֹ חִטִּין, וְהוֹדָה לוֹ בִּשְׂעוֹרִין, פָּטוּר. וְרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל מְחַיֵּיב.
human_translation: And the other does not accept admits of type as the claim, but he holds like Rabban Gamliel As we learned claimed him wheat, and admitted to him barley, exempt And Rabban Gamliel deems liable
llm_translation: And the other one admits regarding the type of claim, he does not have it, and he holds like Rabban Gamliel, as we learned: If one claimed wheat, and he admits to him barley, he is exempt. But Rabban Gamliel obligates.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא רָעֲיָא דְּהָווּ מָסְרִי לֵיהּ כׇּל יוֹמָא חֵיוָתָא בְּסָהֲדֵי. יוֹמָא חַד מְסַרוּ לֵיהּ בְּלָא סָהֲדֵי. לְסוֹף אָמַר לְהוּ: לֹא הָיוּ דְבָרִים מֵעוֹלָם. אֲתוֹ סָהֲדֵי אַסְהִידוּ בֵּיהּ דַּאֲכַל תַּרְתֵּי מִינַּיְיהוּ. אֲמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא: אִם אִיתָא לִדְרַבִּי חִיָּיא קַמַּיְיתָא, מִשְׁתְּבַע אַשְּׁאָרָא.
human_translation: a certain shepherd to whom would give animals every day in of witnesses. One day, they gave him without witnesses. At the end he said to matter never occurred; Witnesses came testified against him that he ate two of them. Rabbi Zeira said: If Rabbi Ḥiyya’s first is so, take an oath with regard to the remainder,
llm_translation: That shepherd who used to deliver to him every day a kid in secret. One day they delivered it to him without witnesses. In the end, he said to them: "These things never existed." Witnesses came and testified against him that he had eaten two of them. Rabbi Zeira said: "If Rabbi Chiya were to come before me, I would make him swear."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: אִם אִיתָא מִשְׁתְּבַע?! וְהָא גַּזְלָן הוּא! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: שֶׁכְּנֶגְדּוֹ קָאָמֵינָא.
human_translation: Abaye said to him: If is so, takes an oath? Isn’t he a robber? said to him: I was saying opposing him
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye: If he comes to make peace?! But he is a thief! He said to him: I am standing opposite him.

hebrew_text: הַשְׁתָּא נָמֵי דְּלֵיתָא לִדְרַבִּי חִיָּיא, נְחַיְּיבֵיהּ מִדְּרַב נַחְמָן.
human_translation: Now, too, that is not in accordance with of Rabbi Ḥiyya, should obligate due to of Rav Naḥman,
llm_translation: At that time when there is no one like Rabbi Chiya, we follow the ruling of Rav Nachman.

hebrew_text: דִּתְנַן: מָנֶה לִי בְּיָדְךָ, אֵין לְךָ בְּיָדִי – פָּטוּר. וְאָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: מַשְׁבִּיעִין אוֹתוֹ שְׁבוּעַת הֶיסֵּת.
human_translation: As we learned I one hundred dinars in your possession, Nothing of yours is in my possession, exempt And Rav Naḥman says: administer an oath of inducement to him.
llm_translation: We learned in a Mishnah: "If you entrust something to me, and it is not in my possession - I am exempt." And Rav Nachman said: "We make him swear the oath of denial."

hebrew_text: דְּרַב נַחְמָן תַּקַּנְתָּא הִיא,
human_translation: of Rav Naḥman is ordinance
llm_translation: Of Rav Nachman it is a remedy,

hebrew_text: וְתַקַּנְתָּא לְתַקַּנְתָּא לָא עָבְדִינַן.
human_translation: and we do not institute ordinance upon ordinance.
llm_translation: And a correction for a correction we do not require.

hebrew_text: וְתִיפּוֹק לֵיהּ דְּהָוֵה לֵיהּ רוֹעֶה! וְאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: סְתָם רוֹעֶה פָּסוּל.
human_translation: But let derive because he is a shepherd; and Rav Yehuda says an ordinary shepherd disqualified
llm_translation: And let him go out because he is a shepherd! And Rav Yehudah said: A regular shepherd is disqualified.

hebrew_text: לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא דִידֵיהּ, הָא דְּעָלְמָא. דְּאִי לָא תֵּימָא הָכִי, אֲנַן חֵיוָתָא לְרוֹעָה הֵיכִי מָסְרִינַן? וְהָא כְּתִיב: ״לִפְנֵי עִוֵּר לֹא תִתֵּן מִכְשֹׁל״! אֶלָּא חֲזָקָה: אֵין אָדָם חוֹטֵא וְלֹא לוֹ.
human_translation: not difficult. That his this belong to others. As if you do not say so, how do we give animals to a shepherd? Isn’t it written: “Do not put a stumbling block before the blind” Rather, there is a presumption a person sins only for his own
llm_translation: Not difficult: this of his, this of the world. For if you do not say so, how do we entrust a living creature to a shepherd? And it is written: "Do not put a stumbling block before the blind!" Rather, it is certain: a person does not sin, and it is not his fault.

hebrew_text: זֶה יִשָּׁבַע שֶׁאֵין לוֹ בָּהּ פָּחוֹת מֵחֶצְיָהּ [וְכוּ׳]. עַל דְּאִית לֵיהּ מִשְׁתְּבַע, אוֹ עַל דְּלֵית לֵיהּ מִשְׁתְּבַע! אָמַר רַב הוּנָא, דְּאָמַר: שְׁבוּעָה שֶׁיֵּשׁ לִי בָּהּ וְאֵין לִי בָּהּ פָּחוֹת מֵחֶצְיָהּ.
human_translation: This takes an oath that he does not have less than half of it, Does he take an oath with regard to that he has or does he take an oath with regard to that he does not have, Rav Huna said: which he says: an oath that I have it, and I do not have less than half of it.
llm_translation: This is the oath that has no less than half of it and so on. Whether he has sworn falsely or not! Rav Huna said, as it is said: "an oath that I have in it and there is not less than half of it."

hebrew_text: וְנֵימָא שְׁבוּעָה שֶׁכּוּלָּהּ שֶׁלִּי. וּמִי יָהֲבִינַן לֵיהּ כּוּלַּהּ?
human_translation: But let him say: an oath that all of it is mine, And would we give him all of it
llm_translation: And it was said: "A week whose entirety is mine." And who will give her entirety?

hebrew_text: וְנֵימָא שְׁבוּעָה שֶׁחֶצְיָהּ שֶׁלִּי – מַרַע לֵיהּ לְדִיבּוּרֵיהּ.
human_translation: But let him say: an oath that half of it is mine. he compromises his statement,
llm_translation: And it was said: "A week that is half mine - it is harmful to him with his words."

hebrew_text: הַשְׁתָּא נָמֵי מַרַע לֵיהּ לְדִיבּוּרֵיהּ. דְּאָמַר: כּוּלָּהּ שֶׁלִּי, וּלְדִבְרֵיכֶם – שְׁבוּעָה שֶׁיֵּשׁ לִי בָּהּ וְאֵין לִי בָּהּ פָּחוֹת מֵחֶצְיָהּ.
human_translation: Now too, he compromises his statement, as he makes statement All of it is mine; but according to your statement, an oath that I have it and I do not have less than half of it.
llm_translation: The Gemara asks: Is it possible that Mar, the Master, would be displeased with his own words? For he said: "It is all mine, and as for your words - it is an oath that I have in it, and I have no less than half of it."

hebrew_text: וְכִי מֵאַחַר שֶׁזֶּה תָּפוּס וְעוֹמֵד וְזֶה תָּפוּס וְעוֹמֵד, שְׁבוּעָה זוֹ לָמָּה? אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: שְׁבוּעָה זוֹ תַּקָּנַת חֲכָמִים הִיא, שֶׁלֹּא יְהֵא כׇּל אֶחָד וְאֶחָד הוֹלֵךְ וְתוֹקֵף בְּטַלִּיתוֹ שֶׁל חֲבֵירוֹ וְאוֹמֵר: ״שֶׁלִּי הוּא״.
human_translation: But since this one is standing in his grasp and that one is standing in his grasp, why this oath Rabbi Yoḥanan says: This oath is an ordinance by the Sages so that everyone will not go and seize the garment of another and say: It is mine.
llm_translation: And when this one grabs and stands, and this one grabs and stands, why is this an oath? Rabbi Yochanan said: This oath is an enactment of the sages, that each one should not go and seize his fellow's garment and say, "It is mine."

hebrew_text: וְנֵימָא מִיגּוֹ דַּחֲשִׁיד אַמָּמוֹנָא חֲשִׁיד נָמֵי אַשְּׁבוּעָתָא?
human_translation: But let us say since he is suspect with regard to financial he is also suspect with regard to an oath,
llm_translation: And it was said from where is it derived that one who conceals a matter, it is considered as if he swore falsely?

hebrew_text: לָא אָמְרִינַן מִיגּוֹ דַּחֲשִׁיד אַמָּמוֹנָא חֲשִׁיד אַשְּׁבוּעָתָא. דְּאִי לָא תֵּימָא הָכִי, הַאי דְּאָמַר רַחֲמָנָא מוֹדֶה מִקְצָת הַטַּעֲנָה יִשָּׁבַע, נֵימָא מִיגּוֹ דַּחֲשִׁיד אַמָּמוֹנָא חֲשִׁיד אַשְּׁבוּעָתָא.
human_translation: we do not say since is suspect with regard to financial he is suspect with regard to an oath. As if you do not say so, that which the Merciful One states, one who admits to part of the claim must take an oath, let us say since he is suspect with regard to financial he is suspect with regard to an oath.
llm_translation: We do not say that from the fact that one is suspected of monetary matters, he is suspected of oaths. For if you do not say so, this that the Merciful One says, "He shall confess that he has sinned in that thing" (Leviticus 5:5), let us say that from the fact that one is suspected of monetary matters, he is suspected of oaths.

hebrew_text: הָתָם אִשְׁתְּמוֹטֵי קָא מִשְׁתְּמִיט לֵיהּ, כִּדְרַבָּה.
human_translation: There, evading in accordance with of Rabba
llm_translation: There, Ishtamutei is leaning on him, as Rabah.

hebrew_text: תִּדַּע דְּאָמַר רַב אִידִי בַּר אָבִין אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: הַכּוֹפֵר בְּמִלְוֶה – כָּשֵׁר לְעֵדוּת. בְּפִיקָּדוֹן – פָּסוּל לְעֵדוּת.
human_translation: Know as Rav Idi bar Avin says Rav Ḥisda says: One who denies a loan is fit to bear witness a deposit disqualified from bearing witness
llm_translation: You should know that Rav Idi bar Avin said in the name of Rav Hisda: One who denies a loan - valid as a witness. In the case of a deposit - disqualified as a witness.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא הָא דְּתָנֵי רָמֵי בַּר חָמָא: אַרְבָּעָה שׁוֹמְרִין צְרִיכִין כְּפִירָה בְּמִקְצָת וְהוֹדָאָה בְּמִקְצָת – שׁוֹמֵר חִנָּם וְהַשּׁוֹאֵל, נוֹשֵׂא שָׂכָר וְהַשּׂוֹכֵר, נֵימָא מִיגּוֹ דַּחֲשִׁיד אַמָּמוֹנָא חֲשִׁיד אַשְּׁבוּעָתָא!
human_translation: But that that Rami bar Ḥama teaches: four bailees require denial of part and admission of part an unpaid bailee, and a borrower; a paid bailee, and a renter. let us say since he is suspect with regard to financial he is suspect with regard to an oath
llm_translation: Rather, this that Rav Hama taught: Four guardians require partial denial and partial admission - a gratuitous guardian and a borrower, a paid guardian and a renter, say in the case where suspicion of embezzlement is strong, suspect an oath!

hebrew_text: הָתָם נָמֵי אִשְׁתְּמוֹטֵי קָא מִשְׁתְּמִיט. סָבַר: מַשְׁכַּחְנָא לְגַנָּב וְתָפֵיסְנָא לֵיהּ. אִי נָמֵי מַשְׁכַּחְנָא לֵיהּ בַּאֲגַם וּמַיְיתֵינָא לֵיהּ.
human_translation: There too, evading thinking: I will find the thief and seize Alternatively, I will find in the marsh and I will bring it to him.
llm_translation: There, before Ishmaelites, he was hiding. He thought: "I will find a thief and catch him." If before Ishmaelites he finds him in a marsh, he will bring him to him.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, הַכּוֹפֵר בְּפִקָּדוֹן אַמַּאי פָּסוּל לְעֵדוּת? נֵימָא: אִשְׁתְּמוֹטֵי קָא מִשְׁתְּמִיט, סָבַר עַד דְּבָחֵשְׁנָא וּמְשַׁכַּחְנָא לֵיהּ!
human_translation: If so, why is one who denies a deposit disqualified from bearing witness? Let us say he is evading thinking: until I search and find
llm_translation: If so, one who denies a deposit, why is he disqualified for testimony? Say: He is removing himself, he thinks until he forgets it!

hebrew_text: כִּי אָמְרִינַן הַכּוֹפֵר בְּפִקָּדוֹן פָּסוּל לְעֵדוּת, כְּגוֹן דְּאָתוּ סָהֲדֵי וְאַסְהִידוּ בֵּיהּ דְּהָהִיא שַׁעְתָּא אִיתֵיהּ לְפִקָּדוֹן בְּבֵיתֵיהּ וַהֲוָה יָדַע, אִי נָמֵי דַּהֲוָה נָקֵיט לֵיהּ בִּידֵיהּ.
human_translation: When we say one who denies a deposit is disqualified from bearing witness, where witnesses came and testified against him that at that time, deposit was in his house and he knew Alternatively, where he was holding in his hand.
llm_translation: We say: One who denies a deposit is disqualified as a witness, for example, if witnesses came and testified that at such and such an hour he had the deposit in his house and he knew, or if it is clear that he took it into his hands.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא הָא דְּאָמַר רַב הוּנָא, מַשְׁבִּיעִין אוֹתוֹ שְׁבוּעָה שֶׁאֵינָהּ בִּרְשׁוּתוֹ, נֵימָא מִיגּוֹ דַּחֲשִׁיד אַמָּמוֹנָא חֲשִׁיד אַשְּׁבוּעָתָא!
human_translation: But that which Rav Huna says administer an oath to him that is not in his possession. Let us say since he is suspected of financial he is suspect with regard to an oath
llm_translation: Rather, this that Rav Huna said, we make him swear an oath that is not within his domain, let us say from the aspect of one who suspects, he suspects the oath!

hebrew_text: הָתָם נָמֵי, מוֹרֶה וְאָמַר: דְּמֵי קָא יָהֵבְנָא לֵיהּ.
human_translation: There too, he could rationalize saying I gave him money
llm_translation: There, Naḥmai, taught and said: "The price, he is giving to him."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אַחָא מִדִּיפְתִּי לְרָבִינָא: וְהָא קָא עָבַר עַל לָאו דְּ״לֹא תַּחְמֹד״?
human_translation: Rav Aḥa of Difti said to Ravina: But doesn’t violate the prohibition of: “You shall not covet
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Acha, from Difti, to Ravina: But didn't he transgress the prohibition of "you shall not covet"?

hebrew_text: ״לֹא תַּחְמֹד״ לְאִינָשֵׁי בְּלָא דְּמֵי מַשְׁמַע לְהוּ.
human_translation: “You shall not covet” is understood by people without money.
llm_translation: "Lo Tachmod" le'inishay bela d'mei mashma lehu.

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא הָא דְּאָמַר רַב נַחְמָן מַשְׁבִּיעִין אוֹתוֹ שְׁבוּעַת הֶיסֵּת, נֵימָא מִיגּוֹ דַּחֲשִׁיד אַמָּמוֹנָא חֲשִׁיד אַשְּׁבוּעָתָא.
human_translation: But that Rav Naḥman says, administer an oath of inducement to him, Let us say since he is suspect with regard to financial he is suspect with regard to an oath.
llm_translation: And rather this that said Rav Nachman we swear him week of drinking, say from that of suspect money suspect week.

hebrew_text: וְתוּ הָא דְתָנֵי רַבִּי חִיָּיא: שְׁנֵיהֶם נִשְׁבָּעִין וְנוֹטְלִין מִבַּעַל הַבַּיִת, נֵימָא מִיגּוֹ דַּחֲשִׁיד אַמָּמוֹנָא חֲשִׁיד אַשְּׁבוּעָתָא.
human_translation: And furthermore, that which Rabbi Ḥiyya teaches both take an oath and take from the employer, Let us say since he is suspect with regard to financial he is suspect with regard to an oath.
llm_translation: And come and see what Rabbi Chiya taught: Both of them swear and take from the homeowner, as it is said, "From the day that he suspected her, he made an oath" (Numbers 5:19), he made an oath.

hebrew_text: וְתוּ הָא דְּאָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת, שָׁלֹשׁ שָׁבוּעוֹת מַשְׁבִּיעִין אוֹתוֹ: שְׁבוּעָה שֶׁלֹּא פָּשַׁעְתִּי בָּהּ, שְׁבוּעָה שֶׁלֹּא שָׁלַחְתִּי בָּהּ יָד, שְׁבוּעָה שֶׁאֵינָהּ בִּרְשׁוּתִי. נֵימָא: מִיגּוֹ דַּחֲשִׁיד אַמָּמוֹנָא חֲשִׁיד אַשְּׁבוּעָתָא.
human_translation: And furthermore, that which Rav Sheshet says: administer three oaths to an oath that I was not negligent in it; an oath that I did not misappropriate an oath that it is no in my possession, let us say since he is suspected of financial he is suspected with regard to an oath.
llm_translation: And come and see what Rav Sheshet said, three weeks they adjure him: a week in which I did not sin in it, a week in which I did not send my hand in it, a week that is not in my domain. It was stated: from the moment that suspicion of embezzlement arises, suspicion of the week arises.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לָא אָמְרִינַן מִיגּוֹ דַּחֲשִׁיד אַמָּמוֹנָא חֲשִׁיד אַשְּׁבוּעָתָא.
human_translation: Rather, we do not say since one is suspected of financial he is suspected with regard to an oath.
llm_translation: Rather, we do not say that due to the suspicion of embezzlement, one should suspect an oath.

hebrew_text: אַבָּיֵי אָמַר: חָיְישִׁינַן שֶׁמָּא מִלְוֶה יְשָׁנָה יֵשׁ לוֹ עָלָיו.
human_translation: Abaye said: we suspect perhaps has an old loan to
llm_translation: Abaye said: We are concerned that perhaps one who lends to an old person has a claim against him.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי נִשְׁקוֹל בְּלָא שְׁבוּעָה!
human_translation: If so, Let him take without an oath,
llm_translation: If so, he is exempt without an oath!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא חָיְישִׁינַן שֶׁמָּא סְפֵק מִלְוֶה יְשָׁנָה יֵשׁ לוֹ עָלָיו.
human_translation: Rather, We suspect perhaps uncertain he has an old loan to
llm_translation: Rather, we are concerned that perhaps one who borrows from an old lender has a claim against him.

hebrew_text: וְלָאו אָמְרִינַן תָּפֵיס מָמוֹנָא מִסְּפֵיקָא? מִשְׁתְּבַע נָמֵי מִסָּפֵק!
human_translation: But don’t we say seizing property due to an uncertain he may also take an oath due to uncertainty?
llm_translation: And do we not say that one can seize money from a doubtful source? One can swear regarding a doubt!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אִידִי: פָּרְשִׁי אִינָשֵׁי מִסְּפֵק שְׁבוּעָה וְלָא פָּרְשִׁי מִסְּפֵק מָמוֹנָא. מַאי טַעְמָא? מָמוֹן אִיתֵיהּ בַּחֲזָרָה, שְׁבוּעָה לֵיתֵיהּ בַּחֲזָרָה.
human_translation: Rav Sheshet, son of Rav Idi, said: People refrain from an oath uncertain but do not refrain from property uncertain. What is the reason property can be returned, an oath cannot be retracted.
llm_translation: Rav Sheshet, son of Rav Idi, said: People separate for the sake of an oath but do not separate for the sake of money. What is the reason? Money can be returned, but an oath cannot be returned.

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי רַבִּי זֵירָא: תְּקָפָהּ אֶחָד בְּפָנֵינוּ, מַהוּ?
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira raises a dilemma: one seized it in our presence, what is
llm_translation: The question of Rabbi Zeira: "If one of its sides is in front of us, what is the ruling?"

hebrew_text: הֵיכִי דָמֵי? אִי דְּשָׁתֵיק, אוֹדוֹיֵי אוֹדִי לֵיהּ. וְאִי דְּקָא צָוַוח, מַאי הֲוָה לֵיהּ לְמֶעְבַּד?
human_translation: What are the circumstances? If remained silent, he admits to And if he shouted what should he have done?
llm_translation: "How are the laws of bloodshed? If one remains silent, it is as if he agrees. And if one cries out, what could he have done?"

hebrew_text: לָא צְרִיכָא דִּשְׁתֵיק מֵעִיקָּרָא וַהֲדַר צָוַוח, מַאי? מִדְּאִשְׁתִּיק – אוֹדוֹיֵי אוֹדִי לֵיהּ, אוֹ דִלְמָא: כֵּיוָן דְּקָא צָוַוח הַשְׁתָּא אִיגַּלַּאי מִילְּתָא דְּהַאי דִּשְׁתֵיק מֵעִיקָּרָא, סָבַר: הָא קָא חָזוּ לֵיהּ רַבָּנַן.
human_translation: No, necessary where he was silent initially, and later shouted. What since he was silent, he admitted to Or perhaps, since he is shouting now the matter is revealed that that he was silent initially he thought: The Rabbis saw him
llm_translation: Not necessary to be silent from the beginning and then shout, what? Since he is silent - he acknowledges to him, or perhaps: since he is shouting now, the matter of why he was silent from the beginning becomes revealed, he thought: the Rabbis have seen him.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן, תָּא שְׁמַע: בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים שֶׁשְּׁנֵיהֶם אֲדוּקִין בָּהּ, אֲבָל הָיְתָה טַלִּית יוֹצֵאת מִתַּחַת יָדוֹ שֶׁל אֶחָד מֵהֶן, הַמּוֹצִיא מֵחֲבֵירוֹ עָלָיו הָרְאָיָה. הֵיכִי דָמֵי? אִי נֵימָא כִּדְקָתָנֵי, פְּשִׁיטָא! אֶלָּא שֶׁתְּקָפָהּ אֶחָד בְּפָנֵינוּ.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman says: Come hear In what is this statement said where both of them are holding But garment was in the possession of one of them, the burden of proof rests upon the claimant, What are the circumstances If we say as it is taught, obvious Rather, where one of them seized it in our presence,
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said, come and hear: In what case are these words said that both of them are precise in it, but if a cloak was coming out from under the hand of one of them, the one who removes it from his fellow is liable to pay?
