How so? If it is said as it is taught, it is obvious! Rather, when one of them seized it before us.

hebrew_text: לָא, הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן – כְּגוֹן דְּאָתוּ לְקַמַּן כְּדִתְפִיסוּ לַהּ תַּרְוַיְיהוּ, וְאָמְרִינַן לְהוּ: זִילוּ פְּלוּגוּ, וּנְפַקוּ, וַהֲדַר אֲתוֹ כִּי תָּפֵיס לַהּ חַד מִינַּיְיהוּ, הַאי אֲמַר: אוֹדוֹיֵי אוֹדִי לִי. וְהַאי אֲמַר: בִּדְמֵי אֹגַרְתִּי נִיהֲלֵיהּ, דְּאָמְרִינַן לֵיהּ: עַד הַשְׁתָּא חָשְׁדַתְּ לֵיהּ בְּגַזְלָן, וְהַשְׁתָּא מוֹגְרַת לֵיהּ בְּלָא סָהֲדִי.
human_translation: No, here we are dealing with where they came before us, while both were holding and we said to them: Go divide and they left and afterward came while one of them was holding it. This said: admitted to me And that said: I rented to him for money as we say to him: Until now you suspected him of a robber, and now you rented to him without witnesses?
llm_translation: Not here, what are we dealing with? - For example, when they come before us as they are arguing with each other, and we say to them: Go separate, and come out, and then come back when one of them catches the other, this one says: "Witnesses, witnesses for me." And this one says: "With the value of my wages I acquired it," for we say to him: "Until now you suspected him of being a thief, and now you suspect him without witnesses."

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא, כִּדְקָתָנֵי: דְּאָתוּ לְקַמַּן כִּי תָּפֵיס לַהּ חַד מִינַּיְיהוּ, וְאִידַּךְ מְסָרֵךְ בָּהּ סָרוֹכֵי, וַאֲפִילּוּ לְסוֹמְכוֹס דְּאָמַר מָמוֹן הַמּוּטָּל בְּסָפֵק חוֹלְקִין בְּלֹא שְׁבוּעָה, מוֹדֶה סוֹמְכוֹס דְּסִרְכָא לָאו כְּלוּם הִיא.
human_translation: And if you wish, say as it is taught, they came before us while one of them was holding but the other was hanging on And even according to Sumakhos, who says property of uncertain ownership divide without an oath, Sumakhos concedes that hanging is nothing.
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: as it was taught: that they come later, when one of them seizes her, and the other one throws her down, and even according to the opinion of Somchus who says that money deposited in doubt is divided without an oath, Somchus admits that throwing down is not considered as nothing.

hebrew_text: אִם תִּמְצֵי לוֹמַר תְּקָפָהּ אֶחָד בְּפָנֵינוּ מוֹצִיאִין אוֹתָהּ מִיָּדוֹ, הִקְדִּישָׁה – אֵינָהּ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת. אִם תִּמְצֵי לוֹמַר תְּקָפָהּ אֶחָד בְּפָנֵינוּ אֵין מוֹצִיאִין אוֹתָהּ מִיָּדוֹ, הִקְדִּישָׁהּ בְּלֹא תְּקָפָהּ – מַהוּ?
human_translation: If you say one seizes in our presence removes it from his possession, consecrated consecration not if you say one seizes in our presence does not remove it from his possession, consecrated without seizing it, what is
llm_translation: If you want to say, "One of its walls is in front of us," we remove it from his possession, it is not sanctified. If you want to say, "One of its walls is in front of us," we do not remove it from his possession, it is sanctified without one of its walls - what is the ruling?

hebrew_text: כֵּיוָן דְּאָמַר מָר: אֲמִירָתוֹ לַגָּבוֹהַּ כִּמְסִירָתוֹ לַהֶדְיוֹט דָּמֵי. כְּמַאן דְּתַקְפַהּ דָּמֵי.
human_translation: Since the Master said a declaration to the Most High is equivalent to a transfer to an ordinary considered like one who seized it,
llm_translation: As the Master said: His statement to the high one is like his statement to the commoner. It is as if one who is strong.

hebrew_text: אוֹ דִלְמָא: הַשְׁתָּא מִיהָא הָא לָא תַּקְפַהּ, וּכְתִיב: ״וְאִישׁ כִּי יַקְדִּישׁ אֶת בֵּיתוֹ קֹדֶשׁ וְגוֹ׳״, מָה בֵּיתוֹ בִּרְשׁוּתוֹ – אַף כֹּל בִּרְשׁוּתוֹ, לְאַפּוֹקֵי הַאי דְּלֹא בִּרְשׁוּתוֹ.
human_translation: Or perhaps now, in any event, he did not seize it And it is written: “And when a man shall sanctify his house to be sacred Just as his house is in his possession, so too, anything in his possession, to the exclusion of this which is not in his possession,
llm_translation: Or perhaps: now, this one did not acquire it, and it is written: "And if a man consecrates his house as holy, etc." Just as his house is within his ownership, so too everything is within his ownership, to exclude this case where it is not within his ownership.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: דְּהָהִיא
human_translation: Come hear as a certain
llm_translation: Come and hear: that which

hebrew_text: מַסּוּתָא דַּהֲווֹ מִנְּצוּ עֲלַהּ בֵּי תְרֵי, הַאי אָמַר דִּידִי הוּא וְהַאי אָמַר דִּידִי הוּא. קָם חַד מִינַּיְיהוּ אַקְדְּשַׁהּ. פָּרְשִׁי מִינַּהּ רַב חֲנַנְיָה וְרַב אוֹשַׁעְיָא וְכוּלְּהוּ רַבָּנַן. וַאֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אוֹשַׁעְיָא לְרַבָּה: כִּי אָזְלַתְּ קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב חִסְדָּא לְכַפְרִי, בְּעִי מִינֵּיהּ.
human_translation: bathhouse over which two were arguing, This said: It is mine, and that said: It is mine. One of them arose consecrated Rav Ḥananya and Rav Oshaya and all the Rabbis kept away from And Rav Oshaya said to Rabba: When you go before Rav Ḥisda in Kafrei, ask him
llm_translation: The incident of the two who were arguing over it, this one said, "It is mine," and that one said, "It is mine." One of them arose and consecrated it. Rab Hananya and Rab Oshaya and all the Rabbis separated from him. And Rab Oshaya said to Rabba: "When you go before Rab Ḥisda to Kapri, inquire about it."

hebrew_text: כִּי אֲתָא לְסוּרָא, אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב הַמְנוּנָא: מַתְנִיתִין הִיא. סְפֵק בְּכוֹרוֹת, אֶחָד בְּכוֹר אָדָם וְאֶחָד בְּכוֹר בְּהֵמָה, בֵּין טְהוֹרִים בֵּין טְמֵאִים: הַמּוֹצִיא מֵחֲבֵירוֹ עָלָיו הָרְאָיָה. וְתָנֵי עֲלַהּ: אֲסוּרִים בְּגִיזָה וּבַעֲבוֹדָה.
human_translation: When came to Sura Rav Hamnuna said to him: is mishna uncertainty firstborns, whether a human firstborn or an animal firstborn, whether kosher or non-kosher the burden of proof rests upon the claimant. And it is taught in that regard prohibited from shearing and from working
llm_translation: When he came to Sura, Rav Hamnuna said to him: It is a Mishnah. A doubt regarding firstborns, whether of a human or of an animal, whether pure or impure: the burden of proof rests upon the one seeking to exempt his fellow. And it was taught about this: They are prohibited in shearing and in labor.

hebrew_text: וְהָא הָכָא דְּאָמַר תְּקָפוֹ כֹּהֵן – אֵין מוֹצִיאִין אוֹתוֹ מִיָּדוֹ, דְּקָתָנֵי הַמּוֹצִיא מֵחֲבֵירוֹ עָלָיו הָרְאָיָה, וְכִי לֹא תְּקָפוֹ – אֲסוּרִין בְּגִיזָּה וּבַעֲבוֹדָה.
human_translation: And here, where says a priest seized does not remove it from his possession, as it teaches the burden of proof rests upon the claimant, when did not seize it, prohibited from shearing and working
llm_translation: And here, where it says "his turban is like a priest's" - they do not remove it from him, as it is taught: one who removes from his fellow, the burden of proof is upon him. And if it is not like a priest's - they are prohibited in shearing and in labor.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבָּה: קְדוּשַּׁת בְּכוֹר קָאָמְרַתְּ – לְעוֹלָם אֵימָא לָךְ תְּקָפוֹ כֹּהֵן מוֹצִיאִין אוֹתוֹ מִיָּדוֹ, וַאֲפִילּוּ הָכִי אֲסוּרִים בְּגִיזָּה וּבַעֲבוֹדָה, דִּקְדוּשָּׁה הַבָּאָה מֵאֵלֶיהָ שָׁאנֵי.
human_translation: Rabba said to him: You say the sanctity of a firstborn. Actually, I will say to you a priest seized it, removes it from his possession, And nevertheless, prohibited from shearing and from working as sanctity that emerges by itself is different.
llm_translation: Rabah said to him: You are speaking of the sanctity of the firstborn - always say to him, "Your redemption is like that of a priest." They take it from him immediately, and even so, they are prohibited in shearing and labor, for the sanctity that comes from itself is different.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב חֲנַנְיָה לְרַבָּה, תַּנְיָא דִּמְסַיַּיע לָךְ: הַסְּפֵיקוֹת נִכְנָסִין לַדִּיר לְהִתְעַשֵּׂר.
human_translation: Rav Ḥananya said to Rabba: is taught that supports your The uncertain enter the pen to be tithed.
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Chananya to Rabba, a teaching that supports you: The doubtful cases enter the chamber to become wealthy.

hebrew_text: וְאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ תְּקָפוֹ כֹּהֵן אֵין מוֹצִיאִין אוֹתוֹ מִיָּדוֹ, אַמַּאי נִכְנָסִין לַדִּיר? נִמְצָא זֶה פּוֹטֵר מָמוֹנוֹ בְּמָמוֹנוֹ שֶׁל כֹּהֵן!
human_translation: And if it enters your mind seized by a priest, does not remove it from his possession, why do enter the pen? this exempting his property with the property of a priest?
llm_translation: And if it comes to your mind, the priest's garment is not removed from him, why do they enter the chamber? It is found that this exempts his money with his money of the priest!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: אִי מִשּׁוּם הָא לָא תְּסַיְּיעֵיהּ לְמָר, הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן – כְּגוֹן דְּלֵית לֵיהּ אֶלָּא תִּשְׁעָה, וְהוּא דְּמָה נַפְשָׁךְ: אִי בַּר חִיּוּבָא הוּא, שַׁפִּיר קָא מְעַשַּׂר. אִי לָאו בַּר חִיּוּבָא הוּא, תִּשְׁעָה לָאו בַּר עַשּׂוֹרֵי נִינְהוּ.
human_translation: Abaye said to him: If due to that does not support the Master. Here, we are dealing with where has only nine and it, Since whichever way you If subject to the obligation tithes properly. And if not subject to the obligation nine not subject to tithing.
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye: If not for the fact that you are not assisting the Master, with what are we dealing here? For example, if he has only nine animals, and you say, "What is the value of your soul?" If it is a matter of obligation, it is fine to tithe. If it is not a matter of obligation, are they not considered as ten?

hebrew_text: הֲדַר אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: לָאו מִילְּתָא הִיא דְּאָמְרִי דִּסְפֵיקָא לָאו בַּר עַשּׂוֹרֵי הִיא, דִּתְנַן: קָפַץ אֶחָד מִן הַמְּנוּיִין לְתוֹכָן – כּוּלָּן פְּטוּרִין.
human_translation: Abaye then said: That which I said is not correct, as, uncertain is not subject to tithing, as we learned one of counted jumped into among all those are exempt
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: Hadr Amar Abbaye: Lav Milta Hi De'amri Dispeika Lav Bar Asorei Hi, Ditnan: Kafatz Echad Min Hamnuyin Letokhan – Kullan Peturin. English translation: Hadr said Abbaye: It is not a matter that they say that it is a doubt, it is not within the ten, as we learned: If one of the designated ones jumped into them - all of them are exempt.

hebrew_text: וְאִי סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ סְפֵיקָא בָּעֵי עַשּׂוֹרֵי, לְעַשֵּׂר מִמָּה נַפְשָׁךְ: דְּאִי בַּר חִיּוּבָא הוּא – שַׁפִּיר מְעַשַּׂר, וְאִי לָאו בַּר חִיּוּבָא הוּא – נִפְּטַר בְּמִנְיָן הָרָאוּי.
human_translation: And if it enters your mind uncertain requires tithing, let him tithe whichever way you Because if obligated he is tithing properly. And if it not obligated is exempt due to a tally fit
llm_translation: If your mind is in doubt, you need to tithe. To what extent should you tithe? If it is a matter of obligation - tithe properly, and if it is not a matter of obligation - exempt yourself according to the appropriate count.

hebrew_text: דְּאָמַר רָבָא: מִנְיָן הָרָאוּי פּוֹטֵר.
human_translation: as Rava says: A tally fit exempts
llm_translation: Rava said: From where is it fitting exempt.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מַאי אִית לָךְ לְמֵימַר, עֲשִׂירִי וַדַּאי אָמַר רַחֲמָנָא וְלֹא עֲשִׂירִי סָפֵק. הָכָא נָמֵי: עֲשִׂירִי וַדַּאי אָמַר רַחֲמָנָא וְלֹא עֲשִׂירִי סָפֵק.
human_translation: Rather, what have you to say The Merciful One states: a certain tenth but not an uncertain tenth, Here too, the Merciful One states a certain tenth and not an uncertain tenth,
llm_translation: Rather what do you have to say? "Rich" for sure the Merciful One said, and not "poor" is uncertain. Here it is stated: "Rich" for sure the Merciful One said, and not "poor" is uncertain.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אַחָא מִדִּפְתִּי לְרָבִינָא: מַאי סְפֵיקוֹת? אִילֵּימָא סְפֵק בְּכוֹרוֹת, ״יִהְיֶה קֹדֶשׁ״ אָמַר רַחֲמָנָא, וְלֹא שֶׁכְּבָר קָדוֹשׁ.
human_translation: Rav Aḥa of Difti said to Ravina: What are uncertain If we say firstborns uncertain, the Merciful One states: shall be sacred But not that is already sacred
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Acha, from Difti to Ravina: What are the doubts? If you say, doubts regarding firstborns, "it shall be holy" the Merciful One said, and not that it is already holy.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא סְפֵק פִּדְיוֹן פֶּטֶר חֲמוֹר, וְכִדְרַב נַחְמָן. דְּאָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר אֲבוּהּ: יִשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ עֲשָׂרָה סְפֵק פִּטְרֵי חֲמוֹר בְּתוֹךְ בֵּיתוֹ – מַפְרִישׁ עֲלֵיהֶן עֲשָׂרָה שֵׂיִין, וּמְעַשְּׂרָן, וְהֵן שֶׁלּוֹ.
human_translation: Rather, an uncertain redemption of a firstborn donkey, And in accordance with of Rav Naḥman, as Rav Naḥman says Rabba bar Avuh says: An Israelite who has ten donkeys firstborn uncertain in his home separates ten lambs and tithes and they belong to him,
llm_translation: Rather, a case of doubt regarding the redemption of a firstborn donkey, as Rav Nachman said. For Rav Nachman said in the name of Rabbah bar Avuh: If an Israelite has ten doubtful firstborn donkeys in his possession, he separates ten se'ahs of wine for them, tithes them, and they become his.

hebrew_text: מַאי הָוֵי עֲלַהּ דְּמַסּוּתָא? תָּא שְׁמַע, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אָבִין: הֲוָה עוֹבָדָא בֵּי רַב חִסְדָּא וְרַב חִסְדָּא בֵּי רַב הוּנָא, וּפַשְׁטַהּ מֵהָא דְּאָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: כׇּל מָמוֹן שֶׁאֵין יָכוֹל לְהוֹצִיאוֹ בְּדַיָּינִין, הִקְדִּישׁוֹ – אֵינוֹ קָדוֹשׁ.
human_translation: What was about of the bathhouse? Come hear as Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Avin said: There was incident the school of Rav Ḥisda, and Rav Ḥisda the school of Rav Huna, and resolved based on that which Rav Naḥman says: any property that cannot recover by legal process, he consecrated it consecration is not
llm_translation: What is the law regarding a concealed object? Come and hear, as Rabbi Chiya bar Avin said: There was a case involving the household of Rav Chisda and Rav Chisda the household of Rav Huna, and she interpreted it from what Rav Nachman said: Any money that one cannot bring out in court, if he consecrated it – it is not consecrated.

hebrew_text: הָא יָכוֹל לְהוֹצִיאוֹ בְּדַיָּינִין, הִקְדִּישׁוֹ – קָדוֹשׁ, אַף עַל גַּב דְּלָא אַפְּקֵיהּ. וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: גָּזַל וְלֹא נִתְיָיאֲשׁוּ הַבְּעָלִים – שְׁנֵיהֶם אֵינָם יְכוֹלִין לְהַקְדִּישׁוֹ. זֶה – לְפִי שֶׁאֵינָהּ שֶׁלּוֹ, וְזֶה – לְפִי שֶׁאֵינָהּ בִּרְשׁוּתוֹ.
human_translation: one can recover by legal process, he consecrated it, consecration although he has not recovered it? But doesn’t Rabbi Yoḥanan say: robbed and the owner did not despair neither can consecrate it; this because it is not his, and that because it is not in his possession?
llm_translation: This one can take him out with judges, he sanctified him - holy, even though he did not redeem him. And Rabbi Yochanan said: If one stole and the owners did not despair - neither of them can sanctify it. This one - because it is not his, and this one - because it is not in his possession.

hebrew_text: מִי סָבְרַתְּ בְּמַסּוּתָא מִטַּלְטְלִין עָסְקִינַן? בְּמַסּוּתָא מְקַרְקְעֵי עָסְקִינַן, דְּכִי יָכוֹל לְהוֹצִיאָה בְּדַיָּינִין, בִּרְשׁוּתֵיהּ קָיְימָא.
human_translation: Did you think we are dealing with a movable bath? we are dealing with a bath ground, once can recover it by legal process exists in his possession.
llm_translation: Who holds in the case of a balance that we are dealing with tilting? In the case of a balance, we are dealing with its legs, for it is able to be moved in legal matters, while it remains in its place.

hebrew_text: תָּנֵי רַב תַּחְלִיפָא בַּר מַעְרְבָא קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: שְׁנַיִם אֲדוּקִים בְּטַלִּית – זֶה נוֹטֵל עַד מָקוֹם שֶׁיָּדוֹ מַגַּעַת, וְזֶה נוֹטֵל עַד מָקוֹם שֶׁיָּדוֹ מַגַּעַת, וְהַשְּׁאָר חוֹלְקִין בְּשָׁוֶה. מַחְוֵי לֵיהּ רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: וּבִשְׁבוּעָה.
human_translation: Rav Taḥalifa from the West, taught before Rabbi Abbahu: two grasping a garment, this takes up to where his hand reaches, and that takes up to where his hand reaches, and they divide the remainder, equally. Rabbi Abbahu indicated And with an oath.
llm_translation: It was taught: Rav Tahalifa bar Ma'arva stood before Rabbi Avahu: "Two people holding onto a tallit - one takes until the place his hand reaches, and the other takes until the place his hand reaches, and the rest they divide equally." Rabbi Avahu objected to him: "And with an oath."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מַתְנִיתִין, דְּקָתָנֵי דְּפָלְגִי בַּהֲדָדֵי, וְלָא קָתָנֵי זֶה נוֹטֵל עַד מְקוֹם שֶׁיָּדוֹ מַגַּעַת, הֵיכִי מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ? אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: דִּתְפִיסִי בְּכַרְכְּשָׁתָא.
human_translation: But how can you find the mishna As teaches that they divide between them, and does not teach that this takes up to where his hand reaches Rav Pappa said: where they are holding onto the fringes [ bekarkashta ]
llm_translation: Rather, it is a Mishnah, as it teaches that one should divide with Hadadei, and it does not teach that one should take until the place where his hand reaches, how does one find it? Rav Papa said: grasp with a spoon.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב מְשַׁרְשְׁיָא, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: הַאי סוּדָרָא, כֵּיוָן דְּתָפֵיס בֵּיהּ שָׁלֹשׁ עַל שָׁלֹשׁ, קָרֵינַן בֵּיהּ ״וְנָתַן לְרֵעֵהוּ״.
human_translation: Rav Mesharshiyya said: Learn a cloth from once has grasped three by three of we consider and gave it to his neighbor;
llm_translation: Rav Mesharshaya said, hear from it: this sudara, since it holds three by three, we read in it "and he shall give to his neighbor."

hebrew_text: דִּכְמַאן דִּפְסִיק דְּמֵי, וְקָנֵי.
human_translation: because as though it were severed and effects the acquisition,
llm_translation: As one who interrupts, acquires.

hebrew_text: וּמַאי שְׁנָא מִדְּרַב חִסְדָּא, דְּאָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: גֵּט בְּיָדָהּ וּמְשִׁיחָה בְּיָדוֹ, אִם יָכוֹל לְנַתְּקוֹ וְלַהֲבִיאוֹ אֶצְלוֹ – אֵינָהּ מְגוֹרֶשֶׁת, וְאִם לָאו – מְגוֹרֶשֶׁת!
human_translation: But what is different from of Rav Ḥisda? As Rav Ḥisda said: a bill of divorce in hand, and a string in his hand, if can pull and bring it to him, she is not divorced; and if not she is divorced.
llm_translation: And what is the difference from Rav Ḥisda, as Rav Ḥisda said: If a divorce document is in her hand and the husband is anointing it with his hand, if he is able to detach it and bring it to himself - she is not divorced, but if not - she is divorced!

hebrew_text: הָתָם כְּרִיתוּת בָּעֵינַן, וְלֵיכָּא. הָכָא נְתִינָה בָּעֵינַן, וְהָא אִיכָּא.
human_translation: There, we require severance and there is no here, we require giving, and there is
llm_translation: There, we require a cutting off, and it is not here. Here, we require placing, and there it is.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: אִם הָיְתָה טַלִּית מוּזְהֶבֶת – חוֹלְקִין. פְּשִׁיטָא? לָא צְרִיכָא, דְּקָאֵי דַּהֲבָא בֵּי מִצְעֵי.
human_translation: Rava says: if garment was with gold they divide obvious? No, necessary where the gold is in the middle
llm_translation: Rava said: If the talit was of gold – they divide. Obvious? Not necessary, for it stands in the house of the bed.

hebrew_text: הָא נָמֵי פְּשִׁיטָא! לָא צְרִיכָא דְּמִיקְרַב לְגַבֵּי דְּחַד. מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא דַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ: פְּלוֹג הָכִי, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן דַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ: מַאי חָזֵית דְּפָלְגַתְּ הָכִי? פְּלוֹג הָכִי.
human_translation: This too obvious; No, necessary where closer to one Lest you say that say to Divide this teaches us that say to him What did you see that you divide that Divide this
llm_translation: Here is the translation of the Talmudic text into English: "This is indeed obvious! It is not necessary for it to come close to one another. What might you say that he said to him: 'Split in this way,' it is evident to us that he said to him: 'What did you see that you split in this way?' 'Split in this way.'"

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: שְׁנַיִם אֲדוּקִין בִּשְׁטָר, מַלְוֶה אוֹמֵר: שֶׁלִּי הוּא, וְנָפַל מִמֶּנִּי וּמְצָאתִיו, וְלֹוֶה אָמַר: שֶׁלְּךָ הוּא, וּפְרַעְתִּיו לָךְ – יִתְקַיֵּים הַשְּׁטָר בְּחוֹתְמָיו, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי.
human_translation: The Sages taught two are grasping note, creditor says: is mine, and I dropped it and I found it, and debtor says: was yours, but I repaid you, the note must be ratified through its signatories the statement of Rabbi
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: Two people holding a document, the lender says, "It is mine," and it falls from him and I found it, and the borrower says, "It is yours," and I will pay you - the document is upheld by its seals, the words of Rabbi.

hebrew_text: רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: יַחְלוֹקוּ.
human_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: divide
llm_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: "They shall divide."

hebrew_text: נָפַל לְיַד דַּיָּין – לֹא יוֹצִיאוֹ עוֹלָמִית. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: הֲרֵי הוּא בְּחֶזְקָתוֹ.
human_translation: fell into the possession of a judge it may never be removed Rabbi Yosei says: retains its presumptive status
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Nafal leyad dayan - lo yotzi'o olamit. Rabbi Yosei omer: harei hu bechezkato." English translation: "If it falls into the hands of the judge - he shall not remove it permanently. Rabbi Yosei says: Behold, it is in his possession."

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: יִתְקַיֵּים הַשְּׁטָר בְּחוֹתְמָיו. וְגָבֵי לֵיהּ מַלְוֶה כּוּלֵּיהּ. וְלֵית לֵיהּ מַתְנִיתִין? שְׁנַיִם אוֹחֲזִין כּוּ׳!
human_translation: The Master said the note must be ratified through its signatories. And creditor collects the entire But doesn’t hold the mishna two people holding
llm_translation: Master said: The document is upheld by its signatories. And regarding the borrower, all of it is collected from him. And does he not have any collateral? Two creditors can seize it!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: בִּמְקוּיָּם – דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל יַחְלוֹקוּ, כִּי פְּלִיגִי בְּשֶׁאֵינוֹ מְקוּיָּם.
human_translation: Rava says Rav Naḥman says: In ratified everyone agrees divide They disagree where not ratified.
llm_translation: Rava said, Rav Nachman said: In a case of "bimkuyam" - everyone will disagree, for they argue in a case that is not "bimkuyam."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי סָבַר: מוֹדֶה בִּשְׁטָר שֶׁכְּתָבוֹ – צָרִיךְ לְקַיְּימוֹ. וְאִי מְקַיֵּים לֵיהּ פָּלֵיג, וְאִי לָא מְקַיֵּים לֵיהּ לָא פָּלֵיג.
human_translation: Rabbi holds admits that he wrote note, must ratify it And if he ratifies he divides and if he does not ratify it he does not divide
llm_translation: Rabbi Savar: One who admits in a document that he wrote - must fulfill it. And if he does fulfill it, they disagree, and if he does not fulfill it, they do not disagree.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא? חַסְפָּא בְּעָלְמָא הוּא, מַאן קָא מְשַׁוֵּי לֵיהּ לְהַאי שְׁטָרָא – לֹוֶה, הָא קָאָמַר דִּפְרִיעַ.
human_translation: What is the reason is merely a shard. Who renders this note? debtor doesn’t say that repaid?
llm_translation: What is the reason? It is merely a promissory note in general. Who is changing it for this document? - A lender, as it says that it is effective.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל סָבַר: מוֹדֶה בִּשְׁטָר שֶׁכְּתָבוֹ אֵין צָרִיךְ לְקַיְּימוֹ, וְאַף עַל גַּב דְּלָא מְקַיֵּים לֵיהּ – יַחְלוֹקוּ.
human_translation: And Rabbi Shimon ben Gamliel holds admits that he wrote note, is not required to ratify it And even if does not ratify it, they divide
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Gamliel holds: One who admits in a document that he wrote it, does not need to fulfill it, and even though he does not fulfill it - they shall divide.

hebrew_text: נָפַל לְיַד דַּיָּין לֹא יוֹצִיאוֹ עוֹלָמִית,
human_translation: fell into the possession of a judge it may never be removed
llm_translation: Fell into the hands of the judge, they shall not remove him permanently.

hebrew_text: מַאי שְׁנָא לְיַד דַּיָּין? אָמַר רָבָא, הָכִי קָאָמַר: וְאַחֵר שֶׁמָּצָא שְׁטָר שֶׁנָּפַל לְיַד דַּיָּין, וְהֵיכִי דָּמֵי – דִּכְתַב בֵּיהּ הֶנְפֵּק, לֹא יוֹצִיאוֹ עוֹלָמִית.
human_translation: What is different into the possession of a judge, Rava said this is saying: But another who found note that had fallen into the possession of a judge, it may never be removed And what are the circumstances? where wrote in a ratification
llm_translation: What is different about a document in the possession of a judge? Rava said, thus he is saying: And if another found a document that fell into the possession of a judge, and how is it different - if he wrote in it "he took it out," he should not produce it in the future.

hebrew_text: וְלָא מִיבַּעְיָא לָא כְּתַב בֵּיהּ הֶנְפֵּק, דְּאִיכָּא לְמֵימַר כָּתַב לִלְוֹת וְלֹא לָוָה, אֶלָּא אֲפִילּוּ כְּתַב בֵּיהּ הֶנְפֵּק, דִּמְקוּיָּם – לֹא יַחֲזִיר, דְּחָיְישִׁינַן לְפֵירָעוֹן.
human_translation: And it is not necessary no ratification written in as it can be said wrote to borrow but he did not borrow Rather, even a ratification written in as a ratified should not return as we suspect that repayment,
llm_translation: And not necessary to say, he did not write in it "he shall go out," for it is possible to say he wrote to lend and not to borrow, but even if he wrote in it "he shall go out," since it is fulfilled - he shall not retract, for we are concerned about repayment.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: הֲרֵי הוּא בְּחֶזְקָתוֹ וְלָא חָיְישִׁינַן לְפֵירָעוֹן. וְלָא חָיֵישׁ רַבִּי יוֹסֵי לְפֵירָעוֹן?
human_translation: And Rabbi Yosei says: retains its presumptive status. And we do not suspect that repayment; But does Rabbi Yosei not suspect that repayment?
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: "He is in his possession, and we are not concerned about repayment. And does Rabbi Yosei not worry about repayment?"

hebrew_text: וְהָתַנְיָא: מָצָא שְׁטַר כְּתוּבָּה בַּשּׁוּק, בִּזְמַן שֶׁהַבַּעַל מוֹדֶה – יַחֲזִיר לָאִשָּׁה, אֵין הַבַּעַל מוֹדֶה – לֹא יַחֲזִיר לֹא לָזֶה וְלֹא לָזֶה.
human_translation: But isn’t it taught found a marriage contract in the marketplace, when the husband admits must return to the wife. the husband does not admit should not return it to this or to that
llm_translation: And it was taught in a Baraita: If one finds a promissory note written in the marketplace, at a time when the husband admits – he shall return it to the woman; if the husband does not admit – he shall not return it neither to this one nor to that one.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: עוֹדָהּ תַּחַת בַּעֲלָהּ – יַחֲזִיר לָאִשָּׁה. נִתְאַרְמְלָה אוֹ נִתְגָּרְשָׁה – לֹא יַחֲזִיר לֹא לָזֶה וְלֹא לָזֶה.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei says is still under her husband, must return to the wife was widowed or divorced, he should not return it to this or to that
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: If she is still under her husband - he shall return her to the woman. If she was kidnapped or divorced - he shall not return her, neither to this one nor to that one.

hebrew_text: אֵיפוֹךְ: נָפַל לְיַד דַּיָּין לֹא יוֹצִיאוֹ עוֹלָמִית, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יוֹסֵי. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: הֲרֵי הוּא בְּחֶזְקָתוֹ.
human_translation: Reverse fell into the possession of a judge, it may never be removed; the statement of Rabbi Yosei. And the Rabbis say: It retains its presumptive status.
llm_translation: Opposite: If it fell into the hand of the judge, he shall not remove it permanently, the words of Rabbi Yosei. And the sages say: It remains in his possession.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי קַשְׁיָא דְּרַבָּנַן אַדְּרַבָּנַן!
human_translation: If so, of the Rabbis and of the Rabbis difficult.
llm_translation: If so, the difficulty of the Rabbis is a difficulty!

hebrew_text: שְׁטַר כְּתוּבָּה, כּוּלָּהּ רַבִּי יוֹסֵי, וְחַסּוֹרֵי מְחַסְּרָא וְהָכִי קָתָנֵי: אֵין הַבַּעַל מוֹדֶה – לֹא יַחֲזִיר לֹא לָזֶה וְלֹא לָזֶה. בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים – שֶׁנִּתְאַרְמְלָה אוֹ שֶׁנִּתְגָּרְשָׁה, אֲבָל עוֹדָהּ תַּחַת בַּעֲלָהּ – יַחֲזִיר לָאִשָּׁה, שֶׁרַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: עוֹדָהּ תַּחַת בַּעֲלָהּ – יַחֲזִיר לָאִשָּׁה, נִתְאַרְמְלָה אוֹ שֶׁנִּתְגָּרְשָׁה – לֹא יַחֲזִיר לֹא לָזֶה וְלֹא לָזֶה.
human_translation: the marriage contract is entirely Rabbi Yosei; And is incomplete, and this it is teaching: the husband does not admit should not return it to this or to that In what is this statement said? where was widowed or divorced. But she is still under her husband, must return to the wife. As Rabbi Yosei says: she is still under her husband, must return to the wife. was widowed or divorced, he should not return to this or to that
llm_translation: Talmudic text: A written document, all of it Rabbi Yosei, and lacking is lacking, and thus it was taught: The husband does not admit - he shall not return neither to this one nor to that one. In what case are these words said - if she was kidnapped or if she was divorced, but if she is still under her husband - he shall return to the woman, for Rabbi Yosei says: If she is still under her husband - he shall return to the woman, if she was kidnapped or if she was divorced - he shall not return neither to this one nor to that one.

hebrew_text: רַב פָּפָּא אָמַר: לְעוֹלָם לָא תֵּיפוֹךְ, רַבִּי יוֹסֵי לְדִבְרֵיהֶם דְּרַבָּנַן קָאָמַר לְהוּ.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: Actually, do not reverse Rabbi Yosei was telling the Rabbis according to their statement,
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: Always do not overturn, Rabbi Yosei regarding their words of the Rabbis he said to them.

hebrew_text: לְדִידִי אֲפִילּוּ נִתְאַרְמְלָה אוֹ נִתְגָּרְשָׁה נָמֵי לָא חָיְישִׁינַן לְפֵירָעוֹן. לְדִידְכוּ אוֹדוֹ לִי מִיהַת בְּעוֹדָהּ תַּחַת בַּעֲלָהּ, דְּיַחֲזִיר לָאִשָּׁה, דְּלָאו בַּת פֵּירָעוֹן הִיא.
human_translation: In my even if she was widowed or divorced we do not suspect payment. according to your concede to me, in any event, while she is still under her husband return to the wife, as is not subject to payment.
llm_translation: Regarding me, even if she was kidnapped or divorced, we are not concerned for her ransom. Regarding you, return to me from under her while she is still under her husband, so that she may not return to her husband, for she is not a woman of ransom.

hebrew_text: וַאֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ רַבָּנַן: אֵימוֹר צְרָרֵי אַתְפְּסָה.
human_translation: And the Rabbis said to him say he gave her bundles
llm_translation: And the sages said to him: "Say, 'You are my bondservants.'"

hebrew_text: רָבִינָא אָמַר: לְעוֹלָם אֵיפוֹךְ קַמַּיְיתָא. וְטַעְמָא דְּרַבָּנַן הָכָא, מִשּׁוּם דְּחָיְישִׁינַן לִשְׁתֵּי כְתוּבּוֹת. וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי לִשְׁתֵּי כְתוּבּוֹת לָא חָיֵישׁ.
human_translation: Ravina said: Actually, reverse the first and The reason of the Rabbis here, is that we suspect that two marriage contracts; And Rabbi Yosei he does not suspect that two marriage contracts;
llm_translation: Ravinah said: Always reverse the order. And the reason of the Rabbis here is because we are concerned for two Scriptures. But Rabbi Yosei is not concerned for two Scriptures.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: מַחֲלוֹקֶת בְּשֶׁשְּׁנֵיהֶם אֲדוּקִים בַּטּוֹפֶס, וּשְׁנֵיהֶם בַּתּוֹרֶף. אֲבָל אֶחָד אָדוּק בַּטּוֹפֶס וְאֶחָד אָדוּק בַּתּוֹרֶף – זֶה נוֹטֵל טוֹפֶס, וְזֶה נוֹטֵל תּוֹרֶף. וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: לְעוֹלָם חוֹלְקִין.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar says: dispute in where both are grasping the standard or both the essential But one is grasping the standard and one is grasping the essential this takes standard and that takes essential And Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Actually, they divide
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: The dispute between them is when both are on the same level, and both are on a slope. But if one is on a level and one is on a slope - this one takes the level, and this one takes the slope. And Rabbi Yochanan said: They always divide.

hebrew_text: וַאֲפִילּוּ אֶחָד אָדוּק בַּטּוֹפֶס וְאֶחָד בַּתּוֹרֶף. וְהָתַנְיָא: זֶה נוֹטֵל עַד מָקוֹם שֶׁיָּדוֹ מַגַּעַת! לָא צְרִיכָא דְּקָאֵי תּוֹרֶף בֵּי מִצְעֵי.
human_translation: And even one is grasping the standard and one the essential But isn’t it taught This takes up to where his hand reaches No, necessary where essential is located in the middle.
llm_translation: And even if one is standing on the threshold and one is standing in the pit. And it was taught: This one takes until the place where his hand touches! It is not necessary that the pit is in the middle.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי מַאי לְמֵימְרָא? לָא צְרִיכָא דִּמְקָרַב לְגַבֵּי דְחַד. מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: אָמַר לֵיהּ פְּלוֹג הָכִי, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן דְּאָמַר לֵיהּ: מַאי חָזֵית דְּפָלְגַתְּ הָכִי? פְּלוֹג הָכִי.
human_translation: If so, what of stating No, necessary where is closer to one Lest you say say to Divide this teaches us that say to him What did you see that you divide that Divide this
llm_translation: So what is there to say? It is not necessary that it is close to one. What might you say? He said to him: "Split like this," we hear that he said to him: "What did you see that you split like this?" "Split like this."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אַחָא מִדִּפְתִּי לְרָבִינָא: לְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר דְּאָמַר זֶה נוֹטֵל טוֹפֶס וְזֶה נוֹטֵל תּוֹרֶף, לְמָה לֵיהּ? וְכִי לָצוּר עַל פִּי צְלוֹחִיתוֹ הוּא צָרִיךְ?
human_translation: Rav Aḥa of Difti said to Ravina: According to Rabbi Elazar, who says this takes standard and that takes essential why do Does he need to cover the opening of his flask?
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Acha, from the city of Difti, to Ravina: Regarding Rabbi Elazar who said, "This one takes a plaster and this one takes a bandage," what is his reasoning? Is it necessary to form it according to the shape of his flask?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לִדְמֵי.
human_translation: said to him: of monetary
llm_translation: He said to him: "Lidmei."

hebrew_text: דְּאָמַר הָכִי: שְׁטָרָא דְּאִית בֵּיהּ זְמַן, כַּמָּה שָׁוֵי? וּדְלֵית בֵּיהּ זְמַן, כַּמָּה שָׁוֵי? בִּשְׁטָרָא דְּאִית בֵּיהּ זְמַן – גָּבֵי מִמְּשַׁעְבְּדֵי. וְאִידַּךְ – לָא גָּבֵי מִמְּשַׁעְבְּדֵי. יָהֵיב לֵיהּ הֵיאַךְ דְּבֵינֵי בֵּינֵי.
human_translation: can say this: note that has date on it; how much worth? And that does not have date on it; how much worth? of note that has date on it, can collect from liened But the other cannot collect from liened the other gives him
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "d'amr haki: shtar'a d'it beh zman, kamah shavi? u'dleit beh zman, kamah shavi? b'shtar'a d'it beh zman – gabei mimshebdei. v'idach – la gabei mimshebdei. yahev lei heich d'veinei beinei." English translation: "He said thus: If a document has a time, how much is it worth? And if it does not have a time, how much is it worth? In a document that has a time – it is effective against the actual possessors. And the other – it is not effective against the actual possessors. He should give it in a way that is between them."

hebrew_text: ״וְיַחְלוֹקוּ״ נָמֵי דַּאֲמַרַן לְדָמֵי. דְּאִי לָא תֵּימָא הָכִי, שְׁנַיִם אוֹחֲזִין בְּטַלִּית הָכִי נָמֵי דְּפָלְגִי? הָא אַפְסְדוּהּ! הָא לָא קַשְׁיָא,
human_translation: And also where we said divide to monetary As, if you do not say so, two holding a garment, also divide But ruin it. This not difficult,
llm_translation: "And they shall divide" - the words that we said are for the purpose of comparison. For if you do not say so, two people holding onto a garment, are they comparable to those who divide it? This is a loss! This is not difficult.

hebrew_text: דְּחַזְיָא לִקְטַנִּים.
human_translation: as it is fit for small
llm_translation: See for the young ones.

hebrew_text: וְהָא דְּאָמַר רָבָא: אִם הָיְתָה טַלִּית מוּזְהֶבֶת – חוֹלְקִין, הָכִי נָמֵי דְּפָלְגִי לַהּ, הָא אַפְסְדוּהָ! הָא לָא קַשְׁיָא, דְּחַזְיָא לִבְנֵי מְלָכִים.
human_translation: But which Rava said, if garment was with gold they divide also that they divide ruin it. That not difficult, as it is fit for the children of kings
llm_translation: And this that Rava said: If the talit was of gold – they divide it, thus it is said that they should split it, but they have lost it! This is not difficult, as it is seen among the sons of kings.

hebrew_text: וְהָא דִּתְנַן: הָיוּ שְׁנַיִם רוֹכְבִין עַל גַּבֵּי בְּהֵמָה וְכוּ׳, הָכִי נָמֵי דְּפָלְגִי לַהּ? הָא אַפְסְדוּהָ! בִּשְׁלָמָא טְהוֹרָה – חַזְיָא לְבָשָׂר. אֶלָּא טְמֵאָה, הָא אַפְסְדוּהָ! אֶלָּא לִדְמֵי, הָכָא נָמֵי לִדְמֵי.
human_translation: But that which we learned two were sitting on an animal also that they divide ruin it. Granted, a kosher fit for meat. But a non-kosher ruin it Rather, monetary Here too, monetary
llm_translation: And this that we learned: If two were riding on the back of an animal, etc., is it not so that they divide it? This, they caused it damage! If it is pure - look at the flesh. But if it is impure, this, they caused it damage! Rather, for its value, here they divide for its value.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָמֵי בַּר חָמָא: זֹאת אוֹמֶרֶת, הַמַּגְבִּיהַּ מְצִיאָה לַחֲבֵירוֹ – קָנָה חֲבֵירוֹ.
human_translation: Rami bar Ḥama says: That is to say: one who lifting a found item on behalf of another, the other acquires
llm_translation: Ramei bar Ḥama said: This is what it means, one who raises his friend's possession - his friend acquires it.

hebrew_text: דְּאִי סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ לֹא קָנָה חֲבֵירוֹ, תֵּיעָשֶׂה זוֹ כְּמִי שֶׁמּוּנַּחַת עַל גַּבֵּי קַרְקַע, וְזוֹ כְּמִי שֶׁמּוּנַּחַת עַל גַּבֵּי קַרְקַע, וְלֹא יִקְנֶה לֹא זֶה וְלֹא זֶה. אֶלָּא לָאו שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: הַמַּגְבִּיהַּ מְצִיאָה לַחֲבֵירוֹ – קָנָה חֲבֵירוֹ.
human_translation: As, if it enters your mind the other does not acquire this would be considered as though lying on the ground, and that as though lying on the ground, and neither this nor that acquires Rather, isn’t it conclude from one who lifting a found item on behalf of another, the other acquires
llm_translation: If your intention was not to acquire it, this one is like one who places it on the ground, and this one is like one who places it on the ground, and neither this one nor this one acquires it. Rather, it is not a valid acquisition: one who lifts an object for his fellow - his fellow acquires it.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא, לְעוֹלָם אֵימָא לָךְ: הַמַּגְבִּיהַּ מְצִיאָה לַחֲבֵירוֹ – לֹא קָנָה חֲבֵירוֹ. וְהָכָא הַיְינוּ טַעְמָא: מִגּוֹ דְּזָכֵי לְנַפְשֵׁיהּ זָכֵי נָמֵי לְחַבְרֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rava said: actually I say to you one who lifting a found item on behalf of another, the other does not acquire And here this is the reason Since acquires for himself, he also acquires for the other
llm_translation: Rava said: Always say to yourself, "One who raises a found object for his fellow - his fellow did not acquire it." And here is the reason: From the fact that he acquired it for himself, he did not acquire it for his fellow.

hebrew_text: תִּדַּע שֶׁאִילּוּ אָמַר לִשְׁלוּחוֹ: ״צֵא וּגְנוֹב לִי״, וְגָנַב – פָּטוּר. וְשׁוּתָּפִין שֶׁגָּנְבוּ – חַיָּיבִין. מַאי טַעְמָא? לָאו מִשּׁוּם דְּאָמְרִינַן: מִגּוֹ דְּזָכֵי לְנַפְשֵׁיהּ זָכֵי נָמֵי לְחַבְרֵיהּ. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: Know as, if says to his agent: Go out and steal for me, and stole exempt but partners who stole liable What is the reason not because we say since who acquires for himself, he also acquires for the other Learn from it
llm_translation: You should know that if one said to his messenger, "Go and steal for me," and he stole - he is exempt. But partners who stole are liable. What is the reason? Not because we say: "From where one merits for oneself, one merits for his companions." Learn from this.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא, הַשְׁתָּא דְּאָמְרַתְּ אָמְרִינַן מִגּוֹ: חֵרֵשׁ וּפִקֵּחַ שֶׁהִגְבִּיהוּ מְצִיאָה, מִתּוֹךְ שֶׁקָּנָה חֵרֵשׁ – קָנָה פִּקֵּחַ.
human_translation: Rava said Now that you said we say: Since [ miggo ] a deaf-mute and competent who lifted a found item since deaf-mute acquires competent acquires
llm_translation: Rava said, "This year, as you said, we say from here: A deaf person and a mentally competent person who lifted an object together, since the deaf person acquired it - the mentally competent person acquired it."

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא חֵרֵשׁ קָנָה – דְּקָא מַגְבַּהּ לֵיהּ בֶּן דַּעַת. אֶלָּא פִּקֵּחַ בְּמַאי קָנָה?
human_translation: Granted, deaf-mute acquires as mentally competent lifted it for him; But how does mentally competent acquire
llm_translation: In truth, a deaf person acquires - for he raises him with understanding. Rather, with what does he acquire?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אֵימָא: חֵרֵשׁ – קָנָה, פִּקֵּחַ – לָא קָנָה. וּמַאי מִגּוֹ? מִגּוֹ דִּשְׁנֵי חֵרְשִׁין בְּעָלְמָא קָנוּ, הַאי נָמֵי קָנֵי.
human_translation: Rather, say deaf-mute acquires competent does not acquire And what miggo Since [ miggo ] in general two deaf-mutes acquire this too, acquires
llm_translation: Rather say: A deaf person - acquired, a mentally competent person - did not acquire. And what is the reason? The reason is that deaf people in general acquire, whereas this one does not acquire.

hebrew_text: הַאי מַאי? אִם תִּמְצָא לוֹמַר הַמַּגְבִּיהַּ מְצִיאָה לַחֲבֵירוֹ קָנָה חֲבֵירוֹ, הָנֵי מִילֵּי הֵיכָא דְּקָא מַגְבַּהּ לֵיהּ אַדַּעְתָּא דְּחַבְרֵיהּ. הַאי אַדַּעְתָּא דִּידֵיהּ קָא מַגְבַּהּ לֵיהּ, אִיהוּ לָא קָנֵי – לְאַחֲרִינֵי מַקְנֵי?!
human_translation: What this if you say one who lifting a found item on behalf of another, the other acquires this statement where he lifts it with the intention of the other person this lifted with the intention of himself; he does not acquire does he acquire for others?
llm_translation: This what? If you find to say the lifter finds for his friend, his friend acquires, these matters where he is lifting with the knowledge of his friend. This knowledge of his own, he is lifting with it, he does not acquire – others acquire after him?!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אֵימָא: מִתּוֹךְ שֶׁלֹּא קָנָה פִּקֵּחַ – לֹא קָנָה חֵרֵשׁ.
human_translation: Rather, say since competent does not acquire deaf-mute does not acquire
llm_translation: Rather say: since he did not acquire with awareness, he did not acquire a deaf person.

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא, מַאי שְׁנָא מִשְּׁנֵי חֵרְשִׁין דְּעָלְמָא – הָתָם תַּקִּינוּ לְהוּ רַבָּנַן דְּלָא אָתֵי לְאִנְּצוֹיֵי. הָכָא מֵימָר אָמַר: פִּקֵּחַ לָא קָנֵי, אֲנָא אֶקְנֵי?
human_translation: And if you would say: what is different from general two deaf-mutes, there, the Sages instituted for them so that they will not come to quarrel Here, says competent does not acquire can I acquire
llm_translation: And if you will say, what is the difference between two deaf-mutes of the world - there they established for them the Rabbis so that they would not come to negligence. Here in this matter it was said: "A fool does not acquire, shall I acquire?"

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אַחָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אַדָּא לְרַב אָשֵׁי: דִּיּוּקֵיהּ דְּרָמֵי בַּר חָמָא מֵהֵיכָא? אִי נֵימָא מֵרֵישָׁא ״שְׁנַיִם אוֹחֲזִין בְּטַלִּית״, הָתָם הַאי קָאָמַר ״כּוּלָּהּ שֶׁלִּי וַאֲנָא אַגְּבַּהְתַּהּ כּוּלַּהּ״, וְהַאי אָמַר ״כּוּלָּהּ שֶׁלִּי וַאֲנָא אַגְּבַּהְתַּהּ כּוּלַּהּ״.
human_translation: Rav Aḥa, son of Rav Adda, said to Rav Ashi: From where is Rami bar Ḥama’s inference If we say from the first clause two holding a garment, there this says: All of it is mine, and I lifted the entire and that says: All of it is mine, and I lifted the entire
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Acha, son of Rav Adda, said to Rav Ashi: Where does one hang a garment that was found in the sun? If we say from the beginning, "Two people are holding a cloak," there he is saying, "It is all mine, and I will take half of it," and here he is saying, "It is all mine, and I will take all of it."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מֵהָא דְּקָתָנֵי ״זֶה אוֹמֵר כּוּלָּהּ שֶׁלִּי וְזֶה אוֹמֵר כּוּלָּהּ שֶׁלִּי״ הָא תּוּ לְמָה לִי? אֶלָּא מִמִּשְׁנָה יְתֵירָה שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: הַמַּגְבִּיהַּ מְצִיאָה לַחֲבֵירוֹ – קָנָה חֲבֵירוֹ.
human_translation: Rather, from that which is taught This says all of it is mine and that says all of it is mine. Why do I this as well? Rather, learn from superfluous mishna one who lifting a found item on behalf of another, the other acquires
llm_translation: Rather, from what is taught: "This one says, 'It is all mine,' and this one says, 'It is all mine.'" Why do I need it? Rather, from the Mishnah, an additional law is derived: One who lifts up an object for his fellow has acquired it for his fellow.

hebrew_text: וְהָא אוֹקֵימְנָא רֵישָׁא בִּמְצִיאָה, וְסֵיפָא בְּמִקָּח וּמִמְכָּר!
human_translation: But didn’t we establish the first clause to a found item, and the latter clause to buying and selling,
llm_translation: And the one establishes the beginning with a find, and the end with a purchase and a sale!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מִסֵּיפָא: ״זֶה אוֹמֵר כּוּלָּהּ שֶׁלִּי וְזֶה אוֹמֵר חֶצְיָהּ שֶׁלִּי״, הָא תּוּ לְמָה לִי? אֶלָּא מִמִּשְׁנָה יְתֵירָה שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: הַמַּגְבִּיהַּ מְצִיאָה לַחֲבֵירוֹ – קָנָה חֲבֵירוֹ.
human_translation: Rather, from the latter clause this says all of it is mine and that says half of it is mine. Why do I this as well? Rather, learn from superfluous mishna one who lifting a found item on behalf of another, the other acquires
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Rather from the latter part: "This one says, 'It is all mine,' and this one says, 'Half of it is mine.'" Why do I need it? Rather, from a Mishnah that teaches an additional case: One who lifts up an object for his fellow - his fellow acquires it.

hebrew_text: וּמִמַּאי דְּבִמְצִיאָה? דִּלְמָא בְּמִקָּח וּמִמְכָּר?
human_translation: And from where that to a found item? Perhaps to buying and selling.
llm_translation: And from where do we know that the law of "bimtziah" applies? Perhaps it is only in the case of buying and selling?

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא: אִי בְּמִקָּח וּמִמְכָּר מַאי לְמֵימְרָא? אִיצְטְרִיךְ, סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא הַאי דְּקָאָמַר ״חֶצְיָהּ שֶׁלִּי״ לֶהֱוֵי כְּמֵשִׁיב אֲבֵידָה וְלִיפְּטַר. קָמַשְׁמַע לַן דְּהַאי אִיעָרוֹמֵי קָא מַעֲרִים. סָבַר: אִי אָמֵינָא ״כּוּלָּהּ שֶׁלִּי״, בָּעֵינָא אִשְׁתְּבוֹעֵי, אֵימָא הָכִי, דְּאֶהְוֵי כְּמֵשִׁיב אֲבֵידָה וְאִיפְּטַר!
human_translation: And if you would say: If to buying and selling, what of stating was necessary enter your mind to say the one who says: Half of it is mine, should be considered the equivalent of one returning a lost item; and he should be exempt teaches us that this is employing artifice. thinking: If I say all of it is mine I will need to take an oath. I will state this as I will be considered the equivalent of one returning a lost item, and I will be exempt
llm_translation: And if you will say: If in a sale or purchase, what is meant to say? It is necessary, for according to your opinion, I would say that what he is saying "half of it is mine" should be like one who returns a lost item and exempts. It is evident to us that this one is causing confusion. He thought: If I were to say "all of it is mine," I would need to swear, so I will say this, that it should be like one who returns a lost item and exempts!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מֵהָא, הָיוּ שְׁנַיִם רוֹכְבִין עַל גַּבֵּי בְּהֵמָה, הָא תּוּ לְמָה לִי? אֶלָּא מִמִּשְׁנָה יְתֵירָה שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: הַמַּגְבִּיהַּ מְצִיאָה לַחֲבֵירוֹ – קָנָה חֲבֵירוֹ.
human_translation: Rather, from this two were sitting on an animal, Why do I this as well? Rather, learn from superfluous mishna one who lifting a found item on behalf of another, the other acquires
llm_translation: Rather, from this, there were two riding on the back of an animal, why do I need it? Rather, from a different Mishnah, hear from it: One who lifts up his friend's lost object - acquires his friend.

hebrew_text: וְדִלְמָא, הָא קָמַשְׁמַע לַן דְּרוֹכֵב נָמֵי קָנֵי!
human_translation: But perhaps this teaches us that who sits also acquires
llm_translation: And perhaps, this is what we can infer, that one who rides in front acquires!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מִסֵּיפָא: בִּזְמַן שֶׁהֵן מוֹדִין אוֹ שֶׁיֵּשׁ לָהֶן עֵדִים – חוֹלְקִין בְּלֹא שְׁבוּעָה. בְּמַאי? אִי בְּמִקָּח וּמִמְכָּר, צְרִיכָא לְמֵימַר?! אֶלָּא לָאו בִּמְצִיאָה, וּשְׁמַע מִינַּהּ הַמַּגְבִּיהַּ מְצִיאָה לַחֲבֵירוֹ קָנָה חֲבֵירוֹ.
human_translation: Rather, from the last clause When they admit or when they have witnesses they divide without an oath. To what If to buying and selling, need to be said? Rather, is it not to a found item? And learn from it one who lifting a found item on behalf of another, the other acquires
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Rather from the latter part: when they admit or when they have witnesses - they divide without an oath. With what? If in a purchase and sale, is it necessary to say?! Rather, is it not in acquisition, and learn from it that one who acquires for his fellow, his fellow acquires.

hebrew_text: וְרָבָא אָמַר לָךְ: מִגּוֹ דְּזָכֵי לְנַפְשֵׁיהּ זָכֵי נָמֵי לְחַבְרֵיהּ.
human_translation: And Rava said to you since he acquires for himself he can also acquire for another
llm_translation: And Rava said to you: From the place where one merits for oneself, one merits for others.

hebrew_text: הָיוּ שְׁנַיִם רוֹכְבִין. אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף, אָמַר לִי רַב יְהוּדָה:
human_translation: two were sitting Rav Yosef said: Rav Yehuda said to me:
llm_translation: They were two riding. Rav Yosef said, Rav Yehudah said to me:

hebrew_text: שְׁמַעִית מִינֵּיהּ דְּמָר שְׁמוּאֵל תַּרְתֵּי: רָכוּב וּמַנְהִיג, חַד קָנֵי וְחַד לָא קָנֵי. וְלָא יָדַעְנָא הֵי מִינַּיְיהוּ.
human_translation: I heard two from Master Shmuel, who sits and who leads one he acquires and one he does not acquire But I do not know which of them.
llm_translation: I heard two things from Mar Samuel: one is riding and leading, one acquires and one does not acquire. And I do not know which one.

hebrew_text: הֵיכִי דָמֵי? אִילֵּימָא רָכוּב לְחוֹדֵיהּ וּמַנְהִיג לְחוֹדֵיהּ – מַנְהִיג לְחוֹדֵיהּ מִי אִיכָּא מַאן דְּאָמַר לָא קָנֵי? אֶלָּא אִי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר דְּלָא קָנֵי – רָכוּב הוּא דְּאִיכָּא לְמֵימַר.
human_translation: What are the circumstances? If we say who sits alone and leads alone, is there anyone who says that who leads alone does not acquire Rather, if it could be said that does not acquire it is sits that it could be said.
llm_translation: How are they similar? If you say that one is riding in front of the other and leading the other - if one is leading the other, who is there to say that he did not acquire? Rather, if there is to say that he did not acquire - it is considered as if he is riding.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא רָכוּב בִּמְקוֹם מַנְהִיג אִיבַּעְיָא לֵיהּ. מַאי: רָכוּב עָדִיף – דְּהָא תָּפֵיס בַּהּ, אוֹ דִלְמָא מַנְהִיג עָדִיף – דְּאָזְלָא מֵחֲמָתֵיהּ?
human_translation: Rather, his dilemma sits while leads What sitting take precedence, as is in his grasp, or perhaps leading takes precedence, as it walks because of him?
llm_translation: Rather, if one is riding in the place of a leader, it is requested of him. What is meant by "riding" is preferable - because he is occupied with it, or perhaps "leading" is preferable - because he is going from his place?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף, אָמַר לִי רַב יְהוּדָה: נֶחְזֵי אֲנַן, דִּתְנַן: הַמַּנְהִיג סוֹפֵג אֶת הָאַרְבָּעִים, וְהַיּוֹשֵׁב בַּקָּרוֹן סוֹפֵג אֶת הָאַרְבָּעִים. רַבִּי מֵאִיר פּוֹטֵר אֶת הַיּוֹשֵׁב בַּקָּרוֹן.
human_translation: Rav Yosef said: Rav Yehuda said to me: let us see ourselves, as we learned the one leading incurs the forty and the one sitting in the wagon [ bakaron ] incurs the forty Rabbi Meir deems the one sitting in the wagon exempt,
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said, Rav Yehudah said to me: We see, as we learned: One who leads absorbs the forty, and one who sits in the corner absorbs the forty. Rabbi Meir exempts the one who sits in the corner.

hebrew_text: וּמִדְּאָפֵיךְ שְׁמוּאֵל וְתָנֵי: וַחֲכָמִים פּוֹטְרִין אֶת הַיּוֹשֵׁב בַּקָּרוֹן, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ רָכוּב לְחוֹדֵיהּ לָא קָנֵי, וְכׇל שֶׁכֵּן רָכוּב בִּמְקוֹם מַנְהִיג.
human_translation: And from that Shmuel reversed and taught: And the Rabbis deem the one sitting in the wagon exempt, Conclude from it sits alone does not acquire and all the more so sits while leads
llm_translation: And from the opposite direction, Samuel teaches: And the sages exempt one who is sitting in a wagon, for it is clear that he did not acquire it by sitting on it, and all the more so one who is sitting in a place of leadership.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי לְרַב יוֹסֵף: הָא זִמְנִין סַגִּיאִין אֲמַרְתְּ לַן: נֶחְזֵי אֲנַן, וְלָא אֲמַרְתְּ לַן מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוּדָה.
human_translation: Abaye said to Rav Yosef: Didn’t you say to us many times Let us see ourselves, And you did not say to us in the name of Rav Yehuda.
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye to Rav Yosef: "This time you said to us: 'Look at us,' but you did not say to us in the name of Rav Yehudah."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִבְרָא! וּדְכִירְנָא נָמֵי דַּאֲמַרִי לֵיהּ: הֵיכִי פָּשֵׁיט מָר רָכוּב מִיּוֹשֵׁב? יוֹשֵׁב לָא תָּפֵיס בְּמוֹסֵירָה, רָכוּב תָּפֵיס בְּמוֹסֵירָה! וַאֲמַר לִי רַב וּשְׁמוּאֵל דְּאָמְרִי תַּרְוַיְיהוּ: מוֹסֵירָה לָא קָנֵי.
human_translation: said to him: Indeed [ ivra ], and I also remember that I said to him How can the Master resolve sits from sits sits does not hold the reins, sits holds the reins. And said to me Rav and Shmuel both say reins does not effect acquisition
llm_translation: He said to him: "Ivra! And remember before you said to him: How does one remove a rider from a sitting animal? If he is sitting, he cannot be removed with a bridle, but if he is riding, he can be removed with a bridle!" And Rav and Shmuel both said to me: Both are not acquired with a bridle.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְאָמְרִי, אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי לְרַב יוֹסֵף: הֵיכִי פָּשֵׁיט מָר רָכוּב מִיּוֹשֵׁב? יוֹשֵׁב לָא תָּפֵיס בְּמוֹסֵירָה, רָכוּב תָּפֵיס בְּמוֹסֵירָה! אֲמַר לֵיהּ, הָכִי תְּנָא אִידֵּי: מוֹסֵירָה לָא קָנֵי.
human_translation: There are who say Abaye said to Rav Yosef: How can the Master resolve sits from sits sits does not hold the reins, sits holds the reins. said to him: Idi taught like this: reins does not effect acquisition
llm_translation: There are some who say, Abaye said to Rav Yosef: How can one differentiate between a rider and a sitter? A sitter does not acquire through a handkerchief, but a rider acquires through a handkerchief! He said to him, so did the Mishna teach: A handkerchief does not effect acquisition.

hebrew_text: אִתְּמַר נָמֵי, אָמַר רַבִּי חֶלְבּוֹ אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: מוֹסֵירָה מֵחֲבֵירוֹ – קָנָה. בִּמְצִיאָה וּבְנִכְסֵי הַגֵּר – לָא קָנֵי.
human_translation: was also stated Rabbi Ḥelbo says Rav Huna says: reins from another acquires with regard to a found or with regard to the property of a convert does not effect acquisition.
llm_translation: It was stated: Naḥmei said, Rabbi Ḥelbo said, Rav Huna said: If one removes from his fellow - he acquires. In the case of finding and in the property of a convert - he does not acquire.

hebrew_text: מַאי לְשׁוֹן מוֹסֵירָה? אָמַר רָבָא: אִידִי אַסְבְּרָא לִי כְּאָדָם הַמּוֹסֵר דָּבָר לַחֲבֵירוֹ. בִּשְׁלָמָא מֵחֲבֵירוֹ קָנֵי, דְּקָא מָסַר לֵיהּ חַבְרֵיהּ. אֶלָּא בִּמְצִיאָה וּבְנִכְסֵי הַגֵּר מַאן קָא מָסַר לֵיהּ דְּלִיקְנֵי?
human_translation: What the term reins [ moseira ]? Rava said: Idi explained to me like a person who transmits [ moser ] an item to another, Granted, from another, effects acquisition as the other hands to him. But of a found or of the property of a convert, who is handing him to acquire
llm_translation: What is the language of relinquishing? Rava said: This is comparable to a person who relinquishes something to his friend. When he acquires it from his friend, it is because he has relinquished it to him. But in the case of finding and the property of a convert, who is relinquishing it to him so that he may acquire it?

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: הָיוּ שְׁנַיִם רוֹכְבִין עַל גַּבֵּי בְּהֵמָה וְכוּ׳. מַנִּי? אִילֵימָא רַבִּי מֵאִיר – הַשְׁתָּא יוֹשֵׁב קָנֵי, רָכוּב מִיבְּעֵי?! אֶלָּא לָאו רַבָּנַן, וּשְׁמַע מִינַּהּ רָכוּב קָנֵי.
human_translation: raises an objection two were sitting on an animal, whose If we say Rabbi Meir, now, sits acquires Is it necessary sits Rather, is it not the Rabbis? And learn from it sits acquires
llm_translation: Challenger: If two were riding on the back of an animal, etc. Who is the Tanna? If you say it is Rabbi Meir - does a rider require a vessel? Rather, it is not the Rabbis, and infer from it that a rider requires a vessel.

hebrew_text: הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן – בְּמַנְהִיג בְּרַגְלָיו. אִי הָכִי, הַיְינוּ מַנְהִיג! תְּרֵי גַּוְונֵי מַנְהִיג, מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: רָכוּב עָדִיף, דְּהָא מַנְהִיג וְתָפֵיס בַּהּ, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: With what are we dealing here? where leads, with his legs. If so, this is leading two types of leading, Lest you say is sitting takes precedence, as he is leading and holding it teaches us
llm_translation: Here we are dealing with - with the leader on his feet. If so, that is the leader! Two types of leaders, what you might say: Riding is preferable, because the leader is in control and holds onto it, this is what we have heard.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: שְׁנַיִם שֶׁהָיוּ מוֹשְׁכִין בְּגָמָל, וּמַנְהִיגִין בַּחֲמוֹר, אוֹ שֶׁהָיָה אֶחָד מוֹשֵׁךְ וְאֶחָד מַנְהִיג,
human_translation: Come hear two who were pulling a camel or driving a donkey or one who was pulling and one driving
llm_translation: Come and hear: Two who were pulling a camel, and leading a donkey, or if one was pulling and one was leading.

hebrew_text: בְּמִדָּה זֹאת קָנוּ. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: לְעוֹלָם לֹא קָנָה עַד שֶׁתְּהֵא מְשִׁיכָה בְּגָמָל וְהַנְהָגָה בַּחֲמוֹר.
human_translation: they acquired in that manner. Rabbi Yehuda says: Actually, acquires only pulling in a camel or driving in a donkey,
llm_translation: In this measure they acquired. Rabbi Yehuda says: One should never acquire until there is pulling with a camel and leading with a donkey.

hebrew_text: קָתָנֵי מִיהַת: אוֹ שֶׁהָיָה אֶחָד מוֹשֵׁךְ וְאֶחָד מַנְהִיג, מוֹשֵׁךְ וּמַנְהִיג – אִין. אֲבָל רָכוּב לָא!
human_translation: In any event, it is taught Or one who was pulling and one driving, pulling and driving indeed but sitting not.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: Or if one was pulling and one was leading, pulling and leading - no. But if riding, yes!

hebrew_text: הוּא הַדִּין דַּאֲפִילּוּ רָכוּב, וְהָא דְּקָתָנֵי מוֹשֵׁךְ וּמַנְהִיג – לְאַפּוֹקֵי מִדְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה דְּאָמַר: עַד שֶׁתְּהֵא מְשִׁיכָה בְּגָמָל וְהַנְהָגָה בַּחֲמוֹר, קָמַשְׁמַע לַן דַּאֲפִילּוּ אִיפְּכָא נָמֵי קָנֵי.
human_translation: The same is true even sitting And that teaches pulling and driving to exclude of Rabbi Yehuda, who says only pulling in a camel or driving in a donkey. teaches us that even the opposite acquires
llm_translation: It is the same as that which was taught: Even if one is riding, and that which is taught, one who pulls and leads - to fulfill the statement of Rabbi Yehuda who said: Until the pulling is done with a camel and the leading with a donkey, it is heard for us that even if it is reversed, it is also acquired.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, לִיעָרְבִינְהוּ וְלִתְנִינְהוּ: שְׁנַיִם שֶׁהָיוּ מוֹשְׁכִין וּמַנְהִיגִין בֵּין בְּגָמָל בֵּין בַּחֲמוֹר!
human_translation: If that is so, let combine and teach them two who were pulling or driving either a camel or a donkey,
llm_translation: If so, let us mix them and teach them: two who were pulling and leading, whether with a camel or with a donkey!

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא חַד צַד דְּלָא קָנֵי: אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי מְשִׁיכָה בַּחֲמוֹר, וְאִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי הַנְהָגָה בְּגָמָל.
human_translation: There is one manner that does not acquire Some say pulling a donkey and some say driving a camel
llm_translation: There is one side that does not acquire: some say pulling with a donkey, and some say leading with a camel.

hebrew_text: וְאִית דְּמוֹתֵיב מִסֵּיפָא: בְּמִדָּה זוֹ קָנָה. ״בְּמִדָּה זוֹ״ לְמַעוֹטֵי מַאי? לָאו לְמַעוֹטֵי רָכוּב?! לָא, לְמַעוֹטֵי אִיפְּכָא.
human_translation: And there are those who raise an objection from the latter clause acquire in that manner. in that manner to exclude what? Is it not to exclude sits No, to exclude the opposite
llm_translation: And there is one who sits and infers from the latter clause: "With this measure he acquires." "With this measure" - to exclude what? Not to exclude movable property?! No, to exclude land.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, הַיְינוּ רַבִּי יְהוּדָה! אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ צַד אֶחָד דְּלֹא קָנָה: אִית דְּאָמְרִי מְשִׁיכָה בַּחֲמוֹר, וְאִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי הַנְהָגָה בְּגָמָל.
human_translation: If so, that is Rabbi Yehuda. There is between them one manner which does not acquire Some say pulling a donkey and some say driving a camel
llm_translation: So it is, this is Rabbi Yehuda! There is a difference between them, one side did not acquire: some say pulling with a donkey, and some say leading with a camel.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: אֶחָד רָכוּב חֲמוֹר וְאֶחָד תָּפוּס בְּמוֹסֵירָה – זֶה קָנָה חֲמוֹר, וְזֶה קָנָה מוֹסֵירָה. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: רָכוּב קָנֵי!
human_translation: Come hear one is sitting a donkey and one is holding the reins, this acquires donkey, and that acquires the reins. Learn from it sits acquires
llm_translation: Come and hear: One who is riding on a donkey and one who is holding it by the halter - this one acquires the donkey, and this one acquires the halter. Learn from it: Riders acquire!

hebrew_text: הָכָא נָמֵי בְּמַנְהִיג בְּרַגְלָיו. אִי הָכִי, נִקְנֵי נָמֵי רָכוּב בְּמוֹסֵירָה! אֵימָא: זֶה קָנָה חֲמוֹר וַחֲצִי מוֹסֵירָה, וְזֶה קָנָה חֲצִי מוֹסֵירָה.
human_translation: Here too, to driving with his feet If so, one who is sitting should acquire of the reins too. say: This acquires donkey and half of reins, and that acquires half of reins.
llm_translation: Here is the translation of the Talmudic text: Here, it is stated: "He acquires property through his appointed agent with his feet." If so, one acquires property through a rider with a halter! Say: This one acquires a donkey and half a halter, and this one acquires half a halter.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא רָכוּב קָנֵי, דְּקָמַגְבַּהּ לֵיהּ בֶּן דַּעַת. אֶלָּא תָּפוּס בְּמוֹסֵירָה בְּמַאי קָנֵי?
human_translation: Granted, sitting acquires because a mentally competent has lifted it for him, but in what does the one holding the reins acquire
llm_translation: In peace a chariot acquires, for it elevates the understanding. Rather, it acquires with a halter; with what does it acquire?

hebrew_text: אֵימָא: זֶה קָנָה חֲמוֹר וְכוּלֵּיהּ מוֹסֵירָה, וְזֶה קָנָה מַה שֶּׁתָּפוּס בְּיָדוֹ.
human_translation: say: This acquires the donkey and the entire reins, and that acquires that held in his hand.
llm_translation: Concerning what? This one acquires a donkey and all of it is relinquished, and this one acquires whatever he grasps in his hand.

hebrew_text: הַאי מַאי?! אִם תִּימְצֵי לוֹמַר הַמַּגְבִּיהַּ מְצִיאָה לַחֲבֵירוֹ קָנָה חֲבֵירוֹ – הָנֵי מִילֵּי הֵיכָא דְּקָא מַגְבַּהּ לֵיהּ אַדַּעְתָּא דְּחַבְרֵיהּ. הַאי אַדַּעְתָּא דִּידֵיהּ קָא מַגְבַּהּ לֵיהּ: אִיהוּ לָא קָנֵי, לְאַחֲרִינֵי מַקְנֵי?!
human_translation: What this if you say one who lifting a found item on behalf of another, the other acquires that statement where lifts with the intention that another this is lifting with the intention of himself. he does not acquire can he acquire for others?
llm_translation: This what?! If you will say, "One who raises finds for his friend, his friend acquires" - these are words where he is raising with the knowledge of his friend. But his own knowledge is raising for him: He does not acquire, others acquire after him?!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: זֶה קָנָה חֲמוֹר וּבֵית פַּגֶּיהָ, וְזֶה קָנָה מַה שֶׁתָּפוּס בְּיָדוֹ – וְהַשְּׁאָר לֹא קָנָה, לֹא זֶה וְלֹא זֶה.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: This acquires donkey and its halter, and that acquires that is held in his hand. And the rest, neither this nor that acquired
llm_translation: Rav Ashei said: This one acquired a donkey and its manger, and this one acquired whatever he grasps in his hand - and the rest he did not acquire, neither this one nor that one.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ אָמַר: לְעוֹלָם כִּדְקָתָנֵי – הוֹאִיל וְיָכוֹל לְנַתְּקָהּ וְלַהֲבִיאָהּ אֶצְלוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Abbahu said: Actually, as it is taught. because he can detach them and bring them toward himself.
llm_translation: Rabbi Abbahu said: Always as it is taught - since he is able to untie it and bring it to him.

hebrew_text: וְהָא דְּרַבִּי אֲבָהוּ בְּרוּתָא הִיא, דְּאִי לָא תֵּימָא הָכִי: טַלִּית שֶׁהִיא מוּנַּחַת חֶצְיָהּ עַל גַּבֵּי קַרְקַע וְחֶצְיָהּ עַל גַּבֵּי עַמּוּד, וּבָא אֶחָד וְהִגְבִּיהַּ חֶצְיָהּ מֵעַל גַּבֵּי קַרְקַע וּבָא אַחֵר וְהִגְבִּיהַּ חֶצְיָהּ מֵעַל גַּבֵּי עַמּוּד, הָכִי נָמֵי דְּקַמָּא קָנֵי וּבָתְרָא לָא קָנֵי, הוֹאִיל וְיָכוֹל לְנַתְּקָ[הּ] וְלַהֲבִיאָ[הּ] אֶצְלוֹ?! אֶלָּא הָא דְּרַבִּי אֲבָהוּ בְּרוּתָא הִיא.
human_translation: And this of Rabbi Abbahu is an error. As, if you do not say so, a garment, half of which lying on the ground and half of which on a pillar, and one came and lifted half of it off the ground, and another came and lifted half of it off the pillar. also that the first acquires and the latter does not acquire since able to detach and bring toward him? Rather, this of Rabbi Abbahu is an error.
llm_translation: And this that Rabbi Avahu said in Bruta, for if you do not say thus: a cloak that is half placed on the ground and half on a pillar, and one came and raised its half from the ground, and another came and raised its half from the pillar, so it is as if the first acquired it and the second did not acquire it, since he could detach it and bring it to himself?! Rather, this that Rabbi Avahu said in Bruta.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: רָכוּב בַּשָּׂדֶה וּמַנְהִיג בָּעִיר – קָנָה! הָכָא נָמֵי מַנְהִיג בְּרַגְלָיו. אִי הָכִי, הַיְינוּ מַנְהִיג! תְּרֵי גַּוְונֵי מַנְהִיג.
human_translation: Come hear Rabbi Eliezer says: sits in the field or leads in the city, acquires Here too, leads, with his feet. If so, that is leading two types of leading.
llm_translation: Come and hear: Rabbi Eliezer says: One who is riding in the field and leading in the city - acquires! Here too, leading with his feet. If not, this is leading! Three types of leading.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, רָכוּב בָּעִיר מַאי טַעְמָא לָא קָנֵי? אָמַר רַב כָּהֲנָא: לְפִי שֶׁאֵין דַּרְכָּן שֶׁל בְּנֵי אָדָם לִרְכּוֹב בָּעִיר.
human_translation: If that is so, what is the reason sits in the city does not acquire Rav Kahana said: because people do not normally ride in the city,
llm_translation: If so, one who is riding in the city, what is the reason that he does not acquire? Rav Kahana said: Because it is not the way of people to ride in the city.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אָשֵׁי לְרַב כָּהֲנָא: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה, הִגְבִּיהַּ אַרְנָקִי בְּשַׁבָּת, שֶׁאֵין דַּרְכָּן שֶׁל בְּנֵי אָדָם לְהַגְבִּיהַּ אַרְנָקִי בְּשַׁבָּת, הָכִי נָמֵי דְּלָא קָנֵי? אֶלָּא מַאי דַּעֲבַד – עֲבַד, וְקָנֵי, הָכָא נָמֵי מַאי דַּעֲבַד – עֲבַד, וּקְנִי.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said to Rav Kahana: If that is so, lifted a purse on Shabbat, has he also not acquired since people do not normally lift a purse on Shabbat Rather, What he did, he did, and he acquires Here too, what he did, he did, and he acquires
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Ashi to Rav Kahana: Rather, from now on, if one lifts a purse on Shabbat, since it is not the way of people to lift a purse on Shabbat, is it not the case that he does not acquire it? Rather, what he does - he does, and he acquires. Here too, what he does - he does, and he acquires.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא בְּמִקָּח וּמִמְכָּר עָסְקִינַן, דַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ: קְנֵי כְּדֶרֶךְ שֶׁבְּנֵי אָדָם קוֹנִין.
human_translation: Rather, we are dealing with buying and selling where said to Acquire the way that people acquire
llm_translation: Rather, we are dealing with buying and selling, as he said to him: Acquire as is the way of people to acquire.

hebrew_text: וְאִי רְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים הוּא – קָנֵי, וְאִי אָדָם חָשׁוּב הוּא – קָנֵי, וְאִי אִשָּׁה הִיא – קָנְיָא, וְאִי אִינִישׁ זִילָא הוּא – קָנֵי.
human_translation: And if it the public domain, he acquires And if he is an important person, he acquires And if is a woman, she acquires And if is a detestable person, acquires
llm_translation: If it is public domain - it acquires, and if a person of importance he is - he acquires, and if she is a woman - she acquires, and if it is a minor - he acquires.

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: הָאוֹמֵר לַחֲבֵירוֹ ״מְשׁוֹךְ בְּהֵמָה זוֹ לִקְנוֹת כֵּלִים שֶׁעָלֶיהָ״, מַהוּ?
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar raises a dilemma: one who says to another, Pull this animal in order acquire vessels that are upon it, what is
llm_translation: Inquiry of Rabbi Elazar: One who says to his fellow, "Pull this animal in order to acquire the vessels upon it," what is the ruling?

hebrew_text: לִקְנוֹת: מִי אֲמַר לֵיהּ קְנֵי! אֶלָּא: ״מְשׁוֹךְ בְּהֵמָה זוֹ וּקְנֵי כֵּלִים שֶׁעָלֶיהָ״, מַהוּ? מִי מַהְנְיָא מְשִׁיכָה דִּבְהֵמָה לְאַקְנוֹיֵי כֵּלִים, אוֹ לָא?
human_translation: In order acquire Did he say to him Acquire Rather, Pull this animal and acquire vessels that are What is Is pulling the animal effective to acquire vessels or not?
llm_translation: To buy: Who said to him, "Buy!" Rather: "Pull this animal and acquire the vessels upon it." What is the law? Is the pulling of the animal necessary for the acquisition of the vessels, or not?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: אִי אֲמַר לֵיהּ קְנֵי בְּהֵמָה וּקְנֵי כֵּלִים – מִי קָנֵי כֵּלִים? חָצֵר מְהַלֶּכֶת הִיא, וְחָצֵר מְהַלֶּכֶת לֹא קָנָה.
human_translation: Rava said: if he said to him: Acquire animal and acquire vessels, does acquire vessels? it is a mobile courtyard, and a mobile courtyard does not effect acquisition
llm_translation: Rava said: If one says to him, "Acquire the animal and acquire the vessels," who acquires the vessels? It is a courtyard that is walking, and a walking courtyard does not acquire.

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא כְּשֶׁעָמְדָה, וְהָא כֹּל שֶׁאִילּוּ מְהַלֵּךְ לֹא קָנָה – עוֹמֵד וְיוֹשֵׁב לֹא קָנָה!
human_translation: And if you would say when standing isn’t anything that does not effect acquisition when moving does not effect acquisition standing or sitting?
llm_translation: And if you will say, when it stood, but anything that even if it walks, it did not acquire - standing and sitting did not acquire!

hebrew_text: וְהִלְכְתָא בִּכְפוּתָהּ.
human_translation: And the halakha when bound.
llm_translation: And the halakha is in accordance with its strictness.

hebrew_text: אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ רַב פָּפָּא וְרַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ לְרָבָא: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה, הָיָה מְהַלֵּךְ בִּסְפִינָה, וְקָפְצוּ דָּגִים וְנָפְלוּ לְתוֹךְ הַסְּפִינָה, הָכִי נָמֵי דְּחָצֵר מְהַלֶּכֶת הִיא וְלָא קָנֵי?! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: סְפִינָה מֵינָח נָיְיחָא, וּמַיָּא הוּא דְּקָא מַמְטוּ לַהּ.
human_translation: Rav Pappa and Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said to Rava: If that is so, was sailing on a boat and fish jumped and fell into the boat, is also a mobile courtyard, and he does not acquire said to boat sits idle, and it is the water that moves it.
llm_translation: They said to Rav Papa and Rav Huna, the son of Rav Yehoshua to Rava: Rather, from now on, if one was walking on a ship, and fish jumped and fell into the ship, is it not considered a private domain and he did not acquire them?! He said to them: A ship is a resting place, and it is the water that is bringing them.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבִינָא לְרַב אָשֵׁי: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה הָיְתָה מְהַלֶּכֶת בִּרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים וְזָרַק לָהּ גֵּט לְתוֹךְ חֵיקָהּ אוֹ לְתוֹךְ קַלְתָּהּ, הָכָא נָמֵי דְּלָא מִגָּרְשָׁה?! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: קַלְתָּהּ מֵינָח נָיְיחָא, וְאִיהִי דְּקָא מְסַגְּיָא מִתּוּתַהּ.
human_translation: Ravina said to Rav Ashi: If that is so, was walking in the public domain and threw a bill of divorce into her lap, or into her basket here too, is she not divorced said to him: Her basket sits idle, and it is she who walks beneath it.
llm_translation: Ravina said to Rav Ashi: Rather, from now on, if she was walking in a public domain and he threw the bill of divorce to her lap or to her basket, here too it is effective, for it is not considered as if he is divorcing her against her will. He said to him: Her basket is resting, and it is she who is moving away from it.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הָיָה רוֹכֵב עַל גַּבֵּי בְּהֵמָה וְרָאָה אֶת הַמְּצִיאָה וְאָמַר לַחֲבֵירוֹ ״תְּנָהּ לִי״. נְטָלָהּ וְאָמַר: ״אֲנִי זָכִיתִי בָּהּ״ – זָכָה בָּהּ. אִם מִשֶּׁנְּתָנָהּ לוֹ, אָמַר: ״אֲנִי זָכִיתִי בָּהּ תְּחִלָּה״ – לֹא אָמַר כְּלוּם.
human_translation: was riding on an animal and saw a found item, and said to another Give to me, took it and said: I have acquired it he has acquired it if, after giving it to he said: I acquired it at the outset, he has said nothing
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: If one was riding on an animal and saw a lost object and said to his fellow, "Give it to me," and he took it and said, "I have acquired it," he has indeed acquired it. But if after it was given to him, he said, "I have acquired it initially," he has said nothing.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תְּנַן הָתָם: מִי שֶׁלִּיקֵּט אֶת הַפֵּאָה, וְאָמַר: ״הֲרֵי זוֹ לִפְלוֹנִי עָנִי״, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: זָכָה לוֹ. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: יִתְּנֶנָּה לֶעָנִי הַנִּמְצָא רִאשׁוֹן.
human_translation: We learned there one who gleaned the produce in the corner of the field, which is given to the poor [ pe’a ], and said: This is for so-and-so, a poor person, Rabbi Eliezer says: He acquired on behalf. And the Rabbis say: he should give it to the first poor person that he encounters.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemara: tanan there: who that plucked the corner, and said: "behold this for so-and-so poor," Rabbi Eliezer says: acquired for him. And the sages say: should be given to the poor who is found first.

hebrew_text: אָמַר עוּלָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: מַחְלוֹקֶת מֵעָשִׁיר לְעָנִי,
human_translation: Ulla said Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: dispute by a rich person, on behalf of a poor person.
llm_translation: Said Ula, said Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi: Dispute from rich to poor,

hebrew_text: דְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר סָבַר: מִגּוֹ דְּאִי בָּעֵי מַפְקַר נִכְסֵיהּ וְהָוֵי עָנִי וַחֲזֵי לֵיהּ – הַשְׁתָּא נָמֵי חֲזֵי לֵיהּ. וּמִגּוֹ דְּזָכֵי לְנַפְשֵׁיהּ, זָכֵי נָמֵי לְחַבְרֵיהּ. וְרַבָּנַן סָבְרִי חַד מִגּוֹ אָמְרִינַן, תְּרֵי מִגּוֹ לָא אָמְרִינַן.
human_translation: As Rabbi Eliezer holds since [ miggo ], if he desires, he can renounce ownership of his property and be poor, and suitable for him, now too, suitable for him And since [ miggo ] he can acquire for himself, he can acquire on behalf of another as well. And the Rabbis hold we say miggo once, we do not say miggo twice.
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer holds: From the moment a person becomes destitute and his possessions are scattered, and he becomes poor, observe him - now he is observed. And from the moment he merits for himself, he merits for his companions. And the Rabbis hold: We only say one of these, we do not say two.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל מֵעָנִי לְעָנִי, דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל זָכָה לוֹ – דְּמִגּוֹ דְּזָכֵי לְנַפְשֵׁיהּ זָכֵי נָמֵי לְחַבְרֵיהּ.
human_translation: But by a poor person on behalf of poor person, everyone agrees he acquires on behalf of as since [ miggo ] he can acquire for himself, he can acquire on behalf of another as well.
llm_translation: But from poor to poor, the words of all are in his favor - for just as he is favorable to himself, he is favorable to his companions.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב נַחְמָן לְעוּלָּא: וְלֵימָא מָר, מֵעָנִי לְעָנִי מַחְלוֹקֶת, דְּהָא מְצִיאָה הַכֹּל עֲנִיִּים אֶצְלָהּ, וּתְנַן: הָיָה רוֹכֵב עַל גַּבֵּי בְּהֵמָה וְרָאָה אֶת הַמְּצִיאָה וְאָמַר לַחֲבֵירוֹ ״תְּנָהּ לִי״, נְטָלָהּ וְאָמַר ״אֲנִי זָכִיתִי בָּהּ״ – זָכָה בָּהּ.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman said to Ulla: But shouldn’t the Master say dispute by a poor person on behalf of poor person? as everyone is poor people with regard to a found item, and we learned was riding on an animal and saw a found item, and said to another Give to me, took it and said: I have acquired it he has acquired it.
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Nachman to Ulai: And say, Master, from poor to poor is a dispute, for she finds all the poor with her, and we learned: If one was riding on an animal and saw a lost object and said to his friend, "Give it to me," he took it and said, "I have acquired it" - he has acquired it.

hebrew_text: אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא: מֵעָנִי לְעָנִי מַחְלוֹקֶת,
human_translation: Granted, if you say dispute by a poor person on behalf of a poor person,
llm_translation: If you say: "From poor to poor is a dispute,"

hebrew_text: מַתְנִיתִין מַנִּי – רַבָּנַן הִיא. אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ בְּעָשִׁיר וְעָנִי מַחְלוֹקֶת, אֲבָל מֵעָנִי לְעָנִי דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל זָכָה לוֹ, הָא מַנִּי? לָא רַבָּנַן וְלָא רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר!
human_translation: whose the mishna? It is the Rabbis, But if you say dispute in a rich person and a poor person but by a poor person on behalf of a poor person everyone agrees he acquired on behalf, whose is this neither the Rabbis nor Rabbi Eliezer.
llm_translation: Mishnah: Matnitin mani - Rabbanan hi. Ela i amrati be'ashir ve'ani machloket, aval me'ani le'ani divrei hakol zachah lo, ha mani? La Rabbanan ve'la Rabbi Eliezer!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ, מַתְנִיתִין דְּאָמַר תְּחִילָּה.
human_translation: said to The mishna where said: at the outset;
llm_translation: He said to him, "The Mishnah that says 'first.'

hebrew_text: הָכִי נָמֵי מִסְתַּבְּרָא, דְּקָתָנֵי סֵיפָא: אִם מִשֶּׁנְּתָנָהּ לוֹ אָמַר אֲנִי זָכִיתִי בָּהּ תְּחִילָּה – לֹא אָמַר כְּלוּם. תְּחִילָּה בְּסֵיפָא לְמָה לִי? פְּשִׁיטָא, אַף עַל גַּב דְּלָא אָמַר תְּחִילָּה, תְּחִילָּה קָאָמַר. אֶלָּא לָאו הָא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן, רֵישָׁא דְּאָמַר ״תְּחִילָּה״.
human_translation: So too, it is reasonable as it teaches in the last clause: if, after giving it to he said: I acquired it at the outset, he has said nothing Why do I need At the outset, in the last clause? It is obvious even if he did not say: At the outset, he meant at the outset, Rather, isn’t teach us this: The first clause where he said: at the outset?
llm_translation: Thus it is reasonable, as it is taught in the latter part: If he said upon receiving it, "I acquired it initially" - he did not say anything. Initially, why do I need the latter part? It is obvious, even though he did not say initially, he is saying initially. Rather, is it not that this is what he is teaching us, the beginning of saying "initially."

hebrew_text: וְאִידַּךְ: תְּנָא סֵיפָא לְגַלּוֹיֵי רֵישָׁא. סֵיפָא, דְּאָמַר תְּחִילָּה. רֵישָׁא, דְּלָא אָמַר תְּחִילָּה.
human_translation: And the other taught the last clause to shed light on the first clause. The last clause where he said at the outset the first clause, where he did not say at the outset.
llm_translation: And the other opinion - a Tanna taught the latter clause to reveal the former. The latter clause, for he said "first." The former, for he did not say "first."

hebrew_text: רַב נַחְמָן וְרַב חִסְדָּא דְּאָמְרִי תַּרְוַיְיהוּ: הַמַּגְבִּיהַּ מְצִיאָה לַחֲבֵירוֹ – לֹא קָנָה חֲבֵירוֹ.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman and Rav Ḥisda, who both say: one who lifting a found item on behalf of another, the other does not acquire
llm_translation: Rav Nachman and Rav Hisda both say: One who lifts up an object for his friend - his friend does not acquire it.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא – הָוֵי תּוֹפֵס לְבַעַל חוֹב בִּמְקוֹם שֶׁחָב לַאֲחֵרִים, וְהַתּוֹפֵס לְבַעַל חוֹב בִּמְקוֹם שֶׁחָב לַאֲחֵרִים – לֹא קָנָה.
human_translation: What is the reason it is one who seizes for a creditor in a situation that a disadvantage for others, and one who seizes for a creditor in a situation that a disadvantage for others does not acquire
llm_translation: "What is the reason? - One who seizes the creditor in a place where he owes to others, and one who seizes the creditor in a place where he owes to others - has not acquired."

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ רָבָא לְרַב נַחְמָן: מְצִיאַת פּוֹעֵל לְעַצְמוֹ.
human_translation: Rava raised an objection to Rav Naḥman The found item of a laborer, to him
llm_translation: Rava raised an objection to Rav Nachman: "The finding of a worker for himself."

hebrew_text: בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים – בִּזְמַן שֶׁאָמַר לוֹ בַּעַל הַבַּיִת ״נַכֵּשׁ עִמִּי הַיּוֹם״, ״עֲדוֹר עִמִּי הַיּוֹם״. אֲבָל אָמַר לוֹ ״עֲשֵׂה עִמִּי מְלָאכָה הַיּוֹם״ – מְצִיאָתוֹ שֶׁל בַּעַל הַבַּיִת הוּא!
human_translation: In what is this statement, said? when the employer said to him: Weed for me today, Till for me today. But said to Work for me today, found item is the employer’s,
