llm_translation: In what case are these words spoken? - When the homeowner said to him, "Weave with me today," "Plow with me today." But if he said to him, "Do work with me today," it is the homeowner's finding!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: שָׁאנֵי פּוֹעֵל, דְּיָדוֹ כְּיַד בַּעַל הַבַּיִת הוּא.
human_translation: said to him: A laborer is different, as his hand is like the hand of the employer.
llm_translation: He said to him: "Different is the case of a hired laborer, for his hand is like the hand of the owner of the house."

hebrew_text: וְהָאָמַר רַב: פּוֹעֵל יָכוֹל לַחֲזוֹר בּוֹ אֲפִילּוּ בַּחֲצִי הַיּוֹם!
human_translation: But doesn’t Rav say a laborer may reconsider even at midday?
llm_translation: And he said, Rav: A worker is able to retract from it even in the middle of the day!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: כֹּל כַּמָּה דְּלָא הָדַר בֵּיהּ, כְּיַד בַּעַל הַבַּיִת הוּא. כִּי הֲדַר בֵּיהּ, טַעְמָא אַחֲרִינָא הוּא, דִּכְתִיב: ״כִּי לִי בְנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל עֲבָדִים, עֲבָדַי הֵם״ – וְלֹא עֲבָדִים לַעֲבָדִים.
human_translation: said to him: As long as he does not retract is like the employer’s hand. When retract is a different reason, as it is written: “For to Me the children of Israel are slaves; They are My slaves, and not slaves of slaves,
llm_translation: He said to him: All that does not dwell in it, is like the hand of the homeowner. For if it dwells in it, it is a different taste, as it is written: "For the children of Israel are My servants, they are My servants" - and not servants to servants.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הַמַּגְבִּיהַּ מְצִיאָה לַחֲבֵירוֹ – קָנָה חֲבֵירוֹ. וְאִם תֹּאמַר מִשְׁנָתֵינוּ, דְּאָמַר ״תְּנָהּ לִי״, וְלָא אָמַר ״זְכָהּ לִי״.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: one who lifting a found item on behalf of another, the other acquires And if you say our mishna where says Give to me, but does not say: Acquire for me.
llm_translation: Rabbi Hiyya bar Abba said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: One who lifts up his friend's lost object - his friend acquires it. And if you say, according to our Mishnah, that he said "Give it to me," and did not say "Acquire it for me."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ רָאָה אֶת הַמְּצִיאָה וְנָפַל עָלֶיהָ, וּבָא אַחֵר וְהֶחְזִיק בָּהּ – זֶה שֶׁהֶחְזִיק בָּהּ זָכָה בָּהּ.
human_translation: saw a found item and fell upon it, and another came and seized it, the one who seized it acquired it
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: If one saw a lost object and stumbled upon it, and another person came and picked it up - this is the one who picked it up, he acquired it.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ מִשּׁוּם אַבָּא כֹּהֵן בַּרְדְּלָא: אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת שֶׁל אָדָם קוֹנוֹת לוֹ בְּכׇל מָקוֹם. [מַאי טַעְמָא] תַּקִּינוּ רַבָּנַן, דְּלָא (אָתֵי) [לֵיתוֹ] לְאִנְּצוֹיֵי. אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: מוֹתֵיב רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר יוֹסֵף פֵּיאָה. אָמַר רָבָא: מוֹתֵיב רַבִּי יַעֲקֹב בַּר אִידִי נְזִיקִין.
human_translation: Reish Lakish says in the name of Abba Kohen Bardela: four cubits a person effects acquisition for him, everywhere. What is the reason The Sages instituted so that would not come to quarrel Abaye said Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Yosef raises an objection Pe’a . Rava said Rabbi Ya’akov bar Idi raises an objection Nezikin .
llm_translation: Gemara: Reish Lakish said in the name of Abba Kohen Bardela: Four cubits of a person acquire for him in every place. What is the reason? The Rabbis instituted it so that he does not come to negligence. Abaye said: Rabbi Chiya bar Yosef Piaah raised an objection. Rava said: Rabbi Yaakov bar Idi raised objections.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי, מוֹתֵיב רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר יוֹסֵף פֵּיאָה: נָטַל מִקְצָת פֵּיאָה וְזָרַק עַל הַשְּׁאָר – אֵין לוֹ בָּהּ כְּלוּם. נָפַל לוֹ עָלֶיהָ, פֵּרַס טַלִּיתוֹ עָלֶיהָ – מַעֲבִירִין אוֹתוֹ הֵימֶנָּה. וְכֵן בְּעוֹמֶר שִׁכְחָה.
human_translation: Abaye said Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Yosef raises an objection Pe’a took some of the pe’a and threw it on the rest he has nothing of it. he fell upon he spread his garment over it; remove him from And the same in a forgotten sheaf
llm_translation: Abaye said, Rabbi Chiya bar Yosef Peya interjected: He took some of the peya and threw it on the rest - it is of no value to him. If it fell on it, he spread his cloak over it - they remove it from him. And so with the forgotten sheaf.

hebrew_text: וְאִי אָמְרַתְּ אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת שֶׁל אָדָם קוֹנוֹת לוֹ בְּכׇל מָקוֹם, נִקְנוֹ לֵיהּ אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת דִּידֵיהּ!
human_translation: And if you say a person’s four cubits effects acquisition for him everywhere, let his four cubits effect acquisition for him.
llm_translation: "If you say, 'Four cubits of a person acquire for him in every place,' then he acquires for himself four cubits!"

hebrew_text: הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן – דְּלָא אֲמַר ״אֶקְנֵי״.
human_translation: With what are we dealing here? where he did not say: I will acquire
llm_translation: Here we are dealing with what? - That he did not say "I will acquire."

hebrew_text: וְאִי תַּקּוּן רַבָּנַן, כִּי לָא אֲמַר מַאי הָוֵי?!
human_translation: But if the Sages instituted where he did not say: what of it?
llm_translation: And if the Rabbis were to establish, for did he not say, "What is to be done?!"

hebrew_text: כֵּיוָן דִּנְפַל, גַּלִּי דַּעְתֵּיהּ דְּבִנְפִילָה נִיחָא לֵיהּ דְּנִקְנֵי, בְּאַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת לָא נִיחָא לֵיהּ דְּנִקְנֵי.
human_translation: Since he fell he revealed his intention: That it is satisfactory for him to acquire by falling it is not satisfactory for him to acquire through four cubits.
llm_translation: Since he fell, his mind was revealed that when he falls, it is pleasing to him to acquire, within four cubits it is not pleasing to him to acquire.

hebrew_text: רַב פָּפָּא אָמַר: כִּי תַּקִּינוּ לֵיה רַבָּנַן אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת – בְּעָלְמָא, בְּשָׂדֶה דְּבַעַל הַבַּיִת לָא תַּקִּינוּ לֵיה רַבָּנַן. וְאַף עַל גַּב דִּזְכָה לֵיהּ רַחֲמָנָא בְּגַוַּהּ, כִּי זְכָה לֵיהּ רַחֲמָנָא – לְהַלּוֹכֵי בַּהּ וּלְנַקּוֹטֵי פֵּיאָה, לְמִיהְוֵי חֲצֵירוֹ לָא זְכָה לֵיהּ רַחֲמָנָא.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said When the Sages instituted four cubits for him, in the world, the Sages did not institute for him in a field belonging to an owner. And even though the Merciful One accorded rights in when the Merciful One accorded him rights to walk in and to collect pe’a , the Merciful One did not accord him the right be considered his courtyard
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: When the Rabbis established four cubits - in general, in the field of the homeowner they did not establish four cubits for him. And even though the Merciful One granted him in his domain, when the Merciful One granted him - for those who walk in it and for those who pick the corners, if his courtyard did not merit the Merciful One did not grant him.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא, מוֹתֵיב רַבִּי יַעֲקֹב בַּר אִידִי נְזִיקִין: רָאָה אֶת הַמְּצִיאָה וְנָפַל לוֹ עָלֶיהָ וּבָא אַחֵר וְהֶחְזִיק בָּהּ, זֶה שֶׁהֶחְזִיק בָּהּ זָכָה בַּהּ. וְאִי אָמְרַתְּ אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת שֶׁל אָדָם קוֹנוֹת לוֹ בְּכׇל מָקוֹם – נִקְנוֹ לֵיהּ אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת דִּידֵיהּ!
human_translation: Rava said Rabbi Ya’akov bar Idi raises an objection Nezikin . saw a found item and fell upon it, and another came and seized it, the one who seized it acquired it. And if you say a person’s four cubits effect acquisition for him everywhere, let his four cubits effect acquisition for him.
llm_translation: Rava said, Rabbi Yaakov bar Idi Nezikin establishes: He saw the lost item and it fell upon him, and another came and held onto it, this one who held onto it acquired it. And if you say, "Four cubits of a person acquire for him everywhere," he acquires for himself four cubits!

hebrew_text: הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן, דְּלָא אֲמַר ״אֶקְנֵי״. וְאִי תַּקּוּן רַבָּנַן, כִּי לָא אֲמַר מַאי הָוֵי! כֵּיוָן דְּנָפַל עָלֶיהָ, גַּלִּי דַּעְתֵּיהּ דְּבִנְפִילָה נִיחָא לֵיהּ דְּנִקְנֵי, בְּאַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת לָא נִיחָא לֵיהּ דְּנִקְנֵי.
human_translation: Here we are dealing with where he did not say: I will acquire But if the Sages instituted when he did not say: what of it? Since he fell upon it, he revealed his intention that it is satisfactory for him to acquire by falling it is not satisfactory for him to acquire through four cubits.
llm_translation: Here we are dealing with what? That he did not say "I will acquire." And if the Rabbis were to establish it, for he did not say what will be! Since it fell upon it, it is revealed that in his mind, it is preferable to acquire through falling, but within four cubits, it is not preferable to him to acquire.

hebrew_text: רַב שֵׁשֶׁת אָמַר: כִּי תַּקִּינוּ רַבָּנַן, בְּסִמְטָא דְּלָא דָּחֲקִי רַבִּים. בִּרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים דְּקָא דָחֲקִי רַבִּים, לָא תַּקִּינוּ רַבָּנַן.
human_translation: Rav Sheshet said When the Sages instituted in an alleyway, where the multitudes do not crowd, the Sages did not institute in the public domain, where the multitudes crowd.
llm_translation: Rav Sheshet said: When the Rabbis established a decree, in a place where the public did not transgress, in a public domain where the public did transgress, the Rabbis did not establish the decree.

hebrew_text: וְהָא בְּכׇל מָקוֹם קָאָמַר!
human_translation: But he says everywhere?
llm_translation: And this, in every place, he said!

hebrew_text: כׇּל מָקוֹם – לְאֵתוֹיֵי צִידֵּי רְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים.
human_translation: everywhere to include the sides of the public domain,
llm_translation: Every place - to indicate the hunting of the public domain.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ מִשּׁוּם אַבָּא כֹּהֵן בַּרְדְּלָא: קְטַנָּה אֵין לָהּ חָצֵר, וְאֵין לָהּ אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת. וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי יַנַּאי אָמַר: יֵשׁ לָהּ חָצֵר, וְיֵשׁ לָהּ אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת.
human_translation: And Reish Lakish says in the name of Abba Kohen Bardela: A minor girl does not have courtyard, and she does not have four cubits. And Rabbi Yoḥanan says in the name of Rabbi Yannai she has courtyard, and she has four cubits.
llm_translation: And Reish Lakish said in the name of Abba Kohen Bardela: A minor does not have a courtyard, and she does not have four cubits. And Rabbi Yochanan said in the name of Rabbi Yannai: She has a courtyard, and she has four cubits.

hebrew_text: בְּמַאי קָמִיפַּלְגִי? מָר סָבַר חָצֵר מִשּׁוּם יָדָהּ אִיתְרַבַּאי, כִּי הֵיכִי דְּאִית לַהּ יָד – חָצֵר נָמֵי אִית לַהּ. וּמָר סָבַר חָצֵר מִשּׁוּם שְׁלִיחוּת אִיתְרַבַּאי, וְכִי הֵיכִי דִּשְׁלִיחוּת לֵית לַהּ – חָצֵר נָמֵי לֵית לַהּ.
human_translation: With regard to what do they disagree? Sage, holds a courtyard is included due to her hand. Just as has hand, she also has courtyard. And Sage, holds a courtyard is included due to agency; and just as has no agency, she does not have courtyard either.
llm_translation: With what do they argue? Master holds that a courtyard is acquired through her handmaid, for just as she has a hand, so too does the courtyard have one. And Master holds that a courtyard is acquired through agency, and just as it does not have agency, so too the courtyard does not have one.

hebrew_text: מִי אִיכָּא מַאן דְּאָמַר חָצֵר מִשּׁוּם שְׁלִיחוּת אִיתְרַבַּאי? וְהָתַנְיָא: ״בְּיָדוֹ״ – אֵין לִי אֶלָּא יָדוֹ. גַּגּוֹ, חֲצֵירוֹ וְקַרְפֵּיפוֹ מִנַּיִן – תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״הִמָּצֵא תִמָּצֵא״, מִכׇּל מָקוֹם.
human_translation: Is there anyone who says a courtyard is included due to agency? But isn’t it taught “in his possession [ beyado ],” I have only his hand [ yado ]. From where his roof, his yard, or his enclosure? The verse states “if shall be found [ himmatze timmatze ],” in any case,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Is there anyone who says that a courtyard can acquire on behalf of others? And it was taught: "In his hand" - I have nothing except his hand. How do we know about his roof, his courtyard, and his balcony? The Talmud teaches: "Whatever he finds, he shall find," in any case.

hebrew_text: וְאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ חָצֵר מִשּׁוּם שְׁלִיחוּת אִיתְרַבַּאי, אִם כֵּן מָצִינוּ שָׁלִיחַ לִדְבַר עֲבֵירָה, וְקַיְימָא לַן אֵין שָׁלִיחַ לִדְבַר עֲבֵירָה!
human_translation: And if it enters your mind a courtyard is included due to agency, if so, we have found agency for a transgression, But we maintain there is no agency for transgression.
llm_translation: And if it enters your mind that a courtyard can acquire ownership due to the agency of its residents, we find that there is an agent for transgression, and yet we hold that there is no agent for transgression!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבִינָא: הֵיכָא אָמְרִינַן דְּאֵין שָׁלִיחַ לִדְבַר עֲבֵירָה – הֵיכָא דְּשָׁלִיחַ בַּר חִיּוּבָא הוּא, אֲבָל בְּחָצֵר דְּלָאו בַּר חִיּוּבָא הוּא – מִיחַיַּיב שׁוֹלְחוֹ.
human_translation: Ravina said: where do we say that there is no agency for transgression? where agent is subject to liability But in a courtyard, which is not subject to liability, its sender, is liable.
llm_translation: Ravina said: Where do we say that there is no agent for transgression? Where the agent is one of obligation, but in a courtyard where he is not one of obligation, he obligates the one who sent him.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה, הָאוֹמֵר לְאִשָּׁה וְעֶבֶד: ״צְאוּ גִּנְבוּ לִי״ – דְּלָאו בְּנֵי חִיּוּבָא נִינְהוּ, הָכִי נָמֵי דְּמִיחַיַּיב שׁוֹלְחָן?!
human_translation: If that is so, one who says to a woman or a slave: Go out and steal for me, is the one who sent them indeed liable, since they are not subject to liability?
llm_translation: Rather from now, one who says to a woman and a slave, "Go steal for me" - since they are not his obligated sons, is it thus that he is obligated to provide them with a table?!

hebrew_text: אָמְרַתְּ אִשָּׁה וְעֶבֶד – בְּנֵי חִיּוּבָא נִינְהוּ, וְהַשְׁתָּא מִיהָא לֵית לְהוּ לְשַׁלּוֹמֵי. דִּתְנַן: נִתְגָּרְשָׁה הָאִשָּׁה, נִשְׁתַּחְרֵר הָעֶבֶד – חַיָּיבִין לְשַׁלֵּם.
human_translation: You can say A woman and a slave they are subject to liability and now, in any event, they do not have to pay. as we learned the woman becomes divorced the slave becomes emancipated, they are liable to pay
llm_translation: The woman and the slave - they are considered obligated individuals, and now they do not have peace. As we learned: If the woman was divorced, the slave was freed - they are obligated to pay.

hebrew_text: רַב סַמָּא אָמַר: הֵיכָא אָמְרִינַן אֵין שָׁלִיחַ לִדְבַר עֲבֵירָה – הֵיכָא דְּאִי בָּעֵי עָבֵיד וְאִי בָּעֵי לָא עָבֵיד, אֲבָל חָצֵר דִּבְעַל כֻּרְחֵיהּ מוֹתֵיב בַּהּ, מִיחַיַּיב שׁוֹלְחוֹ.
human_translation: Rav Samma stated Where do we say there is no agency for transgression? where if wants he can do and if he wants he can not do But a courtyard, where places without its consent, its sender, is liable.
llm_translation: Rav Sama said: Where do we say "there is no agent for sin"? Where if he wants to do, he does, and if he does not want to do, he does not do. But in the case of a courtyard that belongs to its owner, he is liable for sending his agent.

hebrew_text: מַאי בֵּינַיְיהוּ? אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ כֹּהֵן דְּאָמַר לֵיהּ לְיִשְׂרָאֵל: צֵא וְקַדֵּשׁ לִי אִשָּׁה גְּרוּשָׁה, אִי נָמֵי אִישׁ דְּאָמַר לַהּ לְאִשָּׁה: אַקִּפִי לִי קָטָן.
human_translation: What is between between them a priest who said to an Israelite: Go out and betroth a divorced woman for me. Alternatively, a man who said to a woman: Round a minor boy for me.
llm_translation: What is the difference between them? There is a difference between them, as a priest who says to an Israelite: "Go and sanctify for me a divorced woman," or if indeed a man says to a woman: "Acquire for me a minor."

hebrew_text: לְהָךְ לִישָּׁנָא דְּאָמַר כֹּל הֵיכָא דְּאִי בָּעֵי עָבֵיד אִי בָּעֵי לָא עָבֵיד – לָא מִיחַיַּיב שׁוֹלְחוֹ. הָנֵי נָמֵי אִי בָּעֵי עָבֵיד, אִי בָּעֵי לָא עָבֵיד – לָא מִיחַיַּיב שׁוֹלְחָן. לְהָךְ לִישָּׁנָא דְּאָמְרַתְּ כֹּל הֵיכָא דְּשָׁלִיחַ לָאו בַּר חִיּוּבָא מִיחַיַּיב שׁוֹלְחוֹ, הָנֵי נָמֵי כֵּיוָן דְּלָאו בְּנֵי חִיּוּבָא נִינְהוּ – מִיחַיַּיב שׁוּלְחָן.
human_translation: According to the formulation in which said anywhere that if wants he can do if he wants he can not do the one who sent him is not liable these too, if wants he can do if he wants he can not do the one who sent them is not liable. according to the formulation in which said wherever an agent is not subject to liability the one who sent him is liable, these too, since are not subject to liability, the one who sent them is liable.
llm_translation: To strike the case of what was said: wherever if he wants to do, if he doesn't want to do - he is not obligated to send. Those also, if he wants to do, if he doesn't want to do - he is not obligated to send a table. To strike the case of what you said: wherever a messenger is not in the category of obligation, he is obligated to send. Those also, since they are not in the category of obligation - he is obligated to send a table.

hebrew_text: וּמִי אִיכָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר חָצֵר לָאו מִשּׁוּם יָדָהּ אִיתְרַבַּאי? וְהָתַנְיָא: ״יָדָהּ״, אֵין לִי אֶלָּא יָדָהּ. גַּגָּהּ, חֲצֵירָהּ וְקַרְפֵּיפָהּ מִנַּיִן? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְנָתַן״ מִכׇּל מָקוֹם!
human_translation: But is there anyone who says a courtyard is not included due to her hand? But isn’t it taught in her hand” I have only her hand. From where her roof, her courtyard, or in her enclosure, The verse states: “And he gives,” in any case.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And is there anyone who holds that a courtyard is not considered an extension of one's hand? But it was taught: "her hand" - I have only her hand. How do we know that her roof, courtyard, and balcony are included? The Talmud teaches: "And he shall give" - from any place!

hebrew_text: לְעִנְיַן גֵּט כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְּלִיגִי דְּחָצֵר מִשּׁוּם יָדָהּ אִיתְרַבַּאי, כִּי פְּלִיגִי לְעִנְיַן מְצִיאָה. מָר סָבַר:
human_translation: With regard to a bill of divorce everyone agrees that a courtyard is included due to her hand. When they disagree, with regard to a found item Sage, holds
llm_translation: Regarding the matter of a bill of divorce, everyone agrees that a courtyard does not divide due to her handmaid, for they divide in the case of acquisition. Master holds:

hebrew_text: יָלְפִינַן מְצִיאָה מִגֵּט, וּמָר סָבַר: לָא יָלְפִינַן מְצִיאָה מִגֵּט.
human_translation: we derive a found item from a bill of divorce, and Sage, holds we do not derive a found item from a bill of divorce.
llm_translation: We inquire about finding from a divorce document, and Mar believes: We do not inquire about finding from a divorce document.

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: בִּקְטַנָּה כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְּלִיגִי דְּיָלְפִינַן מְצִיאָה מִגֵּט. וְהָכָא בְּקָטָן קָא מִיפַּלְגִי,
human_translation: And if you wish, say with regard to a minor girl, everyone agrees we derive a found item from a bill of divorce, And here they disagree with regard to a minor boy
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: In the case of a minor, everyone agrees that we do not separate a found object from a bill of divorce. And here, in the case of a minor, they are disagreeing.

hebrew_text: מָר סָבַר: יָלְפִינַן קָטָן מִקְּטַנָּה. וּמָר סָבַר: לָא יָלְפִינַן קָטָן מִקְּטַנָּה.
human_translation: Sage, holds we derive a minor boy from a minor girl, And Sage, holds we do not derive a minor boy from a minor girl;
llm_translation: Master says: We may separate a minor from a minor. And Master says: We may not separate a minor from a minor.

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: מָר אֲמַר חֲדָא, וּמָר אֲמַר חֲדָא וְלָא פְּלִיגִי.
human_translation: And if you wish, say Sage, said one and Sage, said another and they do not disagree.
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: One Master said one thing, and the other Master said another thing, and they do not disagree.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ רָאָה אוֹתָן רָצִין אַחַר מְצִיאָה, אַחַר צְבִי שָׁבוּר, אַחַר גּוֹזָלוֹת שֶׁלֹּא פֵּרְחוּ, וְאָמַר: ״זָכְתָה לִי שָׂדִי״ – זָכְתָה לוֹ. הָיָה צְבִי רָץ כְּדַרְכּוֹ, אוֹ שֶׁהָיוּ גּוֹזָלוֹת מַפְרִיחִין, וְאָמַר: ״זָכְתָה לִי שָׂדִי״ – לֹא אָמַר כְּלוּם.
human_translation: saw running after a found after a deer a broken after young pigeons that not fly, and he said: My field has effected acquisition for me, it has effected acquisition for him. deer were running in its manner, or young pigeons were flying, and he said: My field has effected acquisition for me, he has said nothing,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: If one saw deer running after finding something, after a broken gazelle, after fledgling birds that have not yet flown, and he said, "My field has gained merit," his field has indeed gained merit. If a deer was running in its usual manner, or if the fledgling birds were flying, and he said, "My field has gained merit," he has said nothing.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: וְהוּא שֶׁעוֹמֵד בְּצַד שָׂדֵהוּ.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says Shmuel says: And this where standing next to his field
llm_translation: Gemara: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: "And he who stands at the side of his field."

hebrew_text: וְתִקְנֵי לֵיהּ שָׂדֵהוּ, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: חֲצֵרוֹ שֶׁל אָדָם קוֹנָה לוֹ שֶׁלֹּא מִדַּעְתּוֹ!
human_translation: But shouldn’t his field effect acquisition for him As Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, says: A person’s courtyard effects acquisition for him without his knowledge.
llm_translation: And he fixes for him his field, as Rabbi Yosei son of Rabbi Chanina said: A person's courtyard acquires for him without his knowledge!

hebrew_text: הָנֵי מִילֵּי בְּחָצֵר הַמִּשְׁתַּמֶּרֶת, אֲבָל חָצֵר שֶׁאֵינָהּ מִשְׁתַּמֶּרֶת, אִי עוֹמֵד בְּצַד שָׂדֵהוּ – אִין, אִי לָא – לָא.
human_translation: This statement to a secured courtyard, But an unsecured courtyard, if standing next to his field, yes, if not, not
llm_translation: These are the matters in the courtyard that is guarded, but a courtyard that is not guarded, if it is standing next to his field - no, if not - no.

hebrew_text: וּמְנָא תֵּימְרָא דְּחָצֵר שֶׁאֵינָהּ מִשְׁתַּמֶּרֶת, אִי עוֹמֵד בְּצַד שָׂדֵהוּ – אִין, אִי לָא – לָא?
human_translation: And from where do you say that an unsecured courtyard, if standing next to his field, yes, if not, not
llm_translation: "And who says that a courtyard that is not preserved, if it is standing beside his field - no, if not - no?"

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא: הָיָה עוֹמֵד בָּעִיר וְאוֹמֵר, ״יוֹדֵעַ אֲנִי שֶׁעוֹמֶר שֶׁיֵּשׁ לִי בַּשָּׂדֶה פּוֹעֲלִים שְׁכֵחוּהוּ – לֹא יְהֵא שִׁכְחָה״, יָכוֹל לֹא יְהֵא שִׁכְחָה – תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְשָׁכַחְתָּ עֹמֶר בַּשָּׂדֶה״, ״בַּשָּׂדֶה וְשָׁכַחְתָּ״ – וְלֹא בָּעִיר.
human_translation: As it is taught was standing in the town and saying: I know that laborers forgot a sheaf that I have in the field, it shall not be a forgotten might that it is not a forgotten the verse states: and have forgotten a sheaf in the field, “And have forgotten” “in the field,” but not in the town.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: It was taught: If one was standing in the city and saying, "I know that I have a forgotten sheaf in the field - it shall not be forgotten," one might think it shall not be forgotten - therefore the Scripture states: "And you forgot a sheaf in the field," "in the field and you forgot" - but not in the city.

hebrew_text: הָא גּוּפַהּ קַשְׁיָא: אָמְרַתְּ יָכוֹל לֹא יְהֵא שִׁכְחָה – אַלְמָא הָוֵי שִׁכְחָה, וְנָסֵיב לַהּ תַּלְמוּדָא ״בַּשָּׂדֶה וְשָׁכַחְתָּ״ וְלֹא בָּעִיר, אַלְמָא לָא הָוֵי שִׁכְחָה!
human_translation: This itself difficult. you said might that it is not a forgotten apparently it is a forgotten And adduces the derivation “and have forgotten” “in the field,” but not in the town, apparently is not a forgotten
llm_translation: This is a difficult matter: You said, "It is possible that it should not be forgotten" - implying that it should be forgotten. And he brought her a proof from the verse "And you shall forget in the field" and not in the city, implying that it should not be forgotten!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לָאו הָכִי קָאָמַר: בַּשָּׂדֶה – שָׁכוּחַ מֵעִיקָּרוֹ הָוֵי שִׁכְחָה, זָכוּר וּלְבַסּוֹף שָׁכוּחַ אֵין שִׁכְחָה, מַאי טַעְמָא – דְּכֵיוָן דְּקָאֵי גַּבַּהּ, הָוְיָא לַיהּ חֲצֵרוֹ וְזָכְתָה לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rather, isn’t this what is saying: in the field, forgotten at the outset, it is a forgotten it remembered and ultimately forgotten, not a forgotten What is the reason that since he is standing beside is his courtyard, and effects acquisition for him
llm_translation: Rather, this is what he is saying: "In the field" - if it is forgotten from the outset, it is considered forgotten. If it is remembered but ultimately forgotten, it is not considered forgotten. What is the reason? Because since it is standing tall, its courtyard is considered part of it, and it remains in its possession.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל בָּעִיר, אֲפִילּוּ זָכוּר וּלְבַסּוֹף שָׁכוּחַ – הָוְיָא שִׁכְחָה. מַאי טַעְמָא – דְּלֵיתֵיהּ גַּבֵּיהּ דְּלִזְכֵּי לֵיהּ.
human_translation: But in the town, even remembered and ultimately forgotten, it is a forgotten What is the reason because is not beside it, for to effect acquisition for him.
llm_translation: But in the city, even if it is remembered and ultimately forgotten - it is considered forgotten. What is the reason? Because he does not pay attention to it.

hebrew_text: מִמַּאי? דִּלְמָא גְּזֵירַת הַכָּתוּב הִיא, דְּבַשָּׂדֶה נֶהֱוֵי שִׁכְחָה וּבָעִיר לָא נֶהֱוֵי שִׁכְחָה!
human_translation: From where Perhaps It is a Torah edict that in the field, it is a forgotten but in the town, it is not a forgotten
llm_translation: From where? Perhaps it is a decree of the Scripture, that in a field it should be considered forgotten, but in a city it should not be considered forgotten!

hebrew_text: אָמַר קְרָא: ״לֹא תָּשׁוּב לְקַחְתּוֹ״, לְרַבּוֹת שִׁכְחַת הָעִיר.
human_translation: the verse states: “You shall not go back to take it” to include forgotten the town.
llm_translation: The verse says: "You shall not return to take it," to include forgetting the city.

hebrew_text: הַאי מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְלָאו!
human_translation: This necessary to a prohibition
llm_translation: This one requires for him to be without!

hebrew_text: אִם כֵּן נֵימָא קְרָא ״לֹא תִּקָּחֶנּוּ״, מַאי ״לֹא תָּשׁוּב״ – לְרַבּוֹת שִׁכְחַת הָעִיר.
human_translation: If so, let the verse say: You shall not take it. What “You shall not go back to include forgotten the town.
llm_translation: If so, let us say: the verse states "you shall not take it," what is "you shall not return" - to include forgetting the city.

hebrew_text: וְאַכַּתִּי מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ, לִכְדִתְנַן: שֶׁלְּפָנָיו – אֵין שִׁכְחָה, שֶׁלְּאַחֲרָיו – יֵשׁ שִׁכְחָה, שֶׁהוּא בְּבַל תָּשׁוּב.
human_translation: But is still necessary for that which we learned that before him, not a forgotten that is behind him has a forgotten as the prohibition of: You shall not go back,
llm_translation: And once he asked him, as we have learned: "That which is before him - there is no forgetfulness, that which is after him - there is forgetfulness, for it is written in Babylonian, 'you shall not return.'"

hebrew_text: זֶה הַכְּלָל: כֹּל שֶׁהוּא בְּבַל תָּשׁוּב – שִׁכְחָה, כֹּל שֶׁאֵינוֹ בְּבַל תָּשׁוּב – אֵינוֹ שִׁכְחָה!
human_translation: This is the principle: Any to which the prohibition of: You shall not go back, a forgotten any to which the prohibition of: You shall not go back, not not a forgotten
llm_translation: This is the principle: Anything that is in a state of "Bavel Tashuv" - forgetfulness, anything that is not in a state of "Bavel Tashuv" - is not forgetfulness!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי, אָמַר קְרָא ״יִהְיֶה״ – לְרַבּוֹת שִׁכְחַת הָעִיר.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said The verse states: “It shall be” to include forgotten the town.
llm_translation: Rav Ashei said, the verse says "yihyeh" - to include the forgetfulness of the city.

hebrew_text: וְכֵן אָמַר עוּלָּא: וְהוּא שֶׁעוֹמֵד בְּצַד שָׂדֵהוּ. וְכֵן אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה: וְהוּא שֶׁעוֹמֵד בְּצַד שָׂדֵהוּ.
human_translation: And Ulla also says is where is standing next to his field. And Rabba bar bar Ḥana also says is where he is standing next to his field.
llm_translation: And so said Ula: And he who stands at the side of his field. And so said Rabbah bar bar Ḥana: And he who stands at the side of his field.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ רַבִּי אַבָּא לְעוּלָּא: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל וּזְקֵנִים שֶׁהָיוּ בָּאִים בִּסְפִינָה. אָמַר רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל: עִישּׂוּר שֶׁאֲנִי עָתִיד לָמוֹד נָתוּן לִיהוֹשֻׁעַ,
human_translation: Rabbi Abba raised an objection to Ulla an incident involving Rabban Gamliel and Elders, who were traveling on a ship. Rabban Gamliel said One-tenth which I will measure out in the future is given to Yehoshua
llm_translation: He raised an objection to him, Rabbi Abba to Ulai: There was an incident with Rabban Gamliel and elders who were coming on a ship. Rabban Gamliel said: The explanation that I am destined to learn is given to Joshua,

hebrew_text: וּמְקוֹמוֹ מוּשְׂכָּר לוֹ. וְעִישּׂוּר אַחֵר שֶׁאֲנִי עָתִיד לָמוֹד, נָתוּן לַעֲקִיבָא בֶּן יוֹסֵף, כְּדֵי שֶׁיִּזְכֶּה בּוֹ לַעֲנִיִּים, וּמְקוֹמוֹ מוּשְׂכָּר לוֹ.
human_translation: and the place of is rented to him. And another one-tenth that I will measure out in the future is given to Akiva ben Yosef so that he will acquire it for the poor, and its place is rented to him.
llm_translation: And his place is rented to him. And another issue that I am destined to learn, given to Akiva son of Joseph, so that he may merit the poor, and his place is rented to him.

hebrew_text: וְכִי רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ וְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא בְּצַד שָׂדֵהוּ שֶׁל רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל הָיוּ עוֹמְדִין?
human_translation: But were Rabbi Yehoshua and Rabbi Akiva standing next to Rabban Gamliel’s field
llm_translation: And when Rabbi Yehoshua and Rabbi Akiva were on the outskirts of the field of Rabban Gamliel, were they standing?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: דָּמֵי הַאי מֵרַבָּנַן כִּדְלָא גָּמְרִי אִינָשֵׁי שְׁמַעְתָּא.
human_translation: said to him: This one of the Sages seems like one who has not studied halakha .
llm_translation: He said to him: The money of this Rabbi is like those who have not completed their learning.

hebrew_text: כִּי אֲתָא לְסוּרָא אֲמַר לְהוּ: הָכִי אָמַר עוּלָּא וְהָכִי אוֹתְבִיתֵיהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ הָהוּא מֵרַבָּנַן: רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל מִטַּלְטְלֵי אַגַּב מְקַרְקְעֵי הִקְנָה לָהֶם. רַבִּי זֵירָא קַבְּלַהּ, רַבִּי אַבָּא לָא קַבְּלַהּ.
human_translation: When came to Sura, saying to them: This is what Ulla said, and this is how I challenged him. One of the Sages said to him: Rabban Gamliel transferred ownership of movable property, to by means of land. Rabbi Zeira accepted Rabbi Abba did not accept it.
llm_translation: When he came to Sura, he said to them: "Thus said Ulai and thus I have written." That Sage said to him: "Rabban Gamliel would move the beams for them on the festival of Sukkot." Rabbi Zeira accepted it, but Rabbi Abba did not accept it.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: שַׁפִּיר עֲבַיד דְּלָא קַבְּלַהּ, וְכִי לֹא הָיָה לָהֶם סוּדָר לִקְנוֹת מִמֶּנּוּ בַּחֲלִיפִין? אֶלָּא טוֹבַת הֲנָאָה אֵינָהּ מָמוֹן לִקְנוֹת מִמֶּנּוּ בַּחֲלִיפִין. הָכָא נָמֵי טוֹבַת הֲנָאָה אֵינָהּ מָמוֹן לִקְנוֹת עַל גַּבֵּי קַרְקַע.
human_translation: Rava said: did well by not accepting did they not have a cloth to acquire from him by means of exchange? Rather, the benefit of discretion, is not property that can be acquired by means of exchange. Here, too, benefit of discretion is not property that can be acquired by means of land.
llm_translation: Rava said: It is well that they did not accept it, for did they not have a garment to purchase from him with the exchange? Rather, the benefit of pleasure is not considered money to purchase from him with the exchange. Here too, the benefit of pleasure is not considered money to purchase on land.

hebrew_text: וְלָא הִיא, מַתְּנוֹת כְּהוּנָּה נְתִינָה כְּתִיבָא בְּהוּ. חֲלִיפִין, דֶּרֶךְ מִקָּח וּמִמְכָּר הוּא. מִטַּלְטְלִין אַגַּב מִקַּרְקַע, נְתִינָה אַלִּימְתָּא הִיא.
human_translation: But is not so. With regard to gifts of the priesthood giving is written exchange is a form of buying and selling, movable property by means of land is a powerful giving.
llm_translation: "And not this, gifts of priesthood given as written in it. Exchanges, a way of transaction and sale it is. Moving vessels above the ground, it is considered a valid acquisition."

hebrew_text: רַב פָּפָּא אָמַר: דַּעַת אַחֶרֶת מַקְנָה אוֹתָן שָׁאנֵי.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: another mind, transferred their ownership is different,
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: Another opinion acquires them differently.

hebrew_text: וּמְנָא תֵּימְרַאּ – דִּתְנַן: רָאָה אוֹתָן רָצִין אַחַר הַמְּצִיאָה כּוּ׳, וְאָמַר רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: וְהוּא שֶׁרָץ אַחֲרֵיהֶן וּמַגִּיעָן. וּבָעֵי רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה, בְּמַתָּנָה הֵיאַךְ? קַבְּלַהּ מִינֵּיהּ רַבִּי אַבָּא בַּר כָּהֲנָא אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁרָץ אַחֲרֵיהֶן וְאֵין מַגִּיעָן. מַאי טַעְמָא – לָאו מִשּׁוּם דְּדַעַת אַחֶרֶת מַקְנָה אוֹתָן שָׁאנֵי?!
human_translation: And from where do you state As we learned saw running after a found And Rabbi Yirmeya says Rabbi Yoḥanan says is where he run after them and catch them. And Rabbi Yirmeya raises a dilemma: Does as a gift Rabbi Abba bar Kahana accepted of even if he not run after them and catch them. What is the reason not because another mind transfers their ownership, is different,
llm_translation: "And count you shall say - as we learned: If one saw them running after the discovery, etc., and Rabbi Yirmiyah said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: And it is as if a swarm of vermin follows them and reaches them. And Rabbi Yirmiyah asked, in a gift, how so? Rabbi Abba bar Kahana received it even though a swarm follows them and does not reach them. What is the reason? - Is it not because another knowledge acquires them differently?!"

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב שִׁימִי לְרַב פָּפָּא: הֲרֵי גֵּט, דְּדַעַת אַחֶרֶת – מַקְנָה אוֹתָהּ, וְאָמַר עוּלָּא: וְהוּא שֶׁעוֹמֶדֶת בְּצַד בֵּיתָהּ אוֹ בְּצַד חֲצֵרָהּ. שָׁאנֵי גֵּט דְּאִיתֵיהּ בְּעַל כׇּרְחָהּ.
human_translation: Rav Shimi said to Rav Pappa: But a bill of divorce, where another mind, transfers its ownership and Ulla says But it is she is standing next to her house or next to her courtyard? A bill of divorce is different, as it is against her will.
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Shimi to Rav Papa: "Here is a bill of divorce, with the consent of another - she acquires it." And Ulah said: "And this is when she is standing at the side of her house or at the side of her courtyard." This is different from a bill of divorce that is given to her against her will.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב שֵׁשֶׁת בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אִידִי: וְלָאו קַל וָחוֹמֶר הוּא – וּמָה גֵּט דְּאִיתֵיהּ בְּעַל כׇּרְחָהּ, אִי עוֹמֶדֶת בְּצַד בֵּיתָהּ וּבְצַד חֲצֵרָהּ – אִין, אִי לָא – לָא. מַתָּנָה דְּמִדַּעְתֵּיהּ לֹא כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן!
human_translation: Rav Sheshet, son of Rav Idi, objects to this But is it not an a fortiori If a bill of divorce, which is against her will, if she is standing next to her house or next to her courtyard does if not not a gift, which willingly, not all the more so
llm_translation: Rav Sheshet son of Rav Idi objects to her: And it is not a fortiori - And what about a divorce document that her husband forced her to accept, if she stands on the side of her house and on the side of her courtyard - No, if not - No. A gift given willingly is certainly not the same!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי:
human_translation: Rather, Rav Ashi said
llm_translation: Rather, Rav Ashe said:

hebrew_text: חָצֵר אִיתְרַבַּאי מִשּׁוּם יָד וְלָא גָּרְעָה מִשְּׁלִיחוּת. גַּבֵּי גֵּט דְּחוֹב הוּא לָהּ: אֵין חָבִין לְאָדָם אֶלָּא בְּפָנָיו. גַּבֵּי מַתָּנָה דִּזְכוּת הוּא לוֹ: זָכִין לְאָדָם שֶׁלֹּא בְּפָנָיו.
human_translation: courtyard is included due to hand; but it is no less than agency. with regard to a bill of divorce, which is detrimental to one cannot act against the interests of a person unless in his presence. with regard to a gift, which is beneficial for one can act in a person’s interest in his absence.
llm_translation: The courtyard of Itrabai argued on behalf of the hand, but did not diminish from the agency. Regarding a bill of divorce that is a debt to her: we do not obligate a person except in his presence. Regarding a gift that is a merit for him: we grant a person the right to receive it not in his presence.

hebrew_text: גּוּפָא. רָאָה אוֹתָן רָצִין אַחַר הַמְּצִיאָה וְכוּ׳. אָמַר רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: וְהוּא שֶׁרָץ אַחֲרֵיהֶן וּמַגִּיעָן. בָּעֵי רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה: בְּמַתָּנָה הֵיאַךְ? קַבְּלַהּ מִינֵּיהּ רַבִּי אַבָּא בַּר כָּהֲנָא: אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁרָץ אַחֲרֵיהֶן וְאֵין מַגִּיעָן.
human_translation: the itself. saw running after a found Rabbi Yirmeya says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: And is where he run after them and catch them. Rabbi Yirmeya raises a dilemma: Does as a gift Rabbi Abba bar Kahana accepted of even if he not run after them and catch them.
llm_translation: Body. He saw them running after the discovery, etc. Rabbi Yirmeya said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: And he who crawls after them and reaches them. Rabbi Yirmeya asked: How is it with a gift? Rabbi Abba bar Kahana received it: Even though he crawls after them and does not reach them.

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי רָבָא: זָרַק אַרְנָקִי בְּפֶתַח זֶה וְיָצָא בְּפֶתַח אַחֵר, מַהוּ? אֲוִיר שֶׁאֵין סוֹפוֹ לָנוּחַ כְּמוּנָּח דָּמֵי, אוֹ לָא?
human_translation: Rava raises a dilemma: threw a purse through this entrance and exited through another entrance, what is airspace [ avir ] that will not eventually come to rest as though it has come to rest, or not
llm_translation: Ba'ei Rava: zarakh arnaki be'pethakh zeh ve'yatza be'pethakh akher, mah? avir she'ein sofo lanuakh kemunakh damei, o lo?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב פָּפָּא לְרָבָא, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ רַב אַדָּא בַּר מַתְנָה לְרָבָא, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ רָבִינָא לְרָבָא: לָאו הַיְינוּ מַתְנִיתִין. רָאָה אוֹתָן רָצִין אַחַר הַמְּצִיאָה, וְאָמַר רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: וְהוּא שֶׁרָץ אַחֲרֵיהֶן וּמַגִּיעָן, וּבָעֵי רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה: בְּמַתָּנָה הֵיאַךְ? וְקַבְּלַהּ מִינֵּיהּ רַבִּי אַבָּא בַּר כָּהֲנָא: בְּמַתָּנָה אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁרָץ אַחֲרֵיהֶן וְאֵין מַגִּיעָן.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said to Rava, and some say Rav Adda bar Mattana to Rava, and some say Ravina to Rava: Isn’t this the mishna? saw running after a found And Rabbi Yirmeya says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: And is where he run after them and catch them. Rabbi Yirmeya raises a dilemma: Does as a gift Rabbi Abba bar Kahana accepted of even if he not run after them and catch them.
llm_translation: Rav Papa said to Rava, and some say Rav Adda bar Matna said to Rava, and some say Ravina said to Rava: This is not in accordance with the Mishnah. He saw them running after the discovery, and Rabbi Yirmeya said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: And it is like a creeping thing following after them and reaching them. And Rabbi Yirmeya asked: How is it with regard to a gift? And Rabbi Abba bar Kahana received it from him: With regard to a gift, even though a creeping thing follows after them and does not reach them.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ, מִתְגַּלְגֵּל קָאָמְרַתְּ? שָׁאנֵי מִתְגַּלְגֵּל דִּכְמוּנָּח דָּמֵי.
human_translation: said to him: Are you saying rolling, A rolling is different, as it is as though it has come to rest.
llm_translation: He said to him, "Are you rolling?" It is different, for a rolling stone resembles blood.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ מְצִיאַת בְּנוֹ וּבִתּוֹ הַקְּטַנִּים, מְצִיאַת עַבְדּוֹ וְשִׁפְחָתוֹ הַכְּנַעֲנִים, מְצִיאַת אִשְׁתּוֹ – הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ שֶׁלּוֹ. מְצִיאַת בְּנוֹ וּבִתּוֹ הַגְּדוֹלִים, מְצִיאַת עַבְדּוֹ וְשִׁפְחָתוֹ הָעִבְרִים, מְצִיאַת אִשְׁתּוֹ שֶׁגֵּירְשָׁהּ, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁלֹּא נָתַן כְּתוּבָּה – הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ שֶׁלָּהֶן.
human_translation: the found item of minor son or daughter, the found item of his Canaanite slave or maidservant; the found item of his wife, they are his. the found item of adult son or daughter; the found item of his Hebrew slave or maidservant; the found item of his wife, whom he divorced, even if he has not given marriage contract they are theirs.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: If one finds his minor son or daughter, his Canaanite slave or maidservant, or his wife - these belong to him. If one finds his adult son or daughter, his Hebrew slave or maidservant, or his divorced wife, even though he did not give her a marriage contract - these belong to them.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: מִפְּנֵי מָה אָמְרוּ מְצִיאַת קָטָן לְאָבִיו – שֶׁבְּשָׁעָה שֶׁמּוֹצְאָהּ מְרִיצָהּ אֵצֶל אָבִיו, וְאֵינוֹ מְאַחֵר בְּיָדוֹ.
human_translation: Shmuel says: For what did say the found item of minor to his father? as when he finds it, he runs with it to his father and does not retain in his possession.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemara said Shmuel: Why did they say the finding of a minor belongs to his father - because at the time he finds it, he runs to his father, and he does not delay with it in his hand.

hebrew_text: לְמֵימְרָא דְּסָבַר שְׁמוּאֵל קָטָן לֵית לֵיהּ זְכִיָּיה לְנַפְשֵׁיהּ מִדְּאוֹרָיְיתָא? וְהָתַנְיָא: הַשּׂוֹכֵר אֶת הַפּוֹעֵל – יְלַקֵּט בְּנוֹ אַחֲרָיו. לְמֶחֱצָה, לִשְׁלִישׁ וְלִרְבִיעַ – לֹא יְלַקֵּט בְּנוֹ אַחֲרָיו. רַבִּי יוֹסִי אוֹמֵר: בֵּין כָּךְ וּבֵין כָּךְ יְלַקֵּט בְּנוֹ וְאִשְׁתּוֹ אַחֲרָיו. וְאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי.
human_translation: to say that Shmuel holds a minor does not have acquiring for himself by Torah law? But isn’t it taught one who hires laborer the son of may glean behind one-half, one-third, or one-quarter his son may not glean after him, Rabbi Yosei says: both this and that son and wife may glean after him. And Shmuel says halakha in accordance with Rabbi Yosei.
llm_translation: In the matter that Shmuel holds, does a minor not have merit for himself from the Torah? And it was taught: One who hires a laborer - his son may glean after him. For half, for a third, and for a quarter - his son may not glean after him. Rabbi Yosi says: In either case, his son and his wife may glean after him. And Shmuel said: The halakha is according to Rabbi Yosei.

hebrew_text: אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא קָטָן אִית לֵיהּ זְכִיָּיה לְנַפְשֵׁיהּ, כִּי קָא מְלַקֵּט – לְנַפְשֵׁיהּ קָא מְלַקֵּט, וַאֲבוּהּ מִינֵּיהּ קָא זָכֵי. אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ קָטָן לֵית לֵיהּ זְכִיָּיה לְנַפְשֵׁיהּ, כִּי קָא מְלַקֵּט – לְאָבִיו קָא מְלַקֵּט, אֲבוּהּ עָשִׁיר הוּא, אַמַּאי אִשְׁתּוֹ וּבְנוֹ מְלַקֵּט אַחֲרָיו?
human_translation: Granted, if you say a minor has acquiring for himself, when gleans he gleans for himself and his father acquires from him But if you say a minor does not have acquiring for himself, when he gleans he gleans for his father. his father is wealthy why may his wife and son glean after him?
llm_translation: If you say that when a minor collects, he collects for himself, and his father benefits from him, then if the minor does not have the right to collect for himself, when he collects, he collects for his father. His father is wealthy, so why does his wife and son collect after him?

hebrew_text: שְׁמוּאֵל, טַעְמָא דְּתַנָּא דִּידַן קָאָמַר, וְלֵיהּ לָא סְבִירָא לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Shmuel is stating the reason of the tanna of our but he himself does not hold accordingly.
llm_translation: Shmuel, the reason of our Mishna, is saying, and to him it does not seem correct.

hebrew_text: וְסָבַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי קָטָן אִית לֵיהּ זְכִיָּיה מִדְּאוֹרָיְיתָא? וְהָתְנַן: מְצִיאַת חֵרֵשׁ, שׁוֹטֶה וְקָטָן יֵשׁ בָּהֶן מִשּׁוּם גָּזֵל מִפְּנֵי דַּרְכֵי שָׁלוֹם. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: גָּזֵל גָּמוּר.
human_translation: And does Rabbi Yosei hold a minor has acquiring by Torah But didn’t we learn found items of a deaf-mute, an imbecile, or a minor, is considered robbery, for the sake of the ways of peace. Rabbi Yosei says: full-fledged robbery.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And Rabbi Yosei Katan thought, does it have a merit from the Torah? And we learned: The finding of a deaf-mute, an imbecile, and a minor, there is in them the aspect of theft due to ways of peace. Rabbi Yosei says: It is outright theft.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: גָּזֵל גָּמוּר מִדִּבְרֵיהֶן. נָפְקָא מִינַּהּ לְהוֹצִיאָהּ בְּדַיָּינִין.
human_translation: And Rav Ḥisda says full-fledged robbery by rabbinic the difference it is appropriated by the judges
llm_translation: And Rav Hisda said: Complete theft from their words. It emerged from her to bring it out in judgments.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: עֲשָׂאוּהָ כְּמִי שֶׁהָלְכוּ בָּהּ נָמוֹשׁוֹת. דַּעֲנִיִּים גּוּפַיְיהוּ מַסְּחִי דַּעְתַּיְיהוּ. סָבְרִי: בְּרֵיהּ דְּהַיְאךְ מְלַקֵּטי לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rather, Abaye said: rendered like one through which the last gleaners have walked. since poor themselves dismiss from their minds; they assume the son of this is gleaning for him
llm_translation: Rather, Abaye said: Make it like those who walked in it have withered. Their bodies are weak, their minds are weak. They thought: the son of how they gather it.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אַדָּא בַּר מַתְנָה לְאַבָּיֵי: וְכִי מוּתָּר לָאָדָם לְהַרְבִּיץ אֲרִי בְּתוֹךְ שָׂדֵהוּ כְּדֵי שֶׁיִּרְאוּ עֲנִיִּים וְיִבְרְחוּ?
human_translation: Rav Adda bar Mattana said to Abaye: But Is a person permitted to have a lion crouch in his field so that the poor will see and flee?
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Adda bar Matna to Abbaye: Is it permitted for a person to place a lion in the midst of his field so that the poor may see it and flee?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא:
human_translation: Rather, Rava stated
llm_translation: Rather, Rava said:

hebrew_text: עָשׂוּ שֶׁאֵינוֹ זוֹכֶה כְּזוֹכֶה, מַאי טַעְמָא – עֲנִיִּים גּוּפַיְיהוּ נִיחָא לְהוּ, כִּי הֵיכִי דְּכִי אָגְרוּ לְדִידְהוּ נִלְקוֹט בְּנַיְיהוּ בָּתְרַיְיהוּ.
human_translation: rendering who does not acquire like one who acquire What is the reason satisfactory for the poor people themselves, so that when they are hired themselves, their sons will glean after them.
llm_translation: They did that which is not meritorious like that which is meritorious, what is the reason? - The poor themselves are pleasing to them, for in the same way that they gather for themselves, they gather for their children after them.

hebrew_text: וּפְלִיגָא דְּרַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: לֹא גָּדוֹל – גָּדוֹל מַמָּשׁ, וְלֹא קָטָן – קָטָן מַמָּשׁ, אֶלָּא גָּדוֹל וְסָמוּךְ עַל שֻׁלְחָן אָבִיו – זֶהוּ קָטָן. קָטָן וְאֵינוֹ סָמוּךְ עַל שֻׁלְחָן אָבִיו – זֶהוּ גָּדוֹל.
human_translation: And disagrees of Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba. As Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: adult is not an actual adult, and minor is not an actual minor. Rather, an adult dependent on his father’s table this is a minor a minor not dependent on his father’s table this is an adult
llm_translation: Dispute of Rabbi Chiya bar Abba. For Rabbi Chiya bar Abba said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: Not big - truly big, and not small - truly small, but big and adjacent to the table of his father - this is small. Small and not adjacent to the table of his father - this is big.

hebrew_text: מְצִיאַת עַבְדּוֹ וְשִׁפְחָתוֹ הָעִבְרִים הֲרֵי הוּא שֶׁל עַצְמָן. אַמַּאי לֹא יְהֵא אֶלָּא פּוֹעֵל? וְתַנְיָא: מְצִיאַת פּוֹעֵל לְעַצְמוֹ. בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים – בִּזְמַן שֶׁאָמַר לוֹ: ״נַכֵּשׁ עִמִּי הַיּוֹם״, ״עֲדוֹר עַמִּי הַיּוֹם״.
human_translation: The found item of his Hebrew slave or maidservant, it is theirs. Why Let be merely a laborer; and it is taught The found item of a laborer, to him In what is this statement, said? when the employer said to him: Weed for me today, Till for me today.
llm_translation: Discovery of his slave and his maidservant, the Hebrews, behold, they are considered as their own. Why should it not be only regarding a worker? And it was taught: Discovery of a worker for himself. In what case are these matters said? When he said to him, "Graze with me today," "Plow with me today."

hebrew_text: אֲבָל אָמַר לוֹ ״עֲשֵׂה עִמִּי מְלָאכָה הַיּוֹם״ – מְצִיאָתוֹ לְבַעַל הַבַּיִת.
human_translation: But said to Work for me today, found item is the employer’s,
llm_translation: But he said to him, "Do work with me today" - his finding is for the homeowner.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הָכָא בְּעֶבֶד נוֹקֵב מַרְגָּלִיּוֹת עָסְקִינַן, שֶׁאֵין רַבּוֹ רוֹצֶה לְשַׁנּוֹתוֹ לִמְלָאכָה אַחֶרֶת.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Here we are dealing with a slave who pierces pearls [ margaliyyot ], which his master would not want to transfer him to another work
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Chiya bar Abba said Rabbi Yochanan: Here we are dealing with a slave who pierces sandals, for his master does not want to change him to another occupation.

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר: בְּמַגְבִּיהַּ מְצִיאָה עִם מְלַאכְתּוֹ עָסְקִינַן.
human_translation: Rava said: We are dealing with lifts a found item with his work.
llm_translation: Rava said: In the case of one who finds an object while engaged in his work, we are dealing with.

hebrew_text: רַב פָּפָּא אָמַר: כְּגוֹן שֶׁשְּׂכָרוֹ לְלַקֵּט מְצִיאוֹת. וְהֵיכִי דָּמֵי? דְּאַקְּפַי אַגְמָא בִּכְווֹרֵי.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: where he hired him to collect found items. But what are the circumstances where a lake flooded with fish,
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: For example, when his wage is to gather produce. And how so? Because he is diligent in vineyards.

hebrew_text: הַאי שִׁפְחָה הֵיכִי דָמֵי? אִי דְּאַיְיתַי שְׁתֵּי שְׂעָרוֹת, מַאי בָּעֲיָא גַּבֵּיהּ?
human_translation: What are the circumstances of this maidservant? If who has grown two hairs, why is she with
llm_translation: This maidservant, how is she comparable? If she brings two hairs, what does her master require of her?

hebrew_text: וְאִי דְּלָא אַיְיתַי שְׁתֵּי שְׂעָרוֹת, אִי אִיתֵיהּ לְאָב – דַּאֲבוּהּ הָוְיָא! וְאִי דְּלֵיתֵיהּ לָאָב – תִּיפּוֹק בְּמִיתַת הָאָב.
human_translation: And if who has not grown two hairs if father is is her father’s, and if father is not she should have gone free with the death of her father.
llm_translation: If he does not bring two hairs, if he has a father - he is considered a father! And if he does not have a father - he shall be removed by the death of the father.

hebrew_text: דְּאָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: אָמָה הָעִבְרִיָּה קֹנָה עַצְמָהּ בְּמִיתַת הָאָב מֵרְשׁוּת הָאָדוֹן מִקַּל וָחוֹמֶר. וְלָאו אִיתּוֹתַב רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ?
human_translation: As Reish Lakish says: A Hebrew maidservant acquires herself through the death of father, from an a fortiori But wasn’t Reish Lakish conclusively refuted?
llm_translation: As Reish Lakish said: A Hebrew maidservant acquires herself through the death of her father from the ownership of her master by way of a fortiori argument. And is it not written, Reish Lakish?

hebrew_text: נֵימָא מֵהַאי נָמֵי תֶּיהְוֵי תְּיוּבְתָּא!
human_translation: Let us say there is a conclusive refutation from this as well.
llm_translation: "Neima from this, Nami, should be a good improvement!"

hebrew_text: לָא, לְעוֹלָם דְּאִיתֵיהּ לְאָב, וּמַאי ״הֲרֵי הֵן שֶׁלָּהֶן״ – לְאַפּוֹקֵי דְּרַבָּה.
human_translation: not actually where the father is And what They are theirs? to exclude to her master.
llm_translation: Not, forever, that it belongs to the father, and what is "Behold, they are hers" - to refute Rabah.

hebrew_text: מְצִיאַת אִשְׁתּוֹ. גֵּירְשָׁהּ פְּשִׁיטָא!
human_translation: the found item of his wife, he divorced her, obvious
llm_translation: Discovery of his wife. He divorced her, obviously!

hebrew_text: הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן? בִּמְגוֹרֶשֶׁת וְאֵינָהּ מְגוֹרֶשֶׁת, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: כׇּל מָקוֹם שֶׁאָמְרוּ חֲכָמִים ״מְגוֹרֶשֶׁת וְאֵינָהּ מְגוֹרֶשֶׁת״ – בַּעְלָהּ חַיָּיב בִּמְזוֹנוֹתֶיהָ.
human_translation: Here we are dealing with where she is divorced or she is not divorced. As Rabbi Zeira says Shmuel says: Everywhere that the Sages said is divorced or she is not divorced, her husband obligated to her sustenance.
llm_translation: Here we are dealing with what? In the case of a divorce document where it is not a valid divorce document, for Rabbi Zeira said in the name of Shmuel: Any place where the sages said "it is a valid divorce document and it is not a valid divorce document" - the husband is obligated in her sustenance.

hebrew_text: טַעְמָא מַאי אֲמוּר רַבָּנַן מְצִיאַת אִשָּׁה לְבַעְלָהּ, כִּי הֵיכִי דְּלָא תֶּיהְוֵי לַהּ אֵיבָה. הָכָא אִית לַהּ אֵיבָה וְאֵיבָה.
human_translation: what is the reason the Sages said found by a wife to her husband? so that she should not be subject to enmity Here, let her be subject to much enmity.
llm_translation: Reason, what is it that the Rabbis say? The finding of a woman for her husband, so that there will not be enmity towards her. Here, there is enmity towards her and enmity.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ מָצָא שִׁטְרֵי חוֹב, אִם יֵשׁ בָּהֶן אַחְרָיוּת נְכָסִים – לֹא יַחְזִיר, שֶׁבֵּית דִּין נִפְרָעִין מֵהֶן. אֵין בָּהֶן אַחְרָיוּת נְכָסִים – יַחְזִיר, שֶׁאֵין בֵּית דִּין נִפְרָעִין מֵהֶן, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר.
human_translation: found promissory notes, if they include a property guarantee he may not return as, the court use them to collect repayment they do not include a property guarantee, he returns as the court not use them to collect repayment the statement of Rabbi Meir.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: If one finds promissory notes of debt, if they contain encumbrances of property - do not return them, as the court collects from them. If they do not contain encumbrances of property - return them, as the court does not collect from them. These are the words of Rabbi Meir.

hebrew_text: וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: בֵּין כָּךְ וּבֵין כָּךְ לֹא יַחְזִיר, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁבֵּית דִּין נִפְרָעִין מֵהֶן.
human_translation: And the Rabbis say: both this and that he should not return as, the court use them to collect repayment
llm_translation: The sages say: "Whether this way or that way, one should not return, because the court is punished by them."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן? אִילֵימָא כְּשֶׁחַיָּיב מוֹדֶה, כִּי יֵשׁ בָּהֶן אַחְרָיוּת נְכָסִים אַמַּאי לֹא יַחְזִיר? הָא מוֹדֶה! וְאִי כְּשֶׁאֵין חַיָּיב מוֹדֶה, כִּי אֵין בָּהֶן אַחְרָיוּת נְכָסִים אַמַּאי יַחְזִיר? נְהִי דְּלָא גָּבֵי מִמְּשַׁעְבְּדֵי – מִבְּנֵי חָרֵי מִגְבָּא גָּבֵי!
human_translation: With what are we dealing? If we say when liable party, admits when include a property guarantee, why should not return Doesn’t admit And if when debtor does not admit when do not include a property guarantee, why should return Granted, cannot collect from liened he can collect from unsold
llm_translation: We are dealing with what? If you say when one is obligated he admits, because there is subsequent property, why should he not return? He admits! And if you say when one is not obligated he admits, because there is no subsequent property, why should he return? It is not comparable to those who are under obligation - from the sons of Horei to the top of the hill!

hebrew_text: לְעוֹלָם כְּשֶׁחַיָּיב מוֹדֶה, וְהָכָא הַיְינוּ טַעְמָא: דְּחָיְישִׁינַן שֶׁמָּא כָּתַב לִלְוֹת בְּנִיסָן וְלֹא לָוָה עַד תִּשְׁרִי, וְאָתֵי לְמִטְרַף לָקוֹחוֹת שֶׁלֹּא כַּדִּין.
human_translation: Actually, when liable party admits and here, this is the reason that we are concerned perhaps wrote borrow in Nisan but he did not borrow until Tishrei, And will come to repossess purchasers, unlawfully.
llm_translation: Forever when obligated admits, and here that is the reason: we are concerned perhaps he wrote to lend in Nissan and did not lend until Tishrei, and comes to mix up the loans not properly.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, כֹּל שְׁטָרֵי דְּאָתוּ לְקַמַּן נֵיחוּשׁ לְהוּ הָכִי!
human_translation: If so, we should likewise be concerned that all notes that come before us
llm_translation: If so, all the documents that will come before us should be examined in this way!

hebrew_text: כֹּל שְׁטָרֵי לָא רִיעֵי, הָנֵי רִיעֵי.
human_translation: all notes not compromised, these compromised
llm_translation: All documents not of friends, those are of friends.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא הָא דִּתְנַן: כּוֹתְבִין שְׁטָר לַלֹּוֶה אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵין מַלְוֶה עִמּוֹ. לְכַתְּחִילָּה הֵיכִי כָּתְבִינַן? נֵיחוּשׁ שֶׁמָּא כָּתַב לִלְוֹת בְּנִיסָן וְלֹא לָוָה עַד תִּשְׁרִי, וְאָתֵי לְמִטְרַף לָקוֹחוֹת שֶׁלֹּא כַּדִּין!
human_translation: But that which we learned One may write note for a borrower even if lender is not with him How can write ab initio ? Let us be concerned perhaps write to borrow in Nisan, but not borrow until Tishrei, and come to repossess purchasers, unlawfully.
llm_translation: Rather, this that we learned: One may write a contract for the borrower even though he does not lend with him. Initially, how should we write it? We are concerned that perhaps he wrote to lend in Nissan and did not lend until Tishrei, and it will come to be a stumbling block for those who buy debts unlawfully!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אַסִּי:
human_translation: Rav Asi said:
llm_translation: Rav Assi said:

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁטָרֵי הַקְנָאָה, דְּהָא שַׁעְבֵּיד נַפְשֵׁיהּ.
human_translation: to deeds of transfer. Because obligated himself
llm_translation: In the documents of zealotry, for he did it to himself.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, מַתְנִיתִין דְּקָתָנֵי: ״אִם יֵשׁ בָּהֶן אַחְרָיוּת נְכָסִים לֹא יַחֲזִיר״, וְאוֹקֵימְנָא כְּשֶׁחַיָּיב מוֹדֶה, וּמִשּׁוּם שֶׁמָּא כָּתַב לִלְוֹת בְּנִיסָן וְלֹא לָוָה עַד תִּשְׁרֵי, וְאָתֵי לְמִטְרַף לָקוֹחוֹת שֶׁלֹּא כַּדִּין, אַמַּאי לֹא יַחֲזִיר?
human_translation: If that is so, the mishna which teaches if include a property guarantee, should not return and we established when debtor admits and due to perhaps wrote to borrow in Nisan but did not borrow until Tishrei, and he will come to repossess purchasers unlawfully. why shouldn’t return
llm_translation: Talmudic text: If so, the Mishnah teaches: "If there is any subsequent property in them, he shall not return." And we establish it when he admits to the debt, and because perhaps he wrote to lend in Nisan and did not borrow until Tishrei, and he comes to grab collateral improperly, why should he not return?

hebrew_text: נֶחְזֵי אִי בִּשְׁטַר הַקְנָאָה – הָא שַׁעְבֵּיד לֵיהּ נַפְשֵׁיהּ! אִי בִּשְׁטָר דְּלָא הַקְנָאָה – לֵיכָּא לְמֵיחַשׁ, דְּהָא אָמְרַתְּ כִּי לֵיכָּא מַלְוֶה בַּהֲדֵיהּ לָא כָּתְבִינַן.
human_translation: Let us see If to a deed of transfer, didn’t obligate himself if to note that is not transfer, there is no concern, as you said when the lender is not together with we do not write
llm_translation: Behold, if with a document of zealotry - he did it to himself! If without a document of zealotry - there is no concern, for you said: "for we did not write a loan document for him."

hebrew_text: אָמַר לְךָ רַב אַסִּי: אַף עַל גַּב דִּשְׁטָרֵי דְּלָאו הַקְנָאָה, כִּי לֵיכָּא מַלְוֶה בַּהֲדֵיהּ לָא כָּתְבִינַן, מַתְנִיתִין כֵּיוָן דִּנְפַל אִתְּרַע לֵיהּ, וְחָיְישִׁינַן דִּלְמָא אִקְּרִי וּכְתוּב.
human_translation: Rav Asi said to you: Although we do not write notes that are not transfer when the lender is not together with the mishna since was dropped, was compromised, and we are concerned perhaps it happened to have been written
llm_translation: Rav Assi said to you: Even though the scribes did not write with zeal, for there is no jealousy, when they fell into evil, we are concerned that perhaps it will be read and written.

hebrew_text: אַבָּיֵי אָמַר: עֵדָיו בַּחֲתוּמָיו זָכִין לוֹ, וַאֲפִילּוּ שְׁטָרֵי דְּלָאו הַקְנָאָה.
human_translation: Abaye stated witnesses, with their signatures, acquire on behalf, And even notes that are not transfer.
llm_translation: Abaye said: His witnesses in his documents acquire for him, even if they are not documents of ownership.

hebrew_text: מִשּׁוּם דְּקַשְׁיָא לֵיהּ: כֵּיוָן דְּאָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁטָרֵי דְּלָאו הַקְנָאָה כִּי לֵיתֵיהּ לְמַלְוֶה בַּהֲדֵיהּ לָא כָּתְבִינַן, לֵיכָּא לְמֵיחַשׁ דְּאִקְּרִי וּכְתוּב.
human_translation: because difficult for him; since you said with regard to notes that are not transfer we do not write when the lender is not together with there is no concern perhaps it happened to be written
llm_translation: Due to the fact that it is difficult for him: since you said in the documents that jealousy does not apply, for there is no lender to write with him, there is no need to be concerned that it is called and written.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא הָא דִּתְנַן: מָצָא גִּיטֵּי נָשִׁים וְשִׁחְרוּרֵי עֲבָדִים, דְּיָיתֵיקֵי, מַתָּנָה וְשׁוֹבָרִים – הֲרֵי זֶה לֹא יַחְזִיר, שֶׁמָּא כְּתוּבִים הָיוּ וְנִמְלַךְ עֲלֵיהֶם שֶׁלֹּא לִיתְּנָם. וְכִי נִמְלַךְ עֲלֵיהֶם מַאי הָוֵי? וְהָא אָמְרַתְּ: עֵדָיו בַּחֲתוּמָיו זָכִין לוֹ?
human_translation: But that which we learned found bills of divorce, or of manumission of slaves, wills [ deyaitiki ], gift, or receipts, he may not return perhaps they were written and reconsidered about them not to deliver them. If he reconsidered them, what of it? Didn’t you say witnesses, with their signatures, acquire on behalf of
llm_translation: Rather, this that we learned: If one found bills of divorce of women and manumission documents of slaves, that they are torn, gifts and promissory notes - behold, he shall not return them, lest they were written and were erased so that they should not be given. And if they were erased so that they should not be given, what is the law? And did you not say: His witnesses in his signature are valid for him?

hebrew_text: הָנֵי מִילֵּי הֵיכָא דְּקָא מָטוּ לִידֵיהּ. אֲבָל הֵיכָא דְּלָא מָטוּ לִידֵיהּ לָא אָמְרִינַן.
human_translation: This statement, where came into possession; but where did not come into his possession, we do not say
llm_translation: These are the matters where it reaches his hands. But where it does not reach his hands, we do not say.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מַתְנִיתִין דְּקָתָנֵי: מָצָא שִׁטְרֵי חוֹב, אִם יֵשׁ בָּהֶם אַחְרָיוּת נְכָסִים – לֹא יַחְזִיר. וְאוֹקִימְנָא כְּשֶׁחַיָּיב מוֹדֶה, וּמִשּׁוּם שֶׁמָּא כָּתַב לִלְוֹת בְּנִיסָן וְלֹא לָוָה עַד תִּשְׁרֵי.
human_translation: Rather, the mishna As it teaches: found promissory notes, if they include a property guarantee, he may not return And we established when liable party, admits and due to perhaps he wrote to borrow in Nisan but he did not borrow until Tishrei.
llm_translation: Rather, the Mishnah teaches: If one finds promissory notes of debt, if they contain post-dated assets - do not return them. And we establish this when the debtor admits, and because perhaps he wrote to borrow in Nissan and did not borrow until Tishrei.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְרַב אַסִּי דְּאָמַר בִּשְׁטָרֵי אַקְנְיָיתָא – מוֹקֵי לַהּ בִּשְׁטָרֵי דְּלָאו אַקְנְיָיתָא, וְכִדְאָמְרִינַן. אֶלָּא לְאַבָּיֵי, דְּאָמַר: עֵדָיו בַּחֲתוּמָיו זָכִין לוֹ, מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר?
human_translation: Granted, according to Rav Asi, who says with regard to deeds of transfer, established to notes that are not transfer, and as we stated But according to Abaye, who says witnesses, with their signatures, acquire on behalf, what is there to say?
llm_translation: In truth, according to Rav Assi who said, "With documents one acquires ownership," he acquires it with documents that are not documents, as we say. Rather, according to Abbaye who said: "His witnesses in his seal are effective for him," what is there to say?

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָךְ אַבָּיֵי, מַתְנִיתִין הַיְינוּ טַעְמָא: דְּחָיְישִׁ[ינַן] לְפֵרָעוֹן וְלִקְנוּנְיָא.
human_translation: Abaye said to you this is the reason the mishna: that suspects repayment and collusion.
llm_translation: He said to you, Abaye, Mishnaic text, that is the reason: we are concerned for financial loss and for jealousy.

hebrew_text: וְלִשְׁמוּאֵל, דְּאָמַר לָא חָיְישִׁינַן לְפֵרָעוֹן וְלִקְנוּנְיָא, מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר? הָנִיחָא אִי סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַב אַסִּי דְּאָמַר בִּשְׁטָרֵי הַקְנָאָה – מוֹקֵי מַתְנִיתִין בִּשְׁטָרֵי דְּלָאו הַקְנָאָה. אֶלָּא אִי סָבַר כְּאַבָּיֵי דְּאָמַר עֵדָיו בַּחֲתוּמָיו זָכִין לוֹ, מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר?
human_translation: But according to Shmuel, who says we do not suspect repayment and collusion, what is there to say? This works out well if holds in accordance with Rav Asi, who says in deeds of transfer can establish to notes that are not transfer. But if holds in accordance with Abaye, who says witnesses, with their signatures, acquire on behalf, what is there to say?
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And to Shmuel, who said we are not concerned with Per'ahon and Kinunya, what can be said? If he holds like Rav Assi who said in documents of acquisition - the witnesses sign on documents that are not of acquisition. Rather, if he holds like Abbaye who said his witnesses in his signature are effective for him, what can be said?

hebrew_text: שְׁמוּאֵל מוֹקֵי לְמַתְנִיתִין כְּשֶׁאֵין חַיָּיב מוֹדֶה.
human_translation: Shmuel can establish the mishna when the liable party does not admit
llm_translation: Shmuel strikes towards the Matnitin when one is not obligated, he concedes.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, כִּי אֵין בָּהֶן אַחְרָיוּת נְכָסִים אַמַּאי יַחְזִיר? נְהִי דְּלָא גָּבֵי מִן מְשַׁעְבְּדֵי, מִבְּנֵי חָרֵי מִגְבֵּי גָּבֵי!
human_translation: If so, when do not include a property guarantee, why must return Granted, cannot collect from liened he can collect from unsold
llm_translation: Thus, if so, since they do not have succession of property, why should he return? Indeed, because he does not have authority over them, from the sons of free men he should return!

hebrew_text: שְׁמוּאֵל לְטַעְמֵיהּ: דְּאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל, אוֹמֵר הָיָה רַבִּי מֵאִיר: שְׁטַר חוֹב שֶׁאֵין בּוֹ אַחְרָיוּת נְכָסִים – אֵין גּוֹבֶה לָא מִמְּשַׁעְבְּדִי וְלָא מִבְּנֵי חָרֵי.
human_translation: Shmuel to his reasoning, as Shmuel says Rabbi Meir would say: a promissory note that does not include a property guarantee, collects neither from liened nor from unsold
llm_translation: Samuel according to his reasoning: for Samuel said, Rabbi Meir used to say: A promissory note that does not have subsequent assets - one may not collect from slaves nor from free men.

hebrew_text: וְכִי מֵאַחַר שֶׁאֵינוֹ גּוֹבֶה אַמַּאי יַחְזִיר? אָמַר רַבִּי נָתָן בַּר אוֹשַׁעְיָא: לָצוֹר עַל פִּי צְלוֹחִיתוֹ שֶׁל מַלְוֶה.
human_translation: But since cannot collect why should return Rabbi Natan bar Oshaya says: creditor to cover the opening of his flask.
llm_translation: And when he is not tall, why should he return? Rabbi Natan bar Oshaya said: To guard according to the mouth of the borrower's jug.

hebrew_text: וְנַהְדְּרֵיהּ (לְהוּ) לְלֹוֶה לָצוֹר עַל פִּי צְלוֹחִיתוֹ שֶׁל לֹוֶה! לֹוֶה הוּא
human_translation: let return it to the debtor, to cover the opening of debtor’s flask. The debtor is
llm_translation: And his garments (to him) to lend to the Tyrian according to the mouth of his Tyrian garment! He is a Tyrian.

hebrew_text: דְּאָמַר לֹא הָיוּ דְבָרִים מֵעוֹלָם.
human_translation: who says matters, never happened
llm_translation: As he said, "They were never things."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: מַחְלוֹקֶת בְּשֶׁאֵין חַיָּיב מוֹדֶה. דְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר סָבַר: שְׁטָר שֶׁאֵין בּוֹ אַחְרָיוּת נְכָסִים – אֵינוֹ גּוֹבֶה לָא מִמְּשַׁעְבְּדִי וְלָא מִבְּנֵי חָרֵי. וְרַבָּנַן סָבְרִי: מִמְּשַׁעְבְּדִי הוּא דְּלָא גָּבֵי, מִבְּנֵי חָרֵי – מִגְבָּא גָּבֵי. אֲבָל כְּשֶׁחַיָּיב מוֹדֶה – דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל יַחְזִיר, וְלָא חָיְישִׁינַן לְפֵרָעוֹן וְלִקְנוּנְיָא.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar says: dispute in when liable party does not admit As, Rabbi Meir holds with note that does not include a property guarantee, can collect neither from liened nor from unsold And the Rabbis hold it is from liened that one cannot collect does collect from unsold But when liable party admits everyone agrees must return and we do not suspect repayment and collusion [ veliknuneya ]
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: A dispute in a case where the defendant does not admit liability. For Rabbi Meir holds: A document that does not have subsequent assets - it is not collected neither from borrowers nor from guarantors. And the Rabbis hold: It is not collected from borrowers, but it is collected from guarantors. However, when the defendant admits liability - everyone agrees that it shall be returned, and we are not concerned about loss or gain.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: מַחְלוֹקֶת כְּשֶׁחַיָּיב מוֹדֶה, דְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר סָבַר: שְׁטָר שֶׁאֵין בּוֹ אַחְרָיוּת נְכָסִים – מִמְּשַׁעְבְּדִי הוּא דְּלָא גָּבֵי, אֲבָל מִבְּנֵי חָרֵי – מִגְבָּא גָּבֵי. וְרַבָּנַן סָבְרִי: מִמְּשַׁעְבְּדֵי נָמֵי גָּבֵי. אֲבָל כְּשֶׁאֵין חַיָּיב מוֹדֶה – דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל לֹא יַחְזִיר, דְּחָיְישִׁינַן לְפֵרָעוֹן.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan says: dispute when liable party admits As, Rabbi Meir holds it is from liened that one cannot collect note that does not include a property guarantee, but does collect from unsold And the Rabbis hold collects from liened too. But when the liable party does not admit everyone agrees may not return as we suspect repayment.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: A dispute when one is liable, Rabbi Meir holds: A document that does not have successors of property - it is from the hands of slaves that it does not collect, but from free men - it does collect. And the Rabbis hold: It collects from the hands of slaves. But when one is not liable, everyone agrees - he does not return, as we are concerned about payment.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, וּתְיוּבְתָּא דְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בַּחֲדָא, וּתְיוּבְתָּא דִשְׁמוּאֵל בְּתַרְתֵּי.
human_translation: is taught in accordance with of Rabbi Yoḥanan, and a conclusive refutation of one of Rabbi Elazar and a conclusive refutation of two of Shmuel.
llm_translation: It was taught in the school of Rabbi Yochanan, and the student of Rabbi Elazar in one, and the student of Shmuel in two.

hebrew_text: מָצָא שִׁטְרֵי חוֹב וְיֵשׁ בָּהֶם אַחְרָיוּת נְכָסִים, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁשְּׁנֵיהֶם מוֹדִים – לֹא יַחְזִיר לֹא לָזֶה וְלֹא לָזֶה. אֵין בָּהֶן אַחְרָיוּת נְכָסִים, בִּזְמַן שֶׁהַלֹּוֶה מוֹדֶה – יַחְזִיר לַמַּלְוֶה, אֵין הַלֹּוֶה מוֹדֶה – לֹא יַחְזִיר לֹא לָזֶה וְלֹא לָזֶה, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר.
human_translation: found promissory notes and they include a property guarantee, even if both agree should not return to this or to that they do not include a property guarantee, when the debtor admits one should return the debtor does not admit one should not return to this or to that the statement of Rabbi Meir.
llm_translation: He found promissory notes of debt and there are collateral assets in them, even though both parties admit - he shall not return to this one or to that one. If there are no collateral assets in them, when the borrower admits - he shall return to the lender; if the borrower does not admit - he shall not return to this one or to that one. These are the words of Rabbi Meir.

hebrew_text: שֶׁהָיָה רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: שְׁטָרי שֶׁיֵּשׁ (בָּהֶם) [בּוֹ] אַחְרָיוּת נְכָסִים, גּוֹבֶה מִנְּכָסִים מְשׁוּעְבָּדִים. וְשֶׁאֵין (בָּהֶם) [בּוֹ] אַחְרָיוּת נְכָסִים, גּוֹבֶה מִנְּכָסִים בְּנֵי חוֹרִין. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אֶחָד זֶה וְאֶחָד זֶה גּוֹבֶה מִנְּכָסִים מְשׁוּעְבָּדִים.
human_translation: As Rabbi Meir would say: notes that include a property guarantee, one can collect from liened property; but that do not include a property guarantee, collects from unsold property. And the Rabbis say: both this and that one can collect from liened property.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: Rabbi Meir used to say: Documents that contain inheritance of assets, the collection is from real estate. And those that do not contain inheritance of assets, the collection is from movable property. And the sages say: Both these and those, the collection is from real estate.

hebrew_text: תְּיוּבְתָּא דְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בַּחֲדָא, דְּאָמַר: לְרַבִּי מֵאִיר שְׁטָר שֶׁאֵין בּוֹ אַחְרָיוּת נְכָסִים – אֵינוֹ גּוֹבֶה מִנְּכָסִים מְשׁוּעְבָּדִים וְלֹא מִנְּכָסִים בְּנֵי חוֹרִין. וְקָאָמַר: בֵּין לְרַבִּי מֵאִיר בֵּין לְרַבָּנַן לָא חָיְישִׁינַן לִקְנוּנְיָא.
human_translation: a conclusive refutation one of of Rabbi Elazar, who says according to Rabbi Meir, with note that does not include a property guarantee can collect neither from liened nor from unsold And says according to both Rabbi Meir and the Rabbis, we do not suspect collusion
llm_translation: The dispute of Rabbi Elazar in one matter, as he said: According to Rabbi Meir, a document that does not have subsequent assets - it does not collect from assets that are encumbered nor from assets of free men. And he said: Whether for Rabbi Meir or for the Rabbis, we are not concerned about acquisitions.

hebrew_text: וּבָרָיְיתָא קָתָנֵי: שְׁטָר שֶׁאֵין בּוֹ אַחְרָיוּת נְכָסִים – מִמְּשַׁעְבְּדִי הוּא דְּלָא גָּבֵי, הָא מִבְּנֵי חוֹרִין מִגְבָּא גָּבֵי. וְקָתָנֵי: בֵּין לְרַבִּי מֵאִיר בֵּין לְרַבָּנַן, חָיְישִׁינַן לִקְנוּנְיָא. דְּקָתָנֵי: אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁשְּׁנֵיהֶם מוֹדִים לֹא יַחְזִיר לֹא לָזֶה וְלֹא לָזֶה. אַלְמָא חָיְישִׁינַן לִקְנוּנְיָא.
human_translation: And baraita teaches note that does not include a property guarantee cannot collect from liened but he can collect from unsold And teaches according to both Rabbi Meir and the Rabbis, we suspect collusion as it is taught even if both agree should not return to this or to that Apparently, we suspect collusion.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text states: "And the baraita teaches: A document that does not have successors of assets - it is from the hands of slaves, for it does not come from free men. And it teaches: Whether for Rabbi Meir or for the Rabbis, we are concerned about deception. As it teaches: Even though both of them agree, one should not return it to this one or to that one. This implies that we are concerned about deception."

hebrew_text: וְהָא הָנֵי תַּרְתֵּי הוּא?
human_translation: But aren’t these two
llm_translation: And this, are these two the same?

hebrew_text: חֲדָא הוּא, דְּחַד טַעַם הוּא, דְּמִשּׁוּם דְּקָאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר מַחְלוֹקֶת בְּשֶׁאֵין חַיָּיב מוֹדֶה – הוּא מְתָרֵץ הָכִי.
human_translation: It is one as one reason; because Rabbi Elazar says that dispute in when liable party does not admit he explains in this manner,
llm_translation: One is, that one reason is, because Rabbi Elazar said a dispute in which the one who is not liable concedes - he explains thus.

hebrew_text: תְּיוּבְתָּא דִשְׁמוּאֵל בְּתַרְתֵּי: חֲדָא כְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר, דְּהָא מוֹקֵי מַתְנִיתִין בְּשֶׁאֵין חַיָּיב מוֹדֶה.
human_translation: a conclusive refutation of two of of Shmuel: One like Rabbi Elazar as establishes the mishna to when liable party does not admit
llm_translation: The dispute of Shmuel in two cases: One like Rabbi Elazar, for he establishes a Mishnah where one is not liable, he concedes.

hebrew_text: וַחֲדָא דְּאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: מָצָא שְׁטַר הַקְנָאָה בַּשּׁוּק – יַחְזִיר לַבְּעָלִים, וְלָא חָיְישִׁינַן לְפֵרָעוֹן.
human_translation: And one that Shmuel says: found a deed of transfer in the marketplace, he must return to owner, and we do not suspect repayment
llm_translation: And one that Samuel said: If one finds a deed of sale in the marketplace - he shall return it to the owners, and we are not concerned about repayment.

hebrew_text: תְּיוּבְתָּא דְּקָתָנֵי הָכָא: אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁשְּׁנֵיהֶם מוֹדִים לֹא יַחְזִיר לֹא לָזֶה וְלֹא לָזֶה, אַלְמָא חָיְישִׁינַן לְפֵרָעוֹן, וְכׇל שֶׁכֵּן הָכָא דְּלָא מוֹדֵה לֹוֶה – דְּחָיְישִׁינַן לְפֵרָעוֹן.
human_translation: a conclusive refutation as here teaches: Even if they both agree, he should return neither to this nor to that Apparently, we suspect repayment. And all the more so here, when the liable party does not admit as we suspect repayment.
llm_translation: The dispute of the Mishnah here: Even though both of them admit, he shall not return the object neither to this one nor to that one. This implies that we are concerned for the payment, and all the more so here where the borrower does not admit - we are concerned for the payment.

hebrew_text: אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: מַאי טַעְמַיְיהוּ דְּרַבָּנַן? סָבְרִי אַחְרָיוּת טָעוּת סוֹפֵר הוּא.
human_translation: Shmuel said: What is the reason for the Rabbis, They hold guarantee is a scribal error,
llm_translation: Shmuel said: What is the reason of the Rabbis? They hold that it is a mistake of the scribe's following.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא בַּר אִיתַּי לְרַב אִידִי בַּר אָבִין: וּמִי אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל הָכִי? וְהָאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: שֶׁבַח, שֶׁפֶר וְשִׁעְבּוּד – צָרִיךְ לִימָּלֵךְ!
human_translation: Rava bar Ittai said to Rav Idi bar Avin: Did Shmuel say this; But doesn’t Shmuel say enhancement, superior-quality land, and a lien require consultation?
llm_translation: He said to him, Rava son of Ittai to Rav Idi son of Avin: Did Samuel really say this? But Samuel said: "Praise, beauty, and servitude - one must anoint him!"

hebrew_text: לֵימָא מַאן דְּאָמַר הָא לָא אָמַר הָא?
human_translation: Shall we say the one who says this does not say that
llm_translation: Let's say, the one who says this, did not say this?

hebrew_text: לָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן בִּשְׁטַר הַלְוָאָה, דְּלָא יָהֵיב אִינָשׁ זוּזֵי בִּכְדִי. כָּאן בְּמִקָּח וּמִמְכָּר, דְּעָבֵיד אִינָשׁ דְּזָבֵין אַרְעָא לְיוֹמֵיהּ.
human_translation: not difficult. Here, with regard to a promissory note, as a person does not give his money for nothing. There, with regard to buying and selling as a person is apt to purchase land for a day.
llm_translation: Not difficult: Here in a loan document, where a person does not give money in full. Here in a purchase and sale, where a person buys land for his days.

hebrew_text: כִּי הָהִיא דַּאֲבוּהּ בַּר אִיהִי זְבַין עִלִּיתָא מֵאֲחָתֵיהּ, אֲתָא בַּעַל חוֹב טַרְפַהּ מִינֵּיהּ. אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּמָר שְׁמוּאֵל, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: כְּתַבָה לָךְ אַחְרָיוּת? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִם כֵּן, זִיל לִשְׁלָמָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: וְהָא מָר הוּא דְּאָמַר אַחְרָיוּת טָעוּת סוֹפֵר הוּא! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָנֵי מִילֵּי בִּשְׁטָרֵי הַלְוָאָה, אֲבָל בִּשְׁטָרֵי מִקָּח וּמִמְכָּר – לָא, דַּעֲבִיד אִינָשׁ דְּזָבֵין אַרְעָא לְיוֹמֵיהּ.
human_translation: like that which Avuh bar Ihi purchased a loft from his sister. creditor came and repossessed from him. He came before Mar Shmuel said to him: Did she write you a guarantee He said to No. said to If so, go to peace said to But wasn’t it Master, who said guarantee is a scribal error? said to him: This statement to promissory notes, but with regard to deeds of buying and selling not as a person is apt to purchase land for a day.
llm_translation: That which Avuh son of Ihi sold a field to his brother, a creditor came and seized it from him. He came before Mar Samuel, and he said to him: Did you write a lien after him? He said to him: No. He said to him: If so, go to Shalma. He said to him: But isn't it Master who said that a lien after is a mistake of the scribe? He said to him: Those matters are in loan documents, but in sale documents - no, for a person can sell land during his lifetime.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: רְאוּבֵן שֶׁמָּכַר שָׂדֶה לְשִׁמְעוֹן בְּאַחְרָיוּת, וּבָא בַּעַל חוֹב דִּרְאוּבֵן וְקָא טָרֵיף לֵיהּ מִינֵּיהּ, דִּינָא הוּא דְּאָזֵיל רְאוּבֵן וּמִשְׁתַּעֵי דִּינָא בַּהֲדֵיהּ, וְלָא מָצֵי אָמַר לֵיהּ: לָאו בַּעַל דְּבָרִים דִּידִי אַתְּ, דְּאָמַר לֵיהּ: דְּמַפְּקַתְּ מִינֵּיהּ, עֲלַי דִּידִי הָדַר.
human_translation: Abaye said: Reuven, who sold a field to Shimon with guarantee, and Reuven’s creditor came and repossessed from It is the halakha that Reuven can go and litigate with and cannot say to him: I am not legally answerable to you because say to which you take from him comes back to me,
llm_translation: Abaye said: Reuven who sold a field to Shimon with a guarantee, and the creditor of Reuven came and tore it from him, the law is that Reuven goes and pleads his case, and the judgment goes in his favor. And if he cannot find him, he should say to him: "You are not the owner of the things that are mine," for he said to him: "Since you have taken from me, it is upon me to reclaim it."

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: אֲפִילּוּ שֶׁלֹּא בְּאַחְרָיוּת נָמֵי, דְּאָמַר לֵיהּ: לָא נִיחָא לִי דְּלֶיהְוֵי לְשִׁמְעוֹן תַּרְעוֹמֶת עֲלַי.
