human_translation: There are who say Even without guarantee, as he can say to It is not amenable to me that Shimon would have a grievance against me
llm_translation: There are those who say: Even if not in succession, for he said to him: It is not pleasing to me that Shimon should be considered a wicked person on my account.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר אַבָּיֵי: רְאוּבֵן שֶׁמָּכַר שָׂדֶה לְשִׁמְעוֹן שֶׁלֹּא בְּאַחְרָיוּת, וְיָצְאוּ עָלֶיהָ עֲסִיקִין, עַד שֶׁלֹּא הֶחְזִיק בָּהּ
human_translation: And Abaye said: Reuven, who sold a field to Shimon without guarantee, and disputants emerged As long as has not taken possession
llm_translation: And said Abbaye: Reuven who sold a field to Shimon without the right of redemption, and Shimon's workers went out upon it, until he did not take possession of it.

hebrew_text: יָכוֹל לַחֲזוֹר בּוֹ, מִשֶּׁהֶחְזִיק בָּהּ – אֵינוֹ יָכוֹל לַחֲזוֹר בּוֹ. דְּאָמַר לֵיהּ: חַיְיתָא דְקִטְרֵי סְבַרְתְּ וְקַבֵּלְתְּ. מֵאֵימָתַי הָוְיָא חֲזָקָה? מִכִּי דָיֵישׁ אַמִּצְרֵי.
human_translation: he can withdraw Once he has taken possession he cannot withdraw, as say to him: a tied sack you were aware and accepted From when is it possession? from when he walks along the borders
llm_translation: He is able to retract, once he has grasped it - he is unable to retract. For he said to him: "The living essence of the incense you thought and accepted." From when is it considered firmly established? When there is an Egyptian cubit.

hebrew_text: וְאִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי, אֲפִילּוּ בְּאַחְרָיוּת נָמֵי, דְּאָמַר לֵיהּ: אַחְוִי טִרְפָךְ וַאֲשַׁלֵּם לָךְ.
human_translation: And there are who say: Even with guarantee, as say to him: Show me your authorization to repossess, and I will pay you.
llm_translation: And there are those who say, even in the aftermath, as he said to him: "I will heal your wound and pay you."

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר: הַמּוֹכֵר שָׂדֶה לַחֲבֵירוֹ וְנִמְצֵאת שֶׁאֵינָהּ שֶׁלּוֹ. רַב אָמַר: יֵשׁ לוֹ מָעוֹת וְיֵשׁ לוֹ שֶׁבַח. וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: מָעוֹת יֵשׁ לוֹ, שֶׁבַח אֵין לוֹ.
human_translation: It was stated one who sells a field to another and it is found that it did not belong to Rav says has money and has enhancement And Shmuel says he has money, but he does not have enhancement.
llm_translation: It was stated: One who sells a field to his fellow and it is found that it is not his. Rav said: He has liabilities and he has benefits. And Shmuel said: He has liabilities, he has no benefits.

hebrew_text: בְּעוֹ מִינֵּיהּ מֵרַב הוּנָא: פֵּירֵשׁ לוֹ אֶת הַשֶּׁבַח מַהוּ? טַעְמָא דִשְׁמוּאֵל מִשּׁוּם דְּלָא פָּירֵשׁ שְׁבָחָא, וְהָכָא הָא פָּירֵשׁ לֵהּ, אוֹ דִלְמָא טַעְמֵיהּ דִשְׁמוּאֵל: כֵּיוָן דְּלֵית לֵיהּ קַרְקַע, מִחֲזֵי כְּרִיבִּית. אֲמַר לְהוּ: אִין וְלָאו, וְרַפְיָא בִּידֵיהּ.
human_translation: raised a dilemma before Rav Huna: What is specified enhancement the reason for of Shmuel because did not specify the enhancement but here, he did specify it? Or perhaps Shmuel’s reason is since does not have land, appears to be interest. said to them: Yes and no, and unclear to him.
llm_translation: He asked from him Rav Huna: He explained to him the praise, what is it? The reason of Shmuel, because he did not explain the praise, and here he explained it to him, or perhaps the reason of Shmuel: Since there is no ground for him, it appears like a ribbit. He said to them: Yes and no, and the remedy is in his hands.

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר, אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: מָעוֹת יֵשׁ לוֹ, שֶׁבַח אֵין לוֹ, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁפֵּירַשׁ לוֹ אֶת הַשֶּׁבַח. מַאי טַעְמָא? כֵּיוָן דְּקַרְקַע אֵין לוֹ, שְׂכַר מְעוֹתָיו עוֹמֵד וְנוֹטֵל.
human_translation: was stated Rav Naḥman says Shmuel says he has money, he does not have enhancement, even if specified enhancement What is the reason? Since does not have land, standing and taking payment for his money,
llm_translation: It was stated: Rav Nachman said in the name of Shmuel: He has money, but he has no praise, even though he explained the praise to him. What is the reason? Since he has no land, the reward for his money stands and takes.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ רָבָא לְרַב נַחְמָן: אֵין מוֹצִיאִין לַאֲכִילַת פֵּירוֹת, וְלִשְׁבַח קַרְקָעוֹת, וְלִמְזוֹן הָאִשָּׁה וְהַבָּנוֹת מִנְּכָסִים מְשׁוּעְבָּדִים, מִפְּנֵי תִּיקּוּן הָעוֹלָם.
human_translation: Rava raised an objection to Rav Naḥman: one cannot appropriate liened property for consuming produce or for enhancement of land, or for the sustenance of wife and daughters for the betterment of the world,
llm_translation: Rava raised an objection to Rav Nachman: One may not take out on Shabbat for the purpose of eating fruits, or for the sake of praising the ground, or for providing sustenance for a woman and her daughters from properties designated for servitude, due to the improvement of the world.

hebrew_text: מִמְּשַׁעְבְּדִי הוּא דְּלָא מַפְּקִינַן, הָא מִבְּנֵי (חוֹרִין) – [חָרֵי] מַפְּקִינַן, וְקָתָנֵי מִיהָא לִשְׁבַח קַרְקָעוֹת, מַאי לָאו בְּלוֹקֵחַ מִגַּזְלָן!
human_translation: we do not appropriate liened but we do appropriate unsold And in any event, it is taught for enhancement of land. What, is it not to purchases from a robber,
llm_translation: From those who are not obligated, we do not collect, but from the sons of (free men) – we do collect, and it is taught from here to praise the land. What, is it not from those who steal?

hebrew_text: לָא בְּבַעַל חוֹב.
human_translation: No, to a creditor,
llm_translation: Not in Baal Hov.

hebrew_text: אִי בְּבַעַל חוֹב, אֵימָא רֵישָׁא: אֵין מוֹצִיאִין לַאֲכִילַת פֵּירוֹת, וְאִי בְּבַעַל חוֹב, בַּעַל חוֹב מִי אִית לֵיהּ פֵּירֵי? וְהָאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: בַּעַל חוֹב גּוֹבֶה אֶת הַשֶּׁבַח. שֶׁבַח – אִין, אֲבָל פֵּירוֹת – לָא!
human_translation: If to a creditor, say the first clause One cannot appropriate for consuming produce. And if to a creditor, does a creditor have produce But doesn’t Shmuel say a creditor collects the enhancement does enhancement, but not produce.
llm_translation: If it is regarding a creditor, say at the beginning: One does not bring out fruits for eating. And if it is regarding a creditor, does a creditor have fruits? But didn't Shmuel say: A creditor collects praise. Praise - no, but fruits - yes!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא פְּשִׁיטָא בְּגוֹזֵל וְנִגְזָל. וּמִדְּרֵישָׁא בְּגוֹזֵל וְנִגְזָל, סֵיפָא נָמֵי בְּגוֹזֵל וְנִגְזָל.
human_translation: Rather, obvious to a robber, and a robbery victim, And from that the first clause to a robber and a robbery victim, the latter clause, also to a robber and a robbery victim.
llm_translation: Rather, it is obvious in the case of theft and being stolen from. And from the beginning in the case of theft and being stolen from, the end also in the case of theft and being stolen from.

hebrew_text: מִידֵּי אִרְיָא?! הָא כִּדְאִיתָא וְהָא כִּדְאִיתָא.
human_translation: Are the cases comparable? This as it is, and that as it is.
llm_translation: From the hand of a lion?! This one as it was stated, and this one as it was stated.

hebrew_text: וְהָא לָא תָּנֵי הָכִי: לְשֶׁבַח קַרְקָעוֹת כֵּיצַד? הֲרֵי שֶׁגָּזַל שָׂדֶה מֵחֲבֵירוֹ וַהֲרֵי הִיא יוֹצְאָה מִתַּחַת יָדוֹ, כְּשֶׁהוּא גּוֹבֶה – גּוֹבֶה אֶת הַקֶּרֶן מִנְּכָסִים מְשׁוּעְבָּדִים, וְשֶׁבַח – גּוֹבֶה מִנְּכָסִים בְּנֵי חוֹרִין.
human_translation: But it is not taught that way What for enhancement of land? one robbed another of a field and it is appropriated from his possession. When he collects he collects the principal, from liened property, and he collects enhancement from unsold property.
llm_translation: The text does not teach thus: For the praise of the earth, how so? Behold, if one stole a field from his fellow, and it has passed from under his control, when he redeems it - he redeems the horn from assets of slaves, and for praise - he redeems from assets of free men.

hebrew_text: הֵיכִי דָמֵי? אִילֵּימָא כִּדְקָתָנֵי, גַּזְלָן מִמַּאן גָּבֵי? אֶלָּא לָאו: כְּגוֹן שֶׁגָּזַל שָׂדֶה מֵחֲבֵירוֹ וּמְכָרָהּ לְאַחֵר וְהִשְׁבִּיחָהּ!
human_translation: What are the circumstances If we say as it is taught from whom does robber collect? Rather, is it not where robbed another of a field and sold it to another and enhanced it?
llm_translation: "How are they similar? If you say it is as it was taught, who is the robber in this case? Rather, is it not like when one steals a field from his fellow and sells it to another and improves it!"

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָךְ: לָאו תָּרוֹצֵי קָא מְתָרְצַתְּ? תָּרֵיץ נָמֵי בְּבַעַל חוֹב.
human_translation: said to you: Did you not explain also explain to a creditor.
llm_translation: He said to you: "Are you not running to fulfill the commandment?" Run also to fulfill your obligation with a creditor.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: לַאֲכִילַת פֵּירוֹת כֵּיצַד? הֲרֵי שֶׁגָּזַל שָׂדֶה מֵחֲבֵירוֹ וַהֲרֵי הִיא יוֹצְאָה מִתַּחַת יָדוֹ, כְּשֶׁהוּא גּוֹבֶה – גּוֹבֶה אֶת הַקֶּרֶן מִנְּכָסִים מְשׁוּעְבָּדִים, וּפֵירוֹת גּוֹבֶה מִנְּכָסִים בְּנֵי חוֹרִין.
human_translation: Come hear What for consuming produce? one who robbed another of a field, and it is appropriated from his possession. When he collects he collects the principal from liened property and he collects produce from unsold property.
llm_translation: Come and hear: For the eating of fruits, how so? If one stole a field from his fellow, and it is now out of his possession, when he collects - he collects the principal from real estate of slaves, and the fruits he collects from free men's property.

hebrew_text: הֵיכִי דָמֵי? אִילֵּימָא כִּדְקָתָנֵי, גַּזְלָן מִמַּאן גָּבֵי? אֶלָּא לָאו: כְּגוֹן שֶׁגָּזַל שָׂדֶה מֵחֲבֵירוֹ וּמְכָרָהּ לְאַחֵר וְהִשְׁבִּיחָהּ!
human_translation: What are the circumstances? If we say as it is taught from whom does robber collect? Rather, is it not where robbed another of a field and sold it to another and enhanced it?
llm_translation: "How are they similar? If you say it is as it was taught, who is the robber in this case? Rather, is it not like when one steals a field from his fellow and sells it to another and establishes it!"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן – כְּגוֹן שֶׁגָּזַל שָׂדֶה מֵחֲבֵירוֹ, מְלֵאָה פֵּירוֹת, וְאָכַל אֶת הַפֵּירוֹת, וְחָפַר בָּהּ בּוֹרוֹת, שִׁיחִין וּמְעָרוֹת. בָּא נִגְזָל לִגְבּוֹת קֶרֶן – גּוֹבֶה מִנְּכָסִים מְשׁוּעְבָּדִים, בָּא נִגְזָל לִגְבּוֹת פֵּירוֹת – גּוֹבֶה מִנְּכָסִים בְּנֵי חוֹרִין.
human_translation: Rava said: With what are we dealing here? where stole a field full of produce from another, and consumed the produce and dug pits, ditches, and caves in robbery victim comes to collect principal, he collects from liened property. robbery victim comes to collect produce he collects from unsold property.
llm_translation: Rava said: Here we are dealing with what? - For example, one who stole a field from his fellow, planted it with crops, ate the crops, and dug in it pits, ditches, and caves. If one comes to steal in order to collect a debt - he collects from encumbered property. If one comes to steal in order to collect produce - he collects from unencumbered property.

hebrew_text: רַבָּה בַּר רַב הוּנָא אָמַר: כְּגוֹן
human_translation: Rabba bar Rav Huna said: where
llm_translation: Rabba bar Rav Huna said: "Such as"

hebrew_text: שֶׁנְּטָלוּהָ מַסִּיקִין, בָּא נִגְזָל לִגְבּוֹת קֶרֶן – גּוֹבֶה מִנְּכָסִים מְשׁוּעְבָּדִים, בָּא נִגְזָל לִגְבּוֹת פֵּירוֹת – גּוֹבֶה מִנְּכָסִים בְּנֵי חוֹרִין.
human_translation: thugs took robbery victim comes to collect principal, he collects from liened property, robbery victim comes to collect produce, collect from unsold property.
llm_translation: When they took it, they collect; if one comes to steal to deduct principal - deducting from slaves, if one comes to steal to deduct produce - deducting from free men's property.

hebrew_text: רָבָא לָא אָמַר כְּרַבָּה בַּר רַב הוּנָא: ״הֲרֵי הִיא יוֹצְאָה מִתַּחַת יָדוֹ״ – בְּדִינָא מַשְׁמַע. וְרַבָּה בַּר רַב הוּנָא לָא אָמַר כְּרָבָא: ״הֲרֵי הִיא יוֹצְאָה מִתַּחַת יָדוֹ״ – בְּעֵינָא מַשְׁמַע.
human_translation: Rava did not state in accordance with Rabba bar Rav Huna, It is appropriated from his possession, indicates legally And Rabba bar Rav Huna did not state in accordance with Rava, It is appropriated from his possession, indicates in unadulterated form,
llm_translation: Rava did not say like Rabbah bar Rav Huna: "Behold, it is going out from under his hand" - in legal matters it is implied. And Rabbah bar Rav Huna did not say like Rava: "Behold, it is going out from under his hand" - in my opinion it is implied.

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: לִצְדָדִין קָתָנֵי, כְּגוֹן שֶׁגָּזַל שָׂדֶה מֵחֲבֵירוֹ מְלֵאָה פֵּירוֹת וְאָכַל אֶת הַפֵּירוֹת וּמָכַר אֶת הַשָּׂדֶה, בָּא לוֹקֵחַ לִגְבּוֹת קֶרֶן – גּוֹבֶה מִנְּכָסִים מְשׁוּעְבָּדִים. בָּא נִגְזָל לִגְבּוֹת פֵּירוֹת – גּוֹבֶה מִנְּכָסִים בְּנֵי חוֹרִין.
human_translation: Rav Ashi stated teaches disjunctively. where one robbed another of a field full of produce, and he consumed the produce and sold the field. purchaser comes to collect principal he collects from liened property. robbery victim comes to collect produce, he collects from unsold property.
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said: The Mishnah speaks of cases such as one who stole a field from his fellow, harvested its fruits, consumed the fruits, and then sold the field. If he comes to collect the principal – he collects it from encumbered property. If one stole to collect the principal from fruits – he collects it from free property.

hebrew_text: בֵּין לְרָבָא בֵּין לְרַבָּה בַּר רַב הוּנָא, מִלְוָה עַל פֶּה הוּא, וּמִלְוָה עַל פֶּה אֵינוֹ גּוֹבֶה מִנְּכָסִים מְשׁוּעְבָּדִים!
human_translation: According to both Rava and Rabba bar Rav Huna, has a loan by oral and a loan by oral cannot collect from liened property.
llm_translation: Between Rava and Rabbah bar Rav Huna, a loan on verbal agreement is valid, but a loan on verbal agreement is not collected from encumbered property!

hebrew_text: הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן – כְּשֶׁעָמַד בַּדִּין וַהֲדַר זַבֵּין.
human_translation: Here we are dealing with where stood trial and he subsequently sold
llm_translation: Here we are dealing with what? - When he stood in judgment and then returned the witnesses.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, פֵּירוֹת נָמֵי! כְּשֶׁעָמַד בַּדִּין עַל הַקֶּרֶן, וְלֹא עָמַד בַּדִּין עַל הַפֵּירוֹת. וּמַאי פַּסְקָא? סְתָמָא דְמִילְּתָא כִּי תָּבַע אִינִישׁ – קַרְנָא תָּבַע בְּרֵישָׁא.
human_translation: If so, produce as well when stood trial for the principal, but did not stand trial for the produce. And why without qualification? The normal of things when a person files a claim, he first claims the principal
llm_translation: Thus, the fruits are considered! When one is liable for the principal amount, but not liable for the fruits. And what is the ruling? It is a presumption in a matter that when a person claims – he first claims the principal.

hebrew_text: וְסָבַר שְׁמוּאֵל לוֹקֵחַ מִגַּזְלָן לֵית לֵיהּ שְׁבָחָא?
human_translation: But does Shmuel hold buys from a robber does not have the enhancement
llm_translation: And Shmuel thought: Does he not have praise who takes from a thief?

hebrew_text: וְהָא אֲמַר לֵיהּ שְׁמוּאֵל לְרַב חִינָּנָא בַּר שִׁילַת: אִמְּלֵיךְ, וּכְתוֹב ״שׁוּפְרָא שְׁבָחָא וּפֵירֵי״.
human_translation: But didn’t Shmuel say to Rav Ḥinnana bar Sheilat, consult and write superior-quality enhancement and produce
llm_translation: And behold, Samuel said to Rav Hinnana bar Shilat: "Anoint him, and write 'Shufra Shevaha u'Feirei'."

hebrew_text: בְּמַאי? אִי בְּבַעַל חוֹב – מִי אִית לֵיהּ פֵּירֵי? וְהָאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: בַּעַל חוֹב גּוֹבֶה אֶת הַשֶּׁבַח, שֶׁבַח – אִין, אֲבָל פֵּירוֹת – לָא. אֶלָּא לָאו, בְּלוֹקֵחַ מִגַּזְלָן!
human_translation: To what If where creditor does have produce? But doesn’t Shmuel say a creditor collects the enhancement does enhancement, but not produce? Rather, not to buys from a robber,
llm_translation: In what? If in a creditor - does he have produce? But Shmuel said: A creditor collects the praise, praise - no, but produce - yes. Rather, is it not referring to one who takes from a robber!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן – כְּגוֹן שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ קַרְקַע.
human_translation: Rav Yosef said: Here we are dealing with where owns land,
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: Here we are dealing with what - for example, if he has land.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: וְכִי מוּתָּר לִלְוֹת סְאָה בִּסְאָה בִּמְקוֹם שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ קַרְקַע?
human_translation: Abaye said to him: But is it permitted to borrow a se’a for a se’a where he owns land?
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye: And is it permitted to lend a se'ah for a se'ah in a place where he has land?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ, הָתָם הַלְוָאָה, הָכָא זְבִינֵי.
human_translation: said to him: there, a loan, here, a sale.
llm_translation: He said to him, there it is a loan, here it is merchandise.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי, אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן – כְּגוֹן שֶׁקָּנוּ מִיָּדוֹ.
human_translation: There are who say Rav Yosef said: Here we are dealing with where performed an act of acquisition from possession,
llm_translation: There is one who says, Rav Yosef said: Here, with what are we dealing? - For example, when one acquires from his hand.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: וְכִי מוּתָּר לִלְוֹת סְאָה בִּסְאָה בִּמְקוֹם שֶׁקָּנוּ מִיָּדוֹ?
human_translation: Abaye said to him: But is it permitted to borrow a se’a for a se’a where he performed an act of acquisition from possession?
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye: And is it permitted to lend a se'ah for a se'ah in a place where he acquired it from his hand?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָתָם הַלְוָאָה, וְהָכָא זְבִינֵי.
human_translation: said to him: There, a loan, here a sale.
llm_translation: He said to him: There it is a loan, and here it is merchandise.

hebrew_text: גּוּפָא, אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: בַּעַל חוֹב גּוֹבֶה אֶת הַשֶּׁבַח. אָמַר רָבָא: תֵּדַע, שֶׁכָּךְ כּוֹתֵב לוֹ מוֹכֵר לַלּוֹקֵחַ: ״אֲנָא אֵיקוּם וַאֲשַׁפֵּי וַאֲדַכֵּי וַאֲמָרֵיק זְבִינֵי אִילֵּין, אִינּוּן וְעַמְלֵיהוֹן וּשְׁבָחֵיהוֹן, וְאֵיקוּם קֳדָמָךְ, וּצְבִי זָבֹינָא דְּנַן וְקַבֵּיל עֲלוֹהִי״.
human_translation: itself Shmuel says: A creditor collects the enhancement Rava says: Know as this the seller writes to the buyer I will stand and silence and purify and cleanse this sale, itself, and the labor in it, and its enhancement; and I will present before you. And this seller consented and accepted upon himself
llm_translation: The body, Shmuel said: The debtor collects the praise. Rava said: Know that this is how the seller writes to the buyer: "I will rise and inspect and measure and say the praises of these rams, their toil and their praises, and I will rise before you, and the beauty of our rams, and accept their value."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב חִיָּיא בַּר אָבִין לְרָבָא: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה מַתָּנָה דְּלָא כָּתֵיב לֵיהּ הָכִי, הָכִי נָמֵי דְּלָא טָרֵיף שְׁבָחָא?! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִין.
human_translation: Rav Ḥiyya bar Avin said to Rava: If that is so, a gift, where does not write this to indeed that does not repossess the enhancement said to him: Indeed.
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Chiya bar Avin to Rava: Rather, from now on, a gift that is not written for him like this, is it also not a praise?! He said to him: No.

hebrew_text: וְכִי יָפֶה כֹּחַ מַתָּנָה מִמֶּכֶר? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִין יָפֶה וְיָפֶה.
human_translation: But is the power of a gift stronger than a sale, said to him: Yes, it is indeed stronger.
llm_translation: And is the strength of a gift better than a sale? He said to him: It is not better and better.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: הָא מַתְנִיתָא מְסַיַּיע לֵיהּ לְמָר שְׁמוּאֵל, וְהוּנָא חַבְרִין מוֹקֵים לַהּ בְּמִילֵּי אַחֲרִינֵי. דְּתַנְיָא: הַמּוֹכֵר שָׂדֶה לַחֲבֵירוֹ, וַהֲרֵי הִיא יוֹצְאָה מִתַּחַת יָדוֹ, כְּשֶׁהוּא גּוֹבֶה – גּוֹבֶה אֶת הַקֶּרֶן מִנְּכָסִים מְשׁוּעְבָּדִים, וְשֶׁבַח גּוֹבֶה מִנְּכָסִים בְּנֵי חוֹרִין.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman said: This baraita supports Mar Shmuel; but our colleague, Huna, interprets it to other matters, As it is taught one who sells a field to another, and it is appropriated from possession, when collects he collects the principal from liened property, and he collects enhancement from unsold property.
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said: This Mishnah supports the opinion of Master Shmuel, and the colleagues establish it with other words. As it was taught: If one sells a field to his friend, and it turns out to be under a lien, when he redeems it - he redeems the horn from non-sacred property, and the increase he redeems from the property of free men.

hebrew_text: וְהוּנָא חַבְרִין מוֹקֵים לַהּ בְּמִילֵּי אַחֲרִינֵי, בְּלוֹקֵחַ מִגַּזְלָן.
human_translation: But our colleague, Huna, interprets it to other matters, to buys from a robber.
llm_translation: And Huna the colleague establishes for her with other words, with one who acquires from a thief.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא אִידַּךְ: הַמּוֹכֵר שָׂדֶה לַחֲבֵירוֹ וְהִשְׁבִּיחָהּ, וּבָא בַּעַל חוֹב וּטְרָפָהּ, כְּשֶׁהוּא גּוֹבֶה, אִם הַשֶּׁבַח יוֹתֵר עַל הַיְּצִיאָה – נוֹטֵל אֶת הַשֶּׁבַח מִבַּעַל הַקַּרְקַע, וְהַיְּצִיאָה מִבַּעַל חוֹב. וְאִם הַיְּצִיאָה יְתֵירָה עַל הַשֶּׁבַח – אֵין לוֹ אֶלָּא הוֹצָאָה שִׁיעוּר שֶׁבַח מִבַּעַל חוֹב.
human_translation: It is taught another one who sells a field to another, enhances it, and a creditor comes and repossesses when collects If the enhancement is greater than the expenses he takes the enhancement from the owner of the land, and the expenses by the creditor. And if the expenses were greater than the enhancement he expenses, only to the value of enhancement, from the creditor.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: The one who sells a field to his fellow and improves it, and then the creditor comes and seizes it, if the improvement exceeds the original value - he takes the improvement from the landowner, and the original value from the creditor. But if the original value exceeds the improvement - he only has the right to the amount of the original value from the creditor.

hebrew_text: וְהָא שְׁמוּאֵל בְּמַאי מוֹקֵים לַהּ? אִי בְּלוֹקֵחַ מִגַּזְלָן – קַשְׁיָא רֵישָׁא, דְּאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: לוֹקֵחַ מִגַּזְלָן לֵית לֵיהּ שְׁבָחָא. אִי בְּבַעַל חוֹב – קַשְׁיָא רֵישָׁא וְסֵיפָא, דְּאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: בַּעַל חוֹב גּוֹבֶה אֶת הַשֶּׁבַח!
human_translation: But how does Shmuel interpret If to buys from a robber, the first clause a difficulty as Shmuel says buys from a robber does not have the enhancement If to a creditor, the first clause and the latter clause a difficulty as Shmuel says a creditor collects the enhancement
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And what does Shmuel establish her with? If with one who acquires from a robber - the beginning is difficult, for Shmuel said: One who acquires from a robber does not have praise. If with a creditor - the beginning and the end are difficult, for Shmuel said: A creditor collects the praise!

hebrew_text: אִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא בְּלוֹקֵחַ מִגַּזְלָן, כְּגוֹן שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ קַרְקַע. אִי נָמֵי בְּשֶׁקָּנוּ מִיָּדוֹ.
human_translation: If you wish, say to buys from a robber, where owns land Alternatively, to where performed an act of acquisition from possession,
llm_translation: If you will say that it is permitted in the case of one who buys from a thief, for example, if he has land, then yes, when he acquires it from him.

hebrew_text: אִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא בְּבַעַל חוֹב. וְלָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן בְּשֶׁבַח
human_translation: If you wish, say to a creditor, but it not difficult Here, to enhancement
llm_translation: If you ask, say in the case of a creditor. And it is not difficult: here it is in praise.

hebrew_text: הַמַּגִּיעַ לַכְּתֵפַיִם, כָּאן בְּשֶׁבַח שֶׁאֵינוֹ מַגִּיעַ לַכְּתֵפַיִם.
human_translation: that reaches shoulders, there, to enhancement that does not reach shoulders,
llm_translation: One who reaches the shoulders, here in praise that does not reach the shoulders.

hebrew_text: וְהָא מַעֲשִׂים בְּכׇל יוֹם, וְקָא מַגְבֵּי שְׁמוּאֵל אֲפִילּוּ בְּשֶׁבַח הַמַּגִּיעַ לִכְתֵפַיִם!
human_translation: But daily incidents and Shmuel would collect even enhancement that reaches shoulders,
llm_translation: The work is done every day, and Samuel says even in the praise of one who reaches the shoulders!

hebrew_text: לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא דְּמַסֵּיק בֵּיהּ כְּשִׁיעוּר אַרְעָא וּשְׁבָחָא. הָא דְּלָא מַסֵּיק בֵּיהּ אֶלָּא כְּשִׁיעוּר אַרְעָא, דְּיָהֵיב לֵיהּ שְׁבָחֵיהּ וּמְסַלֵּיק לֵיהּ.
human_translation: not difficult; these where owed by the same amount as the land and the enhancement. That where he was owed by only the same amount as the land, as gives his enhancement and dismisses
llm_translation: Not difficult: this that one who measures with it according to the size of the land and the praise. This that one who does not measure with it except according to the size of the land, for he gives it its praise and removes it.

hebrew_text: הָנִיחָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר: אִי אִית לֵיהּ זוּזֵי לְלוֹקֵחַ לָא מָצֵי מְסַלֵּיק לֵיהּ לְבַעַל חוֹב, שַׁפִּיר. אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר כִּי אִית לֵיהּ זוּזֵי לְלוֹקֵחַ מָצֵי מְסַלֵּיק לֵיהּ לְבַעַל חוֹב, נֵימָא לֵיהּ: אִילּוּ הֲוָה לִי זוּזֵי, הֲוָה מְסַלְּקִינָּךְ מִכּוּלַּהּ אַרְעָא, הַשְׁתָּא דְּלֵית לִי זוּזֵי, הַב לִי גְּרִבָא דְאַרְעָא (בְּאַרְעָא) [בְּהָא אַרְעָא] שִׁיעוּר שְׁבָחַאי!
human_translation: This works out well according to the one who says if purchaser has money, he is unable to dismiss creditor But according to the one who says when purchaser has money he can dismiss creditor let say to him: If I had money, I would have dismissed you from the entire land. Now that I do not have money give me a se’a of land from the land the amount of my enhancement.
llm_translation: He left it for the one who says: If he has money to buy, he cannot collect it for the creditor, that is good. But for the one who says: If he has money to buy, he can collect it for the creditor, let him say to him: If I had money, I would remove you from the entire land, but now that I do not have money, come to me a clod of earth, the measure of my praise!

hebrew_text: הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן – כְּגוֹן שֶׁעֲשָׂאוֹ אַפּוֹתֵיקֵי. דַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ: לֹא יְהֵא לְךָ פֵּרָעוֹן אֶלָּא מִזּוֹ.
human_translation: Here we are dealing with where set aside designated repayment [ apoteiki ] as he said to You will be repaid only from this
llm_translation: Here we are dealing with - such as when he made him apothecaries. For he said to him: "You shall have no payment except from this."

hebrew_text: הִכִּיר בָּהּ שֶׁאֵינָהּ שֶׁלּוֹ וּלְקָחָהּ, אָמַר רַב: מָעוֹת יֵשׁ לוֹ, שֶׁבַח אֵין לוֹ. וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ מָעוֹת אֵין לוֹ.
human_translation: recognized that it was not but he purchased it Rav says has money he does not have enhancement And Shmuel says he does not have even money
llm_translation: Recognized in her that she is not his and took her, Rav said: He has money, but no praise. And Shmuel said: Even money he does not have.

hebrew_text: בְּמַאי קָמִיפַּלְגִי? רַב סָבַר: אָדָם יוֹדֵעַ שֶׁקַּרְקַע אֵין לוֹ, וְגָמַר וְנָתַן לְשׁוּם פִּקָּדוֹן. וְנֵימָא לֵיהּ לְשׁוּם פִּקָּדוֹן! סָבַר לָא מְקַבֵּל.
human_translation: With regard to what do disagree? Rav holds a person knows that he does not have land, and he resolved to give as a deposit. But let him say to as a deposit. thought would not accept
llm_translation: With what did he divide? Rav holds: A person knows that he has no ground, and he measured and gave as a deposit. And should we say he gave as a deposit! He holds that it is not accepted.

hebrew_text: וּשְׁמוּאֵל סָבַר: אָדָם יוֹדֵעַ שֶׁקַּרְקַע אֵין לוֹ, וְגָמַר וְנָתַן לְשׁוּם מַתָּנָה. וְנֵימָא לֵיהּ לְשׁוּם מַתָּנָה! כְּסִיפָא לֵיהּ מִילְּתָא.
human_translation: And Shmuel holds a person knows that he does not have land, and he resolved to give as a gift. But let him say to as a gift. the matter embarrassing for
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And Samuel holds: A person knows that he has no land, and he finishes and gives as a gift to Shum. And it is said to him: To Shum as a gift! The end of the matter to him is a word. English translation: And Samuel maintains: A person knows that he has no land, and he concludes and gives as a gift to Shum. And it is said to him: To Shum as a gift! The end of the matter to him is a word.

hebrew_text: וְהָא פְּלִיגִי בַּיהּ חֲדָא זִימְנָא, דְּאִיתְּמַר: הַמְקַדֵּשׁ אֶת אֲחוֹתוֹ, רַב אָמַר: מָעוֹת חוֹזְרִין, וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: מָעוֹת מַתָּנָה. רַב אָמַר: מָעוֹת חוֹזְרִין, אָדָם יוֹדֵעַ שֶׁאֵין קִידּוּשִׁין תּוֹפְסִין בַּאֲחוֹתוֹ, וְגָמַר וְנָתַן לְשׁוּם פִּקָּדוֹן. וְנֵימָא לַהּ לְשׁוּם פִּקָּדוֹן! סָבַר לָא מְקַבְּלָה מִינֵּיהּ.
human_translation: But didn’t disagree about one time? As it was stated one who betroths his sister: Rav says: The money is returned, and Shmuel says: money a gift, Rav says: The money returned a person knows that betrothal does not take effect with his sister, and he decided to give for the purpose of a deposit. And let him say to her for the purpose of a deposit. He thought she would not accept it from him.
llm_translation: And this is the argument that was presented once: It was stated: One who betroths his sister, Rav said: The money returns, and Shmuel said: The money is a gift. Rav said: The money returns, for a person knows that betrothals do not take effect with his sister, and he completes it and gives it for the sake of a deposit. And it is said to him: For the sake of a deposit! He thought that she would not accept it from him.

hebrew_text: וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: מָעוֹת מַתָּנָה – אָדָם יוֹדֵעַ שֶׁאֵין קִידּוּשִׁין תּוֹפְסִין בַּאֲחוֹתוֹ, וְגָמַר וְנָתַן לְשׁוּם מַתָּנָה. וְנֵימָא לָהּ לְשׁוּם מַתָּנָה! כְּסִיפָא לַהּ מִילְּתָא
human_translation: And Shmuel says: money a gift a person knows that betrothal does not take effect with his sister, and he decided to give for the purpose of a gift. And let him say to her for the purpose of a gift. the matter embarrassing to her
llm_translation: Samuel said: "Monetary gifts - a person knows that betrothals do not take effect with his sister, and he completes and gives it as a gift. And it is said to her as a gift! The end of the matter for her."

hebrew_text: צְרִיכָא: דְּאִי אִיתְּמַר בְּהָא, בְּהָא קָאָמַר רַב, דְּלָא עָבְדִי אִינָשֵׁי דְּיָהֲבִי מַתָּנוֹת לְנוּכְרָאָה. אֲבָל גַּבֵּי אֲחוֹתוֹ אֵימָא מוֹדֵה לֵיהּ לִשְׁמוּאֵל.
human_translation: necessary because if it were stated with regard to that in that Rav says as people do not tend to give gifts to non-relatives, But with regard to his sister, say concedes to Shmuel
llm_translation: Issue: If it is stated in this case, in this case Rav is saying, that people should not give gifts to idolaters. But regarding his sister, say that he agrees with Shmuel.

hebrew_text: וְאִי אִיתְּמַר בְּהָךְ, בְּהָךְ קָאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: אֲבָל בְּהָא אֵימָא מוֹדֶה לֵיהּ לְרַב, צְרִיכָא.
human_translation: And if were stated in that in that Shmuel says but in this say concedes to Rav necessary
llm_translation: And if it was stated in that case, in that case Samuel is saying; but in this case, why not concede to Rav, it is necessary.

hebrew_text: בֵּין לְרַב דְּאָמַר פִּקָּדוֹן, בֵּין לִשְׁמוּאֵל דְּאָמַר מַתָּנָה, הַאי לְאַרְעָא בְּמַאי קָא נָחֵית, וּפֵירוֹת הֵיכִי אָכֵיל?
human_translation: Both according to Rav, who says a deposit, and according to Shmuel, who says a gift, this with what does he take possession of the land, and how consuming produce?
llm_translation: Between Rav who said it is a deposit, and Shmuel who said it is a gift, with what does this come to the land, and how does one eat the fruits?

hebrew_text: סָבַר: אֲנָא אֵיחוֹת לְאַרְעָא וְאֶיעְבֵּיד וְאֵיכוֹל בְּגַוַּיהּ כִּי הֵיכִי דַּהֲוָה קָא עָבֵיד אִיהוּ, לְכִי אָתֵי מָרֵיהּ דְּאַרְעָא זוּזַאי נֶהְווֹ, לְרַב דְּאָמַר פִּקָּדוֹן – פִּקָּדוֹן, לִשְׁמוּאֵל דְּאָמַר מַתָּנָה – מַתָּנָה.
human_translation: reasons: I will take possession of the land, and work and consume in it, just as would have done. when the owner of the land comes money will be According to Rav, who says a deposit, a deposit, according to Shmuel, who says a gift, a gift.
llm_translation: He thought: I will go to the land and work and eat with its inhabitants, so that he would be doing his work. When his master of the land came, his wages were ready. According to Rav who says "payment is payment," and according to Shmuel who says "a gift is a gift."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא, הִלְכְתָא: יֵשׁ לוֹ מָעוֹת וְיֵשׁ לוֹ שֶׁבַח, וְאַף עַל פִּי שֶׁלֹּא פֵּירֵשׁ לוֹ אֶת הַשֶּׁבַח. הִכִּיר בָּהּ שֶׁאֵינָהּ שֶׁלּוֹ וּלְקָחָהּ – מָעוֹת יֵשׁ לוֹ, שֶׁבַח אֵין לוֹ.
human_translation: Rava said: the halakha has money and he has enhancement, And even if did not explicitly to him the enhancement. recognized that was not and he purchased it he has money he does not have enhancement,
llm_translation: Rava said, it is a halacha: he has money and he has praise, even though he did not explicitly designate the praise for him. If he recognized it as not his and took it - he has money, but he does not have praise.

hebrew_text: אַחְרָיוּת טָעוּת סוֹפֵר הוּא, בֵּין בִּשְׁטָרֵי הַלְוָאָה, בֵּין בִּשְׁטָרֵי מִקָּח וּמִמְכָּר.
human_translation: guarantee is a scribal error. both with regard to promissory notes and with regard to deeds of buying and selling,
llm_translation: Succession is the error of the scribe, whether in loan documents or in deeds of sale and purchase.

hebrew_text: בְּעָא מִינֵּיהּ שְׁמוּאֵל מֵרַב: חָזַר וּלְקָחָהּ מִבְּעָלִים הָרִאשׁוֹנִים, מַהוּ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מָה מָכַר לוֹ רִאשׁוֹן לַשֵּׁנִי – כׇּל זְכוּת שֶׁתָּבֹא לְיָדוֹ.
human_translation: Shmuel asked Rav: then purchased it from the original owner, what is said to him: What did first sell to the second any rights that will come into his possession.
llm_translation: Samuel asked Rav: He returned and took it from the original owners, what? He said to him: Whatever the first sold to the second - all merit that comes to his hand.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא? מָר זוּטְרָא אָמַר: נִיחָא לֵיהּ דְּלָא נִקְרְיֵיהּ גַּזְלָנָא. רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: נִיחָא לֵיהּ דְּלֵיקוּ בְּהֵמָנוּתֵיהּ.
human_translation: What is the reason Mar Zutra said: It is preferable for him not to be called a robber Rav Ashi said: It is preferable for him to maintain his reliability,
llm_translation: What is the reason? Mar Zutra said: It is preferable for him that he is not called a thief. Rav Ashi said: It is preferable for him that his livestock do not die.

hebrew_text: מַאי בֵּינַיְיהוּ? אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ דְּמִית לוֹקֵחַ: מַאן דְּאָמַר נִיחָא לֵיהּ דְּלָא לִקְרְיֵיהּ גַּזְלָנָא –
human_translation: What is between between them is where purchaser died. the one who says it is preferable for him not to be called a robber,
llm_translation: What is the difference between them? There is a difference between them regarding one who claims that it is preferable for him not to read the stolen item.

hebrew_text: הָא מִית לֵיהּ. וּמַאן דְּאָמַר: נִיחָא לֵיהּ דְּלֵיקוּם בְּהֵמָנוּתֵיהּ – בַּהֲדֵי בְּנֵי נָמֵי נִיחָא לֵיהּ דְּלֵיקוּם בְּהֵמָנוּתֵיהּ.
human_translation: died, And the one who says it is preferable for him to maintain his reliability, it is preferable for him to maintain his reliability with regard to children too.
llm_translation: The text reads: "Ha mit lei. Uman de'amar: Nicha lei de'leikum be'hemanutei - bahadei b'nei namei nicha lei de'leikum be'hemanutei." Translation: "He dies. And one who says: It is preferable for him not to have his livestock - in the presence of the sons of Namei it is preferable for him not to have his livestock."

hebrew_text: סוֹף סוֹף קָרוּ לֵיהּ בְּנֵי לוֹקֵחַ ״גַּזְלָנָא״!
human_translation: Ultimately, the purchaser’s children call a robber
llm_translation: At the end, the sons of Lokai called him "a thief"!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ דְּמִית גַּזְלָן. מַאן דְּאָמַר נִיחָא לֵיהּ לְאִינִישׁ דְּלָא לִקְרְיוּהּו ״גַּזְלָן״, הָא מִית לֵיהּ. לְמַאן דְּאָמַר נִיחָא לֵיהּ דְּלֵיקוּם בְּהֵמָנוּתֵיהּ, הָכִי נָמֵי אַף עַל גַּב דְּמִית – נִיחָא לֵיהּ דְּלֵיקוּם בְּהֵמָנוּתֵיהּ!
human_translation: Rather, between them is where robber died, the one who says it is preferable for a person not to be called a robber, he died according to the one who says it is preferable for him to maintain his reliability, also, even though died, preferable for him to maintain his reliability,
llm_translation: Rather: there is a difference between them regarding one who is suspected of theft. One who says it is preferable for a person not to be called a "thief," he dies. And one who says it is preferable for him that his property be restored to him, so it is also said, even though he is suspected - it is preferable for him that his property be restored to him!

hebrew_text: סוֹף סוֹף קָרוּ לִבְנֵיהּ: ״בְּנֵי גַּזְלָנָא״.
human_translation: Ultimately, call his children the children of a robber.
llm_translation: End, end, his sons called out: "Sons of Gazlanah."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ דְּיַהֲבַהּ בְּמַתָּנָה. מַאן דְּאָמַר נִיחָא לֵיהּ דְּלֵיקוּם בְּהֵמָנוּתֵיהּ – מַתָּנָה נָמֵי נִיחָא לֵיהּ דְּלֵיקוּם בְּהֵמָנוּתֵיהּ. מַאן דְּאָמַר נִיחָא לֵיהּ דְּלָא נִקְרְיוּהּו ״גַּזְלָנָא״ – אָמַר לֵיהּ: מַאי גְּזַלִי מִינָּךְ.
human_translation: Rather, between them is where gave as a gift the one who says it is preferable for him to maintain his reliability, a gift also, it is preferable for him to maintain his reliability. the one who says it is preferable for him not to be called a robber, say to What did I rob you of?
llm_translation: Rather, there is a distinction between them in that he gave it as a gift. The one who says it is preferable for him not to acquire it through his possessions – a gift is also preferable for him not to acquire it through his possessions. The one who says it is preferable for him not to be called a "thief" – he said to him: What have I stolen from you.

hebrew_text: פְּשִׁיטָא: זַבְּנַהּ, אוֹרְתַהּ, וְיַהֲבַהּ בְּמַתָּנָה – לָאו לְאוֹקֹמַהּ קַמֵּי לוֹקֵחַ קָא בָּעֵי.
human_translation: obvious sold it bequeathed it, or gave it as a gift, does not want to establish it before, buyer.
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "Peshita: zavna, orta, v'yahava b'mattana - lav l'okmaha kammei loke'ach ka ba'ei."

hebrew_text: נְפַלָה לֵיהּ בִּירוּשָׁה, יְרוּשָּׁה מִמֵּילָא הִיא, וְלָאו אִיהוּ קָא טָרַח אַבָּתְרַהּ.
human_translation: came into his as an inheritance, an inheritance is passively, and did not make an effort to it.
llm_translation: She fell in inheritance, inheritance is automatically hers, and he is not exerting himself afterwards.

hebrew_text: גַּבְיַ[הּ] (אִיהוּ) בְּחוֹבוֹ, חָזֵינַן אִי אִית לֵיהּ אַרְעָא אַחֲרִיתִי וַאֲמַר: הַאי בָּעֵינָא, לְאוֹקֹמַהּ קַמֵּיהּ לוֹקֵחַ קָא בָּעֵי.
human_translation: collected for a debt to him we see If has other land and said: I want this wanted to establish it before buyer
llm_translation: Gavyah (ihu) bechovo, chazeinan i eit lei ar'a achariti va'amar: hai ba'eina, le'okomah kamaih loke'ach ka ba'e.

hebrew_text: וְאִי לָא, זוּזֵי הוּא דְּבָעֵי אִפְּרוֹעֵי.
human_translation: And if not He wanted to be paid money
llm_translation: And if not, it is Zuzay who requires atonement.

hebrew_text: יַהֲבַהּ נִהֲלֵיהּ בְּמַתָּנָה, פְּלִיגִי בַּהּ רַב אַחָא וְרָבִינָא. חַד אָמַר: מַתָּנָה כִּירוּשָּׁה, דְּהָא מִמֵּילָא. וְחַד אָמַר: מַתָּנָה כְּמֶכֶר, דְּאִי לָאו דְּטָרַח וְאַרְצִי קַמֵּיהּ לָא הָוֵי יָהֵיב לֵיהּ מַתָּנָה, לְהָכִי טְרַח וְאַרְצִי קַמֵּיהּ, כִּי הֵיכִי דְּלֵיקוּם בְּהֵמָנוּתֵיהּ.
human_translation: gave as a gift to Rav Aḥa and Ravina disagree. One says a gift as an inheritance, as passively, and one says a gift as a sale. because were it not that took the trouble to ingratiate himself with he would not have given to him a gift. for this took the trouble to ingratiate himself with him, in order to maintain his reliability.
llm_translation: He gave it to him as a gift, they dispute it: Rav Acha and Ravina. One said: A gift is like an inheritance, for it is from the mouth. And one said: A gift is like a sale, for if not that he exerted and pleased before him, he would not have given him a gift, therefore he exerted and pleased before him, so that his livestock would be established.

hebrew_text: וְעַד אֵימַת נִיחָא לֵיהּ דְּלֵיקוּם בְּהֵמָנוּתֵיהּ? אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: עַד שְׁעַת הַעֲמָדָה בַּדִּין.
human_translation: And until when it is preferable for him to maintain his reliability? Rav Huna says: Until the time of standing trial.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Until when is it preferable for him to establish his ownership of his animals? Rav Huna said: Until the time of standing in judgment.

hebrew_text: חִיָּיא בַּר רַב אָמַר: עַד דְּמָטְ[יָ]א אַדְרַכְתָּא לִידֵיהּ. רַב פָּפָּא אָמַר: עַד דְּמַתְחֲלִן יוֹמֵי אַכְרַזְתָּא.
human_translation: Ḥiyya bar Rav says until authorization comes into possession. Rav Pappa says until the days of announcement begin.
llm_translation: Ḥiyya bar Rav said: Until you reach his doorstep. Rav Papa said: Until the days of the proclamation begin.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רָמֵי בַּר חָמָא: מִכְּדִי הַאי לוֹקֵחַ בְּמַאי קָנֵי לְהַאי אַרְעָא – בְּהַאי שְׁטָרָא, הַאי שְׁטָרָא חַסְפָּא בְּעָלְמָא הוּא!
human_translation: Rami bar Ḥama objects to after all, by what does this purchaser acquire this land? by this deed this document is merely a shard,
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: He (Rami bar Hama) strongly objects to her (the woman's) claim: From where does this one (the buyer) acquire (the land) with what (money)? With this document (contract) - this document is merely a piece of paper!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא: תְּהֵא בְּמַאֲמִינוֹ, בְּהָהִיא הֲנָאָה דְּלָא קָאָמַר לֵיהּ מִידֵּי וְקָא סָמֵיךְ עֲלֵיהּ טָרַח וּמַיְיתֵי לֵיהּ, גָּמַר וּמַקְנֵי לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rava said to him Let to he trusts him By that satisfaction that not having said anything to him but relied on him, takes the trouble and brings to him resolves to transfer ownership to him.
llm_translation: He said to him, Rava: Let it be according to his opinion, in that pleasure that he did not say to him directly, and he relies on it, he exerts effort and brings it to him, he completes and acquires it.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: מַה שֶּׁאִירַשׁ מֵאַבָּא מָכוּר לָךְ, מַה שֶּׁתַּעֲלֶה מְצוּדָתִי מָכוּר לָךְ – לֹא אָמַר כְּלוּם. מַה שֶּׁאִירַשׁ מִן אַבָּא הַיּוֹם מָכוּר לָךְ, מַה שֶּׁתַּעֲלֶה מְצוּדָתִי הַיּוֹם מָכוּר לָךְ – דְּבָרָיו קַיָּימִין!
human_translation: Rav Sheshet raises an objection That which I will inherit from my father is sold to you, That which my net will catch is sold to you, he has said nothing, as That which I will inherit from my father today is sold to you, That which my net will catch today is sold to you, his statement stands.
llm_translation: The Gemara raises an objection: Rav Sheshet raised a dilemma: Whatever one inherits from his father and sells to you, and whatever will come into my possession today and I sell to you - he did not say anything. Whatever one inherits from his father today and sells to you, and whatever will come into my possession today and I sell to you - his words are valid!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָמֵי בַּר חָמָא: הָא גַּבְרָא וְהָא תְּיוּבְתָּא!
human_translation: Rami bar Ḥama said This is the man and this is his refutation
llm_translation: Ramei bar Ḥama said: "Ha gavra ve'ha teyuvta!"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: גַּבְרָא קָא חָזֵינָא, וּתְיוּבְתָּא לָא קָא חָזֵינָא. הָכָא סָמְכָא דַּעְתֵּיהּ, וְהָכָא לָא סָמְכָא דַּעְתֵּיהּ. הָכָא סָמְכָא דַּעְתֵּיהּ – דְּאָזֵיל טָרַח וּמַיְיתֵי לֵיהּ כִּי הֵיכִי, דְּלָא נִקְרְיֵיהּ ״גַּזְלָנָא״. הָכָא לָא סָמְכָא דַּעְתֵּיהּ.
human_translation: Rava said I see man, but I do not see the conclusive refutation. Here, relies but there, does not rely Here, relies to go take the trouble and provide him so that he will not be called a robber. there, does not rely
llm_translation: Rava said: A man we see, but a woman we do not see. Here he relied on his own judgment, and here he did not rely on his own judgment. Here he relied on his own judgment - for he goes and brings it in such a way that he is not called a thief. Here he did not rely on his own judgment.

hebrew_text: שַׁלְחוּהָ לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי אַבָּא בַּר זַבְדָּא. אֲמַר לְהוּ: זוֹ אֵינָהּ צְרִיכָה לִפְנִים. אָמַר רָבָא: זוֹ צְרִיכָה לִפְנִים וְלִפְנַי לִפְנִים. הָכָא סָמְכָא דַּעְתֵּיהּ, וְהָכָא לָא סָמְכָא דַּעְתֵּיהּ.
human_translation: sent it before Rabbi Abba bar Zavda said to them: This need not inside Rava said: This needs inside and inside the innermost here, relies there, does not rely
llm_translation: Send her before Rabbi Abba bar Zabda. He said to them: This one does not need to be brought inside. Rava said: This one needs to be brought inside and brought inside again. Here he relied on his opinion, and here he did not rely on his opinion.

hebrew_text: הֲוָה עוֹבָדָא בְּפוּמְבְּדִיתָא וְאוֹתְבֵיהּ. אֲמַר לְהוּ רַב יוֹסֵף: זוֹ אֵינָהּ צְרִיכָה לְפָנִים. וַאֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: צְרִיכָה לִפְנִים וְלִפְנַי לִפְנִים, הָכָא סָמְכָא דַּעְתֵּיהּ, הָכָא לָא סָמְכָא דַּעְתֵּיהּ.
human_translation: There was an incident in Pumbedita and refuted Rav Yosef said to them: This need not inside And Abaye said to him: needs inside and inside the innermost here relies there does not rely
llm_translation: The matter was in the town of Pumbedita, and he wrote it. Rav Yosef said to them: This one does not need to be before. And Abaye said to him: It needs to be before and before before, here his mind relied, here his mind did not rely.

hebrew_text: וּמַאי שְׁנָא רֵישָׁא וּמַאי שְׁנָא סֵיפָא? אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: סֵיפָא ״מַה שֶּׁאִירַשׁ מֵאַבָּא הַיּוֹם״ – מִשּׁוּם כְּבוֹד אָבִיו. ״מַה שֶּׁתַּעֲלֶה מְצוּדָתִי הַיּוֹם״ –
human_translation: And what is different the first clause, and what is different the latter clause, Rabbi Yoḥanan said: the latter clause, that which I will inherit from my father today, for the honor of his father. That which my net will catch today
llm_translation: "What is the difference between the beginning and the end? Rabbi Yochanan said: The end, 'that which I inherited from my father today,' is out of respect for his father. 'That which my net worth has increased today' –"

hebrew_text: מִשּׁוּם כְּדֵי חַיָּיו.
human_translation: because for his livelihood.
llm_translation: On account of the length of his life.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב הוּנָא אָמַר רַב: הָאוֹמֵר לַחֲבֵרוֹ שָׂדֶה שֶׁאֲנִי לוֹקֵחַ, לִכְשֶׁאֶקָּחֶנָּה, קְנוּיָה לָךְ מֵעַכְשָׁיו – קָנָה.
human_translation: Rav Huna says Rav says: one who says to another: field that I buy, when I buy it, transferred to your ownership from now, acquired
llm_translation: Rav Huna said in the name of Rav: One who says to his friend, "A field that I am acquiring," when he acquires it, it is acquired for you from now on - it is acquired.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: מִסְתַּבְּרָא מִלְּתֵאּ דְרַב בְּשָׂדֶה סְתָם. אֲבָל בְּשָׂדֶה זוֹ – לָא. מִי יֵימַר דִּמְזַבֵּין לַהּ נִיהֲלֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rava said: The statement of Rav is reasonable with regard to an unspecified field, But with regard to this field not who is to say that sell it to him?
llm_translation: Rava said: The matter of Rav is logical in an open field. But in this specific field - no. Who can say that they should sell it to him at its value.

hebrew_text: וְהָאֱלֹהִים! אָמַר רַב: אֲפִילּוּ בְּ״שָׂדֶה זוֹ״ מִכְּדֵי רַב כְּמַאן אַמְרַהּ לִשְׁמַעְתֵּיהּ – כְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר, דְּאָמַר: אָדָם מַקְנֶה דָּבָר שֶׁלֹּא בָּא לָעוֹלָם.
human_translation: By God! Rav said even in This field. After all, in accordance with whose did Rav state his halakha ? in accordance with Rabbi Meir, who says a person can transfer ownership of an entity that has not come into the world.
llm_translation: "And God! Said Rav: Even in 'this field' according to Rav, who did he say it to? - Like Rabbi Meir, who said: A person acquires something that has not come into the world."

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא: הָאוֹמֵר לְאִשָּׁה ״הִתְקַדְּשִׁי לִי לְאַחַר שֶׁאֶתְגַּיֵּיר״, ״לְאַחַר שֶׁתִּתְגַּיְּירִי״, ״לְאַחַר שֶׁאֶשְׁתַּחְרֵר״, ״לְאַחַר שֶׁתִּשְׁתַּחְרְרִי״, ״לְאַחַר שֶׁיָּמוּת בַּעְלִיךְ״, ״לְאַחַר שֶׁיַּחְלוֹץ לָךְ יְבָמִיךְ״, ״לְאַחַר שֶׁתָּמוּת אֲחוֹתִיךְ״ – אֵינָהּ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת.
human_translation: As it is taught one who says to a woman: Be betrothed to me after I convert, After you convert, After I am freed, After you are freed, After your husband dies, After your yavam performs ḥalitza with you, After your sister dies she is not betrothed.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: One who says to a woman, "Be betrothed to me after you convert," "after you have converted," "after you are freed," "after you have been freed," "after your husband dies," "after your yavam performs chalitzah for you," "after your sister dies" – she is not sanctified.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת.
human_translation: Rabbi Meir says: She is betrothed.
llm_translation: Rabbi Meir says: Mequdeshet.

hebrew_text: וְהָא אִשָּׁה כְּ״שָׂדֶה זוֹ״ דָּמְיָא, וְאָמַר רַבִּי מֵאִיר: מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת.
human_translation: And isn’t woman comparable to this field? And Rabbi Meir says she is betrothed.
llm_translation: And the woman is like a field of blood, and Rabbi Meir said: she is betrothed.

hebrew_text: אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הַמּוֹצֵא שְׁטַר הַקְנָאָה בַּשּׁוּק – יַחְזִירוֹ לַבְּעָלִים. דְּאִי מִשּׁוּם דְּכָתַב לִלְוֹת וְלֹא לָוָה – הָא שַׁעְבֵּד נַפְשֵׁיהּ. וְאִי מִשּׁוּם פֵּרָעוֹן – לָא חָיְישִׁינַן לְפֵרָעוֹן, דְּאִם אִיתָא דְּפַרְעֵיהּ – מִקְרָע הֲוָה קָרַע לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Shmuel says: one who finds a deed of transfer, in the marketplace, he must return it to owner, as, if because that wrote to borrow but did not borrow he committed himself And if because of repayment we are not concerned repayment, as, if it were so that repaid it, he would have torn up
llm_translation: Shmuel said: One who finds a bill of sale in the marketplace - shall return it to the owners. For if he wrote to borrow and did not borrow - he has caused harm to himself. And if due to negligence - we are not concerned about negligence, for if it comes to light that he owes - he would have torn it.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: אַבָּא מִן סָפְרֵי דַּיָּינֵי דְּמָר שְׁמוּאֵל הֲוָה, וַהֲוֵינָא כְּבַר שֵׁיתָא כְּבַר שְׁבַע, וּדְכִירְנָא דַּהֲווֹ מַכְרְזִי וְאָמְרִי: הָנֵי שְׁטָרֵי אַקְנְיָיתָא דְּמִשְׁתַּכְחִי בְּשׁוּקָא, נַהְדְּרִינְהוּ לְמָרַיְיהוּ.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman said: My father was of the scribes of the judges of Mar Shmuel, and I was about six seven years old, and I remember that they made an announcement, saying: Those deeds of transfer that are found in the marketplace should be returned to their owners,
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said: Abba from the scribes of Mar Shmuel was, and I was already sixty-seven, and we would remember that there were proclamations and they would say: "These documents of acquisition that were found in the market, let them be honored by their owners."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב עַמְרָם: אַף אֲנַן תְּנֵינָא. כׇּל מַעֲשֵׂה בֵּית דִּין – הֲרֵי זֶה יַחְזִיר, אַלְמָא לָא חָיְישִׁינַן לְפֵרָעוֹן. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי זֵירָא: מַתְנִיתִין בִּשְׁטָרֵי חַלְטָאתָא וְאַדְרַכְתָּא, דְּלָאו בְּנֵי פֵרָעוֹן נִינְהוּ.
human_translation: Rav Amram said: We, too, learn One must return any court enactment, Apparently, we are not concerned repayment. Rabbi Zeira said to him: The mishna with regard to bills of foreclosure, and authorization which are not subject to repayment.
llm_translation: Rav Amram said: We also learned. Every action of the court - this one will return, implying that we are not concerned about reimbursement. Rabbi Zeira said to him: We are dealing with documents of loans and promissory notes, which are not considered children of reimbursement.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: וְהָנֵי לָאו בְּנֵי פֵרָעוֹן נִינְהוּ? וְהָא אָמְרִי נְהַרְדָּעֵי: שׁוּמָא הָדַר עַד תְּרֵיסַר יַרְחֵי שַׁתָּא. וְאָמַר אַמֵּימָר: אֲנָא מִנְּהַרְדְּעָא אֲנָא, וּסְבִירָא לִי דְּשׁוּמָא הָדַר לְעוֹלָם.
human_translation: Rava said And are these not subject to repayment? But didn’t of Neharde’a say appraisal returned until twelve months the year And Ameimar said: I am from Neharde’a, and I hold that an appraisal always returned.
llm_translation: Rava said: Are these not the sons of Pharaoh? But didn't the Nehardeans say: Perhaps he returned until the twelfth month. And Amemar said: I am from Nehardea, and I think that perhaps he returned forever.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא, הָתָם הַיְינוּ טַעְמָא: דַּאֲמַרִי אִיהוּ הוּא דְּאַפְסֵיד אַנַּפְשֵׁיהּ, דִּבְעִידָּנָא דְּפַרְעֵיהּ אִבְּעִי לֵיהּ לְמִקְרְעֵיהּ לִשְׁטָרֵיהּ, אִי נָמֵי לְמִכְתַּב שְׁטָרָא אַחֲרִינָא עִילָּוֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rather, Rava said There, this is the reason As I can say it is he who caused the loss to himself, as at the time he repaid he should have ripped document, alternatively, to write another document for
llm_translation: Rather, Rava said, there, that is the reason: for they say, he is the one who caused himself damage, for at the time when his ox was goring, he should have been careful to restrain it or to write a promissory note. If so, let him bring another promissory note as collateral.

hebrew_text: דְּמִדִּינָא אַרְעָא לָא בָּעֲיָא לְמֶיהְדַּר, וּמִשּׁוּם ״וְעָשִׂיתָ הַיָּשָׁר וְהַטּוֹב בְּעֵינֵי ה׳״ הוּא דַּאֲמוּר רַבָּנַן תֶּהְדַּר. הִלְכָּךְ מֵרֵישָׁא הוּא דְּקָא זָבֵין, אִיבְּעִי לֵיהּ לְמִכְתַּב שְׁטַר זְבִינֵי.
human_translation: that according to the law, the land need not be returned and it is due to “You shall do that which is right and good in the eyes of the Lord” that the Sages said should be returned. Therefore, is purchasing it anew, must write a bill of sale.
llm_translation: From the land of the province does not require to be adorned, and because of "And you shall do what is right and good in the eyes of the Lord" is what the Rabbis said requires adornment. Therefore, from the beginning is when they sell, if he wants to write a bill of sale, let him write it.

hebrew_text: גַּבֵּי שְׁטַר חוֹב מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר? אִם אִיתָא דְּפַרְעֵיהּ, אִיבְּעִי לֵיהּ לְמִיקְרְעֵיהּ לִשְׁטָרֵיהּ. אֵימוֹר אִשְׁתְּמוֹטֵי קָא מִשְׁתְּמִיט לֵיהּ, דְּאָמַר לֵיהּ: לִמְחַר יָהֵבְנָא לָךְ דְּהַשְׁתָּא לֵיתֵיהּ גַּבַּאי, אִי נָמֵי אַפְּשִׁיטֵי דְסָפְרָא זָיֵיר לֵיהּ.
human_translation: With regard to promissory note, what is there to say if it is so that repaid he should have ripped up note? say avoided as he said to him: Tomorrow I will give you as it is not with me now. Alternatively, held back for the fee of the scribe
llm_translation: Regarding a promissory note for a debt, what can be said? If it is found that he has paid it, he should request from him to tear it up. If he claims that it was lost, he should make him swear, saying to him: "Tomorrow I will give it to you, for now I do not have it with me, it is in the hands of the money-changer."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הַמּוֹצֵא שְׁטַר חוֹב בַּשּׁוּק, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁכָּתוּב בּוֹ הֶנְפֵּק – לֹא יַחְזִירוֹ לַבְּעָלִים.
human_translation: Rabbi Abbahu says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: one who finds a promissory note in the marketplace, even if a ratification is written in it, he may not return it to the owner,
llm_translation: Rabbi Avahu said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: One who finds a promissory note of debt in the marketplace, even though it is written in it "to be paid," he should not return it to the owners.

hebrew_text: לָא מִיבַּעְיָא הֵיכָא דְּלֹא כָּתוּב בּוֹ הֶנְפֵּק, דְּאִיכָּא לְמֵימַר כָּתַב לִלְוֹת וְלֹא לָוָה. אֶלָּא אֲפִילּוּ כָּתוּב בּוֹ הֶנְפֵּק, וּמַאי נִיהוּ? דִּמְקוּיָּם – לֹא יַחְזִיר, דְּחָיְישִׁינַן לְפֵרָעוֹן.
human_translation: It is not necessary where a ratification is not written in it, as there is to say wrote to borrow but he did not borrowing But even if a ratification is written in it, And what is that ratified one may not return that we are concerned repayment
llm_translation: The text does not require where it is not written in it, for there is to say he wrote to lend and did not borrow. Rather, even if it is written in it, what is the difference? Since it is established - he shall not return, for we are concerned about loss.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה לְרַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: כׇּל מַעֲשֵׂה בֵּית דִּין הֲרֵי זֶה יַחְזִיר! אֲמַר לֵיהּ יִרְמְיָה בְּרִי: לֹא כׇּל מַעֲשֵׂה בֵּית דִּין שָׁוִים, אֶלָּא כְּגוֹן שֶׁהוּחְזַק כַּפְרָן.
human_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya raised an objection to Rabbi Abbahu One must return any court enactment, said to him: Yirmeya, my son, not all court enactments are equal. Rather, where has the presumptive status of one who denies
llm_translation: He raised an objection to him, Rabbi Yirmeya to Rabbi Avahu: "Every action of the court, behold this will return!" Yirmeya son of Biri said to him: "Not every action of the court is equal, but for example, when it is established like Capran."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: וּמִשּׁוּם דְּהוּחְזַק כַּפְרָן חֲדָא זִמְנָא תּוּ לָא פָּרַע כְּלָל?! אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: מַתְנִיתִין בִּשְׁטַר חַלְטָאתָא וְאַדְרַכְתָּא, וְכִדְרַבִּי זֵירָא.
human_translation: Rava said: But because assumed the presumptive status of one who denies one time never again repay Rather, Rava said: The mishna to a bill of foreclosure, or authorization, in accordance with of Rabbi Zeira.
llm_translation: Rava said: And because he was established as the first Kohen, should he not at all pay?! Rather, Rava said: Mishna in the document of divorce and receipt, as Rabbi Zeira.

hebrew_text: וְכַפְרָן, הוֹאִיל וַאֲתָא לִידַן נֵימָא בֵיהּ מִלְּתָא. דְּאָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף בַּר מִנְיוֹמֵי אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן, אָמְרוּ לוֹ: ״צֵא תֵּן לוֹ״,
human_translation: And one who denies since it came to us, let us say something about it. As Rav Yosef bar Minyumi said Rav Naḥman said: said to Go give him,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And Kafaran, since he came to us with a pleasant word regarding the matter. For Rav Yosef bar Minyomei said in the name of Rav Nachman, they said to him: "Go, give it to him."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר ״פָּרַעְתִּי״ – נֶאֱמָן. בָּא מַלְוֶה לִכְתּוֹב – אֵין כּוֹתְבִין וְנוֹתְנִין לוֹ.
human_translation: and said: I repaid deemed credible. creditor comes to write they do not write and give to him.
llm_translation: And he said, "I have violated" - trustworthy. One who comes to borrow to write - we do not write and give to him.

hebrew_text: ״חַיָּיב אַתָּה לִיתֵּן לוֹ״ וְאָמַר ״פָּרַעְתִּי״ – אֵינוֹ נֶאֱמָן. בָּא מַלְוֶה לִכְתּוֹב – כּוֹתְבִין וְנוֹתְנִין לוֹ.
human_translation: You are liable to give him and said: I repaid is not deemed credible. creditor comes to write they write and give to him.
llm_translation: "You are obligated to give it to him," and he said, "I have paid" - he is not believed. When the lender comes to write - we write and give it to him.

hebrew_text: רַב זְבִיד מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב נַחְמָן אָמַר: בֵּין ״צֵא תֵּן לוֹ״, בֵּין ״חַיָּיב אַתָּה לִיתֵּן לוֹ״, וְאָמַר ״פָּרַעְתִּי״ – נֶאֱמָן. בָּא מַלְוֶה לִכְתּוֹב – אֵין כּוֹתְבִין וְנוֹתְנִין לוֹ.
human_translation: Rav Zevid says in the name of Rabbi Naḥman: Both Go give him and You are liable to give him, said: I repaid deemed credible. creditor comes to write they do not write and give to him.
llm_translation: Rav Zebid, from the name of Rav Nachman, said: Whether "Go out and give it to him," or "You are obligated to give it to him," and he said "I have paid" - he is believed. If one comes to borrow - we do not write and give to him.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אִי אִיכָּא לְפַלּוֹגֵי – הָכִי הוּא דְּאִיכָּא לְפַלּוֹגֵי: אָמְרוּ לוֹ ״צֵא תֵּן לוֹ״, וְאָמַר ״פָּרַעְתִּי״, וְהָעֵדִים מְעִידִין אוֹתוֹ שֶׁלֹּא פְּרָעוֹ, וְחָזַר וְאָמַר ״פָּרַעְתִּי״ – הוּחְזַק כַּפְרָן לְאוֹתוֹ מָמוֹן.
human_translation: Rather, if there is to make a distinction this is how there is to distinguish said to Go give him and said: I repaid and the witnesses testify him that he did not repay it and said again: I repaid has assumed the presumptive status of one who denies to that money,
llm_translation: Rather, if there is room for dispute - this is the case where there is room for dispute: They said to him, "Go, give it to him," and he said, "I have already paid," and the witnesses testify that he did not pay, and he goes back and says, "I have already paid" - he is considered like a deceiver regarding that money.

hebrew_text: ״חַיָּיב אַתָּה לִיתֵּן לוֹ״, וְאָמַר ״פָּרַעְתִּי״, וְהָעֵדִים מְעִידִין אוֹתוֹ שֶׁלֹּא פָּרַע, וְחָזַר וְאָמַר ״פָּרַעְתִּי״ – לֹא הוּחְזַק כַּפְרָן לְאוֹתוֹ מָמוֹן.
human_translation: You are liable to give him and said: I repaid and the witnesses testify him that he did not repay and said again: I repaid, does not assume the presumptive status of one who denies with regard to that money.
llm_translation: "You are obligated to give it to him," and he said, "I have paid." And the witnesses testify that he did not pay, and he then says, "I have paid" - he is not established as a trustworthy person regarding that money.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא? אִשְׁתְּמוֹטֵי הוּא קָא מִשְׁתְּמִיט מִינֵּיהּ, סָבַר עַד דִּמְעַיְּינוּ בִּי רַבָּנַן בְּדִינִי.
human_translation: What is the reason evade thinking until the Sages investigate my case
llm_translation: What is the reason? He is removing himself from it, he thought until when will the Rabbis argue with me in matters.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: ״מָנֶה לִי בְּיָדְךָ״, וְהַלָּה אוֹמֵר: ״אֵין לְךָ בְּיָדִי כְּלוּם״, וְהָעֵדִים מְעִידִים אוֹתוֹ שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ, וְחָזַר וְאָמַר: ״פָּרַעְתִּי״ – הוּחְזַק כַּפְרָן לְאוֹתוֹ מָמוֹן.
human_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥanna says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: I one hundred dinars in your possession and the other says Nothing yours in my possession, and the witnesses testify him that, he does have and subsequently said: I repaid assumes the presumptive status of one who denies with regard to that money.
llm_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana said in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan: "‘Place it in your hand,’ and the borrower says, ‘You have nothing in my hand,’ and witnesses testify that he does have it, and he goes back and says, ‘I have paid’ – he is established as a liar regarding that money."

hebrew_text: כִּי הָא דְּשַׁבְּתַאי בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי מָרִינוּס כְּתַב לַהּ לְכַלְּתֵיהּ אִיצְטְלָא דְמֵילָתָא בִּכְתוּבְּתַהּ, וְקַבְּלַהּ עֲלֵיהּ. אִירְכַס כְּתוּבְּתַהּ. אֲמַר לַהּ: ״לָא הָיוּ דְּבָרִים מֵעוֹלָם״. אֲתוֹ סָהֲדֵי וְאָמְרִי: אִין כְּתַב לַהּ. לְסוֹף אֲמַר לְהוּ: ״פְּרַעְתִּיהָ״. אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי חִיָּיא, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הוּחְזַקְתָּ כַּפְרָן לְאוֹתָהּ אִיצְטְלָא.
human_translation: like this where Shabbtai, son of Rabbi Marinus, wrote to his daughter-in-law a cloak [ itztela ] of fine wool [ demileta ] in her marriage contract, and accepted upon himself Her marriage contract was lost, said to her: These matters never occurred; Witnesses came and said: Yes, he did write her Ultimately, he said to them: I paid it, came before Rabbi Ḥiyya. said to You have assumed the presumptive status of one who denies with regard to that cloak.
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "For the one called Shabbetai, son of Rabbi Marinus, wrote to his daughter the matter of the document in her handwriting, and she accepted it. Her handwriting was erased. He said to her: 'These were never words.' Witnesses came and said: 'He did not write it.' In the end, he said to them: 'I have annulled it.' He came before Rabbi Chiya and he said to him: 'Have you established the document for that matter?'"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אָבִין אָמַר רַבִּי אִלְעָא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הָיָה חַיָּיב לַחֲבֵירוֹ שְׁבוּעָה, וְאָמַר ״נִשְׁבַּעְתִּי״, וְהָעֵדִים מְעִידִין אוֹתוֹ שֶׁלֹּא נִשְׁבַּע, וְחָזַר וְאָמַר ״נִשְׁבַּעְתִּי״ – הוּחְזַק כַּפְרָן לְאוֹתָהּ שְׁבוּעָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Avin says Rabbi Ela says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: was obligated an oath to another and he said: I took the oath, and the witnesses testify him that he did not take an oath and said again: I took the oath, he assumes the status of one who denies with regard to that oath.
llm_translation: Rabbi Avin said in the name of Rabbi Ilai who said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: If one was obligated to his fellow with an oath, and he said, "I have sworn," and witnesses testify that he did not swear, and he then reiterates, "I have sworn" - he is established as a liar regarding that oath.

hebrew_text: אַמְרוּהָ קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי אֲבָהוּ, אֲמַר לְהוּ: מִסְתַּבְּרָא מִלְּתָא דְּרַבִּי אָבִין שֶׁנִּתְחַיֵּיב שְׁבוּעָה בְּבֵית דִּין, אֲבָל חִיֵּיב עַצְמוֹ שְׁבוּעָה – [נֶאֱמָן]. עָבֵיד אִינִישׁ דְּמִקְּרֵי וְאָמַר. אַהְדְּרוּהָ קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי אָבִין, אֲמַר לְהוּ: אֲנָא נָמֵי בְּבֵית דִּין אֲמַרִי.
human_translation: The Rabbis stated before Rabbi Abbahu. He said to them: Rabbi Avin’s statement is reasonable where was obligated by a court to take an oath. But obligated himself an oath, deemed credible. a person is prone to say incidentally brought back Rabbi Avin before said to them: I also said by a court
llm_translation: They said it before Rabbi Avahu, he said to them: It is reasonable the matter of Rabbi Avin that he is obligated to an oath in court, but he himself is obligated to an oath - he is believed. A person may do as he pleases and say. They brought it back before Rabbi Avin, he said to them: I too have said in court.

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר נָמֵי, אָמַר רַבִּי אָבִין אָמַר רַבִּי אִלְעָא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הָיָה חַיָּיב לַחֲבֵירוֹ שְׁבוּעָה בְּבֵית דִּין וְאָמַר ״נִשְׁבַּעְתִּי״ וְהָעֵדִים מְעִידִין אוֹתוֹ שֶׁלֹּא נִשְׁבַּע, וְחָזַר וְאָמַר ״נִשְׁבַּעְתִּי״ – הוּחְזַק כַּפְרָן לְאוֹתָהּ שְׁבוּעָה.
human_translation: It was also stated Rabbi Avin says Rabbi Ela says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: was obligated by a court an oath to another and said: I took the oath, and the witnesses testify him that he did not take an oath and said again: I took the oath, he has assumed that status of one who denies with regard to that oath.
llm_translation: It was stated: Namely, Rabbi Avin said in the name of Rabbi Ela'a who said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: If one was obligated to his fellow in an oath in court, and he said, "I swear," and the witnesses testify that he did not swear, and he then reiterates, "I swear" - he is established as a liar regarding that oath.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אַסִּי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הַמּוֹצֵא שְׁטַר חוֹב בַּשּׁוּק, וְכָתוּב בּוֹ הֶנְפֵּק, וְכָתוּב בּוֹ זְמַנּוֹ בּוֹ בַּיּוֹם – יַחְזִירוֹ לַבְּעָלִים.
human_translation: Rabbi Asi says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: one who finds a promissory note in the marketplace, and a ratification is written in it, and the date of is written in it, on that same day, he must return it to the owner,
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Assi said Rabbi Yochanan: One who finds a promissory note of debt in the marketplace, and it is written in it "it was paid," and it is written in it its time on that day - he shall return it to the owners.

hebrew_text: אִי מִשּׁוּם כָּתַב לִלְוֹת וְלֹא לָוָה – הָא כָּתוּב בּוֹ הֶנְפֵּק. אִי מִשּׁוּם פֵּרָעוֹן – לִפְרִיעָה בַּת יוֹמָא לָא חָיְישִׁינַן.
human_translation: If because wrote to borrow but did not borrow a ratification is written in if because repayment, we are not concerned repayment on the day
llm_translation: If due to a loan and not repayment - what is written in it is derived. If due to negligence - we are not concerned about a loss on that day.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי זֵירָא לְרַבִּי אַסִּי: מִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן הָכִי? הָא אַתְּ הוּא דְּאָמְרַתְּ מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: שְׁטָר שֶׁלָּוָה בּוֹ וּפְרָעוֹ – אֵינוֹ חוֹזֵר וְלֹוֶה בּוֹ, שֶׁכְּבָר נִמְחַל שִׁיעְבּוּדוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira said to Rabbi Asi: Does Rabbi Yoḥanan say this? Isn’t it you who said in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan who borrowed note for and repaid may not reuse it to borrow as its lien is already forgiven
llm_translation: He said to him, Rabbi Zeira to Rabbi Assi: Who said it like this, Rabbi Yochanan? You are the one who said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: A loan document that has been repaid and canceled - one cannot return and borrow with it, as its obligation has already been annulled.

hebrew_text: אֵימַת? אִילֵּימָא לִמְחַר וּלְיוֹמָא חָרָא, מַאי אִרְיָא שֶׁכְּבָר נִמְחַל שִׁעְבּוּדוֹ? תִּיפּוֹק לֵיהּ דְּהָוֵה לֵיהּ מוּקְדָּם, וּתְנַן: שִׁטְרֵי חוֹב הַמּוּקְדָּמִין – פְּסוּלִין.
human_translation: When If we say the day after or another date, Why specifically As its lien is already forgiven? derive that it is antedated, and we learned Antedated promissory notes are invalid.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: When? Perhaps for tomorrow or for the next day, what is the ruling regarding a garment that has already been laundered? Let him bring proof that it was already laundered, and we learned: promissory notes that are prior are invalid. English translation:

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לָאו בְּיוֹמֵיהּ. אַלְמָא פָּרְעִי אִינָשֵׁי בְּיוֹמֵיהּ!
human_translation: Rather, is not on the day Evidently, people do repay on the day
llm_translation: Rather, not in his days. This implies that people are free during his days!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מִי קָא אָמֵינָא דְּלָא פָּרְעִי כְּלָל, דְּלָא שְׁכִיחִי אִינָשֵׁי דְּפָרְעִי בְּיוֹמֵיהּ קָא אָמֵינָא.
human_translation: said to him: Did I say that do not repay at all? I said that uncommon people to repay on the same day.
llm_translation: He said to him: Who is saying that he did not pay at all, for it is not common for people not to pay during their days, I say.

hebrew_text: רַב כָּהֲנָא אָמַר: כְּשֶׁחַיָּיב מוֹדֶה. אִי הָכִי מַאי לְמֵימְרָא?
human_translation: Rav Kahana says when liable party, admits If that is so, what of stating
llm_translation: Rav Kahana said: When one is obligated, he admits. If so, what is there to say?

hebrew_text: מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: הַאי מִפְרָע פַּרְעֵיהּ, וְהַאי דְּקָא אָמַר לָא פְּרַעְתֵּיהּ, מִשּׁוּם דְּקָבָעֵי מֶהְדַּר לְמֵזְפָא בֵּיהּ זִמְנָא אַחֲרִיתִי, וְלִפְשִׁיטֵי דְסָפְרָא חָיֵישׁ, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן דְּאִם כֵּן מַלְוֶה גּוּפֵיהּ לָא שָׁבֵק. סָבַר: שָׁמְעִי בֵּי רַבָּנַן וּמַפְסְדִי לִי.
human_translation: Lest you say this repaid and that says: I did not repay it, is because he wants to go back to borrow again. And concerned about the scribe’s fee teaches us as, if that were so, creditor himself would not allow thinking: The Sages will hear about me and will cause me to lose
llm_translation: What is the reasoning? This one, he is loosening his hair, and this one, he is saying, "I did not loosen it," because they established a fixed time for him to return to his wife, and the scribes are concerned. We learn that if so, he did not leave his body as collateral. He thought: "Listen to the words of the Sages and cause me a loss."

hebrew_text: מַאי שְׁנָא מֵהָא דִּתְנַן: מָצָא שִׁטְרֵי חוֹב, אִם יֵשׁ בָּהֶן אַחְרָיוּת נְכָסִים – לֹא יַחֲזִיר,
human_translation: what is different from that which we learned found promissory notes, if they include a property guarantee he may not return
llm_translation: What is different from what we learned: If one finds promissory notes of debt, if they contain collateral assets - do not return them.

hebrew_text: וְאוֹקִימְנָא, כְּשֶׁחַיָּיב מוֹדֶה. וּמִשּׁוּם שֶׁמָּא כָּתַב לִלְוֹת בְּנִיסָן וְלֹא לָוָה עַד תִּשְׁרֵי, וְאָתֵי לְמִטְרַף לָקוֹחוֹת מִנִּיסָן וְעַד תִּשְׁרֵי שֶׁלֹּא כַּדִּין.
human_translation: And we interpreted when the liable party admits And due to perhaps wrote to borrow in Nisan, but did not borrow until Tishrei, and come to unlawfully repossess purchasers between Nisan and Tishrei.
llm_translation: And we establish, when he admits. And because perhaps he wrote to borrow in Nisan and did not borrow until Tishrei, and he comes to claim receipts from Nisan to Tishrei not in accordance with the law.

hebrew_text: וְלָא אָמְרִינַן דְּאִם כֵּן מַלְוֶה גּוּפֵיהּ לָא שָׁבֵיק. דְּאָמַר לֵיהּ: כְּתוֹב שְׁטָרָא אַחֲרִינָא בְּתִשְׁרִי, דְּדִלְמָא שָׁמְעִי רַבָּנַן וּמַפְסְדִי לִי!
human_translation: And we do not say that if that were so, creditor himself would not allow as he would say to him: Write another note in Tishrei, lest the Sages hear and causing me to lose
llm_translation: And we do not say that if so, he did not leave his body. For he said to him: Write another document in Tishrei, lest the Rabbis hear and cause me a loss!

hebrew_text: אָמְרִי: הָתָם, מִשּׁוּם דְּאִית לֵיהּ רַוְוחָא דְּקָא טָרֵיף לָקוֹחוֹת מִנִּיסָן וְעַד תִּשְׁרֵי, מֵינָח נִיחָא לֵיהּ וְלָא אָמַר וְלָא מִידֵּי. הָכָא, כֵּיוָן דְּלֵית לֵיהּ רַוְוחָא, דְּסוֹף סוֹף שְׁטָרָא הָאִידָּנָא כְּתִיב, מַאי אִיכָּא – דְּקָטָרֵיף לָקוֹחוֹת? בִּשְׁטָר שֶׁנִּמְחַל שִׁיעְבּוּדוֹ לָא שָׁבֵיק.
human_translation: say there, since benefits as repossess purchasers between Nisan and Tishrei, it is satisfactory to him, and he does not say anything here, since does not benefit as ultimately, the note is written current what is there to repossess purchasers he would not allow with note whose lien was forgiven,
llm_translation: They said: There, because there is a space that causes the merchants to rip the bundles from Nissan until Tishrei, he leaves it and does not say "and not immediately." Here, since there is no space, eventually the document will be written, what is the difference - that he ripped the bundles? In a document that was erased, his partnership was not left.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הַטּוֹעֵן אַחַר מַעֲשֵׂה בֵּית דִּין –
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: one who claims already a court enactment,
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Chiya bar Abba said Rabbi Yochanan: One who argues after the ruling of the court -

hebrew_text: לֹא אָמַר כְּלוּם. מַאי טַעְמָא? כׇּל מַעֲשֵׂה בֵּית דִּין – כְּמַאן דְּנָקֵיט שְׁטָרָא בִּידֵיהּ דָּמֵי.
human_translation: he has said nothing. What is the reason any a court enactment is like one who is holding note in his hand,
llm_translation: He did not say anything. What is the reason? All the actions of the court - like one who takes a document in his hand, it is as if he has taken possession.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא לְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: וְלֹא מִשְׁנָתֵינוּ הִיא זוֹ? הוֹצִיאָה גֵּט וְאֵין עִמּוֹ כְּתוּבָּה – גּוֹבָה כְּתוּבָּתָהּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba said to Rabbi Yoḥanan: But Isn’t this a mishna produced a bill of divorce, and there was no accompanying marriage contract, she collects her marriage contract?
llm_translation: He said to him, Rabbi Chiya bar Abba to Rabbi Yochanan: "And is this not from our Mishnah? If one produces a divorce document without any writing on it - its height is its writing."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִי לָאו דְּדַלַּאי לָךְ חַסְפָּא, לָא מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ מַרְגָּנִיתָא תּוּתַהּ.
human_translation: said to him: had I not lifted up the shard for you, you would not have found a pearl beneath it.
llm_translation: He said to him: If it is not that you have a purse, you would not forget a pearl necklace.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: מַאי מַרְגָּנִיתָא? דִּלְמָא בִּמְקוֹם שֶׁאֵין כּוֹתְבִין כְּתוּבָּה עָסְקִינַן, דְּגֵט הַיְינוּ כְּתוּבְּתַהּ. אֲבָל בִּמְקוֹם שֶׁכּוֹתְבִין כְּתוּבָּה, אִי נְקִיטָא כְּתוּבָּה – גָּבְיָא, אִי לָא – לָא גָּבְיָא.
human_translation: Abaye said: What a pearl? perhaps we are dealing with a place where they do not write a marriage contract, as bill of divorce is her marriage contract. But in a place where they do write a marriage contract, if she is holding a marriage contract she collects if not, she does not collect
llm_translation: Abaye said: What is the case of marganita? Perhaps we are dealing with a situation where they do not write a document, for a get is its writing. But in a place where they do write a document, if it takes a document - it is valid; if not - it is not valid.

hebrew_text: הֲדַר אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: לָאו מִלְּתָא הִיא דְּאָמְרִי, דְּאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ בִּמְקוֹם שֶׁאֵין כּוֹתְבִין כְּתוּבָּה עָסְקִינַן, אֲבָל בִּמְקוֹם שֶׁכּוֹתְבִין כְּתוּבָּה, אִי נְקִיטָא כְּתוּבָּה – גָּבְיָא, אִי לָא – לָא גָּבְיָא, אַלְמָנָה מִן הָאֵירוּסִין בְּמַאי גָּבְיָא?
human_translation: Abaye then said: What I said is not correct. As, if it enters your mind we are dealing with a place where they do not write a marriage contract, but in a place where they do write a marriage contract, if she is holding a marriage contract she collects if not she does not collect through what does a widow from betrothal collect
llm_translation: The Talmudic text translates as follows: "Hadar said Abaye: It is not a matter that they said, for if your intention is in a place where they do not write a document, we are dealing with it, but in a place where they write a document, if a document is taken - it is valid, if not - it is not valid. A widow from betrothal, with what are we dealing?"

hebrew_text: בְּעֵדֵי מִיתַת בַּעַל – לִטְעוֹן וְלֵימָא: פְּרַעְתִּיהָ. וְכִי תֵּימָא: הָכִי נָמֵי, אִם כֵּן מָה הוֹעִילוּ חֲכָמִים בְּתַקָּנָתָן?
human_translation: by witnesses to the death of husband, let claim and say: I paid it; And if you would say indeed, if so, what did the Sages accomplish with their ordinance
llm_translation: In the case of the death of a husband - to argue and say: "I have nullified it." And if you say: likewise, if so, what benefit did the sages have in their enactment?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ מָר קַשִּׁישָׁא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב חִסְדָּא לְרַב אָשֵׁי: וְאַלְמָנָה מִן הָאֵירוּסִין, דְּאִית לַהּ כְּתוּבָּה מְנָא לַן?
human_translation: Mar Kashisha, son of Rav Ḥisda, said to Rav Ashi, And from where do we that a widow from betrothal has marriage contract?
llm_translation: The Master, Kashisha, son of Rav Hisda, said to Rav Ashe: "And a widow from the betrothed, who has a marriage contract, from where do we derive this?"

hebrew_text: אִילֵּימָא מֵהָא דִּתְנַן: נִתְאַרְמְלָה אוֹ נִתְגָּרְשָׁה, בֵּין מִן הָאֵירוּסִין וּבֵין מִן הַנִּישּׂוּאִין – גּוֹבָה אֶת הַכֹּל, דִּלְמָא הֵיכָא דִּכְתַב לַהּ?
human_translation: If we say from that which we learned became widowed or divorced, whether from betrothal or from marriage, she collects all perhaps where wrote for her,
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: Perhaps from that which we learned: If she was secluded or divorced, whether from betrothal or from marriage - she collects everything, lest where it is written for her?

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא: מַאי לְמֵימְרָא?! לְאַפּוֹקֵי מִדְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן עֲזַרְיָה, דְּאָמַר שֶׁלֹּא כָּתַב לָהּ אֶלָּא עַל מְנָת לְכוֹנְסָהּ אִצְטְרִיכָא לֵיהּ.
human_translation: And if you would say: what of stating to exclude of Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya, who says as he wrote only on the condition marry her. was necessary for
llm_translation: And if you will say: What is meant by "to say"?! To go out from Rabbi Eliezer ben Azariah, for he said that he did not write it except for the purpose of gathering it, it is necessary for him.

hebrew_text: דַּיְקָא נָמֵי, דְּקָתָנֵי: גּוֹבָה אֶת הַכֹּל. אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא דִּכְתַב לַהּ, הַיְינוּ דְּקָא תָּנֵי גּוֹבֶה אֶת הַכֹּל. אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ דְּלָא כְּתַב לַהּ,
human_translation: is also precise as it teaches: She collects all Granted, if you say that wrote her this is teaches she collects all But if you say that he did not write her
llm_translation: The precise matter stands, as it is taught: "He covers everything." If you say this refers to what is written for it, that is what it is teaching, "He covers everything." But if you say it does not refer to what is written for it,

hebrew_text: מַאי ״גּוֹבָה אֶת הַכֹּל״? מָנֶה וּמָאתַיִם הוּא דְּאִית לַהּ.
human_translation: what She collects all What she has is one hundred or two hundred dinars
llm_translation: What is "Gobah et hakol"? A hundred and two is what it has.

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא, מִדְּתָנֵי רַב חִיָּיא בַּר אַמֵּי: אִשְׁתּוֹ אֲרוּסָה, לֹא אוֹנֵן וְלֹא מִטַּמֵּא לָהּ, וְכֵן הִיא לֹא אוֹנֶנֶת וְלֹא מִטַּמְּאָה לוֹ. מֵתָה – אֵינוֹ יוֹרְשָׁהּ, מֵת הוּא – גּוֹבָה כְּתוּבָּתָהּ.
