human_translation: And instead from that which Rav Ḥiyya bar Ami teaches, One does not enter acute mourning his betrothed wife, nor may he become ritually impure at her and similarly, she does not enter acute mourning for him and may not become ritually impure at his she dies, he does not inherit her he dies, she collects her marriage contract.
llm_translation: And rather, from what Rav Chiya bar Ami taught: His wife, when betrothed, he does not mourn and does not become impure for her, and likewise she does not mourn and does not become impure for him. If she dies, he does not inherit her; if he dies, her marriage contract is collected.

hebrew_text: דִּלְמָא דִּכְתַב לַהּ, וְכִי תֵּימָא: דִּכְתַב לַהּ, מַאי לְמֵימְרָא? מֵתָה אֵינוֹ יוֹרְשָׁהּ אִיצְטְרִיכָא לֵיהּ.
human_translation: perhaps where he wrote for her. And if you would say that he wrote her what of stating it was necessary for she dies, he does not inherit her
llm_translation: Perhaps he wrote to her, and if you will say: he wrote to her, what is there to say? When she dies, he does not inherit her, it is necessary for him.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אַבָּיֵי מִגּוּפַהּ דְּמַתְנִיתִין קָא הָדַר בֵּיהּ, דְּאִי סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ בִּמְקוֹם שֶׁאֵין כּוֹתְבִין כְּתוּבָה עָסְקִינַן, דְּגֵט הַיְינוּ כְּתוּבְּתַהּ, אַטּוּ גֵּט מָנֶה מָאתַיִם כְּתִיב בֵּיהּ?
human_translation: Rather, Abaye retracted from the mishna itself. Because if it enters your mind we are dealing with a place where they do not write a marriage contract, where bill of divorce is her marriage contract, is it written in a bill of divorce one hundred two hundred dinars
llm_translation: Rather, Abbaye is discussing the case of a get (bill of divorce) from the Mishnah, for if it enters your mind that we are dealing with a situation where we do not write a document, the get itself is its writing, then why is it written in the get "a hundred mana"?

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא: כֵּיוָן דְּתַקִּינוּ רַבָּנַן לְמִגְבֵּא (לַהּ) [בֵּיהּ] כְּמַאן דִּכְתִיב בֵּיהּ דָּמֵי, לִטְעוֹן וְלֵימָא פָּרַעְתִּי.
human_translation: And if you would say since the Sages instituted she to collect it is considered as though is written in it, should claim and say: I paid
llm_translation: And if you will say: Since the Rabbis established to collect from him like one who is written in it blood, to claim and say "I have paid."

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא דְּאָמְרִינַן לֵיהּ: אִי פְּרַעְתַּהּ אִיבְּעִי לָךְ לְמִיקְרְעֵיהּ, אָמַר לַן: לָא שְׁבַקְתַּן, אָמְרָה: בָּעֵינָא לְאִנְּסוֹבֵי בֵּיהּ.
human_translation: And if you would say that we would say to him: If, you paid her, you should have torn up he could say to us: She did not allow she said: I need to remarry, by it
llm_translation: And if you say that we say to him: if you have paid it, you should ask for it back, he said to us: I did not leave them, she said: I want to be tested with it.

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא אָמְרִינַן לֵיהּ: אִיבְּעִי לָךְ לְמִיקְרְעֵיהּ וּמִכְתַּב אַגַּבֵּיהּ, גִּיטָּא דְּנַן דִּקְרַעְנוּהּו לָא מִשּׁוּם דְּגִיטָּא פְּסוּלָה הוּא, אֶלָּא כִּי הֵיכִי דְּלָא תִּגְבֵּי בֵּיהּ זִמְנָא אַחֲרִיתִי. אַטּוּ כֹּל דְּמַגְבֵּי, בְּבֵי דִינָא מַגְבֵּי?
human_translation: And if you would say we would say to him: You should have torn up and written on the back of it: that we tore up this bill of divorce is not because it is an invalid bill of divorce, rather in order that not collect again with it, Does everyone who collects collect in court,
llm_translation: And if you will say, we say to him: "If it pleases you to tear it and write another one on top of it, our document that we tore is not invalid as a document, but rather so that it will not be used for another time. Now, does everyone who tears, in the house of judgment, tear?

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ מָצָא גִּיטֵּי נָשִׁים וְשִׁחְרוּרֵי עֲבָדִים, דְּיָיתֵיקֵי, מַתָּנָה, וְשׁוֹבָרִין – הֲרֵי זֶה לֹא יַחֲזִיר. שֶׁאֲנִי אוֹמֵר: כְּתוּבִין הָיוּ, וְנִמְלַךְ עֲלֵיהֶן שֶׁלֹּא לִתְּנָן.
human_translation: one found bills of divorce, or manumission of slaves, wills, a gift, or receipts, he may not return as I say they were written and reconsidered about them not to deliver them.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: If one finds bills of divorce of women and manumission documents of slaves, if they are torn, obliterated, or cut, he shall not return them. For I say: They were written, and it was ruled upon them that they should not be returned.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ טַעְמָא דְּנִמְלַךְ שֶׁלֹּא לִתְּנָן, הָא אָמַר: ״תְּנוּ״ – נוֹתְנִין, וַאֲפִילּוּ לִזְמַן מְרוּבֶּה.
human_translation: reason that reconsidered with regard to them not to deliver them. But says: Give must give And even a long time
llm_translation: The taste of a king who did not consent, this is what he said: "Give" - we give, even to a majority.

hebrew_text: וּרְמִינְהוּ: הַמֵּבִיא גֵּט, וְאָבַד הֵימֶנּוּ – מְצָאוֹ לְאַלְתַּר כָּשֵׁר, אִם לָאו – פָּסוּל.
human_translation: And raises a contradiction who was bringing a bill of divorce and it was lost by him, found it immediately, valid. If not, not valid,
llm_translation: And they raised an objection: One who brings a bill of divorce, and it gets lost - if he finds it immediately, it is valid; if not, it is invalid.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה, לָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן – בִּמְקוֹם שֶׁהַשְּׁיָירוֹת מְצוּיוֹת, כָּאן – בִּמְקוֹם שֶׁאֵין הַשַּׁיָּירוֹת מְצוּיוֹת.
human_translation: Rabba says: not difficult, there, with regard to a place where caravans are common, here with regard to a place where caravans are uncommon,
llm_translation: Rabba said, it is not difficult: here - in a place where the leftovers are found, here - in a place where the leftovers are not found.

hebrew_text: וַאֲפִילּוּ בִּמְקוֹם שֶׁהַשְּׁיָירוֹת מְצוּיוֹת – וְהוּא שֶׁהוּחְזְקוּ שְׁנֵי יוֹסֵף בֶּן שִׁמְעוֹן בְּעִיר אַחַת.
human_translation: And even in a place where caravans are common, and is where has been established two Yosef ben Shimon in one city.
llm_translation: And even in a place where the remnants are found - and this is when it was established that two Joseph ben Shimon were in one city.

hebrew_text: דְּאִי לָא תֵּימָא הָכִי, קַשְׁיָא דְּרַבָּה אַדְּרַבָּה. דְּהָהוּא גִּיטָּא דְּאִשְׁתְּכַח בֵּי דִינָא דְּרַב הוּנָא, דַּהֲוָה כְּתִוב בֵּיהּ בִּשְׁוִירֵי מָתָא דְּעַל רָכִיס נַהֲרָא. אָמַר רַב הוּנָא:
human_translation: As, if you do not say so, difficulty of Rabba and of Rabba. As a certain bill of divorce that was found the court of Rav Huna, in which it was written in Sheviri City, which on the Rakhis River. Rav Huna said
llm_translation: If you don't say it like this, it poses a difficulty for Rabba to Rabba. For that geta that was found in the court of Rav Huna, which had written on it in the songs of the people on the banks of the river. Rab Huna said:

hebrew_text: חָיְישִׁינַן לִשְׁנֵי שְׁוִירֵי, וַאֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב חִסְדָּא לְרַבָּה: פּוֹק עַיֵּין בָּהּ, דִּלְאוּרְתָּא בָּעֵי מִינָּךְ רַב הוּנָא. נְפַק, דַּק וְאַשְׁכַּח. דִּתְנַן: כׇּל מַעֲשֵׂה בֵּית דִּין – הֲרֵי זֶה יַחֲזִיר.
human_translation: We are concerned about two Sheviri And Rav Ḥisda said to Rabba Go out examine as in the evening Rav Huna will ask you He went out, examined and discovered as we learned One must return any court enactment,
llm_translation: We are concerned for two lines, and Rav Ḥisdah said to Rabba: Go and investigate it, for perhaps Rav Huna requires your attention. He went, checked, and found. As we learned in a Mishnah: Any action of the court – this one shall return.

hebrew_text: וְהָא בֵּי דִינָא דְּרַב הוּנָא, דְּכִי מְקוֹם שֶׁהַשְּׁיָירוֹת מְצוּיוֹת דָּמֵי, וְקָא פָּשֵׁיט רַבָּה דְּיַחְזִיר, אַלְמָא אִי הוּחְזְקוּ שְׁנֵי יוֹסֵף בֶּן שִׁמְעוֹן – אִין, אִי לָא – לָא.
human_translation: And the court of Rav Huna is comparable to a place where caravans are common, And Rabba resolved that he should return Evidently if established two Yosef ben Shimon indeed if not, no
llm_translation: The text in question is from the Talmud, Tractate Bava Metzia 38b: "And this is in the court of Rav Huna, for in a place where the leftover items are commonly found, and Rabba has spread out the produce to return, it follows that if the two Joseph sons of Shimon were established - no, and if not - no."

hebrew_text: עֲבַד רַבָּה עוֹבָדָא בְּהָהוּא גִּיטָּא דְּאִשְׁתְּכַח בֵּי כִיתָּנָא דְּפוּמְבְּדִיתָא כִּשְׁמַעְתֵּיהּ.
human_translation: Rabba performed an action, with regard to a certain bill of divorce that was found a flax house in Pumbedita, in accordance with his halakha ,
llm_translation: Rabba performed a certain task with that bill of divorce that was found in the school of Pumbedita when he heard of it.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: הֵיכָא דִּמְזַבְּנִי כִּיתָּנָא וְהוּא שֶׁלֹּא הוּחְזְקוּ, אַף עַל גַּב דִּשְׁכִיחָן שְׁיָירָתָא.
human_translation: There are who say where sell flax, and specifically was not established despite that caravans are common
llm_translation: There are those who say: Where one sells a garment and it was not established, even though they are commonly found, it is considered a remnant.

hebrew_text: וְאִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: הֵיכָא דְּתָרוּ כִּיתָּנָא וְאַף עַל גַּב דְּהוּחְזְקוּ, דְּלָא (שְׁכִיחָא שְׁיָירוֹת).
human_translation: And there are who say where soak flax, and even though it was established as caravans are uncommon
llm_translation: And there are those who say: Wherever it is taught in a Mishnah, even though they were established, it is not common for them to remain.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי זֵירָא רָמֵי מַתְנִיתִין אַבָּרַיְיתָא וּמְשַׁנֵּי. תְּנַן: הַמֵּבִיא גֵּט וְאָבַד הֵימֶנּוּ, מְצָאוֹ לְאַלְתַּר – כָּשֵׁר, וְאִם לָאו – פָּסוּל. וּרְמִינְהִי: מָצָא גֵּט אִשָּׁה בַּשּׁוּק, בִּזְמַן שֶׁהַבַּעַל מוֹדֶה – יַחְזִיר לְאִשָּׁה. אֵין הַבַּעַל מוֹדֶה – לֹא יַחְזִיר לֹא לָזֶה וְלֹא לָזֶה.
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira raises a contradiction between the mishna and a baraita , and he resolves We learned who was bringing a bill of divorce and he lost it, he found it immediately, valid, but if not, it is not valid. And raises a contradiction found a woman’s bill of divorce in the marketplace, when the husband admits must return to the wife; the husband does not admit he may return neither to this one, nor to that one,
llm_translation: Rabbi Zeira raises a contradiction between a Mishnah in the Babylonian Talmud and a Baraita and resolves it. We learned: If one brings a bill of divorce and it gets lost, if it is found immediately - it is valid, but if not - it is invalid. And the question was asked: If one finds a bill of divorce belonging to a woman in the marketplace, at a time when the husband admits - he should return it to the woman. If the husband does not admit - he should not return it to either this one or that one.

hebrew_text: קָתָנֵי מִיהַת בִּזְמַן שֶׁהַבַּעַל מוֹדֶה – יַחְזִיר לָאִשָּׁה, וַאֲפִילּוּ לִזְמַן מְרוּבֶּה!
human_translation: In any event, teaches when the husband admits must return to the wife, and even after a long time.
llm_translation: It was taught in one Tanna: When the husband admits - he must return to the woman, even for a greater time!

hebrew_text: וּמְשַׁנֵּי: כָּאן בִּמְקוֹם שֶׁהַשְּׁיָירוֹת מְצוּיוֹת, וְכָאן בִּמְקוֹם שֶׁאֵין הַשְּׁיָירוֹת מְצוּיוֹת.
human_translation: And answers here, in a place where caravans are common. And there, in a place where caravans are uncommon.
llm_translation: And Mishna: Here in a place where the remnants are found, and here in a place where the remnants are not found.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: וְהוּא שֶׁהוּחְזְקוּ דְּלָא נַהְדַּר, וְהַיְינוּ דְּרַבָּה. אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: אַף עַל גַּב דְּלָא הוּחְזְקוּ לָא נַהְדַּר, וּפְלִיגָא דְּרַבָּה.
human_translation: There are who say, And specifically where established that should not be returned, and this is of Rabba. And there are who say: even if not established should not be returned, and disagrees with of Rabba.
llm_translation: There are those who say: And he is considered not honorable, and that is Rabah. There are those who say: Even though he is not considered honorable, he is not honored, and this is a dispute of Rabah.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא רַבָּה לָא אָמַר כְּרַבִּי זֵירָא, מַתְנִיתִין אַלִּימָא לֵיהּ לְאַקְשׁוֹיֵי. אֶלָּא רַבִּי זֵירָא, מַאי טַעְמָא לָא אָמַר כְּרַבָּה?
human_translation: Granted, Rabba does not state in accordance with Rabbi Zeira he a mishna a stronger for raising a difficulty but what is the reason Rabbi Zeira does not state in accordance with Rabba
llm_translation: In truth, Rabba did not say like Rabbi Zeira, the Mishnah should rather be taught to him for questioning. Rather, Rabbi Zeira, what is the reason Rabba did not say so?

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָךְ, מִי קָא תָנֵי: הָא אָמַר ״תְּנוּ״ – נוֹתְנִין וַאֲפִילּוּ לִזְמַן מְרוּבֶּה? דִּלְמָא הָא אָמַר ״תְּנוּ״ – נוֹתְנִין, וּלְעוֹלָם כִּדְקַיְימָא לַן לְאַלְתַּר.
human_translation: said to you: Does teach that says: Give must give and even a long time Perhaps that says: Give must give but actually, as we maintain immediately.
llm_translation: He said to you, who is teaching: here he said "give" - we give even to someone who is not present? Perhaps here he said "give" - we give, and forever as it is established for us immediately.

hebrew_text: לְמַאן דְּאָמַר לְרַבִּי זֵירָא בִּמְקוֹם שֶׁהַשְּׁיָירוֹת מְצוּיוֹת, וְאַף עַל גַּב שֶׁלֹּא הוּחְזְקוּ שְׁנֵי יוֹסֵף בֶּן שִׁמְעוֹן, וּפְלִיגָא דְּרַבָּה, בְּמַאי קָא מִיפַּלְגִי?
human_translation: According to the one who says according to Rabbi Zeira in a place where caravans are common, and even if not established two Yosef ben Shimon and he disagrees with Rabba, with regard to what do disagree?
llm_translation: To whom did Rabbi Zeira say: In a place where the alleys are found, even though the two Joseph sons of Shimon were not established, and there is a dispute of Rabba, what are they arguing about?

hebrew_text: רַבָּה סָבַר דְּקָתָנֵי כׇּל מַעֲשֵׂה בֵּית דִּין הֲרֵי זֶה יַחְזִיר, דְּאִשְׁתְּכַח בְּבֵית דִּין עָסְקִינַן, וּבֵית דִּין כִּמְקוֹם שֶׁהַשְּׁיָירוֹת מְצוּיוֹת, וְהוּא שֶׁהוּחְזְקוּ – לֹא יַחְזִיר, לֹא הוּחְזְקוּ – יַחְזִיר.
human_translation: Rabba maintains that teaches: One must return any court enactment. we are dealing with that was found in court, and a court is equivalent to a place where caravans are common. And specifically where established should not return not established he should return
llm_translation: Rabah holds that it was taught: Every matter of the court, behold, this one shall return, for we find ourselves engaged in the court, and the court is like a place where the leftovers are found, and this is when it is established - he shall not return, if it is not established - he shall return.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי זֵירָא אָמַר לָךְ: מִי קָתָנֵי ״כׇּל מַעֲשֵׂה בֵּית דִּין שֶׁנִּמְצְאוּ בְּבֵית דִּין״? ״כׇּל מַעֲשֵׂה בֵּית דִּין יַחְזִיר״ קָתָנֵי, וּלְעוֹלָם דְּאִשְׁתְּכַח אַבָּרַאי.
human_translation: And Rabbi Zeira, said to you: Does teach any court enactment that was found in court? It teaches one must return any court enactment, and actually where were found outside
llm_translation: Rabbi Zeira said to you: Who is the one who taught "any action of the court found in the court"? "Any action of the court shall be returned" it teaches, and forever it shall be found in the Creator.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה אָמַר, כְּגוֹן דְּקָא אָמְרִי עֵדִים: מֵעוֹלָם לֹא חָתַמְנוּ אֶלָּא עַל גֵּט אֶחָד שֶׁל יוֹסֵף בֶּן שִׁמְעוֹן.
human_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya states where witnesses say: We have never signed a bill of divorce of Yosef ben Shimon other than one,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya said, as an example, when witnesses say: "We have never signed except on one divorce document of Yosef ben Shimon."

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, מַאי לְמֵימְרָא? מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא לֵיחוּשׁ דִּלְמָא אִתְרְמִי שְׁמָא כִּשְׁמָא, וְעֵדִים כְּעֵדִים, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: If that is so, what of stating lest you say one should be concerned perhaps it happened the names are identical to the names and witnesses are identical to witnesses teaches us
llm_translation: If so, what can be said? What might one say to be concerned that perhaps one name is mistaken for another, and witnesses as witnesses, it is clear to us.

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר, כְּגוֹן דְּקָא אָמַר: נֶקֶב יֵשׁ בּוֹ בְּצַד אוֹת פְּלוֹנִית.
human_translation: Rav Ashi stated where he says: There is a hole in next to such and such a letter.
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said, for example, as he said: "There is a hole in it on the side of so-and-so."

hebrew_text: וְדַוְקָא בְּצַד אוֹת פְּלוֹנִית, אֲבָל נֶקֶב בְּעָלְמָא – לָא.
human_translation: And specifically next to such and such a letter, But only a hole not
llm_translation: And specifically on the side of a certain sign, but a hole in general - no.

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי מְסַפְּקָא לֵיהּ סִימָנִים אִי דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא אִי דְּרַבָּנַן.
human_translation: Rav Ashi is uncertain whether distinguishing marks by Torah law whether by rabbinic law.
llm_translation: Rav Ashei is in doubt about signs, whether they are of biblical origin or rabbinic.

hebrew_text: רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה
human_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana
llm_translation: Rabba bar Bar Ḥana

hebrew_text: אִירְכַס לֵיהּ גִּיטָּא בֵּי מִדְרְשָׁא. אֲמַר: אִי סִימָנָא – אִית לִי בְּגַוֵּיהּ, אִי טְבִיעוּת עֵינָא – אִית לִי בְּגַוֵּיהּ. אַהְדְּרוּהּ נִיהֲלֵיהּ. אֲמַר: לָא יָדַעְנָא אִי מִשּׁוּם סִימָנָא אַהְדְּרוּהּ נִיהֲלִי, וְקָא סָבְרִי סִימָנִין דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא. אִי מִשּׁוּם טְבִיעוּת עֵינָא אַהְדְּרוּהּ נִיהֲלִי, וְדַוְקָא צוּרְבָּא מִדְּרַבָּנַן. אֲבָל אִינִישׁ דְּעָלְמָא – לָא.
human_translation: lost a bill of divorce, in the study hall. he said: If a distinguishing mark, I have for it. If visual recognition, I have for it. They returned to him. He said I do not know if they returned it to me due to the distinguishing mark and they hold distinguishing marks by Torah law, if they returned it to me due to visual recognition, and specifically a Torah scholar, but an ordinary person not
llm_translation: He saw a scroll in the study hall. He said: If there is a sign - I have it in my body, if there is a cataract in the eye - I have it in my body. He reconsidered it. He said: We do not know whether because of a sign I reconsidered it, and they thought that signs are from the Torah. If because of a cataract in the eye I reconsidered it, and specifically the cataract of the Sages. But an ordinary person - no.

hebrew_text: גּוּפָא: מָצָא גֵּט אִשָּׁה בַּשּׁוּק, בִּזְמַן שֶׁהַבַּעַל מוֹדֶה – יַחְזִיר לְאִשָּׁה. אֵין הַבַּעַל מוֹדֶה – לֹא יַחְזִיר לֹא לָזֶה וְלֹא לָזֶה.
human_translation: the itself found a woman’s bill of divorce in the marketplace, when the husband admits must return to the wife. the husband does not admit may neither return to this one, nor to that one,
llm_translation: Body: If one finds a bill of divorce of a woman in the marketplace, at a time when the husband admits - he shall return it to the woman. If the husband does not admit - he shall not return it neither to this one nor to that one.

hebrew_text: בִּזְמַן שֶׁהַבַּעַל מוֹדֶה מִיהָא יַחְזִיר לָאִשָּׁה. וְלֵיחוּשׁ שֶׁמָּא כָּתַב לִיתֵּן בְּנִיסָן וְלֹא נָתַן לָהּ עַד תִּשְׁרֵי, וַאֲזַל בַּעַל זַבֵּין פֵּירֵי מִנִּיסָן וְעַד תִּשְׁרֵי, וּמַפְּקָא לְגִיטָּא דִּכְתִיב בְּנִיסָן, וְאָתְיָא לְמִטְרַף לָקוֹחוֹת שֶׁלֹּא כַּדִּין.
human_translation: In any event, when the husband admits must return to the wife. But let us suspect perhaps he wrote to give in Nisan, but did not give to her until Tishrei, and husband went sold produce between Nisan and Tishrei, And produce the bill of divorce, which he wrote in Nisan, and come to repossess purchasers unlawfully.
llm_translation: In a time when the husband admits from her, he shall return to the woman. And lest one suspect that he wrote to give in Nisan and did not give to her until Tishrei, and the husband of Zabbin went from Nisan until Tishrei, and he produced a divorce document that was written in Nisan, and it came to be scrutinized by scribes not according to the law.

hebrew_text: הָנִיחָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר כֵּיוָן שֶׁנָּתַן עֵינָיו לְגָרְשָׁהּ שׁוּב אֵין לַבַּעַל פֵּירוֹת – שַׁפִּיר. אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר יֵשׁ לַבַּעַל פֵּירוֹת עַד שְׁעַת נְתִינָה, מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר?
human_translation: This works out well according to the one who says once he has decided to divorce her, the husband no longer has produce. But according to the one who says the husband has produce until the time of giving what is there to say?
llm_translation: The one who said: once he has given his eyes to divorce her, the husband has no right to the fruits - it is good. But the one who said: the husband has rights to the fruits until the time of giving, what can be said?

hebrew_text: כִּי אָתְיָא לְמִטְרַף אָמְרִינַן לַהּ: אַיְיתַי רְאָיָה אֵימַת מְטָא גִּיטָּא לְיָדְךָ.
human_translation: When she comes to repossess we say to her: bring proof when the bill of divorce came into your possession,
llm_translation: When one comes to the blacksmith, we say to him: "Bring proof when the bill of divorce came into your possession."

hebrew_text: וּמַאי שְׁנָא מִשְּׁטָרֵי חוֹב? דִּתְנַן: מָצָא שְׁטָרֵי חוֹב, אִם יֵשׁ בָּהֶן אַחְרָיוּת נְכָסִים – לֹא יַחְזִיר. וְאוֹקֵימְנָא כְּשֶׁחַיָּיב מוֹדֶה, וּמִשּׁוּם שֶׁמָּא כָּתַב לִלְווֹת בְּנִיסָן וְלֹא לָוָה עַד תִּשְׁרֵי וְקָא טָרֵיף לָקוֹחוֹת שֶׁלֹּא כַּדִּין.
human_translation: But what is different from promissory notes? As we learned found promissory notes, if they include a property guarantee he may not return And we interpreted where the liable party admits and due to perhaps he wrote to borrow in Nisan, but did not borrow until Tishrei, and unlawfully repossess purchasers.
llm_translation: And what is different about promissory notes of debt? For it was taught: If one finds promissory notes of debt, if they contain post-dated assets - he shall not return them. And we establish it when the debtor admits, and because perhaps he wrote to borrow in Nissan and did not borrow until Tishrei, and he invalidates the lenders improperly.

hebrew_text: הָתָם נָמֵי לִיהְדַּר, וְכִי אָתֵי לְמִטְרַף נֵימָא לֵיהּ: אַיְיתִי רְאָיָה אֵימַת מְטָא שְׁטַר חוֹב לְיָדָךְ!
human_translation: there, should also be returned, and when comes to repossess let say to him: bring proof when promissory note came into your possession.
llm_translation: There, before him, to be honored, and when he comes to refute him, he says to him: "Bring proof! When will the document of debt come into your possession!"

hebrew_text: אָמְרִי, הָכָא גַּבֵּי גֵּט אִשָּׁה אָתֵי לוֹקֵחַ וְתָבַעה, אָמַר: הַאי דְּ[אַ]הְדְּרוּהּ נִיהֲלַהּ רַבָּנַן לְגִיטָּא, מִשּׁוּם דְּלָא תִּעֲגִין וְתֵיתִיב. הַשְׁתָּא דְּקָא אָתְיָא לְמִטְרַף – תֵּיזִל וְתַיְתֵי רְאָיָה אֵימַת מְטָא גִּיטָּא לִידַהּ.
human_translation: say Here, with regard to a woman’s bill of divorce, purchaser come and demand say that the Sages returned the bill of divorce to her so that she would not dwell a deserted wife Now that she is coming to repossess she should go and bring proof when the bill of divorce came into her possession.
llm_translation: They said, here regarding a bill of divorce of a woman, he comes to take and claim, he said: this one who has returned her, the Rabbis have arranged for her divorce, because she should not be distressed and sit. Now that he is coming to the trap - she should go down and sit, when will the bill of divorce come to her hand.

hebrew_text: הָכָא גַּבֵּי שְׁטַר חוֹב לָא אָתֵי לוֹקֵחַ וְתָבַע, [אָמַר] מִדְּאַהְדְּרוּהּ נִיהֲלֵיהּ רַבָּנַן לִשְׁטַר חוֹב, פְּשִׁיטָא לְמַאי הִלְכְתָא אַהְדְּרוּהּ נִיהֲלֵיהּ – לְמִטְרַף הוּא, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ קָמוּ רַבָּנַן בְּמִילְּתָא, וּמִקַּמֵּי דִּידִי מְטָא שְׁטָרָא לִידֵיהּ.
human_translation: here, with regard to a promissory note, the purchaser will not come and demand from that the Sages returned promissory note to him obviously for what halakha did return it to him? It to repossess conclude from it: The Sages clarified the matter and note came into the possession of prior to my
llm_translation: Here regarding a promissory note for a debt, the buyer does not come and claim. He said, since the sages have arranged for him to write a promissory note for the debt, it is obvious - what is the law? Since the sages have arranged for him, it is for his benefit, for they have come to a conclusion in the matter, and before we come, a promissory note comes into his hands.

hebrew_text: שִׁחְרוּרֵי עֲבָדִים וְכוּ׳. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: מָצָא שְׁטַר שִׁחְרוּר בְּשׁוּק, בִּזְמַן שֶׁהָרַב מוֹדֶה – יַחְזִיר לָעֶבֶד, אֵין הָרַב מוֹדֶה – לֹא יַחְזִיר לֹא לָזֶה וְלֹא לָזֶה.
human_translation: manumission of slaves The Sages taught found a bill of manumission in the marketplace, when the master admits one should return to the slave. the master does not admit one should neither return to this nor to that
llm_translation: The text reads: "Documents of manumission, etc. The Rabbis taught: If one finds a manumission document in the marketplace, at a time when the master acknowledges it - he shall return it to the slave; if the master does not acknowledge it - he shall not return it, neither to this one nor to that one."

hebrew_text: בִּזְמַן שֶׁהָרַב מוֹדֶה מִיהָא יַחְזִיר לָעֶבֶד, וְאַמַּאי? נֵיחוּשׁ שֶׁמָּא כָּתַב לִיתֵּן לוֹ בְּנִיסָן וְלֹא נָתַן לוֹ עַד תִּשְׁרֵי, וַאֲזַל עַבְדָּא וּקְנָה נִכְסִין מִנִּיסָן וְעַד תִּשְׁרֵי, וַאֲזַיל הָרַב וְזַבְּנִינְהוּ וּמַפֵּיק לֵיהּ לְשִׁחְרוּר דִּכְתִב בְּנִיסָן, וְקָא טָרֵיף לָקוֹחוֹת שֶׁלֹּא כַּדִּין.
human_translation: In any event, when the master admits should return to the slave. But why Let us suspect perhaps he wrote to give to him in Nisan, but did not give to him until Tishrei, and the slave went and bought property between Nisan and Tishrei, and the master went and sold And produce manumission, which wrote in Nisan, and repossess purchasers unlawfully.
llm_translation: In a time when the master admits from the mouth, he shall return to the slave, and why? Concerned that perhaps he wrote to give it to him in Nissan and did not give it to him until Tishrei, and the slave went and acquired properties from Nissan until Tishrei, and the master went and sold them and gave him the document of manumission that he wrote in Nissan, and he rendered the purchases invalid not in accordance with the law.

hebrew_text: הָנִיחָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר זְכוּת הוּא לָעֶבֶד שֶׁיּוֹצֵא מִתַּחַת רַבּוֹ לְחֵירוּת, וּכְאַבָּיֵי דְּאָמַר: עֵדָיו בַּחֲתוּמָיו זָכִין לֵיהּ, שַׁפִּיר. אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר חוֹב הוּא לָעֶבֶד שֶׁיּוֹצֵא מִתַּחַת רַבּוֹ לְחֵירוּת, מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר?
human_translation: This works out well according to the one who says it is in a slave’s interest to leave his master’s authority and attain freedom and in accordance with Abaye, who says its witnesses, with their signatures, acquire on his behalf. well. But according to the one who says it is against a slave’s interests to leave his master’s authority and attain freedom, what is there to say?
llm_translation: He left it for the one who says merit belongs to the slave who goes out from under his master to freedom, and like Abbaye who says: his witnesses in his documents acquire for him, good. Rather, for the one who says it is an obligation for the slave who goes out from under his master to freedom, what can be said?

hebrew_text: דְּכִי אָתֵי לְמִטְרַף אָמְרִינַן לֵיהּ: אַיְיתִי רְאָיָה אֵימַת מְטָא שִׁחְרוּר לְיָדָךְ.
human_translation: that when comes to repossess we say to him: Bring proof when manumission reached your possession
llm_translation: When one comes to the tannery, we say to him: "Bring proof of when the release of the animal came into your possession."

hebrew_text: דְּיָיתֵיקֵי מַתָּנָה וְכוּ׳. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אֵיזוֹ הִיא דְּיָיתֵיקֵי – דָּא תְּהֵא לְמֵיקַם וְלִהְיוֹת שֶׁאִם מֵת נְכָסָיו לִפְלוֹנִי. מַתָּנָה – כֹּל שֶׁכָּתוּב בּוֹ ״מֵהַיּוֹם וּלְאַחַר מִיתָה״.
human_translation: wills [ deyaytiki ] gift, The Sages taught What is a deyaytiki This deed will be to stand [ da tehe lemeikam ] and exist as if dies, his property to so-and-so. gift, any in which it is written: from today and after death
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: "Deyatikei matanah etc." The Rabbis taught: What is considered 'deyatikei'? That it should be established and designated that if he dies, his assets go to so-and-so. 'Matanah' - anything that is written with the phrase 'from this day and after death.'

hebrew_text: אַלְמָא אִי כְּתִיבָא ״מֵהַיּוֹם וּלְאַחַר מִיתָה״ הוּא דְּקָנֵי, וְאִי לָא – לָא קָנֵי?!
human_translation: Apparently, only if it is written From today and after death acquires and otherwise, he does not acquire
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: "Alma i k'tiva 'me'hayom u'le'achar mitah' hu d'kanei, v'i la - la kanei?!"

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי, הָכִי קָאָמַר: אֵיזוֹ הִיא מַתְּנַת בָּרִיא שֶׁהִיא כְּמַתְּנַת שְׁכִיב מְרַע, דְּלָא קָנֵי אֶלָּא לְאַחַר מִיתָה, כֹּל שֶׁכָּתוּב בָּהּ ״מֵהַיּוֹם וּלְאַחַר מִיתָה״.
human_translation: Abaye said this is saying: What gift of a healthy person is like gift of a person on his deathbed, that acquires only after death any in which it is written: from today and after death.
llm_translation: Abaye said, thus he said: Which is a gift of a healthy person that is like the gift of a dying person, for it is acquired only after death, anything that is written in it "from this day and after death."

hebrew_text: טַעְמָא דְּלָא אָמַר ״תְּנוּ״. הָא אָמַר ״תְּנוּ״ – נוֹתְנִין.
human_translation: The reason that doesn’t say Give But he says: Give must give
llm_translation: Reason for not saying "give." This one said "give" - we give.

hebrew_text: וּרְמִינְהוּ: מָצָא דְּיָיתֵקָאוֹת, אַפּוֹתֵיקָאוֹת וּמַתָּנוֹת, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁשְּׁנֵיהֶם מוֹדִין – לֹא יַחְזִיר לֹא לָזֶה וְלֹא לָזֶה!
human_translation: And raises a contradiction found wills, designated repayment, or gift, even if both agree he should return neither to this nor to that
llm_translation: And they asked: If one found rings, signet rings, and gifts, even though both parties agree - he should not return to this one or to that one!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אַבָּא בַּר מֶמֶל: לָא קַשְׁיָא,
human_translation: Rabbi Abba bar Memel said: not difficult.
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Abba bar Memel: Not difficult.

hebrew_text: הָא בְּבָרִיא, וְהָא בִּשְׁכִיב מְרַע.
human_translation: This in a healthy person, and that in a person on his deathbed.
llm_translation: This one in a state of health, and this one in a state of illness.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִיתִין דְּקָתָנֵי: הָא אָמַר תְּנוּ נוֹתְנִין – בִּשְׁכִיב מְרַע, דְּבַר מִהְדַּר הוּא.
human_translation: The mishna that teaches that says: Give must give in a person on his deathbed, who is capable of retracting
llm_translation: Mishnah that it is taught: Here it says "they said to give" - in a lying position, for it is a dignified matter.

hebrew_text: דְּאָמְרִינַן, מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר: דִּלְמָא כַּתְבַהּ מֵעִיקָּרָא לְהַאי וְאִמְּלִיךְ וְלָא יַהֲבַהּ נִיהֲלֵיהּ, וַהֲדַר כַּתְבַהּ לְאִינִישׁ אַחֲרִינָא וְיַהֲבַיהּ נִיהֲלֵיהּ – הַשְׁתָּא קָא הָדַר בֵּיהּ מֵהָהוּא דְּיַהֲבַהּ נִיהֲלֵיהּ.
human_translation: as we say: What is there to say perhaps initially wrote for this but reconsidered and did not give it to him, and then he wrote for another person and gave to him. now retract that to whom he gave
llm_translation: We say, what is there to say: perhaps he wrote it originally for this one and changed his mind and did not give it to him, and then wrote it for another person and gave it to him - now he is retracting from what he gave to him.

hebrew_text: אִי בְּמַתְּנַת בָּרִיא יַהֲבַהּ לֵיהּ – לֵית לֵיהּ פְּסֵידָא, דְּכִי נָפְקָא תַּרְתֵּי, בָּתְרָיְיתָא זָכֵי, דְּהָא הֲדַר בֵּיהּ מִקַּמָּיְיתָא.
human_translation: If he gave to as the gift of a healthy person, incurs no loss because, when the two are produced the later acquires as retracted the first
llm_translation: If in a healthy gift he gave it to him - he does not have a loss, for when two come out, in the latter one he acquires, because he returns to its original state.

hebrew_text: אִי בְּמַתְּנַת שְׁכִיב מְרַע נָמֵי יַהֲבַהּ נִיהֲלֵיהּ, לֵית בַּהּ פְּסֵידָא – דְּבָתְרָיְיתָא זָכֵי, דְּקָא הָדַר בֵּיהּ מִקַּמָּיְיתָא.
human_translation: So too, if he gave it to as the gift of a person on his deathbed, he incurs no loss. because the later acquires as retracted the first
llm_translation: If in a gift of a bed, the recipient gave it to another, there is no loss - for in the latter case, he acquires, as he returns it from its original place.

hebrew_text: כִּי קָתָנֵי בְּבָרַיְיתָא: אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁשְּׁנֵיהֶם מוֹדִים לֹא יַחְזִיר לֹא לָזֶה וְלֹא לָזֶה – בְּבָרִיא, דְּלָאו בַּר מִהְדַּר הוּא,
human_translation: when the baraita teaches even if both agree should neither return to this nor to that to a healthy person, who is not able to retract
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "For it is taught in a baraita: Even though both of them agree, one should not return the lost item neither to this one nor to that one - in a healthy state, for he is not a son who returns."

hebrew_text: דְּאָמְרִינַן: דִּלְמָא כַּתְבַהּ לְהַאי מֵעִיקָּרָא וְאִמְּלִיךְ וְלָא יַהֲבַהּ לֵיהּ, וַהֲדַר כַּתְבַהּ לְאִינִישׁ אַחֲרִינָא וְיַהֲבַהּ לֵיהּ – הַשְׁתָּא קָא הָדַר בֵּיהּ מֵהָהוּא דְּיַהֲבַהּ לֵיהּ וְסָבַר: מִהְדָּר לָא מָצֵינָא הָדַרְנָא בִּי, אֵימַר לְהוּ דַּאֲנָא לְהַאי יַהֲבִתַהּ, וְנַיהְדְּרוּ נִיהֲלֵיהּ כְּתָבָא, כִּי הֵיכִי דְּכִי מַפֵּיק הַאי כְּתָבָא, דְּקָדֵים זָכֵה בֵּיהּ הוּא.
human_translation: as we say perhaps initially wrote for this but reconsidered and did not give it to him, and then he wrote for another person and gave to him; now retract that to whom he gave thinking: I cannot retract I will say to that I gave to this and they will return the deed to him, in order that when he produces this deed which earlier, he will acquire
llm_translation: We say: perhaps he wrote to this innkeeper and he delayed and did not give it to him, and then he wrote to another person and gave it to him - now he is returning to him from that one to whom he gave it, and he thinks: since I did not find favor in his eyes, let me say that I gave it to this one, and they will return it to him as a letter, so that when this letter is produced, he will be the first to have it.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמְרִינַן לֵיהּ אֲנַן: הַאי כְּתָבָא לָא יָהֲבִינַן לֵיהּ לְהַאי. דִּלְמָא מִכְתָּב כְּתַבְתְּ, מֵיהָב לָא יְהַבְתְּ נִיהֲלֵיהּ, וִיהַבְתַּהּ לְאִינִישׁ אַחֲרִינָא וְקָא הָדְרַתְּ בֵּיהּ. אִי לָא יְהַבְתַּהּ לְאִינִישׁ אַחֲרִינָא וְקָא בָּעֵית דְּתִתְּבַהּ לְהַאי, כְּתֹב לֵיהּ הַשְׁתָּא כְּתָבָא אַחֲרִינָא וְיַהֲבֵיהּ נִיהֲלֵיהּ, דְּאִי יָהֲבַתְּ לְאִינִישׁ אַחֲרִינָא לֵית בַּהּ פְּסֵידָא, דְּקָדֵים זָכֵי.
human_translation: Rather, we say to We will not give this document to this perhaps you wrote did not give it to him, and you gave to another person, and you retract him if you did not give to another person, and you wish to return it to this Write another deed for him now and give it to him, that if you did give to another person, incur no loss, as the earlier acquires
llm_translation: We rather say to him: This document we did not give to this one. Perhaps you wrote a document, but you did not give it to him, and you gave it to another person, and he returned it to him. If you did not give it to another person and you claim that it was written for this one, write now another document and give it to him, for if you gave it to another person, there is no loss in it, as the one who is first in line has precedence.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב זְבִיד: וְהָא אִידֵּי וְאִידֵּי דְּיָיתֵקָאוֹת קָא תָנֵי! אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב זְבִיד: הָא וְהָא בִּשְׁכִיב מְרַע, וְלָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא בֵּיהּ, וְהָא בִּבְרֵיהּ!
human_translation: Rav Zevid objects to this But don’t this and that teach wills? Rather, Rav Zevid said this and that to a person on his deathbed, and not difficult; this to him, and that to his son
llm_translation: Rav Zevid objects to her: But both this and that are taught when they are lying down! Rather, Rav Zevid said: This one and that one in a state of illness, and it is not difficult: this one in herself, and that one in her son!

hebrew_text: דְּקָא אָמַר ״תְּנוּ״ נוֹתְנִין, בְּדִידֵיהּ דְּבַר מִהְדָּר הוּא, דְּאָמְרִינַן: אִי נָמֵי יַהֲבַהּ לְאִינִישׁ אַחֲרִינָא לֵית בַּהּ פְּסֵידָא, דְּקַמָּא וּבָתְרָא – בָּתְרָא זָכֵי, דְּהָא הֲדַר בֵּיהּ מִקַּמָּא.
human_translation: The mishna, which says: Give give to himself as he is capable of retracting as we say even if he gave to another person, incurs no loss. because a first one and a last one, the last one acquires as retracted the first
llm_translation: He said, "Give," we give, in its own matter it is honorable, as we say: If one gives to another, there is no loss in it, for before and after - after is meritorious, for he honored it more than before.

hebrew_text: כִּי קָא תָנֵי בְּבָרַיְיתָא: אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁשְּׁנֵיהֶם מוֹדִים, לֹא יַחְזִיר לֹא לָזֶה וְלֹא לָזֶה, בִּבְרֵיהּ.
human_translation: when the baraita teaches even if both agree should neither return to this nor to that to his son
llm_translation: He taught in a baraita: Even though both of them admit, he shall not return neither to this one nor to that one, in its place.

hebrew_text: דְּאָמְרִינַן: דִּלְמָא כְּתַב אֲבוּהּ לְהַאי, וְאִמְּלִיךְ וְלָא יַהֲבַיהּ נִיהֲלֵיהּ, וּבָתַר אֲבוּהּ כְּתַב אִיהוּ לְאִינִישׁ אַחֲרִינָא וְיַהֲבַהּ לֵיהּ, וְהַשְׁתָּא קָא הָדַר בֵּיהּ מֵהָהוּא. סָבַר: מִהְדָּר לָא מָצֵינָא הָדַרְנָא בִּי. אֵימַר לְהוּ דְּאַבָּא יַהֲבַהּ לֵיהּ לְהַאי, וְנִתְּבוּ לֵיהּ כְּתָבֵיהּ, וְנֵיזִיל וְנַפֵּיק מִינֵּיהּ דְּהוּא זָכֵי וְנִפְלוֹג בַּהֲדֵיהּ.
human_translation: as we say perhaps his father wrote for this and reconsidered and did not give it to him, and after his father wrote to another person and gave it to him. And now retract that thinking: I cannot retract I will say to that my father gave to this and they will return him his deed and he will go and appropriate from the one who as he will acquiring and I will divide with him.
llm_translation: We say: Perhaps his father wrote to this one, and he became king but did not give it to him, and afterwards his father wrote to another person and gave it to him, and now he has returned to him from that one. He thought: Since he has returned to me, I will not find another who will return to me. He should say to them that his father gave it to this one, and his writings were found with him, and he should go and take it from him, for he is the rightful owner and he should argue his case with him.

hebrew_text: הִלְכָּךְ אָמְרִינַן לֵיהּ אֲנַן: הַאי כְּתָבָא לָא יָהֲבִינַן לֵיהּ לְהַאי, דְּדִלְמָא מִכְתָּב כַּתְבֵיהּ אֲבוּהּ מֵיהָב לָא יַהֲבַהּ לֵיהּ, וִיהַבְתֵּיהּ אַתְּ לְאִינִישׁ אַחֲרִינָא וְקָא הָדְרַתְּ בֵּיהּ.
human_translation: Therefore, we say to We will not give this deed to this as perhaps father wrote it did not give it to him, and you gave to another person, and you retract
llm_translation: Therefore, we say to him: We did not give this document to this person, for perhaps the one who wrote it did not give it to him, and you gave it to another person, and he returned it to him.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אִי קוּשְׁטָא קָא אָמְרַתְּ, דִּיהַב לֵיהּ אֲבוּךְ – זִיל אַתְּ הַשְׁתָּא כְּתֹב לֵיהּ שְׁטָרָא אַחֲרִינָא, דְּאִי נָמֵי לָא יַהֲבַהּ לֵיהּ אֲבוּהּ וּכְתַבְתֵּיהּ אַתְּ לְאִינִישׁ אַחֲרִינָא – לֵית בַּהּ פְּסֵידָא, דְּקַמָּא וּבָתְרָא – קַמָּא זָכֵי.
human_translation: Rather, if you are telling the truth that your father gave him you go now write another deed for him, that even if father did not give him and you wrote to another person, incur no loss. because a first one and a last one, the first one acquires
llm_translation: Rather, you are saying a logical argument, that if your father gave him – go now and write for him another document, for if indeed he did not give him, your father, and you wrote it, you are not causing a loss, for the first and the last – the first one prevails.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: מָצָא שׁוֹבָר, בִּזְמַן שֶׁהָאִשָּׁה מוֹדֶה – יַחְזִיר לַבַּעַל. אֵין הָאִשָּׁה מוֹדֶה – לֹא יַחְזִיר לֹא לָזֶה וְלֹא לָזֶה.
human_translation: The Sages taught found a receipt when the wife admits he should return to the husband. the wife does not admit he should neither return to this nor to that
llm_translation: The Sages taught: If a man finds a bill of divorce, at a time when the woman admits, he shall return it to the husband. If the woman does not admit, he shall not return it, neither to this one nor to that one.

hebrew_text: בִּזְמַן שֶׁהָאִשָּׁה מוֹדֶה מִיהַת יַחְזִיר לַבַּעַל, וְלֵיחוּשׁ דִּלְמָא כָּתְבָה לִיתֵּן בְּנִיסָן, וְלֹא נָתְנָה עַד תִּשְׁרֵי, וַאֲזַלָה זְבֵנְתַּהּ לִכְתוּבְּ[תַ]הּ בְּטוֹבַת הֲנָאָה מִנִּיסָן עַד תִּשְׁרֵי.
human_translation: In any event, when the wife admits should return to the husband. But let us suspect perhaps wrote to give in Nisan, but she did not give until Tishrei, and she went sold her marriage contract for financial advantage between Nisan and Tishrei.
llm_translation: In a time when a woman admits from herself, she shall return to her husband, and there is concern lest perhaps she wrote to give in Nisan, and did not give until Tishrei, and then she went to write her document for her benefit from Nisan until Tishrei.

hebrew_text: וּמַפֵּיק לֵיהּ לְשׁוֹבָר דִּכְתִיב בְּנִיסָן, וְאָתֵא לְמִטְרַף לָקוֹחוֹת שֶׁלֹּא כַּדִּין!
human_translation: And produce the receipt that was written in Nisan and come to repossess from purchasers unlawfully.
llm_translation: And he brought it out to the Shovar, as it is written in Nisan, and he came to Mitraf to take the rods not in the proper manner!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא:
human_translation: Rava said:
llm_translation: Rava said:

hebrew_text: שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: אִיתַאּ לְדִשְׁמוּאֵל, דְּאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הַמּוֹכֵר שְׁטַר חוֹב לַחֲבֵירוֹ, וְחָזַר וּמְחָלוֹ – מָחוּל, וַאֲפִילּוּ יוֹרֵשׁ מוֹחֵל.
human_translation: Conclude from of Shmuel is accepted. As Shmuel says: one who sells a promissory note to another, and then forgives it is forgiven, and even heir can forgive
llm_translation: Listen to the conclusion: It was stated in the name of Shmuel, for Shmuel said: If one sells a promissory note of debt to his fellow, and then retracts and forgives it - it is forgiven, even if the heir forgives.

hebrew_text: אַבָּיֵי אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא לֵיתַיהּ לְדִשְׁמוּאֵל, הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן – בְּשֶׁשְּׁטַר כְּתוּבָּה יוֹצֵא מִתַּחַת יָדָהּ. וְרָבָא אָמַר: אִי מִשּׁוּם שְׁטַר כְּתוּבָּה, חָיְישִׁינַן לִשְׁתֵּי כְתוּבּוֹת.
human_translation: Abaye said: Even you say of Shmuel is not here we are dealing with where marriage contract emerges from her possession, And Rava said: If due to marriage contract we suspect two marriage contracts.
llm_translation: Abaye said: Even if you say she did not consent to Shmuel, here we are dealing with what? - with a written document that emerges from her possession. And Rava said: If not for a written document, we would be concerned for two documents.

hebrew_text: וְאַבָּיֵי אָמַר, חֲדָא: לִשְׁתֵּי כְתוּבּוֹת לָא חָיְישִׁינַן. וְעוֹד, שׁוֹבָר בִּזְמַנּוֹ טָרֵיף. אַבָּיֵי לְטַעְמֵיהּ, דְּאָמַר: עֵדָיו בַּחֲתוּמָיו זָכִין לוֹ.
human_translation: And Abaye said First, we are not concerned about two marriage contracts. And furthermore, a receipt repossess from time Abaye to his reasoning, as he says the document’s witnesses, with their signatures, acquire on his behalf.
llm_translation: And Abbaye said, one: for two written documents we are not concerned. And furthermore, a borrower at the time is exempt. Abbaye according to his reasoning, for he said: his witnesses in his signature are valid for him.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ מָצָא אִיגְּרוֹת שׁוּם וְאִיגְּרוֹת מָזוֹן, שְׁטָרֵי חֲלִיצָה וּמֵיאוּנִין, וּשְׁטָרֵי בֵירוּרִין, וְכׇל מַעֲשֵׂה בֵּית דִּין – הֲרֵי זֶה יַחְזִיר.
human_translation: found documents of appraisal or documents concerning food, documents of ḥalitza ; or refusal or documents of beirurin , or any court enactment, must return
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: If one found promissory notes for garlic and promissory notes for food, bills of divorce and deeds of betrothal, and all court documents - he must return them.

hebrew_text: מָצָא בַּחֲפִיסָה אוֹ בִדְלוֹסְקָמָא, תַּכְרִיךְ שֶׁל שְׁטָרוֹת אוֹ אֲגוּדָּה שֶׁל שְׁטָרוֹת – הֲרֵי זֶה יַחְזִיר. וְכַמָּה אֲגוּדָּה שֶׁל שְׁטָרוֹת – שְׁלֹשָׁה קְשׁוּרִין זֶה בָּזֶה. רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: אֶחָד הַלֹּוֶה מִשְּׁלֹשָׁה – יַחְזִיר לַלֹּוֶה. שְׁלֹשָׁה הַלֹּוִין מִן הָאֶחָד – יַחְזִיר לַמַּלְוֶה.
human_translation: found in a ḥafisa or in a deluskema , a roll of documents or a bundle of documents, he must return And how many a bundle of documents? three tied together. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: one who borrowed from three must return to the debtor, three who borrowed from one he must return to the creditor,
llm_translation: He found in a pocket or in a purse, a bundle of promissory notes or a bundle of promissory notes - he shall return. And how much is a bundle of promissory notes - three tied to each other. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: One who borrows from three - shall return to the lender. Three lenders from one - shall return to the borrower.

hebrew_text: מָצָא שְׁטָר בֵּין שְׁטָרוֹתָיו וְאֵינוֹ יוֹדֵעַ מָה טִיבוֹ – יְהֵא מוּנָּח עַד שֶׁיָּבוֹא אֵלִיָּהוּ. אִם יֵשׁ עִמָּהֶן סִמְפּוֹנוֹת, יַעֲשֶׂה מָה שֶׁבַּסִּמְפּוֹנוֹת.
human_translation: found a document among his documents and he does not know what its nature is, is placed until Elijah comes If there are cancellations of contracts [ simponot ] among them, he should do what in the simponot .
llm_translation: He found a document among his documents and does not know its status - it shall remain until Elijah comes. If there are indications with them, he should do what is in the indications.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאי ״שְׁטָרֵי בֵירוּרִין״? הָכָא תַּרְגִּמוּ שְׁטָרֵי טַעֲנָתָא. רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה אָמַר: זֶה בּוֹרֵר לוֹ אֶחָד וְזֶה בּוֹרֵר לוֹ אֶחָד.
human_translation: What documents of beirurin ? Here, interpret documents of claims Rabbi Yirmeya, said: this chooses [ borer ] one and that chooses one
llm_translation: Gemara: What is "shetarei beirurin"? Here they translated it as shetarei ta'anata. Rabbi Yirmiyah said: This one chooses for himself one and this one chooses for himself one.

hebrew_text: וְכׇל מַעֲשֵׂה בֵּית דִּין הֲרֵי זֶה יַחְזִיר. הָהוּא גִּיטָּא דְּאִשְׁתְּכַח בֵּי דִינָא דְּרַב הוּנָא, דַּהֲוָה כְּתִיב בֵּיהּ ״בִּשְׁוִירֵי מָתָא דְּעַל רָכִיס נַהֲרָא״. אֲמַר רַב הוּנָא:
human_translation: And any court enactment, must return a certain bill of divorce that was found the court of Rav Huna, in which it was written in Sheviri City, which is on the Rakhis River. Rav Huna said
llm_translation: "And all the actions of the court, behold, this one shall return. That bill of divorce that was found in the court of Rav Huna, for it was written in it, 'In the plains of the city upon the bank of the river.' Rav Huna said:"

hebrew_text: חָיְישִׁינַן לִשְׁנֵי שְׁוִירֵי. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב חִסְדָּא לְרַבָּה: פּוֹק עַיֵּין, דִּלְאוּרְתָּא בָּעֵי לַהּ רַב הוּנָא מִינָּךְ. נְפַק דַּק וְאַשְׁכַּח, דִּתְנַן: כׇּל מַעֲשֵׂה בֵּית דִּין הֲרֵי זֶה יַחְזִיר.
human_translation: We are concerned for two Sheviri, Rav Ḥisda said to Rabba: Go out examine as in the evening Rav Huna will ask you He went out, examined and discovered as we learned any court enactment, must return
llm_translation: We are concerned for two barley loaves. Rav Ḥisdah said to Rabba: Go out and see, for perhaps Rav Huna requires them for his son. He went out, searched, and found, as we learned: "Any action of the court, this one shall return."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב עַמְרָם לְרַבָּה: הֵיכִי פָּשֵׁיט מָר אִיסּוּרָא מִמָּמוֹנָא? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: תְּרָדָא, ״שְׁטָרֵי חֲלִיצָה וּמֵיאוּנִין״ תְּנַן.
human_translation: Rav Amram said to Rabba: How can the Master resolve a ritual matter, from monetary matters? said to him: Fool, we learned documents of ḥalitza and refusal
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Amram said to Rabbah: How does one remove a prohibition from money? He said to him: Through a document, "bills of divorce and appraisals," we learned.

hebrew_text: פְּקַע אַרְזָא דְּבֵי רַב. מָר אָמַר: מִשּׁוּם לַתַּאי דִּידִי פְּקַע. וּמָר אָמַר: מִשּׁוּם לַתַּאי דִּידִי פְּקַע.
human_translation: cedar of the study hall dislodged. Sage said: due to my fortune dislodged, and Sage said: due to my fortune dislodged,
llm_translation: Split the cedar of the house of Rav. Mar said: Because of the benefit of mine, split. And Mar said: Because of the benefit of mine, split.

hebrew_text: מָצָא בַּחֲפִיסָה אוֹ בִדְלוֹסְקָמָא. מַאי חֲפִיסָה? אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה: חֵמֶת קְטַנָּה. מַאי דְּלוֹסְקָמָא? אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר שְׁמוּאֵל: טְלִיקָא דְסָבֵי.
human_translation: found in a ḥafisa or in a deluskema , What is a ḥafisa ? Rabba bar bar Ḥana says: a small flask. What is a deluskema ? Rabba bar Shmuel says: a container [ telika ] by the elderly.
llm_translation: He found in a heap or in a pile of stones. What is a heap? Rabba bar bar Ḥana said: a small pit. What is a pile of stones? Rabba bar Shmuel said: a mound of bricks.

hebrew_text: תַּכְרִיךְ שֶׁל שְׁטָרוֹת אוֹ אֲגוּדָּה שֶׁל שְׁטָרוֹת וְכוּ׳. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: כַּמָּה הוּא תַּכְרִיךְ שֶׁל שְׁטָרוֹת? שְׁלֹשָׁה כְּרוּכִין זֶה בָּזֶה. וְכַמָּה הִיא אֲגוּדָּה שֶׁל שְׁטָרוֹת? שְׁלֹשָׁה קְשׁוּרִין זֶה בָּזֶה.
human_translation: a roll of documents or a bundle of documents, The Sages taught How many constitute a roll of documents? three rolled together. And how many constitute a bundle of documents? three tied together.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: A bundle of documents or a bundle of documents, etc. The Rabbis taught: How much is a bundle of documents? Three tied together. And how much is a bundle of documents? Three bound together.

hebrew_text: שָׁמְעַתְּ מִינַּהּ קֶשֶׁר סִימָן.
human_translation: Conclude from it knot a distinguishing mark
llm_translation: You have heard from her a sign of a knot.

hebrew_text: הָא תָּנֵי רַבִּי חִיָּיא: שְׁלֹשָׁה כְּרוּכִין זֶה בָּזֶה.
human_translation: Doesn’t Rabbi Ḥiyya teach three rolled together?
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Ha tanay Rabbi Chiya: Shlosha keruchin zeh bazeh." English translation: "This was taught by Rabbi Chiya: Three intertwined with each other."

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, הַיְינוּ תַּכְרִיךְ? תַּכְרִיךְ כֹּל חַד וְחַד בְּרֵאשֵׁהּ דְּחַבְרֵיהּ, אֲגוּדָּה דִּרְמוּ אַהֲדָדֵי (וּכְרוּכוֹת).
human_translation: If so, is a roll A roll each and every one at the top of another one, A bundle, where they are located one on top of the other and rolled
llm_translation: If so, is that the same as "takrich"? "Takrich" - each and every one at the beginning of his colleagues, a bundle of those who are intertwined (and intertwined).

hebrew_text: מַאי מַכְרִיז, מִנְיָן?
human_translation: What proclaim number
llm_translation: What is the meaning of "makhriz," from where?

hebrew_text: מַאי אִרְיָא תְּלָתָא אֲפִילּוּ תְּרֵין נָמֵי!
human_translation: why specifically three Even two also
llm_translation: What is the meaning of "three"? Even two are also considered!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא כִּדְאָמַר רָבִינָא: טִבְעָא מַכְרֵיז, הָכָא נָמֵי ״שְׁטָרֵי״ מַכְרֵיז.
human_translation: Rather, similar to that which Ravina said: proclaims coins, Here too, proclaims documents,
llm_translation: Rather as said Ravina: a document proclaims, here too "contracts" proclaims.

hebrew_text: רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: אֶחָד הַלֹּוֶה מִשְּׁלֹשָׁה יַחְזִיר לַלֹּוֶה וְכוּ׳. דְּאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ דְּמַלְוִין נִינְהוּ, מַאי בָּעוּ גַּבֵּי הֲדָדֵי?
human_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: one who borrowed from three he must return to the debtor. that if it enters your mind that these belong to creditors, what are they doing together
llm_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: One who borrows from three, shall repay to the lender, etc. For if it enters your mind that they are borrowers, what do they need with each other?

hebrew_text: דִּלְמָא לְקַיּוֹמִינְהוּ אָזְלִי? דִּמְקַיְּימִי.
human_translation: Perhaps went to ratify where are ratified.
llm_translation: Perhaps they went to establish it? For they establish.

hebrew_text: דִּלְמָא מִידָא דְסָפְרָא נְפֻל? לָא מְשַׁהֵי אִינִישׁ קִיּוּמֵיהּ בִּידָא דְסָפְרָא.
human_translation: Perhaps fell from hand of the scribe A person does not leave his ratified in the possession of the scribe.
llm_translation: Perhaps from the hand of the scribe it fell? One should not rely on the permanence of the scribe's hand.

hebrew_text: שְׁלֹשָׁה שֶׁלָּווּ מֵאֶחָד יַחְזִיר לַמַּלְוֶה וְכוּ׳. דְּאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ דְּלֹוִין נִינְהוּ, מַאי בָּעוּ גַּבֵּי הֲדָדֵי?
human_translation: three who borrowed from one must return to the creditor. that if it enters your mind that these belong to debtors, what are they doing together?
llm_translation: Three who borrowed from one, one of them should repay the lender, etc. For if you think they are considered as guarantors, what do they need with each other?

hebrew_text: דִּלְמָא לְמִכְתְּבִנְהוּ אֲזֻל? דִּכְתִיבִי בִּתְלָת יְדֵי סָפְרֵי.
human_translation: Perhaps went to write where are written in the handwriting of three scribes.
llm_translation: Perhaps to write them should he go? For it is written in three hands of books.

hebrew_text: וְדִלְמָא לְקַיּוֹמִינְהוּ אֲזֻל? מַלְוֶה מְקַיֵּים שְׁטָרֵיהּ, לֹוֶה לָא מְקַיֵּים שְׁטָרֵיהּ.
human_translation: And perhaps went to ratify creditor ratifies his note; debtor does not ratify his note.
llm_translation: Perhaps he will go to establish them? The lender fulfills his documents, the borrower does not fulfill his documents.

hebrew_text: אִם יֵשׁ עִמָּהֶן סִמְפּוֹנוֹת – יַעֲשֶׂה מָה שֶׁבַּסִּמְפּוֹנוֹת. אָמַר רַב יִרְמְיָה בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר רַב: סִמְפּוֹן הַיּוֹצֵא מִתַּחַת יְדֵי מַלְוֶה, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁכָּתוּב בִּכְתַב יָדוֹ – אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא כִּמְשַׂחֵק, וּפָסוּל.
human_translation: If there are cancellations of contracts [ simponot ] among he should do what is in the simponot . Rav Yirmeya bar Abba says Rav says: a simpon that emerges from the possession of a creditor, even if it is written in his handwriting it is as though he were merely jesting and is invalid.
llm_translation: If there are sponges with them - do what is in the sponges. Rav Yirmeya bar Abba said in the name of Rav: A sponge that emerges from under the lender's control, even though it is written in his handwriting - it is only like a joke, and it is invalid.

hebrew_text: לָא מִבַּעְיָא כָּתוּב בִּכְתַב יַד סוֹפֵר, דְּאִיכָּא לְמֵימַר סָפְרָא אִתְרְמִי לֵיהּ וּכְתַב, אֶלָּא אֲפִילּוּ כָּתוּב בִּכְתַב יָדוֹ פָּסוּל. סָבַר דִּלְמָא מִתְרְמֵי וְאָתֵי בֵּין הַשְּׁמָשׁוֹת וְקָא פָרַע לִי, דְּאִי לָא יָהֵיבְנָא לֵיהּ לָא יָהֵיב לִי זוּזֵי, אֶכְתּוֹב אֲנָא דְּכִי (אַיְיתַי) [מַיְיתֵי] לִי זוּזַי אֶתֵּן לֵיהּ.
human_translation: It is not necessary it is written in the handwriting of a scribe, as it can be said he happened to the scribe and write But even it is written in the handwriting of it is invalid. thinking: Perhaps will happen to come at twilight and repay me. as, if I do not give him he will not give me money. I will write that when he brings me money, I will give to him.
llm_translation: Not needed is it written in handwriting of scribe, for there is to say a book is found and written, rather even if written in handwriting of his hand invalid. He thought perhaps he will give and will come between the suns and will annul for me, for if he does not give to me he will not give me coins, I will write that when he brings coins I will give to him.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: אִם יֵשׁ עִמָּהֶן סִמְפּוֹנוֹת, יַעֲשֶׂה מָה שֶׁבְּסִמְפּוֹנוֹת.
human_translation: we learned If there are simponot among he should do what is in the simponot .
llm_translation: We learned in the Mishnah: If there are sponges with them, one should do what is with the sponges.

hebrew_text: כִּדְאָמַר רַב סָפְרָא: שֶׁנִּמְצָא בֵּין שְׁטָרוֹת קְרוּעִין, הָכָא נָמֵי שֶׁמְּצָאוֹ בֵּין שְׁטָרוֹת קְרוּעִין.
human_translation: in accordance with which Rav Safra said where was found among torn documents. Here too, where was found among torn documents.
llm_translation: As Rav Safra said: If one was found between tied documents, here too it is said that he was found between tied documents.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: נִמְצָא לְאֶחָד בֵּין שְׁטָרוֹתָיו שְׁטָרוֹ שֶׁל יוֹסֵף בֶּן שִׁמְעוֹן פָּרוּעַ – שְׁטָרוֹת שְׁנֵיהֶם פְּרוּעִין!
human_translation: Come hear one found among his documents the note of Yosef ben Shimon is repaid, the promissory notes of both of them are repaid,
llm_translation: "Come and hear: It was found for one, between his documents, the document of Yosef son of Shimon is spread out - their documents are both spread out!"

hebrew_text: כִּדְאָמַר רַב סָפְרָא: שֶׁנִּמְצָא בֵּין שְׁטָרוֹת קְרוּעִין, הָכָא נָמֵי שֶׁנִּמְצָא בֵּין שְׁטָרוֹת קְרוּעִין.
human_translation: in accordance with which Rav Safra said where was found among torn documents. Here too, where was found among torn documents.
llm_translation: As Rav Safra said: If one was found between tied documents, here too, if one was found between tied documents.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: ״שְׁבוּעָה שֶׁלֹּא פְּקָדַנוּ אַבָּא, וְשֶׁלֹּא אָמַר לָנוּ אַבָּא, וְשֶׁלֹּא מָצָאנוּ בֵּין שְׁטָרוֹתָיו שֶׁל אַבָּא שֶׁשְּׁטָר זֶה פָּרוּעַ״.
human_translation: Come hear an oath that father did not instruct us nor did father say to us nor did we find among the documents of father that this note repaid.
llm_translation: "Come and hear: 'An oath that our father did not administer, and that our father did not tell us about, and that we did not find among the documents of our father that this document is torn.'"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב סָפְרָא: שֶׁנִּמְצָא בֵּין שְׁטָרוֹת קְרוּעִין.
human_translation: Rav Safra, said where was found among torn documents.
llm_translation: Rav Safra said: that which was found between torn documents.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: סִמְפּוֹן שֶׁיֵּשׁ עָלָיו עֵדִים יִתְקַיֵּים בְּחוֹתְמָיו. אֵימָא ״יִתְקַיֵּים מֵחוֹתְמָיו״!
human_translation: Come hear A simpon upon which witnesses is ratified by its signatories. Say Is ratified from its signatories,
llm_translation: "Come and hear: A document that has witnesses signed on it is validated by its seals. Say, 'Validated by its seals!'"

hebrew_text: דְּשָׁיְילִינַן לְהוּ לְסָהֲדִי אִי פָּרוּעַ אִי לָא פָּרוּעַ.
human_translation: as we ask the witnesses whether repaid whether not repaid.
llm_translation: We ask them to testify whether it was done openly or not openly.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: סִמְפּוֹן שֶׁיֵּשׁ עָלָיו עֵדִים – כָּשֵׁר. מַאי עֵדִים? עֵדֵי קִיּוּם.
human_translation: Come hear A simpon upon which witnesses valid. what witnesses witnesses of ratification.
llm_translation: Come and hear: A document that has witnesses on it - valid. What are witnesses? Witnesses of validation.

hebrew_text: הָכִי נָמֵי מִסְתַּבְּרָא, מִדְּקָתָנֵי סֵיפָא: וְשֶׁאֵין עָלָיו עֵדִים – פָּסוּל. מַאי ״אֵין עָלָיו עֵדִים״? אִילֵּימָא דְּלֵיכָּא עִלָּוֵיהּ עֵדִים כְּלָל, צְרִיכָא לְמֵימַר דְּפָסוּל?! אֶלָּא לָאו עֵדֵי קִיּוּם.
human_translation: this too stands to reason, from that teaches the latter clause: And upon which witnesses not invalid. What Upon which witnesses not If we say that there are no witnesses on it at all, need to be said that invalid? Rather, is it not witnesses of ratification?
llm_translation: Thus it was stated: from the end of the Mishnah it is inferred: "And if there are no witnesses against him - he is disqualified." What does "there are no witnesses against him" mean? If you say it means that there are no witnesses at all against him, it is necessary to say that he is disqualified?! Rather, it means witnesses of establishment.

hebrew_text: גּוּפָא. סִמְפּוֹן שֶׁיֵּשׁ עָלָיו עֵדִים – יִתְקַיֵּים בְּחוֹתְמָיו. אֵין עָלָיו עֵדִים וְיוֹצֵא מִתַּחַת יְדֵי שָׁלִישׁ, אוֹ שֶׁיּוֹצֵא לְאַחַר חִיתּוּם שְׁטָרוֹת – כָּשֵׁר.
human_translation: the itself A simpon upon which witnesses is ratified by its signatories. there are no witnesses on it, but emerges from the possession of a third party or it emerges after the signing of documents, valid.
llm_translation: Body. A document that has witnesses on it - is validated by its signatures. If it does not have witnesses and emerges from the hands of a third party, or if it emerges after the sealing of the documents - it is valid.

hebrew_text: יוֹצֵא מִתַּחַת יְדֵי שָׁלִישׁ, דְּהָא הֵימְנֵיהּ מַלְוֶה לְשָׁלִישׁ. יוֹצֵא לְאַחַר חִיתּוּם שְׁטָרוֹת נָמֵי, דְּאִי לָאו דִּפְרִיעַ לָא הֲוָה מַרַע לֵיהּ לִשְׁטָרֵיהּ.
human_translation: emerges from the possession of a third party that creditor granted credibility to third party So too, it emerges after the signing of documents, as, if not that was repaid, would not have undermined his note
llm_translation: One who goes out from under the hand of a creditor, for he trusts him to lend to a third party. One who goes out after the sealing of the documents, for if not, it would be harmful for him to his documents.

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ שְׁנַיִם אוֹחֲזִין
llm_translation: The two are holding on to you.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אֵלּוּ מְצִיאוֹת שֶׁלּוֹ, וְאֵלּוּ חַיָּיב לְהַכְרִיז.
human_translation: which found items to him, and which one obligated to proclaim
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: These are his findings, and these he is obligated to announce.

hebrew_text: אֵלּוּ מְצִיאוֹת שֶׁלּוֹ: מָצָא פֵּירוֹת מְפוּזָּרִין, מָעוֹת מְפוּזָּרוֹת, כְּרִיכוֹת בִּרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים, וְעִגּוּלֵי דְבֵילָה, כִּכָּרוֹת שֶׁל נַחְתּוֹם, מַחְרוֹזוֹת שֶׁל דָּגִים, וַחֲתִיכוֹת שֶׁל בָּשָׂר, וְגִיזֵּי צֶמֶר הַלְּקוּחִין מִמְּדִינָתָן, וַאֲנִיצֵי פִשְׁתָּן, וּלְשׁוֹנוֹת שֶׁל אַרְגָּמָן – הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ שֶׁלּוֹ, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר.
human_translation: These found items to him: found scattered produce, scattered coins, bundles in a public area, round cakes figs, baker’s loaves, strings of fish, cuts of meat, wool fleeces that are taken from their state flax stalks, or strips of purple wool, these to him, the statement of Rabbi Meir.
llm_translation: These are his findings: if one finds scattered fruits, scattered coins, bundles in a public domain, dung pellets, seal rings, fish spines, pieces of meat, woolen threads from their province, linen threads, and purple threads - these are his. These are the words of Rabbi Meir.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: כֹּל שֶׁיֵּשׁ בּוֹ שִׁינּוּי – חַיָּיב לְהַכְרִיז. כֵּיצַד? מָצָא עִגּוּל וּבְתוֹכוֹ חֶרֶס, כִּכָּר וּבְתוֹכוֹ מָעוֹת.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: any in which there is an alteration, obligated to proclaim How so? found a round earthenware inside it a loaf with coins inside it,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: Anything that has a change in it - one is obligated to announce. How so? If one found a round object with clay inside, a loaf with coins inside.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: כׇּל כְּלֵי אַנְפּוּרְיָא אֵין חַיָּיב לְהַכְרִיז.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: any anpurya vessels, not obligated to proclaim
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: All vessels of Anpurya are not obligated to declare.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מָצָא פֵּירוֹת מְפוּזָּרִין. וְכַמָּה? אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: קַב בְּאַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת.
human_translation: found scattered produce. And how much Rabbi Yitzḥak says: kav in four cubits.
llm_translation: Gemar found scattered fruits. And how much? Rabbi Yitzchak said: a kab within four cubits.

hebrew_text: הֵיכִי דָּמֵי? אִי דֶּרֶךְ נְפִילָה – אֲפִילּוּ טוּבָא נָמֵי! וְאִי דֶּרֶךְ הִינּוּחַ – אֲפִילּוּ בְּצִיר מֵהָכִי נָמֵי לָא!
human_translation: What are the circumstances? If a manner falling even greater also And if a manner placement, even less also not
llm_translation: "How are they similar? If it is in the manner of falling - even a good one nearby! And if it is in the manner of resting - even in a narrow place like this, not nearby!"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב עוּקְבָא בַּר חָמָא: בְּמַכְנַשְׁתָּא דְּבֵי דָרֵי עָסְקִינַן. קַב בְּאַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת דִּנְפִישׁ טִרְחַיְיהוּ – לָא טָרַח אִינִישׁ וְלָא הָדַר אָתֵי וְשָׁקֵיל לְהוּ, אַפְקוֹרֵי מַפְקַר לְהוּ. בְּצִיר מֵהָכִי – טָרַח וְהָדַר אָתֵי וְשָׁקֵיל לְהוּ, וְלָא מַפְקַר לְהוּ.
human_translation: Rav Ukva bar Ḥama said: We are dealing with the gathering on the threshing floor. kav in four cubits, whose great exertion, a person does not exert and does not return take them. he renounces ownership them smaller than that, exerts and returns takes them. And he does not renounce ownership them.
llm_translation: Rav Ukva bar Ḥama said: We are dealing with a case of a courtyard of the residents of a village. If a beam is within four cubits of them, they do not need to exert themselves to bring it in, nor do they need to return and take it, as abandoned property is considered ownerless. However, in a vineyard, they must exert themselves to bring it in, and if they do not, it is not considered ownerless.

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה: חֲצִי קַב בִּשְׁתֵּי אַמּוֹת, מַהוּ? קַב בְּאַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת, טַעְמָא מַאי – מִשּׁוּם דִּנְפִישׁ טִרְחַיְיהוּ. חֲצִי קַב בִּשְׁתֵּי אַמּוֹת, כֵּיוָן דְּלָא נְפִישׁ טִרְחַיְיהוּ – לָא מַפְקַר לְהוּ. אוֹ דִּלְמָא: מִשּׁוּם דְּלָא חֲשִׁיבִי, וַחֲצִי קַב בִּשְׁתֵּי אַמּוֹת, כֵּיוָן דְּלָא חֲשִׁיבִי – מַפְקַר לְהוּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya raises a dilemma: a half- kav in two cubits, what is kav scattered in an area of four cubits, what is the reason due to that great exertion. a half- kav in two cubits, since them not great exertion, not renounce ownership them. Or perhaps, kav scattered in an area of four cubits due to that they are not significant a half- kav in two cubits, since not significant he renounces ownership
llm_translation: Inquiry of Rabbi Yirmiyah: Half a kab in two cubits, what is the ruling? A kab in four cubits, what is the reason? - Because their efforts are not significant. Half a kab in two cubits, as long as their efforts are not significant, it is not considered ownerless. Or perhaps, because it is not considered significant, and half a kab in two cubits, as long as it is not considered significant, it is ownerless.

hebrew_text: קַבַּיִים בִּשְׁמוֹנֶה אַמּוֹת, מַהוּ? קַב בְּאַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת, טַעְמָא מַאי – מִשּׁוּם דִּנְפִישׁ טִרְחַיְיהוּ, וְכׇל שֶׁכֵּן קַבַּיִים בִּשְׁמוֹנֶה אַמּוֹת, כֵּיוָן דִּנְפִישׁא טִרְחַיְיהוּ טְפֵי – מַפְקַר לְהוּ. אוֹ דִלְמָא: מִשּׁוּם דְּלָא חֲשִׁיבִי, וְקַבַּיִים בִּשְׁמוֹנֶה אַמּוֹת, כֵּיוָן דַּחֲשִׁיבִי – לָא מַפְקַר לְהוּ.
human_translation: two kav in eight cubits, what is one kav in an area of four cubits, what is the reason due to that them great exertion. all the more so two kav in eight cubits, since them even greater exertion, renounces ownership them. Or perhaps, scattered in an area of four cubits due to that they are not significant But two kav in eight cubits, since they are significant does not renounce ownership them.
llm_translation: Kabbayim in eight cubits, what is it? A kab in four cubits, what is the reason? Because their efforts are greater, and certainly kabbayim in eight cubits, since their efforts are greater, they are exempt. Or perhaps because they are not considered significant, and kabbayim in eight cubits, since they are considered significant, they are not exempt.

hebrew_text: קַב שׁוּמְשְׁמִין בְּאַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת, מַהוּ? קַב בְּאַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת טַעְמָא מַאי – מִשּׁוּם דְּלָא חֲשִׁיבִי, וְשׁוּמְשְׁמִין כֵּיוָן דַּחֲשִׁיבִי – לָא מַפְקַר לְהוּ. אוֹ דִלְמָא: מִשּׁוּם דִּנְפִישׁ טִרְחַיְיהוּ, וְכׇל שֶׁכֵּן שׁוּמְשְׁמִין, כֵּיוָן דִּנְפִישׁ טִרְחַיְיהוּ טְפֵי – מַפְקַר לְהוּ.
human_translation: kav of sesame in four cubits, what is kav in four cubits, what is the reason due to that they are not significant And sesame since they are significant does not renounce ownership them. Or perhaps, in four cubits due to that them great exertion. all the more so sesame Since them even greater exertion, he renounces ownership them.
llm_translation: A kab that is placed within four cubits, what is the law? A kab within four cubits, what is the reason? - Because it is not considered significant, and Shumshemin, since it is considered significant, is not exempt. Or perhaps: because their efforts are greater, and all the more so Shumshemin, since their efforts are greater - they are exempt.

hebrew_text: קַב תַּמְרֵי בְּאַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת, קַב רִמּוֹנֵי בְּאַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת, מַהוּ? קַב בְּאַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת, טַעְמָא מַאי? מִשּׁוּם דְּלָא חֲשִׁיבִי. קַב תַּמְרֵי בְּאַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת, קַב רִמּוֹנֵי בְּאַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת נָמֵי, כֵּיוָן דְּלָא חֲשִׁיבִי – מַפְקַר לְהוּ.
human_translation: kav of dates in four cubits, kav of pomegranates in four cubits, what is kav in four cubits, what is the reason due to that they are not significant and also kav of dates in four cubits or kav of pomegranates in four cubits, since they are not significant he renounces ownership
llm_translation: A kab of dates in four cubits, a kab of pomegranates in four cubits, what is the law? A kab in four cubits, what is the reason? Because it is not considered. A kab of dates in four cubits, a kab of pomegranates in four cubits also, since it is not considered - it is ownerless.

hebrew_text: אוֹ דִלְמָא: מִשּׁוּם דִּנְפִישׁא טִרְחַיְיהוּ, וְקַב תַּמְרֵי בְּאַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת, וְקַב רִמּוֹנֵי בְּאַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת, כֵּיוָן דְּלָא נְפִישׁ טִרְחַיְיהוּ – לָא מַפְקַר לְהוּ. מַאי? תֵּיקוּ.
human_translation: Or perhaps, kav kernels in four cubits due to that them great exertion. And kav of dates in four cubits or kav of pomegranates in four cubits, since them does not great exertion not renounce ownership them. what shall stand
llm_translation: Or perhaps: because their efforts are greater, and a kab of dates in four cubits, and a kab of pomegranates in four cubits, since their efforts are not greater - it is not considered ownerless. What? Let it stand.

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר:
human_translation: It was stated:
llm_translation: It was stated:

hebrew_text: יֵאוּשׁ שֶׁלֹּא מִדַּעַת, אַבָּיֵי אָמַר: לָא הָוֵי יֵאוּשׁ. וְרָבָא אָמַר: הָוֵי יֵאוּשׁ.
human_translation: despair that is not a conscious Abaye said: It is not despair; And Rava said: It is despair
llm_translation: Despair due to lack of knowledge, Abaye said: It is not despair. And Rava said: It is despair.

hebrew_text: בְּדָבָר שֶׁיֵּשׁ בּוֹ סִימָן – כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְּלִיגִי דְּלָא הָוֵי יֵאוּשׁ. וְאַף עַל גַּב דְּשַׁמְעִינֵיהּ דְּמִיָּאַשׁ לְסוֹף, לָא הָוֵי יֵאוּשׁ, דְּכִי אֲתָא לִידֵיהּ – בְּאִיסּוּרָא הוּא דַּאֲתָא לִידֵיהּ, דִּלְכִי יָדַע דִּנְפַל מִינֵּיהּ לָא מִיָּאַשׁ, מֵימָר אָמַר: סִימָנָא אִית לִי בְּגַוֵּיהּ, יָהֵבְנָא סִימָנָא וְשָׁקֵילְנָא לֵיהּ.
human_translation: In an item on which there is a distinguishing mark, everyone agrees is not despair. And even though we hear that he ultimately despairs not despair, as when came into possession in a prohibited that it came into his possession. because when learns that it fell from his he does not despair he says: I have a distinguishing mark on I will provide the distinguishing mark and I will take
llm_translation: In a matter that has a sign - everyone does not dispute that it is not considered lost. And even though its signs are fading, it is not considered lost, for when it comes into his hands - it is in a state of prohibition that comes into his hands, for he knows that if it falls from him, it is not lost. The saying goes: "I have a sign in its body, I will give a sign and take it."

hebrew_text: בְּזוּטוֹ שֶׁל יָם וּבִשְׁלוּלִיתוֹ שֶׁל נָהָר, אַף עַל גַּב דְּאִית בֵּיהּ סִימָן, רַחֲמָנָא שַׁרְיֵיהּ, כִּדְבָעֵינַן לְמֵימַר לְקַמַּן.
human_translation: by the tide of the sea or by the flooding of a river, even though has a distinguishing mark, the Merciful One permits it as we seek to state below,
llm_translation: In its smallness of the sea and in its shallowness of the river, even though there is a sign in it, the Merciful One permits it, as we will say later.

hebrew_text: כִּי פְּלִיגִי בְּדָבָר שֶׁאֵין בּוֹ סִימָן. אַבָּיֵי אָמַר: לָא הָוֵי יֵאוּשׁ, דְּהָא לָא יָדַע דִּנְפַל מִינֵּיהּ. רָבָא אָמַר: הָוֵי יֵאוּשׁ, דִּלְכִי יָדַע דִּנְפַל מִינֵּיהּ – מִיָּאַשׁ. מֵימָר אָמַר: סִימָנָא לֵית לִי בְּגַוֵּיהּ, מֵהַשְׁתָּא הוּא דְּמִיָּאַשׁ.
human_translation: When they disagree, with regard to an item in which there is no distinguishing mark. Abaye said: is not despair, as he did not know that fell from him; Rava said: is despair, as when he discovers that it fell from him, he will despair he says I have no distinguishing mark on from now, that he despairs.
llm_translation: When they disputed a matter that has no sign. Abbaye said: It is not hopeless, for he does not know that it has fallen from him. Rava said: It is hopeless, for since he knows that it has fallen from him, he despairs. Memar said: I have no sign in his body, now is when he despairs.

hebrew_text: (סִימַן פמג״ש ממקגט״י ככסע״ז)
human_translation: a mnemonic Peh , mem , gimmel , shin ; mem , mem , kuf , gimmel , tet , yod ; kaf , kaf , samekh , ayin , zayin .
llm_translation: Tractate: Siman Pumagash Memkagtai Kekase'az (

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: פֵּירוֹת מְפוּזָּרִין, הָא לָא יָדַע דִּנְפַל מִינֵּיהּ! הָא אָמַר רַב עוּקְבָא בַּר חָמָא: הָכָא בְּמַכְנַשְׁתָּא (דְּבִיזְרֵי) [דְּבֵי דָרֵי] עָסְקִינַן, דַּאֲבֵידָה מִדַּעַת הִיא.
human_translation: Come hear scattered produce, isn’t unaware that they fell from him? Didn’t Rav Ukva bar Ḥama say: We are dealing with kernels of wheat that remained during gathering on the threshing floor? That is a deliberate loss,
llm_translation: "Come and hear: scattered fruits, does he not know that it fell from them! Here, Rav Ukva bar Hama said: Here we are dealing with a basket of figs, for it is lost from its knowledge."

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: מָעוֹת מְפוּזָּרוֹת – הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ שֶׁלּוֹ, אַמַּאי? הָא לָא יָדַע דִּנְפַל מִינֵּיהּ! הָתָם נָמֵי כִּדְרַבִּי יִצְחָק דְּאָמַר: אָדָם עָשׂוּי לְמַשְׁמֵשׁ בְּכִיסוֹ בְּכׇל שָׁעָה וְשָׁעָה. הָכָא נָמֵי אָדָם עָשׂוּי לְמַשְׁמֵשׁ בְּכִיסוֹ בְּכׇל שָׁעָה וְשָׁעָה.
human_translation: Come hear scattered coins, these to him. Why isn’t unaware that they fell from him? There too, in accordance with of Rabbi Yitzḥak, who says: A person is prone to feel his pouch constantly. Here too, a person is prone to feel his pouch constantly;
llm_translation: Come and hear: scattered coins - these belong to him, why? Because he did not know that they fell from him! There, too, it is similar to what Rabbi Yitzchak said: a person is fit to serve as a vessel in his pocket at all times. Here, too, a person is fit to serve as a vessel in his pocket at all times.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: עִיגּוּלֵי דְבֵילָה וְכִכָּרוֹת שֶׁל נַחְתּוֹם – הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ שֶׁלּוֹ. אַמַּאי? וְהָא לָא יָדַע דִּנְפַל מִינֵּיהּ? הָתָם נָמֵי, אַגַּב דְּיַקִּירֵי מִידָּע יָדַע בְּהוּ.
human_translation: Come hear round cakes figs or baker’s loaves, these to him. Why isn’t unaware that they fell from him? There too, Since are heavy he knows they
llm_translation: Come and hear: The cakes of a fool and the loaves of Nahshon - these belong to him. Why? Doesn't he know that they fell from him? There too, because of his preciousness, he knows about them.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: וּלְשׁוֹנוֹת שֶׁל אַרְגָּמָן – הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ שֶׁלּוֹ. וְאַמַּאי? הָא לָא יָדַע דִּנְפַל מִינֵּיהּ! הָתָם נָמֵי, אַגַּב דַּחֲשִׁיבִי מַשְׁמוּשֵׁי מְמַשְׁמֵשׁ בְּהוּ, וְכִדְרַבִּי יִצְחָק.
human_translation: Come hear strips of purple wool, these to him. And why isn’t unaware that they fell from him? There too, Since they are significant feels for them and in accordance with of Rabbi Yitzḥak
llm_translation: "Come and hear: And the tongues of argaman - these are his. And why? Because he did not know that it fell from him! There too, since he was occupied with his uses, and like Rabbi Yitzchak."

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: הַמּוֹצֵא מָעוֹת בְּבָתֵּי כְנֵסִיּוֹת וּבְבָתֵּי מִדְרָשׁוֹת, וּבְכׇל מָקוֹם שֶׁהָרַבִּים מְצוּיִין שָׁם – הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ שֶׁלּוֹ, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהַבְּעָלִים מִתְיָאֲשִׁין מֵהֶן. וְהָא לָא יָדַע דִּנְפַל מִינֵּיהּ? אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: אָדָם עָשׂוּי לְמַשְׁמֵשׁ בְּכִיסוֹ בְּכׇל שָׁעָה.
human_translation: Come hear one who finds coins in synagogues, and in study halls, and in any place where the multitudes are found, these to him due to that the owners despair of their isn’t unaware that fell from him? Rabbi Yitzḥak says: A person is prone to feel his pouch constantly;
llm_translation: Come and hear: One who finds money in synagogues and study halls, and in any place where the public gathers – these belong to him, because the owners despair of them. But does he not need to announce that he found it? Rabbi Yitzchak said: A person is fit to serve as a vessel in his pocket at any time.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: מֵאֵימָתַי כׇּל אָדָם מוּתָּרִים בַּלֶּקֶט? מִשֶּׁיֵּלְכוּ בָּהּ הַנָּמוֹשׁוֹת. וְאָמְרִינַן: מַאי נָמוֹשׁוֹת? וְאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: סָבֵי דְּאָזְלִי אַתִּיגְרָא. רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אָמַר: לָקוֹטֵי בָּתַר לָקוֹטֵי.
human_translation: Come hear From when is it permitted any person to gleanings, once the nemushot have walked in And we say What are nemushot ? And Rabbi Yoḥanan said: elderly people who walk on a cane. Reish Lakish said: gleaners after gleaners,
llm_translation: Come and hear: From when are all people permitted to gather gleanings? From when the ants go in it. And we say: What are "ants"? And Rabbi Yochanan said: The elders who go to the attic. Resh Lakish said: Gatherers after gatherers.

hebrew_text: וְאַמַּאי? נְהִי דַּעֲנִיִּים דְּהָכָא מִיָּאֲשִׁי – אִיכָּא עֲנִיִּים בְּדוּכְתָּא אַחְרִיתָא דְּלָא מִיָּאֲשִׁי! אָמְרִי: כֵּיוָן דְּאִיכָּא עֲנִיִּים הָכָא, הָנָךְ מֵעִיקָּרָא אִיָּאוֹשֵׁי מִיָּאַשׁ, וְאָמְרִי: עֲנִיִּים דְּהָתָם מְלַקְּטִי לֵיהּ.
human_translation: And why although the poor who here renounce ownership there are poor in another place who do not renounce ownership? say Since there are poor here, those despair from the outset, and they say: poor who there gather
llm_translation: And why? Because the poor who are here are not hopeless - there are poor in the outskirts who are hopeless! They said: Since there are poor here, those there will not despair, and they said: The poor there will gather it.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: קְצִיעוֹת בַּדֶּרֶךְ, וַאֲפִילּוּ בְּצַד שְׂדֵה קְצִיעוֹת, וְכֵן תְּאֵנָה הַנּוֹטָה לַדֶּרֶךְ, וּמָצָא תְּאֵנִים תַּחְתֶּיהָ – מוּתָּרוֹת מִשּׁוּם גָּזֵל, וּפְטוּרוֹת מִן הַמַּעֲשֵׂר. בְּזֵיתִים וּבְחָרוּבִים – אָסוּר.
human_translation: Come hear dried figs on the path, and even at the side of a field dried figs and likewise, a fig extend over a path and one found figs beneath it, are permitted due to robbery. And exempt from tithes. of olives or of carobs, prohibited
llm_translation: Come and hear: Cuttings on the road, even on the side of a field of cuttings, and similarly a fig tree leaning towards the road, and one finds figs beneath it - they are permitted due to theft, and exempt from tithing. But with olive trees and carob trees - they are forbidden.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא רֵישָׁא לְאַבָּיֵי לָא קַשְׁיָא: אַגַּב דַּחֲשִׁיבִי – מְמַשְׁמֵשׁ בְּהוּ. תְּאֵנָה נָמֵי מִידָּע יְדִיעַ דְּנָתְרָא.
human_translation: Granted, the first clause not difficult according to Abaye, Since are significant one feels for them fig too, one knows that fall
llm_translation: In truth, the beginning for Abbaye is not difficult: since he considers it - he is benefiting from it. The fig tree is also known for the knowledge that it provides.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא סֵיפָא לְרָבָא קַשְׁיָא, דְּקָתָנֵי ״בְּזֵיתִים וּבְחָרוּבִים אָסוּר״, אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: שָׁאנֵי זַיִת, הוֹאִיל וְחָזוּתוֹ מוֹכִיחַ עָלָיו, וְאַף עַל גַּב דְּנָתְרִין זֵיתֵי מִידָּע יְדִיעַ, דּוּכְתָּא דְּאִינִישׁ אִינִישׁ הוּא.
human_translation: But the latter clause difficult according to Rava, as it teaches: of olives or of carobs, prohibited Rabbi Abbahu said: an olive is different, since its appearance proves of and even though the olives fall knows a place that person person
