llm_translation: Rather, the latter part is difficult for Rava, as it teaches, "With olives and with carobs it is forbidden." Rabbi Abbahu said: Olives are different, since their appearance testifies on their behalf, and even though the olives are crushed, the knowledge of the person is immediate, for the appearance of a thing is the thing itself.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, אֲפִילּוּ רֵישָׁא נָמֵי! אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: תְּאֵנָה עִם נְפִילָתָהּ נִמְאֶסֶת.
human_translation: If so, even first as well, Rav Pappa said: A fig becomes disgusting with its fall
llm_translation: If so, even the beginning also! Rav Papa said: A fig with its fall is despised.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: הַגַּנָּב שֶׁנָּטַל מִזֶּה וְנָתַן לָזֶה, וְכֵן גַּזְלָן שֶׁנָּטַל מִזֶּה וְנָתַן לָזֶה,
human_translation: Come hear A thief who took from this and gave to that and likewise, a robber who took from this and gave to that
llm_translation: Come and hear: A thief who took from this one and gave to that one, and similarly a robber who took from this one and gave to that one,

hebrew_text: וְכֵן יַרְדֵּן שֶׁנָּטַל מִזֶּה וְנָתַן לָזֶה, מַה שֶּׁנָּטַל – נָטַל, וּמַה שֶּׁנָּתַן – נָתַן.
human_translation: and likewise, Jordan that took from this and gave to that that which took, he took, and that which gave, he gave.
llm_translation: "And so too the Jordan, which flows from here and is given there, whatever is taken - is taken, and whatever is given - is given."

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא גַּזְלָן וְיַרְדֵּן, דְּקָא חָזֵי לְהוּ וּמִיָּאַשׁ. אֶלָּא גַּנָּב, מִי קָא חָזֵי לֵיהּ דְּמִיָּאַשׁ? תַּרְגְּמַהּ רַב פָּפָּא בְּלִסְטִים מְזוּיָּן. אִי הָכִי הַיְינוּ גַּזְלָן! תְּרֵי גַּוְונֵי גַּזְלָן.
human_translation: Granted robber and Jordan that sees them and despairs but thief, does see him that despair? Rav Pappa interpreted armed bandits [ listim ]; If so, this is a robber, two types of robbers;
llm_translation: In truth, a robber and a bandit, for he sees them and despairs. But a thief, who sees him that he despairs? Rav Papa translated it as "with a visible sign." If so, this is indeed a robber! Two types of robbers.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: שָׁטַף נָהָר קוֹרָיו, עֵצָיו, וַאֲבָנָיו, וּנְתָנוֹ בְּתוֹךְ שְׂדֵה חֲבֵירוֹ – הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ שֶׁלּוֹ, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁנִּתְיָאֲשׁוּ הַבְּעָלִים. טַעְמָא דְּנִתְיָאֲשׁוּ הַבְּעָלִים, הָא סְתָמָא – לָא! הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן? כְּשֶׁיָּכוֹל לְהַצִּיל.
human_translation: Come hear a river swept one’s beams, one’s wood, or one’s stones and placed them into the field of another, these to due to that the owners despaired The reason that the owners despaired; but an unspecified not With what are we dealing here? where capable of rescuing
llm_translation: Come and hear: If a river floods its cold waters, its trees, and its stones, and places them in the field of his neighbor - these are considered his, because the owners despaired. The reason the owners despaired is that they despaired. Here, what are we dealing with? When it is possible to save.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי אֵימָא סֵיפָא: אִם הָיוּ הַבְּעָלִים מְרַדְּפִין אַחֲרֵיהֶם – חַיָּיב לְהַחְזִיר. אִי בִּיכוֹלִין לְהַצִּיל, מַאי אִרְיָא מְרַדְּפִין? אֲפִילּוּ אֵין מְרַדְּפִין נָמֵי! הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן? בִּיכוֹלִין לְהַצִּיל עַל יְדֵי הַדְּחָק. מְרַדְּפִין – לָא אִיָּיאוּשׁ, אֵין מְרַדְּפִין – אִיָּיאוֹשֵׁי מִיָּאַשׁ.
human_translation: If so, say the latter clause If the owners were pursuing obligated to return If where capable of rescuing why specifically pursuing Even not pursuing also With what are we dealing here? where capable of rescuing with difficulty. pursue they did not despair do not pursue they despaired
llm_translation: If so, say the latter part: If the owners were pursuing after them - he is obligated to return. If they are able to save themselves, what is the meaning of "pursuing"? Even if they are not actually pursuing! Here, what are we dealing with? They are able to save themselves through distress. Pursuing - there is no despair, not pursuing - there is despair of who will save.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: כֵּיצַד אָמְרוּ הַתּוֹרֵם שֶׁלֹּא מִדַּעַת תְּרוּמָתוֹ תְּרוּמָה – הֲרֵי שֶׁיָּרַד לְתוֹךְ שְׂדֵה חֲבֵירוֹ וְלִיקֵּט וְתָרַם שֶׁלֹּא בִּרְשׁוּת, אִם חוֹשֵׁשׁ מִשּׁוּם גָּזֵל – אֵין תְּרוּמָתוֹ תְּרוּמָה, וְאִם לָאו – תְּרוּמָתוֹ תְּרוּמָה.
human_translation: Come hear When did say one separates teruma without consent, his teruma is teruma ? there was who entered another’s field and gathered and separated teruma without permission. If concerned about as robbery, his teruma is not teruma , but if not his teruma is teruma .
llm_translation: Come and hear: How did they say the one who separates his contribution without knowledge, his contribution is separated? If he descended into the field of his fellow and gathered and separated without permission, if he is concerned about theft - his contribution is not a contribution, and if not - his contribution is a contribution.

hebrew_text: וּמִנַּיִן הוּא יוֹדֵעַ אִם חוֹשֵׁשׁ מִשּׁוּם גָּזֵל וְאִם לָאו? הֲרֵי שֶׁבָּא בַּעַל הַבַּיִת וּמְצָאוֹ, וְאָמַר לוֹ: ״כְּלָךְ אֵצֶל יָפוֹת״. אִם נִמְצְאוּ יָפוֹת מֵהֶן – תְּרוּמָתוֹ תְּרוּמָה, וְאִם לָאו – אֵין תְּרוּמָתוֹ תְּרוּמָה. לִיקְּטוּ הַבְּעָלִים וְהוֹסִיפוּ עֲלֵיהֶן, בֵּין כָּךְ וּבֵין כָּךְ – תְּרוּמָתוֹ תְּרוּמָה.
human_translation: And from where would he know whether concerned about as robbery or not? the owner came and found him and said to him: gone to better if better than is found, his teruma is teruma , But if not, his teruma is not teruma , the owners were gathering and adding either way, his teruma is teruma .
llm_translation: And from where does he know if he is concerned about theft or not? Behold, the homeowner came and found it, and said to him: "Take it to beautiful ones." If beautiful ones were found among them - his contribution is a contribution, and if not - his contribution is not a contribution. The owners gathered and added to them, whether this way or that way - his contribution is a contribution.

hebrew_text: וְכִי נִמְצְאוּ יָפוֹת מֵהֶן תְּרוּמָתוֹ תְּרוּמָה, אַמַּאי? בְּעִידָּנָא דִּתְרַם הָא לָא הֲוָה יָדַע! תַּרְגְּמַהּ רָבָא אַלִּיבָּא דְּאַבָּיֵי: דְּשַׁוְּיֵהּ שָׁלִיחַ.
human_translation: But why if better than is found his teruma is teruma ? At the time that he separated the teruma , he did not know Rava interpreted in accordance with of Abaye: where designated him an agent.
llm_translation: And if beautiful ones were found among them, his contribution is a contribution. Why? At the time he contributed, this was not known! Rava translated it in the name of Abbaye: "It was placed by a messenger."

hebrew_text: הָכִי נָמֵי מִסְתַּבְּרָא, דְּאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ דְּלָא שַׁוְּויֵהּ שָׁלִיחַ, מִי הָוְיָא תְּרוּמָתוֹ תְּרוּמָה? וְהָא ״אַתֶּם״ ״גַּם אַתֶּם״ אָמַר רַחֲמָנָא לְרַבּוֹת שְׁלוּחֲכֶם. מָה אַתֶּם לְדַעְתְּכֶם, אַף שְׁלוּחֲכֶם לְדַעְתְּכֶם.
human_translation: So too, it is reasonable, as if it enters your mind that did not designate him an agent, would his teruma be teruma ? But doesn’t the Merciful One state: “you,” “you also” to include an agent. Just as you, with your knowledge, so too your agent with your knowledge.
llm_translation: So it was thought, for if it were to enter your mind that if his agent was not approved, would his contribution be considered a contribution? But the Merciful One said, "You also," to include your agents. Just as "you" according to your understanding, so too your agents according to your understanding.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן – כְּגוֹן דְּשַׁוְּיֵהּ שָׁלִיחַ, וַאֲמַר לֵיהּ: ״זִיל תְּרוֹם״, וְלָא אֲמַר לֵיהּ ״תְּרוֹם מֵהָנֵי״. וּסְתָמֵיהּ דְּבַעַל הַבַּיִת כִּי תָּרֵים מִבֵּינוֹנִית (הוּא) תָּרֵים, וַאֲזַל אִיהוּ וּתְרַם מִיָּפוֹת, וּבָא בַּעַל הַבַּיִת וּמְצָאוֹ וַאֲמַר לֵיהּ: ״כְּלָךְ אֵצֶל יָפוֹת״, אִם נִמְצְאוּ יָפוֹת מֵהֶן – תְּרוּמָתוֹ תְּרוּמָה, וְאִם לָאו – אֵין תְּרוּמָתוֹ תְּרוּמָה.
human_translation: Rather, with what are we dealing here? where designated him an agent and said to him: Go and separate teruma , but did not say to him: Separate teruma from these And the owner’s unspecified, when separates teruma , from intermediate quality he separates teruma . And went and separated teruma from higher-quality and the owner came and found him and said to him: gone to better If better than is found, his teruma is teruma . But if not, his teruma is not teruma .
llm_translation: Rather, here we are dealing with what? - For example, when he appointed a messenger, and he said to him, "Go and lift it," and did not say to him, "Lift it from these." And the presumption of the homeowner is that when he says "lift," he means to lift from the middle. So he went and lifted from the good ones, and the homeowner came and found him and said to him, "Take it back to the good ones." If the good ones are found among them - his contribution is a contribution, but if not - his contribution is not a contribution.

hebrew_text: אַמֵּימָר וּמָר זוּטְרָא וְרַב אָשֵׁי אִקְּלַעוּ לְבוּסְתָּנָא דְּמָרִי בַּר אִיסַק, אַיְיתִי אֲרִיסֵיהּ תַּמְרֵי וְרִימּוֹנֵי וּשְׁדָא קַמַּיְיהוּ. אַמֵּימָר וְרַב אָשֵׁי אָכְלִי, מָר זוּטְרָא לָא אֲכַל. אַדְּהָכִי אֲתָא מָרִי בַּר אִיסַק, אַשְׁכְּחִינְהוּ, וַאֲמַר לֵיהּ לַאֲרִיסֵיהּ: אַמַּאי לָא אַיְיתֵית לְהוּ לְרַבָּנַן מֵהָנָךְ שַׁפִּירָתָא?
human_translation: Ameimar, Mar Zutra, and Rav Ashi happened to the orchard [ levustana ] of Mari bar Isak. His sharecropper came and placed dates and pomegranates before them. Ameimar and Rav Ashi ate Mar Zutra did not eat Meanwhile, Mari bar Isak came found them and said to his sharecropper: Why didn’t you bring the Sages from those higher-quality
llm_translation: Ammemar and Mar Zutra and Rav Ashei happened to enter the wine cellar of Mari bar Isak. He brought before them dates, pomegranates, and almonds. Ammemar and Rav Ashei ate, but Mar Zutra did not eat. Meanwhile, Mari bar Isak came, found them, and said to his servant: "Why did you not bring to the Rabbis from those beautiful things?"

hebrew_text: אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ אַמֵּימָר וְרַב אָשֵׁי לְמָר זוּטְרָא: הַשְׁתָּא אַמַּאי לָא אָכֵיל מָר? וְהָתַנְיָא: אִם נִמְצְאוּ יָפוֹת מֵהֶן – תְּרוּמָתוֹ תְּרוּמָה! אֲמַר לְהוּ, הָכִי אָמַר רָבָא: לֹא אָמְרוּ כְּלָךְ אֵצֶל יָפוֹת אֶלָּא לְעִנְיַן תְּרוּמָה בִּלְבַד, מִשּׁוּם דְּמִצְוָה הוּא וְנִיחָא לֵיהּ, אֲבָל הָכָא – מִשּׁוּם כְּסִיפוּתָא הוּא דְּאָמַר הָכִי.
human_translation: Ameimar and Rav Ashi said to Mar Zutra: Now why is the Master not eating the fruit? But isn’t it taught if better than is found, his teruma is teruma . said to them this Rava said: said gone to better only with regard to the matter of teruma , due to that it is a mitzva and is amenable But here, due to shame that he said this:
llm_translation: They said to him, Amemar and Rav Ashe to Mar Zutra: "Now, why does the master not eat?" And it was taught: "If beautiful ones are found among them - his contribution is a contribution!" He said to them, thus said Rava: "They did not say 'beautiful' except in the context of contribution alone, because it is a commandment and it is pleasing to him, but here - it is because of respect, as he said so."

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: עוֹדֵהוּ הַטַּל עֲלֵיהֶן וְשָׂמַח – הֲרֵי זֶה בְּכִי יֻתַּן. נִגְּבוּ, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁשָּׂמַח –
human_translation: Come hear the dew is still upon was glad that when is placed had dried even though he was glad
llm_translation: "Come and hear: 'He will still shower upon them and cause joy' - this is a gift that will be given. They dried up, even though he rejoiced -"

hebrew_text: אֵינָן בְּכִי יוּתַּן.
human_translation: is not when is placed [ khi yuttan ]
llm_translation: They are not in the valley of Jotun.

hebrew_text: טַעְמָא מַאי? לָאו מִשּׁוּם דְּלָא אָמְרִינַן כֵּיוָן דְּאִיגַּלַּאי מִילְּתָא דְּהַשְׁתָּא נִיחָא לֵיהּ, מֵעִיקָּרָא נָמֵי נִיחָא לֵיהּ? שָׁאנֵי הָתָם, דִּכְתִיב ״כִּי יִתֵּן״. עַד שֶׁיִּתֵּן.
human_translation: What is the reason not due to that we do not say: Since the matter was revealed that he is amenable now, he was also amenable from the outset? is different there, as it is written: When one places [ ki yitten ], only places
llm_translation: Reason what? No because not we say since revealed matter of now it is pleasing to him, from the beginning also it is pleasing to him? It is different there, as it is written "when he gives." Until he gives.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, רֵישָׁא נָמֵי: הָתָם כִּדְרַב פָּפָּא. דְּרַב פָּפָּא רָמֵי, כְּתִיב ״כִּי יִתֵּן״, וְקָרֵינַן כִּי יוּתַּן! הָא כֵּיצַד?
human_translation: If so, the first clause too, There, in accordance with of Rav Pappa, as Rav Pappa raised a contradiction: is written “ ki yitten .” we read “ ki yuttan ,” How so?
llm_translation: If so, the beginning is similar: there, as Rav Papa. For Rav Papa raises a contradiction: it is written "when he gives," and we read it as "when he is given"! How so?

hebrew_text: בָּעֵינַן ״כִּי יוּתַּן״ דֻּומְיָא ״דְּכִי יִתֵּן״. מָה ״יִתֵּן״ לְדַעַת, אַף ״כִּי יוּתַּן״ נָמֵי לְדַעַת.
human_translation: we require “when water is placed [ ki yuttan ]” similar to When one places [ dekhi yitten ]: Just as places [ yitten ] that with the knowledge of so too, “is placed [ yuttan ]” that with his knowledge
llm_translation: We require "ki yutan" similar to "deki yiten." What "yiten" for knowledge, also "ki yutan" likewise for knowledge.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל בֶּן יְהוֹצָדָק: מִנַּיִן לַאֲבֵידָה שֶׁשְּׁטָפָהּ נָהָר שֶׁהִיא מוּתֶּרֶת? דִּכְתִיב: ״וְכֵן תַּעֲשֶׂה לַחֲמוֹרוֹ וְכֵן תַּעֲשֶׂה לְשִׂמְלָתוֹ וְכֵן תַּעֲשֶׂה לְכׇל אֲבֵידַת אָחִיךָ אֲשֶׁר תֹּאבַד מִמֶּנּוּ וּמְצָאתָהּ״. מִי שֶׁאֲבוּדָה הֵימֶנּוּ וּמְצוּיָה אֵצֶל כׇּל אָדָם, יָצָאתָה זוֹ שֶׁאֲבוּדָה מִמֶּנּוּ וְאֵינָהּ מְצוּיָה אֵצֶל כׇּל אָדָם.
human_translation: Come hear which Rabbi Yoḥanan says in the name of Rabbi Yishmael ben Yehotzadak: From where with regard to a lost item that the river swept away that it is permitted as it is written: “And so shall you do with his donkey; and so shall you do with his garment; and so shall you do with every lost item of your brother, which shall be lost from him, and you have found it” that which is lost from him, but is found by any person. Excluded that which is lost from him and is not found by any person;
llm_translation: Come and hear, as Rabbi Yochanan said in the name of Rabbi Yishmael ben Yehotzadak: From where do we derive that a lost item that a river washed away is permitted? As it is written: "And so shall you do with his donkey, and so shall you do with his garment, and so shall you do with every lost item of your brother which he has lost and you have found." If the lost item has been lost from him and is found by everyone, this is the lost item that has been lost from him but is not found by everyone.

hebrew_text: וְאִיסּוּרָא דּוּמְיָא דְּהֶיתֵּירָא, מָה הֶיתֵּירָא בֵּין דְּאִית בַּהּ סִימָן וּבֵין דְּלֵית בַּהּ סִימָן – שַׁרְיָא, אַף אִיסּוּרָא בֵּין דְּאִית בַּהּ סִימַן וּבֵין דְּלֵית בַּהּ סִימָן – אֲסִירָא. תְּיוּבְתָּא דְרָבָא, תְּיוּבְתָּא!
human_translation: And the prohibition similar to the allowance just as the allowance, whether there is a distinguishing mark and whether there is no distinguishing mark, so too the prohibition, whether there is a distinguishing mark and whether there is no distinguishing mark, prohibited The refutation of Rava is refutation.
llm_translation: The prohibition of something similar to that which is permitted, what is the permitted thing whether it has a sign in it or whether it does not have a sign in it - is permitted, so too the prohibition whether it has a sign in it or whether it does not have a sign in it - is prohibited. Rav's reasoning, Rav's reasoning!

hebrew_text: וְהִלְכְתָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּאַבָּיֵי בְּיַעַל קַגַּם.
human_translation: And halakha in accordance with Abaye in Yod , ayin , lamed ; kuf , gimmel , mem .
llm_translation: And the halakha is like the opinion of Abbaye in the matter of the Ya'al Kaggam.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אַחָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרָבָא לְרַב אָשֵׁי: וְכִי מֵאַחַר דְּאִיתּוֹתַב רָבָא – הָנֵי תַּמְרֵי דְזִיקָא הֵיכִי אָכְלִינַן לְהוּ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: כֵּיוָן דְּאִיכָּא שְׁקָצִים וּרְמָשִׂים דְּקָא אָכְלִי לְהוּ, מֵעִיקָּרָא יָאוֹשֵׁי מְיָאַשׁ מִנַּיְיהוּ.
human_translation: Rav Aḥa, son of Rava, said to Rav Ashi: And now that Rava was conclusively refuted, those dates by the wind, how do we eat them? said to him: Since there are repugnant creatures and creeping animals that eat despairs of their from the outset.
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Acha, son of Rava, said to Rav Ashi: "Since Rava sat down - how do we eat these dates of the palm tree?" He said to him: "Once there are insects and creeping things that they eat, from the outset it is preferable to desist from them."

hebrew_text: יַתְמֵי דְּלָאו בְּנֵי מְחִילָה נִינְהוּ, מַאי? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: בָּאגָא בְּאַרְעָא דְיַתְמֵי לָא מַחְזְקִינַן.
human_translation: minor who, they are not capable of relinquishing what said to him: We do not presume a valley to land to orphans,
llm_translation: The days that are not of the sons of Meḥila, who are they? What? He said to him: In the valley in the land where the days are not established.

hebrew_text: מוּחְזָק וְעוֹמֵד, מַאי? כְּרַכְתָּא, מַאי? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֲסִירָן.
human_translation: presumptive status previously what fences what said to him: are forbidden
llm_translation: Established and standing, what is it? A bundle, what is it? He said to him: "It is forbidden."

hebrew_text: כְּרִיכוֹת בִּרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים – הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ שֶׁלּוֹ. אָמַר רַבָּה: וַאֲפִילּוּ בְּדָבָר שֶׁיֵּשׁ בּוֹ סִימָן. אַלְמָא קָסָבַר רַבָּה: סִימָן הֶעָשׂוּי לִידָּרֵס לָא הָוֵי סִימָן. רָבָא אָמַר: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא בְּדָבָר שֶׁאֵין בּוֹ סִימָן, אֲבָל בְּדָבָר שֶׁיֵּשׁ בּוֹ סִימָן חַיָּיב לְהַכְרִיז. אַלְמָא קָסָבַר רָבָא: סִימָן הֶעָשׂוּי לִידָּרֵס הָוֵי סִימָן.
human_translation: bundles in a public area, these to him. Rabba says And even with regard to an item on which there is a distinguishing mark. Apparently, Rabba holds a distinguishing mark that is prone to be trampled is not a distinguishing mark. Rava said: taught only with regard to an item on which there is no distinguishing mark, but with regard to an item on which there is a distinguishing mark, obligated to proclaim Apparently, Rava holds a distinguishing mark that is prone to be trampled is a distinguishing mark.
llm_translation: Bundles in the public domain - these belong to him. Rabbah said: Even in a matter that has a distinguishing mark. This implies that Rabbah holds: A distinguishing mark made to be trampled upon is not considered a distinguishing mark. Rava said: They only taught this regarding a matter that does not have a distinguishing mark, but in a matter that has a distinguishing mark, one must make a proclamation. This implies that Rava holds: A distinguishing mark made to be trampled upon is considered a distinguishing mark.

hebrew_text: וְאִיכָּא דְּמַתְנֵי לְהָא שְׁמַעְתָּא בְּאַנְפֵּי נַפְשַׁהּ: סִימָן הֶעָשׂוּי לִידָּרֵס, רַבָּה אָמַר: לָא הָוֵי סִימָן, וְרָבָא אָמַר: הָוֵי סִימָן.
human_translation: And there are who teach this halakha independent a distinguishing mark that is prone to be trampled, Rabba says: It is not a distinguishing mark. And Rava says: It is a distinguishing mark.
llm_translation: And there is one who teaches this matter with a passionate soul: A sign that is destined to be eradicated, Rabah said: It is not a sign, and Rava said: It is a sign.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: כְּרִיכוֹת בִּרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים – הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ שֶׁלּוֹ, בִּרְשׁוּת הַיָּחִיד – נוֹטֵל וּמַכְרִיז. הֵיכִי דָּמֵי? אִי דְּלֵית בְּהוּ סִימָן, בִּרְשׁוּת הַיָּחִיד מַאי מַכְרֵיז? אֶלָּא לָאו דְּאִית בְּהוּ סִימָן, וְקָתָנֵי: בִּרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים – הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ שֶׁלּוֹ. אַלְמָא סִימָן הֶעָשׂוּי לִידָּרֵס לָא הָוֵי סִימָן, תְּיוּבְתָּא דְּרָבָא!
human_translation: we learned bundles in a public area, these to him; in a secluded area, takes and proclaims What are the circumstances? If where there is no distinguishing mark in a secluded area, what does he proclaim? Rather, is it not where there is a distinguishing mark And it is taught in a public area those to him. Apparently, a distinguishing mark that is prone to be trampled is not a distinguishing mark. a conclusive refutation of Rava.
llm_translation: We learned in the Mishnah: Bundles in a public domain - these belong to him; in a private domain - he takes and proclaims. How so? If there is no distinguishing mark on them, in a private domain what does he proclaim? Rather, if there is a distinguishing mark on them, and it teaches: in a public domain - these belong to him. Hence, a distinguishing mark that is made to be trampled upon is not a distinguishing mark, the assertion of Rava!

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָךְ רָבָא: לְעוֹלָם דְּלֵית בְּהוּ סִימָן, וּדְקָא אָמְרַתְּ בִּרְשׁוּת הַיָּחִיד מַאי מַכְרֵיז? מַכְרֵיז מָקוֹם. וְרַבָּה אָמַר: מָקוֹם לָא הָוֵי סִימָן. דְּאִיתְּמַר: מָקוֹם, רַבָּה אָמַר: לָא הָוֵי סִימָן, וְרָבָא אָמַר: הָוֵי סִימָן.
human_translation: Rava said to you: Actually, where there is no distinguishing mark on And which you said: in a secluded area, what does he proclaim? He proclaims location And Rabba said: location, is not a distinguishing mark As it was stated location, Rabba says: It is not a distinguishing mark, and Rava says: It is a distinguishing mark.
llm_translation: Rava said to you: Always that there is no sign in it, and when you said "with the permission of the individual," what does it proclaim? It proclaims a place. And Rabbah said: A place is not a sign. As it was stated: a place, Rabbah said: it is not a sign, and Rava said: it is a sign.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: כְּרִיכוֹת בִּרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים – הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ שֶׁלּוֹ, בִּרְשׁוּת הַיָּחִיד – נוֹטֵל וּמַכְרִיז. וְהָאֲלוּמּוֹת, בֵּין בִּרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים בֵּין בִּרְשׁוּת הַיָּחִיד – נוֹטֵל וּמַכְרִיז. רַבָּה הֵיכִי מְתָרֵץ לַהּ, וְרָבָא הֵיכִי מְתָרֵץ לַהּ? רַבָּה מְתָרֵץ לְטַעְמֵיהּ, בְּסִימָן. וְרָבָא מְתָרֵץ לְטַעְמֵיהּ, בְּמָקוֹם.
human_translation: Come hear bundles in a public area, these to him; in a secluded area, takes and proclaims And the sheaves, whether in a public area whether in a secluded area, takes and proclaims How does Rabba explain and how does Rava explain Rabba explains, according to his reasoning, with a distinguishing mark. And Rava explains, according to his reasoning, whose location
llm_translation: Come and hear: Bundles in a public domain - these belong to him; in a private domain - he takes and proclaims. And the sheaves, whether in a public domain or in a private domain - he takes and proclaims. How does Rabah resolve it, and how does Rava resolve it? Rabah resolves it according to his reasoning, by a sign. And Rava resolves it according to his reasoning, by a place.

hebrew_text: רַבָּה מְתָרֵץ לְטַעְמֵיהּ בְּסִימָן: כְּרִיכוֹת בִּרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים – הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ שֶׁלּוֹ, מִשּׁוּם
human_translation: Rabba explains, according to his reasoning, with a distinguishing mark: bundles in a public area, these to him due to
llm_translation: Rabah resolves according to his reasoning in the sign: "Piles in a public domain - these are his."

hebrew_text: דְּמִדַּרְסָא. בִּרְשׁוּת הַיָּחִיד – נוֹטֵל וּמַכְרִיז, דְּלָא מִדַּרְסָא. וְהָאֲלוּמּוֹת, בֵּין בִּרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים וּבֵין בִּרְשׁוּת הַיָּחִיד – נוֹטֵל וּמַכְרִיז, כֵּיוָן דִּגְבִיהָן לָא מִדַּרְסָא.
human_translation: that they are trampled. in a secluded area, takes and proclaims as they are not trampled And the sheaves, whether in a public area whether in a secluded area, takes and proclaims Since they high not trampled.
llm_translation: "D'midarsa. Birshut hayachid - notel u'machriz, d'lo midarsa. Veha'alumot, bein birshut harabim u'vein birshut hayachid - notel u'machriz, keivan digvihan lo midarsa."

hebrew_text: וְרָבָא מְתָרֵץ לְטַעְמֵיהּ בְּמָקוֹם: כְּרִיכוֹת בִּרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ שֶׁלּוֹ – דְּמִינַּשְׁתְּפָא. בִּרְשׁוּת הַיָּחִיד חַיָּיב לְהַכְרִיז – דְּלָא מִינַּשְׁתְּפָא. וְהָאֲלוּמּוֹת, בֵּין בִּרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים, וּבֵין בִּרְשׁוּת הַיָּחִיד – נוֹטֵל וּמַכְרִיז, כֵּיוָן דְּיַקִּירֵי לָא מִינַּשְׁתְּפָא.
human_translation: And Rava explains, according to his reasoning, whose location bundles in a public area, these to him that they are and roll in a secluded area, obligated to proclaim they are and do not roll, And the sheaves, whether in a public area whether in a secluded area, takes and proclaims Since they are heavy, they do not roll
llm_translation: Rava resolves according to his reasoning: Bundles in a public domain, these belong to him - for they are common property. In a private domain, one must announce - for they are not common property. And the alleys, whether in a public domain or in a private domain - one may take and announce, since they are not common property.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: כִּכָּרוֹת שֶׁל נַחְתּוֹם – הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ שֶׁלּוֹ. הָא שֶׁל בַּעַל הַבַּיִת חַיָּיב לְהַכְרִיז. שֶׁל בַּעַל הַבַּיִת מַאי טַעְמָא? כֵּיוָן דְּאִית בְּהוּ סִימָן, דְּמִידָּע יְדִיעַ רִפְתָּא דְאִינִישׁ אִינִישׁ הוּא. וְלָא שְׁנָא רְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים וְלָא שְׁנָא רְשׁוּת הַיָּחִיד – נוֹטֵל וּמַכְרִיז, אַלְמָא סִימָן הֶעָשׂוּי לִידָּרֵס הָוֵי סִימָן, תְּיוּבְתָּא דְּרַבָּה!
human_translation: Come hear baker’s loaves, these to him. But loaves of a homeowner, obligated to proclaim What is the reason? of a homeowner because there is a distinguishing mark on As it is known that the loaves of a person person. And is no difference in a public area, and is no difference in a secluded area; takes and proclaims Apparently, a distinguishing mark that is prone to be trampled is a distinguishing mark. a conclusive refutation of Rabba.
llm_translation: Come and hear: The loaves of bread of Nachtom - behold, these belong to him. The loaf of the homeowner, he is obligated to announce. What is the reason for the loaf of the homeowner? Since it has a distinguishing mark, for one knows the identity of the person. And it makes no difference whether it is in a public domain or a private domain - he takes and announces. Therefore, a distinguishing mark that is made to be erased is a distinguishing mark, the statement of Rabah!

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָךְ רַבָּה: הָתָם הַיְינוּ טַעְמָא – מִשּׁוּם דְּאֵין מַעֲבִירִין עַל הָאוֹכָלִין. וְהָא אִיכָּא גּוֹיִם! גּוֹיִם חָיְישִׁי לִכְשָׁפִים. וְהָאִיכָּא בְּהֵמָה וּכְלָבִים! בְּאַתְרָא דְּלָא שְׁכִיחִי בְּהֵמָה וּכְלָבִים.
human_translation: Rabba said to you: There, this is the reason due to that one does not pass by food But aren’t there gentiles Gentiles are concerned of sorcery. But aren’t there beasts and dogs a place where beasts and dogs are not commonly
llm_translation: Rabba said to you: There, that is the reason - because we do not pass over the food. But there are non-Jews! Non-Jews are concerned with witchcraft. But there are animals and dogs! In a place where animals and dogs are not common.

hebrew_text: לֵימָא כְּתַנָּאֵי: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: כׇּל דָּבָר שֶׁיֵּשׁ בּוֹ שִׁינּוּי, חַיָּיב לְהַכְרִיז. כֵּיצַד? מָצָא עִיגּוּל וּבְתוֹכוֹ חֶרֶס, כִּכָּר וּבְתוֹכוֹ מָעוֹת. מִכְּלָל דְּתַנָּא קַמָּא סָבַר הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ שֶׁלּוֹ.
human_translation: Let us say parallel to tanna’im Rabbi Yehuda says: any in which there is an alteration, obligated to proclaim How so? found a round earthenware inside it, a loaf with coins inside it, by inference that the first tanna holds those to him.
llm_translation: Let us say like the Tannaim: Rabbi Yehuda says: Anything that has a change in it, one must announce. How so? If one finds a nut with a worm inside, a loaf with coins inside. From the principle that the first Tanna holds, these belong to him.

hebrew_text: סַבְרוּהָ: דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא סִימָן הַבָּא מֵאֵילָיו הָוֵי סִימָן, וּמַעֲבִירִין עַל הָאוֹכָלִין. מַאי לָאו: בְּסִימָן הֶעָשׂוּי לִידָּרֵס קָא מִיפַּלְגִי, מָר סָבַר: לָא הָוֵי סִימָן, וּמָר סָבַר: הָוֵי סִימָן?
human_translation: assumed that everyone agrees that a distinguishing mark that come on its own is a distinguishing mark, and one passes by food what Is it not with regard to a distinguishing mark that is prone to be trampled they disagree? Sage, holds is not a distinguishing mark, and Sage, holds is a distinguishing mark.
llm_translation: They thought: that all the world, a sign that comes from its own is a sign, and they pass over the food. What is it not? In a sign that is made to be trampled upon, they disagree. One Master thinks: it is not a sign, and one Master thinks: it is a sign?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב זְבִיד מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרָבָא: אִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ דְּקָא סָבַר תַּנָּא קַמָּא סִימָן הֶעָשׂוּי לִידָּרֵס לָא הָוֵי סִימָן, וּמַעֲבִירִין עַל הָאוֹכָלִין, כִּכָּרוֹת שֶׁל בַּעַל הַבַּיִת בִּרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים אַמַּאי מַכְרִיז?
human_translation: Rav Zevid said in the name of Rava: If it enters your mind that the first tanna holds a distinguishing mark that is prone to be trampled is not a distinguishing mark and one passes by food loaves of a homeowner in a public area, why does he proclaim
llm_translation: Rav Zevid said in the name of Rava: If it enters your mind that the first Mishnah holds that a sign that is made to be trampled upon is not considered a sign, and they pass over it while eating, the loaves belonging to the householder in a public domain, why do they announce it?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, אָמַר רַב זְבִיד מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרָבָא: דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא סָבְרִי סִימָן הֶעָשׂוּי לִידָּרֵס הָוֵי סִימָן, וּמַעֲבִירִין עַל הָאוֹכָלִין. וְהָכָא בְּסִימָן הַבָּא מֵאֵילָיו קָא מִיפַּלְגִי, דְּתַנָּא קַמָּא סָבַר: סִימָן הַבָּא מֵאֵילָיו לָא הָוֵי סִימָן, וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה סָבַר: הָוֵי סִימָן.
human_translation: Rather, Rav Zevid said in the name of Rava that everyone holds a distinguishing mark that is prone to be trampled is a distinguishing mark and one passes by food And here, with regard to a distinguishing mark that come on its own they disagree. The first tanna holds is not a distinguishing mark, and Rabbi Yehuda holds is a distinguishing mark.
llm_translation: Rather, Rav Zevid said in the name of Rava: The entire world holds that a sign that is made to be erased is considered a sign, and we pass over it for the sake of the food. But here, regarding a sign that comes from its source, they argue, for the first Tanna holds: a sign that comes from its source is not considered a sign, and Rabbi Yehuda holds: it is considered a sign.

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּה אָמַר לָךְ: דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא סִימָן הֶעָשׂוּי לִידָּרֵס – לָא הָוֵי סִימָן וְאֵין מַעֲבִירִין עַל הָאוֹכָלִין. וְהָכָא בְּסִימָן הַבָּא מֵאֵילָיו קָמִיפַּלְגִי תַּנָּא קַמָּא סָבַר: לָא הָוֵי סִימָן, וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה סָבַר: הָוֵי סִימָן.
human_translation: And Rabba said to you that everyone agrees a distinguishing mark that is prone to be trampled is not a distinguishing mark and one does not pass by food And here, with regard to a distinguishing mark that come on its own they disagree. The first tanna holds a distinguishing mark, and Rabbi Yehuda holds is a distinguishing mark.
llm_translation: Rabah said to you: In all the world, a sign that is made to be erased - is not a sign, and one does not pass over food. And here, in the case of a sign that comes from its own, a Tanna of the first generation holds: it is not a sign, and Rabbi Yehuda holds: it is a sign.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי, סַבְרוּהָ: דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא סִימָן הַבָּא מֵאֵילָיו הָוֵי סִימָן, וְסִימָן הֶעָשׂוּי לִידָּרֵס לָא הָוֵי סִימָן. מַאי לָאו: בְּמַעֲבִירִין עַל הָאוֹכָלִין קָא מִיפַּלְגִי, דְּמָר סָבַר: מַעֲבִירִין, וּמַר סָבַר: אֵין מַעֲבִירִין?
human_translation: There are who say, assumed that everyone agrees that a distinguishing mark that come on its own is a distinguishing mark, and a distinguishing mark that is prone to be trampled is not a distinguishing mark. What, Is it not with regard to one passes by food they disagree. As Sage, holds one passes and Sage, holds one does not pass
llm_translation: There are some who say: They hold the view that anything that comes from its source is a sign, and anything that is made to be destroyed is not a sign. What is the reason? It is because they disagree regarding removing dishes from the table, for one Sage holds: one may remove them, and the other Sage holds: one may not remove them.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב זְבִיד מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרָבָא: אִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ סָבַר תַּנָּא קַמָּא סִימָן הֶעָשׂוּי לִידָּרֵס לָא הָוֵי סִימָן, וּמַעֲבִירִין עַל הָאוֹכָלִין – כִּכָּרוֹת שֶׁל בַּעַל הַבַּיִת בִּרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים אַמַּאי מַכְרִיז?
human_translation: Rav Zevid said in the name of Rava: If it enters your mind that the first tanna holds a distinguishing mark that is prone to be trampled is not a distinguishing mark and one passes by food loaves of a homeowner in a public area, why does he proclaim
llm_translation: Rav Zevid said in the name of Rava: If it enters your mind that the first Tanna holds that a sign that is made to be trampled upon is not considered a sign, and we remove it for the sake of the eaters - the loaves of the homeowner in a public domain, why do we announce it?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב זְבִיד מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרָבָא: דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא סָבְרִי סִימָן הֶעָשׂוּי לִידָּרֵס – הָוֵי סִימָן, וּמַעֲבִירִין עַל הָאוֹכָלִין. וְהָכָא בְּסִימָן הַבָּא מֵאֵילָיו קָא מִיפַּלְגִי, דְּתַנָּא קַמָּא סָבַר: סִימָן הַבָּא מֵאֵילָיו – לָא הָוֵי סִימָן, וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה סָבַר: הָוֵי סִימָן.
human_translation: Rather, Rav Zevid said in the name of Rava that everyone holds a distinguishing mark that is prone to be trampled is a distinguishing mark and one passes by food And here, with regard to a distinguishing mark that come on its own they disagree. The first tanna holds a distinguishing mark that come on its own is not a distinguishing mark, and Rabbi Yehuda holds is a distinguishing mark.
llm_translation: Rather, Rav Zevid said in the name of Rava: The entire world holds that a sign that is made to be erased is considered a sign, and it is permissible to move it on Shabbat. But here, regarding a sign that comes from its place, they dispute, as it was taught in the first clause: A sign that comes from its place is not considered a sign, and Rabbi Yehuda holds that it is considered a sign.

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּה אָמַר לָךְ: דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא סִימָן הֶעָשׂוּי לִידָּרֵס – לָא הָוֵי סִימָן, וְאֵין מַעֲבִירִין עַל הָאוֹכָלִין. וְהָכָא בְּסִימָן הַבָּא מֵאֵילָיו קָא מִיפַּלְגִי, תַּנָּא קַמָּא סָבַר: סִימָן הַבָּא מֵאֵילָיו – לָא הָוֵי סִימָן, וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה סָבַר: הָוֵי סִימָן.
human_translation: And Rabba said to you that everyone agrees a distinguishing mark that is prone to be trampled is not a distinguishing mark and one does not pass by food And here, with regard to a distinguishing mark that come on its own they disagree. The first tanna holds a distinguishing mark that come on its own is not a distinguishing mark, and Rabbi Yehuda holds is a distinguishing mark.
llm_translation: Rabah said to you: Regarding all the people, a sign that is made to be trampled upon - is not considered a sign, and we do not pass over food. And here, in the case of a sign that comes from its own kind, they are in disagreement. The first Tanna holds: A sign that comes from its own kind - is not considered a sign, and Rabbi Yehuda holds: It is considered a sign.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב זְבִיד מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרָבָא: כְּלָלָא דַּאֲבֵידְתָּא כֵּיוָן דְּאָמַר ״וַוי לֵהּ לְחֶסְרוֹן כִּיס״ – מִיָּאַשׁ לֵיהּ מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: Rav Zevid said in the name of Rava the principle of a lost item: Once says: Woe for the monetary loss, he has despaired of its
llm_translation: Rav Zevid said in the name of Rava: The principle of lost property, since it says "Woe to him who incurs debt for what is not his" - who will guarantee it for him.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב זְבִיד מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרָבָא: הִלְכְתָא, כְּרִיכוֹת בִּרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים – הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ שֶׁלּוֹ. בִּרְשׁוּת הַיָּחִיד, אִי דֶּרֶךְ נְפִילָה – הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ שֶׁלּוֹ, אִי דֶּרֶךְ הַנָּחָה – נוֹטֵל וּמַכְרִיז. וְזֶה וָזֶה בְּדָבָר שֶׁאֵין בּוֹ סִימָן, אֲבָל בְּדָבָר שֶׁיֵּשׁ בּוֹ סִימָן – לָא שְׁנָא בִּרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים וְלָא שְׁנָא בִּרְשׁוּת הַיָּחִיד, בֵּין דֶּרֶךְ נְפִילָה וּבֵין דֶּרֶךְ הַנָּחָה – חַיָּיב לְהַכְרִיז.
human_translation: And Rav Zevid said in the name of Rava: halakha bundles in a public area, those to him. If in a secluded area a manner fallen, those to him. If a manner placed takes and proclaims And this and that in an item in which there is no distinguishing mark. But in an item on which there is a distinguishing mark, is no different in a public area and is no different in a secluded area; whether a manner fallen or whether a manner placed obligated to proclaim
llm_translation: And Rav Zevid said in the name of Rava: Halacha, bundles in a public domain - these belong to him. In a private domain, if it is in a way of falling - these belong to him, if it is in a way of resting - he takes and proclaims. And this and this in a matter that has no distinguishing mark, but in a matter that has a distinguishing mark - it makes no difference whether it is in a public domain or in a private domain, whether it is in a way of falling or in a way of resting - one is obligated to proclaim.

hebrew_text: וּמַחְרוֹזוֹת שֶׁל דָּגִים. אַמַּאי? לֶהֱוֵי קֶשֶׁר סִימָן! בְּקִטְרָא דְּצַיָּידֵא, דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא הָכִי מְקַטְּרִי. וְלֶהֱוֵי מִנְיָן סִימָן! בְּמִנְיָנָא דְּשָׁוִין.
human_translation: strings of fish Why let the knot a distinguishing mark? to the fisherman’s knot with which everyone ties But let the number a distinguishing mark? to a number that is equal
llm_translation: "And strings of fish. Why? To be a sign of a knot! In the smoke of the fish, everyone does so. And how do we know it is a sign? From a similar count."

hebrew_text: בְּעוֹ מִינֵּיהּ מֵרַב שֵׁשֶׁת: [מִנְיָן] הָוֵי סִימָן אוֹ לָא הָוֵי סִימָן? אֲמַר לְהוּ רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: תְּנֵיתוּהָ, מָצָא כְּלֵי כֶסֶף וּכְלֵי נְחוֹשֶׁת, גִּסְטְרוֹן שֶׁל אֲבָר, וְכׇל כְּלֵי מַתָּכוֹת – הֲרֵי זֶה לֹא יַחֲזִיר עַד שֶׁיִּתֵּן אוֹת, אוֹ עַד שֶׁיְּכַוֵּין מִשְׁקְלוֹתָיו. וּמִדְּמִשְׁקָל הָוֵי סִימָן, מִדָּה וּמִנְיָן נָמֵי הָוֵי סִימָן.
human_translation: raised a dilemma before Rav Sheshet: is number a distinguishing mark or is it not a distinguishing mark? Rav Sheshet said to them: You learned it silver vessels, copper vessels, fragments of lead, and any metal vessels, that shall not return until provides sign or until accurately provides its weight. And from that weight a distinguishing mark, measure and number also a distinguishing mark.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "He inquired of Rav Sheshet: From where is it a sign or is it not a sign? Rav Sheshet said to them: You shall teach it, if he found silver vessels and copper vessels, a leaden casket, and all metal vessels - this one shall not return until he gives a sign, or until he weighs his belongings. And from weighing is it a sign, from measurement and from counting is it a sign." English translation:

hebrew_text: וַחֲתִיכוֹת שֶׁל בָּשָׂר וְכוּ׳. אַמַּאי? לֶהֱוֵי מַשְׁקְלָא סִימָן! בְּמַשְׁקְלָא דְּשָׁוִין. וְתֶהֱוֵי חֲתִיכָה גּוּפַהּ סִימָן, אוֹ דְּדָפְקָא אוֹ דְּאַטְמָא! מִי לָא תַּנְיָא: מָצָא חֲתִיכוֹת דָּגִים וְדָג נָשׁוּךְ – חַיָּיב לְהַכְרִיז. חָבִיּוֹת שֶׁל יַיִן וְשֶׁל שֶׁמֶן וְשֶׁל תְּבוּאָה וְשֶׁל גְּרוֹגְרוֹת וְשֶׁל זֵיתִים – הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ שֶׁלּוֹ.
human_translation: cuts of meat Why let the weight a distinguishing mark? to a weight that is equal, But let the cut itself a distinguishing mark, either the neck or the thigh Isn’t it taught one found cuts of fish, or a fish was bitten, obligated to proclaim barrels of wine, or of oil, or of grain, or of dried figs, or of olives, these to him?
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And pieces of meat, etc. Why? To be a sign of weight! In the weight of equals. And let it be a piece itself a sign, whether it is beaten or tainted! Who did not teach: If one finds pieces of fish and a bitten fish - he is obligated to announce. Barrels of wine, and of oil, and of produce, and of dried figs, and of olives - these belong to him." English translation:

hebrew_text: הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן? בִּדְאִיכָּא סִימָנָא בִּפְסָקָא, כִּי הָא דְּרַבָּה בַּר רַב הוּנָא מְחַתֵּיךְ לֵיהּ אַתְּלָת קַרְנָתָא. דַּיְקָא נָמֵי דְּקָתָנֵי דּוּמְיָא דְּדָג נָשׁוּךְ, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: With what are we dealing here in where there is a distinguishing mark in the the cut, as that of Rabba bar Rav Huna cut with three corners, is also precise, as is taught similar to a fish was bitten, Learn from it
llm_translation: Here we are dealing with what? Because there is a sign in the conclusion, as this that Rabba bar Rav Huna was cutting for him a radish. It is precisely stated in the Mishnah that it is similar to a fish that was bitten, learn from it.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: חָבִיּוֹת שֶׁל יַיִן וְשֶׁל שֶׁמֶן וְשֶׁל תְּבוּאָה וְשֶׁל גְּרוֹגְרוֹת וְשֶׁל זֵיתִים – הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ שֶׁלּוֹ. וְהָא תְּנַן: כַּדֵּי יַיִן וְכַדֵּי שֶׁמֶן חַיָּיב לְהַכְרִיז! אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא אָמַר רַב: מַתְנִיתִין בְּרָשׁוּם. מִכְּלָל דְּבָרַיְיתָא בְּפָתוּחַ, אִי בְּפָתוּחַ – אֲבֵידָה מִדַּעַת הִיא. אָמַר רַב הוֹשַׁעְיָא: בְּמֵצִיף.
human_translation: The Master said barrels of wine, or of oil, or of grain, or of dried figs, or of olives, these to him. But didn’t we learn jugs of wine or jugs of oil, obligated to proclaim Rabbi Zeira said Rav said: The mishna to sealed by inference that the baraita to open if to open it is a deliberate loss. Rav Hoshaya says: to covers
llm_translation: Master said: Wine barrels and oil barrels and produce barrels and dried fig barrels and olive barrels - these are his. But didn't we learn: For a wine barrel and for an oil barrel one must announce! Rabbi Zeira said in the name of Rav: The Mishnah is explicit. From the principle of clarity in the open, if it is not in the open - it is a lost item. Rav Hoshaya said: In a sealed container.

hebrew_text: אַבָּיֵי אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא אִידֵּי וְאִידֵּי בְּרָשׁוּם, וְלָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן – קוֹדֶם שֶׁנִּפְתְּחוּ הָאוֹצָרוֹת, כָּאן – לְאַחַר שֶׁנִּפְתְּחוּ הָאוֹצָרוֹת. כִּי הָא דְּרַב יַעֲקֹב בַּר אַבָּא אַשְׁכַּח חָבִיתָא דְחַמְרָא לְאַחַר שֶׁנִּפְתְּחוּ הָאוֹצָרוֹת, אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּאַבָּיֵי, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: זִיל שְׁקוֹל לְנַפְשָׁךְ.
human_translation: Abaye said: You even say that this and that to sealed, and not difficult. Here, before the storehouses were opened. There, after the storehouses were opened. as that where Rav Ya’akov bar Abba found a barrel of wine after the storehouses were opened. He came before Abaye said to him: Go take for yourself.
llm_translation: Abaye said: Even if you say both were written explicitly, and it is not difficult: here - before the storehouses were opened, here - after the storehouses were opened. For when Rav Yaakov bar Abba found a barrel of wine after the storehouses were opened, he came before Abaye, and he said to him: Go, take it for yourself.

hebrew_text: בְּעָא מִינֵּיהּ רַב בִּיבִי מֵרַב נַחְמָן: מָקוֹם הָוֵי סִימָן, אוֹ לָא הָוֵי סִימָן? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: תְּנֵיתוּהָ, מָצָא חָבִיּוֹת שֶׁל יַיִן וְשֶׁל שֶׁמֶן וְשֶׁל תְּבוּאָה וְשֶׁל גְּרוֹגְרוֹת וְשֶׁל זֵיתִים – הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ שֶׁלּוֹ. וְאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ דְּמָקוֹם הָוֵי סִימָן, לִכְרוֹז מָקוֹם! אָמַר רַב זְבִיד, הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן? בְּרַקְּתָא דְנַהֲרָא.
human_translation: Rav Beivai raised a dilemma before Rav Naḥman: Is location a distinguishing mark, or is it not a distinguishing mark? said to him you learned it found barrels of wine, or of oil, or of grain, or of dried figs, or of olives, these to him. And if it enters your mind that location is a distinguishing mark, let proclaim location Rav Zevid said: With what are we dealing here? on the bank of the river.
llm_translation: Rav Bibi asked Rav Nachman: Is a designated place considered a sign or not considered a sign? He said to him: Teach it, if one finds barrels of wine, oil, produce, dried figs, and olives – these are his. And if you think that a designated place is considered a sign, then make a proclamation of the place! Rav Zevid said, what are we dealing with here? We are dealing with a boat on the river.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב מָרִי: מַאי טַעְמָא אֲמַרוּ רַבָּנַן רַקְּתָא דְנַהֲרָא לָא הָוֵי סִימָן? דְּאָמְרִינַן לֵיהּ: כִּי הֵיכִי דְּאִתְרְמִי לְדִידָךְ אִתְרְמִי נָמֵי לְחַבְרָךְ. אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי, אָמַר רַב מָרִי: מַאי טַעְמָא אֲמַרוּ רַבָּנַן מָקוֹם לָא הָוֵי סִימָן? דְּאָמְרִינַן לֵיהּ: כִּי הֵיכִי דְּאִתְרְמִי לְדִידָךְ הַאי מְקוֹם, אִתְרְמִי נָמֵי לְחַבְרָךְ הַאי מָקוֹם.
human_translation: Rav Mari said: What is the reason that the Sages said the bank of a river is not a distinguishing mark? because we say to Just as it happened you it also happened another Some say Rav Mari said: What is the reason that the Sages said location is not a distinguishing mark? because we say to Just as it happened you that place, it also happened another that place.
llm_translation: Rav Mari said: What is the reason that the Rabbis said, "The bend of the river is not a distinguishing mark"? Because we say to it: Just as you can rely on yourself, rely also on your colleague. Some say, Rav Mari said: What is the reason that the Rabbis said, "An empty space is not a distinguishing mark"? Because we say to it: Just as you can rely on this place, rely also on your colleague in this place.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא גַּבְרָא דְּאַשְׁכַּח כּוּפְרָא בֵּי מַעֲצַרְתָּא, אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: זִיל שְׁקוֹל לְנַפְשָׁךְ. חַזְיֵיהּ דַּהֲוָה קָא מְחַסֵּם, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: זִיל פְּלוֹג לֵיהּ לְחִיָּיא בְּרִי מִינֵּיהּ. לֵימָא קָא סָבַר רַב מָקוֹם לָא הָוֵי סִימָן? אָמַר רַבִּי אַבָּא: מִשּׁוּם יֵאוּשׁ בְּעָלִים נָגְעוּ בָּהּ, דַּחֲזָא דְּקָדְחִי בֵּיהּ חִלְפֵי.
human_translation: a certain man who found pitch the winepress. He came before Rav said to him: Go take for yourself. saw that was hesitating, said to him: Go divide it with Ḥiyya my son, Let us say that Rav holds that location is not a distinguishing mark. Rabbi Abba said: due to despair of its owner touched upon As, saw that grass was growing through
llm_translation: That man who found a coin in the Beit Ma'atzarta, came before Rav, said to him: "Go and take it for yourself." He saw that he was hesitating, said to him: "Go and divide it with the living son of its owner." Should we say that Rav did not consider a place as a sign? Rabbi Abba said: Because the owners despaired, they touched it, for it was seen that it had been worn by them.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר וְכוּ׳. מַאי אַנְפּוּרְיָא? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: כֵּלִים חֲדָשִׁים שֶׁלֹּא שְׂבָעָתַן הָעַיִן. הֵיכִי דָמֵי? אִי אִית בְּהוּ סִימָן – כִּי לֹא שְׂבָעָתַן הָעַיִן מַאי הָוֵי? אִי דְּלֵית בְּהוּ סִימָן – כִּי שְׂבָעָתַן הָעַיִן מַאי הָוֵי?
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: What are anpurya Rav Yehuda says Shmuel says: new vessels, as the eye not sufficiently seen them What are the circumstances? If there is a distinguishing mark on when the eye not sufficiently seen them, what of it? If there is no distinguishing mark on when the eye sufficiently seen them, what of it?
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says, etc. What is Anpurya? Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: New vessels that have not been satiated by the eye. How so? If there is a distinguishing mark on them - when they have not been satiated by the eye, what is the ruling? If there is no distinguishing mark on them - when they have been satiated by the eye, what is the ruling?

hebrew_text: לְעוֹלָם דְּלֵית בְּהוּ סִימָן – נָפְקָא מִינַּהּ לְאַהְדּוֹרֵי לְצוּרְבָּא מֵרַבָּנַן בִּטְבִיעוּת עֵינָא. שְׂבָעָתַן הָעַיִן – קִים לֵיהּ בְּגַוַּיְיהוּ וּמַהְדְּרִינַן לֵיהּ. כִּי לֹא שְׂבָעָתַן הָעַיִן – לָא קִים לֵיהּ בְּגַוַּיְיהוּ, וְלָא מַהְדְּרִינַן לֵיהּ, דְּאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: בְּהָנֵי תְּלָת מִילֵּי עֲבִידִי רַבָּנַן דִּמְשַׁנּוּ בְּמִלַּיְיהוּ – בְּמַסֶּכֶת, וּבְפוּרְיָא
human_translation: Actually, in which there is no distinguishing mark, and the difference to returning to a Torah scholar of visual recognition. the eye sufficiently seen them he is certain about them, and we return to him When the eye not sufficiently seen them, he is not certain about them, and we do not return to him, as Rav Yehuda says Shmuel says: With regard to these three matters is normal Sages to amend their statements With regard to a tractate, And with regard to a bed,
llm_translation: Forever that not in it sign - came out from it to the people to the sages in the immersion of the eye. If the eye is satisfied - they establish it in their bodies and honor it. But if the eye is not satisfied - they do not establish it in their bodies, and do not honor it, as Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: With these three things the sages made a tradition in their words - in the tractate, and in the fruit.

hebrew_text: וּבְאוּשְׁפִּיזָא. מַאי נָפְקָא מִינַּהּ? אָמַר מָר זוּטְרָא: לְאַהְדּוֹרֵי לֵיהּ אֲבֵידְתָּא בִּטְבִיעוּת עֵינָא. אִי יָדְעִינַן בֵּיהּ דְּלָא מְשַׁנֵּי אֶלָּא בְּהָנֵי תְּלָת – מַהְדְּרִינַן לֵיהּ, וְאִי מְשַׁנֵּי בְּמִילֵּי אַחֲרִינֵי – לָא מַהְדְּרִינַן לֵיהּ.
human_translation: And with regard to a host [ ushpiza ], What is the difference Mar Zutra says: to returning a lost item on visual recognition. If we know about him that he alters only with regard to these three we return to him, but if he alters with regard to other matters, we do not return to him.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And in Apisiza. What is derived from it? Mar Zutra said: To investigate the lost object with the immersion of the eye. If we know about it that it does not change except in three things - we return it, and if it changes in other matters - we do not return it.

hebrew_text: מָר זוּטְרָא חֲסִידָא אִגְּנִיב לֵיהּ כָּסָא דְכַסְפָּא מֵאוּשְׁפִּיזָא. חַזְיֵאּ לְהָהוּא בַּר בֵּי רַב דְּמָשֵׁי יְדֵיהּ וְנָגֵיב בִּגְלִימָא דְחַבְרֵיהּ. אֲמַר: הַיְינוּ הַאי דְּלָא אִיכְפַּת לֵיהּ אַמָּמוֹנָא דְחַבְרֵיהּ. כַּפְתֵיהּ וְאוֹדִי.
human_translation: A silver goblet was stolen from the host of Mar Zutra Ḥasida. saw a certain student who washed his hands and dried on the cloak of another. said: This is who does not care about the property of another. He bound and confessed
llm_translation: Mar Zutra the pious stole the silver cup from the treasury. He saw that certain son of Rav was concealing his hands and wiping them on his cloak. He said: This is the one who did not care about the trust of his friends. He clapped his hands and left.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא: מוֹדֶה רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר בְּכֵלִים חֲדָשִׁים שֶׁשְּׂבָעָתַן הָעַיִן שֶׁחַיָּיב לְהַכְרִיז. וְאֵלּוּ הֵן כֵּלִים חֲדָשִׁים שֶׁלֹּא שְׂבָעָתַן הָעַיִן שֶׁאֵינוֹ חַיָּיב לְהַכְרִיז, כְּגוֹן בַּדֵּי מְחָטִין, וְצִינּוֹרִיּוֹת, וּמַחְרוֹזוֹת שֶׁל קַרְדּוּמּוֹת. כׇּל אֵלּוּ שֶׁאָמְרוּ, אֵימָתַי מוּתָּרִים? בִּזְמַן שֶׁמְּצָאָן אֶחָד אֶחָד, אֲבָל מְצָאָן שְׁנַיִם שְׁנַיִם – חַיָּיב לְהַכְרִיז.
human_translation: It is taught Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar concedes obligated to proclaim of new vessels that the eye sufficiently seen. And these are new vessels that the eye not sufficiently seen which not obligated to proclaim for example, branches [ badei ] needles or utensils spinning or strings of axes. When is it permitted for all those that mentioned when he found them one at a time. But he found them two at a time, obligated to proclaim
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar concedes regarding new vessels that their eye has been satisfied, that one is obligated to announce. And these are the new vessels that their eye has not been satisfied, that one is not obligated to announce, such as needles, and pipes, and the fasteners of curtains. All of these that they said, when are they permitted? When one finds them one by one, but if one finds them two by two - one is obligated to announce.

hebrew_text: מַאי ״בַּדֵּי״? שׂוֹכֵי. וְאַמַּאי קָרוּ לֵיהּ ״בַּדֵּי״? דָּבָר דְּתָלוּ בֵּיהּ מִידֵּי, ״בַּד״ קָרוּ לֵיהּ. כִּי הַהוּא דִּתְנַן הָתָם: עָלֶה אֶחָד בְּבַד אֶחָד.
human_translation: What badei ? branches. And why did call them branches? upon which one hangs item [ davar detalu bei midei ], he calls it a branch, like that which we learned there One leaf on one branch.
llm_translation: What is "badei"? Branches. And why is it called "badei"? Because a matter that depends on it immediately, they called it "bad." As we learned there: "One went up by himself, one by himself."

hebrew_text: וְכֵן הָיָה רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: הַמַּצִּיל מִן הָאֲרִי וּמִן הַדּוֹב וּמִן הַנָּמֵר וּמִן הַבַּרְדְּלָס וּמִן זוֹטוֹ שֶׁל יָם וּמִשְּׁלוּלִיתוֹ שֶׁל נָהָר, הַמּוֹצֵא בִּסְרַטְיָא וּפְלַטְיָא גְּדוֹלָה, וּבְכׇל מָקוֹם שֶׁהָרַבִּים מְצוּיִין שָׁם – הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ שֶׁלּוֹ, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהַבְּעָלִים מִתְיָאֲשִׁין מֵהֶן.
human_translation: And likewise, Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar would say: one who rescues from a lion, or from a bear, or from a leopard, or from a cheetah [ bardelas ], or from the tide of the sea, or from the flooding of a river; one who finds in a main thoroughfare [ seratya ] or a large plaza [ pelatya ], or in any place where the multitudes are found, these to him due to that the owner despairs of their
llm_translation: And so was Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar saying: One who saves from a lion, and from a bear, and from a leopard, and from a panther, and from the sea's serpent, and from the river's crocodile, if he finds in a desert and in a great wilderness, and in any place where people are commonly found - these belong to him, because the owners despair of them.

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: כִּי קָאָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר – בְּרוֹב גּוֹיִם אֲבָל בְּרוֹב יִשְׂרָאֵל – לָא, אוֹ דִלְמָא אֲפִילּוּ בְּרוֹב יִשְׂרָאֵל נָמֵי אָמַר?
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before When Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says where there is a majority of gentiles; but where there is a majority of Jews, not Or perhaps, even where there is a majority of Jews, he also says
llm_translation: He asked them: When Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar said - in the majority of nations, but in the majority of Israel - no, or perhaps even in the majority of Israel he also said?

hebrew_text: אִם תִּמְצָא לוֹמַר אֲפִילּוּ בְּרוֹב יִשְׂרָאֵל נָמֵי אָמַר, פְּלִיגִי רַבָּנַן עֲלֵיהּ, אוֹ לָא פְּלִיגִי?
human_translation: if you say even where there is a majority of Jews, he also said do the Rabbis disagree with him or do they not disagree?
llm_translation: If you find to say even in the majority of Israel indeed he said, the Rabbis dispute about it, or do they not dispute?

hebrew_text: וְאִם תִּמְצָא לוֹמַר פְּלִיגִי, בְּרוֹב יִשְׂרָאֵל וַדַּאי פְּלִיגִי, בְּרוֹב גּוֹיִם פְּלִיגִי אוֹ לָא פְּלִיגִי?
human_translation: And if you say the Rabbis disagree where there is a majority of Jews, they certainly disagree. where there is a majority of gentiles, do disagree, or do they not disagree?
llm_translation: And if you find to say "he disputes," in the majority of Israelites he certainly disputes, in the majority of gentiles does he dispute or does he not dispute?

hebrew_text: וְאִם תִּמְצָא לוֹמַר פְּלִיגִי אֲפִילּוּ בְּרוֹב גּוֹיִם הֲלָכָה כְּמוֹתוֹ אוֹ אֵין הֲלָכָה כְּמוֹתוֹ?
human_translation: And if you say the Rabbis disagree even where there is a majority of gentiles, halakha in accordance with or halakha not in accordance with his
llm_translation: And if you should find to say "Peligi" even with the majority of nations, is the law like him or not like him?

hebrew_text: אִם תִּמְצָא לוֹמַר הֲלָכָה כְּמוֹתוֹ, דַּוְקָא בְּרוֹב גּוֹיִם אוֹ אֲפִילּוּ בְּרוֹב יִשְׂרָאֵל?
human_translation: if you say halakha in accordance with specifically where there is a majority of gentiles, or even where there is a majority of Jews?
llm_translation: If you find to say a halakha like his, specifically in the majority of non-Jews or even in the majority of Israelites?

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: הַמּוֹצֵא מָעוֹת בְּבָתֵּי כְנֵסִיּוֹת וּבְבָתֵּי מִדְרָשׁוֹת, וּבְכׇל מָקוֹם שֶׁהָרַבִּים מְצוּיִין שָׁם – הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ שֶׁלּוֹ, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהַבְּעָלִים מִתְיָאֲשִׁין מֵהֶן. מַאן שָׁמְעַתְּ לֵיהּ דְּאָזֵיל בָּתַר רוּבָּא? רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר, שָׁמְעַתְּ מִינַּהּ אֲפִילּוּ בְּרוֹב יִשְׂרָאֵל נָמֵי.
human_translation: Come hear one who finds coins in synagogues [ bevatei khenesiyyot ] and study halls or in any place where the multitudes are found, these to him, due to that the owner despairs of their Who whom you heard that he follows the multitudes, Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar. Conclude from even where there is a majority of Jews,
llm_translation: Come and hear: One who finds money in synagogues, study halls, and any place where the public gathers - these belong to him, because the owners have despaired of them. Who heard that he goes after the majority? Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar, heard from her that even in the majority of Israelites also.

hebrew_text: הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן? בִּמְפוּזָּרִין. אִי בִּמְפוּזָּרִין מַאי אִרְיָא מָקוֹם שֶׁהָרַבִּים מְצוּיִין שָׁם? אֲפִילּוּ אֵין הָרַבִּים מְצוּיִין שָׁם!
human_translation: With what are we dealing here? where scattered If where scattered, why specifically a place where the multitudes are found? Even the multitudes are not found,
llm_translation: Here we are dealing with what? With scattered individuals. If with scattered individuals, what is the law regarding a place where the public is present there? Even if the public is not present there!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לְעוֹלָם בִּצְרוּרִין, וְהָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן – בְּבָתֵּי כְנֵסִיּוֹת שֶׁל גּוֹיִם, בָּתֵּי מִדְרָשׁוֹת מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר? בָּתֵּי מִדְרָשׁוֹת דִּידַן דְּיָתְבִי בְּהוּ גּוֹיִם. הַשְׁתָּא דְּאָתֵית לְהָכִי, בָּתֵּי כְנֵסִיּוֹת נָמֵי דִּידַן דְּיָתְבִי בְּהוּ נָכְרִים.
human_translation: Rather, actually where bound, and with what are we dealing here? in houses of assembly [ bevatei khenesiyyot ] of gentiles, study halls, what can be said? our study halls in which gentile are sitting. Now that you have arrived at this our synagogues, in which gentiles are sitting.
llm_translation: Rather, we are dealing always with bundles, and here what are we dealing with? - with synagogues of gentiles. What can one say about houses of study? Our houses of study are situated among gentiles. Now that you have come to this, synagogues are also situated among us that are situated among gentiles.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: מָצָא בָּהּ אֲבֵידָה, אִם רוֹב יִשְׂרָאֵל – חַיָּיב לְהַכְרִיז, אִם רוֹב גּוֹיִם – אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב לְהַכְרִיז. מַאן שָׁמְעַתְּ לֵיהּ דְּאָמַר אָזְלִינַן בָּתַר רוּבָּא? רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר, שָׁמְעַתְּ מִינַּהּ: כִּי קָאָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר בְּרוֹב גּוֹיִם, אֲבָל בְּרוֹב יִשְׂרָאֵל – לָא!
human_translation: Come hear one found a lost item in if a majority of Jews obligated to proclaim If a majority of gentiles not obligated to proclaim Who whom you heard that he follows the multitudes, Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar. Resolve from that when Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says where there is a majority of gentiles, but where there is a majority of Jews, no,
llm_translation: Come and hear: If one found a lost object in it, if the majority are Israelites - he is obligated to announce it, if the majority are non-Jews - he is not obligated to announce it. Who did you hear this from that we follow the majority? Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar, heard from him: When Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar said this regarding the majority of non-Jews, but regarding the majority of Israelites - no!

hebrew_text: מַנִּי? רַבָּנַן הִיא, תִּפְשׁוֹט מִינַּהּ דְּמוֹדוּ לֵיהּ רַבָּנַן לְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר בְּרוֹב גּוֹיִם.
human_translation: whose is this is the Rabbis. resolve from that the Rabbis concede to Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar where there is a majority of gentiles.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text translates to: "Who is it? It is the Rabbis. Remove from it that which the Rabbis agreed upon for Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar in the majority of cases among the nations."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לְעוֹלָם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר הִיא, וַאֲפִילּוּ בְּרוֹב יִשְׂרָאֵל נָמֵי. וְהָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן? בְּטָמוּן. אִי בְּטָמוּן, מַאי עֲבִידְתֵּיהּ גַּבֵּיהּ?! וְהָתְנַן: מָצָא כְּלִי בָּאַשְׁפָּה, מְכוּסֶּה – לֹא יִגַּע בּוֹ, מְגוּלֶּה – נוֹטֵל וּמַכְרִיז.
human_translation: Rather, actually is Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar, and even in where there is a majority of Jews. And with what are we dealing here? where concealed. If concealed, what is with And didn’t we learn one found a vessel in a garbage dump, concealed he may not touch it, exposed, takes and proclaims
llm_translation: Rather, Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar is indeed correct, even in the majority of Israel. And here, what are we dealing with? With hidden objects. If it is with hidden objects, what does he do with it?! And we learned: If one finds a vessel in the garbage, covered – he should not touch it; uncovered – he should take it and announce it.

hebrew_text: כִּדְאָמַר רַב פָּפָּא, בְּאַשְׁפָּה שֶׁאֵינָהּ עֲשׂוּיָה לְפַנּוֹת, וְנִמְלַךְ עָלֶיהָ לְפַנּוֹתָהּ. הָכָא נָמֵי בְּאַשְׁפָּה שֶׁאֵינָהּ עֲשׂוּיָה לְפַנּוֹת, וְנִמְלַךְ עָלֶיהָ לְפַנּוֹתָהּ.
human_translation: as Rav Pappa says to a garbage dump that is not designed to be cleared, and reconsidered to clear it. Here too, to a garbage dump that is not designed to be cleared, and reconsidered to clear it.
llm_translation: As Rav Papa said, in a fire that is not made to be turned, and it is extinguished to be turned. Here too, in a fire that is not made to be turned, and it is extinguished to be turned.

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: לְעוֹלָם רַבָּנַן, מִי קָתָנֵי ״הֵן שֶׁלּוֹ״? ״אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב לְהַכְרִיז״ קָתָנֵי. וְיַנִּיחַ, וְיֵיתֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל וְיָהֵיב בֵּיהּ סִימָנָא וְשָׁקֵיל.
human_translation: And if you wish, say actually the Rabbis. Is it taught are his? It is taught he is not obligated to proclaim but he shall place and a Jew will come and provide a distinguishing mark and take
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: Always the Rabbis, who teaches "his are they"? "He is not obligated to announce" teaches. And let him leave, and let an Israelite come and give him a sign and take.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע, דְּאָמַר רַב אַסִּי: מָצָא חָבִית יַיִן בְּעִיר שֶׁרוּבָּהּ גּוֹיִם – מוּתֶּרֶת מִשּׁוּם מְצִיאָה וַאֲסוּרָה בַּהֲנָאָה. בָּא יִשְׂרָאֵל וְנָתַן בָּהּ סִימָן – מוּתֶּרֶת בִּשְׁתִיָּה, לְמוֹצְאָהּ.
human_translation: Come hear which Rav Asi says: one found a barrel of wine in a city whose a majority of gentiles, is permitted in terms of finding and benefit is prohibited, a Jew came and provided a distinguishing mark it, drinking is permitted for its finder,
llm_translation: Come and hear, for Rav Assi said: If one finds a barrel of wine in a city whose majority are non-Jews - it is permitted due to finding, but forbidden in benefit. If a Jew comes and places a sign on it - it is permitted for drinking, to identify it.

hebrew_text: כְּמַאן? כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ כִּי קָאָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר – בְּרוֹב גּוֹיִם אֲבָל בְּרוֹב יִשְׂרָאֵל לָא. לְעוֹלָם אֵימָא לָךְ רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר אֲפִילּוּ בְּרוֹב יִשְׂרָאֵל נָמֵי קָאָמַר, וְרַב אַסִּי סָבַר לַהּ כְּווֹתֵיהּ בַּחֲדָא, וּפְלִיג עֲלֵיהּ בַּחֲדָא.
human_translation: In accordance with whose in accordance with Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar. Conclude from it that when Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar stated where there is a majority of gentiles; but where there is a majority of Jews, not Actually, I will say to you even where there is a majority of Jews, Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar also stated and Rav Asi holds in accordance with in one and disagrees with him in one
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "K'man? K'Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar. Shema minah ki ka'amar Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar - b'rov goyim aval b'rov Yisrael la. Le'olam eima lakh Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar afilu b'rov Yisrael namei ka'amar, u'Rav Assi savar la k'voteih bachada, u'plig aleih bachada." English translation: "Like whom? Like Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar. Learn from it that Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar said - in the majority of non-Jews, but not in the majority of Israel. Always say to you, Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar, even in the majority of Israel also said, and Rav Assi thought in accordance with him in one matter, and disagreed with him in one matter."

hebrew_text: וְכִי מֵאַחַר דַּאֲסִירָא בַּהֲנָאָה מוּתֶּרֶת מִשּׁוּם מְצִיאָה, לְמַאי הִלְכְתָא? אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: לְקַנְקַנָּהּ.
human_translation: And once that benefit is prohibited, is permitted in terms of finding for what halakha Rav Ashi said: to its container,
llm_translation: "And when it is prohibited for benefit, is it permitted due to acquisition? For what halakha? Rav Ashei said: To acquire it."

hebrew_text: הָהוּא גַּבְרָא דְּאַשְׁכַּח אַרְבָּעָה זוּזֵי דְּצַיְירִי בִּסְדִינָא וּשְׁדוּ בִּנְהַר בֵּירָן, אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב יְהוּדָה. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: זִיל אַכְרֵיז. וְהָא זוֹטוֹ שֶׁל יָם הוּא! שָׁאנֵי נְהַר בֵּירָן, כֵּיוָן דְּמִתְּקִיל לָא מִיָּאַשׁ. וְהָא רוּבָּא גּוֹיִם נִינְהוּ, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ אֵין הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר אֲפִילּוּ בְּרוֹב גּוֹיִם! שָׁאנֵי נְהַר בֵּירָן, דְּיִשְׂרָאֵל סָכְרוּ לֵיהּ וְיִשְׂרָאֵל כָּרוּ לֵיהּ. כֵּיוָן דְּיִשְׂרָאֵל סָכְרוּ לֵיהּ – אֵימוֹר מִיִּשְׂרָאֵל נְפַל, וְכֵיוָן דְּיִשְׂרָאֵל כָּרוּ לֵיהּ – לָא מִיָּאַשׁ.
human_translation: a certain man who found four dinars that were bound in a cloth and cast into the Biran River. He came before Rav Yehuda said: Go proclaim But isn’t it in the tide of the sea The Biran River is different. Since it contains obstacles, does not despair But isn’t it majority is gentiles? Conclude from it that halakha is not in accordance with Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar even in a majority of gentiles. The Biran River is different, as Jews dammed it and Jews dredge it. Since Jews dammed it, say that fell from a Jew, and since Jews dredge it, does not despair
llm_translation: That man who found four coins that were minted in Sidon and threw them into the Euphrates River, came before Rav Yehuda. He said to him: "Go announce it." But that is the deep sea! The Euphrates River is different, as once it becomes sweet, it does not become bitter again. And most of them are non-Jews, and we learn from this that the halacha is not like Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar, even in the majority of non-Jews! The Euphrates River is different, as the Israelites have drawn water from it and the Israelites have dug pits for it. Once the Israelites have drawn water from it - say that it will not fall from the Israelites, and once the Israelites have dug pits for it - it will not become bitter again.

hebrew_text: רַב יְהוּדָה הֲוָה שָׁקֵיל וְאָזֵיל בָּתְרֵיהּ דְּמָר שְׁמוּאֵל בְּשׁוּקָא דְּבֵי דַיְסָא, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מָצָא כָּאן אַרְנָקִי, מַהוּ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ שֶׁלּוֹ. בָּא יִשְׂרָאֵל וְנָתַן בָּהּ סִימָן, מַהוּ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: חַיָּיב לְהַחְזִיר. תַּרְתֵּי! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לִפְנִים מִשּׁוּרַת הַדִּין. כִּי הָא דַּאֲבוּהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל אַשְׁכַּח הָנָךְ חֲמָרֵי בְּמַדְבְּרָא וְאַהְדְּרִינְהוּ לְמָרַיְיהוּ לְבָתַר תְּרֵיסַר יַרְחֵי שַׁתָּא, לִפְנִים מִשּׁוּרַת הַדִּין.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda was moving along behind Mar Shmuel in the market pounded grain said to one found a purse [ arnakei ] here, what is said to him These to him. a Jew came and provided a distinguishing mark what is said to him: obligated to return two said to him: beyond the letter of the law. like that where Shmuel’s father found these donkeys in the desert and returned them to their owner after twelve months of the year, beyond the letter of the law.
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah was walking and going behind Mar Shmuel in the market of Beis Daisa. He said to him: "I found a wallet here, what should I do?" He said to him: "These are his." A Jew came and placed a sign in it, what should he do? He said to him: "He is obligated to return it." Two cases! He said to him: "According to the strict law." For this that the father of Shmuel found donkeys in the wilderness and returned them to their owners after twelve months, according to the strict law.

hebrew_text: רָבָא הֲוָה שָׁקֵיל וְאָזֵיל בָּתְרֵיהּ דְּרַב נַחְמָן בְּשׁוּקָא דְגִלְדָּאֵי, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ בְּשׁוּקָא דְרַבָּנַן, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מָצָא כָּאן אַרְנָקִי, מַהוּ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ שֶׁלּוֹ. בָּא יִשְׂרָאֵל וְנָתַן בָּהּ סִימָן, מַהוּ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ שֶׁלּוֹ. וַהֲלֹא עוֹמֵד וְצוֹוֵחַ! נַעֲשָׂה כְּצוֹוֵחַ עַל בֵּיתוֹ שֶׁנָּפַל וְעַל סְפִינָתוֹ שֶׁטָּבְעָה בַּיָּם.
human_translation: Rava was moving along behind Rav Naḥman in the tanner’s market, and some say in the marketplace the Sages. said to one found a purse here, what is said to him These to him. a Jew came and provided a distinguishing mark what is said to him These to him. But isn’t standing and screaming He becomes as screams about his house that collapsed or about his ship that sank in the sea.
llm_translation: Rava was walking and going behind Rav Nachman in the market of Gildai, and they said to him in the market of the Rabbis, he said to them: "Did you find a wallet here?" What did he say to them? "These are his." A Jew came and placed a sign in it, what did he say to him? "These are his." But isn't he standing and shouting! It is considered as shouting over his fallen house and his sunken ship.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא דַּיּוֹ דְּשָׁקֵיל בִּשְׂרָא בְּשׁוּקָא וְשַׁדְיֵהּ בְּצִנְיָיתָא דְּבֵי בַּר מָרִיּוֹן. אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּאַבָּיֵי, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: זִיל שְׁקוֹל לְנַפְשָׁךְ. וְהָא רוּבָּא דְּיִשְׂרָאֵל נִינְהוּ, שָׁמְעַתְּ מִינַּהּ הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר אֲפִילּוּ בְּרוֹב יִשְׂרָאֵל! שָׁאנֵי דַּיּוֹ, דִּכְזוֹטוֹ שֶׁל יָם דָּמֵי. וְהָא אָמַר רַב: בָּשָׂר שֶׁנִּתְעַלֵּם מִן הָעַיִן – אָסוּר! בְּעוֹמֵד וְרוֹאֵהוּ.
human_translation: a certain kite that took meat in the marketplace and cast it among the palm trees of the house of bar Maryon. came before Abaye said to him: Go take for yourself. But isn’t a majority of Jews? Conclude from it that halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar even in a majority of Jews. A kite is different, as similar in the tide of the sea. But doesn’t Rav say: Meat that was obscured from sight forbidden, stands and sees
llm_translation: That one, Daiyo, who would take meat in the market and throw it into the basket of the house of Bar Mariyon. He came before Abbaye, he said to him: Go weigh for yourself. And the majority of Israelites are they, you have heard from them the halakha according to Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar even in the majority of Israel! It is different with Daiyo, whose appearance is like the sea. And Rav said: Meat that is hidden from the eye - forbidden! When standing, one may look at it.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי חֲנִינָא מָצָא גְּדִי שָׁחוּט בֵּין טְבֶרְיָא לְצִיפּוֹרִי וְהִתִּירוּהוּ לוֹ. אָמַר רַבִּי אַמֵּי: הִתִּירוּהוּ לוֹ מִשּׁוּם מְצִיאָה כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר, מִשּׁוּם שְׁחִיטָה כְּרַבִּי חֲנַנְיָא בְּנוֹ שֶׁל רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי. דְּתַנְיָא: הֲרֵי שֶׁאָבְדוּ לוֹ גְּדָיָיו וְתַרְנְגוֹלָיו, הָלַךְ וּמְצָאָן שְׁחוּטִין, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹסֵר, וְרַבִּי חֲנַנְיָא בְּנוֹ שֶׁל רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי מַתִּיר.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥanina found a slaughtered young goat between Tiberias and Tzippori and permitted it to him. Rabbi Ami said: permitted it to him in terms of finding in accordance with Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar, in terms of slaughter in accordance with Rabbi Ḥananya, son of Rabbi Yosei HaGelili. As it is taught where one’s young goats and roosters were lost, went and found them slaughtered, Rabbi Yehuda deems forbidden, and Rabbi Ḥananya, son of Rabbi Yosei HaGelili, deems permitted.
llm_translation: Rabbi Chanina found a slaughtered goat between Teverya and Tzipori, and they permitted it for him. Rabbi Amei said: They permitted it for him due to the principle of acquisition, like Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar, and due to the method of slaughter, like Rabbi Chananya, son of Rabbi Yosei the Galilean. As it was taught: If one's goats and chickens went missing, and he found them slaughtered, Rabbi Yehuda prohibits them, while Rabbi Chananya, son of Rabbi Yosei the Galilean permits them.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי: נִרְאִין דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה כְּשֶׁמְּצָאָן בְּאַשְׁפָּה, וְדִבְרֵי רַבִּי חֲנַנְיָא בְּנוֹ שֶׁל רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי כְּשֶׁמְּצָאָן בַּבַּיִת. מִדְּהִתִּירוּהוּ לוֹ מִשּׁוּם שְׁחִיטָה, רוּבָּא יִשְׂרָאֵל נִינְהוּ, שָׁמְעַתְּ מִינַּהּ הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר אֲפִילּוּ בְּרוֹב יִשְׂרָאֵל! אָמַר רָבָא: רוֹב גּוֹיִם וְרוֹב טַבָּחֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל.
human_translation: Rabbi says: The statement of Rabbi Yehuda appears where he found in a garbage dump, And the statement of Rabbi Ḥananya, son of Rabbi Yosei HaGelili, appears correct where he found them in the house. From that permitted to him in terms of slaughter, a majority of Jews. Conclude from it that halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar even in a majority of Jews. Rava said: a majority of gentiles but majority of slaughterers are Jews.
llm_translation: Rabbi said: The words of Rabbi Yehuda are seen as if they are found in the garbage heap, and the words of Rabbi Chananya, the son of Rabbi Yosei the Galilean, are seen as if they are found in the house. When they permitted it to him because of slaughter, they are mostly Israelites. You have heard from her that the halakha is like Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar even with the majority of Israel. Rava said: The majority are non-Jews and the majority of slaughterers are Israelites.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אַמֵּי אַשְׁכַּח פַּרְגִּיּוֹת שְׁחוּטוֹת בֵּין טְבֶרְיָא לְצִיפּוֹרִי, אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי אַסִּי, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ בֵּי מִדְרְשָׁא. וַאֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: זִיל שְׁקוֹל לְנַפְשָׁךְ. רַבִּי יִצְחָק נַפָּחָא אַשְׁכַּח קִיבּוּרָא דְאִזְלֵי בֵּי אָזְלוֹיֵי, אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ בְּבֵי מִדְרְשָׁא, וַאֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: זִיל שְׁקוֹל לְנַפְשָׁךְ.
human_translation: Rabbi Ami found slaughtered fledglings between Tiberias and Tzippori. He came before Rabbi Asi and some say before Rabbi Yoḥanan, and some say the study hall. And they said to him: Go take for yourself. Rabbi Yitzḥak Nappaḥa found a skein from which a net was woven. He came before Rabbi Yoḥanan and some say the study hall. And they said to him: Go take for yourself,
llm_translation: Rabbi Ammi found slaughtered pigeons between Teverya and Tzipori. He came before Rabbi Assi, and some say before Rabbi Yochanan, and some say before the Beit Midrash. They said to him: "Go, take care of yourself." Rabbi Yitzchak Nappacha found a grave of those who go to the bathhouses, he came before Rabbi Yochanan, and some say before the Beit Midrash, and they said to him: "Go, take care of yourself."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ וְאֵלּוּ חַיָּיב לְהַכְרִיז: מָצָא פֵּירוֹת בִּכְלִי, אוֹ כְּלִי כְּמוֹת שֶׁהוּא. מָעוֹת בְּכִיס, אוֹ כִּיס כְּמוֹת שֶׁהוּא. צִבּוּרֵי פֵירוֹת, צִבּוּרֵי מָעוֹת,
human_translation: And these obligated to proclaim one found produce inside a vessel, or a vessel by itself; coins inside a pouch, or a pouch by itself; piles of produce; piles of coins,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: And these are the cases where one is obligated to make a public announcement: If one found fruits in a vessel, or a vessel the size of which it is, or coins in a purse, or a purse the size of which it is. Public announcements are made for fruits, and public announcements are made for coins.

hebrew_text: שְׁלֹשָׁה מַטְבְּעוֹת זֶה עַל גַּב זֶה, כְּרִיכוֹת בִּרְשׁוּת הַיָּחִיד, וְכִכָּרוֹת שֶׁל בַּעַל הַבַּיִת, וְגִיזֵּי צֶמֶר הַלְּקוּחִין מִבֵּית הָאוּמָּן, כַּדֵּי יַיִן וְכַדֵּי שֶׁמֶן – הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ חַיָּיב לְהַכְרִיז.
human_translation: three coins one atop another; bundles in a secluded area; loaves of a homeowner, wool fleeces that are taken from the house of a craftsman, jugs of wine; or jugs of oil. these, obligated to proclaim
llm_translation: Three coins, one on top of the other, bundles in private domain, and loaves of the homeowner, and woolen threads purchased from the craftsman, enough for wine and enough for oil - these are obligated to be announced.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ טַעְמָא דְּמָצָא פֵּירוֹת בִּכְלִי וּמָעוֹת בְּכִיס. הָא כְּלִי וּלְפָנָיו פֵּירוֹת, כִּיס וּלְפָנָיו מָעוֹת – הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ שֶׁלּוֹ. תְּנֵינָא לְהָא, דְּתָנוּ רַבָּנַן: מָצָא כְּלִי וּלְפָנָיו פֵּירוֹת, כִּיס וּלְפָנָיו מָעוֹת – הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ שֶׁלּוֹ. מִקְצָתָן בַּכְּלִי וּמִקְצָתָן עַל גַּבֵּי קַרְקַע, מִקְצָתָן בַּכִּיס וּמִקְצָתָן עַל גַּבֵּי קַרְקַע – חַיָּיב לְהַכְרִיז.
human_translation: The reason that he found produce inside the vessel or coins inside the pouch; but a vessel and produce before it, a pouch and coins before it, those, to him. We learn that the Sages taught a vessel and produce before it, a pouch and coins before it, those, to him. some of in the vessel and some of on the ground, some of inside the pouch and some of them on the ground, obligated to proclaim
llm_translation: The taste of that which one finds fruits in a vessel and coins in a pocket. Here, if fruits are in the vessel and coins in front of it, if coins are in the pocket and fruits in front of it - these belong to him. We learned this, as the Rabbis taught: If one finds a vessel with fruits in front of it, a pocket with coins in front of it - these belong to him. Some of them are in the vessel and some are on the ground, some of them are in the pocket and some are on the ground - he is obligated to announce.

hebrew_text: וּרְמִינְהוּ: מָצָא דָּבָר שֶׁאֵין בּוֹ סִימָן בְּצַד דָּבָר שֶׁיֵּשׁ בּוֹ סִימָן – חַיָּיב לְהַכְרִיז. בָּא בַּעַל סִימָן וְנָטַל אֶת שֶׁלּוֹ – זָכָה הַלָּה בְּדָבָר שֶׁאֵין בּוֹ סִימָן.
human_translation: And raises a contradiction found an item on which there is no distinguishing mark alongside an item on which there is a distinguishing mark, obligated to proclaim owner of distinguishing mark came and took his the other acquires the item on which there is no distinguishing mark.
llm_translation: And they raised a dilemma: If one found an item that has no identifying mark next to an item that does have an identifying mark - he is obligated to proclaim it. If the owner of the item with the identifying mark comes and takes his item - he has acquired the item that has no identifying mark.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב זְבִיד, לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא בְּכוּבָּא וְכִיתָּנָא, הָא בְּצַנָּא וּפֵירֵי.
human_translation: Rav Zevid said not difficult: This where to a container and flax. That to a basket and produce.
llm_translation: Rav Zevid said, it is not difficult: this is in the case of a basket and a jug, and this is in the case of a basket and its produce.

hebrew_text: רַב פָּפָּא אָמַר: הָא וְהָא בְּצַנָּא וּפֵירֵי, וְלָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא דְּאִשְׁתְּיַיר בַּהּ מִידֵּי, הָא דְּלָא אִשְׁתְּיַיר בַּהּ מִידֵּי.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: this and that a basket and produce, not difficult: This where where some remains in That where no remains in
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: This and this in a basket and fruits, and it is not difficult: this one that remains in it immediately, this one that does not remain in it immediately.

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: הָא וְהָא דְּלָא אִשְׁתְּיַיר בַּהּ מִידֵּי, וְלָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא דִּמְהַדְּרִי אַפֵּיהּ לְגַבֵּי פֵּירֵי, הָא דְּלָא מְהַדְּרִי אַפֵּיהּ לְגַבֵּי פֵּירֵי.
human_translation: And if you wish, say this and that where no remains in and not difficult: This where mouth is facing the produce, That where mouth is not facing the produce.
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: This and this, that does not remain in it immediately, and it is not difficult: this that he returns its face to the fruits, this that he does not return its face to the fruits.

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: הָא וְהָא דִּמְהַדְּרִי אַפֵּיהּ לְגַבֵּי פֵּירֵי, וְלָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא דְּאִית לֵהּ אוּגְנִין לְצַנָּא, הָא דְּלֵית לֵהּ אוּגְנִין לְצַנָּא.
human_translation: And if you wish, say this and that where mouth is facing the produce, not difficult: That where basket has a rim. This where where the basket has no rim
