llm_translation: And if you wish, say: This and this, who turns his face towards the fruits, and it is not difficult: this one who has a plate for a dish, this one who does not have a plate for a dish.

hebrew_text: צִבּוּרֵי פֵירוֹת וְצִבּוּרֵי מָעוֹת. שָׁמְעַתְּ מִינַּהּ מִנְיָן הָוֵי סִימָן, תְּנִי: ״צִבּוּר פֵּירוֹת״. שָׁמְעַתְּ מִינַּהּ מָקוֹם הָוֵי סִימָן, תְּנִי: ״צִבּוּרֵי פֵּירוֹת״.
human_translation: Piles of produce and piles of coins. Conclude from it number is a distinguishing mark, teach A pile of produce. conclude from it location is a distinguishing mark. teach Piles of produce.
llm_translation: The congregation of fruits and the congregation of coins. You heard from it, what is the source that it should be a sign? It teaches: "congregation of fruits." You heard from it, what is the place that it should be a sign? It teaches: "congregation of fruits."

hebrew_text: שְׁלֹשָׁה מַטְבְּעוֹת זֶה עַל גַּב זֶה. אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק מַגְדְּלָאָה: וְהוּא שֶׁעֲשׂוּיִין כְּמִגְדָּלִין. תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: מָצָא מָעוֹת מְפוּזָּרוֹת – הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ שֶׁלּוֹ, עֲשׂוּיִין כְּמִגְדָּלִים – חַיָּיב לְהַכְרִיז. וְאֵלּוּ הֵן עֲשׂוּיִין כְּמִגְדָּלִים? שְׁלֹשָׁה מַטְבְּעִין זֶה עַל גַּב זֶה.
human_translation: Three coins one atop another. Rabbi Yitzḥak from Migdal says: And is where are arranged in towers. This is also taught found scattered coins, these to him. are arranged in towers, obligated to proclaim And these are arranged in towers: Three coins one atop another.
llm_translation: Three coins on top of each other. Rabbi Yitzchak Magdalaah said: And they are made like towers. It was also taught similarly: If one finds scattered coins - they are his, if they are made like towers - he must announce. And what are coins made like towers? Three coins on top of each other.

hebrew_text: הָא גּוּפַהּ קַשְׁיָא: אָמְרַתְּ מָצָא מָעוֹת מְפוּזָּרוֹת הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ שֶׁלּוֹ, הָא מְשַׁלְחֲפִי שַׁלְחוֹפֵי חַיָּיב לְהַכְרִיז! אֵימָא סֵיפָא: עֲשׂוּיִין כְּמִגְדָּלִין חַיָּיב לְהַכְרִיז, הָא מְשַׁלְחֲפִי שַׁלְחוֹפֵי הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ שֶׁלּוֹ! תָּנָא כֹּל שֶׁאֵין עֲשׂוּיִין כְּמִגְדָּלִין – מְפוּזָּרוֹת קָרֵי לְהוּ.
human_translation: This itself is difficult. you said: found scattered coins, these to him, if partially overlap [ meshalḥefei shalḥufei ], obligated to proclaim Say the latter clause are arranged in towers, obligated to proclaim if partially overlap, those belong to him. tanna calls any that is not arranged in towers: Scattered.
llm_translation: This is a difficult case: If she says, "I found scattered coins," these are hers. If he sends messengers, he is obligated to announce! Say the latter part: If they are made like towers, he is obligated to announce, these are his! A Tanna taught: Anything that is not made like towers is called scattered.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא שֶׁל שְׁלֹשָׁה מְלָכִים, אֲבָל שֶׁל מֶלֶךְ אֶחָד אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב לְהַכְרִיז. הֵיכִי דָמֵי? אִי דַּעֲשׂוּיִין כְּמִגְדָּלִין – אֲפִילּוּ שֶׁל מֶלֶךְ אֶחָד נָמֵי, וְאִי דְּאֵין עֲשׂוּיִין כְּמִגְדָּלִין – אֲפִילּוּ שֶׁל שְׁלֹשָׁה מְלָכִים נָמֵי לָא!
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥanina says: taught only by three kings, but by one king, one is not obligated to proclaim What are the circumstances? If are arranged in towers, even by one king, also And if are not arranged in towers, even coins by three kings, also not
llm_translation: Rabbi Chanina said: They only decreed to recite the blessing for the rains for three kings, but for one king, one is not obligated to make the proclamation. How so? If they are made like towers - even for one king alone, they are still valid. But if they are not made like towers - even for three kings together, they are not valid!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אִי אִתְּמַר, הָכִי אִתְּמַר: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא שֶׁל מֶלֶךְ אֶחָד כְּעֵין שְׁלֹשָׁה מְלָכִים, אֲבָל שֶׁל מֶלֶךְ אֶחָד אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב לְהַכְרִיז. וְהֵיכִי דָּמֵי דַּעֲשׂוּיִין כְּמִגְדָּלִים? רְוִיחָא תַּתָּאָה וּמְצִיעָא עִילָּוֵיהּ וְזוּטָא עִילָּוֵיהּ מְצִיעָא. דְּאָמְרִינַן: אַנּוֹחֵי אַנְחִינְהוּ. אֲבָל שֶׁל מֶלֶךְ אֶחָד, דְּכוּלְּהוּ כִּי הֲדָדֵי נִינְהוּ אַף עַל גַּב דְּמַנְּחִי אַהֲדָדֵי – הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ שֶׁלּוֹ, אֵימַר: אִתְרְמוֹיֵי אִתְרְמִי וּבַהֲדֵי הֲדָדֵי נְפוּל.
human_translation: Rather, if was stated, this it was stated: taught only by one king, similar to three kings. But by one king, he is not obligated to proclaim what are the circumstances that are arranged in towers the bottom broadest, and the intermediate-sized atop it and the smallest atop the intermediate as we say: They were placed But by one king, each of them sized like the other, even if each is placed upon the other, those coins belong to say it happenstance and they fell together,
llm_translation: Rather, it was stated thus: They only taught this regarding the wine of one king, which is like the wine of three kings, but the wine of one king does not require a declaration. And how are they similar to towers? The lower one is wide, the upper one is narrow, and the middle one is narrow. As we say: "We are his and he is ours." But the wine of one king, since they are all Hadadei, even though they are from different regions – these are his. Say: "Let the treacherous deal treacherously, and let the treacherous fall together."

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ שֶׁל מֶלֶךְ אֶחָד נָמֵי מַכְרֵיז. מַאי מַכְרֵיז? מִנְיָן. מַאי אִירְיָא תְּלָתָא? אֲפִילּוּ תְּרֵין נָמֵי. אָמַר רָבִינָא: טִבְעָא מַכְרֵיז.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Even by one king, also proclaim What proclaim number why specifically three even two Ravina said: proclaims coins,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: Even for the sale of one belonging to a king, one may announce. What is meant by "announce"? From where? What is the meaning of "three"? Even for two, one may announce. Ravina said: A ring is announced.

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה: כְּשֵׁיר, מַהוּ? כְּשׁוּרָה, מַהוּ? כַּחֲצוּבָה, מַהוּ? כְּסוּלָּם, מַהוּ?
human_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya raises a dilemma: like bracelet, what is like line, what is like a triangle, what is like ladder, what is
llm_translation: The request of Rabbi Yirmiyah: What is "kesheir"? What is "keshurah"? What is "kachatuvah"? What is "ksulam"?

hebrew_text: פְּשׁוֹט מֵהָא חֲדָא, דְּאָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר אֲבוּהּ: כֹּל שֶׁאִילּוּ מַכְנִיס לָהֶ[ן] קֵיסָם בֵּינֵיהֶן וְנוֹטְלָם בְּבַת אַחַת, חַיָּיב לְהַכְרִיז.
human_translation: Resolve at least one as Rav Naḥman says Rabba bar Avuh says: any if one introduce a wood chip between lift them all at once obligated to proclaim
llm_translation: Simply from this one, as Rav Nachman said, Rabba bar Avuh said: Anyone who brings their the judges' case to them and takes them in one go, is obligated to announce.

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי רַב אָשֵׁי:
human_translation: Rav Ashi raises a dilemma:
llm_translation: The request is to translate the phrase "בָּעֵי רַב אָשֵׁי" into English word-for-word, maintaining the original style and format of Talmudic discourse. Here is the translation: "Ba'ei Rav Ashei"

hebrew_text: כְּאַבְנֵי בֵּית קוּלִיס, מַהוּ?
human_translation: like the stones of the house Mercury, what is
llm_translation: Like the stones of Beit Kulis, what is it?

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע, דְּתַנְיָא: מָצָא מָעוֹת מְפוּזָּרוֹת – הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ שֶׁלּוֹ, כְּאַבְנֵי בֵּית קוּלִיס – חַיָּיב לְהַכְרִיז. וְאֵלּוּ הֵן אַבְנֵי בֵּית קוּלִיס: אַחַת מִכָּאן וְאַחַת מִכָּאן וְאַחַת עַל גַּבֵּיהֶן.
human_translation: Come hear As it is taught found scattered coins, these belong to him. like the stones of the house Mercury, obligated to proclaim And these are like the stones of the house Mercury: One here and one there and one atop them.
llm_translation: Come and hear, as it was taught: If one finds scattered coins - they are his, like stones of the Beit Kulis - he is obligated to announce. And these are the stones of the Beit Kulis: one from here, and one from here, and one on top of them.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הַמּוֹצֵא סֶלַע בְּשׁוּק, וּמְצָאוֹ חֲבֵירוֹ וְאָמַר: שֶׁלִּי הִיא, חֲדָשָׁה הִיא, נִירוֹנִית הִיא, שֶׁל מֶלֶךְ פְּלוֹנִי הִיא – לֹא אָמַר כְּלוּם. וְלֹא עוֹד, אֶלָּא אֲפִילּוּ שְׁמוֹ כָּתוּב עָלֶיהָ – לֹא אָמַר כְּלוּם. לְפִי שֶׁאֵין סִימָן לְמַטְבֵּעַ. דְּאָמַר: דִּלְמָא אַפּוֹקֵי אַפְּקַהּ וּמֵאִינִישׁ אַחֲרִינָא נְפַל.
human_translation: The Sages taught one who finds a sela in the marketplace and another finds him and says: It is mine, it is new, is by Nero, by king so-and-so, he has not said anything Moreover, even his name is written on he has not said anything, due to that there is no distinguishing mark for a coin as says: Perhaps he spent and it fell from another person.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: One who finds a stone in the marketplace, and his fellow finds it and says, "It is mine, it is new, it is a coin of a certain king" - he does not say anything. Moreover, even if his name is written on it, he does not say anything. Because there is no distinguishing mark for currency. For it is said: Perhaps I will take it and throw it, and another person will fall after it.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ מָצָא אַחַר הַגָּפָה אוֹ אַחַר הַגָּדֵר גּוֹזָלוֹת מְקוּשָּׁרִים, אוֹ בִּשְׁבִילִין שֶׁבַּשָּׂדוֹת – הֲרֵי זֶה לֹא יִגַּע בָּהֶן. מָצָא כְּלִי בָּאַשְׁפָּה, אִם מְכוּסֶּה – לֹא יִגַּע בּוֹ, אִם מְגוּלֶּה – נוֹטֵל וּמַכְרִיז.
human_translation: found, behind fence or behind fence, bound fledglings, or in the paths that through fields, he may not touch them, one found a vessel in a garbage dump, if concealed, he may not touch it, If exposed, takes and proclaims
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: If one finds stolen produce behind a stack of sheaves or behind a fence, if they are tied up, or in the furrows of the field - one should not touch them. If one finds a vessel in the garbage, if it is covered - one should not touch it, if it is uncovered - one should take it and announce it.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאי טַעְמָא? דְּאָמְרִינַן: הָנֵי, אִינָשׁ אַצְנְעִינְהוּ, וְאִי שָׁקֵיל לְהוּ – לֵית לְהוּ לְמָרַיְיהוּ סִימָנָא בְּגַוַּויְיהוּ, הִלְכָּךְ לִשְׁבְּקִינְהוּ עַד דְּאָתֵי מָרַיְיהוּ וְשָׁקֵיל לְהוּ.
human_translation: What is the reason that we say these A person concealed them, and if one takes them, their owner has no distinguishing mark on them Therefore, let leave until their owner comes and takes them.
llm_translation: Gemara: What is the reason? As we say: those, a person hides them, and if he takes them out - he does not have a sign from their master in their body, therefore we leave them until their master comes and takes them.

hebrew_text: וְאַמַּאי לֶיהֱוֵי קֶשֶׁר סִימָנָא! אָמַר רַבִּי אַבָּא בַּר זַבְדָּא אָמַר רַב: בִּמְקוּשָּׁרִין בְּכַנְפֵיהֶן, דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא הָכִי מְקַטְּרִי לְהוּ.
human_translation: But why? Let knot distinguishing mark. Rabbi Abba bar Zavda said Rav said: where bound at their wings. Since everyone binds them that
llm_translation: And why should it be a sign of connection! Rabbi Abba bar Zavda said in the name of Rav: They are tied in their wings, for everyone in the world thus offers incense to them.

hebrew_text: וְלֶהֱוֵי מָקוֹם סִימָן! אָמַר רַב עוּקְבָא בַּר חָמָא: בְּמִדַּדִּין. אִי בְּמִדַּדִּין – מֵעָלְמָא אָתוּ וּמוּתָּרִין!
human_translation: And let location distinguishing mark. Rav Ukva bar Ḥama said: where hop If where hop, came from elsewhere and is permitted
llm_translation: And it should be a place of a sign! Rav Ukva bar Chama said: in measurements. If in measurements - they come from the world and are permitted!

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר מֵעָלְמָא אֲתוֹ, וְאִיכָּא לְמֵימַר אִינָשׁ אַצְנְעִינְהוּ, וְהָוֵה לֵיהּ סְפֵק הִינּוּחַ, וְאָמַר רַבִּי אַבָּא בַּר זַבְדָּא אָמַר רַב: כֹּל סְפֵק הִינּוּחַ – לְכַתְּחִילָּה לֹא יִטּוֹל, וְאִם נָטַל לֹא יַחֲזִיר.
human_translation: It can be said that came from elsewhere and it can be said a person concealed them, and is uncertainty placement And Rabbi Abba bar Zavda says Rav says: any uncertainty placement may not take ab initio . And if he took not return
llm_translation: There is a saying from the world that they came, and there is a saying from people that they are modest, and there was a doubt of rest to him, and Rabbi Abba bar Zavda said in the name of Rav: Any doubt of rest - initially, one should not take, and if he took, he should not return.

hebrew_text: מָצָא כְּלִי בָּאַשְׁפָּה, מְכוּסֶּה – לֹא יִגַּע בּוֹ, מְגוּלֶּה – נוֹטֵל וּמַכְרִיז. וּרְמִינְהוּ: מָצָא כְּלִי טָמוּן בָּאַשְׁפָּה – נוֹטֵל וּמַכְרִיז, שֶׁכֵּן דֶּרֶךְ אַשְׁפָּה לִפַּנּוֹת.
human_translation: one found a vessel in a garbage dump, if concealed, he may not touch it, If exposed, takes and proclaims raises a contradiction found a vessel concealed in a garbage dump, takes and proclaims because routine a garbage dump to be cleared.
llm_translation: He found a vessel in the garbage - covered: he should not touch it, uncovered - he should take it and announce. And they raised a dilemma: If he found a hidden vessel in the garbage - he should take it and announce, for it is the way of garbage to turn things over.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב זְבִיד, לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא בְּכוּבֵּי וְכָסֵי, הָא בְּסַכִּינֵי וְהֶמְנֵיק. בְּכוּבֵּי וְכָסֵי – לֹא יִגַּע, בְּסַכִּינֵי וְהֶמְנֵיק – נוֹטֵל וּמַכְרִיז.
human_translation: Rav Zevid said not difficult: This to containers or cups. That to knives or a fork [ vehamnik ]. In containers or cups, he may not touch In knives or forks, takes and proclaims
llm_translation: Rav Zevid said, it is not difficult: here with pitchers and cups, there with knives and forks. With pitchers and cups - one may not touch, with knives and forks - one may take and announce.

hebrew_text: רַב פָּפָּא אָמַר: הָא וְהָא בְּכוּבֵּי וְכָסֵי, וְלָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן בְּאַשְׁפָּה הָעֲשׂוּיָה לִפַּנּוֹת, כָּאן בְּאַשְׁפָּה שֶׁאֵינָהּ עֲשׂוּיָה לִפַּנּוֹת.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: this and that to containers and cups, and not difficult: Here, to a garbage dump that is designed to be cleared; There, to a garbage dump that is not designed to be cleared;
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: Here and here in containers and covers, and it is not difficult: here in the ash made for turning, here in the ash that is not made for turning.

hebrew_text: אַשְׁפָּה הָעֲשׂוּיָה לִפַּנּוֹת אֲבֵידָה מִדַּעַת הִיא! אֶלָּא בְּאַשְׁפָּה שֶׁאֵינָהּ עֲשׂוּיָה לִפַּנּוֹת, וְנִמְלַךְ עָלֶיהָ לְפַנּוֹתָהּ.
human_translation: garbage dump that is designed to be cleared? a deliberate loss Rather, a garbage dump that is not designed to be cleared, and reconsidered to clear it.
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "Ashpah ha'asu'yah lifannot avedah mi'da'at hi! Ela b'ashpah she'einah asu'yah lifannot, v'nimlach aleha lefanotah."

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְרַב פָּפָּא – הַיְינוּ דְּקָתָנֵי: שֶׁכֵּן דֶּרֶךְ אַשְׁפָּה לִפַּנּוֹת. אֶלָּא לְרַב זְבִיד, מַאי שֶׁכֵּן דֶּרֶךְ אַשְׁפָּה לִפַּנּוֹת? שֶׁכֵּן דֶּרֶךְ אַשְׁפָּה לְפַנּוֹת לָהּ כֵּלִים קְטַנִּים.
human_translation: Granted, according to Rav Pappa, this that the teaches because routine a garbage dump to be cleared, But according to Rav Zevid, What Because routine a garbage dump to be cleared? Because routine a garbage dump to small utensils cleared, into it.
llm_translation: In truth, to Rav Papa - that is what is taught: for it is the way of a maid to turn before him. Rather, to Rav Zevid, what is the way of a maid to turn before him? It is the way of a maid to turn before him small vessels.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ מָצָא בְּגַל וּבְכוֹתֶל יָשָׁן – הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ שֶׁלּוֹ. מָצָא בְּכוֹתֶל חָדָשׁ, מֵחֶצְיוֹ וְלַחוּץ – שֶׁלּוֹ, מֵחֶצְיוֹ וְלִפְנִים – שֶׁל בַּעַל הַבַּיִת. אִם הָיָה מַשְׂכִּירוֹ לַאֲחֵרִים – אֲפִילּוּ בְּתוֹךְ הַבַּיִת, הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ שֶׁלּוֹ.
human_translation: found in a heap or in an old wall, these to him. one found in a new wall from its midpoint and outward, to him. from its midpoint and inward, to the homeowner. If would rent to others even inside the house, these to him.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: If one finds an object in a heap and against a wall - they are his. If one finds an object in a new wall, from its midpoint outward - it is his, from its midpoint inward - it belongs to the homeowner. If he rented out his house to others - even if the object is found inside the house, they are his.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנָא: מִפְּנֵי שֶׁיָּכוֹל לוֹמַר לוֹ שֶׁל אֲמוֹרִיִּים הֵן. אַטּוּ אֱמוֹרִים מַצְנְעִי, יִשְׂרָאֵל לָא מַצְנְעִי? לָא צְרִיכָא
human_translation: taught due to that can say to him: They to the Amorites, Is that to say Amorites conceal Jews do not conceal No, is necessary
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Gemara: Tanah: mipnei sheyakhol loimar lo she'l amoriiyim hein. Attu emoriim matznei, Yisrael lo matznei? Lo tzerikha." English translation: "Gemara: It was taught: Because he can say to him, 'They are of the Amorites.' Are the Amorites modest, and Israel is not modest? It is necessary."

hebrew_text: דִּשְׁתִיךְ טְפֵי.
human_translation: where extremely rusted,
llm_translation: Your request is to translate the Aramaic phrase "דִּשְׁתִיךְ טְפֵי" into English word-for-word. Here is the translation: "Your drink is sweet."

hebrew_text: בְּכוֹתֶל חָדָשׁ, מֵחֶצְיוֹ וְלַחוּץ – שֶׁלּוֹ, מֵחֶצְיוֹ וְלִפְנִים – שֶׁל בַּעַל הַבַּיִת.
human_translation: one found in a new wall from its midpoint and outward, to him. from its midpoint and inward, to the homeowner.
llm_translation: In a new wall, from its midpoint and outward - belongs to him, from its midpoint and inward - belongs to the homeowner.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: סַכִּינָא בָּתַר קַתָּא, וְכִיסָא בָּתַר שִׁנְצֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: a knife follows the handle, and pouch follows the laces
llm_translation: Rav Ashe said: A knife after a thorn, and a purse after its teeth.

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא מַתְנִיתִין דְּקָתָנֵי: מֵחֶצְיוֹ וְלַחוּץ – שֶׁלּוֹ, מֵחֶצְיוֹ וְלִפְנִים – שֶׁל בַּעַל הַבַּיִת. וְלֶחְזֵי, אִי קַתָּא לְגָאו אִי קַתָּא לְבַר! אִי שִׁנְצֵיהּ לְגָאו אִי שִׁנְצֵיהּ לְבַר! מַתְנִיתִין בְּאוּדְרָא וּנְסָכָא.
human_translation: But the mishna, which teaches: from its midpoint and outward, to him, from its midpoint and inward, to the homeowner? But let us see if its handle inward if its handle outward, if its straps inward or if its straps outward. The mishna where rags or metal strips.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And rather, the Mishnah teaches: From its half and outward – belongs to him, from its half and inward – belongs to the homeowner. And let us see, whether the wall is leaning outward or leaning inward! Whether its teeth are outward or its teeth are inward! Mishnah in Udra and Nisakha.

hebrew_text: תָּנָא: אִם הָיָה כּוֹתֶל מְמוּלָּא מֵהֶן – חוֹלְקִין. פְּשִׁיטָא! לָא צְרִיכָא, דִּמְשַׁפַּע בְּחַד גִּיסָא, מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: אִשְׁתְּפוֹכֵי אִישְׁתְּפוּךְ, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: taught: If wall was filled with divide obvious? No, necessary where the wall is inclined toward one side Lest you say slipped teaches us
llm_translation: Mishna: If there was a wall in front of them - they divide. Obvious! Not necessary, for it is leaning to one side, lest you say: "It should be turned, it should be turned," it teaches us.

hebrew_text: אִם הָיָה מַשְׂכִּירוֹ לַאֲחֵרִים, אֲפִילּוּ מָצָא בְּתוֹךְ הַבַּיִת – הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ שֶׁלּוֹ. וְאַמַּאי? לֵיזִיל בָּתַר בָּתְרָא.
human_translation: If would rent to others even inside the house, these to him. And why Let us follow the last
llm_translation: If he was renting to others, even if he found it inside the house - these belong to him. And why? Let him go after the latter.

hebrew_text: מִי לָא תְּנַן: מָעוֹת שֶׁנִּמְצְאוּ לִפְנֵי סוֹחֲרֵי בְּהֵמָה – לְעוֹלָם מַעֲשֵׂר, בְּהַר הַבַּיִת – חוּלִּין;
human_translation: Didn’t we learn money that was found before animal merchants always tithe, on the Temple Mount non-sacred
llm_translation: We learned in a Mishnah: Coins that were found in front of livestock merchants - always considered as Ma'aser; on the Temple Mount - considered as regular (non-sacred) coins.

hebrew_text: וּבִירוּשָׁלַיִם, בִּשְׁאָר יְמוֹת הַשָּׁנָה – חוּלִּין. בִּשְׁעַת הָרֶגֶל – הַכֹּל מַעֲשֵׂר.
human_translation: And in Jerusalem, during the rest of the days of the year, non-sacred during the Festival, all tithe
llm_translation: In Jerusalem, during the rest of the days of the year - Hullin. During the pilgrimage festival - everything is tithed.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב שְׁמַעְיָה בַּר זְעֵירָא: מַאי טַעְמָא? הוֹאִיל וְשׁוּקֵי יְרוּשָׁלַיִם עֲשׂוּיִן לְהִתְכַּבֵּד בְּכׇל יוֹם. אַלְמָא אָמְרִינַן קַמָּאֵי קַמָּאֵי אֲזַלוּ, וְהָנֵי אַחֲרִינֵי נִינְהוּ. הָכָא נָמֵי: קַמָּא קַמָּא אֲזַל, וְהָנֵי דְּבָתְרָא הוּא!
human_translation: And Rav Shemaya bar Ze’eira says What is the reason Since the markets of Jerusalem tend to be cleaned every day, Apparently, we say each of the first is gone, and these are other Here too, to each of the first are gone and these to the last
llm_translation: And Rav Shemaya bar Zeira said: What is the reason? Because the markets of Jerusalem are prepared to be honored every day. This implies that they went first, and those others followed. Here too: they went first, and those after them!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ מִשּׁוּם בַּר קַפָּרָא: כְּגוֹן שֶׁעֲשָׂאוֹ פּוּנְדָּק לִשְׁלֹשָׁה יִשְׂרָאֵל.
human_translation: Reish Lakish said in the name of bar Kappara: where rendered an inn [ pundak ] for three Jews.
llm_translation: Reish Lakish said in the name of Bar Kappara: For example, if he made a partition for three Jews.

hebrew_text: שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר אֲפִילּוּ בְּרוֹב יִשְׂרָאֵל!
human_translation: Conclude from it that halakha in accordance with Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar even in a Jewish majority.
llm_translation: Listen, derive from it: the law is according to Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar, even in the majority of Israel!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב מְנַשְּׁיָא בַּר יַעֲקֹב: כְּגוֹן שֶׁעֲשָׂאוֹ פּוּנְדָּק לִשְׁלֹשָׁה נָכְרִים.
human_translation: Rather, Rav Menashya bar Ya’akov said: where he rendered an inn for three gentiles.
llm_translation: Rav Menashya bar Yaakov said: For example, if one made a pandak for three non-Jews.

hebrew_text: רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר אֲבוּהּ: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא לִשְׁלֹשָׁה יִשְׂרָאֵל, מַאי טַעְמָא? הָהוּא דִּנְפַל מִינֵּיהּ מִיָּאַשׁ, מֵימָר אָמַר: מִכְּדֵי אִינִישׁ אַחֲרִינָא לָא הֲוָה בַּהֲדַי אֶלָּא הָנֵי, אֲמַרִי קַמַּיְיהוּ כַּמָּה זִמְנֵי לַיהְדְּרוּ לִי, וְלָא [אַ]הְדַּרוּ לִי, וְהַשְׁתָּא לַיהְדְּרוּ?! אִי דַּעְתַּיְיהוּ לְאַהְדּוֹרַהּ אַהְדְּרוּהָ נִיהֲלִי, וְהַאי דְּלָא אַהְדְּרוּהָ לִי בְּדַעְתַּיְיהוּ לְמִיגְזְלַהּ.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman Rabba bar Avuh said: Even you say rendered an inn for three Jews, What is the reason the from whom fell despairs says: Now, no other person was with me only these I said in their presence several times to return to me, and they did not return to me; and now to return If their intention was to return they would have returned it to me, and that they did not return it to me their intention to rob
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said, Rabba bar Avuh said: Even if you were to say to three Jews, what is the reason? That one who fell from him, does he despair, from there it is said: "For no one else was there with me, only these." They said before him, how many times should we urge him to return to us, and he does not return to us, and now should we urge him?! If their intention was to return, they would have returned it to me, but since they did not return it to me, their intention is to steal it.

hebrew_text: וְאַזְדָּא רַב נַחְמָן לְטַעְמֵיהּ, דְּאָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: רָאָה סֶלַע
human_translation: And Rav Naḥman follows his reasoning, as Rav Naḥman says: saw a sela
llm_translation: And it was established according to the reasoning of Rav Nachman, for Rav Nachman said: "He saw a rock."

hebrew_text: שֶׁנָּפַל מִשְּׁנַיִם חַיָּיב לְהַחְזִיר. מַאי טַעְמָא? הָהוּא דִּנְפַל מִינֵּיהּ לָא מִיָּאַשׁ, מֵימָר אָמַר: מִכְּדֵי אִינִישׁ אַחֲרִינָא לָא הֲוָה בַּהֲדַאי אֶלָּא הַאי, נָקֵיטְנָא לֵיהּ וְאָמֵינָא לֵיהּ: אַנְתְּ הוּא דִּשְׁקַלְתֵּיהּ.
human_translation: that fell from two obligated to return What is the reason? The from whom fell does not despair He says: After all, no other person was with me, only this I will seize him and say to him: is you who took it.
llm_translation: He who fell from two parties is obligated to return the item. What is the reason? Because the one from whom he fell did not despair. The Sage said: "Since no one else took it, only this one person did, we take it from him and say to him: 'You are the one who took it.'"

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב לְהַחְזִיר. מַאי טַעְמָא? הָהוּא דִּנְפַל מִינֵּיהּ וַדַּאי מִיָּאַשׁ, מֵימָר אָמַר: מִכְּדֵי תְּרֵי הֲווֹ בַּהֲדַאי, אִי נָקֵיטְנָא לְהַאי אָמַר: ״לָא שְׁקַלְתֵּיהּ״, וְאִי נָקֵיטְנָא לְהַאי אָמַר: ״לָא שְׁקַלְתֵּיהּ״.
human_translation: In three is not obligated to return What is the reason? The from whom fell certainly despairs He says: After all, two were with me. If I seize this say: I did not take it. And if I seize that say: I did not take it.
llm_translation: In three not obligated to return. What reason? That one that fell from him and certainly who will despair, from where said: since two were in this, if we take this one said: "I did not weigh it," and if we take this one said: "I did not weigh it."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: הַאי דְּאָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב לְהַחְזִיר – לָא אֲמַרַן אֶלָּא דְּלֵית בֵּיהּ שָׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה לְכׇל חַד וְחַד, אֲבָל אִית בֵּיהּ שָׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה לְכׇל חַד וְחַד – חַיָּיב לְהַחְזִיר. מַאי טַעְמָא? אֵימוֹר שׁוּתָּפֵי נִינְהוּ וְלָא מִיָּאֲשׁוּ.
human_translation: Rava said: that which you said, in three is not obligated to return we said only where does not value of one peruta for each and every one but value of one peruta for each and every one obligated to return What is the reason? Say they are partners, they do not despair,
llm_translation: Rava said: This that you said, "With three one is not obligated to return" - we only said this when it does not contain a common denominator for each individual separately, but if it contains a common denominator for each individual separately - one is obligated to return. What is the reason? They are partners and did not despair.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי, אָמַר רָבָא: אַף עַל גַּב דְּלֵית בֵּיהּ אֶלָּא שָׁוֶה שְׁתֵּי פְרוּטוֹת – חַיָּיב לְהַחְזִיר, מַאי טַעְמָא? אֵימוֹר שׁוּתָּפֵי נִינְהוּ וְחַד מִנַּיְיהוּ אַחוֹלֵי אַחֲלֵיהּ לִמְנָתֵיהּ גַּבֵּי חַבְרֵיהּ.
human_translation: There are who say Rava said: Even if its value is only two perutot , obligated to return What is the reason? Say they are partners and one relinquishes his share to another.
llm_translation: There are some who say, Rava said: Even though it only contains two prutot - one must return it. What is the reason? Because they are partners, and one of them is particular about his portion more than his companions.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רָבָא: רָאָה סֶלַע שֶׁנָּפְלָה, נְטָלָהּ לִפְנֵי יֵאוּשׁ עַל מְנָת לְגוֹזְלָהּ – עוֹבֵר בְּכוּלָּן: מִשּׁוּם ״לֹא תִגְזוֹל״, וּמִשּׁוּם ״הָשֵׁב תְּשִׁיבֵם״, וּמִשּׁוּם ״לֹא תוּכַל לְהִתְעַלֵּם״. וְאַף עַל גַּב (דַּחֲזָרָה) [דְּאַהְדְּרַהּ] לְאַחַר יֵאוּשׁ, מַתָּנָה הוּא דְּיָהֵיב לֵיהּ, וְאִיסּוּרָא דַּעֲבַד – עֲבַד.
human_translation: And Rava says: one saw a sela that fell he took in order to steal it, before despair he violates all of due to “You shall not…rob” and due to “You shall return and due to “You may not disregard” And even if he returned it after despair a gift that he gave him; and the transgression that he performed, he performed,
llm_translation: And Rava said: If one sees a rock that fell, he should pick it up before it becomes ownerless in order to steal it - he transgresses all of them: because of "You shall not steal," and because of "You shall surely return them," and because of "You cannot hide yourself." And even though (once) he (the owner) returns (and takes it back) after it becomes ownerless, it is a gift that he gave to him, and the prohibition that he transgressed - he transgressed.

hebrew_text: נְטָלָהּ לִפְנֵי יֵאוּשׁ עַל מְנָת לְהַחְזִירָהּ, וּלְאַחַר יֵאוּשׁ נִתְכַּוֵּין לְגוֹזְלָהּ – עוֹבֵר מִשּׁוּם ״הָשֵׁב תְּשִׁיבֵם״.
human_translation: he took in order to return it, before despair and after despair he intended to steal it; he violates “You shall return
llm_translation: She took it before Ye'ush with the intention to return it, and after Ye'ush, he intended to steal it - he transgresses the commandment of "you shall surely return them."

hebrew_text: הִמְתִּין לָהּ עַד שֶׁנִּתְיָאֲשׁוּ הַבְּעָלִים וּנְטָלָהּ, אֵינוֹ עוֹבֵר אֶלָּא מִשּׁוּם ״לֹא תוּכַל לְהִתְעַלֵּם״ בִּלְבָד.
human_translation: he waited until the owner despaired and took it, he violates only “You may not disregard,”
llm_translation: He waits for her until the owners despair and divorce her, he only transgresses because of "you cannot ignore" alone.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: הַאי מַאן דְּחָזֵי דִּנְפוּל זוּזֵי מֵחַבְרֵיהּ בֵּי חָלָתָא וְאַשְׁכְּחֵיהּ וְשַׁקְלֵיהּ – לָא מִיחַיַּיב לְאַהְדּוֹרֵי לֵיהּ, מַאי טַעְמָא? הָהוּא דִּנְפַל מִינֵּיהּ מִיָּאַשׁ הוּא. אַף עַל גַּב דְּחַזְיֵיהּ דְּאַיְיתִי אַרְבְּלָא וְקָא מְרַבֵּל, מֵימָר אָמַר: כִּי הֵיכִי דִּנְפוּל מִינַּאי דִּידִי הָכִי נְפוּל מֵאִינִישׁ אַחֲרִינָא וּמַשְׁכַּחְנָא מִידֵּי.
human_translation: Rava says: this who saw that a dinar fell from another into the sand, and found it and took it, is not obligated to return it to What is the reason? the one from whom the money fell despairs Even if sees that brought a sifter and is sifting is saying: Just as fell from me so too, fell from another person and I will find some item
llm_translation: Rava said: One who sees that his money has fallen from his friend's house, and he finds it and takes it, he is not obligated to announce it to the public. What is the reason? Because the one from whom it fell has already despaired of it. Even though he sees that he is bringing a purse and counting money, the saying goes: "In the way that my money fell from me, so will it fall from another person and come into my possession."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ מָצָא בַּחֲנוּת – הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ שֶׁלּוֹ. בֵּין הַתֵּיבָה וְלַחֶנְוָנִי – שֶׁל חֶנְוָנִי. לִפְנֵי שׁוּלְחָנִי – הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ שֶׁלּוֹ. בֵּין הַכִּסֵּא וְלַשּׁוּלְחָנִי – הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ שֶׁל שׁוּלְחָנִי.
human_translation: found in a store, those to him, between the counter and the storekeeper, to the storekeeper; before a money changer, those to him. between the chair and the money changer, those to the money changer,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: "If one found objects in a shop - behold, they are his. Between the ark and the Chanvani - belonging to the Chanvani. Before the Shulhani - behold, they are his. Between the chair and the Shulhani - belonging to the Shulhani."

hebrew_text: הַלּוֹקֵחַ פֵּירוֹת מֵחֲבֵירוֹ, אוֹ שֶׁשִּׁילַּח לוֹ חֲבֵירוֹ פֵּירוֹת, וּמָצָא בָּהֶן מָעוֹת – הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ שֶׁלּוֹ. אִם הָיוּ צְרוּרִין – נוֹטֵל וּמַכְרִיז.
human_translation: one who purchases produce from another or where another sent him produce and he found coins with those him. If were bundled, takes and proclaims
llm_translation: One who takes fruits from his fellow, or if his fellow sent him fruits, and he found money in them - these are his. If they were tied up - he takes and announces.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: אֲפִילּוּ מוּנָּחִין עַל גַּבֵּי שׁוּלְחָן.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar says: Even placed upon table
llm_translation: Gemara: Rabbi Elazar said: Even if they are placed on the table.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: לִפְנֵי שׁוּלְחָנִי – הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ שֶׁלּוֹ. הָא, עַל גַּבֵּי שׁוּלְחָן – דְּשׁוּלְחָנִי! אֵימָא סֵיפָא: בֵּין הַכִּסֵּא וְלַשּׁוּלְחָנִי – שֶׁל שׁוּלְחָנִי! הָא, עַל גַּבֵּי שׁוּלְחָן שֶׁלּוֹ. אֶלָּא מֵהָא לֵיכָּא לְמִשְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: We learned before a money changer, those belong to him; that upon the table, to the money changer. Say the latter clause between the chair and the money changer, those to the money changer; that upon the table, to Rather, no to be learned from this
llm_translation: We learned in the Mishnah: "Before his table" - these belong to him. Now, on top of the table - they belong to him! Let us say the latter part: "Between the chair and the table" - they belong to the table! Now, on top of his table. Rather, from here it is not heard to infer.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר, הָא מְנָא לֵיהּ? אָמַר רָבָא: מַתְנִיתִין קְשִׁיתֵיהּ. מַאי אִרְיָא דְּתָנֵי ״בֵּין הַכִּסֵּא לַשּׁוּלְחָנִי שֶׁל שׁוּלְחָנִי״? לִיתְנֵי ״עַל שׁוּלְחָן״, אִי נָמֵי: ״מָצָא בַּשּׁוּלְחָנוּת״ כִּדְקָתָנֵי רֵישָׁא ״מָצָא בַּחֲנוּת שֶׁלּוֹ״. אֶלָּא שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: אֲפִילּוּ מוּנָּחִין עַל גַּבֵּי שׁוּלְחָן – הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ שֶׁלּוֹ.
human_translation: And Rabbi Elazar from where this Rava said: The mishna is difficult him: Why teach specifically between the chair and the money changer, to the money changer? Let teach on table, or: in the money-changing establishment, as is taught the first clause found in a store, to him. Rather, learn from it even placed upon table these to him.
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar, did he appoint him? Rava said: Mishnaic teaching his difficulty. What is the meaning of the teaching "between the chair and the table of the table"? It should teach "on the table," or alternatively: "he found in his store" as the beginning teaches "he found in his store." Rather, infer from it: even if they are placed on the table - they are considered his.

hebrew_text: הַלּוֹקֵחַ פֵּירוֹת מֵחֲבֵירוֹ וְכוּ׳. אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי יַנַּאי: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא
human_translation: one who purchases produce from another, Reish Lakish says in the name of Rabbi Yannai: taught only
llm_translation: The one who takes fruits from his fellow, etc. Reish Lakish said in the name of Rabbi Yannai: They only taught this regarding...

hebrew_text: בְּלוֹקֵחַ מִן הַתַּגָּר, אֲבָל בְּלוֹקֵחַ מִבַּעַל הַבַּיִת – חַיָּיב לְהַחְזִיר. וְכֵן תָּנֵי תַּנָּא קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב נַחְמָן: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא בְּלוֹקֵחַ מִן הַתַּגָּר, אֲבָל בְּלוֹקֵחַ מִבַּעַל הַבַּיִת – חַיָּיב לְהַחְזִיר.
human_translation: in who purchases from a merchant, But in who purchases from owner, obligated to return And likewise, the tanna taught before Rav Naḥman: taught only in who purchases from a merchant, but in who purchases from a owner, obligated to return
llm_translation: Talmudic text: When one takes from a peddler, but when one takes from the homeowner - he is obligated to return. And similarly, it was taught before Rav Nachman: They only taught this regarding taking from a peddler, but when one takes from the homeowner - he is obligated to return.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב נַחְמָן: וְכִי בַּעַל הַבַּיִת בְּעַצְמוֹ דָּשָׁן? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֶיסְמְיַהּ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָא, תִּתַּרְגַּם מַתְנִיתִין כְּגוֹן שֶׁדָּשָׁן עַל יְדֵי עַבְדּוֹ וְשִׁפְחָתוֹ הַכְּנַעֲנִים.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman said to But does owner thresh himself? said to should I delete it said to No. Interpret the baraita where was threshed by his Canaanite slave or maidservant,
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Nachman: Is the homeowner himself the one who threshes? He said to him: Is it possible? He said to him: No, the Mishnah should be interpreted as referring to a case where he threshes through his Canaanite slave and maidservant.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אַף הַשִּׂמְלָה הָיְתָה בִּכְלַל כׇּל אֵלּוּ, וְלָמָּה יָצָאת? לְהַקִּישׁ אֵלֶיהָ, לוֹמַר לְךָ: מָה שִׂמְלָה מְיוּחֶדֶת, שֶׁיֵּשׁ בָּהּ סִימָנִין וְיֵשׁ לָהּ תּוֹבְעִין, אַף כׇּל דָּבָר שֶׁיֵּשׁ בּוֹ סִימָנִין וְיֵשׁ לוֹ תּוֹבְעִים חַיָּיב לְהַכְרִיז.
human_translation: The garment was also in the generalization all of these And why did it emerge To draw an analogy to it and to say to you: What about a garment? in that there are distinguishing marks concerning it and it has claimants So too any item concerning which there are distinguishing marks and it has claimants obligated to proclaim
llm_translation: The Mishnah also taught: Even a garment was included among all these items. And why did it go out? To compare it, to say to you: Just as a garment is distinctive, in that it has distinguishing marks and is subject to claims, so too, anything that has distinguishing marks and is subject to claims, one is obligated to announce.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאי ״בִּכְלַל כׇּל אֵלּוּ״? אָמַר רָבָא: בִּכְלַל ״כׇּל אֲבֵדַת אָחִיךָ״.
human_translation: in the generalization all of these what Rava said: in the generalization: every lost item of your brother,
llm_translation: Gemara: What is the meaning of "inclusion of all these"? Rava said: Inclusion of "all the lost property of your brother."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: לְמָה לִי דִּכְתַב רַחֲמָנָא ״שׁוֹר״, ״חֲמוֹר״, ״שֶׂה״ וְ״שִׂמְלָה״?
human_translation: Rava says: Why do I that the Merciful One writes An ox, a donkey, a sheep, and a garment?
llm_translation: Rava said: Why did the Merciful One write "ox," "donkey," "sheep," and "garment"?

hebrew_text: צְרִיכִי, דְּאִי כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא שִׂמְלָה, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: הָנֵי מִילֵּי בְּעֵדִים דְּגוּפַהּ וְסִימָנִין דְּגוּפַהּ. אֲבָל חֲמוֹר בְּעֵדִים דְּאוּכָּף וְסִימָנִין דְּאוּכָּף, אֵימָא לָא מַהְדְּרִינַן לֵיהּ, כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא ״חֲמוֹר״ דַּאֲפִילּוּ חֲמוֹר בְּסִימָנֵי הָאוּכָּף.
human_translation: are necessary, As, if the Merciful One had written “garment,” I would say: This matter, applies where witnesses about itself or distinguishing marks concerning itself; but a donkey where witnesses with regard to the saddle or distinguishing marks concerning the saddle say we do not return to the Merciful One writes: “Donkey,” that a donkey even where distinguishing marks the saddle.
llm_translation: I need, for if the Merciful One had written "garment," I would say: these are the matters of its witnesses and the signs of its witnesses. But a donkey with its witnesses and its signs that are being pursued, I would say we do not return it to him, if the Merciful One had written "donkey," even a donkey with the signs of being pursued.

hebrew_text: ״שׁוֹר״ וָ״שֶׂה״, דִּכְתַב רַחֲמָנָא לְמָה לִי? ״שׁוֹר״ – דַּאֲפִילּוּ לְגִיזַּת זְנָבוֹ, וְ״שֶׂה״ – לְגִיזּוֹתָיו. וְלִכְתּוֹב רַחֲמָנָא ״שׁוֹר״, דַּאֲפִילּוּ לְגִיזַּת זְנָבוֹ, וְכׇל שֶׁכֵּן ״שֶׂה״ לְגִיזּוֹתָיו!
human_translation: “ox” and “sheep” that the Merciful One writes, why do I “ox” that even the sheared of its tail; and “sheep” that its sheared And let the Merciful One write “ox,” that even the sheared of its tail, and all the more so that sheared of a sheep.
llm_translation: "Ox" and "lamb," why did the Merciful One write them? "Ox" - even for its tail hairs, and "lamb" - for its wool. And the Merciful One wrote "ox," even for its tail hairs, so certainly "lamb" for its wool!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: ״חֲמוֹר״ דְּבוֹר לְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, וְ״שֶׂה״ דַאֲבֵידָה – לְדִבְרֵי הַכֹּל קַשְׁיָא.
human_translation: Rather, Rava said: “donkey” with regard to Pit, according to Rabbi Yehuda and “sheep” with regard to a lost item, according to everyone, difficult.
llm_translation: Rava said: "Donkey" is according to Rabbi Yehuda, and "sheep" that it got lost - according to everyone it is difficult.

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא לִגְלָלִים הוּא דַּאֲתָא? גְּלָלִים – אַפְקוֹרֵי מַפְקַר לְהוּ. וְדִילְמָא לְסִימָנִין הוּא דַּאֲתָא, דְּאִיבַּעְיָא לַן: סִימָנִין דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא אוֹ דְרַבָּנַן. כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא ״שֶׂה״, דַּאֲפִילּוּ בְּסִימָנִין מַהְדְּרִינַן, וְסִימָנִין דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא.
human_translation: And say comes to dung? dung, renounced its ownership. And perhaps comes to distinguishing marks, as we raised a dilemma: distinguishing marks by Torah law or by rabbinic law? the Merciful One writes: “Sheep” that even on distinguishing marks we return and distinguishing marks by Torah law.
llm_translation: And why is it that he came for "scrolls"? Scrolls - they are open to everyone. And perhaps he came for signs, for we require: signs of Torah or of Rabbinic law. The Merciful One wrote "a lamb," that even with signs we honor, and signs of Torah.

hebrew_text: אָמְרִי: מִדְּקָתָנֵי לְהוּ תַּנָּא, לְסִימָנִין גַּבֵּי שִׂמְלָה, דְּקָתָנֵי: מָה שִׂמְלָה מְיוּחֶדֶת שֶׁיֵּשׁ בָּהּ סִימָנִין וְיֵשׁ לָהּ תּוֹבְעִין – חַיָּיב לְהַכְרִיז, אַף כׇּל דָּבָר שֶׁיֵּשׁ בּוֹ סִימָנִין וְיֵשׁ לוֹ תּוֹבְעִין – חַיָּיב לְהַכְרִיז. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ דְּ״שֶׂה״ לָאו לְסִימָנִין הוּא דַּאֲתָא.
human_translation: say: from that the tanna teaches distinguishing marks together garment. it is taught What about a garment? in that there are distinguishing marks concerning it and it has claimants obligated to proclaim So too any item concerning which there are distinguishing marks and it has claimants obligated to proclaim Conclude from it that “sheep” does not come to distinguishing marks.
llm_translation: They said: From where do we learn that if a Sage taught a law for the purpose of providing signs regarding a garment, as it is taught: "What is a unique garment that has signs in it and one can claim it? - He is obligated to announce it. So too, anything that has signs in it and one can claim it, he is obligated to announce it." Learn from it that "wool" is not considered signs that come to distinguish it.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״אֲשֶׁר תֹּאבַד״ – פְּרָט לַאֲבֵידָה שֶׁאֵין בָּהּ שָׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: ״וּמְצָאתָהּ״ – פְּרָט לַאֲבֵידָה שֶׁאֵין בָּהּ שָׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה.
human_translation: The Sages taught which shall be lost to exclude a lost item in which there is not the value of one peruta , Rabbi Yehuda says and you have found it.” to exclude a lost item in which there is not the value of one peruta .
llm_translation: The sages taught: "When you find" - this is a specification for a lost item that has no identifying mark. Rabbi Yehuda says: "And you found it" - this is a specification for a lost item that has no identifying mark.

hebrew_text: מַאי בֵּינַיְיהוּ? אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: מַשְׁמָעוּת דּוֹרְשִׁין אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ. מָר נָפְקָא לֵיהּ מֵ״אֲשֶׁר תֹּאבַד״ וּמָר נָפְקָא לֵיהּ מִ״וּמְצָאתָהּ״.
human_translation: What between Abaye said: interpretation of the meaning is between Sage, derives it from “Which shall be lost and Sage, derives it from “And you have found it.”
llm_translation: What is the difference between them? Abaye said: The interpretation that they seek is the difference between them. One Master derives it from "that which is lost" and the other Master derives it from "what you have found."

hebrew_text: וּלְמַאן דְּנָפְקָא לֵיהּ מֵ״אֲשֶׁר תֹּאבַד״ הַאי ״וּמְצָאתָהּ״ מַאי עָבֵיד לֵיהּ?
human_translation: And according to who derives from “which shall be lost what does he do with “And you have found it”?
llm_translation: And for the one who benefits from "from that which is lost," what does he do with this "and you shall find it"?

hebrew_text: הַהוּא מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְכִדְרַבְנַאי, דְּאָמַר רַבְנַאי: ״וּמְצָאתָהּ״ – דַּאֲתַאי לִידֵיהּ מַשְׁמַע.
human_translation: that is necessary for in accordance with of Rabbenai. As Rabbenai says “and you have found it” means that when enters his possession.
llm_translation: That one asked of him to Rav Nachman, as Rav Nachman said: "And you shall find it" - that implies it came into his hands.

hebrew_text: וּלְמַאן דְּנָפְקָא לֵיהּ מִ״וּמְצָאתָהּ״, הַאי ״אֲשֶׁר תֹּאבַד״ מַאי עָבֵיד לֵיהּ?
human_translation: And according to who derives “And you have found it,” what does he do with “Which has been lost
llm_translation: And for the one who benefits from "and you shall find it," what does he do with this "which is lost"?

hebrew_text: מִבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְכִדְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹחַאי: מִנַּיִין לַאֲבֵידָה שֶׁשְּׁטָפָהּ נָהָר שֶׁהִיא מוּתֶּרֶת? שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כֵּן תַּעֲשֶׂה לְכׇל אֲבֵדַת אָחִיךָ אֲשֶׁר תֹּאבַד מִמֶּנּוּ וּמְצָאתָהּ״ – מִי שֶׁאֲבוּדָה הֵימֶנּוּ וּמְצוּיָה אֵצֶל כׇּל אָדָם, יָצְתָה זוֹ שֶׁאֲבוּדָה הֵימֶנּוּ וְאֵינָהּ מְצוּיָה אֵצֶל כׇּל אָדָם.
human_translation: that is necessary for in accordance with of Rabbi Yoḥanan. As Rabbi Yoḥanan says in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai: From where with regard to a lost item that the river swept away that it is permitted as it is written: so shall you do with every lost item of your brother, which shall be lost from him, and you have found it” that which is lost from him, but is found by any person. Excluded that which is lost from him and is not found by any person;
llm_translation: He wants according to Rabbi Yochanan. For Rabbi Yochanan said in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yochai: From where do we derive that a lost object that a river washed away is permissible? As it is stated: "So shall you do to every lost thing of your brother that may be lost from him and you find it" - one that its loss is from him and it is found by everyone, this is one that its loss is from him but it is not found by everyone.

hebrew_text: וְאִידַּךְ, הָא דְּרַבְנַאי מְנָא לֵיהּ? נָפְקָא לֵיהּ מִ״וּמְצָאתָהּ״.
human_translation: And the other from where of Rabbenai derives it from “and you have found it.”
llm_translation: And the other one, this that Rav Nachman said to him? He derived it from "and you found her."

hebrew_text: וְאִידַּךְ, הָא דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מְנָא לֵיהּ? נָפְקָא לֵיהּ ״מִמֶּנּוּ״. וְאִידָּךְ? ״מִמֶּנּוּ״ לָא מַשְׁמַע לֵיהּ.
human_translation: And the other from where of Rabbi Yoḥanan that derives it “from him,” And for the other he does not learn “from him.”
llm_translation: And the other opinion is, this that Rabbi Yochanan attributes it to him? It emerges to him "from him." And the other? "From him" does not sound to him.

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר: פְּרוּטָה שֶׁהוּזְלָה אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ, מַאן דְּאָמַר מֵ״אֲשֶׁר תֹּאבַד״ – אִיכָּא, וּמַאן דְּאָמַר מִ״וּמְצָאתָהּ״ – לֵיכָּא.
human_translation: Rava said: between them one peruta that was devalued the one who says from “which shall be lost there is And the one who says from “And you have found it,” there is no
llm_translation: Rava said: A coin that was lost, there is a distinction between them. One who says "from when it is lost" - there is, and one who says "when you find it" - there is not.

hebrew_text: וּלְמַאן דְּאָמַר ״אֲשֶׁר תֹּאבַד״ – הָא בָּעֵינַן ״וּמְצָאתָהּ״, וְלֵיכָּא!
human_translation: But according to the one who says from “which shall be lost do we not require “and you have found it”? And it is not
llm_translation: And for the one who says "that it shall be lost" - here we require "and you shall find it," and it is not there!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: פְּרוּטָה שֶׁהוּקְרָה אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ, מַאן דְּאָמַר ״וּמְצָאתָהּ״ – אִיכָּא, וּמַאן דְּאָמַר ״אֲשֶׁר תֹּאבַד״ – לֵיכָּא.
human_translation: Rather, between them one peruta that appreciated in value the one who says “And you have found it,” there is And the one who says from “Which shall be lost there is no
llm_translation: Rather: a coin that was found between them, one who says "and you found it" - it is there, and one who says "that which is lost" - it is not there.

hebrew_text: וּלְמַאן דְּאָמַר ״וּמְצָאתָהּ״, הָא בָּעֵינַן ״אֲשֶׁר תֹּאבַד״ וְלֵיכָּא!
human_translation: But according to the one who says from “and you have found it,” do we not require “which shall be lost And it is not
llm_translation: And for the one who says "and you shall find it," we require "that it be lost," and it is not there!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא פְּרוּטָה שֶׁהוּקְרָה וְהוּזְלָה וְחָזְרָה וְהוּקְרָה אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ. מַאן דְּאָמַר ״אֲשֶׁר תֹּאבַד״ – אִיכָּא. וּמַאן דְּאָמַר ״וּמְצָאתָהּ״ – בָּעֵינַן דְּאִית בַּהּ שִׁיעוּר מְצִיאָה מִשְּׁעַת אֲבֵידָה וְעַד שְׁעַת מְצִיאָה.
human_translation: Rather, between them one peruta that appreciated in value and was devalued and appreciated in value the one who says “Which shall be lost there is And the one who says “And you have found it,” we require that there will be the value measure a lost item, from the time of loss and until the time of finding,
llm_translation: Rather, a coin that was lost, and was found, and was lost again, and was found again, there is a distinction between them. One who says "that it is lost" - there is a distinction. And one who says "and you find it" - we require that there is a measurable time from the moment of loss until the moment of finding.

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: סִימָנִין דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא אוֹ דְרַבָּנַן? מַאי נָפְקָא מִינַּהּ?
human_translation: A dilemma was raised distinguishing marks by Torah law or by rabbinic law? What difference is
llm_translation: He asked them: Are the signs of the Torah or of the Rabbis? What is derived from it?

hebrew_text: לְאַהְדּוֹרֵי גֵּט אִשָּׁה בְּסִימָנִים. אִי אָמְרַתְּ דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא – מַהְדְּרִינַן, וְאִי אָמְרַתְּ דְּרַבָּנַן – כִּי עֲבוּד רַבָּנַן תַּקַּנְתָּא בְּמָמוֹנָא, אֲבָל בְּאִיסּוּרָא – לָא עֲבוּד רַבָּנַן תַּקַּנְתָּא.
human_translation: with regard to returning the bill of divorce of a woman on the basis of distinguishing marks. If you say by Torah law, we return But if you say by rabbinic law, when the Sages institute an ordinance, with regard to monetary matters but with regard to ritual matters, the Sages do not institute an ordinance.
llm_translation: For future generations, a woman may be divorced with signs. If you say it is from the Torah - we validate it, and if you say it is from the Rabbis - because the Rabbis' work is established with money, but with matters of prohibition - the Rabbis' work is not established.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: אַף הַשִּׂמְלָה הָיְתָה בִּכְלַל כׇּל אֵלּוּ, וְלָמָּה יָצָאת לְהַקִּישׁ אֵלֶיהָ? וְלוֹמַר לְךָ: מָה שִׂמְלָה מְיוּחֶדֶת שֶׁיֵּשׁ לָהּ סִימָנִין וְיֵשׁ לָהּ תּוֹבְעִין חַיָּיב לְהַכְרִיז, אַף כׇּל דָּבָר שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ סִימָנִין וְיֵשׁ לוֹ תּוֹבְעִין חַיָּיב לְהַכְרִיז. תַּנָּא: תּוֹבְעִין אִצְטְרִיכָא לֵיהּ, סִימָנִין כְּדִי נַסְבַהּ.
human_translation: Come hear The garment was also in the generalization all of these And why did it emerge To draw an analogy to it and to say to you: What about a garment? in that there are distinguishing marks concerning it and it has claimants obligated to proclaim So too any item concerning which there are distinguishing marks and it has claimants obligated to proclaim was necessary for the tanna claimants, cited of distinguishing marks for no reason,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Come and hear: Even a garment was included among all these. And why did you go out to compare it to them? And to say to you: Just as a unique garment that has distinguishing marks and claims must be announced, so too, anything that has distinguishing marks and claims must be announced. It was taught: Claims require it, distinguishing marks in order to elevate it." English translation:

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: חֲמוֹר בְּסִימָנֵי אוּכָּף. אֵימָא ״בְּעֵדֵי אוּכָּף״.
human_translation: Come hear a donkey on the basis of distinguishing marks of the saddle say: on the basis of witnesses the saddle
llm_translation: Come and hear: A donkey with a saddle. Say: "With the utensils of the saddle."

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: ״וְהָיָה עִמְּךָ עַד דְּרֹשׁ אָחִיךָ אֹתוֹ״. וְכִי תַּעֲלֶה עַל דַּעְתְּךָ שֶׁיִּתְּנֶנּוּ לוֹ קוֹדֶם שֶׁיִּדְרְשֶׁנּוּ?! אֶלָּא דׇּרְשֵׁהוּ אִם רַמַּאי הוּא אוֹ אֵינוֹ רַמַּאי.
human_translation: Come hear and it shall be with you until your brother claims [ derosh ] it, Would it enter your mind that he would give to him before he claims it? Rather, Scrutinize him [ darshehu ] whether is a swindler whether he is not a swindler.
llm_translation: "Come and hear: 'And it shall be with you until your brother seeks it.' Do you think that you should give it to him before he seeks it?! Rather, investigate whether he is deceitful or not deceitful."

hebrew_text: מַאי לָאו בְּסִימָנִין? לֹא, בְּעֵדִים.
human_translation: What, is it not on the basis of distinguishing marks No, on the basis of witnesses.
llm_translation: What is meant by "not with signs"? Not with witnesses.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: אֵין מְעִידִין אֶלָּא עַל פַּרְצוּף הַפָּנִים עִם הַחוֹטֶם, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁיֵּשׁ סִימָנִין בְּגוּפוֹ וּבְכֵלָיו.
human_translation: Come hear One testifies only about the countenance [ partzuf ] of the face with the nose, Although there are distinguishing marks on his body and on his garments,
llm_translation: Come and hear: We only testify based on the appearance of the face with the nose, even though there are signs on his body and limbs.

hebrew_text: שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ סִימָנִין לָאו דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא! אָמְרִי: גּוּפוֹ – דְּאָרוֹךְ וְגוּץ. כֵּלָיו – דְּחָיְישִׁינַן לִשְׁאֵלָה.
human_translation: Conclude from it distinguishing marks is not by Torah law. say his body that tall or short, his as we are concerned about a loan,
llm_translation: Listen, from it we can infer signs not of the Torah! They said: His body - that it is long and thick. His kidneys - that we are concerned for inquiry.

hebrew_text: אִי חָיְישִׁינַן לִשְׁאֵלָה, חֲמוֹר בְּסִימָנֵי אוּכָּף הֵיכִי מַהְדְּרִינַן? אָמְרִי: אוּכָּף, לָא שָׁאיְלִי אִינָשֵׁי אוּכָּפָא, מִשּׁוּם דִּמְסַקֵּב לֵיהּ לַחֲמָרָא.
human_translation: If we are concerned about a loan, how do we return a donkey on the basis of distinguishing marks of the saddle; say People do not borrow a saddle because wound the donkey.
llm_translation: If we are concerned about asking a question, how do we honor a donkey with the signs of a yoke? They said: A yoke, people do not ask about a yoke, because it leads to the matter of the donkey.

hebrew_text: אִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: כֵּלָיו בְּחִיוָּרֵי וּבְסוּמְקִי.
human_translation: If you wish, say his garments where white or red,
llm_translation: If you wish, say: his kidneys in the courtyard and in the depths.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא הָא דְּתַנְיָא: מְצָאוֹ קָשׁוּר בְּכִיס אוֹ בְּאַרְנָקִי וּבְטַבַּעַת, אוֹ שֶׁמְּצָאוֹ בֵּין כֵּלָיו, אֲפִילּוּ לִזְמַן מְרוּבֶּה – כָּשֵׁר. וְאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ חָיְישִׁינַן לִשְׁאֵלָה, כִּי מְצָאוֹ קָשׁוּר בְּכִיס אַמַּאי כָּשֵׁר? נֵיחוּשׁ לִשְׁאֵלָה!
human_translation: But that which is taught If found bound to pouch, or purse, or ring, or if he found it among his garments, even a long time valid. And if it enters your mind we are concerned about a loan, when he found bound to pouch, why is it valid? Let us be concerned about a loan
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Rather, this that was taught: If one found it tied in a pocket or in a purse or in a ring, or if he found it between his garments, even to invite many – it is valid. And if you would say we are concerned about a question, for if he found it tied in a pocket, why is it valid? We are concerned about a question!

hebrew_text: אָמְרִי: כִּיס וְאַרְנָקִי וְטַבַּעַת לָא מַשְׁאֲלִי אִינָשֵׁי. כִּיס וְאַרְנָקִי – מִשּׁוּם דִּמְסַמְּנִי, וְטַבַּעַת – מִשּׁוּם דִּמְזַיֵּיף.
human_translation: say people do not loan a pouch, a purse, or ring pouch and purse due to that it portends And ring due to that forge
llm_translation: They said: A purse, a wallet, and a ring are not borrowed items. A purse and a wallet - because they mark me, and a ring - because it deceives.

hebrew_text: לֵימָא כְתַנָּאֵי: אֵין מְעִידִין עַל הַשּׁוּמָא, וְאֶלְעָזָר בֶּן מַהֲבַאי אוֹמֵר: מְעִידִין עַל הַשּׁוּמָא. מַאי לָאו בְּהָא קָמִיפַּלְגִי? דְּתַנָּא קַמָּא סָבַר: סִימָנִין דְּרַבָּנַן, וְאֶלְעָזָר בֶּן מַהֲבַאי סָבַר: סִימָנִין דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא.
human_translation: Let us say the subject of tanna’im , One does not testify on the basis of a mole And Elazar ben Mahavai says: One testifies on the basis of a mole. What, is it not with regard to this that they disagree; as the first tanna holds distinguishing marks by rabbinic law and Elazar ben Mahavai holds distinguishing marks by Torah law.
llm_translation: Let us say like the Tannaim: One does not testify regarding a signet ring, and Elazar ben Mahavai says: One does testify regarding a signet ring. What is the reason they do not argue about this? For the first Tanna holds: Signs of the Rabbis, and Elazar ben Mahavai holds: Signs of the Torah.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא סִימָנִין דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא, וְהָכָא בְּשׁוּמָא מְצוּיָה בְּבֶן גִּילוֹ קָמִיפַּלְגִי. מָר סָבַר: שׁוּמָא מְצוּיָה בְּבֶן גִּילוֹ, וּמָר סָבַר: שׁוּמָא אֵינָהּ מְצוּיָה בְּבֶן גִּילוֹ.
human_translation: Rava said: everyone distinguishing marks by Torah law, and here, with regard to a mole is found on one’s contemporary, they disagree. One Sage, holds a mole is found on one’s contemporary and one Sage, holds that a mole is not found on one’s contemporary,
llm_translation: Rava said: In all the world, signs of the Torah, and here, with Shuma being found in Ben Gilo, they disagree. One Master thinks: Shuma is found in Ben Gilo, and one Master thinks: Shuma is not found in Ben Gilo.

hebrew_text: אִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא שׁוּמָא אֵינָהּ מְצוּיָה בְּבֶן גִּילוֹ, וְהָכָא בְּסִימָנִין הָעֲשׂוּיִן לְהִשְׁתַּנּוֹת לְאַחַר מִיתָה קָמִיפַּלְגִי. מָר סָבַר: סִימָנִין עֲשׂוּיִם לְהִשְׁתַּנּוֹת לְאַחַר מִיתָה. וּמָר סָבַר: סִימָנִין אֵין עֲשׂוּיִם לְהִשְׁתַּנּוֹת לְאַחַר מִיתָה.
human_translation: If you wish, say everyone a mole is not found on one’s contemporary, and here with regard to distinguishing marks is apt to change after death they disagree. One Sage, holds distinguishing marks is apt to change after death, and one Sage, holds distinguishing marks is not apt to change after death,
llm_translation: If you wish, say: Perhaps the entire world is named Shuma, she is not found in Ben Gilo, and here, in signs made to change after death, they disagree. Mar thought: Signs are made to change after death. And Mar thought: Signs are not made to change after death.

hebrew_text: אִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא שׁוּמָא אֵינָהּ עֲשׂוּיָה לְהִשְׁתַּנּוֹת לְאַחַר מִיתָה, וְסִימָנִין דְּרַבָּנַן, וְהָכָא בְּשׁוּמָא סִימָן מוּבְהָק הוּא קָמִיפַּלְגִי. מָר סָבַר: שׁוּמָא סִימָן מוּבְהָק הוּא, וּמָר סָבַר: שׁוּמָא לָאו סִימָן מוּבְהָק הוּא.
human_translation: If you wish, say everyone a mole is not apt to change after death, and distinguishing marks is by rabbinic law, and here with regard to a mole is a clear-cut distinguishing mark they disagree. One Sage, holds a mole is a clear-cut distinguishing mark and one Sage, holds that a mole is not a clear-cut distinguishing mark.
llm_translation: If you wish, say: Perhaps the entire world is named Shuma, it is not destined to change after death, and the signs are of the Rabbis. And here in Shuma, it is a clear sign that he is in doubt. Mar thought: Shuma is a clear sign, and Mar thought: Perhaps it is not a clear sign.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: אִם תִּמְצֵי לוֹמַר סִימָנִין לָאו דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא, הֵיכִי מַהְדְּרִינַן אֲבֵידְתָּא בְּסִימָנִין? דְּנִיחָא לֵיהּ לְמוֹצֵא אֲבֵידָה דְּנַהְדַּר בְּסִימָנִין, כִּי הֵיכִי דְּכִי אָבְדָה לֵיהּ לְדִידֵהּ נָמֵי נַהְדְּרוּ לֵיהּ בְּסִימָנִין.
human_translation: Rava says: If you say distinguishing marks is not by Torah law, how do we return a lost item on the basis of distinguishing marks; as satisfactory to the finder of a lost item to return on the basis of distinguishing marks, so that when is lost from him will return it to him on the basis of distinguishing marks as well.
llm_translation: Rava said: If you might say that signs are not from the Torah, how do we return a lost item with signs? We leave it for him to find his lost item that is adorned with signs, so that when he loses it again, others will return it to him with signs.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב סָפְרָא לְרָבָא: וְכִי אָדָם עוֹשֶׂה טוֹבָה לְעַצְמוֹ בְּמָמוֹן שֶׁאֵינוֹ שֶׁלּוֹ?
human_translation: Rav Safra said to Rava: But can a person perform benefit for himself with property that is not his?
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Safra to Rava: And can a person do good for himself with money that is not his?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא נִיחָא לֵיהּ לְבַעַל אֲבֵידָה לְמֵיהַב סִימָנִין וּלְמִשְׁקְלֵיהּ. מִידָּע יָדַע דְּעֵדִים לֵית לֵיהּ, וּמֵימָר אָמַר: כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא יָדְעִי סִימָנִין מוּבְהָקִים דִּידַהּ, וַאֲנָא יָהֵיבְנָא סִימָנִין מוּבְהָקִים דִּידַהּ וְשָׁקֵלְנָא לַהּ.
human_translation: Rather, satisfactory to the owner of the lost item to provide distinguishing marks and take He knows that he has no witnesses and he says: No one knows clear-cut distinguishing marks And I will provide clear-cut distinguishing marks, and I will take
llm_translation: Rather, it is preferable for the owner of a lost object to provide identifying marks and to weigh it. Immediately he knows that witnesses are not available to him, and he says: "All the people of the world do not know the distinguishing marks of this item, but I will provide distinguishing marks of this item and weigh it for her."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא הָא דִּתְנַן, רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: אֶחָד הַלֹּוֶה מִשְּׁלֹשָׁה – יַחְזִיר לַלֹּוֶה, שְׁלֹשָׁה שֶׁלָּווּ מִן הָאֶחָד – יַחְזִיר לַמַּלְוֶה. נִיחָא לֵיהּ לְלֹוֶה לְאַהְדּוֹרֵי לֵיהּ לְמַלְוֶה?
human_translation: But that which we learned Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: one who borrowed from three he must return to the debtor. three who borrowed from one he must return to the creditor. satisfactory to the debtor to returned to the creditor,
llm_translation: Rather, this that we learned: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: One who borrows from three - shall return to the lender, three who borrowed from one - shall return to the borrower. Is it preferable for the lender to lend to others or for the borrower to borrow?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָתָם סְבָרָא הוּא, אֶחָד הַלֹּוֶה מִשְּׁלֹשָׁה יַחְזִיר לַלֹּוֶה – דְּגַבֵּי לֹוֶה שְׁכִיחִי, גַּבֵּי מַלְוֶה לָא שְׁכִיחִי. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ מִלֹּוֶה נְפוּל. שְׁלֹשָׁה שֶׁלָּווּ מֵאֶחָד יַחְזִיר לַמַּלְוֶה – דְּגַבֵּי מַלְוֶה שְׁכִיחִי, גַּבֵּי לֹוֶה לָא שְׁכִיחִי.
human_translation: said to There, is logical reasoning. one who borrowed from three he shall return to the debtor, is found with debtor is not found with a creditor, Conclude from it that fell from the debtor three who borrowed from one he shall return to the creditor, is found with creditor is not found with a debtor,
llm_translation: He said to him: There it is a logical reasoning, one who borrows from three should return to the lender - because regarding the lender it is common, but regarding the borrower it is not common. Learn from it that the borrower is at a disadvantage. Three who borrowed from one should return to the lender - because regarding the lender it is common, but regarding the borrower it is not common.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא הָא דִּתְנַן: מָצָא תַּכְרִיךְ שֶׁל שְׁטָרוֹת אוֹ אֲגוּדָּה שֶׁל שְׁטָרוֹת – הֲרֵי זֶה יַחְזִיר, הָכִי נָמֵי דְּנִיחָא לֵיהּ לְלֹוֶה לְאַהְדּוֹרֵי לֵיהּ לְמַלְוֶה?
human_translation: But that which we learned found a roll of documents or a bundle of documents, he shall return so too, satisfactory to the debtor to returned to the creditor?
llm_translation: Rather, this that we learned: If one finds a bundle of promissory notes or a bundle of receipts of promissory notes - behold, he shall return it. Is it so that it is proper for him to lend it to others in order to lend it back to him?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: סִימָנִין דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְהָיָה עִמְּךָ עַד דְּרֹשׁ אָחִיךָ אֹתוֹ״, וְכִי תַּעֲלֶה עַל דַּעְתְּךָ שֶׁיִּתְּנֶנּוּ קוֹדֶם שֶׁיִּדְרְשֶׁנּוּ?! אֶלָּא דׇּרְשֵׁהוּ אִם רַמַּאי הוּא אוֹ אֵינוֹ רַמַּאי. לָאו בְּסִימָנִין? שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: Rather, Rava said: distinguishing marks by Torah law, as it is written: and it shall be with you until your brother claims [ derosh ] it, Would it enter your mind that he would give to him before he claims it? Rather, Scrutinize him [ darshehu ] whether is a swindler whether he is not a swindler. What, is it not on the basis of distinguishing marks Conclude from it
llm_translation: Rather, Rava said: Signs of the Torah, as it is written: "And it shall be with you until your brother seeks it." And would you suggest that you should offer it to him before he seeks it?! Rather, investigate whether he is a deceiver or not. Is it not through signs? Learn from it.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: אִם תִּמְצֵי לוֹמַר סִימָנִין דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא. ״אִם תִּמְצֵי לוֹמַר״?! הָא פְּשִׁיט לֵיהּ סִימָנִין דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא! מִשּׁוּם דְּאִיכָּא לְמֵימַר כִּדְשַׁנִּינַן.
human_translation: Rava says: If you say distinguishing marks by Torah law. If you say? Didn’t he resolve distinguishing marks by Torah law? due to that one could say as we explained
llm_translation: Rava said: If you want to say signs of the Torah. "If you want to say"?! It is obvious to him signs of the Torah! Because there is to say as we say.

hebrew_text: סִימָנִין וְסִימָנִין – יַנִּיחַ. סִימָנִין וְעֵדִים – יִנָּתֵן לְבַעַל הָעֵדִים. סִימָנִין וְסִימָנִין וְעֵד אֶחָד – עֵד אֶחָד כְּמַאן דְּלֵיתֵיהּ דָּמֵי, וְיַנִּיחַ.
human_translation: distinguishing marks and distinguishing marks shall leave distinguishing marks and witnesses shall be given to with witnesses. distinguishing marks and distinguishing marks and one witness one witness is as one who is not and shall leave
llm_translation: Signs and signs - he shall leave. Signs and witnesses - shall be given to the owner of the witnesses. Signs and signs and one witness - one witness is like one who does not have, and he shall leave.

hebrew_text: עֵדֵי אֲרִיגָה וְעֵדֵי נְפִילָה – תִּנָּתֵן לְעֵדֵי נְפִילָה, דְּאָמְרִינַן זַבּוֹנֵי זַבְּנַהּ וּמֵאִינִישׁ אַחֲרִינָא נְפַל.
human_translation: witnesses woven and witnesses fallen shall be given to witnesses fallen as we say sold and fell from another person,
llm_translation: Witnesses of weaving and witnesses of falling - should be given to witnesses of falling, as we say, "The builders have built it, and another man will fall."

hebrew_text: מִדַּת אׇרְכּוֹ וּמִדַּת רׇחְבּוֹ – תִּנָּתֵן לְמִדַּת אׇרְכּוֹ, דְּמִדַּת רׇחְבּוֹ שַׁעוֹרֵי קָא מְשַׁעַר לַהּ כַּד מִכַּסֵּי לַהּ מָרַהּ וְקָאֵי, וּמִדַּת אׇרְכּוֹ לָא מִשְׁתַּעַר לֵהּ.
human_translation: the measure of length of and the measure of its width, shall be given to measure of its length, as one can approximate the measure of its width when its owner dons and stands, but the measure of its length cannot be approximated
llm_translation: Measurement of its length and measurement of its width - the measurement of its length should be given precedence, as the measurement of its width is like the gates of a corral that close it off and stand, but the measurement of its length does not close it off.

hebrew_text: מִדַּת אׇרְכּוֹ וּמִדַּת רׇחְבּוֹ וּמִדַּת גַּמָּיו – יִנָּתֵן לְמִדַּת אׇרְכּוֹ וְרׇחְבּוֹ.
human_translation: the measure of its length and the measure of its width and the measure of its gamma, shall be given to the measure of its length and its width
llm_translation: Measure of its length and measure of its width and measure of its height - the measure of its length and width shall be given.

hebrew_text: מִדַּת אׇרְכּוֹ וּמִדַּת רׇחְבּוֹ וּמִדַּת מִשְׁקְלוֹתָיו – יִנָּתֵן לְמִדַּת מִשְׁקְלוֹתָיו.
human_translation: the measure of its length and the measure of its width and the measure of its weight, shall be given to the measure of its weight,
llm_translation: Measure of his length and measure of his width and measure of his weight - should be given to measure of his weight.

hebrew_text: הוּא אוֹמֵר סִימָנֵי הַגֵּט וְהִיא אוֹמֶרֶת סִימָנֵי הַגֵּט – יִנָּתֵן לָהּ. בְּמַאי? אִילֵימָא בְּמִדַּת אׇרְכּוֹ וְרׇחְבּוֹ, דִּלְמָא בַּהֲדֵי דְּנָקֵיט לֵיהּ חֲזַיְתֵיהּ. אֶלָּא – נֶקֶב יֵשׁ בּוֹ בְּצַד אוֹת פְּלוֹנִי.
human_translation: states distinguishing marks of the bill of divorce and states distinguishing marks of the bill of divorce shall be given to With what If we say with the measure of its height and its width, perhaps while was holding she saw it, Rather, there is a perforation alongside such and such letter
llm_translation: He says, "The identifying marks of the bill of divorce," and she says, "The identifying marks of the bill of divorce" - it should be given to her. With what? If you say, with the measure of its length and width, perhaps she will take it with her and see it. Rather - it contains a specific letter on the side of a certain individual.

hebrew_text: הוּא אוֹמֵר סִימָנֵי הַחוּט, וְהִיא אוֹמֶרֶת סִימָנֵי הַחוּט – יִנָּתֵן לָהּ. בְּמַאי? אִילֵימָא בְּחִיוָּרָא וּבְסוּמָּקָא, וְדִלְמָא בַּהֲדֵי דְּנָקֵיט לֵיהּ חֲזַיְתֵיהּ? אֶלָּא בְּמִדַּת אׇרְכּוֹ.
human_translation: states distinguishing marks of the string and she states distinguishing marks of the string, shall be given to With what If we say by white or by red, perhaps while was holding she saw Rather, the measure of its length.
llm_translation: He says "the signs of the thread," and she says "the signs of the thread" - it should be given to her. With what? If you say with a needle and with a pin, perhaps when she takes it she will see it? Rather, with a measuring rod.

hebrew_text: הוּא אוֹמֵר בַּחֲפִיסָה וְהִיא אוֹמֶרֶת בַּחֲפִיסָה – יִנָּתֵן לוֹ. מַאי טַעְמָא? מִידָּע יָדְעָה דְּכֹל מָה דְּאִית לֵיהּ בַּחֲפִיסָה הוּא דְּמַנַּח לֵיהּ.
human_translation: states in a case, and states in a case, shall be given to What is the reason? she knows that he places any that he has in the case.
llm_translation: He says in a whisper, and she says in a whisper - it shall be given to him. What is the reason? She knows that anything that is in the whisper, he puts it down.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ וְעַד מָתַי חַיָּיב לְהַכְרִיז? עַד כְּדֵי שֶׁיֵּדְעוּ בּוֹ שְׁכֵנָיו, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: שָׁלֹשׁ רְגָלִים, וְאַחַר הָרֶגֶל הָאַחֲרוֹן שִׁבְעָה יָמִים, כְּדֵי שֶׁיֵּלֵךְ לְבֵיתוֹ שְׁלֹשָׁה, וְיַחְזוֹר שְׁלֹשָׁה, וְיַכְרִיז יוֹם אֶחָד.
human_translation: And until when obligated to proclaim until that the neighbors will know of its the statement of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda says: three pilgrimage Festivals and seven days after the last pilgrimage Festivals, so that will go to his home, three and will return three and proclaim one day.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: Until when is one obligated to announce? Until his neighbors are aware of it, the words of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda says: Three festivals, and after the last festival, seven days, so that he may go to his home for three days, return for three days, and announce for one day.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנָא: שְׁכֵנֵי אֲבֵידָה. מַאי שְׁכֵנֵי אֲבֵידָה? אִילֵימָא שְׁכֵינִים דְּבַעַל אֲבֵידָה? אִי יָדַע לֵיהּ לֵיזוֹל וְלַהְדְּרַיהּ נִהֲלֵיהּ! אֶלָּא שְׁכֵנֵי מָקוֹם שֶׁנִּמְצֵאת בּוֹ אֲבֵידָה.
human_translation: taught: neighbors of the lost item What Neighbors of the lost item? If we say neighbors of the owner of the lost item, if knows let him go and return it to him. Rather, neighbors of the place where the lost item was found.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Gemara: Tanah: Shekhenai Avedah. Mai Shekhenai Avedah? Ileima Shekhenim deBa'al Avedah? Iyada Lei Leizol veLahdari Lei Nehalei! Ella Shekhenai Makom Shenimtzeit Bo Avedah." English translation: "Gemara: It was taught: Neighbors of a lost object. What are neighbors of a lost object? Perhaps the neighbors of the owner of the lost object? If he knows, let him go and return it to him! Rather, neighbors of the place where the lost object is found."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: כּוּ׳.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says:
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: "Ku."

hebrew_text: וּרְמִינְהוּ: בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה בִּמְרַחְשְׁוָן שׁוֹאֲלִין אֶת הַגְּשָׁמִים. רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: בְּשִׁבְעָה בּוֹ, שֶׁהוּא חֲמִישָּׁה עָשָׂר יוֹם אַחַר הֶחָג, כְּדֵי שֶׁיַּגִּיעַ אַחֲרוֹן שֶׁבְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל לִנְהַר פְּרָת!
human_translation: raises a contradiction On the third of Marḥeshvan one request rain Rabban Gamliel says: on the seventh of which is fifteen days after the festival so that last who are in Eretz Yisrael can reach the Euphrates River
llm_translation: And they asked: On the third of Marḥeshvan, one inquires about the rains. Rabban Gamliel says: On the seventh of it, which is fifteen days after the festival, so that the latter rain in the land of Israel may arrive!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: לָא קַשְׁיָא, כָּאן – בְּמִקְדָּשׁ רִאשׁוֹן, כָּאן – בְּמִקְדָּשׁ שֵׁנִי.
human_translation: Rav Yosef says: not difficult. Here, during the First Temple there, during the Second Temple
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: Not difficult. Here - in the First Temple, here - in the Second Temple.

hebrew_text: בְּמִקְדָּשׁ רִאשׁוֹן, דִּנְפִישִׁי יִשְׂרָאֵל טוּבָא, דִּכְתִיב בְּהוּ: ״יְהוּדָה וְיִשְׂרָאֵל רַבִּים כַּחוֹל אֲשֶׁר עַל הַיָּם לְרַב״ – בָּעֵינַן כּוּלֵּי הַאי. בְּמִקְדָּשׁ שֵׁנִי, דְּלָא נְפִישִׁי יִשְׂרָאֵל טוּבָא, דִּכְתִיב בְּהוּ: ״כׇּל הַקָּהָל כְּאֶחָד אַרְבַּע רִבּוֹא אַלְפַּיִם שְׁלֹשׁ מֵאוֹת שִׁשִּׁים״ – לָא בָּעֵינַן כּוּלֵּי הַאי.
human_translation: During the First Temple when the Jewish people were very numerous, as it is written with regard to them: “Judea and Israel were many, as the sand that is by the sea in multitude, we need that much During the Second Temple when the Jewish people were not very numerous, as it is written: “The whole congregation together was forty and two thousand three hundred and sixty” we do not need that much
llm_translation: In the First Temple, the greatness of Israel was abundant, as it is written: "Judah and Israel were many, like the sand by the sea in multitude" - we require all of this. In the Second Temple, the greatness of Israel was not abundant, as it is written: "All the congregation together was forty-two thousand three hundred and sixty" - we do not require all of this.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: וְהָא כְּתִיב ״וַיֵּשְׁבוּ הַכֹּהֲנִים וְהַלְוִיִּם וְגוֹ׳ וְהַמְשֹׁרְרִים וְהַשּׁוֹעֲרִים וְכׇל יִשְׂרָאֵל בְּעָרֵיהֶם״.
human_translation: Abaye said to But isn’t it written: “So the priests, and the Levites, and the singers, and the porters, and all Israel in their cities”
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye: But is it not written, "And the priests and the Levites, etc., and the singers and the gatekeepers and all Israel in their cities"?

hebrew_text: וְכֵיוָן דְּהָכִי הוּא, אִפְּכָא מִסְתַּבְּרָא: מִקְדָּשׁ רִאשׁוֹן, דִּנְפִישִׁי יִשְׂרָאֵל טוּבָא, דִּמְצַוַּות עָלְמָא, וּמִשְׁתַּכְחִי שְׁיָירָתָא דְּאָזְלִי בֵּין בִּימָמָא וּבֵין בְּלֵילְיָא – לָא בָּעֵינַן כּוּלֵּי הַאי, וְסַגִּי בִּתְלָתָא יוֹמָא. מִקְדָּשׁ שֵׁנִי, דְּלָא נְפִישִׁי יִשְׂרָאֵל טוּבָא, וְלָא מְצַוַּות עָלְמָא, וְלָא מִשְׁתַּכְחִי שְׁיָירָתָא דְּאָזְלִי בֵּין בִּימָמָא וּבֵין בְּלֵילְיָא – בָּעֵינַן כּוּלֵּי הַאי.
human_translation: And since that the opposite is reasonable. First Temple when the Jewish people were very numerous when everyone was in groups, and caravans found that traveled both during the day and during the night, we do not need that much and three days suffice. Second Temple when the Jewish people were not very numerous and when everyone was not in groups, and therefore, caravans not found that traveled both during the day and during the night, we need that much
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And since this is the case, it is more logical: the First Temple, which was very beloved to Israel, as it had eternal commandments, and the Divine Presence would dwell there both by day and by night - we do not require all this, and it is enough for three days. The Second Temple, which was not as beloved to Israel, and did not have eternal commandments, and the Divine Presence did not dwell there both by day and by night - we require all this.

hebrew_text: רָבָא אֲמַר: לָא שְׁנָא בְּמִקְדָּשׁ רִאשׁוֹן וְלָא שְׁנָא בְּמִקְדָּשׁ שֵׁנִי, לֹא הִטְרִיחוּ רַבָּנַן בַּאֲבֵדָה יוֹתֵר מִדַּאי.
human_translation: Rava said: is no different during the First Temple and is no different during the Second Temple the Sages did not trouble excessively in a lost item
llm_translation: Rava said: It is no different in the First Temple than in the Second Temple; the Rabbis did not trouble themselves excessively with lost property beyond what is necessary.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבִינָא: שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ כִּי מַכְרֵיז, גְּלִימָא מַכְרֵיז. דְּאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ ״אֲבֵידְתָּא״ מַכְרֵיז, בָּעֵינַן לְמִטְפֵּי לֵיהּ חֲדָא יוֹמָא לְעַיּוֹנֵי בְּמָאנֵיהּ. אֶלָּא שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: גְּלִימָא מַכְרֵיז. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: Ravina says: Learn from when proclaims he proclaims a cloak. As, if it enters your mind proclaims a lost item we need to increase one day to examine his vessels. Rather, learn from it proclaims a cloak. Learn from it
llm_translation: Ravina said: Hear from it that when he proclaims, the cloak proclaims. For if your intention is "lost item," we require that on the following day he announce in his place. Rather, hear from it: the cloak proclaims. Hear from it.

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא ״אֲבֵידְתָּא״ מַכְרֵיז, לֹא הִטְרִיחוּ רַבָּנַן בַּאֲבֵידָה יוֹתֵר מִדַּאי.
human_translation: Rava said: Even you say proclaims lost item, the Sages did not trouble excessively in a lost item
llm_translation: Rava said: Even if one were to say "aveidta" (lost item), the Rabbis did not trouble themselves excessively with the lost item more than necessary.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: רֶגֶל רִאשׁוֹן אוֹמֵר רֶגֶל רִאשׁוֹן, רֶגֶל שֵׁנִי אוֹמֵר רֶגֶל שֵׁנִי, רֶגֶל שְׁלִישִׁי אוֹמֵר סְתָם.
human_translation: The Sages taught first pilgrimage Festival says: the first pilgrimage Festival second pilgrimage Festival says: the second pilgrimage Festival the third pilgrimage Festival, says without specification
llm_translation: The Sages taught: The first foot says the first foot, the second foot says the second foot, the third foot says "stam."

hebrew_text: וְאַמַּאי? לֵימָא רֶגֶל שְׁלִישִׁי! דְּלָא אָתֵי לְאִחַלּוֹפֵי בְּשֵׁנִי. שֵׁנִי נָמֵי
human_translation: And why let say third pilgrimage Festival. that not come to confuse with the second the second too,
llm_translation: And why? Let us say the third foot! For it does not come to exchange with the second. The second, indeed.

hebrew_text: אַתְיָא לְאִחַלּוֹפֵי בְּרִאשׁוֹן! הָא קָא אָתֵי רֶגֶל שְׁלִישִׁי.
human_translation: come to confuse with the first won’t come third pilgrimage Festival,
llm_translation: The question was raised in the first place! Here comes the third foot.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: בָּרִאשׁוֹנָה, כׇּל מִי שֶׁמָּצָא אֲבֵידָה הָיָה מַכְרִיז עָלֶיהָ שְׁלֹשָׁה רְגָלִים, וְאַחַר רֶגֶל אַחֲרוֹן שִׁבְעַת יָמִים, כְּדֵי שֶׁיֵּלֵךְ שְׁלֹשָׁה וְיַחְזוֹר שְׁלֹשָׁה וְיַכְרִיז יוֹם אֶחָד. מִשֶּׁחָרַב בֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ, שֶׁיִּבָּנֶה בִּמְהֵרָה בְּיָמֵינוּ, הִתְקִינוּ שֶׁיְּהוּ מַכְרִיזִים בְּבָתֵּי כְנֵסִיּוֹת וּבְבָתֵּי מִדְרָשׁוֹת. וּמִשֶּׁרַבּוּ הָאַנָּסִים הִתְקִינוּ שֶׁיְּהוּ מוֹדִיעִין לִשְׁכֵינָיו וְלִמְיוּדָּעָיו וְדַיּוֹ.
human_translation: The Sages taught: Initially, anyone who found a lost item would proclaim three pilgrimage Festivals and seven days after the last pilgrimage Festivals, so that will go to his home, three and will return three and proclaim one day. from that the Temple was destroyed, may it be rebuilt speedily in our days, instituted that shall proclaim in synagogues and study halls. And from that the oppressors proliferated, instituted that shall inform his neighbors and acquaintances, and suffice for him.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: Initially, anyone who found a lost object would proclaim it for three festivals, and after the last festival, for seven days, so that one would go three times and return three times, and proclaim for one day. From when the Temple was destroyed, with the hope that it will be rebuilt speedily in our days, they instituted that announcements should be made in synagogues and study halls. And when bandits increased, they instituted that they should inform their neighbors and acquaintances, and that is sufficient.

hebrew_text: מַאי מִשֶּׁרַבּוּ הָאַנָּסִין? דְּאָמְרִי אֲבֵידְתָּא לְמַלְכָּא. רַבִּי אַמֵּי אַשְׁכַּח אוּדְיָיא דְּדִינָרֵי, חַזְיֵיהּ הָהוּא רוֹמָאָה דְּקָא מִירְתַת. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: זִיל שְׁקוֹל לְנַפְשָׁךְ, דְּלָאו פָּרְסָאֵי אֲנַן דְּאָמְרִי אֲבֵידְתָּא לְמַלְכָּא.
human_translation: What From that the oppressors proliferated? that they say: A lost item to the king. Rabbi Ami found a vessel of dinars. A certain Roman saw that he was wary said to him: Go, take it for yourself; as we are not Persians, who say that a lost item to the king.
