llm_translation: What is the reason that the pigeons have become numerous? Because they say "a loss to the king." Rabbi Amei found a purse full of dinars, he saw a Roman officer who was running. He said to him: Go take it for yourself, for we are not informers who say "a loss to the king."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אֶבֶן טוֹעִ[י]ן הָיְתָה בִּירוּשָׁלַיִם. כׇּל מִי שֶׁאָבְדָה לוֹ אֲבֵידָה נִפְנֶה לְשָׁם, וְכׇל מִי שֶׁמּוֹצֵא אֲבֵידָה נִפְנֶה לְשָׁם. זֶה עוֹמֵד וּמַכְרִיז, וְזֶה עוֹמֵד וְנוֹתֵן סִימָנִין וְנוֹטְלָהּ. וְזוֹ הִיא שֶׁשָּׁנִינוּ: צְאוּ וּרְאוּ אִם נִמְחֵת אֶבֶן הַטּוֹעִ[י]ן.
human_translation: The Sages taught There was a Claimant’s Stone in Jerusalem, anyone who lost an item would be directed there and anyone who found a lost item would be directed there. This stand and proclaim and that would stand and provide distinguishing marks and take And that is we learned Go and see if the Claimant’s Stone has been obscured
llm_translation: The sages taught: There was a stone of lost items in Jerusalem. Anyone who lost something would go there, and anyone who found something would go there. This one stands and proclaims, and this one stands and gives signs and takes it. And this is what we learned: Go out and see if the stone of lost items has been erased.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אָמַר אֶת הָאֲבֵידָה, וְלֹא אָמַר סִימָנֶיהָ – לֹא יִתֵּן לוֹ. וְהָרַמַּאי, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאָמַר סִימָנֶיהָ – לֹא יִתֵּן לוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״עַד דְּרֹשׁ אָחִיךָ אֹתוֹ״, עַד שֶׁתִּדְרוֹשׁ אֶת אָחִיךָ אִם רַמַּאי הוּא אִם אֵינוֹ רַמַּאי.
human_translation: stated the lost item but did not state, its distinguishing marks, shall not give to him. And a swindler, even though he stated its distinguishing marks, shall not give to him, as it is stated: until your brother claims [ derosh ] it [ oto ], until scrutinize [ shetidrosh ] your brother whether is a swindler whether he is not a swindler.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: If one said, "I lost an item," without specifying its identifying marks, he should not give it to him. And regarding a Rammai, even though he specified its identifying marks, he should not give it to him, as it is stated: "Until your brother inquire after it," meaning, you should inquire whether he is truly your brother or not.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אִתְּמַר, רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר: ״אֲבֵידְתָּא״ מַכְרֵיז, וְרַב נַחְמָן אָמַר: ״גְּלִימָא״ מַכְרֵיז.
human_translation: It was stated Rav Yehuda said: proclaims a lost item And Rav Naḥman said: he proclaims a cloak.
llm_translation: Gemara: It was stated: Rav Yehudah said: "Aveidata" proclaims, and Rav Nachman said: "Gleima" proclaims.

hebrew_text: רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר: ״אֲבֵידְתָּא״ מַכְרֵיז, דְּאִי אָמְרַתְּ ״גְּלִימָא״ מַכְרֵיז – חָיְישִׁינַן לְרַמַּאי.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said: proclaims a lost item, as if you say he proclaims a cloak, we are concerned about a swindler
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said: "Aveidta" proclaims, for if you say "Gelima" proclaims - we are concerned for the deceiver.

hebrew_text: רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר: ״גְּלִימָא״ מַכְרֵיז, לְרַמַּאי לָא חָיְישִׁינַן, דְּאִם כֵּן אֵין לַדָּבָר סוֹף.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman said: proclaims a cloak, and we are not concerned about a swindler as if so, there is no end to the matter.
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said: "Gelimah" announces, for those who seek to deceive we are not concerned, for if so, there is no end to the matter.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: אָמַר אֶת הָאֲבֵידָה וְלֹא אָמַר אֶת סִימָנֶיהָ – הֲרֵי זֶה לֹא יִתֵּן לוֹ. אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא ״אֲבֵידְתָּא״ מַכְרֵיז, הָא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן אַף עַל גַּב דְּאָמַר ״גְּלִימָא״, כִּי לָא אָמַר סִימָנִין לָא מַהְדְּרִינַן לֵיהּ. אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ ״גְּלִימָא״ מַכְרֵיז, אָמַר אִיהוּ גְּלִימָא, וְאָמַר אִיהוּ גְּלִימָא, צְרִיכָא לְמֵימַר כִּי לָא אָמַר סִימָנִין לָא מַהְדְּרִינַן לֵיהּ?
human_translation: we learned states the lost item but did not state its distinguishing marks, shall not give to him. Granted, if you say proclaims lost item, this teaches us even though stated a cloak, as he did not state distinguishing marks, we do not return to him. But if you say proclaims a cloak, stated a cloak and stated a cloak, need to be said when he did not state distinguishing marks, we do not return it to him?
llm_translation: We learned: If one said "I found a lost object" but did not specify its identifying marks - he should not return it to him. If you say, "When he proclaims 'I found it,' he is heard even though he did not mention 'its identifying marks,'" it is because we do not return it to him without specifying identifying marks. But if you say, "When he proclaims 'its identifying marks,' he is heard," he should say 'its identifying marks,' and he should say 'its identifying marks,' which necessitates saying that we do not return it to him without specifying identifying marks.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב סָפְרָא, לְעוֹלָם ״גְּלִימָא״ מַכְרֵיז, אָמַר אִיהוּ גְּלִימָא, וְאָמַר אִיהוּ סִימָנִין. וּמַאי לֹא אָמַר אֶת סִימָנֶיהָ? לָא אֲמַר סִימָנִין מוּבְהָקִין דִּידַהּ.
human_translation: Rav Safra said: Actually, proclaims a cloak, stated a cloak, and stated distinguishing marks. And what did not state its distinguishing marks? he did not state its clear-cut distinguishing marks
llm_translation: Rav Safra said, "One should always announce 'Gelima'." He said, "He announced 'Gelima' and he said 'Simanin'." Why didn't he say its signs? He did not say its signs because they are clear.

hebrew_text: וְהָרַמַּאי אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאָמַר אֶת סִימָנֶיהָ – הֲרֵי זֶה לֹא יִתֵּן לוֹ. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: בָּרִאשׁוֹנָה, כׇּל מִי שֶׁאָבְדָה לוֹ אֲבֵידָה – הָיָה נוֹתֵן סִימָנִין וְנוֹטְלָהּ. מִשֶּׁרַבּוּ הָרַמָּאִין, הִתְקִינוּ שֶׁיְּהוּ אוֹמְרִים לוֹ: צֵא וְהָבֵא עֵדִים דְּלָאו רַמַּאי אַתְּ, וְטוֹל.
human_translation: And a swindler, even though he stated its distinguishing marks, shall not give to him. The Sages taught: Initially, anyone who lost an item would provide distinguishing marks and take it. when the swindlers proliferated, instituted that say to him: Go and bring witnesses that you are not a swindler, and take
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And the Ramai, even though he said its identifying marks - behold, this one shall not give it to him. The Rabbis taught: Initially, anyone who lost a lost object, he would give identifying marks and take it. When the Ramai increased, they instituted that they should say to him: Go and bring witnesses that you are not a Ramai, and take it.

hebrew_text: כִּי הָא דַּאֲבוּהּ דְּרַב פָּפָּא אִירְכַס לֵיהּ חַמְרָא וְאַשְׁכְּחוּהּ. אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבָּה בַּר רַב הוּנָא, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: זִיל אַיְיתִי סָהֲדִי דְּלָאו רַמַּאי אַתְּ, וְטוֹל. אֲזַל אַיְיתִי סָהֲדֵי, אֲמַר לְהוּ: יָדְעִיתוּן בֵּיהּ דְּרַמַּאי הוּא? אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: אִין. אֲמַר לְהוּ: אֲנָא רַמָּאָה אֲנָא?! אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: אֲנַן ״לָאו רַמַּאי אַתְּ״ קָאָמְרִינַן. אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר רַב הוּנָא: מִסְתַּבְּרָא, לָא מַיְיתֵי אִינִישׁ חוֹבְתָּא לְנַפְשֵׁיהּ.
human_translation: as that the father of Rav Pappa, lost a donkey and found it. He came before Rabba bar Rav Huna said Go and bring witnesses that you are not a swindler, and take went and brought witnesses. said to Do you know about him he is a swindler? said: Yes. said, to I am a swindler? said to him: We were saying that you are not a swindler. Rabba bar Rav Huna said: is reasonable a person does not bring condemnation upon himself;
llm_translation: The case of the father of Rav Papa, a donkey driver found wine and forgot it. He came before Rabba bar Rav Huna, who said to him: "Go bring witnesses that you are not a deceiver, and then take it." He went and brought witnesses, and he said to them: "Do you know that he is not a deceiver?" They said to him: "No." He said to them: "Am I a deceiver?!" They said to him: "We are saying 'you are not a deceiver.'" Rabba bar Rav Huna said: It is logical, a person does not bring a liability upon himself.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ כׇּל דָּבָר שֶׁעוֹשֶׂה וְאוֹכֵל – יַעֲשֶׂה וְיֹאכַל, וְדָבָר שֶׁאֵין עוֹשֶׂה וְאוֹכֵל – יִמָּכֵר, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַהֲשֵׁבוֹתוֹ לוֹ״, רְאֵה הֵיאַךְ תְּשִׁיבֶנּוּ לוֹ.
human_translation: any being that works and eats, shall work and eat And any being that does not work but eat shall be sold, as it is stated: and you shall return it to him” see how to return it to him.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: Anything that one can make and eat - he should make and eat, and anything that one cannot make and eat - he should sell, as it is stated: "And you shall return it to him," see how you shall return it to him.

hebrew_text: מָה יְהֵא בַּדָּמִים? רַבִּי טַרְפוֹן אוֹמֵר: יִשְׁתַּמֵּשׁ בָּהֶן, לְפִיכָךְ אִם אָבְדוּ – חַיָּיב בְּאַחְרָיוּתָן. רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: לֹא יִשְׁתַּמֵּשׁ בָּהֶן, לְפִיכָךְ אִם אָבְדוּ – אֵין חַיָּיב בְּאַחְרָיוּתָן.
human_translation: What shall be with the money Rabbi Tarfon says: may use it; therefore, if is lost, liable restitution it. Rabbi Akiva says: He may not use therefore, if it is lost, not liable restitution it.
llm_translation: What should be done with the blood? Rabbi Tarfon says: It should be utilized, therefore if it is lost - one is liable for it. Rabbi Akiva says: It should not be utilized, therefore if it is lost - one is not liable for it.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ וּלְעוֹלָם? אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: עַד שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר חֹדֶשׁ. תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: כׇּל דָּבָר שֶׁעוֹשֶׂה וְאוֹכֵל כְּגוֹן פָּרָה וַחֲמוֹר – מִטַּפֵּל בָּהֶן עַד שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר חֹדֶשׁ, מִכָּאן וְאֵילָךְ – שָׁם דְּמֵיהֶן וּמַנִּיחָן.
human_translation: And forever? Rav Naḥman says Shmuel says: until twelve months This is also taught any being that works and eats, e.g., a cow or a donkey, tends to them until twelve months From that forward, one assesses their value, and places
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Gemar u'le'olam? Amar Rav Nachman amar Shmuel: Ad shneim asar chodesh. Tanaya namei hachi: Kol davar she'oseh ve'ochel k'gon parah v'chamor – mitapeil bahen ad shneim asar chodesh, mikahn v'eilakh – sham d'meihen u'mani'chan." English translation: "Is it finished forever? Rav Nachman said in the name of Shmuel: Until twelve months. It was also taught similarly: Anything that is made and eaten, such as a cow or a donkey – one may be lenient with them until twelve months, from then on – their value is set and they are left."

hebrew_text: עֲגָלִים וּסְיָיחִין – מִטַּפֵּל בָּהֶן שְׁלֹשָׁה חֳדָשִׁים, מִכָּאן וְאֵילָךְ – שָׁם דְּמֵיהֶן וּמַנִּיחָן. אֲווֹזִין וְתַרְנְגוֹלִין – מִטַּפֵּל בָּהֶם שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם, מִכָּאן וְאֵילָךְ – שָׁם דְּמֵיהֶן וּמַנִּיחָן.
human_translation: calves and foals, he tends to them three months, From that forward, one assesses their value, and places geese and roosters, he tends to them thirty days. From that forward, one assesses their value, and places
llm_translation: Calves and foals - one must wait with them for three months, from then on - their value and leave them. Goats and chickens - one must wait with them for thirty days, from then on - their value and leave them.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: תַּרְנְגוֹלֶת כִּבְהֵמָה גַּסָּה. תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: תַּרְנְגוֹלֶת וּבְהֵמָה גַּסָּה – מִטַּפֵּל בָּהֶן שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר חוֹדֶשׁ, מִכָּאן וְאֵילָךְ – שָׁם דְּמֵיהֶן וּמַנִּיחָן. עֲגָלִים וּסְיָיחִין – מִטַּפֵּל בָּהֶן שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם, מִכָּאן וְאֵילָךְ – שָׁם דְּמֵיהֶן וּמַנִּיחָן. אֲווֹזִין וְתַרְנְגוֹלִין וְכׇל דָּבָר שֶׁטִּיפּוּלוֹ מְרוּבֶּה מִשְּׂכָרוֹ – מִטַּפֵּל בָּהֶן שְׁלֹשָׁה יָמִים, מִכָּאן וְאֵילָךְ – שָׁם דְּמֵיהֶן וּמַנִּיחָן.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak says: a chicken is like a large domesticated animal This is also taught a chicken and a large domesticated animal, tends to them for twelve months. From that forward, one assesses their value, and places calves and foals, he tends to them thirty days. From that forward, one assesses their value, and places geese and roosters and anything that more to tend to than revenue it, he tends to them three days. From that forward, one assesses their value, and places
llm_translation: Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: A hen is like a domestic animal. It was taught in a baraita likewise: A hen and a domestic animal - one should wait twelve months for them, from then on - their blood is permitted. Calves and lambs - one should wait thirty days for them, from then on - their blood is permitted. Geese, chickens, and anything whose fattening is greater than its value - one should wait three days for them, from then on - their blood is permitted.

hebrew_text: קַשְׁיָא עֲגָלִים וּסְיָיחִין אַעֲגָלִים וּסְיָיחִין, אֲווֹזִין וְתַרְנְגוֹלִין אַאֲווֹזִין וְתַרְנְגוֹלִין!
human_translation: difficult, calves and foals and calves and foals geese and roosters and geese and roosters
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "Kashya agalim u'seyachin, a'agalim u'seyachin, avozin v'tarngolin a'avozin v'tarngolin!"

hebrew_text: עֲגָלִים וּסְיָיחִין אַעֲגָלִים וּסְיָיחִין לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא דְּרִעְיָא, וְהָא דְּפִטּוּמָא.
human_translation: calves and foals and calves and foals not difficult. This that graze and that that fattened
llm_translation: Calfs and yearlings, calfs and yearlings are not difficult: this one of the pasture, and this one of the stall.

hebrew_text: אֲווֹזִין וְתַרְנְגוֹלִין אַאֲווֹזִין וְתַרְנְגוֹלִין נָמֵי לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא בְּרַבְרְבֵי, הָא בְּזוּטְרֵי.
human_translation: geese and roosters and geese and roosters also not difficult. This to large and that to small
llm_translation: אֲוֹזִין וְתַרְנְגוֹלִין - Goats and roosters, goats and roosters, are not difficult: this one in Ravbervei, this one in Zutrei.

hebrew_text: וְשֶׁאֵינוֹ עוֹשֶׂה וְאוֹכֵל. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״וַהֲשֵׁבוֹתוֹ לוֹ״ – רְאֵה הֵיאַךְ תְּשִׁיבֶנּוּ לוֹ, שֶׁלֹּא יַאֲכִיל עֵגֶל לַעֲגָלִים, וּסְיָח לִסְיָיחִין, אֲווֹזָא לַאֲווֹזִין, וְתַרְנְגוֹל לְתַרְנְגוֹלִין.
human_translation: And that does not work but eat The Sages taught “And you shall return it to him” see how to return it to him, that shall not feed a calf to calves nor a foal to foals nor a goose to geese nor a rooster to roosters
llm_translation: "And one who does not perform and eat. The Rabbis taught: 'And you shall restore it to him' - see how you shall restore it to him, that he should not feed a calf to calves, and a goose to goslings, a duck to ducks, and a chicken to chickens."

hebrew_text: מָה יְהֵא בַּדָּמִים? רַבִּי טַרְפוֹן אוֹמֵר יִשְׁתַּמֵּשׁ וְכוּ׳. עַד כָּאן לָא פְּלִיגִי
human_translation: What shall be with the money Rabbi Tarfon says: may use it; disagree
llm_translation: What should be done with the blood? Rabbi Tarfon says it should be used, etc. Until here they do not disagree.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא כְּשֶׁנִּשְׁתַּמֵּשׁ בָּהֶן. אֲבָל לֹא נִשְׁתַּמֵּשׁ בָּהֶן, אִם אָבְדוּ – פָּטוּר.
human_translation: only where used But did not use if is lost, exempt
llm_translation: Rather, when they were utilized. But if they were not utilized, if they were lost – one is exempt.

hebrew_text: לֵימָא תֶּיהְוֵי תְּיוּבְתָּא דְּרַב יוֹסֵף? דְּאִתְּמַר: שׁוֹמֵר אֲבֵידָה, רַבָּה אָמַר: כְּשׁוֹמֵר חִנָּם, רַב יוֹסֵף אָמַר: כְּשׁוֹמֵר שָׂכָר.
human_translation: Let us say this shall be a conclusive refutation of Rav Yosef, as it was stated a bailee a lost item. Rabba said: is like an unpaid bailee, Rav Yosef said: is like a paid bailee,
llm_translation: Let it be the preference of Rav Yosef? For it was stated: One who guards lost property, Rabba said: like one who guards for free, Rav Yosef said: like one who guards for payment.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לְךָ רַב יוֹסֵף: בִּגְנֵיבָה וַאֲבֵידָה – דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְּלִיגִי דְּחַיָּיב, כִּי פְּלִיגִי בְּאוּנְסִין דְּשׁוֹאֵל, רַבִּי טַרְפוֹן סָבַר: שָׁרוּ לֵיהּ רַבָּנַן לְאִשְׁתַּמּוֹשֵׁי בְּגַוַּיְיהוּ, וְהָוֵה לֵיהּ שׁוֹאֵל עֲלַיְיהוּ. וְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא סָבַר: לָא שָׁרוּ לֵיהּ רַבָּנַן לְאִשְׁתַּמּוֹשֵׁי בְּגַוַּיְיהוּ, הִלְכָּךְ לָא הָוֵי שׁוֹאֵל עֲלַיְיהוּ.
human_translation: Rav Yosef said to you: In theft or loss, everyone agrees that liable When they disagree in circumstances beyond his control, of a borrower Rabbi Tarfon holds: The Sages permitted him to use and he is a borrower with regard to it, And Rabbi Akiva holds: The Sages did not permit him to use is therefore not a borrower with regard to it.
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said to you: In the case of theft and loss - the people of the world do not argue that one is liable, for they argue in cases of forced circumstances. Rabbi Tarfon thought: The Rabbis permitted him to benefit from their bodies, and he would then ask for payment from them. But Rabbi Akiva thought: The Rabbis did not permit him to benefit from their bodies, therefore he should not ask for payment from them.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, ״לְפִיכָךְ״ דְּאָמַר רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, לְמָה לִי? אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא בִּגְנֵיבָה וַאֲבֵידָה הוּא דִּפְלִיגִי, הַיְינוּ דְּקָתָנֵי ״רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר לֹא יִשְׁתַּמֵּשׁ בָּהֶן, לְפִיכָךְ אִם אָבְדוּ – אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב בְּאַחְרָיוּתָן״. סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא שׁוֹמֵר שָׂכָר הָוֵי כִּדְרַב יוֹסֵף, וּבִגְנֵיבָה וַאֲבֵידָה מְחַיֵּיב, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן ״לְפִיכָךְ״. הַשְׁתָּא דְּאָמְרַתְּ לֹא יִשְׁתַּמֵּשׁ בָּהֶן, שׁוֹמֵר שָׂכָר לָא הָוֵי וְלָא מְחַיֵּיב בִּגְנֵיבָה וַאֲבֵידָה.
human_translation: If so, why do I that Rabbi Akiva said: therefore, Granted, if you say in theft or loss that they disagree, that that the teaches Rabbi Akiva says: He may not use therefore, if lost, he is not liable restitution it. it enters your mind to say is a paid bailee, in accordance with of Rav Yosef, and in theft and loss liable teaches us: Therefore, Now that you said he may not use he is not a paid bailee and not liable in theft and loss.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: If so, "therefore," as Rabbi Akiva said, why do I need it? If you say it is in the case of theft and loss that they dispute, that is what is taught: "Rabbi Akiva says: One should not make use of them, therefore if they are lost, he is not liable for their replacement." Your opinion is that a watchman is considered as one who receives payment, like Rav Yosef, and in the case of theft and loss, he is liable, we learn "therefore." Now that you say one should not make use of them, a watchman is not considered as one who receives payment, and he is not liable for theft and loss.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּגְנֵיבָה וַאֲבֵידָה דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְּלִיגִי דְּחַיָּיב, כִּי פְּלִיגִי בְּאוּנְסִין דְּשׁוֹאֵל, מַאי ״לְפִיכָךְ״ דְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא? הָכִי מִבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְמִתְנֵא: ״רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר לֹא יִשְׁתַּמֵּשׁ בָּהֶן״, וַאֲנָא יָדַעְנָא דְּכֵיוָן דְּלֹא יִשְׁתַּמֵּשׁ בָּהֶן – לָאו שׁוֹאֵל הָוֵי וְאֵינוֹ חַיָּיב בְּאַחְרָיוּתָן, ״לְפִיכָךְ״ דְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא לְמָה לִי?
human_translation: But if you say in theft or loss, everyone agrees that liable when they disagree in circumstances beyond his control of a borrower what Rabbi Akiva: Therefore, this is what should have taught: Rabbi Akiva says: He may not use and I would know that since he may not use he is not a borrower, Why do I that Rabbi Akiva said: Therefore,
llm_translation: Rather, if you say in the case of theft and loss that everyone does not disagree that one is liable, for they disagree in cases of ones who borrow, what is the meaning of "therefore" according to Rabbi Akiva? This is what the Mishnah means to teach: "Rabbi Akiva says one should not make use of them," and I know that since one does not make use of them - he is not considered a borrower and is not liable for their loss. Therefore, why do I need "therefore" according to Rabbi Akiva?

hebrew_text: מִשּׁוּם ״לְפִיכָךְ״ דְּרַבִּי טַרְפוֹן.
human_translation: due to Therefore, by Rabbi Tarfon.
llm_translation: From the reason of "therefore" of Rabbi Tarfon.

hebrew_text: וּלְפִיכָךְ דְּרַבִּי טַרְפוֹן לְמָה לִי? הָכִי קָאָמַר: כֵּיוָן דְּשָׁרוּ לֵיהּ רַבָּנַן לְאִשְׁתַּמּוֹשֵׁי בְּגַוַּיְיהוּ כְּמַאן דְּאִישְׁתַּמַּשׁ בְּגַוַּיְיהוּ דָּמֵי וְחַיָּיב בְּאַחְרָיוּתָן.
human_translation: And why do I that Rabbi Tarfon Therefore, This is saying: Since the Sages permitted him to use like one who used it and liable restitution it.
llm_translation: And therefore, concerning Rabbi Tarfon, why do I need it? Thus he said: Since the Rabbis permitted him to make use of their property, whoever makes use of their property is considered as if he made use of his own property, and is liable for their consequences.

hebrew_text: וְהָא ״אָבְדוּ״ קָתָנֵי!
human_translation: But doesn’t teach: is lost?
llm_translation: And this, "they were lost," is taught!

hebrew_text: כִּדְרַבָּה. דְּאָמַר רַבָּה: ״נִגְנְבוּ״ בְּלִסְטִים מְזוּיָּין, ״אָבְדוּ״ שֶׁטָּבְעָה סְפִינָתוֹ בַּיָּם.
human_translation: in accordance with of Rabba, as Rabba says they were stolen, by armed bandits; they were lost, ship sank at sea.
llm_translation: As Ravah said: "Stolen" in regards to distinguished garments, "lost" when his ship sank in the sea.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי טַרְפוֹן. בְּיַד רַחֲבָה (הֲוָה לֵיהּ) [הֲווֹ] הָנְהוּ זוּזֵי דְיַתְמֵי, אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב יוֹסֵף, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מַהוּ לְאִשְׁתַּמּוֹשֵׁי בְּגַוַּיְיהוּ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָכִי אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי טַרְפוֹן.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says Shmuel says: halakha in accordance with Rabbi Tarfon, were these dinars to orphans in the possession of Raḥava. came before Rav Yosef said to him: What is to use said to him: This Rav Yehuda says Shmuel says: halakha in accordance with Rabbi Tarfon.
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Tarfon. In the possession of Rachavah (he had) those coins of Tyrian (silver), he came before Rav Yosef, he said to him: What about using them in their current state? He said to him: Thus said Rav Yehudah in the name of Shmuel: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Tarfon.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: וְלָאו אִתְּמַר עֲלַהּ אָמַר רַבִּי חֶלְבּוֹ אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא בִּדְמֵי אֲבֵידָה הוֹאִיל וְטָרַח בַּהּ, אֲבָל מָעוֹת אֲבֵידָה דְּלָא טָרַח בְּהוּ – לָא. וְהָנֵי כְּמָעוֹת אֲבֵידָה דָּמוּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: זִיל לָא שְׁבַקוּ לִי דְּאֶשְׁרֵי לָךְ.
human_translation: Abaye said to Wasn’t it stated concerning this Rabbi Ḥelbo says Rav Huna says: taught this only in money of a lost item since he exerted to it. But lost coins, where he did not exert to them, not And these is similar lost coins. said to Go; they did not allow me to permit for you.
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye: And wasn't it stated regarding it? Rabbi Helbo said, Rabbi Huna said: They only taught this regarding the value of a lost item since one exerted effort for it, but regarding the value of a lost item for which one did not exert effort - no. And these are like the value of a lost item whose blood. He said to him: Go, do not leave me, for it is beneficial for you.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ : מָצָא סְפָרִים – קוֹרֵא בָּהֶן אֶחָד לִשְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם. וְאִם אֵינוֹ יוֹדֵעַ לִקְרוֹת – גּוֹלְלָן. אֲבָל לֹא יִלְמוֹד בָּהֶן בַּתְּחִילָּה, וְלֹא יִקְרָא אַחֵר עִמּוֹ.
human_translation: found scrolls, he reads them once in thirty days And if he does not know to read, he rolls them But he shall not study in them for the first time, And another shall not read with him,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: If one finds books - he may read from them for up to thirty days. And if he does not know how to read - he should roll them. However, he should not study from them initially, and he should not read them with someone else.

hebrew_text: מָצָא כְּסוּת – מְנַעֲרָהּ אֶחָד לִשְׁלשִׁים יוֹם וְשׁוֹטְחָהּ לְצׇרְכָּהּ, אֲבָל לֹא לִכְבוֹדוֹ.
human_translation: found a garment, he shakes it once in thirty days, and he spreads it for its sake, but not for his prestige.
llm_translation: He found a garment - he shakes it out for thirty days and widens it for its need, but not for his honor.

hebrew_text: כְּלֵי כֶסֶף וּכְלֵי נְחוֹשֶׁת – מִשְׁתַּמֵּשׁ בָּהֶן לְצׇרְכָּן, אֲבָל לֹא לְשַׁחֲקָן. כְּלֵי זָהָב וּכְלֵי זְכוּכִית – לֹא יִגַּע בָּהֶן עַד שֶׁיָּבוֹא אֵלִיָּהוּ.
human_translation: silver vessels or copper vessels, may use them for their sake but not to erode them. gold vessels or glass vessels, he may not touch them until Elijah will come
llm_translation: Vessels of silver and vessels of copper - one may use them for their intended purpose, but not for frivolity. Vessels of gold and vessels of glass - one should not touch them until Elijah comes.

hebrew_text: מָצָא שַׂק אוֹ קוּפָּה וְכׇל דָּבָר שֶׁאֵין דַּרְכּוֹ לִיטּוֹל – הֲרֵי זֶה לֹא יִטּוֹל.
human_translation: found a sack or a basket or any item that is not his manner to take he not take
llm_translation: He found a sack or basket and anything that is not its normal manner to take - behold, this one shall not take.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הַמּוֹצֵא תְּפִילִּין בַּשּׁוּק – שָׁם דְּמֵיהֶן וּמַנִּיחָן לְאַלְתַּר.
human_translation: Shmuel says: One who finds phylacteries in the marketplace assesses their value and immediately places
llm_translation: Gemara said Shmuel: One who finds phylacteries in the market - their value is there, and he should leave them there immediately.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רָבִינָא: מָצָא סְפָרִים – קוֹרֵא בָּהֶן אֶחָד לִשְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם, וְאִם אֵינוֹ יוֹדֵעַ לִקְרוֹת – גּוֹלְלָן. גּוֹלְלָן – אִין, שָׁם דְּמֵיהֶן וּמַנִּיחָן – לָא, אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: תְּפִילִּין בֵּי בַּר חָבוּ מִשְׁכָּח שְׁכִיחִי, סְפָרִים לָא שְׁכִיחִי.
human_translation: Ravina raises an objection found scrolls, he reads them once in thirty days; and if he does not know to read, he rolls them. roll them, yes, assess their value and place no, Abaye said: Phylacteries are available at the house of bar Ḥavu, scrolls are not available,
llm_translation: Ravinah raises an objection: If one finds books - he reads in them for thirty days, and if he does not know how to read - he rolls them. If he rolls them - no, there their value and leaves them - no, Abaye said: Tefillin of Bar Chavu are common, books are not common.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הַשּׁוֹאֵל סֵפֶר תּוֹרָה מֵחֲבֵירוֹ, הֲרֵי זֶה לֹא יַשְׁאִילֶנּוּ לְאַחֵר, פּוֹתְחוֹ וְקוֹרֵא בּוֹ, וּבִלְבַד שֶׁלֹּא יִלְמוֹד בּוֹ בַּתְּחִילָּה, וְלֹא יִקְרָא אַחֵר עִמּוֹ.
human_translation: The Sages taught one who borrows a Torah scroll from another, that may not lend it to another, may open it and read it, provided that he does not study in it for the first time, And another shall not read with him,
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: One who borrows a Torah scroll from his friend, he may not lend it to another. He may unroll it and read from it, as long as he does not study from it initially, and he may not read with someone else.

hebrew_text: וְכֵן הַמַּפְקִיד סֵפֶר תּוֹרָה אֵצֶל חֲבֵירוֹ, גּוֹלְלוֹ כׇּל שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר חֹדֶשׁ, פּוֹתְחוֹ וְקוֹרֵא בּוֹ, אִם בִּשְׁבִילוֹ פְּתָחוֹ – אָסוּר. סוֹמְכוֹס אוֹמֵר: בְּחָדָשׁ – שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם, בְּיָשָׁן – שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר חֹדֶשׁ. רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב אוֹמֵר: אֶחָד זֶה וְאֶחָד זֶה – שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר חֹדֶשׁ.
human_translation: And likewise, one who deposits a Torah scroll with another, rolls it every twelve months, may open it and read it. If for himself he opened it, prohibited. Sumakhos says: In a new thirty days in an old twelve months. Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov says: both this and that twelve months.
llm_translation: And so one who entrusts a Torah scroll to his fellow, he rolls it every twelve months, he opens it and reads from it. If he opened it for its sake - it is prohibited. Simeon the Tempter says: In a new one - thirty days, in an old one - twelve months. Rabbi Eliezer ben Jacob says: Either this one or that one - twelve months.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: הַשּׁוֹאֵל סֵפֶר תּוֹרָה מֵחֲבֵירוֹ – הֲרֵי זֶה לֹא יַשְׁאִילֶנּוּ לְאַחֵר. מַאי אִרְיָא סֵפֶר תּוֹרָה? אֲפִילּוּ כֹּל מִילֵּי נָמֵי, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן לָקִישׁ: כָּאן שָׁנָה רַבִּי – אֵין הַשּׁוֹאֵל רַשַּׁאי לְהַשְׁאִיל, וְאֵין הַשּׂוֹכֵר רַשַּׁאי לְהַשְׂכִּיר!
human_translation: The Master said: one who borrows a Torah scroll from another, that may not lend it to another, Why specifically Torah scroll? any item as well, as Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish says: Here Rabbi taught: A borrower is not allowed to lend and a renter is not allowed to rent out
llm_translation: Master said: One who borrows a Torah scroll from his fellow - behold, he may not lend it to another. What is considered a Torah scroll? Even mere words, as Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said: Here Rabbi changed - the borrower is not permitted to lend, and the renter is not permitted to rent!

hebrew_text: סֵפֶר תּוֹרָה אִיצְטְרִיכָא לֵיהּ, מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: נִיחָא לֵיהּ לְאִינִישׁ דְּתִיעֲבִיד מִצְוָה בְּמָמוֹנֵיהּ, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: was necessary for a Torah scroll, lest you say a person is amenable to having a mitzva performed with his property teaches us
llm_translation: The book of Torah is necessary for him, what you may say: it is pleasing to a person who performs a commandment with his money, it is heard for us.

hebrew_text: פּוֹתְחוֹ וְקוֹרֵא בּוֹ. פְּשִׁיטָא! וְאֶלָּא לְמַאי שַׁיְילֵיהּ מִינֵּיהּ? סֵיפָא אִיצְטְרִיכָא לֵיהּ: וּבִלְבַד שֶׁלֹּא יִלְמוֹד בּוֹ בַּתְּחִלָּה.
human_translation: may open it and read it. obvious? And rather, for what borrow from him, It was necessary the last clause: Provided that he does not study in it for the first time.
llm_translation: He opens it and reads in it. Obviously! But rather, what is the question he is asking from it? The latter part is necessary for him: And only if he did not learn from it initially.

hebrew_text: וְכֵן הַמַּפְקִיד סֵפֶר תּוֹרָה אֵצֶל חֲבֵירוֹ – גּוֹלְלוֹ כׇּל שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר חֹדֶשׁ, פּוֹתְחוֹ וְקוֹרֵא בּוֹ. מַאי עֲבִידְתֵּיהּ גַּבֵּיהּ? וְתוּ, אִם בִּשְׁבִילוֹ פְּתָחוֹ – אָסוּר, הָא אָמְרַתְּ: פּוֹתְחוֹ וְקוֹרֵא בּוֹ! הָכִי קָאָמַר: אִם כְּשֶׁהוּא גּוֹלְלוֹ פּוֹתְחוֹ וְקוֹרֵא בּוֹ – מוּתָּר, אִם בִּשְׁבִילוֹ פְּתָחוֹ – אָסוּר.
human_translation: And likewise, one who deposits a Torah scroll with another, rolls it every twelve months, may open it and read it. What is doing with it? And furthermore, If for himself he opened it, prohibited, didn’t you say He may open it and read it? This is saying: If, when he is rolling he opens it and reads it, permitted. If for himself he opened it, prohibited.
llm_translation: And so one who entrusts a Torah scroll to his fellow - he rolls it every twelve months, opens it and reads from it. What is his purpose in doing so? And if you say, if it is for his sake that he opens it - it is prohibited, but didn't you say: he opens it and reads from it! This is what he is saying: if when he rolls it he opens it and reads from it - it is permitted, but if it is for his sake that he opens it - it is prohibited.

hebrew_text: סוֹמְכוֹס אוֹמֵר: בְּחָדָשׁ – שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם, בְּיָשָׁן – שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר חֹדֶשׁ. רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב אוֹמֵר: אֶחָד זֶה וְאֶחָד זֶה – שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר חֹדֶשׁ. רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב, הַיְינוּ תַּנָּא קַמָּא! אֶלָּא אֵימָא: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב אוֹמֵר אֶחָד זֶה וְאֶחָד זֶה שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם.
human_translation: Sumakhos says: In a new thirty days in an old twelve months. Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov says: both this and that twelve months. Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov is the first tanna , Rather say Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov says: Both this and that thirty days.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text translates as follows: Talmudic text: Simekos says: In a new house - thirty days, in an old house - twelve months. Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov says: One this and one this - twelve months. Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov, is that the first Tanna! Rather say: Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov says: One this and one this - thirty days.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל לֹא יִלְמוֹד בּוֹ בַּתְּחִלָּה וְלֹא יִקְרָא אַחֵר עִמּוֹ. וּרְמִינְהוּ: לֹא יִקְרָא פָּרָשָׁה וְיִשְׁנֶה, וְלֹא יִקְרָא בּוֹ פָּרָשָׁה וִיתַרְגֵּם, וְלֹא יִפְתַּח בּוֹ יוֹתֵר מִשְּׁלֹשָׁה דַּפִּין, וְלֹא יִקְרְאוּ בּוֹ שְׁלֹשָׁה בְּנֵי אָדָם בְּכֶרֶךְ אֶחָד – הָא שְׁנַיִם קוֹרִין!
human_translation: But he shall not study in them for the first time and another shall not read with him. raises a contradiction he shall not read a passage and review it, and he shall not read a passage in it and translate and he shall not open it more than three columns and three people shall not read in it from one volume. But two people may read
llm_translation: Talmudic text: But he should not study it initially, nor should he read it with someone else. And they raised a dilemma: He should not read a passage and repeat it, and he should not read a passage and translate it, and he should not open it for more than three pages, and three people should not read it in one row - for two read!

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: לָא קַשְׁיָא, כָּאן בְּעִנְיָן אֶחָד, כָּאן בִּשְׁנֵי עִנְיָנִים.
human_translation: Abaye said: not difficult. Here, where one matter There, where two matters,
llm_translation: Abaye said: Not difficult, here in one matter, here in two matters.

hebrew_text: מָצָא כְּסוּת מְנַעֲרָהּ אֶחָד לִשְׁלשִׁים יוֹם. לְמֵימְרָא דְּנִיעוּר מְעַלֵּי לַהּ? וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מִי שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ גַּרְדִּי אוּמָּן בְּתוֹךְ בֵּיתוֹ, יְנַעֵר כְּסוּתוֹ בְּכׇל יוֹם! אָמְרִי: בְּכׇל יוֹם – קָשֵׁי לַהּ, אֶחָד לִשְׁלשִׁים יוֹם – מְעַלֵּי לַהּ.
human_translation: found a garment, he shakes it once in thirty days. Is this to say that shaking is beneficial for it? But doesn’t Rabbi Yoḥanan say: one who has a skilled weaver [ gardi ] in his house may shake his garment every day, say: every day is harmful to it, once in thirty days is beneficial for it.
llm_translation: He found the garment of his wife one to thirty days. Is it to say that he suspects her of adultery? But didn't Rabbi Yochanan say: One who has a gardi craftsman in his house should launder his garment every day! They said: Every day - it is difficult for her, one to thirty days - it is suspicious for her.

hebrew_text: אִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: לָא קַשְׁיָא, הָא בְּחַד, וְהָא בִּתְרֵי.
human_translation: If you wish, say not difficult. this where one And that where two
llm_translation: If you will say: It is not difficult, this one is in one case, and this one is in two cases.

hebrew_text: אִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא בִּידָא, וְהָא בְּחוּטְרָא.
human_translation: If you wish, say not difficult. this by hand. And that with a stick.
llm_translation: If you wish, say it is not difficult: this one is in the hand, and this one is in the reed.

hebrew_text: אִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא בִּדְעַמְרָא, הָא בִּדְכִיתָּנָא.
human_translation: If you wish, say not difficult. this where of wool. And that where of linen.
llm_translation: If you ask, say it is not difficult: here in Deamra, here in D'chitna.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: כָּסָא דְחָרָשִׁין וְלָא כָּסָא דְפוֹשְׁרִין. וְלָא אֲמַרַן אֶלָּא בִּכְלֵי מַתָּכוֹת. אֲבָל בִּכְלֵי חֶרֶשׂ – לֵית לַן בַּהּ. וּבִכְלֵי מַתָּכוֹת נָמֵי לָא אֲמַרַן אֶלָּא דְּלָא צְוִיץ, אֲבָל דִּצְוִיץ – לֵית לַן בַּהּ. וְלָא אֲמַרַן אֶלָּא דְּלָא שְׁדָא בַּהּ צִיבַיָּא, אֲבָל שְׁדָא בֵּיהּ צִיבַיָּא – לֵית לַן בַּהּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says: a cup of witches and not a cup of lukewarm We said this only with regard to in metal vessels, but in earthenware vessels we have no with it. And even in metal vessels, we said this only where not boiled, but boiled we have no with it. And we said only one did not cast flavorings into but if he cast flavorings into we have no with it.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: A chair of earthenware and not a chair of wood. And we only said this regarding utensils of metal. But with utensils of earthenware - we do not have it. And with utensils of metal, we also only said it that it does not have a rim, but if it has a rim - we do not have it. And we only said it that it does not have a colored design on it, but if it has a colored design - we do not have it.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מִי שֶׁהִנִּיחַ לוֹ אָבִיו מָעוֹת הַרְבֵּה וְרוֹצָה לְאַבְּדָן, יִלְבַּשׁ בִּגְדֵי פִשְׁתָּן, וְיִשְׁתַּמֵּשׁ בִּכְלֵי זְכוּכִית, וְיִשְׂכּוֹר פּוֹעֲלִים וְאַל יֵשֵׁב עִמָּהֶן. יִלְבַּשׁ בִּכְלֵי פִשְׁתָּן – בְּכִיתָּנָא רוֹמִיתָא. וְיִשְׁתַּמֵּשׁ בִּכְלֵי זְכוּכִית – בְּזוּגִּיתָא חִיוָּרְתָּא. וְיִשְׂכּוֹר פּוֹעֲלִים וְאַל יֵשֵׁב עִמָּהֶן – תַּרְגּוּמַאּ
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan says: one whose father bequeathed him a great deal of money and he seeks to lose it, should wear linen garments, and should use glass vessels, and should hire laborers and not sit with them He should wear linen garments; with regard to Roman linen, He should use glass vessels; with regard to white glass. And he should hire laborers and not sit with them; the explanation is
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yochanan said: One who inherited a large sum of money from his father and wishes to lose it, should wear linen garments, and use glass vessels, and hire workers but not sit with them. He should wear linen garments - in a Roman tunic. And use glass vessels - in a colored glass goblet. And hire workers but not sit with them - this is an explanation.

hebrew_text: בְּתוֹרֵי דִּנְפִישׁ פְּסֵידַיְיהוּ.
human_translation: with oxen, whose damage is great
llm_translation: In the rows of Nefish, their losses.

hebrew_text: שׁוֹטְחָהּ לְצוֹרְכָּהּ אֲבָל לֹא לִכְבוֹדוֹ וְכוּ׳. אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: לְצוֹרְכּוֹ וּלְצוֹרְכָּהּ, מַאי?
human_translation: spreads it for its sake but not for his prestige. A dilemma was raised before for his sake and for its sake, what
llm_translation: She prepares it for her needs, but not for his honor, etc. It was asked: For his needs and for her needs, what is the law?

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: ״שׁוֹטְחָהּ לְצוֹרְכָּהּ״, לְצוֹרְכָּהּ – אִין. הָא לְצוֹרְכּוֹ וּלְצוֹרְכָּהּ לָא! אֵימָא סֵיפָא: ״אֲבָל לֹא לִכְבוֹדוֹ״, לִכְבוֹדוֹ הוּא דְּלָא, הָא לְצוֹרְכָּהּ וּלְצוֹרְכּוֹ – שַׁפִּיר דָּמֵי. אֶלָּא מֵהָא לֵיכָּא לְמִשְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: Come hear He spreads it for its sake. For its sake, yes, but for his sake and for its sake, not Say the latter clause But not for his prestige. for his prestige that not but for its sake and for his sake, well Rather, no to be learned from this
llm_translation: Come and hear: "For her own benefit," for her own benefit - no. But for his benefit and for her benefit - yes! Say the latter part: "But not for his honor," it is not for his honor, but for her benefit and for his benefit - it is reasonable. Rather, from here it is not possible to infer.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: לֹא יִשְׁטָחֶנָּה לֹא עַל גַּבֵּי מִטָּה וְלֹא עַל גַּבֵּי מַגּוֹד לְצׇרְכּוֹ, אֲבָל יִשְׁטָחֶנָּה עַל גַּבֵּי מִטָּה וְעַל גַּבֵּי מַגּוֹד לְצׇרְכָּהּ. נִזְדַּמְּנוּ לוֹ אוֹרְחִים – לֹא יִשְׁטָחֶנָּה לֹא עַל גַּבֵּי מִטָּה וְלֹא עַל גַּבֵּי מַגּוֹד, בֵּין לְצוֹרְכּוֹ בֵּין לְצוֹרְכָּהּ!
human_translation: Come hear he may not spread it on a bed or on a hanger for his sake, but he may spread it on a bed or on a hanger for its sake. guests happened he may not spread it, neither on a bed nor on a hanger neither for his sake nor for its sake.
llm_translation: Come and hear: One may not spread it neither on the bed nor on the couch for his need, but he may spread it on the bed and on the couch for her need. If guests arrived - he may not spread it neither on the bed nor on the couch, whether for his need or for her need!

hebrew_text: שָׁאנֵי הָתָם, דְּמִקְלָא קָלֵי לַהּ אִי מִשּׁוּם עֵינָא, אִי מִשּׁוּם גַּנָּבֵי.
human_translation: is different there, as burning it, either due to the eye or due to thieves,
llm_translation: The difference there, for a light is to her, either because of the eye, or because of the thieves.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: הִכְנִיסָה לְרִבְקָה וְדָשָׁה – כְּשֵׁירָה. בִּשְׁבִיל שֶׁתִּינַק וְתָדוּשׁ – פְּסוּלָה. וְהָא הָכָא דִּלְצוֹרְכּוֹ וּלְצוֹרְכָּהּ הוּא, וְקָתָנֵי פְּסוּלָה!
human_translation: Come hear one introduced into a yoke lirvaka and it threshed it is fit so that it will suckle and it will thresh, it is unfit And here, isn’t for his sake, and for its sake, and teaches is unfit?
llm_translation: Come and hear: If she entered for Rivkah and she threshed - it is fit. Because she will nurse and wash - she is unfit. And here, since it is for his need and her need, and it teaches unfit!

hebrew_text: שָׁאנֵי הָתָם, דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״אֲשֶׁר לֹא עֻבַּד בָּהּ״ מִכׇּל מָקוֹם.
human_translation: is different there, as the verse states: that has not been worked with in any case
llm_translation: The difference there, as the verse says: "which has not been served in it" from any place.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי אֲפִילּוּ רֵישָׁא נָמֵי!
human_translation: If so even the first clause,
llm_translation: If so, even the beginning is also considered!

hebrew_text: הָא לָא דָּמְיָא אֶלָּא לְהָא, דִּתְנַן: שָׁכַן עָלֶיהָ עוֹף – כְּשֵׁירָה, עָלָה עָלֶיהָ זָכָר – פְּסוּלָה. מַאי טַעְמָא?
human_translation: This is comparable only to this as we learned a bird rested upon it fit a male mounted it it is unfit What is the reason
llm_translation: Here is the translation of the Talmudic text you provided: Talmudic text: This one is comparable only to that one, as we learned: If a bird dwells upon it - it is fit; if a male mounts it - it is unfit. What is the reason?

hebrew_text: כִּדְרַב פָּפָּא, דְּאָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: אִי כְּתִיב ״עוּבַּד״ וְקָרֵינַן ״עוּבַּד״ – הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: אֲפִילּוּ מִמֵּילָא. וְאִי כְּתִיב ״עָבַד״ וְקָרֵינַן ״עָבַד״ – הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: עַד דַּעֲבַד בָּהּ אִיהוּ.
human_translation: in accordance with Rav Pappa, as Rav Pappa says If were written Has been worked with [ ubbad ], and we vocalized ubbad , I would say even by itself, If were written He used it for labor [ avad ], and we vocalized avad , I would say until used it for labor.
llm_translation: As Rav Papa said in the name of Rav Papa: If it is written "uved" and we read "uved" - I would say: even from the beginning. And if it is written "avad" and we read "avad" - I would say: until he performs with it.

hebrew_text: הַשְׁתָּא דִּכְתִיב ״עָבַד״ וְקָרֵינַן ״עוּבַּד״ – בָּעֵינַן ״עוּבַּד״ דּוּמְיָא דְּ״עָבַד״. מָה ״עָבַד״ דְּנִיחָא לֵיהּ, אַף ״עוּבַּד״ דְּנִיחָא לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Now that is written avad and we vocalize ubbad , we require ubbad similar to avad . Just as avad that is amenable so too, ubbad that is amenable
llm_translation: The matter is as follows: since it is written "avad" and we read it as "u'bad" - we require "u'bad" similar to "avad." Just as "avad" is fitting for it, so too "u'bad" is fitting for it.

hebrew_text: כְּלֵי כֶסֶף וּכְלֵי נְחוֹשֶׁת מִשְׁתַּמֵּשׁ בָּהֶן וְכוּ׳. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הַמּוֹצֵא כְּלֵי עֵץ מִשְׁתַּמֵּשׁ בָּהֶן בִּשְׁבִיל שֶׁלֹּא יֵרָקְבוּ, כְּלֵי נְחוֹשֶׁת מִשְׁתַּמֵּשׁ בָּהֶן בְּחַמִּין, אֲבָל לֹא עַל יְדֵי הָאוּר, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁמַּשְׁחִיקָן. כְּלֵי כֶּסֶף מִשְׁתַּמֵּשׁ בָּהֶן בְּצוֹנֵן, אֲבָל לֹא בְּחַמִּין, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁמַּשְׁחִירָן. מַגְרֵיפוֹת וְקַרְדּוּמּוֹת מִשְׁתַּמֵּשׁ בָּהֶן בְּרַךְ, אֲבָל לֹא בְּקָשֶׁה מִפְּנֵי שֶׁמַּפְחִיתָן. כְּלֵי זָהָב וּכְלֵי זְכוּכִית לֹא יִגַּע בָּהֶן עַד שֶׁיָּבֹא אֵלִיָּהוּ.
human_translation: silver vessels or copper vessels, may use them The Sages taught One who finds wooden vessels uses them, so that they will not deteriorate copper vessels uses them with hot but not on the fire, due to that it erodes them. silver vessels he uses them with cold but not with hot because it tarnishes them. rakes or axes, may use them with soft but not with hard because damages them. gold vessels or glass vessels, he may not touch them until Elijah will come
llm_translation: Vessels of silver and vessels of copper are used with them, etc. The Sages taught: One who finds wooden vessels uses them so that they do not rot; copper vessels are used with them in hot water, but not with fire, because they blacken. Silver vessels are used with them in cold, but not in hot, because they blacken. Scouring pads and sponges are used with them in vinegar, but not in lye, because it diminishes them. Vessels of gold and vessels of glass one should not touch until Elijah comes.

hebrew_text: כְּדֶרֶךְ שֶׁאָמְרוּ בַּאֲבֵידָה כָּךְ אָמְרוּ בְּפִקָּדוֹן. פִּקָּדוֹן מַאי עֲבִידְתֵּיהּ גַּבֵּיהּ? אָמַר רַב אַדָּא בַּר חָמָא אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: בְּפִקָּדוֹן שֶׁהָלְכוּ בַּעֲלֵיהֶן לִמְדִינַת הַיָּם.
human_translation: the manner that said with regard to a lost item, so they said a deposit. What is doing with a deposit; Rav Adda bar Ḥama said Rav Sheshet said: to a deposit whose owner went to a country overseas.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Just as they said regarding a lost item, so they said regarding a deposit. What is the function of a deposit? Rav Adda bar Hama said in the name of Rav Sheshet: In a deposit where their owners went to the country of the sea. English translation:

hebrew_text: מָצָא שַׂק אוֹ קוּפָּה [וְכׇל דָּבָר] שֶׁאֵין דַּרְכּוֹ לִיטּוֹל – הֲרֵי זֶה לֹא יִטּוֹל. מְנָהָנֵי מִילֵּי? דְּתָנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״וְהִתְעַלַּמְתָּ״, פְּעָמִים שֶׁאַתָּה מִתְעַלֵּם וּפְעָמִים שֶׁאִי אַתָּה מִתְעַלֵּם.
human_translation: found a sack or a basket or any item that is not his manner to take he not take From where are these matters as the Sages taught and disregard occasions which you may disregard and occasions which you may not disregard
llm_translation: He found a sack or basket and anything that is not normally taken - he shall not take. Are you enjoying words? For the Rabbis taught: "And you have ignored," sometimes you ignore and sometimes you do not ignore.

hebrew_text: הָא כֵּיצַד? הָיָה כֹּהֵן וְהִיא בְּבֵית הַקְּבָרוֹת, אוֹ שֶׁהָיָה זָקֵן וְאֵינָהּ לְפִי כְּבוֹדוֹ, אוֹ שֶׁהָיְתָה מְלָאכָה שֶׁלּוֹ מְרוּבָּה מִשֶּׁל חֲבֵירוֹ, לְכָךְ נֶאֱמַר: ״וְהִתְעַלַּמְתָּ מֵהֶם״.
human_translation: How so; he was a priest and is in the graveyard or he was an elderly person and it is not in keeping with his dignity or his labor was greater than the other therefore, it is stated: “And disregard them.”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: How so? There was a kohen and she was in a cemetery, or he was an elder and she is not according to his honor, or his work was more abundant than that of his fellow, therefore it is said: "And you shall ignore them."

hebrew_text: לְמַאי אִיצְטְרִיךְ קְרָא? אִילֵימָא לְכֹהֵן וְהִיא בְּבֵית הַקְּבָרוֹת – פְּשִׁיטָא, הַאי עֲשֵׂה וְהַאי לֹא תַעֲשֶׂה, וַעֲשֵׂה וְלָא אָתֵי עֲשֵׂה וְדָחֵי אֶת לֹא תַעֲשֶׂה וַעֲשֵׂה, וְתוּ: לָא דָּחֵינַן אִיסּוּרָא מִקַּמֵּי מָמוֹנָא.
human_translation: For what was a verse necessary If we say for a priest and in the graveyard, obvious this is a positive mitzva: and that a prohibition: and a positive mitzva: a positive mitzva does not override a prohibition and a positive mitzva. And furthermore, we do not override prohibition in the face of monetary matters.
llm_translation: For what purpose does the verse need to be necessary? If you say for a priest and it is in a cemetery - it is obvious, this one is a positive commandment and this one is a negative commandment, and a positive commandment does not come to push aside a positive and negative commandment, and come and learn: we do not push aside a prohibition for the sake of monetary loss.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לְשֶׁלּוֹ מְרוּבֶּה מִשֶּׁל חֲבֵירוֹ – מִדְּרַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב נָפְקָא, דְּאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: ״אֶפֶס כִּי
human_translation: Rather, to his labor was greater than the other. derived Rav Yehuda Rav says. As Rav Yehuda says Rav says: “Only so that
llm_translation: Rather, for his own benefit more than his friend's - from Rav Yehudah said Rav Nafka, as Rav Yehudah said Rav: "No, for

hebrew_text: לֹא יִהְיֶה בְּךָ אֶבְיוֹן״ – שֶׁלְּךָ קוֹדֵם לְשֶׁל כׇּל אָדָם,
human_translation: there shall be no needy among you” your take precedence over of any person.
llm_translation: "There shall be no poor among you" - yours takes precedence over that of all people,

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לְזָקֵן וְאֵינָהּ לְפִי כְּבוֹדוֹ.
human_translation: Rather, to an elderly person and it is not in keeping with his dignity
llm_translation: Rather for an elder, and not according to his honor.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה: הִכִּישָׁהּ – חַיָּיב בָּהּ. אַבָּיֵי הֲוָה יָתֵיב קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבָּה, חֲזָא לְהָנָךְ עִיזֵּי דְּקָיְימוּ, שְׁקַל קָלָא וּשְׁדָא בְּהוּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִיחַיַּיבְתְּ בְּהוּ, קוּם אַהְדְּרִינְהוּ.
human_translation: Rabba says: struck it obligated to it Abaye was sitting before Rabba saw these goats standing He picked up a clod of dirt and threw it at them, said to him: You have obligated yourself to them. Arise and return them
llm_translation: Rabah said: If he struck her - he is liable for her. Abaye was sitting before Rabah, he saw some goats passing by, he took a stick and threw it at them. He said to him: You have made yourself liable for them, go and return them.

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: דַּרְכּוֹ לְהַחְזִיר בַּשָּׂדֶה, וְאֵין דַּרְכּוֹ לְהַחְזִיר בָּעִיר, מַהוּ? מִי אָמְרִינַן הֲשָׁבָה מְעַלְּיָא בָּעֵינַן, וְכֵיוָן דְּלָאו דַּרְכֵּיהּ לְהַחְזִיר בָּעִיר – לָא לִחַיַּיב? אוֹ דִלְמָא בַּשָּׂדֶה מִיהַת הוּא דְּאִיחַיַּיב לֵיהּ, וְכֵיוָן דְּאִיחַיַּיב עֲלֵיהּ בַּשָּׂדֶה – אִיחַיַּיב לֵיהּ בָּעִיר? תֵּיקוּ.
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before is his manner to return in the field, but it is not his manner to return in the city, what is we say we need an unequivocal return and since it is not his manner to return in the city, let him not be obligated Or perhaps, he is obligated in any event in the field, and once he is obligated it in the field, he is obligated in the city. shall stand
llm_translation: He asked them: His way is to return in the field, and his way is not to return in the city, what is the law? Do we say that we require a higher level of return, and since his way is not to return in the city - he is not liable? Or perhaps in the field is where he is liable, and since he is liable for it in the field - he is liable for it in the city? The matter remains unresolved.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: כֹּל שֶׁבְּשֶׁלּוֹ מַחְזִיר, בְּשֶׁל חֲבֵירוֹ נָמֵי מַחְזִיר. וְכֹל שֶׁבְּשֶׁלּוֹ פּוֹרֵק וְטוֹעֵן, בְּשֶׁל חֲבֵירוֹ נָמֵי פּוֹרֵק וְטוֹעֵן.
human_translation: Rava says: any where he would recover his own also return another’s And any he unloads and loads his own also unload and load another’s
llm_translation: Rava said: Everything that is in its own vessel returns its flavor, in the vessel of its fellow it also returns its flavor. And everything that is in its own vessel imparts and absorbs, in the vessel of its fellow it also imparts and absorbs.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל בְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי הֲוָה קָאָזֵיל בְּאוֹרְחָא, פְּגַע בֵּיהּ הָהוּא גַּבְרָא, הֲוָה דָּרֵי פִּתְכָּא דְאוֹפֵי, אוֹתְבִינְהוּ וְקָא מִיתְּפַח, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: דְּלִי לִי, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: כַּמָּה שָׁוִין? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: פַּלְגָא דְזוּזָא, יְהַיב לֵיהּ פַּלְגָא דְזוּזָא וְאַפְקְרֵהּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yosei, was walking on the road. A certain man encountered him, was carrying a burden of wood. He set down and was resting. said to him: Lift for me said to him: How much are they worth? said to him: A half-dinar. gave him a half-dinar, and declared ownerless.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yosei, was walking on the road. A certain man met him, who was carrying a load of wood on his shoulders. He approached him and greeted him. He said to him: "Lift it for me." He said to him: "How much are they worth?" He said to him: "Half a zuz." He gave him half a zuz and released him.

hebrew_text: הֲדַר זְכָה בְּהוּ, הֲדַר יְהַיב לֵיהּ פַּלְגָא דְזוּזָא וְאַפְקְרֵהּ. חַזְיֵיהּ דַּהֲוָה קָא בָּעֵי לְמֶיהְדַּר לְמִזְכֵּיה בְּהוּ, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לְכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא אַפְקַרְ[תִּי]נְהוּ וְלָךְ לָא אַפְקַרְ[תִּי]נְהוּ.
human_translation: then reacquired and again gave him a half-dinar, and declared ownerless. He saw that desired to reacquire said to him: I declared ownerless with regard to everyone but I did not declare them ownerless with regard to you.
llm_translation: The one who adorned himself with it, adorned him with half a zuz and released him. He saw that he wanted to adorn himself with it, he said to him: "I have released them to all the people of the world, and I have not released them to you."

hebrew_text: וּמִי הָוֵי הֶפְקֵר כִּי הַאי גַוְונָא? וְהָתְנַן, בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: הֶפְקֵר לַעֲנִיִּים – הֶפְקֵר. וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: אֵינוֹ הֶפְקֵר עַד שֶׁיְּהֵא הֶפְקֵר לַעֲנִיִּים וְלַעֲשִׁירִים, כִּשְׁמִיטָּה.
human_translation: But is rendered ownerless in a case like this? But didn’t we learn Beit Shammai say: declared ownerless for the poor is ownerless. And Beit Hillel say: It is not ownerless, until will be ownerless for the poor and for the rich, like the Sabbatical Year,
llm_translation: And who is considered ownerless in this case? And it was taught: Beit Shammai say: Ownerless for the poor - ownerless. And Beit Hillel say: It is not ownerless until it is ownerless for both the poor and the rich, like the Sabbatical year.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל בְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי לְכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא אַפְקְרִינְהוּ, וּבְמִלְּתָא בְּעָלְמָא הוּא דְּאוֹקְמֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rather, Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yosei, declared ownerless to everyone and was with a mere statement that he prevented him
llm_translation: Rather, Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yosei, entrusted them to all the people of the world, and in a matter of the world, it is established.

hebrew_text: וְהָא רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל בְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי זָקֵן וְאֵינָהּ לְפִי כְבוֹדוֹ הֲוָה! רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל בְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי לִפְנִים מִשּׁוּרַת הַדִּין הוּא דַּעֲבַד.
human_translation: But wasn’t Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yosei, an elderly person and it was not in keeping with his dignity Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yosei, he conducted beyond the letter of the law,
llm_translation: And this, Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yosei the Elder, and it is not according to his honor was! Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yosei, previously from the line of judgment he acted.

hebrew_text: דְּתָנֵי רַב יוֹסֵף: ״וְהוֹדַעְתָּ לָהֶם״ – זֶה בֵּית חַיֵּיהֶם, ״אֶת הַדֶּרֶךְ״ – זוֹ גְּמִילוּת חֲסָדִים, ״אֲשֶׁר יֵלְכוּ״ – זֶה בִּיקּוּר חוֹלִים, ״בָּהּ״ – זוֹ קְבוּרָה, ״וְאֶת הַמַּעֲשֶׂה״ – זֶה הַדִּין, ״אֲשֶׁר יַעֲשׂוּן״ – זוֹ לִפְנִים מִשּׁוּרַת הַדִּין.
human_translation: As Rav Yosef taught “And you shall teach them,” that the structure of their livelihood, “the path,” that acts of kindness; “they shall walk,” that visiting the ill; “wherein,” that burial; “and the action,” that law; “that they must perform,” that beyond the letter of the law.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Rabbi Yosef taught: "And you shall make it known to them" - this refers to their home, "the way" - this is acts of kindness, "they shall go" - this is visiting the sick, "in it" - this is burial, "and the work" - this is judgment, "that they shall do" - this is beyond the requirements of the law.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: ״אֲשֶׁר יֵלְכוּ״ – זֶה בִּיקּוּר חוֹלִים, הַיְינוּ גְּמִילוּת חֲסָדִים! לֹא נִצְרְכָה אֶלָּא לְבֶן גִּילוֹ, דְּאָמַר מָר: בֶּן גִּילוֹ נוֹטֵל אֶחָד מִשִּׁשִּׁים בְּחׇלְיוֹ, וַאֲפִילּוּ הָכִי מִבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְמֵיזַל לְגַבֵּיהּ.
human_translation: The Master said: “they shall walk,” that visiting the ill. That is acts of kindness; necessary only for the contemporary of as the Master said: one who is a contemporary takes one-sixtieth of his illness. even so, he is required to go him.
llm_translation: Master said: " 'That they may go' - this refers to visiting the sick, meaning performing acts of loving-kindness! It is only necessary for a son of old age, as Master said: A son of old age takes one out of sixty of his illness, and even so, he wants to die for him."

hebrew_text: ״בָּהּ״ – זוֹ קְבוּרָה. הַיְינוּ גְּמִילוּת חֲסָדִים! לֹא נִצְרְכָה אֶלָּא לְזָקֵן וְאֵינָהּ לְפִי כְּבוֹדוֹ.
human_translation: “wherein,” that burial. That is acts of kindness; necessary only to an elderly person, and it is not in keeping with his dignity
llm_translation: "Ba" - this is burial. That is, acts of loving-kindness! It is only needed for an elder, and not according to his honor.

hebrew_text: אֲשֶׁר יַעֲשׂוּן זוֹ לִפְנִים מִשּׁוּרַת הַדִּין. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: לֹא חָרְבָה יְרוּשָׁלַיִם אֶלָּא עַל שֶׁדָּנוּ בָּהּ דִּין תּוֹרָה. אֶלָּא דִּינֵי דְּמָגִיזְתָּא לְדַיְּינוּ?! אֶלָּא אֵימָא: שֶׁהֶעֱמִידוּ דִּינֵיהֶם עַל דִּין תּוֹרָה וְלָא עֲבַדוּ לִפְנִים מִשּׁוּרַת הַדִּין.
human_translation: “That they must perform”; that beyond the letter of the law, as Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Jerusalem was destroyed only for that they adjudicated Torah law in Rather, Should they rather have adjudicated arbitrary decisions [ demagizeta ]? Rather, say: That they established their rulings on Torah law and did not go beyond the letter of the law.
llm_translation: The text: "Asher ya'asun zo lifnim mi'shurat ha'din. D'amar Rabbi Yochanan: Lo charvah Yerushalayim ela al she'danu bah din Torah. Ela dinei d'magizta le'dainu?! Ela eima: shehe'emidu dineihem al din Torah ve'lo avadu lifnim mi'shurat ha'din." Translation: "That they should do this beyond the requirements of the law. For Rabbi Yochanan said: Jerusalem was only destroyed because they judged by the Torah law. But did they not judge according to the law of magistrates?! Rather say: they established their laws on the basis of Torah law and did not act beyond the requirements of the law."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אֵי זוֹ הִיא אֲבֵידָה? מָצָא חֲמוֹר אוֹ פָּרָה רוֹעִין בַּדֶּרֶךְ – אֵין זוֹ אֲבֵידָה. חֲמוֹר וְכֵלָיו הֲפוּכִין, פָּרָה רָצָה בֵּין הַכְּרָמִים – הֲרֵי זוֹ אֲבֵידָה. הֶחְזִירָהּ וּבָרְחָה, הֶחְזִירָהּ וּבָרְחָה, אֲפִילּוּ אַרְבָּעָה וַחֲמִישָׁה פְּעָמִים – חַיָּיב לְהַחְזִירָהּ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״הָשֵׁב תְּשִׁיבֵם״.
human_translation: Which is lost property? one found a donkey or a cow grazing on the path, that is not lost property, a donkey with its accoutrements overturned, or a cow ran through the vineyards, that is lost property. one returned and it fled, returned it and it fled, even four or five times, obligated to return it is stated: you shall return them
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: What is considered a lost item? If one finds a donkey or a cow roaming on the road - this is not considered a lost item. If a donkey and its utensils are overturned, or if a cow wants to go between the vineyards - this is considered a lost item. If one returns it and it runs away, and one returns it and it runs away, even four or five times - one is obligated to return it, as it is stated: "You shall surely return them" (Deuteronomy 22:1).

hebrew_text: הָיָה בָּטֵל מִסֶּלַע, לֹא יֹאמַר לוֹ: תֵּן לִי סֶלַע, אֶלָּא נוֹתֵן לוֹ שְׂכָרוֹ כְּפוֹעֵל. אִם יֵשׁ שָׁם בֵּית דִּין – מַתְנֶה בִּפְנֵי בֵּית דִּין, אִם אֵין שָׁם בֵּית דִּין – בִּפְנֵי מִי יַתְנֶה? שֶׁלּוֹ קוֹדֵם.
human_translation: was idle from a sela , he shall not say to Give me a sela Rather, gives him his wage as a laborer, If there are there a court, may stipulate before the court If there is no court there before whom he can stipulate his take precedence
llm_translation: He was idle from a rock, one should not say to him: "Give me the rock," rather one should give him his wage as a worker. If there is a court there - appoint in front of the court, if there is no court there - in front of whom should he appoint? His takes precedence.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אַטּוּ כֹּל הָנֵי דְּאָמְרִינַן, לָאו אֲבֵידָה הָווּ? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: הָכִי קָאָמַר, אֵי זוֹ הִיא כְּלַל אֲבֵידָה שֶׁהוּא חַיָּיב בָּהּ? מָצָא חֲמוֹר וּפָרָה רוֹעִין בַּדֶּרֶךְ – אֵין זוֹ אֲבֵידָה וְלָא מִיחַיַּיב בַּהּ. חֲמוֹר וְכֵלָיו הֲפוּכִים, פָּרָה וְרָצָה בֵּין הַכְּרָמִים – הֲרֵי זוֹ אֲבֵידָה וּמִיחַיַּיב בַּהּ.
human_translation: Is that to say that all those other that we stated are not lost property? Rav Yehuda said this is saying: What is the principle a lost item that one is obligated to found a donkey or a cow grazing on the path, that is not lost property, and he is not obligated to it. a donkey with its accoutrements overturned, or a cow that was running through the vineyards, that is lost property, and he is obligated to it.
llm_translation: Gemara: Atu kol hanei de'amrinan, lav avida havu? Amar Rav Yehudah: Hachi ka'amar, ei zu hi klal avaida shehu chayav bah? Matza chamor u'parah ro'in baderech - ein zo avaida v'lo michayav bah. Chamor v'chalav hafuchim, parah v'ratzah bein hakramim - harei zo avaida u'michayav bah.

hebrew_text: וּלְעוֹלָם?! אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: עַד שְׁלֹשָׁה יָמִים. הֵיכִי דָמֵי? אִי בְּלֵילָוָתָא – אֲפִילּוּ חֲדָא שַׁעְתָּא נָמֵי, אִי בִּימָמָא – אֲפִילּוּ טוּבָא נָמֵי לָא!
human_translation: And forever? Rav Yehuda said Rav said: Until three days What are the circumstances? If at night, even even one hour If during the day, even more also not
llm_translation: And forever?! Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: Until three days. How so? If at night – even for a moment, if during the day – even for a long time not!

hebrew_text: לָא צְרִיכָא, דַּהֲוָה חָזֵי לַהּ בְּקַדְמְתָא וּבַחֲשֶׁכְתָּא, תְּלָתָא יוֹמֵי אָמְרִינַן: אִיתְרְמוֹיֵי אִתְרְמִי לַהּ וְנָפְקָא, טְפֵי וַדַּאי אֲבֵידָה הִיא.
human_translation: No, is necessary where one saw in the early and in the dark three days, we say: It happened went out more certainly a lost item.
llm_translation: Not necessary, for he saw her in the east and in the darkness, for three days we say: her charms are charming to her and she goes out, surely it is a lost item.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: מָצָא טַלִּית וְקַרְדּוֹם
human_translation: This is also taught one found a cloak or an ax
llm_translation: It was taught in a baraita: Nami the Elder said: "If one finds a cloak and a purse."

hebrew_text: בְּאִסְרַטְיָא וּפָרָה רָצָה בֵּין הַכְּרָמִים – הֲרֵי זוֹ אֲבֵידָה. טַלִּית בְּצַד גָּדֵר, קַרְדּוֹם בְּצַד גָּדֵר, וּפָרָה רוֹעָה בֵּין הַכְּרָמִים – אֵין זוֹ אֲבֵידָה. שְׁלֹשָׁה יָמִים זֶה אַחַר זֶה – הֲרֵי זוֹ אֲבֵידָה. רָאָה מַיִם שֶׁשּׁוֹטְפִין וּבָאִין – הֲרֵי זֶה גּוֹדֵר בִּפְנֵיהֶם.
human_translation: on a main thoroughfare [ be’isratiyya ], or a cow running through the vineyards, that is lost property. a cloak alongside a fence, an ax alongside a fence, or a cow grazing among the vineyards, that is not lost property. three consecutive days, that is lost property. one saw water that is flowing and coming he must establish a barrier before
llm_translation: In a path and a cow wants among the vineyards - this is a lost item. A cloak alongside a fence, a shovel alongside a fence, and a cow grazing among the vineyards - this is not a lost item. Three days, one after the other - this is a lost item. He saw water that is flowing and coming - this one is digging in front of them.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: ״לְכׇל אֲבֵידַת אָחִיךָ״ – לְרַבּוֹת אֲבֵידַת קַרְקַע. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב חֲנַנְיָא לְרָבָא: תַּנְיָא דִּמְסַיַּיע לָךְ, רָאָה מַיִם שֶׁשּׁוֹטְפִין וּבָאִין הֲרֵי זֶה גּוֹדֵר בִּפְנֵיהֶם.
human_translation: Rava says with every lost item of your brother” to include loss of land. Rav Ḥananya said to Rava: that is taught that supports your one saw water that is flowing and coming he must establish a barrier before
llm_translation: Rava said: "To every lost item of your brother" - to include lost property. Rav Chananya said to Rava: A Mishna that supports you, if one sees water flowing and coming, he may dam it in front of them.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִי מִשּׁוּם הָא לָא (תְּסַיְּיעַי) [תְּסַיְּיעַן], הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן? בִּדְאִיכָּא עוּמְרִין. אִי דְּאִיכָּא עוּמְרִין, מַאי לְמֵימְרָא – לָא צְרִיכָא, דְּאִית בַּהּ עוּמְרִין דִּצְרִיכִי לְאַרְעָא, מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: כֵּיוָן דִּצְרִיכִי לְאַרְעָא, כִּי גּוּפַהּ דְּאַרְעָא דָּמַיִין, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: said to If due to that do not support my With what are we dealing here in which there are sheaves If in which there are sheaves what of stating No, necessary there are sheaves that need the land Lest you say: Since they still need the land, their is like the land itself teaches us
llm_translation: He said to him: If not for this, would you not assist? Here, with what are we dealing? With bundles of sheaves. If there are bundles of sheaves, what can we say – it is not necessary, for if there are sheaves in it that need to be spread out in the field, what can you say: since it needs to be spread out in the field, it is like the body of the field itself, indicating to us.

hebrew_text: מָצָא חֲמוֹר וּפָרָה [וְכוּ׳]. הָא גּוּפַהּ קַשְׁיָא! אָמְרַתְּ: מָצָא חֲמוֹר וּפָרָה רוֹעִין בַּדֶּרֶךְ – אֵין זוֹ אֲבֵידָה, רוֹעִין בַּדֶּרֶךְ הוּא דְּלָא הָווּ אֲבֵידָה, הָא רָצָה בַּדֶּרֶךְ וְרוֹעָה בֵּין הַכְּרָמִים הָוְיָא אֲבֵידָה. אֵימָא סֵיפָא: חֲמוֹר וְכֵלָיו הֲפוּכִים וּפָרָה רָצָה בֵּין הַכְּרָמִים – הֲרֵי זוֹ אֲבֵידָה. רָצָה בֵּין הַכְּרָמִים הוּא דְּהָוְיָא אֲבֵידָה, הָא רָצָה בַּדֶּרֶךְ וְרוֹעָה בֵּין הַכְּרָמִים – אֵין זוֹ אֲבֵידָה!
human_translation: one found a donkey or a cow This itself difficult. you said: one found a donkey or a cow grazing on the path, that is not lost property, grazing on the path it is not lost property, but running on the path or grazing among the vineyards, it is a lost item. say the latter clause a donkey with its accoutrements overturned, or a cow ran through the vineyards, is lost property. running through the vineyards is it lost property, but running on the path or grazing among the vineyards, it is not lost property.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: If one finds a donkey and an ox etc.. This is a difficult case! You say: if one finds a donkey and an ox grazing on the road - this is not a lost item, for if they were grazing on the road, it is not considered lost. But if it was grazing in the vineyards, it is considered lost. Say the latter part: if a donkey and its utensils are overturned and an ox is grazing in the vineyards - this is considered a lost item. If it is grazing in the vineyards, it is considered lost, but if it is grazing on the road and among the vineyards - it is not considered lost!

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: ״יַגִּיד עָלָיו רֵעוֹ״; תְּנָא רוֹעָה בַּדֶּרֶךְ דְּלָא הָוְיָא אֲבֵידָה, וְהוּא הַדִּין לְרוֹעָה בֵּין הַכְּרָמִים. תְּנָא רָצָה בֵּין הַכְּרָמִים דְּהָוְיָא אֲבֵידָה, וְהוּא הַדִּין לְרָצָה בַּדֶּרֶךְ.
human_translation: Abaye said Its counterpart tells about it taught grazing on the path, where not lost property, and the same is true grazing among the vineyards. taught running through the vineyards, where is lost property, and the same is true of running on the path.
llm_translation: Abaye said: "His neighbor should inform on him"; a Tanna taught: If one is shepherding on the road, it is not considered a lost item, and the same applies to shepherding among the vineyards. A Tanna taught: If one is running among the vineyards, it is considered a lost item, and the same applies to running on the road.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא: אִי ״יַגִּיד עָלָיו רֵעוֹ״ – לִיתְנֵי קִילְּתָא, וְכׇל שֶׁכֵּן חֲמִירְתָּא. לִיתְנֵי רָצָה בַּדֶּרֶךְ דְּהָוְיָא אֲבֵידָה, וְכׇל שֶׁכֵּן רָצָה בֵּין הַכְּרָמִים. וְלִתְנֵי רוֹעָה בֵּין הַכְּרָמִים, דְּלָא הָוְיָא אֲבֵידָה, וְכׇל שֶׁכֵּן רוֹעָה בַּדֶּרֶךְ.
human_translation: Rava said to him: If Its counterpart tells about it, let him teach the lenient and all the more so the stringent Let teach running on the path it is lost property and all the more so running through the vineyards. And let teach grazing among the vineyards it is not lost property, and all the more so when grazing on the path.
llm_translation: He said to him, Rava: If "his neighbor testifies against him" - let him bring a witness, and all the more so if it is a stringent matter. Let him bring a shepherd on the road where it would be lost, and all the more so if it is among the vineyards. And let him bring a shepherd among the vineyards, where it would not be lost, and all the more so if it is on the road.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: רָצָה אַרָצָה לָא קַשְׁיָא, הָא דְּאַפַּהּ לְגַבֵּי דַּבְרָא, הָא דְּאַפַּהּ לְגַבֵּי מָתָא.
human_translation: Rather, Rava said: between running running not difficult. This where its face is toward the field, That where its face is toward the city.
llm_translation: Rather, Rava said: If he wanted, it would not be difficult. This is like one who bakes regarding a thing, this is like one who bakes regarding dough.

hebrew_text: רוֹעָה אַרוֹעָה נָמֵי לָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן בַּאֲבֵידַת גּוּפָהּ, כָּאן בַּאֲבֵידַת קַרְקַע.
human_translation: between grazing grazing also not difficult. Here, with regard to loss of itself. There, loss to the land.
llm_translation: Shepherd who grazes, shepherd who grazes, it is not difficult: here in the loss of her body, here in the loss of her property.

hebrew_text: כִּי קָתָנֵי רוֹעָה בַּדֶּרֶךְ לָא הָוְיָא אֲבֵידָה, הָא רוֹעָה בֵּין הַכְּרָמִים הָוְיָא אֲבֵידָה בַּאֲבֵידַת קַרְקַע. וְכִי קָתָנֵי רָצָה בֵּין הַכְּרָמִים הָוְיָא אֲבֵידָה, הָא רוֹעָה בֵּין הַכְּרָמִים לָא הָוְיָא אֲבֵידָה בַּאֲבֵידַת גּוּפָהּ, דְּרָצָה בֵּין הַכְּרָמִים מִסְ[תַּ]קְּבָא, וְרוֹעָה בֵּין הַכְּרָמִים לָא מִסְ[תַּ]קְּבָא.
human_translation: When teaches grazing on the path, lost property do not But grazing among the vineyards lost property do loss to the land And when teaches running among the vineyards lost property do But grazing among the vineyards lost property do not to loss of itself, as running among the vineyards wounded but grazing among the vineyards not wounded.
llm_translation: When a small animal grazes on the road, it is not considered lost property, but if it grazes among the vineyards, it is considered lost property in terms of the loss of the land. And when a large animal runs among the vineyards, it is considered lost property, but if it grazes among the vineyards, it is not considered lost property in terms of the loss of its body, because when it runs among the vineyards, its body is separated, but when it grazes among the vineyards, its body is not separated.

hebrew_text: וְרוֹעָה בֵּין הַכְּרָמִים, נְהִי דְּלָא מִסְ[תַּ]קְּבָא תִּיפּוֹק לֵיהּ מִשּׁוּם אֲבֵידַת קַרְקַע! בִּדְגוֹי.
human_translation: And grazing among the vineyards although it is not wounded, derive due to loss to the land with regard to of a gentile,
llm_translation: "And he grazes among the vineyards, woe that he does not depart from there due to the loss of the ground! In a case of goring."

hebrew_text: וְתִיפּוֹק לֵיהּ מִשּׁוּם אֲבֵידַת גּוּפָהּ, דְּדִלְמָא קָטְלוּ לַהּ! בְּאַתְרָא דְּמַתְרוּ וַהֲדַר קָטְלִי. וְדִלְמָא אַתְרוֹ בָּהּ! אִי אַתְרוֹ בַּהּ וְלָא אִזְדְּהַרוּ בַּהּ, וַדַּאי אֲבֵידָה מִדַּעַת הִיא.
human_translation: But derive due to loss of itself, as perhaps kill it? with regard to a place where they forewarn and then kill And perhaps they forewarned with regard to If they forewarned with regard to and did not heed this is certainly deliberate loss,
llm_translation: And let it come out because of the loss of her body, perhaps they killed her! In a place where they permitted, and then they killed. And perhaps they permitted her! If they permitted her and did not take care of her, then surely it is a loss due to negligence.

hebrew_text: הֶחְזִירָהּ וּבָרְחָה הֶחְזִירָהּ וּבָרְחָה [וְכוּ׳]. אֲמַר לֵיהּ הָהוּא מִדְּרַבָּנַן לְרָבָא, אֵימָא: ״הָשֵׁב״ חֲדָא זִמְנָא, ״תְּשִׁיבֵם״ תְּרֵי זִמְנֵי!
human_translation: one returned and it fled, returned it and it fled, A certain of the Sages said to Rava: Say “ hashev ” once, “ teshivem ” twice,
llm_translation: The sow returned and fled, the sow returned and fled and so forth. That one said to him from the sages to Rava, say: "Return" one time, "you shall return them" two times!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: ״הָשֵׁב״ אֲפִילּוּ מֵאָה פְּעָמִים מַשְׁמַע, ״תְּשִׁיבֵם״ אֵין לִי אֶלָּא לְבֵיתוֹ, לְגִינָּתוֹ וּלְחוּרְבָּתוֹ מִנַּיִן? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״תְּשִׁיבֵם״, מִכׇּל מָקוֹם. הֵיכִי דָמֵי? אִי דְּמִינַּטְרָא, פְּשִׁיטָא. אִי דְּלָא מִינַּטְרָא, אַמַּאי?
human_translation: said to him: “ Hashev ” indicates even one hundred times. “ Teshivem ” I have only to house. From where to his garden or to his ruins? The verse states: “ Teshivem ,” in any case, What are the circumstances? If protected, obvious If not protected, why
llm_translation: He said to him: "Return." Even a hundred times he heard. "Return them" I have only to his house, his garden, and his courtyard, from where? The Scripture says: "Return them," from any place. How so? If he is a trustee, it is obvious. If he is not a trustee, why?

hebrew_text: לְעוֹלָם דְּמִינַּטְרָא, וְהָא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן: דְּלָא בָּעֵינַן דַּעַת בְּעָלִים. וְכִדְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר דְּאָמַר: הַכֹּל צְרִיכִין דַּעַת בְּעָלִים, חוּץ מֵהֲשָׁבַת אֲבֵידָה, שֶׁהַתּוֹרָה רִיבְּתָה הֲשָׁבוֹת הַרְבֵּה.
human_translation: Actually, where protected. And this teaches us that we do not require the owner’s knowledge And is in accordance with Rabbi Elazar, who says: Every requires the owner’s knowledge except for the return of a lost item, as the Torah amplified multiple return
llm_translation: Forever, minatra, and this implies to us: that we do not require the knowledge of the owners. And like Rabbi Elazar said: everything requires the knowledge of the owners, except for returning a lost item, for the Torah has greatly multiplied returning lost items.

hebrew_text: ״שַׁלֵּחַ תְּשַׁלַּח״, אֵימָא: ״שַׁלֵּחַ״ חֲדָא זִימְנָא, ״תְּשַׁלַּח״ תְּרֵי זִמְנֵי!
human_translation: “You shall dispatch [ shalle’aḥ teshallaḥ ] Say “ shalle’aḥ ” once, “ teshallaḥ ” twice,
llm_translation: "Send, you shall surely send." Why not just "send" once, and "you shall surely send" twice!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: ״שַׁלֵּחַ״ – אֲפִילּוּ מֵאָה פְּעָמִים מַשְׁמַע. ״תְּשַׁלַּח״ אֵין לִי אֶלָּא לִדְבַר הָרְשׁוּת, לִדְבַר מִצְוָה מִנַּיִן? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״תְּשַׁלַּח״, מִכׇּל מָקוֹם.
human_translation: said to him: “ Shalle’aḥ ” indicates even one hundred times. “ Teshallaḥ ” I have only for a non-compulsory matter, for a matter a mitzva, from where The verse states: “ Teshallaḥ ,” in any case
llm_translation: He said to him: "Send" - even a hundred times one hears. "You shall send" - I have only for a matter of permission, for a matter of commandment, from where? The Talmud teaches: "You shall send," from any place.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ הָהוּא מִדְּרַבָּנַן לְרָבָא: וְאֵימָא ״הוֹכֵחַ״ חֲדָא זִימְנָא, ״תּוֹכִיחַ״ תְּרֵי זִמְנֵי?
human_translation: A certain of the Sages said to Rava: Say “ hokhe’aḥ ” once, “ tokhiaḥ ” twice,
llm_translation: He said to him that one from the sages to Rava: And why not "rebuke" once, "you shall surely rebuke" twice?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: ״הוֹכֵחַ״ – אֲפִילּוּ מֵאָה פְּעָמִים מַשְׁמַע. ״תּוֹכִיחַ״ – אֵין לִי אֶלָּא הָרַב לְתַלְמִיד. תַּלְמִיד לְרַב מִנַּיִן? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״הוֹכֵחַ תּוֹכִיחַ״, מִכׇּל מָקוֹם.
human_translation: said to him: “ Hokhe’aḥ ” indicates even one hundred times. “ Tokhiaḥ ” I have only a teacher to a student. a student to a teacher, from where The verse states: “ Hokhe’aḥ tokhiaḥ ” in any case
llm_translation: He said to him: "Rebuke" - even a hundred times you shall hear. "Reprove" - I have only the master to the disciple. From where do we derive that a disciple can reprove the master? The Torah teaches: "Rebuke, you shall surely rebuke," from any place.

hebrew_text: ״עָזֹב תַּעֲזֹב עִמּוֹ״, אֵין לִי אֶלָּא בְּעָלָיו עִמּוֹ. שֶׁאֵין בְּעָלָיו עִמּוֹ, מִנַּיִן? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״עָזֹב תַּעֲזֹב״, מִכׇּל מָקוֹם.
human_translation: you shall release it [ azov ta’azov ] with him” I have only its owner is with it. From where where its owner is not with it The verse states: “ Azov ta’azov ,” in any case.
llm_translation: "Abandon, you shall surely abandon with him," I have only his owner with him. If his owner is not with him, from where? The Torah teaches "abandon, you shall surely abandon," in any case.

hebrew_text: ״הָקֵם תָּקִים עִמּוֹ״, אֵין לִי אֶלָּא בְּעָלָיו עִמּוֹ. שֶׁאֵין בְּעָלָיו עִמּוֹ, מִנַּיִן? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״הָקֵם תָּקִים״, מִכׇּל מָקוֹם.
human_translation: you shall lift them [ hakem takim ] with him” I have only its owner is with it. From where where its owner is not with it The verse states: “ Hakem takim ,” in any case.
llm_translation: "The one who establishes shall establish with him," I have only his owner with him. If his owner is not with him, from where? The Talmud teaches to say "the one who establishes shall establish," from any place.

hebrew_text: וּלְמָה לֵיהּ לְמִכְתַּב פְּרִיקָה, וּלְמָה לֵיהּ לְמִכְתַּב טְעִינָה? צְרִיכִי, דְּאִי כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא פְּרִיקָה – הֲוָה אָמֵינָא מִשּׁוּם דְּאִיכָּא צַעַר בַּעֲלֵי חַיִּים וְאִיכָּא חֶסְרוֹן כִּיס, אֲבָל טְעִינָה, דְּלָאו צַעַר בַּעֲלֵי חַיִּים אִיכָּא וְלָא חֶסְרוֹן כִּיס אִיכָּא, אֵימָא לָא.
human_translation: And why does to write unloading and why does to write loading are necessary, as had the Merciful One written unloading, I would say due to that there is suffering of animals and there is monetary loss, But in loading, there is no suffering of animals and there is no monetary loss, say no,
llm_translation: And why does it need a writing of separation, and why does it need a writing of loading? It is necessary, for if the Merciful One wrote a separation - I would have said it is because there is distress for living creatures and there is a lack of food, but for loading, where there is no distress for living creatures and there is no lack of food, I would say no.

hebrew_text: וְאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן טְעִינָה מִשּׁוּם דִּבְשָׂכָר, אֲבָל פְּרִיקָה דִּבְחִנָּם, אֵימָא לָא. צְרִיכָא.
human_translation: And had taught us loading, due to that with remuneration, But unloading, which is for free, say no, necessary.
llm_translation: "And if we were to hear the loading due to the honey wine, but the unloading for free, we might say no. This is necessary."

hebrew_text: וּלְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן דְּאָמַר: אַף טְעִינָה בְּחִנָּם, מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר? לְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן לָא מְסַיְּימִי קְרָאֵי.
human_translation: And according to Rabbi Shimon, who says even loading for free, what is there to say According to Rabbi Shimon, is not defined the verses
llm_translation: And for Rabbi Shimon who said: Even loading for free, what is there to say? For Rabbi Shimon does not conclude with verses.

hebrew_text: לְמָה לִי לְמִכְתַּב הָנֵי תַּרְתֵּי, וּלְמָה לִי לְמִכְתַּב אֲבֵידָה? צְרִיכִי, דְּאִי כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא הָנֵי תַּרְתֵּי – מִשּׁוּם דְּצַעֲרָא דְּמָרַהּ אִיתָא, צַעֲרָא דִּידַהּ אִיתָא. אֲבָל אֲבֵידָה, דְּצַעֲרָא דְּמָרַהּ אִיתָא וְצַעֲרָא דִּידַהּ לֵיתָא, אֵימָא לָא. וְאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן אֲבֵידָה – מִשּׁוּם דְּלֵיתֵאּ לְמָרַהּ בַּהֲדַהּ,
human_translation: Why do I to write these two and why do I to write a lost item? are necessary, as had the Merciful One written these two due to there is suffering of its owner and there is suffering of itself. But a lost item, where there is suffering of its owner but there is no suffering of say no, And had taught us a lost item, due to its owner is not with it
llm_translation: "Why do I need these two documents, and why do I need this lost item? I need them, for if the Merciful One wrote these two documents - because the pain of the creditor is present, the pain of the debtor is present. But the lost item, since the pain of the creditor is present and the pain of the debtor is not present, I might say it is not necessary. And if we need the lost item - because the creditor is not present at the same time."

hebrew_text: אֲבָל הָנֵי תַּרְתֵּי דְּאִיתֵאּ לְמָרַהּ בַּהֲדַהּ, אֵימָא לָא. צְרִיכָא.
human_translation: but these two where its owner is with it, say no, necessary
llm_translation: But these two that are mentioned regarding the bitterness, say no. It is necessary.

hebrew_text: ״מוֹת יוּמַת הַמַּכֶּה״, אֵין לִי אֶלָּא בְּמִיתָה הַכְּתוּבָה בּוֹ. מִנַּיִן שֶׁאִם אִי אַתָּה יָכוֹל לַהֲמִיתוֹ בְּמִיתָה הַכְּתוּבָה בּוֹ שֶׁאַתָּה רַשַּׁאי לַהֲמִיתוֹ בְּכׇל מִיתָה שֶׁאַתָּה יָכוֹל לַהֲמִיתוֹ? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״מוֹת יוּמַת״, מִכׇּל מָקוֹם.
human_translation: he that struck him shall be put to death [ mot yumat ]” I have only with death written with regard to him, From where that if you are unable to execute him with death written with regard to him, it is permitted for you to execute him with any death which you are able to execute him? The verse states: “ Mot yumat ,” in any case.
