This is a case of an oath imposed upon the borrower, and the Sages say: 'Let the borrower swear, lest this one swear falsely and cause the lender to lose his deposit.'

hebrew_text: וְאִם
human_translation: But if
llm_translation: And if

hebrew_text: אִיתָא לִדְרַב הוּנָא כֵּיוָן דְּמִשְׁתְּבַע מִלְוֶה שֶׁאֵינָהּ בִּרְשׁוּתוֹ, הֵיכִי מָצֵי מַפֵּיק לַהּ? אָמַר רָבָא: שֶׁיֵּשׁ עֵדִים שֶׁנִּשְׂרְפָה.
human_translation: Rav Huna is so, once creditor takes an oath that is not in his possession, how can he produce it Rava said: where there are witnesses that was burned.
llm_translation: It was stated to Rav Huna: Since he borrowed without permission, how can he collect from him? Rava said: Because there are witnesses that were burned.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, מֵהֵיכָא מַיְיתֵי לַהּ? אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: שֶׁיֵּשׁ עֵדִים שֶׁנִּגְנְבָה. סוֹף סוֹף מֵהֵיכָא מַיְיתֵי לַהּ? דְּטָרַח וּמַיְיתֵי לַהּ.
human_translation: If so, From where will he bring it Rather, Rav Yosef said: where there are witnesses that was stolen. Ultimately, from where will bring exert and bring
llm_translation: Talmudic text: If so, from where does he bring it? Rather, Rav Yosef said: There are witnesses that she stole it. In the end, from where does he bring it? He exerted effort and brought it.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, כִּי מִשְׁתְּבַע מַלְוֶה נָמֵי, לִטְרַח לֹוֶה וְלַיְתֵי! בִּשְׁלָמָא מַלְוֶה יָדַע מַאן קָא עָיֵיל וְנָפֵק בְּבֵיתֵיהּ, וְאָזֵיל וְטָרַח וּמַיְיתֵי לַהּ. אֶלָּא לֹוֶה, מִי יָדַע מַאן עָיֵיל וְנָפֵיק בְּבֵיתֵיהּ דְּמַלְוֶה?
human_translation: If so, where creditor takes an oath as well, let debtor exert and bring Granted, creditor knows who enters and exits his house, And he goes and exerts and brings But debtor, does he know who enters and exits the creditor’s house?
llm_translation: If so, when the lender swears, let the borrower trouble himself and come! Granted, the lender knows who is coming and going in his house, and then he goes and troubles himself and brings it to him. But the borrower, who knows who is coming and going in the house of the lender?

hebrew_text: אַבָּיֵי אוֹמֵר: גְּזֵירָה שֶׁמָּא יִטְעוֹן וְיֹאמַר לוֹ: אַחַר שְׁבוּעָה מְצָאתִיהָ. רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: זֶה נִשְׁבָּע וְזֶה נִשְׁבָּע, זֶה נִשְׁבָּע שֶׁאֵינָהּ בִּרְשׁוּתוֹ, וְזֶה נִשְׁבָּע כַּמָּה הָיָה שָׁוֶה. וְהָכִי קָאָמַר: מִי נִשְׁבָּע תְּחִילָּה? מַלְוֶה נִשְׁבָּע תְּחִילָּה, שֶׁמָּא יִשָּׁבַע זֶה וְיוֹצִיא הַלָּה אֶת הַפִּקָּדוֹן.
human_translation: Abaye says: a decree lest claim and say to him: I found after oath. Rav Ashi says: This takes an oath and that takes an oath. This takes an oath that is not in his possession. And that takes an oath how much was worth. And this is saying: Who takes an oath first? The creditor takes an oath first lest this take an oath and the other produce the deposit.
llm_translation: Abaye says: A decree is made lest he the borrower deny the loan and say to him the lender: "After a week I found it." Rav Ashi says: This one swore and this one swore, this one swore about something that is not in his possession, and this one swore how much it was worth. And this is what he is saying: Who should swear first? The lender should swear first, lest this one swear and cause the guarantor to pay.

hebrew_text: רַב הוּנָא בַּר תַּחְלִיפָא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרָבָא אָמַר: רֵישָׁא דְסֵיפָא תְּיוּבְתָּא לְרַב הוּנָא, סֶלַע הִלְוִיתַנִי עָלָיו, שְׁתַּיִם הָיָה שָׁוֶה. וְהַלָּה אוֹמֵר: לֹא כִי, אֶלָּא סֶלַע הִלְוִיתִיךָ עָלָיו, סֶלַע הָיָה שָׁוֶה – פָּטוּר. וְאִם אִיתָא לִדְרַב הוּנָא מִגּוֹ דְּמִשְׁתְּבַע מַלְוֶה שֶׁאֵינָהּ בִּרְשׁוּתוֹ, לִישְׁתְּבַע נָמֵי אַגִּילְגּוּל שְׁבוּעָה כַּמָּה הָיָה שָׁוֶה!
human_translation: Rav Huna bar Taḥlifa said in the name of Rava: The first of the latter clause a conclusive refutation of Rav Huna, You loaned me a sela on was worth two And the other said: That is not rather, I loaned you a sela on was worth a sela . exempt. And if Rav Huna is so, the creditor takes an oath that is not in his possession, let him also take an oath by means of extension of an oath how much was worth,
llm_translation: Rav Huna son of Tachlifa, from the name of Rava, said: The beginning of the end is an addition for Rav Huna, a rock I lent to him, it was worth two. And the other one says: Not so, rather a rock I lent you, it was worth two - exempt. And if it comes to Rav Huna from one who claims a loan that is not in his possession, he should also claim a rolling stone, how much was it worth!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: אַמְרִיתַהּ לִשְׁמַעְתָּא קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב כָּהֲנָא וְאָמַר לִי: תְּהֵא בְּמַאֲמִינוֹ. וּנְהֵמְנֵיהּ לֹוֶה לְמַלְוֶה נָמֵי בְּהָא כַּמָּה הֲוָה שָׁוֶה? לָא קִים לֵיהּ בְּגַוֵּיהּ. וּנְהֵמְנֵיהּ מַלְוֶה לְלֹוֶה, דְּקִים לֵיהּ בְּגַוֵּיהּ? לָא מְהֵימַן לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: I stated halakha before Rav Kahana, and he said to me: Let be with regard to trusts But let the debtor trust the creditor with regard to this how much was worth. not certain about But let the creditor trust the debtor, as certain about does not trust
llm_translation: Rav Ashe said: I said it for you to hear before Rav Kahana, and he said to me: Let it be with his trust. And he leaned it to lend to a borrower, how much was it worth? It did not stand in its place. And he leaned it to another lender, how much was it worth? He did not trust him.

hebrew_text: וּמַאי שְׁנָא לֹוֶה דִּמְהֵימַן לֵיהּ לְמַלְוֶה, וּמַאי שְׁנָא מַלְוֶה דְּלָא מְהֵימַן לֵיהּ לְלֹוֶה? לֹוֶה מְקַיֵּים בֵּיהּ בְּמַלְוֶה ״תֻּמַּת יְשָׁרִים תַּנְחֵם״, מַלְוֶה מְקַיֵּים בֵּיהּ בְּלֹוֶה ״וְסֶלֶף בּוֹגְדִים יְשָׁדֵּם״.
human_translation: And what is different debtor trusts the creditor and what is different creditor does not trust the debtor debtor in the creditor fulfillment “The integrity of the upright shall guide them” creditor in the debtor fulfillment “But the perverseness of the faithless shall destroy them”
llm_translation: And what is the difference between a lender who trusts the borrower, and a borrower who does not trust the lender? The lender fulfills in it with lending, "The integrity of the upright guides them," and the borrower fulfills in it with borrowing, "But the perversity of the treacherous will destroy them."

hebrew_text: הָהוּא גַּבְרָא דְּאַפְקֵיד כִּיפֵּי גַּבֵּי חַבְרֵיהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הַב לִי כִּיפַּי, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָא יָדַעְנָא הֵיכָא אוֹתְבִי[תִי]נְהוּ. אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב נַחְמָן. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: כֹּל לָא יָדַעְנָא פְּשִׁיעוּתָא הִיא, זִיל שַׁלֵּים! לָא שַׁילֵּם. אֲזַל רַב נַחְמָן אַגַּבְּיֵהּ לְאַפַּדְנֵיהּ מִינֵּיהּ, לְסוֹף אִישְׁתְּכֻח כִּיפֵּי וְאִיַּקּוּר. אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: הָדְרִי כִּיפֵּי לְמָרַיְיהוּ. וְהָדְרָא אַפַּדְנָא לְמָרַהּ.
human_translation: A certain man deposited jewels [ keifei ] with another. said to Give me jewels. said to him I do not know where I placed them. came before Rav Naḥman, said to Every I do not know is negligence. Go pay did not pay. Rav Naḥman went repossess his palace Ultimately, were the jewels found, but increased Rav Naḥman said: The jewels return to their owner, and the palace returns to its owner,
llm_translation: That man who took the baskets of his friends. He said to him: "Give me my baskets." He said to him: "I do not know where they are." He came before Rav Nachman. He said to him: "I do not know anything about the theft, go pay!" He did not pay. Rav Nachman went and collected from him, in the end he returned the baskets and the cover. Rav Nachman said: "Return the baskets to their owners." And he returned them to their owner.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: הֲוָה יָתֵיבְנָא קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב נַחְמָן, וּפִרְקִין ״הַמַּפְקִיד״ הֲוָה, וַאֲמַרִי לֵיהּ: שִׁילֵּם וְלֹא רָצָה לִישָּׁבַע. וְלָא אַהְדַּר לִי.
human_translation: Rava said: I was sitting before Rav Naḥman, and our chapter was One who deposits, And I said to paid and did not wish to take an oath? who And did not answer me, and he did well that he did not answer me,
llm_translation: Rava said: I was sitting before Rav Nachman, and the chapter of "hamafkid" came up, and they said to him: "Pay up," but he did not want to take an oath. And he did not return to me.

hebrew_text: וְשַׁפִּיר עֲבַד דְּלָא אַהְדַּר לִי. מַאי טַעְמָא? הָתָם לָא אַטְרְחֵיהּ לְבֵי דִינָא, הָכָא אַטְרְחֵיהּ לְבֵי דִינָא.
human_translation: What is the reason There, He did not inconvenience to go to court. Here, inconvenienced to go to court.
llm_translation: "And Shapir did not return to me. What is the reason? There, he did not trouble the court; here, he troubled the court."

hebrew_text: לְמֵימְרָא דְּסָבַר רַב נַחְמָן דְּשׁוּמָא הָדַר? שָׁאנֵי הָתָם, דְּשׁוּמָא בְּטָעוּת הֲוָה, (דְּקָא) [דְּהָא] הֲוָה כִּיפֵּי מֵעִיקָּרָא.
human_translation: Is this to say that Rav Naḥman holds that appraisal returned it is different there, as it was an erroneous appraisal, that the jewels were from the outset
llm_translation: In the matter of whether Rav Nachman holds that Shuma returned? It is different there, for Shuma was in error, as it was like the original covering.

hebrew_text: אָמְרִי נְהַרְדָּעֵי: שׁוּמָא הָדַר עַד תְּרֵיסַר יַרְחֵי שַׁתָּא. וְאָמַר אַמֵּימָר: אֲנָא מִנְּהַרְדְּעָא אֲנָא, וּסְבִירָא לִי שׁוּמָא הָדַר לְעוֹלָם. וְהִלְכְתָא: שׁוּמָא הָדַר לְעוֹלָם, מִשּׁוּם שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר ״וְעָשִׂיתָ הַיָּשָׁר וְהַטּוֹב״.
human_translation: of Neharde’a say: appraisal returned until the twelve months the year And Ameimar said: I am from Neharde’a, and I hold that an appraisal always returned. And the halakha an appraisal always returned, due to that it is stated: “And you shall do that which is right and good”
llm_translation: The people of Nehardea said: Perhaps Shuma will return after twelve months. And Amemar said: I am from Nehardea, and I think Shuma will return forever. And the halakha is: Shuma will return forever, as it is stated, "And you shall do what is right and good."

hebrew_text: פְּשִׁיטָא: שָׁמוּ לֵיהּ לְבַעַל חוֹב, וַאֲזַל אִיהוּ וְשָׁמַהּ לְבַעַל חוֹב דִּידֵיהּ, אָמְרִינַן לֵיהּ: לָא עֲדִיף אַתְּ מִגַּבְרָא דַּאֲתֵית מִינֵּיהּ. זַבְּנַהּ, אוֹרְתַאּ, וְיַהֲבַהּ בְּמַתָּנָה, וַדַּאי הָנֵי מֵעִיקָּרָא אַדַּעְתָּא דְּאַרְעָא נְחוּת וְלָאו אַדַּעְתָּא דְּזוּזֵי נְחוּת.
human_translation: obvious appraised a creditor, and went and appraised to his creditor, we say to Your are not superior of the man through whom you came sold it bequeathed it gave it as a gift, certain from the outset, those with the intent the land they descended and not with the intent they descended
llm_translation: The Gemara: It is obvious: he appointed him as a creditor, and he went and appointed him as his own creditor. We say to him: You are not preferable to the man who comes from him. He bought it, lit it, and gave it as a gift, and certainly these are from the outset the knowledge of settled land and not the knowledge of movable property.

hebrew_text: שָׁמוּ לַהּ לְאִשָּׁה וְאִינְּסִיבָא, אוֹ שָׁמוּ מִינַּהּ דְּאִשָּׁה וְאִינְּסִיבָא וּמֵתָה בַּעַל בְּנִכְסֵי אִשְׁתּוֹ לוֹקֵחַ הָוֵי – לָא מַיהְדַּר וְלָא מַהְדְּרִינַן לֵיהּ.
human_translation: appraised to a woman and she married, or appraised from a woman and she married and died, a husband with regard to his wife’s property is a buyer, he does not return And we do not return to him
llm_translation: They named her to him for a wife and he did not marry her, or they named her from him for a wife and he did not marry her, and if the husband died, the one who takes his wife's property is not to be honored, and we do not honor him.

hebrew_text: דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר חֲנִינָא: בְּאוּשָׁא הִתְקִינוּ – הָאִשָּׁה שֶׁמָּכְרָה בְּנִכְסֵי מְלוֹג בְּחַיֵּי בַּעְלָהּ וָמֵתָה – הַבַּעַל מוֹצִיא מִיַּד הַלָּקוֹחוֹת.
human_translation: as Rabbi Yosei bar Ḥanina said: In Usha instituted a woman who sold of her usufruct property during the life of her husband and she died, the husband repossesses from the purchasers.
llm_translation: As Rabbi Yosei bar Hanina said: In the case of a widow, they established - if a woman sold her husband's property during his lifetime and then died, the husband retrieves it from the buyers.

hebrew_text: אַגְבְּיֵהּ אִיהוּ בְּחוֹבוֹ, פְּלִיגִי בַּהּ רַב אַחָא וְרָבִינָא. חַד אָמַר: הָדְרָה, וְחַד אָמַר: לָא הָדְרָה.
human_translation: authorized repossess for his debt, Rav Aḥa and Ravina disagree. One says: reversed And one says: not reversed.
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: אַגְבְּיֵהּ אִיהוּ בְּחוֹבוֹ, פְּלִיגִי בַּהּ רַב אַחָא וְרָבִינָא. חַד אָמַר: הָדְרָה, וְחַד אָמַר: לָא הָדְרָה. Translation: Agveyeh is in his debt, Rav Acha and Ravina dispute about it. One said: "It is valid," and one said: "It is not valid."

hebrew_text: מַאן דְּאָמַר לָא הָדְרָה סָבַר: הַאי זְבִינֵי מְעַלְּיָא הִיא, דְּהָא מִדַּעְתָּא דְּנַפְשֵׁיהּ אַגְבְּיֵהּ. וּמַאן דְּאָמַר הָדְרָה סָבַר: לָא זְבִינֵי מְעַלְּיָא הוּא, וְהַאי דְּאַגְבְּיֵהּ מִדַּעְתֵּיהּ וְלָא אֲתָא לְדִינָא – מֵחֲמַת כִּיסּוּפָא הוּא דְּאַגְבְּיֵהּ.
human_translation: The one who says not reversed holds this is a full-fledged sale, as he authorized the repossession at his own initiative. And the one who says reversed holds is not a full-fledged sale. And that he authorized the repossession at his initiative and did not come to a ruling was due to embarrassment that he authorized the repossession.
llm_translation: One who says "I will not return," he holds: this is a vow of refusal, for he has made a resolution in his own mind. And one who says "I will return," he holds: it is not a vow of refusal, and this resolution in his mind does not come to judgment - it is due to a change of mind.

hebrew_text: וּמֵאֵימַת אָכֵיל פֵּירֵי? רַבָּה אָמַר: מִכִּי מָטְיָא אַדְרַכְתָּא לִידֵיהּ. אַבָּיֵי אָמַר: עֵדָיו בַּחֲתוּמָיו זָכִין לוֹ.
human_translation: And from when does he consume the produce Rabba said: from when authorization reaches his possession. Abaye said: the document’s witnesses, with their signatures, acquire on his behalf.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: From when may one eat fruits? Rabbah said: When the path leads to it. Abbaye said: His witnesses in his sealed documents are effective for him.

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר: מִכִּי שְׁלִימוּ יְמֵי אַכְרַזְתָּא.
human_translation: Rava said: from when the days of proclamation conclude.
llm_translation: Rava said: "Since you have fulfilled the days of Akrazta."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַשּׂוֹכֵר פָּרָה מֵחֲבֵירוֹ וְהִשְׁאִילָהּ לְאַחֵר, וּמֵתָה כְּדַרְכָּהּ – יִשָּׁבַע הַשּׂוֹכֵר שֶׁמֵּתָה כְּדַרְכָּהּ, וְהַשּׁוֹאֵל יְשַׁלֵּם לַשּׂוֹכֵר. אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי: כֵּיצַד הַלָּה עוֹשֶׂה סְחוֹרָה בְּפָרָתוֹ שֶׁל חֲבֵירוֹ? אֶלָּא תַּחְזוֹר פָּרָה לַבְּעָלִים.
human_translation: one who rents a cow from another, and lends it to another and dies in its manner, the renter takes an oath that died in its manner, and the borrower pays the renter Rabbi Yosei said: How does the other do business with another’s cow? Rather, cow should be returned to owner.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: If a person rents a cow from his fellow and then lends it to another person, and it dies in its usual manner - the renter must swear that it died in its usual manner, and the borrower must compensate the renter. Rabbi Yosei said: How can a cow make a profit for its owner's friend? Rather, return the cow to its owners.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אִידִי בַּר אָבִין לְאַבָּיֵי: מִכְּדֵי, שׂוֹכֵר בְּמַאי קָנֵי לְהַאי פָּרָה? בִּשְׁבוּעָה.
human_translation: Rav Idi bar Avin said to Abaye: After all, the renter, with what does he acquire this cow with an oath
llm_translation: Gemara: Rav Idi bar Avin said to Abbaye: From where does he acquire this cow? With an oath.

hebrew_text: וְנֵימָא לֵיהּ מַשְׂכִּיר לְשׂוֹכֵר: דַּל אַנְתְּ וְדַל שְׁבוּעֲתָךְ, וַאֲנָא מִשְׁתַּעֵינָא דִּינָא בַּהֲדֵי שׁוֹאֵל. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מִי סָבְרַתְּ, שׂוֹכֵר בִּשְׁבוּעָה הוּא דְּקָא קָנֵי לַהּ? מִשְּׁעַת מִיתָה הוּא דְּקָנֵי. וּשְׁבוּעָה כְּדֵי לְהָפִיס דַּעְתּוֹ שֶׁל בַּעַל הַבַּיִת.
human_translation: But let the one who rented say to the renter: Remove yourself and remove your oath. and I will litigate with the borrower said to Do you hold is with an oath renter acquires from the moment of death, acquires And oath to alleviate the concerns of the owner,
llm_translation: He said to him: "Renting to a renter: You are poor and your week is poor, and I am occupied with the law in the matter of the borrower." He said to him: "Who do you think, that the renter acquires it with a week? He acquires it from the moment of death. And the week is to appease the mind of the homeowner."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא: פְּעָמִים שֶׁהַבְּעָלִים מְשַׁלְּמִין כַּמָּה פָּרוֹת לַשּׂוֹכֵר. הֵיכִי דָּמֵי? אַגְרַהּ מִינֵּיהּ מְאָה יוֹמֵי, וַהֲדַר שַׁיְילַהּ מִינֵּיהּ תִּשְׁעִין יוֹמֵי, הֲדַר אַגְרַהּ מִינֵּיהּ תְּמָנַן יוֹמֵי, וַהֲדַר שַׁיְילַהּ מִינֵּיהּ שִׁבְעִין יוֹמֵי, וּמֵתָה בְּתוֹךְ יְמֵי שְׁאֵלָתָהּ, דְּאַכֹּל שְׁאֵלָה וּשְׁאֵלָה מִיחַיַּיב חֲדָא פָּרָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira says: times when the owner pays several cows to the renter. What are the circumstances? where rented from him one hundred days, and the then borrowed from ninety days, and then rented from eighty days, and then borrowed seventy days, and died within period of its borrowing, for each and every borrowing owes one cow.
llm_translation: Rabbi Zeira said: Sometimes the owners pay how many cows to the renter. How much is the payment? He rents it out for one hundred days, then he takes it back for ninety days, then he rents it out for eighty days, then he takes it back for seventy days, and she dies during the days of her asking, for each asking he is liable for one cow.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אַחָא מִדִּיפְתִּי לְרָבִינָא: מִכְּדִי חֲדָא פָּרָה הִיא, עַיְילַהּ וְאַפְּקַהּ, אַפְּקַהּ מִשְּׂכִירוּת וְעַיְּילַהּ לִשְׁאֵילָה, אַפְּקַהּ מִשְּׁאֵילָה וְעַיְּילַהּ לִשְׂכִירוּת? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: וּמִי אִיתַהּ לְפָרָה בְּעֵינָא דְּנֵימָא לֵיהּ הָכִי?
human_translation: Rav Aḥa of Difti said to Ravina After all, it is one cow, and he introduced it into and removed it He removed it from rental and he introduced it into borrowing; he removed it from borrowing and introduced it into rental. said to And is cow intact that could say this to
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Acha, from Difti to Ravina: Since it is one cow, bring it and divide it, divide it from rental and bring it for borrowing, divide it from borrowing and bring it for rental? He said to him: And who is there for the cow in the eyes that we should say to it like this?

hebrew_text: מָר בַּר רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: אֵין לוֹ עֲלֵיהֶן אֶלָּא שְׁתֵּי פָּרוֹת, חֲדָא דִּשְׁאֵלָה וַחֲדָא דִּשְׂכִירוּת. שׁוּם שְׁאֵלָה אַחַת הִיא, וְשׁוּם שְׂכִירוּת אַחַת הִיא. דִּשְׁאֵלָה קָנֵי לִגְמָרֵי, דִּשְׂכִירוּת – עָבֵד בַּהּ יְמֵי שְׂכִירוּתֵיהּ, וּמַיהְדַּר לַיהּ לְמָרַהּ.
human_translation: Mar bar Rav Ashi said has against only two cows, one for borrowing and one for rental category of borrowing is one and category of rental is one. for borrowing, acquires completely. for rental, he works with it its rental period and he returns it to its owner.
llm_translation: Mar bar Rav Ashi said: He has only two cows on them, one for borrowing and one for renting. One borrowing is it, and one renting is it. Borrowing is a complete acquisition, renting - he worked with her during the days of her rental, and he returns her to her owner.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה: פְּעָמִים שֶׁשְּׁנֵיהֶם בְּחַטָּאת,
human_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya says: times that both to a sin-offering;
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yirmeya: "At times, both of them are in a sin offering."

hebrew_text: פְּעָמִים שֶׁשְּׁנֵיהֶם בְּאָשָׁם. פְּעָמִים שֶׁהַשּׂוֹכֵר בְּחַטָּאת וְהַשּׁוֹאֵל בְּאָשָׁם, פְּעָמִים שֶׁהַשּׂוֹכֵר בְּאָשָׁם וְהַשּׁוֹאֵל בְּחַטָּאת.
human_translation: times that both to a guilt-offering; times that the renter to a sin-offering and the borrower to a guilt-offering; times that the renter to a guilt-offering and the borrower to a sin-offering.
llm_translation: Times that both of them in guilt-offering. Times that the renter in sin-offering and the borrower in guilt-offering, times that the renter in guilt-offering and the borrower in sin-offering.

hebrew_text: הָא כֵּיצַד? כְּפִירַת מָמוֹן – אָשָׁם. בִּיטּוּי שְׂפָתַיִם – חַטָּאת.
human_translation: How so? denial of a monetary matter a guilt-offering. an utterance of the lips a sin-offering.
llm_translation: This is how? Covering of money - guilt offering. Confession of lips - sin offering.

hebrew_text: פְּעָמִים שֶׁשְּׁנֵיהֶם בְּחַטָּאת – כְּגוֹן שֶׁמֵּתָה כְּדַרְכָּהּ, וְאָמְרוּ נֶאֶנְסָה. שׂוֹכֵר דְּבֵין כָּךְ וּבֵין כָּךְ מִיפְּטַר פָּטוּר בְּחַטָּאת, שׁוֹאֵל דְּבֵין כָּךְ וּבֵין כָּךְ חַיּוֹבֵי מִיחַיַּיב בְּחַטָּאת.
human_translation: times that both to a sin-offering. where died in its manner and said due beyond his control. A renter, in any case is exempt to a sin-offering A borrower, in any case is liable to a sin-offering
llm_translation: Times that both of them in sin - such as she died in her normal way, and they said she was coerced. One who rents property between this and that is exempt in sin, one who borrows between this and that is liable in sin.

hebrew_text: פְּעָמִים שֶׁשְּׁנֵיהֶם בְּאָשָׁם – כְּגוֹן שֶׁנִּגְנְבָה, וְאָמְרוּ מֵתָה מֵחֲמַת מְלָאכָה, דְּתַרְוַיְיהוּ קָא כָפְרִי מָמוֹנָא, דְּהָא מִיחַיְּיבִי, וְקָא פָטְרִי נַפְשַׁיְיהוּ.
human_translation: times that both to a guilt-offering. where was stolen and said it died due to labor. where both denied a monetary matter, as they are liable and exempt themselves.
llm_translation: Times that both of them in guilt - such as she stole, and they said she died due to work, their atonement is like money, for they are liable, and they exempt themselves.

hebrew_text: שׂוֹכֵר בְּחַטָּאת וְשׁוֹאֵל בְּאָשָׁם – כְּגוֹן שֶׁמֵּתָה כְּדַרְכָּהּ, וְאָמְרוּ מֵתָה מֵחֲמַת מְלָאכָה. שׂוֹכֵר דְּבֵין כָּךְ וּבֵין כָּךְ מִיפְּטַר פָּטוּר – חַיָּיב בְּחַטָּאת. שׁוֹאֵל דְּמִיחַיַּיב בְּמֵתָה כְּדַרְכָּהּ, וְקָא פָטַר נַפְשֵׁיהּ בְּמֵתָה מֵחֲמַת מְלָאכָה – בְּאָשָׁם.
human_translation: a renter to a sin-offering and a borrower to a guilt-offering. where died in its manner and said it died due to labor. A renter, who in any case is exempt, liable to a sin-offering, A borrower, who is liable died in its manner and to exempt himself it died due to labor, to a guilt-offering.
llm_translation: One who rents with a sin offering and borrows with a guilt offering - for example, if she died in her usual way, and they said she died due to work. One who rents in between this and that is exempt - liable for a sin offering. One who borrows, if he is liable for her death in her usual way, and he exempted himself by saying she died due to work - is liable for a guilt offering.

hebrew_text: שׂוֹכֵר בְּאָשָׁם וְשׁוֹאֵל בְּחַטָּאת – כְּגוֹן שֶׁנִּגְנְבָה וְאָמְרוּ מֵתָה כְּדַרְכָּהּ. שׂוֹכֵר הוּא דְּמִיחַיַּיב בִּגְנֵיבָה וַאֲבֵידָה, וְקָא פָטַר נַפְשֵׁיהּ בְּמֵתָה כְּדַרְכָּהּ – בְּאָשָׁם. שׁוֹאֵל דְּבֵין כָּךְ וּבֵין כָּךְ חַיּוֹבֵי מִיחַיַּיב – בְּחַטָּאת.
human_translation: a renter to a guilt-offering and a borrower to a sin-offering. where was stolen and said died in its manner. The renter, who is liable theft and loss and to exempt himself died in its manner, to a guilt-offering. A borrower, who in any case is liable to a sin-offering.
llm_translation: One who rents with guilt-offering and borrows with sin-offering - for example, if it was stolen and they said she died in her normal way. He who rents is liable for theft and loss, and he exempts himself with her death in her normal way - with a guilt-offering. He who borrows, whether in this way or in that way, is liable - with a sin-offering.

hebrew_text: מַאי קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן? לְאַפּוֹקֵי מִדְּרַבִּי אַמֵּי, דְּאָמַר: כׇּל שְׁבוּעָה שֶׁהַדַּיָּינִים מַשְׁבִּיעִים אוֹתָהּ – אֵין חַיָּיבִין עָלֶיהָ מִשּׁוּם שְׁבוּעַת בִּיטּוּי, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אוֹ נֶפֶשׁ כִּי תִשָּׁבַע לְבַטֵּא בִשְׂפָתַיִם״ ״כִּי תִשָּׁבַע״ מֵעַצְמָהּ. קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן דְּלָא כְּרַבִּי אַמֵּי.
human_translation: What is teaching us to exclude Rabbi Ami, who says: any oath that the judges administer, one is not liable oath an utterance, as it is stated “Or if a soul takes an oath clearly to utter with lips” who takes an oath on his own teaches us that not in accordance with Rabbi Ami,
llm_translation: What is it teaching us? To go out from the teaching of Rabbi Ammi, who said: Any oath that the judges administer - they do not incur liability for a false oath, as it is stated: "Or a soul who swears with his lips" - "when he swears" by itself. It is teaching us that it is not like Rabbi Ammi.

hebrew_text: אִתְּמַר: שׁוֹמֵר שֶׁמָּסַר לְשׁוֹמֵר, רַב אָמַר: פָּטוּר, וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: חַיָּיב.
human_translation: It was stated a bailee who conveyed to bailee Rav says: exempt And Rabbi Yoḥanan said: liable
llm_translation: It was stated: If a watchman handed over to another watchman, Rav said: he is exempt, and Rabbi Yochanan said: he is liable.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי, לְטַעְמֵיהּ דְּרַב, לָא מִבַּעְיָא שׁוֹמֵר חִנָּם שֶׁמָּסַר לְשׁוֹמֵר שָׂכָר דְּעַלּוֹיֵי עַלְּיַיהּ לִשְׁמִירָתוֹ, אֶלָּא אֲפִילּוּ שׁוֹמֵר שָׂכָר שֶׁמָּסַר לְשׁוֹמֵר חִנָּם, דְּגָרוֹעֵי גָּרְעַהּ לִשְׁמִירָתוֹ – פָּטוּר. מַאי טַעְמָא? דְּהָא מְסָרָהּ לְבֶן דַּעַת.
human_translation: Abaye says: to Rav’s reasoning, it is not necessary an unpaid bailee who conveyed to a paid bailee, as enhanced his safeguarding, But even a paid bailee who conveyed to an unpaid bailee, where diminished his safeguarding, exempt. What is the reason? because he conveyed to a mentally competent person,
llm_translation: Abaye said, according to the reasoning of Rav, a free guardian who handed over to a paid guardian for his protection, does not require a free guardian, but even a paid guardian who handed over to a free guardian, as he has diminished his responsibility for its protection - he is exempt. What is the reason? Because he entrusted it to an irresponsible person.

hebrew_text: וּלְטַעְמֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, לָא מִיבַּעְיָא שׁוֹמֵר שָׂכָר שֶׁמָּסַר לְשׁוֹמֵר חִנָּם דְּגָרוֹעֵי גָּרְעַהּ לִשְׁמִירָתוֹ, אֶלָּא אֲפִילּוּ שׁוֹמֵר חִנָּם שֶׁמָּסַר לְשׁוֹמֵר שָׂכָר, דְּעַלּוֹיֵי עַלְּיַיהּ לִשְׁמִירָתוֹ – חַיָּיב. דְּאָמַר לֵיהּ: ״אֵין רְצוֹנִי שֶׁיְּהֵא פִּקְדוֹנִי בְּיַד אַחֵר״.
human_translation: to Rabbi Yoḥanan’s reasoning, it is not necessary a paid bailee who conveyed to an unpaid bailee, as diminished his safeguarding, But even an unpaid bailee who conveyed to a paid bailee, where enhanced his safeguarding, liable because said to him: It is not my desire that my deposit be in the possession of another
llm_translation: And according to the reasoning of Rabbi Yochanan, it is not necessary for a paid guardian who entrusted to a free guardian to deduct from his payment for his guardianship, but even a free guardian who entrusted to a paid guardian, since he relies on him for his guardianship - is liable. For he said to him: "I do not desire that my deposit be in the hands of another."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: הָא דְּרַב לָאו בְּפֵירוּשׁ אִתְּמַר, אֶלָּא מִכְּלָלָא. דְּהָנְהוּ גִּינָּאֵי, דְּכֹל יוֹמָא הֲווֹ מַפְקְדִי מָרַיְיהוּ גַּבַּהּ דְּהַהִיא סָבְתָּא. יוֹמָא חַד אַפְקְדֻינְהוּ לְגַבֵּי חַד מִינַּיְיהוּ, שְׁמַע קָלָא בֵּי הִלּוּלָא נְפַק אֲזַל. אַפְקְדִינְהוּ לְגַבַּהּ דְּהַהִיא סָבְתָּא, אַדַּאֲזַל וַאֲתָא אִגְּנוּב מָרַיְיהוּ.
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: This that Rav was not stated explicitly. Rather, inferred as these gardeners who each day would deposit their spades with a certain old woman. One day they deposited with one of heard noise a wedding hall out He deposited with that old woman. In that he went and came their spades were stolen.
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: This that Rav said is not stated explicitly, but derived by inference. For these gardeners, every day they would appoint their overseers at the height of that elderberry tree. One day they appointed one of them against one of them, a loud noise was heard from the house of Hillel, and he went out. They appointed him at the height of that elderberry tree, a thief came and stole their overseers.

hebrew_text: אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב וּפַטְרֵיהּ, מַאן דַּחֲזָא סָבַר מִשּׁוּם שׁוֹמֵר שֶׁמָּסַר לְשׁוֹמֵר פָּטוּר. וְלָא הִיא, שָׁאנֵי הָתָם דְּכֹל יוֹמָא נָמֵי אִינְהוּ גּוּפַיְיהוּ גַּבַּהּ דְּהַהִיא סָבְתָּא הֲווֹ מַפְקְדִי לְהוּ.
human_translation: came before Rav, and exempted One who observed thought due to a bailee who conveyed to bailee is exempt. But is not so. There, is different, as themselves would deposit with that old woman.
llm_translation: He came before Rav and he exempted him. Whoever sees a case where a guardian handed over property to another guardian, he is exempt. But it is not so, for there it is different, as every day they would appoint themselves as the guardians of that old woman.

hebrew_text: יָתֵיב רַבִּי אַמֵּי וְקָאָמַר לַהּ לְהָא שְׁמַעְתָּא. אֵיתִיבֵיהּ רַבִּי אַבָּא בַּר מֶמֶל לְרַבִּי אַמֵּי: הַשּׂוֹכֵר פָּרָה מֵחֲבֵירוֹ וְהִשְׁאִילָהּ לְאַחֵר וּמֵתָה כְּדַרְכָּהּ – יִשָּׁבַע הַשּׂוֹכֵר שֶׁמֵּתָה כְּדַרְכָּהּ וְהַשּׁוֹאֵל מְשַׁלֵּם לַשּׂוֹכֵר. וְאִם אִיתָא, לֵימָא לֵיהּ: אֵין רְצוֹנִי שֶׁיְּהֵא פִּקְדוֹנִי בְּיַד אַחֵר! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן? בְּשֶׁנָּתְנוּ לוֹ רְשׁוּת הַבְּעָלִים לְהַשְׁאִיל.
human_translation: Rabbi Ami sat and stated this halakha . Rabbi Abba bar Memel raised an objection to Rabbi Ami one who rents a cow from another, and lends it to another and dies in its manner the renter takes an oath that died in its manner, and the borrower pays the renter And if is so, let say It is not my desire that my deposit be in the possession of another said to him: With what are we dealing here? where the owner gave permission to lend
llm_translation: Rabbi Ammi was sitting and saying to her this teaching. Rabbi Abba bar Memel raised an objection to Rabbi Ammi: If one rents a cow from his fellow and lends it to another, and it dies in its usual manner - the renter must swear that it died in its usual manner, and the borrower must pay the renter. And if he comes, let him say to him: I do not want my responsibility to be in the hands of another! He said to him: What are we dealing with here? We are dealing with a case where the owners gave him permission to lend it.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי לִבְעָלִים בָּעֵי לְשַׁלּוֹמֵי! דַּאֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: לְדַעְתָּךְ.
human_translation: If so, should be required to pay the owner, where said to at your discretion.
llm_translation: Thus, the owners require for peace! For they said to him: According to your opinion.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רָמֵי בַּר חָמָא: הַמַּפְקִיד מָעוֹת אֵצֶל חֲבֵירוֹ צְרָרָן וְהִפְשִׁילָן לַאֲחוֹרָיו, מְסָרָן לִבְנוֹ וּבִתּוֹ הַקְּטַנִּים, וְנָעַל בִּפְנֵיהֶם שֶׁלֹּא כָּרָאוּי – חַיָּיב, שֶׁלֹּא שָׁמַר כְּדֶרֶךְ הַשּׁוֹמְרִים.
human_translation: Rami bar Ḥama raises an objection one who deposited coins with another, bound it and slung it behind him, conveyed them to his minor son or daughter or locked before in an inappropriate, liable as he did not safeguard in the manner of bailees.
llm_translation: The Gemara raises an objection: Ramei bar Ḥama asks: One who entrusts coins to his fellow, binds them and places them behind him, and then hands them over to his son and daughter who are minors, and he locks the door in front of them in an improper manner – he is liable, as he did not guard them in the manner of guardians.

hebrew_text: טַעְמָא דִּקְטַנִּים, הָא גְּדוֹלִים – פָּטוּר. אַמַּאי? נֵימָא לֵיהּ: אֵין רְצוֹנִי שֶׁיְּהֵא פִּקְדוֹנִי בְּיַד אַחֵר!
human_translation: The reason that minor but adult exempt. Why? Let the say to him It is not my desire that my deposit be in the possession of another
llm_translation: Reason of small, this great - exempt. Why? Say to him: "I do not desire that my appointment should be in another's hand!"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: כׇּל הַמַּפְקִיד
human_translation: Rava said: anyone who deposits
llm_translation: Rava said: "Anyone who entrusts..."

hebrew_text: עַל דַּעַת אִשְׁתּוֹ וּבָנָיו הוּא מַפְקִיד.
human_translation: with the awareness wife and his children he deposits
llm_translation: On the knowledge of his wife and children he relies.

hebrew_text: אָמְרִי נְהַרְדָּעֵי, דַּיְקָא נָמֵי דְּקָתָנֵי: אוֹ שֶׁמְּסָרָן לִבְנוֹ וּבִתּוֹ הַקְּטַנִּים – חַיָּיב. הָא לִבְנוֹ וּלְבִתּוֹ הַגְּדוֹלִים – פָּטוּר. מִכְלָל דְּלַאֲחֵרִים, לָא שְׁנָא גְּדוֹלִים וְלָא שְׁנָא קְטַנִּים – חַיָּיב, דְּאִם כֵּן, לִיתְנֵי קְטַנִּים סְתָמָא. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: of Neharde’a say: is also precise, as it teaches: Or conveyed to his minor son or daughter liable But adult son and daughter, exempt. By inference, that to others, is no different adults and is no different minors. liable as, if let teach: minors, without qualification. learn from
llm_translation: The Nehardeans said, it is specifically stated in the Mishnah: whether he gave them to his son and daughter who are minors - he is liable. But if he gave them to his adult son and daughter - he is exempt. From the inference that it does not matter if they are adults or minors - he is liable, for if not, it would have stated specifically minors. Learn from it.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא, הִלְכְתָא: שׁוֹמֵר שֶׁמָּסַר לְשׁוֹמֵר – חַיָּיב, לָא מִבַּעְיָא שׁוֹמֵר שָׂכָר שֶׁמָּסַר לְשׁוֹמֵר חִנָּם דְּגָרוֹעֵי גָּרְעַהּ לִשְׁמִירָתוֹ, אֶלָּא אֲפִילּוּ שׁוֹמֵר חִנָּם שֶׁמָּסַר לְשׁוֹמֵר שָׂכָר – חַיָּיב, מַאי טַעְמָא? דַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ: אַתְּ מְהֵימְנַתְּ לִי בִּשְׁבוּעָה, הַאיְךְ לָא מְהֵימַן לִי בִּשְׁבוּעָה.
human_translation: Rava says: The halakha A bailee who conveyed to bailee liable It is not necessary a paid bailee who conveyed to an unpaid bailee, as diminished his safeguarding, But even an unpaid bailee who conveyed to a paid bailee, liable What is the reason as say to him: You are trustworthy to me when an oath That is not trustworthy to me when an oath.
llm_translation: Rava said: Halacha: A watchman who handed over to another watchman - is liable. It is not necessary for the watchman to ask for payment that he handed over to another watchman for free, as he deducts from his own watch. Rather, even a watchman who handed over for free to another watchman for payment - is liable. What is the reason? Because he said to him: "You are trustworthy to me with an oath, how much more so should you be trustworthy to me without an oath."

hebrew_text: אִתְּמַר: פָּשַׁע בָּהּ וְיָצָאת לַאֲגַם, וּמֵתָה כְּדַרְכָּהּ. אַבָּיֵי מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַבָּה אָמַר: חַיָּיב, רָבָא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַבָּה אָמַר: פָּטוּר.
human_translation: It was stated one was negligent and went into a marsh, but it died in its manner Abaye says in the name of Rabba: liable Rava says in the name of Rabba: exempt
llm_translation: It was stated: If one transgressed with her and she went out to the lake, and died in her natural way. Abbaye from the name of Rabbah said: Guilty. Rava from the name of Rabbah said: Exempt.

hebrew_text: אַבָּיֵי מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַבָּה אָמַר: חַיָּיב, כׇּל דַּיָּינָא דְּלָא דָּאֵין כִּי הַאי דִּינָא לָאו דַּיָּינָא הוּא. לָא מִבַּעְיָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר תְּחִילָּתוֹ בִּפְשִׁיעָה וְסוֹפוֹ בְּאוֹנֶס חַיָּיב, דְּחַיָּיב. אֶלָּא אֲפִילּוּ לְמַאן דְּאָמַר פָּטוּר, הָכָא חַיָּיב. מַאי טַעְמָא? דְּאָמְרִינַן: הַבְלָא דְאַגְמָא קַטְלַהּ.
human_translation: Abaye said in the name of Rabba: liable any judge who does not rule in accordance with this halakha is not a judge. It is not necessary according to the one who says: initially through negligence and ultimately by accident, liable that liable But even according to the one who says: exempt, here liable What is the reason because we say: The air of the marsh killed
llm_translation: Abaye from the name of Rabba said: obligated, every judge that does not judge like this judgment is not a judge. It is not necessary according to the one who says his beginning is with negligence and his end is with coercion, obligated, he is obligated. Rather, even according to the one who says he is exempt, here he is obligated. What is the reason? For we say: the folly of the calf killed it.

hebrew_text: רָבָא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַבָּה אָמַר: פָּטוּר, כֹּל דַּיָּינָא דְּלָא דָּאֵין כִּי הַאי דִּינָא לָאו דַּיָּינָא הוּא. לָא מִיבַּעְיָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר תְּחִילָּתוֹ בִּפְשִׁיעָה וְסוֹפוֹ בְּאוֹנֶס פָּטוּר, דְּפָטוּר, אֶלָּא אֲפִילּוּ לְמַאן דְּאָמַר חַיָּיב, הָכָא פָּטוּר. מַאי טַעְמָא? דְּאָמְרִינַן: מַלְאַךְ הַמָּוֶת מָה לִי הָכָא וּמָה לִי הָתָם.
human_translation: Rava says in the name of Rabba: exempt, any judge who does not rule in accordance with this halakha is not a judge. It is not necessary according to the one who says: initially through negligence and ultimately by accident, exempt that exempt. But even according to the one who says: liable here exempt What is the reason because we say the Angel of Death, What to me here, and what to me there?
llm_translation: Rava from the name of Rabba said: exempt, any judge who is not fit for this judgment is not a judge. It is not necessary according to the one who says that if his beginning was intentional and his end was accidental, he is exempt, he is exempt, rather even according to the one who says he is liable, here he is exempt. What is the reason? For we say: what do I need the Angel of Death here for and what do I need him there.

hebrew_text: וּמוֹדֵי אַבָּיֵי, דְּאִי הֲדַרָא לְבֵי מָרַהּ וּמִתָה – דְּפָטוּר. מַאי טַעְמָא? דְּהָא הֲדַרָא לַהּ וְלֵיכָּא לְמֵימַר הַבְלָא דְּאַגְמָא קַטְלַהּ. וּמוֹדֵי רָבָא כֹּל הֵיכָא דְּאִי גַּנְבַהּ גַּנָּב בַּאֲגַם וּמֵתָה כְּדַרְכָּהּ בֵּי גַנָּב – דְּחַיָּיב. מַאי טַעְמָא? דְּאִי שַׁבְקַהּ מַלְאַךְ הַמָּוֶת בְּבֵיתֵיהּ דְּגַנָּבָא הֲוָה קָיְימָא.
human_translation: And Abaye concedes that if returned to its owner’s house and died that exempt. What is the reason that returned, and there is no to say the air of the marsh killed it. And Rava concedes that anytime was stolen and dies in its manner in the house of the thief that liable What is the reason because if the Angel of Death spared it would be standing in the house of the thief
llm_translation: And the students of Abaye concede, that if a woman returned to her husband and died - he is exempt. What is the reason? Because if she returned to him, it is not possible to say that the angel of death killed her. And the students of Rava concede, in every case where if a thief stole and the stolen item is found in the thief's possession and the owner dies in the usual manner of thieves - he is liable. What is the reason? Because if the angel of death had left the thief's house, the thief would have remained standing.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי לְרָבָא: לְדִידָךְ, דְּאָמְרַתְּ מַלְאַךְ הַמָּוֶת מָה לִי הָכָא וּמָה לִי הָתָם, הַאי דְּאוֹתְבֵיהּ רַבִּי אַבָּא בַּר מֶמֶל לְרַבִּי אַמֵּי וְשַׁנִּי לֵיהּ בְּשֶׁנָּתְנוּ לוֹ בְּעָלִים רְשׁוּת לְהַשְׁאִיל, וְלֵימָא לֵיהּ: מַלְאַךְ הַמָּוֶת מָה לִי הָכָא וּמָה לִי הָתָם!
human_translation: Abaye said to Rava: According to you, who said the Angel of Death: What to me here and what to me there? that objection that was raised by Rabbi Abba bar Memel to Rabbi Ami and answered him: where the owner gave permission to lend But let say to him the Angel of Death, what to me here, and what to me there.
llm_translation: He said to him, Abaye to Rava: According to your opinion, since you said, "What do I have to do with the Angel of Death here and what do I have to do with him there," this that Rabbi Abba bar Memel brought before Rabbi Amei and repeated to him when they gave him permission to lend, and he did not say to him: "What do I have to do with the Angel of Death here and what do I have to do with him there!"

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לְדִידְכוּ דְּמַתְנִיתוּ ״אֵין רְצוֹנִי שֶׁיְּהֵא פִּקְדוֹנִי בְּיַד אַחֵר״ – אִיכָּא לְאוֹתֹבַהּ לְהַהִיא, לְדִידִי דְּאָמֵינָא: אַנְתְּ מְהֵימְנַתְּ לִי בִּשְׁבוּעָה וְהַאיְךְ לָא מְהֵימַן לִי – בִּשְׁבוּעָה לֵיכָּא לְאוֹתֹבַהּ כְּלָל.
human_translation: said to According to you, that you teach It is not my desire that my deposit be in the possession of another there is to raise that objection. according to me, as I say You are trustworthy to me when an oath that is not trustworthy to me when an oath, there is no to raise that objection at all.
llm_translation: He said to him: According to your opinion that it is stated, "I do not desire that My oversight be in the hands of another," there is room for objection to that, according to my opinion: If you are trustworthy to me with an oath, how is it that you are not trustworthy to me - with an oath there is no room for objection at all.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רָמֵי בַּר חָמָא: הֶעֱלָהּ לְרָאשֵׁי צוּקִין וְנָפְלָה – אֵין זֶה אוֹנֶס, וְחַיָּיב. הָא מֵתָה כְּדַרְכָּהּ – הֲרֵי זֶה אוֹנֶס וּפָטוּר. וְאַמַּאי? לֵימָא לֵיהּ: אַוֵּירָא דְהַר קַטְלַהּ, אִי נָמֵי אוּבְצָנָא דְהַר קַטְלַהּ!
human_translation: Rami bar Ḥama raises an objection one brought to the edge of a cliff and it fell, that is not an accident, and liable that it died in its manner, an accident and exempt. But why? Let say the air of the mountain killed it, or: The exhaustion the mountain killed it.
llm_translation: The Gemara raises an objection: If she ascended to the tops of cliffs and fell - this is not considered coercion, and she is liable. But if she died in her normal manner - this is considered coercion, and she is exempt. And why? Let us say to him: The air of Mount Kataleh killed her, or the wolf of Mount Kataleh killed her!

hebrew_text: הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן? שֶׁהֶעֱלָהּ לְמִרְעֶה שָׁמֵן וְטוֹב. אִי הָכִי, נָפְלָה נָמֵי! שֶׁהָיָה לוֹ לְתוֹקְפָּהּ וְלֹא תְּקָפָהּ.
human_translation: With what are we dealing here? where took to a bountiful and high-quality pasture. If so, even fell. because he should have subdued and he did not subdue it.
llm_translation: Here we are dealing with what? That he brought up for his flock oil and good. If so, it should have fallen! That he should have established it and did not establish it.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, אֵימָא רֵישָׁא: עָלְתָה לְרָאשֵׁי צוּקִין וְנָפְלָה – הֲרֵי זֶה אוֹנֶס, אִיבְּעִי לֵיהּ לְמִיתְקְפַהּ! לָא צְרִיכָא שֶׁתְּקָפַתּוּ וְעָלְתָה, תְּקָפַתּוּ וְיָרְדָה.
human_translation: If so, say the first clause climbed to the top of a cliff and fell, it is a circumstance beyond his control he was required to subdue it No, it is necessary where overpowered him and ascended overpowered him and descended.
llm_translation: If so, say at the beginning: if it ascended to the tops of the cliffs and fell - this is considered an accident. If it is necessary to enclose it, it is not necessary that it ascend and then be enclosed, rather enclose it and then it will ascend and descend.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי: כֵּיצַד הַלָּה עוֹשֶׂה סְחוֹרָה בְּפָרָתוֹ כּוּ׳. אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר יְהוּדָה לְרַב יְהוּדָה: אֲמַרְתְּ לַן מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל: חָלוּק הָיָה רַבִּי יוֹסֵי
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei said: How does the other do business with cow? Rav Yehuda says Shmuel says: halakha in accordance with Rabbi Yosei. Rav Shmuel bar Yehuda said to Rav Yehuda: You told us in the name of Shmuel Rabbi Yosei was in disagreement
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei said: How does a Halah make a transaction with its calf? Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: The halacha is according to Rabbi Yosei. Rav Shmuel bar Yehudah said to Rav Yehudah: You have told us in the name of Shmuel: Rabbi Yosei was meticulous.

hebrew_text: אַף בָּרִאשׁוֹנָה, הֲלָכָה כְּמוֹתוֹ אוֹ אֵין הֲלָכָה כְּמוֹתוֹ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: חָלוּק הָיָה רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אַף בָּרִאשׁוֹנָה, וַהֲלָכָה כְּמוֹתוֹ אַף בָּרִאשׁוֹנָה.
human_translation: even in the first halakha accordance with his or halakha not in accordance with his said to him: Rabbi Yosei was in disagreement even in the first and the halakha in accordance with his even in the first
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Even in the first instance, does the law follow his opinion or not follow his opinion? He said to him: Rabbi Yosei was meticulous even in the first instance, and the law follows his opinion even in the first instance.

hebrew_text: אִתְּמַר נָמֵי. אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: חָלוּק הָיָה רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אַף בָּרִאשׁוֹנָה, וַהֲלָכָה כְּמוֹתוֹ אַף בָּרִאשׁוֹנָה. וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: מוֹדֶה הָיָה רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בָּרִאשׁוֹנָה שֶׁכְּבָר שִׁילֵּם.
human_translation: It was also stated Rabbi Elazar says: Rabbi Yosei was in disagreement even in the first and the halakha in accordance with his even in the first And Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Rabbi Yosei conceded in the first because already paid
llm_translation: It was stated: Rabbi Elazar said: Rabbi Yosei was lenient even initially, and the halakha is like him even initially. And Rabbi Yochanan said: Rabbi Yosei admitted initially that he had already paid.

hebrew_text: שִׁילֵּם – אִין, לֹא שִׁילֵּם – לָא? וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: לֹא ״שִׁילֵּם״ שִׁילֵּם מַמָּשׁ, אֶלָּא כֵּיוָן שֶׁאָמַר ״הֲרֵינִי מְשַׁלֵּם״ אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁלֹּא שִׁילֵּם. אֵימָא: מוֹדֶה הָיָה רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בָּרִאשׁוֹנָה שֶׁכְּבָר אָמַר ״הֲרֵינִי מְשַׁלֵּם״.
human_translation: he paid, yes, he did not pay, no? But doesn’t Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba say Rabbi Yoḥanan says: paid, not actually paid; rather, once said: I hereby pay, even if he did not pay, say: Rabbi Yosei conceded in the first because already said: I hereby pay.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Shilem - ein, lo shilem - la? Ve'ha'amar Rabbi Chiya bar Abba amar Rabbi Yochanan: Lo 'shilem' shilem mamash, ela keivan she'amar 'harenai meshalem' af al pi she'lo shilem. Eima: Modeh hayah Rabbi Yosei barishona she'kevar amar 'harenai meshalem'." English translation: "He paid - yes, he did not pay - no? But didn't Rabbi Chiya bar Abba say in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: Not 'he paid' in actuality, but once he said 'I will pay,' even though he did not pay. Say: Rabbi Yosei must have admitted initially when he already said 'I will pay.'"

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אָמַר לִשְׁנַיִם: גָּזַלְתִּי לְאֶחָד מִכֶּם מָנֶה וְאֵינִי יוֹדֵעַ אֵיזֶה מִכֶּם. אוֹ: אָבִיו שֶׁל אֶחָד מִכֶּם הִפְקִיד לִי מָנֶה וְאֵינִי יוֹדֵעַ אֵיזֶה הוּא – נוֹתֵן לָזֶה מָנֶה וְלָזֶה מָנֶה, שֶׁהוֹדָה מִפִּי עַצְמוֹ.
human_translation: one said to two I robbed one of you of one hundred dinars, but I do not know which of you or The father of one of you deposited one hundred dinars with me, but I do not know which he is, gives one hundred dinars to this and one hundred dinars to that because he admitted at his own
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: He said to two individuals: "I stole a Maneh from one of you, and I do not know which one of you it is." Or: "The father of one of you entrusted me with a Maneh, and I do not know who it is - he should give one Maneh to this one and one Maneh to that one, for he admitted from his own mouth."

hebrew_text: שְׁנַיִם שֶׁהִפְקִידוּ אֵצֶל אֶחָד, זֶה מָנֶה וְזֶה מָאתַיִם. זֶה אוֹמֵר: שֶׁלִּי מָאתַיִם, וְזֶה אוֹמֵר: שֶׁלִּי מָאתַיִם. נוֹתֵן לָזֶה מָנֶה וְלָזֶה מָנֶה, וְהַשְּׁאָר יְהֵא מוּנָּח עַד שֶׁיָּבֹא אֵלִיָּהוּ.
human_translation: two who deposited with one this one hundred dinars and that two hundred this says: My two hundred and that says: My two hundred gives one hundred dinars to this and one hundred dinars to that And the rest will be placed until Elijah comes
llm_translation: Two who deposited by one, this one a hundred and this one two hundred. This one says: "Mine is two hundred," and this one says: "Mine is two hundred." He gives to this one a hundred and to this one a hundred, and the rest shall remain until Elijah comes.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי: אִם כֵּן, מָה הִפְסִיד הָרַמַּאי? אֶלָּא הַכֹּל יְהֵא מוּנָּח עַד שֶׁיָּבֹא אֵלִיָּהוּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei said: If so, what did the swindler lose? Rather, the entire will be placed until Elijah comes. As
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei said: If so, what did the Ramai lose? Rather, everything should be left until Elijah comes.

hebrew_text: וְכֵן שְׁנֵי כֵלִים, אֶחָד יָפֶה מָנֶה, וְאֶחָד יָפֶה אֶלֶף זוּז, זֶה אוֹמֵר: יָפֶה שֶׁלִּי, וְזֶה אוֹמֵר: יָפֶה שֶׁלִּי – נוֹתֵן אֶת הַקָּטָן לְאֶחָד מֵהֶן, וּמִתּוֹךְ הַגָּדוֹל נוֹתֵן דְּמֵי קָטָן לַשֵּׁנִי, וְהַשְּׁאָר יְהֵא מוּנָּח עַד שֶׁיָּבֹא אֵלִיָּהוּ. אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי: אִם כֵּן מָה הִפְסִיד הָרַמַּאי? אֶלָּא, הַכֹּל יְהֵא מוּנָּח עַד שֶׁיָּבֹא אֵלִיָּהוּ.
human_translation: And likewise, two vessels, one worth one hundred dinars and one worth one thousand dinars, this says: The expensive is mine, and that says: The expensive is mine, gives the small to one of them, and from the the large he gives the value of the small to the other, and the rest is placed until Elijah comes. Rabbi Yosei said: If so, what did the swindler lose? Rather, the entire are placed until Elijah comes
llm_translation: And so too, two vessels, one worth a Maneh, and one worth an Alf Zuz, this one says: "Mine is more beautiful," and this one says: "Mine is more beautiful" - he gives the smaller one to one of them, and from the larger one he gives the value of the smaller one to the other, and the rest shall remain until Elijah comes. Rabbi Yosei said: If so, what did the deceiver lose? Rather, everything shall remain until Elijah comes.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אַלְמָא מִסְּפֵיקָא מַפְּקִינַן מָמוֹנָא, וְלָא אָמְרִינַן: אוֹקֵי מָמוֹנָא בְּחֶזְקַת מָרֵיהּ.
human_translation: apparently, in uncertainty, we expropriate property And we do not say: Establish the money in the possession of its owner.
llm_translation: Gemara: Therefore, from a doubt we collect money, and we do not say: the money is established in the possession of its owner.

hebrew_text: וּרְמִינְהִי: שְׁנַיִם שֶׁהִפְקִידוּ אֵצֶל אֶחָד, זֶה מָנֶה וְזֶה מָאתַיִם, זֶה אוֹמֵר ״שֶׁלִּי מָאתַיִם״ וְזֶה אוֹמֵר ״שֶׁלִּי מָאתַיִם״ – נוֹתֵן לָזֶה מָנֶה וְלָזֶה מָנֶה, וְהַשְּׁאָר יְהֵא מוּנָּח עַד שֶׁיָּבֹא אֵלִיָּהוּ.
human_translation: And raise a contradiction two who deposited with one this one hundred dinars and that two hundred this says: My two hundred and that says: My two hundred gives one hundred dinars to this and one hundred dinars to that And the rest will be placed until Elijah comes
llm_translation: And ask: Two who deposited by one, this a hundred and this two hundred, this one says "mine two hundred" and this one says "mine two hundred" - give to this one a hundred and to this one a hundred, and the rest shall be left until Elijah comes.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: פִּקָּדוֹן אַגָּזֵל קָא רָמֵית, גָּזֵל דַּעֲבַד אִיסּוּרָא – קַנְסוּהּ רַבָּנַן, פִּקָּדוֹן דְּלָא עֲבַד אִיסּוּרָא – לָא קַנְסוּהּ רַבָּנַן.
human_translation: said to Are you raising a contradiction a deposit and a robbery? robbery, where one transgressed a prohibition, the Sages penalized him a deposit, where he did not transgress a prohibition, the Sages did not penalize him.
llm_translation: He said to him: A deposit that was stolen, you have deceived, a stolen item that was used for a prohibited purpose - the Rabbis penalize him, a deposit that was not used for a prohibited purpose - the Rabbis do not penalize him.

hebrew_text: וּרְמִי פִּקָּדוֹן אַפִּקָּדוֹן, וּרְמִי גָּזֵל אַגָּזֵל. פִּקָּדוֹן אַפִּקְדוֹן, דְּקָתָנֵי רֵישָׁא: אוֹ אָבִיו שֶׁל אֶחָד מִכֶּם הִפְקִיד אֶצְלִי מָנֶה, וְאֵינִי יוֹדֵעַ אֵיזֶה הוּא נוֹתֵן לָזֶה מָנֶה וְלָזֶה מָנֶה. וּרְמִינְהִי: שְׁנַיִם שֶׁהִפְקִידוּ וְכוּ׳!
human_translation: And they raised a contradiction a deposit and a deposit, and they raised a contradiction a robbery and a robbery. a deposit and a deposit, it is taught the first clause Or, The father of one of you deposited one hundred dinars with me, but I do not know which he is, gives one hundred dinars to this and one hundred dinars to that raises a contradiction two people who deposited
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "U-remi pikadon apikadon, u-remi gazel agazel. Pikadon apikadon, dekatanei reishah: o aviv she'l echad mikem hifkid etzli maneh, ve'eini yodea eizeh hu noten laze maneh ve'laze maneh. U-reminei: shnayim shehipkidu veku!" English translation: "And one who deposits a deposit, let him deposit, and one who steals, let him steal. Deposit, let him deposit, as it is taught in the beginning: 'Or the father of one of you entrusted with me a maneh, and I do not know which one he gives to this one a maneh and to this one a maneh.' And ask: 'Two who were entrusted and so on!'"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: רֵישָׁא נַעֲשָׂה כְּמִי שֶׁהִפְקִידוּ לוֹ בִּשְׁנֵי כְרִיכוֹת, דַּהֲוָה לֵיהּ לְמֵידַק. סֵיפָא נַעֲשָׂה כְּמִי שֶׁהִפְקִידוּ לוֹ בְּכֶרֶךְ אֶחָד, דְּלָא הֲוָה לֵיהּ לְמֵידַק, כְּגוֹן דְּאַפְקִידוּ תַּרְוַיְיהוּ בַּהֲדֵי הֲדָדֵי בְּחַד זִימְנָא, דְּאָמַר לְהוּ: אַנְתְּ גּוּפַיְיכוּ לָא קָפְדִיתוּ אַהֲדָדֵי, אֲנָא קָפֵידְנָא?
human_translation: Rava said: the first clause becomes like one with whom they deposited two bundles, as the should have been discerning the latter clause becomes like one with whom they deposited one bundle, as no that he should have been discerning. where they both deposited together at one time, as says to them: you yourselves were not suspicious of each other, I be suspicious?
llm_translation: Rava said: The beginning was made as if they entrusted it to him in two bundles, so that he would have to grind it. The end was made as if they entrusted it to him in one bundle, so that he would not have to grind it, such as when they entrusted both of them to each other at the same time, as he said to them: "You did not grind for each other, but I have ground for you?"

hebrew_text: וּרְמִי גָּזֵל אַגָּזֵל, קָתָנֵי הָכָא: אֲמַר לִשְׁנַיִם גָּזַלְתִּי לְאֶחָד מִכֶּם מָנֶה וְאֵינִי יוֹדֵעַ אֵיזֶה מִכֶּם, אוֹ אָבִיו שֶׁל אֶחָד מִכֶּם הִפְקִיד לִי מָנֶה וְאֵינִי יוֹדֵעַ אֵיזֶה הוּא – נוֹתֵן לָזֶה מָנֶה וְלָזֶה מָנֶה.
human_translation: And they raised a contradiction a robbery and a robbery. It is taught here: one said to two I robbed one of you of one hundred dinars, but I do not know which of you or The father of one of you deposited one hundred dinars with me, but I do not know which he is, he gives one hundred dinars to this and one hundred dinars to that
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And if one stole a stolen object, it is taught here: If he says to two people, 'I stole a maneh from one of you, and I do not know which one of you,' or 'The father of one of you entrusted me with a maneh, and I do not know who he is' – he gives one of them a maneh and the other a maneh."

hebrew_text: וּרְמִינְהִי: גָּזַל אֶחָד מֵחֲמִשָּׁה, וְאֵינוֹ יוֹדֵעַ אֵיזֶה מֵהֶן גָּזַל, זֶה אוֹמֵר: אוֹתִי גָּזַל, וְזֶה אוֹמֵר: אוֹתִי גָּזַל, מַנִּיחַ גְּזֵילָה בֵּינֵיהֶם וּמִסְתַּלֵּק, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי טַרְפוֹן. אַלְמָא מִסְּפֵקָא לָא מַפְּקִינַן מָמוֹנָא, וְאָמְרִינַן: אוֹקֵים מָמוֹנָא בְּחֶזְקַת מָרֵיהּ.
human_translation: raises a contradiction robbed one of five and he does not know which of them this says: He robbed me, and that says: He robbed me, places stolen item between them and withdraws the statement of Rabbi Tarfon. Apparently, we do not expropriate property due to an uncertainty and we say: Establish the money in the possession of its owner.
llm_translation: And ask: he stole one out of five, and does not know which one he stole, this one says: he stole me, and this one says: he stole me, he leaves the stolen object between them and departs, the words of Rabbi Tarfon. Apparently, in a case of doubt we do not extract money, and we say: establish the money in the possession of its owner.

hebrew_text: וּמִמַּאי דְּמַתְנִיתִין דְּהָכָא רַבִּי טַרְפוֹן הִיא? דְּקָתָנֵי עֲלַהּ דְּהַהִיא מוֹדֶה רַבִּי טַרְפוֹן בְּאוֹמֵר לִשְׁנַיִם גָּזַלְתִּי לְאֶחָד מִכֶּם מָנֶה וְאֵינִי יוֹדֵעַ אֵיזֶה מִכֶּם שֶׁנּוֹתֵן לָזֶה מָנֶה וְלָזֶה מָנֶה.
human_translation: And from where that the mishna here Rabbi Tarfon? as it is taught concerning that Rabbi Tarfon concedes in says to two I robbed one of you one hundred dinars, but I do not know which of you he gives one hundred dinars to this and one hundred dinars to that
llm_translation: And from where in the Mishnah is it that here Rabbi Tarfon is mentioned? For it is taught regarding the case where Rabbi Tarfon admits: "I stole a Maneh from one of you, but I do not know which one of you to whom I should give a Maneh and to whom another Maneh."

hebrew_text: הָתָם דְּקָא תָבְעִי לֵיהּ, הָכָא בְּבָא לָצֵאת יְדֵי שָׁמַיִם. דַּיְקָא נָמֵי דְּקָתָנֵי: שֶׁהוֹדָה מִפִּי עַצְמוֹ. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: There, where demand from him. here, where comes to fulfill his obligation to Heaven. is also precise, as teaches: Because he admitted at his own Learn from
llm_translation: There, where he was demanding it, here, in order to fulfill the requirements of Heaven. Precisely as it was taught: "He admits from his own mouth." Learn from it.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: הָתָם דְּקָא תָבְעִי לֵיהּ. וְהַלָּה מָה טוֹעֵן? רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: הַלָּה שׁוֹתֵק. רַב מַתְנָה אָמַר רַב: הַלָּה
human_translation: the Master said: There, where demand from him. And the other what does he claim Rav Yehuda Rav says: The other is silent, Rav Mattana Rav says: The other
llm_translation: Master said: There, where he is claiming it. And what does the other one respond? Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: The other one is silent. Rav Matna said in the name of Rav: The other one.

hebrew_text: צוֹוֵחַ. מַאן דְּאָמַר הַלָּה צוֹוֵחַ, אֲבָל שְׁתִיקָה – כְּהוֹדָאָה. וּמַאן דְּאָמַר הַלָּה שׁוֹתֵק, שְׁתִיקָה דְּהָכָא לָאו כְּהוֹדָאָה הוּא, מָצֵי אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הַאי דִּשְׁתִיקִי לְכֹל חַד וְחַד, דְּאָמֵינָא דִּלְמָא הַאי הוּא.
human_translation: screams The one who says the other screams But silence is tantamount to admission And the one who says the other is silent that the silence here is not tantamount to admission, could say to him: that I was silent to each and every one is because I said: Perhaps this is he,
llm_translation: He shouts. Whoever says "this one shouts," but is silent - is like a witness. And whoever says "this one is silent," the silence here is not like a witness, for one can say to him: "This one is silent to everyone, for I might say perhaps this is he."

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: מַנִּיחַ גְּזֵילָה בֵּינֵיהֶם וּמִסְתַּלֵּק. וְשָׁקְלִי לַהּ כּוּלְּהוּ וְאָזְלִי? וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי אַבָּא בַּר זַבְדָּא אָמַר רַב: כֹּל סְפֵק הִינּוּחַ לְכַתְּחִילָּה לֹא יִטּוֹל, וְאִם נָטַל – לֹא יַחֲזִיר. אָמַר רַב סָפְרָא: וְיַנִּיחַ.
human_translation: The Master said: places stolen item between them and withdraws And all of them take it and go, But doesn’t Rabbi Abba bar Zavda say Rav says any uncertainty placement may not take ab initio , and if he took he should not return it Rav Safra says: And should place
llm_translation: Master said: He leaves the stolen item between them and departs. And should they all take it and go? But didn't Rabbi Abba bar Zavda say in the name of Rav: Any doubtful case, one should not take initially, and if one took, they should not return it. Rav Safra said: And he should leave it.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי לְרָבָא: מִי אָמַר רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא לֹא זוֹ הַדֶּרֶךְ מוֹצִיאָתוֹ מִידֵי עֲבֵירָה עַד שֶׁיְּשַׁלֵּם גְּזֵילָה לְכֹל חַד וְחַד? אַלְמָא מִסְּפֵיקָא מַפְּקִינַן מָמוֹנָא, וְלָא אָמְרִינַן ״אוֹקֵים מָמוֹנָא בְּחֶזְקַת מָרֵיהּ״.
human_translation: Abaye said to Rava: did Rabbi Akiva say: This is not way to spare him from transgression; until he pays stolen item to each and every one Apparently, in uncertainty, we expropriate property and we do not say: Establish the money in the possession of its owner.
llm_translation: Abaye said to Rava: Who said that Rabbi Akiva did not follow this way, that one should not remove him from sin until he pays back theft to each and every one? This implies that we collect money from his property, and we do not say, "He establishes the money in the possession of his master."

hebrew_text: וּרְמִינְהִי: נָפַל הַבַּיִת עָלָיו וְעַל אִמּוֹ, יוֹרְשֵׁי הַבֵּן אוֹמְרִים: הָאֵם מֵתָה רִאשׁוֹנָה. וְיוֹרְשֵׁי הָאֵם אוֹמְרִים: הַבֵּן מֵת רִאשׁוֹן. אֵלּוּ וָאֵלּוּ מוֹדִים שֶׁיַּחְלוֹקוּ. וְאָמַר רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: מוֹדֶה אֲנִי בָּזוֹ שֶׁהַנְּכָסִים בְּחֶזְקָתָן!
human_translation: raises a contradiction A house collapsed on and on his mother, The son’s heirs say: The mother died first And the mother’s heirs say: The son died first, these and those agree that they should divide And Rabbi Akiva said: I concede in this that the property its status.
llm_translation: And they asked: If the house fell on him and on his mother, the heirs of the son say: The mother died first. And the heirs of the mother say: The son died first. Both of these agree that they should divide. And Rabbi Akiva said: I agree with the one who says that the properties are in their possession!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ, הָתָם – שֶׁמָּא וְשֶׁמָּא, גָּזַל אֶחָד מֵחֲמִשָּׁה – בָּרִי וְשֶׁמָּא. וְהָא מַתְנִיתִין דְּהָכָא אָמַר לִשְׁנַיִם: גָּזַלְתִּי לְאֶחָד מִכֶּם מָנֶה, דְּשֶׁמָּא וְשֶׁמָּא הוּא, וְקָתָנֵי: נוֹתֵן לָזֶה מָנֶה וְלָזֶה מָנֶה.
human_translation: said to There, an uncertain and an uncertain one robbed from one of five a certain and an uncertain But in the mishna here, one said to two I robbed one of you of one hundred dinars, an uncertain and an uncertain and it is taught: He gives one hundred dinars to this and one hundred dinars to that
llm_translation: He said to him, there - perhaps and perhaps, he stole one out of five - a clear perhaps. And the Mishnah here said to two: I stole from one of you a Maneh, perhaps and perhaps it is, and it teaches: he gives to this one a Maneh and to that one a Maneh.

hebrew_text: וּמִמַּאי דְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא הִיא? דְּקָתָנֵי עֲלַהּ דְּהַהִיא: מוֹדֶה רַבִּי טַרְפוֹן בְּאוֹמֵר לִשְׁנַיִם ״גָּזַלְתִּי לְאֶחָד מִכֶּם מָנֶה וְאֵינִי יוֹדֵעַ אֵיזֶה מִכֶּם כּוּ׳״, לְמַאן מוֹדֶה? לָאו לְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא בַּר פְּלוּגְתֵּיהּ?
human_translation: And from where that the mishna here is Rabbi Akiva? as it is taught concerning that Rabbi Tarfon concedes where one says to two I robbed one of you of one hundred dinars and I do not know which of you To whom does Rabbi Tarfon concede? Is it not to Rabbi Akiva, his disputant?
llm_translation: And from where is it derived that which Rabbi Akiva said? For it is taught in a Baraita: Rabbi Tarfon concedes the following case: If one says to two people, "I stole a Maneh from one of you, and I do not know which one of you I stole from," to whom does he concede? Not to Rabbi Akiva according to his reasoning?

hebrew_text: וּמִמַּאי דְּשֶׁמָּא וְשֶׁמָּא הוּא? חֲדָא דְּלָא קָתָנֵי תּוֹבְעִין אוֹתוֹ. וְעוֹד, הָא תָּנֵי רַבִּי חִיָּיא: זֶה אוֹמֵר ״אֵינִי יוֹדֵעַ״ וְזֶה אוֹמֵר ״אֵינִי יוֹדֵעַ״.
human_translation: And from where an uncertain and an uncertain One, it is not taught they demand from him. And furthermore, didn’t Rabbi Ḥiyya teach this says: I do not know, and that says: I do not know,
llm_translation: And from what source that perhaps it is and perhaps it is he? One who does not teach it demands it. And furthermore, Rabbi Chiya taught: This one says, "I do not know," and this one says, "I do not know."

hebrew_text: הָא אוֹקֵימְנָא לַהּ בְּבָא לָצֵאת יְדֵי שָׁמַיִם.
human_translation: Didn’t we establish is coming to fulfill his obligation to Heaven?
llm_translation: This is how we establish for her in Bava Metzia to fulfill the requirements of Heaven.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבִינָא לְרַב אָשֵׁי: וּמִי אָמַר רָבָא כֹּל בִּשְׁתֵּי כְּרִיכוֹת הֲוָה לֵיהּ לְמֵידַק? וְהָאָמַר רָבָא, וְאִי תֵּימָא רַב פָּפָּא: הַכֹּל מוֹדִים בִּשְׁנַיִם שֶׁהִפְקִידוּ אֵצֶל רוֹעֶה, שֶׁמַּנִּיחַ רוֹעֶה בֵּינֵיהֶן וּמִסְתַּלֵּק! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָתָם כְּשֶׁהִפְקִידוּ בְּעֶדְרוֹ שֶׁל רוֹעֶה שֶׁלֹּא מִדַּעְתּוֹ.
human_translation: Ravina said to Rav Ashi: And did Rava say every in two bundles should have been discerning But didn’t Rava say, and some say Rav Pappa Everyone concedes in two who deposited with a shepherd, that the shepherd places among them and leaves? said to There, where deposited in the shepherd’s flock without his knowledge.
llm_translation: Ravina said to Rav Ashi: And who did Rava say had everything in two bundles to grind? And Rava said, and if you say Rav Papa: everyone agrees in two that they entrusted by the shepherd, who leaves the shepherd between them and departs! He said to him: there, when they entrusted it in the shepherd's flock without his knowledge.

hebrew_text: וְכֵן שְׁנֵי כֵלִים אֶחָד יָפֶה מָנֶה וְאֶחָד יָפֶה אֶלֶף זוּז כּוּ׳. וּצְרִיכָא.
human_translation: And likewise, two vessels, one worth one hundred dinars and one worth one thousand dinars, And necessary
llm_translation: And so too, two vessels, one worth a Maneh and one worth a thousand Zuz, thus. And it is necessary.

hebrew_text: דְּאִי אַשְׁמְועִינַן הָךְ קַמַּיְיתָא: בְּהַהִיא קָאָמְרִי רַבָּנַן מִשּׁוּם דְּלֵיכָּא פְּסֵידָא. אֲבָל בְּהָא, דְּאִיכָּא פְּסֵידָא דְגָדוֹל אֵימָא מוֹדוּ לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי. וְאִי אִתְּמַר בְּהָא, בְּהָא קָאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי. אֲבָל בְּהָךְ אֵימָא מוֹדֵי לְהוּ לְרַבָּנַן. צְרִיכָא.
human_translation: that if taught us this first in this the Rabbis say because there is no loss. But in that where there is a loss of the large say they concede to Rabbi Yosei And had been stated in that in that Rabbi Yosei said But in this say he concedes to the Rabbis. necessary
llm_translation: If we were to hear that case before us: In that case, the Rabbis were saying because there is no loss. But in this case, where there is a loss, say to Rabbi Yosei. And if it is said in this case, in this case Rabbi Yosei says. But in that case, they should admit to the Rabbis. This is necessary.

hebrew_text: וְהָא טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי מִשּׁוּם הֶפְסֵד הָרַמַּאי הוּא. אֶלָּא תַּרְוַיְיהוּ לְרַבָּנַן אִיצְטְרִיךְ, וְלֹא זוֹ אַף זוֹ קָתָנֵי.
human_translation: But isn’t the reason of Rabbi Yosei Due to the loss of the fraud? Rather, both of are necessary to the Rabbis. And teaches Not this also that,
llm_translation: And the reason of Rabbi Yosei is due to the loss of the Ramai. Rather, both are necessary for the Rabbis, and not this one alone nor that one alone.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַמַּפְקִיד פֵּירוֹת אֵצֶל חֲבֵירוֹ, אֲפִילּוּ הֵן אֲבוּדִין – לֹא יִגַּע בָּהֶן. רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: מוֹכְרָן בִּפְנֵי בֵּית דִּין, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהוּא כְּמֵשִׁיב אֲבֵידָה לַבְּעָלִים.
human_translation: one who deposits produce with another, even if it is lost may not touch it, Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: He sells it before court, as he is like returning a lost item to the owner,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who entrusts his produce to his fellow, even if they are lost, he shall not touch them. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: Sell them in the presence of the court, because he is like one who returns a lost object to its owners.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאי טַעְמָא? אָמַר רַב כָּהֲנָא: אָדָם רוֹצֶה בְּקַב שֶׁלּוֹ מִתִּשְׁעָה קַבִּים שֶׁל חֲבֵירוֹ. וְרַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק אָמַר: חָיְישִׁינַן שֶׁמָּא עֲשָׂאָן הַמַּפְקִיד תְּרוּמָה וּמַעֲשֵׂר עַל מָקוֹם אַחֵר.
human_translation: What is the reason Rav Kahana says A person prefers a kav his to nine kav of another’s Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak says: We are concerned perhaps the one who deposited rendered it teruma and tithe for another place,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemara, what is the reason? Rav Kahana said: A person prefers his own kab over nine kabs of his friend. And Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: We are concerned that perhaps the one who deposited them made them terumah and tithes in another place.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: הַמַּפְקִיד פֵּירוֹת אֵצֶל חֲבֵירוֹ, הֲרֵי זֶה לֹא יִגַּע בָּהֶן. לְפִיכָךְ בַּעַל הַבַּיִת עוֹשֶׂה אוֹתָן תְּרוּמָה וּמַעֲשֵׂר עַל מָקוֹם אַחֵר. בִּשְׁלָמָא לְרַב כָּהֲנָא, הַיְינוּ דְּקָתָנֵי ״לְפִיכָךְ״.
human_translation: raises an objection one who deposits produce with another, may not touch it, therefore the owner may render it teruma or tithe for another place. Granted, according to Rav Kahana, this that the teaches: therefore
llm_translation: The question was raised: One who entrusts his produce to his fellow, he shall not touch them. Therefore, the homeowner should designate them as terumah and tithes in another place. This is in accordance with Rav Kahana, as it is taught, "Therefore."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לְרַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק מַאי ״לְפִיכָךְ״? הָכִי קָאָמַר: הַשְׁתָּא דַּאֲמוּר רַבָּנַן לָא נְזַבֵּין, דְּחָיְישִׁינַן – לְפִיכָךְ בַּעַל הַבַּיִת עוֹשֶׂה אוֹתָן תְּרוּמָה וּמַעֲשֵׂר עַל מָקוֹם אַחֵר.
human_translation: But according to Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak, what is therefore? This is saying: Now that the Sages said may not sell that we are concerned Therefore, the owner render it teruma and tithe for another place
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Rather, for Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak, what is "therefore"? This is what he is saying: The case where the Sages did not decree, for we are concerned - therefore the homeowner should separate terumah and tithes in a different place. English translation:

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מַחֲלוֹקֶת בִּכְדֵי חֶסְרוֹנָן, אֲבָל יוֹתֵר מִכְּדֵי חֶסְרוֹנָן – דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל מוֹכְרָן בְּבֵית דִּין.
human_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: The dispute where at its rate of deterioration. But greater than its rate of deterioration, everyone agrees that sells it before the court.
llm_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana said in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan: A dispute is permitted up to the point of their loss, but more than their loss – everyone agrees that it is forbidden and such disputes are sold in court.

hebrew_text: אַדְּרַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק – וַדַּאי פְּלִיגָא. אַדְּרַב כָּהֲנָא מִי לֵימָא פְּלִיגָא? כִּי קָאָמַר רַב כָּהֲנָא – בִּכְדֵי חֶסְרוֹנָן קָאָמַר.
human_translation: certainly disagrees with the opinion of Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak, Shall we say disagrees with Rav Kahana? When Rav Kahana says where at its rate of deterioration he says
llm_translation: Rabbi Nachman bar Yitzchak - and surely it is a dispute. Rabbi Kahana, who does he say it is a dispute? When Rabbi Kahana says - he is saying it in terms of their loss.

hebrew_text: וְהָא רוֹצֶה בְּקַב שֶׁלּוֹ מִתִּשְׁעָה קַבִּין שֶׁל חֲבֵירוֹ קָאָמַר! גּוּזְמָא בְּעָלְמָא.
human_translation: But prefers a kav his to nine kav of another’s merely an exaggeration,
llm_translation: And he who wants his kab to be from his nine kabs of his fellow, he says! It is a mere presumption.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: לְפִיכָךְ בַּעַל הַבַּיִת עוֹשֶׂה אוֹתָן תְּרוּמָה וּמַעֲשֵׂר עַל מָקוֹם אַחֵר. וְלֵיחוּשׁ דִּלְמָא הֲווֹ לְהוּ יוֹתֵר מִכְּדֵי חֶסְרוֹנָן, וְזַבְּנִינְהוּ – וְקָא אָכֵיל טְבָלִים! יוֹתֵר מִכְּדֵי חֶסְרוֹנָן לָא שְׁכִיחַ.
human_translation: raises an objection Therefore, the owner renders it teruma or tithe for another place. And let be concerned perhaps greater than its rate of deterioration, and sold it, eating untithed produce. greater than its rate of deterioration uncommon,
llm_translation: Challenger: Therefore, the homeowner should make them a contribution and tithe in another place. And be concerned lest perhaps they were more than necessary, and he sold them - and he is eating untithed produce! More than necessary is not common.

hebrew_text: וְאִי מִשְׁתַּכְחִי מַאי? מְזַבְּנִינַן לְהוּ? וְלֵיחוּשׁ שֶׁמָּא עֲשָׂאָן בַּעַל הַבַּיִת תְּרוּמָה וּמַעֲשֵׂר עַל מָקוֹם אַחֵר! כִּי מְזַבְּנִינַן נָמֵי – לְכֹהֲנִים בִּדְמֵי תְרוּמָה מְזַבְּנִינַן לְהוּ.
human_translation: And if it is found what we sell it? But let us be concerned perhaps the owner rendered teruma and tithe for another place. Even when we sell to priests at the price of teruma we sell it.
llm_translation: And if they are found, what is the law? Do we sell them to him? And should we be concerned that perhaps the homeowner made them into terumah and tithes in another place! For if we sell them indeed – we sell them to the priests for the value of terumah we sell them to them.

hebrew_text: וּלְרַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק נָמֵי נְזַבְּנִינְהוּ לְכֹהֲנִים בִּדְמֵי תְרוּמָה? בְּהָא פְּלִיגִי, דְּרַבָּה בַּר בַּר חַנָּה סְבַר: יוֹתֵר מִכְּדֵי חֶסְרוֹנָן לָא שְׁכִיחַ מִידֵּי, וְכִי מִשְׁתְּכַח, לְקַמֵּיהּ הוּא דְּהָוְיָא יָתֵיר מִכְּדֵי חֶסְרוֹנָן. אִי עָבֵיד לְהוּ בַּעַל הַבַּיִת תְּרוּמָה וּמַעֲשֵׂר עַל מָקוֹם אַחֵר, מִקַּמֵּיה דְּהָווּ לְהוּ יוֹתֵר מִכְּדֵי חֶסְרוֹנָן עָבֵיד לְהוּ. הִלְכָּךְ, כִּי הָווּ לְהוּ יוֹתֵר מִכְּדֵי חֶסְרוֹנָן – נְזַבְּנִינְהוּ לְכֹהֲנִים בִּדְמֵי תְרוּמָה.
human_translation: And according to Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak as well, let sell to priests at the price of teruma . this that they disagree, as Rabba bar bar Ḥana holds: greater than its rate of deterioration not common at all. And when it occurs it is from now that it became greater than its rate of deterioration. if the owner rendered teruma and tithe for another place, it was before it greater than its rate of deterioration he did it. Therefore, when greater than its rate of deterioration, should sell to priests at the price of teruma ,
llm_translation: And for Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak, are we designating them for the priests with the blood of terumah? In this they dispute, for Rabba bar bar Channah holds: More than their loss is not common, and when it is forgotten, before him it is more than their loss. If the homeowner separates terumah and tithes elsewhere, before him it is more than their loss he does for them. Therefore, when it is more than their loss – we designate them for the priests with the blood of terumah.

hebrew_text: וְרַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק סָבַר: יָתֵר מִכְּדֵי חֶסְרוֹנָן מִשְׁכָּח שְׁכִיחַ וְכִי הָווּ לְהוּ – לְאַלְתַּר הוּא דְּהָווּ לְהוּ. וְאִי אָמְרַתְּ נְזַבְּנִינְהוּ – זִימְנִין דְּקָדֵים וּמְזַבֵּין לְהוּ, וְכִי עָבֵיד לְהוּ בַּעַל הַבַּיִת תְּרוּמָה וּמַעֲשֵׂר עַל מְקוֹם אַחֵר – לָא יָדַע דִּ[מְ]זַבְּנָא, וְקָא אָכֵיל טְבָלִים.
human_translation: And Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak holds: greater than its rate of deterioration is common. And when became immediately that it became And if you say: Let us sell it, at times will sell it early. And when the owner renders teruma and tithe for another place, he does not know that sold eats untithed produce.
llm_translation: Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak holds: More than their lack is their forgetfulness common. And if you say they would have – immediately they would have. And if you say we should sell them – sometimes they are valuable and sometimes not, and if the homeowner were to give them terumah and ma'aser in a different place – he does not know if they were tithed, and he is eating untithed produce.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: הַמַּפְקִיד פֵּירוֹת אֵצֶל חֲבֵירוֹ וְהִרְקִיבוּ, יַיִן וְהֶחְמִיץ, שֶׁמֶן וְהִבְאִישׁ, דְּבַשׁ וְהִדְבִּישׁ – הֲרֵי זֶה לֹא יִגַּע בָּהֶן, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: עוֹשֶׂה לָהֶם תַּקָּנָה, וּמוֹכְרָן בְּבֵית דִּין. וּכְשֶׁהוּא מוֹכְרָן – מוֹכְרָן לַאֲחֵרִים וְאֵינוֹ מוֹכְרָן לְעַצְמוֹ.
human_translation: raises an objection one who deposits produce with another and it rotted, wine and it fermented, oil and it putrefied, honey and it spoiled, may not touch them; the statement of Rabbi Meir. And the Rabbis say: He effects a remedy for and sells them in court. And when he sells them, he sells them to others and does not sell them to himself,
llm_translation: Challenger: One who entrusts fruits with his fellow and they rotted, wine and it soured, oil and it spoiled, honey and it fermented - behold, he shall not touch them, the words of Rabbi Meir. And the sages say: He shall make a remedy for them, and sell them in a court. And when he sells them - he sells them to others and does not sell them to himself.

hebrew_text: כַּיּוֹצֵא בּוֹ: גַּבָּאֵי צְדָקָה בִּזְמַן שֶׁאֵין לָהֶם עֲנִיִּים לְחַלֵּק – פּוֹרְטִין לַאֲחֵרִים, וְאֵין פּוֹרְטִין לְעַצְמָן. גַּבָּאֵי תַמְחוּי בִּזְמַן שֶׁאֵין לָהֶם עֲנִיִּים לְחַלֵּק – מוֹכְרִין לַאֲחֵרִים, וְאֵין מוֹכְרִים לְעַצְמָן.
human_translation: On a similar charity collectors, when they do not have poor people to distribute they change for other but they do not change for themselves, collectors for the charity plate at a time where there are no poor people to distribute they sell to others but do not sell to themselves.
llm_translation: As an example of this: Gabbaei Tzedakah, when they do not have poor to distribute to - they collect for others, but do not collect for themselves. Gabbaei Tamchui, when they do not have poor to distribute to - they sell to others, but do not sell to themselves.

hebrew_text: קָתָנֵי מִיהַת פֵּירוֹת וְהִרְקִיבוּ, מַאי לָאו אֲפִילּוּ יָתֵר מִכְּדֵי חֶסְרוֹנָן? לֹא, בִּכְדֵי חֶסְרוֹנָן. וְהָא יַיִן וְהֶחְמִיץ, שֶׁמֶן וְהִבְאִישׁ, דְּבַשׁ וְהִדְבִּישׁ – דְּיָתֵר מִכְּדֵי חֶסְרוֹנָן נִינְהוּ! שָׁאנֵי הָנֵי כֵּיוָן דְּקָם – קָם.
human_translation: In any event, it is taught: Produce and it rotted. What, is it not even greater than its rate of deterioration? No; where at their rate of deterioration. But aren’t wine and it fermented, oil and it putrefied, honey and it spoiled where greater than their rate of deterioration, Those are different. Once they become they remain
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: "If they have rotted and become putrid, what is the law? Is it not that even if they are more than the amount of loss? No, it is only up to the amount of loss. And wine that has turned sour, oil that has become rancid, honey that has fermented – they are more than the amount of loss! These are different, for once they have arisen – they have arisen."

hebrew_text: שֶׁמֶן וְהִבְאִישׁ, דְּבַשׁ וְהִדְבִּישׁ –
human_translation: oil and it putrefied, honey and it spoiled,
llm_translation: Oil and he spoiled, honey and he spoiled -

hebrew_text: לְמַאי חֲזוּ? שֶׁמֶן חֲזֵי לְגִלְדָּאֵי, דְּבַשׁ לִכְתִישָׁא דְגַמְלֵי.
human_translation: for what are they fit? Oil is fit for tanners Honey for a wound of camels.
llm_translation: Regarding what do they see? Oil they see for the wheels, honey for the jawbone of camels.

hebrew_text: וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: עוֹשֶׂה לָהֶם תַּקָּנָה וּמוֹכְרָן בְּבֵית דִּין. מַאי תַּקַּנְתָּא עָבֵיד לְהוּ? אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: לְקַנְקַנִּים.
human_translation: And the Rabbis say effects a remedy for and sells them in court. What remedy does he effect for Rav Ashi said: for the casks.
llm_translation: The sages say: One should make a regulation for them and sell them in court. What regulation did you make for them? Rav Ashe said: For glassmakers.

hebrew_text: בְּמַאי קָא מִיפַּלְגִי? דְּמָר סָבַר: לְהֶפְסֵד מְרוּבֶּה – חָשְׁשׁוּ, לְהֶפְסֵד מוּעָט – לֹא חָשְׁשׁוּ. וּמָר סָבַר: אֲפִילּוּ לְהֶפְסֵד מוּעָט נָמֵי חָשְׁשׁוּ.
human_translation: with regard to what do disagree? that one Sage, holds: were concerned for a significant loss, were not concerned for an insignificant loss, And one Sage, holds: were concerned even for an insignificant loss.
llm_translation: With what do they argue? For Mar holds: if there is a potential loss of a majority, they are concerned; if there is a potential loss of a minority, they are not concerned. And Mar holds: even for a potential loss of a minority, they are also concerned.

hebrew_text: רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר יִמְכְּרֵם בְּבֵית דִּין, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהוּא כְּמֵשִׁיב אֲבֵידָה לִבְעָלִים. אִתְּמַר, רַבִּי אַבָּא בְּרַבִּי יַעֲקֹב אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל. וְרָבָא אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: הֲלָכָה כְּדִבְרֵי חֲכָמִים.
human_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: He sells it before the court, due to that he is like returning a lost item to the owner. It was stated Rabbi Abba, son of Rabbi Ya’akov, Rabbi Yoḥanan says: halakha in accordance with Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel. And Rava Rav Naḥman says: halakha in accordance with the statement of the Rabbis.
llm_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: They should be sold by the court, because it is like returning a lost object to its owners. It was stated: Rabbi Abba, son of Rabbi Yaakov, said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: The halakha is according to Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel. And Rava said: The halakha is according to the words of the sages.
