hebrew_text: וְהָא אַמְרַהּ רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן חֲדָא זִמְנָא, דְּאָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: כׇּל מָקוֹם שֶׁשָּׁנָה רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל בְּמִשְׁנָתֵינוּ הֲלָכָה כְּמוֹתוֹ, חוּץ מֵעָרֵב, וְצַיְדָן, וּרְאָיָה אַחֲרוֹנָה.
human_translation: But Didn’t Rabbi Yoḥanan say one time As Rabba bar bar Ḥana says Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Every place where Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel taught in our mishna, halakha in accordance with his except for guarantor and Tzaidan and evidence final
llm_translation: And this, Rabbi Yochanan said once, as Rabba bar bar Ḥana said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: In every place that Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel changed a halakha in our Mishnah, the halakha follows his opinion, except for Erev, Tzaidan, and the last sighting.

hebrew_text: אָמוֹרָאֵי נִינְהוּ וְאַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן.
human_translation: are amora’im with regard to of Rabbi Yoḥanan.
llm_translation: The sages are they, and the school of Rabbi Yochanan.

hebrew_text: מִדְּרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל נִשְׁמָע דְּמוֹרִידִין קָרוֹב לְנִכְסֵי שָׁבוּי. מִדְּרַבָּנַן נִשְׁמַע דְּאֵין מוֹרִידִין קָרוֹב לְנִכְסֵי שָׁבוּי.
human_translation: From of Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, it is learned a relative, descend the property of a captive. From of the Rabbis, it is learned that does not authorize a relative descend the property of a captive.
llm_translation: From Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel it was heard that we lower the price of property close to that of a captive. From the sages it was heard that we do not lower the price of property close to that of a captive.

hebrew_text: וּמִמַּאי? דִּלְמָא עַד כָּאן לָא קָאָמַר רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל הָכָא, אֶלָּא מִשּׁוּם דְּקָא כָלְיָא קַרְנָא, אֲבָל הָתָם הָכִי נָמֵי דְּאֵין מוֹרִידִין. וְעַד כָּאן לָא קָאָמְרִי רַבָּנַן הָכָא, אֶלָּא אִי כְּרַב כָּהֲנָא, אִי כְּרַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק. אֲבָל הָתָם הָכִי נָמֵי דְּמוֹרִידִין.
human_translation: And from where Perhaps Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel states his opinion here only due to that the principal, is destroyed. But there, indeed, does not authorize And the Rabbis state their opinion only here either of Rav Kahana, or of Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak, But there, indeed authorizes
llm_translation: And from where? Perhaps until here Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel did not say here, but because the horn is being completed, but there they say that we do not descend. And until here the Rabbis did not say here, but either like Rav Kahana, or like Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak. But there they say that we descend.

hebrew_text: לְמֵימְרָא דִּתְרֵי טַעְמֵי נִינְהוּ? וְהָאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל, וְאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: מוֹרִידִין קָרוֹב לְנִכְסֵי שָׁבוּי. לָאו מִשּׁוּם דְּחַד טַעְמָא הוּא? לָא, תְּרֵי טַעְמֵי נִינְהוּ.
human_translation: Is this to say that they are two reasons But doesn’t Rav Yehuda say Shmuel says: halakha in accordance with Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, and Shmuel says: authorizes a relative to descend the property of a captive? Is it not due to that there is one reason No, they are two reasons,
llm_translation: In the matter of two reasons, what are they? And Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: The halakha is according to Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, and Shmuel said: We lower the price of property close to that of a captive. Is it not because it is one reason? No, they are two reasons.

hebrew_text: הָכִי נָמֵי מִסְתַּבְּרָא, דְּאָמַר רָבָא אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: הֲלָכָה כְּדִבְרֵי חֲכָמִים. וְאָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: מוֹרִידִין קָרוֹב לְנִכְסֵי שָׁבוּי. אֶלָּא שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: תְּרֵי טַעְמֵי נִינְהוּ, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: So too, it is reasonable as Rava says Rav Naḥman says: halakha in accordance with the Rabbis, and Rav Naḥman says: authorizes a relative to descend the property of a captive. Rather, learn from it they are two reasons. Learn from it
llm_translation: Thus it was stated: for Rava said in the name of Rav Nachman: the halakha follows the words of the Sages. And Rav Nachman said: we lower the price for the close relatives of the captive. Rather, learn from it: there are two reasons for it, learn from it.

hebrew_text: אִתְּמַר: שָׁבוּי שֶׁנִּשְׁבָּה, רַב אָמַר: אֵין מוֹרִידִין קָרוֹב לִנְכָסָיו, שְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: מוֹרִידִין קָרוֹב לִנְכָסָיו.
human_translation: it was stated was taken captive. Rav says: does not authorize a relative to descend the property Shmuel says: authorizes a relative to descend the property
llm_translation: It was stated: One who is captured and taken captive, Rav said: We do not reduce him close to his property, Shmuel said: We reduce him close to his property.

hebrew_text: בְּשֶׁשָּׁמְעוּ בּוֹ שֶׁמֵּת – כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְּלִיגִי דְּמוֹרִידִין.
human_translation: where they heard that died, everyone agrees that authorizes descend
llm_translation: When they heard about him that he died - all the people did not argue that we lower.

hebrew_text: כִּי פְּלִיגִי בְּשֶׁלֹּא שָׁמְעוּ בּוֹ שֶׁמֵּת. רַב אָמַר: אֵין מוֹרִידִין, דִּלְמָא מַפְסִיד לְהוּ. וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: מוֹרִידִין, כֵּיוָן דְּאָמַר מָר שָׁיְימִינַן לְהוּ כְּאָרִיס, לָא מַפְסֵיד לְהוּ.
human_translation: When they disagree, where they did not hear that died Rav says: does not authorize lest he devalue And Shmuel says: authorizes Since the Master said: we appraise as a sharecropper, will not devalue
llm_translation: When they argued about one who did not heed him and died. Rav said: we do not impose a penalty, perhaps he will cause them a loss. And Shmuel said: we impose a penalty, since the Master said we should treat them like an heir, he does not cause them a loss.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: מִמַּשְׁמַע שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר ״וְחָרָה אַפִּי וְהָרַגְתִּי אֶתְכֶם״ יוֹדֵעַ אֲנִי שֶׁנְּשׁוֹתֵיהֶם אַלְמָנוֹת וּבְנֵיהֶם יְתוֹמִים, אֶלָּא מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״וְהָיוּ נְשֵׁיכֶם וְגוֹ׳״?
human_translation: raises an objection Rabbi Eliezer says: By inference, from that which is stated: “My wrath shall wax hot, and I will kill you” I know that their wives widows and their children orphans. Rather, what the verse states: “And your wives shall be
llm_translation: The Tanna raises an objection: Rabbi Eliezer says: From the explicit meaning of the verse, as it is stated, "My anger will flare up, and I will kill you," I know that their widows and their orphans will be left, but what is the teaching in stating, "And your wives will be..."?

hebrew_text: מְלַמֵּד שֶׁנְּשׁוֹתֵיהֶם מְבַקְּשׁוֹת לִינָּשֵׂא וְאֵין מַנִּיחִין אוֹתָן, וּבְנֵיהֶן רוֹצִים לֵירֵד לְנִכְסֵי אֲבִיהֶן וְאֵין מַנִּיחִין אוֹתָן. אָמַר רָבָא: לֵירֵד וְלִמְכּוֹר תְּנַן.
human_translation: teaches Their wives will seek to marry, and will not allow them And their children will wish to descend to their father’s property, and will not allow them Rava said: We learned to descend and to sell
llm_translation: Teaching that their wives seek to be married and they do not allow them, and their sons want to inherit their fathers' property and they do not allow them. Rava said: We learned to inherit and to sell.

hebrew_text: הֲוָה עוֹבָדָא בִּנְהַרְדְּעָא, וּפַשְׁטַהּ רַב שֵׁשֶׁת מֵהָא מַתְנִיתָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב עַמְרָם: דִּלְמָא לֵירֵד וְלִמְכּוֹר תְּנַן? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: דִּלְמָא מִפּוּמְבְּדִיתָא אַתְּ, דִּמְעַיְּילִין פִּילָא בְּקוֹפָא דְמַחְטָא. וְהָא דּוּמְיָא דִּנְשׁוֹתֵיהֶם [וּבְנֵיהֶם] קָתָנֵי, מָה הָתָם כְּלָל לָא – אַף הָכָא נָמֵי כְּלָל לָא.
human_translation: was incident in Neharde’a, and Rav Sheshet resolved from this baraita Rav Amram said to him: Perhaps we learned to descend and to sell said to him, Perhaps you are from Pumbedita, where pass an elephant through the eye of a needle, But doesn’t their wives and their children teach similar Just as there, not at all, so too here, not at all.
llm_translation: There was a matter in Nehardea, and Rav Sheshet interpreted it from that Mishnah. Rav Amram said to him: Perhaps we should teach to descend and sell? He said to him: Perhaps you are from Pumbedita, where they bring a basket of sin. And that which is written about their wives and their children, just as there it is not a general principle - so too here it is not a general principle.

hebrew_text: וּמוֹרִידִין קָרוֹב לְנִכְסֵי שָׁבוּי תַּנָּאֵי הִיא, דְּתַנְיָא: הַיּוֹרֵד לְנִכְסֵי שָׁבוּי – אֵין מוֹצִיאִין אוֹתוֹ מִיָּדוֹ, וְלֹא עוֹד אֶלָּא אֲפִילּוּ שָׁמַע שֶׁמְּמַשְׁמְשִׁין וּבָאִין, וְקָדַם וְתָלַשׁ וְאָכַל – הֲרֵי זֶה זָרִיז וְנִשְׂכָּר. וְאֵלּוּ הֵן נִכְסֵי שְׁבוּיִין – הֲרֵי שֶׁהָיָה אָבִיו אוֹ אָחִיו אוֹ אֶחָד מִן הַמּוֹרִישִׁין, הָלְכוּ לָהֶם לִמְדִינַת הַיָּם, וְשָׁמְעוּ בָּהֶן שֶׁמֵּת.
human_translation: And authorizes a relative to descend the property of a captive is tanna’im , as it is taught one who descends to the property of a captive does not confiscate it from his possession. And furthermore, even if he heard that are approaching and arriving, and preceded and uprooted and consumed that diligent and he profits, And these is captives’ property: where one’s father, or brother, or one of who bequeaths went to a country overseas, and heard that died.
llm_translation: And we descend close to the property of a captive – it is a teaching, as it was taught: one who descends to the property of a captive – we do not remove it from his possession immediately, and not only that, but even if he heard that they are using and benefiting from it, and he went and plowed and sowed and ate – behold, this one is diligent and rewarded. And these are the properties of captives – if his father or his brother or one of the inheritors went to the sea country, and they heard that they died.

hebrew_text: הַיּוֹרֵד לְנִכְסֵי נְטוּשִׁים – מוֹצִיאִין אוֹתוֹ מִיָּדוֹ. וְאֵלּוּ הֵן נִכְסֵי נְטוּשִׁים: הֲרֵי שֶׁהָיָה אָבִיו אוֹ אָחִיו אוֹ אֶחָד מִן הַמּוֹרִישִׁין, הָלְכוּ לָהֶם לִמְדִינַת הַיָּם וְלֹא שָׁמְעוּ בָּהֶם שֶׁמֵּת. וְאָמַר רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל: שָׁמַעְתִּי שֶׁהַנְּטוּשִׁים כִּשְׁבוּיִין.
human_translation: one who descends to abandoned property, removes it from the possession of And these is abandoned property: where one’s father, or brother, or one of who bequeaths went to a country overseas, and did not hear that died. And Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel said: I heard that the abandoned is like captives,
llm_translation: The one who descends to abandoned properties - we remove it from his possession. And these are the abandoned properties: if his father or his brother or one of the heirs went to a maritime province and they did not hear from them that they died. And Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel said: I heard that the abandoned properties are considered as if they are captured.

hebrew_text: הַיּוֹרֵד לְנִכְסֵי רְטוּשִׁים – מוֹצִיאִין אוֹתוֹ מִיָּדוֹ. וְאֵלּוּ הֵן נִכְסֵי רְטוּשִׁים – הֲרֵי שֶׁהָיָה אָבִיו אוֹ אָחִיו אוֹ אֶחָד מִן הַמּוֹרִישִׁין כָּאן, וְאֵינוֹ יוֹדֵעַ לְהֵיכָן הָלְכוּ.
human_translation: one who descends to forsaken property, removes it from his possession. And these forsaken property: where one’s father, or brother, or one of who bequeaths here, and does not know where they went.
llm_translation: The one who descends to inherited properties of minors - they remove it from his hand. And these are the inherited properties of minors - if his father or his brother or one of the heirs was here, and he does not know where they went.

hebrew_text: מַאי שְׁנָא הָנָךְ דְּקָרוּ לְהוּ ״נְטוּשִׁים״, וּמַאי שְׁנָא הָנֵי דְּקָרוּ לְהוּ ״רְטוּשִׁים״?
human_translation: What is different that it is called abandoned And what is different that it is called forsaken
llm_translation: What is the difference between those that are called "netushim," and what is the difference between those that are called "retushim"?

hebrew_text: ״נְטוּשִׁים״ דִּבְעַל כׇּרְחָן, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְהַשְּׁבִיעִת תִּשְׁמְטֶנָּה וּנְטַשְׁתָּהּ״ – אַפְקַעְתָּא דְמַלְכָּא. ״רְטוּשִׁים״ דְּמִדַּעְתָּן, דִּכְתִיב: ״אֵם עַל בָּנִים רֻטָּשָׁה״.
human_translation: Abandoned [ netushim ]; perforce. When it is written: “But the seventh year you shall let it rest and lie fallow [ untashtah ]” expropriation by the King Forsaken [ retushim ]; of their volition, as it is written: “A mother was forsaken [ rutasha ] with her sons”
llm_translation: "Netushim" of Baal Korchan, as it is written: "And in the seventh year you shall release it, and abandon it" - the decree of the king. "Retushim" of Midat'an, as it is written: "If she is embittered against her children."

hebrew_text: תָּנָא: וְכוּלָּם שָׁמִין לָהֶם כְּאָרִיס. אַהֵיָיא? אִילֵּימָא אַשְּׁבוּיִין, הַשְׁתָּא זָרִיז וְנִשְׂכָּר הֲוָה, מַאי דְּאַשְׁבַּח מִיבַּעְיָא? אֶלָּא אַרְטוּשִׁים – וְהָא ״מוֹצִיאִין אוֹתָן מִיָּדוֹ״ קָתָנֵי!
human_translation: taught And all of them, appraises their as a sharecropper. To which If we say with regard to captives’ now he is diligent and he profits, necessary of what enhance Rather, with regard to forsaken But isn’t it taught: removes it from his possession?
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: It was taught: And all of them listen to him like an heir. Ahaiya? If you will say they are captives, now he is diligent and intoxicated, what is praiseworthy about him? Rather, they are slaves - and this is what is taught: "They remove them from his hand!"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אַנְּטוּשִׁים. לְמַאן? אִילֵּימָא לְרַבָּנַן – הָא אָמְרִי מוֹצִיאִין אוֹתוֹ מִיָּדוֹ. אִי רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל – הָא אָמַר שָׁמַעְתִּי שֶׁהַנְּטוּשִׁים כִּשְׁבוּיִין.
human_translation: Rather, with regard to abandoned In accordance with whose If we say it is in accordance with the Rabbis, don’t they say: removes it from his possession? if Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, doesn’t he say: I heard that abandoned is like captives’
llm_translation: Rather, they are detached. According to whom? If you say according to the Rabbis - they said, "One may remove it from his hand." If you say according to Rabbi Shimon ben Gamliel - he said, "I have heard that the detached fringes are considered as attached."

hebrew_text: כִּשְׁבוּיִין וְלֹא שְׁבוּיִין. כִּשְׁבוּיִין – דְּאֵין מוֹצִיאִין אוֹתָן מִיָּדוֹ, וְלֹא שְׁבוּיִין – דְּאִילּוּ הָתָם זָרִיז וְנִשְׂכָּר, וְאִילּוּ הָכָא שָׁיְימִינַן לֵיהּ כְּאָרִיס.
human_translation: like captives’ but not captives’ like captives’ does not remove it from his possession. But not captives’ as there, diligent and he profits while here, one appraises their as a sharecropper.
llm_translation: Prisoners and not prisoners. Prisoners - for they are not removed from his hand, and not prisoners - for even there, if he is diligent and sober, and here, we should consider him like an heir.

hebrew_text: וּמַאי שְׁנָא מֵהָא דִּתְנַן: הַמּוֹצִיא הוֹצָאוֹת עַל נִכְסֵי אִשְׁתּוֹ, הוֹצִיא הַרְבֵּה וְאָכַל קִימְעָא, קִימְעָא וְאָכַל הַרְבֵּה – מַה שֶּׁהוֹצִיא הוֹצִיא, וּמַה שֶּׁאָכַל אָכַל.
human_translation: And what is different from that which we learned one who outlays expenditures to his wife’s property, he spent much and consumed little little and consumed much, What he spent, he spent, and what he consumed, he consumed.
llm_translation: And what is the difference from what we learned: One who brings out expenses on his wife's property, he brought out much and ate little - he brought out much, and ate little, and what he ate, he ate.

hebrew_text: הָא לָא דָּמְיָא אֶלָּא לְהָא דִּתְנַן: הַמּוֹצִיא הוֹצָאוֹת עַל נִכְסֵי אִשְׁתּוֹ קְטַנָּה – כְּמוֹצִיא עַל נִכְסֵי אַחֵר דָּמֵי. אַלְמָא: כֵּיוָן דְּלָא סָמְכָא דַּעְתֵּיהּ, תַּקִּינוּ לֵיה רַבָּנַן כִּי הֵיכִי דְּלָא לַפְסְדִינְהוּ, הָכָא נָמֵי תַּקִּינוּ לֵיה רַבָּנַן כִּי הֵיכִי דְּלָא לַפְסְדִינְהוּ.
human_translation: This is comparable only to that which we learned one who outlays expenditures to the property of his minor wife, is like one who outlays to the property of another, Apparently, since he does not rely the Sages instituted on his behalf so that he will not devalue Here too, the Sages instituted on behalf so that he will not devalue
llm_translation: Here is the word-for-word English translation of the Talmudic text: "This one is similar only to that which we learned: One who brings out expenses on the property of his minor wife - it is like bringing out expenses on the property of another, money. It is evident: since his mind did not rely, the Rabbis established for him so that he would not incur a loss, here too the Rabbis established for him so that he would not incur a loss."

hebrew_text: וְכוּלָּן שָׁמִין לָהֶם כְּאָרִיס – וְכוּלָּן לְאֵיתוֹיֵי מַאי?
human_translation: And all of them, appraises as a sharecropper, what to include,
llm_translation: And all of them listen to them like an heir - and all of them for the purpose of what?

hebrew_text: לְאֵיתוֹיֵי הָא דְּאָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: שָׁבוּי שֶׁנִּשְׁבָּה מוֹרִידִין קָרוֹב לִנְכָסָיו, יָצָא לְדַעַת אֵין מוֹרִידִין קָרוֹב לִנְכָסָיו. וְרַב נַחְמָן דִּידֵיהּ אָמַר: בּוֹרֵחַ הֲרֵי הוּא כְּשָׁבוּי. בּוֹרֵחַ מֵחֲמַת מַאי? אִילֵימָא מֵחֲמַת כְּרָגָא – הַיְינוּ לְדַעַת, אֶלָּא בּוֹרֵחַ מֵחֲמַת מְרָדִין.
human_translation: to include that which Rav Naḥman says Shmuel says: a captive who was taken captive, authorizes a relative to descend his property. he left of his volition, does not authorize a relative to descend his property. And Rav Naḥman says his own one who flees is like a captive. One who flees what If we say due to a tax [ karga ] that is of volition. Rather, flees due to murder [ meradin ],
llm_translation: To the question of Rav Nachman who said in the name of Shmuel: A captive who escaped, we bring him close to his property; is it known that we do not bring him close to his property. And Rav Nachman himself said: One who flees is like a captive. Why does he flee? If you say it is because of fear - that is known, rather he flees because of the authorities.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: שָׁבוּי שֶׁנִּשְׁבָּה וְהִנִּיחַ קָמָה לִקְצוֹר, עֲנָבִים לִבְצוֹר, תְּמָרִים לִגְדּוֹר, זֵיתִים לִמְסוֹק – בֵּית דִּין יוֹרְדִין לִנְכָסָיו וּמַעֲמִידִין אַפּוֹטְרוֹפּוֹס, וְקוֹצֵר וּבוֹצֵר וְגוֹדֵר וּמוֹסֵק, וְאַחַר כָּךְ מוֹרִידִין קָרוֹב לִנְכָסָיו. וְלוֹקֵים אַפּוֹטְרוֹפָּא לְעוֹלָם! אַפּוֹטְרוֹפָּא לְדִיקְנָנֵי לָא מוֹקְמִינַן.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says Shmuel says: a captive who was taken captive and left standing grain to be reaped, grapes to be harvested, dates to be cut, olives to be picked, the court descends to his property and appoints a steward And he reaps, and harvests, and cuts, and picks, and thereafter authorizes a relative to descend his property. let always appoint a steward We do not appoint a steward [ apoteropa ] for the bearded,
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: A captive who was taken captive and left a standing crop to harvest, grapes to prune, dates to fence, olives to harvest - the court descends to his estate and appoints an overseer, and they harvest, prune, fence, and gather, and only afterwards do they bring close to his estate. And they appoint an overseer forever! We do not appoint an overseer for meticulous people.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: אֵין מוֹרִידִין קָטָן לְנִכְסֵי שָׁבוּי, וְלֹא קָרוֹב לְנִכְסֵי קָטָן, וְלָא קָרוֹב מֵחֲמַת קָרוֹב לְנִכְסֵי קָטָן.
human_translation: Rav Huna says: does not authorize a minor, to descend to the property of a captive. And not a relative to the property of a minor And not a relative due to a relative to the property of a minor.
llm_translation: Rav Huna said: We do not lower a minor for the sake of property of a captive, nor do we bring a minor close to the property of a minor, nor do we bring one close due to proximity to the property of a minor.

hebrew_text: אֵין מוֹרִידִין קָטָן לְנִכְסֵי שָׁבוּי, דִּלְמָא מַפְסֵיד לְהוּ. וְלָא קָרוֹב מֵחֲמַת קָרוֹב לְנִכְסֵי קָטָן, בְּאַחֵי מֵאִימָּא. וְלָא קָרוֹב לְנִכְסֵי קָטָן, כֵּיוָן דְּלָא מָחֵי – אָתֵי לְאַחְזוֹקֵי בֵּיהּ.
human_translation: does not authorize a minor to descend to the property of a captive, lest he devalue the property. And not a relative due to a relative to the property of a minor. where a maternal brother. And not a relative to the property of a minor. since does not protest come to assume presumptive ownership
llm_translation: We do not lower a minor for the sake of property of captives, lest he cause a loss. And it is not close due to the closeness of a minor to the property of a minor, in the brothers of the mother. And it is not close to the property of a minor, since he does not protest - he will come to strengthen it.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא, שְׁמַע מִינֵּיהּ מִדְּרַב הוּנָא: אֵין מַחֲזִיקִין בְּנִכְסֵי קָטָן,
human_translation: Rava said: Learn from of Rav Huna one cannot assume presumptive ownership of the property of a minor.
llm_translation: Rava said, hear from the teachings of Rav Huna: We do not hold onto the property of a minor.

hebrew_text: וַאֲפִילּוּ הִגְדִּיל.
human_translation: And even reached majority,
llm_translation: And even he enlarged.

hebrew_text: וְלָא אֲמַרַן אֶלָּא בְּאַחֵי דְאַבָּא, אֲבָל בְּאַחֵי דְאִמָּא לֵית לַן בַּהּ. וַאֲחֵי דְאַבָּא נָמֵי לָא אֲמַרַן אֶלָּא בְּאַרְעָתָא, אֲבָל בְּבָתֵּי לֵית לַן בַּהּ. וּבְאַרְעָתָא נָמֵי לָא אֲמַרַן אֶלָּא דְּלָא עֲבִיד עִיטְדָּא, אֲבָל עֲבִיד עִיטְדָּא – קָלָא אִית לַהּ.
human_translation: And we said only in paternal brothers But in maternal brothers we have no with it, And paternal brothers, we said only with regard to land. But in houses we have no with it, And with regard to land too, we said only where did not draft a document of division But where drafted a document of division, it generates publicity,
llm_translation: We did not say except in the case of the brothers of the father, but in the case of the brothers of the mother, we do not have it. And the brothers of the father also we did not say except in the land, but in houses we do not have it. And in the land also we did not say except that he does not make a fence, but if he makes a fence - it has a voice.

hebrew_text: וְלָא הִיא – לָא שְׁנָא אַחֵי דְאַבָּא וְלָא שְׁנָא אַחֵי דְאִמָּא, לָא שְׁנָא אַרְעָתָא וְלָא שְׁנָא בָּתֵּי, וְלָא שְׁנָא עֲבִיד עִיטְדָּא לָא שְׁנָא לָא עֲבִיד עִיטְדָּא – לָא מַחֲתִינַן.
human_translation: But is not so, no difference paternal brothers and no difference maternal brothers; no different land, and no different houses; and no different he drafted a document of division, and no different he did not draft a document of division. We do not authorize
llm_translation: "And not this - not differentiates between the brothers of the father and not differentiates between the brothers of the mother, not differentiates between the lands and not differentiates between the houses, and not differentiates whether one performs the ritual of the bird offering or not performs the ritual of the bird offering - we do not differentiate."

hebrew_text: הָהִיא סָבְתָּא דַּהֲוַיָא לַהּ תְּלָת בְּנָתָא. אִישְׁתְּבַאי אִיהִי וַחֲדָא בְּרַתָּא. אִידַּךְ תַּרְתֵּי בְּנָתָא, שְׁכִיבָא חֲדָא מִינַּיְיהוּ וּשְׁבַקָה יָנוֹקָא. אֲמַר אַבָּיֵי: הֵיכִי נַעֲבֵיד? לוֹקְמִינְהוּ לְנִכְסֵי בִּידָא דַּאֲחָתָא – דִּלְמָא שְׁכִיבָא סָבְתָּא וְאֵין מוֹרִידִין קָרוֹב לְנִכְסֵי קָטָן! נוֹקְמִינְהוּ לְנִכְסֵיה בִּידָא דְּיָנוֹקָא – דִּלְמָא לָא שְׁכִיבָא סָבְתָּא וְאֵין מוֹרִידִין קָטָן לְנִכְסֵי שָׁבוּי!
human_translation: a certain old woman who had three daughters. She and one daughter were taken captive. the other two daughters, one died and left a minor Abaye said: What we do Let us establish the property in the possession of the sister, perhaps the old woman died and does not authorize a relative to descend the property of a minor. Let us establish the property in the possession of the minor, perhaps the old woman did not die, and does not authorize a minor to descend the property of a captive.
llm_translation: That elderly woman who had three daughters. One of them married and had one daughter. The other had two daughters, one of whom died and left a baby. Abaye said: What should we do? If we establish them as heirs in the possession of the living daughter – perhaps the living daughter will die and we will not bring the close relative down to the possession of the minor! If we establish them as heirs in the possession of the baby – perhaps the baby will not survive and we will not bring the minor down to the possession of the captive!

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: הִלְכָּךְ, פַּלְגָא יָהֲבִינָא לַהּ לַאֲחָתָא. וְאִידַּךְ פַּלְגָא מוֹקְמִינַן לֵיהּ אַפּוֹטְרוֹפָּא לְיָנוֹקָא. רָבָא אָמַר: מִגּוֹ דְּמוֹקְמִינַן אַפּוֹטְרוֹפָּא לְפַלְגָא, מוֹקְמִינַן לֵיהּ אַפּוֹטְרוֹפָּא לְאִידַּךְ פַּלְגָא.
human_translation: Abaye said: Consequently, half is given to the sister. And the other half we establish a steward on behalf of the minor, Rava said: Once we appoint a steward for half we appoint a steward for the other half
llm_translation: Abaye said: Therefore, I gave her half to one. And the other half we establish for her as a nursemaid for the child. Rava said: From the place where we establish a nursemaid for one, we establish a nursemaid for the other half.

hebrew_text: לְסוֹף שְׁמַעוּ דִּשְׁכִיבָא סָבְתָּא. אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: תִּילְתָּא יָהֲבִינַן לַהּ לַאֲחָתָא, וְתִילְתָּא יָהֲבִינַן לֵיהּ לְיָנוֹקָא. וְאִידַּךְ תִּילְתָּא יָהֲבִינַן דַּנְקָא לַאֲחָתָא, וְאִידַּךְ דַּנְקָא מוֹקְמִינַן לֵיהּ אַפּוֹטְרוֹפָּא לְיָנוֹקָא. רָבָא אָמַר: מִגּוֹ דְּמוֹקֵים אַפּוֹטְרוֹפָּא לְדַנְקָא מוֹקְמִינַן נָמֵי אַפּוֹטְרוֹפָּא לְאִידַּךְ דַּנְקָא.
human_translation: Ultimately, they heard that that old woman died, Abaye said: We give one-third to the daughter. And we give one-third to the minor, And the other one-third we give one-sixth [ danka ] to the sister, and the other one-sixth, we appoint a steward on behalf of the minor, Rava said: Once we appoint a steward for one-sixth we also appoint a steward for the other one-sixth
llm_translation: At the end of Shema, when you lie down, old man. Abaye said: We give three to the mother and three to the child. And the other opinion is: We give three to the mother, and the other three we appoint for the child. Rava said: From the place where we appoint for the child, we also appoint for the mother.

hebrew_text: מָרִי בַּר אִיסַק אֲתָא לֵיהּ אַחָא מִבֵּי חוֹזָאֵי. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: פְּלוֹג לִי. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָא יָדַעְנָא לָךְ.
human_translation: Mari bar Isak, a brother come to him from Bei Ḥozai, said to him: Divide to me, said to him: I do not know you
llm_translation: Master Bar Isak came to Acha from the house of the sages. He said to him: "Argue for me." He said to him: "I do not know for you."

hebrew_text: אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב חִסְדָּא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: שַׁפִּיר קָאָמַר לָךְ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיַּכֵּר יוֹסֵף אֶת אֶחָיו וְהֵם לֹא הִכִּרֻהוּ״ – מְלַמֵּד שֶׁיָּצָא בְּלֹא חֲתִימַת זָקָן וּבָא בַּחֲתִימַת זָקָן. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: זִיל אַיְיתִי סָהֲדִי דַּאֲחוּהּ אַתְּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִית לִי סָהֲדִי, וְדָחֲלִי מִינֵּיהּ דְּגַבְרָא אַלִּימָא הוּא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ לְדִידֵיהּ: זִיל אַנְתְּ אַיְיתִי סָהֲדֵי דְּלָאו אֲחוּךְ הוּא.
human_translation: came before Rav Ḥisda. He said to spoke well to you, as it is stated: “And Joseph knew his brothers and they knew him not” teaches that left without the trace of a beard, and he came with the trace of a beard. said to Go bring witnesses that you are his brother. said to him: I have witnesses, but they fear because he is a violent man. said to You go bring witnesses that he is not your brother.
llm_translation: He came before Rav Ḥisda. He said to him: You are saying well, as it is stated: "And Joseph recognized his brothers, but they did not recognize him" (Genesis 42:8) – this teaches that he went out without a beard and came in with a beard. He said to him: Go, bring me witnesses that you are his brother. He said to him: I have witnesses, but I am afraid of that man, as he is a violent person. He said to himself: Go, you bring witnesses that he is not your brother.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: דִּינָא הָכִי?! הַמּוֹצִיא מֵחֲבֵירוֹ עָלָיו הָרְאָיָה. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָכִי דָּיְינִינָא לָךְ וּלְכֹל אַלִּימֵי דְּחַבְרָךְ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: סוֹף סוֹף אָתוּ סָהֲדִי וְלָא מַסְהֲדִי. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: תַּרְתֵּי לָא עָבְדִי.
human_translation: said to him: Is this the halakha ? the burden of proof rests upon the claimant? said to him: This is I judge you and all of your fellow violent said to him: Ultimately, witnesses will come, and they will not testify said to him: They will not perform two
llm_translation: He said to him: Is this the law?! One who brings evidence from his fellow, the burden of proof is upon him. He said to him: This is how I judge for you and for all those who are your colleagues. He said to him: Eventually the witnesses came, but they were not credible. He said to him: I did not do two things.

hebrew_text: לְסוֹף אֲתוֹ סָהֲדִי דַּאֲחוּהּ הוּא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לִפְלוֹג לִי נָמֵי מִפַּרְדֵּיסֵי וּבוּסְתָּנִי דִּשְׁתַל. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: שַׁפִּיר קָאָמַר לָךְ, דִּתְנַן: הִנִּיחַ בָּנִים גְּדוֹלִים וּקְטַנִּים, וְהִשְׁבִּיחוּ גְּדוֹלִים אֶת הַנְּכָסִים – הִשְׁבִּיחוּ לָאֶמְצַע.
human_translation: Ultimately, witnesses came that was his brother. said to Divide me of the orchards and the gardens that you planted as well. said to He spoke well to you, as we learned left adult and minor sons, and the adult enhanced the property, they enhanced to the middle,
llm_translation: At the end, his witnesses came. He said to him: "Separate for me from the orchards and the vineyards that were planted." He said to him: "You are saying well, as we learned: If one left both adult and minor children, and the adults consumed the property – they consumed it not in the middle."

hebrew_text: וְכֵן אָמַר רַבָּה: הִשְׁבִּיחוּ לָאֶמְצַע. אָמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: מִי דָּמֵי? הָתָם, גְּדוֹלִים גַּבֵּי קְטַנִּים יָדְעִי וְקָא מָחֲלִי, הָכָא מִי יָדַע דְּלֵיחִיל?
human_translation: And likewise, Rabba says: They enhanced to the middle. Abaye said to him: Are comparable? There, adults are aware that the minors and forgo Here, was aware that he could forgo
llm_translation: And so said Rabba: They have silenced the middle. Abaye said to him: Who is similar? There, the great ones knew about the small ones and forgave, but here, who knows that they will not be afraid?

hebrew_text: אִגַּלְגַּל מִלְּתָא וּמְטָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי אַמֵּי. אֲמַר לְהוּ: גְּדוֹלָה מִזּוֹ אָמְרוּ: שָׁמִין לָהֶם כְּאָרִיס, הַשְׁתָּא דִּידֵיהּ לָא יָהֲבִינַן לֵיהּ?
human_translation: The matter continued and came before Rabbi Ami. He said stated a more far-reaching than that: appraises their as a sharecropper. now, his, we do not give him?
llm_translation: He rolled a matter and came before Rabbi Ammi. He said to them: "Greater than this they said: 'They listen to him like an heir, but now we do not understand his words?"

hebrew_text: אַהְדְּרוּהָ (הָא) לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב חִסְדָּא. אֲמַר לְהוּ: מִי דָּמֵי? הָתָם בִּרְשׁוּת נָחֵית, הָכָא לָאו בִּרְשׁוּת נָחֵית. וְעוֹד: קָטָן הוּא, וְאֵין מוֹרִידִין קָרוֹב לְנִכְסֵי קָטָן.
human_translation: They returned this before Rav Ḥisda. said to them: Are comparable? There, with authorization descended Here, without authorization descended And furthermore, a minor and does not authorize a relative to descend the property of a minor.
llm_translation: Return her to stand before Rav Ḥisda. He said to them: Who is similar? There, she descended with permission, here, she did not descend with permission. And furthermore: She is a minor, and we do not collect debts from the property of a minor.

hebrew_text: אַהְדְּרוּהָ לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי אַמֵּי, אֲמַר לְהוּ: לָא סַיְּימוּהָ קַמַּי דְּקָטָן הוּא.
human_translation: They returned this before Rabbi Ami. said to them: They did not complete before me, that was a minor.
llm_translation: Return it before Rabbi Ammi, he said to them: They did not finish it before me, for it is a minor.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַמַּפְקִיד פֵּירוֹת אֵצֶל חֲבֵירוֹ, הֲרֵי זֶה יוֹצִיא לוֹ חֶסְרוֹנוֹת: לְחִטִּים וּלְאוֹרֶז – תִּשְׁעָה חֲצָאֵי קַבִּין לְכוֹר, לִשְׂעוֹרִין וּלְדוֹחַן – תִּשְׁעָה קַבִּין לְכוֹר, לְכוּסְּמִין וּלְזֶרַע פִּשְׁתָּן – שָׁלֹשׁ סְאִין לְכוֹר, הַכֹּל לְפִי הַמִּדָּה וְהַכֹּל לְפִי הַזְּמַן.
human_translation: one who deposits produce with another, that deducts decrease For wheat and for rice, nine half- kav per kor , for barley and millet, nine kav per kor ; for spelt and flaxseed, three se’a , per kor . The entire according to the measure, and the entire according to the time
llm_translation: It was taught: One who entrusts his produce to his fellow, he has fulfilled his obligation to him: for wheat and barley - nine half-kabs per kor, for barley and spelt - nine kabs per kor, for cumin and flaxseed - three se'ahs per kor, everything according to the measure and everything according to the time.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן נוּרִי: וְכִי מָה אִכְפַּת לָהֶן לָעַכְבָּרִין? וַהֲלֹא אוֹכְלוֹת בֵּין מֵהַרְבֵּה וּבֵין מִקִּמְעָה! אֶלָּא אֵינוֹ יוֹצִיא לוֹ חֶסְרוֹנוֹת אֶלָּא לְכוֹר אֶחָד בִּלְבַד. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אִם הָיְתָה מִדָּה מְרוּבָּה, אֵינוֹ מוֹצִיא לוֹ חֶסְרוֹנוֹת, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁמּוֹתִירוֹת.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Nuri said: And what do the mice care Don’t they eat the same whether from much and whether from little Rather, he deducts decrease of just one kor Rabbi Yehuda says: If was a large measure, does not deduct decrease it, due to that it increases.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan ben Nuri said: "And why do they care about the mice? Don't they eat from both the top and the bottom! Rather, it only does not cause him loss except for one hole alone." Rabbi Yehuda says: "If it was a large measure, it does not cause him loss, because they are permissible."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אוֹרֶז טוּבָא חָסֵר! אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: בְּאוֹרֶז קָלוּף שָׁנוּ. לְכוּסְּמִין וּלְזֶרַע פִּשְׁתָּן שְׁלֹשָׁה סְאִין לְכוֹר וְכוּ׳. אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא: זֶרַע פִּשְׁתָּן בְּגִבְעוֹלִין שָׁנוּ. תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: לְכוּסְּמִין וּלְזֶרַע פִּשְׁתָּן בַּגִּבְעוֹלִין, וּלְאוֹרֶז שֶׁאֵינוֹ קָלוּף – שְׁלֹשָׁה סְאִין לְכוֹר.
human_translation: rice is lacking a greater Rabba bar bar Ḥana says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: with regard to shelled rice taught For spelt and flaxseed, three se’a per kor . Rabbi Yoḥanan says Rabbi Ḥiyya says: with regard to flaxseed on stalks taught That is also taught For spelt and for flaxseed on stalks and for unshelled rice, three se’a per kor .
llm_translation: Gemara: "The rice is good but lacking! Rabba bar bar Ḥana said in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan: In rice, the husk is different. For sesame and flax seeds, three se'ahs for a kor and so on. Rabbi Yoḥanan said in the name of Rabbi Ḥiyya: The flax seed in the hills is different. It was also taught in a baraita in this manner: For sesame and flax seeds in the hills, and for rice that is not husked – three se'ahs for a kor."

hebrew_text: הַכֹּל לְפִי הַמִּדָּה וְכוּ׳. תָּנָא: כֵּן לְכׇל כּוֹר וָכוֹר, וְכֵן לְכׇל שָׁנָה וְשָׁנָה.
human_translation: The entire according to the measure, taught That for each and every kor , and that for each and every year.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Everything according to the measure, etc." It was taught: So for every kor and kor, and so for every year and year.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן נוּרִי וְכוּ׳. תַּנְיָא, אָמְרוּ לוֹ לְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הַרְבֵּה אוֹבְדוֹת מֵהֶן, הַרְבֵּה מִתְפַּזְּרוֹת מֵהֶן.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Nuri said: It is taught said to Rabbi Yoḥanan: Much of lost, much of scattered.
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yochanan ben Nuri and so forth. It was taught: They said to Rabbi Yochanan, "Many are lost from them, many are scattered from them."

hebrew_text: תָּנָא: בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים? שֶׁעֵירְבָן עִם פֵּירוֹתָיו. אֲבָל יִחֵד לוֹ קֶרֶן זָוִית, אוֹמֵר לוֹ: הֲרֵי שֶׁלְּךָ לְפָנֶיךָ.
human_translation: taught: In what is this statement said, where mixed with his produce, But he designated a corner says to That which is yours is before you,
llm_translation: Mishnah: In what case are these words said? When he mixed it with its fruits. But if he has a corner horn attached to it, he says to him: "Here is yours before you."

hebrew_text: וְכִי עֵירְבָן עִם פֵּירוֹתָיו מַאי הָוֵי? לִיחְזֵי לְדִידֵיהּ כַּמָּה הָוְיָין! בְּמִסְתַּפֵּק מֵהֶם.
human_translation: And when he mixed with his produce, what of it? Let him see how much his was, where took supplies from
llm_translation: "And if one mixed with its fruits, what is the ruling? Let us see according to our view how many they are! It is in doubt from them."

hebrew_text: וְלִיחְזֵי כַּמָּה אִסְתַּפַּק! דְּלָא יָדְעִי כַּמָּה אִסְתַּפַּק.
human_translation: And let him see how much he took supplies where does not know how much he took supplies,
llm_translation: And to Yehzei, how much is it in doubt! For he does not know how much is in doubt.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אִם הָיְתָה וְכוּ׳. כַּמָּה מִדָּה מְרוּבָּה? אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: עֲשָׂרָה כּוֹרִין. תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: כַּמָּה מִדָּה מְרוּבָּה? עֲשָׂרָה כּוֹרִין.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: If was How much is a large measure? Rabba bar bar Ḥana says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: ten kor . This is also taught How much is a large measure? ten kor .
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehudah says: "If it was, etc." How much is a large measure? Rabbah bar bar Ḥana said in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan: Ten kor. It was also taught similarly: How much is a large measure? Ten kor.

hebrew_text: תָּנֵי תַּנָּא קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב נַחְמָן: בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים? שֶׁמָּדַד לוֹ מִתּוֹךְ גּוֹרְנוֹ וְהֶחְזִיר לוֹ מִתּוֹךְ גּוֹרְנוֹ. אֲבָל מָדַד לוֹ מִתּוֹךְ גּוֹרְנוֹ וְהֶחְזִיר לוֹ מִתּוֹךְ בֵּיתוֹ – אֵינוֹ יוֹצִיא לוֹ חֶסְרוֹנוֹת, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁמּוֹתִירוֹת.
human_translation: The tanna taught before Rav Naḥman: In what is this statement said, where measured for from his threshing floor, and returned to him from his threshing floor. But where measured for from his threshing floor and returned to him from his house, he does not deduct decrease because increased
llm_translation: The Tanna taught before Rav Nachman: In what case are these words said? That he measured for him from the midst of his granary and returned to him from the midst of his granary. But if he measured for him from the midst of his granary and returned to him from the midst of his house - he does not fulfill his deficiencies for him, because they are left over.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: וְכִי בְּשׁוּפְטָנֵי עָסְקִינַן דְּיָהֲבִי בִּכְיָילָא רַבָּא וְשָׁקְלִי בִּכְיָילָא זוּטָא? דִּלְמָא בִּימוֹת הַגּוֹרֶן קָאָמְרַתְּ. בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים – שֶׁמָּדַד לוֹ בִּימוֹת הַגּוֹרֶן וְהֶחְזִיר לוֹ בִּימוֹת הַגּוֹרֶן. אֲבָל מָדַד לוֹ בִּימוֹת הַגּוֹרֶן וְהֶחְזִיר לוֹ בִּימוֹת הַגְּשָׁמִים – אֵינוֹ יוֹצִיא לוֹ חֶסְרוֹן מִפְּנֵי שֶׁמּוֹתִירוֹת.
human_translation: said to him: And are we dealing with fools, who give with a large measure and take with a small measure? Perhaps you are stating the season of the threshing floor, In what is this statement said? where he measured for during the season of the threshing floor and returned to him during the season of the threshing floor, But he measured for during the season of the threshing floor and returned to him during the rainy season, he does not deduct decrease because expanded,
llm_translation: He said to him: Are we dealing with judges who give a large measure in the granary and take back a small measure in the granary? Perhaps you are speaking about the days of the granary. In what case are these words said? - When he measured for him in the days of the granary and returned to him in the days of the granary. But if he measured for him in the days of the granary and returned to him in the days of the rains, he does not fulfill his obligation, because they are unreliable.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב פָּפָּא לְאַבָּיֵי: אִם כֵּן, לִפְקַע כַּדָּא! הֲוָה עוֹבָדָא וּפְקַע כַּדָּא. אִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא, מִשּׁוּם אִיצְצָא.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said to Abaye: If so, the jug should burst was an incident and the jug burst. If you wish, say due to compression.
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Papa to Abbaye: If so, then let it burst like a jug! It was a deed, and it burst like a jug. If you wish, say it was due to the splinter.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ יוֹצִיא לוֹ שְׁתוּת לְיַיִן. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: חוֹמֶשׁ. יוֹצִיא לוֹ שְׁלֹשָׁה לוּגִּין שֶׁמֶן לְמֵאָה: לוֹג וּמֶחֱצָה שְׁמָרִים, לוֹג וּמֶחֱצָה בָּלַע. אִם הָיָה שֶׁמֶן מְזוּקָּק – אֵינוֹ יוֹצִיא לוֹ שְׁמָרִים. אִם הָיוּ קַנְקַנִּים יְשָׁנִים – אֵינוֹ יוֹצִיא לוֹ בֶּלַע. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אַף הַמּוֹכֵר שֶׁמֶן מְזוּקָּק לַחֲבֵירוֹ כׇּל יְמוֹת הַשָּׁנָה – הֲרֵי זֶה מְקַבֵּל עָלָיו לוֹג וּמֶחֱצָה שְׁמָרִים לְמֵאָה.
human_translation: he deducts one-sixth for wine, Rabbi Yehuda says: one-fifth. He deducts three log of oil for one hundred A log and a half for sediment and a log and a half absorption If it was refined oil, he does not deduct for sediment If was old casks he does not deduct absorption. Rabbi Yehuda says: Even one who sells refined oil to another all the days of the year, this accepts upon himself a log and a half of sediment for one hundred
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One may add water to wine. Rabbi Yehudah says: One may add vinegar. One may add three log of oil to a hundred: a log and a half of sesame oil, a log and a half of olive oil. If the oil was refined - one may not add sesame oil. If there were old jugs - one may not add olive oil. Rabbi Yehudah says: Even one who sells refined oil to his fellow throughout the year - he must accept upon himself a log and a half of sesame oil to a hundred.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ וְלָא פְּלִיגִי: מָר כִּי אַתְרֵיהּ וּמָר כִּי אַתְרֵיהּ. בְּאַתְרֵיהּ דְּמָר חָפוּ בְּקִירָא וְלָא מָיֵיץ טְפֵי, בְּאַתְרֵיהּ דְּמָר חָפוּ בְּכוּפְרָא וּמָיֵיץ טְפֵי. אִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא מִשּׁוּם גַּרְגִּישְׁתָּא, הָא מָיְיצָא טְפֵי וְהָא לָא מָיְיצָא טְפֵי.
human_translation: And do not disagree Sage in accordance with his locale, and Sage in accordance with his locale. In the place of Sage, they coat with wax [ bekira ] and it does not absorb much. In the place of Sage, they coat with pitch and it absorbs much. If you wish, say it is due to the of earth [ gargishta ] this absorb much, and that do not absorb much.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemara, and they do not argue: Master when he was in his place, and Master when he was in his place. In his place, Master covered with straw and did not moisten the ashes, in his place, Master covered with lime and moistened the ashes. If you wish, say it is due to the quality of the lime, this one moistens the ashes and this one does not moisten the ashes.

hebrew_text: בְּאַתְרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוּדָה רָמוּ אַרְבָּעִים וְתַמְנֵי כּוּזֵי בְּדַנָּא. אָזֵיל דַּנָּא בְּשִׁיתָּא זוּזֵי, פָּרֵיס רַב יְהוּדָה שִׁיתָּא שִׁיתָּא בְּזוּזָא,
human_translation: In Rav Yehuda’s place they would place forty-eight pitchers into a barrel, The barrel went six dinars, Rav Yehuda divided six for one dinar.
llm_translation: In his place, of Rav Yehudah, they raised forty and two cups of wine. Danah went with six zuz, Rav Yehudah spread six sixes of zuz.

hebrew_text: דַּל תְּלָתִין וְשִׁיתָּא בְּשִׁיתָּא, פָּשׁוּ לֵיהּ תְּרֵיסַר. דַּל תְּמָנְיָא שְׁתוּתֵי, פָּשׁוּ לְהוּ אַרְבְּעָה.
human_translation: Subtract thirty-six for six each, Twelve remained for him. Subtract eight one-sixth Four remained
llm_translation: The poor thirty and six in thirty-six, they are spread out to him twelve. The poor forty-eight in forty-eight, they are spread out to him four.

hebrew_text: וְהָאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הַמִּשְׂתַּכֵּר אַל יִשְׂתַּכֵּר יוֹתֵר עַל שְׁתוּת!
human_translation: But doesn’t Shmuel say one who profits may not profit more than one-sixth?
llm_translation: And Samuel said: One who hires should not hire excessively beyond the value!

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא גּוּלְפֵי וּשְׁמָרַיָּא. אִי הָכִי נְפִישׁ לֵיהּ טְפֵי מִשְּׁתוּת? אִיכָּא טִרְחֵיהּ וּדְמֵי בַּרְזַנְיָיתָא.
human_translation: There are the barrel and the sediment If so, is greater than one-sixth. There is his exertion, and payment for tapping,
llm_translation: There are Golfei and Shemaraya. If so, is there more of it than of Shetut? There is his trouble and the blood of Barzaniyata.

hebrew_text: אִם הָיָה שֶׁמֶן מְזוּקָּק אֵינוֹ יוֹצִיא לוֹ שְׁמָרִים וְכוּ׳. וְהָא אִי אֶפְשָׁר דְּלָא בָּלַע! אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: בִּמְזוּפָּפִין שָׁנוּ. אַבָּיֵי אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא שֶׁלֹּא בִּמְזוּפָּפִין, כֵּיוָן דִּטְעוּן – טְעוּן.
human_translation: If it was refined oil, he does not deduct for sediment. But isn’t it impossible that did not absorb Rav Naḥman says: with regard to coated with pitch taught Abaye said: Even if you say that not coated with pitch, once they are saturated they are saturated,
llm_translation: If there was boiled oil, it does not require guarding, etc. But is it possible that he did not swallow it! Rav Nachman said: They spoke about in the case of boiling. Abaye said: Even if you say it's not in the case of boiling, since they are mixed - they are mixed.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אַף הַמּוֹכֵר שֶׁמֶן מְזוּקָּק לַחֲבֵירוֹ כׇּל יְמוֹת הַשָּׁנָה, הֲרֵי זֶה מְקַבֵּל עָלָיו לוֹג וּמֶחֱצָה שְׁמָרִים לְמֵאָה. אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: כְּשֶׁתִּמְצָא לוֹמַר, לְדִבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה מוּתָּר לְעָרֵב שְׁמָרִים, לְדִבְרֵי חֲכָמִים אָסוּר לְעָרֵב שְׁמָרִים.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: Even one who sells refined oil to another all the days of the year, this accepts upon himself a log and a half of sediment for one hundred Abaye said: When you will find to say according to the statement of Rabbi Yehuda, permitted to mix sediment And according to the statement of the Rabbis, prohibited to mix sediment
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: Even one who sells refined oil to his fellow throughout the entire year, he is obligated to accept upon himself a log and a half of oil for every hundred. Abaye said: When you find an opportunity to say, according to the words of Rabbi Yehuda it is permissible to mix oils, but according to the words of the Sages it is forbidden to mix oils.

hebrew_text: לְדִבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה מוּתָּר לְעָרֵב שְׁמָרִים, וְהַיְינוּ טַעְמָא דִּמְקַבֵּל, דַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִי בְּעַי לְעָרוֹבֵי לָךְ – מִי לָא עָרֵבִי לָךְ? הַשְׁתָּא נָמֵי קַבֵּיל.
human_translation: According to the statement of Rabbi Yehuda, permitted to mix sediment, and that is the reason that accepts as says to him: If I wished to mix to you, couldn’t I mix to you? Now too, accept
llm_translation: According to the words of Rabbi Yehuda, it is permitted to mix Shemarim, and this is the reason why he accepts it, for he said to him: If you want to mix for yourself - who will mix for you? Now also accept.

hebrew_text: וְלֵימָא לֵיהּ: אִי עָרֵבְתְּ לֵיהּ – הֲוָה מִזְדַּבַּן לִי, הַשְׁתָּא מַאי אֶעֱבֵיד לֵיהּ? לְחוֹדֵיהּ לָא מִזְדַּבַּן לִי! בְּבַעַל הַבַּיִת עָסְקִינַן – דְּנִיחָא לֵיהּ בְּצִילָא. וְלֵימָא לֵיהּ: מִדְּלָא עָרֵבִית לִי – אַחוֹלֵי אַחֵלְתְּ לִי!
human_translation: And let say to him: If you had mixed into it have been sold for me Now what will I do with it? cannot be sold on its own, We are dealing with a homeowner, and filtered is preferable for him, And let say to him: From that you did not mix for me, you renounced it to me.
llm_translation: And let him say to him: If you did not guarantee for him - he was causing me damage, what can I do for him now? To his creditor, I am not causing damage! We are dealing with a homeowner - I left it in his care. And let him say to him: Since you did not guarantee for me - I will eat and consume it!

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה לְטַעְמֵיהּ, דְּלֵית לֵיהּ מְחִילָה. דִּתְנַן: מָכַר לוֹ אֶת הַצֶּמֶד – לֹא מָכַר לוֹ אֶת הַבָּקָר. מָכַר לוֹ אֶת הַבָּקָר – לֹא מָכַר לוֹ אֶת הַצֶּמֶד.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda to his reasoning, as he is not renunciation, as we learned one sold the yoke [ tzemed ] to he did not sell the cattle to him. one sold the cattle to he did not sell the yoke to him.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda according to his reasoning, that he does not have forgiveness. For it was taught: If he sold him the pair - he did not sell him the cow. If he sold him the cow - he did not sell him the pair.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: הַדָּמִים מוֹדִיעִין. כֵּיצַד? אָמַר לוֹ: מְכוֹר לִי צִמְדְּךָ בְּמָאתַיִם זוּז – הַדָּבָר יָדוּעַ שֶׁאֵין הַצֶּמֶד בְּמָאתַיִים זוּז. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אֵין הַדָּמִים רְאָיָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: The money informs How so? said to Sell me your tzemed for two hundred dinars, the matter is well-known that a yoke not two hundred dinars, And the Rabbis say: The money is not a proof,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: Blood informs. How so? He said to him: Sell me your pair for two hundred zuz - it is known that a pair is not for two hundred zuz. And the sages say: Blood is not evidence.

hebrew_text: לְדִבְרֵי חֲכָמִים אָסוּר לְעָרֵב שְׁמָרִים, וְהַיְינוּ טַעְמָא דְּלָא מְקַבֵּל – דַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִי בָּעֵית לְעָרוֹבֵי מִי הֲוָה שְׁרֵי לָךְ? הַשְׁתָּא נָמֵי לָא מְקַבֵּילְנָא.
human_translation: According to the statement of the Rabbis, prohibited to mix sediment, and this is the reason does not accept as says to him: If you wished to mix would it be permitted for you Now too, I do not accept
llm_translation: According to the words of the sages, it is forbidden to mix Shemarim, and this is the reason - because it is not accepted. For he said to him: If you wanted to mix, who would allow you? Now too, we do not accept.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב פָּפָּא לְאַבָּיֵי: אַדְּרַבָּה, אִיפְּכָא מִסְתַּבְּרָא! לְדִבְרֵי חֲכָמִים מוּתָּר לְעָרֵב שְׁמָרִים, וְהַיְינוּ טַעְמָא דְּלָא מְקַבֵּל – דַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ: מִדְּלָא עָרֵבְתְּ לִי, אַחוֹלֵי אַחֵלְיתְּ לִי. לְדִבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אָסוּר לְעָרֵב שְׁמָרִים, וְהַיְינוּ טַעְמָא דִּמְקַבֵּל – דְּאָמַר לֵיהּ: אִי בְּעַי לְעָרוֹבֵי – לָא שְׁרֵי לִי לְעָרוֹבֵי לָךְ, קַבּוֹלֵי לָא מְקַבְּלַתְּ. זְבוֹן וְזַבֵּין תַּגָּרָא אִיקְּרִי?
human_translation: Rav Pappa said to Abaye: On the contrary, the opposite is reasonable. According to the statement of the Rabbis, permitted to mix sediment. And this is the reason does not accept as said to From that you did not mix for me, you renounced to me. According to the statement of Rabbi Yehuda, prohibited to mix sediment. And this is the reason accepts as says to him: If I wished to mix it is prohibited for me to mix for you, do not accept buys and sells he called a merchant?
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Papa to Abbaye: "Adraba, ifpacha mistabera! According to the words of the sages, it is permissible to mix watchmen, and this is the reason why it is not accepted - for he said to him: 'Since you did not mix for me, I will not eat your mixture.' According to the words of Rabbi Yehuda, it is forbidden to mix watchmen, and this is the reason why it is accepted - for he said to him: 'If you want to mix, it is not permissible for me to mix for you, if you accept, I do not accept.' Is it called 'Zevon and Zabbin' a dispute?

hebrew_text: תַּנָּא: אֶחָד הַלּוֹקֵחַ וְאֶחָד הַמַּפְקִיד לִפְקָטִים. מַאי לִפְקָטִים? אִילֵימָא כִּי הֵיכִי דְּלוֹקֵחַ לָא מְקַבֵּל פְּקָטִים, מַפְקִיד נָמֵי לָא מְקַבֵּל פְּקָטִים – וְלֵימָא לֵיהּ: פְּקָטָךְ מַאי אֶיעְבֵּיד לְהוּ?
human_translation: taught: both one who buys and one who deposits to residue [ piktim ], What to residue? If we say that Just as the buyer does not accept residue, too, the one who deposits does not accept residue But let say to What shall I do with your residue?
llm_translation: We learned: One who buys and one who appoints for overseers. What is meant by "for overseers"? If you say, in order that the buyer does not accept overseers, the appointer also does not accept overseers - and say to him: What shall I do with your overseer?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא כִּי הֵיכִי דְּמַפְקִיד מְקַבֵּל פְּקָטִים, לוֹקֵחַ נָמֵי מְקַבֵּל פְּקָטִים. וּמִי מְקַבֵּל לוֹקֵחַ פְּקָטִים? וְהָתַנְיָא, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: לֹא אָמְרוּ שֶׁמֶן עָכוּר אֶלָּא לַמּוֹכֵר בִּלְבָד, שֶׁהֲרֵי לוֹקֵחַ מְקַבֵּל עָלָיו לוֹג וּמֶחֱצָה שְׁמָרִים, בְּלֹא פְּקָטִים.
human_translation: Rather, Just as the one who deposits accepts the residue too, the buyer accepts the residue And does the buyer accept residue? But isn’t it taught Rabbi Yehuda says: stated murky oil only for the seller, as the buyer accepts upon himself a log and a half of sediment without residue?
llm_translation: Rather, how does one appoint a receiver of produce? One takes a trustworthy person as a receiver of produce. And who receives? And it was taught: Rabbi Yehuda says: They only said that impure oil is for the seller alone, for the buyer receives upon himself a log and a half of oils, without produce.

hebrew_text: לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא דְּיָהֵיב לֵיהּ זוּזֵי בְּתִשְׁרִי וְקָא שָׁקֵיל מִינֵּיהּ בְּנִיסָן, כִּי מִדָּה דְתִשְׁרִי. הָא דְּיָהֵיב לֵיהּ זוּזֵי בְּנִיסָן וְקָא שָׁקֵיל מִינֵּיהּ בְּנִיסָן, כִּי מִדָּה דְנִיסָן.
human_translation: not difficult, as this where gave the seller money in Tishrei, and he takes from him in Nisan according to measure of Tishrei. That where gave the seller money in Nisan, and he takes from him in Nisan according to measure Nisan,
llm_translation: Not difficult: this one who gave him coins in Tishrei and took from him in Nisan, according to the measure of Tishrei. This one who gave him coins in Nisan and took from him in Nisan, according to the measure of Nisan.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַמַּפְקִיד חָבִית אֵצֶל חֲבֵירוֹ וְלֹא יִחֲדוּ לָהּ בְּעָלִים מָקוֹם, וְטִלְטְלָהּ וְנִשְׁתַּבְּרָה – אִם מִתּוֹךְ יָדוֹ נִשְׁבְּרָה, לְצוֹרְכּוֹ – חַיָּיב, לְצוֹרְכָּהּ – פָּטוּר. אִם מִשֶּׁהִנִּיחָהּ נִשְׁבְּרָה, בֵּין לְצוֹרְכּוֹ בֵּין לְצוֹרְכָּהּ – פָּטוּר. יִחֲדוּ לָהּ הַבְּעָלִים מָקוֹם, וְטִלְטְלָהּ וְנִשְׁבְּרָה – בֵּין מִתּוֹךְ יָדוֹ וּבֵין מִשֶּׁהִנִּיחָהּ, לְצוֹרְכּוֹ – חַיָּיב, לְצוֹרְכָּהּ – פָּטוּר.
human_translation: one who deposits a barrel with another, and the owners did not designate place for moved it and it broke, if it broke while in his hand, for his purposes, liable for its purposes, exempt. If, after he replaced it broke, whether for his purposes whether for its purposes, exempt. the owners designated place for and moved it and it broke, whether while in his hand or whether after he replaced for his purposes liable for its purposes, exempt.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who entrusts a barrel to his friend, and the owners did not designate a specific place for it, and it was moved and broke - if it broke while in his hand, for his own need - he is liable; for her need - he is exempt. If it broke after he placed it down, whether for his need or for her need - he is exempt. If the owners designated a specific place for it, and it was moved and broke - whether it broke while in his hand or after he placed it down, for his need - he is liable; for her need - he is exempt.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ הָא מַנִּי? רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל הִיא, דְּאָמַר: לָא בָּעִינַן דַּעַת בְּעָלִים. דְּתַנְיָא: הַגּוֹנֵב טָלֶה מִן הָעֵדֶר וְסֶלַע מִן הַכִּיס – לִמְקוֹם שֶׁגָּנַב יַחְזִיר, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל. רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר:
human_translation: whose is this It is Rabbi Yishmael, who says: we do not require the knowledge of the owner as it is taught one who steals a lamb from the flock or a sela from the purse, he should return it to the place from which he stole the statement of Rabbi Yishmael. Rabbi Akiva says:
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemara, ha mani? Rabbi Yishmael hi, de'amar: lo bainan da'at be'alim. Detanya: hagonav taleh min ha'edeh ve'sela min ha'kis - limkom she'ganav yachzir, divrei Rabbi Yishmael. Rabbi Akiva omer: English translation: Gemara, who is the authority? It is Rabbi Yishmael, as he said: We do not require the knowledge of the owners. As it was taught: If one steals a lamb from the flock or a rock from the pocket - he shall return it to the place from which he stole, the words of Rabbi Yishmael. Rabbi Akiva says:

hebrew_text: צָרִיךְ דַּעַת בְּעָלִים.
human_translation: requires the knowledge of the owner
llm_translation: Requires knowledge of owners.

hebrew_text: אִי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל, מַאי אִירְיָא לֹא יִחֲדוּ? אֲפִילּוּ יִחֲדוּ נָמֵי!
human_translation: If Rabbi Yishmael, why specifically did not designate Even designated
llm_translation: If Rabbi Yishmael, what is the meaning of "they did not unite"? Even if they did unite, it is still valid!

hebrew_text: לָא מִיבַּעְיָא קָאָמַר: לָא מִיבַּעְיָא יִחֲדוּ דִּמְקוֹמָהּ הוּא, אֶלָּא אֲפִילּוּ לֹא יִחֲדוּ דְּלָאו מְקוֹמָהּ הוּא – לָא בָּעֵינַן דַּעַת בְּעָלִים.
human_translation: is speaking It is not necessary. It is not necessary designated that is its place. But even did not designate that is not its place, we do not require the knowledge of the owners.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text translates as follows: "Not because he is seeking to say: Not because he is seeking to say that they must be together, for even if they are not together, as it is not its place - we do not require the consent of the owners."

hebrew_text: אֵימָא סֵיפָא: יִחֲדוּ לָהּ הַבְּעָלִים מָקוֹם וְטִלְטְלָהּ וְנִשְׁבְּרָה, בֵּין מִתּוֹךְ יָדוֹ, בֵּין מִשֶּׁהִנִּיחָהּ, לְצׇרְכּוֹ – חַיָּיב, לְצׇרְכָּהּ – פָּטוּר. אֲתָאן לְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, דְּאָמַר: בָּעֵינַן דַּעַת בְּעָלִים.
human_translation: Say the latter clause the owners designated place for and moved it and it broke, whether while in his hand or whether after he replaced for his purposes liable for its purposes, exempt. We arrive at Rabbi Akiva, who says: We require the knowledge of the owners.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Eima seifa: Yichadu lah habaalim makom vetiltelah venishberah, bein mitoch yado, bein mishehenichah, letzorko - chayav, letzorkaha - patur. Atan leRabbi Akiva, deamar: Baeinan daat bebaalim." English translation: "The reason is the latter clause: If the owners joined together in moving it and it broke, whether from within his hand or after he placed it down, if it was for his need - he is liable, if it was for her need - he is exempt. They came to Rabbi Akiva, who said: We require the intent of the owners."

hebrew_text: אִי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא – מַאי אִירְיָא יִחֲדוּ? אֲפִילּוּ לֹא יִחֲדוּ נָמֵי!
human_translation: If Rabbi Akiva, why specifically designated Even did not designate
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva said: What is the meaning of "they shall be united"? Even if they are not united in actuality!

hebrew_text: לָא מִיבַּעְיָא קָאָמַר: לָא מִיבַּעְיָא לֹא יִחֲדוּ דְּלָאו מְקוֹמָהּ הוּא, אֶלָּא אֲפִילּוּ יִחֲדוּ נָמֵי, דִּמְקוֹמָהּ הוּא – בָּעֵינַן דַּעַת בְּעָלִים.
human_translation: is speaking It is not necessary. It is not necessary did not designate as is not its place. But even designated where is its place, we require the knowledge of the owners
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: "La mivaya ka'amar: la mivaya lo yichadu d'lo makomah hu, ela afilu yichadu namei, dimkomah hu - bainan da'at be'alim." English translation: "He does not require it" - he said: He does not require it to be united, for it is not its place, but even if they are united, since it is its place - we require the intention of the owners."

hebrew_text: רֵישָׁא רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל וְסֵיפָא רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא? אִין, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מַאן דִּמְתַרְגֵּם לִי חָבִית אַלִּיבָּא דְּחַד תַּנָּא, מוֹבֵלְנָא מָאנֵיהּ בָּתְרֵיהּ לְבֵי מַסּוּתָא.
human_translation: the first clause Rabbi Yishmael and the latter clause Rabbi Akiva. Indeed, as Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Anyone who explains to me a barrel according to one tanna carry his garments after him to the bathhouse,
llm_translation: Beginning: Rabbi Yishmael. And the end: Rabbi Akiva? No, as Rabbi Yochanan said: Whoever translates for me a barrel in the house of one Mishna, I will carry his load to the bathhouse.

hebrew_text: תַּרְגְּמַהּ רַבִּי יַעֲקֹב בַּר אַבָּא קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב: שֶׁנְּטָלָהּ עַל מְנָת לְגוֹזְלָהּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Ya’akov bar Abba interpreted before Rav: where took in order to rob it,
llm_translation: Translate: Rabbi Yaakov bar Abba interpreted before Rav: "She took it in order to steal it."

hebrew_text: תַּרְגְּמַהּ רַבִּי נָתָן בַּר אַבָּא קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב: שֶׁנְּטָלָהּ עַל מְנָת לִשְׁלוֹחַ בָּהּ יָד.
human_translation: Rabbi Natan bar Abba interpreted before Rav: where took in order to misappropriate it,
llm_translation: Rabbi Natan bar Abba translated it before Rav: "That she took it in order to send with it a hand."

hebrew_text: בְּמַאי קָמִיפַּלְגִי? בִּשְׁלִיחוּת יָד צְרִיכָה חֶסְרוֹן. מַאן דְּאָמַר לְגוֹזְלָהּ – קָסָבַר שְׁלִיחוּת יָד צְרִיכָה חֶסְרוֹן, וּמַאן דְּאָמַר לִשְׁלוֹחַ בָּהּ יָד – קָסָבַר שְׁלִיחוּת יָד אֵינָהּ צְרִיכָה חֶסְרוֹן.
human_translation: With regard to what do disagree? with regard to misappropriation requires loss: The one who says to rob it holds misappropriation requires loss. And the one who says took to misappropriate it holds misappropriation does not require loss.
llm_translation: With what do they argue? In the case of sending a hand, a deficiency is required. One who says "to her theft" - he holds that sending a hand requires a deficiency, and one who says "to send a hand to her" - he holds that sending a hand does not require a deficiency.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: מִידֵּי ״נְטָלָהּ״ קָתָנֵי? ״טִלְטְלָהּ״ קָתָנֵי! אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן – כְּגוֹן שֶׁטִּלְטְלָהּ לְהָבִיא עָלֶיהָ גּוֹזָלוֹת, וְקָא סָבַר: שׁוֹאֵל שֶׁלֹּא מִדַּעַת – גַּזְלָן הָוֵי. וְכוּלָּהּ רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל הִיא, וְסֵיפָא: שֶׁהִנִּיחָהּ בְּמָקוֹם שֶׁאֵינָהּ מְקוֹמָהּ.
human_translation: Rav Sheshet objects to Does teach took it? It is taught moved it, Rather, Rav Sheshet said: With what are we dealing here? where moved to upon it bring fledglings And holds: one who borrows without the knowledge is a robber And entire Rabbi Yishmael. And the latter clause where placed in a place that is not its place.
llm_translation: Rav Sheshet objects to her: From the term "נְטָלָהּ" it teaches? It teaches from "טִלְטְלָהּ"! Rather, Rav Sheshet said: What are we dealing with here? For example, if one carried it to bring stolen goods upon it, and he thought: He asks without knowledge - he is a thief. And all of this is Rabbi Yishmael's opinion, and the end: that he left it in a place that is not its place.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: ״הִנִּיחָהּ״ בִּמְקוֹמָהּ מַשְׁמַע.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan, He placed it, indicates in its place.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan: "Hinichah" in its place implies.

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר רַב וְלֵוִי. חַד אָמַר: שְׁלִיחוּת יָד צְרִיכָה חֶסְרוֹן, וְחַד אָמַר: שְׁלִיחוּת יָד אֵינָהּ צְרִיכָה חֶסְרוֹן. תִּסְתַּיֵּים דְּרַב הוּא דְּאָמַר שְׁלִיחוּת יָד אֵינָהּ צְרִיכָה חֶסְרוֹן, דְּתַנְיָא: רוֹעֶה שֶׁהָיָה רוֹעֶה עֶדְרוֹ, וְהִנִּיחַ עֶדְרוֹ וּבָא לָעִיר, וּבָא זְאֵב וְטָרַף וּבָא אֲרִי וְדָרַס – פָּטוּר. הִנִּיחַ מַקְלוֹ וְתַרְמִילוֹ עָלֶיהָ – חַיָּיב.
human_translation: It was stated Rav and Levi. One says: Misappropriation requires loss. And one says: Misappropriation does not require loss. It may be concluded that is Rav who says: Misappropriation does not require loss, as it is taught a shepherd who was herding his flock, and he abandoned his flock and went to the city, and a wolf came and devoured and a lion came and clawed exempt, he placed his staff and his satchel on liable
llm_translation: It was stated: Rav and Levi. One said: Agency of the hand requires deficiency, and one said: Agency of the hand does not require deficiency. The matter is concluded according to Rav who said: Agency of the hand does not require deficiency, as it was taught: A shepherd who was tending his flock, and he left his flock and entered the city, and a wolf came and tore the flock, or a lion came and trampled the flock – he is exempt. If he left his staff and bag upon it – he is liable.

hebrew_text: וְהָוֵינַן בָּהּ: מִשּׁוּם דְּהִנִּיחַ מַקְלוֹ וְתַרְמִילוֹ עָלֶיהָ חַיָּיב? הָא שַׁקְלִינְהוּ!
human_translation: And we discussed Due to that he placed his staff and his satchel liable Didn’t he remove them?
llm_translation: And we ask about it: since he placed his staff and pouch on it, is he liable? No, we have weighed them!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר אֲבוּהּ אָמַר רַב: בְּעוֹדָן עָלֶיהָ. וְכִי עוֹדָן עָלֶיהָ מַאי הָוֵי? הָא לָא מַשְׁכַהּ!
human_translation: Rav Naḥman says Rabba bar Avuh said Rav said: when were still on And if are still on what of it? But he did not pull
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said, Rabba bar Avuh said, Rav said: "While they are still upon it." And when they are still upon it, what is it? This is not drawn out!

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר רַב יִצְחָק אָמַר רַב: שֶׁהִכִּישָׁהּ בְּמַקֵּל וְרָצְתָה לְפָנָיו. וְהָא לָא חַסְּרַהּ! אֶלָּא לָאו שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ קָסָבַר שְׁלִיחוּת יָד אֵינָהּ צְרִיכָה חֶסְרוֹן?
human_translation: And Rav Shmuel bar Yitzḥak says Rav says: where struck with a staff and it ran before him, But he did not cause a loss Rather, not conclude from it holds: Misappropriation does not require loss?
llm_translation: And said Rav Shmuel bar Rav Yitzchak said Rav: that she struck him with a stick and wanted to be before him. But did she not lack him! Rather, does he not hear from it that he holds that the agency of the hand is not necessary lack?

hebrew_text: אֵימָא שֶׁהִכְחִישָׁהּ בְּמַקֵּל. דַּיְקָא נָמֵי, דְּקָתָנֵי ״שֶׁהִכִּישָׁהּ בְּמַקֵּל״. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: Say that he weakened with a staff, is also precise, as he teaches: Where struck with a staff. Learn from it
llm_translation: The mother who denied the child with a stick. Specifically stated, as it is taught: "who denied the child with a stick." Learn from it.

hebrew_text: וּמִדְּרַב סָבַר שְׁלִיחוּת יָד צְרִיכָה חֶסְרוֹן, לֵוִי סָבַר שְׁלִיחוּת יָד אֵינָהּ צְרִיכָה חֶסְרוֹן. מַאי טַעְמָא דְּלֵוִי? אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בֶּן נְהוֹרַאי: מְשׁוּנָּה שְׁלִיחוּת יָד הָאֲמוּרָה בְּשׁוֹמֵר שָׂכָר מִשְּׁלִיחוּת יָד הָאֲמוּרָה בְּשׁוֹמֵר חִנָּם.
human_translation: And from that Rav holds misappropriation requires loss, Levi holds misappropriation does not require loss. What is the reason of Levi? Rabbi Yoḥanan says in the name of Rabbi Yosei ben Nehorai: Misappropriation that is stated with regard to a paid bailee is different from misappropriation that is stated with regard to an unpaid bailee.
llm_translation: From Rav who holds that agency of the hand requires a deficiency, to Levi who holds that agency of the hand does not require a deficiency. What is the reason according to Levi? Rabbi Yochanan said in the name of Rabbi Yosei ben Nehorai: The distinction is between agency of the hand mentioned in the case of a paid guardian and agency of the hand mentioned in the case of an unpaid guardian.

hebrew_text: וַאֲנִי אוֹמֵר אֵינָהּ מְשׁוּנָּה.
human_translation: And I say is not different.
llm_translation: And I say, it is not different.

hebrew_text: וּמַאי מְשׁוּנָּה? לֹא תֵּאָמֵר שְׁלִיחוּת יָד בְּשׁוֹמֵר שָׂכָר, וְתֵיתֵי מִשּׁוֹמֵר חִנָּם: וּמָה שׁוֹמֵר חִנָּם שֶׁפָּטוּר בִּגְנֵבָה וַאֲבֵדָה שָׁלַח בָּהּ יָד – חַיָּיב, שׁוֹמֵר שָׂכָר שֶׁחַיָּיב בִּגְנֵבָה וַאֲבֵידָה לֹא כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן. לְמַאי הִלְכְתָא כַּתְבִינְהוּ רַחֲמָנָא? לוֹמַר לָךְ: שְׁלִיחוּת יָד אֵינָהּ צְרִיכָה חֶסְרוֹן.
human_translation: And what different misappropriation not be stated with regard to a paid bailee, and derive it from an unpaid bailee And if an unpaid bailee, who is exempt in theft and loss, misappropriated liable a paid bailee, who is liable in theft and loss, all the more so not With regard to what halakha did the Merciful One write to say to you: Misappropriation does not require loss;
llm_translation: And what is the difference? Do not say that a gratuitous guardian is different from a paid guardian, and the case of a gratuitous guardian is more stringent: For a gratuitous guardian who is exempt for theft and loss, if he handed it over to someone else - he is liable, a paid guardian who is liable for theft and loss, all the more so. What is the halacha according to the understanding of the Merciful One? To tell you: A gratuitous guardian does not require a deficiency.

hebrew_text: וַאֲנִי אוֹמֵר: אֵינָהּ מְשׁוּנָּה כְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר, דְּאָמַר: דָּא וְדָא אַחַת הִיא. מַאי דָּא וְדָא אַחַת? מִשּׁוּם דְּאִיכָּא לְמִפְרַךְ: מָה לְשׁוֹמֵר חִנָּם, שֶׁכֵּן מְשַׁלֵּם תַּשְׁלוּמֵי כֶפֶל בְּטוֹעֵן טַעֲנַת גַּנָּב.
human_translation: And I say not different, in accordance with Rabbi Elazar, who says: This and that are one. What This and that one? due to that can be refuted What about an unpaid bailee? in that he pays double payment when he states the claim a thief
llm_translation: And I say: It is not different from Rabbi Elazar, for he said: This and that are one. What is "this and that are one"? Because there is room to refute: Just as one who guards for free, so too he pays double restitution when claiming that the thief is a robber.

hebrew_text: וּמַאן דְּלָא פָּרֵיךְ סָבַר: קַרְנָא בְּלָא שְׁבוּעָה עֲדִיפָא מִכְּפֵילָא בִּשְׁבוּעָה.
human_translation: And the one who does not refute holds: the principal without oath is more than the double payment with oath.
llm_translation: And one who does not fulfill the vow of a Nazirite, he holds: a horn without an oath is preferable to a double oath.

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר: לֹא תֵּאָמֵר שְׁלִיחוּת יָד לֹא בְּשׁוֹמֵר חִנָּם וְלֹא בְּשׁוֹמֵר שָׂכָר, וְתֵיתֵי מִשּׁוֹאֵל. וּמַה שׁוֹאֵל דִּלְדַעַת בְּעָלִים קָא עָבֵיד שָׁלַח בָּהּ יָד – חַיָּיב, שׁוֹמֵר חִנָּם וְשׁוֹמֵר שָׂכָר לֹא כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן.
human_translation: Rava says: not state misappropriation, neither with regard to an unpaid bailee nor with regard to a paid bailee, and derive it from a borrower: And if a borrower, who with the knowledge of the owner, misappropriated liable an unpaid bailee and a paid bailee, all the more so not
llm_translation: Rava said: Do not say that there is no liability for a gratuitous bailee or for a paid bailee, but rather it should be derived from a borrower. And just as a borrower acts with the knowledge of the owners, if he sends his hand with it - he is liable, all the more so a gratuitous bailee and a paid bailee.

hebrew_text: לָמָּה נֶאֱמַר? חֲדָא לוֹמַר לָךְ: שְׁלִיחוּת יָד אֵין צְרִיכָה חֶסְרוֹן. וְאִידָּךְ: שֶׁלֹּא תֹּאמַר, דַּיּוֹ לַבָּא מִן הַדִּין לִהְיוֹת כְּנִידּוֹן. מָה שׁוֹאֵל בִּבְעָלִים פָּטוּר – אַף שׁוֹמֵר חִנָּם וְשׁוֹמֵר שָׂכָר בִּבְעָלִים פָּטוּר.
human_translation: Why, is stated One to say to you: Misappropriation does not require loss. And the other so that you will not say: sufficient for the conclusion inferred from inference to be like the source Just as a borrower with the owner exempt, so too, an unpaid bailee and a paid bailee with the owner exempt.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Why is it stated? One to say to you: agency of hand not needed deficiency. And the other: lest you say, enough for the bailee from the law to be like a judge. Just as one who borrows from owners is exempt - so too, one who guards for free and one who guards for pay from owners is exempt.

hebrew_text: וּלְמַאן דְּאָמַר שְׁלִיחוּת יָד צְרִיכָה חֶסְרוֹן, הָנֵי תַּרְתֵּי שְׁלִיחוּת יָד לְמָה לִי? חֲדָא שֶׁלֹּא תֹּאמַר דַּיּוֹ לַבָּא מִן הַדִּין לִהְיוֹת כַּנִּדּוֹן.
human_translation: And according to the one who says: Misappropriation requires a loss, why do I these two misappropriation? One so that you will not say It is sufficient for the emerges from inference to be like source.
llm_translation: "And according to the one who says that agency of the hand requires deficiency, why do I need these two agencies of the hand? One, so that you should not say 'enough for the ba to be like the nidon.'"

hebrew_text: וְאִידָּךְ לְכִדְתַנְיָא: ״וְנִקְרַב בַּעַל הַבַּיִת אֶל הָאֱלֹהִים״ לִשְׁבוּעָה. אַתָּה אוֹמֵר לִשְׁבוּעָה, אוֹ אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא לְדִין? נֶאֶמְרָה שְׁלִיחוּת יָד לְמַטָּה, וְנֶאֶמְרָה שְׁלִיחוּת יָד לְמַעְלָה, מָה לְהַלָּן לִשְׁבוּעָה – אַף כָּאן לִשְׁבוּעָה.
human_translation: And the other for that which is taught “And the master of the house shall approach the judges to an oath. you say to an oath, or only to judgment? Misappropriation is stated below, and misappropriation is stated above, Just as below to an oath: so too here, to an oath
llm_translation: The other one according to the one who teaches: "And the master of the house shall approach God" for an oath. Do you say for an oath, or is it only for judgment? It was said hand delivery below, and it was said hand delivery above, just as there for an oath - so too here for an oath.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַמַּפְקִיד מָעוֹת אֵצֶל חֲבֵרוֹ, צְרָרָן וְהִפְשִׁילָן לַאֲחוֹרָיו, אוֹ שֶׁמְּסָרָם לִבְנוֹ וּלְבִתּוֹ הַקְּטַנִּים, וְנָעַל בִּפְנֵיהֶם שֶׁלֹּא כָּרָאוּי – חַיָּיב, שֶׁלֹּא שִׁימֵּר כְּדֶרֶךְ הַשּׁוֹמְרִים. וְאִם שִׁימֵּר כְּדֶרֶךְ הַשּׁוֹמְרִים – פָּטוּר.
human_translation: one who deposited coins with another, bound it and slung it behind him, conveyed them to his minor son or daughter or locked before them in an inappropriate, liable as he did not safeguard in the manner of bailees. But if he safeguarded in the manner bailees exempt.
llm_translation: It was taught: One who entrusts coins to his friend, and he tied them and placed them behind him, or if he handed them over to his small son or daughter, and he wore shoes in front of them that are not appropriate - he is liable, for he did not guard them as is the way of guardians. But if he guarded them as is the way of guardians - he is exempt.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ בִּשְׁלָמָא כּוּלְּהוּ שֶׁלֹּא שִׁימֵּר כְּדֶרֶךְ הַשּׁוֹמְרִים. אֶלָּא צְרָרָן וְהִפְשִׁילָן לַאֲחוֹרָיו, מַאי הֲוָה לֵיהּ לְמִיעְבַּד? אָמַר רָבָא אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק אָמַר קְרָא: ״וְצַרְתָּ הַכֶּסֶף בְּיָדְךָ״, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁצְּרוּרִין – יִהְיוּ בְּיָדְךָ.
human_translation: Granted, all as he did not safeguard in the manner bailees But bound it and slung it behind him, what was he to do? Rava says Rabbi Yitzḥak said: The verse states: “And you shall bind up the money in your hand” Although it is bound, it be in your hand.
llm_translation: Gemara: In truth, all of them did not observe the law like the way of the guardians. Rather, he would tie them and hang them behind him, what would it help him to do? Rava said, Rabbi Yitzchak said a verse: "And you shall have the money in your hand," even though they are tied - they shall be in your hand.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: לְעוֹלָם יְהֵא כַּסְפּוֹ שֶׁל אָדָם מָצוּי בְּיָדוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְצַרְתָּ הַכֶּסֶף בְּיָדְךָ״. וְאָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: לְעוֹלָם יַשְׁלִישׁ אָדָם אֶת מְעוֹתָיו, שְׁלִישׁ בְּקַרְקַע, וּשְׁלִישׁ בִּפְרַקְמַטְיָא, וּשְׁלִישׁ תַּחַת יָדוֹ.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yitzḥak says: A person’s money should always be found in his possession. as it is stated: “And you shall bind up the money in your hand.” And Rabbi Yitzḥak says: A person should always divide his money into three; one-third in the ground, and one-third in business [ bifrakmatya ], and one-third in his possession.
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yitzchak said: Always let a person's money be found in his hand, as it is stated: "And the silver shall be in your hand." And Rabbi Yitzchak said: Always let a person divide his money into three parts, one third in land, one third in merchandise, and one third at hand.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: אֵין הַבְּרָכָה מְצוּיָה אֶלָּא בְּדָבָר הַסָּמוּי מִן הָעַיִן, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״יְצַו ה׳ אִתְּךָ אֶת הַבְּרָכָה בַּאֲסָמֶיךָ״. תָּנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: אֵין הַבְּרָכָה מְצוּיָה אֶלָּא בְּדָבָר שֶׁאֵין הָעַיִן שׁוֹלֶטֶת בּוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״יְצַו ה׳ אִתְּךָ אֶת הַבְּרָכָה בַּאֲסָמֶיךָ״.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yitzḥak says: Blessing is found only in a matter concealed from the eye, as it is stated: “The Lord will command blessing with you in your storehouses” The school of Rabbi Yishmael taught: Blessing is found only in a matter which the eye has no dominion, as it is stated: “The Lord will command blessing with you in your storehouses.”
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yitzchak said: The blessing is only found in something hidden from the eye, as it says: "The Lord will command the blessing upon you in your barns." A Tanna of the school of Rabbi Yishmael taught: The blessing is only found in something that the eye does not control, as it says: "The Lord will command the blessing upon you in your barns."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הַהוֹלֵךְ לָמוֹד אֶת גּוֹרְנוֹ, אוֹמֵר: ״יְהִי רָצוֹן מִלְּפָנֶיךָ ה׳ אֱלֹהֵינוּ שֶׁתִּשְׁלַח בְּרָכָה בְּמַעֲשֵׂה יָדֵינוּ״. הִתְחִיל לָמוֹד, אוֹמֵר: ״בָּרוּךְ הַשּׁוֹלֵחַ בְּרָכָה בַּכְּרִי הַזֶּה״. מָדַד וְאַחַר כָּךְ בֵּירַךְ – הֲרֵי זֶה תְּפִילַּת שָׁוְא, לְפִי שֶׁאֵין הַבְּרָכָה מְצוּיָה לֹא בְּדָבָר הַשָּׁקוּל וְלֹא בְּדָבָר הַמָּדוּד וְלֹא בְּדָבָר הַמָּנוּי, אֶלָּא בְּדָבָר הַסָּמוּי מִן הָעַיִן, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״יְצַו ה׳ אִתְּךָ אֶת הַבְּרָכָה בַּאֲסָמֶיךָ״.
human_translation: The Sages taught: One who goes to measure his threshing floor recites: May it be Your will, O Lord, our God, that You send blessing upon the product of our hands. one began to measure he says: Blessed is He Who sends blessing upon this pile one measured and afterward recited this is a prayer in vain, because blessing is found neither in a matter that is weighed, nor in a matter that is measured, nor in a matter that is counted. Rather, in a matter concealed from the eye, as it is stated: “The Lord will command blessing with you in your storehouses.”
llm_translation: The sages taught: One who goes to grind his grain, he says: "May it be Your will, Lord our God, that You send blessing into the work of our hands." If he began to grind, he says: "Blessed is the One who sends blessing into this mill." If he measured and then blessed, this is a prayer in vain, because the blessing is not found neither in the weighed item nor in the measured item nor in the counted item, but in the item hidden from the eye, as it is said: "The Lord will command the blessing for you in your barns."

hebrew_text: אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: כְּסָפִים אֵין לָהֶם שְׁמִירָה אֶלָּא בַּקַּרְקַע. אָמַר רָבָא: וּמוֹדֵי שְׁמוּאֵל בְּעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת בֵּין הַשְּׁמָשׁוֹת, דְּלָא אַטְרְחוּהּ רַבָּנַן. וְאִי שְׁהָא לְמוֹצָאֵי שַׁבָּת שִׁעוּר לְמִקְבְּרִינְהוּ וְלָא קַבְרִינְהוּ – מְחַיַּיב. וְאִי צוּרְבָּא מֵרַבָּנַן הוּא סָבַר: דִּלְמָא מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ זוּזֵי לְאַבְדַּלְתָּא.
human_translation: Shmuel says: safeguarding money only in the ground. Rava said: And Shmuel concedes on Shabbat eve at twilight, that the Rabbis did not impose upon him And if, at the conclusion of Shabbat, he delayed and did not bury period to bury it, he is liable And if is a Torah scholar thought: Perhaps he requires money for havdala ,
llm_translation: Shmuel said: Silver has no protection except in the ground. Rava said: And the followers of Shmuel on Friday evening between the suns, for the Rabbis did not pay attention to it. And if it is close to the end of Shabbat, the measure is to bury it and not to bury it - he is liable. And if it is a dispute from the Rabbis, he holds: perhaps he needs to remove the coins to the door.

hebrew_text: וְהָאִידָּנָא דִּשְׁכִיחִי גָּשׁוֹשָׁאֵי – אֵין לָהֶן שְׁמִירָה אֶלָּא בִּשְׁמֵי קוֹרָה. וְהָאִידָּנָא דִּשְׁכִיחִי פָּרוֹמָאֵי – אֵין לָהֶם שְׁמִירָה אֶלָּא בֵּינֵי אוּרְבֵי. אָמַר רָבָא: וּמוֹדֶה שְׁמוּאֵל בְּכוֹתֶל, אִי נָמֵי בֵּין הַקְּרָנוֹת. וְהָאִידָּנָא דִּשְׁכִיחִי טָפוֹחָאֵי – אֵין לָהֶן שְׁמִירָה אֶלָּא בְּטֶפַח הַסָּמוּךְ לַקַּרְקַע, אוֹ בְּטֶפַח הַסָּמוּךְ לִשְׁמֵי קוֹרָה.
human_translation: And now that rummagers, are commonplace, safeguarding only in the beams of the roof And now that dismantlers, are commonplace, safeguarding only between the bricks Rava said: And Shmuel concedes in the wall or, alternatively, between the corners And now that tappers, are commonplace, safeguarding only in the handbreadth adjacent to the ground or in the handbreadth adjacent to the ceiling,
llm_translation: The Gemara: And the case of those who are found in the vineyards - they have no protection except in the name of a beam. And the case of those who are found in the fields - they have no protection except between the rows. Rava said: And Shmuel agrees regarding a wall, whether it is between the horns.
