And the case of those who are found in the pits - they have no protection except in a handbreadth close to the ground, or in a handbreadth close to a beam.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אַחָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יוֹסֵף לְרַב אָשֵׁי: הָתָם תְּנַן: חָמֵץ שֶׁנָּפְלָה עָלָיו מַפּוֹלֶת – הֲרֵי הוּא כִּמְבוֹעָר. רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: כֹּל שֶׁאֵין הַכֶּלֶב יָכוֹל לְחַפֵּשׂ אַחֲרָיו. וְתָנָא: כַּמָּה חֲפִישַׂת הַכֶּלֶב – שְׁלֹשָׁה טְפָחִים. הָכָא מַאי? מִי בָּעֵינַן שְׁלֹשָׁה טְפָחִים אוֹ לָא?
human_translation: Rav Aḥa, son of Rav Yosef, said to Rav Ashi: We learned there leavened bread upon which a rockslide fell is like eliminated, Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: any that a dog is unable to detect it. And taught: How much is the detection of a dog? three handbreadths. Here, what Do we require three handbreadths or not?
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Acha, son of Rav Yosef, said to Rav Ashi: There we learned: If leaven falls on it (a dough) from a roof, it is considered as if it were burned. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: Anything that a dog cannot search for (and find), (the leaven is nullified). And it was taught: How much does a dog search? Three handbreadths. What do we require here? Three handbreadths or not?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָתָם מִשּׁוּם רֵיחָא – בָּעֵינַן שְׁלֹשָׁה טְפָחִים. הָכָא מִשּׁוּם אִיכַּסּוֹיֵי מֵעֵינָא – לָא בָּעֵינַן שְׁלֹשָׁה טְפָחִים. וְכַמָּה? אָמַר רַפְרָם מִסִּיכְרָא: טֶפַח.
human_translation: said to There, due to the scent we require three handbreadths Here, because obscured from the eye we do not need three handbreadths. And how Rafram from Sikhera said: handbreadth.
llm_translation: He said to him: There, because of the smell - we require three handbreadths. Here, because of concealment - we do not require three handbreadths. And how much? Raphram from Sikra said: a handbreadth.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא גַּבְרָא דְּאַפְקֵיד זוּזֵי גַּבֵּי חַבְרֵיהּ, אוֹתְבִינְהוּ בִּצְרִיפָא דְאוּרְבָּנֵי, אִיגְּנוּב. אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: אַף עַל גַּב דִּלְעִנְיַן גַּנָּבֵי – נְטִירוּתָא הִיא, לְעִנְיַן נוּרָא – פְּשִׁיעוּתָא הִיא, הָוֵה תְּחִילָּתוֹ בִּפְשִׁיעָה וְסוֹפוֹ בְּאוֹנֶס – חַיָּיב. וְאִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: אַף עַל גַּב דִּלְעִנְיַן נוּרָא – פְּשִׁיעוּתָא הִיא, לְעִנְיַן גַּנָּבֵי – נְטִירוּתָא הִיא, וּתְחִלָּתוֹ בִּפְשִׁיעָה וְסוֹפוֹ בְּאוֹנֶס – פָּטוּר. וְהִילְכְתָא: תְּחִילָּתוֹ בִּפְשִׁיעָה וְסוֹפוֹ בְּאוֹנֶס – חַיָּיב.
human_translation: a certain man who deposited money with another, placed it in a willow hut was stolen. Rav Yosef said: Although with regard to thieves, is safeguarding, with regard to fire it is negligence, initially through negligence and ultimately by accident, liable And some say: Although with regard to fire it is negligence, with regard to thieves it is safeguarding. beginning of negligence and ultimately by accident, exempt. And the halakha initially through negligence and ultimately by accident, liable
llm_translation: That man who entrusted coins with his friends, they were stolen in the thieves' bundle, he is negligent. Rav Yosef said: Even though regarding thieves - it is negligence, regarding fire - it is recklessness. If its beginning was with recklessness and its end with coercion - he is liable. And there are those who say: Even though regarding fire - it is recklessness, regarding thieves - it is negligence, and if its beginning was with recklessness and its end with coercion - he is exempt. And the conclusion is: If its beginning was with recklessness and its end with coercion - he is liable.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא גַּבְרָא דְּאַפְקֵיד זוּזֵי גַּבֵּי חַבְרֵיהּ, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הַב לִי זוּזַאי! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָא יָדַעְנָא הֵיכָא אוֹתְבִינְהוּ. אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרָבָא, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: כֹּל ״לָא יָדַעְנָא״ פְּשִׁיעוּתָא הִיא, זִיל שַׁלֵּם.
human_translation: a certain man who deposited money with another. said to Give me my money. said to him: I do not know where I placed it. came before Rava, said to Every I do not know, is negligence; go pay.
llm_translation: That man who entrusted money to his friends, said to him: "Give me my money!" He said to him: "I do not know where they are." He came before Rava, who said to him: "Every 'I do not know' is a form of negligence, go and pay."

hebrew_text: הָהוּא גַּבְרָא דְּאַפְקֵיד זוּזֵי גַּבֵּי חַבְרֵיהּ, אַשְׁלְמִינְהוּ לְאִימֵּיהּ, וְאוֹתְבִינְהוּ בְּקַרְטְלִיתָא, וְאִיגְּנוּב. אָמַר רָבָא: הֵיכִי נְדַיְינוּ דַּיָּינֵי לְהַאי דִּינָא?
human_translation: a certain man who deposited money with another. gave to his mother, and placed in a chest [ bekartalita ], and it was stolen. Rava said: How should judges rule in this case?
llm_translation: That man who entrusted money to his friends, they paid it to his mother, and they wrote it in a document, and it was stolen. Rava said: How can we establish judges for this case?

hebrew_text: נֵימָא לֵיהּ לְדִידֵיהּ: זִיל שַׁלֵּים, אָמַר:
human_translation: Let us say to Go pay. say:
llm_translation: He said to him: Go and pay.

hebrew_text: כׇּל הַמַּפְקִיד, עַל דַּעַת אִשְׁתּוֹ וּבָנָיו הוּא מַפְקִיד.
human_translation: anyone who deposits with the awareness wife and his children he deposits
llm_translation: Every who appoints, on the knowledge of his wife and sons he appoints.

hebrew_text: נֵימָא לַהּ לְאִימֵּיהּ: זִילִי שַׁלִּימִי, אָמְרָה: לָא אֲמַר לִי דְּלָאו דִּידֵיהּ נִינְהוּ דְּאֶקְבְּרִינְהוּ.
human_translation: Let us say to his mother: Go pay. say: did not tell me that is not his that I should bury it,
llm_translation: "Say to her mother: 'Go, make peace.' She said: 'He did not tell me that they are not his own that I should bury them.'"

hebrew_text: נֵימָא לֵיהּ: אַמַּאי לָא אֲמַרְתְּ לַהּ? אָמַר: כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן, דְּכִי אָמֵינָא לַהּ דְּדִידִי נִינְהוּ – טְפֵי מִזְדַּהֲרָא בְּהוּ.
human_translation: Let us say to Why did you not say to her He say: All the more so as when I say to her that is mine, she is more careful with it.
llm_translation: He said to him: Why did you not say to him? He said: Certainly, for when I say to him that they are ours - they are more precious to him.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: מִשְׁתְּבַע אִיהוּ דְּהָנְהוּ זוּזֵי אַשְׁלְמִינְהוּ לְאִימֵּיהּ, וּמִשְׁתַּבְעָא אִימֵּיהּ דְּהָנְהוּ זוּזֵי אוֹתְבִינְהוּ בְּקַרְטְלִיתָא וְאִיגְּנוּב – וּפָטוּר.
human_translation: Rather, Rava said: takes an oath that he gave to his mother, and his mother takes an oath that she placed the money in the chest and it was stolen, and exempt
llm_translation: Rather, Rava said: If he swore that he had repaid the money to his mother, and his mother swore that she had received the money from him in a wallet and a purse - he is exempt.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא אַפּוֹטְרוֹפָּא דְיַתְמֵי דִּזְבַן לְהוּ תּוֹרָא לְיַתְמֵי וּמַסְרֵיהּ לְבַקָּרָא. לָא הֲווֹ לֵיהּ כַּכֵּי וְשִׁינֵּי לְמֵיכַל, וּמִית. אָמַר רָמֵי בַּר חָמָא: הֵיכִי נְדַיְינוּ דַּיָּינֵי לְהַאי דִּינָא?
human_translation: a certain steward of orphans, who purchased an ox for the orphans and passed it to the cowherd. did not have molars and teeth with which to eat, and died Rami bar Ḥama said: How should judges rule in this case?
llm_translation: That certain physician who bought a bull for orphans and delivered it to a butcher. Its horns were not yet fully developed, and it gored and killed. Ramei bar Hama said: How should the judges be judged for this case?

hebrew_text: נֵימָא לֵיהּ לְאַפּוֹטְרוֹפָּא: זִיל שַׁלֵּים, אָמַר: אֲנָא לְבַקָּרָא מְסַרְתֵּיהּ.
human_translation: Let them say to the steward: Go pay say: I gave it to the cowherd
llm_translation: He said to his attendant: "Go pay him." He said: "I will deliver it to the reader."

hebrew_text: נֵימָא לֵיהּ לְבַקָּרָא: זִיל שַׁלֵּים, אָמַר: אֲנָא בַּהֲדֵי תּוֹרֵי אוֹקֵימְתֵּיהּ, אוּכְלָא שְׁדַאי לֵיהּ, לָא הֲוָה יָדַעְינָא דְּלָא אֲכַל.
human_translation: Let us say to the cowherd: Go pay He say: I placed with oxen and I threw food before it. We did not know that it did not eat.
llm_translation: He said to him: Go pay him. He said: I, in the presence of the Torah, established it, the field was not known to him, that he did not eat.

hebrew_text: מִכְּדֵי בַּקָּרָא שׁוֹמֵר שָׂכָר דְּיַתְמֵי הוּא! אִיבְּעִי לֵיהּ לְעַיּוֹנֵי אִי אִיכָּא פְּסֵידָא דְיַתְמֵי. הָכִי נָמֵי, וְהָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן – דְּלֵיכָּא פְּסֵידָא דְיַתְמֵי, דְּאַשְׁכְּחוּהּ לְמָרֵיהּ דְּתוֹרָא וּשְׁקוּל יַתְמֵי זוּזֵי מִינֵּיהּ.
human_translation: After all, the cowherd is a paid bailee of the orphans. he was required to examine If there was loss for the orphans, indeed, And with what are we dealing here? where there is no loss by the orphans, as they found the owner of the ox, and the orphans took money from him
llm_translation: From the fact that it says in the verse, "He guards the reward of the righteous," he inquired of the sages: If there is a loss of the righteous. Thus it is stated, and here we are dealing with - that there is no loss of the righteous, for their Master finds it in the Torah and takes away the losses from them.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מַאן קָא טָעֵין? מָרֵיהּ דְּתוֹרָא קָטָעֵין. אִיבְּעִי לֵיהּ לְאוֹדוֹעַן! מַאי מוֹדְעִינַן לֵיהּ? מִידָּע יָדַע דְּמִקָּח טָעוּת הָוֵי. בְּסַפְסֵירָא דְּזָבֵן מֵהָכָא וּמְזַבֵּין לְהָכָא, הִלְכָּךְ מִישְׁתְּבַע אִיהוּ דְּלָא הֲוָה יָדַע, וּמְשַׁלֵּם בַּקָּרָא דְּמֵי בָשָׂר בְּזוֹל.
human_translation: Rather, who claims The owner of the ox claims He should have informed us What we inform He knows that it is a mistaken transaction, with regard to a trader who buys from here and sells to there Therefore, takes an oath he did not know and the cowherd pays the value of the meat based on cheapest
llm_translation: Rather, who is mistaken? His Torah teacher is mistaken. If he asks to be informed! What do we inform him? He already knows that a mistaken purchase is considered a valid transaction. In a place where they buy from here and sell to here, therefore, he who did not know is liable, and he pays the price of meat at a low price.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא גַּבְרָא דְּאַפְקֵיד כְּשׁוּתָא גַּבֵּי חַבְרֵיהּ, הֲוָה לֵיהּ לְדִידֵיהּ נָמֵי כַּרְיָא דִכְשׁוּתָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ לְסַרְסְיֵהּ: מֵהַאי רְמֵי. אֲזַל רְמָא מֵאִידַּךְ. אָמַר רַב עַמְרָם: הֵיכִי נְדַיְינוּ דַּיָּינֵי לְהַאי דִּינָא?
human_translation: a certain man who deposited hops, with another. himself had a pile of hops. said to his brewer: Cast from this went and cast from other Rav Amram said: How should judges rule in this case?
llm_translation: That man who was appointed as a collector of taxes from his colleagues, had for himself a jug like the jug of the tax collector. He said to his servant: "Fill from this jug." The servant went and filled from another. Rav Amram said: How can we establish the judges for this case?

hebrew_text: נֵימָא לֵיהּ לְדִידֵיהּ: זִיל שַׁלֵּים, אָמַר: אֲנָא אָמְרִי לֵיהּ מֵהַאי רְמִי.
human_translation: Let us say to Go pay. say: I said to him, Cast from this
llm_translation: He said to him according to our view: Go and pay. He said: I say to him from this verse.

hebrew_text: נֵימָא לֵיהּ לְסַרְסְיֵהּ: זִיל שַׁלֵּים, אָמַר: לָא אֲמַר לִי מֵהַאי רְמִי וּמֵהַאי לָא תִּרְמֵי.
human_translation: Let us say to the brewer: Go pay. say: did not say to me: Cast from this and do not cast from that
llm_translation: Nayma leih l'Sarsei: Zil shalem, amar: La amar li mehai remi u'mehai la tirmei.

hebrew_text: וְאִי דִּשְׁהָא שִׁיעוּר לְאֵיתוֹיֵי לֵיהּ וְלָא אַיְיתִי לֵיהּ – גַּלִּי אַדַּעְתֵּיהּ דְּנִיחָא לֵיהּ! בִּדְלָא שְׁהָא.
human_translation: And if delayed period to bring and he did not bring them to him, revealed that he was amenable where he did not delay
llm_translation: "If the measurement is not sufficient for him, and he does not bring it - reveal his knowledge that it is satisfactory for him! If not, it is not satisfactory."

hebrew_text: סוֹף סוֹף, מַאי פְּסֵידָא אִיכָּא? וְהָא קָא מִשְׁתָּרְשִׁי לֵיהּ! אָמַר רַב סַמָּא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרָבָא: דַּהֲוָה שִׁיכְרָא חַלָּא. רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: בְּכִיסֵי,
human_translation: Ultimately, what loss is there? But doesn’t profit Rav Sama, son of Rava, said: where the beer becomes vinegar. Rav Ashi said: with thorns
llm_translation: At the end, what is the loss? Is there any loss? But it is becoming established for him! Rav Samma, son of Rava, said: It was a jar of vinegar. Rav Ashi said: in pockets.

hebrew_text: וּמְשַׁלֵּם לֵיהּ דְּמֵי כִּיסֵי.
human_translation: And he pays him the value of thorns
llm_translation: And he pays him the money of the purse.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַמַּפְקִיד מָעוֹת אֵצֶל שׁוּלְחָנִי, אִם צְרוּרִין – לֹא יִשְׁתַּמֵּשׁ בָּהֶן, לְפִיכָךְ אִם אָבְדוּ אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב בְּאַחְרָיוּתָן. מוּתָּרִין – יִשְׁתַּמֵּשׁ בָּהֶן, לְפִיכָךְ אִם אָבְדוּ חַיָּיב בְּאַחְרָיוּתָן. אֵצֶל בַּעַל הַבַּיִת, בֵּין צְרוּרִין וּבֵין מוּתָּרִין – לֹא יִשְׁתַּמֵּשׁ בָּהֶן, לְפִיכָךְ אִם אָבְדוּ אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב בְּאַחְרָיוּתָן. חֶנְוָנִי כְּבַעַל הַבַּיִת, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: חֶנְוָנִי כַּשּׁוּלְחָנִי.
human_translation: one who deposits money with a money changer, if is bound, may not use it. Therefore, if it is lost he does not bear responsibility for it. was unbound, may use it. Therefore, if it is lost he bears responsibility for it. with a homeowner, whether is bound or whether is unbound, may not use it, Therefore, if lost he does not bear responsibility for it. a storekeeper, is like a homeowner; the statement of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda says: a storekeeper, is like a money changer.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who entrusts coins with a money changer, if they are in bundles - he may not make use of them, therefore if they are lost he is not liable for them. If they are loose - he may make use of them, therefore if they are lost he is liable for them. With the homeowner, whether they are in bundles or loose - he may not make use of them, therefore if they are lost he is not liable for them. Chenvani is like the homeowner, the words of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda says: Chenvani is like the money changer.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מִשּׁוּם דִּצְרוּרִין לֹא יִשְׁתַּמֵּשׁ בָּהֶן? אָמַר רַב אַסִּי אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: בִּצְרוּרִין וַחֲתוּמִין שָׁנוּ. רַב מָרִי אָמַר: בְּקֶשֶׁר מְשׁוּנֶּה. אִיכָּא דְאָמְרִי, בָּעֵי רַב מָרִי: קֶשֶׁר מְשׁוּנֶּה מַאי? תֵּיקוּ.
human_translation: due to that is bound may not use it? Rav Asi said Rav Yehuda said: where bound and sealed, is taught. Rav Mari says: with an atypical knot, There are who say Rav Mari raises a dilemma: What with an atypical knot? shall stand
llm_translation: Gemara: Because of what are tzururin not to be used? Rav Assi said in the name of Rav Yehudah: They decreed regarding tzururin and chatumin. Rav Mari said: In a unique knot. Some say, Rav Mari asked: What is a unique knot? Teiku.

hebrew_text: מוּתָּרִין יִשְׁתַּמֵּשׁ בָּהֶן כּוּ׳. אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: וַאֲפִילּוּ נֶאֶנְסוּ. וְהָא ״אָבְדוּ״ קָתָנֵי! כִּדְרַבָּה דְּאָמַר רַבָּה: ״נִגְנְבוּ״ – בְּלִסְטֵיס מְזוּיָּין, ״אָבְדוּ״ – שֶׁטָּבְעָה סְפִינָתוֹ בַּיָּם.
human_translation: unbound may use it, Rav Huna says: And even if it was circumstances beyond his control But isn’t it taught It is lost, in accordance with which Rabba as Rabba says: They were stolen; by armed bandits. They were lost; his ship sunk at sea.
llm_translation: Permitted to use them as is. Rav Huna said: Even if they were forced. But it says "lost"! Like Rabah who said: "Stolen" - with well-known bandits, "lost" - when his ship sank in the sea.

hebrew_text: וְרַב נַחְמָן אָמַר: נֶאֶנְסוּ לָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא לְרַב נַחְמָן: לְדִידָךְ דְּאָמְרַתְּ נֶאֶנְסוּ לָא, אַלְמָא לָא הָוֵי שׁוֹאֵל עֲלַיְיהוּ, אִי שׁוֹאֵל לָא הָוֵי שׁוֹמֵר שָׂכָר נָמֵי לָא הָוֵי! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: בְּהָא מוֹדֵינָא לָךְ, דְּהוֹאִיל וְנֶהֱנָה מַהֲנֶה, בְּהָהוּא הֲנָאָה דְּאִי מִיתְרְמֵי לֵיהּ זְבִינָא דְּאִית בֵּהּ רַוְוחָא זָבֵן בְּהוּ, הָוֵי עֲלַיְיהוּ שׁוֹמֵר שָׂכָר.
human_translation: And Rav Naḥman says: it was circumstances beyond his control, not Rava said to Rav Naḥman: According to your that you said it was circumstances beyond his control, not apparently, is not a borrower with regard to If he is not a borrower, he is not a paid bailee either. said to him: In this I concede since he benefits with the benefit that if a profitable purchase happen to him purchase with he is a paid bailee with regard to
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said: They did not try to find a solution. Rava said to Rav Nachman: According to your opinion that they did not try to find a solution, it implies that one should not inquire about them. If one does not inquire, will he not receive reward? He said to him: I admit to you that since he benefits from the benefit, in that benefit, if he would have asked for the purchase price of the wine that is in it, he would have received reward.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ רַב נַחְמָן לְרַב הוּנָא: הַמַּפְקִיד מָעוֹת אֵצֶל שׁוּלְחָנִי, אִם צְרוּרִין – לֹא יִשְׁתַּמֵּשׁ בָּהֶן, לְפִיכָךְ אִם הוֹצִיא – לֹא מָעַל הַגִּזְבָּר. וְאִם מוּתָּרִין – יִשְׁתַּמֵּשׁ בָּהֶן, לְפִיכָךְ אִם הוֹצִיא – מָעַל הַגִּזְבָּר.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman raised an objection to Rav Huna who deposits money with a money changer, if is bound, may not use it. Therefore, if he spent treasurer not misuse was unbound, may use it. Therefore, if spent treasurer misuse
llm_translation: He raised an objection to him, Rav Nachman to Rav Huna: One who deposits coins by my table, if they are tied up - he should not make use of them, therefore if he takes them out - he does not transgress the prohibition of theft. And if they are untied - he may make use of them, therefore if he takes them out - he transgresses the prohibition of theft.

hebrew_text: וְאִי אָמְרַתְּ אֲפִילּוּ נֶאֶנְסוּ, מַאי אִירְיָא הוֹצִיא? אֲפִילּוּ לֹא הוֹצִיא נָמֵי!
human_translation: And if you say even if was circumstances beyond his control, why specifically spent Even if he did not spend
llm_translation: And if you say, even if they were forced, what is the liability of "hotzi"? Even if he did not take out, still!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הוּא הַדִּין אַף עַל גַּב דְּלֹא הוֹצִיא, וְאַיְּידֵי דִּתְנָא רֵישָׁא ״הוֹצִיא״, תְּנָא סֵיפָא נָמֵי ״הוֹצִיא״.
human_translation: said to him: The same is true even if he did not spend And since taught in the first clause he spent taught in the latter clause as well he spent
llm_translation: He said to him: It is the same even though he did not bring out, and since the first Tanna taught "he brought out," the latter Tanna also teaches "he brought out."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַשּׁוֹלֵחַ יָד בְּפִקָּדוֹן, בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: יִלְקֶה בְּחָסֵר וּבְיָתֵר. וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: כִּשְׁעַת הוֹצָאָה. רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: כִּשְׁעַת הַתְּבִיעָה.
human_translation: one who misappropriates a deposit, Beit Shammai say: He is penalized for decrease and increase. And Beit Hillel say: in accordance with the time of removal. Rabbi Akiva says: in accordance with the time of the claim.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who extends his hand in a deposit, Beit Shammai say: he is liable for any decrease or increase. Beit Hillel say: only at the time of withdrawal. Rabbi Akiva says: only at the time of claim.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רַבָּה: הַאי מַאן דִּגְזַל חָבִיתָא דְחַמְרָא מֵחַבְרֵיהּ, מֵעִיקָּרָא שָׁוְיָא זוּזָא, הַשְׁתָּא שָׁוְיָא אַרְבְּעָה. תַּבְרַהּ אוֹ שַׁתְיַיהּ – מְשַׁלֵּם אַרְבְּעָה, אִיתְּבַר מִמֵּילָא – מְשַׁלֵּם זוּזָא.
human_translation: Rabba says: this one who robbed another of a barrel of wine, initially it was worth dinar now it is worth four broke or drank he pays four it broke by itself, he pays dinar.
llm_translation: Gemara: Rabah said: One who steals a barrel of wine from his fellow, initially it is worth a zuz, now it is worth four. If it broke or was drunk – he pays four, if it spoiled on its own – he pays a zuz.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא? כֵּיוָן דְּאִי אִיתַהּ הָדְרָא לְמָרַהּ בְּעֵינָא, הָהִיא שַׁעְתָּא דְּקָא שָׁתֵי לַיהּ אוֹ דְּקָא תָּבַר לַהּ, קָא גָזֵל מִינֵּיהּ, וּתְנַן: כׇּל הַגַּזְלָנִין מְשַׁלְּמִין כִּשְׁעַת הַגְּזֵילָה. אִיתְּבַר מִמֵּילָא מְשַׁלֵּם זוּזָא. מַאי טַעְמָא? הַשְׁתָּא לָא עָבֵיד לַהּ וְלָא מִידֵּי, אַמַּאי קָא מְחַיְּיבַתְּ לֵיהּ? אַהָהִיא שַׁעְתָּא דְּגַזְלַהּ, הָהִיא שַׁעְתָּא זוּזָא הוּא דְּשָׁוְיָא.
human_translation: What is the reason Since if were it would return to its owner in its state that moment that he drank it or that he broke it he stole from And we learned All robbers pay in accordance with at the moment of the robbery. broke by itself, pays dinar. What is the reason He did not do anything to now. Why do you deem him liable of that moment he robbed it. that moment, it was worth only dinar.
llm_translation: What is the reason? Since if she had come back to her husband, the moment that he either drinks it or breaks it, he has stolen from her. And we learned: All those who steal pay at the time of the theft. He pays immediately. What is the reason? Now, she did not do it, and it is not in her hands, so why is she obligated? At that moment of her theft, that moment is the payment.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: בֵּית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים כִּשְׁעַת הוֹצָאָה. מַאי כִּשְׁעַת הוֹצָאָה? אִילֵימָא כִּשְׁעַת הוֹצָאָה מִן הָעוֹלָם.
human_translation: We learned Beit Hillel say: in accordance with the time of removal. What In accordance with the time of removal? If we say in accordance with the time of removal from the world,
llm_translation: We learned in a Mishnah: Beit Hillel say "like the time of going out." What is "like the time of going out"? If you say, "like the time of going out from the world."

hebrew_text: וּבְמַאי? אִי בְּחָסֵר, מִי אִיכָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר? וְהָא תְּנַן: כׇּל הַגַּזְלָנִין מְשַׁלְּמִין כִּשְׁעַת הַגְּזֵילָה! וְאִי בְּיָתֵר – הַיְינוּ בֵּית שַׁמַּאי!
human_translation: And with regard to what If with regard to a decrease is there anyone who says But didn’t we learn All robbers pay in accordance with the moment of the robbery, And if with regard to an increase that is Beit Shammai,
llm_translation: And with what? If with a deficiency, who has anything for the one who says? But we learned: All robbers pay at the time of the robbery! And if with excess – that is Beit Shammai!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא פְּשִׁיטָא כִּשְׁעַת הוֹצָאָה מִבֵּית בְּעָלִים. לֵימָא רַבָּה דְּאָמַר כְּבֵית שַׁמַּאי?! אָמַר לָךְ רַבָּה: בְּיָתֵר כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְלִיגִי, כִּי פְּלִיגִי בְּחָסֵר.
human_translation: Rather, obvious in accordance with the time of removal from the owner’s house, shall we say that Rabba stated in accordance with Beit Shammai Rabba said to you: With regard to increase everyone, agrees When they disagree, in decrease
llm_translation: Rather, it is obvious, like the moment of departure from the husband's house. Let us say, Rabba said, as Beit Shammai said?! Rabba said to you: In most matters of the world, they do not disagree, for they disagree in a case of deficiency.

hebrew_text: בֵּית שַׁמַּאי סָבְרִי: שְׁלִיחוּת יָד אֵינָהּ צְרִיכָה חֶסְרוֹן – וְכִי חָסַר בִּרְשׁוּתָא דִידֵיהּ חָסַר. וּבֵית הִלֵּל סָבְרִי: שְׁלִיחוּת יָד צְרִיכָה חֶסְרוֹן – וְכִי חָסַר בִּרְשׁוּתָא דְּמָרֵיהּ חָסַר.
human_translation: Rabba clarifies: Beit Shammai hold misappropriation does not require loss, And when decreases, it decreases in his possession. And Beit Hillel hold misappropriation requires loss, And when decreases, it decreases in the possession of its owner.
llm_translation: House of Shammai hold: agency of hand not needs deficiency - and when deficient in his domain deficient. And House of Hillel hold: agency of hand needs deficiency - and when deficient in his master's domain deficient.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא הָא דְּאָמַר רָבָא שְׁלִיחוּת יָד אֵינָהּ צְרִיכָה חֶסְרוֹן, לֵימָא רָבָא דְּאָמַר כְּבֵית שַׁמַּאי?! אֶלָּא, הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן? כְּגוֹן שֶׁטִּלְטְלָהּ לְהָבִיא עָלֶיהָ גּוֹזָלוֹת, וּבְשׁוֹאֵל שֶׁלֹּא מִדַּעַת קָא מִיפַּלְגִי;
human_translation: But this that Rava says: Misappropriation does not require loss, shall we say that Rava stated is in accordance with Beit Shammai? Rather, with what are we dealing here? where moved to upon it bring fledglings And they disagree with regard to one who borrows without the knowledge
llm_translation: Rather, this that Rava said: "Agency of the hand does not require deficiency," let us say: Rava said this like Beit Shammai?! Rather, what are we dealing with here? For example, when one moves it to bring stolen items upon it, and he borrows without knowledge, he is liable.

hebrew_text: בֵּית שַׁמַּאי סָבְרִי: שׁוֹאֵל שֶׁלֹּא מִדַּעַת – גַּזְלָן הָוֵי, וְכִי חָסַר – בִּרְשׁוּתָא דִּידֵיהּ חָסַר. וּבֵית הִלֵּל סָבְרִי: שׁוֹאֵל שֶׁלֹּא מִדַּעַת – שׁוֹאֵל הָוֵי, וְכִי חָסַר – בִּרְשׁוּתָא דְּמָרֵהּ חָסַר.
human_translation: Beit Shammai hold: one who borrows without the knowledge is a robber And when decreases, it decreases in his possession. And Beit Hillel hold: one who borrows without the knowledge is a borrower, And when decreases, it decreases in the possession of its owner.
llm_translation: House of Shammai hold: One who borrows without knowledge - is considered a thief, and if lacking - in his own domain he is lacking. And House of Hillel hold: One who borrows without knowledge - is considered a borrower, and if lacking - in the lender's domain he is lacking.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא הָא דְּאָמַר רָבָא: שׁוֹאֵל שֶׁלֹּא מִדַּעַת – לְרַבָּנַן גַּזְלָן הָוֵי, לֵימָא רָבָא דְּאָמַר כְּבֵית שַׁמַּאי?! אֶלָּא הָכָא בְּשֶׁבַח (שֶׁל) גְּזֵילָה קָמִיפַּלְגִי. בֵּית שַׁמַּאי סָבְרִי: שֶׁבַח גְּזֵילָה דְּנִגְזָל הָוֵי, וּבֵית הִלֵּל סָבְרִי: שֶׁבַח גְּזֵילָה דְּגַזְלָן הָוֵי.
human_translation: But this that Rava says: one who borrows without the knowledge according to the Rabbis, is a robber shall we say that Rava stated is in accordance with Beit Shammai? Rather, here, with regard to enhancement of stolen they disagree. Beit Shammai hold: of stolen who was robbed. And Beit Hillel hold: enhancement of stolen the robber.
llm_translation: Rather, this that Rava said: One who borrows without permission - he is considered a thief by the Rabbis. Let Rava say: According to Beit Shammai?! Rather, here in regards to the praise of theft they argue. Beit Shammai hold: The praise of theft of one who is stolen from, and Beit Hillel hold: The praise of theft of the thief.

hebrew_text: וּבִפְלוּגְתָּא דְּהָנֵי תַּנָּאֵי, דְּתַנְיָא: הַגּוֹזֵל אֶת הָרָחֵל, גְּזָזָהּ וְיָלְדָה מְשַׁלֵּם אוֹתָהּ וְאֶת גִּיזּוֹתֶיהָ וְאֶת וַלְדוֹתֶיהָ, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: גְּזֵילָה חוֹזֶרֶת בְּעֵינֶיהָ.
human_translation: And with regard to the dispute between these tanna’im as it is taught one who robs a ewe, he sheared it or gave birth, pays it and its fleece or its offspring; the statement of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda says: The stolen returns in its state.
llm_translation: In the dispute of those Tannaim, as it was taught: One who steals Rachel, slaughters her, and she gives birth, he pays her and her shearings and her offspring, the words of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda says: The theft returns in her eyes.

hebrew_text: דַּיְקָא נָמֵי, דְּקָתָנֵי: בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים יִלְקֶה בְּחָסֵר וּבְיָתֵר, וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: כִּשְׁעַת הוֹצָאָה. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: is also precise, as it is taught Beit Shammai say: He is penalized for decrease and increase. And Beit Hillel say: in accordance with the time of removal. Learn from
llm_translation: Precisely it was stated, as it was taught: Beit Shammai say he is flogged for both a deficiency and an excess, and Beit Hillel say: at the time of withdrawal. Learn from it.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר כִּשְׁעַת הַתְּבִיעָה. אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא. וּמוֹדֶה רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא בִּמְקוֹם שֶׁיֵּשׁ עֵדִים. מַאי טַעְמָא – דְּאָמַר קְרָא ״לַאֲשֶׁר הוּא לוֹ יִתְּנֶנּוּ בְּיוֹם אַשְׁמָתוֹ״, וְכֵיוָן דְּאִיכָּא עֵדִים, מֵהָהוּא שַׁעְתָּא – הוּא דְּאִיחַיַּיב לֵיהּ אַשְׁמָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: in accordance with the time of the claim. Rav Yehuda says Shmuel says: halakha in accordance with Rabbi Akiva. And Rabbi Akiva concedes where there are witnesses What is the reason as the verse states “To whom it appertains shall he give it on the day of his being guilty” And since there are witnesses from that moment he is liable to him guilt.
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: At the time of the claim. Rav Yehuda said in the name of Shmuel: The halakha is according to Rabbi Akiva. And Rabbi Akiva concedes in a case where there are witnesses. What is the reason? - Because the verse says, "To whom it belongs, he shall give it on the day of his guilt offering." And since there are witnesses, at that moment, he is obligated to pay the guilt offering.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אוֹשַׁעְיָא לְרַב יְהוּדָה: רַבִּי, אַתָּה אוֹמֵר כֵּן? הָכִי אָמַר רַבִּי אַסִּי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: חָלוּק הָיָה רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אֲפִילּוּ בִּמְקוֹם שֶׁיֵּשׁ עֵדִים, מַאי טַעְמָא? דְּאָמַר קְרָא ״לַאֲשֶׁר הוּא לוֹ יִתְּנֶנּוּ בְּיוֹם אַשְׁמָתוֹ״, וּבֵי דִינָא הוּא דְּקָא מְחַיְּיבִי לֵיהּ אַשְׁמָה.
human_translation: Rav Oshaya said to Rav Yehuda: My teacher, that you say? This Rabbi Asi says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Rabbi Akiva was in disagreement even where there are witnesses What is the reason as the verse states: “To whom it appertains shall he give it on the day of his being guilty,” and the court, that renders him liable to him guilt.
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Oshaya to Rav Yehuda: Rabbi, do you say so? Thus said Rabbi Assi said Rabbi Yochanan: Rabbi Akiva was lenient even in a place where there are witnesses, what is the reason? As the verse says, "to whom it belongs, he shall give it on the day of his guilt offering," and it is the court that obligates him to bring a guilt offering.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי זֵירָא לְרַבִּי אַבָּא בַּר פָּפָּא: כִּי אָזְלַתְּ לְהָתָם, אַקֵּיף אַסּוּלָּמָא דְצוֹר, וְעוּל לְגַבֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי יַעֲקֹב בַּר אִידִי, וּבְעִי מִינֵּיהּ אִי שְׁמִיעָא לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹ אֵין הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָכִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא לְעוֹלָם.
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira said to Rabbi Abba bar Pappa: When you go there, take a circuitous to the Ladder of Tyre, and enter before Rabbi Ya’akov bar Idi, and ask of him if he heard to Rabbi Yoḥanan halakha in accordance with Rabbi Akiva or halakha not in accordance with Rabbi Akiva. said to him: This Rabbi Yoḥanan says: halakha always in accordance with Rabbi Akiva.
llm_translation: He said to him, Rabbi Zeira said to Rabbi Abba bar Papa: When you go there, take a palm branch of Tyre and ascend it upon the shoulder of Rabbi Yaakov bar Idi, and ask him whether the halakha is like Rabbi Akiva or is the halakha not like Rabbi Akiva? He said to him: This is what Rabbi Yochanan said: The halakha is always like Rabbi Akiva.

hebrew_text: מַאי לְעוֹלָם? אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: שֶׁלֹּא תֹּאמַר הָנֵי מִילֵּי הֵיכָא דְּלֵיכָּא עֵדִים, אֲבָל הֵיכָא דְּאִיכָּא עֵדִים לָא.
human_translation: What is always? Rav Ashi said: that you will not say This statement, applies where there are no witnesses, but where there are witnesses, no,
llm_translation: What is the law exactly? Rav Ashei said: It means that you should not say these matters apply where there are no witnesses, but rather where there are witnesses, it does not apply.

hebrew_text: וְאִי נָמֵי דְּאַהְדְּרַהּ לְדוּכְתַּהּ וְאִיתְּבַרָא לְאַפּוֹקֵי מִדְּרַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל, דְּאָמַר: לָא בָּעֵינַן דַּעַת בְּעָלִים, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן דְּבָעֵינַן דַּעַת בְּעָלִים. וְרָבָא אָמַר: הֲלָכָה כְּבֵית הִלֵּל.
human_translation: Or alternatively, where he returns to its place and it broke. to exclude Rabbi Yishmael, who says we do not require the knowledge of the owners teaches us that we require the knowledge of the owners, And Rava says: halakha in accordance with Beit Hillel.
llm_translation: And if you say that she returned to her original state and was created to go out from Rabbi Yishmael, who said: "We do not require the knowledge of the owners," it implies to us that we do require the knowledge of the owners. And Rava said: The halakha is like Beit Hillel.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַחוֹשֵׁב לִשְׁלוֹחַ יָד בְּפִקָּדוֹן, בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: חַיָּיב, וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב עַד שֶׁיִּשְׁלַח בּוֹ יָד, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אִם לֹא שָׁלַח יָדוֹ בִּמְלֶאכֶת רֵעֵהוּ״. הִטָּה אֶת הֶחָבִית וְנָטַל הֵימֶנָּה רְבִיעִית וְנִשְׁבְּרָה – אֵינוֹ מְשַׁלֵּם אֶלָּא רְבִיעִית. הִגְבִּיהָהּ וְנָטַל הֵימֶנָּה רְבִיעִית וְנִשְׁבְּרָה – מְשַׁלֵּם דְּמֵי כוּלָּהּ.
human_translation: one who intends to misappropriate a deposit Beit Shammai say: liable and Beit Hillel say: liable only he misappropriates as it is stated “Whether he has misappropriated his neighbor’s goods” he tilted the barrel and took from it a quarter and broke, he pays only quarter . he lifted and took from it a quarter and broke, he pays the value of entire
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who intends to fulfill his obligation by sending money in a deposit, Beit Shammai say: he is liable, and Beit Hillel say: he is not liable until he sends his hand with it, as it is stated: "If he did not send his hand in his neighbor's work." If he tilted the barrel and took a quarter from it and it broke - he only pays a quarter. If he lifted it and took a quarter from it and it broke - he pays its full value.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ מְנָהָנֵי מִילֵּי? דְּתָנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״עַל כׇּל דְּבַר פֶּשַׁע״, בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: מְלַמֵּד שֶׁחַיָּיב עַל הַמַּחְשָׁבָה כְּמַעֲשֶׂה. וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב עַד שֶׁיִּשְׁלַח בּוֹ יָד, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אִם לֹא שָׁלַח יָדוֹ בִּמְלֶאכֶת רֵעֵהוּ״. אָמְרוּ לָהֶן בֵּית שַׁמַּאי לְבֵית הִלֵּל: וַהֲלֹא כְּבָר נֶאֱמַר ״עַל כׇּל דְּבַר פֶּשַׁע״! אָמְרוּ לָהֶן בֵּית הִלֵּל לְבֵית שַׁמַּאי: וַהֲלֹא כְּבָר נֶאֱמַר ״אִם לֹא שָׁלַח יָדוֹ בִּמְלֶאכֶת רֵעֵהוּ״!
human_translation: From where are these matters as the Sages taught: “For every matter of [ devar ] trespass” Beit Shammai say: teaches one is liable for a thought as an action. And Beit Hillel say: He is liable only he misappropriates as it is stated: “Whether he has misappropriated his neighbor’s goods” Beit Shammai said to Beit Hillel: But isn’t it already stated: “For every matter of trespass”? Beit Hillel said to Beit Shammai: But isn’t it already stated: “Whether he has misappropriated his neighbor’s goods”?
llm_translation: Gemara: What is the practical difference? For the Rabbis taught: "For every matter of transgression," Beit Shammai say: It teaches that one is liable for intent as for the deed. And Beit Hillel say: One is not liable until he actually performs the act, as it is stated: "If he did not send his hand in his neighbor's work." Beit Shammai said to Beit Hillel: Has it not already been stated, "For every matter of transgression"? Beit Hillel said to Beit Shammai: Has it not already been stated, "If he did not send his hand in his neighbor's work"!

hebrew_text: אִם כֵּן, מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״עַל כׇּל דְּבַר פֶּשַׁע״? שֶׁיָּכוֹל אֵין לִי אֶלָּא הוּא, אָמַר לְעַבְדּוֹ וְלִשְׁלוּחוֹ מִנַּיִן? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״עַל כׇּל דְּבַר פֶּשַׁע״.
human_translation: If so, what the verse states “for every matter of trespass”? might I have only he said to his slave or to his agent from where The verse states: “For every matter of trespass,”
llm_translation: If so, what does the Talmud mean by "for any sin"? That he can say, "I have only him," he said to his slave and messenger, from where? The Talmud says: "for any sin."

hebrew_text: הִטָּה אֶת הֶחָבִית כּוּ׳. אָמַר רַבָּה: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא נִשְׁבְּרָה, אֲבָל הֶחְמִיצָה – מְשַׁלֵּם אֶת כּוּלָּהּ. מַאי טַעְמָא? גִּירֵי דִידֵיהּ הוּא דְּאַהֲנוֹ לַהּ.
human_translation: he tilted the barrel, Rabba says: taught only broke. But fermented he pays for the entire What is the reason his arrows, were effective
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Tilted the barrel, so and so. Rabah said: They only taught that if it broke, but if it fermented - he pays for all of it. What is the reason? It is his own grain that benefited it.

hebrew_text: הִגְבִּיהָהּ וְנָטַל הֵימֶנָּה כּוּ׳. אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: לֹא נָטַל נָטַל מַמָּשׁ, אֶלָּא כֵּיוָן שֶׁהִגְבִּיהָהּ לִיטּוֹל, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁלֹּא נָטַל.
human_translation: one lifted and took from it Shmuel says: took not actually took Rather, once he lifted it to take it, although he did not take
llm_translation: He raised it and took from it. Samuel said: He did not actually take, but once he raised it to take, even though he did not take.

hebrew_text: לֵימָא קָא סָבַר שְׁמוּאֵל שְׁלִיחוּת יָד אֵינָהּ צְרִיכָה חֶסְרוֹן? אָמְרִי: לָא, שָׁאנֵי הָכָא דְּנִיחָא לֵיהּ דְּתִיהְוֵי הָא חָבִית כּוּלַּהּ בָּסִיס לְהָא רְבִיעִית.
human_translation: Shall we say Shmuel holds misappropriation does not require loss? say: No, It is different here, since it is preferable for that this barrel will a base for that quarter
llm_translation: Let us say, does Samuel hold that agency of hand is not necessary? They said: No, it is different here, for it is preferable for it to be a complete barrel in the fourth.

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי רַב אָשֵׁי: הִגְבִּיהַּ אַרְנָקִי לִיטּוֹל הֵימֶנָּה דִּינָר, מַהוּ? חַמְרָא הוּא דְּלָא מִינְּטַר אֶלָּא אַגַּב חַמְרָא, אֲבָל זוּזָא מִינְּטַר? אוֹ דִּלְמָא שָׁאנֵי נְטִירוּתָא דְּאַרְנָקִי מִנְּטִירוּתָא דְּדִינָר? תֵּיקוּ.
human_translation: Rav Ashi raises a dilemma one lifts a purse to take from it dinar, what is Is it wine, which is preserved only by means of the wine but a dinar, which is preserved Or, perhaps safeguarding a purse is different from safeguarding a dinar. shall stand
llm_translation: Inquiries of Rav Ashe: If one raised a purse to take a dinar from it, what is the ruling? It is wine that is not subject to interest, only due to wine, but is a coin subject to interest? Or perhaps the method of guarding the purse differs from the method of guarding a coin? This matter remains unresolved.

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ הַמַּפְקִיד
llm_translation: We will return to you, Hamafkid.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַזָּהָב קוֹנֶה אֶת הַכֶּסֶף, וְהַכֶּסֶף אֵינוֹ קוֹנֶה אֶת הַזָּהָב.
human_translation: the gold acquires the silver But the silver does not acquire the gold
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: "Gold acquires silver, but silver does not acquire gold."

hebrew_text: הַנְּחֹשֶׁת קוֹנָה אֶת הַכֶּסֶף, וְהַכֶּסֶף אֵינוֹ קוֹנֶה אֶת הַנְּחשֶׁת. מָעוֹת הָרָעוֹת קוֹנוֹת אֶת הַיָּפוֹת, וְהַיָּפוֹת אֵינָן קוֹנוֹת אֶת הָרָעוֹת.
human_translation: the copper acquires the silver But the silver does not acquire the copper the flawed coins, acquires the unflawed But the unflawed does not acquire the flawed
llm_translation: The copper acquires the silver, and the silver does not acquire the copper. The bad qualities acquire the good qualities, and the good qualities do not acquire the bad qualities.

hebrew_text: אֲסִימוֹן קוֹנֶה אֶת הַמַּטְבֵּעַ, וְהַמַּטְבֵּעַ אֵינוֹ קוֹנֶה אֶת אֲסִימוֹן. מִטַּלְטְלִין קוֹנִין אֶת הַמַּטְבֵּעַ, מַטְבֵּעַ אֵינוֹ קוֹנֶה אֶת הַמִּטַּלְטְלִין.
human_translation: an unminted coin [ asimon ], acquires coin. coin, does not acquire an unminted coin. movable property acquires the coin. coin, does not acquire the movable property.
llm_translation: The signet ring acquires the coin, but the coin does not acquire the signet ring. Movables acquire the coin, but the coin does not acquire the movables.

hebrew_text: זֶה הַכְּלָל: כׇּל הַמִּטַּלְטְלִים קוֹנִין זֶה אֶת זֶה. כֵּיצַד? מָשַׁךְ הֵימֶנּוּ פֵּירוֹת וְלֹא נָתַן לוֹ מָעוֹת – אֵינוֹ יָכוֹל לַחְזוֹר בּוֹ. נָתַן לוֹ מָעוֹת וְלֹא מָשַׁךְ הֵימֶנּוּ פֵּירוֹת – יָכוֹל לַחְזוֹר בּוֹ.
human_translation: This is the principle: all movable property, each acquires the other, How pulled produce from but did not give money, he cannot renege gave money but did not pull produce from him, he can renege
llm_translation: This is the principle: All those who exchange items acquire from one another. How so? If one drew produce from him and did not give him money - he cannot retract. If he gave him money and did not draw produce from him - he can retract.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל אָמְרוּ: מִי שֶׁפָּרַע מֵאַנְשֵׁי דּוֹר הַמַּבּוּל וּמִדּוֹר הַפְּלַגָּה – הוּא עָתִיד לְהִפָּרַע מִמִּי שֶׁאֵינוֹ עוֹמֵד בְּדִבּוּרוֹ.
human_translation: But said: He Who exacted payment from the people of the generation of the flood, and from the generation of the dispersion, will exact payment from whoever does not stand by his statement.
llm_translation: But they said: One who behaves wickedly like the people of the generation of the Flood and the generation of the Tower of Babel - he is destined to be punished by one who does not stand by his word.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: כֹּל שֶׁהַכֶּסֶף בְּיָדוֹ – יָדוֹ עַל הָעֶלְיוֹנָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: Anyone who has the money in his possession has the advantage.
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: "Anyone who has money in his hand - his hand is on top."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַתְנֵי לֵיהּ רַבִּי לְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בְּרֵיהּ: הַזָּהָב קוֹנֶה אֶת הַכֶּסֶף. אָמַר לוֹ: רַבִּי, שָׁנִיתָ לָנוּ בְּיַלְדוּתֶיךָ: הַכֶּסֶף קוֹנֶה אֶת הַזָּהָב, וְתַחֲזוֹר וְתִשְׁנֶה לָנוּ בְּזִקְנוּתֶיךָ: הַזָּהָב קוֹנֶה אֶת הַכֶּסֶף!
human_translation: Rabbi teach Rabbi Shimon, his son: the gold acquires the silver said to him: My teacher, you taught us in your youth, the silver acquires the gold and do you then teach us in your old age: the gold acquires the silver
llm_translation: The Gemara teaches it to Rabbi to Rabbi Shimon his son: "Gold acquires silver." He said to him: "Rabbi, you have changed for us in your youth: 'Silver acquires gold,' and you will return and change for us in your old age: 'Gold acquires silver!'"

hebrew_text: בְּיַלְדוּתֵיהּ מַאי סְבַר, וּבְזִקְנוּתֵיהּ מַאי סָבַר? בְּיַלְדוּתֵיהּ סְבַר: דַּהֲבָא דַּחֲשִׁיב הָוֵי טִבְעָא, כַּסְפָּא דְּלָא חֲשִׁיב – הָוֵי פֵּירָא, וְקָנֵי לֵיהּ פֵּירָא לְטִבְעָא. בְּזִקְנוּתֵיהּ סְבַר: כַּסְפָּא
human_translation: In his youth, what did hold, and in his maturity, what did hold? In his youth he held: Gold which are valuable, are currency; silver which are not valuable, are a commodity, a commodity acquires the currency. In his old age, he held: Silver
llm_translation: In her youth, what does she think, and in her old age, what does she think? In her youth, she thinks: that which comes from gold is considered natural, but that which comes from silver is not considered - it is considered a fruit, and she acquires a fruit for a natural item. In her old age, she thinks: silver.

hebrew_text: דְּחָרִיף – הָוֵי טִבְעָא. דַּהֲבָא דְּלָא חָרִיף – הָוֵי פֵּירָא, וְקָנֵי לֵיהּ פֵּירָא לְטִבְעָא.
human_translation: which circulate, are currency; gold which do not circulate, are a commodity. And the commodity, acquires the currency.
llm_translation: דְּחָרִיף – הָוֵי טִבְעָא. דַּהֲבָא דְּלָא חָרִיף – הָוֵי פֵּירָא, וְקָנֵי לֵיהּ פֵּירָא לְטִבְעָא. "Decharif - havei tiv'a. Dahava d'lo charif - havei peira, v'kanei lei peira l'tiv'a."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: כְּיַלְדוּתֵיהּ מִסְתַּבְּרָא, מִדְּקָתָנֵי: ״הַנְּחֹשֶׁת קוֹנָה אֶת הַכֶּסֶף״.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: It is reasonable in accordance with his youth. from that teaches the copper acquires the silver
llm_translation: Rav Ashe said: Like its youth it is formed, as it is taught: "The copper acquires the silver."

hebrew_text: אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא כַּסְפָּא לְגַבֵּי דַּהֲבָא פֵּירָא הָוֵי, הַיְינוּ דְּקָא תָנֵי: ״הַנְּחֹשֶׁת קוֹנָה אֶת הַכֶּסֶף״, דְּאַף עַל פִּי דִּלְגַבֵּי דַּהֲבָא פֵּירָא הָוֵיא, לְגַבֵּי נְחֹשֶׁת טִבְעָא הָוֵי. אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ כַּסְפָּא לְגַבֵּי דַּהֲבָא טִבְעָא הָוֵי, הַשְׁתָּא לְגַבֵּי דַּהֲבָא דַּחֲשִׁיב מִינֵּיהּ, אָמְרַתְּ טִבְעָא הָוֵי, לְגַבֵּי נְחֹשֶׁת, דְּאִיהוּ חֲשִׁיב וְאִיהוּ חָרִיף – מִבַּעְיָא?
human_translation: Granted, if you say the silver relative to the gold are a commodity, that is that teaches: the copper acquires the silver as, even though relative to the gold the silver are a commodity, relative to copper are currency. But if you say the silver relative to the gold are currency now, relative to the gold which are more valuable than you say are currency, relative to copper as are valuable and they circulate is it necessary
llm_translation: If you say that silver is considered primary in comparison to gold, this is what it is teaching: "The copper acquires the silver," even though in comparison to gold it is secondary, in comparison to copper it is primary. But if you say that silver is considered secondary in comparison to gold, now in comparison to gold, which is more esteemed than it, do you say it is secondary in comparison to copper, which is both esteemed and sharp - is this necessary?

hebrew_text: אִיצְטְרִיךְ, סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא: הָנֵי פְּרִיטֵי, בְּאַתְרָא דְּסָגַיִי – אִינְהוּ חֲרִיפִי טְפֵי מִכַּסְפָּא, אֵימָא טִבְעָא הָוֵי! קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן, כֵּיוָן דְּאִיכָּא דּוּכְתָּא דְּלָא סָגֵי בֵּיהּ – פֵּירָא הָוֵי.
human_translation: was necessary enter your mind to say in a place where these perutot circulate, they circulate than silver say are currency teaches us since there is a place where do not circulate, are a commodity.
llm_translation: It is necessary, as your mind has concluded: these fruits, in a place of sufficiency - they are sharp, more than silver, perhaps they are gold! It is heard to us, since there is a place where it is not sufficient - it becomes wild.

hebrew_text: וְאַף רַבִּי חִיָּיא סְבַר דַּהֲבָא טִבְעָא הָוֵי. דְּרַב אוֹזֵיף דִּינָרֵי מִבְּרַתֵּיה דְּרַבִּי חִיָּיא, לְסוֹף אִיַּיקּוּר דִּינָרֵי. אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי חִיָּיא, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: זִיל שַׁלֵּים לַהּ טָבִין וּתְקִילִין. אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא דַּהֲבָא טִבְעָא הָוֵי – שַׁפִּיר. אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ פֵּירָא הָוֵי, הָוֵה לֵיהּ סְאָה בִּסְאָה, וְאָסוּר!
human_translation: And Rabbi Ḥiyya, as well, holds gold are currency where Rav borrowed dinars from the daughter of Rabbi Ḥiyya. Ultimately, the dinars appreciated came before Rabbi Ḥiyya said to Go pay her unflawed and weighed Granted, if you say the gold are currency, well, But if you say are a commodity, this is a se’a a se’a prohibited,
llm_translation: And even Rabbi Chiya holds that a coin that was lost is considered as if it is found. For Rav Ozeif took dinars from the purse of Rabbi Chiya, at the end they were found to be his. He came before Rabbi Chiya, he said to him: Go, repay him the good and light coins. If you say that a lost coin is considered as if it is found - it is fine. But if you say that it is considered as if it is lost, he will have a sa'ah for a sa'ah, and it is prohibited!

hebrew_text: רַב דִּינָרֵי הֲווֹ לֵיהּ, וְכֵיוָן דַּהֲווֹ לֵיהּ דִּינָרֵי – נַעֲשָׂה כְּאוֹמֵר לָהּ: הַלְוֵינִי עַד שֶׁיָּבֹא בְּנִי אוֹ עַד שֶׁאֶמְצָא מַפְתֵּחַ.
human_translation: Rav had dinars And since he had dinars, it is tantamount to saying to her: Lend me until my son comes or until I find key.
llm_translation: Rav Dinarai had a loan, and once he had the loan of the dinars - it was done as it says to her: "Lend me until my son comes or until I find the key."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: הַאי תַּנָּא סָבַר דַּהֲבָא טִבְעָא הָוֵי, דְּתַנְיָא: פְּרוּטָה שֶׁאָמְרוּ – אֶחָד מִשְּׁמוֹנָה בָּאִיסָּר הָאִיטַלְקִי. לְמַאי נָפְקָא מִינַּהּ? לְקִדּוּשֵׁי אִשָּׁה. אִיסָּר – אֶחָד מֵעֶשְׂרִים וְאַרְבָּעָה בְּדִינָר שֶׁל כֶּסֶף. לְמַאי נָפְקָא מִינַּהּ? לְמִקָּח וּמִמְכָּר.
human_translation: Rava said: This tanna holds that the gold are currency, as it is taught peruta which spoke one-eighth of an Italian issar . What is the difference for the betrothal of a woman An issar one twenty-fourth of a silver dinar. What is the difference for buying and selling,
llm_translation: Rava said: This Tanna holds that a gold coin is considered currency, as it was taught: A small coin, which they said - one of the eight in the Italian Sela. What is it derived for? For the betrothal of a woman. Sela - one of twenty-four silver dinars. What is it derived for? For buying and selling.

hebrew_text: דִּינָר שֶׁל כֶּסֶף – אֶחָד מֵעֶשְׂרִים וַחֲמִשָּׁה בְּדִינָר שֶׁל זָהָב. לְמַאי נָפְקָא מִינַּהּ? לְפִדְיוֹן הַבֵּן.
human_translation: A silver dinar one twenty-fifth of a gold dinar. What is the difference with regard to redemption of the son.
llm_translation: Silver dinar - one of twenty-five in a gold dinar. For what is it derived? For redeeming the son.

hebrew_text: אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא טִבְעָא הָוֵי, מְשַׁעֵר תַּנָּא בְּמִידֵּי דְּקִיץ! אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ פֵּירָא הָוֵי, מְשַׁעֵר תַּנָּא בְּמִידֵּי דְּאוֹקֵיר וְזִיל? זִימְנִין דְּמַהְדַּר לֵיהּ כָּהֲנָא וְזִימְנִין דְּמוֹסֵיף לֵיהּ אִיהוּ לְכָהֲנָא. אֶלָּא, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: טִבְעָא הָוֵי. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: Granted, if you say are currency, the tanna calculates based on an item whose fixed. But if you say is a commodity, the tanna calculate based on an item that appreciates and depreciates? sometimes the priest returns and sometimes must add to to the priest Rather, learn from it are currency. Learn from it
llm_translation: If you say it is in the context of "Tib'a," it is logical, as the Mishna estimates in the case of a "deceased fetus"! Rather, if you say it is in the context of "Peira," it is logical, as the Mishna estimates in the case of one who is "awake and walking." Sometimes it is fitting for him to be a priest, and sometimes it is fitting for him to be someone else besides a priest. Rather, conclude from it: it is in the context of "Tib'a." Conclude from it.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן הָתָם, בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: לֹא יַעֲשֶׂה אָדָם סְלָעִין דִּינְרֵי זָהָב, וּבֵית הִלֵּל מַתִּירִין. רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן וְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ חַד אָמַר: מַחְלוֹקֶת בִּסְלָעִים עַל דִּינָרִין, דְּבֵית שַׁמַּאי סָבְרִי: כַּסְפָּא טִבְעָא, וְדַהֲבָא פֵּירָא, וְטִבְעָא אַפֵּירָא לָא מְחַלְּלִינַן. וּבֵית הִלֵּל סָבְרִי: כַּסְפָּא פֵּירָא, וְדַהֲבָא טִבְעָא, וּפֵירָא אַטִּבְעָא מְחַלְּלִינַן. אֲבָל פֵּירוֹת עַל דִּינָרִין – דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל מְחַלְּלִינַן.
human_translation: We learned there Beit Shammai say: A person may not transfer sela coins gold dinars and Beit Hillel permit Rabbi Yoḥanan and Reish Lakish One said: dispute with regard to sela coins for dinars, as Beit Shammai hold the silver are currency and the gold are a commodity, and we do not desacralize currency with a commodity. And Beit Hillel hold the silver are a commodity and the gold are currency, and we desacralize a commodity with currency. But everyone agrees we desacralize produce with dinars.
llm_translation: We learned there, Beit Shammai says: A person should not make coins of gold. And Beit Hillel permits it. Rabbi Yochanan and Reish Lakish, one of them said: The dispute regarding coins is about dinars, for Beit Shammai holds: silver is the main currency, and gold is subsidiary, and we do not debase the subsidiary. But Beit Hillel holds: gold is the main currency, and silver is subsidiary, and we debase the subsidiary. However, fruits as coins – everyone agrees we debase them.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא – מִידֵּי דְּהָוֵה אַכֶּסֶף לְבֵית הִלֵּל. כֶּסֶף לְבֵית הִלֵּל, אַף עַל גַּב דְּכַסְפָּא לְגַבֵּי דַּהֲבָא פֵּירָא הָוֵי, לְגַבֵּי פֵּירָא טִבְעָא הָוֵי. זָהָב נָמֵי לְבֵית שַׁמַּאי, אַף עַל גַּב דְּדַהֲבָא לְגַבֵּי כַּסְפָּא פֵּירָא הָוֵי, לְגַבֵּי פֵּירָא טִבְעָא הָוֵי. וְחַד אָמַר: אַף בְּפֵירוֹת עַל דִּינָרִין מַחְלוֹקֶת.
human_translation: What is the reason just as it is with regard to silver according to Beit Hillel. silver according to Beit Hillel, although silver relative to gold are a commodity, relative to produce are currency. So too gold according to Beit Shammai: Although gold are a commodity relative to silver relative to produce are currency. And one said: Even with regard to produce for dinars a dispute
llm_translation: "What is the reason? - Because it was silver for the House of Hillel. Silver for the House of Hillel, even though silver is inferior to gold, it is considered precious. Gold is considered precious for the House of Shammai, even though gold is inferior to silver, it is considered precious. And one said: Even in fruits, there is a dispute over dinars."

hebrew_text: וּלְמַאן דְּאָמַר: אַף בְּפֵירוֹת עַל דִּינָרִין מַחְלוֹקֶת, אַדְּמִיפַּלְגִי בְּסִלְעִין עַל דִּינָרִין – לִפְלוּג בְּפֵירוֹת עַל דִּינָרִין! אִי אִיפְּלוּג בְּפֵירוֹת עַל דִּינָרִין, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: הָנֵי מִילֵּי בְּפֵירוֹת עַל דִּינָרִין, אֲבָל בְּסִלְעִין עַל דִּינָרִין – מוֹדוּ לָהֶן בֵּית הִלֵּל לְבֵית שַׁמַּאי דְּדַהֲבָא לְגַבֵּי כַּסְפָּא פֵּירָא הָוֵי וְלָא מְחַלְּלִינַן, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: And according to the one who says: a dispute even with regard to produce for dinars, rather than disagreeing with regard to sela coins for dinars let them disagree with regard to produce for dinars. Had they disagreed with regard to produce for dinars, I would say: This matter with regard to produce for dinars. But with regard to sela coins for dinars, Beit Hillel concede to Beit Shammai that gold relative to silver are a commodity, and we do not desacralize teaches us
llm_translation: And for the one who says: Even regarding fruits in exchange for coins there is a dispute, if they argue about rocks in exchange for coins – let them argue about fruits in exchange for coins! If they were to argue about fruits in exchange for coins, I would say: Those matters are regarding fruits in exchange for coins, but regarding rocks in exchange for coins – Beit Hillel concedes to Beit Shammai that gold in exchange for silver is considered a fruit and we do not violate the prohibition of mixing different types of produce. This is what we hear.

hebrew_text: תִּסְתַּיֵּים דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן הוּא דְּאָמַר אֵין מְחַלְּלִין, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן:
human_translation: Conclude that it is Rabbi Yoḥanan who said: One does not desacralize as Rabbi Yoḥanan said:
llm_translation: The completion of Rabbi Yochanan, he said, "We do not desecrate," as Rabbi Yochanan said:

hebrew_text: אָסוּר לִלְווֹת דִּינָר בְּדִינָר.
human_translation: It is prohibited to borrow a dinar with a dinar,
llm_translation: It is forbidden to lend a dinar with a dinar.

hebrew_text: דִּינָר דְּמַאי? אִילֵּימָא דִּינָר שֶׁל כֶּסֶף בְּדִינָר שֶׁל כֶּסֶף, לְגַבֵּי נַפְשֵׁיהּ מִי אִיכָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר לָאו טִבְעָא הָוֵי? אֶלָּא פְּשִׁיטָא דִּינָר שֶׁל זָהָב בְּדִינָר שֶׁל זָהָב, וּלְמַאן? אִי לְבֵית הִלֵּל – הָא אָמְרִי טִבְעָא הָוֵי. אֶלָּא לָאו לְבֵית שַׁמַּאי, וּשְׁמַע מִינַּהּ רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן הוּא דְּאָמַר: אֵין מְחַלְּלִין!
human_translation: a dinar of what If we say a silver dinar with a silver dinar, is there anyone who says relative to itself is not currency? Rather, obvious a gold dinar with a gold dinar. And in accordance with whose If in accordance with Beit Hillel, don’t they say is currency? Rather, isn’t it in accordance with Beit Shammai? And learn from it it is Rabbi Yoḥanan who said we do not desacralize
llm_translation: Dinar demai? Ileima dinar shel kesef bedinar shel kesef, legabei nafsheih mi ikka lemaan deamar lav tiv'aa havei? Ella peshita dinar shel zahav bedinar shel zahav, ulmaan? Ii lebeit Hillel – ha amri tiv'aa havei. Ella lav lebeit Shammai, ushma minah Rabbi Yochanan hu deamar: Ein mechallelin!

hebrew_text: לָא, לְעוֹלָם אֵימָא לָךְ רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן הוּא דְּאָמַר מְחַלְּלִין, וְשָׁאנֵי הַלְוָאָה כֵּיוָן דִּלְעִנְיַן מִקָּח וּמִמְכָּר שַׁוְּיוּהּו רַבָּנַן כִּי פֵירָא, דְּאָמְרִינַן: אִיהוּ נִיהוּ דְּאוֹקֵיר וְזִיל – לְגַבֵּי הַלְוָאָה נָמֵי פֵּירָא הָוֵי.
human_translation: No, actually I will say to you it is Rabbi Yoḥanan who said we desacralize And a loan is different as with regard to buying and selling, the Sages deemed like a commodity. As we say: It is that appreciates and depreciates With regard to a loan as well, is like a commodity,
llm_translation: Not, forever I will say to you, Rabbi Yochanan, he who says profane, and different is a loan, since regarding the matter of buying and selling, the Rabbis have established it as permissible, as we say: "He who is diligent and goes – in the case of a loan, it is also considered diligence."

hebrew_text: הָכִי נָמֵי מִסְתַּבְּרָא, דְּכִי אֲתָא רָבִין אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאָמְרוּ אָסוּר לִלְווֹת דִּינָר בְּדִינָר, אֲבָל מְחַלְּלִין מַעֲשֵׂר שֵׁנִי עָלָיו. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: So too, it is reasonable as when Ravin came Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Even though they said it is prohibited to borrow dinar with dinar, yet, one may desacralize second tithe with Conclude from it
llm_translation: Thus it was stated: When Ravin came, Rabbi Yochanan said: Even though they said it is forbidden to lend a dinar for a dinar, nevertheless, one may redeem the second tithe with it. Learn from this.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: הַפּוֹרֵט סֶלַע מִמְּעוֹת מַעֲשֵׂר שֵׁנִי, בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: בְּכׇל הַסֶּלַע מָעוֹת, וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: בְּשֶׁקֶל כֶּסֶף, בְּשֶׁקֶל מָעוֹת. הַשְׁתָּא לְבֵית שַׁמַּאי לְגַבֵּי פְּרִיטֵי מְחַלְּלִינַן, לְגַבֵּי דַּהֲבָא מִיבַּעְיָא? שָׁאנֵי פְּרִיטֵי בְּאַתְרָא דְּסָגַיִין חֲרִיפֵי.
human_translation: Come hear: one who exchanges of second-tithe Beit Shammai say: coins for the entire sela . And Beit Hillel say: for a silver shekel, and with regard to shekel, coins. Now, according to Beit Shammai we desacralize with perutot , is necessary with gold Perutot are different, in a place where they are in circulation, they circulate
llm_translation: Come and hear: One who separates a rock from a pile of second tithe produce, Beit Shammai say: in every rock there are coins, and Beit Hillel say: in a silver shekel, in a coin shekel. Now, according to Beit Shammai, with regard to small coins, do we desecrate them, but with regard to gold, do we not require them? The case is different with small coins, as they are found in a place where they are commonly used.

hebrew_text: לִישָּׁנָא אַחֲרִינָא אָמְרִי לַהּ, רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן וְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ. חַד אָמַר: מַחְלוֹקֶת בִּסְלָעִין עַל דִּינָרִים, דְּבֵית שַׁמַּאי סָבְרִי: ״הַכֶּסֶף״ – כֶּסֶף רִאשׁוֹן וְלֹא כֶּסֶף שֵׁנִי.
human_translation: another version some say Rabbi Yoḥanan and Reish Lakish. One said: dispute with regard to sela coins for dinars, as Beit Shammai hold “the money” first money, and not second money,
llm_translation: The other sages said to her, Rabbi Yochanan and Reish Lakish. One said: A dispute regarding coins, Beit Shammai holds: "the money" - first money and not second money.

hebrew_text: וּבֵית הִלֵּל סָבְרִי: ״הַכֶּסֶף״, ״כֶּסֶף״, רִיבָּה – וַאֲפִילּוּ כֶּסֶף שֵׁנִי. אֲבָל פֵּירוֹת עַל דִּינָרִין – דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל מְחַלְּלִינַן, דְּאַכַּתִּי כֶּסֶף רִאשׁוֹן הוּא.
human_translation: And Beit Hillel hold “The money,” money “the money” include even second money. But produce with dinars, everyone agrees we desacralize as are still first money
llm_translation: House of Hillel hold: "the silver", "silver", interest - and even a second silver. But fruits for dinars - the words of everyone we desecrate, because indeed the first silver it is.

hebrew_text: וְחַד אָמַר: אַף בְּפֵירוֹת עַל דִּינָרִין נָמֵי מַחְלוֹקֶת.
human_translation: And one said: a dispute even with regard to produce with dinars,
llm_translation: And one said: Even regarding fruits with regards to dinars there is a dispute.

hebrew_text: וּלְמַאן דְּאָמַר סְלָעִין עַל דִּינָרִין מַחְלוֹקֶת, אַדְּמִיפַּלְגִי בִּסְלָעִין עַל דִּינָרִין, לִיפְלוֹג בִּסְלָעִין עַל סְלָעִין!
human_translation: But according to the one who says: dispute with regard to sela coins for dinars, rather than disagreeing with regard to sela coins for dinars, let disagree with regard to sela coins for sela coins,
llm_translation: And for the one who says that rocks are subject to dispute regarding dinars, let him dispute regarding rocks with dinars, so that he may dispute regarding rocks with rocks!

hebrew_text: אִי אִפְּלוּג בִּסְלָעִין עַל סְלָעִין, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: הָנֵי מִילֵּי בִּסְלָעִין עַל סְלָעִין, אֲבָל בִּסְלָעִין עַל דִּינָרִין – מוֹדוּ לְהוּ בֵּית הִלֵּל לְבֵית שַׁמַּאי דְּדַהֲבָא לְגַבֵּי כַּסְפָּא פֵּירָא הָוֵי וְלָא מְחַלְּלִינַן, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: Had they disagreed with regard to sela coins for sela coins, I would say: This matter with regard to sela coins for sela coins, but with regard to sela coins for dinars, Beit Hillel concede to Beit Shammai that gold relative to silver are a commodity, and we do not desacralize teaches us
llm_translation: If they fell on rocks upon rocks, I would say: those words on rocks upon rocks, but on rocks upon dinars - Beit Hillel concedes to Beit Shammai that gold in comparison to silver is considered beautiful and we do not debase it, this is what we hear.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: הַפּוֹרֵט סֶלַע שֶׁל מַעֲשֵׂר שֵׁנִי בִּירוּשָׁלַיִם, בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: בְּכׇל הַסֶּלַע מָעוֹת, וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: בְּשֶׁקֶל כֶּסֶף, בְּשֶׁקֶל מָעוֹת. הַשְׁתָּא כַּסְפָּא לְגַבֵּי פְּרִיטֵי מְחַלְּלִינַן, וְלָא אָמְרִינַן ״כֶּסֶף רִאשׁוֹן וְלֹא כֶּסֶף שֵׁנִי״, לְגַבֵּי דַּהֲבָא דַּחֲשִׁיב מִינֵּיהּ, מִי אָמְרִינַן ״כֶּסֶף רִאשׁוֹן וְלֹא כֶּסֶף שֵׁנִי״?
human_translation: Come hear one who exchanges sela of second-tithe in Jerusalem, Beit Shammai say: With the entire sela coins; and Beit Hillel say: for a silver shekel, and coins a shekel. Now we desacralize silver for perutot , and we do not say first money and not second money, with regard to gold, which is more valuable than do we say first money and not second money?
llm_translation: Come and hear: One who redeems the second tithe produce in Jerusalem, Beit Shammai say: with all the produce is money, and Beit Hillel say: with a silver shekel, with silver money. Now, when it comes to silver in relation to the pieces of the Temple vessels, we may redeem them, and we do not say "first silver and not second silver," in relation to gold which is more esteemed than it, do we say "first silver and not second silver"?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: יְרוּשָׁלַיִם קָמוֹתְבַתְּ? שָׁאנֵי יְרוּשָׁלַיִם, דִּכְתִיב בֵּיהּ ״וְנָתַתָּה הַכֶּסֶף בְּכֹל אֲשֶׁר תְּאַוֶּה נַפְשְׁךָ בַּבָּקָר וּבַצֹּאן״.
human_translation: Rava said Are you raising an objection from Jerusalem Jerusalem is different as it is written with regard to “And you shall bestow the money for whatever your soul desires, for cattle or for sheep”
llm_translation: Rava said: Is Jerusalem written? It is different with Jerusalem, as it is written in it, "And you shall spend the money for whatever your soul desires, for oxen or for sheep."

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: הַפּוֹרֵט סֶלַע מִמְּעוֹת מַעֲשֵׂר שֵׁנִי – בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: בְּכׇל הַסֶּלַע מָעוֹת, וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: בְּשֶׁקֶל כֶּסֶף, בְּשֶׁקֶל מָעוֹת!
human_translation: Come hear one who exchanges of second-tithe Beit Shammai say: coins for the entire sela . And Beit Hillel say: for a silver shekel, and with regard to shekel, coins.
llm_translation: Come and hear: One who separates a rock from the innards of the second tithe - Beit Shammai say: in every rock are innards, and Beit Hillel say: in a silver shekel, in a shekel are innards!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא ״הַכֶּסֶף״ ״כֶּסֶף״ רִיבָּה, וַאֲפִילּוּ כֶּסֶף שֵׁנִי. אֶלָּא אִי אִיתְּמַר דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן לָקִישׁ, הָכִי אִיתְּמַר: חַד אָמַר מַחְלוֹקֶת בִּסְלָעִין עַל דִּינָרִין, דְּבֵית שַׁמַּאי סָבְרִי: גָּזְרִינַן
human_translation: Rather, that everyone agrees “The money,” money “the money” include even second money. Rather, if between Rabbi Yoḥanan and Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish was stated, it was stated like this: One said: dispute with regard to sela coins for dinars. As Beit Shammai hold: We issue a decree
llm_translation: Rather, the entirety of the world, "silver" "silver" is interest, even a second silver. Rather, if it was stated that Rabbi Yochanan and Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said thus: One said a dispute in Sela'im regarding Dinars, for Beit Shammai hold: We decree...

hebrew_text: שֶׁמָּא יְשַׁהֶה עֲלִיּוֹתָיו, דְּזִימְנִין דְּלָא מָלוּ זוּזֵי בְּדִינָרָא וְלָא מַסֵּיק. וּבֵית הִלֵּל סָבְרִי: לָא גָּזְרִינַן שֶׁמָּא יְשַׁהֶה עֲלִיּוֹתָיו, דְּכִי לָא מָלוּ נָמֵי בְּדִינָרָא אַסּוֹקֵי מַסֵּיק לְהוּ. אֲבָל בְּפֵירוֹת עַל דִּינָרִין – דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל מְחַלְּלִינַן, דְּכֵיוָן דְּמַרְקְבִי לָא מְשַׁהֵי לְהוּ.
human_translation: lest one delay his ascension as sometimes coins do not amount to the dinar, and he will not ascend And Beit Hillel hold: We do not issue a decree lest he delay his ascension, as even if do not amount to the dinar he will ascend with But with regard to produce with dinars, everyone agrees that we desacralize that since rots, does not delay
llm_translation: Perhaps he will delay his payments, as sometimes they do not fill the coins with a dinar and do not suffice. And Beit Hillel hold: We do not decree that he will delay his payments, for if the coins are not filled with a dinar, the money-changers will suffice for them. But regarding fruits for dinars - everyone agrees that we may desecrate them, for since they are not weighed, we do not delay for them.

hebrew_text: וְחַד אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ בְּפֵירוֹת עַל דִּינָרִין נָמֵי מַחְלוֹקֶת.
human_translation: And one said: Even with regard to produce for dinars a dispute,
llm_translation: And one said: Even with fruits for a dinar there is a dispute.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְהָךְ לִישָּׁנָא דְּאָמְרַתְּ דְּמִדְּאוֹרָיְיתָא מִשְׁרָא שְׁרֵי וְרַבָּנַן הוּא דִּגְזַרוּ בֵּיהּ – הַיְינוּ דְּקָתָנֵי ״יַעֲשֶׂה״ וְ״לֹא יַעֲשֶׂה״, אֶלָּא לְהָךְ לִישָּׁנָא דְּאָמְרַתְּ דְּמִדְּאוֹרָיְיתָא פְּלִיגִי: מְחַלְּלִינַן וְלָא מְחַלְּלִינַן מִבְּעֵי לֵיהּ? קַשְׁיָא.
human_translation: Granted, according to that version which you said that permitted by Torah law and is the Sages who issued a decree it, this that is taught One may do, and: One may not do, But according to that version which you said that with regard to by Torah law they disagree, it should have We desacralize, and: We do not desacralize, difficult.
llm_translation: In truth, to strike the matter to the point of what you said, that from the Torah it is permitted, and it is the Rabbis who decreed upon it – that is to say, that which is taught "he shall do" and "he shall not do," rather to strike the matter to the point of what you said, that from the Torah they disagree: do we desecrate or do we not desecrate, he wants to ask? This is a difficulty.

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר: רַב וְלֵוִי, חַד אָמַר: מַטְבֵּעַ נַעֲשֶׂה חֲלִיפִין, וְחַד אָמַר: אֵין מַטְבֵּעַ נַעֲשֶׂה חֲלִיפִין. אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּמַאן דְּאָמַר אֵין מַטְבֵּעַ נַעֲשֶׂה חֲלִיפִין – מִשּׁוּם דְּדַעְתֵּיהּ אַצּוּרְתָּא, וְצוּרְתָּא עֲבִידָא דְּבָטְלָא.
human_translation: It was stated Rav and Levi. One said: Money can be exchange. And one said: Money cannot be exchange, Rav Pappa said: What is the reason of the one who says money cannot be exchange? because mind of on the form and the form is apt to be canceled
llm_translation: It was stated: Rav and Levi, one said: a coin will be made into a substitute, and one said: a coin will not be made into a substitute. Rav Papa said: What is the reason of the one who said a coin will not be made into a substitute? Because his mind is formed, and a formed object is considered null.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: הַזָּהָב קוֹנֶה אֶת הַכֶּסֶף, מַאי לָאו בַּחֲלִיפִין, וּשְׁמַע מִינַּהּ מַטְבֵּעַ נַעֲשֶׂה חֲלִיפִין? לֹא, בְּדָמִים. אִי הָכִי הַזָּהָב קוֹנֶה אֶת הַכֶּסֶף, מְחַיֵּיב מִבְּעֵי לֵיהּ! תְּנִי: הַזָּהָב מְחַיֵּיב.
human_translation: We learned the gold acquires the silver What, not by means of exchange, and learn from it a coin can be exchange? No, by means of money. If so, the gold acquires the silver should have obligates him teach: the gold obligates him
llm_translation: We learned in a Mishnah: Gold acquires silver. What is the reason? Is it not through exchange? And if you would say that a coin is made into an exchange, no, it is through blood. If so, gold acquires silver, it should obligate him in its requirements! It was taught: Gold obligates.

hebrew_text: הָכִי נָמֵי מִסְתַּבְּרָא, מִדְּקָתָנֵי סֵיפָא: הַכֶּסֶף אֵינוֹ קוֹנֶה אֶת הַזָּהָב. אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא בְּדָמִים – הַיְינוּ דְּאָמְרִינַן דַּהֲבָא פֵּירָא, וְכַסְפָּא טִבְעָא, וְטִבְעָא פֵּירָא לָא קָנֵי. אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ בַּחֲלִיפִין, תַּרְוַיְיהוּ לִקְנוֹ אַהֲדָדֵי.
human_translation: So too, it is reasonable from that it teaches the latter clause the silver does not acquire the gold Granted, if you say by means of money, this is of which we said: Gold is a commodity, and silver is currency, and currency does not effect acquisition of a commodity. But if you say by means of exchange, let both acquire from each other.
llm_translation: Thus it was stated: from the end of the Mishnah, "Silver does not acquire gold." If you say this refers to blood - this is what we say: gold is fruit, and silver is a vessel, and a vessel does not acquire fruit. Rather, if you say it refers to exchanges, both acquire each other.

hebrew_text: וְעוֹד, תַּנְיָא: הַכֶּסֶף אֵינוֹ קוֹנֶה אֶת הַזָּהָב, כֵּיצַד? מָכַר לוֹ עֶשְׂרִים וַחֲמִשָּׁה דִּינָר שֶׁל כֶּסֶף בְּדִינָר שֶׁל זָהָב, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁמָּשַׁךְ אֶת הַכֶּסֶף – לֹא קָנָה עַד שֶׁיִּמְשׁוֹךְ אֶת הַזָּהָב. אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא בְּדָמִים – מִשּׁוּם הָכִי לָא קָנֵי. אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ בַּחֲלִיפִין – נִקְנֵי.
human_translation: And furthermore, it is taught the silver does not acquire the gold How one sold twenty-five silver dinars to for a gold dinar, even though he pulled the silver he does not acquire until pulls the gold Granted, if you say by means of money, due to that he does not acquire But if you say by means of exchange, let him acquire
llm_translation: And furthermore, it was taught: "Silver does not acquire gold." How so? If one sold to him twenty-five dinars of silver for one dinar of gold, even though he handed over the silver, he does not acquire it until he hands over the gold. If you say this is because of blood money, then it is not acquired. Rather, if you say it is through exchange, it is acquired.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מַאי, בְּדָמִים? אִי הָכִי אֵימָא רֵישָׁא: הַזָּהָב קוֹנֶה אֶת הַכֶּסֶף, כֵּיצַד? מָכַר לוֹ דִּינָר שֶׁל זָהָב בְּעֶשְׂרִים וַחֲמִשָּׁה דִּינָר שֶׁל כֶּסֶף, כֵּיוָן שֶׁמָּשַׁךְ אֶת הַזָּהָב נִקְנָה כֶּסֶף בְּכׇל מָקוֹם שֶׁהוּא.
human_translation: Rather, what by means of money? If so, say the first clause the gold acquires the silver How one sold a gold dinar to for twenty-five silver dinars, once he pulled the gold silver are acquired wherever are.
llm_translation: Rather, what is meant by "with blood"? If so, say at the beginning: "Gold acquires silver, how so? If one sells a gold dinar for twenty-five silver dinars, as soon as he draws the gold, the silver is acquired wherever it is."

hebrew_text: אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא בַּחֲלִיפִין, הַיְינוּ דְּקָתָנֵי ״נִקְנֶה כֶּסֶף בְּכׇל מָקוֹם שֶׁהוּא״. אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ בְּדָמִים, הַאי ״נִקְנֶה כֶּסֶף בְּכׇל מָקוֹם שֶׁהוּא״, נִתְחַיֵּיב גַּבְרָא מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Granted, if you say by means of exchange, this is which is taught: silver are acquired wherever are, But if you say by means of money, this silver are acquired wherever are, should have the man is obligated
llm_translation: If you say it is referring to coins, that is what is taught: "Silver is acquired in any place it is." But if you say it is referring to blood, this "Silver is acquired in any place it is," a man would be required to give it.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: לְעוֹלָם בְּדָמִים. וּמַאי ״בְּכׇל מָקוֹם שֶׁהוּא״? כְּמוֹת שֶׁהוּא, כְּדַאֲמַר לֵיהּ. אִי אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מֵאַרְנָקִי חֲדָשָׁה יָהֲבִינָא לָךְ, לָא מָצֵי יָהֵיב לֵיהּ מֵאַרְנָקִי יְשָׁנָה, אַף עַל גַּב דַּעֲדִיפִי מִינַּיְיהוּ. מַאי טַעְמָא, דְּאָמַר לֵיהּ: לְיַשְּׁנָן קָא בָעֵינָא לְהוּ.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: Actually, by means of money. And what Wherever are? as are, as said to him, If said to I will give you from a purse new he cannot give him from a purse old even though preferable to What is the reason that says to I need them to age them;
llm_translation: Rav Ashei said: Always with blood. And what is "in every place that he is"? Like his death, as he said to him. If he had said to him: I would have given you a new purse, he would not have accepted from him an old purse, even though it is more preferable than mine. What is the reason? Because he said to him: I want them to be old.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: אֲפִילּוּ לְמַאן דְּאָמַר אֵין מַטְבֵּעַ נַעֲשֶׂה חֲלִיפִין – מֶיעְבָּד הוּא דְּלָא עָבֵיד חֲלִיפִין, אַקְנוֹיֵי מִיקְּנוּ בַּחֲלִיפִין, מִידֵּי דְּהָוֵה אַפֵּירֵא לְרַב נַחְמָן. פֵּירֵא לְרַב נַחְמָן, לָאו אַף עַל גַּב דְּאִינְהוּ לָא עָבְדִי חֲלִיפִין – אַקְנוֹיֵי מִקְּנוּ בַּחֲלִיפִין, טִבְעָא נָמֵי לָא שְׁנָא.
human_translation: Rav Pappa says: Even according to the one who says: Money cannot be exchange, does not effect exchange; is acquired by exchange. just as it is with regard to produce, according to Rav Naḥman. not even though produce itself does not effect exchange, is acquired by exchange? Currency, too, no different.
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: Even according to the one who says that a coin does not become a substitute, he is compelled to acquire with substitutes, so that it will be pleasing to Rav Nachman. If it is pleasing to Rav Nachman, is it not the case that even though they did not make substitutes, they acquire with substitutes? The reason is that the nature of the matter is not different.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: הָיָה עוֹמֵד בַּגּוֹרֶן וְאֵין בְּיָדוֹ מָעוֹת, אוֹמֵר לַחֲבֵירוֹ: הֲרֵי פֵּירוֹת הַלָּלוּ נְתוּנִים לְךָ בְּמַתָּנָה,
human_translation: raises an objection was standing on the threshing floor and had no money in his hand, he says to another: This produce is hereby given to you as a gift,
llm_translation: Challenger: He was standing in the threshing floor and he has no coins in his hand, he says to his fellow: "Behold, these fruits are given to you as a gift."

hebrew_text: וְחוֹזֵר וְאוֹמֵר: הֲרֵי הֵן מְחוּלָּלִין עַל מְעוֹת שֶׁיֵּשׁ לִי בַּבַּיִת. טַעְמָא דְּאֵין בְּיָדוֹ מָעוֹת, הָא אִם יֵשׁ בְּיָדוֹ מָעוֹת – לַיקְנֵי לְהוּ לְאִידַּךְ בִּמְשִׁיכָה וּפָרֵיק, דְּהָכִי עֲדִיף, דְּהָוֵה לֵיהּ נֻכְרַאי.
human_translation: and then he says: is hereby desacralized on coins that I have at home. The reason that he does not have coins in his hand. But if he has coins in his hand let him transfer ownership to the other by means of pulling, and desacralize that this is preferable, as is a stranger,
llm_translation: And he goes back and says: "Behold, they are profaned on coins that I have in the house." The reason is that if he does not have coins in his possession, then if he has coins in his possession, let him acquire them from the other with drawing and releasing, for this is preferable, as it will be unknown to him.

hebrew_text: וְאִי אָמְרַתְּ מַטְבֵּעַ נִקְנֶה בַּחֲלִיפִין: נִיקְּנוֹ לֵיהּ מָעוֹת לְהַיְאךְ אַגַּב סוּדָר, וְלִפְרוֹק! דְּלֵית לֵיהּ סוּדָר. וְנַקְנִינְהוּ נִהֲלֵיהּ אַגַּב קַרְקַע! דְּלֵית לֵיהּ קַרְקַע.
human_translation: And if you say a coin is acquired by exchange, let transfer ownership to the other by means of a cloth, and let desacralize which he does not have a cloth. And let transfer ownership to the other by means of land, which he does not have land.
llm_translation: If you say that a coin is acquired through exchange: one acquires it with money to what extent? In exchange for a sudar, and to remove it! Because it does not have a sudar. And one acquires it for him in exchange for land! Because it does not have land.

hebrew_text: וְהָא עוֹמֵד בַּגּוֹרֶן קָתָנֵי! בְּגוֹרֶן שֶׁאֵינוֹ שֶׁלּוֹ. וְאִיכְּפַל תַּנָּא לְאַשְׁמוֹעִינַן גַּבְרָא עַרְטִילַאי דְּלֵית לֵיהּ וְלָא כְּלוּם? אֶלָּא לָאו, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: אֵין מַטְבֵּעַ נִקְנֶה בַּחֲלִיפִין. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: But isn’t it taught standing on the threshing floor? on a threshing floor that is not his. And did the tanna go to all that trouble just to teach us of a naked man, who has nothing at all? Rather, not conclude from it money is not acquired by means of exchange? Learn from it
llm_translation: And this one stands in the threshing floor, it is taught! In a threshing floor that is not his. And why did the Mishna teach us about a man who has no artila and nothing? Rather, no, learn from it: a coin is not acquired through exchange. Learn from it.

hebrew_text: וְאַף רַב פָּפָּא הֲדַר בֵּיהּ. כִּי הָא דְּרַב פָּפָּא הֲווֹ לֵיהּ תְּרֵיסַר אַלְפֵי דִּינָרֵי בֵּי חוֹזָאֵי, אַקְנִינְהוּ לְרַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר אַחָא אַגַּב אַסִּיפָּא דְּבֵיתֵיהּ. כִּי אֲתָא, נְפַק לְאַפֵּיהּ עַד תְּווֹךְ.
human_translation: And even Rav Pappa retracted his as this which Rav Pappa had twelve thousand dinars Bei Ḥozai. He transferred ownership of to Rav Shmuel bar Aḥa, by means of the threshold of his house When came went out as far as Tevakh to him.
llm_translation: And also Rav Papa returned to it. For this that Rav Papa had twelve thousand dinars in the treasury of the house of Hozai, he acquired them for Rav Shmuel bar Acha due to the gathering of his household. When he came, he took them out to the middle.

hebrew_text: וְכֵן אָמַר עוּלָּא: אֵין מַטְבֵּעַ נַעֲשֶׂה חֲלִיפִין. וְכֵן אָמַר רַב אַסִּי: אֵין מַטְבֵּעַ נַעֲשֶׂה חֲלִיפִין, וְכֵן אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אֵין מַטְבֵּעַ נַעֲשֶׂה חֲלִיפִין.
human_translation: And likewise, Ulla says: Money cannot be exchange. And likewise, Rav Asi says: Money cannot be exchange. And likewise, Rabba bar bar Ḥana says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Money cannot be exchange.
llm_translation: And so said Ula: A coin does not become a garment. And so said Rav Assi: A coin does not become a garment. And so said Rabbah bar bar Ḥana in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan: A coin does not become a garment.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ רַבִּי אַבָּא לְעוּלָּא: הֲרֵי שֶׁהָיוּ חֲמָרָיו וּפוֹעֲלָיו תּוֹבְעִין אוֹתוֹ בַּשּׁוּק, וְאָמַר לַשּׁוּלְחָנִי: תֵּן לִי בְּדִינָר מָעוֹת וַאֲפַרְנְסֵם, וַאֲנִי אַעֲלֶה לְךָ יָפֶה דִּינָר וּטְרֵיסִית מִמָּעוֹת שֶׁיֵּשׁ לִי בְּבֵיתִי. אִם יֵשׁ לוֹ מָעוֹת – מוּתָּר, וְאִם לָאו – אָסוּר. וְאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ אֵין מַטְבֵּעַ נַעֲשֶׂה חֲלִיפִין, הָוְיָא לֵיהּ הַלְוָאָה, וְאָסוּר! אִשְׁתִּיק.
human_translation: Rabbi Abba raised an objection to Ulla one whose donkey drivers or laborers were demanding from him in the marketplace, and he said to the money changer: Give me coins a dinar and I will provide for them, and I will give you worth a dinar and a tereisit , from money that I have at home, if he has money permitted, But if not forbidden And if it enters your mind money cannot be exchange, it is a loan and forbidden was silent.
llm_translation: He raised an objection to Ulai: If his donkeys and workers were demanding payment from him in the market, and he said to the money-changer, "Give me a dinar of coins and I will support them, and I will give you a good dinar and a trisit of coins that I have in my house," if he has coins - it is permitted, and if not - it is forbidden. And if, heaven forbid, your intention is that coins should not be made into change, it would be considered a loan, and it is forbidden! He remained silent.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: דִּלְמָא אִידֵּי וְאִידֵּי בִּפְרוּטָטוֹת שָׁנוּ, דְּלֵיכָּא עֲלַיְיהוּ טִבְעָא. וְאִידֵּי וְאִידֵּי פֵּירָא הָווּ, וּמִשּׁוּם הָכִי נִקְּנוֹ בַּחֲלִיפִין. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִין, דַּיְקָא נָמֵי, דְּקָתָנֵי: יָפֶה דִּינָר וּטְרֵיסִית, וְלָא קָתָנֵי: דִּינָר יָפֶה וּטְרֵיסִית. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: said to Perhaps taught in these and those perotetot , that are unminted, and these and those is a commodity; and due to that they are acquired by means of exchange. said to him: Yes, is also precise, as it teaches: worth a dinar and a tereisit , and it does not teach: an unflawed dinar and a tereisit . Learn from it
llm_translation: He said to him: Perhaps both of them spoke in specifics, for there is no contradiction between them. Both of them were speaking about a cow, and that is why they were acquired through exchange. He said to him: Yes, indeed, as it is taught: "A dinar and a trisit" and not as it is taught: "A beautiful dinar and a trisit." Learn from this.
