hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: לְעוֹלָם בְּדָמִים וּבִפְרוּטָטוֹת, כֵּיוָן דְּאִית לֵיהּ, נַעֲשֶׂה כְּאוֹמֵר: הַלְוֵינִי עַד שֶׁיָּבֹא בְּנִי אוֹ עַד שֶׁאֶמְצָא מַפְתֵּחַ.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: Actually, with money and to perotetot , Since he has it is tantamount to saying: Lend me until my son comes or until I find key.
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said: Always with blood and with small coins, since it has, it will be done as it says: "Lend me until my son comes or until I find the key."

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: כׇּל הַנַּעֲשֶׂה דָּמִים בְּאַחֵר, כֵּיוָן שֶׁזָּכָה זֶה – נִתְחַיֵּיב זֶה בַּחֲלִיפִין. כׇּל הַנַּעֲשֶׂה דָּמִים בְּאַחֵר, מַאי נִיהוּ – מַטְבֵּעַ, וּשְׁמַע מִינַּהּ מַטְבֵּעַ נַעֲשֶׂה חֲלִיפִין!
human_translation: Come hear all used as monetary for another once one acquires this is obligated exchanged for it. all used as monetary for another what does this a coin, and learn from a coin can be exchange.
llm_translation: Come and hear: Anyone who causes bloodshed in another, once this one is acquitted, that one becomes liable for the exchange. Anyone who causes bloodshed in another, what is the case? - Coinage. And hear from it that coinage becomes the exchange!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה, הָכִי קָאָמַר:
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said: This is saying:
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said, thus he said:

hebrew_text: כׇּל הַנִּישּׁוֹם דָּמִים בְּאַחֵר, כֵּיוָן שֶׁזָּכָה זֶה נִתְחַיֵּיב זֶה בַּחֲלִיפִין.
human_translation: all that appraised as monetary for another once one acquires this is obligated exchanged for it.
llm_translation: All who exchange blood with another, once this one is acquitted, this one becomes liable for the exchange.

hebrew_text: הָכִי נָמֵי מִסְתַּבְּרָא, מִדְּקָתָנֵי סֵיפָא: כֵּיצַד? הֶחְלִיף שׁוֹר בְּפָרָה אוֹ חֲמוֹר בְּשׁוֹר. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: So too, it is reasonable from that the latter clause teaches: How so? one exchanges an ox for a cow, or a donkey for an ox, Learn from it
llm_translation: Thus it was stated: from the end of the Mishnah, how so? He exchanged an ox for a cow or a donkey for an ox. Learn from it.

hebrew_text: וּלְמַאי דִּסְלֵיק אַדַּעְתֵּיהּ מֵעִיקָּרָא – מַטְבֵּעַ, מַאי ״כֵּיצַד״? הָכִי קָאָמַר, וּפֵירֵי נָמֵי עָבְדִי חֲלִיפִין, כֵּיצַד – הֶחְלִיף שׁוֹר בְּפָרָה אוֹ חֲמוֹר בְּשׁוֹר.
human_translation: And to what entered our minds initially, a coin exchange, what How so; this is what is saying: but produce, can also effect exchange. How so? one exchanged an ox for a cow, or a donkey for an ox,
llm_translation: And for what does his mind depart from the outset? - currency. What is "how"? This is what he is saying, and the fruits of the tree also perform exchanges, how - he exchanged an ox for a cow or a donkey for an ox.

hebrew_text: הָנִיחָא לְרַב שֵׁשֶׁת, דְּאָמַר פֵּירֵי עָבְדִי חֲלִיפִין, אֶלָּא לְרַב נַחְמָן, דְּאָמַר: כְּלִי – אִין, אֲבָל פֵּירֵי לָא עָבְדִי חֲלִיפִין, מַאי ״כֵּיצַד״?
human_translation: This works out well according to Rav Sheshet, who said: Produce effects exchange. But according to Rav Naḥman, who said: A vessel, yes, but produce does not effect exchange, what How so?
llm_translation: The text reads: "He left it for Rav Sheshet, for he said: the fruits of my slaves are exchangeable. Rather, for Rav Nachman, for he said: a vessel - no, but the fruits are not exchangeable. What is the meaning of 'how'?"

hebrew_text: הָכִי קָאָמַר: יֵשׁ דָּמִים שֶׁהֵן כַּחֲלִיפִין, כֵּיצַד? הֶחְלִיף דְּמֵי שׁוֹר בְּפָרָה אוֹ דְמֵי חֲמוֹר בְּשׁוֹר.
human_translation: this is saying: There is money that is like exchange. How so? one exchanged monetary an ox for a cow, or monetary a donkey for an ox.
llm_translation: Thus he said: There are bloods that are like substitutions, how so? He substituted the blood of an ox for that of a cow, or the blood of a donkey for that of an ox.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמֵיהּ דְּרַב נַחְמָן? סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן. דְּאָמַר: דְּבַר תּוֹרָה מָעוֹת קוֹנוֹת. וּמִפְּנֵי מָה אָמְרוּ מְשִׁיכָה קוֹנָה – גְּזֵירָה שֶׁמָּא יֹאמַר לוֹ: נִשְׂרְפוּ חִטֶּיךָ בָּעֲלִיָּיה.
human_translation: What is the reason of Rav Naḥman? holds in accordance with Rabbi Yoḥanan, who says: By Torah law money effects acquisition, And for what reason did say pulling acquires decree lest say to Your wheat was burned in the upper story.
llm_translation: What is the reason of Rav Nachman? He holds like Rabbi Yochanan, who said: "A word of Torah acquires." And why did they say that pulling acquires? As a preventive measure, lest one say to him: "Your wheat has been burned in my possession."

hebrew_text: וּמִלְּתָא דִּשְׁכִיחָא – גְּזַרוּ בֵּיהּ רַבָּנַן. מִלְּתָא דְּלָא שְׁכִיחָא – לָא גְּזַרוּ בֵּיהּ רַבָּנַן.
human_translation: And with regard to a common matter the Sages issued a decree, with regard to an uncommon matter, the Sages did not issue a decree.
llm_translation: The matter that is common - the Rabbis decreed upon it. The matter that is not common - the Rabbis did not decree upon it.

hebrew_text: וּלְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ דְּאָמַר מְשִׁיכָה מְפוֹרֶשֶׁת מִן הַתּוֹרָה, הָנִיחָא אִי סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַב שֵׁשֶׁת, מְתָרֵץ לַהּ כְּרַב שֵׁשֶׁת.
human_translation: And according to Reish Lakish, who says pulling explicitly in the Torah? This works out well if holds in accordance with Rav Sheshet, explain in accordance with Rav Sheshet.
llm_translation: And to Reish Lakish who said: "Explicit drawing from the Torah," leave it be. If he thinks like Rav Sheshet, he resolves it like Rav Sheshet.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אִי סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַב נַחְמָן, דְּאָמַר: פֵּירֵי לָא עָבְדִי חֲלִיפִין וּמַטְבֵּעַ לָא קָנֵי, הֵיכִי מְתָרֵץ לַהּ? עַל כֻּרְחָךְ כְּרַב שֵׁשֶׁת מְתָרֵץ לַהּ.
human_translation: But if he holds in accordance with Rav Naḥman, who says produce does not effect exchange and a coin does not effect acquisition how does he explain Perforce explains in accordance with Rav Sheshet.
llm_translation: Rather, if he holds like Rav Nachman, who said: "I did not make exchanges with produce, and I did not acquire coins, how does he explain it to her? By force, like Rav Sheshet explains it to her."

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: כׇּל הַמִּטַּלְטְלִין קוֹנִין זֶה אֶת זֶה. וְאָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: וַאֲפִילּוּ כִּיס מָלֵא מָעוֹת בְּכִיס מָלֵא מָעוֹת! תַּרְגְּמָא רַב אַחָא: בְּדִינָר אַנְ[יָ]קָא וַאֲנִיגְרָא, אֶחָד שֶׁפְּסָלַתּוּ מַלְכוּת, וְאֶחָד שֶׁפְּסָלַתּוּ מְדִינָה.
human_translation: We learned all movable property, each acquires the other. And Reish Lakish says: even pouch full of coins for pouch full of coins. Rav Aḥa interpreted with anka and with anigera dinars. One that the kingdom invalidated, and one that a province invalidated,
llm_translation: We learned in the Mishnah: All movable objects acquire ownership for one another. And Reish Lakish said: Even if one purse is full of coins and another purse is full of coins! Rav Acha translated: With a dinar of Aniqa and a dinar of Inigra, one that was invalidated by a kingdom, and one that was invalidated by a province.

hebrew_text: וּצְרִיכָא, דְּאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן פְּסָלַתּוּ מַלְכוּת – מִשּׁוּם דְּלָא סָגֵי כְּלָל. אֲבָל פְּסָלַתּוּ מְדִינָה, דְּסָגֵי לֵיהּ בִּמְדִינָה אַחֲרִיתִי – אֵימָא אַכַּתִּי מַטְבֵּעַ הוּא וְאֵין מַטְבֵּעַ נִקְנֶה בַּחֲלִיפִין.
human_translation: And necessary as, if taught us the kingdom invalidated, due to that it does not circulate at all, But a province invalidated, which circulates in a different state, say its is still a coin, and money cannot be acquired by means of exchange.
llm_translation: And it is necessary, for if we were to hear that his statue is of royalty - because it does not reach the general rule. But if his statue is of a province, for it reaches him in another province - say perhaps it is a counterfeit and a counterfeit is not acquired with exchanges.

hebrew_text: וְאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן פְּסָלַתּוּ מְדִינָה – מִשּׁוּם דְּלָא סָגֵי לֵיהּ לָא בְּצִנְעָא וְלָא בְּפַרְהֶסְיָא. אֲבָל פְּסָלַתּוּ מַלְכוּת, דְּסָגֵי לֵיהּ בְּצִנְעָא – אֵימָא אַכַּתִּי מַטְבֵּעַ הוּא, וְאֵין מַטְבֵּעַ נִקְנֶה בַּחֲלִיפִין. צְרִיכָא.
human_translation: And if taught us a province invalidated, due to that it neither circulates in private nor in public, But the kingdom invalidated, which circulate in private, say its is still a coin, and money cannot be acquired by means of exchange. necessary
llm_translation: And if we were to hear that his idol is from a province - because it is not fitting for it neither in private nor in public. But if his idol is from a kingdom, for it is fitting for it in private - we might say that it is a coin, and a coin is not acquired through exchange. This is necessary.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: ״מְכוֹר לִי בְּאֵלּוּ״, קָנָה,
human_translation: Rabba says Rav Huna says: Sell me for these acquired
llm_translation: Rabba said, Rav Huna said: "Sell to me with these," he acquires.

hebrew_text: וְיֵשׁ לוֹ עָלָיו אוֹנָאָה.
human_translation: And has exploitation against
llm_translation: And there is upon him ona'ah.

hebrew_text: קָנָה – אַף עַל גַּב דְּלָא מָשַׁךְ, דְּכֵיוָן דְּלָא קָפֵיד – קָנָה, דְּכִי חֲלִיפִין דָּמֵי. וְיֵשׁ לוֹ עָלָיו אוֹנָאָה – דִּ״מְכוֹר לִי בְּאֵלּוּ״ קָאָמַר לֵיהּ. רַב אַבָּא אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: ״מְכוֹר לִי בְּאֵלּוּ״ – קָנָה, וְאֵין לוֹ עָלָיו אוֹנָאָה.
human_translation: acquires even though he did not pull because since is not particular acquired as similar exchange. And has exploitation against because said to him: Sell me for these Rav Abba Rav Huna says Sell me for these acquired and has no exploitation against
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Kanah - af al gav de'lau mashach, de'keivun de'lau kapeid - kanah, de'khi chalifin damei. Ve'yesh lo alav ona'ah - di'mekhor li be'elu" ka'amar lei. Rav Abba amar Rav Huna: "Mekhor li be'elu" - kanah, ve'ein lo alav ona'ah. English translation: "He acquired - even though he did not pull, since he is not particular - he acquired, for the exchange of value. And he has upon him ona'ah - 'sell to me with these' he says to him. Rav Abba said in the name of Rav Huna: 'Sell to me with these' - he acquired, and he has no ona'ah upon him."

hebrew_text: פְּשִׁיטָא: דָּמִים וְאֵין מַקְפִּיד עֲלֵיהֶן – הָא קָאָמְרִינַן דְּקָנֵי, דְּכַחֲלִיפִין דָּמוּ. חֲלִיפִין וּמַקְפִּיד עֲלֵיהֶן, מַאי?
human_translation: obvious money and is not particular about we say that acquires as similar exchange. exchange and is particular that what
llm_translation: The blood, and not particular about them - this is what we say, that they acquire, for they exchange blood. They exchange and are particular about them, what?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אַדָּא בַּר אַהֲבָה, תָּא שְׁמַע: הֲרֵי שֶׁהָיָה תּוֹפֵשׂ פָּרָתוֹ וְעוֹמֵד, וּבָא חֲבֵירוֹ וְאָמַר לוֹ: פָּרָתְךָ לָמָּה? לַחֲמוֹר אֲנִי צָרִיךְ. יֵשׁ לִי חֲמוֹר שֶׁאֲנִי נוֹתֵן לְךָ. פָּרָתְךָ בְּכַמָּה? בְּכָךְ וְכָךְ. חֲמוֹרְךָ בְּכַמָּה? בְּכָךְ וְכָךְ.
human_translation: Rav Adda bar Ahava says: Come hear There is was grasping his cow and standing and another came and said to him: Why your cow I need a donkey, I have a donkey that I give you; for how much your cow? for such and such For how much your donkey? for such and such
llm_translation: Rav Adda bar Ahava said: Come and hear: If one was holding his cow and standing, and his friend came and said to him, "Why do you need your cow? I need a donkey." "I have a donkey that I can give you." "How much is your cow worth?" "So much." "How much is your donkey worth?" "So much."

hebrew_text: מָשַׁךְ בַּעַל הַחֲמוֹר אֶת הַפָּרָה, וְלֹא הִסְפִּיק בַּעַל הַפָּרָה לִמְשׁוֹךְ אֶת הַחֲמוֹר עַד שֶׁמֵּת הַחֲמוֹר – לֹא קָנָה בַּעַל הַחֲמוֹר אֶת הַפָּרָה.
human_translation: the owner of the donkey pulled the cow, but the owner of the cow did not manage to pull the donkey before the donkey died, the owner of the donkey did not acquire the cow,
llm_translation: The owner of the donkey pulled the cow, and the owner of the cow did not manage to pull the donkey until the donkey died - the owner of the donkey did not acquire the cow.

hebrew_text: שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: חֲלִיפִין וּמַקְפִּיד עֲלֵיהֶן – לֹא קָנָה.
human_translation: Learn from it exchange and is particular that he does not acquire
llm_translation: Listen to the conclusion: If one exchanges and is particular about them - he did not acquire.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: אַטּוּ חֲלִיפִין בְּשׁוּפְטָנֵי עָסְקִינַן, דְּלָא קָפְדִי? אֶלָּא כׇּל חֲלִיפִין מִיקְפָּד קָפְדִי וְקָנָה. וְהָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן – דַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ: חֲמוֹר בְּפָרָה וְטָלֶה, וּמָשַׁךְ אֶת הַפָּרָה וַעֲדַיִין לֹא מָשַׁךְ אֶת הַטָּלֶה, דְּלָא הָוֵה לֵיהּ מְשִׁיכָה מַעַלְיָא.
human_translation: Rava said: Is that to say exchange we are dealing with fools, who are not particular Rather, every exchange, are particular and acquires And with what are we dealing here? where said to a donkey for a cow and a lamb, and pulled the cow and did not yet pull the lamb, as he has not a proper pulling.
llm_translation: Rava said: Are we dealing with exchanges in the courts so that he is not particular? Rather, every exchange he is particular and acquires. And here, what are we dealing with? - that he said to him: A donkey with a cow and a calf, and he pulled the cow and has not yet pulled the calf, as there was no pulling above.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: ״מְכוֹר לִי בְּאֵלּוּ״ – קָנָה, וְיֵשׁ לוֹ עָלָיו אוֹנָאָה. לֵימָא סָבַר רַב הוּנָא מַטְבֵּעַ נַעֲשֶׂה חֲלִיפִין?
human_translation: The Master, said Sell me for these acquired and has a exploitation against Let us say that Rav Huna holds a coin can be exchange.
llm_translation: Master said: "Sell to me with these" - he acquires, and he has upon it ona'ah. Let us say, perhaps Rav Huna holds that a coin can become a substitute?

hebrew_text: לָא, רַב הוּנָא סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן דְּאָמַר: דְּבַר תּוֹרָה מָעוֹת קוֹנוֹת. וּמִפְּנֵי מָה אָמְרוּ מְשִׁיכָה קוֹנָה – גְּזֵירָה שֶׁמָּא יֹאמַר לוֹ נִשְׂרְפוּ חִטֶּיךָ בַּעֲלִיָּיה. מִלְּתָא דִּשְׁכִיחָא – גְּזַרוּ בַּהּ רַבָּנַן, וּמִלְּתָא דְּלָא שְׁכִיחָא – לָא גְּזַרוּ בַּהּ רַבָּנַן. אֲמַר לֵיהּ מָר הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב נַחְמָן לְרַב אָשֵׁי: אַתּוּן, הָכִי מַתְנִיתוּ לַהּ, אֲנַן הָכִי מַתְנֵינַן לַהּ: וְכֵן אָמַר רַב הוּנָא, אֵין מַטְבֵּעַ נַעֲשֶׂה חֲלִיפִין.
human_translation: No, Rav Huna holds in accordance with Rabbi Yoḥanan, who says: By Torah law money effects acquisition. And for what reason did say pulling acquires decree lest say to Your wheat was burned in the upper story. And with regard to a common matter the Sages issued a decree, but with regard to an uncommon matter the Sages did not issue a decree. Mar Huna, son of Rav Naḥman, said to Rav Ashi: You teach in that we teach it in this And likewise, Rav Huna said: Money cannot be exchange.
llm_translation: No, Rav Huna holds like Rabbi Yochanan who said: "A Torah matter acquires ownership." And why did they say that pulling acquires ownership? As a preventive measure lest one say to his neighbor, "Your wheat burned in my house." Regarding a common matter, the Rabbis enacted a decree, and regarding an uncommon matter, the Rabbis did not enact a decree. Mar Huna said to Rav Ashi, son of Rav Nachman: "You, this is how you teach it to her, and we teach it to her like this: And so said Rav Huna, a coin does not become a substitute."

hebrew_text: בַּמֶּה קוֹנִין?
human_translation: With what does one acquire
llm_translation: In what can one acquire?

hebrew_text: רַב אָמַר: בְּכִלְיוֹ שֶׁל קוֹנֶה. דְּנִיחָא לֵיהּ לְקוֹנֶה דְּלֶהֱוֵי מַקְנֶה קוֹנֶה, כִּי הֵיכִי דְּלִגְמַר וְלַקְנֵי לֵיהּ. וְלֵוִי אָמַר: בְּכִלְיוֹ שֶׁל מַקְנֶה, כִּדְבָעֵינַן לְמֵימַר לְקַמַּן.
human_translation: Rav says: with the vessels of the one acquiring that the one acquiring is amenable to having the one transferring ownership acquire so that he will resolve to transfer ownership to him. And Levi says: by the vessels of the one transferring ownership, as we seek to explain below.
llm_translation: Rav said: In the vessel of the buyer. It is preferable for the buyer that it should be in the vessel of the buyer, so that he can complete it and acquire it. And Levi said: In the vessel of the seller, as we will say later on.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב הוּנָא מִדִּסְקַרְתָּא לְרָבָא: וּלְלֵוִי, דְּאָמַר בְּכִלְיוֹ שֶׁל מַקְנֶה, הָא קָא קָנֵי אַרְעָא אַגַּב גְּלִימָא. אִם כֵּן, הָווּ לֵיהּ נְכָסִים שֶׁיֵּשׁ לָהֶן אַחְרָיוּת וְנִקְנִין עִם נְכָסִים שֶׁאֵין לָהֶן אַחְרָיוּת. וַאֲנַן אִיפְּכָא תְּנַן: נְכָסִים שֶׁאֵין לָהֶן אַחְרָיוּת נִקְנִין עִם נְכָסִים שֶׁיֵּשׁ לָהֶן אַחְרָיוּת!
human_translation: Rav Huna from Diskarta said to Rava: But according to Levi, who says with the vessels of the one transferring ownership, that acquiring land by means of a cloak. If so, is property that is guaranteed, and it is acquired with property that is not guaranteed, And we learned the opposite Property that is not guaranteed is acquired with property that is guaranteed,
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Huna from Diskarta to Rava: And to Levi, who said regarding the vessel of livestock, here he acquires land with a cloak. If so, he would have assets that have succession and can be acquired with assets that do not have succession. And we learned the opposite: assets that do not have succession can be acquired with assets that have succession!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִי הֲוָה לֵוִי הָכָא, הֲוָה מַפֵּיק לְאַפָּךְ פּוּלְסֵי דְנוּרָא! מִי סָבְרַתְּ גְּלִימָא מַקְנֵה לֵיהּ? בְּהָהִיא הֲנָאָה דְּקָא מְקַבֵּל מִינֵּיהּ – גָּמַר וּמַקְנֵי לֵיהּ.
human_translation: said to him: If Levi, were here, he would take out rods of fire before you Do you maintain cloak he transfers ownership to him? in that pleasure accepted it from him, he resolves to transfer ownership to him.
llm_translation: He said to him: If Levi were here, he would bring out the flasks of wine! Do you think a cloak acquires it for him? In that case, the benefit he receives from it - he acquires and acquires it for him.

hebrew_text: כְּתַנָּאֵי: ״וְזֹאת לְפָנִים בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל עַל הַגְּאוּלָּה וְעַל הַתְּמוּרָה לְקַיֵּם כׇּל דָּבָר שָׁלַף אִישׁ נַעֲלוֹ וְנָתַן לְרֵעֵהוּ״. ״גְּאוּלָּה״ – זוֹ מְכִירָה, וְכֵן הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״לֹא יִגָּאֵל״. ״תְּמוּרָה״ – זוֹ חֲלִיפִין, וְכֵן הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״לֹא יַחֲלִיפֶנּוּ וְלֹא יָמִיר אוֹתוֹ״.
human_translation: parallel to tanna’im . “Now this was the custom in former time in Israel concerning redemption and concerning substitution, to confirm all matters; a man drew off his shoe, and gave it to his neighbor” “Redemption”; that is a sale. And likewise it says: nor shall be redeemed” “Substitution”; that is exchange. And likewise it says: “He may neither exchange it nor substitute it”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "As the Tannaim taught: 'And this is the law in Israel concerning redemption and exchange, to fulfill every matter: if a man draws off his shoe and gives it to his fellow.' 'Redemption' - this refers to sale, as it says: 'He shall not redeem.' 'Exchange' - this refers to substitutions, as it says: 'He shall not exchange it or make a substitution for it.'" English translation:

hebrew_text: ״לְקַיֵּם כׇּל דָּבָר שָׁלַף אִישׁ נַעֲלוֹ וְנָתַן לְרֵעֵהוּ״. מִי נָתַן לְמִי? בּוֹעַז נָתַן לַגּוֹאֵל. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: גּוֹאֵל נָתַן לְבוֹעַז.
human_translation: “To confirm all matters; a man drew off his shoe, and gave it to his neighbor,” Who gave to whom? Boaz gave to the redeemer, Rabbi Yehuda says: redeemer gave to Boaz.
llm_translation: "To fulfill every matter that a man drew off his shoe and gave to his fellow." Who gave to whom? Boaz gave to the redeemer. Rabbi Yehuda says: The redeemer gave to Boaz.

hebrew_text: תָּנָא: קוֹנִין בִּכְלִי אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵין בּוֹ שָׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה. אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא בִּכְלִי, אֲבָל בְּפֵירֵי – לָא. רַב שֵׁשֶׁת אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ בְּפֵירוֹת. מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַב נַחְמָן? אָמַר קְרָא ״נַעֲלוֹ״, נַעַל – אִין, מִידֵּי אַחֲרִינָא – לָא.
human_translation: was taught: One can acquire by a vessel, even if it does not value of one peruta . Rav Naḥman says: taught only by a vessel, but not by produce, Rav Sheshet says: even by produce. What is the reason of Rav Naḥman? The verse states: “His shoe” a shoe yes, item other no,
llm_translation: Mishnah: One may acquire an item with a vessel, even though it does not contain a perutah. Rav Nachman said: They only taught this regarding a vessel, but with produce – no. Rav Sheshet said: Even with produce. What is the reason for Rav Nachman's opinion? He said: The verse states "his shoe," indicating his shoe – yes, from others – no.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמֵיהּ דְּרַב שֵׁשֶׁת, אָמַר קְרָא: ״לְקַיֵּם כׇּל דָּבָר״. לְרַב נַחְמָן נָמֵי, הָכְתִיב: ״לְקַיֵּם כׇּל דָּבָר״! הַהוּא לְקַיֵּם כׇּל דָּבָר, דְּנִיקְנִין בְּמִנְעָל. וְרַב שֵׁשֶׁת נָמֵי, הָכְתִיב: ״נַעֲלוֹ״! אָמַר לְךָ רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: מָה נַעֲלוֹ דָּבָר הַמְסוּיָּים – אַף כׇּל דָּבָר הַמְסוּיָּים, לְאַפּוֹקֵי חֲצִי רִמּוֹן וַחֲצִי אֱגוֹז, דְּלָא.
human_translation: What is the reason of Rav Sheshet? The verse states: “To confirm all matters,” According to Rav Naḥman as well, isn’t it written: “To confirm all matters”? that “To confirm all matters,” that can be acquired by a shoe. And Rav Sheshet as well, isn’t it written: “His shoe”? Rav Sheshet said to you Just as his shoe is a complete item, so too, every complete item to exclude half a pomegranate and half a nut, which cannot
llm_translation: What is the reason for Rav Sheshet's opinion? The verse says: "to fulfill every matter." To Rav Nachman the son of, it is written: "to fulfill every matter"! That one to fulfill every matter, that they are acquired with a shoe. And Rav Sheshet the son of, it is written: "his shoe"! Rav Sheshet said to you: Just as his shoe is a specific item - so too every specific item, excluding half a pomegranate and half a walnut, not.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אִידִי: כְּמַאן כָּתְבִינַן הָאִידָּנָא ״בְּמָנָא דְּכָשַׁר לְמִקְנְיָא בֵּיהּ״. ״בְּמָנָא״ – לְאַפּוֹקֵי מִדְּרַב שֵׁשֶׁת, דְּאָמַר קוֹנִין בְּפֵירוֹת. ״דְּכָשַׁר״ – לְאַפּוֹקֵי מִדִּשְׁמוּאֵל, דְּאָמַר קוֹנִין
human_translation: Rav Sheshet, son of Rav Idi, said: In accordance with whose do we write today with a vessel that is fit to acquire with it? with a vessel to exclude of Rav Sheshet, says: One acquires by produce. that is fit to exclude of Shmuel, who says: One acquires
llm_translation: Rav Sheshet, son of Rav Idi, said: In whose name did we write this? In the name of the Mishnah that is valid for acquisition. "In the name of" – to exclude Rav Sheshet, for he said one acquires through produce. "Valid" – to exclude Shmuel, for he said one acquires.

hebrew_text: בְּמָרוֹקָא. ״לְמִקְנְיָא״ – לְאַפּוֹקֵי מִדְּלֵוִי, דְּאָמַר בְּכִלְיוֹ שֶׁל מַקְנֶה, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן ״לְמִקְנְיָא״ וְלָא ״לְ[אַ]קְנוֹיֵי״. ״בֵּיהּ״ – רַב פָּפָּא אָמַר: לְמַעוֹטֵי מַטְבֵּעַ. וְרַב זְבִיד, וְאִיתֵּימָא רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: לְמַעוֹטֵי אִיסּוּרֵי הֲנָאָה.
human_translation: with date pits to acquire to exclude of Levi, who says by means of the vessels of the one transferring ownership teaches us to acquire and not to transfer ownership With it, Rav Pappa said: to exclude a coin, And Rav Zevid, and some say Rav Ashi, said: to exclude items from which benefit is prohibited.
llm_translation: In Maroka. "Lemikneya" - to exclude from the obligation of lending, for it was stated regarding the vessel of a herd, it teaches us "lemikneya" and not "leakneyei." "Beih" - Rav Papa said: to exclude foreign currency. And Rav Zevid, and some say Rav Ashei said: to exclude prohibitions of benefit.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: ״בֵּיהּ״ – אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: לְמַעוֹטֵי מַטְבֵּעַ. ״דְּכָשַׁר״ – אָמַר רַב זְבִיד, וְאִיתֵּימָא רַב אָשֵׁי: לְמַעוֹטֵי אִיסּוּרֵי הֲנָאָה. אֲבָל מוֹרִיקָא לָא אִצְטְרִיךְ.
human_translation: Some say With it, Rav Pappa said: to exclude a coin, That is fit, Rav Zevid, and some say Rav Ashi, said: to exclude items from which benefit is prohibited. But date pits not necessary,
llm_translation: There are those who say: "Beih" - Rav Papa said: to exclude coins. "Dekashar" - Rav Zevid said, and some say Rav Ashe: to exclude forbidden benefits. But Morika is not necessary.

hebrew_text: אֲסִימוֹן קוֹנֶה אֶת הַמַּטְבֵּעַ וְכוּ׳. מַאי ״אֲסִימוֹן״? אָמַר רַב: מָעוֹת הַנִּיתָּנוֹת בְּסִימָן לְבֵית הַמֶּרְחָץ.
human_translation: an asimon , acquires the coin. What an asimon ? Rav said: coins given as a token into the bathhouse,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Asimon koneh et ha'matbea v'chu. Mai 'asimon'? Amar Rav: ma'ot ha'nitannot b'siman l'veit ha'merchatz." English translation: "A coin acquires the coin and so forth. What is 'asimon'? Rav said: money given with a sign for the bathhouse."

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: אֵין מְחַלְּלִין מַעֲשֵׂר שֵׁנִי עַל אֲסִימוֹן וְלֹא עַל מָעוֹת הַנִּיתָּנוֹת בְּסִימָן לְבֵית הַמֶּרְחָץ. מִכְּלַל דַּאֲסִימוֹן לָאו מָעוֹת הַנִּיתָּנוֹת בְּסִימָן לְבֵית הַמֶּרְחָץ! וְכִי תֵּימָא פָּרוֹשֵׁי קָמְפָרֵשׁ – וְהָא לָא תַּנָּא הָכִי: מְחַלְּלִין מַעֲשֵׂר שֵׁנִי עַל אֲסִימוֹן, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי דּוֹסָא. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אֵין מְחַלְּלִין. וְשָׁוִין שֶׁאֵין מְחַלְּלִין עַל מָעוֹת הַנִּיתָּנוֹת בְּסִימָן לְבֵית הַמֶּרְחָץ!
human_translation: raises an objection One desacralizes second-tithe neither with an asimon nor with coins given as a token into the bathhouse. by inference that an asimon is not coins given as tokens in a bathhouse. And if you would say is explaining But wasn’t it taught like this: One desacralizes second-tithe with an asimon ; the statement of Rabbi Dosa. And the Rabbis say: One does not desacralize And they agree that one does not desacralize onto coins given as a token into the bathhouse.
llm_translation: The question was raised: One does not redeem Second Tithe with a promissory note, nor with coins designated for the bathhouse. From the inference that a promissory note is not like coins designated for the bathhouse! And if you might say that the Sages of Camparsh interpreted it differently - but did not the Mishnah teach thus: One redeems Second Tithe with a promissory note, the words of Rabbi Dosa. And the Sages say: One does not redeem. And it is equal that one does not redeem with coins designated for the bathhouse!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מַאי אֲסִימוֹן – פּוּלְסָא. וְאַזְדָּא רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן לְטַעְמֵיהּ, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: רַבִּי דּוֹסָא וְרַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל אָמְרוּ דָּבָר אֶחָד, רַבִּי דּוֹסָא – הָא דַּאֲמַרַן. רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל מַאי הִיא, דְּתַנְיָא: ״וְצַרְתָּ הַכֶּסֶף בְּיָדְךָ״ – לְרַבּוֹת כׇּל דָּבָר הַנִּצְרָר בַּיָּד, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל. רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: לְרַבּוֹת כׇּל דָּבָר שֶׁיֵּשׁ עָלָיו צוּרָה.
human_translation: Rather, Rabbi Yoḥanan said: What an asimon ? a blank, And Rabbi Yoḥanan follows his reasoning, as Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Rabbi Dosa and Rabbi Yishmael said the same thing. Rabbi Dosa, as we stated, Rabbi Yishmael, what is as it is taught “And you shall bind up [ vetzarta ] the money in your hand” to include any type that is bound [ hanitzrar ] in hand, the statement of Rabbi Yishmael. Rabbi Akiva says: to include any type that has an imprint [ tzura ].
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Rather, Rabbi Yochanan said: What is the meaning of "asimon"? - A coin. And Rabbi Yochanan reconciled his statements, for Rabbi Yochanan said: Rabbi Dosa and Rabbi Yishmael said one thing, Rabbi Dosa - this is what we said. What is Rabbi Yishmael's opinion? As it was taught: "And you shall have money in your hand" - to include anything that is shaped in the hand, the words of Rabbi Yishmael. Rabbi Akiva says: to include anything that has a form.

hebrew_text: כֵּיצַד: מָשַׁךְ הֵימֶנּוּ פֵּירוֹת וְלֹא נָתַן לוֹ מָעוֹת – אֵינוֹ יָכוֹל לַחֲזוֹר בּוֹ וְכוּ׳. אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: דְּבַר תּוֹרָה מָעוֹת קוֹנוֹת, וּמִפְּנֵי מָה אָמְרוּ מְשִׁיכָה קוֹנָה – גְּזֵירָה שֶׁמָּא יֹאמַר לוֹ ״נִשְׂרְפוּ חִטֶּיךָ בָּעֲלִיָּיה״.
human_translation: How so? pulled produce from but did not give coins, he cannot renege By Torah law money effects acquisition, And for what reason did say pulling acquires decree lest say to Your wheat was burned in the upper story.
llm_translation: How: he pulled from him fruits and did not give him money - he cannot retract and so on. Rabbi Yochanan said: Torah matters acquire money, and why did they say that pulling acquires - a decree lest he say "your wheat burned in my possession."

hebrew_text: סוֹף סוֹף, מַאן דִּשְׁדָא דְּלֵיקָה בָּעֵי שַׁלּוֹמֵי! אֶלָּא: גְּזֵירָה שֶׁמָּא תִּפּוֹל דְּלֵיקָה בְּאוֹנֶס. אִי מוֹקְמַתְּ לְהוּ בִּרְשׁוּתֵיהּ – מָסַר נַפְשֵׁיהּ, טָרַח וּמַצֵּיל. וְאִי לָא – לָא מָסַר נַפְשֵׁיהּ, טָרַח וּמַצֵּיל.
human_translation: Ultimately, the one who ignited the fire is required to pay Rather, decree lest a fire be ignited due to circumstances beyond control, If you establish in possession he will expend effort, exert himself, and rescue But if not he will not expend effort, exert himself, and rescue
llm_translation: At the end of the day, one who kindles a flame requires peace offerings! Rather, it is a precaution lest the flame fall due to an accident. If it is in his domain – he risks his life, exerts effort, and saves. But if not – he does not risk his life, exerts effort, and saves.

hebrew_text: רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אָמַר: מְשִׁיכָה מְפוֹרֶשֶׁת מִן הַתּוֹרָה. מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ? אָמַר קְרָא: ״וְכִי תִמְכְּרוּ מִמְכָּר לַעֲמִיתֶךָ אוֹ קָנֹה מִיַּד עֲמִיתֶךָ״, דָּבָר הַנִּקְנֶה מִיָּד לְיָד.
human_translation: Reish Lakish says: pulling is explicit in the Torah, What is the reason of Reish Lakish? the verse states: “And if you sell to your colleague an item that is sold, or acquire from your colleague’s hand, an item that is acquired from hand to hand,
llm_translation: Reish Lakish said: Drawing explicitly from the Torah. What is the reason for Reish Lakish? The verse says: "And if you make a sale to your neighbor or buy from your neighbor's hand," a matter acquired from hand to hand.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: ״מִיַּד״ – לְמַעוֹטֵי קַרְקַע, דְּלֵית בַּהּ אוֹנָאָה.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan said: “from hand” to exclude land, which is not exploitation
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: "Immediately" - to exclude the ground, which does not contain interest.

hebrew_text: וְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ, אִם כֵּן לִכְתּוֹב קְרָא: ״וְכִי תִמְכְּרוּ מִמְכָּר מִיַּד עֲמִיתֶךָ אַל תּוֹנוּ״, ״אוֹ קָנֹה״ לְמָה לִי? שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ לִמְשִׁיכָה.
human_translation: And Reish Lakish if so let the verse write: And if you sell, from your colleague’s hand, an item that is sold, you shall not exploit. Why do I “or acquire”? Learn from it by means of pulling.
llm_translation: Reish Lakish, if so it is written in the verse: "And if you sell anything to your neighbor or buy from your neighbor's hand, you shall not wrong one another," "or acquire," why do I need it? Learn from it for the principle of extension.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: ״אוֹ קָנֹה״ מַאי עָבֵיד לֵיהּ? מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ, לְכִדְתַנְיָא: ״וְכִי תִמְכְּרוּ מִמְכָּר אַל תּוֹנוּ״, אֵין לִי אֶלָּא שֶׁנִּתְאַנָּה לוֹקֵחַ, נִתְאַנָּה מוֹכֵר מִנַּיִן? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״אוֹ קָנֹה אַל תּוֹנוּ״.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan, what does he do with “or acquire”? He requires for that which is taught “And if you sell an item that is sold…you shall not exploit,” I have only where the buyer was exploited. From where seller was exploited? The verse states: “Or acquire…you shall not exploit,”
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan: "Or acquire," what does he do with it? He requires it, as it was taught: "And if you sell anything to your neighbor or buy from your neighbor's hand, you shall not wrong one another" (Leviticus 25:14). I only know that the buyer is warned, from where do we know that the seller is warned? The Talmud teaches: "Or acquire, you shall not wrong."

hebrew_text: וְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: תַּרְתֵּי גָּמַר מִינֵּיהּ.
human_translation: And Reish Lakish He derives two from
llm_translation: And Reish Lakish: two learnings from it.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: כֹּל שֶׁהַכֶּסֶף בְּיָדוֹ – יָדוֹ עַל הָעֶלְיוֹנָה. מוֹכֵר הוּא דְּמָצֵי הָדַר בֵּיהּ, לוֹקֵחַ לָא מָצֵי הָדַר בֵּיהּ. אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא מָעוֹת קוֹנוֹת – מִשּׁוּם הָכִי מוֹכֵר מָצֵי הָדַר בֵּיהּ, לוֹקֵחַ לָא מָצֵי הָדַר בֵּיהּ. אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ מָעוֹת אֵינָן קוֹנוֹת – לוֹקֵחַ נָמֵי לִיהְדַּר בֵּיהּ!
human_translation: We learned Rabbi Shimon says: Anyone who has the money in his possession has the advantage. seller who can retract buyer cannot retract Granted, if you say money effects acquisition due to that seller can retract buyer cannot retract But if you say that money does not effect acquisition let buyer also renege
llm_translation: We learned in the Mishnah: Rabbi Shimon says: "Anyone who has money in his hand - his hand is on top. If he is a seller, he finds beauty in it; if he is a buyer, he does not find beauty in it. If you say that coins acquire - for this reason, a seller finds beauty in it, but a buyer does not find beauty in it. Rather, if you say that coins do not acquire - a buyer should also find beauty in it!"

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָךְ רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: אַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן – לָא קָאָמֵינָא, כִּי קָאָמֵינָא – אַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבָּנַן.
human_translation: Reish Lakish said to you: I did not state in accordance with of Rabbi Shimon; when I stated in accordance with of the Rabbis.
llm_translation: He said to you, Reish Lakish: In the opinion of Rabbi Shimon - I am not saying, when I am saying - in the opinion of the Rabbis.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ – הַיְינוּ דְּאִיכָּא בֵּין רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן לְרַבָּנַן. אֶלָּא לְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, מַאי אִיכָּא בֵּין רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן לְרַבָּנַן? אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ דְּרַב חִסְדָּא. דְּאָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: כְּדֶרֶךְ שֶׁתִּקְּנוּ מְשִׁיכָה בַּמּוֹכְרִין כָּךְ תִּקְנוּ מְשִׁיכָה בַּלָּקוֹחוֹת. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן לֵית לֵיהּ דְּרַב חִסְדָּא, רַבָּנַן אִית לְהוּ דְּרַב חִסְדָּא.
human_translation: Granted, according to Reish Lakish, that is between Rabbi Shimon and the Rabbis, But according to Rabbi Yoḥanan, what is there between Rabbi Shimon and the Rabbis? between them is of Rav Ḥisda, as Rav Ḥisda says: Just as instituted pulling for the sellers, likewise, they instituted pulling for the buyers. Rabbi Shimon does not hold of Rav Ḥisda, the Rabbis hold of Rav Ḥisda.
llm_translation: In truth, with regard to Reish Lakish - that is where there is a difference between Rabbi Shimon and the Rabbis. Rather, with regard to Rabbi Yochanan, what is the difference between Rabbi Shimon and the Rabbis? The difference between them is Rav Chisda. For Rav Chisda said: Just as you establish pulling in transactions with sellers, so too establish pulling in transactions with buyers. Rabbi Shimon does not have Rav Chisda, but the Rabbis have Rav Chisda.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: אֲבָל אָמְרוּ, מִי שֶׁפָּרַע מִדּוֹר הַמַּבּוּל – הוּא עָתִיד לִיפָּרַע מִמִּי שֶׁאֵינוֹ עוֹמֵד בְּדִיבּוּרוֹ. אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא מָעוֹת קוֹנוֹת – מִשּׁוּם הָכִי קָאֵי בַּ״אֲבָל״, אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ מָעוֹת אֵינָן קוֹנוֹת, אַמַּאי קָאֵי בַּ״אֲבָל״? מִשּׁוּם דְּבָרִים.
human_translation: We learned But said: He Who exacted payment from the generation of the flood, will exact payment from whoever does not stand by his statement. Granted, if you say money effects acquisition due to that stands subject to But But if you say money does not effect acquisition why does stand subject to But due to a statement
llm_translation: We learned in a Mishnah: However, they said, one who withholds from the generation of the Flood - he is destined to be withheld from one who does not stand by his word. If you say that money acquires - for this reason it stands in the "but," but if you say that money does not acquire, why does it stand in the "but"? Because of words.

hebrew_text: וּבִדְבָרִים מִי קָאֵי בַּ״אֲבָל״? וְהָתַנְיָא,
human_translation: And a statement stand subject to But But isn’t it taught
llm_translation: And in what context is the term "aval" used? And it was taught:

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאָמְרוּ טַלִּית קוֹנָה דִּינַר זָהָב וְאֵין דִּינַר זָהָב קוֹנֶה טַלִּית, מִכׇּל מָקוֹם כָּךְ הֲלָכָה. אֲבָל אָמְרוּ: מִי שֶׁפָּרַע מֵאַנְשֵׁי דּוֹר הַמַּבּוּל וּמֵאַנְשֵׁי דּוֹר הַפְּלַגָּה וּמֵאַנְשֵׁי סְדוֹם וַעֲמוֹרָה וּמִמִּצְרַיִם בַּיָּם – הוּא עָתִיד לִיפָּרַע מִמִּי שֶׁאֵינוֹ עוֹמֵד בְּדִיבּוּרוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: Even though said a garment, acquires a gold dinar, but a gold dinar, does not acquire a garment, in any case, that is halakha But said He Who exacted payment from the people of the generation of the flood, and from the people of the generation of the dispersion, and from the inhabitants of Sodom and Gomorrah, and from the Egyptians in the Sea, will exact payment from whoever does not stand by his statement.
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: Even though they said, "A cloak acquires a golden dinar," and a golden dinar does not acquire a cloak, nevertheless, this is the halakha. But they said: One who refrains from the men of the generation of the Flood, and from the men of the generation of the Tower of Babel, and from the men of Sodom and Gomorrah, and from Egypt at the sea – he is destined to refrain from one who does not stand by his word.

hebrew_text: וְהַנּוֹשֵׂא וְנוֹתֵן בִּדְבָרִים – לֹא קָנָה, וְהַחוֹזֵר בּוֹ – אֵין רוּחַ חֲכָמִים נוֹחָה הֵימֶנּוּ.
human_translation: And one who negotiates, with a statement did not acquire But one who reneges on the Sages are displeased with him.
llm_translation: The one who lifts and gives in words - did not acquire, and the one who returns it - the spirit of the wise does not rest with him.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רָבָא: אָנוּ אֵין לָנוּ אֶלָּא ״אֵין רוּחַ חֲכָמִים נוֹחָה הֵימֶנּוּ״. דְּבָרִים וְאִיכָּא בַּהֲדַיְיהוּ מָעוֹת – קָאֵי בַּ״אֲבָל״. דְּבָרִים וְלֵיכָּא בַּהֲדַיְיהוּ מָעוֹת – לָא קָאֵי בַּ״אֲבָל״.
human_translation: And Rava says: we have only the Sages are displeased with him, a statement and there is money accompanying it, he stands subject to But a statement and there is no money accompanying it, he does not stand subject to But
llm_translation: And Rava said: We have only "the spirit of the wise rests with us." (Proverbs 15:23) When there are matters in which they are equal - it stands in "but." When there are matters in which they are not equal - it does not stand in "but."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא, קְרָא וּמַתְנִיתָא מְסַיַּיע לֵיהּ לְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ. קְרָא, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְכִחֵשׁ בַּעֲמִיתוֹ בְּפִקָּדוֹן אוֹ בִתְשׂוּמֶת יָד אוֹ בְגָזֵל אוֹ עָשַׁק אֶת עֲמִיתוֹ״. ״תְּשׂוּמֶת יָד״ – אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: כְּגוֹן שֶׁיִּחֵד לוֹ כְּלִי לְהַלְוָאָתוֹ. ״עָשַׁק״ – אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: כְּגוֹן שֶׁיִּחֵד לוֹ כְּלִי לְעׇשְׁקוֹ.
human_translation: Rava says: A verse and a baraita support of Reish Lakish A verse, as it is written: “And deal falsely with his colleague in a matter of deposit, or of pledge, or of robbery, or oppressed his colleague” “pledge,” Rav Ḥisda says: where designated a vessel for his loan “oppressed,” Rav Ḥisda says: where designated a vessel for him and in his oppression.
llm_translation: Rava said, a verse and a Mishnah support Reish Lakish. The verse, as it is written: "And he denies his fellow in a deposit or in a pledge or in a robbery or in oppression of his fellow." "A pledge" - Rav Ḥisda said: For example, if he gave him a utensil as collateral. "Oppression" - Rav Ḥisda said: For example, if he gave him a utensil to oppress him.

hebrew_text: וְכִי אַהְדְּרֵיהּ קְרָא, כְּתִיב: ״וְהָיָה כִּי יֶחֱטָא וְאָשֵׁם וְהֵשִׁיב אֶת הַגְּזֵלָה אֲשֶׁר גָּזָל אוֹ אֶת הָעֹשֶׁק אֲשֶׁר עָשָׁק אוֹ אֶת הַפִּקָּדוֹן אֲשֶׁר הׇפְקַד אִתּוֹ״, וְאִילּוּ תְּשׂוּמֶת יָד לָא אַהְדְּרֵיהּ, מַאי טַעְמָא? לָאו מִשּׁוּם דִּמְחַסְּרָא מְשִׁיכָה?
human_translation: And when the verse repeats it is written: “And then it shall be, if he has sinned, and is guilty, that he shall restore that which he took by robbery, or the thing that he has gotten by oppression, or the deposit that was deposited with him” while does not repeat “pledge.” What is the reason not because it lacks pulling
llm_translation: He revisited the verse, as it is written: "And it shall be when he sins and becomes guilty, he shall restore the stolen item that he stole, or the extorted item that he extorted, or the deposit that was deposited with him." And if he does not restore, why does he not revisit it? Is it not because it lacks a compelling reason for enforcement?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב פָּפָּא לְרָבָא: אֵימָא מֵעוֹשֶׁק הוּא, דְּאַהְדַּר קְרָא! הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן – כְּגוֹן שֶׁנְּטָלוֹ מִמֶּנּוּ וְחָזַר וְהִפְקִידוֹ אֶצְלוֹ.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said to Rava: Say the verse repeated of oppression. With what are we dealing here? where took from
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Papa to Rava: Say it is from extortion, for the verse supports it! Here, what are we dealing with - for example, when they took from him and he returned and deposited it with him.

hebrew_text: הַיְינוּ פִּקָּדוֹן! תְּרֵי גַּוְנֵי פִּקָּדוֹן.
human_translation: That is a deposit two types of deposit:
llm_translation: This is the meaning of "pikadon"! Two types of "pikadon."

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, תְּשׂוּמֶת יָד נָמֵי לַיהְדְּרֵיהּ, וְלוֹקְמֵיהּ כְּגוֹן שֶׁנְּטָלוֹ הֵימֶנּוּ וְחָזַר וְהִפְקִידוֹ אֶצְלוֹ! אִי אַהְדְּרֵיהּ קְרָא – לָא תְּיוּבְתָּא וְלָא סִיַּיעְתָּא. הַשְׁתָּא דְּלָא אַהְדְּרֵיהּ קְרָא – מְסַיַּיע לֵיהּ.
human_translation: If so, let repeat a pledge as well, and interpret it where took from him and then deposited with If the verse had repeated neither a refutation nor a support Now that does not repeat supports his
llm_translation: If so, the placing of the hand is not effective for him, and his opponents, for example, if he took it from him and then returned and placed it beside him! If he reads his opponent's move - it is neither beneficial nor harmful. But if he does not read his opponent's move - it helps him.

hebrew_text: וּתְשׂוּמֶת יָד לָא אַהְדְּרֵיהּ קְרָא? וְהָתַנְיָא, אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן: מִנַּיִן לִיתֵּן אֶת הָאָמוּר לְמַעְלָה לְמַטָּה, דִּכְתִיב: ״אוֹ מִכֹּל אֲשֶׁר יִשָּׁבַע עָלָיו לַשֶּׁקֶר״, וְאָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר אֲבוּהּ אָמַר רַב: לְרַבּוֹת תְּשׂוּמֶת יָד לְהִישָּׁבוֹן. בְּהֶדְיָא מִיהָא לָא אַהְדְּרֵיהּ קְרָא.
human_translation: And does the verse not repeat a pledge? But isn’t it taught Rabbi Shimon said: From where to apply that which is stated above, below, as it is written: “Or anything about which he has taken a false oath” And Rav Naḥman says Rabba bar Avuh says Rav says: to include of a pledge in return, In any event, the verse did not repeat explicitly,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And is there no placing of the hand to retract the verse? And it was taught: Rabbi Shimon said: From where do we derive to place the stated above the below, as it is written: 'Or by all that a man shall swear falsely by it.' And Rav Nachman said in the name of Rabba bar Avuh said Rav: To include the placing of the hand to retract. Nevertheless, the verse does not retract."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִיתָא מְנָלַן? דְּתַנְיָא: נְתָנָהּ לְבַלָּן מָעַל, וְאָמַר רַב: דַּוְקָא בַּלָּן הוּא דְּלָא מְחַסְּרָא מְשִׁיכָה, אֲבָל מִידֵּי אַחֲרִיתִי דִּמְחַסְּרָא מְשִׁיכָה – לֹא מָעַל עַד דְּמָשֵׁיךְ.
human_translation: From where do we a baraita ? as it is taught gave it to a bathhouse attendant [ leballan ] misuse of consecrated property And Rav says: it is specifically with regard to a bathhouse attendant as no lack of pulling, But other matters, where there is a lack of pulling, misuse only once he pulls
llm_translation: Mishnah: From where do we derive this? As it was taught: If one gave it to Balan to lift, and Rav said: Specifically Balan, who does not lack strength, but from another person who lacks strength - he may not lift until he actually lifts.

hebrew_text: וְהָתַנְיָא: נְתָנָהּ לְסַפָּר מָעַל. וְסַפָּר הָא בָּעֵי לְמִמְשַׁךְ תִּסְפּוֹרֶת. הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן – בְּסַפָּר גּוֹי, דְּלָאו בַּר מְשִׁיכָה הוּא.
human_translation: But isn’t it taught gave it to a barber, misuse of consecrated property and a barber, doesn’t he need to pull the haircut With what are we dealing here? with a gentile barber, who is not subject to pulling,
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: And it was taught: She gave it to the scribe to count. And the scribe wanted to prolong the counting. What are we dealing with here? With a non-Jewish scribe, for he is not skilled in counting.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: נְתָנָהּ לְסַפָּר אוֹ לְסַפָּן אוֹ לְכׇל בַּעֲלֵי אוּמָּנוּת – לֹא מָעַל עַד דְּמָשֵׁךְ. קַשְׁיָין אַהֲדָדֵי. אֶלָּא לָאו, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: כָּאן בְּסַפָּר גּוֹי, כָּאן בְּסַפָּר יִשְׂרָאֵל. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: This is also taught and gave it to a barber, or to a sailor, or to any craftsmen, misuse of consecrated property only once he pulls difficult, each other. Rather, not conclude from it here, with regard to a gentile barber, there, with regard to a Jewish barber, Learn from it
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: If one gave it to a barber, a sailor, or to any skilled craftsman - he has not fulfilled his obligation until he draws it. They are contradictory. Rather, it is not so, infer from it: here with a non-Jewish barber, here with a Jewish barber. Infer from it.

hebrew_text: וְכֵן אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן, דְּבַר תּוֹרָה מָעוֹת קוֹנוֹת. וּבַדְקַהּ לֵוִי בְּמַתְנִיתֵיהּ וְאַשְׁכַּח: נְתָנָהּ לְסִיטוֹן – מָעַל!
human_translation: And so says Rav Naḥman, By Torah law, money effects acquisition And Levi examined his baraitot , and he discovered he gave it to a wholesaler [ siton ] misuse of consecrated property.
llm_translation: And so said Rav Nachman, a matter of Torah, ma'ot konot. And Levi examined in his Mishnah and found: If she gave it to a thief - it is stolen!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא קַשְׁיָא לְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ! אָמַר לָךְ רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: הָא מַנִּי רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן הִיא.
human_translation: But difficult according to Reish Lakish. Reish Lakish said to you: whose is this It is Rabbi Shimon,
llm_translation: Rather, a difficulty for Reish Lakish! Reish Lakish said to you: "This is the teaching of Rabbi Shimon."

hebrew_text: אֲבָל אָמְרוּ מִי שֶׁפָּרַע וְכוּ׳. אִיתְּמַר, אַבָּיֵי אָמַר: אוֹדוֹעֵי מוֹדְעִינַן לֵיהּ. רָבָא אָמַר: מֵילָט לָיְיטִינַן לֵיהּ.
human_translation: But said: He Who exacted payment It was stated Abaye said we inform Rava said we curse him
llm_translation: But they said, "One who damages, etc." It was stated: Abbaye said: We make him known to him. Rava said: We bring witnesses against him.

hebrew_text: אַבָּיֵי אָמַר: אוֹדוֹעֵי מוֹדְעִינַן לֵיהּ, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְנָשִׂיא בְעַמְּךָ לֹא תָאֹר״. רָבָא אָמַר: מֵילָט לָיְיטִינַן לֵיהּ, דִּכְתִיב: ״בְּעַמְּךָ״ – בְּעוֹשֶׂה מַעֲשֵׂה עַמְּךָ.
human_translation: Abaye said we inform him, as it is written: “Nor curse a ruler among your people” Rava said we curse him, as it is written: “Among your people,” with regard to one who performs an action your people,
llm_translation: Abaye said: We inform him the thief through informers, as it is written: "And a prince in your midst you shall not curse" (Exodus 22:27). Rava said: We give him a hint, as it is written: "In your midst" - in one who acts among your people.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא, מְנָא אָמֵינָא לַהּ? דְּרַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר יוֹסֵף יְהַבוּ לֵיהּ זוּזֵי אַמִּלְחָא. לְסוֹף אִיַּיקַּר מִלְחָא. אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: זִיל הַב לְהוּ, וְאִי לָא – קַבֵּיל עֲלָיךְ ״מִי שֶׁפָּרַע״. וְאִי אָמְרַתְּ אוֹדוֹעֵי מוֹדְעִינַן לֵיהּ, רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר יוֹסֵף בַּר אוֹדוֹעֵי הוּא. וְאֶלָּא מַאי – מֵילָט לָיְיטִינַן לֵיהּ? רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר יוֹסֵף אָתֵי לְקַבּוֹלֵי עֲלֵיהּ לָטוּתָא דְרַבָּנַן?!
human_translation: Rava said: From where do I say where gave Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Yosef money to salt Ultimately salt increased, He came before Rabbi Yoḥanan said to him: Go give them and if not, accept upon yourself: He Who exacted payment. And if you say we inform him Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Yosef one who informed? Rather, what we curse him? Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Yosef come to accept upon himself a curse of the Sages?
llm_translation: Rava said, "From where do I know this? Because Rabbi Chiya bar Yosef gave him a zuz for salt. In the end, the salt became precious. He came before Rabbi Yochanan, who said to him, 'Go and give it to them, and if not, they will impose upon you the penalty of 'one who refuses to pay.' And if you say we are acquaintances, Rabbi Chiya bar Yosef is an acquaintance. Rather, what - should we bring him to court? Rabbi Chiya bar Yosef came to accept upon himself the ruling of the Rabbis?!"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר יוֹסֵף עֵרָבוֹן הוּא דְּיָהֲבִי לֵיהּ. הוּא סָבַר: כְּנֶגְדּוֹ הוּא קוֹנֶה. וַאֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: כְּנֶגֶד כּוּלּוֹ הוּא קוֹנֶה.
human_translation: Rather, It is a down payment that gave Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Yosef. held effects acquisition commensurate with its And Rabbi Yoḥanan said to him: effects acquisition commensurate with entire
llm_translation: Rather, Rabbi Chiya bar Yosef gave him the pledge. He thought: "Opposite him he acquires." And Rabbi Yochanan said to him: "Opposite all of it he acquires."

hebrew_text: אִתְּמַר: עֵרָבוֹן, רַב אוֹמֵר: כְּנֶגְדּוֹ הוּא קוֹנֶה, וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: כְּנֶגֶד כּוּלּוֹ הוּא קוֹנֶה.
human_translation: It was stated a down payment. Rav says: effects acquisition commensurate with its And Rabbi Yoḥanan said: It effects acquisition commensurate with entire
llm_translation: It was stated: regarding a pledge, Rav says: "He acquires it opposite him," and Rabbi Yochanan says: "He acquires it opposite all of it."

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: הַנּוֹתֵן עֵרָבוֹן לַחֲבֵירוֹ, וְאָמַר לוֹ: ״אִם אֲנִי חוֹזֵר בִּי – עֶרְבוֹנִי מָחוּל לָךְ״, וְהַלָּה אוֹמֵר לוֹ: ״אִם אֲנִי אֶחְזוֹר בִּי, אֶכְפּוֹל לְךָ עֵרְבוֹנְךָ״ – נִתְקַיְּימוּ הַתְּנָאִים, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יוֹסֵי. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי לְטַעְמֵיהּ, דְּאָמַר: אַסְמַכְתָּא קָנְיָא.
human_translation: raises an objection one who gives a down payment to another, and says to him: If I renege, my down payment is forfeited to you, and the other says to him: If I renege, I will double your down payment for you, the conditions are in effect; the statement of Rabbi Yosei. Rabbi Yosei to his reasoning, as he says: A transaction with inconclusive consent [ asmakhta ] effects acquisition.
llm_translation: The opponent raises an objection: One who gives a pledge to his fellow and says to him, "If I retract, my pledge is annulled for you," and the other says to him, "If I retract, I will forfeit your pledge" - the stipulations of the Mishnah are upheld, the words of Rabbi Yosei. Rabbi Yosei supports his opinion, for he said: A pledge is acquired through a support.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: דַּיּוֹ שֶׁיִּקְנֶה כְּנֶגֶד עֵרְבוֹנוֹ. אָמַר רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל: בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים – בִּזְמַן שֶׁאָמַר לוֹ ״עֶרְבוֹנִי יִקּוֹן״. אֲבָל מָכַר לוֹ בַּיִת אוֹ שָׂדֶה בְּאֶלֶף זוּז, וּפָרַע לוֹ מֵהֶם חֲמֵשׁ מֵאוֹת זוּז – קָנָה, וּמַחֲזִיר לוֹ אֶת הַשְּׁאָר אֲפִילּוּ לְאַחַר כַּמָּה שָׁנִים. מַאי לָאו הוּא הַדִּין לְמִטַּלְטְלִין, (בְּדִסְתָמָא) [דְּבִסְתָמָא] קָנֵי לְהוּ לְכוּלְּהוּ!
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: It is sufficient that effects acquisition commensurate with his down payment. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel said: In what is this statement said? when said to My down payment will effect acquisition But one sold a house or a field for one thousand dinars, and paid him five hundred dinars of acquired and he returns the rest even after several years What, is it not the same is true to movable property in where unspecified, acquires the entire
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: Sufficient that he acquires against his pledge. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel said: In what case are these words said? - When he said to him, "My pledge shall stand." But if he sold him a house or field for a thousand zuz, and he paid him five hundred zuz from them - he acquires, and he returns to him the rest even after many years. What is the reason? It is not the same as movable property, for in movable property, he acquires it all!

hebrew_text: לָא, מִטַּלְטְלִין בִּסְתָמָא לָא קָנֵי. וּמַאי שְׁנָא קַרְקַע, דִּבְכַסְפָּא קָנֵי לֵיהּ מַמָּשׁ – קָנֵי לֵיהּ לְכוּלַּהּ. מִטַּלְטְלֵי דְּלָא קָנֵי אֶלָּא לְקַבּוֹלֵי ״מִי שֶׁפָּרַע״ – לָא קָנֵי לֵיהּ כּוּלֵּיהּ.
human_translation: No, movable property in where unspecified, does not acquire And what is different land, which with money one genuinely acquires it acquires the entire movable property, which with one acquires it only to receive He Who exacted payment, does not acquire the entire
llm_translation: Not, move in general not acquire. And what difference earth, for with money acquire to it actual – acquire to it entirely. Move that not acquire except to receive "one who damages" – not acquire to it all.

hebrew_text: לֵימָא כְּתַנָּאֵי: הַמַּלְוֶה אֶת חֲבֵירוֹ עַל הַמַּשְׁכּוֹן, וְנִכְנְסָה הַשְּׁמִיטָּה, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵינוֹ שָׁוֶה אֶלָּא פְּלָג – אֵינוֹ מְשַׁמֵּט, דִּבְרֵי רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה הַנָּשִׂיא אוֹמֵר: אִם הָיָה מַשְׁכּוֹן כְּנֶגֶד הַלְוָאָתוֹ – אֵינוֹ מְשַׁמֵּט, וְאִם לָאו – מְשַׁמֵּט.
human_translation: Let us say is parallel to tanna’im . one who lends to another on collateral, and the Sabbatical commenced, even if is worth only half does not abrogate the statement of Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel. Rabbi Yehuda HaNasi says: If collateral was commensurate with the his loan, does not abrogate but if not abrogates
llm_translation: Let us say like the Tannaite: One who lends to his fellow with a collateral, and the collateral is lost, even though it is only worth half - he does not release the debt, the words of Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel. Rabbi Yehuda the Prince says: If the collateral was opposite his loan - he does not release the debt, but if not - he releases the debt.

hebrew_text: מַאי ״אֵינוֹ מְשַׁמֵּט״ דְּקָאָמַר רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל? אִילֵּימָא כְּנֶגְדּוֹ, מִכְּלָל דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה הַנָּשִׂיא סָבַר: לְהָךְ פַּלְגָא נָמֵי מְשַׁמֵּט!
human_translation: What does not abrogate that Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel is saying? If we say commensurate with by inference that Rabbi Yehuda HaNasi holds also abrogates that half as well.
llm_translation: What is "he does not distribute" that Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel is saying? If you say it is against him, does this imply that Rabbi Yehuda HaNasi holds: to strike a half is better than distributing!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מַשְׁכּוֹן דְּנָקֵיט לְמָה לֵיהּ? אֶלָּא לָאו, שְׁמַע מִינֵּיהּ: מַאי ״אֵינוֹ מְשַׁמֵּט״ דְּקָאָמַר רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל – אֵינוֹ מְשַׁמֵּט בְּכוּלּוֹ, וּמַאי ״מְשַׁמֵּט״ דְּקָאָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה הַנָּשִׂיא – לְהָךְ פַּלְגָא דְּלָא נָקֵיט עֲלֵיהּ מַשְׁכּוֹן.
human_translation: then why does he collateral that he is holding? Rather, do not conclude from it: What does not abrogate that Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel is saying? does not abrogate the entire And what abrogates that Rabbi Yehuda HaNasi is saying? to that half that he did not take on collateral.
llm_translation: Rather, why does he need a dwelling? Rather, no, learn from it: What is "he does not take a pledge" that Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel said - he does not take a pledge at all, and what is "he takes a pledge" that Rabbi Yehuda the Prince said - to take a half that he does not take a pledge on.

hebrew_text: וּבְהָא קָמִיפַּלְגִי, דְּרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל סָבַר: כְּנֶגֶד כּוּלּוֹ הוּא קוֹנֶה, וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה הַנָּשִׂיא סָבַר: כְּנֶגְדּוֹ הוּא קוֹנֶה.
human_translation: And they disagree with regard to this: As Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel holds effects acquisition commensurate with entire and Rabbi Yehuda HaNasi holds effects acquisition commensurate with its
llm_translation: And in this case they argue, for Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel holds: "He acquires the entire field opposite him," and Rabbi Yehuda the Prince holds: "He acquires opposite him."

hebrew_text: לָא, מַאי ״אֵינוֹ מְשַׁמֵּט״ דְּקָאָמַר רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל – לְהָךְ פַּלְגָא דְּנָקֵיט עֲלֵיהּ מַשְׁכּוֹן, מִכְּלָל דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה הַנָּשִׂיא סָבַר: לְהָךְ פַּלְגָא דְּנָקֵיט עֲלֵיהּ מַשְׁכּוֹן נָמֵי מְשַׁמֵּט. אֶלָּא מַשְׁכּוֹן דְּנָקֵיט, לְמָה לֵיהּ? לְזִכְרוֹן דְּבָרִים בְּעָלְמָא.
human_translation: No, what does not abrogate that Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel is saying? to that half that he took on collateral. by inference that Rabbi Yehuda HaNasi holds: also abrogates that half that he took on collateral. Then why does he collateral that he is holding? a mere reminder
llm_translation: Not, what "he does not appraise" that Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel said - to this half of the staff that he takes for a pledge, from the principle of Rabbi Yehuda the Prince he holds: to this half of the staff that he takes for a pledge, it is as if he appraises. Rather, why does he take the staff? As a remembrance of matters in the world.

hebrew_text: רַב כָּהֲנָא יְהַבוּ לֵיהּ זוּזֵי אַכִּיתָּנָא, לְסוֹף אִיַּיקַּר כִּיתָּנָא. אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: בְּמַאי דִּנְקִיטַתְּ זוּזֵי – הַב לְהוּ, וְאִידַּךְ – דְּבָרִים נִינְהוּ, וּדְבָרִים אֵין בָּהֶן מִשּׁוּם מְחוּסְּרֵי אֲמָנָה.
human_translation: gave money to Rav Kahana to linen. Ultimately, linen increased. came before Rav said to him: Give them in money that you received, and the rest, is a statement, and a verbal does not constitute bad faith.
llm_translation: Rav Kahana they gave him coins of Akitana, at the end it was called Kitana. He came before Rav. He said to him: With what are you collecting coins? - Give them to him, and the other - they are words, and words do not involve any lack of trust.

hebrew_text: דְּאִיתְּמַר: דְּבָרִים, רַב אָמַר: אֵין בָּהֶן מִשּׁוּם מְחוּסְּרֵי אֲמָנָה, וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: יֵשׁ בָּהֶם מִשּׁוּם מְחוּסְּרֵי אֲמָנָה.
human_translation: as it was stated: a verbal Rav says: It does not constitute bad faith. And Rabbi Yoḥanan says: It constitutes bad faith.
llm_translation: It was stated: concerning words, Rav said: they do not have any lack of trustworthiness, and Rabbi Yochanan said: they do have a lack of trustworthiness.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי, רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״הִין צֶדֶק״, וַהֲלֹא ״הִין״ בִּכְלַל אֵיפָה הָיָה? אֶלָּא לוֹמַר לָךְ: שֶׁיְּהֵא הֵן שֶׁלְּךָ צֶדֶק, וְלָאו שֶׁלְּךָ צֶדֶק. אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: הָהוּא שֶׁלֹּא יְדַבֵּר אֶחָד בַּפֶּה וְאֶחָד בַּלֵּב.
human_translation: raises an objection: Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says: What the verse states: a just hin , But wasn’t a hin included in an ephah? Rather, to say to you that your yes [ hen ] just, and your no just. Abaye says: That that one should not say one with mouth and one in heart.
llm_translation: The question was raised: Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says: What does the verse mean by "hin tzedek," when "hin" is already included in the measurement of the ephah? Rather, it comes to tell you: Let your 'hins' be just, and not unjust. Abaye said: That one should not speak one thing with the mouth and another thing in the heart.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאָמְרוּ טַלִּית קוֹנָה דִּינַר זָהָב, וְאֵין דִּינַר זָהָב קוֹנֶה טַלִּית, מִכׇּל מָקוֹם כָּךְ הֲלָכָה. אֲבָל אָמְרוּ: מִי שֶׁפָּרַע מֵאַנְשֵׁי דּוֹר הַמַּבּוּל וּמֵאַנְשֵׁי דּוֹר הַפְּלַגָּה הוּא עָתִיד לִיפָּרַע מִמִּי שֶׁאֵינוֹ עוֹמֵד בְּדִיבּוּרוֹ!
human_translation: raises an objection. Rabbi Shimon says: Even though said a garment, acquires a gold dinar, but a gold dinar, does not acquire a garment, in any case, that is halakha But said He Who exacted payment from the people of the generation of the flood, and from the people of the generation of the dispersion, and from the inhabitants of Sodom and Gomorrah, and from the Egyptians in the Sea, will exact payment from whoever does not stand by his statement.
llm_translation: The Tanna raises an objection: Rabbi Shimon says: Even though they said a talit acquires a gold dinar, and a gold dinar does not acquire a talit, nevertheless, this is the halakha. But they said: One who withholds payment from the generation of the Flood and from the generation of the Tower of Babel, he is destined to withhold payment from one who does not fulfill his word!

hebrew_text: תַּנָּאֵי הִיא. דִּתְנַן: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן מַתְיָא שֶׁאָמַר לִבְנוֹ: צֵא וּשְׂכוֹר לָנוּ פּוֹעֲלִים. הָלַךְ וּפָסַק לָהֶם מְזוֹנוֹת. וּכְשֶׁבָּא אֵצֶל אָבִיו, אָמַר לוֹ: בְּנִי, אֲפִילּוּ אַתָּה עוֹשֶׂה לָהֶם כִּסְעוּדַת שְׁלֹמֹה בִּשְׁעָתוֹ לֹא יָצָאתָ יְדֵי חוֹבָתְךָ עִמָּהֶם, שֶׁהֵן בְּנֵי אַבְרָהָם יִצְחָק וְיַעֲקֹב. אֶלָּא עַד שֶׁלֹּא יַתְחִילוּ בִּמְלָאכָה, צֵא וֶאֱמוֹר לָהֶם: עַל מְנָת שֶׁאֵין לָכֶם עָלַי אֶלָּא פַּת וְקִטְנִית בִּלְבַד.
human_translation: is tanna’im , as we learned an incident involving Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Matya, who said to his son: Go out and hire laborers for us. went and allocated sustenance for them, And when he came to his father, said to him: My son, even if you prepare for them like the feast of Solomon during his era, you will not fulfill your obligation to them, as they are the descendants of Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, Rather, Before they begin in labor, go out and say to them: on the condition that you have from me only bread and legumes.
llm_translation: It is taught in a Baraita: As we learned in a Mishnah: There was an incident involving Rabbi Yochanan ben Matyah, who said to his son: Go out and hire laborers for us. He went and provided them with sustenance. When he came to his father, he said to him: My son, even if you were to provide them with a feast like that of King Solomon in his time, you would not have fulfilled your obligation towards them, for they are the descendants of Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob. Rather, until they begin working, go out and say to them: You are hired on the condition that you have no claim against me except for bread and a small amount only.

hebrew_text: וְאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ דְּבָרִים יֵשׁ בָּהֶן מִשּׁוּם מְחוּסְּרֵי אֲמָנָה, הֵיכִי אֲמַר לֵיהּ זִיל הֲדַר בָּךְ? שָׁאנֵי הָתָם, דְּפוֹעֲלִים גּוּפַיְיהוּ לָא סָמְכָא דַּעְתַּיְיהוּ. מַאי טַעְמָא – מִידָּע יָדְעִי דְּעַל אֲבוּהּ סָמֵךְ.
human_translation: And if it enters your mind a verbal constitutes bad faith, how did tell renege? is different there as the laborers themselves do not rely on What is the reason they know that he relied on his father
llm_translation: And if it enters your mind that there are in these matters some lacking trustworthiness, how can one say to him, "Go, return to yourself"? It is different there, for they do not rely on their own actions. What is the reason? - Because they know that upon their Father they rely.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, אֲפִילּוּ הִתְחִילוּ בִּמְלָאכָה נָמֵי? הִתְחִילוּ בִּמְלָאכָה, וַדַּאי סָמְכִי דַּעְתַּיְיהוּ, אֲמַרוּ: מֵימָר אָמַר קַמֵּיהּ דַּאֲבוּהּ וְנִיחָא לֵיהּ.
human_translation: If so, even began in labor, they began in labor they certainly rely they say: He before his father stated and is amenable
llm_translation: If so, even if they began work on the eve of Shabbat? They began work, and surely they relied on their own judgment, saying: "Memar said in the presence of his father-in-law, and it was pleasing to him."

hebrew_text: וּמִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן הָכִי? וְהָאָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הָאוֹמֵר לַחֲבֵירוֹ מַתָּנָה אֲנִי נוֹתֵן לָךְ – יָכוֹל לַחֲזוֹר בּוֹ. יָכוֹל, פְּשִׁיטָא! אֶלָּא: מוּתָּר לַחֲזוֹר בּוֹ. אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: וּמוֹדֶה רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בְּמַתָּנָה מוּעֶטֶת, דְּסָמְכָא דַּעְתַּיְיהוּ.
human_translation: And did Rabbi Yoḥanan say this, But didn’t Rabba bar bar Ḥana say Rabbi Yoḥanan says: One who says to another: I am giving you a gift, is able to renege on He is able to obvious Rather, permitted to renege on Rav Pappa said: And Rabbi Yoḥanan concedes in a small gift as rely
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And who said thus, Rabbi Yochanan? But didn't Rabbah bar bar Chanah say in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: One who says to his fellow, "I am giving you a gift," can retract? Can he retract? Obviously! Rather, he is permitted to retract. Rav Papa said: And Rabbi Yochanan concedes in the case of a small gift, for their minds are at ease.

hebrew_text: הָכִי נָמֵי מִסְתַּבְּרָא, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: יִשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁאָמַר לְבֶן לֵוִי: כּוֹר מַעֲשֵׂר יֵשׁ לְךָ בְּיָדִי. בֶּן לֵוִי רַשַּׁאי לַעֲשׂוֹתוֹ תְּרוּמַת מַעֲשֵׂר עַל מָקוֹם אַחֵר. אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא לָא מָצֵי לְמִיהְדַּר בֵּיהּ – מִשּׁוּם הָכִי רַשַּׁאי. אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ מָצֵי לְמִיהְדַּר בֵּיהּ, אַמַּאי רַשַּׁאי? אִישְׁתְּכַח דְּקָא אָכֵיל טְבָלִים!
human_translation: So too, it is reasonable as Rabbi Abbahu says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: an Israelite who said to a Levite: You have a kor of tithe in my possession the Levite may render teruma of the tithe for another place. Granted, if you say one is unable, to renege, due to that may But if you say one is able, to renege, why may eventuate that he is consuming untithed produce,
llm_translation: So it was explained, for Rabbi Abbahu said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: If an Israelite said to a Levite, "You have a pile of tithe in my possession," the Levite is permitted to separate the tithe from the tithe in another place. If you say that he cannot rectify it - it is because of this that he is permitted. But if you say that he can rectify it, why is he permitted? It is found that he is eating tevel!

hebrew_text: הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן – כְּגוֹן שֶׁנְּטָלוֹ מִמֶּנּוּ וְחָזַר וְהִפְקִידוֹ אֶצְלוֹ.
human_translation: With what are we dealing here? where took from him and then deposited it with him,
llm_translation: Here we are dealing with what? - For example, if they took it from him and then he returned and deposited it with him.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי אֵימָא סֵיפָא: נְתָנוֹ לְבֶן לֵוִי אַחֵר – אֵין לוֹ עָלָיו אֶלָּא תַּרְעוֹמֶת. וְאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ כְּגוֹן שֶׁנְּטָלוֹ מִמֶּנּוּ וְחָזַר וְהִפְקִידוֹ אֶצְלוֹ, אַמַּאי אֵין לוֹ עָלָיו אֶלָּא תַּרְעוֹמֶת? כֵּיוָן דְּמַשְׁכֵיהּ מָמוֹנָא אִית לֵיהּ גַּבֵּיהּ! אֶלָּא לָאו, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ בִּדְלָא נְטָלוֹ. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: If so, say the latter clause gave to a different Levite, has only a grievance against And if it enters your mind where took from and then deposited it with him, why does have only a grievance against him? Once pulled he has property in Rather, not conclude from it where did not take Conclude from it
llm_translation: Talmudic text: If so, say the latter part: If a Levite gave it to another Levite - he has only the terumah. And if it is according to your opinion, for example, that they took it from him and then he deposited it with him, why does he have only the terumah? Since he drew money from it, he has his share! Rather, no, infer from it that if he did not take it. Infer from it.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא גַּבְרָא דִּיהַיב זוּזֵי אַשּׁוּמְשְׁמֵי. לְסוֹף אִיַּיקַּר שׁוּמְשְׁמֵי. הֲדַרוּ בְּהוּ וַאֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: לֵית לַן שׁוּמְשְׁמֵי, שְׁקוֹל זוּזָךְ. לָא שְׁקֵיל זוּזֵיהּ, אִיגְּנוּב. אֲתוֹ לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרָבָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: כֵּיוָן דְּאָמְרִי לָךְ שְׁקוֹל זוּזָךְ וְלָא שְׁקַלְיתְּ, לָא מִבַּעְיָא שׁוֹמֵר שָׂכָר דְּלָא הָוֵי, אֶלָּא אֲפִילּוּ שׁוֹמֵר חִנָּם נָמֵי לָא הָוֵי. אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ רַבָּנַן לְרָבָא: וְהָא בָּעֵי לְקַבּוֹלֵי עֲלֵיהּ ״מִי שֶׁפָּרַע״? אֲמַר לְהוּ: הָכִי נָמֵי.
human_translation: a certain man who gave money for sesame. Ultimately, sesame increased, reneged and said to him: We have no sesame; take your money. did not take his money, was stolen. They came before Rava said to Once they said to you: Take your money, and you did not take it is not necessary that is not a paid bailee. But is not even an unpaid bailee. The Sages said to Rava: But aren’t required to accept upon themselves He Who exacted payment? said to them: Indeed,
llm_translation: That man who gave coins to the poor. Eventually, his coins ran out. They came to him and said: "We have no more coins, take back your coins." He did not take back his coins, they stole them. They came before Rava. He said to him: "Since they told you to take back your coins and you did not take them back, you do not deserve reward that is not yours, even if you guard for free, you will not be rewarded." The Rabbis said to Rava: "Does he require to accept upon himself 'one who pays back'?" He said to them: "So it is."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פַּפֵּי, אָמַר לִי רָבִינָא: לְדִידִי אֲמַר לִי הָהוּא מֵרַבָּנַן וְרַב טָבוּת שְׁמֵיהּ, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ רַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר זוּטְרָא שְׁמֵיהּ, דְּאִי הֲווֹ יָהֲבִי לֵיהּ כֹּל חֲלָלָא דְעָלְמָא לָא (הֲוֵי קָא) [הָוֵה] מְשַׁנֵּי בְּדִבּוּרֵיהּ. בְּדִידִי הֲוָה עוֹבָדָא: הָהוּא יוֹמָא אַפַּנְיָא דְּמַעֲלֵי שַׁבְּתָא הֲוָה, וַהֲוָה יָתֵיבְנָא, וַאֲתָא הָהוּא גַּבְרָא וְקָאֵי אַבָּבָא. אֲמַר לִי: אִית לָךְ שׁוּמְשְׁמֵי לְזַבּוֹנֵי?
human_translation: Rav Pappi said Ravina said to me: One of the Sages, and Rav Tavot is his name, and some say Rav Shmuel bar Zutra is his name, who if they were to give him the entire expanse of the world he would not deviate from his speech, said to me: There was an incident in which I that day, was twilight on Shabbat eve, and I was sitting, and a certain man came and stood at the entrance. said to me: Do you have sesame to sell?
llm_translation: Rav Pappa said, Ravina said to me: According to my opinion, that certain individual, a scholar, his name is Rav Tavut. And some say his name is Rav Shmuel bar Zutra. For if they were to give him all the treasures of the world, he would not change his manner of speech. According to my opinion, the incident was as follows: On that day before Shabbat, I was sitting, and that man came and stood at the door. He said to me: Do you have any oil for lamps?

hebrew_text: אֲמַרִי לֵיהּ: לָא. אֲמַר לִי: לֶיהְווֹ הָנָךְ זוּזֵי בְּפִקָּדוֹן גַּבָּךְ, דְּהָא חֲשַׁכָה לִי. אֲמַרִי לֵיהּ: הָא בֵּיתָא קַמָּךְ. אוֹתְבִינְהוּ בְּבֵיתָא וְאִיגְּנוּב. אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרָבָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: כֹּל ״הָא בֵּיתָא קַמָּךְ״ לָא מִיבַּעְיָא שׁוֹמֵר שָׂכָר דְּלָא הָוֵי, אֶלָּא אֲפִילּוּ שׁוֹמֵר חִנָּם נָמֵי לָא הָוֵי. אֲמַרִי לֵיהּ: וְהָא אֲמַרוּ [לֵיהּ] רַבָּנַן לְרָבָא: אִיבְּעִי לֵיהּ לְקַבּוֹלֵי עֲלֵיהּ ״מִי שֶׁפָּרַע״. וַאֲמַר לִי: לֹא הָיוּ דְבָרִים מֵעוֹלָם.
human_translation: I said to him: No. He said to me: Let these dinars as a deposit with you, as has grown dark for me I said to him: This house is before you. He placed them in the house and were stolen. came before Rava, said to him: anyone This house is before you, it is not necessary that he is not a paid bailee, but he is not even an unpaid bailee. said to But didn’t the Sages say to Rava: is required to accept upon himself He Who exacted payment? And said to me: were never matters;
llm_translation: They said to him: No. He said to me: Let the money be in your possession, for it is dark to me. They said to him: The house is before you. They placed it in the house and it was stolen. He came before Rava. He said to him: "The house is before you" does not require a watchman for unpaid wages, but even a watchman for free is also not required. They said to him: But didn't the Rabbis say to Rava: If he wants to accept upon himself "one who pays"? And he said to me: Those words were never spoken.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: כֹּל שֶׁהַכֶּסֶף בְּיָדוֹ – יָדוֹ עַל הָעֶלְיוֹנָה וְכוּ׳. תַּנְיָא, אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן: אֵימָתַי – בִּזְמַן שֶׁהַכֶּסֶף וְהַפֵּירוֹת בְּיַד מוֹכֵר. אֲבָל כֶּסֶף בְּיַד מוֹכֵר וּפֵירוֹת בְּיַד לוֹקֵחַ – אֵינוֹ יָכוֹל לַחֲזוֹר בּוֹ, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁכַּסְפּוֹ בְּיָדוֹ. ״בְּיָדוֹ״?! בְּיַד מוֹכֵר הוּא. אֶלָּא – מִפְּנֵי שֶׁדְּמֵי כַסְפּוֹ בְּיָדוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: Anyone who has the money in his possession has the advantage. It is taught Rabbi Shimon says: When when the money and the produce are in the possession of seller. But money in the possession of seller and the produce in the possession of buyer, cannot renege, because his money is in his possession. In his, possession? Isn’t it in the possession of seller? Rather, Because the value of his, money is in his, possession.
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: "Anyone who has the money in his hand - his hand is on the higher ground, etc." It was taught: Rabbi Shimon said: "When is this? When the money and the produce are in the hand of the seller. But if the money is in the hand of the seller and the produce is in the hand of the buyer - he cannot retract, because his money is in his hand." "In his hand"?! It is in the hand of the seller. Rather - because the price of his money is in his hand.

hebrew_text: פְּשִׁיטָא! אָמַר רָבָא: הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן – כְּגוֹן שֶׁהָיְתָה עֲלִיָּיה שֶׁל לוֹקֵחַ מוּשְׂכֶּרֶת בְּיַד מוֹכֵר. טַעְמָא מַאי תַּקִּינוּ רַבָּנַן מְשִׁיכָה – גְּזֵירָה שֶׁמָּא יֹאמַר לוֹ נִשְׂרְפוּ חִטֶּיךָ בַּעֲלִיָּיה. הָכָא בִּרְשׁוּתֵיהּ דְּלוֹקֵחַ נִינְהוּ, אִי נָפְלָה דְּלֵיקָה בְּאוֹנֶס – אִיהוּ טָרַח וּמַיְיתֵי לַהּ.
human_translation: obvious Rava said: With what are we dealing here? where the upper story of buyer, was rented to seller. What is the reason the Sages instituted pulling, decree, lest say to Your wheat burned in the upper story Here, is in the domain of buyer. if a fire is ignited due to circumstances beyond his control, will exert himself and bring
llm_translation: It is obvious! Rava said: Here we are dealing with what – for example, when the pledge was in the possession of the buyer from the seller. What is the reason that the Rabbis instituted the law of pulling? – It is a decree lest he say to him, "Your wheat was burned in my possession." Here, since it is in the domain of the buyer, if it accidentally falls into a fire – he exerted effort and brought it to him.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא גַּבְרָא דִּיהַיב זוּזֵי אַחַמְרָא. לְסוֹף שְׁמַע דְּקָא בָעֵי לְמִנְסְבֵיהּ דְּבֵי פַּרְזַק רוּפִילָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הַב לִי זוּזַי, לָא בָּעֵינָא חַמְרָא. אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב חִסְדָּא, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: כְּדֶרֶךְ שֶׁתִּיקְּנוּ מְשִׁיכָה בַּמּוֹכְרִין כָּךְ תִּיקְּנוּ מְשִׁיכָה בַּלָּקוֹחוֹת.
human_translation: a certain man who gave money for wine. Ultimately he heard that from the house of Parzak the vizier [ rufila ] sought to appropriate said to Give me my money, I do not want wine. came before Rav Ḥisda, said to him: Just as instituted pulling with regard to sellers, so did they institute pulling with regard to buyers.
llm_translation: That man who gave coins of silver. At the end, he heard that they wanted to marry him to the daughter of the house of Parzak Rufila. He said to him: "Give me coins of silver, I do not want wine." He came before Rav Ḥisda, he said to him: "Just as you would make a purchase with a pull in the marketplace, so too make a purchase with the merchants."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הָאוֹנָאָה, אַרְבָּעָה כֶּסֶף מֵעֶשְׂרִים וְאַרְבָּעָה כֶּסֶף לַסֶּלַע, שְׁתוּת לְמִקָּח. עַד מָתַי מוּתָּר לְהַחְזִיר? עַד כְּדֵי שֶׁיַּרְאֶה לַתַּגָּר אוֹ לִקְרוֹבוֹ.
human_translation: The exploitation four silver from twenty-four silver in a sela , one-sixth of the transaction. Until when permitted to return until a period that show to a merchant or to his relative
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: Regarding interest, four silver coins for twenty, and four silver coins for a sela, is considered a permissible transaction. Until when is it permitted to return it? Until the point where it would be noticeable to the merchant or his relative.

hebrew_text: הוֹרָה רַבִּי טַרְפוֹן בְּלוֹד: הָאוֹנָאָה שְׁמוֹנָה כֶּסֶף מֵעֶשְׂרִים וְאַרְבַּע כֶּסֶף לַסֶּלַע, שְׁלִישׁ לְמִקָּח. וְשָׂמְחוּ תַּגָּרֵי לוֹד. אָמַר לָהֶם: כׇּל הַיּוֹם מוּתָּר לַחְזוֹר. אָמְרוּ לוֹ יַנִּיחַ לָנוּ רַבִּי טַרְפוֹן בִּמְקוֹמֵינוּ, וְחָזְרוּ לְדִבְרֵי חֲכָמִים.
human_translation: Rabbi Tarfon ruled in Lod: Exploitation eight silver from twenty-four silver of a sela , one-third of the transaction. And the merchants of Lod rejoiced, said to them: the entire day to renege said to him: Let Rabbi Tarfon leave us as we were, and they reverted to the statement of the Rabbis
llm_translation: Rabbi Tarfon taught in Lod: The interest is eight silver coins out of twenty-four silver coins for a sela, a third for a purchase. The merchants of Lod rejoiced. He said to them: All day it is permitted to retract. They said to him, let Rabbi Tarfon leave us in our place, and they returned to the words of the Sages.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אִתְּמַר: רַב אָמַר: שְׁתוּת מִקָּח שָׁנִינוּ. וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: שְׁתוּת מָעוֹת נָמֵי שָׁנִינוּ. שָׁוֵי שִׁיתָּא בְּחַמְשָׁא, שָׁוֵי שִׁיתָּא בְּשִׁבְעָה – כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְּלִיגִי דְּבָתַר מִקָּח אָזְלִינַן וְאוֹנָאָה הָוְיָא. כִּי פְּלִיגִי שָׁוֵי חַמְשָׁא בְּשִׁיתָּא וְשָׁוֵי שִׁבְעָה בְּשִׁיתָּא.
human_translation: It was stated Rav says: We learned one-sixth of transaction, And Shmuel says: We learned also one-sixth of money worth six for five worth six for seven everyone agrees we follow transaction, and it is exploitation. Where disagree worth five for six or worth seven for six
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemara itmar: Rav amar: Shutut mikach shaninu. U'Shmuel amar: Shutut ma'ot namei shaninu. Shavei shitta b'chamsha, shavei shitta b'shiv'a – kulei olma la p'ligi d'vata mikach azlinan v'onaa havaya. Ki p'ligi shavei chamsha b'shitta v'shavei shiv'a b'shitta. English translation: Gemara was stated: Rav said: We learned the concept of a shared purchase. And Shmuel said: We learned the concept of shared money. If one contributes a sixth in a group of five, and one contributes a sixth in a group of seven – everyone agrees that in the case of a purchase, we go and the transaction is valid. When they disagree is when one contributes a fifth in a group of six, and one contributes a seventh in a group of six.

hebrew_text: לִשְׁמוּאֵל דְּאָמַר: בָּתַר מָעוֹת אָזְלִינַן, אִידֵּי וְאִידֵּי אוֹנָאָה הָוֵי. לְרַב דְּאָמַר: בָּתַר מִקָּח אָזְלִינַן, שָׁוֵי חַמְשָׁא בְּשִׁיתָּא בִּיטּוּל מִקָּח הָוְיָא. שָׁוֵי שִׁבְעָה בְּשִׁיתָּא, מְחִילָה הָוְיָא.
human_translation: According to Shmuel, who says we follow money this and that are exploitation, According to Rav, who says we follow transaction, worth five for six is a nullification of the transaction, worth seven for six is a waiver
llm_translation: To Shmuel who said: After the money is given, both parties are subject to ona'ah. According to Rav who said: After the acquisition is made, if one adds five to six, the acquisition is nullified. If one adds seven to six, it is considered a gift.

hebrew_text: וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: כִּי אָמְרִינַן מְחִילָה וּבִיטּוּל מִקָּח – הֵיכָא דְּלֵיכָּא שְׁתוּת מִשְּׁנֵי צְדָדִים. אֲבָל הֵיכָא דְּאִיכָּא שְׁתוּת מִצַּד אֶחָד – אוֹנָאָה הָוְיָא.
human_translation: And Shmuel says: When we say a waiver or a nullification of the transaction, where there is not one-sixth from both aspects, But where there is one-sixth from one aspect, it is exploitation.
llm_translation: Samuel said: For we say, a sale and a renunciation of acquisition - where there is no drinking from both sides. But where there is drinking from one side - it is considered a deception.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: הָאוֹנָאָה אַרְבָּעָה כֶּסֶף מֵעֶשְׂרִים וְאַרְבָּעָה כֶּסֶף לַסֶּלַע, שְׁתוּת לְמִקָּח. מַאי לָאו, דְּזַבֵּין שָׁוֵי עֶשְׂרִים בְּעֶשְׂרִין וְאַרְבְּעָה, וּשְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: שְׁתוּת מָעוֹת נָמֵי שָׁנִינוּ! לָא, דְּזַבֵּין שָׁוֵי עֶשְׂרִים וְאַרְבְּעָה בְּעֶשְׂרִים.
human_translation: We learned exploitation four silver from twenty-four silver in a sela , one-sixth of the transaction. What, is it not where he bought worth twenty for twenty-four And conclude from we learned also one-sixth of money No, where he sold worth twenty-four for twenty
llm_translation: We learned: The interest is four silver coins out of twenty, and four silver coins for the rock, a sixth for a purchase. What is the reason? Because they sell twenty for twenty-four, and we learn from it: a sixth of money is a sixth! No, because they sell twenty-four for twenty.

hebrew_text: מִי נִתְאַנָּה – מוֹכֵר. אֵימָא סֵיפָא: עַד מָתַי מוּתָּר לְהַחְזִיר – בִּכְדֵי שֶׁיַּרְאֶה לַתַּגָּר אוֹ לִקְרוֹבוֹ. וְאָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא לוֹקֵחַ, אֲבָל מוֹכֵר – לְעוֹלָם חוֹזֵר.
