llm_translation: From the statement "it appears that the words of Rabbi Eliezer are seen on Shabbat, indicating that he disagrees even on a weekday." From the statement "it appears that the words of Rabbi Yehoshua are seen on a weekday, indicating that he disagrees even on Shabbat."

hebrew_text: מַאי לָאו בְּהָא סְבָרָא קָמִיפַּלְגִי: דְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר סָבַר חוֹמֶשׁ לָא מְעַכֵּב, וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ סָבַר חוֹמֶשׁ מְעַכֵּב?
human_translation: What, not they disagree with regard to this reasoning, that Rabbi Eliezer holds one-fifth does not prevent and Rabbi Yehoshua holds one-fifth prevents
llm_translation: What is the reason that they do not agree in this reasoning? For Rabbi Eliezer holds that a wall does not prevent the carrying, and Rabbi Yehoshua holds that a wall does prevent the carrying?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: לָא, דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא חוֹמֶשׁ לָא מְעַכֵּב. וְהָכָא בְּחָיְישִׁינַן לִפְשִׁיעוּתָא קָמִיפַּלְגִי. מָר סָבַר חָיְישִׁינַן לִפְשִׁיעוּתָא. וּמַר סָבַר לָא חָיְישִׁינַן לִפְשִׁיעוּתָא.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: No, everyone agrees one-fifth does not prevent and here disagree with regard to we are concerned for negligence. Sage, holds: We are concerned for negligence, And Sage, holds: We are not concerned for negligence,
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: No, the entire world does not prevent. And here we are concerned for the possibility of stumbling. One Sage holds that we are concerned for stumbling, and the other Sage holds that we are not concerned for stumbling.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הַכֹּל מוֹדִים בְּהֶקְדֵּשׁ – שֶׁחִילֵּל, הוֹאִיל וְגִזְבָּרִין תּוֹבְעִין אוֹתוֹ בַּשּׁוּק.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says: all concede with regard to consecrated that he desacralized since treasurers demand him in the marketplace,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: Everyone agrees with regard to hekdesh - that if one desecrated it, since the treasurers demand it in the market.

hebrew_text: וּבְהֶקְדֵּשׁ לָא פְּלִיגִי? וְהָתַנְיָא: נָתַן אֶת הַקֶּרֶן, וְלֹא נָתַן לוֹ אֶת הַחוֹמֶשׁ, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: חִילֵּל, וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: לֹא חִילֵּל. אָמַר רַבִּי: נִרְאִין דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בְּהֶקְדֵּשׁ, וְדִבְרֵי חֲכָמִים בְּמַעֲשֵׂר.
human_translation: And do they not disagree with regard to consecrated But isn’t it taught gave the principal but did not give him the one-fifth, Rabbi Eliezer says: He desacralized the Rabbis say: He not desacralize Rabbi said: The statement of Rabbi Eliezer appears with regard to consecrated and the statement of the Rabbis with regard to tithe.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And in regard to consecration, do they not disagree? And it was taught: If one gave the principal but did not give the fifth, Rabbi Eliezer says: He has profaned it, and the Sages say: He has not profaned it. Rabbi said: The words of Rabbi Eliezer are seen in regard to consecration, and the words of the Sages are seen in regard to tithing."

hebrew_text: מִדְּאָמַר נִרְאִין דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בְּהֶקְדֵּשׁ – מִכְּלָל דִּפְלִיג אֲפִילּוּ בְּמַעֲשֵׂר. מִדְּקָאָמַר נִרְאִין דִּבְרֵי חֲכָמִים בְּמַעֲשֵׂר – מִכְּלָל דְּאִינְהוּ פְּלִיגִי אֲפִילּוּ בְּהֶקְדֵּשׁ!
human_translation: From that says the statement of Rabbi Eliezer appears with regard to consecrated by inference they disagree even with regard to tithe. from that said the Rabbis appears with regard to tithe, by inference they disagree even with regard to consecrated
llm_translation: From the statement "the words of Rabbi Eliezer appear in matters of consecration" - this implies that he disagrees even in matters of tithing. From the statement "the words of the sages appear in matters of tithing" - this implies that they do not disagree even in matters of consecration!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אִי אִתְּמַר, הָכִי אִתְּמַר: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הַכֹּל מוֹדִים בְּשַׁבָּת בְּהֶקְדֵּשׁ שֶׁחִילֵּל. חֲדָא – דִּכְתִיב: ״וְקָרָאתָ לַשַּׁבָּת עֹנֶג״. וְעוֹד, הוֹאִיל וְגִזְבָּרִין תּוֹבְעִין אוֹתוֹ בַּשּׁוּק.
human_translation: Rather, if was stated, was stated like this: Rabbi Yoḥanan says: All concede concerning Shabbat with regard to consecrated that he desacralized One as it is written: “And you shall call Shabbat a delight” And furthermore, since treasurers demand him in the marketplace.
llm_translation: Rather, if it is stated, it is stated thus: Rabbi Yochanan said: Everyone agrees that on Shabbat in a case of desecration of the sanctity, one may benefit. One proof is as it is written: "And you shall call the Shabbat a delight." Furthermore, since the tax collectors demand it in the market.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָמֵי בַּר חָמָא: הֲרֵי אָמְרוּ הֶקְדֵּשׁ אֵינוֹ מִתְחַלֵּל עַל הַקַּרְקַע, דְּרַחֲמָנָא אָמַר: ״וְנָתַן הַכֶּסֶף וְקָם לוֹ״. חוּמְשׁוֹ מַהוּ שֶׁיִּתְחַלֵּל עַל הַקַּרְקַע?
human_translation: Rami bar Ḥama says: said consecrated cannot be desacralized with land, as the Merciful One states “And he will give the money and it will be assured to him” its one-fifth: What is that it will be desacralized with land?
llm_translation: Ramei bar Ḥama said: Behold, they said, "Hekdesh does not become profaned upon the ground," for the Merciful One said: "And he shall give the money, and it shall be his." What is the law if it becomes profaned upon the ground?

hebrew_text: תְּרוּמָה אֵינָהּ מִשְׁתַּלֶּמֶת אֶלָּא מִן הַחוּלִּין. דְּרַחֲמָנָא אָמַר: ״וְנָתַן לַכֹּהֵן אֶת הַקֹּדֶשׁ״, דָּבָר הָרָאוּי לִהְיוֹת קֹדֶשׁ. חוּמְשָׁהּ מַהוּ שֶׁיִּשְׁתַּלֵּם שֶׁלֹּא מִן הַחוּלִּין?
human_translation: teruma , can be repaid only with non-sacred as the Merciful One states: and he shall give that which is sacred to a priest” an item fit to become sacred, its one-fifth: What is that it will be repaid not from non-sacred
llm_translation: Trumah does not take effect except from the profane. For the Merciful One said: "And he shall give the holy to the kohen," something fitting to be holy. What is its fifth that it should not take effect except from the profane?

hebrew_text: מַעֲשֵׂר אֵין מִתְחַלֵּל עַל הָאֲסִימוֹן. דְּרַחֲמָנָא אָמַר: ״וְצַרְתָּ הַכֶּסֶף בְּיָדְךָ״, לְרַבּוֹת כׇּל דָּבָר שֶׁיֵּשׁ עָלָיו צוּרָה. חוּמְשׁוֹ מַהוּ שֶׁיִּתְחַלֵּל עַל הָאֲסִימוֹן?
human_translation: tithe cannot be desacralized with an unminted coin, as the Merciful One states: “And you shall bind up [ vetzarta ] the money in your hand” to include any item that has the imprint [ tzura ] upon it its one-fifth: What is that it will be desacralized with an unminted coin?
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Ma'aser ein mitchalel al ha'asimon. D'rachamana amar: "V'tzarta hakesef beyadcha", l'rabot kol davar sheyesh alav tzurah. Chumsho mah hu sheyitchalel al ha'asimon? English translation: Tithe does not become profaned on the coin. For the Merciful One said: "And you shall shape the silver in your hand," to include anything that has a form. What is the case that becomes profaned on the coin?

hebrew_text: אִתְגַּלְגַּל מִלְּתָא וּמְטָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרָבָא. אֲמַר לְהוּ: אָמַר קְרָא ״עָלָיו״, לְרַבּוֹת חוּמְשׁוֹ כְּמוֹתוֹ.
human_translation: the matter proceeded and came before Rava, said to The verse states: unto it to include its one-fifth as its
llm_translation: He mocked a matter and came before Rava. He said to them: The verse says "upon him," to include his fifth like himself.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבִינָא: אַף אֲנַן נָמֵי תְּנֵינָא, הַגּוֹנֵב תְּרוּמָה וְלֹא אֲכָלָהּ – מְשַׁלֵּם תַּשְׁלוּמֵי כֶפֶל דְּמֵי תְרוּמָה. אֲכָלָהּ – מְשַׁלֵּם שְׁנֵי קְרָנִים וָחוֹמֶשׁ. קֶרֶן וָחוֹמֶשׁ מִן הַחוּלִּין, וְהַקֶּרֶן דְּמֵי תְרוּמָה.
human_translation: Ravina said: We too learn One who steals teruma and did not partake of it pays a payment of double the price of teruma , ate it he pays two principals and one-fifth principal and one-fifth from non-sacred and the principal, the price of teruma .
llm_translation: Ravina said: We also learned similarly, one who steals Terumah and did not eat it - he pays double the value of the Terumah. If he ate it - he pays the principal and a fifth. The principal and a fifth are from common funds, and the principal is the value of the Terumah.

hebrew_text: שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ חוּמְשׁוֹ כְּמוֹתוֹ. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: Learn from it its one-fifth like itself, Learn from it
llm_translation: Hear from it, its fifth like its own. Hear from it.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא, גַּבֵּי גָּזֵל כְּתִיב: ״וַחֲמִשִׁתָיו יֹסֵף עָלָיו״. וּתְנַן: נָתַן לוֹ אֶת הַקֶּרֶן, וְנִשְׁבַּע לוֹ עַל הַחוֹמֶשׁ – הֲרֵי זֶה מוֹסִיף חוֹמֶשׁ עַל חוֹמֶשׁ, עַד שֶׁיִּתְמַעֵט הַקֶּרֶן פָּחוֹת מִשָּׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה.
human_translation: Rava said: With regard to robbery, it is written: and he shall add its one-fifth payments to it” and we learned gave the principal and took oath to him concerning the one-fifth This adds one-fifth apart from one-fifth until the principal, is reduced to less than the value of one peruta .
llm_translation: Rava said, regarding theft, it is written: "And his restitution shall be doubled for him." And we learned in a Mishnah: If he gave him the principal and swore to him regarding the fifth of the value - this one adds a fifth upon a fifth until the principal diminishes to less than a perutah's worth.

hebrew_text: גַּבֵּי תְּרוּמָה כְּתִיב: ״אִישׁ כִּי יֹאכַל קֹדֶשׁ בִּשְׁגָגָה וְיָסַף חֲמִשִׁיתוֹ עָלָיו״. וּתְנַן: הָאוֹכֵל תְּרוּמָה בְּשׁוֹגֵג – מְשַׁלֵּם קֶרֶן וָחוֹמֶשׁ. אֶחָד הָאוֹכֵל וְאֶחָד הַשּׁוֹתֶה וְאֶחָד הַסָּךְ. אֶחָד תְּרוּמָה טְהוֹרָה, וְאֶחָד תְּרוּמָה טְמֵאָה – מְשַׁלֵּם חוּמְשָׁהּ וְחוּמְשָׁא דְחוּמְשָׁא. וְאִילּוּ גַּבֵּי מַעֲשֵׂר, לָא מִכְתָּב כְּתִיב, וְלָא מִיתְנָא תְּנֵא, וְלָא אִיבְּעוֹיֵי אִיבַּעְיָא לַן.
human_translation: With regard to teruma it is written: “If a man eats that which is sacred unwittingly, then he shall add its one-fifth payment to it” and as we learned One who partakes of teruma unwittingly pays principal and one-fifth. whether one who partakes of or one who drinks or one who applies whether ritually pure teruma or ritually impure teruma . He pays its one-fifth and one-fifth of its one-fifth. While with regard to tithe, is neither written nor taught a mishna, nor raised as a dilemma before us
llm_translation: Regarding the matter of Terumah, it is written: "If a man eats holy food unintentionally, he must add a fifth of its value to it." And we learned in a Mishnah: One who eats Terumah unintentionally must pay the principal amount and a fifth. Whether one eats, drinks, or anoints with it. Whether it is pure Terumah or impure Terumah - he must pay its fifth and the fifth of that fifth. But regarding Ma'aser, it is neither written in Scripture, nor is it taught in a Mishnah, nor is it a matter of dispute among us.

hebrew_text: גַּבֵּי הֶקְדֵּשׁ כְּתִיב: ״וְאִם הַמַּקְדִּישׁ יִגְאַל אֶת בֵּיתוֹ וְיָסַף חֲמִישִׁית כֶּסֶף עֶרְכְּךָ״. וּתְנַן: הַפּוֹדֶה אֶת הֶקְדֵּשׁוֹ – מוֹסִיף חוֹמֶשׁ. חוּמְשָׁא תְּנַן, חוּמְשָׁא דְחוּמְשָׁא לָא תְּנַן. מַאי? גַּבֵּי תְּרוּמָה כְּתִיב ״וְיָסַף״, גַּבֵּי קֹדֶשׁ נָמֵי הָא כְּתִיב ״וְיָסַף״.
human_translation: With regard to consecrated it is written: “And if he who consecrated it will redeem his house, then he shall add one-fifth of the money of your valuation and we learned One who redeems his consecrated adds one-fifth We learned one-fifth; we did not learn one-fifth of the one-fifth. What With regard to teruma it is written: “Then he shall add,” with regard to consecrated too, isn’t it written: “Then he shall add”?
llm_translation: Regarding the matter of consecrated items, it is written: "But if the one who consecrated it wishes to redeem his house, he shall add a fifth to the money of your valuation." And we learned in a Mishnah: One who redeems his consecrated item - he adds a fifth. We learned a fifth, but we did not learn a fifth of a fifth. What is the reason? Regarding terumah it is written "and he shall add," and regarding consecrated items, it is also written "and he shall add."

hebrew_text: אוֹ דִלְמָא גַּבֵּי תְּרוּמָה כְּתִיב ״וְיָסַף״: אִי שָׁקְלַתְּ לֵיהּ לְוָיו דִּ״וְיָסַף״ וְשָׁדֵית לֵיהּ עַל ״חֲמִשִּׁיתוֹ״, הָוֵה לֵיהּ ״חֲמִישִׁיתָיו״. גַּבֵּי הֶקְדֵּשׁ כְּתִיב ״וְיָסַף חֲמִישִׁית״: אַף עַל גַּב דְּכִי שָׁקְלַתְּ לֵיהּ לְוָיו דִּ״וְיָסַף״ וְשָׁדֵית לֵיהּ עַל ״חֲמִישִׁית״, סוֹף סוֹף הָוֵה לֵיהּ ״חֲמִשִׁתוֹ״.
human_translation: Or perhaps With regard to teruma it is written: “Then he shall add [ veyasaf ],” If you take the vav of veyasaf , and cast it to ḥamishito , it becomes ḥamishitav , With regard to consecrated it is written: “Then he shall add [ veyasaf ] one-fifth [ ḥamishit ].” Even when you take the vav of veyasaf and cast it to ḥamishit , ultimately it is ḥamishito ,
llm_translation: Or perhaps regarding Terumah it is written "and he shall add": If you took its Levi portion and added onto it a fifth, it would be considered as his fifth. Regarding Hekdesh it is written "and he shall add a fifth": Even though you took its Levi portion and added onto it a fifth, ultimately it would be considered as his fifth.

hebrew_text: וְתִיפּוֹק לֵיהּ דְּהָוֵה לֵיהּ הֶקְדֵּשׁ שֵׁנִי. וְאָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: אַהֶקְדֵּשׁ רִאשׁוֹן מוֹסִיף חוֹמֶשׁ, עַל הֶקְדֵּשׁ שֵׁנִי אֵין מוֹסִיף חוֹמֶשׁ! אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב פַּפִּי לְרָבִינָא: הָכִי אָמַר רָבָא: חוֹמֶשׁ כִּתְחִילַּת הֶקְדֵּשׁ דָּמֵי.
human_translation: And why not derive that it is a second consecration. And Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi says: For first consecration one adds one-fifth; for second consecration one does not add one-fifth. Rav Pappi said to Ravina this Rava said: one-fifth is like of initial consecration,
llm_translation: And it should come out that he has a second sanctification. And Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: The first sanctification adds a fifth, on the second sanctification one does not add a fifth! Rav Pappi said to Ravina: So said Rava: The fifth is like the beginning of the sanctification.

hebrew_text: מַאי הָוֵה עֲלַהּ? אָמַר רַב טָבְיוֹמֵי מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּאַבָּיֵי: אָמַר קְרָא ״וְיָסַף חֲמִישִׁית כֶּסֶף עֶרְכְּךָ״, מַקִּישׁ חוּמְשׁוֹ לְכֶסֶף עֶרְכּוֹ. מָה כֶּסֶף עֶרְכּוֹ מוֹסִיף חוֹמֶשׁ – אַף כֶּסֶף חוּמְשׁוֹ נָמֵי מוֹסִיף חוֹמֶשׁ.
human_translation: What was about Rav Tavyumei said in the name of Abaye the verse states “Then he shall add one-fifth of the money of your valuation juxtaposes its one-fifth to the money of its valuation, Just as the money of its valuation one adds one-fifth, so too, the money of its one-fifth, one adds one-fifth as well.
llm_translation: What was the case regarding it? Rav Tavyumei, in the name of Abbaye, said: The verse states, "And he shall add a fifth to its value," equating the fifth to its value. Just as its value increases a fifth - so too, its fifth increases a fifth.

hebrew_text: גּוּפָא, אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: עַל הֶקְדֵּשׁ רִאשׁוֹן מוֹסִיף חוֹמֶשׁ, וְעַל הֶקְדֵּשׁ שֵׁנִי אֵין מוֹסִיף חוֹמֶשׁ. אָמַר רָבָא: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי, אָמַר קְרָא: ״וְאִם הַמַּקְדִּישׁ יִגְאַל אֶת בֵּיתוֹ״. הַמַּקְדִּישׁ, וְלֹא הַמַּתְפִּיס.
human_translation: the itself. Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi says: For first consecration one adds one-fifth; for second consecration one does not add one-fifth. Rava said: What is the reason of Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi? the verse states: “And if he who consecrated it will redeem his house, he who consecrates but not one who associates
llm_translation: The body, Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: On the first tithe, one adds a fifth, and on the second tithe, one does not add a fifth. Rava said: What is the reason for Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi's statement? The verse states: "But if the one who consecrated it wishes to redeem his house." The one who consecrated it, but not the one who seized it.

hebrew_text: תָּנֵי תַּנָּא קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: ״וְאִם בַּבְּהֵמָה הַטְּמֵאָה וּפָדָה בְעֶרְכֶּךָ״, מָה בְּהֵמָה טְמֵאָה מְיוּחֶדֶת, שֶׁתְּחִילָּתָהּ הֶקְדֵּשׁ וְכוּלָּהּ לַשָּׁמַיִם – וּמוֹעֲלִין בָּהּ, אַף כֹּל שֶׁתְּחִילָּתָהּ הֶקְדֵּשׁ וְכוּלָּהּ לַשָּׁמַיִם – מוֹעֲלִין בָּהּ.
human_translation: the tanna taught before Rabbi Elazar. “And if it is of a non-kosher animal, then he shall redeem it according to your valuation” just as a non-kosher animal is unique that it is initial consecration and it is entirely to Heaven, and one misuse by it so too, any initial consecration and is entirely to Heaven, one misuse by it
llm_translation: The Tanna taught before Rabbi Elazar: "And if it is an unclean animal and you redeem it according to your valuation," just as an unclean animal is designated, its beginning is holy and its entirety belongs to Heaven - and one may commit trespass with it, so too, anything that is designated, its beginning is holy and its entirety belongs to Heaven - one may commit trespass with it.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר לְתַנָּא: בִּשְׁלָמָא ״כּוּלָּהּ לַשָּׁמַיִם״ – לְמַעוֹטֵי קָדָשִׁים קַלִּים, כֵּיוָן דְּאִית לְהוּ לִבְעָלִים בְּגַוַּיְיהוּ – לֵית בְּהוּ מְעִילָה. אֶלָּא ״תְּחִילַּת הֶקְדֵּשׁ״ לְמַעוֹטֵי מַאי? תְּחִילַּת הֶקְדֵּשׁ הוּא דְּאִית בֵּיהּ מְעִילָה, סוֹף הֶקְדֵּשׁ לֵית בֵּיהּ מְעִילָה?! דִּלְמָא לְעִנְיַן חוֹמֶשׁ קָאָמְרַתְּ, וּכְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִין, הָכִי קָאָמֵינָא.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar said to the tanna : Granted, It is entirely to Heaven, to exclude offerings of lesser sanctity, Since the owners have in them, they are not subject to misuse But what initial consecration to exclude? initial consecration is subject to misuse ultimate consecration is not subject to misuse Perhaps to matter of one-fifth you are saying and in accordance with Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi? said to him: Yes, that is I am saying.
llm_translation: He said to him, Rabbi Elazar said to the Tanna: Regarding "all of it is for the heavens" - to exclude light holy items, since they have owners in their bodies - there is no covering for them. Rather, "the beginning of consecration" - to exclude what? What is "the beginning of consecration" that has a covering, but "the end of consecration" does not have a covering?! Perhaps you are speaking in terms of tithing, like Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi? He said to him: No, this is what I am saying.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אָשֵׁי לְרָבִינָא: בְּהֵמָה טְמֵאָה בִּתְחִילַּת הֶקְדֵּשׁ אִיתַהּ?
human_translation: Rav Ashi said to Ravina: a non-kosher animal is to initial consecration
llm_translation: Rav Ashe said to Ravina: In the case of an impure animal, is it included at the outset of the sanctification?

hebrew_text: בְּאֶמְצַע הֶקְדֵּשׁ, לֵיתַהּ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לְפִי שֶׁאֵינָהּ בְּסוֹף הֶקְדֵּשׁ.
human_translation: is not to intermediate consecration said to him: due to that is not to ultimate consecration.
llm_translation: In the middle of the Sanctuary, is she not there? He said to him: Because she is not at the end of the Sanctuary.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אַחָא: מִדִּיפְתִּי לְרָבִינָא, בְּאֶמְצַע הֶקְדֵּשׁ מִיהָא אִיתַהּ, וְלוֹסֵיף נָמֵי חוֹמֶשׁ! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הֲרֵי הוּא כְּסוֹף הֶקְדֵּשׁ, מָה סוֹף הֶקְדֵּשׁ אֵינוֹ מוֹסִיף חוֹמֶשׁ – אַף אֶמְצַע הֶקְדֵּשׁ אֵינוֹ מוֹסִיף חוֹמֶשׁ.
human_translation: Rav Aḥa of Difti said to Ravina: is at least, to intermediate consecration; and let one add one-fifth as well. said to him: like that of ultimate consecration: Just as one does not add one-fifth ultimate consecration, so too, one does not add one-fifth intermediate consecration.
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Acha: From the middle of the hekdesh she has, and to add a fifth! He said to him: Behold, it is like the end of hekdesh, just as the end of hekdesh does not add a fifth - so too the middle of hekdesh does not add a fifth.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב זוּטְרָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב מָרִי לְרָבִינָא: מַאי חָזֵית דִּמְדַמֵּית לֵיהּ לְסוֹף הֶקְדֵּשׁ? נְדַמְּיֵיהּ לִתְחִילַּת הֶקְדֵּשׁ! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מִסְתַּבְּרָא לְסוֹף הֶקְדֵּשׁ הֲוָה לֵיהּ לְדַמּוֹיֵי, שֶׁכֵּן נִתְפָּס מִנִּתְפָּס. אַדְּרַבָּה: לִתְחִילַּת הֶקְדֵּשׁ הֲוָה לֵיהּ לְדַמּוֹיֵי, שֶׁכֵּן דָּבָר שֶׁיֵּשׁ אַחֲרָיו קְדוּשָּׁה מִדָּבָר שֶׁיֵּשׁ אַחֲרָיו קְדוּשָּׁה!
human_translation: Rav Zutra, son of Rav Mari, said to Ravina: What did you see that you to liken to ultimate consecration? Let us liken it to initial consecration. said to him: It stands to reason that he should liken it to ultimate consecration, as by association with by association. On the contrary, he should have likened it to initial consecration, an item after which there is sanctity, from an item after which there is sanctity.
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Zutra, son of Rav Mari, to Ravina: What do you see that you compare it to the end of the Holy of Holies? It should be compared to the beginning of the Holy of Holies! He said to him: It makes sense to compare it to the end of the Holy of Holies, for that is how it was apprehended from what was apprehended. Adda Rabba: It should be compared to the beginning of the Holy of Holies, for something that has holiness after it is holier than something that has holiness after it!

hebrew_text: כִּדְאָמַר רָבָא ״הָעֹלָה״ – עוֹלָה רִאשׁוֹנָה. הָכִי נָמֵי ״הַטְּמֵאָה״ – טְמֵאָה רִאשׁוֹנָה.
human_translation: as Rava says: “The burnt-offering” first burnt-offering. So too, The non-kosher initial non-kosher
llm_translation: As Rava said, "The 'olah' - the first olah. Similarly, "the tamei" - the first tamei.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: ״פָּרָה זוֹ תַּחַת פָּרָה שֶׁל הֶקְדֵּשׁ״, ״טַלִּית זוֹ תַּחַת טַלִּית שֶׁל הֶקְדֵּשׁ״ – הֶקְדֵּשׁוֹ פָּדוּי, וְיַד הֶקְדֵּשׁ עַל הָעֶלְיוֹנָה.
human_translation: It is taught in accordance with of Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi: this cow is in place of cow, belongs to Temple this garment is in place of that garment, belongs to Temple his consecrated is redeemed, and the consecrated is at an advantage.
llm_translation: It was taught in the name of Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi: "This cow is in place of the cow of the Temple," "This cloak is in place of the cloak of the Temple" - its sanctity is redeemed, and the sanctity of the hand is upon the upper garment.

hebrew_text: ״פָּרָה זוֹ בְּחָמֵשׁ סְלָעִים תַּחַת פָּרָה שֶׁל הֶקְדֵּשׁ״, ״טַלִּית זוֹ בְּחָמֵשׁ סְלָעִים תַּחַת טַלִּית שֶׁל הֶקְדֵּשׁ״ – הֶקְדֵּשׁוֹ פָּדוּי. עַל הֶקְדֵּשׁ רִאשׁוֹן מוֹסִיף חוֹמֶשׁ, עַל הֶקְדֵּשׁ שֵׁנִי אֵין מוֹסִיף חוֹמֶשׁ.
human_translation: This cow at five sela is in place of this cow, belongs to Temple This garment at five sela is instead of this garment, belongs to Temple his consecrated is redeemed. He adds one-fifth initial consecration, for second consecration, he does not add one-fifth.
llm_translation: "The cow, this one with five rocks underneath the cow of the hekdesh, the garment, this one with five rocks underneath the garment of the hekdesh - its sanctification is redeemed. On the first hekdesh, one adds a fifth, on the second hekdesh, one does not add a fifth."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הָאוֹנָאָה – אַרְבָּעָה כֶּסֶף, וְהַטַּעֲנָה – שְׁתֵּי כֶּסֶף, וְהַהוֹדָאָה – שָׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה.
human_translation: The exploitation four silver And the claim two silver And the admission the value of one peruta .
llm_translation: The Mishnah: The fee - four silver coins, and the loading - two silver coins, and the admission - worth a penny.

hebrew_text: חָמֵשׁ פְּרוּטוֹת הֵן: הַהוֹדָאָה שָׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה, וְהָאִשָּׁה מִתְקַדֶּשֶׁת בְּשָׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה, וְהַנֶּהֱנֶה בְּשָׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה מִן הַהֶקְדֵּשׁ מָעַל, וְהַמּוֹצֵא שָׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה חַיָּיב לְהַכְרִיז, וְהַגּוֹזֵל אֶת חֲבֵירוֹ שָׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה וְנִשְׁבַּע לוֹ, יוֹלִיכֶנּוּ אַחֲרָיו אֲפִילּוּ לְמָדַי.
human_translation: there are five perutot : The admission the value of one peruta , and a woman is betrothed with the value of one peruta . And one who derives benefit the value of one peruta from consecrated misused and one who finds the value of one peruta is obligated to proclaim And one who robs from another the value of one peruta and took an oath to him he must take follow even to Media.
llm_translation: Five prutot they are: acknowledgment equals a prutah, and a woman becomes consecrated with a prutah, and one who benefits from a prutah of consecrated property transgresses, and one who finds a prutah must announce it, and one who steals from his fellow a prutah and swears falsely to him, he should bring him after him even to Media.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תְּנֵינָא חֲדָא זִימְנָא: הָאוֹנָאָה אַרְבָּעָה כֶּסֶף מֵעֶשְׂרִים וְאַרְבָּעָה כֶּסֶף לַסֶּלַע, שְׁתוּת לְמִקָּח! הַטַּעֲנָה שְׁתֵּי כֶּסֶף וְהַהוֹדָאָה שָׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה אִצְטְרִיכָא לֵיהּ.
human_translation: We learned another occasion The exploitation four silver from twenty-four silver in a sela , one-sixth of the transaction. necessary for The claim two silver and the admission the value of one peruta .
llm_translation: Gemara: We learned in one place: The interest of four silver coins from twenty, and four silver coins for the rock, a total of six for a purchase! The loading is two silver coins, and the acknowledgment is worth a perutah, it requires it.

hebrew_text: הָא נָמֵי תְּנֵינָא: שְׁבוּעַת הַדַּיָּינִין, הַטַּעֲנָה שְׁתֵּי כֶּסֶף וְהַהוֹדָאָה שָׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה! סֵיפָא אִצְטְרִיכָא לֵיהּ, דְּקָתָנֵי: חָמֵשׁ פְּרוּטוֹת הֵן.
human_translation: That too we learned The oath the judges the claim two silver the admission the value of one peruta . It was necessary for the latter clause as it teaches: There are five perutot ,
llm_translation: Here is the English translation of the Talmudic text: Talmudic text: "Here is what we learned: The oath of litigants, the claim is two silver coins, and the admission is worth a perutah! The latter clause is necessary, as it is taught: They are five perutot."

hebrew_text: חָמֵשׁ פְּרוּטוֹת הֵן כּוּ׳. וְלִיתְנֵי נָמֵי הָאוֹנָאָה פְּרוּטָה? אָמַר רַב כָּהֲנָא: זֹאת אוֹמֶרֶת, אֵין אוֹנָאָה לִפְרוּטוֹת.
human_translation: There are five perutot . And let also teach the exploitation one peruta . Rav Kahana said: That is to say there is no exploitation concerning perutot .
llm_translation: Five prutot they are. And should we say that ona'ah is a prutah? Rav Kahana said: This means, there is no ona'ah for prutot.

hebrew_text: וְלֵוִי אָמַר: יֵשׁ אוֹנָאָה לִפְרוּטוֹת. וְכֵן תָּנֵי לֵוִי בְּמַתְנִיתֵיהּ: חָמֵשׁ פְּרוּטוֹת הֵן: הָאוֹנָאָה פְּרוּטָה, וְהַהוֹדָאָה פְּרוּטָה, וְקִדּוּשֵׁי אִשָּׁה בִּפְרוּטָה, וְגָזֵל בִּפְרוּטָה, וִישִׁיבַת הַדַּיָּינִין בִּפְרוּטָה.
human_translation: And Levi says: There is exploitation for perutot . And likewise, Levi taught in his Mishna, there are five perutot : The exploitation one peruta , the admission one peruta , and the betrothal of a woman is with one peruta , and a robbery in one peruta , and the convening of judges in one peruta .
llm_translation: Levi said: There is ona'ah in details. And Levi also taught in his Mishnah: There are five details: ona'ah is a detail, and hod'ah is a detail, and the sanctification of a woman in detail, and theft in detail, and the seating of judges in detail.

hebrew_text: וְתַנָּא דִּידַן, מַאי טַעְמָא לָא קָתָנֵי יְשִׁיבַת הַדַּיָּינִין? תְּנָא לֵיהּ גָּזֵל.
human_translation: And the tanna of our what is the reason does not teach convening of judges He taught robbery,
llm_translation: And it was taught in our Mishnah, what is the reason that it does not teach "Yeshivat HaDayanim"? It teaches him "Gezel."

hebrew_text: וּמִי לָא תָּנֵי גָּזֵל וְקָתָנֵי אֲבֵידָה? הָנָךְ אִצְטְרִיכָא לֵיהּ: גָּזֵל – הַגּוֹזֵל מֵחֲבֵירוֹ שָׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה וְנִשְׁבָּע לוֹ, יוֹלִיכֶנּוּ אַחֲרָיו וַאֲפִילּוּ לִמְדִי. אֲבֵידָה – הַמּוֹצֵא אֲבֵידָה שָׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה חַיָּיב לְהַכְרִיז, וְאַף עַל גַּב דְּזַל.
human_translation: But doesn’t teach robbery and teach lost property? these necessary for robbery one who robs from another worth one peruta and took an oath to him he must carry follow even to Media. lost property one who finds lost property the value of one peruta is obligated to proclaim even though depreciated
llm_translation: And who does not teach both theft and lost property? It is necessary for it: Theft - one who steals from his fellow, if the stolen item is worth a prutah and he swears falsely to him, he must return it to him, even to a non-Jew. Lost property - one who finds lost property worth a prutah is obligated to proclaim it, even though it is considered as if it were stolen.

hebrew_text: וְלֵוִי, מַאי טַעְמָא לָא תָּנֵי אֲבֵידָה בִּפְרוּטָה? תְּנָא לֵיהּ גָּזֵל.
human_translation: And Levi, what is the reason does not teach lost property one peruta ? He taught robbery,
llm_translation: Levi, what is the reason he does not teach about a lost item in detail? A Tanna teaches him: theft.

hebrew_text: וּמִי לָא קָתָנֵי גָּזֵל וְקָתָנֵי יְשִׁיבַת הַדַּיָּינִין? יְשִׁיבַת הַדַּיָּינִין אִצְטְרִיכָא לֵיהּ, לְאַפּוֹקֵי מִדְּרַב קַטִּינָא, דְּאָמַר רַב קַטִּינָא: בֵּית דִּין נִזְקָקִין אֲפִילּוּ לְפָחוֹת מִשָּׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה.
human_translation: But doesn’t he teach robbery and teach the convening of judges? the convening of judges necessary for to exclude of Rav Ketina, as Rav Ketina says: The court attends to even less than the value of one peruta .
llm_translation: The Talmudic text translates as follows: "And who does not agree with the opinion of Gazel and agrees with the opinion of the Yeshiva of Dayanim? The Yeshiva of Dayanim needs it, to counter the statement of Rav Katina, as Rav Katina said: A court is needed even for an amount less than the value of a perutah."

hebrew_text: וְלֵוִי, מַאי טַעְמָא לָא קָתָנֵי הֶקְדֵּשׁ? בְּחוּלִּין קָמַיְירֵי, בְּקָדָשִׁים לָא קָמַיְירֵי.
human_translation: And Levi, what is the reason does not teach consecrated He is speaking with regard to non-sacred he is not speaking with regard to consecrated
llm_translation: Levi, what is the reason that he does not teach about consecrated items? He teaches about mundane matters, but he does not teach about consecrated items.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא תַּנָּא דִּידַן דְּקָא מַיְירֵי בְּקָדָשִׁים, נִתְנֵי מַעֲשֵׂר בִּפְרוּטָה? כְּמַאן דְּאָמַר אֵין בְּחוּמְשׁוֹ פְּרוּטָה. וְלִיתְנֵי חוֹמֶשׁ מַעֲשֵׂר בִּפְרוּטָה? בְּקַרְנָא קָא מַיְירֵי, בְּחוֹמֶשׁ לָא קָא מַיְירֵי.
human_translation: But the tanna of our who is speaking with regard to consecrated let him teach tithe one peruta . in accordance with the one who says: its one-fifth, one peruta . And let him teach tithe one-fifth, one peruta . is speaking with regard to the principal; is not speaking with regard to one-fifth.
llm_translation: Instead, our Mishna, which discusses consecrated items, teaches that tithes are given in detail? Like the one who says there is no detail in a fifth. And should it not teach that a fifth of the tithe is given in detail? It is referring to the corner, not to a fifth.

hebrew_text: גּוּפָא, אָמַר רַב קַטִּינָא: בֵּית דִּין נִזְקָקִין אֲפִילּוּ לְפָחוֹת מִשָּׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה. מֵתִיב רָבָא: ״וְאֵת אֲשֶׁר חָטָא מִן הַקֹּדֶשׁ יְשַׁלֵּם״,
human_translation: the itself Rav Ketina says: The court attends to even less than the value of one peruta . Rava raises an objection “And he shall make restitution for that which he has done amiss in the sacred matter”
llm_translation: The body, Rav Katina said: The court is needed even for less than the value of a perutah. Rava objects: "And he shall make restitution for that which he has sinned from the holy things."

hebrew_text: לְרַבּוֹת פָּחוֹת מִשָּׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה לְהִישָּׁבוֹן. לְקֹדֶשׁ – אִין, אֲבָל לְהֶדְיוֹט – לָא.
human_translation: to include less than the value of one peruta in restitution To Temple yes, but to an ordinary person [ hedyot ], no,
llm_translation: To include less than the value of a prutah for sitting. For sanctity - yes, but for commoners - no.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, אִי אִתְּמַר הָכִי אִתְּמַר: אָמַר רַב קַטִּינָא, אִם הוּזְקְקוּ בֵּית דִּין לְשָׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה – גּוֹמְרִין, אֲפִילּוּ לְפָחוֹת מִשָּׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה. תְּחִילַּת הַדִּין בָּעֵינַן פְּרוּטָה, גְּמַר הַדִּין לָא בָּעֵינַן פְּרוּטָה.
human_translation: Rather, if was stated, this it was stated: Rav Ketina says: If the court attends to the value of one peruta , conclude even less than the value of one peruta . the beginning of the legal we require one peruta , the verdict, we do not require one peruta .
llm_translation: Rather, if it was stated thus, it was stated thus: Rav Katina said, "If the court established a minimal value - we conclude, even less than the minimal value. At the beginning of the judgment, we require the minimal value, but at the conclusion of the judgment, we do not require the minimal value."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ חֲמִשָּׁה חוּמְשִׁין הֵן, אֵלּוּ הֵן: הָאוֹכֵל תְּרוּמָה, וּתְרוּמַת מַעֲשֵׂר, וּתְרוּמַת מַעֲשֵׂר שֶׁל דְּמַאי, וְהַחַלָּה, וְהַבִּכּוּרִים – מוֹסִיף חוֹמֶשׁ. וְהַפּוֹדֶה נֶטַע רְבָעִי וּמַעֲשֵׂר שֵׁנִי שֶׁלּוֹ – מוֹסִיף חוֹמֶשׁ. הַפּוֹדֶה אֶת הֶקְדֵּשׁוֹ – מוֹסִיף חוֹמֶשׁ. הַנֶּהֱנֶה שָׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה מִן הַהֶקְדֵּשׁ – מוֹסִיף חוֹמֶשׁ. וְהַגּוֹזֵל אֶת חֲבֵירוֹ שָׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה וְנִשְׁבַּע לוֹ – מוֹסִיף חוֹמֶשׁ.
human_translation: There are five one-fifth these are they: who eats teruma , or teruma of the tithe, or teruma of the tithe of demai , or ḥalla , or first fruits; he adds one-fifth And one who redeems his a fourth-year sapling or second-tithe adds one-fifth. One who redeems his consecrated adds one-fifth. One who derives benefit worth one peruta from consecrated adds one-fifth. And one who robs the value of one peruta from another and takes oath to his adds one-fifth
llm_translation: It was taught: There are five types of additional payments, and they are: one who eats Terumah, and the tithe of the tithe, and the tithe of Demai, and Challah, and first fruits - he adds a fifth. And one who redeems a fourth of his planted field and its second tithe - he adds a fifth. One who redeems his consecrated property - he adds a fifth. One who benefits from something equivalent to a Perutah from consecrated property - he adds a fifth. And one who steals from his fellow something equivalent to a Perutah and swears falsely to him - he adds a fifth.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רָבָא: קַשְׁיָא לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר תְּרוּמַת מַעֲשֵׂר שֶׁל דְּמַאי, וְכִי עָשׂוּ חֲכָמִים חִיזּוּק לְדִבְרֵיהֶם כְּשֶׁל תּוֹרָה?
human_translation: Rava says: Rabbi Elazar teruma of the tithe of demai difficult. And did the Sages reinforce their pronouncements parallel to Torah
llm_translation: Gemara said Rava: difficult for him to Rabbi Elazar tithe of demai, and when did the sages make a strengthening to their words like that of the Torah?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הָא מַנִּי – רַבִּי מֵאִיר הִיא, דְּאָמַר עָשׂוּ חֲכָמִים חִיזּוּק לְדִבְרֵיהֶם כְּשֶׁל תּוֹרָה. דְּתַנְיָא: הַמֵּבִיא גֵּט מִמְּדִינַת הַיָּם, נְתָנוֹ לָהּ וְלֹא אָמַר לָהּ ״בְּפָנַי נִכְתַּב וּבְפָנַי נֶחְתַּם״ – יוֹצִיא, וְהַוָּלָד מַמְזֵר, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אֵין הַוָּלָד מַמְזֵר. כֵּיצַד יַעֲשֶׂה? יִטְּלֶנּוּ מִמֶּנָּה וְיַחֲזוֹר וְיִתְּנֶנּוּ לָהּ בִּפְנֵי שְׁנַיִם, וְיֹאמַר לָהּ: ״בְּפָנַי נִכְתַּב וּבְפָנַי נֶחְתַּם״.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman said Shmuel said: whose is this It is Rabbi Meir, who says: The Sages reinforced their pronouncements parallel to Torah as it is taught who brings a bill of divorce from a country overseas, he gave it to but did not say to her: It was written in my presence and it was signed in my presence, must divorce and offspring a mamzer ; the statement of Rabbi Meir. And the Rabbis say: the offspring is not a mamzer . How should proceed? He should take from her and give it to her again, in the presence of two and say to her: It was written in my presence and it was signed in my presence.
llm_translation: Rav Nahman said in the name of Shmuel: This is the teaching - it is from Rabbi Meir, as the Sages made their words as strong as those of the Torah. As it was taught: One who brings a bill of divorce from overseas, gives it to her, and does not say to her, "Written and signed in my presence," - he may divorce her, and the child is a mamzer, the words of Rabbi Meir. And the Sages say: The child is not a mamzer. How should he do it? He should take it from her, return it to her in front of two witnesses, and say to her: "Written and signed in my presence."

hebrew_text: וּלְרַבִּי מֵאִיר, מִשּׁוּם דְּלֹא אָמַר לָהּ ״בְּפָנַי נִכְתַּב וּבְפָנַי נֶחְתַּם״, יוֹצִיא וְהַוָּלָד מַמְזֵר? אִין, רַבִּי מֵאִיר לְטַעְמֵיהּ, דְּאָמַר רַב הַמְנוּנָא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּעוּלָּא: אוֹמֵר הָיָה רַבִּי מֵאִיר: כָּל הַמְשַׁנֶּה מִמַּטְבֵּעַ שֶׁטָּבְעוּ חֲכָמִים בְּגִיטִּין – יוֹצִיא, וְהַוָּלָד מַמְזֵר.
human_translation: And to Rabbi Meir, due to that he did not say to her: It was written in my presence and it was signed in my presence, must he divorce her and the offspring is a mamzer ? Yes, Rabbi Meir to his reasoning, as Rav Hamnuna says in the name of Ulla Rabbi Meir would say: anyone who deviates from the formula coined by the Sages with regard to bills of divorce, must divorce her, and the offspring is a mamzer .
llm_translation: And for Rabbi Meir, because he did not say to her, "Written in my presence and signed in my presence," does he exclude the child born from a forbidden relationship? No, Rabbi Meir follows his reasoning, for Rav Hamnuna said in the name of Ulah: Rabbi Meir used to say, "Anyone who alters from the natural form that the sages established in bills of divorce – he is excluded, and the child born from a forbidden relationship."

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: מְחַלְּלִין אוֹתוֹ כֶּסֶף עַל כֶּסֶף, נְחוֹשֶׁת עַל נְחוֹשֶׁת, כֶּסֶף עַל נְחוֹשֶׁת, וּנְחוֹשֶׁת עַל הַפֵּירוֹת, וְיַחְזוֹר וְיִפְדֶּה אֶת הַפֵּירוֹת – דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: יַעֲלוּ פֵּירוֹת וְיֹאכְלוּ בִּירוּשָׁלַיִם.
human_translation: Rav Sheshet raises an objection One may desacralize silver upon silver copper upon copper silver upon copper and copper upon produce, and he may then redeem produce the statement of Rabbi Meir. And the Rabbis say: That produce must be taken up and eaten in Jerusalem.
llm_translation: The Gemara raises an objection: Rav Sheshet raises a contradiction: We may redeem it with silver for silver, copper for copper, silver for copper, and copper for produce, and then return and redeem the produce - these are the words of Rabbi Meir. And the Sages say: Let the produce be appraised and eaten in Jerusalem.

hebrew_text: וּמִי מְחַלְּלִינַן כֶּסֶף עַל נְחוֹשֶׁת? וְהָא תְּנַן: סֶלַע שֶׁל מַעֲשֵׂר שֵׁנִי וְשֶׁל חוּלִּין שֶׁנִּתְעָרְבוּ, מֵבִיא בְּסֶלַע מָעוֹת וְאוֹמֵר: כׇּל מָקוֹם שֶׁיֶּשְׁנָהּ סֶלַע שֶׁל מַעֲשֵׂר שֵׁנִי, מְחוּלֶּלֶת עַל מָעוֹת הַלָּלוּ, וּבוֹרֵר אֶת הַיָּפֶה שֶׁבָּהֶן וּמְחַלְּלוֹ עָלֶיהָ.
human_translation: And can one desacralize silver with copper But didn’t we learn sela of second tithe and of non-sacred that were intermingled, one brings ma’a a sela and says: Wherever there is a sela of second tithe redeemed upon these ma’a , And he selects the better- among and redeems upon
llm_translation: And who desecrates silver on copper? But didn't we learn: If a rock of second tithe and common produce got mixed together, one brings coins in a rock and says: Any place where there is a rock of second tithe, one desecrates on these coins, and selects the best among them and desecrates it on them.

hebrew_text: מִפְּנֵי שֶׁאָמְרוּ: מְחַלְּלִין (אוֹתוֹ), כֶּסֶף עַל נְחֹשֶׁת, מִדּוֹחַק, לֹא שֶׁיְּקַיֵּים כֵּן, אֶלָּא שֶׁחוֹזֵר וּמְחַלְּלָן עַל הַכֶּסֶף. קָתָנֵי מִיהַת: מְחַלְּלִין מִדּוֹחַק, מִדּוֹחַק – אִין, שֶׁלֹּא מִדּוֹחַק – לָא.
human_translation: due to that said: One desacralizes silver upon copper under duress. not that he will maintain that rather, that he again desacralizes them upon silver In any event, teaches one desacralizes under duress, Under duress, yes; not under duress, no.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Because they said: "They desecrate (it), silver on copper, under pressure, if it will not hold so, but rather he goes back and desecrates it on the silver." It was taught in the Mishnah: "They desecrate under pressure, under pressure - no, if not under pressure - yes."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁמֵּיקֵל רַבִּי מֵאִיר בְּפִדְיוֹנוֹ, מַחְמִיר הוּא בַּאֲכִילָתוֹ, דְּתַנְיָא: לֹא הִתִּירוּ לִמְכּוֹר דְּמַאי אֶלָּא לְסִיטוֹן בִּלְבָד, וּבַעַל הַבַּיִת. בֵּין כָּךְ וּבֵין כָּךְ, צָרִיךְ לְעַשֵּׂר, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר.
human_translation: Rav Yosef said: Although Rabbi Meir is lenient with regard to redemption he is stringent with regard to its consumption. as it is taught permitted only a wholesaler to sell demai . But a proprietor whether or whether must tithe the statement of Rabbi Meir.
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: Even though Rabbi Meir is lenient in his redemption, he is stringent in his eating, as it was taught: They did not permit the sale of produce of the Sabbatical year except to a wholesaler alone, and the owner of the house. In any case, one must tithe, the words of Rabbi Meir.

hebrew_text: וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אֶחָד הַסִּיטוֹן וְאֶחָד בַּעַל הַבַּיִת – מוֹכֵר, וְשׁוֹלֵחַ לַחֲבֵירוֹ, וְנוֹתֵן לוֹ בְּמַתָּנָה, וְאֵינוֹ חוֹשֵׁשׁ.
human_translation: And the Rabbis say: Both a wholesaler and a proprietor may sell or send to another, or give to him as a gift, and not be concerned.
llm_translation: The sages say: One who is a tenant and one who is a homeowner - may sell, and send to his fellow, and give to him as a gift, and he is not concerned.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רָבִינָא: הַלּוֹקֵחַ מִן הַנַּחְתּוֹם, מְעַשֵּׂר מִן הַחַמָּה עַל הַצּוֹנֶנֶת, וּמִן הַצּוֹנֶנֶת עַל הַחַמָּה, וַאֲפִילּוּ מִדְּפוּסִים הַרְבֵּה, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר.
human_translation: Ravina raises an objection One who purchases from a baker may tithe from warm for, cold and from cold for warm and even from many molds; the statement of Rabbi Meir.
llm_translation: Ravina raises an objection: One who takes from the sun, tithes from the shade on the wall, and from the wall onto the sun, even from many prints, these are the words of Rabbi Meir.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא מִן הַצּוֹנֶנֶת עַל הַחַמָּה, כִּדְרַבִּי אִילְעַאי. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אִילְעַאי: מִנַּיִן לַתּוֹרֵם מִן הָרָעָה עַל הַיָּפָה שֶׁתְּרוּמָתוֹ תְּרוּמָה? שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְלֹא תִשְׂאוּ עָלָיו חֵטְא בַּהֲרִימְכֶם אֶת חֶלְבּוֹ מִמֶּנּוּ״. אִם אֵינוֹ קֹדֶשׁ, נְשִׂיאַת חֵטְא לָמָּה? מִכָּאן לַתּוֹרֵם מִן הָרָעָה עַל הַיָּפָה, שֶׁתְּרוּמָתוֹ תְּרוּמָה.
human_translation: Granted, from cold for warm in accordance with Rabbi Elai, as Rabbi Elai says: From where with regard to one who separates teruma from poor-quality for superior-quality that his teruma is teruma ? as it is stated: “And you shall bear no sin by reason of it, seeing that you have set apart from it the best thereof” If is not sacred, why he bears sin? From here that one who separates teruma from poor-quality for superior-quality his teruma is teruma .
llm_translation: Talmudic text: In truth, from the tail of the lizard on the wall, like Rabbi Ilai. For Rabbi Ilai said: From where do we learn that one may separate from the evil onto the beautiful, that his separation is a true separation? As it is stated: "And you shall not bear sin because of it when you have lifted up his fat from it." If it is not holy, why the bearing of sin? From here we learn that one may separate from the evil onto the beautiful, that his separation is a true separation.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אֲפִילּוּ מִדְּפוּסִים הַרְבֵּה, לֵיחוּשׁ דִּלְמָא אָתֵי לְאַפְרוֹשֵׁי מִן הַחִיּוּב עַל הַפְּטוּר, וּמִן הַפְּטוּר עַל הַחִיּוּב!
human_translation: Rather, even from many molds, let be concerned lest come to tithe from the obligated for the exempt or from the exempt for the obligated.
llm_translation: Rather, even from the printing presses many, we should be concerned lest one come to distinguish between the obligation on the exempt and the exemption on the obligated!

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר שַׁפִּיר קָא קַשְׁיָא לֵיהּ, וּשְׁמוּאֵל לָא שַׁפִּיר קָא מְשַׁנֵּי לֵיהּ. דְּקַשְׁיָא לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: מִיתָה דְּבִידֵי שָׁמַיִם, וּמְשַׁנֵּי לֵיהּ שְׁמוּאֵל: מִיתַת בֵּית דִּין. דִּלְמָא שָׁאנֵי מִיתַת בֵּית דִּין דַּחֲמִירָא!
human_translation: Abaye said: Rabbi Elazar was legitimately difficult for him, and Shmuel did not legitimately responded to his that death at the hand of Heaven, was difficult for Rabbi Elazar, and Shmuel responded to him court capital punishment. Perhaps court capital punishment is different, as stringent,
llm_translation: Abaye said: Rabbi Elazar's argument is well-founded, and Samuel's argument is not well-founded. For Rabbi Elazar's argument is based on death by the hands of Heaven, and Samuel's argument is based on death by the court. Perhaps death by the court is more severe!

hebrew_text: וְרַב שֵׁשֶׁת לָא שַׁפִּיר קָא מוֹתֵיב לֵיהּ, דְּקָאָמְרִי אִינְהוּ מִיתָה. וּמוֹתֵיב רַב שֵׁשֶׁת לָאו, דִּכְתִיב ״לֹא תוּכַל לֶאֱכֹל בִּשְׁעָרֶיךָ״. וּלְמַאי דְּמוֹתֵיב רַב שֵׁשֶׁת, רַב יוֹסֵף שַׁפִּיר קָא מְשַׁנֵּי לֵיהּ.
human_translation: And Rav Sheshet does not legitimately raise an objection, as are speaking death, and Rav Sheshet raised objection prohibition, as it is written “You may not eat within your gates And to which Rav Sheshet raised an objection, Rav Yosef legitimately respond to his
llm_translation: Rav Sheshet does not properly state, for they say it is death. And Rav Sheshet does not properly state, as it is written, "You shall not eat within your gates." And for what Rav Sheshet does not properly state, Rav Yosef properly explains to him.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא רָבִינָא, עַד דְּמוֹתֵיב מִנַּחְתּוֹם לְסַיַּיע לֵיהּ מִפַּלְטֵר! דִּתְנַן: הַלּוֹקֵחַ מִן הַפַּלְטֵר – מְעַשֵּׂר מִן כׇּל דְּפוּס וּדְפוּס, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר.
human_translation: But Ravina, Rather than raising an objection from a baker, let him support for from merchant [ mipalter ], as we learned One who purchases from a merchant tithes from each and every mold; the statement of Rabbi Meir.
llm_translation: Rather Ravina, until he sits from his seat to help him from the Plater! For we learned: One who takes from the Plater - tithes from every press and press, the words of Rabbi Meir.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מַאי אִית לָךְ לְמֵימַר? פַּלְטֵר מִתְּרֵי תְּלָתָא גַּבְרָא זָבֵין, נַחְתּוֹם נָמֵי מֵחַד גַּבְרָא הוּא זָבֵין.
human_translation: Rather, what have you to say a merchant purchases from two three people. baker, as well; purchases from one person.
llm_translation: Rather, what do you have to say? A bed from two or three men who are selling, the price is from one man, he is selling.

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר: שְׁמוּאֵל שַׁפִּיר קָא מְשַׁנֵּי לֵיהּ, שֵׁם מִיתָה בָּעוֹלָם.
human_translation: Rava said: Shmuel responds well to the category of death in the world
llm_translation: Rava said: Shmuel beautifully explains it, the name of death in the world.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אֵלּוּ דְּבָרִים שֶׁאֵין לָהֶם אוֹנָאָה: הָעֲבָדִים, וְהַשְּׁטָרוֹת, וְהַקַּרְקָעוֹת, וְהַהֶקְדֵּשׁוֹת. אֵין לָהֶן תַּשְׁלוּמֵי כֶפֶל, וְלֹא תַּשְׁלוּמֵי אַרְבָּעָה וַחֲמִשָּׁה. שׁוֹמֵר חִנָּם אֵינוֹ נִשְׁבָּע, וְנוֹשֵׂא שָׂכָר אֵינוֹ מְשַׁלֵּם. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר:
human_translation: These are matters that are not exploitation Slaves, and documents, and land, and consecrated neither payment of double nor payment of four or five An unpaid bailee does not take an oath and a paid bailee does not pay Rabbi Shimon says:
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: These are the things that do not involve ona'ah (unfair dealing): slaves, contracts, real estate, and consecrated items. They do not require double payment, nor do they require payment of four or five times the amount. A gratuitous guardian is not required to take an oath, and a paid guardian is not required to make restitution. Rabbi Shimon says:

hebrew_text: קֳדָשִׁים שֶׁהוּא חַיָּיב בְּאַחְרָיוּתָן – יֵשׁ לָהֶן אוֹנָאָה. וְשֶׁאֵינוֹ חַיָּיב בְּאַחְרָיוּתָן – אֵין לָהֶן אוֹנָאָה. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אַף הַמּוֹכֵר סֵפֶר תּוֹרָה, בְּהֵמָה וּמַרְגָּלִית – אֵין לָהֶם אוֹנָאָה. אָמְרוּ לוֹ: לֹא אָמְרוּ אֶלָּא אֶת אֵלּוּ.
human_translation: sacrificial animals for which one bears responsibility them, they are exploitation, And for which one does not bear responsibility them, they are not exploitation. Rabbi Yehuda says: Even one who sells a Torah scroll, an animal, or a pearl, are not exploitation, said to him: stated only these
llm_translation: Holy items that one is obligated in their aftermath - they have onaah. And that which one is not obligated in their aftermath - they do not have onaah. Rabbi Yehuda says: Even one who sells a Torah scroll, an animal, and a pearl - they do not have onaah. They said to him: They only said this about these.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מְנָהָנֵי מִילֵּי? דְּתָנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״וְכִי תִמְכְּרוּ מִמְכָּר לַעֲמִיתֶךָ אוֹ קָנֹה מִיַּד עֲמִיתֶךָ״, דָּבָר הַנִּקְנֶה מִיָּד לְיָד. יָצְאוּ קַרְקָעוֹת, שֶׁאֵינָן מְטַלְטְלִים. יָצְאוּ עֲבָדִים, שֶׁהוּקְּשׁוּ לְקַרְקָעוֹת. יָצְאוּ שְׁטָרוֹת, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְכִי תִמְכְּרוּ מִמְכָּר״, שֶׁגּוּפוֹ מָכוּר וְגוּפוֹ קָנוּי. יָצְאוּ שְׁטָרוֹת, שֶׁאֵין גּוּפָן מָכוּר וְאֵין גּוּפָן קָנוּי, וְאֵינָן עוֹמְדִין אֶלָּא לִרְאָיָה שֶׁבָּהֶם.
human_translation: From where are these matters as the Sages taught: “And if you sell to your colleague an item that is sold, or acquire from your colleague’s hand, an item acquired from hand to hand. Land is excluded, as it is not movable. Slaves are excluded, as they are juxtaposed to land Documents are excluded, as it is written: “And if you sell an item that is sold,” an item itself sold and itself acquired. Documents are excluded, as they are not sold themselves and they are not acquired themselves. and they exist only for the proof therein.
llm_translation: Gemara: What are the cases of movable property? For the Rabbis taught: "And if you sell anything to your neighbor or acquire from the hand of your neighbor," - a matter that is acquired from hand to hand. Real estate is excluded, as it is not movable. Slaves are excluded, as they are attached to the real estate. Contracts are excluded, as it is written: "And if you sell anything," indicating that the body is sold and the body is acquired. Contracts are excluded, where the body is not sold and the body is not acquired, and they only stand for the purpose of the writing contained in them.

hebrew_text: מִכָּאן אָמְרוּ: הַמּוֹכֵר שְׁטָרוֹתָיו לְבַשָּׂם, יֵשׁ לָהֶם אוֹנָאָה. פְּשִׁיטָא! לְאַפּוֹקֵי מִדְּרַב כָּהֲנָא, דְּאָמַר: אֵין אוֹנָאָה לִפְרוּטוֹת, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן: יֵשׁ אוֹנָאָה לִפְרוּטוֹת. הֶקְדֵּשׁוֹת? אָמַר קְרָא ״אָחִיו״ – אָחִיו, וְלֹא הֶקְדֵּשׁ.
human_translation: From here said: one who sells his documents to a perfumer they are exploitation obvious? to exclude Rav Kahana, who says: There is no exploitation for perutot , teach us: There is exploitation for perutot . Consecrated the verse states: his brother” “his brother,” but not consecrated
llm_translation: Talmudic text: From here they said: One who sells his promissory notes to a perfumer, they have ona'ah. Obviously! To oppose Rav Kahana, who said: There is no ona'ah for details, it is heard for us: There is ona'ah for details. Consecrated items? The verse says "his brother" - his brother, not consecrated.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַבָּה בַּר מֶמֶל: כֹּל הֵיכָא דִּכְתִיב ״יָדוֹ״, יָדוֹ מַמָּשׁ הוּא? אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה, דִּכְתִיב ״וַיִּקַּח אֶת כׇּל אַרְצוֹ מִיָּדוֹ״, הָכִי נָמֵי דְּכֹל אַרְעָא בִּידֵיהּ הֲוָה נָקֵיט לַהּ? אֶלָּא מֵרְשׁוּתוֹ, הָכָא נָמֵי מֵרְשׁוּתוֹ.
human_translation: Rabba bar Memel objects to this: anywhere that it is written “his hand,” is his actual hand, If that is so, which is written: “And taken all his land from his hand” also here he was holding all his land in his hand? Rather, from his possession. Here too, from his possession.
llm_translation: Rabah bar Memel objected to him: Wherever it is written "his hand," is it his actual hand? Rather, from now on, since it is written "and he took all his land from his hand," is it possible that he took all the land in his hands? Rather, from his possession, here it means from his possession.

hebrew_text: וְכֹל הֵיכָא דִּכְתִיב ״יָדוֹ״, לָאו יָדוֹ מַמָּשׁ הוּא? וְהָתַנְיָא: ״אִם הִמָּצֵא תִמָּצֵא בְיָדוֹ״, אֵין לִי אֶלָּא יָדוֹ. גַּגּוֹ, חֲצֵירוֹ וְקַרְפֵּיפוֹ מִנַּיִן? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״אִם הִמָּצֵא תִמָּצֵא״, מִכׇּל מָקוֹם.
human_translation: anywhere that it is written “his hand” is not his actual hand? But isn’t it taught “If is found in his hand” I have only his hand; from where his roof, his courtyard, or his enclosure? The verse states: “If is found [ himmatze timmatze ]”; in any case
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And wherever it is written "his hand," is it not his actual hand? And it was taught: "If it is found in his hand," I have only his hand. His roof, his courtyard, and his balcony, from where? The Talmud teaches: "If it is found, it shall be found," from any place.

hebrew_text: טַעְמָא דִּכְתַב רַחֲמָנָא ״אִם הִמָּצֵא תִמָּצֵא״, הָא לָאו הָכִי הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: כֹּל הֵיכָא דִּכְתַב ״יָדוֹ״, יָדוֹ מַמָּשׁ הוּא. וְתוּ, תַּנְיָא: ״וְנָתַן בְּיָדָהּ״, אֵין לִי אֶלָּא יָדָהּ. גַּגָּהּ חֲצֵירָהּ וְקַרְפֵּיפָהּ מִנַּיִן? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְנָתַן״, מִכׇּל מָקוֹם. טַעְמָא דִּכְתַב רַחֲמָנָא ״וְנָתַן״, הָא לָאו הָכִי הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: כֹּל הֵיכָא דִּכְתַב ״יָדוֹ״, יָדוֹ מַמָּשׁ.
human_translation: The reason the Merciful One writes: “If the theft is found [ himmatze timmatze ].” that not so, I would say wherever He writes “his hand,” is his actual hand. And furthermore, it is taught “And place it in her hand” I have only her hand; from where her roof, her courtyard, or her enclosure? The verse states: And place, in any case The reason the Merciful One writes “and place.” that not so, I would say wherever He writes “his hand,” is his actual hand.
llm_translation: The reason that the Merciful One wrote "if it is found, it shall be found," I would not have said this way: wherever it writes "his hand," it is his actual hand. And furthermore, it was taught: "and he placed it in her hand," I have only her hand. How do we know her roof, courtyard, and balcony? The Talmud teaches: "and he placed," from any place. The reason that the Merciful One wrote "and he placed," I would not have said this way: wherever it writes "his hand," it is his actual hand.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, כֹּל ״יָדוֹ״ – יָדוֹ מַמָּשׁ הוּא. וְשָׁאנֵי הָתָם, דְּלֵיכָּא לְמֵימַר הָכִי, אֶלָּא בִּרְשׁוּתוֹ.
human_translation: Rather, Every “his hand” is his actual hand. And it is different there, where it cannot be said that Rather, In his possession.
llm_translation: Rather, all "his hand" - his actual hand. And the difference there is that there is no need to say so, rather in his domain.

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי רַבִּי זֵירָא: שְׂכִירוּת יֵשׁ לוֹ אוֹנָאָה, אוֹ אֵין לוֹ אוֹנָאָה? ״מִמְכָּר״ אָמַר רַחֲמָנָא, אֲבָל לֹא שְׂכִירוּת, אוֹ דִלְמָא לָא שְׁנָא? אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: מִי כְּתִיב ״מִמְכָּר לְעוֹלָם״? ״מִמְכָּר״ סְתָמָא כְּתִיב, וְהַאי נָמֵי, בְּיוֹמֵיהּ מְכִירָה הִיא.
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira raises a dilemma rental: it to exploitation, it not to exploitation? an item that is sold the Merciful One speaks, but not a rental; or perhaps is no difference? Abaye said to him: Is it written: an item that is sold forever? is written simply: an item that is sold,” and indeed for its day is a sale.
llm_translation: Inquiry of Rabbi Zeira: Does renting have ona'ah, or does it not have ona'ah? "Sale," the Merciful One said, but not renting, or perhaps it is not different? Abaye said to him: Who is it written "a sale forever"? "Sale" is written simply, and this too, during his days it is a sale.

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי רָבָא: חִטִּין וּזְרָעָן בַּקַּרְקַע, מַהוּ? יֵשׁ לָהֶם אוֹנָאָה, אוֹ אֵין לָהֶם אוֹנָאָה? כְּמַאן דְּשַׁדְיָין בְּכַדָּא דָּמְיָין, וְיֵשׁ לָהֶם אוֹנָאָה, אוֹ דִלְמָא בַּטְּלִינְהוּ עַל גַּב אַרְעָא?
human_translation: Rava raises a dilemma: wheat and one sowed them in the ground, what is they to exploitation, or they not to exploitation? like cast into a jug, and they to exploitation, Or, perhaps he subordinated them to the ground,
llm_translation: Rava asked: Wheat and their seeds in the ground, what is the law regarding them? Do they have ona'ah (unfair pricing) or do they not have ona'ah? According to the one who compares them to a vessel, and they have ona'ah, or perhaps we nullify them on the ground?

hebrew_text: הֵיכִי דָמֵי? אִילֵימָא דְּאָמַר אִיהוּ: ״שְׁדַאי בַּהּ שִׁיתָּא״, וַאֲתוֹ סָהֲדִי וְאָמְרִי דְּלָא שְׁדָא בָּהּ אֶלָּא חַמְשָׁה, וְהָאָמַר רָבָא: כׇּל דָּבָר שֶׁבְּמִדָּה וְשֶׁבְּמִשְׁקָל וְשֶׁבְּמִנְיָן, אֲפִילּוּ פָּחוֹת מִכְּדֵי אוֹנָאָה – חוֹזֵר!
human_translation: What are the circumstances? If we say that said: I sowed six in and witnesses came and said that he sowed only five in it, but doesn’t Rava say: any item that by measure, or by weight, or by number, even less than the measure of exploitation reversed.
llm_translation: "How are the damages estimated? Perhaps one might say that he said, 'Assess it at six,' and then witnesses came and said that it should not be assessed at more than five. But didn't Rava say: 'Anything that involves measurement, weight, or count, even if it is less than the value of a perutah, one must return it!'"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא דְּאָמַר אִיהוּ: ״שְׁדַאי בָּהּ כִּדְאִבְּעִי לַהּ״, וְאִיגַּלַּאי מִילְּתָא דְּלָא שְׁדָא בָּהּ כִּדְאִבְּעִי לַהּ, יֵשׁ לָהֶם אוֹנָאָה אוֹ אֵין לָהֶם אוֹנָאָה? כְּמַאן דִּשְׁדֵי בְּכַדָּא דָּמְיָין וְיֵשׁ לָהֶם אוֹנָאָה, אוֹ דִּלְמָא בַּטְּלִינְהוּ אַגַּב אַרְעָא?
human_translation: Rather, where said: I cast as required, and it was discovered that he did not cast as required. they to exploitation they not to exploitation? like cast into a jug, and they to exploitation? Or, perhaps subordinated them to the ground?
llm_translation: Rather, he said: "It is sufficient for her as she desires," and the matter is revealed that it is not sufficient for her as she desires, do they have ona'ah or do they not have ona'ah? According to the one who values the jug and they have ona'ah, or perhaps they nullify it due to the land?

hebrew_text: נִשְׁבָּעִין עֲלֵיהֶן, אוֹ אֵין נִשְׁבָּעִין עֲלֵיהֶן? כְּמַאן דְּשַׁדְיָין בְּכַדָּא דָּמְיָין וְנִשְׁבָּעִין עֲלֵיהֶן, אוֹ דִלְמָא בַּטְּלִינְהוּ אַגַּב אַרְעָא וְאֵין נִשְׁבָּעִין עֲלֵיהֶן?
human_translation: he take an oath with regard to or he not take an oath with regard to like cast into a jug, and one takes an oath with regard to them? Or, perhaps he subordinated them to the ground, and one does not take an oath with regard to them, one does not take an oath about
llm_translation: Sworn upon them, or not sworn upon them? According to the one who evaluates with a jug of wine and swears upon them, or perhaps they are nullified due to the land, and not sworn upon them?

hebrew_text: עוֹמֶר מַתִּירָן אוֹ אֵין עוֹמֶר מַתִּירָן? הֵיכִי דָמֵי: אִי דְּאַשְׁרוּשׁ – תְּנֵינָא, אִי דְּלָא אַשְׁרוּשׁ – תְּנֵינָא! דִּתְנַן: אִם הִשְׁרִישׁוּ קוֹדֶם לָעוֹמֶר – עוֹמֶר מַתִּירָן, וְאִם לָאו – אֲסוּרִין עַד שֶׁיָּבֹא עוֹמֶר הַבָּא!
human_translation: omer offering permit or does omer offering not permit What are the circumstances? If where took root, we learned If where did not take root, we learned As we learned If took root before the omer offering, omer offering renders it permitted them. And if not, it is prohibited to eat them until the next omer offering will arrive.
llm_translation: The Omer permits or does the Omer not permit? What is the case? If they uprooted before the Omer - the Omer permits, and if not - the Omer does not permit! As we learned: If they uprooted before the Omer - the Omer permits, and if not - they are forbidden until the next Omer comes!

hebrew_text: לָא צְרִיכָא, דְּחַצְדִינְהוּ וְזַרְעִינְהוּ קוֹדֶם לָעוֹמֶר, וַאֲתָא לֵיהּ עוֹמֶר וַחֲלֵיף עִילָּוַיְיהוּ, וְלָא אַשְׁרוּשׁ קוֹדֶם לָעוֹמֶר.
human_translation: No, necessary where one reaped and sowed prior to the omer offering, and the omer offering arrived and passed they and did not take root before the omer offering.
llm_translation: Not necessary, for we cut them and sow them before the Omer, and the Omer arrives and changes their status, and not the Ashrush before the Omer.

hebrew_text: מַהוּ לְמִינְקַט וּמֵיכַל מִינַּיְיהוּ: כְּמַאן דְּשַׁדְיָין בְּכַדָּא דָּמֵי, וּשְׁרִינְהוּ עוֹמֶר, אוֹ דִלְמָא בַּטְּלִינְהוּ אַגַּב אַרְעָא? תֵּיקוּ.
human_translation: What is to take and eat from them? like cast into a jug, and omer offering rendered their permitted? Or perhaps he subordinated them to the ground, shall stand
llm_translation: What is the law regarding a small vessel and a large vessel: according to the one who estimates by the measure of a kab, and he permits it in an omer, or perhaps he nullifies it due to the earth? This matter remains unresolved.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: אָמַר רַב חַסָּא, בָּעֵי רַבִּי אַמֵּי: אוֹנָאָה אֵין לָהֶם, בִּיטּוּל מִקָּח יֵשׁ לָהֶם אוֹ אֵין לָהֶן? אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: הֲדַר אָמַר רַב חַסָּא, פָּשֵׁיט רַבִּי אַמֵּי: אוֹנָאָה אֵין לָהֶם, בִּיטּוּל מִקָּח יֵשׁ לָהֶם. רַבִּי יוֹנָה אָמַר אַהֶקְדֵּשׁוֹת, רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה אָמַר אַקַּרְקָעוֹת, וְתַרְוַיְיהוּ מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמְרוּ: אוֹנָאָה אֵין לָהֶם, בִּיטּוּל מִקָּח יֵשׁ לָהֶן.
human_translation: Rava said Rav Ḥasa said Rabbi Ami raises a dilemma they are not exploitation they are nullification of the transaction Or, they are not Rav Naḥman said: Rav Ḥasa then said Rabbi Ami resolved They are not exploitation; they are nullification of the transaction. Rabbi Yona said: to consecrated Rabbi Yirmeya said: to land. And both of them said in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan: They are not exploitation; they are nullification of the transaction.
llm_translation: Rava said: Rav Ḥasa said, the students of Rabbi Ammi asked: Do they have ona'ah or not? Do they have the option of annulment of a purchase or not? Rav Naḥman said: When Rav Ḥasa returned, Rabbi Ammi's statement was clear: They do not have ona'ah, but they do have the option of annulment of a purchase. Rabbi Yonah said Akdishot, Rabbi Yirmeya said Akarke'ot, and both in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan they said: They do not have ona'ah, but they have the option of annulment of a purchase.

hebrew_text: מַאן דְּאָמַר אַהֶקְדֵּשׁוֹת, כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן אַקַּרְקָעוֹת. מַאן דְּאָמַר אַקַּרְקָעוֹת, אֲבָל אַהֶקְדֵּשׁוֹת לָא. כְּדִשְׁמוּאֵל, דְּאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הֶקְדֵּשׁ שָׁוֶה מָנֶה שֶׁחִילְּלוֹ עַל שָׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה – מְחוּלָּל.
human_translation: one who states to consecrated all the more so to land. The one who states to land but to consecrated in accordance with of Shmuel, as Shmuel says: Consecrated worth one hundred dinars that one desacralized upon worth one peruta , is desacralized.
llm_translation: The one who says "ahakdishot," all the more so "akarka'ot." The one who says "akarka'ot," but not "ahakdishot." As Shmuel said: Shmuel said: One who sanctifies is equivalent to one who appraises, for he has profaned the equivalent of a prutah - he is profaned.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן הָתָם: אִם הָיָה קוֹדֶשׁ בַּעַל מוּם, יָצָא לְחוּלִּין, וְצָרִיךְ לַעֲשׂוֹת לוֹ דָּמִים. אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: יָצָא לְחוּלִּין – דְּבַר תּוֹרָה, וְצָרִיךְ לַעֲשׂוֹת לוֹ דָּמִים – מִדִּבְרֵיהֶם. וְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אָמַר: אַף צָרִיךְ לַעֲשׂוֹת לוֹ דָּמִים מִן הַתּוֹרָה.
human_translation: We learned there If consecrated was blemished leaves non-sacred and one is required to calculate monetary Rabbi Yoḥanan says: leaves non-sacred by Torah law, and one is required to calculate monetary by rabbinic law. And Reish Lakish says: Even one is required to calculate monetary by Torah law.
llm_translation: We learned there: If there was consecrated property with a blemish, it goes out to common use, and one must make restitution for it. Rabbi Yochanan said: It goes out to common use - a matter of Torah law, and one must make restitution for it - from their words. And Reish Lakish said: One must also make restitution for it from the Torah.

hebrew_text: בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן? אִילֵימָא בִּכְדֵי אוֹנָאָה, בְּהָא לֵימָא רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: צָרִיךְ לַעֲשׂוֹת לוֹ דָּמִים דְּבַר תּוֹרָה? וְהָתְנַן: אֵלּוּ דְּבָרִים שֶׁאֵין לָהֶם אוֹנָאָה: הַקַּרְקָעוֹת, וְהָעֲבָדִים, וְהַשְּׁטָרוֹת, וְהַהֶקְדֵּשׁוֹת!
human_translation: With what are we dealing? If we say the measure of exploitation, does Reish Lakish say in that He is required to calculate monetary by Torah law? But didn’t we learn These are matters that are not exploitation: Land, slaves, documents, and consecrated
llm_translation: In what are we dealing? If you say in the case of ona'ah, in this regard Reish Lakish said: Is it necessary to pay him blood of the Torah? But we learned: These are the things that have no ona'ah: lands, slaves, documents, and consecrated items!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא בִּיטּוּל מִקָּח, בְּהָא לֵימָא רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן צָרִיךְ לַעֲשׂוֹת לוֹ דָּמִים מִדִּבְרֵיהֶם? וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹנָה אַהֶקְדֵּשׁוֹת, וְרַבִּי יִרְמְיָה אָמַר אַקַּרְקָעוֹת, וְתַרְוַיְיהוּ מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמְרִי: אוֹנָאָה אֵין לָהֶם, בִּיטּוּל מִקָּח יֵשׁ לָהֶם! לְעוֹלָם בְּבִיטּוּל מִקָּח, וְאֵיפוֹךְ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן – לְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ, וּדְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ – לְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן.
human_translation: Rather, nullification of the transaction. In that case, would Rabbi Yoḥanan say: He is required to calculate in monetary by rabbinic law? But didn’t Rabbi Yona say to consecrated and Rabbi Yirmeya say to land, and both of them say in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan: They are not exploitation; they are nullification of the transaction? Actually, nullification of the transaction. And reverse of Rabbi Yoḥanan to Reish Lakish, and of Reish Lakish to Rabbi Yoḥanan.
llm_translation: Rather, regarding the annulment of a transaction, with that should it be said, Rabbi Yochanan requires that blood be drawn from their words? But didn't Rabbi Yonah say "consecrated items," and Rabbi Yirmeya say "plowed fields," and both in the name of Rabbi Yochanan said: "They have no claim, annulment of a transaction they have!" Indeed, regarding the annulment of a transaction, and the opposite of Rabbi Yochanan – to Reish Lakish, and Reish Lakish – to Rabbi Yochanan.

hebrew_text: בְּמַאי קָמִיפַּלְגִי? בְּדִשְׁמוּאֵל, דְּאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הֶקְדֵּשׁ שָׁוֶה מָנֶה שֶׁחִילְּלוֹ עַל שָׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה – מְחוּלָּל. מָר אִית לֵיהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל, וּמָר לֵית לֵיהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל.
human_translation: With regard to what do disagree? with regard to of Shmuel, as Shmuel says: Consecrated worth one hundred dinars that one desacralized worth one peruta is desacralized. Sage, accepts of Shmuel, And Sage, does not accept of Shmuel,
llm_translation: With what did he disagree? With regard to Shmuel, for Shmuel said: If consecrated property is equal in value to a Maneh, and he profaned it for the value of a Perutah - it is profaned. One Master has Shmuel, and one Master does not have Shmuel.

hebrew_text: אִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא, דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא אִית לְהוּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל, וְהָכָא בְּהָא קָמִיפַּלְגִי: מָר סָבַר שֶׁחִילְּלוֹ – אִין, לְכַתְּחִילָּה – לָא. וּמָר סָבַר: אֲפִילּוּ לְכַתְּחִלָּה.
human_translation: If you wish, say that everyone accepts of Shmuel, and here they disagree about this: Sage, yes, that one desacralized ab initio , no, And Sage, even ab initio .
llm_translation: If you wish, say that in the entire world there is one named Shmuel, and here in this case they disagree: One master holds that if he desecrated - no, ideally - yes. And the other master holds: even ideally.

hebrew_text: אִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: לְעוֹלָם בִּכְדֵי אוֹנָאָה, וְלָא תֵּיפוֹךְ, וּבִדְרַב חִסְדָּא קָמִיפַּלְגִי, דְּאָמַר: מַאי אֵין לָהֶם אוֹנָאָה? אֵינָן בְּתוֹרַת אוֹנָאָה,
human_translation: If you wish, say Actually, the measure of exploitation, and do not reverse And they disagree with regard to of Rav Ḥisda, who said: What They are not exploitation? they are not the principle of exploitation
llm_translation: If you wish, say: Always in order to prevent oppression, and not to reverse, and in the school of Hesed they argue, for it is said: What, do they not have oppression? They are not under the law of oppression.

hebrew_text: דַּאֲפִילּוּ פָּחוֹת מִכְּדֵי אוֹנָאָה חוֹזֵר.
human_translation: that even less than the measure of exploitation, may renege
llm_translation: Even less than the value of Ona'ah, he returns.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: רִבִּית וְאוֹנָאָה לַהֶדְיוֹט, וְאֵין רִבִּית וְאוֹנָאָה לַהֶקְדֵּשׁ! מִי אַלִּימָא מִמַּתְנִיתִין דְּאוֹקֵימְנָא בְּתוֹרַת אוֹנָאָה? הָכִי נָמֵי: רִבִּית וְדִין אוֹנָאָה לַהֶדְיוֹט, וְאֵין רִבִּית וְדִין אוֹנָאָה לַהֶקְדֵּשׁ.
human_translation: raises an objection with a layman are interest and exploitation, but consecrated are not interest and exploitation. Is stronger than the mishna, which we established to the principle of exploitation, So too interest and principle of exploitation apply to a layman, but interest and principle of exploitation do not apply to consecrated
llm_translation: Challenger: Interest and usury for a layman, but there is no interest and usury for the Temple treasury! Do we say this based on the Mishnah that establishes the law of usury? So too: Interest and the law of usury for a layman, but there is no interest and the law of usury for the Temple treasury.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, הַיְינוּ דְּקָתָנֵי סֵיפָא: זֶה חוֹמֶר בַּהֶדְיוֹט מִבַּהֶקְדֵּשׁ? אַרִבִּית! לִיתְנֵי נָמֵי: זֶה חוֹמֶר בַּהֶקְדֵּשׁ מִבַּהֶדְיוֹט, אַאוֹנָאָה!
human_translation: If so, that which is taught the latter clause This is the stringency with regard to the layman, in contrast to with regard to consecrated of interest, let also teach: This is the stringency with regard to consecrated in contrast to with regard to the layman
llm_translation: If so, this is what is taught in the latter part: Is this a stringency in mundane matters compared to matters of sanctity? A fortiori! It should also be taught: Is this a stringency in matters of sanctity compared to mundane matters? A fortiori!

hebrew_text: הָכִי הַשְׁתָּא? בִּשְׁלָמָא, זֶה חוֹמֶר בַּהֶדְיוֹט מִבַּהֶקְדֵּשׁ, וְתוּ לָא. אֶלָּא הֶקְדֵּשׁ, זֶה חוֹמֶר וְתוּ לָא?
human_translation: How can be compared? Granted, This is the stringency with regard to the layman, in contrast to with regard to consecrated and nothing further, But consecrated property, This is stringency, and nothing further,
llm_translation: So now? In Shlama, this is a matter of mundane from sacred, and if not. Rather, sacred, this is a matter and if not?

hebrew_text: רִבִּית דְּהֶקְדֵּשׁ הֵיכִי דָמֵי? אִילֵּימָא דְּאוֹזְפֵיהּ גִּזְבָּר מֵאָה בְּמֵאָה וְעֶשְׂרִים – וַהֲלֹא מָעַל הַגִּזְבָּר, וְכֵיוָן שֶׁמָּעַל הַגִּזְבָּר, יָצְאוּ מְעוֹתָיו לְחוּלִּין, וְהָווּ לְהוּ דְּהֶדְיוֹט!
human_translation: What are the circumstances of interest of consecrated If we say that treasurer lent one hundred in one hundred and twenty didn’t the treasurer misuse And once the treasurer misused his money leaves non-sacred And it is of a layman,
llm_translation: Interest of the Temple treasury how blood? Perhaps that he stole a mouse a hundred for a hundred and twenty - but isn't it a trespass of the mouse, and once it is a trespass of the mouse, his coins became mundane, and they were like the coins of the layman!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב הוֹשַׁעְיָא: הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן? כְּגוֹן שֶׁקִּיבֵּל עָלָיו לְסַפֵּק סְלָתוֹת מֵאַרְבַּע, וְעָמְדוּ מִשָּׁלֹשׁ. כִּדְתַנְיָא: הַמְקַבֵּל עָלָיו לְסַפֵּק סְלָתוֹת מֵאַרְבַּע וְעָמְדוּ מִשָּׁלֹשׁ – מְסַפֵּק מֵאַרְבַּע; מִשָּׁלֹשׁ וְעָמְדוּ מֵאַרְבַּע – מְסַפֵּק מֵאַרְבַּע, שֶׁיַּד הֶקְדֵּשׁ עַל הָעֶלְיוֹנָה.
human_translation: Rav Hoshaya said: With what are we dealing here? where one accepts upon himself to supply fine flour at four and stood at three as it is taught one who accepts upon himself to supply fine flour at four and stood at three supply at four at three and stood at four supply at four as the treasury is at an advantage.
llm_translation: Rav Hoshaya said: Here, what are we dealing with? For example, if one accepted upon himself to supply four seahs of flour, and they stood from three. As it was taught: One who accepts upon himself to supply four seahs of flour and they stood from three - he supplies four; from three and they stood from four - he supplies four, for the hand of the Holy One is upon the superior.

hebrew_text: רַב פָּפָּא אָמַר: הָכָא בְּאַבְנֵי בִנְיָן הַמְּסוּרוֹת לְגִזְבָּר עָסְקִינַן, כְּדִשְׁמוּאֵל, דְּאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: בּוֹנִין בַּחוֹל, וְאַחַר כָּךְ מַקְדִּישִׁין.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said Here we are dealing with building stones that are entrusted to the treasurer, in accordance with of Shmuel, as Shmuel says: One builds with non-sacred and one consecrates thereafter.
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: Here we are dealing with building stones designated for the treasurer, as Shmuel said: Shmuel said: We build with sand, and afterwards we consecrate.

hebrew_text: אֵין בָּהֶן תַּשְׁלוּמֵי כֶפֶל וְכוּ׳. מְנָהָנֵי מִילֵּי? דְּתָנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״עַל כׇּל דְּבַר פֶּשַׁע״ – כְּלָל, ״עַל שׁוֹר עַל חֲמוֹר עַל שֶׂה עַל שַׂלְמָה״ – פְּרָט, ״עַל כׇּל אֲבֵדָה אֲשֶׁר יֹאמַר״ – חָזַר וְכָלַל.
human_translation: are not payment of double From where are these matters as the Sages taught “For any matter of trespass” a generalization; “whether it be for an ox, for a donkey, for a sheep, for a garment” a detail. “Or for any manner of lost thing,” it then generalizes
llm_translation: Talmudic text: They do not have double payments, etc. Are these words beneficial? For the Rabbis taught: "For every sin" - this is a general principle, "For an ox, for a donkey, for a sheep, for a garment" - this is a specification, "For any lost item of which one may say" - he repeated and included.

hebrew_text: כְּלָל וּפְרָט וּכְלָל, אִי אַתָּה דָן אֶלָּא כְּעֵין הַפְּרָט; מָה הַפְּרָט מְפוֹרָשׁ – דָּבָר הַמִּטַּלְטֵל וְגוּפוֹ מָמוֹן, אַף כׇּל דָּבָר הַמִּטַּלְטֵל וְגוּפוֹ מָמוֹן.
human_translation: a generalization, and a detail, and a generalization, you may deduce only similar to the detail. just as the detail defined as an item that is movable property and intrinsic monetary so too any item that is movable property and intrinsic monetary
llm_translation: General and specific and general, if you judge only like the specific; just as the specific is explicit - something that is movable and its essence is monetary, so too, anything that is movable and its essence is monetary.

hebrew_text: יָצְאוּ קַרְקָעוֹת, שֶׁאֵינָן מִטַּלְטְלִין. יָצְאוּ עֲבָדִים, שֶׁהוּקְּשׁוּ לְקַרְקָעוֹת. יָצְאוּ שְׁטָרוֹת, שֶׁאַף עַל פִּי שֶׁמִּטַּלְטְלִין, אֵין גּוּפָן מָמוֹן. הֶקְדֵּשׁוֹת – אָמַר קְרָא: ״רֵעֵהוּ״ – רֵעֵהוּ וְלֹא הֶקְדֵּשׁ.
human_translation: Land is excluded, as it is not movable property. slaves are excluded, as they are compared to land documents are excluded, as, although they are movable property, they do not intrinsic monetary consecrated is excluded it is written the other, but not Temple
llm_translation: The earthworms went out, which do not move. The slaves went out, who were attached to the earthworms. The promissory notes went out, even though they move, their substance is not money. Consecrated items - the verse says: "his neighbor" - his neighbor and not consecrated.

hebrew_text: וְלֹא תַּשְׁלוּמֵי אַרְבָּעָה וַחֲמִשָּׁה וְכוּ׳. מַאי טַעְמָא? תַּשְׁלוּמֵי אַרְבָּעָה וַחֲמִשָּׁה אָמַר רַחֲמָנָא, וְלֹא תַּשְׁלוּמֵי שְׁלֹשָׁה וְאַרְבָּעָה.
human_translation: Nor payment of four and five What is the reason The Merciful One states a payment of four or five but not payment of three and four
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And not payments of four and five, etc. What is the reason? Payments of four and five, the Merciful One said, and not payments of three and four." English translation: "And not payments of four and five, etc. What is the reason? Payments of four and five, the Merciful One said, and not payments of three and four."

hebrew_text: שׁוֹמֵר חִנָּם אֵינוֹ נִשְׁבָּע וְכוּ׳. מְנָהָנֵי מִילֵּי? דְּתָנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״כִּי יִתֵּן אִישׁ אֶל רֵעֵהוּ״ – כְּלָל, ״כֶּסֶף אוֹ כֵּלִים״ – פְּרָט, ״וְגֻנַּב מִבֵּית הָאִישׁ״ – חָזַר וְכָלַל.
human_translation: An unpaid bailee does not take an oath From where are these matters as the Sages taught “When a man delivers to his neighbor” a generalization; “money or vessels” a detail. “And it is stolen out of the man’s house,” it then generalizes
llm_translation: The one who watches for free is not liable to swear, etc. What are the specifics? For the Rabbis taught: "When a man gives to his neighbor" - this is a general principle, "silver or vessels" - this is a specification, "and it was stolen from the man's house" - he returns and includes it in the general principle.

hebrew_text: כְּלָל וּפְרָט וּכְלָל, אִי אַתָּה דָן אֶלָּא כְּעֵין הַפְּרָט: מָה הַפְּרָט מְפוֹרָשׁ – דָּבָר הַמִּטַּלְטֵל וְגוּפוֹ מָמוֹן, אַף כׇּל דָּבָר הַמִּטַּלְטֵל וְגוּפוֹ מָמוֹן.
human_translation: a generalization, and a detail, and a generalization, you may deduce only similar to the detail. just as the detail defined as an item that is movable property and intrinsic monetary so too any item that is movable property and intrinsic monetary
llm_translation: General and specific and general, if you judge only like the specific: just as the specific is explicit - something that is movable and its essence is monetary, so too, everything that is movable and its essence is monetary.

hebrew_text: יָצְאוּ קַרְקָעוֹת, שֶׁאֵינָן מִטַּלְטְלִין. יָצְאוּ עֲבָדִים, שֶׁהוּקְּשׁוּ לְקַרְקָעוֹת. יָצְאוּ שְׁטָרוֹת, שֶׁאַף עַל פִּי שֶׁמִּטַּלְטְלִין, אֵין גּוּפָן מָמוֹן. הֶקְדֵּשׁוֹת – אָמַר קְרָא: ״רֵעֵהוּ״ – רֵעֵהוּ, וְלֹא שֶׁל הֶקְדֵּשׁ.
human_translation: Land is excluded, as it is not movable property. slaves are excluded, as they are compared to land documents are excluded, as, although they are movable property, they do not intrinsic monetary consecrated is excluded it is written the other, but not Temple
llm_translation: The earth came out, which does not move. Slaves came out, who are attached to the earth. Documents came out, even though they move, their essence is not money. Consecrated items - the verse says: "his neighbor" - his neighbor, and not that of consecrated items.

hebrew_text: נוֹשֵׂא שָׂכָר אֵינוֹ מְשַׁלֵּם וְכוּ׳. מְנָהָנֵי מִילֵּי? דְּתָנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״כִּי יִתֵּן אִישׁ אֶל רֵעֵהוּ״ – כְּלָל, ״חֲמוֹר אוֹ שׁוֹר אוֹ שֶׂה״ – פָּרַט, ״וְכׇל בְּהֵמָה לִשְׁמוֹר״ – חָזַר וְכָלַל.
human_translation: A paid bailee does not pay From where are these matters as the Sages taught “When a man delivers to his neighbor” a generalization; “a donkey, or an ox, or a sheep” a detail. “Or any beast to safeguard,” it then generalizes
llm_translation: Bearer of reward does not pay etc. Enjoyers of words? For the Rabbis taught: "When a man gives to his neighbor" - this is a general principle, "a donkey or an ox or a sheep" - this is a specification, "and all livestock to keep" - he repeated and included.

hebrew_text: כְּלָל וּפְרָט וּכְלָל, אִי אַתָּה דָן אֶלָּא כְּעֵין הַפְּרָט: מָה הַפְּרָט מְפוֹרָשׁ – דָּבָר הַמִּטַּלְטֵל וְגוּפוֹ מָמוֹן, אַף כׇּל דָּבָר הַמִּטַּלְטֵל וְגוּפוֹ מָמוֹן.
human_translation: a generalization, and a detail, and a generalization, you may deduce only similar to the detail. just as the detail defined as an item that is movable property and intrinsic monetary so too any item that is movable property and intrinsic monetary
llm_translation: General and specific and general, if you judge only like the specific: just as the specific is explicit - a movable object and its body is money, so too every movable object and its body is money.

hebrew_text: יָצְאוּ קַרְקָעוֹת, שֶׁאֵינָן מִטַּלְטְלִין. יָצְאוּ עֲבָדִים, שֶׁהוּקְּשׁוּ לְקַרְקָעוֹת. יָצְאוּ שְׁטָרוֹת, שֶׁאַף עַל פִּי שֶׁמִּטַּלְטְלִין, אֵין גּוּפָן מָמוֹן. הֶקְדֵּשׁוֹת – אָמַר קְרָא: ״רֵעֵהוּ״ – רֵעֵהוּ, וְלֹא שֶׁל הֶקְדֵּשׁ.
human_translation: Land is excluded, as it is not movable property. slaves are excluded, as they are compared to land documents are excluded, as, although they are movable property, they do not intrinsic monetary consecrated is excluded it is written the other, but not Temple
llm_translation: The earthworms went out, which do not move. The slaves went out, who were attached to the earthworms. The promissory notes went out, even though they move, their essence is not money. Consecrated items - the verse says: "his neighbor" - his neighbor, not of consecrated items.
