hebrew_text: שׁוֹמֵר חִנָּם אֵינוֹ נִשְׁבָּע וְכוּ׳. וּרְמִינְהוּ, בְּנֵי הָעִיר שֶׁשָּׁלְחוּ אֶת שִׁקְלֵיהֶן וְנִגְנְבוּ אוֹ שֶׁאָבְדוּ,
human_translation: An unpaid bailee does not take an oath And raises a contradiction residents of the city who sent their shekels and were stolen or were lost
llm_translation: The one who watches for free is not obligated to take an oath, etc. And they raised a dilemma: The residents of a city who sent their shekels and they were stolen or lost,

hebrew_text: אִם מִשֶּׁנִּתְרְמָה הַתְּרוּמָה –
human_translation: If contributions had been collected
llm_translation: If from which separated the contribution -

hebrew_text: נִשְׁבָּעִין לַגִּזְבָּרִין, וְאִם לָאו – נִשְׁבָּעִין לִבְנֵי הָעִיר, וּבְנֵי הָעִיר שׁוֹקְלִין אֲחֵרִים תַּחְתֵּיהֶן. נִמְצְאוּ, אוֹ שֶׁהֶחְזִירוּם הַגַּנָּבִים – אֵלּוּ וְאֵלּוּ שְׁקָלִים הֵם, וְאֵין עוֹלִין לָהֶם לַשָּׁנָה הַבָּאָה.
human_translation: take the oath to the treasurers If not take an oath to the residents of the city. The residents of the city contribute other in place If were found or the thieves returned them, these, and those, shekels But do not count for the following year.
llm_translation: Sworn to the treasurers, and if not, sworn to the residents of the city, and the residents of the city collect from others in their place. If they are found, or if the thieves returned them - both these and those are the collectors, and they do not have to pay for the next year.

hebrew_text: אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הָכָא בְּנוֹשֵׂא שָׂכָר עָסְקִינַן, וְנִשְׁבָּעִין לִיטּוֹל שְׂכָרָן. אִי הָכִי, נִשְׁבָּעִין לַגִּזְבָּרִין? לִבְנֵי הָעִיר מִבְּעֵי לֵיהּ! אָמַר רַבָּה: נִשְׁבָּעִין לִבְנֵי הָעִיר בְּמַעֲמַד גִּזְבָּרִין, כִּי הֵיכִי דְּלָא נִחְשְׁדִינְהוּ, וְאִי נָמֵי, כִּי הֵיכִי דְּלָא לִקְרוֹ לְהוּ ״פּוֹשְׁעִים״.
human_translation: Shmuel said: Here we are dealing with paid bailees, they take an oath to collect their wages. If so, They take an oath to the treasurers? should have to the residents of the city, Rabba said: They take an oath to the residents of the city in the presence of the treasurers, so that will not suspect Alternatively, so that will not call them negligent.
llm_translation: Shmuel said: Here we are dealing with a hired laborer, and they swear to receive their wages. If so, do they swear to the tax collectors? They swear to the residents of the city! Rava said: They swear to the residents of the city in the presence of the tax collectors, so that they will not be suspected. And if not, so that they will not be called "transgressors."

hebrew_text: וְהָא נִגְנְבוּ אוֹ שֶׁאָבְדוּ קָתָנֵי, וְשׁוֹמֵר שָׂכָר בִּגְנֵיבָה וַאֲבֵידָה חַיּוֹבֵי מִיחַיַּיב! וְהָכָא נָמֵי, נְהִי דְּשַׁלּוֹמֵי לָא מְשַׁלְּמִי, אַגְרַיְיהוּ מִיהָא לַפְסֵיד.
human_translation: But isn’t it taught And were stolen or were lost and paid bailees are liable in theft and loss? And here too, although do not pay let them at least forfeit their wages,
llm_translation: And this, they stole or lost minors, and a watchman who receives payment for theft and loss is liable! And here too, yes, that the borrowers do not repay, their reward is from the one who will cause them to lose.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה: נִגְנְבוּ – בְּלִסְטִים מְזוּיָּין, אָבְדוּ – שֶׁטָּבְעָה סְפִינָתוֹ בַּיָּם.
human_translation: Rabba said: they were stolen, by armed bandits. they were lost, ship sank at sea.
llm_translation: Rabba said: "If they were stolen - with distinguished seals, they are lost - for his ship sank in the sea."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: הָא מַנִּי? רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן הִיא, דְּאָמַר: קָדָשִׁים שֶׁחַיָּיב בְּאַחְרָיוּתָן – יֵשׁ לָהֶן אוֹנָאָה, וְנִשְׁבָּעִין עֲלֵיהֶם.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said: whose is this It is Rabbi Shimon, who says: Consecrated for which one bears responsibility them are exploitation, and one takes an oath concerning them.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: Is this a question? It is Rabbi Shimon, who said: "Sacred items that are obligated in their after-effects - they have ona'ah, and one may swear regarding them."

hebrew_text: הָתִינַח עַד שֶׁלֹּא נִתְרְמָה הַתְּרוּמָה. מִשֶּׁנִּתְרְמָה הַתְּרוּמָה, קָדָשִׁים שֶׁאֵינוֹ חַיָּיב בְּאַחְרָיוּתָן נִינְהוּ, דְּתַנְיָא: תּוֹרְמִין עַל הָאָבוּד, וְעַל הַגָּבוּי, וְעַל הֶעָתִיד לִגָּבוֹת.
human_translation: This works out well contribution had not been collected once the contribution had been collected, sacrificial animals for which one does not bear responsibility, as it is taught One collects for that are lost and for that are collected and for that are destined to be collected
llm_translation: He deposited until not was separated the contribution. From when separated the contribution, holy things that not obligated in their afterness they are, as it was taught: they contribute for the lost, and for the stolen, and for the future to be stolen.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: שְׁבוּעָה זוֹ תַּקָּנַת חֲכָמִים הִיא, שֶׁלֹּא יְהוּ בְּנֵי אָדָם מְזַלְזְלִים בַּהֶקְדֵּשׁוֹת.
human_translation: Rather, Rabbi Elazar said: This oath is a rabbinic ordinance, so that people will not treat consecrated property with contempt.
llm_translation: Rather, Rabbi Elazar said: This oath is an enactment of the sages, that people should not treat holy things with contempt.

hebrew_text: נוֹשֵׂא שָׂכָר אֵינוֹ מְשַׁלֵּם. רָמֵי לֵיהּ רַב יוֹסֵף בַּר חָמָא לְרַבָּה: תְּנַן, נוֹשֵׂא שָׂכָר אֵינוֹ מְשַׁלֵּם, וּרְמִינְהוּ: הַשּׂוֹכֵר אֶת הַפּוֹעֵל לִשְׁמוֹר אֶת הַפָּרָה, לִשְׁמוֹר אֶת הַתִּינוֹק, לִשְׁמוֹר אֶת הַזְּרָעִים – אֵין נוֹתְנִים לוֹ שְׂכַר שַׁבָּת, לְפִיכָךְ אֵין אַחְרָיוּת שַׁבָּת עָלָיו.
human_translation: A paid bailee does not pay Rav Yosef bar Ḥama raises a contradiction before Rabba. We learned A paid bailee does not pay. And raises a contradiction One who hires laborer to watch the heifer to watch the child to safeguard the seeds does not give him wages for Shabbat. Therefore, if were lost responsibility for Shabbat is not upon him,
llm_translation: The one who hires does not pay. Rav Yosef bar Ḥama raised an objection to Rabba: We learned: The one who hires does not pay, and we raised a dilemma: If one hires a worker to guard a cow, to guard a baby, to guard seeds - he is not given wages for Shabbat, therefore the responsibility of Shabbat does not fall upon him.

hebrew_text: הָיָה שְׂכִיר שַׁבָּת, שְׂכִיר חֹדֶשׁ, שְׂכִיר שָׁנָה, שְׂכִיר שָׁבוּעַ – נוֹתְנִין לוֹ שְׂכַר שַׁבָּת, לְפִיכָךְ אַחְרָיוּת שַׁבָּת עָלָיו. מַאי לָאו לְשַׁלֵּם?
human_translation: hired for a week, hired for a month, hired for a year, hired for seven years, gives him wages Shabbat Therefore, responsibility for Shabbat is upon him. What, is it not to pay
llm_translation: Talmudic text: If he was hired for the Sabbath, hired for the month, hired for the year, hired for the week - they give him the wage of the Sabbath, therefore the after-effect of the Sabbath is upon him. What is the reason? Is it not to pay?

hebrew_text: לָא, לְהַפְסִיד שְׂכָרוֹ. אִי הָכִי, רֵישָׁא דְּקָתָנֵי: ״אֵין אַחְרָיוּת שַׁבָּת עָלָיו״ – הָכִי נָמֵי דִּלְהַפְסִיד שְׂכָרוֹ? וּמִי אִית לֵיהּ שְׂכַר שַׁבָּת? וְהָא קָתָנֵי: ״אֵין נוֹתְנִין לוֹ שְׂכַר שַׁבָּת״! אִשְׁתִּיק.
human_translation: No, with regard to forfeiting his wages If so, the first clause which teaches responsibility for Shabbat is not upon him, also with regard to forfeiting his wages? But does he have wages for Shabbat? But isn’t it taught that one does not give him wages for Shabbat? was silent,
llm_translation: Not to, to cause loss his wage. If so, the beginning of the teaching: "There is no responsibility for Shabbat upon him" - is this also to cause loss his wage? But does he have a wage for Shabbat? And it is taught: "One does not give him a wage for Shabbat"! He was silent.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מִידֵּי שְׁמִיעַ לָךְ בְּהָא? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָכִי אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת, בְּשֶׁקָּנוּ מִיָּדוֹ. וְכֵן אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, בְּשֶׁקָּנוּ מִיָּדוֹ.
human_translation: said to Have you heard anything with regard to this? said to him this Rav Sheshet says: with regard to where they performed acquisition with And likewise Rabbi Yoḥanan says: with regard to where they performed acquisition with him.
llm_translation: He said to him: From where did you hear this? He said to him: So said Rav Sheshet, when he acquired it from his hand. And so said Rabbi Yochanan, when he acquired it from his hand.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: קָדָשִׁים שֶׁחַיָּיב בְּאַחְרָיוּתָן – יֵשׁ לָהֶן אוֹנָאָה. וְשֶׁאֵינוֹ חַיָּיב בְּאַחְרָיוּתָן – אֵין לָהֶן אוֹנָאָה. תָּנֵי תַּנָּא קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי יִצְחָק בַּר אַבָּא:
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: Sacrificial for which one bears responsibility them are exploitation, and for which one does not bear responsibility them are not exploitation. the tanna taught before Rabbi Yitzḥak bar Abba
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: Holy items that are obligated in their after-effects - they have onaah. And those that are not obligated in their after-effects - they do not have onaah. A Tanna taught before Rabbi Yitzchak bar Abba:

hebrew_text: קָדָשִׁים שֶׁחַיָּיב בְּאַחְרָיוּתָן, חַיָּיב, שֶׁאֲנִי קוֹרֵא בָּהֶן: ״בַּה׳ וְכִחֵשׁ״. וְשֶׁאֵינוֹ חַיָּיב בְּאַחְרָיוּתָן, פָּטוּר, שֶׁאֲנִי קוֹרֵא בָּהֶן: ״בַּעֲמִיתוֹ וְכִחֵשׁ״.
human_translation: sacrificial for which one bears responsibility, liable as I apply “against the Lord, and deals falsely.” And for which one does not bear responsibility, exempt, as I read in their regard: With his neighbor, and deals falsely.
llm_translation: The holy items that are obligated in their aftermath, are obligated, for I read in them: "with the Lord and he denied." And the items that are not obligated in their aftermath, are exempt, for I read in them: "with his fellow and he denied."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: כְּלַפֵּי לְיָיא?!
human_translation: said to him: Isn’t it the opposite kelapei layya
llm_translation: He said to him: "According to the will of the Lord?!"

hebrew_text: אִיפְּכָא מִסְתַּבְּרָא! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֶיסְמְיַהּ?
human_translation: The opposite is reasonable. said to him: Should I delete
llm_translation: Opposite it is established! He said to him: What is his name?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָא. הָכִי קָאָמַר: קָדָשִׁים שֶׁחַיָּיב בְּאַחְרָיוּתָן – חַיָּיב, דְּאִיתְרַבּוּ מִ״בַּה׳ וְכִחֵשׁ״. וְשֶׁאֵינוֹ חַיָּיב בְּאַחְרָיוּתָן – פָּטוּר, דְּאִמְּעִיט מִ״בַּעֲמִיתוֹ וְכִחֵשׁ״.
human_translation: said to him: No, this is what saying: sacrificial for which one bears responsibility, liable as it is included “against the Lord, and deals falsely.” And sacrificial for which one does not bear responsibility, exempt, as it is excluded With his neighbor and deals falsely.
llm_translation: He said to him: No. This is what he is saying: Holy things that are obligated in their aftermath - are obligated, for they are derived from "and he shall deny". And that which is not obligated in their aftermath - is exempt, for it diminishes from "his fellow" and denies.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אַף הַמּוֹכֵר סֵפֶר תּוֹרָה, מַרְגָּלִית וּבְהֵמָה, אֵין לָהֶם אוֹנָאָה. תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אַף הַמּוֹכֵר סֵפֶר תּוֹרָה, אֵין לָהּ אוֹנָאָה – לְפִי שֶׁאֵין קֵץ לְדָמֶיהָ. בְּהֵמָה וּמַרְגָּלִית, אֵין לָהֶם אוֹנָאָה – מִפְּנֵי שֶׁאָדָם רוֹצֶה לְזַוְּוגָן.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: Even one who sells a Torah scroll, a pearl, or an animal, are not exploitation. It is taught Rabbi Yehuda says: Even one who sells a Torah scroll, is not exploitation, as there is no limit to its value. An animal and a pearl are not exploitation because a person seeks to pair them.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: Even one who sells a Torah scroll, a ritual bath, or an animal, they have no oppression. It was taught: Rabbi Yehuda says: Even one who sells a Torah scroll, she has no oppression - because there is no end to its value. As for an animal and a ritual bath, they have no oppression - because a person desires to pair them.

hebrew_text: אָמְרוּ לוֹ: וַהֲלֹא הַכֹּל אָדָם רוֹצֶה לְזַוְּוגָן? וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, הָנֵי חֲשִׁיבִי לֵיהּ, וְהָנֵי לָא חֲשִׁיבִי לֵיהּ. וְעַד כַּמָּה? אָמַר אַמֵּימָר: עַד כְּדֵי דְּמֵיהֶם.
human_translation: said to him: But isn’t every item, a person seeks to pair And Rabbi Yehuda these are significant to but those are not significant to him. And up to how much Ameimar said: up to their value.
llm_translation: They said to him: But doesn't everyone want to marry them? And Rabbi Yehuda, those are considered for him, and those are not considered for him. And until when? Amemar said: Until their value.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן בְּתֵירָא אוֹמֵר: אַף הַמּוֹכֵר סוּס וְסַיִיף וַחֲטִיטוֹם בַּמִּלְחָמָה – אֵין לָהֶם אוֹנָאָה, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁיֵּשׁ בָּהֶן חַיֵּי נֶפֶשׁ.
human_translation: It is taught Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira says: Even one who sells a horse, or a sword, or a helmet [ veḥatitom ] during wartime, are not exploitation, because they have life,
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Yehuda ben Betera says: Even one who sells a horse, a sword, and a shield for battle - they have no warranty, because they contain the element of life.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ כְּשֵׁם שֶׁאוֹנָאָה בְּמִקָּח וּמִמְכָּר, כָּךְ אוֹנָאָה בִּדְבָרִים. לֹא יֹאמַר לוֹ: בְּכַמָּה חֵפֶץ זֶה? וְהוּא אֵינוֹ רוֹצֶה לִיקַּח. אִם הָיָה בַּעַל תְּשׁוּבָה, לֹא יֹאמַר לוֹ: זְכוֹר מַעֲשֶׂיךָ הָרִאשׁוֹנִים. אִם הוּא בֶּן גֵּרִים, לֹא יֹאמַר לוֹ: זְכוֹר מַעֲשֵׂה אֲבוֹתֶיךָ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְגֵר לֹא תוֹנֶה וְלֹא תִלְחָצֶנּוּ״.
human_translation: Just as exploitation [ ona’a ] in buying and selling, so is there ona’a in statements, One may not say to For how much this item, if he does not wish to purchase If one is a penitent, may not say to him: Remember your earlier deeds. If one is the child of converts, may not say to him: Remember the deeds of your ancestors, as it is stated: “And a convert shall you neither mistreat, nor shall you oppress him”
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: Just as there is ona'ah (unfair dealing) in buying and selling, so too there is ona'ah in words. One should not say to someone, "At what price will you sell this item?" when he does not wish to buy it. If the person has repented, one should not say to him, "Remember your previous deeds." If he is a convert, one should not say to him, "Remember the deeds of your ancestors," as it is stated: "And a stranger you shall not wrong, neither shall you oppress him."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״לֹא תוֹנוּ אִישׁ אֶת עֲמִיתוֹ״ – בְּאוֹנָאַת דְּבָרִים הַכָּתוּב מְדַבֵּר. אַתָּה אוֹמֵר בְּאוֹנָאַת דְּבָרִים, אוֹ אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא בְּאוֹנָאַת מָמוֹן? כְּשֶׁהוּא אוֹמֵר ״וְכִי תִמְכְּרוּ מִמְכָּר לַעֲמִיתֶךָ אוֹ קָנֹה מִיַּד עֲמִיתֶךָ״, הֲרֵי אוֹנָאַת מָמוֹן אָמוּר! הָא מָה אֲנִי מְקַיֵּים ״לֹא תוֹנוּ אִישׁ אֶת עֲמִיתוֹ״? בְּאוֹנָאַת דְּבָרִים.
human_translation: The Sages taught: “And you shall not mistreat [ tonu ] one man his colleague; The verse is speaking with regard to verbal mistreatment. you say verbal mistreatment [ be’ona’at devarim ], or it is only with regard to monetary exploitation [ be’ona’at mammon ]? When it says “And if you sell to your colleague an item that is sold, or acquire from your colleague’s hand, monetary exploitation is stated. How do I realize “And you shall not mistreat one man his colleague”? with regard to verbal mistreatment.
llm_translation: The sages taught: "Do not wrong one another" - the verse is speaking about verbal wronging. Do you say it is only verbal wronging, or is it also wronging in monetary matters? When it says, "If you sell anything to your neighbor or buy from your neighbor," it is speaking of monetary wronging! How then do I fulfill "Do not wrong one another"? Through verbal wronging.

hebrew_text: הָא כֵּיצַד? אִם הָיָה בַּעַל תְּשׁוּבָה, אֵל יֹאמַר לוֹ: ״זְכוֹר מַעֲשֶׂיךָ הָרִאשׁוֹנִים״. אִם הָיָה בֶּן גֵּרִים, אַל יֹאמַר לוֹ: ״זְכוֹר מַעֲשֵׂה אֲבוֹתֶיךָ״. אִם הָיָה גֵּר וּבָא לִלְמוֹד תּוֹרָה, אַל יֹאמַר לוֹ: ״פֶּה שֶׁאָכַל נְבֵילוֹת וּטְרֵיפוֹת, שְׁקָצִים וּרְמָשִׂים, בָּא לִלְמוֹד תּוֹרָה שֶׁנֶּאֶמְרָה מִפִּי הַגְּבוּרָה״?
human_translation: How so? If one is a penitent, may not say to him: Remember your earlier deeds. If one is the child of converts, may not say to him: Remember the deed of your ancestors. If one is a convert and came to study Torah, may not say to him: mouth that ate unslaughtered carcasses and animals that had wounds that would have caused them to die within twelve months [ tereifot ], repugnant creatures, and creeping animals, comes to study Torah that was stated from the mouth of the Almighty?
llm_translation: Talmudic text: How so? If he was a Baal Teshuvah, God should say to him: "Remember your former deeds." If he was a convert, God should not say to him: "Remember the deeds of your ancestors." If he was a convert and came to study Torah, God should not say to him: "A mouth that has eaten neveilot and treifot, abominations and creeping things, comes to study Torah that was spoken from the mouth of the Almighty."

hebrew_text: אִם הָיוּ יִסּוּרִין בָּאִין עָלָיו, אִם הָיוּ חֳלָאִים בָּאִין עָלָיו, אוֹ שֶׁהָיָה מְקַבֵּר אֶת בָּנָיו, אַל יֹאמַר לוֹ כְּדֶרֶךְ שֶׁאָמְרוּ לוֹ חֲבֵירָיו לְאִיּוֹב: ״הֲלֹא יִרְאָתְךָ כִּסְלָתֶךָ תִּקְוָתְךָ וְתֹם דְּרָכֶיךָ. זְכׇר נָא מִי הוּא נָקִי אָבָד״.
human_translation: If torments are afflicting if illnesses are afflicting him, or if he is burying his children, may not speak to him in the manner that friends of Job spoke to him: “Is not your fear of God your confidence, and your hope the integrity of your ways? Remember, I beseech you, whoever perished, being innocent?”
llm_translation: If there were punishments coming upon him, if there were illnesses coming upon him, or if he had buried his sons, one should not say to him as his friends said to Job: "Is not your fear your confidence, and the integrity of your ways your hope? Remember now, who that was innocent ever perished."

hebrew_text: אִם הָיוּ חַמָּרִים מְבַקְּשִׁין תְּבוּאָה מִמֶּנּוּ, לֹא יֹאמַר לָהֶם: ״לְכוּ אֵצֶל פְּלוֹנִי שֶׁהוּא מוֹכֵר תְּבוּאָה״, וְיוֹדֵעַ בּוֹ שֶׁלֹּא מָכַר מֵעוֹלָם. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אַף לֹא יִתְלֶה עֵינָיו עַל הַמִּקָּח, בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁאֵין לוֹ דָּמִים, שֶׁהֲרֵי הַדָּבָר מָסוּר לַלֵּב, וְכׇל דָּבָר הַמָּסוּר לַלֵּב נֶאֱמַר בּוֹ ״וְיָרֵאתָ מֵאֱלֹהֶיךָ״.
human_translation: if donkey drivers are asking grain from he may not say to them: Go to so-and-so, as he sells grain, if he knows about him that he never sold Rabbi Yehuda says: One may not even cast his eyes on the merchandise at a time when he does not have money as the matter is given to the heart And with regard to any matter given to the heart, it is stated: “And you shall fear your God”
llm_translation: If they were diligent, seeking produce from him, he should not say to them, "Go to so-and-so who sells produce," knowing that he never sold. Rabbi Yehuda says: He should not even look at the transaction when he has no funds, for the matter is dependent on the heart, and anything dependent on the heart, it is said about it, "And you shall fear your God."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹחַאי: גָּדוֹל אוֹנָאַת דְּבָרִים מֵאוֹנָאַת מָמוֹן, שֶׁזֶּה נֶאֱמַר בּוֹ ״וְיָרֵאתָ מֵאֱלֹהֶיךָ״, וְזֶה לֹא נֶאֱמַר בּוֹ ״וְיָרֵאתָ מֵאֱלֹהֶיךָ״. וְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: זֶה בְּגוּפוֹ וְזֶה בְּמָמוֹנוֹ. רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי אָמַר: זֶה נִיתַּן לְהִישָּׁבוֹן, וְזֶה לֹא נִיתַּן לְהִישָּׁבוֹן.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai: Greater is verbal mistreatment than monetary exploitation, as with regard to this, it is stated: “And you shall fear your God.” But with regard to that, it is not stated: “And you shall fear your God.” And Rabbi Elazar said This, one’s body; but that, one’s money. Rabbi Shmuel bar Naḥmani says: This, is given to restitution; but that, is not given to restitution.
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yochanan in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yochai: Greater is the oppression of words than the oppression of money, as it is stated regarding the former, "And you shall fear your God," while this is not stated regarding the latter, "And you shall fear your God." And Rabbi Elazar says: This applies to his person, and this applies to his money. Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachmani says: This can be returned, and this cannot be returned.

hebrew_text: תָּנֵי תַּנָּא קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: כׇּל הַמַּלְבִּין פְּנֵי חֲבֵירוֹ בָּרַבִּים, כְּאִילּוּ שׁוֹפֵךְ דָּמִים. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: שַׁפִּיר קָא אָמְרַתְּ, דְּחָזֵינָא לֵיהּ דְּאָזֵיל סוּמָּקָא וְאָתֵי חִוּוֹרָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי לְרַב דִּימִי: בְּמַעְרְבָא בְּמַאי זְהִירִי? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: בְּאַחְווֹרֵי אַפֵּי, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא: הַכֹּל יוֹרְדִין לְגֵיהִנָּם, חוּץ מִשְּׁלֹשָׁה.
human_translation: the tanna taught before Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak: Anyone who humiliates another in public, it is as though he were spilling blood. said to him: You have spoken well, as we see that the red leaves and pallor comes Abaye said to Rav Dimi: In the West, with regard to what are they vigilant? said to him: in humiliating as Rabbi Ḥanina says: Everyone descends to Gehenna except for three.
llm_translation: The Tanna taught before Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak: Anyone who embarrasses his fellow in public, it is as though he spills blood. He said to him: You have spoken well, for I see that when one goes into a dark alley, a blind man comes and a lame man follows. Abaye said to Rav Dimi: In the West, what do they take care about? He said to him: About the back of the neck, as Rabbi Chanina said: Everyone goes down to Gehenna, except for three.

hebrew_text: הַכֹּל סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ? אֶלָּא אֵימָא: כָּל הַיּוֹרְדִין לְגֵיהִנָּם עוֹלִים, חוּץ מִשְּׁלֹשָׁה שֶׁיּוֹרְדִין וְאֵין עוֹלִין. וְאֵלּוּ הֵן: הַבָּא עַל אֵשֶׁת אִישׁ, וְהַמַּלְבִּין פְּנֵי חֲבֵירוֹ בָּרַבִּים, וְהַמְכַנֶּה שֵׁם רַע לַחֲבֵירוֹ. מְכַנֶּה הַיְינוּ מַלְבִּין? אַף עַל גַּב דְּדָשׁ בֵּיהּ בִּשְׁמֵיהּ.
human_translation: Does it enter your mind everyone Rather, say: Anyone who descends to Gehenna ascends, except for three who descend and do not ascend, and these are they: One who engages in intercourse with a married woman, and one who humiliates another in public; and one who calls a derogatory name. one who calls That is one who shames Although grew accustomed to in his name,
llm_translation: All ascend according to your opinion? Rather say: All who descend to Gehenna ascend, except for three who descend and do not ascend. And these are they: one who commits adultery, one who publicly shames his fellow, and one who gives a bad nickname to his fellow. Giving a bad nickname is the same as publicly shaming, even though he sweetens it with a name.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן:
human_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana says Rabbi Yoḥanan says:
llm_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana said in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan:

hebrew_text: נוֹחַ לוֹ לְאָדָם שֶׁיָּבוֹא עַל סְפֵק אֵשֶׁת אִישׁ, וְאַל יַלְבִּין פְּנֵי חֲבֵירוֹ בָּרַבִּים. מְנָא לַן? מִדְּדָרֵשׁ רָבָא, דְּדָרֵשׁ רָבָא: מַאי דִּכְתִיב ״וּבְצַלְעִי שָׂמְחוּ וְנֶאֱסָפוּ... קָרְעוּ וְלֹא דָמּוּ״? אָמַר דָּוִד לִפְנֵי הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא: רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם, גָּלוּי וְיָדוּעַ לְפָנֶיךָ, שֶׁאִם הָיוּ מְקָרְעִים בְּשָׂרִי, לֹא הָיָה דָּמִי שׁוֹתֵת לָאָרֶץ.
human_translation: It is preferable for a person to engage in intercourse with a woman married uncertain and not humiliate another in public. From where do we from that which Rava interpreted, as Rava interpreted: What which is written: “And when I limped they rejoiced and gathered…they tore and did not cease [ damu ]” David said before the Holy One, Blessed be He: Master of the Universe, it is revealed and known before You that if were to tear my flesh, my blood [ dami ] would not flow to the ground,
llm_translation: It is beneficial for a person to approach a married woman with uncertainty, and not to embarrass his fellow in public. From where do we derive this? As Rava expounded, for Rava expounded: What is the meaning of what is written, "And they rejoiced in my side and gathered... they tore and did not bleed"? David said before the Holy One, blessed be He: Master of the Universe, it is revealed and known before You, that if they were to tear my flesh, my blood would not flow to the ground.

hebrew_text: וְלֹא עוֹד אֶלָּא, אֲפִילּוּ בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁעוֹסְקִין בִּנְגָעִים וְאֹהָלוֹת, אוֹמְרִים לִי: דָּוִד, הַבָּא עַל אֵשֶׁת אִישׁ, מִיתָתוֹ בַּמֶּה? וַאֲנִי אוֹמֵר לָהֶם: מִיתָתוֹ בְּחֶנֶק, וְיֵשׁ לוֹ חֵלֶק לָעוֹלָם הַבָּא. אֲבָל הַמַּלְבִּין אֶת פְּנֵי חֲבֵירוֹ בָּרַבִּים, אֵין לוֹ חֵלֶק לָעוֹלָם הַבָּא.
human_translation: And moreover, even at the time they are engaged of leprous sores and tents they say to me: David, one who engages in intercourse with a married woman, his death with what And I say to them: One who engages in intercourse with a married woman his death is by strangulation, but he has a share in the World-to-Come. But one who humiliates another in public has no share in the World-to-Come.
llm_translation: And not only that, but even at a time when they are engaged in discussing plagues and tents, they say to me: "David, one who commits adultery with a married woman, what is his death by?" And I say to them: "His death is by strangulation, and he has a share in the World to Come. But one who publicly shames his fellow, has no share in the World to Come."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר מָר זוּטְרָא בַּר טוֹבִיָּה אָמַר רַב, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ: אָמַר רַב חָנָא בַּר בִּיזְנָא אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן חֲסִידָא, וְאָמְרִי לָהּ: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹחַאי: נוֹחַ לוֹ לְאָדָם שֶׁיַּפִּיל עַצְמוֹ לְכִבְשַׁן הָאֵשׁ וְאַל יַלְבִּין פְּנֵי חֲבֵירוֹ בָּרַבִּים. מְנָא לַן? מִתָּמָר, דִּכְתִיב: ״הִיא מוּצֵאת וְהִיא שָׁלְחָה אֶל חָמִיהָ״.
human_translation: And Mar Zutra bar Toviyya says Rav says; and some say Rav Ḥana bar Bizna says Rabbi Shimon Ḥasida says; and some say Rabbi Yoḥanan says in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai: It is more comfortable for a person to cast himself into a fiery furnace, humiliate another in public From where do we From Tamar, as it is written: When she was brought forth, she sent to her father-in-law,
llm_translation: And Mar Zutra son of Tobiah said in the name of Rav, and some say: Rav Hanan son of Bizna said in the name of Rabbi Shimon Chasida, and some say: Rabbi Yochanan said in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yochai: It is better for a person to throw himself into a fiery furnace than to shame his fellow in public. How do we know this? From a palm tree, as it is written: "She took it and sent it to her brother."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חִנָּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אִידִי: מַאי דִּכְתִיב ״וְלֹא תוֹנוּ אִישׁ אֶת עֲמִיתוֹ״? עַם שֶׁאִתְּךָ בְּתוֹרָה וּבַמִּצְווֹת, אַל תּוֹנֵיהוּ. אָמַר רַב: לְעוֹלָם יְהֵא אָדָם זָהִיר בְּאוֹנָאַת אִשְׁתּוֹ, שֶׁמִּתּוֹךְ שֶׁדִּמְעָתָהּ מְצוּיָה, אוֹנָאָתָהּ קְרוֹבָה.
human_translation: Rav Ḥinnana, son of Rav Idi, says: What which is written: “And you shall not mistreat each man his colleague [ amito ]” With with you in Torah and mitzvot, you shall not mistreat Rav says: A person must always be careful about mistreatment of his wife. Since her tear is easily her mistreatment is immediate.
llm_translation: Rav Ḥanina, son of Rav Idi, said: What is the meaning of the verse, "And you shall not wrong one another"? With regard to a people who are with you in Torah and commandments, do not wrong them. Rav said: A person should always be careful regarding the wronging of his wife, for since her tears are frequent, her wrong is close.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: מִיּוֹם שֶׁנֶּחְרַב בֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ, נִנְעֲלוּ שַׁעֲרֵי תְפִילָּה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״גַּם כִּי אֶזְעַק וַאֲשַׁוֵּעַ שָׂתַם תְּפִילָּתִי״. וְאַף עַל פִּי שֶׁשַּׁעֲרֵי תְפִילָּה נִנְעֲלוּ, שַׁעֲרֵי דְמָעוֹת לֹא נִנְעֲלוּ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״שִׁמְעָה תְפִלָּתִי ה׳ וְשַׁוְעָתִי הַאֲזִינָה, אֶל דִּמְעָתִי אַל תֶּחֱרַשׁ״.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar says: Since the day the Temple was destroyed the gates of prayer were locked, as it is stated “Though I plead and call out, He shuts out my prayer” despite that the gates of prayer were locked the gates of tears were not locked, as it is stated: “Hear my prayer, Lord, and give ear to my pleading, keep not silence at my tears”
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: "Since the day the Temple was destroyed, the gates of prayer have been locked, as it is said: 'Even when I cry out and plead, He shuts out my prayer.' And even though the gates of prayer have been locked, the gates of tears have not been locked, as it is said: 'Hear my prayer, O Lord, and listen to my cry; do not be silent at my tears.'"

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב: כׇּל הַהוֹלֵךְ בַּעֲצַת אִשְׁתּוֹ נוֹפֵל בְּגֵיהִנָּם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״רַק לֹא הָיָה כְאַחְאָב וְגוֹ׳״. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב פָּפָּא לְאַבָּיֵי: וְהָא אָמְרִי אִינָשֵׁי, אִיתְּתָךְ גּוּצָא – גְּחֵין וְתִלְחוֹשׁ לָהּ! לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא בְּמִילֵּי דְעָלְמָא, וְהָא בְּמִילֵּי דְבֵיתָא. לִישָּׁנָא אַחֲרִינָא: הָא בְּמִילֵּי דִשְׁמַיָּא, וְהָא בְּמִילֵּי דְעָלְמָא.
human_translation: And Rav says: anyone who follows the counsel of his wife descends into Gehenna, as it is stated: “But there was none like Ahab, Rav Pappa said to Abaye: But don’t people say your wife is short, stoop and whisper to her not difficult, this in general matters; and that in household matters. another version This in divine matters; and that in general matters.
llm_translation: And Rav said: Anyone who follows the advice of his wife falls into Gehinnom, as it is stated: "But there was none like Ahab, etc." Rav Papa said to Abbaye: But people say, "Your wife is a small container – bend and speak to her!" It is not difficult: this is regarding matters of the world, and this is regarding matters of the home. Another version: this is regarding matters of Heaven, and this is regarding matters of the world.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: כׇּל הַשְּׁעָרִים נִנְעָלִים, חוּץ מִשַּׁעֲרֵי אוֹנָאָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״הִנֵּה ה׳ נִצָּב עַל חוֹמַת אֲנָךְ וּבְיָדוֹ אֲנָךְ״. אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: הַכֹּל נִפְרָע בִּידֵי שָׁלִיחַ, חוּץ מֵאוֹנָאָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וּבְיָדוֹ אֲנָךְ״.
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda says: All the gates locked, except for the gates of mistreatment, as it is stated: “And behold, the Lord stood upon a wall built with a plumb line, and a plumb line in His hand” Rabbi Elazar says: all punishes by means of an agent, except for mistreatment [ ona’a ], as it is stated: “And a plumb line [ anakh ] in His hand.”
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: All the gates are locked, except for the gates of Ona'ah, as it is stated: "Behold, the Lord stands upon a wall made with a plumb line, with a plumb line in His hand." Rabbi Elazar said: Everything is settled by the hands of a messenger, except for Ona'ah, as it is stated: "And with a plumb line in His hand."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: שְׁלֹשָׁה אֵין הַפַּרְגּוֹד נִנְעָל בִּפְנֵיהֶם: אוֹנָאָה, וְגָזֵל, וַעֲבוֹדָה זָרָה. אוֹנָאָה, דִּכְתִיב: ״וּבְיָדוֹ אֲנָךְ״. גָּזֵל, דִּכְתִיב: ״חָמָס וָשֹׁד יִשָּׁמַע בָּהּ עַל פָּנַי תָּמִיד״. עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה, דִּכְתִיב: ״הָעָם הַמַּכְעִיסִים אוֹתִי עַל פָּנַי תָּמִיד וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: Rabbi Abbahu says: three before the curtain [ hapargod ] is not locked; mistreatment, robbery, and idol worship. Mistreatment, as it is stated: “And a plumb line in His hand”; robbery, as it is stated: “Violence and robbery are heard in her, they are before Me continually” idol worship, as it is stated: “A people that angers Me before Me continually;
llm_translation: Rabbi Avahu said: Three cases the Paragog is not closed before them: Ona'ah, and Gezel, and Avodah Zarah. Ona'ah, as it is written: "And in his hand is a scepter." Gezel, as it is written: "Violence and robbery shall not be heard within her." Avodah Zarah, as it is written: "The people who provoke Me to anger before Me continually, etc."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: לְעוֹלָם יְהֵא אָדָם זָהִיר בִּתְבוּאָה בְּתוֹךְ בֵּיתוֹ, שֶׁאֵין מְרִיבָה מְצוּיָה בְּתוֹךְ בֵּיתוֹ שֶׁל אָדָם אֶלָּא עַל עִסְקֵי תְבוּאָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״הַשָּׂם גְּבוּלֵךְ שָׁלוֹם חֵלֶב חִטִּים יַשְׂבִּיעֵךְ״. אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא, הַיְינוּ דְּאָמְרִי אִינָשֵׁי: כְּמִשְׁלַם שְׂעָרֵי מִכַּדָּא, נָקֵישׁ וְאָתֵי תִּגְרָא בְּבֵיתָא.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says: A person must always be careful about grain inside his house, as discord is found in a person’s house only over matters of grain, as it is stated: “He makes your borders peace; He gives you plenty with the finest wheat” Rav Pappa said: This that people say: When the barley is emptied from the jug, quarrel knocks and enters the house.
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said: Always should a person be careful with produce in his house, for strife is not found in a person's house except over matters of produce, as it is stated: "He who sets your boundary in peace, He will satisfy you with the finest of wheat." Rav Papa said, this is what people say: Like one who pays for a haircut from his pocket, he comes out clean and a dispute arises in the house.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב חִינָּנָא בַּר פָּפָּא: לְעוֹלָם יְהֵא אָדָם זָהִיר בִּתְבוּאָה בְּתוֹךְ בֵּיתוֹ, שֶׁלֹּא נִקְרְאוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל דַּלִּים אֶלָּא עַל עִסְקֵי תְבוּאָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְהָיָה אִם זָרַע יִשְׂרָאֵל וְגוֹ׳״, וּכְתִיב: ״וַיַּחֲנוּ עֲלֵיהֶם וְגוֹ׳״, וּכְתִיב: ״וַיִּדַּל יִשְׂרָאֵל מְאֹד מִפְּנֵי מִדְיָן״.
human_translation: And Rav Ḥinnana bar Pappa says: A person must always be careful about grain inside his house, as the Jewish people were characterized as poor only over matters of grain, as it is stated: “And it was, if Israel sowed, and it is written: “And they encamped against them and it is written: “And Israel was greatly impoverished due to Midian”
llm_translation: And Rav Chinana bar Papa said: A person should always be careful with the produce in his house, so that the Israelites are not called poor except in matters of produce, as it is stated: "And if the seed of Israel," and it is written: "And they camped against them," and it is written: "And Israel was greatly impoverished because of Midian."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי חֶלְבּוֹ: לְעוֹלָם יְהֵא אָדָם זָהִיר בִּכְבוֹד אִשְׁתּוֹ, שֶׁאֵין בְּרָכָה מְצוּיָה בְּתוֹךְ בֵּיתוֹ שֶׁל אָדָם אֶלָּא בִּשְׁבִיל אִשְׁתּוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וּלְאַבְרָם הֵטִיב בַּעֲבוּרָהּ״. וְהַיְינוּ דַּאֲמַר לְהוּ רָבָא לִבְנֵי מָחוֹזָא: אוֹקִירוּ לִנְשַׁיְיכוּ, כִּי הֵיכִי דְּתִתְעַתְּרוּ.
human_translation: And Rabbi Ḥelbo says: A person must always be careful about the honor of his wife, as blessing is found in a person’s house only because of his wife, as it is stated “And he dealt well with Abram for her sake, And that is what Rava said to the residents of Meḥoza, Honor your wives, so that you will become rich.
llm_translation: And Rabbi Helbo said: Always should a person be careful with the honor of his wife, for blessing is only found in a person's home on account of his wife, as it is stated: "And for Abram's sake." And this is what Rava said to the people of Mahoza: Honor your wives, so that you may become rich.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן הָתָם: חֲתָכוֹ חוּלְיוֹת, וְנָתַן חוֹל בֵּין חוּלְיָא לְחוּלְיָא – רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר מְטַהֵר, וַחֲכָמִים מְטַמְּאִין.
human_translation: we learned there one cut into segments, and placed sand between each and every segment, Rabbi Eliezer deems it ritually pure. And the Rabbis deem it ritually impure,
llm_translation: We learned there: If one cut his nails and placed sand between nail and nail - Rabbi Eliezer declares him clean, while the Sages declare him unclean.

hebrew_text: וְזֶה הוּא תַּנּוּר שֶׁל עַכְנַאי. מַאי עַכְנַאי? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: שֶׁהִקִּיפוּ[הוּ] דְּבָרִים כְּעַכְנָא זוֹ, וְטִמְּאוּהוּ. תָּנָא: בְּאוֹתוֹ הַיּוֹם הֵשִׁיב רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר כׇּל תְּשׁוּבוֹת שֶׁבָּעוֹלָם, וְלֹא קִיבְּלוּ הֵימֶנּוּ.
human_translation: And this is the oven of akhnai . What akhnai , Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: that surrounded with statements like this snake, and deemed it impure. taught: On that day, Rabbi Eliezer answered all answers in the world but did not accept from him.
llm_translation: This is the oven of Akhnai. What is Akhnai? Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: that they encompassed it with words like Akhnai, and rendered it impure. It was taught: On that day, Rabbi Eliezer answered all the arguments in the world, but they did not accept it from him.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָהֶם: אִם הֲלָכָה כְּמוֹתִי – חָרוּב זֶה יוֹכִיחַ. נֶעֱקַר חָרוּב מִמְּקוֹמוֹ מֵאָה אַמָּה, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ: אַרְבַּע מֵאוֹת אַמָּה. אָמְרוּ לוֹ: אֵין מְבִיאִין רְאָיָה מִן הֶחָרוּב. חָזַר וְאָמַר לָהֶם: אִם הֲלָכָה כְּמוֹתִי – אַמַּת הַמַּיִם יוֹכִיחוּ. חָזְרוּ אַמַּת הַמַּיִם לַאֲחוֹרֵיהֶם. אָמְרוּ לוֹ: אֵין מְבִיאִין רְאָיָה מֵאַמַּת הַמַּיִם.
human_translation: said to them: If halakha in accordance with my this carob will prove carob was uprooted from its place one hundred cubits, and some say four hundred cubits. said to him: One does not cite proof from the carob then said to them: If halakha in accordance with my the stream will prove the stream turned backward They said to him: One does not cite proof from a stream.
llm_translation: He said to them: If the halakha is like me - this carob tree will prove it. The carob tree was uprooted from its place one hundred cubits, and some say four hundred cubits. They said to him: We do not bring proof from a carob tree. He went back and said to them: If the halakha is like me - the water channel will prove it. The water channel went backward. They said to him: We do not bring proof from a water channel.

hebrew_text: חָזַר וְאָמַר לָהֶם: אִם הֲלָכָה כְּמוֹתִי – כּוֹתְלֵי בֵּית הַמִּדְרָשׁ יוֹכִיחוּ. הִטּוּ כּוֹתְלֵי בֵּית הַמִּדְרָשׁ לִיפּוֹל. גָּעַר בָּהֶם רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ, אָמַר לָהֶם: אִם תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים מְנַצְּחִים זֶה אֶת זֶה בַּהֲלָכָה, אַתֶּם מָה טִיבְכֶם? לֹא נָפְלוּ מִפְּנֵי כְבוֹדוֹ שֶׁל רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ, וְלֹא זָקְפוּ מִפְּנֵי כְבוֹדוֹ שֶׁל רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר, וַעֲדַיִן מַטִּין וְעוֹמְדִין.
human_translation: then said to them: If halakha in accordance with my the walls of the study hall will prove The walls of the study hall leaned to fall. Rabbi Yehoshua scolded said to them: If Torah scholars are contending each other in halakha , what nature your did not fall because of deference Rabbi Yehoshua, but they did not straighten because of deference Rabbi Eliezer, and they still remain leaning.
llm_translation: He returned and said to them: If the halakha is like me, the walls of the study hall will prove it. The walls of the study hall leaned. Rabbi Yehoshua rebuked them, saying to them: If the disciples of the sages are prevailing over each other in halakha, what is your worth? They did not fall because of the honor of Rabbi Yehoshua, and they did not stand because of the honor of Rabbi Eliezer, yet they still lean and stand.

hebrew_text: חָזַר וְאָמַר לָהֶם: אִם הֲלָכָה כְּמוֹתִי – מִן הַשָּׁמַיִם יוֹכִיחוּ. יָצָאתָה בַּת קוֹל וְאָמְרָה: מָה לָכֶם אֵצֶל רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר, שֶׁהֲלָכָה כְּמוֹתוֹ בְּכׇל מָקוֹם.
human_translation: then said to them: If halakha in accordance with my Heaven will prove A Divine Voice emerged and said: Why are you with Rabbi Eliezer, as halakha in accordance with in every place
llm_translation: He returned and said to them: If the halakha is like me - they will prove it from heaven. A Bat Kol came out and said: What do you want with Rabbi Eliezer, for the halakha is like him in every place.

hebrew_text: עָמַד רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ עַל רַגְלָיו וְאָמַר: ״לֹא בַשָּׁמַיִם הִיא!״ מַאי ״לֹא בַּשָּׁמַיִם הִיא״? אָמַר רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה: שֶׁכְּבָר נִתְּנָה תּוֹרָה מֵהַר סִינַי, אֵין אָנוּ מַשְׁגִּיחִין בְּבַת קוֹל, שֶׁכְּבָר כָּתַבְתָּ בְּהַר סִינַי בַּתּוֹרָה ״אַחֲרֵי רַבִּים לְהַטֹּת״. אַשְׁכְּחֵיהּ רַבִּי נָתָן לְאֵלִיָּהוּ, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מַאי עָבֵיד קוּדְשָׁא בְּרִיךְ הוּא בְּהַהִיא שַׁעְתָּא? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: קָא חָיֵיךְ וְאָמַר, ״נִצְּחוּנִי בָּנַי! נִצְּחוּנִי בָּנַי!״
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua stood on his feet and said: “It is not in heaven” What “It is not in heaven” Rabbi Yirmeya says: the Torah was already given at Mount Sinai, we do not regard a Divine Voice, as You already wrote at Mount Sinai, in the Torah: “After a majority to incline” Rabbi Natan encountered Elijah said to him: What did the Holy One, Blessed be He, do at that time, said to him: smiled and said: My children have triumphed over Me; My children have triumphed over Me.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua stood on his feet and said: "It is not in heaven!" What is "It is not in heaven"? Rabbi Yirmiyah said: Since the Torah was already given from Mount Sinai, we do not pay attention to a heavenly voice, as you have already written in the Torah at Mount Sinai, "After the majority to incline." Rabbi Natan found Elijah, and said to him: What was the Holy One, blessed be He, doing at that time? He said to him: He was laughing and saying, "My sons have defeated Me! My sons have defeated Me!"

hebrew_text: אָמְרוּ: אוֹתוֹ הַיּוֹם הֵבִיאוּ כׇּל טְהָרוֹת שֶׁטִּיהֵר רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר וּשְׂרָפוּם בָּאֵשׁ. וְנִמְנוּ עָלָיו וּבֵרְכוּהוּ, וְאָמְרוּ: מִי יֵלֵךְ וְיוֹדִיעוֹ? אֲמַר לָהֶם רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: אֲנִי אֵלֵךְ, שֶׁמָּא יֵלֵךְ אָדָם שֶׁאֵינוֹ הָגוּן וְיוֹדִיעוֹ, וְנִמְצָא מַחְרִיב אֶת כָּל הָעוֹלָם כּוּלּוֹ.
human_translation: said: that day, brought all the ritually pure deemed pure by Rabbi Eliezer and burned them in fire, and reached a consensus in his regard and ostracized him. And said: Who will go and inform him Rabbi Akiva, said to them: I will go, lest an unseemly person go and he would thereby destroy the entire world.
llm_translation: They said: On that day, they brought all the pure items that Rabbi Eliezer declared pure and burned them in fire. And they counted against him and blessed him, and they said: Who will go and inform him? Rabbi Akiva said to them: I will go, lest an unfit person goes and informs him, and the entire world will be destroyed.

hebrew_text: מָה עָשָׂה רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא? לָבַשׁ שְׁחוֹרִים וְנִתְעַטֵּף שְׁחוֹרִים, וְיָשַׁב לְפָנָיו בְּרִיחוּק אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת. אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר: עֲקִיבָא, מָה יוֹם מִיָּמִים? אָמַר לוֹ: רַבִּי, כִּמְדוּמֶּה לִי שֶׁחֲבֵירִים בְּדֵילִים מִמֶּךָ. אַף הוּא קָרַע בְּגָדָיו וְחָלַץ מִנְעָלָיו, וְנִשְׁמַט וְיָשַׁב עַל גַּבֵּי קַרְקַע.
human_translation: What did Rabbi Akiva do? He wore black and wrapped himself in black, and sat before at a distance of four cubits, Rabbi Eliezer said to him: Akiva, what today from other days, said to him: My teacher, it appears to me that colleagues are distancing from you. too, rent his garments and removed his shoes, and he dropped and sat upon the ground.
llm_translation: What did Rabbi Akiva do? He wore black garments and wrapped himself in black, and sat before him at a distance of four cubits. Rabbi Eliezer said to him: Akiva, what day is today? He said to him: Rabbi, it is as clear to me as if my colleagues were separated from you. He also tore his garments, removed his shoes, and fell to the ground and sat on the earth.

hebrew_text: זָלְגוּ עֵינָיו דְּמָעוֹת, לָקָה הָעוֹלָם: שְׁלִישׁ בְּזֵיתִים, וּשְׁלִישׁ בְּחִטִּים, וּשְׁלִישׁ בִּשְׂעוֹרִים. וְיֵשׁ אוֹמְרִים: אַף בָּצֵק שֶׁבִּידֵי אִשָּׁה טָפַח. תָּנָא: אַף גָּדוֹל הָיָה בְּאוֹתוֹ הַיּוֹם, שֶׁבְּכָל מָקוֹם שֶׁנָּתַן בּוֹ עֵינָיו רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר – נִשְׂרַף.
human_translation: His eyes shed tears, the world was afflicted: One-third of olives and one-third of wheat, and one-third of barley. And some say even dough in a woman’s hands spoiled. taught: There was great anger on that day, as any place that Rabbi Eliezer fixed his gaze was burned.
llm_translation: His eyes trickled tears, the world was struck: one-third in olives, one-third in wheat, and one-third in barley. And some say: even dough in the hands of a woman is a handful. It was taught: there was also a great man on that day, for wherever Rabbi Eliezer cast his eyes, it burned.

hebrew_text: וְאַף רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל הָיָה בָּא בִּסְפִינָה. עָמַד עָלָיו נַחְשׁוֹל לְטַבְּעוֹ. אָמַר: כִּמְדוּמֶּה לִי שֶׁאֵין זֶה אֶלָּא בִּשְׁבִיל רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן הוּרְקָנוֹס. עָמַד עַל רַגְלָיו וְאָמַר: רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם, גָּלוּי וְיָדוּעַ לְפָנֶיךָ שֶׁלֹּא לִכְבוֹדִי עָשִׂיתִי, וְלֹא לִכְבוֹד בֵּית אַבָּא עָשִׂיתִי, אֶלָּא לִכְבוֹדְךָ, שֶׁלֹּא יִרְבּוּ מַחְלוֹקוֹת בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל. נָח הַיָּם מִזַּעְפּוֹ.
human_translation: And even Rabban Gamliel, was coming on a boat a large wave swelled over him to drown him. said: It seems to me that this is only for the sake of Rabbi Eliezer ben Hyrcanus, stood on his feet and said: Master of the Universe, it is revealed and known before You that neither was it for my honor I acted nor was it for the honor of the house of my father I acted; rather, for Your honor, so that disputes will not proliferate in Israel. the sea calmed from its raging.
llm_translation: Rabban Gamliel also came on a ship. A serpent came and encircled him to drown him. He said: "It is clear to me that this is only because of Rabbi Eliezer ben Hurkenos." He stood on his feet and said: "Master of the Universe, it is revealed and known before You that I did not do this for my honor, nor for the honor of my father's house, but for Your honor, so that disputes may not increase among the Jewish people." The sea calmed down from its anger.

hebrew_text: אִימָּא שָׁלוֹם, דְּבֵיתְהוּ דְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר, אֲחָתֵיהּ דְּרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל הֲוַאי. מֵהָהוּא מַעֲשֶׂה וְאֵילָךְ, לָא הֲוָה שָׁבְקָה לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר לְמִיפַּל עַל אַפֵּיהּ. הָהוּא יוֹמָא רֵישׁ יַרְחָא הֲוָה, וְאִיחַלַּף לַהּ בֵּין מָלֵא לְחָסֵר. אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: אֲתָא עַנְיָא וְקָאֵי אַבָּבָא, אַפִּיקָא לֵיהּ רִיפְתָּא.
human_translation: Imma Shalom, the wife of Rabbi Eliezer, was the sister of Rabban Gamliel. From that incident forward, she would not allow Rabbi Eliezer to lower his head A certain day was the New Moon, and she substituted a full for a deficient Some say a pauper came and stood at the door, she took bread out to him.
llm_translation: Mother of Shalom, the wife of Rabbi Eliezer, was the sister of Rabban Gamliel the Elder. From that incident and onward, she did not leave him, Rabbi Eliezer, to fall on his face. On that day, the first of the month, he exchanged between full and deficient. Some say: A poor person came and stood at the door, and she gave him a loaf of bread.

hebrew_text: אַשְׁכַּחְתֵּיהּ דְּנָפֵל עַל אַנְפֵּיהּ. אֲמַרָה לֵיהּ: קוּם, (קטלית לאחי) [קְטַלְיתֵּהּ לְאָח]. אַדְּהָכִי נְפַק שִׁיפּוּרָא מִבֵּית רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל דִּשְׁכֵיב. אֲמַר לַהּ: מְנָא יְדַעְתְּ? אֲמַרָה לֵיהּ: כָּךְ מְקוּבְּלַנִי מִבֵּית אֲבִי אַבָּא: כׇּל הַשְּׁעָרִים נִנְעָלִים חוּץ מִשַּׁעֲרֵי אוֹנָאָה.
human_translation: she found him that he had lowered his head She said to him: Arise, you killed my brother. Meanwhile, a shofar emerged from the house of Rabban Gamliel that had died. said to her: From where did you know She said to him: This is I received from the house of the father of father: All the gates locked, except for the gates of mistreatment.
llm_translation: I found him fallen on his face. She said to him: Get up, (you have killed my brother). Meanwhile, Shippura came out from the house of Rabban Gamliel who was lying down. He said to her: How do you know? She said to him: This is what I have received from the house of my grandfather's father: All gates are locked except for the gates of Ona'ah.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הַמְאַנֶּה אֶת הַגֵּר, עוֹבֵר בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה לָאוִין. וְהַלּוֹחֲצוֹ, עוֹבֵר בִּשְׁנַיִם.
human_translation: The Sages taught: One who mistreats the convert violates three prohibitions, and one who oppresses him violates two.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: One who refuses a convert transgresses three negative commandments. And one who oppresses him transgresses two.

hebrew_text: מַאי שְׁנָא מְאַנֶּה, דִּכְתִיבִי שְׁלֹשָׁה לָאוִין: ״וְגֵר לֹא תוֹנֶה״, ״וְכִי יָגוּר אִתְּךָ גֵּר בְּאַרְצְכֶם לֹא תוֹנוּ אֹתוֹ״, ״וְלֹא תוֹנוּ אִישׁ אֶת עֲמִיתוֹ״, וְגֵר בִּכְלַל עֲמִיתוֹ הוּא. לוֹחֲצוֹ נָמֵי שְׁלֹשָׁה כְּתִיבִי: ״וְלֹא תִלְחָצֶנּוּ״, ״וְגֵר לֹא תִלְחָץ״, ״וְלֹא תִהְיֶה לוֹ כְּנֹשֶׁה״, וְגֵר בַּכְּלָל הוּא! אֶלָּא, אֶחָד זֶה וְאֶחָד זֶה בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה.
human_translation: What is different mistreatment, that three prohibitions are written “And you shall neither mistreat a convert” “And when a convert lives in your land, you shall not mistreat him” “And you shall not mistreat, each man his colleague” and a convert is colleague? one who also oppresses as well, three are written: nor oppress him” “And you shall not oppress a convert “And you shall not be to him like a creditor” in which converts are included. Rather, both this and that violate three prohibitions.
llm_translation: What is the difference between rejecting a loan and oppressing a borrower, for it is written three prohibitions: "And a stranger you shall not oppress," "And if a stranger dwells with you in your land, you shall not oppress him," "And you shall not oppress each man his fellow," and a stranger is included in the category of one's fellow. Concerning pressing a borrower, three prohibitions are written: "And you shall not oppress him," "And a stranger you shall not oppress," "And you shall not be to him as a creditor," and a stranger is included in this as well! Rather, one prohibition and one prohibition are counted as three.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר הַגָּדוֹל אוֹמֵר: מִפְּנֵי מָה הִזְהִירָה תּוֹרָה בִּשְׁלֹשִׁים וְשִׁשָּׁה מְקוֹמוֹת, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ: בְּאַרְבָּעִים וְשִׁשָּׁה מְקוֹמוֹת, בְּגֵר? מִפְּנֵי שֶׁסּוֹרוֹ רַע.
human_translation: It is taught Rabbi Eliezer the Great says: For what reason did the Torah issue warnings in thirty-six places, and some say in forty-six places, with regard to a convert? due to that inclination is evil,
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Eliezer the Great says: Why did the Torah caution in thirty-six places, and some say: in forty-six places, regarding a convert? Because his evil inclination is strong.

hebrew_text: מַאי דִּכְתִיב ״וְגֵר לֹא תוֹנֶה וְלֹא תִלְחָצֶנּוּ כִּי גֵרִים הֱיִיתֶם בְּאֶרֶץ מִצְרָיִם״? תְּנֵינָא, רַבִּי נָתָן אוֹמֵר: מוּם שֶׁבְּךָ אַל תֹּאמַר לַחֲבֵרֶךָ. וְהַיְינוּ דְּאָמְרִי אִינָשֵׁי: דִּזְקִיף לֵיהּ זְקִיפָא בִּדְיוּתְקֵיהּ, לָא נֵימָא לֵיהּ לְחַבְרֵיהּ זְקֵיף בִּינִיתָא.
human_translation: What which is written: “And you shall not mistreat a convert nor oppress him, because you were strangers in the land of Egypt” We learned Rabbi Natan says: A defect that is in you, do not mention in another. And this that people say: One who has hanged in his family [ bidyotkei ], does not say to another Hang a fish for me,
llm_translation: What is the meaning of the verse, "You shall not wrong a stranger or oppress him, for you were strangers in the land of Egypt"? It was taught: Rabbi Nathan says, "Do not say to your fellow, 'The blemish that is in you.'" This is what people say: If a person is strict with himself, do not say to his friend, 'Be strict with yourself.'

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אֵין מְעָרְבִין פֵּירוֹת בְּפֵירוֹת, אֲפִילּוּ חֲדָשִׁים בַּחֲדָשִׁים.
human_translation: One may not intermingle produce with produce, even new with new
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One may not mix produce with produce, even fresh with fresh.

hebrew_text: וְאֵין צָרִיךְ לוֹמַר, חֲדָשִׁים בִּישָׁנִים.
human_translation: And needless to say, new with old
llm_translation: And there is no need to say, "New over old."

hebrew_text: בֶּאֱמֶת אָמְרוּ: בְּיַיִן הִתִּירוּ לְעָרֵב קָשֶׁה בְּרַךְ, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהוּא מַשְׁבִּיחוֹ. אֵין מְעָרְבִין שִׁמְרֵי יַיִן בְּיַיִן, אֲבָל נוֹתֵן לוֹ אֶת שְׁמָרָיו.
human_translation: Actually, they said: With regard to wine, they permitted one to mix strong with weak because one enhances it. One may not mix wine sediment with the wine, but one may give its sediment;
llm_translation: Truly they said: with wine they permitted to mix hard cheese, because it enhances it. One does not mix lees of wine with wine, but one gives it its lees.

hebrew_text: מִי שֶׁנִּתְעָרֵב מַיִם בְּיֵינוֹ, לֹא יִמְכְּרֶנּוּ בַּחֲנוּת, אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן הוֹדִיעוֹ. וְלֹא לַתַּגָּר, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁהוֹדִיעוֹ, שֶׁאֵינוֹ אֶלָּא לְרַמּוֹת בּוֹ. מָקוֹם שֶׁנָּהֲגוּ לְהָטִיל מַיִם בַּיַּיִן – יָטִילוּ.
human_translation: One who water mix with his wine may not sell it in the store, unless he informs And he may not to a merchant, even if he informs him as, it for nothing other than deceit a place where they are accustomed to place water into the wine one may place
llm_translation: One who mixed water in his wine, may not sell it in the store, unless he informed. And not to a peddler, even though he informed, for it is only to deceive him. In a place where it is customary to pour water into wine - they shall pour.

hebrew_text: הַתַּגָּר נוֹטֵל מֵחָמֵשׁ גֳּרָנוֹת וְנוֹתֵן לְתוֹךְ מְגוּרָה אַחַת, מֵחָמֵשׁ גִּתּוֹת וְנוֹתֵן לְתוֹךְ פִּיטוֹם אֶחָד, וּבִלְבַד שֶׁלֹּא יְהֵא מִתְכַּוֵּין לְעָרֵב.
human_translation: a merchant may take from five threshing floors and place in one warehouse. from five winepresses and place in one large cask [ pitom ], provided that he does not intend to mix
llm_translation: The tager takes from five granaries and puts into one silo, from five winepresses and puts into one vat, provided that he does not intend to mix them.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אֵין צָרִיךְ לוֹמַר חֲדָשׁוֹת מֵאַרְבַּע וִישָׁנוֹת מִשָּׁלֹשׁ דְּאֵין מְעָרְבִין, אֶלָּא אֲפִילּוּ חֲדָשׁוֹת מִשָּׁלֹשׁ וִישָׁנוֹת מֵאַרְבַּע – אֵין מְעָרְבִין, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁאָדָם רוֹצֶה לְיַשְּׁנָן.
human_translation: The Sages taught: Needless to say, new four and old three one may not intermingle Rather, even new three and old four one may not intermingle because people want to age
llm_translation: The Sages taught: It is unnecessary to say that new produce from the fourth year and old produce from the third year do not combine for the purpose of eruv, rather even new produce from the third year and old produce from the fourth year - do not combine, because a person prefers to consume them.

hebrew_text: בֶּאֱמֶת אָמְרוּ: בַּיַּיִן הִתִּירוּ לְעָרֵב קָשֶׁה בְּרַךְ, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהוּא מַשְׁבִּיחוֹ וְכוּ׳. אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: עֲדָא אָמְרָה, כֹּל ״בֶּאֱמֶת אָמְרוּ״ – הֲלָכָה הִיא.
human_translation: Actually, they said: With regard to wine, they permitted one to mix strong with weak because enhances it. Rabbi Elazar said: That is to say, every Actually they said, is halakha
llm_translation: In truth they said: With wine they permitted to mix a hard bracha, because it enhances it, etc. Rabbi Elazar said: This is a witness, every "In truth they said" is a Halacha.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: וּבֵין הַגִּיתּוֹת שָׁנוּ.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman says: And among the winepresses, they taught
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said: "And between the Gittot they differed."

hebrew_text: וְהָאִידָּנָא דְּקָא מְעָרְבִי שֶׁלֹּא בֵּין הַגִּיתּוֹת? אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: דְּיָדְעִי וְקָא מָחֲלִי. רַב אַחָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אִיקָא אָמַר: הָא מַנִּי? רַבִּי אַחָא הִיא, דְּתַנְיָא: רַבִּי אַחָא מַתִּיר בְּדָבָר הַנִּטְעָם.
human_translation: And today, when mix not among the winepresses, Rav Pappa said: because are aware and waive Rav Aḥa, son of Rav Ika, said: whose is this It is Rabbi Aḥa, as it is taught Rabbi Aḥa permits in will be tasted
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: "And what about the case where he mixed the wool, but not between the threads? Rav Papa said: He knows and is forgiving. Rav Acha, son of Rav Ika, said: Is this a question? It is Rabbi Acha, as it was taught: Rabbi Acha permits in a matter that has a taste."

hebrew_text: וְאֵין מְעָרְבִין שִׁמְרֵי יַיִן בְּיַיִן, אֲבָל נוֹתֵן לוֹ אֶת שְׁמָרָיו וְכוּ׳. וְהָא אָמְרַתְּ רֵישָׁא אֵין מְעָרְבִין כְּלָל! וְכִי תֵּימָא מַאי ״נוֹתֵן לוֹ אֶת שְׁמָרָיו״? דְּקָא מוֹדַע לֵיהּ, הָא מִדְּקָתָנֵי סֵיפָא: לֹא יִמְכְּרֶנּוּ בַּחֲנוּת אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן מוֹדִיעוֹ, וְלֹא לַתַּגָּר אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁמּוֹדִיעוֹ, מִכְּלָל דְּרֵישָׁא אַף עַל גַּב דְּלָא מוֹדַע לֵיהּ!
human_translation: And one may not mix wine sediment with the wine, but one may give its sediment. But didn’t you say in the former clause one may not mix sediment at all? And lest you say: What is He may give its sediment; that he informs From that the latter clause teaches: One may not sell it in the store unless he informs and may not to a merchant even if he informs him, it may be inferred that the former clause even if he does not inform
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And one does not mix the lees of wine with wine, but one gives him his lees, etc. But didn't you say at the beginning that one does not mix at all! And if you say, what does 'one gives him his lees' mean? That he is informed, as it is taught in the latter part: One may not sell it in the store unless he informs him, and not to a peddler even though he informs him, which implies the same as the beginning even though he is not informed!"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: הָכִי קָאָמַר, אֵין מְעָרְבִין שְׁמָרִים שֶׁל אֶמֶשׁ בְּשֶׁל יוֹם, וְלֹא שֶׁל יוֹם בְּשֶׁל אֶמֶשׁ. אֲבָל נוֹתֵן לוֹ אֶת שְׁמָרָיו. תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: הַשּׁוֹפֶה יַיִן לַחֲבֵירוֹ – הֲרֵי זֶה לֹא יְעָרֵב שֶׁל אֶמֶשׁ בְּשֶׁל יוֹם, וְלֹא שֶׁל יוֹם בְּשֶׁל אֶמֶשׁ. אֲבָל מְעָרֵב שֶׁל אֶמֶשׁ בְּשֶׁל אֶמֶשׁ, וְשֶׁל יוֹם בְּשֶׁל יוֹם.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said: This is saying: One may neither mix sediment from the night before with of day, nor of day with of the night before. But he may give sediment of itself. That is also taught Rabbi Yehuda says: one who pours wine for another, may neither mix from the night before with of day, nor of day with of the night before. But he may mix of the night before with the night before, and of day with of day.
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said: Thus he said, one does not combine the watchmen of yesterday with those of today, nor those of today with those of yesterday. But one may give him his watchmen. It was also taught likewise: Rabbi Yehudah says: One who pours wine for his friend – this does not combine the watchmen of yesterday with those of today, nor those of today with those of yesterday. But one may combine the watchmen of yesterday with those of yesterday, and those of today with those of today.

hebrew_text: מִי שֶׁנִּתְעָרֵב מַיִם בְּיֵינוֹ, הֲרֵי זֶה לֹא יִמְכְּרֶנּוּ בַּחֲנוּת, אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן מוֹדִיעוֹ וְכוּ׳. רָבָא אַיְיתוֹ לֵיהּ חַמְרָא מֵחָנוּתָא, מַזְגֵיהּ, טַעְמֵיהּ, לָא הֲוָה בְּסִים, שַׁדְּרֵיהּ לְחָנוּתָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: וְהָא אֲנַן תְּנַן, וְלֹא לַתַּגָּר, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁהוֹדִיעוֹ! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מִזְגָּא דִּידִי מִידָּע יְדִיעַ. וְכִי תֵּימָא דְּטָפֵי וּמְחַיְּילֵיהּ וּמְזַבֵּין לֵיהּ – אִם כֵּן, אֵין לַדָּבָר סוֹף.
human_translation: One who water mix with his wine may not sell it in the store, unless he informs They brought wine to Rava from a store. He diluted it tasted it, and it was not tasty. He sent it to the store, Abaye said to him: But didn’t we learn And he may not to a merchant, even if he informs him? said to him: My dilution is evident And lest you say will add wine, and sweeten and sell it if there is no end to the matter.
llm_translation: One who mixes water into his wine, behold, this one may not sell it in the store, unless he informs and so on. Rava brought him wine from the store, he mixed it, tasted it, it was not to his liking, he sent it back to the store. Abaye said to him: But we learned, not to mix, even though he informed! He said to him: My mixing is different, it is known. And if you say that he dilutes it and strengthens it and sells it – if so, there is no end to the matter.

hebrew_text: מָקוֹם שֶׁנָּהֲגוּ לְהַטִּיל מַיִם בַּיַּיִן, יָטִילוּ וְכוּ׳. תָּנָא: לְמֶחֱצָה, לִשְׁלִישׁ, וְלִרְבִיעַ. אָמַר רַב: וּבֵין הַגִּיתּוֹת שָׁנוּ.
human_translation: a place where they are accustomed to place water into the wine one may place It was taught: one-half, one-third, or one-fourth Rav says: And among the winepresses, they taught
llm_translation: Place where accustomed to pour water into wine, they shall pour and so on. It was taught: half, third, and quarter. Rav said: and between the winepresses they differed.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: לֹא יְחַלֵּק הַחֶנְוָנִי קְלָיוֹת וֶאֱגוֹזִין לַתִּינוֹקוֹת, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהוּא מַרְגִּילָן לָבֹא אֶצְלוֹ. וַחֲכָמִים מַתִּירִין. וְלֹא יִפְחוֹת אֶת הַשַּׁעַר, וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: זָכוּר לַטּוֹב.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: A storekeeper may not hand out toasted grain and nuts to children due to that he accustoms them to come to him And the Rabbis permit And one may not reduce the rate. And the Rabbis say: remembered positively.
llm_translation: The Mishnah: Rabbi Yehuda says: The storekeeper should not distribute dried figs and nuts to children, because he accustoms them to come to him. But the Sages permit it. And one should not lessen the gate, and the Sages say: Remember for the good.

hebrew_text: לֹא יָבוֹר אֶת הַגְּרִיסִין, דִּבְרֵי אַבָּא שָׁאוּל. וַחֲכָמִים מַתִּירִין, וּמוֹדִים שֶׁלֹּא יָבוֹר מֵעַל פִּי מְגוּרָה, שֶׁאֵינוֹ אֶלָּא כְּגוֹנֵב אֶת הָעַיִן. אֵין מְפַרְכְּסִין לֹא אֶת הָאָדָם, וְלֹא אֶת הַבְּהֵמָה, וְלֹא אֶת הַכֵּלִים.
human_translation: may not sift ground beans the statement of Abba Shaul. And the Rabbis permit And concede that one may not sift from the opening of the bin as this is nothing other than deception. One may neither adorn a person nor an animal nor vessels
llm_translation: He shall not bury the grape skins, the words of Abba Shaul. And the sages permit it, and they agree that one should not bury them above a pit, for it is only like stealing the eye. One may not cover either a person, or an animal, or utensils.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאי טַעְמַיְיהוּ דְּרַבָּנַן? דַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֲנָא מְפַלֵּיגְנָא אַמְגּוֹזֵי, וְאַתְּ פַּלֵּיג שִׁיסְקֵי.
human_translation: What is the reason for the the Rabbis, because say to his I hand out nuts; and you hand out jujubes [ shiskei ].
llm_translation: Gemara: What is the reason of the Rabbis? For he said to him: "I divide amgozei, and you divide shiskei."

hebrew_text: וְלֹא יִפְחוֹת אֶת הַשַּׁעַר, וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: זָכוּר לַטּוֹב וְכוּ׳. מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבָּנַן?
human_translation: And one may not reduce the rate. And the Rabbis say: remembered positively. What is the reason for the Rabbis,
llm_translation: "And not diminish the gate, and the sages say: 'Remember for good, etc.' What is the reason of the Rabbis?"

hebrew_text: מִשּׁוּם דְּקָא מַרְוַוח לְתַרְעָא:
human_translation: due to that he eases the rate,
llm_translation: Due to the fact that it is pleasing to the Creator.

hebrew_text: וְלֹא יָבוֹר אֶת הַגְּרִיסִין, דִּבְרֵי אַבָּא שָׁאוּל. וַחֲכָמִים מַתִּירִין וְכוּ׳. מַאן חֲכָמִים? רַבִּי אַחָא, דְּתַנְיָא: רַבִּי אַחָא מַתִּיר בְּדָבָר הַנִּרְאֶה.
human_translation: And one may not sift ground beans the statement of Abba Shaul. And the Rabbis permit Who Rabbis Rabbi Aḥa, as it is taught Rabbi Aḥa permits an item which is obvious.
llm_translation: "And one should not bury the grape pits, the words of Abba Shaul. And the sages permit, etc. Who are the sages? Rabbi Akha, as it was taught: Rabbi Akha permits in a matter that is visible."

hebrew_text: אֵין מְפַרְכְּסִין, לֹא אֶת הָאָדָם וְכוּ׳ וְלֹא אֶת הַכֵּלִים. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אֵין מְשַׁרְבְּטִין אֶת הַבְּהֵמָה, וְאֵין נוֹפְחִין בַּקְּרָבַיִים, וְאֵין שׁוֹרִין אֶת הַבָּשָׂר בַּמַּיִם. מַאי אֵין מְשַׁרְבְּטִין? הָכָא תַּרְגִּמוּ: מַיָּא דְחִיזְרָא. זְעֵירִי אָמַר רַב כָּהֲנָא: מַזְקַפְתָּא.
human_translation: One may neither adorn a person, nor vessels. The Sages taught: One may neither stiffen an animal nor inflate innards nor soak meat in water What One may not stiffen an animal? Here, they explained bran water, Ze’eiri said Rav Kahana: scrubbing
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Ein mefarkesin, lo et ha'adam v'chu'... v'lo et ha'kelim. Tanu Rabbanan: Ein mesharbetin et ha'beheima, v'ein nofchin ba'kervayim, v'ein shorin et ha'basar ba'mayim. Mai ein mesharbetin? Hacha targimu: maya d'chizra. Ze'iri amar Rav Kahana: mazkafeta." English translation: "We do not separate, neither the human and... nor the vessels. The Rabbis taught: We do not bathe the animal, and we do not inflate the intestines, and we do not soak the meat in water. What is meant by 'we do not bathe'? Here they explained: the water of the courtyard. Ze'iri said in the name of Rav Kahana: a sponge."

hebrew_text: שְׁמוּאֵל שְׁרָא לְמִרְמֵא תּוּמֵי לְסַרְבָּלָא. רַב יְהוּדָה שְׁרָא לְכַסְכּוֹסֵי קִרְמֵי. רַבָּה שְׁרָא לְמִידַּק (צַרְדֵי) [צַדְרֵי]. רָבָא שְׁרָא לְצַלּוֹמֵי גִּירֵי. רַב פָּפָּא בַּר שְׁמוּאֵל שְׁרָא לְצַלּוֹמֵי דִּיקּוּלֵי. וְהָא אֲנַן תְּנַן: אֵין מְפַרְכְּסִין לֹא אֶת הָאָדָם, וְלֹא אֶת הַבְּהֵמָה, וְלֹא אֶת הַכֵּלִים! לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא בְּחַדְתֵי, הָא בְּעַתִּיקֵי.
human_translation: Shmuel permitted to place fringes on a cloak; Rav Yehuda permitted to clean ornamented garments; Rabba permitted to taper linen garments Rava permitted to draw arrows Rav Pappa bar Shmuel permitted to draw baskets But didn’t we learn One may neither adorn a person, nor an animal, nor vessels? not difficult, this new That of old
llm_translation: Samuel would lend wool to the people of Mirmeh for Sarbala. Rav Yehudah would lend cups of cream. Rabbah would lend (linen) sheets. Rava would lend saws for cutting. Rav Pappa, son of Samuel, would lend sickles. But we learned: One may not lend either to a person, or to an animal, or to utensils! There is no difficulty: this is in the case of new ones, that is in the case of old ones.

hebrew_text: פִּרְכּוּס דְּאָדָם מַאי הִיא? כִּי הָא דְּהָהוּא עַבְדָּא סָבָא, דַּאֲזַל צַבְעֵיהּ לְרֵישֵׁיהּ וּלְדִיקְנֵיהּ. אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרָבָא, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: זִיבְנַן! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: יִהְיוּ עֲנִיִּים בְּנֵי בֵיתֶךָ.
human_translation: Adornment of a person, what is it? as that involving a certain elderly slave who went dyed his head and beard He came before Rava said to him: Purchase me said to him Let the poor be members of your household.
llm_translation: The kerchief of a person, what is it? Like that case of that elderly servant, who would go and arrange his head and his beard. He came before Rava, he said to him: "Color us!" He said to him: "May the sons of your house be poor."

hebrew_text: אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב פָּפָּא בַּר שְׁמוּאֵל, זַבְנֵיהּ. יוֹמָא חַד אֲמַר לֵיהּ: ״אַשְׁקְיַין מַיָּא!״ אֲזַל חַוְּורֵיהּ לְרֵישֵׁיהּ וּלְדִיקְנֵיהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: ״חֲזִי דַּאֲנָא קַשִּׁישׁ מֵאֲבוּךְ״. קָרֵי אַנַּפְשֵׁיהּ: ״צַדִּיק מִצָּרָה נֶחֱלָץ וַיָּבֹא אַחֵר תַּחְתָּיו״.
human_translation: came before Rav Pappa bar Shmuel, purchased him. One day said to Give me water to drink. went and whitened his head and his beard. said to See that I am older than your father, read about himself: The righteous person is delivered from trouble, and another comes in his stead
llm_translation: He came before Rav Papa, son of Shmuel, his students. One day he said to him, "Give me water!" His students went to fetch water for him. He said to him, "See that I am older than your father." He recited to himself, "The righteous is delivered from trouble, and the wicked comes in his place."

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ הַזָּהָב
llm_translation: We will return to you, O gold.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אֵיזֶהוּ נֶשֶׁךְ וְאֵיזֶהוּ תַּרְבִּית?
human_translation: Which is neshekh , and which is tarbit ?
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: What is interest and what is usury?

hebrew_text: אֵיזֶהוּ נֶשֶׁךְ? הַמַּלְוֶה סֶלַע בַּחֲמִשָּׁה דִּינָרִין, סָאתַיִם חִטִּין בְּשָׁלֹשׁ – אָסוּר, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהוּא נוֹשֵׁךְ.
human_translation: Which is neshekh ? one who lends a sela , for five dinars two se’a of wheat for three prohibited, as it is taking interest [ noshekh ].
llm_translation: Which is interest? One who lends a sela for five dinars, two se'ahs of wheat for three - it is forbidden, because it is interest.

hebrew_text: וְאֵיזֶהוּ תַּרְבִּית? הַמַּרְבֶּה בְּפֵירוֹת. כֵּיצַד? לָקַח הֵימֶנּוּ חִטִּין בְּדִינַר זָהָב הַכּוֹר, וְכֵן הַשַּׁעַר. עָמְדוּ חִטִּין בִּשְׁלֹשִׁים דִּינָרִין.
human_translation: And which is tarbit ? one who an increase in the produce How so? one acquired wheat from of kor for gold dinar, and such the price wheat stood at thirty dinars.
llm_translation: And which is interest? One who increases with fruits. How? He took from him wheat for a golden dinar, the measure, and likewise the gate. The wheat stood at thirty dinars.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לוֹ: תֵּן לִי חִטַּי, שֶׁאֲנִי רוֹצֶה לְמוֹכְרָן וְלִיקַּח בָּהֶן יַיִן. אָמַר לוֹ: הֲרֵי חִטֶּיךָ עֲשׂוּיוֹת עָלַי בִּשְׁלֹשִׁים, וַהֲרֵי לְךָ אֶצְלִי בָּהֶן יַיִן, וְיַיִן אֵין לוֹ.
human_translation: said to Give me my wheat as I wish to sell it and purchase wine with it. said to him: your wheat is considered by me thirty and you have its wine from me. And did not have wine
llm_translation: He said to him: Give me your wheat, for I want to sell it and buy wine with it. He said to him: Your wheat is made into thirty loaves, and behold, you have wine with me, but the wine has none.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מִדְּשָׁבֵיק לְרִיבִּית דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא, וְקָא מְפָרֵשׁ דְּרַבָּנַן, מִכְּלָל דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא, (דְּ)נֶשֶׁךָ וְתַרְבִּית – חֲדָא מִלְּתָא הִיא. וְהָא קְרָאֵי כְּתִיבִי: נֶשֶׁךְ כֶּסֶף, וְרִיבִּית אוֹכֶל!
human_translation: From that sets aside the topic interest by Torah law, and explicates by rabbinic law, by inference by Torah law, neshekh and tarbit are one matter, But aren’t verses written neshekh money and ribit , food?
llm_translation: Gemara: From where do we derive the prohibition of interest usury from the Torah, and the Mishnah explains that it is derived from the general principle of the Torah, since interest and usury - it is one matter. And the verses are written: "Interest of money, and usury you shall not take!"

hebrew_text: וְתִיסְבְּרָא דְּאִיכָּא נֶשֶׁךְ בְּלֹא תַּרְבִּית, וְתַרְבִּית בְּלֹא נֶשֶׁךְ? נֶשֶׁךְ בְּלֹא תַּרְבִּית הֵיכִי דָּמֵי?
human_translation: And can you understand that there is neshekh without tarbit , and tarbit without neshekh ? What are the circumstances neshekh without tarbit ?
llm_translation: And it was thought that there is interest without usury, and usury without interest? Interest without usury, how is it considered?

hebrew_text: אִי דְּאוֹזְפֵיהּ מְאָה בִּמְאָה וְעֶשְׂרִים, מֵעִיקָּרָא קָיְימִי מְאָה בְּדַנְקָא, וּלְבַסּוֹף קָיְימִי מְאָה וְעֶשְׂרִים בְּדַנְקָא. נֶשֶׁךְ אִיכָּא – דְּקָא נָכֵית לֵיהּ, דְּקָא שָׁקֵיל מִינֵּיהּ מִידֵּי דְּלָא יָהֵיב. וְתַרְבִּית לֵיכָּא – דְּלֵית לֵיהּ רַוְוחָא, דְּדַנְקָא אוֹזְפֵיהּ וְדַנְקָא קָא שָׁקֵיל מִינֵּיהּ.
human_translation: If one lends to one hundred with one hundred and twenty, initially one hundred are one-sixth [ bedanka ] and ultimately, one hundred and twenty are one-sixth there is neshekh , as reduces since takes from that he did not give and there is no tarbit , as there is no profit since he lent him one-sixth and he received from him one-sixth
llm_translation: If he increased it by a hundred at a time, initially he established a hundred in a dinar, and ultimately he established a hundred and twenty in a dinar. If there is interest - because he struck him, as he took from him immediately without giving. And if there is no interest - because there is no profit, as he increased one dinar and another dinar he took from him.

hebrew_text: סוֹף סוֹף, אִי בָּתַר מֵעִיקָּרָא אָזְלַתְּ – הֲרֵי נֶשֶׁךְ וַהֲרֵי תַּרְבִּית. אִי בָּתַר בְּסוֹף אָזְלַתְּ, לָא נֶשֶׁךְ אִיכָּא וְלָא תַּרְבִּית אִיכָּא.
human_translation: Ultimately, if you go according to the initial there is neshekh and there is tarbit , If you go according to the ultimate there is neither neshekh nor is there tarbit ,
llm_translation: At the end, if she went out before the initial act - there is both interest and usury. If she went out at the end, there is neither interest nor usury.

hebrew_text: וְתוּ, תַּרְבִּית בְּלֹא נֶשֶׁךְ הֵיכִי דָמֵי? אִי דְּאוֹזֵיף מְאָה בִּמְאָה, מֵעִיקָּרָא קָיְימִי מְאָה בְּדַנְקָא, וּלְבַסּוֹף מְאָה בְּחוּמְשָׁא.
human_translation: Additionally, what are the circumstances tarbit without neshekh ? If one lends to one hundred with one hundred, initially one hundred are one-sixth and ultimately, one hundred are one-fifth
llm_translation: And, you, how are the prices increased without interest? If one adds a hundred to a hundred, initially a hundred is established as a hundred, and ultimately a hundred is with five.

hebrew_text: אִי בָּתַר מֵעִיקָּרָא אָזְלַתְּ – לָא נֶשֶׁךְ אִיכָּא וְלָא תַּרְבִּית אִיכָּא. אִי בָּתַר סוֹף אָזְלַתְּ – הֲרֵי נֶשֶׁךְ וַהֲרֵי תַּרְבִּית!
human_translation: If you go according to the initial there is neither neshekh nor is there tarbit , If you go according to the ultimate there is neshekh and there is tarbit ,
llm_translation: If after the initial transaction you went – there is neither interest nor usury. If after the final transaction you went – behold, there is interest and behold, there is usury!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: אִי אַתָּה מוֹצֵא לֹא נֶשֶׁךְ בְּלֹא תַּרְבִּית, וְלֹא תַּרְבִּית בְּלֹא נֶשֶׁךְ. וְלֹא חִלְּקָן הַכָּתוּב אֶלָּא לַעֲבוֹר עָלָיו בִּשְׁנֵי לָאוִין.
human_translation: Rather, Rava said: You do not find neshekh without tarbit nor tarbit without neshekh , and the verse distinguished them only so that violating two prohibitions.
llm_translation: Rather, Rava said: If you do not find interest without usury, you will find usury without interest. The Scripture only divided them to make one transgress two prohibitions.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״אֶת כַּסְפְּךָ לֹא תִתֵּן לוֹ בְּנֶשֶׁךְ וּבְמַרְבִּית לֹא תִתֵּן אׇכְלֶךָ״. אֵין לִי אֶלָּא נֶשֶׁךְ בְּכֶסֶף וְרִבִּית בְּאוֹכֶל. נֶשֶׁךְ בְּאוֹכֶל מִנַּיִן? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״נֶשֶׁךְ אֹכֶל״. רִבִּית בְּכֶסֶף מִנַּיִן? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״נֶשֶׁךְ כֶּסֶף״.
human_translation: The Sages taught “You shall not give him your money with neshekh and with marbit you shall not give him your food” I have only neshekh for money and ribit for food. From where neshekh with regard to food verse states: neshekh of food, From where ribit with regard to money? The verse states: “ Neshekh of money.”
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: "You shall not give him your money at interest, nor give him your food at increase." I have only interest in money and increase in food. From where do we derive interest in food? The verse teaches: "Interest food." From where do we derive increase in money? The verse teaches: "Interest money."

hebrew_text: אִם אֵינוֹ עִנְיָן לְנֶשֶׁךְ כֶּסֶף, שֶׁהֲרֵי כְּבָר נֶאֱמַר ״לֹא תַשִּׁיךְ לְאָחִיךָ״, תְּנֵהוּ עִנְיָן לְרִבִּית כֶּסֶף.
human_translation: If not matter of neshekh money, as it is already stated “You shall not lend with interest [ tashikh ] to your brother,” apply to matter of ribit , money.
llm_translation: If it is not a matter of interest for a monetary loan, for it has already been stated, "You shall not lend upon interest to your brother," give it as a matter of interest for a monetary loan.

hebrew_text: אֵין לִי אֶלָּא בְּלֹוֶה, בְּמַלְוֶה מִנַּיִן?
human_translation: I have only with regard to a borrower, From where with regard to a lender?
llm_translation: I have nothing except for a borrower, from where do I know about a lender?

hebrew_text: נֶאֱמַר נֶשֶׁךְ בַּלֹּוֶה וְנֶאֱמַר נֶשֶׁךְ בַּמַּלְוֶה. מָה נֶשֶׁךְ הָאָמוּר בַּלֹּוֶה – לֹא חִלַּקְתָּ בּוֹ בֵּין בְּכֶסֶף בֵּין בְּאוֹכֶל בֵּין בְּנֶשֶׁךְ בֵּין בְּרִבִּית, אַף נֶשֶׁךְ הָאָמוּר בַּמַּלְוֶה – לֹא תַּחְלוֹק בּוֹ בֵּין בְּכֶסֶף בֵּין בְּאוֹכֶל בֵּין בְּנֶשֶׁךְ בֵּין בְּרִבִּית. מִנַּיִן לְרַבּוֹת כׇּל דָּבָר? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״נֶשֶׁךְ כׇּל דָּבָר אֲשֶׁר יִשָּׁךְ״.
human_translation: Neshekh is stated with regard to a borrower, and neshekh is stated with regard to a lender. Just as neshekh that is stated with regard to a borrower, you did not distinguish with regard to it between of money of food, between as neshekh as ribit , so too, neshekh stated with regard to a lender, do not distinguish with regard to it between of money of food, between as neshekh as ribit . From where to include any sort? The verse states: “ Neshekh of anything that is lent with interest.”
llm_translation: It is stated "interest" in lending, and it is stated "interest" in borrowing. What is the "interest" mentioned in lending - you shall not differentiate in it between money, food, interest, or usury. Likewise, the "interest" mentioned in borrowing - you shall not differentiate in it between money, food, interest, or usury. From where do we derive to include everything? The Talmud teaches to say: "interest in anything that is lent."

hebrew_text: רָבִינָא אָמַר: לָא נֶשֶׁךְ בְּאוֹכֶל וְלָא רִבִּית בְּכֶסֶף צְרִיכִי קְרָא, דְּאִי כְּתִיב ״אֶת כַּסְפְּךָ לֹא תִתֵּן לוֹ בְּנֶשֶׁךְ וְאׇכְלְךָ בְּמַרְבִּית״ – כִּדְקָאָמְרַתְּ. הַשְׁתָּא דִּכְתִיב ״אֶת כַּסְפְּךָ לֹא תִתֵּן לוֹ בְּנֶשֶׁךְ וּבְמַרְבִּית לֹא תִתֵּן אׇכְלֶךָ״, קְרִי בֵּיהּ הָכִי: ״אֶת כַּסְפְּךָ לֹא תִתֵּן לוֹ בְּנֶשֶׁךְ וּבְמַרְבִּית״, ״וּבְנֶשֶׁךְ וּבְמַרְבִּית לֹא תִתֵּן אׇכְלֶךָ״.
human_translation: Ravina said: verse is required, neither neshekh of food nor ribit of money. As, if it written: You shall not give him your money with neshekh and your food with marbit , as you say, now that it is written: “You shall not give him your money with neshekh and with marbit you shall not give him your food,” read into this Your money you shall not give him for neshekh and for marbit ; and for neshekh and for marbit you shall not give your food.
llm_translation: Ravina said: "For interest in food and for interest in money, a verse is necessary, for if it were written 'Do not give him your money with interest and your food with increase' - as you said. Now that it is written 'Do not give him your money with interest and with increase give him your food,' read it thus: 'Do not give him your money with interest and with increase give him your food.'"

hebrew_text: וְהָא תַּנָּא ״נֶאֱמַר״ ״נֶאֱמַר״ קָאָמַר!
human_translation: But isn’t tanna saying is stated is stated
llm_translation: And the Tanna taught: "It is said," "it is said," is what he is saying!

hebrew_text: הָכִי קָאָמַר: אִילּוּ לֹא נֶאֱמַר קְרָא, הָיִיתִי אוֹמֵר גְּזֵירָה שָׁוָה. עַכְשָׁיו שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר קְרָא, גְּזֵירָה שָׁוָה לָא צְרִיךְ. אֶלָּא גְּזֵירָה שָׁוָה לְמָה לִי? לְ״נֶשֶׁךְ כׇּל דָּבָר אֲשֶׁר יִשָּׁךְ״, דְּלָא כְּתִב בְּמַלְוֶה.
human_translation: This is saying: Had verse not stated I would have said a verbal analogy. Now, as verse is stated a verbal analogy is not necessary. Rather, why do I verbal analogy? to “ neshekh of anything that is lent for interest” which is not written with regard to a lender,
llm_translation: So it is stated: If it had not been said in the verse, I would have said it is an equal decree. Now that it is said in the verse, an equal decree is not necessary. Rather, why do I need an equal decree? For "a bite of anything that bites," which is not written in the case of a loan.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: לְמָה לִי דִּכְתַב רַחֲמָנָא לָאו בְּרִבִּית, לָאו בְּגָזֵל, לָאו בְּאוֹנָאָה?
human_translation: Rava said: Why do I that the Merciful One writes a prohibition with regard to interest, a prohibition with regard to robbery a prohibition with regard to exploitation
llm_translation: Rava said: Why did the Merciful One write not in interest, not in theft, not in oppression?

hebrew_text: צְרִיכִי, דְּאִי כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא לָאו בְּרִבִּית – מִשּׁוּם דְּחִידּוּשׁ הוּא, דַּאֲפִילּוּ בְּלֹוֶה אָסְרָה רַחֲמָנָא.
human_translation: are necessary. As, had the Merciful One written prohibition with regard to interest, because it is a novel element that the Merciful One prohibited even for the borrower.
llm_translation: It is necessary, for if the Merciful One wrote "not with interest" - it is because it is a novelty, for even in a loan, the Merciful One forbade it.

hebrew_text: וְאִי כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא לָאו בְּגָזֵל – מִשּׁוּם דִּבְעַל כֻּרְחֵיהּ, אֲבָל אוֹנָאָה – אֵימָא לָא.
human_translation: And had the Merciful One written prohibition with regard to robbery, due to that against the will But exploitation say not
