llm_translation: "If the Merciful One wrote 'not with theft' - because of the owner's will, but with oppression - why not?"

hebrew_text: וְאִי כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא לָאו בְּאוֹנָאָה, מִשּׁוּם דְּלָא יָדַע דְּמָחֵיל.
human_translation: And had the Merciful One written prohibition with regard to exploitation, due to that does not know that waive
llm_translation: And if wrote the Merciful One not in the affliction, because not knew that forgives.

hebrew_text: חֲדָא מֵחֲדָא לָא אָתְיָא. תֵּיתֵי חֲדָא מִתַּרְתֵּי. הֵי תֵּיתֵי? לָא לִכְתּוֹב רַחֲמָנָא לָאו בְּרִבִּית, וְתֵיתֵי מֵהָנָךְ. מָה לְהָנָךְ שֶׁכֵּן שֶׁלֹּא מִדַּעַת, תֹּאמַר בְּרִבִּית דְּמִדַּעְתֵּיהּ.
human_translation: no one be derived from one one derived from two. Which derive Let the Merciful One not write prohibition with regard to interest, and derive from these What about these in that without consent Will you say with regard to interest, which with his consent,
llm_translation: One from one does not come. Give one from two. Give one from two. Shall we give? Not to write, "The Merciful One does not want with interest," and give from here. What from here? Just as here it is without knowledge, you would say with interest that it is with knowledge.

hebrew_text: לָא לִכְתּוֹב רַחֲמָנָא לָאו בְּאוֹנָאָה, וְתֵיתֵי מֵהָנָךְ. מָה לְהָנָךְ, שֶׁכֵּן אֵין דֶּרֶךְ מִקָּח וּמִמְכָּר בְּכָךְ.
human_translation: Let the Merciful One not write prohibition with regard to exploitation, and derive from these What about these in that not in the manner of buying and selling.
llm_translation: Not to write "Merciful One" is not iniquity, and it is derived from here. What is derived from here? That there is no customary practice of buying and selling in this manner.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לָא לִכְתּוֹב רַחֲמָנָא לָאו בְּגָזֵל, וְתֵיתֵי מֵהָנָךְ. דְּמַאי פָּרְכַתְּ: מָה לְרִבִּית שֶׁכֵּן חִידּוּשׁ? אוֹנָאָה תּוֹכִיחַ!
human_translation: Rather, let the Merciful One not write with regard to robbery, derive from these As what refutation you What about interest? in that a novel element; exploitation will prove
llm_translation: Rather, not to write, the Merciful One, not in theft, and come from here. Demai explains: What about interest, is it not a novelty? Ona'ah will prove it!

hebrew_text: מָה לְאוֹנָאָה שֶׁכֵּן לָא יָדַע וּמָחֵיל? רִבִּית תּוֹכִיחַ!
human_translation: what about exploitation? in that does not know waive interest will prove
llm_translation: What is the punishment for one who does not know and is negligent? A quarter shall prove it!

hebrew_text: וְחָזַר הַדִּין: לֹא רְאִי זֶה כִּרְאִי זֶה, וְלֹא רְאִי זֶה כִּרְאִי זֶה. הַצַּד הַשָּׁוֶה שֶׁבָּהֶן, שֶׁכֵּן גּוֹזְלוֹ. אַף אֲנִי אָבִיא גָּזֵל!
human_translation: And the inference has reverted The aspect of this is not like the aspect of that and the aspect of that is not like the aspect of this Their common denominator is that one robs another I will also bring robbery,
llm_translation: And the judgment returned: not seeing this like seeing that, and not seeing that like seeing this. The equal side in both, that is how they steal. I too will bring a theft!

hebrew_text: אָמְרִי: הָכִי נָמֵי. אֶלָּא, לָאו בְּגָזֵל לְמָה לִי? לְכוֹבֵשׁ שְׂכַר שָׂכִיר.
human_translation: said: Indeed, But why do I prohibition with regard to robbery? to withholds the wages of a hired laborer.
llm_translation: They said: thus it was stated. Rather, why do I need to be involved in theft? It is for the reward of the employer to the hired laborer.

hebrew_text: כּוֹבֵשׁ שְׂכַר שָׂכִיר, בְּהֶדְיָא כְּתִיב בֵּיהּ ״לֹא תַעֲשֹׁק שָׂכִיר עָנִי וְאֶבְיוֹן״! לַעֲבוֹר עָלָיו בִּשְׁנֵי לָאוִין.
human_translation: With regard to withholds the wages of a hired laborer, it is explicitly written: “You shall not oppress a hired laborer who is poor and destitute” so that violating two prohibitions.
llm_translation: Employer withholding wages of hired worker, indeed written in it "You shall not oppress a hired worker who is poor and needy"! To transgress upon him with two prohibitions.

hebrew_text: וְלוֹקְמַהּ בְּרִבִּית וְאוֹנָאָה, וְלַעֲבוֹר עָלָיו בִּשְׁנֵי לָאוִין? דָּבָר הַלָּמֵד מֵעִנְיָינוֹ,
human_translation: But let us interpret interest or exploitation, and so that violating two prohibitions. a matter derived from its context,
llm_translation: "And for what reason is one liable for interest and usury, and to transgress upon it with two prohibitions? A matter that is learned from its context,"

hebrew_text: וּבְעִנְיָינָא דְּשָׂכִיר כְּתִיב.
human_translation: and is written in the matter of a hired
llm_translation: And in the matter of a hired laborer it is written.

hebrew_text: ״לֹא תִּגְנֹבוּ״ דִּכְתַב רַחֲמָנָא לְמָה לִי? לְכִדְתַנְיָא: לֹא תִּגְנֹב – עַל מְנָת לְמֵיקַט, לֹא תִּגְנֹב – עַל מְנָת לְשַׁלֵּם תַּשְׁלוּמֵי כֶפֶל.
human_translation: Why do I “You shall not steal” that the Merciful One wrote? for that which is taught “You shall not steal” in order to aggravate “you shall not steal” in order to pay the double payment
llm_translation: "Do not steal" - why did the Merciful One write this? As it was taught: "Do not steal" - with the intention to take, "Do not steal" - with the intention to pay double restitution.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב יֵימַר לְרַב אָשֵׁי: לָאו דִּכְתַב רַחֲמָנָא בְּמִשְׁקָלוֹת, לְמָה לִי? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לְטוֹמֵן מִשְׁקְלוֹתָיו בְּמֶלַח. הַיְינוּ גָּזֵל מְעַלְּיָא הוּא! לַעֲבוֹר עָלָיו מִשְּׁעַת עֲשִׂיָּיה.
human_translation: Rav Yeimar said to Rav Ashi: Why do I prohibition that the Merciful One wrote with regard to weights: said to him: to buries his weights in salt, That is full-fledged robbery; to violates from the moment of the act
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Yeimar to Rav Ashi: Is it not that the Merciful One did not write in weights, why do I need it? He said to him: To store his weights in salt. This is considered stealing from above! To transgress against it from the time of its making.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״לֹא תַעֲשׂוּ עָוֶל בַּמִּשְׁפָּט בַּמִּדָּה בַּמִּשְׁקָל וּבַמְּשׂוּרָה״. ״בַּמִּדָּה״ – זוֹ מְדִידַת קַרְקַע, שֶׁלֹּא יִמְדּוֹד לְאֶחָד בִּימוֹת הַחַמָּה וּלְאֶחָד בִּימוֹת הַגְּשָׁמִים. ״בַּמִּשְׁקָל״ – שֶׁלֹּא יַטְמִין מִשְׁקְלוֹתָיו בְּמֶלַח. ״וּבַמְּשׂוּרָה״ – שֶׁלֹּא יַרְתִּיחַ.
human_translation: The Sages taught: The verse states: “You shall do no unrighteousness in judgment, in measure, in weight, or in volume [ uvamesura ]” “In measure”; this measurement of land, that one may not measure to one during the summer and to the other during the rainy season, “In weight”; this to he may not bury his measuring weights in salt. And “in volume”; that one may not froth
llm_translation: The sages taught: "Do not commit injustice in measurement, in weight, or in volume." "In measurement" - this refers to measuring land, that one should not measure for one person during sunny days and for another person during rainy days. "In weight" - that one should not hide his weights in salt. "And in volume" - that one should not heat.

hebrew_text: וַהֲלֹא דְּבָרִים קַל וְחוֹמֶר: וּמָה מְשׂוּרָה שֶׁהִיא אֶחָד מִשְּׁלֹשִׁים וּשְׁלֹשָׁה בַּלּוֹג הִקְפִּידָה עָלָיו תּוֹרָה – קַל וְחוֹמֶר לְהִין, וַחֲצִי הִין, וּשְׁלִישִׁית הִין, וּרְבִיעִית הַהִין, וְלוֹג, וַחֲצִי לוֹג, וּרְבִיעִית הַלּוֹג.
human_translation: And are matters not a fortiori : And if mesura one thirty third of a log , Torah was fastidious concerning it a fortiori to a hin , and a half- hin , and a third- hin , and a quarter- hin , and a log , and a half- log , and a quarter- log ,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And are not these matters a fortiori: And what is the measure that one of thirty and three log the Torah imposed upon him - a fortiori to hin, and half a hin, and a third of a hin, and a quarter of a hin, and a log, and half a log, and a quarter of a log." English translation:

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: לְמָה לִי דִּכְתַב רַחֲמָנָא יְצִיאַת מִצְרַיִם בְּרִבִּית, יְצִיאַת מִצְרַיִם גַּבֵּי צִיצִית, יְצִיאַת מִצְרַיִם בְּמִשְׁקָלוֹת?
human_translation: Rava says: Why do I the exodus from Egypt that the Merciful One wrote in interest the exodus from Egypt with regard to ritual fringes the exodus from Egypt in weights
llm_translation: Rava said: Why did the Merciful One write the Exodus from Egypt in the Torah with an interest, the Exodus from Egypt in regard to tzitzit, and the Exodus from Egypt with weights?

hebrew_text: אָמַר הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא: אֲנִי הוּא שֶׁהִבְחַנְתִּי בְּמִצְרַיִם בֵּין טִפָּה שֶׁל בְּכוֹר לְטִפָּה שֶׁאֵינָהּ שֶׁל בְּכוֹר, אֲנִי הוּא שֶׁעָתִיד לִיפָּרַע מִמִּי שֶׁתּוֹלֶה מְעוֹתָיו בְּגוֹי וּמַלְוָה אוֹתָם לְיִשְׂרָאֵל בְּרִבִּית, וּמִמִּי שֶׁטּוֹמֵן מִשְׁקְלוֹתָיו בְּמֶלַח, וּמִמִּי שֶׁתּוֹלֶה קָלָא אִילָן בְּבִגְדוֹ וְאוֹמֵר: ״תְּכֵלֶת הוּא״.
human_translation: The Holy One, Blessed be He, said: I am He Who distinguished in Egypt between drop that a firstborn and drop that not a firstborn, I am He Who is destined to exact punishment from one who attributes his money to a gentile and lends it to a Jew with interest. And from one who buries his weights in salt, And from one who hangs indigo [ kala ilan ] on his garment and says it is sky-blue dye
llm_translation: The Holy One, blessed be He, said: I am the One who distinguished in Egypt between a drop of a firstborn and a drop that is not of a firstborn. I am the One who is destined to exact punishment from one who lends with interest to the Israelites and borrows from them to the nations, and from one who conceals his weights with salt, and from one who inserts a colored wool into his garment and says, "It is techelet."

hebrew_text: רָבִינָא אִיקְּלַע לְסוּרָא דִפְרָת. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב חֲנִינָא מִסּוּרָא דִּפְרָת לְרָבִינָא: יְצִיאַת מִצְרַיִם דִּכְתַב רַחֲמָנָא גַּבֵּי שְׁרָצִים, לְמָה לִי? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אָמַר הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא, אֲנִי הוּא שֶׁהִבְחַנְתִּי בֵּין טִפָּה שֶׁל בְּכוֹר לְטִפָּה שֶׁאֵינָהּ שֶׁל בְּכוֹר, אֲנִי עָתִיד לִיפָּרַע מִמִּי שֶׁמְּעָרֵב קִרְבֵי דָגִים טְמֵאִין בְּקִרְבֵי דָגִים טְהוֹרִין וּמוֹכְרָן לְיִשְׂרָאֵל.
human_translation: Ravina happened to Sura on the Euphrates. Rav Ḥanina of Sura on the Euphrates said to Ravina: Why do I the exodus from Egypt that the Merciful One wrote in creeping animals: said to him: The Holy One, Blessed be He, said: I am He Who distinguished in Egypt between drop that a firstborn and drop that not a firstborn, I am He Who is destined to exact punishment from one who intermingles the innards of non-kosher fish with the innards of kosher fish and sells them to a Jew,
llm_translation: Ravinah arrived in the town of Pumbedita. Rav Hanina from Pumbedita said to Ravina: The verse "The exodus from Egypt, which the Merciful One wrote concerning the swarms of insects, why do I need it?" He said to him: The Holy One, blessed be He, said, "I am the one who distinguished between a drop of a firstborn and a drop that is not of a firstborn. I will exact punishment from those who mix the entrails of impure fish with the entrails of pure fish and sell them to Israel."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֲנָא ״הַמַּעֲלֶה״ קָא קַשְׁיָא לִי, מַאי שְׁנָא הָכָא ״הַמַּעֲלֶה״ דִּכְתַב רַחֲמָנָא?
human_translation: said to him: I “Who brings you up” difficult for me. What is different here, that the Merciful One wrote: “Who brings you up
llm_translation: He said to him: I, "the one who ascends," find difficulty, what is the difference here with "the one who ascends" that the Merciful One wrote?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לְכִדְתָנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל. דְּתָנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל, אָמַר הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא: אִילְמָלֵא (לֹא) הֶעֱלֵיתִי אֶת יִשְׂרָאֵל מִמִּצְרָיִם אֶלָּא בִּשְׁבִיל דָּבָר זֶה, שֶׁאֵין מְטַמְּאִין בִּשְׁרָצִים – דַּיִּי.
human_translation: said to him: to as it was taught in the school of Rabbi Yishmael. As it was taught in the school of Rabbi Yishmael: The Holy One, Blessed be He, said: Had I brought the Jewish people up from Egypt only for this matter, that they not become impure creeping animals, it would be sufficient for Me,
llm_translation: He said to him: Go and learn the teaching of the school of Rabbi Ishmael. For it was taught in the school of Rabbi Ishmael: The Holy One, blessed be He, said: If I had not brought the children of Israel out of Egypt except for this matter, that they do not become defiled by creeping things - it would be sufficient.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: וּמִי נְפִישׁ אַגְרַיְיהוּ טְפֵי מֵרִבִּית וּמִצִּיצִית וּמִמִּשְׁקָלוֹת? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אַף עַל גַּב דְּלָא נְפִישׁ אַגְרַיְיהוּ טְפֵי, מְאִיסִי לְמֵכְלִינְהוּ.
human_translation: said to him: And is the reward for greater than interest and ritual fringes and weights? said to him: Even though their reward is not greater, repulsive to eat
llm_translation: He said to him: And who is greater, the reward of those who give a small amount from their excess, or those who give a large amount from their own resources? He said to him: Even though the reward of those who give a small amount from their excess is not greater, they are more praiseworthy.

hebrew_text: וְאֵיזֶהוּ תַּרְבִּית, הַמַּרְבֶּה בְּפֵירוֹת. כֵּיצַד? לָקַח הֵימֶנּוּ חִטִּים בְּדִינַר זָהָב וְכוּ׳. אַטּוּ כֹּל הָנֵי דְּאָמְרִינַן עַד הַשְׁתָּא, לָאו רִבִּית הוּא?
human_translation: And which is tarbit ? one who an increase in the produce How so? one acquired wheat from for gold dinar, Is that to say all these that we said until now are not interest?
llm_translation: "And which is usury? One who increases with fruits. How so? He took from him wheat for a golden dinar, etc. Are all these that we have said until now not considered usury?"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: עַד כָּאן שֶׁל תּוֹרָה, מִכָּאן וְאֵילָךְ שֶׁל דִּבְרֵיהֶם. וְכֵן אָמַר רָבָא: עַד כָּאן שֶׁל תּוֹרָה, מִכָּאן וְאֵילָךְ שֶׁל דִּבְרֵיהֶם.
human_translation: Rabbi Abbahu says: Until here, by Torah law, from this forward by rabbinic law. And so says Rava: Until here by Torah law, from this forward by rabbinic law.
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Avahu: Until here of Torah, from here and onwards of their words. And so said Rava: Until here of Torah, from here and onwards of their words.

hebrew_text: עַד כָּאן – ״יָכִין רָשָׁע וְיִלְבַּשׁ צַדִּיק״. עַד כָּאן, וְתוּ לָא? אֶלָּא, אֲפִילּוּ עַד כָּאן – ״יָכִין רָשָׁע וְיִלְבַּשׁ צַדִּיק״!
human_translation: until here The wicked may prepare and the righteous shall don until here, and no further? Rather, Even until here The wicked may prepare and the righteous shall don.
llm_translation: Until here - "Let the wicked be prepared and let the righteous wear it." Until here, and not further? Rather, even until here - "Let the wicked be prepared and let the righteous wear it!"

hebrew_text: עַד כָּאן – רִבִּית קְצוּצָה. מִכָּאן וְאֵילָךְ – אֲבַק רִבִּית.
human_translation: Until here fixed interest, From this forward a hint of interest,
llm_translation: Until here - a cut ribit. From here and onwards - a dust ribit.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: רִבִּית קְצוּצָה יוֹצְאָה בְּדַיָּינִין, אֲבַק רִבִּית אֵינָהּ יוֹצְאָה בְּדַיָּינִין. רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ רִבִּית קְצוּצָה נָמֵי אֵינָהּ יוֹצְאָה בְּדַיָּינִין.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar says: Fixed interest removed by judges. a hint of interest, cannot be removed by judges. Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Even fixed interest cannot be removed by judges.
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: Ribit ketsutzah yotz'ah b'dayyanin, avak ribit einah yotz'ah b'dayyanin. Rabbi Yochanan said: Even ribit ketsutzah namei einah yotz'ah b'dayyanin.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן? דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״בַּנֶּשֶׁךְ נָתַן וְתַרְבִּית לָקַח וָחָי לֹא יִחְיֶה אֵת כׇּל הַתֹּעֵבוֹת הָאֵלֶּה עָשָׂה״ – לְמִיתָה נִיתַּן וְלֹא לְהִישָּׁבוֹן. רַב אַדָּא בַּר אַהֲבָה אָמַר, אָמַר קְרָא: ״אֶל תִּקַּח מֵאִתּוֹ נֶשֶׁךְ וְתַרְבִּית וְיָרֵאתָ מֵאֱלֹהֶיךָ״ – לְמוֹרָא נִיתַּן וְלֹא לְהִשָּׁבוֹן.
human_translation: Rabbi Yitzḥak says: What is the reason of Rabbi Yoḥanan? as the verse states: “He has given forth with neshekh and he took tarbit , shall he live? He shall not live. He performed all these abominations, subject to death but not to repayment, Rav Adda bar Ahava said the verse states: “You shall not take from him neshekh or tarbit ; you shall fear your God subject to fear but not to repayment.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yitzchak said: What is the reason for Rabbi Yochanan's statement? As the verse says: "He has given on interest and has taken increase; shall he then live? He shall not live; he has done all these abominations, he shall surely die; his blood shall be upon him" - given for death and not for repentance. Rav Adda bar Ahava said, as the verse says: "You shall not take interest from him, nor increase; you shall fear your God" - given for fear and not for repentance.

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר: מִגּוּפֵיהּ דִּקְרָא שְׁמִיעַ לֵיהּ, ״מוֹת יוּמָת דָּמָיו בּוֹ יִהְיֶה״. הוּקְשׁוּ מַלְוֵי רִבִּית לְשׁוֹפְכֵי דָּמִים: מָה שׁוֹפְכֵי דָּמִים לֹא נִיתְּנוּ לְהִשָּׁבוֹן – אַף מַלְוֵי רִבִּית לֹא נָתְנוּ לְהִשָּׁבוֹן.
human_translation: Rava said: It can be derived from the verse itself, “He shall be executed; his blood shall be upon him” lenders interest were juxtaposed with shedders of blood. Just as shedders of blood are not subject to repayment, so too, lenders interest are not subject to repayment.
llm_translation: Rava said: From the body of the verse itself, it is heard, "His blood shall be upon him." The lenders with interest were compared to bloodshedders: Just as bloodshedders were not given the opportunity to repent, so too lenders with interest were not given the opportunity to repent.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר? דְּאָמַר קְרָא:
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: What is the reason of Rabbi Elazar as the verse states:
llm_translation: Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: What is the reason for Rabbi Elazar's statement? Because the verse says:

hebrew_text: ״וְחֵי אָחִיךָ עִמָּךְ״. אַהְדַּר לֵיהּ כִּי הֵיכִי דְּנֵיחֵי.
human_translation: “And your brother shall live with you” Return to him so that he may live.
llm_translation: "And your brother shall live with you." Revere him, for how can he be left?

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, הַאי ״וְחֵי אָחִיךָ עִמָּךְ״ מַאי עָבֵיד לֵיהּ? מִבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְכִדְתַנְיָא: שְׁנַיִם שֶׁהָיוּ מְהַלְּכִין בַּדֶּרֶךְ וּבְיַד אֶחָד מֵהֶן קִיתוֹן שֶׁל מַיִם, אִם שׁוֹתִין שְׁנֵיהֶם – מֵתִים. וְאִם שׁוֹתֶה אֶחָד מֵהֶן – מַגִּיעַ לַיִּשּׁוּב. דָּרַשׁ בֶּן פְּטוֹרָא: מוּטָב שֶׁיִּשְׁתּוּ שְׁנֵיהֶם וְיָמוּתוּ, וְאַל יִרְאֶה אֶחָד מֵהֶם בְּמִיתָתוֹ שֶׁל חֲבֵירוֹ. עַד שֶׁבָּא רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא וְלִימֵּד: ״וְחֵי אָחִיךָ עִמָּךְ״, חַיֶּיךָ קוֹדְמִים לְחַיֵּי חֲבֵירֶךָ.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan, what does he do with this “And your brother shall live with you”? He requires for that which is taught two were walking on path and a jug [ kiton ] of water in the possession of one of them, if both drink die, but if one of them drinks, he will reach a settled area, Ben Petora taught: preferable that both of them drink and die, and let neither one of them see the death of the other. until Rabbi Akiva came and taught “And your brother shall live with you,” your life takes precedence over the life of the other.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan, this "and your brother shall live with you," what does he do with it? He wanted to reconcile it with what was taught: Two who were walking on the road, and there was a jug of water in the hand of one of them, if both drink - they both die. But if one of them drinks - he reaches the water cistern. Ben Petora expounded: It is better that both drink and die, and not that one of them should see the death of his companion. Until Rabbi Akiva came and taught: "and your brother shall live with you," your life takes precedence over the life of your friend.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: הִנִּיחַ לָהֶם אֲבִיהֶם מָעוֹת שֶׁל רִבִּית, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁיּוֹדְעִים שֶׁהֵן שֶׁל רִבִּית – אֵינָן חַיָּיבִין לְהַחְזִירָן. הָא אֲבִיהֶן חַיָּיב לְהַחְזִיר!
human_translation: raises an objection their father bequeathed them money as interest, even though know that as interest, they are not obligated to return But their father obligated to return
llm_translation: Challenger: He left for them their father coins of interest, even though they know that they are of interest - they are not obligated to return them. But their father is obligated to return!

hebrew_text: בְּדִין הוּא דַּאֲבוּהוֹן נָמֵי לָא מִיחַיַּיב לְהַחְזִיר, וְאַיְּידֵי דְּקָא בָעֵי לְמִתְנֵי סֵיפָא: הִנִּיחַ לָהֶן אֲבִיהֶם פָּרָה וְטַלִּית וְכׇל דָּבָר הַמְסוּיָּם חַיָּיבִין לְהַחְזִיר מִפְּנֵי כְּבוֹד אֲבִיהֶם, תָּנֵי נָמֵי רֵישָׁא בְּדִידְהוּ.
human_translation: By right, it that their father is also not obligated to return But since wants to teach the latter clause, their father bequeathed them a cow, or a garment, or any defined item they are obligated to return due to their father’s honor, also taught the first clause with regard to their
llm_translation: In judgment it is that their father is not obligated to return, and since he wants to bring proof from the latter clause: If their father left for them a cow, a cloak, and any other valuable item, they are obligated to return it out of respect for their father. It was also taught in the first clause according to their opinion.

hebrew_text: וְהָנֵי, מִפְּנֵי כְּבוֹד אֲבִיהֶם מִי מִיחַיְּיבִי? קְרִי כָּאן: ״וְנָשִׂיא בְעַמְּךָ לֹא תָאֹר״, בְּעוֹשֶׂה מַעֲשֵׂה עַמְּךָ.
human_translation: And these are they obligated due to their father’s honor? Read here “Nor curse a ruler of your people” to one who performs an action your people.
llm_translation: And these, because of the honor of their father, who is obligated? It is read here: "And a prince among your people you shall not curse," concerning one who acts among your people.

hebrew_text: כִּדְאָמַר רַבִּי פִּנְחָס מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרָבָא: בְּשֶׁעָשָׂה תְּשׁוּבָה, הָכָא נָמֵי בְּשֶׁעָשָׂה תְּשׁוּבָה. אִי עָשָׂה תְּשׁוּבָה, מַאי בָּעֵי גַּבֵּיהּ? שֶׁלֹּא הִסְפִּיק לְהַחְזִיר עַד שֶׁמֵּת.
human_translation: as Rabbi Pineḥas said in the name of Rava where repented. Here too, where repented, If he repented, what is doing in his where did not manage to return before he died.
llm_translation: As Rabbi Pinchas said in the name of Rava: "When one repents, here it is stated 'when one repents.' If one did not repent, what does his body require? That he did not have the opportunity to repent before he died."

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: הַגַּזְלָנִין וּמַלְוֵי רִבִּית, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁגָּבוּ – מַחְזִירִין. גַּזְלָנִים מַאי ״אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁגָּבוּ״ אִיכָּא? אִי גְּזוּל – גְּזוּל, אִי לָא גְּזוּל – גַּזְלָנִין קָרֵית לְהוּ?! אֶלָּא אֵימָא: גַּזְלָנִין, מַאי נִיהוּ? מַלְוֵי רִבִּית. אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁגָּבוּ – מַחְזִירִין.
human_translation: raises an objection robbers and those who lend with interest, even though they collected they must return robbers, what is there Even though they collected If they robbed, they robbed, if they did not rob, do you call them robbers? Rather, say Robbers; who are they? those who lend with interest, even though they collected they return
llm_translation: Challenger: The robbers and those who lend with interest, even though they have collected - they return. Robbers, what is "even though they have collected" applicable to them? If it is a robbery - it is a robbery, if it is not a robbery - are they called robbers?! Rather say: Robbers, what are they? Those who lend with interest. Even though they have collected - they return.

hebrew_text: תַּנָּאֵי הִיא, דְּתַנְיָא: רַבִּי נְחֶמְיָה וְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב פּוֹטְרִין אֶת הַמַּלְוֶה וְאֶת הֶעָרֵב, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁיֵּשׁ בָּהֶן קוּם עֲשֵׂה. מַאי קוּם עֲשֵׂה? לָאו מִשּׁוּם דְּאָמְרִינַן לְהוּ קוּמוּ אַהֲדוּרוּ?
human_translation: is tanna’im , as it is taught Rabbi Neḥemya and Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov exempt the lender and the guarantor because they are arise and take action, What arise and take action not due to that we say to them: Arise return
llm_translation: It is taught in a Baraita: Rabbi Neḥemya and Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov exempt the lender and the guarantor, because they contain a positive commandment. What is the positive commandment? Is it not because we say to them, "Arise and be adorned"?

hebrew_text: מִכְּלָל דְּתַנָּא קַמָּא סָבַר לָאו בְּנֵי אַהְדּוֹרֵי נִינְהוּ! לָא, מַאי ״קוּם עֲשֵׂה״ – לִקְרוֹעַ שְׁטָרָא.
human_translation: by inference that the first tanna holds these are not subject to repayment. No, what is arise and take action? to tear the note
llm_translation: From the principle that the first Tanna holds that they are not considered descendants of the same generation! No, what is "arise and do" - to tear up the document.

hebrew_text: מַאי קָסָבַר? אִי קָסָבַר שְׁטָר הָעוֹמֵד לִגְבּוֹת כְּגָבוּי דָּמֵי, וְהָא עֲבַדוּ אִיסּוּרַיְיהוּ. וְאִי לָאו כְּגָבוּי דָּמֵי, הָא לָא עֲבוּד וְלֹא כְּלוּם!
human_translation: What does hold? If he holds a document that is fit to be collected is as though collected, and they already performed their transgression And if is not as though collected, they have done nothing
llm_translation: What does he hold? If he holds that a document stands to collect like the collection of money, but they performed their prohibitions. And if not like the collection of money, then they did not do anything!

hebrew_text: לְעוֹלָם קָסָבַר שְׁטָר הָעוֹמֵד לִגְבּוֹת לָאו כְּגָבוּי דָּמֵי, וְהָא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן דְּשׂוּמָא מִילְּתָא הִיא.
human_translation: Actually, holds a document that is fit to be collected is not as though collected, and teaches us That appraisal is matter.
llm_translation: "Forever he holds that a document standing to collect is not like collecting money, and here it is evident to us that it is a matter of common sense."

hebrew_text: הָכִי נָמֵי מִסְתַּבְּרָא, דִּתְנַן: וְאֵלּוּ עוֹבְרִים בְּלֹא תַעֲשֶׂה: הַמַּלְוֶה וְהַלּוֹוֶה, הֶעָרֵב וְהָעֵדִים. בִּשְׁלָמָא כּוּלְּהוּ עֲבוּד מַעֲשֶׂה, אֶלָּא עֵדִים מַאי עֲבוּד? אֶלָּא לָאו, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ דְּשׂוּמָא מִילְּתָא הִיא. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: So too, it is reasonable as we learned And these violate the prohibition The lender, and the borrower, the guarantor, and the witnesses. Granted, all of them, they performed an action. But witnesses, what did they do Rather, isn’t it conclude from that appraisal is matter? Conclude from
llm_translation: So it was taught in a Baraita: And these are the cases of transgressing a negative commandment: the lender and the borrower, the guarantor and the witnesses. The actions of all of them are understandable, but what is the action of the witnesses? Rather, it is not that it is an action, but rather it is to teach that it is a matter of importance. Learn from it.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב סָפְרָא: כֹּל שֶׁאִילּוּ בְּדִינֵיהֶם מוֹצִיאִים מִלֹּוֶה לְמַלְוֶה, בְּדִינֵינוּ מַחְזִירִין מִמַּלְוֶה לְלֹוֶה. כֹּל שֶׁאִילּוּ בְּדִינֵיהֶם אֵין מוֹצִיאִין מִלֹּוֶה לְמַלְוֶה, בְּדִינֵינוּ אֵין מַחְזִירִין מִמַּלְוֶה לְלֹוֶה.
human_translation: Rav Safra says: any where by laws of one removes from the borrower to the lender, by our laws one returns from the lender to the borrower. And any where by their laws one does not remove from the borrower to the lender, by our laws one does not return from the lender to the borrower.
llm_translation: Rav Safra said: Anyone in their laws they would extract from the borrower to the lender, in our laws we return from the lender to the borrower. Anyone in their laws they would not extract from the borrower to the lender, in our laws we do not return from the lender to the borrower.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי לְרַב יוֹסֵף: וּכְלָלָא הוּא? וַהֲרֵי סְאָה בִּסְאָה – דִּבְדִינֵיהֶם מוֹצִיאִין מִלֹּוֶה לְמַלְוֶה, וּבְדִינֵינוּ אֵין מַחְזִירִין מִמַּלְוֶה לְלֹוֶה! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִינְהוּ בְּתוֹרַת פִּקָּדוֹן אֲתָא לִידֵיהּ.
human_translation: Abaye said to Rav Yosef: And is it principle But a se’a for a se’a where by their laws one removes from the borrower to the lender, and by our laws one does not return from the lender to the borrower, said to him: it entered the possession with the status of a deposit,
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye to Rav Yosef: And is it a general principle? But behold, a se'ah for a se'ah - in their laws they take from the lender to the borrower, but in our laws we do not return from the borrower to the lender! He said to him: They come with the principle of a deposit.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבִינָא לְרַב אָשֵׁי: וַהֲרֵי מַשְׁכַּנְתָּא בְּלָא נַכְיְיתָא – דִּבְדִינֵיהֶם מוֹצִיאִין מִלֹּוֶה לְמַלְוֶה
human_translation: Ravina said to Rav Ashi: But a mortgage without deduction, by laws one removes from the borrower to the lender.
llm_translation: Ravina said to Rav Ashi: "But what about a collateral-free loan? In their presence, lenders can collect from the borrower."

hebrew_text: וּבְדִינֵינוּ אֵין מַחְזִירִין מִמַּלְוֶה לְלֹוֶה. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִינְהוּ, בְּתוֹרַת זְבִינֵי אֲתָא לִידַיְיהוּ.
human_translation: And by our laws one does not return from the lender to the borrower. said to him: they came into his possession in the form of a sale.
llm_translation: In our laws, we do not return from borrower to lender. He said to him: They, in the law of merchants, come to their hands.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא כֹּל שֶׁאִילּוּ בְּדִינֵיהֶן, דְּקָאָמַר רַב סָפְרָא: מַאי אֲתָא לְאַשְׁמוֹעִינַן! הָכִי אֲתָא לְאַשְׁמוֹעִינַן: כֹּל שֶׁאִילּוּ בְּדִינֵיהֶן מוֹצִיאִין מִלֹּוֶה לְמַלְוֶה, בְּדִינֵינוּ מַחְזִירִין מִמַּלְוֶה לְלֹוֶה, וּמַאי נִיהוּ – בְּרִבִּית קְצוּצָה, וְכִדְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר.
human_translation: But Any where by their laws, that Rav Safra is saying, what is he coming to teach us? this he is coming to teach us: any where by their laws one removes from the borrower to the lender, by our laws one returns from the lender to the borrower. And what is of fixed interest, and in accordance with of Rabbi Elazar.
llm_translation: Rather, all that they would ask in their laws, as Rav Safra said: What does he come to teach us? He comes to teach us: All that they would ask in their laws, they would take from the lender to the borrower. In our laws, we return from the borrower to the lender. And what is the difference? In a case of interest that is cut off, as Rabbi Elazar said.

hebrew_text: כֹּל שֶׁאִילּוּ בְּדִינֵיהֶם אֵין מוֹצִיאִין, בְּדִינֵינוּ אֵין מַחְזִירִין – רִבִּית מוּקְדֶּמֶת, רִבִּית מְאוּחֶרֶת.
human_translation: any where by their laws one does not remove by our laws one does not return prior interest, subsequent interest,
llm_translation: All that they would not have extracted in their laws, we do not return in our laws - Ribit Muqdemet, Ribit Me'uharet.

hebrew_text: כֵּיצַד: לָקַח הֵימֶנּוּ חִטִּים בְּדִינַר זָהָב הַכּוֹר, וְכֵן הַשַּׁעַר וְכוּ׳. וְכִי אֵין לוֹ יַיִן, מַאי הָוֵי?
human_translation: How so? one acquired wheat from of kor for gold dinar, and such the price And if he does not have wine, what of it?
llm_translation: How: He took from it wheat for a golden dinar the measure, and so the gate, etc. And if he does not have wine, what is to be done?

hebrew_text: וְהָתַנְיָא: אֵין פּוֹסְקִין עַל הַפֵּירוֹת עַד שֶׁיֵּצֵא הַשַּׁעַר, יָצָא הַשַּׁעַר – פּוֹסְקִין, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵין לָזֶה, יֵשׁ לָזֶה!
human_translation: But isn’t it taught one may not set produce until the rate is publicized. the rate has been publicized, one may set even though this does not have that does have
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And it was taught: One does not conclude the blessing over the fruits until the gate is closed. Once the gate is closed - one concludes the blessing, even though there is no one there, there is someone there!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה: מַתְנִיתִין בְּבָא לָחוּב בִּדְמֵיהֶן עָסְקִינַן.
human_translation: Rabba said: the mishna, we are dealing with one who comes to incur a debt for their value,
llm_translation: Rabba said: We are dealing with a Mishnah in Bava Kama concerning the obligation to pay their blood money.

hebrew_text: וְכִדְתַנְיָא: הֲרֵי שֶׁהָיָה נוֹשֶׁה בַּחֲבֵירוֹ מָנֶה, וְהָלַךְ וְעָמַד עַל גּוֹרְנוֹ, וְאוֹמֵר: תֵּן לִי מְעוֹתַי, שֶׁאֲנִי רוֹצֶה לִיקַּח בָּהֶם חִטִּים. אָמַר לוֹ: חִטִּים יֵשׁ לִי שֶׁאֲנִי נוֹתֵן לְךָ, צֵא וַעֲשֵׂה עָלַי כְּשַׁעַר שֶׁל עַכְשָׁיו, וַאֲנִי אַעֲלֶה לְךָ כׇּל שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר חֹדֶשׁ – אָסוּר, דְּלָאו כְּאִיסָּרוֹ הַבָּא לְיָדוֹ דָּמֵי.
human_translation: And as it is taught If was owed one hundred dinars by another, and he went and stood by granary and said Give me my money, as I wish to buy wheat with it. said to him: I have wheat that I will give you; go and calculate for me by the current rate, and I will give you a full twelve months, forbidden as not similar to his issar has come into his possession.
llm_translation: And as it was taught: If one was borrowing from his fellow a Maneh, and he went and stood on his threshing floor, and said: "Give me my coins, for I want to buy wheat with them." He said to him: "I have wheat that I can give you, go and make for me a gate of now, and I will give you all twelve months - it is forbidden, for it is not like his own prohibition that comes into his hand, it is as if it were a loan.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: אִי דְּלָא כְּאִיסָּרוֹ הַבָּא לְיָדוֹ, מַאי אִירְיָא ״אֵין לוֹ״? אֲפִילּוּ יֵשׁ לוֹ נָמֵי! אֶלָּא אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: מַתְנִיתִין, כִּדְתָנֵי רַב סָפְרָא בְּרִבִּית דְּבֵי רַבִּי חִיָּיא.
human_translation: Abaye said to If it is not similar to his issar has come into his possession, why specifically he does not have Even if he does have also Rather, Abaye said: The mishna like taught by Rav Safra with regard to interest, school of Rabbi Ḥiyya.
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye: If it is not like his pledge that comes into his possession, what is the meaning of "he has nothing"? Even if he has something! Rather, Abaye said: It is as the Mishnah teaches, as Rav Safra taught in the study hall of Rabbi Chiya.

hebrew_text: דְּתָנֵי רַב סָפְרָא בְּרִבִּית דְּבֵי רַבִּי חִיָּיא: יֵשׁ דְּבָרִים שֶׁהֵם מוּתָּרִין וַאֲסוּרִין מִפְּנֵי הַעֲרָמַת רִבִּית. כֵּיצַד? אָמַר לוֹ: הַלְוֵינִי מָנֶה! אָמַר לוֹ: מָנֶה אֵין לִי, חִטִּין בְּמָנֶה יֵשׁ לִי שֶׁאֲנִי נוֹתֵן לָךְ. נָתַן לוֹ חִטִּין בְּמָנֶה, וְחָזַר וּלְקָחָן הֵימֶנּוּ בְּעֶשְׂרִים וְאַרְבַּע סֶלַע – מוּתָּר, וְאָסוּר לַעֲשׂוֹת כֵּן מִפְּנֵי הַעֲרָמַת רִבִּית.
human_translation: As Rav Safra taught school of Rabbi Ḥiyya with regard to interest: There are matters that are permitted but are prohibited because artifices interest. How so? one said to Lend me one hundred dinars, said to him: I do not have one hundred dinars I have wheat one hundred dinars that I will give you, he gave him wheat one hundred dinars, and went and acquired back from him for twenty-four sela , permitted But it is prohibited to do so because an artifice of interest.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita of the school of Rabbi Chiya: There are things that are permitted and prohibited due to the prohibition of interest. How so? He said to him: "Lend me a Maneh!" He replied: "I do not have a Maneh, but I have wheat worth a Maneh that I can give you." He gave him wheat worth a Maneh, and then he returned and took it back from him for twenty-four Sela – it is permitted, but it is prohibited to do so due to the prohibition of interest.

hebrew_text: הָכָא נָמֵי. כְּגוֹן דְּאָמַר: הַלְוֵינִי שְׁלֹשִׁים דִּינָרִים, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: שְׁלֹשִׁים דִּינָרִים אֵין לִי, חִטִּין בִּשְׁלֹשִׁים דִּינָרִים יֵשׁ לִי שֶׁאֲנִי נוֹתֵן לָךְ. נָתַן לוֹ חִטִּין בִּשְׁלֹשִׁים דִּינָרִים, וְחָזַר וּלְקָחָם הֵימֶנּוּ בְּדִינַר זָהָב. אִי אִית לֵיהּ חַמְרָא לְלֹוֶה, דְּיָהֵיב לֵיהּ בִּשְׁלֹשִׁים דִּינָר – פֵּירָא הוּא דְּקָא שָׁקֵיל מִינֵּיהּ, וְלֵית לַן בַּהּ. וְאִי לָא, כֵּיוָן דְּלֵית לֵיהּ חַמְרָא – וַדַּאי מִשְׁקַל זוּזֵי מִינֵּיהּ, מִחֲזֵי כְּרִבִּית.
human_translation: Here too, where he said Lend me thirty dinars, said to him: I do not have thirty dinars, I have wheat thirty dinars that I will give you. He gave him wheat thirty dinars, and he went and acquired back from him for a gold dinar, if the borrower has wine that he gives him thirty dinars, it is produce that takes from him, and we have no with it. And if not, since he does not have wine, certainly the taking of money from him has the appearance of interest.
llm_translation: Here is the translation of the Talmudic text: Here it is taught: For example, if one said, "Lend me thirty dinars," and he said to him, "I do not have thirty dinars, but I have wheat worth thirty dinars that I can give you." He gave him wheat worth thirty dinars, and then he returned and took them back from him for a golden dinar. If he has wine to lend, for if he gives it to him for thirty dinars, it is clear that he is taking it back from him, and we have no concern. But if not, since he does not have wine, he is certainly taking interest from him, and it appears as usury.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא: אִי הָכִי, ״תֵּן לִי חִיטַּי״, דְּמֵי חִיטַּי מִבְּעֵי לֵיהּ! תְּנִי ״דְּמֵי חִיטַּי״. ״שֶׁאֲנִי מוֹכְרָן״, ״שֶׁמְּכַרְתִּים לָךְ״ מִבַּעְיָא לֵיהּ! תְּנִי ״שֶׁמְּכַרְתִּים לָךְ״. ״הֲרֵי חִטֶּיךָ עֲשׂוּיוֹת עָלַי בִּשְׁלֹשִׁים דִּינָרִין״, מֵעִיקָּרָא נָמֵי הָכִי אוֹקְמִינְהוּ עִילָּוֵיהּ! הָכִי קָאָמַר לֵיהּ: בִּדְמֵי חִטֶּיךָ שֶׁעָשִׂיתָ עָלַי בִּשְׁלֹשִׁים דִּינָר.
human_translation: Rava said to If so, Give me my wheat, it should have the value of my wheat. teach: The value of my wheat. As I wish to sell it, it should have Which I sold to you. teach: Which I sold to you. Your wheat is considered by me thirty dinars, he had also established for him at this at the outset. This is what he is saying to him: according to the value of your wheat that you calculated for me at thirty dinars.
llm_translation: He said to him, Rava: If so, "Give me my wheat," for the price of my wheat he wants! Teach "the price of my wheat." "That I am selling them," "that I have sold them to you" he wants! Teach "that I have sold them to you." "Behold, your wheat is valued at thirty dinars," from the outset thus I established it for you! This is what he is saying to him: With the price of your wheat that you have made for me at thirty dinars.

hebrew_text: ״הֲרֵי לָךְ אֶצְלִי בָּהֶן יַיִן וְיַיִן אֵין לוֹ״, וְהָא ״בְּדִינַר זָהָב הַכּוֹר וְכֵן הַשַּׁעַר״ קָתָנֵי! אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: כִּי שָׁכֵיבְנָא רַבִּי אוֹשַׁעְיָא נְפַק לְווֹתִי,
human_translation: And you have its wine from me, and he does not have wine But taught: of kor for gold dinar, and indeed the price Rather, Rava said When I die, Rabbi Oshaya will come out to greet me,
llm_translation: "Behold, with me there is wine, and he has no wine." But isn't it taught: "With a golden dinar, a hole, and likewise a gate"? Rather, Rava said: When Rabbi Oshaya lay down, I went out to accompany him.

hebrew_text: דִּמְתָרַצְנָא מַתְנִיתִין כְּווֹתֵיהּ.
human_translation: as I resolve the mishna in accordance with his
llm_translation: We have a dispute of Tannaim like his words.

hebrew_text: דְּתָנֵי רַבִּי אוֹשַׁעְיָא: הֲרֵי שֶׁהָיָה נוֹשֶׁה בַּחֲבֵירוֹ מָנֶה, וְהָלַךְ וְעָמַד עַל גּוֹרְנוֹ וְאָמַר: תֵּן לִי מְעוֹתַי, שֶׁאֲנִי רוֹצֶה לִיקַּח בָּהֶן חִטִּין. וְאָמַר לוֹ: חִטִּין יֵשׁ לִי שֶׁאֲנִי נוֹתֵן לְךָ, צֵא וַעֲשָׂאֵן עָלַי כְּשַׁעַר שֶׁל עַכְשָׁיו. הִגִּיעַ זְמַן חִטִּין לִמְכּוֹר, אָמַר לוֹ: תֵּן לִי חִטִּין, שֶׁאֲנִי רוֹצֶה לְמוֹכְרָן וְלִיקַּח בָּהֶן יַיִן. אָמַר לוֹ: יֵשׁ לִי יַיִן שֶׁאֲנִי נוֹתֵן לְךָ, צֵא וַעֲשָׂאֵן עָלַי כְּשַׁעַר שֶׁל עַכְשָׁיו.
human_translation: As Rabbi Oshaya teaches was owed one hundred dinars by another, and he went and stood by granary and said: Give me my money, as I wish to buy wheat with it, and said to him: I have wheat that I will give you; go and calculate for me at the current rate. the time to sell wheat arrived, said to him: Give me wheat, as I want to sell it and acquire wine with it. said to him: I have wine that I will give you; go and calculate for me at the current rate.
llm_translation: It was taught by Rabbi Oshaya: Behold, if one was borrowing from his fellow a Maneh, and he went and stood on his threshing floor and said: "Give me my coins, for I wish to buy wheat with them." And he said to him: "I have wheat that I can give you, go and make it upon me at today's market price." When the time for selling the wheat arrived, he said to him: "Give me wheat, for I wish to sell it and buy wine with it." He said to him: "I have wine that I can give you, go and make it upon me at today's market price."

hebrew_text: הִגִּיעַ זְמַן יַיִן לִמְכּוֹר, וְאָמַר לוֹ: תֵּן לִי יֵינִי שֶׁאֲנִי רוֹצֶה לְמוֹכְרוֹ וְלִיקַּח בּוֹ שֶׁמֶן. אָמַר לוֹ: שֶׁמֶן יֵשׁ לִי שֶׁאֲנִי נוֹתֵן לְךָ, צֵא וַעֲשֵׂהוּ עָלַי כְּשַׁעַר שֶׁל עַכְשָׁיו. כּוּלָּם, אִם יֵשׁ לוֹ – מוּתָּר. אֵין לוֹ – אָסוּר. וּמַאי ״לָקַח״ – לָקַח בְּהַלְוָאָתוֹ.
human_translation: the time to sell wine arrived, and said to Give me my wine, as I want to sell it and acquire oil with it. said to him: I have oil that I will give you; go and calculate for me at the current rate. all if has permitted, he does not have forbidden. And what is Acquired? he acquired as his loan.
llm_translation: The time for selling wine arrived, and he said to him: "Give me my wine, for I wish to sell it and buy oil with it." He said to him: "I have oil that I can give you, go and make it on my behalf at today's price." All of them, if he has it – it is permitted. If he does not have it – it is forbidden. And what is "to take"? - He took it on credit.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ מִדְּרַבִּי אוֹשַׁעְיָא תְּלָת. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ דְּמַעֲמִידִין מִלְוֶה עַל גַּבֵּי פֵּירוֹת, וְלָא אָמְרִינַן דְּלָא כְּאִיסָּרוֹ הַבָּא לְיָדוֹ הוּא. וּשְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: הוּא דְּיֵשׁ לוֹ. וּשְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: אִיתַהּ לִדְרַבִּי יַנַּאי.
human_translation: Rava said: Conclude from of Rabbi Oshaya three Conclude from it that one may establish a loan upon produce, and we do not say like his issar has not come into his possession, conclude from it provided that he has produce And conclude from it is with of Rabbi Yannai.
llm_translation: Rava said: Learn from it three things from Rabbi Oshaya. Learn from it that we establish a loan on the produce, and we do not say that it is as if the produce came into his possession. And learn from it: he who has. And learn from it: it came to Rabbi Yannai.

hebrew_text: דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יַנַּאי: מָה לִי הֵן מָה לִי דְּמֵיהֶן.
human_translation: as Rabbi Yannai says: What to me what to me value?
llm_translation: As Rabbi Yannai said: "What to me, what to me, their blood."

hebrew_text: דְּאִתְּמַר, רַב אָמַר: עוֹשִׂין אֲמָנָה בְּפֵירוֹת. וְאֵין עוֹשִׂין אֲמָנָה בְּדָמִים. וְרַבִּי יַנַּאי אָמַר: מָה לִי הֵן, וּמָה לִי דְּמֵיהֶן.
human_translation: As it was stated Rav says one may make trust with regard to produce, but one may not make trust with regard to money, And Rabbi Yannai says: What to me the produce, and what to me value?
llm_translation: It was stated: Rav said: They make a support for fruits. And they do not make a support for blood. And Rabbi Yannai said: What do I have to do with them, and what do I have to do with their blood.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: כּוּלָּם, אִם יֵשׁ לוֹ מוּתָּר. אָמַר רַב הוּנָא אָמַר רַב: בְּשֶׁמָּשַׁךְ. אִי בְּשֶׁמָּשַׁךְ צְרִיכָא לְמֵימַר? אֶלָּא כְּגוֹן שֶׁיִּחֵד לוֹ קֶרֶן זָוִית.
human_translation: raises an objection all of them, if has permitted, Rav Huna says Rav says: with regard to where pulled If he pulled need to be said? Rather, where designated a corner for
llm_translation: The Talmudic text translates as follows: Challenger: All of them, if he has permission. Rav Huna said in the name of Rav: When he pulls. If he pulls, is it necessary to say? Rather, for example, when he joins for himself a corner horn.

hebrew_text: וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: הָא מַנִּי – רַבִּי יְהוּדָה הִיא, דְּאָמַר: צַד אֶחָד בְּרִבִּית מוּתָּר.
human_translation: And Shmuel said: whose is this It is Rabbi Yehuda, who said uncertain interest, permitted.
llm_translation: Samuel said: "Ha mani - Rabbi Yehuda hi, de'amar: tzad echad b'ribit mutar."

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא: הֲרֵי שֶׁהָיָה נוֹשֶׁה בַּחֲבֵירוֹ מָנֶה, וְעָשָׂה לוֹ שָׂדֵהוּ מֶכֶר. בִּזְמַן שֶׁהַמּוֹכֵר אוֹכֵל פֵּירוֹת – מוּתָּר. לוֹקֵחַ אוֹכֵל פֵּירוֹת – אָסוּר. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אַף בִּזְמַן שֶׁהַלּוֹקֵחַ אוֹכֵל פֵּירוֹת – מוּתָּר.
human_translation: As it is taught If was owed one hundred dinars by another, and performed a sale his field for him that the seller, consumes the produce permitted, buyer, consumes the produce, prohibited, Rabbi Yehuda says: Even if the buyer consumes the produce, permitted.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: If one was renting from his fellow a field, and he made a sale of his field. When the seller eats its fruits - it is permitted. When the buyer eats its fruits - it is forbidden. Rabbi Yehuda says: Even when the buyer eats its fruits - it is permitted.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָהֶם רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּבַיְתוֹס בֶּן זוֹנִין שֶׁעָשָׂה שָׂדֵהוּ מֶכֶר עַל פִּי רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן עֲזַרְיָה וְלוֹקֵחַ אוֹכֵל פֵּירוֹת הָיָה! אָמְרוּ לוֹ: מִשָּׁם רְאָיָה?! מוֹכֵר אוֹכֵל פֵּרוֹת הָיָה, וְלֹא לוֹקֵחַ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda said to An incident involving Baitos ben Zunin, who performed a sale his field on the basis of Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya, was buyer consumed the produce. said to bring a proof from there? It was seller, not the buyer, who consumed the produce.
llm_translation: He said to them, Rabbi Yehuda: There was an incident with Baytos ben Zonin who made his field a sale according to the ruling of Rabbi Elazar ben Azariah, and he was taking the produce to eat! They said to him: Is that a proper demonstration?! He was selling the produce, not buying it.

hebrew_text: מַאי בֵּינַיְיהוּ? אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: צַד אֶחָד בְּרִבִּית אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ. רָבָא אָמַר: רִבִּית עַל מְנָת לְהַחֲזִיר אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ.
human_translation: What between Abaye said: between them uncertain interest. Rava said: The between them interest on the condition given back.
llm_translation: What is the difference between them? Abaye said: There is one side with interest between them. Rava said: Interest with the intention to return is the difference between them.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא, הַשְׁתָּא דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יַנַּאי:
human_translation: Rava said: Now that Rabbi Yannai saying
llm_translation: Rava said, "This year, as Rabbi Yannai said:"

hebrew_text: מָה לִי הֵן וּמָה לִי דְּמֵיהֶן – אָמְרִינַן, מָה לִי דְּמֵיהֶן וּמָה לִי הֵן – נָמֵי אָמְרִינַן. וּפוֹסְקִין עַל שַׁעַר שֶׁבַּשּׁוּק, וְאַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵין לוֹ.
human_translation: we say: What to me and what to me value, we also say: What to me value, and what to me and one may set by the market rate. And even though he does not have
llm_translation: "What to me them and what to me their blood" - we say, "What to me their blood and what to me them" - we also say. And we rule regarding a gate in the market, even though it does not have one.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ רַב פָּפָּא וְרַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ לְרָבָא: כּוּלָּם, אִם יֵשׁ לוֹ – מוּתָּר, אִם אֵין לוֹ – אָסוּר! אֲמַר לְהוּ: הָתָם הַלְוָאָה, הָכָא זְבִינֵי.
human_translation: Rav Pappa, and Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, raised an objection to Rava all of them, if he has permitted, if he does not have prohibited. said to them: there a loan here sale,
llm_translation: They raised an objection to Rav Papa and Rav Huna the son of Rav Yehoshua to Rava: All of them, if he has - permitted, if he does not have - forbidden! He said to them: There it is a loan, here it is merchandise.

hebrew_text: רַבָּה וְרַב יוֹסֵף דְּאָמְרִי תַּרְוַיְיהוּ: מַאי טַעְמָא אֲמַרוּ רַבָּנַן פּוֹסְקִין עַל שַׁעַר שֶׁבַּשּׁוּק וְאַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵין לוֹ? דְּאָמַר לֵיהּ: שְׁקִילָא טֵיבוּתָיךְ וְשַׁדְיָיא אַחִיזְרֵי. מַאי אַהְנֵית לִי? אִי הֲווֹ לִי זוּזֵי בִּידֵי – הֲוָה מְזַבֵּנְינָא בְּהִינֵי וּבְשִׁילֵי בְּזוּלָא.
human_translation: Rabba and Rav Yosef both say: What is the reason the Sages said one may set by the market rate and that even though he does not have Because says to Your favor is taken and thrown on the thorns. how have you helped me? If I had money in my hands I would buy in Hini and Shili, at an inexpensive
llm_translation: Rabba and Rav Yosef both said: What is the reason that the Rabbis said to place a guard at a gate in the marketplace even though it does not belong to him? He said to him: Take your cleanliness and go back. What benefit do I have? If I had money in my hands, I would buy with it oil and turnips.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי לְרַב יוֹסֵף: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה מוּתָּר לִלְוֹת סְאָה בִּסְאָה, מִשּׁוּם דְּמָצֵי אֲמַר לֵיהּ: שְׁקִילָא טֵיבוּתָיךְ וְשַׁדְיָיא אַחִיזְרֵי, דְּאָמַר לֵיהּ: חִטֵּי דְּקָדְחִי בַּאֲכַלְבַּאי? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָתָם הַלְוָאָה, הָכָא – זְבִינֵי.
human_translation: Abaye said to Rav Yosef: But if that is so, permitted to lend a se’a for a se’a as can say to Your favor is taken and thrown on the thorns, since he says to him: wheat burn in my warehouse [ be’akalbai ]? said to him: there a loan, here a sale.
llm_translation: Abbaye said to Rav Yosef: Rather, from now on it is permitted to lend a se'ah for a se'ah, because he found a source. He said to him: Take your spice box and return it, for he said to him: Do you grind wheat in a millstone? He said to him: There it is a loan, here it is a purchase.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַדָּא בַּר אַבָּא לְרָבָא: וְהָא בָּעֵי לְמִיתַּב זוּזֵי לְסַפְסֵירָא! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: דְּקָא יָהֵיב לֵיהּ נָמֵי. רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: זוּזֵי דְּאִינָשֵׁי אִינְהוּ עָבְדִי לֵיהּ סַפְסֵירוּתֵיהּ.
human_translation: Adda bar Abba said to Rava: But he would have to give a dinar to a broker, said to him: where also gives Rav Ashi said: a person’s dinars serve as a broker for him.
llm_translation: He said to him, Adah son of Abba said to Rava: But he needs to sit down money for Sapphire! He said to him: Because he also gave him. Rav Ashi said: The money of people, they do his Sapphire work for him.

hebrew_text: רַבָּה וְרַב יוֹסֵף דְּאָמְרִי תַּרְוַיְיהוּ: הַאי מַאן דְּיָהֵיב זוּזֵי אַתַּרְעָא חֲרִיפָא, צָרִיךְ לְאִיתְחֲזוֹיֵי לְבֵי דָרֵי.
human_translation: Rabba and Rav Yosef both say: One who gives money at the advance price must present himself at the granary
llm_translation: Rabba and Rav Yosef both said: Whoever gives money to the poor, should do so discreetly.

hebrew_text: לְמַאי? אִי לְמִקְנֵא – הָא לָא קָנֵי, אִי לְקַבּוֹלֵי עֲלֵיהּ ״מִי שֶׁפָּרַע״, כִּי לָא מִיתְחֲזֵי נָמֵי מְקַבֵּל עֲלֵיהּ ״מִי שֶׁפָּרַע״!
human_translation: For what If to acquire he does not acquire if to accept upon himself, He Who exacted payment if does not present himself also accepts upon himself He Who exacted payment.
llm_translation: For what? If for jealousy - this is not jealousy. If for accepting upon oneself "one who pays damages," because it does not appear that he accepts upon himself "one who pays damages"!

hebrew_text: לְעוֹלָם לְקַבּוֹלֵי עֲלֵיהּ ״מִי שֶׁפָּרַע״, וּמַאן דְּיָהֵיב זוּזֵי אַתַּרְעָא [חֲרִיפָא], לְבֵי תְרֵי תְּלָתָא יָהֵיב, אִי מִיתְחֲזֵי לֵיהּ – סָמְכָא דַּעְתֵּיהּ, וְאִי לָא – אָמַר לֵיהּ: אָמֵינָא דְּאַשְׁכַּחְתְּ פֵּירֵי דְּשַׁפִּירֵי מִדִּידִי וּשְׁקַלְתְּ.
human_translation: Actually, to accept upon himself He Who exacted payment, One who gives money at the advance price gives to two three if he presents himself relies But if not say to him: I said that you found better produce than mine, and you took
llm_translation: Always to the receivers of it "one who pays", and who gives money to the treasurer collector, to the house of two or three, he gives. If he is seen by him - he relies on his opinion, and if not - he says to him: I believe that you have found fruits that are beautiful from mine and you have taken.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: הַשְׁתָּא דְּאָמְרַתְּ מִשּׁוּם מִסְמָךְ דַּעְתָּא, אֲפִילּוּ אַשְׁכְּחֵיהּ בְּשׁוּקָא וַאֲמַר לֵיהּ – סָמְכָא דַּעְתֵּיהּ.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: Now that you have said due to relying even if finds in the marketplace and says to him rely
llm_translation: Rav Ashe said: The support of one's opinion, even if one finds it in the marketplace and says to him - "the support of his opinion."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: כְּלָלָא דְרִיבִּיתָא, כֹּל אֲגַר נְטַר לֵיהּ – אָסוּר. וְאָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: הַאי מַאן דְּיָהֵיב זוּזֵי לְקִירָאָה וְקָא אָזְלִי אַרְבַּע אַרְבַּע, וַאֲמַר לֵיהּ: יָהֵיבְנָא לָךְ חֲמֵשׁ חֲמֵשׁ, אִיתַנְהוּ גַּבֵּיהּ – שְׁרֵי, לֵיתַנְהוּ גַּבֵּיהּ – אָסוּר.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman said: The principle with regard to interest Any payment his waiting, forbidden. And Rav Naḥman said: this one who gives money to a wax seller and go for four and said to him: I will give you five if has with him permitted does not have with him, forbidden,
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said: In the general principle of interest, any additional amount that is guarded for it - is forbidden. And Rav Nachman said: This person who gives coins to a money changer and they go four by four, and he says to him: I will give you five by five, if he gives them to him with his back turned - it is permitted, if he does not give them to him with his back turned - it is forbidden.

hebrew_text: פְּשִׁיטָא! לָא צְרִיכָא דְּאִית לֵיהּ אַשְׁרַאי בְּמָתָא. מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: כֵּיוָן דְּאִית לֵיהּ אַשְׁרַאי בְּמָתָא – כְּ״עַד שֶׁיָּבֹא בְּנִי״ אוֹ ״עַד שֶׁאֶמְצָא מַפְתֵּחַ״ דָּמֵי, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן כֵּיוָן דִּמְחַסְּרִי גּוּבְיָינָא – כְּמַאן דְּלֵיתַנְהוּ דָּמֵי.
human_translation: obvious? No, necessary where has credit in the town, lest you say: Since he has credit in the town similar until my son comes, or: Until I find key, teaches us since lack collection, they are considered as though they were not
llm_translation: It is obvious! It is not necessary that he has a guarantee in the city. What might you say: Since he has a guarantee in the city - it is similar to "until my son comes" or "until I find the key," it implies to us that since they are lacking in understanding - it is as if they do not have a guarantee.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: הַאי מַאן דְּאוֹזֵיף פְּשִׁיטֵי מֵחַבְרֵיהּ וְאַשְׁכַּח בֵּיהּ טוּפְיָינָא, אִי בִּכְדֵי שֶׁהַדַּעַת טוֹעָה – מִיחַיַּיב לְאַהֲדוֹרֵיהּ לֵיהּ, וְאִי לָאו – מַתָּנָה בְּעָלְמָא הוּא דְּיָהֵיב לֵיהּ.
human_translation: And Rav Naḥman said: this one who borrowed coins from another, he found an additional if within the that can make a mistake, is obligated to return to him. But if not, only has given him a gift.
llm_translation: And Rav Nachman said: One who borrows utensils from his friend and finds them broken, if it is possible that his intention was mistaken - he is obligated to compensate him, and if not - it is merely a gift that he gives him.

hebrew_text: הֵיכִי דָּמֵי ״בִּכְדֵי שֶׁהַדַּעַת טוֹעָה״? אָמַר רַב אַחָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יוֹסֵף:
human_translation: What are the circumstances within the that can make a mistake? Rav Aḥa, son of Rav Yosef, said:
llm_translation: "How is the case of 'when the mind errs' comparable? Rav Acha, son of Rav Yosef, said:"

hebrew_text: בְּעִישּׂוּרְיָיתָא וְחוּמְשְׁיָיתָא.
human_translation: in tens or fives,
llm_translation: In the city of Yishuriya and in the city of Khumshiya.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אַחָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרָבָא לְרַב אָשֵׁי: וְאִי אִינִישׁ תַּקִּיפָא הוּא דְּלָא יָהֵיב מַתָּנָה, מַאי? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: דִּלְמָא מִיגְזָל גַּזְלֵיהּ וְאַבְלַע לֵיהּ בְּחֶשְׁבּוֹן. דְּתַנְיָא: הַגּוֹזֵל אֶת חֲבֵירוֹ וְהִבְלִיעַ לוֹ בְּחֶשְׁבּוֹן – יָצָא.
human_translation: Rav Aḥa, son of Rava, said to Rav Ashi: And if is a harsh person, who is not giving gifts, what said to him: Perhaps robbed and he included in the calculation As it is taught One who robs another and including it in the calculation has fulfilled
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Acha, son of Rava, said to Rav Ashi: "And if a person is strong and does not give a gift, what is it?" He said to him: "Perhaps he stole his neighbor's property and swallowed it with calculation." As it was taught: "One who steals from his fellow and swallows it with calculation - he is exempt."

hebrew_text: וְאִי אִינִישׁ דְּאָתֵי מֵעָלְמָא, דְּלָא שָׁקֵיל וְטָרֵי בַּהֲדֵיהּ, מַאי? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: דִּלְמָא אִינִישׁ אַחֲרִינָא גַּזְלֵיהּ, וַאֲמַר לֵיהּ: כִּי יָזֵיף פְּלוֹנִי פְּשִׁיטֵי מִינָּךְ – אַבְלַע לֵיהּ בְּחֶשְׁבּוֹן.
human_translation: And if was a person from the outside, with whom had never conducted business, what said to him: Perhaps another person, robbed and said to When so-and-so borrows money from you, include it in the calculation.
llm_translation: And if a person comes from the world, and does not take two coins with him, what is the reason? He said to him: Perhaps another person will steal from him. And he said to him: "If the wicked restore the pledge, give again that he has robbed" - swallow it with calculation.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב כָּהֲנָא: הֲוָה יָתֵיבְנָא בְּשִׁילְהֵי פִּרְקֵי דְּרַב, וּשְׁמַעִית דְּקָאָמַר ״קָרֵי קָרֵי״ וְלָא יָדַעְנָא מַאי קָאָמַר. בָּתַר דְּקָם רַב, אָמְרִי לְהוּ: מַאי ״קָרֵי קָרֵי״ דְּקָאָמַר רַב?
human_translation: Rav Kahana said: I was sitting at the end of Rav’s study, and I heard him say: Gourds, gourds, but I did not know what saying, After Rav arose I said to What gourds, gourds, that Rav saying?
llm_translation: Rav Kahana said: I was sitting in the rows of Rav's disciples, and I heard him say, "Karei karei," but I did not know what he meant. After Rav stood up, they said to him: What is the "karei karei" that Rav said?

hebrew_text: אֲמַרוּ לִי, הָכִי קָאָמַר רַב: הַאי מַאן דְּיָהֵיב זוּזֵי לְגִינָּאָה אַקָּרֵי, וְקָא אָזְלִי עֲשָׂרָה קָרֵי בְּנֵי זַרְתָּא, וַאֲמַר לֵיהּ: יָהֵבְינָא לָךְ בְּנֵי גַרְמִידָא, אִיתַנְהוּ – שְׁרֵי, לֵיתַנְהוּ – אָסוּר.
human_translation: They said to me: This is what Rav saying: someone gave money to a gardener gourds and they were going ten gourds a span, for a dinar, and said to I will give you a cubit are permitted. are not prohibited,
llm_translation: They said to me, thus said Rav: The one who gives money to a winepress is called, and ten sons of Zarta went and he said to them: "If I give you sons of Germida, if you accept them - it is permitted, if you do not accept them - it is forbidden."

hebrew_text: פְּשִׁיטָא! מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: כֵּיוָן דְּמִמֵּילָא קָא רָבוּ – שַׁפִּיר דָּמֵי, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: obvious? lest you say: Since they increase of themselves permitted, teaches us
llm_translation: It is obvious! What might you say: since from words they increased - it is good, it is implied to us.

hebrew_text: כְּמַאן – כִּי הַאי תַּנָּא. דְּתַנְיָא: הַהוֹלֵךְ לַחְלוֹב אֶת עִזָּיו, וְלִגְזוֹז אֶת רְחֵלָיו, וְלִרְדּוֹת אֶת כַּוַּורְתּוֹ, מְצָאוֹ חֲבֵירוֹ וְאָמַר לוֹ: מַה שֶּׁעִזַּי חוֹלְבוֹת מָכוּר לָךְ, מַה שֶּׁרְחֵלַי גּוֹזְזוֹת מָכוּר לָךְ, מַה שֶּׁכַּוַּורְתִּי רוֹדָה מָכוּר לָךְ – מוּתָּר.
human_translation: In accordance with whose in accordance with this tanna , as it is taught one who went to milk his goats, or shear his sheep, or extract from his hives, another found him and said to Whatever my goats produce sold to you, whatever will be sheared from my sheep sold to you, whatever will be extracted from my hive sold to you, permitted.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "K'man - ki hai tanah. D'tanya: ha-holekh la-chalov et izzav, v'ligzoz et rechelav, v'lirdot et kavvarto, matzo chaverav v'amar lo: mah she'izzai chol'vot makur lakh, mah she'rechelai goz'zot makur lakh, mah she'kavvarti rodah makur lakh - mutar." English translation: "Like whom - for this Mishnah. As it was taught: One who goes to milk his goats, shear his sheep, or plow his field, and he finds his friend and says to him: 'Whatever my goats produce in milk, whatever my sheep produce in wool, whatever my field produces in crops - is permitted.'"

hebrew_text: אֲבָל אִם אָמַר לוֹ: מַה שֶּׁעִזַּי חוֹלְבוֹת כָּךְ וְכָךְ מָכוּר לָךְ, מַה שֶּׁרְחֵלַי גּוֹזְזוֹת כָּךְ וְכָךְ מָכוּר לָךְ, מַה שֶּׁכַּוַּורְתִּי רוֹדָה כָּךְ וְכָךְ מָכוּר לָךְ – אָסוּר. וְאַף עַל גַּב דְּמִמֵּילָא קָא רָבוּ, כֵּיוָן דְּלֵיתַנְהוּ בְּהַהִיא שַׁעְתָּא – אָסוּר.
human_translation: But if said to him: Such and such what my goats produce sold to you, such and such what will be sheared from my sheep sold to you, such and such what will be extracted from my hive sold to you, prohibited, And even though increased of themselves, since they are not at time forbidden.
llm_translation: But if he said to him: "What my she-goats milk, such and such, are sold to you, what my ewes shear, such and such, are sold to you, what my female donkey plows, such and such, are sold to you - it is prohibited. And even though they have increased in value, since they were not specified at that time - it is prohibited.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי, אָמַר רָבָא: כֵּיוָן דְּמִמֵּילָא קָא רָבוּ – שַׁפִּיר דָּמֵי. וְהָתַנְיָא: כָּךְ וְכָךְ – אָסוּר!
human_translation: There are who say Rava said: since grow by themselves permitted, But isn’t it taught Such and such forbidden?
llm_translation: There are some who say, Rava said: Since they increased in words - the price is good. And it was taught: Such and such - forbidden!

hebrew_text: הָתָם לָאו מִינֵּיהּ קָא רָבוּ, דְּשָׁקְלִי לֵיהּ לְהַאי וְאָתֵי אַחֲרִינָא בְּדוּכְתֵּיהּ. הָכָא מִינֵּיהּ קָא רָבוּ, דְּכִי שָׁקְלִי לֵיהּ לְהַאי – לָא אָתֵי אַחֲרִינָא בְּדוּכְתֵּיהּ.
human_translation: There, they do not increase of themselves. that they remove this other replaces it. here, they increase of themselves, that when they remove this no other will replace it.
llm_translation: There, not of its kind, were they arguing, that he took it to this one and another came afterwards in its place. Here, of its kind, were they arguing, that when he took it to this one - another did not come afterwards in its place.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: שָׁרֵי לֵיהּ לְאִינִישׁ לְמֵימַר לֵיהּ לְחַבְרֵיהּ, הֵילָךְ אַרְבְּעָה זוּזֵי אַחָבִיתָא דְחַמְרָא, אִי תָּקְפָה – בִּרְשׁוּתָךְ, אִי יָקְרָא אִי זִילָא – בִּרְשׁוּתַי. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב שֵׁרֵבְיָא לְאַבָּיֵי:
human_translation: Abaye said: It is permitted for a person to say to another: Take four dinars for a barrel of wine; if it sours, in your possession if it appreciates or depreciates in my possession, Rav Sherevya said to Abaye:
llm_translation: Abaye said: It is permitted for a person to permit his friend to say something to his companions, provided that he pays four zuz of wine. If he has turned it over to you, it is in your domain; if not, go and return it to me. Rav She'revya said to Abaye:

hebrew_text: הַאי קָרוֹב לְשָׂכָר וְרָחוֹק לְהֶפְסֵד הוּא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ כֵּיוָן דִּמְקַבֵּל עֲלֵיהּ זוֹלָא, קָרוֹב לָזֶה וְלָזֶה הוּא.
human_translation: This is close to a gain and far from a loss said to him: Since accepts upon himself depreciates, it is close to this and that,
llm_translation: This is close to reward and far from loss. He said to him, since he receives it with contempt, it is close to this one and that one.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ : הַמַּלְוֶה אֶת חֲבֵירוֹ לֹא יָדוּר בַּחֲצֵרוֹ חִנָּם, וְלֹא יִשְׂכּוֹר מִמֶּנּוּ בְּפָחוֹת – מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהוּא רִבִּית.
human_translation: One who lends another may not reside in courtyard free nor may he rent from him at less because this is interest.
llm_translation: Mishnah: One who lends to his fellow should not dwell in his courtyard for free, and should not rent from him for less - because it is interest.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף בַּר מִנְיוֹמֵי אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאָמְרוּ הַדָּר בַּחֲצַר חֲבֵירוֹ שֶׁלֹּא מִדַּעְתּוֹ – אֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ לְהַעֲלוֹת לוֹ שָׂכָר. הִלְוָהוּ וְדָר בַּחֲצֵירוֹ – צָרִיךְ לְהַעֲלוֹת לוֹ שָׂכָר. מַאי קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן? תְּנֵינָא: הַמַּלְוֶה אֶת חֲבֵירוֹ לֹא יָדוּר בַּחֲצֵירוֹ חִנָּם, וְלֹא יִשְׂכּוֹר מִמֶּנּוּ בְּפָחוֹת, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהוּא רִבִּית!
human_translation: Rav Yosef bar Minyumi says Rav Naḥman says: Even though said one who resides in another’s courtyard without his knowledge does not have to pay him rent he lent and resides in his courtyard, must pay him rent. What teaching us We learn this One who lends another may not reside in courtyard free nor may he rent from him at less because this is interest.
llm_translation: Gemara: Rav Yosef bar Minyomei said in the name of Rav Nachman: Even though they said that one who dwells in his friend's courtyard without his knowledge does not need to pay him rent, if he borrowed and dwelled in his courtyard, he must pay him rent. What does this teach us? It was taught in a Mishnah: One who lends to his friend should not dwell in his courtyard for free, nor should he rent from him for less, because this is considered interest!

hebrew_text: אִי מִמַּתְנִיתִין, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: הָנֵי מִילֵּי בְּחָצֵר דְּקַיְימָא לְאַגְרָא, וְגַבְרָא דַּעֲבִיד לְמֵיגַר. אֲבָל חָצֵר דְּלָא קָיְימָא לְאַגְרָא, וְגַבְרָא דְּלָא עֲבִיד לְמֵיגַר – אֵימָא לָא, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: If from the mishna I would say this matter to a courtyard that stands to be rented out and a man who usually rents But a courtyard that does not stand to be rented out and a man who does not usually rent say not teaches us
llm_translation: From the Mishnah, I would say: Those matters in a courtyard that are set aside for a storage area, and a man who does work for storage. But a courtyard that is not set aside for storage, and a man who does not work for storage - say no, it seems to us.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי, אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף בַּר מִנְיוֹמֵי אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאָמְרוּ הַדָּר בַּחֲצַר חֲבֵירוֹ שֶׁלֹּא מִדַּעְתּוֹ – אֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ לְהַעֲלוֹת לוֹ שָׂכָר. ״הַלְוֵינִי וְדוּר בַּחֲצֵרִי״ – צָרִיךְ לְהַעֲלוֹת לוֹ שָׂכָר.
human_translation: There are who say Rav Yosef bar Minyumi says Rav Naḥman says: Even though said one who resides in another’s courtyard without his knowledge does not have to pay him rent, Lend me and reside in my courtyard, must pay him rent.
llm_translation: There is one who says, Rav Yosef bar Minyomei said in the name of Rav Nachman: Even though they said about one who dwells in his friend's courtyard without his knowledge - he does not need to pay him rent. "Lend me and I will dwell in your courtyard" - he needs to pay him rent.

hebrew_text: מַאן דְּאָמַר הִלְוָהוּ – כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן הַלְוֵינִי. וּמַאן דְּאָמַר הַלְוֵינִי – אֲבָל הִלְוָהוּ לָא. מַאי טַעְמָא – כֵּיוָן דְּמֵעִיקָּרָא לָאו אַדַּעְתָּא דְּהָכִי אוֹזְפֵיהּ – לֵית לַן בַּהּ.
human_translation: the one who said if he lent him all the more so Lend me According to the one who said Lend me But he lent him not What is the reason Since initially he did not lend him with this intention, we have no with it,
llm_translation: One who says "lend to me" - certainly lend to him. And one who says "lend to him" - but do not lend to me. What is the reason? Since initially he did not have in mind such a thing, we do not rely on it.

hebrew_text: רַב יוֹסֵף בַּר חָמָא תָּקֵיף עַבְדֵי דְאִינָשֵׁי דְּמַסֵּיק בְּהוּ זוּזֵי, וְעָבֵיד בְּהוּ עֲבִידְתָּא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא בְּרֵיהּ: מַאי טַעְמָא עָבֵיד מָר הָכִי? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֲנָא כְּרַב נַחְמָן סְבִירָא לִי, דְּאָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: עַבְדָּא, נְהוֹם כְּרֵיסֵיהּ לָא שָׁוֵי.
human_translation: Rav Yosef bar Ḥama, would seize the slaves of people who owed him money, and he would work them Rava, son of said to him: What is the reason that Master does this, said to him: I maintain in accordance with Rav Naḥman, as Rav Naḥman said: A slave is not worth the bread in his stomach.
llm_translation: Rav Yosef bar Ḥama was strict with the people who collect money for charity, and he would make them work. Rava said to his son: Why does our master act in this way? He said to him: I, like Rav Naḥman, hold the opinion, as Rav Naḥman said: A collector who is not strict with himself is not fit.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֵימוֹר דְּאָמַר רַב נַחְמָן כְּגוֹן דָּארוּ עַבְדֵּיהּ דִּמְרַקֵּיד בֵּי כוּבֵי, עַבְדֵי אַחֲרִינֵי מִי אָמַר? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֲנָא, כִּי הָא דְּרַב דָּנִיאֵל בַּר רַב קַטִּינָא אָמַר רַב סְבִירָא לִי. דְּאָמַר: הַתּוֹקֵף עַבְדּוֹ שֶׁל חֲבֵירוֹ וְעָשָׂה בּוֹ מְלָאכָה – פָּטוּר.
human_translation: said to him: I will say that Rav Naḥman said such as his slave Dari, who dances among barrels [ khuvei ] Did he say other slaves? said to him: I maintain in accordance with this Rav Daniel bar Rav Ketina Rav says, as he says: One who seizes another’s slave and has him perform labor is exempt
llm_translation: He said to him: Say that which Rav Nachman said, for example, that if his slave was dancing in the streets of Kubya, who is responsible for the actions of other slaves? He said to him: I, for as Rav Daniyel bar Rav Katina said, Rav Savyira agrees with me. For he said: One who hires his fellow's slave and has him do work - he is exempt.

hebrew_text: דְּנִיחָא לֵיהּ דְּלָא נִסְתְּרֵי עַבְדֵּיהּ.
human_translation: as satisfactory for that his slave not be undone.
llm_translation: It is preferable for him that his servants not be hidden.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָנֵי מִילֵּי הֵיכָא דְּלָא מַסֵּיק בֵּיהּ זוּזֵי. מָר כֵּיוָן דְּמַסֵּיק בְּהוּ זוּזֵי מִחֲזֵי כְּרִבִּית. דְּאָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף בַּר מִנְיוֹמֵי אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאָמְרוּ הַדָּר בַּחֲצַר חֲבֵירוֹ שֶׁלֹּא מִדַּעְתּוֹ אֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ לְהַעֲלוֹת לוֹ שָׂכָר. הִלְוָהוּ וְדָר בַּחֲצֵירוֹ צָרִיךְ לְהַעֲלוֹת לוֹ שָׂכָר. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הֲדַרִי בִּי.
human_translation: said to him: This statement when is not owed money since the Master is owed money by has appearance of interest, as Rav Yosef bar Minyumi says Rav Naḥman says: Even though said one who resides in another’s courtyard without his knowledge does not have to pay him rent, he lent and resides in his courtyard, must pay him rent. bar Ḥama said to him: I retract
llm_translation: He said to him: These matters, where one does not involve him with money. Master, once he involves him with money, he sees like a ribit. For Rav Yosef bar Minyomei said in the name of Rav Nachman: Even though they said one who dwells in his friend's courtyard without his knowledge does not need to pay him rent, if he borrowed from him and dwells in his courtyard, he must pay him rent. He said to him: You have returned to me.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: הַאי מַאן דְּמַסֵּיק זוּזֵי דְרִיבִּיתָא בְּחַבְרֵיהּ וְקָא אָזְלִי חִטֵּי אַרְבְּעָה גְּרִיוֵי בְּזוּזָא בְּשׁוּקָא, וְיָהֵיב לֵיהּ אִיהוּ חַמְשָׁה, כִּי מַפְּקִינַן מִינֵּיהּ – אַרְבְּעָה מַפְּקִינַן מִינֵּיהּ. אִידַּךְ – אוֹזוֹלֵי הוּא דְּקָא מוֹזֵיל גַּבֵּיהּ. רָבָא אָמַר: חַמְשָׁה מַפְּקִינַן מִינֵּיהּ, דְּמֵעִיקָּרָא בְּתוֹרַת רִיבִּיתָא אֲתַאי לִידֵיהּ.
human_translation: Abaye said: this one, who was owed a dinar of interest by another, and wheat was going four se’a [ gerivei ] for a dinar in the market, and gave five when we, remove from we remove four from the other, is a discount he granted him, Rava said: We take five from him, as initially came into his possession in the form of interest,
llm_translation: Abaye said: This person who collects interest from his companions and goes to buy wheat in the market for four zuz in a zuz, and he gives him five, when they take from him - they take four from him. Alternatively - he is the one who is causing his own loss. Rava said: They take five from him, as originally he came to him with the Torah of interest.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר אַבָּיֵי: הַאי מַאן דְּמַסֵּיק אַרְבְּעָה זוּזֵי דְרִיבִּיתָא בְּחַבְרֵיהּ וְיָהֵיב לֵיהּ גְּלִימָא בְּגַוַּיְיהוּ, כִּי מַפְּקִינַן מִינֵּיהּ – אַרְבְּעָה מַפְּקִינַן מִינֵּיהּ, גְּלִימָא לָא מַפְּקִינַן מִינֵּיהּ. רָבָא אָמַר: גְּלִימָא מַפְּקִינַן מִינֵּיהּ. מַאי טַעְמָא, כִּי הֵיכִי דְּלָא לֵימְרוּ: גְּלִימָא דִּמְכַסֵּי וְקָאֵי – גְּלִימָא דְרִיבִּיתָא הוּא.
human_translation: And Abaye said: this one, who was owed four dinars of interest by another, and gave him a cloak for it, when we take from we take four from him, but we do not take the cloak from him, Rava said: We take the cloak from him. What is the reason So that should not say the cloak is wearing is a cloak interest.
llm_translation: And Abaye said: One who lends four zuz of interest to his fellow and gives him a cloak as security, when they collect from him - they collect four zuz from him, but the cloak they do not collect from him. Rava said: The cloak they do collect from him. What is the reason? So that people should not say: The cloak that is hidden and standing - it is the cloak of interest.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: הַאי מַאן דְּמַסֵּיק תְּרֵיסַר זוּזֵי דְּרִיבִּיתָא בְּחַבְרֵיהּ וְאֹגַר לֵיהּ חָצֵר דְּמִתַּגְרָא בְּעַשְׂרָה וְאוֹגְרַיהּ נִהֲלֵיהּ בִּתְרֵיסַר, כִּי מַפְּקִינַן מִינֵּיהּ – תְּרֵיסַר מַפְּקִינַן מִינֵּיהּ.
human_translation: Rava said: this one, who was owed twelve dinars of interest by another, and rented a courtyard from generally rented for ten but he rented to him to twelve When we take from we take twelve from him
llm_translation: Rava said: This one who collects twelve zuz of interest from his companions and stores it in a courtyard that is disputed by ten, and he collects it in twelve, when they collect from him - they collect twelve from him.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אַחָא מִדִּפְתִּי לְרָבִינָא: וְלֵימָא לֵיהּ, כִּי (אַגְרָא) [אֲגַרִי] הָכִי – דַּהֲוָה קָא מִשְׁתָּרְשִׁי לִי, הַשְׁתָּא דְּלָא מִשְׁתָּרְשִׁי לִי – כִּדְאָגְרִי כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא הוּא דְּאָגַרְנָא, מִשּׁוּם דַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ: סְבַרְתְּ וְקַבֵּלְתְּ.
human_translation: Rav Aḥa of Difti said to Ravina: But let say when I rented it from you I profited from it now that I am not profiting, I rent it as everyone else rents, as we say to him: You considered and accepted it
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Acha, from Difti to Ravina: And let him say to him, "For thus is the wage - when it was being determined for me, now that it is not being determined for me - like a wage of the whole world that I am receiving, because he said to him: You have thought and accepted."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ מַרְבִּין עַל הַשָּׂכָר וְאֵין מַרְבִּין עַל הַמֶּכֶר. כֵּיצַד? הִשְׂכִּיר לוֹ אֶת חֲצֵרוֹ, וְאָמַר לוֹ: ״אִם מֵעַכְשָׁיו אַתָּה נוֹתֵן לִי – הֲרֵי הוּא לְךָ בְּעֶשֶׂר סְלָעִים לַשָּׁנָה, וְאִם שֶׁל חוֹדֶשׁ בַּחוֹדֶשׁ – סֶלַע לַחוֹדֶשׁ״, מוּתָּר. מָכַר לוֹ אֶת שָׂדֵהוּ, וְאָמַר לוֹ: ״אִם מֵעַכְשָׁיו אַתָּה נוֹתֵן לִי – הֲרֵי הִיא שֶׁלְּךָ בְּאֶלֶף זוּז, אִם לַגּוֹרֶן – בִּשְׁנֵים עָשָׂר מָנֶה״, אָסוּר.
human_translation: One may increase rent but one may not increase a sale. How so? rented his courtyard to and said to If you give me now, is yours for ten sela a year, but if on a monthly a sela for month, permitted, sold his field to and said to him: If you give me now, it is yours for one thousand dinars, if at the harvest, for twelve hundred prohibited
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One may increase the rent for a lease, but one may not increase the price for a sale. How so? If one rented his courtyard to another and said to him: "If you pay me from now on, it is yours for ten sela per year, and if you pay monthly – a sela per month," it is permitted. If one sold his field to another and said to him: "If you pay me from now on, it is yours for a thousand zuz, if for the winepress – for twelve mana," it is prohibited.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאי שְׁנָא רֵישָׁא וּמַאי שְׁנָא סֵיפָא? רַבָּה וְרַב יוֹסֵף דְּאָמְרִי תַּרְוַיְיהוּ: שְׂכִירוּת אֵינָהּ מִשְׁתַּלֶּמֶת אֶלָּא בַּסּוֹף, וְהַאי כֵּיוָן דְּלָא מְטָא זִמְנֵיהּ לְמִיגְבֵּא – לָאו אֲגַר נְטַר לֵיהּ, מִשְׁווֹא הוּא דְּהָכִי שָׁוְיָא, וְהַאי דְּקָאָמַר לֵיהּ ״אִם מֵעַכְשָׁיו אַתָּה נוֹתֵן לִי הֲרֵי הוּא לְךָ בְּעֶשֶׂר סְלָעִים לְשָׁנָה״ – אוֹזוֹלֵי הוּא דְּקָא מוֹזֵיל גַּבֵּיהּ.
human_translation: What is different the first clause and what is different the latter clause? Rabba and Rav Yosef both say: to pay a rental only at the end and this since its time to be claimed had not arrived not payment for waiting. This is the value it is worth, and that which he says to him: If you give me now it is yours for ten sela a year, is a discount that he offers him
llm_translation: Talmudic text: What is the difference between the beginning and the end? Rabba and Rav Yosef both say: Rental does not take effect except at the end, and this is the reason: if his time does not come to collect – he is not a paid guardian for him, for it is equal to this, and this one who says to him, "If you give me from now, here are ten rocks for you for a year" – he is removing his back.

hebrew_text: סֵיפָא: כֵּיוָן דִּזְבִינֵי נִינְהוּ וּבָעֵי לְמִשְׁקַל דְּמֵי מֵעַכְשָׁיו, הִלְכָּךְ אֲגַר נְטַר לֵיהּ הוּא, וְאָסוּר. אָמַר רָבָא: דָּקוּ בַּהּ רַבָּנַן בְּהָא מִילְּתָא וְאוֹקְמוּהָ אַקְּרָא: ״כִּשְׂכִיר שָׁנָה בְּשָׁנָה״, שְׂכִירוּת שֶׁל שָׁנָה זוֹ אֵינָהּ מִשְׁתַּלֶּמֶת אֶלָּא בְּשָׁנָה אַחֶרֶת.
human_translation: the latter clause, since it is a sale, and wants take money from now, therefore payment for waiting, and forbidden. Rava said: The Sages examined this matter closely and established from the verse “Like a hired laborer, year by year” to pay the rental of this year is only in the following year.
llm_translation: End: Since they are merchants and they want to weigh the price immediately, therefore, he is hired to watch over it, and it is prohibited. Rava said: The Rabbis were meticulous in this matter and established the verse: "Like a hired worker year by year," (Leviticus 25:53) indicating that the hiring of this year does not take effect except in the following year.

hebrew_text: וְאִם לַגּוֹרֶן בִּשְׁנֵים עָשָׂר מָנֶה – אָסוּר. אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: טַרְשָׁא שְׁרֵי.
human_translation: But if at the harvest, for twelve hundred prohibited. Rav Naḥman said: Tacit interest [ tarsha ] permitted.
llm_translation: If to the threshing floor with twelve mana - forbidden. Rav Nachman said: "Tarsha is permitted."

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ רָמֵי בַּר חָמָא לְרַב נַחְמָן, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ רַב עוּקְבָא בַּר חָמָא לְרַב נַחְמָן: וְאִם לַגּוֹרֶן בִּשְׁנֵים עָשָׂר מָנֶה – אָסוּר! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָתָם – קַץ לֵיהּ, הָכָא – לָא קַץ לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rami bar Ḥama raised an objection to Rav Naḥman, and some say Rav Ukva bar Ḥama to Rav Naḥman: But if at the harvest, for twelve hundred prohibited. said to him: There, he fixed for him here, he did not fix for him
llm_translation: He raised an objection to Rav Nachman: Ramai Bar Chama objected to Rav Nachman, and some say that Rav Ukva Bar Chama objected to Rav Nachman: "And if one were to thresh grain with twelve Maneh - it is forbidden!" He said to him: There - he has a limit, here - he does not have a limit.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: טַרְשָׁא דִּידִי שְׁרֵי, מַאי טַעְמָא – שִׁכְרַאי לָא פָּסֵיד, זוּזֵי לָא צְרִיכְנָא, אֲנָא הוּא דְּקָא עָבֵידְנָא מִילְּתָא גַּבֵּי לוֹקֵחַ.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: My tacit interest permitted. What is the reason My liquor would not be lost and I do not need money it is I who am performing matter for the customer,
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: "My pitcher is permitted, what is the reason? - The beer is not spoiled, the coins are not needed, I am the one who is doing the matter regarding the buyer."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב שֵׁשֶׁת בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אִידִי לְרַב פָּפָּא: מַאי חָזֵי מָר דְּקָא אָזְלַתְּ בָּתַר דִּידָךְ? זִיל בָּתַר דִּידְהוּ, דְּאִילּוּ הֲווֹ לְהוּ זוּזֵי – הֲווֹ שָׁקְלִי כִּי הַשְׁתָּא, הַשְׁתָּא דְּלֵית לְהוּ זוּזֵי – שָׁקְלִי כְּיוּקְרָא דִּלְקַמֵּיהּ!
human_translation: Rav Sheshet, son of Rav Idi, said to Rav Pappa: What does the Master see to follow yourself, follow their as, if they had money they would buy at current now that they have no money they buy in accordance with the future, expensive
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Sheshet son of Rav Idi said to Rav Papa: What does the master see that you are going after our daughter? Go after their daughter, for if they had money - they would have taken it now, now that they have no money - take it as a precious thing before them!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חָמָא: טַרְשָׁא דִּידִי וַדַּאי שְׁרֵי.
human_translation: Rav Ḥama said: My tacit interest certainly permitted.
llm_translation: Rav Hama said: "My trencher and certainly permissible."

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא – נִיחָא לְהוּ דְּלֵיקוּ בִּרְשׁוּתִי, דְּכֹל הֵיכָא דְּקָא אָזְלִי – שָׁבְקִי לְהוּ מִכְסָא (וּנְקוּט) [וְנָקְטִי] לְהוּ שׁוּקָא.
