human_translation: What is the reason convenient for them established in my domain, as anywhere that they go, leave them alone taxes and maintain the market for
llm_translation: "What is the reason? - It is preferable for them to be lit in my domain, for wherever they go - I leave them a chair (and) I take a market."

hebrew_text: וְהִלְכְתָא כְּרַב חָמָא, וְהִלְכְתָא כְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר, וְהִלְכְתָא כְּרַבִּי יַנַּאי, דְּאָמַר: מָה לִי הֵן וּמָה לִי דְּמֵיהֶן.
human_translation: And the halakha in accordance with Rav Ḥama, And the halakha in accordance with Rabbi Elazar, And the halakha in accordance with Rabbi Yannai, who says: What to me and what to me value?
llm_translation: The halakha follows Rav Hama, and the halakha follows Rabbi Elazar, and the halakha follows Rabbi Yannai, for he said: "What do I have to do with them and what do I have to do with their money."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ מָכַר לוֹ אֶת הַשָּׂדֶה, וְנָתַן לוֹ מִקְצָת דָּמִים, וְאָמַר לוֹ: אֵימָתַי שֶׁתִּרְצֶה הָבֵא מָעוֹת וְטוֹל אֶת שֶׁלְּךָ – אָסוּר. הִלְוָהוּ עַל שָׂדֵהוּ, וְאָמַר לוֹ: אִם אִי אַתָּה נוֹתֵן לִי מִכָּאן וְעַד שָׁלֹשׁ שָׁנִים – הֲרֵי הִיא שֶׁלִּי, הֲרֵי הִיא שֶׁלּוֹ. וְכָךְ הָיָה בַּיְתוֹס בֶּן זוֹנִין עוֹשֶׂה עַל פִּי חֲכָמִים.
human_translation: sold a field and gave him some of money, and said to him: Whenever you wish, bring money and take your prohibited. lent to on field and said to him: If you do not give me from now until three years is mine, is his. And this is what Baitos ben Zunin would do, with the consent of the Sages,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: If one sells a field to another and gives him some of the money, and says to him: "When the buyer wants, bring the money and take what is yours," it is prohibited. If one lends money on his field, and says to him: "If you do not give me the money from now until three years have passed, it is mine; if you do, it is his." And so did Baytos ben Zonin act according to the ruling of the sages.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מִי אוֹכֵל פֵּירוֹת? רַב הוּנָא אָמַר: מוֹכֵר אוֹכֵל פֵּירוֹת. רַב עָנָן אָמַר: מְשַׁלְּשִׁין אֶת הַפֵּירוֹת. וְלָא פְּלִיגִי. הָא דְּאָמַר: לְכִי מַיְיתֵית קְנִי. הָא דְּאָמַר: לְכִי מַיְיתֵית קְנִי מֵעַכְשָׁיו.
human_translation: who enjoys the profits Rav Huna says: seller enjoys the profits Rav Anan says: they deposit the profits with a third party And do not disagree. This one where says: When you bring acquire that one where he says When you bring acquire from now.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Who eats the fruits? Rav Huna said: A seller eats the fruits. Rav Anan said: They divide the fruits. And they do not disagree. As it was said: "Go, buy a vessel." As it was said: "Go, buy a vessel from now."

hebrew_text: תָּנֵי רַב סָפְרָא בְּרִבִּית דְּבֵי רַבִּי חִיָּיא: פְּעָמִים שֶׁשְּׁנֵיהֶם מוּתָּרִין, פְּעָמִים שֶׁשְּׁנֵיהֶם אֲסוּרִין, וּפְעָמִים שֶׁהַמּוֹכֵר מוּתָּר וְלוֹקֵחַ אָסוּר, וּפְעָמִים שֶׁהַלּוֹקֵחַ מוּתָּר וּמוֹכֵר אָסוּר.
human_translation: Rav Safra taught interest of the school of Rabbi Ḥiyya: Sometimes they are both permitted sometimes they are both prohibited And sometimes permitted for the seller but prohibited for the buyer and sometimes permitted for the buyer and prohibited for the seller
llm_translation: It was taught by Rav Safra in the study hall of Rabbi Chiya: Sometimes both of them are permitted, sometimes both of them are forbidden, and sometimes the seller is permitted while the buyer is forbidden, and sometimes the buyer is permitted while the seller is forbidden.

hebrew_text: עָנֵי רָבָא בָּתְרֵיהּ: פְּעָמִים שֶׁשְּׁנֵיהֶם מוּתָּרִין, דְּאָמַר לֵיהּ: קְנִי כְּשִׁיעוּר זוּזָךְ. פְּעָמִים שֶׁשְּׁנֵיהֶם אֲסוּרִין, דְּאָמַר לֵיהּ: לְכִי מַיְיתֵית קְנִי מֵעַכְשָׁיו.
human_translation: Rava answered after him, Sometimes they are both permitted if said to him: Acquire in accordance with the measure of your money, Sometimes they are both prohibited if said to him: When you bring acquire from now,
llm_translation: The poor of Rava inquired of his son: Sometimes both of them are permitted, for he said to him: Acquire according to the value of your coin. Sometimes both of them are forbidden, for he said to him: Go and acquire from now.

hebrew_text: פְּעָמִים מוֹכֵר מוּתָּר וְלוֹקֵחַ אָסוּר, דְּאָמַר לֵיהּ: לְכִי מַיְיתֵית קְנִי. פְּעָמִים שֶׁהַלּוֹקֵחַ מוּתָּר וּמוֹכֵר אָסוּר, דְּאָמַר לֵיהּ: קְנִי מֵעַכְשָׁיו וְזוּזַאי לִהְווֹ הַלְוָאָה גַּבָּךְ.
human_translation: Sometimes the seller is permitted and the buyer prohibited if said to him: When you bring acquire And sometimes the buyer is permitted and the seller prohibited if said to him: Acquire from now, will be a loan your
llm_translation: Times seller permitted and buyer forbidden, for said to him: go bring acquire. Times that buyer permitted and seller forbidden, for said to him: acquire from now and money will be a loan on you.

hebrew_text: מַאן תָּנָא שְׁנֵיהֶם אֲסוּרִין? אָמַר רַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ, דְּלָא כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה. דְּאִי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה, הָאָמַר: צַד אֶחָד בְּרִבִּית – מוּתָּר.
human_translation: Who taught they are both prohibited Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, says not in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda. As, if Rabbi Yehuda, doesn’t say uncertain interest is permitted?
llm_translation: Who is the Tanna that both are forbidden? Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said: Not like Rabbi Yehuda. For if it were Rabbi Yehuda, he said: If one side is in a corner - it is permitted.

hebrew_text: מִשְׁכֵּן לוֹ בַּיִת, מִשְׁכֵּן לוֹ שָׂדֶה, וְאָמַר לוֹ: ״לִכְשֶׁתִּרְצֶה לְמוֹכְרָם – לֹא תִּמְכְּרֵם אֶלָּא לִי בַּדָּמִים הַלָּלוּ״ – אָסוּר. ״בְּשׇׁוְיֵיהֶן״ – מוּתָּר.
human_translation: pledged a house to pledged a field to him and said to When you want to sell sell them only to me for this monetary prohibited, according to their value permitted.
llm_translation: Tabernacle for him house, tabernacle for him field, and said to him: "When you want to sell them - do not sell them except to me with this money" - forbidden. "At their value" - permitted.

hebrew_text: מַאן תַּנָּא ״בַּדָּמִים הַלָּלוּ״ אָסוּר? אָמַר רַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: דְּלָא כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, דְּאִי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה, הָאָמַר: צַד אֶחָד בְּרִבִּית – מוּתָּר.
human_translation: Who taught for this monetary prohibited? Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said not in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda. As, if Rabbi Yehuda, doesn’t say uncertain interest is permitted?
llm_translation: Who taught "These bloods" are prohibited? Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said: Not like Rabbi Yehuda, for if it were like Rabbi Yehuda, who said: "One side in a ribit transaction - permitted."

hebrew_text: מָכַר לוֹ בַּיִת, מָכַר לוֹ שָׂדֶה, וְאָמַר לוֹ: ״לִכְשֶׁיִּהְיוּ לִי מָעוֹת הַחְזִירֵם לִי״ – אָסוּר. ״לִכְשֶׁיִּהְיוּ לְךָ מָעוֹת אַחֲזִירֵם לָךְ״ – מוּתָּר. מַאן תַּנָּא? אָמַר רַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: דְּלָא כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה. דְּאִי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה, הָאָמַר צַד אֶחָד בְּרִבִּית – מוּתָּר.
human_translation: sold a house sold him a field, and said to When I have money, give back to me prohibited, When you have money I will return to you, permitted. Who taught Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said not in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda. As, if Rabbi Yehuda, doesn’t say uncertain interest is permitted?
llm_translation: He sold him a house, he sold him a field, and he said to him: "When my money returns to me, give it back to me" - prohibited. "When your money returns to you, I will give it back to you" - permitted. Who is the Tanna? Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said: Not like Rabbi Yehuda. For if it were Rabbi Yehuda, he said, "One side with interest" - permitted.

hebrew_text: מַאי שְׁנָא רֵישָׁא וּמַאי שְׁנָא סֵיפָא? אָמַר רָבָא: רֵישָׁא – דְּלָא אֲמַר לֵיהּ מִדַּעְתֵּיהּ. סֵיפָא – דְּאָמַר לֵיהּ מִדַּעְתֵּיהּ.
human_translation: What is different the first clause and what is different the latter clause? Rava says: The first clause where did not tell of own accord, the latter clause, where said of his own accord.
llm_translation: What is the difference between the beginning and the end? Rava said: The beginning - where he did not say it willingly. The end - where he said it willingly.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא גַּבְרָא דְּזַבֵּין לֵיהּ אַרְעָא לְחַבְרֵיהּ שֶׁלֹּא בְּאַחְרָיוּת, חַזְיֵיהּ דַּהֲוָה (קָא) עֲצִיב. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אַמַּאי עֲצִיבַתְּ? אִי טָרְפוּ לַהּ מִינָּךְ, מַגְבֵּינָא לָךְ שׁוּפְרָא, שְׁבָחָא, וּפֵירֵי.
human_translation: a certain man who sold land to another without a guarantee He observed that was distressed, said to Why are you distressed? If seizes from you, I will pay you best-quality improvement and produce
llm_translation: That man who was selling land to his friends not properly, he saw that he was sad. He said to him: Why are you sad? If they have taken from you your due, I will restore to you the horn, the shofar, and the fruits.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַמֵּימָר:
human_translation: Ameimar said:
llm_translation: Said Amemar:

hebrew_text: פַּטּוֹמֵי מִילֵּי בְּעָלְמָא הוּא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אָשֵׁי לְאַמֵּימָר: טַעְמָא מַאי – כֵּיוָן דְּלוֹקֵחַ בָּעֵי לְאַתְנוֹיֵי, וְהָכָא מוֹכֵר קָא מַתְנֵי, אָמְרַתְּ פַּטּוֹמֵי מִילֵּי בְּעָלְמָא הוּא.
human_translation: These are merely words of enticement [ pittumei millei ] Rav Ashi said to Ameimar: What is the reason Since the buyer needs to stipulate and here the seller who stipulated you said these are merely words of enticement?
llm_translation: The hidden meaning of words is it. Rav Ashe said to Ameimar: What is the reason? Since one who buys wants to acquire, and here one is selling, you say, "The hidden meaning of words is it."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מַתְנִיתָא דְּקָתָנֵי: ״לִכְשֶׁיִּהְיוּ לְךָ מָעוֹת אַחְזִיר לָךְ – מוּתָּר״, דְּמוֹכֵר הוּא דְּבָעֵי לְאַתְנוֹיֵי, מוֹכֵר לָא אַתְנִי וְלוֹקֵחַ קָא מַתְנֵי.
human_translation: But the baraita , as it teaches When you have money I will give back to you, permitted. it is the seller who needs to stipulate seller did not stipulate and the buyer stipulated
llm_translation: Rather, the Mishnah teaches: "When you have coins, return them to you - permissible," for it is a seller who wants to acquire, if he sells, he does not acquire, and the buyer acquires.

hebrew_text: וְאָמְרִינַן: מַאי שְׁנָא רֵישָׁא וּמַאי שְׁנָא סֵיפָא? וְאָמַר רָבָא: סֵיפָא, דַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ מִדַּעְתֵּיהּ. טַעְמָא דַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ מִדַּעְתֵּיהּ, הָא לָא אֲמַר לֵיהּ מִדַּעְתֵּיהּ – לָא אָמְרִינַן פַּטּוֹמֵי מִילֵּי בְּעָלְמָא הוּא.
human_translation: And we said What is different the first clause and what is different the latter clause? And Rava says the latter clause where said of his own accord. reason said to him of his own accord. But if he did not say to him of his own accord, we not say these are merely words of enticement,
llm_translation: And we say: What is the difference between the beginning and the end? And Rava said: The end, for he said it willingly. The reason he said it willingly, if he did not say it willingly - we do not say vague words in general.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: נַעֲשֶׂה כְּמַאן דַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ מִדַּעְתֵּיהּ אִתְּמַר.
human_translation: said to him: was stated considered like one who said of his own accord.
llm_translation: He said to him: Let it be done as the one who said to him, it was said from his knowledge.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא שְׁכִיב מְרַע, דִּכְתַב לַהּ גִּיטָּא לִדְבֵיתְהוּ, אִנְּגִיד וְאִתְּנַח. אֲמַרָה לֵיהּ: אַמַּאי קָא מִתְּנַחַתְּ? אִי קָיְימַתְּ – דִּידָךְ אֲנָא. אָמַר רַב זְבִיד: פַּטּוֹמֵי מִילֵּי בְּעָלְמָא הוּא.
human_translation: a certain person on his deathbed who wrote a bill of divorce for his wife he moaned and sighed She said to him: Why do you sigh? If you recover I am yours, Rav Zevid said: These are merely words of enticement
llm_translation: That one who is lying ill, who wrote a bill of divorce for his wife, "I will tell and I will give." She said to him: "Why are you giving it?" If you are alive - I am yours. Rav Zevid said: These are just empty words in the world.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אַחָא מִדִּפְתִּי לְרָבִינָא: וְאִי לָאו פַּטּוֹמֵי מִילֵּי מַאי? בְּדִידַהּ קָיְימָא לְמִישְׁדֵּי תְּנָאָה בְּגִיטָּא? בְּדִידֵיהּ קָיְימָא לְמִשְׁדֵּי תְּנָאָה! מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: הוּא גּוּפֵיהּ אַדַּעְתָּא דִידַהּ קָא גָמֵיר וְיָהֵיב גִּיטָּא – קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: Rav Aḥa of Difti said to Ravina: And if they were not words of enticement, what her to stipulate a condition bill of divorce? his to establish a condition, lest you say he himself relied upon her decided give her the bill of divorce, teaches us
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Acha, from the city of Difti, to Ravina: "And if not, the sealed matters, what is it? Is it standing for the fulfillment of the condition in a bill of divorce? It is standing for the fulfillment of the condition in a bill of divorce! What might you say: He himself knows that he is fulfilling the condition and giving the bill of divorce - this is evident to us."

hebrew_text: הִלְוָהוּ עַל שָׂדֵהוּ, אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: בִּשְׁעַת מַתַּן מָעוֹת – קָנָה הַכֹּל. לְאַחַר מַתַּן מָעוֹת – לֹא קָנָה אֶלָּא כְּנֶגֶד מְעוֹתָיו. וְרַב נַחְמָן אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ לְאַחַר מַתַּן מָעוֹת – קָנָה הַכֹּל.
human_translation: lent to on his field Rav Huna says: at the time of the giving of the money, he has acquired it all, after the giving of the money, he has acquired only corresponding to the money he And Rav Naḥman says: Even after the giving of the money, he has acquired it all.
llm_translation: Borrowed upon his field, said Rav Huna: at the time of giving money - acquires everything. After giving money - acquires only corresponding to his money. And Rav Nachman said: even after giving money - acquires everything.

hebrew_text: עֲבַד רַב נַחְמָן עוֹבָדָא גַּבֵּי רֵישׁ גָּלוּתָא כִּשְׁמַעְתֵּיהּ, קַרְעֵיהּ רַב יְהוּדָה לִשְׁטָרֵיהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רֵישׁ גָּלוּתָא: רַב יְהוּדָה קְרַע לִשְׁטָרָךְ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: דַּרְדְּקָא קַרְעֵיהּ? גַּבְרָא רַבָּה קַרְעֵיהּ, חֲזָא בֵּיהּ טַעְמָא וְקַרְעֵיהּ!
human_translation: Rav Naḥman performed an action in the court of the Exilarch in accordance with his statement Rav Yehuda, tore up deed The Exilarch said Rav Yehuda tore up your document, said to him: a child tear it up? A great man tore it up; seen in it reason and tore it up.
llm_translation: Rav Nachman performed a service in front of the head of the exile. When the head of the exile heard it, Rav Yehuda tore up his document. The head of the exile said to him, "Rav Yehuda, tear up your document." He said to him, "Did a great man tear it up? He saw a reason in it and tore it up!"

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְאָמְרִי, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: דַּרְדְּקָא קַרְעֵיהּ, דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לְגַבֵּי דִּידִי בְּדִינָא דַּרְדְּקֵי נִינְהוּ.
human_translation: There are who say said to him: A child tore it up, as everyone is a child relative to me with regard to laws.
llm_translation: There are some who say, he said to him: his cloak tore, all the people in the world on my judgment his cloak tore they are.

hebrew_text: הֲדַר אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: אֲפִילּוּ בִּשְׁעַת מַתַּן מָעוֹת – לֹא קָנָה וְלֹא כְּלוּם. אֵיתִיבֵיהּ רָבָא לְרַב נַחְמָן: אִם אִי אַתָּה נוֹתֵן לִי מִכָּאן וְעַד שָׁלֹשׁ שָׁנִים, הֲרֵי הִיא שֶׁלִּי – הֲרֵי הִיא שֶׁלּוֹ!
human_translation: Rav Naḥman then said Even at the time of the giving of the money, he has not acquired anything. Rava raised an objection to Rav Naḥman If you do not give me from now until three years is mine, is his.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: Hadr amar Rav Nachman: afilu bish'at matan ma'ot - lo kana v'lo kelum. Eitveih Rava l'Rav Nachman: im ita naten li mikahn v'ad shalosh shanim, harei hi sheli - harei hi shelo! English translation: Rav Nachman further stated: even at the time of giving money - he did not acquire and nothing. Rava raised an objection to Rav Nachman: if you do not give it to me from now until three years, it is mine - it is his!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֲנִי אוֹמֵר אַסְמַכְתָּא קָנְיָא. וּמִנְיוֹמֵי אָמַר: אַסְמַכְתָּא לָא קָנְיָא.
human_translation: said to him: I say a transaction with inconclusive consent [ asmakhta ] effects acquisition, But Minyumi said an asmakhta does not effect acquisition,
llm_translation: He said to him: I say, "A support is acquired." And from his words he said: "A support is not acquired."

hebrew_text: וּלְמִנְיוֹמֵי קַשְׁיָא מַתְנִיתִין! אִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא מַתְנִיתִין רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הִיא, דְּאָמַר אַסְמַכְתָּא קָנְיָא.
human_translation: But the mishna difficult according to Minyumi. If you wish, say the mishna is Rabbi Yosei, who said an asmakhta effects acquisition,
llm_translation: And regarding the Minyomi of Kashya, Mishnaic teachings! If you wish, say that it is the Mishna of Rabbi Yosei, as he said: "A support is an acquisition."

hebrew_text: אִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: דַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ קְנִי מֵעַכְשָׁיו.
human_translation: If you wish, say where said to acquire from now,
llm_translation: If you ask, say: for he said to him, "Buy from now."

hebrew_text: אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ מָר יָנוֹקָא וּמָר קַשִּׁישָׁא בְּנֵי דְּרַב חִסְדָּא לְרַב אָשֵׁי, הָכִי אָמְרִי נְהַרְדְּעָאֵי מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב נַחְמָן: הַאי אַסְמַכְתָּא, בְּזִמְנֵיהּ קָנְיָא, בְּלָא זִמְנֵיהּ לָא קָנְיָא.
human_translation: Mar Yanuka and Mar Kashisha, sons of Rav Ḥisda, said to Rav Ashi: This of Neharde’a say in the name of Rav Naḥman: this asmakhta effects acquisition at its time, does not effect acquisition not at its time.
llm_translation: They said to him, Master Yanuka and Master Kashisha, the sons of Rav Hisda, to Rav Ashe: Thus said the Nehardeans in the name of Rav Nachman: This support, in its time is effective, but not in its time is not effective.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לְהוּ: כֹּל מִידֵּי, בְּזִמְנֵיהּ קָנֵי, בְּלָא זִמְנֵיהּ לָא קָנֵי.
human_translation: said to them: every matter: effects acquisition at its time, does not effect acquisition not at its time.
llm_translation: He said to them: Everything by way, in its time acquires; without its time does not acquire.

hebrew_text: דִּלְמָא הָכִי קָאָמְרִיתוּ: אַשְׁכְּחֵיהּ בְּגוֹ זִמְנֵיהּ וַאֲמַר לֵיהּ קְנִי – קָנֵי, בָּתַר זִמְנֵיהּ וַאֲמַר לֵיהּ קְנִי – לָא קָנֵי. מַאי טַעְמָא – מֵחֲמַת כִּיסּוּפָא הוּא דְּקָאָמַר לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Perhaps you say this: encountered within its time, and told him acquire acquires after its time, and told acquire not acquire What is the reason says to out of shame
llm_translation: Perhaps this is what they were saying: He found it during its designated time and said to him, "Acquire it - you acquire it." After its designated time, he said to him, "You do not acquire it." What is the reason? It is due to the uncertainty he expressed to him.

hebrew_text: וְלָא הִיא, דַּאֲפִילּוּ בְּגוֹ זִמְנֵיהּ נָמֵי לָא קָנֵי, וְהַאי דְּקָאָמַר לֵיהּ ״קְנִי״ – קָא סָבַר: כִּי מָטֵי זִמְנֵיהּ, לָא לַיְתֵי לִיטְרְדַן.
human_translation: But not so, as does not acquire even within its time. And that told him acquire he thinks: when the time arrives, he will not come and disturb me.
llm_translation: And not this, for even in its proper time it does not acquire, and this that he said to him "acquire" - he thought: when its time arrives, it will not come to be rejected.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: הַאי אַסְמַכְתָּא, זִימְנִין קָנְיָא וְזִימְנִין לָא קָנְיָא. אַשְׁכְּחֵיהּ דְּקָא שָׁתֵי שִׁכְרָא – קָנֵי. דְּקָא מְהַפֵּךְ אַזּוּזֵי – לָא קָנֵי.
human_translation: Rav Pappa says: this asmakhta , sometimes effects acquisition and sometimes does not effect acquisition. encountered while was drinking beer, effects acquisition, was searching for money not effect acquisition,
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: This support, sometimes it acquires and sometimes it does not acquire. If he was found drinking beer - he acquires. If he was turning coins - he does not acquire.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אַחָא מִדִּפְתִּי לְרָבִינָא: דִּלְמָא לְפַכּוֹחֵי פַּחְדֵּיהּ קָא שָׁתֵי, אִי נָמֵי: אִינִישׁ אַחֲרִינָא אַסְמְכֵיהּ אַזּוּזֵי! אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבִינָא: אִי קָפֵיד בִּדְמֵי – וַדַּאי קָנֵי.
human_translation: Rav Aḥa of Difti said to Ravina: perhaps he was drinking to neutralize his fear, Or, someone else promised him money, Rather, Ravina said If is particular about money, has certainly acquired
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Acha, from Difti to Ravina: Perhaps he is drinking to strengthen his fears, or else: Another person will support him with coins! Rather, Ravina said: If he is particular about the value - then he certainly acquires.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אַחָא מִדִּפְתִּי לְרָבִינָא: דִּלְמָא סָבַר כִּי הֵיכִי דְּלָא תִּיתְּזִיל אַרְעֵיהּ, אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: אִי קָפֵיד בְּאַרְעָא, וַדַּאי קָנֵי.
human_translation: Rav Aḥa of Difti said to Ravina: perhaps thinks in order that the of his lands not be lowered. Rather, Rav Pappa said If he is particular about land certainly acquires
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Acha, from Difti to Ravina: Perhaps he thinks that in this way his land will not deteriorate, but Rav Papa said: If one is careful with his land, he will certainly acquire it.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: אַף עַל גַּב דַּאֲמוּר רַבָּנַן אַסְמַכְתָּא לָא קָנְיָא, אַפּוֹתֵיקֵי הָוְיָא לְמִיגְבֵּא מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: And Rav Pappa said: Even though the Sages said an asmakhta does not effect acquisition, is designated repayment [ apoteiki ] for to collect from it
llm_translation: And Rav Papa said: Even though the Rabbis said that a support does not acquire, the rings are considered part of it.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב נָתָן לְרַב פָּפָּא: מִי קָאָמַר לֵיהּ קְנִי לְגוּבְיָינָא? אֲמַר לֵיהּ מָר זוּטְרָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב מָרִי לְרָבִינָא: וְאִי אָמַר קְנִי לְמִיגְבֵּא מִינֵּיהּ – קָנֵי? סוֹף סוֹף אַסְמַכְתָּא הִיא, וְאַסְמַכְתָּא לָא קָנְיָא.
human_translation: Rav Huna, son of Rav Natan, said to Rav Pappa: Did say to Acquire for collection? Mar Zutra, son of Rav Mari, said to Ravina: And if he said to him: Acquire for collection, acquire Ultimately, it is an asmakhta , an asmakhta does not effect acquisition.
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Huna son of Rav Nathan said to Rav Papa: Who said to you to acquire for Gubya? He said to him, Mar Zutra son of Rav Mari said to Ravina: And if he said to acquire for Migbe from him - he acquires? Ultimately, it is a support, and a support is not an acquisition.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אַפּוֹתֵיקֵי דְּאָמַר רַב פָּפָּא, מַאי הִיא: דַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ לֹא יְהֵא לְךָ פֵּרָעוֹן אֶלָּא מִזּוֹ.
human_translation: But what is designated repayment spoken Rav Pappa? where said to you will receive payment only from this
llm_translation: Rather, the oven of which Rav Papa said, what is it? That he said to him, "You shall have no authority except from this."

hebrew_text: הָהוּא גַּבְרָא דְּזַבֵּין לֵיהּ אַרְעָא לְחַבְרֵיהּ בְּאַחְרָיוּת. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִי טָרְפוּ לַיהּ מִנַּאי מַגְבֵּית לִי מֵעִידֵּי עִידִּית דְּאִית לָךְ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מֵעִידֵּי עִידִּית לָא מַגְבֵּינָא לָךְ, דְּבָעֵינָא לְמֵיקַם קַמַּאי, אֶלָּא מַגְבֵּינָא לָךְ מֵעִידִּית אַחֲרִיתִ[י] דְּאִית לִי. לְסוֹף טַרְפוּהָ מִינֵּיהּ, אֲתָא בִּדְקָא שְׁקֵיל לְעִידֵּי עִידִּית.
human_translation: a certain man who sold land to another with guarantee, said to him: If seize from me, you me to collect from superior quality of superior-quality that you have? said to him: I will not you to collect from superior quality of superior-quality as I want to keep before me. But I will you to collect from other superior-quality I have. Ultimately, seized from a flood came and flooded superior quality of superior-quality
llm_translation: That man who sold his field to his friends with a condition. He said to him: If it becomes invalid in your possession, bring me witnesses that you have. He said to him: I will not bring you witnesses that I have, because I need to establish myself first, but I will bring you witnesses of another one that I have. In the end, it became invalid in his possession, he came with a sack and took witnesses of another one that he had.

hebrew_text: סְבַר רַב פָּפָּא לְמֵימַר: מֵעִידִּית אֲמַר לֵיהּ, וְהָא קָיְימָא.
human_translation: Rav Pappa thought to say: said to from superior-quality and intact,
llm_translation: Rav Papa thought to say: "From the witness he said to him, and the matter stands."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אַחָא מִדִּפְתִּי לְרָבִינָא: וְלֵימָא לֵיהּ, כִּי אֲמַרִי לָךְ אֲנָא מַגְבֵּינָא לָךְ – דַּהֲוָה עִידֵּי עִידִּית קָיְימָא, הַשְׁתָּא קָיְימָא לֵיהּ עִידִּית בִּמְקוֹם עִידֵּי עִידִּית.
human_translation: Rav Aḥa of Difti said to Ravina: But let say to When I said to you I you to collect when the superior quality intact. now superior-quality stands in place of the superior quality of superior-quality
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Acha, from Difti to Ravina: And let him say to him, "When I tell you, I am clarifying for you" - for it was testimony of testimony established, now testimony is established for him in the place of testimony.

hebrew_text: רַב בַּר שְׁבָא הֲוָה מַסֵּיק בֵּיהּ רַב כָּהֲנָא זוּזֵי. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִי לָא פָּרַעְנָא לָךְ לְיוֹם פְּלוֹנִי – גְּבִי מֵהַאי חַמְרָא. סְבַר רַב פָּפָּא לְמֵימַר: כִּי אָמְרִינַן אַסְמַכְתָּא לָא קָנְיָא – הָנֵי מִילֵּי בְּאַרְעָא, דְּלָאו לְזַבּוֹנֵי קָיְימָא. אֲבָל חַמְרָא כֵּיוָן דִּלְזַבּוֹנֵי קָאֵי – כְּזוּזֵי דָּמֵי.
human_translation: Rav bar Shabba owed money to Rav Kahana. said to him: If I do not repay you by such and such a date, collect from this wine. Rav Pappa thought to say: When we said an asmakhta does not effect acquisition, this matter to land, which does not stand to be sold, But wine, since it does stand to be sold, it is like money,
llm_translation: Rav bar Sheva was concluding with Rav Kahana for a fee. He said to him: If I have not paid you by a certain day - take from this wine. Rav Papa thought to say: When we say "a leaning is not an acquisition" - that is regarding matters in the land, which are not standing for the buyers. But wine, since it is standing for the buyers - it is considered as money.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ לְרַב פָּפָּא, הָכִי אָמְרִינַן מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַבָּה: כֹּל דְּאִי – לָא קָנֵי.
human_translation: Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said to Rav Pappa: This we say in the name of Rabba: Any If, not effect acquistion.
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Huna son of Rav Yehoshua said to Rav Papa, thus we say in the name of Rabba: "Anything that is not acquired."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: הַשְׁתָּא דַּאֲמוּר רַבָּנַן אַסְמַכְתָּא לָא קָנְיָא, הָדְרָא אַרְעָא וְהָדְרִי פֵּירֵי. לְמֵימְרָא דְּסָבַר רַב נַחְמָן מְחִילָה בְּטָעוּת לָא הָוְיָא מְחִילָה?
human_translation: Rav Naḥman said: Now that the Sages have said an asmakhta does not effect acquisition, the land must be returned and produce must be returned. to say that Rav Naḥman maintains that mistaken forgiveness is not forgiveness,
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said: This year, when the Sages said "an asmachta does not acquire," the land was here, and the fruits were here. By saying that Rav Nachman holds that a mistake does not constitute a valid acquisition?

hebrew_text: וְהָאִיתְּמַר: הַמּוֹכֵר פֵּירוֹת דֶּקֶל לַחֲבֵירוֹ. אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: עַד שֶׁלֹּא בָּאוּ לָעוֹלָם – יָכוֹל לַחְזוֹר בּוֹ. מִשֶּׁבָּאוּ לָעוֹלָם – אֵין יָכוֹל לַחְזוֹר בּוֹ. וְרַב נַחְמָן אָמַר: אַף מִשֶּׁבָּאוּ לָעוֹלָם יָכוֹל לַחְזוֹר בּוֹ,
human_translation: But it was stated If one sells the fruit of a palm tree to another Rav Huna says: He can retract until have come into the world, once they have come into the world, he cannot retract, And Rav Naḥman says: He can retract even once they have come into the world,
llm_translation: The Gemara: One who sells dates from a palm tree to his fellow. Rav Huna said: Until they have not come into the world - he can retract. Once they have come into the world - he cannot retract. And Rav Nachman said: Even once they have come into the world, he can retract.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: מוֹדֵינָא דְּאִי שָׁמֵיט וְאָכֵיל – לָא מַפְּקִינַן מִינֵּיהּ! הָתָם זְבִינֵי, הָכָא הַלְוָאָה.
human_translation: And Rav Naḥman said: I concede that if seized and consumed we do not take from him. There, a sale, Here, a loan,
llm_translation: And Rav Nachman said: The halacha is that if one releases his debt and eats the produce - we do not remove from him! There it is selling, here it is lending.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא:
human_translation: Rava said:
llm_translation: Rava said:

hebrew_text: הֲוָה יָתֵיבְנָא קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב נַחְמָן, וּבְעַי לְאוֹתֹבֵיהּ אוֹנָאָה, וְאוֹדֵיק, חֲזִיתַן אַיְילוֹנִית. וַהֲרֵי אוֹנָאָה דִּמְחִילָה בְּטָעוּת הִיא, וְלָא הָוְיָא מְחִילָה! וְאוֹדֵיק, חֲזִיתַן אַיְילוֹנִית: הֲרֵי אַיְילוֹנִית דִּמְחִילָה בְּטָעוּת הִיא, וְהָוְיָא מְחִילָה.
human_translation: I was sitting before Rav Naḥman and I wanted to raise an objection to him exploitation, and he observed and showed me a sexually underdeveloped woman [ ailonit ]. But exploitation, which is mistaken forgiveness and it is not forgiveness. And he observed showed me an ailonit . Doesn’t an ailonit mistaken forgiveness, and it is forgiveness?
llm_translation: We were sitting before Rav Nachman, and he wanted to show us a certain type of tree, and he pointed and said, "Behold the terebinth tree." And behold, the terebinth tree is inherently crooked, and it does not straighten! And he pointed and said, "Behold the palm tree." Behold, the palm tree is inherently straight, and it straightens.

hebrew_text: דִּתְנַן: הַמְמָאֶנֶת וְהַשְּׁנִיָּיה וְהָאַיְילוֹנִית, אֵין לָהֶן לֹא כְּתוּבָּה וְלֹא פֵּירוֹת וְלֹא מְזוֹנוֹת וְלֹא בְּלָאוֹת.
human_translation: As we learned who refuses a secondary relative, and an ailonit , is not entitled to a marriage contract, and not produce and not sustenance, and not worn clothes
llm_translation: We learned in a Mishnah: The Mema'enet, the Shniyyah, and the Aylonit, they have neither a written document, nor fruits, nor sustenance, nor clothing.

hebrew_text: וְלָא הִיא: לָא אוֹנָאָה הָוְיָא תְּיוּבְתֵּיהּ, וְלָא אַיְילוֹנִית מְסַיַּיע לֵיהּ.
human_translation: But not so; exploitation is not a refutation of nor a sexually underdeveloped woman support his
llm_translation: And not it is: not Ona'ah was its excess, and not Aylonit was assisting it.

hebrew_text: לָא אוֹנָאָה תְּיוּבְתֵּיהּ: דְּלָא יָדַע דְּאִיתֵיהּ אוֹנָאָה דְּמָחֵיל גַּבֵּיהּ. וְלָא אַיְילוֹנִית מְסַיַּיע לֵיהּ, דְּנִיחָא לַהּ (דְּתִיפּוֹק) [דְּנִיפּוֹק] עֲלַהּ שְׁמָא דְאִישׁוּת.
human_translation: Exploitation is not a refutation of his as does not know that there is exploitation that forgive him Nor a sexually underdeveloped woman support his as it is amenable to her that she receive the name of a married
llm_translation: Not oppression its benefit: for not knowing that there is oppression that weakens him. And not a tree that assists him, for it is preferable for him (to go out) lest the name of independence come out.

hebrew_text: הָהִיא אִיתְּתָא דַּאֲמַרָה לֵיהּ לְהָהוּא גַּבְרָא: זִיל זְבֵין לִי אַרְעָא מִקָּרִיבַיי. אֲזַל זְבַן לַהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִי הָווּ לִי זוּזֵי מַהְדְּרַתְּ לַהּ נִיהֲלִי? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אַתְּ וְנַוְולָא אַחֵי.
human_translation: a certain woman who said to a certain man: Go purchase for me from my relatives. He went purchased for her. said to If I will have money will you give back to me? said to him: You and she [ venavla ] are relatives,
llm_translation: That woman said to that man: "Go buy me land from my relatives." He went and bought it for her. He said to her: "If I had money, would I have returned it to you?" She said to him: "You and the money are my brothers."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר רַב הוּנָא: כֹּל ״אַתְּ וְנַוְולָא אַחֵי״ (אָמַר) סָמְכָא דַּעְתֵּיהּ, וְלָא גָּמַר וּמַקְנֵי.
human_translation: Rabba bar Rav Huna said: any You and she are relatives, says, relies and he does not conclusively enable acquire
llm_translation: Rabba bar Rav Huna said: "All 'you and your brothers' (he said) he relied on his opinion, and did not conclude and acquire."

hebrew_text: אַרְעָא הָדְרָה, פֵּירֵי מַאי? רִבִּית קְצוּצָה הָווּ וְיוֹצְאִין בְּדַיָּינִין, אוֹ דִילְמָא כִּי אֲבַק רִבִּית הָווּ וְאֵין יוֹצְאִין?
human_translation: the land must be returned what produce it fixed interest, and can be removed by judges? Or perhaps like a hint of interest, and cannot be removed
llm_translation: Field, its fruit? Interest cut were and go out with judges, or perhaps like dust interest were and not go out?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר רַב הוּנָא: מִסְתַּבְּרָא כִּי אֲבַק רִבִּית הָווּ, וְאֵין יוֹצְאִין בְּדַיָּינִין. וְכֵן אָמַר רָבָא: כִּי אֲבַק רִבִּית הָווּ, וְאֵין יוֹצְאִין בְּדַיָּינִין.
human_translation: Rabba bar Rav Huna said: It stands to reason it is like a hint of interest, and cannot be removed by judges. And Rava similarly said: It is like a hint of interest, and cannot be removed by judges.
llm_translation: Rabba bar Rav Huna said: It appears as though they were dusting off interest, yet they do not fulfill their obligations. And so Rava said: It appears as though they were dusting off interest, yet they do not fulfill their obligations.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי לְרַבָּה: מַשְׁכַּנְתָּא, מַאי? הָתָם טַעְמָא מַאי – מִשּׁוּם דְּלָא קַץ לֵיהּ, הָכָא נָמֵי לָא קַץ לֵיהּ. אוֹ דִילְמָא הָתָם זְבִינֵי, הָכָא הַלְוָאָה?
human_translation: Abaye said to Rava: a mortgage, what There, what is the reason because did not fix for Here too, did not fix for Or perhaps there, a sale, here, a loan,
llm_translation: Abaye said to Rava: "Mashkanta, what is it?" There, what is the reason? - Because it did not satisfy him. Here too, it did not satisfy him. Or perhaps there it was a purchase, here it is a loan?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָתָם טַעְמָא מַאי – מִשּׁוּם דְּלָא קַץ לֵיהּ, הָכָא נָמֵי לָא קַץ לֵיהּ.
human_translation: said to him: There, what is the reason because did not fix for Here too, did not fix for
llm_translation: He said to him: There, what is the reason? - Because he did not cut it off. Here too, he did not cut it off.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פַּפִּי: עֲבַד רָבִינָא עוֹבָדָא, וְחַשֵּׁיב וְאַפֵּיק פֵּירֵי, דְּלָא כְּרַבָּה בַּר רַב הוּנָא.
human_translation: Rav Pappi said: Ravina performed an action and he calculated and removed produce was not in accordance with Rabba bar Rav Huna.
llm_translation: Rav Pappi said: Ravina did a deed, and he considered it and produced fruits, unlike Rabba bar Rav Huna.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יוֹסֵף מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרָבָא: הָא מַשְׁכַּנְתָּא בְּאַתְרָא דִּמְסַלְּקִי, אֲכַל שִׁיעוּר זוּזֵי – מְסַלְּקִינַן לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Mar, son of Rav Yosef, said in the name of Rava: this mortgage, In a place where removes consumed a measure money we remove him
llm_translation: Master, son of Rav Yosef, said in the name of Rava: "If the Shechinah is in the place where they are removing, we remove it with the value of a zuz."

hebrew_text: אֲכַל טְפֵי – לָא מַפְּקִינַן מִינֵּיהּ, וְלָא מְחַשְּׁבִינַן מִשְּׁטָרָא לִשְׁטָרָא.
human_translation: consumed more we do not remove from him, And we do not calculate from one document to another.
llm_translation: "Eat the crumbs - we do not remove from it, and we do not calculate from one line to another."

hebrew_text: וּבִדְיַתְמֵי אֲכַל שִׁיעוּר זוּזֵי, מְסַלְּקִינַן לֵיהּ. אֲכַל טְפֵי – מַפְּקִינַן מִינֵּיהּ, וּמְחַשְּׁבִינַן מִשְּׁטָרָא לִשְׁטָרָא.
human_translation: And to orphans, consumed a measure money we remove him he consumed more we take from him; and we calculate from one document to another.
llm_translation: And in Deyatmei, if he ate a shiur of zuzim, we remove it from him. If he ate less, we remove it from him, and we calculate from one market to another.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: הַשְׁתָּא דְּאָמְרַתְּ אֲכַל טְפֵי – לָא מַפְּקִינַן מִינֵּיהּ. אֲכַל שִׁיעוּר זוּזֵי נָמֵי – לָא מְסַלְּקִינַן לֵיהּ בְּלָא זוּזֵי, מַאי טַעְמָא: סַלּוֹקֵי בְּלָא זוּזֵי – אַפּוֹקֵי מִינֵּיהּ הוּא. הָוֵי אֲבַק רִבִּית, וַאֲבַק רִבִּית אֵינָהּ יוֹצְאָה בְּדַיָּינִין.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: Now that you have said he consumed more we do not take from him, he consumed a measure money we also do not remove him without money. What is the reason To remove him without money is like taking from him, this is a hint of interest, a hint of interest cannot be removed by judges.
llm_translation: Rav Ashe said: The case where you said "eating a small amount" - we do not remove it from him. Eating a specific amount of money also - we do not remove it from him without the money. What is the reason? Removing it without the money - he will remove it from him. It should be like interest, and interest does not go out with the judges.

hebrew_text: עֲבַד רַב אָשֵׁי עוֹבָדָא בִּיתוֹמִים קְטַנִּים
human_translation: Rav Ashi performed an action involving minor orphans,
llm_translation: Servant Rav Ashi work orphan small

hebrew_text: כִּגְדוֹלִים,
human_translation: as adults.
llm_translation: Like the great ones,

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יוֹסֵף מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרָבָא: הַאי מַשְׁכַּנְתָּא, בְּאַתְרָא דִּמְסַלְּקִי – לָא נֵיכוֹל אֶלָּא בְּנַכְיְיתָא. וְצוּרְבָּא מִדְּרַבָּנַן – אֲפִילּוּ בְּנַכְיְיתָא לָא נֵיכוֹל. אֶלָּא בְּמַאי נֵיכוֹל? בְּקִיצּוּתָא.
human_translation: Rava, son of Rav Yosef, says in the name of Rava: this mortgage, In a place where removes may consume only with a deduction And a Torah scholar [ tzurva miderabbanan ], may not consume even with a deduction But in what may he consume the By a fixed
llm_translation: Rava, son of Rav Yosef, said in the name of Rava: This tabernacle, in the place where it is removed – can only be eaten with bread. And tzurba from the sages – even with bread it cannot be eaten. So with what can it be eaten? With dried figs.

hebrew_text: הָנִיחָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר קִיצּוּתָא שַׁרְיָא, אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר קִיצּוּתָא אֲסִירָא, מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר? דְּאִתְּמַר: קִיצּוּתָא, פְּלִיגָא בַּהּ רַב אַחָא וְרָבִינָא. חַד אָמַר: קִיצּוּתָא שַׁרְיָא, וְחַד אָמַר: קִיצּוּתָא אֲסִירָא. הֵיכִי דָּמֵי קִיצּוּתָא? דְּאָמַר לֵיהּ: עַד חֲמֵשׁ שְׁנִין אָכֵילְנָא לַהּ בְּלָא נַכְיְיתָא, מִכָּאן וְאֵילָךְ שָׁיֵימְנָא לָךְ כּוּלְּהוּ פֵּירֵי.
human_translation: This works out well according to the one who says a fixed is permitted, but according to the one who says a fixed is forbidden, what is there to say? As it was stated: With regard to a fixed Rav Aḥa and Ravina disagreed: One said a fixed is permitted, and one said a fixed is forbidden. What are the circumstances fixed where says to up to five years, I will consume without a deduction from that forward I will appraise for you all produce
llm_translation: The one who says that cutting is permitted, what can he say? For it was stated: Cutting, Rav Acha and Ravina disagree about it. One said: Cutting is permitted, and one said: Cutting is forbidden. What is the case of cutting? He said to him: For five years I ate it without cutting, from now on all its fruits are permitted to you.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְאָמְרִי: כֹּל בְּלָא נַכְיְיתָא – אָסוּר, אֲבָל הֵיכִי דָּמֵי קִיצּוּתָא – דְּאָמַר לֵיהּ: עַד חֲמֵשׁ שְׁנִין אָכֵילְנָא בְּנַכְיְיתָא, מִכָּאן וְאֵילָךְ שָׁיֵימְנָא לָךְ כּוּלְּהוּ פֵּירֵי.
human_translation: There are who say Any without a deduction prohibited And what are the circumstances fixed When says to up to five years I will consume with deduction from this forward I will appraise for you all produce
llm_translation: There are those who say: anything without a pit - forbidden, but how is it similar to the end? - for he said to him: until five years we eat with a pit, from here on we will provide you with all the fruits.

hebrew_text: מַאן דְּאָסַר בְּקַמַּיְיתָא שָׁרֵי בְּבָתְרַיְיתָא, מַאן דְּאָסַר בְּבָתְרַיְיתָא, הֵיכִי שְׁרֵי לְמֵיכַל? שְׁרֵי כִּי מַשְׁכַּנְתָּא דְסוּרָא, דְּכָתְבִי בַּהּ הָכִי: בְּמִשְׁלָם שְׁנַיָּא אִילֵּין תִּיפּוֹק אַרְעָא דָּא בְּלָא כְּסַף.
human_translation: The one who prohibits to the first permits in the second. the one who prohibits the second how is it permitted to consume It is permitted like a mortgage Sura, in which this is written Upon the completion of these years, this land shall leave without money
llm_translation: One who forbids in the beginning may permit in the end; one who permits in the end, how may he permit to eat? He may permit like the Mishkan of Surah, as it is written about it: "With the payment of two lambs you shall redeem the land without silver."

hebrew_text: רַב פָּפָּא וְרַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אָמְרִי תַּרְוַיְיהוּ: הַאי מַשְׁכַּנְתָּא, בְּאַתְרָא דִּמְסַלְּקִי – אֵין בַּעַל חוֹב גּוֹבֶה הֵימֶנָּה, וְאֵין הַבְּכוֹר נוֹטֵל בָּהּ פִּי שְׁנַיִם, וּשְׁבִיעִית מְשַׁמַּטְתָּהּ.
human_translation: Rav Pappa and Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, both say: this mortgage, In a place where removes creditor cannot collect by it; and firstborn does not receive a double portion of it and the Sabbatical cancels
llm_translation: Rav Papa and Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, both said: In a place where they remove the Mishkan, the creditor does not collect from it, the firstborn does not take a double portion from it, and the seventh year releases it.

hebrew_text: וּבְאַתְרָא דְּלָא מְסַלְּקִי – בַּעַל חוֹב גּוֹבֶה הֵימֶנָּה וּבְכוֹר נוֹטֵל בָּהּ פִּי שְׁנַיִם, וְאֵין שְׁבִיעִית מְשַׁמַּטְתָּהּ.
human_translation: But in a place where they do not remove a creditor can collect by it, and firstborn receives a double portion of it, and the Sabbatical does not cancel
llm_translation: In the case where they do not separate - the creditor collects it, and the firstborn takes two-thirds of it, and the seventh year does not release it.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר מָר זוּטְרָא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב פָּפָּא: הַאי מַשְׁכַּנְתָּא, בְּאַתְרָא דִּמְסַלְּקִי – מְסַלְּקִי לֵיהּ וַאֲפִילּוּ מִתַּמְרֵי דְּאַבּוּדְיָא. וְאִי אַגְבְּהִנְהוּ בְּסִיסָנֵי, קְנָנְהוּ. וּלְמַאן דְּאָמַר כִּלְיוֹ שֶׁל לוֹקֵחַ בִּרְשׁוּת מוֹכֵר קָנָה לוֹקֵחַ – אֲפִילּוּ דְּלָא אַגְבְּהִנְהוּ בְּסִיסָנֵי, קְנָנְהוּ.
human_translation: And Mar Zutra said in the name of Rav Pappa: this mortgage, In a place where removes they remove him even from dates the mats. But if he has lifted them in the baskets [ besisanei ], he has acquired them, And according to the one who says buyer’s vessels in the seller’s domain the buyer has acquired even if he did not lift them in the baskets, he acquired them
llm_translation: And Mar Zutra said in the name of Rav Papa: This dwelling, in a place where they remove - they remove it even from date palms of destruction. And if one redeems them with sycamore figs, he acquires them. And according to the one who says the vessel of the buyer in the possession of the seller acquires - even if he did not redeem them with sycamore figs, he acquires them.

hebrew_text: פְּשִׁיטָא: בְּאַתְרָא דִּמְסַלְּקִי וְאָמַר ״לָא מִסְתַּלַּקְנָא״ – הָא קָאָמַר דְּלָא מִסְתַּלַּקְנָא. אֶלָּא בְּאַתְרָא דְּלָא מְסַלְּקִי, וְאָמַר ״מִסְתַּלַּקְנָא״ – מַאי: צָרִיךְ לְמִיקְנֵא מִינֵּיהּ, אוֹ לָא?
human_translation: obvious in a place where they remove but said: I will not be removed, as he said that will not be removed, But in a place where they do not remove and he said: I will be removed what necessary to perform acquisition with him or not
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Pesheeta: be'atra de'misalkei ve'amar "la mistalakna" - ha ka'amar de'la mistalakna. Ella be'atra de'la misalkei, ve'amar "mistalakna" - mai: tzarich le'miknei mineih, o la? English translation: Conclusion: in the place where they depart and he said "he did not depart" - this means he did not depart. Rather, in the place where he did not depart, and he said "he departed" - what is the law: does he need to acquire it from him, or not?

hebrew_text: רַב פָּפָּא אָמַר: לָא צְרִיךְ לְמִקְנֵא מִינֵּיהּ. רַב שֵׁשֶׁת בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אִידִי אָמַר: צְרִיךְ לְמִקְנֵא מִינֵּיהּ. וְהִלְכְתָא: צְרִיךְ לְמִקְנֵא מִינֵּיהּ.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: It is not necessary to perform acquisition with him. Rav Sheshet, son of Rav Idi, said: It is necessary to perform acquisition with him. And the halakha it is necessary to perform acquisition with him.
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: It is not necessary to be jealous of him. Rav Sheshet, son of Rav Idi, said: It is necessary to be jealous of him. And the halakha is: It is necessary to be jealous of him.

hebrew_text: אָמַר: ״אֵיזִיל וְאַיְיתֵי זוּזֵי״ – לָא אָכֵיל. ״אֵיזִיל וְאֶטְרַח וְאַיְיתֵי זוּזֵי״, רָבִינָא אָמַר: אָכֵיל, וּמָר זוּטְרָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב מָרִי אָמַר: לָא אָכֵיל. וְהִלְכְתָא: לָא אָכֵיל.
human_translation: said I will go to get money may not consume I am going to make an effort to get money, Ravina said: may consume And Mar Zutra, son of Rav Mari, said: may not consume And the halakha may not consume
llm_translation: He said: "I will go and bring money" - he did not eat. "I will go, make an effort, and bring money," Rabinah said: he ate, but Mar Zutra, son of Rav Mari, said: he did not eat. And the halakha is: he did not eat.

hebrew_text: רַב כָּהֲנָא וְרַב פָּפָּא וְרַב אָשֵׁי לָא אָכְלִי בְּנַכְיְיתָא. רָבִינָא אָכֵיל בְּנַכְיְיתָא.
human_translation: Rav Kahana, and Rav Pappa, and Rav Ashi would not consume with a deduction Ravina would consume with a deduction
llm_translation: Rav Kahana and Rav Papa and Rav Ashe did not eat in the upper chamber. Ravina ate in the upper chamber.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר זוּטְרָא: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּמַאן דְּאָכֵיל בְּנַכְיְיתָא – מִידֵּי דְּהָוֵה אַשְּׂדֵה אֲחוּזָּה. שְׂדֵה אֲחוּזָּה, לָאו אַף עַל גַּב דְּקָא אָכֵיל פֵּירֵי טוּבָא, אָמַר רַחֲמָנָא
human_translation: Mar Zutra said: The explanation of the one who does consume with a deduction just as it is in of an ancestral field, an ancestral field, not even though he consumes abundant produce the Merciful One states
llm_translation: Master Zutra said: What is the reason that one who eats from a stolen animal – it is as if he is eating from a field that is seized. A seized field, even though he is eating its good fruits, the Merciful One has said.

hebrew_text: קָא פָרֵיק לַהּ בְּאַרְבְּעָה זוּזֵי, הָכָא נָמֵי לָא שְׁנָא.
human_translation: he redeems it at four dinars Here too, is no different.
llm_translation: He divided to her in four zuz, here it is not different.

hebrew_text: וּמַאן דְּאָסַר – אָמַר לָךְ: שְׂדֵה אֲחוּזָּה הֶקְדֵּשׁ הִיא, וְרַחֲמָנָא אוֹקְמֵיהּ אַפִּדְיוֹן. הָכָא – הַלְוָאָה הִיא וּמִיחֲזֵי כְּרִבִּית.
human_translation: And the one who prohibits said to you an ancestral field is consecrated property and the Merciful One established redemption for it, Here, a loan, and has the appearance of interest.
llm_translation: And one who forbids - he says to you: "It is a consecrated field of ancestral possession, and the Merciful One will redeem it." Here - it is a loan, and it appears as interest.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: אֲמַרוּ לִי סָבֵי דְּמָתָא מַחְסֵיָא: סְתַם מַשְׁכַּנְתָּא – שַׁתָּא. לְמַאי נָפְקָא מִינַּהּ? דְּאִי אָכֵיל לַהּ שַׁתָּא – מָצֵי מְסַלֵּק לֵיהּ, וְאִי לָא – לָא מָצֵי מְסַלֵּק לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: The elders of Mata Meḥasya told me: An unspecified mortgage [ mashkanta ] a year. What is the difference that if consumed its a year, can remove him; but if not, cannot remove him,
llm_translation: Rav Ashe said: The elders of the town of Machseya told me: A regular dwelling - half. What is the practical difference? If one eats half of it - he may remove it, and if not - he may not remove it.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: אֲמַרוּ לִי סָבֵי דְּמָתָא מַחְסֵיָא, מַאי ״מַשְׁכַּנְתָּא״ – דִּשְׁכוּנָה גַּבֵּיהּ. לְמַאי נָפְקָא מִינַּהּ? לְדִינָא דְּבַר מִצְרָא.
human_translation: And Rav Ashi said: The elders of Mata Meḥasya told me: What mashkanta ? that it resides [ shekhuna ] with him. What is the difference for the halakha of one borders
llm_translation: And Rav Ashe said: The elders of the town of Machseya told me, what is "mashkanta" - its dwelling place. What is derived from it? For the law of a guarantor.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: לֵית הִלְכְתָא לָא כְּטַרְשֵׁי פַּפּוּנָאֵי, וְלָא כִּשְׁטָרֵי מָחוֹזְנָאֵי, וְלָא כַּחֲכִירֵי נַרְשָׁאֵי.
human_translation: Rava said: halakha not in accordance with the tacit interest of Rav Pappa, nor in accordance with the documents of Meḥoza, nor in accordance with the tenancies of Neresh.
llm_translation: Rava said: There is no halakha like the trays of the Pappunaeans, nor like the documents of the tax collectors, nor like the agreements of the officials of Narseh.

hebrew_text: כְּטַרְשֵׁי פַּפּוּנָאֵי – כְּטַרְשֵׁי דְּרַב פָּפָּא.
human_translation: in accordance with the tacit interest of Rav Pappa; to the tacit interest of Rav Pappa
llm_translation: Like the baskets of the people of Pappunai - like the baskets of Rav Papa.

hebrew_text: שְׁטָרֵי מָחוֹזְנָאֵי – דְּזָקְפִי לֵיהּ לְרַוְוחָא אַקַּרְנָא, וְכָתְבִי לֵיהּ בִּשְׁטָרָא. מִי יֵימַר דְּהָוֵה רַוְוחָא?
human_translation: the documents of Meḥoza? they would add the profits to the principal, and they would write in the document. who says there will be profit?
llm_translation: Documents of merchants - if one lifts it to the wind and reads it, and writes it in a document. Who can say that it is wind?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ מָר בַּר אַמֵּימָר לְרַב אָשֵׁי: אַבָּא עָבֵיד הָכִי, וְכִי אָתוּ לְקַמֵּיהּ מְהֵימַן לְהוּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: תִּינַח הֵיכָא דְּאִיתֵיהּ לְדִידֵיהּ, אִי שָׁכֵיב וְנָפֵל שְׁטָרָא קַמֵּי יַתְמֵי, מַאי? הָוֵי ״כִּשְׁגָגָה שֶׁיֹּצָא מִלִּפְנֵי הַשַּׁלִּיט״ וְנָח נַפְשֵׁיהּ דְּאַמֵּימָר.
human_translation: Mar, son of Ameimar, said to Rav Ashi: Father would do so, and when they came before him he would believe them said to him: works out well while is here, if he dies and the document comes before the orphans, what was “like an error that proceeds from a ruler” and Ameimar died
llm_translation: He said to him, Master, son of Amemar, to Rav Ashe: Abba did so, and when they came before him, they trusted him. He said to him: Let it be placed where it is for us, if he lies down and the document falls before him, what is the law? It is considered "an unintentional act that issues from the ruler," and the soul of Amemar is at ease.

hebrew_text: חֲכִירֵי נַרְשָׁאֵי, דְּכָתְבִי הָכִי: מִשְׁכֵּן לֵיהּ פְּלָנְיָא אַרְעֵיהּ לִפְלָנְיָא, וַהֲדַר חַכְרַהּ מִינֵּיהּ. אֵימַת קְנָאָהּ דְּאַקְנְיַיהּ נִהֲלֵיהּ?
human_translation: the tenancies of Neresh? they would write in this So-and-so has mortgaged his land to so-and-so, and went and leased it back from him When did acquire it, transfer it to
llm_translation: The merchants of Narsei wrote thus: "A certain person's field adjoins the Tabernacle, and afterwards he sold it. When is the jealousy of the buyer effective to annul the sale?"

hebrew_text: וְהָאִידָּנָא דְּקָא כָתְבִי הָכִי: ״קְנֵינָא מִינֵּיהּ וּשְׁהֵינָא כַּמָּה עִידָּנֵי, וַהֲדַר חַכְרַהּ״, כְּדֵי שֶׁלֹּא תִּנְעוֹל דֶּלֶת בִּפְנֵי לוֹוִין – שַׁפִּיר דָּמֵי. וְלָאו מִלְּתָא הִיא.
human_translation: And nowadays, when we write in this We acquired from him and we waited a while and went and leased it back so as not to lock the door in the face of borrowers, permitted, But this is not correct,
llm_translation: The current case that they are writing thus: "We acquire from him and we assess how many witnesses, and then we investigate it," so that the door will not be locked in front of the claimants - it is proper. And this is not a matter of dispute.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אֵין מוֹשִׁיבִין חֶנְוָנִי לְמַחֲצִית שָׂכָר, וְלֹא יִתֵּן מָעוֹת לִיקַּח בָּהֶן פֵּירוֹת לְמַחֲצִית שָׂכָר, אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן נוֹתֵן לוֹ שְׂכָרוֹ כְּפוֹעֵל.
human_translation: One may not establish a storekeeper for half the profits. And one may not give money with which to acquire produce for half the profits. unless gives his wages as laborer
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One may not hire a sharecropper for half of the produce, nor may one give him money to purchase fruits for half of the produce. Rather, unless one gives him his full wage as is the custom.

hebrew_text: אֵין מוֹשִׁיבִין תַּרְנְגוֹלִין לְמֶחֱצָה, וְאֵין שָׁמִין עֲגָלִין וּסְיָיחִין לְמֶחֱצָה, אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן נוֹתֵן לוֹ שְׂכַר עֲמָלוֹ וּמְזוֹנוֹ.
human_translation: One may not place chickens for half and one may not appraise calves or foals for half unless gives wages for his toil and food
llm_translation: We do not place roosters halfway, and we do not listen to calves and talk halfway, unless one gives them their reward for their labor and sustenance.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל מְקַבְּלִין עֲגָלִין וּסְיָיחִין לְמֶחֱצָה, וּמְגַדְּלִין אוֹתָן עַד שֶׁיְּהוּ מְשׁוּלָּשִׁין. וַחֲמוֹר עַד שֶׁתְּהֵא טוֹעֶנֶת.
human_translation: But one may accept calves or foals for half and may raise them until they reach one-third And a donkey, until it is to bear a load.
llm_translation: But they accept calves and talk about them halfway, and they raise them until they are three years old. And a donkey until it carries.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנָא: כְּפוֹעֵל בָּטֵל. מַאי כְּפוֹעֵל בָּטֵל?
human_translation: taught: as an idle laborer. What as an idle laborer?
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Gemara: k'poel batel. Mai k'poel batel?" English translation: "Gemara: like a worker who is idle. What is meant by 'like a worker who is idle'?"

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: כְּפוֹעֵל בָּטֵל שֶׁל אוֹתָהּ מְלָאכָה דִּבְטַל מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: Abaye says: as a laborer idle from that labor from which he is idle.
llm_translation: Abaye said: Like the worker who is idle in that work, so is he idle from it.

hebrew_text: וּצְרִיכָא, דְּאִי תְּנָא חֶנְוָנִי: חֶנְוָנִי הוּא דְּסַגִּי לֵיהּ כְּפוֹעֵל בָּטֵל, מִשּׁוּם דְּלָא נְפִישׁ טִרְחֵיהּ. אֲבָל מָעוֹת לִיקַּח בָּהֶן פֵּירוֹת, דִּנְפִישׁ טִרְחֵיהּ – אֵימָא לָא סַגִּי לֵיהּ כְּפוֹעֵל בָּטֵל.
human_translation: And necessary As had he taught a storekeeper it is a storekeeper for whom it is enough as an idle laborer, because his toil is not great, But money with which to acquire produce, whose toil is great, I might say not sufficient for him as an idle laborer.
llm_translation: The matter requires, for if one teaches "Chenvani: Chenvani is one who engages in it like a worker who is idle, because his efforts are not great. But if he takes from them fruits, since his efforts are great - say, perhaps he does not engage in it like a worker who is idle.

hebrew_text: וְאִי תְּנָא מָעוֹת לִיקַּח בָּהֶן פֵּירוֹת – הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: הָתָם הוּא דְּבָעֵי כְּפוֹעֵל בָּטֵל, מִשּׁוּם דִּנְפִישׁ טִרְחֵיהּ. אֲבָל חֶנְוָנִי, דְּלָא נְפִישׁ טִרְחֵיהּ – אֵימָא סַגִּי לֵיהּ בְּמַשֶּׁהוּ בְּעָלְמָא, דַּאֲפִילּוּ לֹא טִבֵּל עִמּוֹ אֶלָּא בְּצִיר, וְלֹא אָכַל עִמּוֹ אֶלָּא גְּרוֹגֶרֶת אַחַת – זֶהוּ שְׂכָרוֹ, צְרִיכָא.
human_translation: And had taught money with which to acquire produce, I would say there that he requires as an idle laborer, because his toil is great, but a storekeeper, whose toil is not great, I would say any amount is enough for him; that, even if only immersed in brine with or only ate one dried fig with him, this is his wages, necessary
llm_translation: And if he stipulated to purchase with them produce - I would say: There, he requires like a worker who is nullified, because his efforts are great. But Chenvani, whose efforts are not great - I would say: it is sufficient for him with his own wage in the world, for even if he did not immerse with him except in a small amount, and did not eat with him except one dried fig - this is his reward, it is necessary.

hebrew_text: (כַּמָּה עִיזֵּי וְתַרְנְגוֹלִין מַעֲלִין סִימָן)
human_translation: How many goats, and chickens, we add; a mnemonic
llm_translation: As many goats and chickens ascend, a sign.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: כַּמָּה הוּא שְׂכָרוֹ? בֵּין מְרוּבֶּה וּבֵין מוּעָט, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אֲפִילּוּ לֹא טִבֵּל עִמּוֹ אֶלָּא בְּצִיר, וְלֹא אָכַל עִמּוֹ אֶלָּא גְּרוֹגֶרֶת אַחַת – זֶהוּ שְׂכָרוֹ. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹחַאי אוֹמֵר: נוֹתֵן לוֹ שְׂכָרוֹ מְשַׁלֵּם.
human_translation: The Sages taught How much is his wage? whether a lot or a little, the statement of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda says: Even if he only immersed in brine with him, or only ate one dried fig with him, this is his wage. Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai says: give him his full wage,
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: How much is his reward? Whether much or little, these are the words of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda says: Even if he only dipped with him in the olive press, and only ate with him one dried fig - this is his reward. Rabbi Shimon ben Yochai says: One who gives him his reward fulfills it.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אֵין שָׁמִין לֹא אֶת הָעִזִּים וְלֹא אֶת הָרְחֵלִים, וְלֹא כׇּל דָּבָר שֶׁאֵינוֹ עוֹשֶׂה וְאוֹכֵל לְמֶחֱצָה.
human_translation: The Sages taught: One may not appraise for half neither goats, nor sheep, nor anything that does not produce while it eats.
llm_translation: The sages taught: One does not hear neither the goats nor the ewes, and not any matter that does not both do and eat in halves.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: שָׁמִין אֶת הָעִזִּים מִפְּנֵי שֶׁחוֹלְבוֹת, וְאֶת הָרְחֵלִים מִפְּנֵי שֶׁגּוֹזְזוֹת וְשׁוֹטְפוֹת וּמוֹרְטוֹת, וְאֶת הַתַּרְנְגוֹלֶת מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהִיא עוֹשָׂה וְאוֹכֶלֶת.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says: One may appraise goats because they produce milk, and sheep because they are shorn and they washed and they are plucked And a chicken, because it produces while it eats.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says: We inspect the goats because of their udders, and the ewes because of their shearing, washing, and milking, and the hens because they lay eggs and eat.

hebrew_text: וְתַנָּא קַמָּא: גִּיזָּה וְחָלָב לָא סָפֵק שְׂכַר עֲמָלוֹ וּמְזוֹנוֹ? בְּגִיזָּה וְחָלָב – כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְּלִיגִי, כִּי פְלִיגִי בְּנַסְיוֹבֵי וְתוּתְרֵי.
human_translation: And the first tanna , shearing and milk do not provide of the wage for his toil and food? the sheared and milk, everyone agrees When they disagree, with regard to whey [ benasyovi ], and the pluckings [ vetoteri ]
llm_translation: And it was taught in the first Tanna: Wool and milk - there is no doubt that he receives wages for his labor and sustenance? In wool and milk - the entire world does not dispute, for they dispute in cases of spinning and weaving.

hebrew_text: תַּנָּא קַמָּא סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹחַי, דְּאָמַר: נוֹתֵן לוֹ שְׂכָרוֹ מִשָּׁלֵם. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה סָבַר לַהּ כַּאֲבוּהּ, דְּאָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ לֹא טִבֵּל עִמּוֹ אֶלָּא בְּצִיר, וְלֹא אָכַל עִמּוֹ אֶלָּא גְּרוֹגֶרֶת אַחַת – זֶהוּ שְׂכָרוֹ.
human_translation: The first tanna holds in accordance with Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai, who says he gives him his full wage. Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, holds in accordance with his father, who says even if he only immersed in brine with him, or only ate one dried fig with him, this is his wage,
llm_translation: We learned in the first teaching: One holds like Rabbi Shimon ben Yochai, who said: "He gives him his wage from the employer." Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, holds like his father, who said: "Even if he did not immerse with him except in a pool, and did not eat with him except one dried fig - this is his wage."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: מַשְׂכֶּרֶת אִשָּׁה לַחֲבֶרְתָּהּ תַּרְנְגוֹלֶת בִּשְׁנֵי אֶפְרוֹחִין. אִשָּׁה שֶׁאָמְרָה לַחֲבֶרְתָּהּ: ״תַּרְנְגוֹלֶת שֶׁלִּי וּבֵיצִים שֶׁלִּיכִי, וַאֲנִי וְאַתְּ נַחְלוֹק בָּאֶפְרוֹחִין״ – רַבִּי יְהוּדָה מַתִּיר, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹסֵר.
human_translation: The Sages taught: A woman may rent to another a chicken for two chicks a woman who said to another: chicken is mine and the eggs are yours, and you and I shall share the chicks, Rabbi Yehuda permits Rabbi Shimon prohibits
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: A woman's wage to her friend is a hen with two chicks. A woman who said to her friend: "My hen and your eggs, and we will divide the chicks" - Rabbi Yehuda permits, Rabbi Shimon prohibits.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה לָא בָּעֵי שְׂכַר עֲמָלוֹ וּמְזוֹנוֹ? אִיכָּא בֵּיצִים מוּזָרוֹת.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yehuda, not require the wage for the toil of and food? There are unfertilized eggs,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda does not require payment for his labor and sustenance? There are strange eggs.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: מָקוֹם שֶׁנָּהֲגוּ לְהַעֲלוֹת שְׂכַר כַּתָּף לְמָעוֹת לִבְהֵמָה – מַעֲלִין, וְאֵין מְשַׁנִּין מִמִּנְהַג הַמְּדִינָה. רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: שָׁמִין עֵגֶל עִם אִמּוֹ, וּסְיָח עִם אִמּוֹ, וַאֲפִילּוּ בִּמְקוֹם שֶׁנָּהֲגוּ לְהַעֲלוֹת שְׂכַר כַּתָּף לְמָעוֹת.
human_translation: The Sages taught: a place where are accustomed to add the wages a porter animal to the money must add and one may not deviate from the regional custom. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: One may appraise a calf with its mother and a foal with its mother and even in a place where they have the custom to add the wages a porter to the money
llm_translation: The Sages taught: In a place where it is customary to bring the shoulder of an animal as a gift to the priests, they may bring it, and they do not deviate from the local custom. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: One may fatten a calf with its mother, and one may pair it with its mother, even in a place where it is customary to bring the shoulder of an animal as a gift to the priests.

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל לָא בָּעֵי שְׂכַר עֲמָלוֹ וּמְזוֹנוֹ? אִיכָּא גְּלָלִים. וְאִידַּךְ: גְּלָלִים – אַפְקוֹרֵי מַפְקֵיר לְהוּ.
human_translation: But Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, not require the wage for the toil of and food? There is the dung, And the other he declares the dung ownerless,
llm_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel does not require payment for his labor and sustenance? There are pebbles. And the other opinion: pebbles - they are like abandoned produce.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, וַהֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, וַהֲלָכָה כְּרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman said: halakha in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda; and halakha in accordance with Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda; and halakha in accordance with Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel.
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said: The halakha is like Rabbi Yehudah, and the halakha is like Rabbi Yosei, the son of Rabbi Yehudah, and the halakha is like Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel.

hebrew_text: בְּנֵי רַב עִילִישׁ נְפַק עֲלַיְיהוּ הָהוּא שְׁטָרָא דַּהֲוָה כְּתִיב בֵּיהּ ״פַּלְגָא בַּאֲגַר, פַּלְגָא בְּהֶפְסֵד״. אָמַר רָבָא: רַב עִילִישׁ גַּבְרָא רַבָּה הוּא, וְאִיסּוּרָא לְאִינָשֵׁי לָא הָוֵי סָפֵי. מָה נַפְשָׁךְ? אִי פַּלְגָא בַּאֲגַר – תְּרֵי תִּילְתֵי בְּהֶפְסֵד,
human_translation: document emerged concerning the sons of Rav Ilish, in which it was written one-half of the profit and one-half of the loss. Rava said: Rav Ilish was a great man, and he would not feed people with forbidden. no matter what, If one-half of the profit, two-thirds of the loss,
llm_translation: Sons of Rav Eilish went out with him that document that was written in it "half in profit, half in loss." Rava said: Rav Eilish is a great man, and a prohibition to people is not sufficient. What is your opinion? If "half in profit" - two thirds in loss.

hebrew_text: אִי פַּלְגָא בְּהֶפְסֵד – תְּרֵי תִּילְתֵי בַּאֲגַר.
human_translation: or one-half of the loss two-thirds of the profit.
llm_translation: If Pelega in loss - two thirds in reward.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב כָּהֲנָא: אַמְרִיתָא לִשְׁמַעְתָּא קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב זְבִיד מִנְּהַרְדְּעָא, וַאֲמַר לִי: דִּלְמָא רַב עִילִישׁ טוֹבֵל עִמּוֹ בְּצִיר הֲוָה. וְאָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָאו הִלְכְתָא אִיתְּמַר, אֶלָּא שִׁיטָה אִיתְּמַר.
human_translation: Rav Kahana said: I said this halakha before Rav Zevid of Neharde’a and he said to me: Perhaps Rav Ilish immersed in brine together with and Rav Naḥman says: halakha in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda. said to It was not stated halakha but rather it was stated opinion
llm_translation: Rav Kahana said: A certain teaching was heard before Rav Zevid from Nehardea, and he said to me: Perhaps Rav Illesh was immersing with him in the courtyard. And Rav Nachman said: The halakha is according to Rabbi Yehudah! He said to him: It is not a halakha that was stated, but rather a specific opinion was stated.

hebrew_text: הָכִי נָמֵי מִסְתַּבְּרָא, דְּאִי לָא תֵּימָא הָכִי – לְמָה לֵיהּ לְמִיחְשַׁב וּלְמֵימַר הֲלָכָה הֲלָכָה? לֵימָא הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, דְּמֵיקֵל מִכּוּלְּהוּ.
human_translation: This too stands to reason, as, if you do not say so, why did list and say: halakha halakha let say halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda, the most lenient of all of them,
llm_translation: Thus it is fitting to explain, for if you do not say so - why should he think and say "halakha halakha"? Let him say "halakha" like Rabbi Yehuda, who is lenient in all cases.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב: מוֹתַר שְׁלִישׁ בִּשְׂכָרְךָ – הֲרֵי זֶה מוּתָּר. וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: לֹא מָצָא מוֹתַר שְׁלִישׁ, יֵלֵךְ לְבֵיתוֹ רֵיקָן! אֶלָּא אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: קוֹצֵץ לוֹ דִּינָר.
human_translation: Rav says: the surplus one-third is your wages, this is permitted, And Shmuel says: there is no surplus one-third he goes home empty-handed, Rather, Shmuel says: set aside a dinar for
llm_translation: Rav said: "If a third of the produce is left in your possession, it is permitted." And Shmuel said: "If one does not find a third left, let him go home empty-handed!" Rather, Shmuel said: "Cut him a dinar."

hebrew_text: וְסָבַר רַב אֵין קוֹצְצִין לוֹ דִּינָר? וְהָאָמַר רַב: רֵישׁ עִגְלָא לְפָטוֹמָא, מַאי לָאו דְּאָמַר לֵיהּ: מוֹתַר שְׁלִישׁ בִּשְׂכָרְךָ?
human_translation: And Rav hold that he is not set aside a dinar for him? But doesn’t Rav say the head of the calf to the fattener, What, is it not that he said to him: The surplus one-third is your wages,
llm_translation: And Rav thought, "Do we not cut for him a dinar?" And Rav said, "The head of the calf for the potoma, what is it that he did not say to him: 'Is it permitted to take a third in your wage?'"

hebrew_text: לֹא, דְּקָאָמַר לֵיהּ: אִי מוֹתַר שְׁלִישׁ, אִי רֵישׁ עִגְלָא לְפָטוֹמָא. אִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: כִּי קָאָמַר רַב מוֹתַר שְׁלִישׁ בִּשְׂכָרְךָ מוּתָּר – כְּגוֹן דְּאִית לֵיהּ בְּהֵמָה לְדִידֵיהּ. דְּאָמְרִי אִינָשֵׁי: גַּבֵּיל לְתוֹרָא, גַּבֵּיל לְתוֹרֵי.
human_translation: No, where said to him: Either the surplus one-third, or head of the calf to the fattener. if you wish, say When Rav says The surplus one-third is your wages it is permitted, where had his own animal as people say Mix for an ox, mix for oxen,
llm_translation: He did not, for he said to him: If it is permitted to a third party, it is as if the calf's head is in the pit. If you wish, say: When Rav said, "If it is permitted to a third party, it is permitted for your wage," for example, if he has an animal for himself. People say: "Tie for the ox, tie for the plow."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר מֵהַגְרוֹנְיָא זָבֵין בְּהֵמָה, וְיָהֵיב לֵיהּ לַאֲרִיסֵיהּ מְפַטֵּים לֵיהּ, וְיָהֵיב לֵיהּ רֵישָׁא בְּאַגְרֵיהּ, וְיָהֵיב פַּלְגָא רַוְוחָא. אֲמַרָה לֵיהּ דְּבֵיתְהוּ: אִי מִשְׁתַּתְּפַתְּ בַּהֲדֵיהּ יָהֵיב לָךְ נָמֵי אַלְיְתָא. אֲזַל זָבֵין בַּהֲדֵיהּ, פְּלֵיג לֵיהּ מֵאַלְיְתָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: תָּא נִפְלְגֵיהּ לְרֵישָׁא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הַשְׁתָּא כְּמֵעִיקָּרָא נָמֵי לָא?
human_translation: Rav Elazar of Hagronya purchased an animal, and gave it to his sharecropper fatten it, and gave him the head as his wages and gave one-half of the profits. wife said to him: If you would have participated with him he would have given you the tail also. went and purchased with and gave him one-half of the tail said to him: Let’s divide the head. said to him: Now will you not also give me as initially?
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar from Hagronya would buy an animal, give it to his sharecropper to plow, give him the head as wages, and give him half the profit. His wife said to him: If you participate in the plowing, you should also receive a share. He participated in the plowing, and divided the profit with him. He said to him: Come, let us divide it from the head. He said to him: Now, just as originally, should I not receive a share?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: עַד הָאִידָּנָא זוּזֵי דִּידִי הֲווֹ, אִי לָא הֲוָה יָהֵיבְנָא לָךְ טְפֵי פּוּרְתָּא – מִיחֲזֵי כְּרִבִּית, הַשְׁתָּא שׁוּתָּפֵי אֲנַן, מַאי קָאָמְרַתְּ טָרַחְנָא טְפֵי פּוּרְתָּא, אָמְרִי אִינָשֵׁי: סְתַם אֲרִיסָא לְמָרֵי אַרְעָא קָמְשַׁעְבֵּד נַפְשֵׁיהּ לְאֵתוֹיֵי לֵיהּ רִעְיָא.
human_translation: said to him: Until now the money was mine, had I not given you a little more it would have appeared like interest. now we are partners, what you say? That you exert a little more people say An ordinary sharecropper subjugates himself to bring him pasture.
llm_translation: He said to him: Until now, my own coins were used, if not, I would have given you a little money - it looks like a quarter, now we are partners, what are you saying, you are bothering with a little money, people say: a tenant who serves his master's land is doing it for his own benefit.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הַשָּׁם בְּהֵמָה לַחֲבֵירוֹ, עַד מָתַי חַיָּיב לִטַּפֵּל בָּהּ? סוֹמְכוֹס אוֹמֵר: בַּאֲתוֹנוֹת שְׁמוֹנָה עָשָׂר חֹדֶשׁ, בְּגוֹדְרוֹת עֶשְׂרִים וְאַרְבָּעָה חֹדֶשׁ. וְאִם בָּא לַחֲלוֹק בְּתוֹךְ זְמַנּוֹ – חֲבֵרוֹ מְעַכֵּב עָלָיו, אֲבָל אֵינוֹ דּוֹמֶה טִיפּוּלָהּ שֶׁל שָׁנָה זוֹ לְטִיפּוּלָהּ שֶׁל שָׁנָה אַחֶרֶת.
human_translation: The Sages taught: one who appraises an animal for another how long obligated to care for it Sumakhos says: For female donkeys, eighteen months; for flocks twenty-four months. And if comes to divide, within the time, the other can prevent him but the care of this year is not comparable to the care of another year.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: If one's animal caused damage to another's, how long is one obligated to take care of it? Simeon says: For camels, eighteen months; for gederot, twenty-four months. And if one comes to divide within its time period, his fellow can object to him, but the care of this year is not equivalent to the care of another year.

hebrew_text: ״אֲבָל״ מַאי קָאָמַר? אֶלָּא: לְפִי שֶׁאֵינוֹ דּוֹמֶה טִיפּוּלָהּ שֶׁל שָׁנָה זוֹ לְטִיפּוּלָהּ שֶׁל שָׁנָה אַחֶרֶת.
human_translation: but what is it saying? Rather, Because the care of this year is not comparable to the care of another year.
llm_translation: "However," what is it saying? Rather: because its effectiveness of this year is not similar to the effectiveness of another year.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא אִידַּךְ: הַשָּׁם בְּהֵמָה לַחֲבֵירוֹ, עַד מָתַי חַיָּיב לִטַּפֵּל בַּוְּלָדוֹת? בַּדַּקָּה – שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם, וּבַגַּסָּה – חֲמִשִּׁים יוֹם. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: בַּדַּקָּה שְׁלֹשָׁה חֳדָשִׁים, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁטִּיפּוּלָהּ מְרוּבֶּה. מַאי טִיפּוּלָהּ מְרוּבֶּה – מִפְּנֵי שֶׁשִּׁינֶּיהָ דַּקּוֹת. מִכָּאן וְאֵילָךְ נוֹטֵל מֶחֱצָה שֶׁלּוֹ, וַחֲצִי מֶחֱצָה בְּשֶׁל חֲבֵירוֹ.
human_translation: It is taught another one who appraises an animal for another how long is obligated to care for the offspring For small thirty days, and for large fifty days. Rabbi Yosei says: For small three months, as it a lot of care. What A lot of care? due to that its teeth are thin, From this forward, takes one-half his and one-half of one-half of the other’s
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: The ox of one person gores the ox of another, until when is he obligated to pay for the damages to the offspring? In a small pen - thirty days, and in a large pen - fifty days. Rabbi Yosei says: In a small pen, three months, because its offspring are more delicate. What does it mean that its offspring are more delicate? Because its teeth are sharp. From here on, he takes half of it, and half of the half belongs to its owner.

hebrew_text: רַב מְנַשְּׁיָא בַּר גַּדָּא שְׁקַל מֶחֱצָה שֶׁלּוֹ וַחֲצִי מֶחֱצָה בְּשֶׁל חֲבֵירוֹ. אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּאַבָּיֵי. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מַאן פְּלַג לָךְ? וְעוֹד: מָקוֹם שֶׁנָּהֲגוּ לְגַדֵּל הוּא, וּתְנַן: מָקוֹם שֶׁנָּהֲגוּ לְגַדֵּל – יְגַדֵּילוּ.
human_translation: Rav Menashya bar Gadda he took his one-half and one-half of the other’s one-half. came before Abaye. said to Who divided for you? And furthermore, is a place where it is customary to raise and we learned a place where it is customary to raise they should be raised
llm_translation: Rav Menashya bar Gadda took half of his and half of his friend's. He came before Abbaye. He said to him: Who divided for you? And furthermore: A place where they are accustomed to grow, and we learned: A place where they are accustomed to grow - they shall grow.

hebrew_text: הָנְהוּ תְּרֵי כּוּתָאֵי דַּעֲבוּד עִסְקָא בַּהֲדֵי הֲדָדֵי. אֲזַל חַד מִנַּיְיהוּ פְּלַיג זוּזֵי בְּלָא דַּעְתֵּיהּ דְּחַבְרֵיהּ. אֲתוֹ לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב פָּפָּא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מַאי נָפְקָא מִינַּהּ? הָכִי אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: זוּזֵי כְּמַאן דִּפְלִיגִי דָּמוּ.
human_translation: these two Samaritans who entered into a joint venture with each other. One of them went divided the money without the knowledge of the other. They came before Rav Pappa. said What difference This is Rav Naḥman said: Money is as though divided.
llm_translation: Behold, there were two Kutaei involved in a business transaction together. One of them went and spent money without the knowledge of his partner. He came before Rav Papa. He said to him: What is the law in this case? Thus said Rav Nachman: The money is like that of one who separates, it is lost.

hebrew_text: לְשָׁנָה זְבוּן חַמְרָא בַּהֲדֵי הֲדָדֵי. קָם אִידַּךְ פְּלַיג לֵיהּ בְּלָא דַּעְתֵּיהּ דְּחַבְרֵיהּ, אֲתוֹ לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב פָּפָּא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מַאן פְּלַג לָךְ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: קָא חָזֵינָא דְּבָתַר דִּידִי קָא אָתֵי מָר! אֲמַר רַב פָּפָּא:
human_translation: The year purchased wine together, the other one arose divided without the knowledge of the other. they came before Rav Pappa. said to Who divided for you? said to him: I see that the Master pursues me Rav Pappa said:
llm_translation: Year of wine, vinegar in the presence of Hadadei. The other one arose and argued with him without the knowledge of his colleagues, they came before Rav Papa. He said to him: Who is arguing with you? He said to him: I see that after me the Master is coming! Rav Papa said:

hebrew_text: כְּהַאי גַּוְנָא וַדַּאי צְרִיךְ לְאוֹדוֹעֵיהּ: זוּזֵי, מִי שָׁקֵיל טָבֵי וְשָׁבֵיק חַסִּרֵי?
human_translation: a case like this certainly necessary to inform money, did he take good and leave deficient
llm_translation: Like this case, certainly it requires clarification: Zuzei, who takes good and leaves bad?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: חַמְרָא, כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא יָדְעִי דְּאִיכָּא דִּבְסִים וְאִיכָּא דְּלָא בְּסִים.
human_translation: said to him: No, said to him: wine, everyone knows that there is that is sweet and there is that is not sweet,
llm_translation: He said to him: No. He said to him: Wine, everyone in the world knows that there are those who are fragrant and those who are not fragrant.

hebrew_text: גּוּפָא, אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: זוּזֵי, כְּמַאן דִּפְלִיגִי דָּמוּ. הָנֵי מִילֵּי טָבֵי וְטָבֵי, תְּקוּלֵי וּתְקוּלֵי. אֲבָל טָבֵי וּתְקוּלֵי – לָא.
human_translation: the itself: Rav Naḥman said: Money is considered as if divided This matter good and good heavy and heavy But good and heavy, not
llm_translation: The body, said Rav Nachman: Zuzai, like one who differentiates blood. These are good words and good words, light and light. But good and light - no.

hebrew_text: רַב חָמָא הֲוָה מוֹגַר זוּזֵי בִּפְשִׁיטָא בְּיוֹמָא. כְּלוֹ זוּזֵי דְּרַב חָמָא. הוּא סָבַר: מַאי שְׁנָא מִמָּרָא? וְלָא הִיא מָרָא הָדְרָא בָּעֵינָא וִידִיעַ פְּחָתֵיהּ, זוּזֵי לָא הָדְרִי בְּעֵינַיְיהוּ וְלָא יְדִיעַ פְּחָתֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rav Ḥama would rent out dinars at peshita , per day for Rav Ḥama’s money was lost he thought: what different from a hoe? But is not so, hoe returns as is, and its depreciation is known, dinars do not return as is, and their depreciation is not known.
llm_translation: Rav Ḥama was accustomed to deposit coins in a purse during the day. All the coins of Rav Ḥama. He thought: What is different about a coin from a mirror? A mirror I want to see and know its value, coins I do not want to see and do not know their value.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: שְׁרֵי לֵיהּ לְאִינִישׁ לְמֵימַר לֵיהּ לְחַבְרֵיהּ: הֵילָךְ אַרְבְּעָה זוּזֵי וְאוֹזְפֵיהּ לִפְלָנְיָא זוּזֵי, לֹא אָסְרָה תּוֹרָה אֶלָּא רִבִּית הַבָּאָה מִלֹּוֶה לְמַלְוֶה. וְאָמַר רָבָא: שְׁרֵי לֵיהּ לְאִינִישׁ לְמֵימַר לֵיהּ לְחַבְרֵיהּ ״שְׁקֹל לָךְ אַרְבְּעָה זוּזֵי וֶאֱמוֹר לֵיהּ לִפְלוֹנִי לְאוֹזֹפַן זוּזֵי״. מַאי טַעְמָא – שְׂכַר אֲמִירָה קָא שָׁקֵיל.
human_translation: Rava said: It is permitted for a person to say to another: Here are four dinars; go and lend money to so-and-so. the Torah prohibited only interest that comes from the borrower to the lender, And Rava said: It is permitted for a person to say to another: Take four dinars for yourself and tell so-and-so to lend me money. What is the reason he takes payment for talking
llm_translation: Rava said: It is permitted for a person to say to another to tell his friend: "Go take four zuz and give them to so-and-so," as the Torah only prohibited interest that comes from lending to a borrower. And Rava said: It is permitted for a person to say to another, "Take four zuz and tell so-and-so to give them to so-and-so." What is the reason? Payment for speaking is being taken.

hebrew_text: כִּי הָא דְּאַבָּא מָר בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב פָּפָּא הֲוָה שָׁקֵיל אוּגְנָא דְקִירָא מִקִּירָאֵי, וַאֲמַר לֵיהּ לַאֲבוּהּ: אוֹזְפִינְהוּ זוּזֵי. אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ רַבָּנַן לְרַב פָּפָּא: אָכֵיל בְּרֵיהּ דְּמָר רִבִּיתָא! אֲמַר לְהוּ: כֹּל כִּי הַאי רִבִּיתָא נֵיכוֹל, לֹא אָסְרָה תּוֹרָה אֶלָּא רִבִּית הַבָּאָה מִלֹּוֶה לְמַלְוֶה. הָכָא – שְׂכַר אֲמִירָה קָא שָׁקֵיל, וּשְׁרֵי.
human_translation: similar to this Abba Mar, son of Rav Pappa, would take pans of wax from wax manufacturers and tell his father: Lend them money. The Sages said to Rav Pappa: The Master’s son consumes interest, said to them: We may consume any interest of this kind. the Torah prohibited only interest that comes from the borrower to the lender. Here, he takes payment for talking, and permitted.
llm_translation: The matter of Abba the son of Rav Pappa, he took a beam of a beam from the beams, and said to his father: "Add coins to it." The Sages said to Rav Pappa: "The son of the master has eaten interest!" He said to them: "All that this interest is consumed, the Torah only forbade the interest that comes from lending to a borrower. Here - payment for a statement he took, and it is permitted."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ שָׁמִין פָּרָה וַחֲמוֹר וְכׇל דָּבָר שֶׁהוּא עוֹשֶׂה וְאוֹכֵל לְמֶחֱצָה. מָקוֹם שֶׁנָּהֲגוּ לַחְלוֹק אֶת הַוְּלָדוֹת מִיָּד – חוֹלְקִין. מָקוֹם שֶׁנָּהֲגוּ לְגַדֵּל – יְגַדֵּילוּ.
human_translation: One may appraise a cow or a donkey or any item that generates while it eats for one-half a place where it is customary to divide the offspring immediately they divide a place where it is customary to raise raise
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One may listen to a cow, a donkey, and any creature that both produces and consumes simultaneously. In a place where it is customary to immediately divide the offspring, they divide it. In a place where it is customary to let it grow, they let it grow.

hebrew_text: רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: שָׁמִין עֵגֶל עִם אִמּוֹ, וּסְיָח עִם אִמּוֹ, וּמַפְרִיז עַל שָׂדֵהוּ, וְאֵינוֹ חוֹשֵׁשׁ מִשּׁוּם רִבִּית.
human_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: One may appraise a calf with its mother or a foal with its mother And may inflate [ umafriz ] for his field, and he need not be concerned with regard to interest,
llm_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: One may raise a calf with its mother, and one may play with its mother, and one may let it graze in its field, and he is not concerned about interest.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: מַפְרִיז עַל שָׂדֵהוּ וְאֵינוֹ חוֹשֵׁשׁ מִשּׁוּם רִבִּית, כֵּיצַד? הַשּׂוֹכֵר אֶת הַשָּׂדֶה מֵחֲבֵירוֹ בַּעֲשָׂרָה כּוֹרִים חִטִּין לְשָׁנָה, וְאוֹמֵר לוֹ: תֵּן לִי מָאתַיִם זוּז וַאֲפַרְנְסֶנָּה, וַאֲנִי אַעֲלֶה לְךָ שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר כּוֹרִין לְשָׁנָה – מוּתָּר.
