human_translation: The Sages taught: One may inflate for his field, and he need not be concerned with regard to interest. How so? one who rents a field from another for ten kor wheat per year, and says to Give me two hundred dinars and I will equip it and I will pay you twelve kor per year permitted,
llm_translation: The sages taught: One may spread out his field and not be concerned about interest. How so? If one rents a field from his fellow for ten kor of wheat per year, and says to him: Give me two hundred zuz and I will provide for you, and I will bring up for you twelve kor of wheat per year - it is permitted.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל אֵין מַפְרִיז לֹא עַל חֲנוּת וְלֹא עַל סְפִינָה.
human_translation: But one may not inflate for a store or a ship.
llm_translation: But does not separate neither on a storehouse nor on a ship.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר אֲבוּהּ: פְּעָמִים שֶׁמַּפְרִיז עַל חֲנוּת לָצוֹר בָּהּ צוּרָה, סְפִינָה לַעֲשׂוֹת לָהּ אִיסְקַרְיָא. חֲנוּת לָצוֹר בָּהּ צוּרְתָּא: דְּצָבוּ בַּהּ אִינָשֵׁי וְהָוֵי אַגְרָא טְפֵי. סְפִינָה לַעֲשׂוֹת לָהּ אִיסְקַרְיָא: כֵּיוָן דְּשַׁפִּירָא אִיסְקַרְיָא טְפֵי – אַגְרָא טְפֵי.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman says Rabba bar Avuh said: times when one may inflate for a store, to paint a design a ship, to fashion sail [ iskarya ]. a store to paint a design because people will want to come and the profits are increased. a ship to fashion a sail, because the profits are greater since the sail is improved.
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said, Rabba bar Avuh said: Sometimes when one spreads a net over a fishpond, it forms a shape in it, a boat to make it is called Iskarya. A fishpond with a shape in it: people step on it and it becomes like a roof. A boat to make it is called Iskarya: once the Iskarya is well-formed, it becomes like a roof.

hebrew_text: סְפִינְתָּא, אָמַר רַב: אַגְרָא וּפַגְרָא. אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ רַב כָּהֲנָא וְרַב אַסִּי לְרַב: אִי אַגְרָא – לָא פַּגְרָא, אִי פַּגְרָא – לָא אַגְרָא. שְׁתֵיק רַב.
human_translation: a ship Rav said: rent and damage Rav Kahana and Rav Asi said to Rav: If rent, not damage, if damage, not rent, Rav was silent,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Sefinta, amar Rav: Agra u'Pagra. Amaruh lei Rav Kahana veRav Asi leRav: I Aggra - la Pagra, I Pagra - la Aggra. Shtei Rav. English translation: Sefinta, Rav said: Hire and carcass. Rav Kahana and Rav Asi said to Rav: If hire - not carcass, if carcass - not hire. Rav was silent.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: מַאי טַעְמָא שְׁתֵיק רַב? לָא שְׁמִיעָא לֵיהּ הָא דְּתַנְיָא: אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאָמְרוּ אֵין מְקַבְּלִין צֹאן בַּרְזֶל מִיִּשְׂרָאֵל, אֲבָל מְקַבְּלִין צֹאן בַּרְזֶל מִן הַגּוֹיִם. אֲבָל אָמְרוּ: הַשָּׁם פָּרָה לַחֲבֵירוֹ, וְאָמַר לוֹ: הֲרֵי פָּרָתְךָ עֲשׂוּיָה עָלַי בִּשְׁלֹשִׁים דִּינָר, וַאֲנִי אַעֲלֶה לְךָ סֶלַע בְּחֹדֶשׁ – מוּתָּר, לְפִי שֶׁלֹּא עֲשָׂאָהּ דָּמִים.
human_translation: Rav Sheshet said: What is the reason Rav was silent? Did he not hear that which is taught Even though said that one may not accept a guaranteed investment [ tzon barzel ] from a Jew, but one may accept a guaranteed investment from gentiles, But said: If one appraised a cow for another and said to Your cow is evaluated for me at thirty dinars and I will pay you a sela per month permitted, because he did not make money.
llm_translation: Rav Sheshet said: What is the reason Rav remained silent? It is because he did not hear the teaching that was taught: Even though they said, "We do not accept iron sheep from Israelites, but we do accept iron sheep from Gentiles." But they said: If one lends his cow to his friend and says to him, "Here is your cow, made for me at a cost of thirty dinars, and I will ascend a rock for you next month" – it is permitted, because he did not make it a sale.

hebrew_text: וְלֹא עֲשָׂאָהּ?! אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: לֹא עֲשָׂאָהּ דָּמִים מֵחַיִּים, אֶלָּא לְאַחַר מִיתָה.
human_translation: And did he not make it Rav Sheshet said: he did not make it money while alive, rather after death.
llm_translation: "And did he not do it?!" Rav Sheshet said: He did not do it with live blood, but after death."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא, הִלְכְתָא: סְפִינָה אַגְרָא וּפַגְרָא.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: halakha a ship rent and damage.
llm_translation: Rav Papa said, halakha: a ship is like a chest and a corpse.

hebrew_text: וְנָהֲגוּ בְּנֵי כוּפְרָא אַגְרָא בִּשְׁעַת מְשִׁיכָה, פַּגְרָא בִּשְׁעַת שְׁבִירָה. אַטּוּ בְּמִנְהָגָא תַּלְיָא מִילְּתָא? מִשּׁוּם דְּמַתְנִיתָא תַּנְיָא – מִנְהָגָא.
human_translation: And the men of pitch [ benei kufera ], are accustomed to rent at the time of pulling damage at the time of breakage. Is that to say this matter depends on custom? Because the baraita taught this, custom
llm_translation: The people of Kufra would hire a wagon at the time of pulling, a boat at the time of breaking. Is it proper to rely on custom alone? Because a baraita teaches - custom.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב עָנָן אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: מָעוֹת שֶׁל יְתוֹמִים מוּתָּר לְהַלְווֹתָן בְּרִבִּית. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב נַחְמָן: מִשּׁוּם דְּיַתְמֵי נִינְהוּ (סָפֵינָא) [סָפֵינַן] לְהוּ אִיסּוּרָא?! יַתְמֵי דְּאָכְלִי דְּלָאו דִּידְהוּ לֵיזְלוּ בָּתַר שָׁבְקַיְיהוּ! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֵימָא לִי אִיזִי גּוּפָא דְעוֹבָדָא הֵיכִי הֲוָה?
human_translation: Rav Anan says Shmuel says: permitted to lend with interest money to orphans. Rav Naḥman said to him: Because they are orphans we may feed them prohibited Orphans that consume that which is not theirs will follow their deceased said to Say to me now, what was the actual incident?
llm_translation: Rav Anan said in the name of Shmuel: It is permitted to lend orphans money with interest. Rav Nachman said to him: Because they are orphans, should we bring upon them prohibition? Orphans who eat, as they are not responsible for themselves, should we let them go hungry after we have left them? He said to him: Should I go myself and see how the matter stands?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָהוּא דּוּדָא דִּבְנֵי מָר עוּקְבָא דַּהֲוָה בֵּי מָר שְׁמוּאֵל, תָּקֵיל וְיָהֵיב לֵיהּ, תָּקֵיל וְשָׁקֵיל לֵיהּ. שָׁקֵיל אַגְרָא וְשָׁקֵיל פַּחֲתָא. אִי אַגְרָא – לָא פַּחֲתָא, וְאִי פַּחֲתָא – לָא אַגְרָא.
human_translation: said to him: a certain kettle that the children of Mar Ukva, was in the house of Mar Shmuel, would weigh it and give it out, weigh it and take it back, he would take a rental fee and would take for depreciation if a rental should not depreciation, and if he takes for depreciation, should not a rental
llm_translation: He said to him: That particular David, son of Mar Ukva, who was of the household of Mar Samuel, he would weigh and give to him, he would weigh and take from him. He would take a large measure and take a small measure. If he took a large measure - it was not a small measure, and if he took a small measure - it was not a large measure.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: כִּי הָא – אֲפִילּוּ בְּדִקְנָנֵי נָמֵי שְׁרֵי לְמִיעְבַּד, דְּהָא מְקַבְּלִי עֲלַיְיהוּ חוּסְכָא דִנְחָשָׁא, דְּכַמָּה דְּמִקְּלֵי נְחָשָׁא בְּצִיר דְּמֵיהּ.
human_translation: said to him: like this, as even for bearded ones, permitted to act in this as accept upon themselves the depreciation of the copper, as the more the copper is burned, the more the value of the pot is diminished.
llm_translation: He said to him: For this - even with thin reeds it is permitted to be done, for they receive upon themselves the protection of the snake, just as the snake sheds its skin.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר שֵׁילָא אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ, אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר יוֹסֵף בַּר חָמָא אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: מָעוֹת שֶׁל יְתוֹמִים מוּתָּר לְהַלְווֹתָן קָרוֹב לְשָׂכָר וְרָחוֹק לְהֶפְסֵד.
human_translation: Rabba bar Sheila says Rav Ḥisda says, and some say Rabba bar Yosef bar Ḥama says Rav Sheshet says: permitted to lend the money of orphans that is close to profit and far from loss.
llm_translation: Rabba bar Sheilah said in the name of Rav Ḥisda, and some say it was Rabba bar Yosef bar Ḥama who said in the name of Rav Sheshet: Money of orphans, it is permitted to lend to them, close to profit and far from loss.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: קָרוֹב לְשָׂכָר וְרָחוֹק לְהֶפְסֵד – רָשָׁע. קָרוֹב לְהֶפְסֵד וְרָחוֹק לְשָׂכָר – חָסִיד. קָרוֹב לָזֶה וְלָזֶה, רָחוֹק מִזֶּה וּמִזֶּה – זוֹ הִיא מִדַּת כׇּל אָדָם.
human_translation: The Sages taught: close to profit and far from loss, a wicked person, close to loss and far from profit, a pious person, close to this and to that far from this and from that, this is quality of every person
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: Close to reward and far from loss - wicked. Close to loss and far from reward - righteous. Close to this and to that, far from this and from that - this is the attribute of every person.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבָּה לְרַב יוֹסֵף: הָנֵי זוּזֵי דְיַתְמֵי הֵיכִי עָבְדִינַן לְהוּ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מוֹתְבִינַן לְהוּ בֵּי דִינָא וְיָהֲבִינַן לְהוּ זוּזָא זוּזָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: וְהָא קָא כָלְיָא קַרְנָא.
human_translation: Rabba said to Rav Yosef: this money to orphans, what do we do with it? said to him: We set up court for them, and we give them dinar by dinar, said to him: But the principal, will be depleted,
llm_translation: He said to him, Rabba said to Rav Yosef: How do we give these coins to them? He said to him: We sit them in the court and give them coin by coin. He said to him: But this is like a horned basket.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ מָר: הֵיכִי עָבֵיד? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: בָּדְקִינַן גַּבְרָא דְּאִית לֵיהּ דַּהֲבָא פְּרִיכָא, וְנָקְטִינַן דַּהֲבָא מִינֵּיהּ, וְיָהֲבִינַן לְהוּ נִיהֲלֵיהּ קָרוֹב לְשָׂכָר וְרָחוֹק לְהֶפְסֵד. אֲבָל דָּבָר מְסוּיָּם – לָא, דִּלְמָא פִּקָּדוֹן נִינְהוּ, וְאָתֵי מָרֵיהּ יָהֵיב סִימָנִין וְשָׁקֵיל לֵיהּ.
human_translation: said to him: What does the Master do said to him: We look a man who has scraps of gold, and we purchase the gold from him and we give to him close to profit and far from loss. but not a specific item, perhaps it is a deposit and the owner will come and provide distinguishing marks and take it,
llm_translation: He said to him, "Master, how should one act?" He said to him, "We examine a man who has a gold coin, and we take the gold coin from him, and we give it to him to manage - close to profit and far from loss. But with a deposited item - no, perhaps they are entrusted, and the owner comes and gives signs and takes it back."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: תִּינַח אִי מִשְׁתְּכַח גַּבְרָא דְּאִית לֵיהּ דַּהֲבָא פְּרִיכָא, אִי לָא מִשְׁתְּכַח גַּבְרָא דְּאִית לֵיהּ דַּהֲבָא פְּרִיכָא נֵיכְלוּ זוּזֵי דְיַתְמֵי? אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: חָזֵינַן גַּבְרָא דִּמְשַׁפּוּ נִכְסֵיהּ, וּמְהֵימַן, וְשָׁמַע דִּינָא דְאוֹרָיְיתָא וְלָא מְקַבֵּל שַׁמְתָּא דְרַבָּנַן, וְיָהֲבִינַן לְהוּ נִיהֲלֵיהּ בְּבֵי דִינָא.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: works out well if a man is found who has scraps of gold. if no man is found who has scraps of gold, the money of the orphans be depleted? Rather, Rav Ashi said: We look for a man whose properties are quiet, and trustworthy who listens the laws of the Torah and is not subject to excommunication by the Sages, and we give him in court
llm_translation: Rav Ashei said: If a man is found to have a golden dish, if he is found to have a golden dish, should the coins that are found between them be considered his? Rather, Rav Ashei said: We see a man who appraises his property, trusts, and hears the judgment of the Torah and does not accept the decree of the Rabbis, and we give him to be managed in the court.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אֵין מְקַבְּלִין צֹאן בַּרְזֶל מִיִּשְׂרָאֵל – מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהוּא רִבִּית. אֲבָל מְקַבְּלִין צֹאן בַּרְזֶל מִן הַגּוֹיִם,
human_translation: One may not accept from a Jew a guaranteed investment, because it is interest. But one may accept a guaranteed investment from gentiles,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One does not accept sheep of iron from a Jew, because it is usury. But one may accept sheep of iron from non-Jews.

hebrew_text: וְלֹוִין מֵהֶן וּמַלְוִין אוֹתָן בְּרִבִּית. וְכֵן בְּגֵר תּוֹשָׁב. מַלְוֶה יִשְׂרָאֵל מְעוֹתָיו שֶׁל נׇכְרִי – מִדַּעַת הַנׇּכְרִי, אֲבָל לֹא מִדַּעַת יִשְׂרָאֵל.
human_translation: And one may borrow from them and one may lend to them with interest. And similarly, with regard to a gentile who resides in Eretz Yisrael and observes the seven Noahide mitzvot [ ger toshav ], a Jew may lend a gentile’s money with the knowledge of the gentile, but not with the knowledge of a Jew,
llm_translation: And they lend from them and borrow from them with interest. And so too with a resident alien. A Jew may lend his money to a non-Jew - with the non-Jew's knowledge, but not with the Jew's knowledge.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ לְמֵימְרָא דְּבִרְשׁוּתָא דִּמְקַבֵּל קָיְימָא? וּרְמִינְהוּ: הַמְקַבֵּל צֹאן בַּרְזֶל מִן הַגּוֹיִם – וְלָדוֹת פְּטוּרִין מִן הַבְּכוֹרָה!
human_translation: to say that stands in the possession of the recipient, And the raises a contradiction one who accepts from gentiles a guaranteed investment, offspring are exempt from a firstborn.
llm_translation: Gemara: "Is one who acquires property through the agency of a gentile considered as having acquired it legally? And the Gemara raises a dilemma: If one acquires sheep from gentiles with iron coins, are the offspring exempt from the laws of firstborn animals?"

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי, לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא דִּמְקַבֵּל עֲלֵיהּ אוּנְסָא וְזוֹלָא, הָא דְּלָא קַבֵּיל עֲלֵיהּ אוּנְסָא וְזוֹלָא.
human_translation: Abaye said: not difficult. That where accepts upon himself an accident or depreciation this where did not accept upon himself an accident or depreciation.
llm_translation: Abaye said, it is not difficult: this one who accepts upon himself Ones and Zola, and this one who does not accept upon himself Ones and Zola.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא: אִי דְּקַבֵּיל עֲלֵיהּ מָרַהּ אוּנְסָא וְזוֹלָא – צֹאן בַּרְזֶל קָרֵית לֵיהּ?
human_translation: Rava said to If the owner accepted upon himself an accident or depreciation, you call it a guaranteed investment?
llm_translation: Rava said to him: If a woman accepts upon herself bitter herbs and vinegar - do you call her a city of iron?

hebrew_text: וְעוֹד אַדְּתָנֵי סֵיפָא: אֲבָל מְקַבְּלִין צֹאן בַּרְזֶל מִן הַגּוֹיִם לִיפְלוֹג בְּדִידֵיהּ: בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים – דְּלָא קַבֵּיל עֲלֵיהּ אוּנְסָא וְזוֹלָא, אֲבָל קַבֵּיל מָרַהּ אוּנְסָא וְזוֹלָא – שַׁפִּיר דָּמֵי!
human_translation: And furthermore, Instead of teaching the latter clause But one may accept a guaranteed investment from gentiles, let distinguish within itself, In what is this statement, said? when did not accept upon himself an accident or depreciation, but the owner accepted upon himself an accident or depreciation, well
llm_translation: And furthermore, it was taught in the latter part: But one may accept iron sheep from the Gentiles to divide among themselves. In what case are these words said? - That he did not accept upon it theft and robbery, but if he accepted upon it theft and robbery - the price is valid!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: אִידֵּי וְאִידֵּי דְּלָא קַבֵּיל עֲלֵיהּ מָרַהּ אוּנְסָא וְזוֹלָא, וְגַבֵּי בְּכוֹרוֹת הַיְינוּ טַעַם דִּוְלָדוֹת פְּטוּרִין מִן הַבְּכוֹרָה: כֵּיוָן דְּאִי לָא יָהֵיב זוּזֵי, אָתֵי גּוֹי תָּפֵיס לַהּ לִבְהֵמָה. וְאִי לָא מַשְׁכַּח לַהּ לִבְהֵמָה, תָּפֵיס לְהוּ לִוְלָדוֹת, וְהָוֵי לַיהּ יַד גּוֹי בָּאֶמְצַע.
human_translation: Rather, Rava said: this and that the owner did not accept upon himself responsibility for an accident or depreciation. And with regard to the firstborn, this is the reason the offspring are exempt from a firstborn: Since, if does not give the money the gentile will come and seize the animal, and if he does not find the animal he will seize the offspring; the hand of a gentile is in the middle,
llm_translation: Rather, Rava said: Both this and that, if the mother did not accept upon herself the obligation of the ransom and the fine, regarding firstborn animals, the taste of their afterbirth exempts them from the obligation of the firstborn. Since if one does not give the coins, a non-Jew may come and seize it for himself for an animal. And if one forgets to give it for the animal, he may give it for the afterbirth, and it will be as if the non-Jew's hand is in the middle.

hebrew_text: וְכׇל יָד גּוֹי בָּאֶמְצַע – פָּטוּר מִן הַבְּכוֹרָה.
human_translation: every the hand of a gentile is in the middle, exempt from a firstborn.
llm_translation: And every hand of a non-Jew in the middle - exempt from the firstborn.

hebrew_text: ״מַרְבֶּה הוֹנוֹ בְּנֶשֶׁךְ וְתַרְבִּית לְחוֹנֵן דַּלִּים יִקְבְּצֶנּוּ״. מַאי לְחוֹנֵן דַּלִּים? אָמַר רַב: כְּגוֹן שַׁבּוּר מַלְכָּא.
human_translation: “He who augments his substance by interest [ beneshekh ] and increase [ vetarbit ] gathers it for him who has pity on the poor” What “him who has pity on the poor”? Rav said: such as King Shapur,
llm_translation: "Increasing his wealth through interest, and gathering it for one who is gracious to the poor." What is 'gracious to the poor'? Rav said: For example, King Solomon.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן, אָמַר לִי הוּנָא: לֹא נִצְרְכָה אֶלָּא דַּאֲפִילּוּ רִבִּית דְּגוֹי. אֵיתִיבֵיהּ רָבָא לְרַב נַחְמָן: ״לַנׇּכְרִי תַשִּׁיךְ״, מַאי תַשִּׁיךְ – לָאו תִּשּׁוֹךְ? לָא, תַּשִּׁיךְ.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman said: Huna said to me necessary only that even interest from a gentile Rava raised an objection to Rav Naḥman: “Unto a gentile tashikh ” what “ tashikh ”? Doesn’t tishokh , No, pay interest,
llm_translation: Rav Nahman said, Hunah told me: It is not necessary except even the interest of a gentile. Rava raised an objection to Rav Nahman: "You may charge interest to a foreigner," what is "you may charge" - not that you may charge? No, you may charge.

hebrew_text: לָא סַגִּי דְּלָאו הָכִי? לְאַפּוֹקֵי אָחִיךָ דְּלָא.
human_translation: Is it not sufficient without this? to exclude your brother, that not
llm_translation: Not enough that not so? To go out your brother not.

hebrew_text: אָחִיךָ בְּהֶדְיָא כְּתִב בֵּיהּ: ״וּלְאָחִיךְ לֹא תַשִּׁיךְ״! לַעֲבוֹר עָלָיו בַּעֲשֵׂה וְלֹא תַעֲשֶׂה.
human_translation: your brother is written explicitly “Unto your brother you shall not lend with interest.” that he violates the positive and the prohibition
llm_translation: Your brother in Hadya wrote in it: "And to your brother you shall not lend with interest!" To transgress upon him with a positive commandment and not a negative commandment.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ: לֹוִין מֵהֶן וּמַלְוִין אוֹתָם בְּרִבִּית, וְכֵן בְּגֵר תּוֹשָׁב! אָמַר רַב חִיָּיא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב הוּנָא: לֹא נִצְרְכָה אֶלָּא
human_translation: raised an objection to One may borrow from them and one may lend to them with interest. And similarly, with regard to a ger toshav , Rav Ḥiyya, son of Rav Huna, said: is necessary only
llm_translation: He raised an objection against him: They lend to them and borrow from them with interest, and likewise with a resident alien! Rav Ḥiyya, son of Rav Huna, said: It was necessary only...

hebrew_text: בִּכְדֵי חַיָּיו.
human_translation: to the extent a livelihood to
llm_translation: In the measure of his life.

hebrew_text: רָבִינָא אָמַר: הָכָא בְּתַלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים עָסְקִינַן. טַעְמָא מַאי גְּזוּר רַבָּנַן – שֶׁמָּא יִלְמוֹד מִמַּעֲשָׂיו, וְכֵיוָן דְּתַלְמִיד חָכָם הוּא – לֹא יִלְמוֹד מִמַּעֲשָׂיו.
human_translation: Ravina said: Here we are dealing with Torah scholars, What is the reason the Sages decreed perhaps will learn from actions. And since is a Torah scholar, he will not learn from actions.
llm_translation: Ravinah said: Here we are dealing with the disciples of the sages. The reason for the decree of the Rabbis is lest one learn from his actions, and since he is a disciple of a sage, he should not learn from his actions.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּמַתְנֵי לַהּ לְהָא דְּרַב הוּנָא אַהָא דְּתָנֵי רַב יוֹסֵף: ״אִם כֶּסֶף תַּלְוֶה אֶת עַמִּי אֶת הֶעָנִי עִמָּךְ״. עַמִּי וְגוֹי – עַמִּי קוֹדֵם, עָנִי וְעָשִׁיר – עָנִי קוֹדֵם. ״עֲנִיֶּיךָ וַעֲנִיֵּי עִירֶךָ״ – עֲנִיֶּיךָ קוֹדְמִין, עֲנִיֵּי עִירֶךָ וַעֲנִיֵּי עִיר אַחֶרֶת – עֲנִיֵּי עִירֶךָ קוֹדְמִין.
human_translation: There are who teach that which Rav Huna that which Rav Yosef taught: “If you lend money to any of My people, even to the poor person who is with you” My people, and a gentile My people take precedence. a poor person and a rich person the poor person takes precedence. your poor person, and the poor of your city your poor person takes precedence. the poor of your city and the poor of another city, the the poor of your city takes precedence.
llm_translation: There is one who teaches it to her, to that which Rav Huna taught, as Rav Yosef taught: "If you lend money to My people, to the poor with you." My people and a gentile - My people take precedence, poor and rich - poor take precedence. "Your poor and the poor of your city" - your poor take precedence, the poor of your city and the poor of another city - the poor of your city take precedence.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: עַמִּי וְגוֹי עַמִּי קוֹדֵם, פְּשִׁיטָא! אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר לִי הוּנָא: לָא נִצְרְכָא, דַּאֲפִילּוּ לְגוֹי בְּרִבִּית וּלְיִשְׂרָאֵל בְּחִנָּם.
human_translation: The Master said My people and a gentile My people take precedence. obvious? Rav Naḥman said Huna said to me: It is necessary only that even to a gentile with interest or to a Jew for free,
llm_translation: Master said: "My nation and the nation, my nation comes first, it is obvious!" Rav Nachman said Huna told me: "It is not necessary, for even if a non-Jew charges interest and Israelites lend without interest."

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי: בֹּא וּרְאֵה סַמְיוּת עֵינֵיהֶם שֶׁל מַלְוֵי בְּרִבִּית. אָדָם קוֹרֵא לַחֲבֵירוֹ ״רָשָׁע״ – יוֹרֵד עִמּוֹ לְחַיָּיו. וְהֵם מְבִיאִין עֵדִים וְלַבְלָר וְקוּלְמוֹס וּדְיוֹ, וְכוֹתְבִין וְחוֹתְמִין: פְּלוֹנִי זֶה כָּפַר בֵּאלֹהֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל.
human_translation: It is taught Rabbi Yosei says: Come and see the blindness in the eyes of those who lend with interest. a person calls another a wicked person he harasses him in his life But they bring witnesses and a scribe [ velavlar ] and a pen [ vekulmos ] and ink and write and sign So-and-so denies the God of Israel,
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Yosei said, "Come and see the blindness of the eyes of the Levites regarding interest. When a person calls his fellow 'wicked,' he brings him down with him to Gehenna. And they bring witnesses and a scribe, a quill, and ink, and they write and sign: 'So-and-so has denied the God of Israel.'"

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: כָּל מִי שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ מָעוֹת וּמַלְוֶה אוֹתָם שֶׁלֹּא בְּרִבִּית, עָלָיו הַכָּתוּב אוֹמֵר ״כַּסְפּוֹ לֹא נָתַן בְּנֶשֶׁךְ וְשֹׁחַד עַל נָקִי לֹא לָקָח עֹשֵׂה אֵלֶּה לֹא יִמּוֹט לְעוֹלָם״. הָא לָמַדְתָּ שֶׁכׇּל הַמַּלְוֶה בְּרִבִּית נְכָסָיו מִתְמוֹטְטִין. וְהָא קָא חָזֵינַן דְּלָא מוֹזְפִי בְּרִבִּית וְקָא מִתְמוֹטְטִין! אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: הַלָּלוּ מִתְמוֹטְטִין וְעוֹלִין, וְהַלָּלוּ מִתְמוֹטְטִין וְאֵינָן עוֹלִין.
human_translation: It is taught Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: anyone who has money and lends it without interest, the verse says about him: “He who has not given his money with interest and who has not taken a bribe against the innocent, he who does these shall never collapse” You learn that anyone who lends with interest, his property, collapses. But we see who do not lend with interest and collapses. Rabbi Elazar says: Those collapse but rise, but these, collapse and do not rise
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: Anyone who has money and lends it without interest, the verse says about him, "He has not given his money at interest, nor has he taken a bribe against the innocent. He who does these things shall never be moved." You learn that all who lend with interest, their possessions deteriorate. But we see that those who do not lend with interest, their possessions deteriorate! Rabbi Elazar said: These deteriorate and rise, and these deteriorate and do not rise.

hebrew_text: ״לָמָּה תַבִּיט בּוֹגְדִים תַּחֲרִישׁ כְּבַלַּע רָשָׁע צַדִּיק מִמֶּנּוּ״. אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: צַדִּיק מִמֶּנּוּ – בּוֹלֵעַ, צַדִּיק גָּמוּר – אֵינוֹ בּוֹלֵעַ.
human_translation: “Why do You observe the treacherous, and remain silent while the wicked swallows the one who is more righteous than he?” Rav Huna says One who is more righteous than he, he swallows he does not swallow a completely righteous person
llm_translation: "Why do you look at the treacherous, keep silent when the wicked swallows the righteous?" Rav Huna said: "The righteous being swallowed - he swallows, a completely righteous person - he does not swallow."

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: גֵּר צֶדֶק הָאָמוּר לְעִנְיַן מְכִירָה, וְגֵר תּוֹשָׁב הָאָמוּר לְעִנְיַן רִבִּית, אֵינִי יוֹדֵעַ מַה הוּא.
human_translation: It is taught Rabbi says: convert that is mentioned concerning the sale and ger toshav that is mentioned concerning interest, I do not know what is.
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi says: A righteous convert mentioned in the context of selling land, and a resident alien mentioned in the context of interest, I do not know what it is.

hebrew_text: גֵּר צֶדֶק הָאָמוּר לְעִנְיַן מְכִירָה, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְכִי יָמוּךְ אָחִיךָ עִמָּךְ וְנִמְכַּר לָךְ״. וְלֹא לְךָ, אֶלָּא לְגֵר, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״לְגֵר״.
human_translation: The convert that is mentioned concerning the sale as it is written: “If your brother waxes poor with you and is sold unto you” And not to you, but to a convert, as it is stated: to a stranger [ leger ]”
llm_translation: A righteous convert mentioned in the context of selling, as it is written: "And if your brother becomes poor with you and is sold to you." And not to you, but to a convert, as it is stated: "to a convert."

hebrew_text: וְלֹא לְגֵר צֶדֶק אֶלָּא לְגֵר תּוֹשָׁב, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״לְגֵר תּוֹשָׁב״. ״מִשְׁפַּחַת גֵּר״ – זֶה הַגּוֹי. כְּשֶׁהוּא אוֹמֵר ״אוֹ לְעֵקֶר״ – זֶה הַנִּמְכָּר לַעֲבוֹדָה זָרָה עַצְמָהּ.
human_translation: And not to a righteous convert [ leger tzedek ], but to a ger toshav , as it is stated: to a stranger who is a settler [ leger toshav ]” a stranger’s family,” this is a gentile, When it states: “Or to an offshoot this is one sold for idol worship itself,
llm_translation: "And not for a convert righteous, but for a resident alien, as it is stated: 'for a resident alien.' 'The family of a convert' - this refers to a non-Jew. When it says 'or for a eunuch' - this refers to one who has been sold for the purpose of idolatrous worship itself."

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: וְלֹא לְךָ אֶלָּא לְגֵר, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״לְגֵר״, לְמֵימְרָא דְּגֵר קָנֵי עֶבֶד עִבְרִי? ורְמִינְהִי: אֵין הַגֵּר נִקְנֶה בְּעֶבֶד עִבְרִי, וְאֵין אִשָּׁה וְגֵר קוֹנִין עֶבֶד עִבְרִי.
human_translation: The Master said: And not to you, but to a convert, as it is stated: to a stranger.” to say that a convert may acquire a Hebrew slave? raises a contradiction A convert cannot be acquired as a Hebrew slave, and a woman or a convert may not acquire a Hebrew slave.
llm_translation: The Master said: "And not for you, but for the convert, as it is stated: 'for the convert,' to say that a convert acquires a Hebrew slave? And raise a contradiction: A convert does not acquire a Hebrew slave, and neither a woman nor a convert acquires a Hebrew slave."

hebrew_text: גֵּר לֹא נִקְנֶה בְּעֶבֶד עִבְרִי: ״וְשָׁב אֶל מִשְׁפַּחְתּוֹ״ בָּעֵינַן, וְהָא לֵיכָּא. וְאֵין אִשָּׁה וְגֵר קוֹנִין עֶבֶד עִבְרִי: אִשָּׁה – לָאו אוֹרַח אַרְעָא. גֵּר נָמֵי גְּמִירִי: דְּמִקְּנֵי – קָנֵי, דְּלָא מִקְּנֵי – לָא קָנֵי.
human_translation: A convert cannot be acquired as a Hebrew slave, we require and shall return to his own family” and is not And a woman or a convert may not acquire a Hebrew slave. a woman, not proper conduct, a convert as well, is learned who can be acquired can acquire who cannot be acquired cannot acquire
llm_translation: A convert is not acquired through an Israelite slave: "And he shall return to his family" we require, but this is not applicable. And a woman and a convert do not acquire an Israelite slave: a woman – is not a way of the land. A convert, too, is learned: if he acquires – he acquires, if he does not acquire – he does not acquire.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: אֵינוֹ קוֹנֶה וְדִינוֹ כְּיִשְׂרָאֵל, אֲבָל קוֹנֶה וְדִינוֹ כְּגוֹי.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: He cannot acquire and his halakha of a Jew but he can acquire and his halakha of a gentile
llm_translation: Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: He does not acquire, and his judgment is like that of a Jew, but he acquires, and his judgment is like that of a gentile.

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא: הַנִּרְצָע וְהַנִּמְכָּר לְגוֹי אֵינוֹ עוֹבֵד לֹא אֶת הַבֵּן וְלֹא אֶת הַבַּת.
human_translation: as it is taught had his ear pierced and who was sold to a gentile, does not serve son and not daughter
llm_translation: Talmudic text: D'tanya: hanirtza v'hanimkar l'goy einu oved lo et haben v'lo et habat. English translation: It was taught in a Baraita: One who is killed or sold to a non-Jew does not work neither for the son nor for the daughter.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: וְאֵין אִשָּׁה וְגֵר קוֹנִין עֶבֶד עִבְרִי. נֵימָא דְּלָא כְּרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל? דְּתַנְיָא: אִשָּׁה קוֹנָה אֶת הַשְּׁפָחוֹת, וְאֵינָהּ קוֹנָה אֶת הָעֲבָדִים. רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: אַף קוֹנָה אֶת הָעֲבָדִים! אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל, וְלָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן – בְּעֶבֶד עִבְרִי, כָּאן – בְּעֶבֶד כְּנַעֲנִי.
human_translation: The Master said And a woman or a convert may not acquire a Hebrew slave. Let us say that not in accordance with Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel. As it is taught A woman may acquire maidservants but may not acquire slaves, Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: She may also acquire slaves. Even you say Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, not difficult. Here, with regard to a Hebrew slave, there, with regard to a Canaanite slave.
llm_translation: Master said: And a woman and a convert do not acquire a Hebrew slave. Should we say this is not like Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel? For it was taught: A woman acquires female slaves, but does not acquire male slaves. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: She also acquires male slaves! Even if you say it is Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, it is not difficult: here - with a Hebrew slave, here - with a Canaanite slave.

hebrew_text: עֶבֶד עִבְרִי צְנִיעַ לַהּ, עֶבֶד כְּנַעֲנִי פְּרִיץ לַהּ.
human_translation: A Hebrew slave discreet in her a Canaanite slave indiscreet in her
llm_translation: A Hebrew slave is modest to her, a Canaanite slave is brazen to her.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא הָא דְּתָנֵי רַב יוֹסֵף: אַרְמַלְתָּא לָא תְּרַבֵּי כַּלְבָּא, וְלָא תַּשְׁרֵי בַּר בֵּי רַב בְּאוּשְׁפִּיזָא. בִּשְׁלָמָא בַּר בֵּי רַב צְנִיעַ לַהּ, אֶלָּא כַּלְבָּא, כֵּיוָן דִּמְסָרֵיךְ בַּהּ מִירַתְּתָא! אָמְרִי: כֵּיוָן דְּכִי שָׁדְיָא לֵיהּ אוּמְצָא מְסָרֵיךְ בָּתְרַהּ, אָמְרִי אִינָשֵׁי: מִשּׁוּם אוּמְצָא דְּשָׁדְיָא לֵיהּ הוּא דִּמְסָרֵיךְ.
human_translation: But that Rav Yosef teaches: A widow may not raise a dog, and she may not allow a student as a lodger Granted, a student discreet in her But a dog, since it would follow her she is afraid say Since it will follow her if she throws it a piece of meat [ umtza ], people will say: It is following her due to the meat she threw to it,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Rather, this that Rav Yosef taught: A ramalta does not increase like a dog, and it is not permitted to leave a son of Rav in Aushpiza. Granted, a son of Rav is modest, but a dog, once it has been entrusted to you, will bark! They said: Once you have handed it over to him, you will find it barking afterwards. People say: Because it is the one that was handed over to him that barks.

hebrew_text: גֵּר תּוֹשָׁב הָאָמוּר לְעִנְיַן רִבִּית מַאי הִיא, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְכִי יָמוּךְ אָחִיךָ וּמָטָה יָדוֹ עִמָּךְ וְהֶחֱזַקְתָּ בּוֹ גֵּר וְתוֹשָׁב וָחַי עִמָּךְ. אַל תִּקַּח מֵאִתּוֹ נֶשֶׁךְ וְתַרְבִּית וְיָרֵאתָ מֵאֱלֹהֶיךָ וְחֵי אָחִיךָ עִמָּךְ״. וּרְמִינְהִי: לֹוִין מֵהֶן וּמַלְוִין אוֹתָן בְּרִבִּית, וְכֵן בְּגֵר תּוֹשָׁב!
human_translation: The ger toshav that was mentioned concerning interest, what is it? As it is written: “And if your brother waxes poor, and his means fail with you, then you shall strengthen him, as a stranger and a resident [ ger vetoshav ] shall he live with you. You may not take interest or increase from him, but fear your God, and your brother should live with you” And raises a contradiction One may borrow from them, and lend to them with interest, and similarly, a ger toshav
llm_translation: A resident alien who is spoken of in relation to interest, what is it? As it is written: "And if your brother becomes poor and his hand falters with you, then you shall strengthen him, a resident alien and a settler, and he shall live with you. Do not take from him interest or profit, but fear your God, and let your brother live with you." And ask: They lend to them and borrow from them with interest, and so too with a resident alien!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: מִי כְּתִיב ״אַל תִּקַּח מֵאִתָּם״? ״מֵאִתּוֹ״ כְּתִיב, מִיִּשְׂרָאֵל.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak says: Is it written: Do not take from them? it is written: from him,” from a Jew.
llm_translation: Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: Who is it written "do not take from them"? "From him" is written, from Israel.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״אַל תִּקַּח מֵאִתּוֹ נֶשֶׁךְ וְתַרְבִּית״ – אֲבָל אַתָּה נַעֲשֶׂה לוֹ עָרֵב.
human_translation: the Sages taught: “You may not take interest or increase from him,” but you may become a guarantor for him
llm_translation: The sages taught: "Do not take interest from him, interest and increase" - but you may become a guarantor for him.

hebrew_text: עָרֵב לְמַאן? אִילֵימָא עָרֵב לְיִשְׂרָאֵל, וְהָא תָּנָא: אֵלּוּ עוֹבְרִין בְּלֹא תַּעֲשֶׂה הַמַּלְוֶה וְהַלֹּוֶה, הֶעָרֵב וְהָעֵדִים!
human_translation: a guarantor for whom? If we say a guarantor for a Jew But the Sages taught These are the ones who transgress a prohibition: The lender and the borrower, the guarantor and the witnesses.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Arav le'man? Ileima arav le'Yisrael, ve'ha tana: Elu ovrim b'lo ta'aseh hamalveh ve'haloveh, he'arev ve'ha'edim!" English translation: "Who is the guarantor for? If you say the guarantor is for Israel, but it was taught: These are the ones who transgress without a negative commandment - the lender and the borrower, the guarantor and the witnesses!"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לְגוֹי וְכֵיוָן דְּדִינֵיהּ דְּגוֹי דְּאָזֵיל בָּתַר עָרְבָא, אִיהוּ נִיהוּ דְּקָא שָׁקֵיל מִינֵּיהּ רִבִּיתָא!
human_translation: Rather, for a gentile since the law of the gentiles is that he goes after the guarantor that is who takes the interest from
llm_translation: Rather for a non-Jew, and since his judgment is like that of a non-Jew who goes after the majority, he is the one who takes the interest from him!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: שֶׁקִּיבֵּל עָלָיו לָדוּן בְּדִינֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל. אִי קִיבֵּל עָלָיו לָדוּן בְּדִינֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל – רִבִּית נָמֵי לָא לִשְׁקוֹל! אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: שֶׁקִּיבֵּל עָלָיו לָזוֹ, וְלֹא קִיבֵּל עָלָיו לָזוֹ.
human_translation: Rav Sheshet said: that accepted upon himself to judged by the laws of the Jews, If accepted upon himself to judged by the laws of the Jews, he should also not take interest, Rav Sheshet said: He accepted upon himself with regard to this, but he did not accept upon himself with regard to that,
llm_translation: Rav Sheshet said: If he accepted upon himself to be judged by the laws of Israel. If he accepted upon himself to be judged by the laws of Israel - interest is not to be weighed! Rav Sheshet said: If he accepted upon himself to pay, and did not accept upon himself to pay.

hebrew_text: מַלְוֶה יִשְׂרָאֵל מְעוֹתָיו שֶׁל נׇכְרִי מִדַּעַת הַנׇּכְרִי כּוּ׳. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: מַלְוֶה יִשְׂרָאֵל מְעוֹתָיו שֶׁל נׇכְרִי מִדַּעַת הַנׇּכְרִי, אֲבָל לֹא מִדַּעַת יִשְׂרָאֵל, כֵּיצַד? יִשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁלָּוָה מָעוֹת מִן הַגּוֹי בְּרִבִּית וּבִיקֵּשׁ לְהַחְזִירָם לוֹ, מְצָאוֹ יִשְׂרָאֵל אַחֵר וְאָמַר לוֹ: תְּנֵם לִי וַאֲנִי אַעֲלֶה לָךְ כְּדֶרֶךְ שֶׁאַתָּה מַעֲלֶה לוֹ – אָסוּר. וְאִם הֶעֱמִידוּ אֵצֶל גּוֹי – מוּתָּר.
human_translation: A Jew may lend a gentile’s money with the knowledge of the gentile, The Sages taught A Jew may lend a gentile’s money with the knowledge of the gentile, but not with the knowledge of a Jew. How so? a Jew who borrowed money with interest from a gentile and wanted to return it to him, another Jew found and said to him: give it to me and I will pay you in the same way that you pay prohibited, But if presented to the gentile permitted.
llm_translation: Borrowing of Israel from the money of a gentile with the knowledge of the gentile, etc. The Rabbis taught: Borrowing of Israel from the money of a gentile with the knowledge of the gentile, but not with the knowledge of Israel. How so? If an Israelite borrowed money from a gentile with interest and sought to return it to him, another Israelite found him and said to him: "Give them to me, and I will pay you back as you would pay him" - prohibited. But if they stood by a gentile - permitted.

hebrew_text: וְכֵן גּוֹי שֶׁלָּוָה מָעוֹת מִיִּשְׂרָאֵל בְּרִבִּית וּבִיקֵּשׁ לְהַחְזִירָם לוֹ, מְצָאוֹ יִשְׂרָאֵל אַחֵר וְאָמַר לוֹ: תְּנֵם לִי וַאֲנִי אַעֲלֶה לְךָ כְּדֶרֶךְ שֶׁאַתָּה מַעֲלֶה לוֹ – מוּתָּר. וְאִם הֶעֱמִידוֹ אֵצֶל יִשְׂרָאֵל – אָסוּר.
human_translation: And similarly, if a gentile borrowed money with interest from a Jew and wanted to return it to him, another Jew found and said to him: Give it to me and I will pay you in the same way that you pay permitted, if presented to prohibited.
llm_translation: And so, a non-Jew who borrowed money from a Jew with interest and sought to return it to him, if another Jew found it and said to him: "Give it to me, and I will return it to you as you would have returned it to him" - it is permitted. But if he stood it up next to the Jew - it is forbidden.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא סֵיפָא, לְחוּמְרָא. אֶלָּא רֵישָׁא: כֵּיוָן דְּאֵין שְׁלִיחוּת לְגוֹי, אִיהוּ נִיהוּ דְּקָא שָׁקֵיל מִינֵּיהּ רִבִּיתָא?
human_translation: Granted, the latter clause a stringency but in the first clause since there is no agency for a gentile, is who takes the interest from
llm_translation: Talmudic text: In truth, the latter part is more stringent. Rather, the former part: Since there is no agency for a non-Jew, is it he or is it the lender who is taking interest from him?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב הוּנָא בַּר מָנוֹחַ מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב אַחָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אִיקָא: הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן – כְּגוֹן דַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ: הַנִּיחֵם עַל גַּבֵּי קַרְקַע וְהִיפָּטֵר. אִי הָכִי, מַאי לְמֵימְרָא?
human_translation: Rav Huna bar Manoaḥ said in the name of Rav Aḥa, son of Rav Ika: Here we are dealing with where said to Place it upon the ground and be dismissed, If that is so, what of stating
llm_translation: Rav Huna son of Manoah said in the name of Rav Acha son of Rava Ika: Here, with what are we dealing? For example, if one said to him: "Place them on the ground and be exempt." If so, what can be said?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: כְּגוֹן שֶׁנָּטַל וְנָתַן בַּיָּד. וְאַכַּתִּי, מַאי לְמֵימְרָא?! מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: גּוֹי גּוּפֵיהּ כִּי עָבֵיד – אַדַּעְתָּא דְּיִשְׂרָאֵל קָא גָמֵיר וְיָהֵיב, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: Rather, Rav Pappa said: where took and gave by hand. But still, what of stating Lest you say: The gentile himself, when he does this, he gives it with the knowledge of the Jew, teaches us
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Rather, Rav Papa said: For example, when he took and gave into the hand. But, what is there to say?! What you might think: When a non-Jew himself does it - the intent of a Jew is fulfilled and given, it is heard for us.

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: כִּי אָמְרִינַן אֵין שְׁלִיחוּת לְגוֹי – הָנֵי מִילֵּי בִּתְרוּמָה, אֲבָל בְּכׇל הַתּוֹרָה כּוּלָּהּ – יֵשׁ שְׁלִיחוּת לְגוֹי.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: When we say that there is no agency for a gentile, this matter concerning teruma , but concerning the rest of the Torah, there is agency for a gentile.
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said: When we say "there is no agency for a gentile," that applies to matters of terumah, but in all of the Torah, there is agency for a gentile.

hebrew_text: וְהָא דְּרַב אָשֵׁי בְּרוּתָא הִיא: מַאי שְׁנָא תְּרוּמָה דְּלָא, דִּכְתִיב ״אַתֶּם״ – ״גַּם אַתֶּם״: מָה אַתֶּם בְּנֵי בְּרִית – אַף שְׁלוּחֲכֶם נָמֵי בְּנֵי בְּרִית.
human_translation: And this of Rav Ashi is an error, what is different teruma cannot As it is written “you,” “you also” Just as you, members of the covenant, so too, your agents members of the covenant.
llm_translation: And this that Rav Ashe baruta said: What is the difference of terumah that is not, as it is written "you" - "also you": Just as you are sons of the covenant - so too your messengers are considered sons of the covenant.

hebrew_text: שְׁלִיחוּת דְּכׇל הַתּוֹרָה כּוּלָּהּ נָמֵי מִתְּרוּמָה גָּמְרִינַן לַהּ. אֶלָּא דְּרַב אָשֵׁי בְּרוּתָא הִיא.
human_translation: agency with regard to the rest of the Torah is also we learn from teruma , Rather, by Rav Ashi is an error.
llm_translation: Agency of all the Torah entirely we say from the terumah we conclude to it. Rather Rav Ashe son of Ruta it is.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי, אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: כִּי אָמְרִינַן אֵין שְׁלִיחוּת לְגוֹי הָנֵי מִילֵּי אִינְהוּ לְדִידַן, אֲבָל אֲנַן לְדִידְהוּ הָוֵינָא לְהוּ שְׁלִיחַ. וְהָא דְּרַב אָשֵׁי בְּרוּתָא הִיא, מַאי שְׁנָא אִינְהוּ לְדִידַן דְּלָא – דִּכְתִיב: ״אַתֶּם״ ״גַּם אַתֶּם״ – לְרַבּוֹת שְׁלוּחֲכֶם: מָה אַתֶּם בְּנֵי בְרִית – אַף שְׁלוּחֲכֶם בְּנֵי בְרִית.
human_translation: There are who say Rav Ashi said: When we say there is no agency for a gentile, this matter them for us, but we can be agents for them. And this of Rav Ashi is an error, what is different they cannot for us? As it is written “you,” “you also” to include your agents. Just as you, members of the covenant, so too, your agents members of the covenant.
llm_translation: There are those who say, Rav Ashe said: When we say "there is no agency for a gentile in these matters for us," but for their own matters, we are their agents. And what is the difference between them not being for us – as it is written: "You" "also you" – to include your agency: Just as "you" are sons of the covenant – so too, your agency are sons of the covenant.

hebrew_text: אֲנַן לְדִידְהוּ נָמֵי, מָה אַתֶּם בְּנֵי בְרִית קָאָמַר! אֶלָּא הָא דְּרַב אָשֵׁי בְּרוּתָא הִיא.
human_translation: we also for them, is said: Just as you, are children of the covenant, Rather, by Rav Ashi is an error.
llm_translation: We, according to them, also, what you, sons of the covenant, are saying! Rather, that which Rav Ashe bar Ruta said.

hebrew_text: רָבִינָא אָמַר: נְהִי דִּשְׁלִיחוּת לְגוֹי לֵית לֵיהּ, זְכִיָּה מִדְּרַבָּנַן אִית לֵיהּ, מִידֵּי דְּהָוֵי אַקָּטָן. קָטָן לָאו אַף עַל גַּב דְּלֵית לֵיהּ שְׁלִיחוּת,
human_translation: Ravina says Granted, a gentile is not agency. he has by rabbinic law, acquire similar to minor. a minor, is it not that even though he is not of agency,
llm_translation: Ravina said: "A non-Jew does not have agency, but he has merit from the Rabbis, as he is considered like a minor. A minor, even though he does not have agency,

hebrew_text: אִית לֵיהּ זְכִיָּה מִדְּרַבָּנַן. הָכָא נָמֵי לָא שְׁנָא.
human_translation: he has by rabbinic law, acquire Here, also, is not different;
llm_translation: There is merit to his argument from the Rabbis. Here, it is not different.

hebrew_text: וְלָא הִיא: יִשְׂרָאֵל אָתֵי לִכְלַל שְׁלִיחוּת, נׇכְרִי לָא אָתֵי לִכְלַל שְׁלִיחוּת.
human_translation: But is not so. Jew will reach agency, a gentile will not reach for agency.
llm_translation: And not this: Yisrael comes to include agency, a non-Jew does not come to include agency.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: יִשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁלָּוָה מָעוֹת מִן הַנׇּכְרִי בְּרִבִּית, וּזְקָפָן עָלָיו בְּמִלְוֶה, וְנִתְגַּיֵּיר. אִם קוֹדֶם שֶׁנִּתְגַּיֵּיר זְקָפָן עָלָיו בְּמִלְוֶה – גּוֹבֶה אֶת הַקֶּרֶן וְגוֹבֶה אֶת הָרִבִּית. וְאִם לְאַחַר שֶׁנִּתְגַּיֵּיר זְקָפָן עָלָיו בְּמִלְוֶה – גּוֹבֶה אֶת הַקֶּרֶן וְאֵינוֹ גּוֹבֶה אֶת הָרִבִּית.
human_translation: The Sages taught: a Jew who borrowed money with interest from a gentile, and established as a loan for and converted, If established it as a loan for him before he converted, he may collect the principal and he may collect the interest. But if he established it as a loan for him after he converted, he may collect the principal but may not collect the interest,
llm_translation: The sages taught: If an Israelite borrowed money from a non-Jew with interest, and then converted to Judaism, if the interest was collected from him while he was still a non-Jew - he must pay back the principal and pay the interest. But if the interest was collected from him after he converted - he must pay back the principal but is not required to pay the interest.

hebrew_text: וְכֵן נׇכְרִי שֶׁלָּוָה מָעוֹת מִיִּשְׂרָאֵל בְּרִבִּית וּזְקָפָן עָלָיו בְּמִלְוֶה וְנִתְגַּיֵּיר, אִם עַד שֶׁלֹּא נִתְגַּיֵּיר זְקָפָן עָלָיו בְּמִלְוֶה – גּוֹבֶה אֶת הַקֶּרֶן וְגוֹבֶה אֶת הָרִבִּית. אִם מִשֶּׁנִּתְגַּיֵּיר זְקָפָן עָלָיו בְּמִלְוֶה – גּוֹבֶה אֶת הַקֶּרֶן וְאֵינוֹ גּוֹבֶה אֶת הָרִבִּית.
human_translation: And similarly, a gentile who borrowed money with interest from a Jew and established as a loan for and converted, if he established it as a loan before he converted, may collect the principal and may collect the interest. If he established it as a loan for after he converted, he may collect the principal but may not collect the interest,
llm_translation: And so, a gentile who borrowed money from a Jew with interest, and then converted, if before he converted the interest was collected from him as part of the loan, he must pay both the principal and the interest. But if after he converted the interest was collected from him as part of the loan, he must pay the principal but is not required to pay the interest.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: נׇכְרִי שֶׁלָּוָה מָעוֹת מִיִּשְׂרָאֵל בְּרִבִּית, בֵּין כָּךְ וּבֵין כָּךְ – גּוֹבֶה אֶת הַקֶּרֶן וְגוֹבֶה אֶת הָרִבִּית. אָמַר רָבָא אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי. אָמַר רָבָא: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי – כְּדֵי שֶׁלֹּא יֹאמְרוּ בִּשְׁבִיל מְעוֹתָיו נִתְגַּיֵּיר זֶה.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: If a gentile borrowed money with interest from a Jew whether this or whether that may collect the principal and he may collect the interest. Rava says Rav Ḥisda says Rav Huna says: halakha in accordance with Rabbi Yosei. Rava says: What is the reasoning of Rabbi Yosei? in order that people will not say: This converted due to his money.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: A non-Jew who borrows money from a Jew with interest, whether this way or that way - he should pay back the principal and pay back the interest. Rava said in the name of Rav Hisda who said in the name of Rav Huna: The halakha is according to Rabbi Yosei. Rava said: What is the reason for Rabbi Yosei's opinion? - So that people will not say that he converted for the sake of his money.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: שְׁטָר שֶׁכָּתוּב בּוֹ רִבִּית – קוֹנְסִין אוֹתוֹ, וְאֵינוֹ גּוֹבֶה לֹא אֶת הַקֶּרֶן וְלֹא אֶת הָרִבִּית, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: גּוֹבֶה אֶת הַקֶּרֶן וְאֵינוֹ גּוֹבֶה אֶת הָרִבִּית. בְּמַאי קָמִיפַּלְגִי? רַבִּי מֵאִיר סָבַר: קָנְסִינַן הֶתֵּירָא מִשּׁוּם אִיסּוּרָא, וְרַבָּנַן סָבְרִי: לָא קָנְסִינַן הֶתֵּירָא מִשּׁוּם אִיסּוּרָא.
human_translation: The Sages taught: note in which interest were written, we penalize and he may not collect the principal and may not collect the interest; the statement of Rabbi Meir. And the Rabbis say: He may collect the principal but he may not collect the interest. With regard to what do they disagree? Rabbi Meir holds: We penalize permitted due to prohibited, and the Rabbis hold: We do not penalize permitted due to prohibited.
llm_translation: The sages taught: A document in which interest is written - we acquire it, but one does not collect either the principal or the interest, these are the words of Rabbi Meir. And the sages say: One collects the principal but does not collect the interest. What are they arguing about? Rabbi Meir holds: We acquire it to prevent transgression, and the sages hold: We do not acquire it to prevent transgression.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן הָתָם: שְׁטָרֵי חוֹב הַמּוּקְדָּמִין – פְּסוּלִין, וְהַמְאוּחָרִין – כְּשֵׁרִין. מוּקְדָּמִין אַמַּאי פְּסוּלִין? נְהִי דְּלָא גְּבוֹ מִזְּמַן רִאשׁוֹן, נִיגְבּוֹ מִזְּמַן שֵׁנִי!
human_translation: We learned elsewhere Antedated promissory notes, are not valid, but postdated are valid. Why antedated not valid? Granted, they cannot collect from the first date, they should collect from the second date,
llm_translation: We learned there: promissory notes that are advanced - invalid, and those that are delayed - valid. Why are the advanced ones invalid? Because they have not yet reached the first designated time, but they have reached the second designated time!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן לָקִישׁ: בְּמַחְלוֹקֶת שְׁנוּיָה, וְרַבִּי מֵאִיר הִיא. וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא רַבָּנַן – גְּזֵירָה שֶׁמָּא יִגְבֶּה מִזְּמַן רִאשׁוֹן.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish says: is subject to dispute, and it is Rabbi Meir, And Rabbi Yoḥanan says: You even say the Rabbis, decree lest he collect from the first date.
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said: In a dispute that is repeated, and it is Rabbi Meir's. And Rabbi Yochanan said: Even if you say the Rabbis - a decree lest he become arrogant from the first time.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא גַּבְרָא דְּמַשְׁכֵּין לֵיהּ פַּרְדֵּיסָא לְחַבְרֵיהּ, אַכְלַהּ תְּלָת שְׁנֵי. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִי מְזַבְּינַתְּ לַהּ נִיהֲלִי – מוּטָב, וְאִי לָא – כָּבֵישְׁנָא לַהּ לִשְׁטַר מַשְׁכַּנְתָּא וְאָמֵינָא: ״לְקוּחָה הִיא בְּיָדִי״.
human_translation: a certain man who mortgaged his orchard to another consumed three years. said to If you sell me the good. But if not, I will hide the document of the mortgage and I will say: It is purchased, in my possession,
llm_translation: That man who was pulling his friend's garden, his ox ate three years. He said to him: If you want to pay me, it is better, and if not, I will take you to court and say, "It is in my possession."

hebrew_text: אֲזַל קָם אַקְנְיַיהּ לִבְנוֹ קָטָן, וַהֲדַר זַבְּנַהּ נִיהֲלֵיהּ.
human_translation: He went and transferred to his minor son and afterward sold to
llm_translation: He went, he acquired for his son small, and then he sold it to him.

hebrew_text: זְבִינֵי וַדַּאי לָא הָווּ זְבִינֵי. זוּזֵי כְּמִלְוֶה בִּשְׁטָר דָּמוּ וְגוֹבֶה מִנְּכָסִים מְשׁוּעְבָּדִים, אוֹ דִילְמָא כְּמִלְוֶה עַל פֶּה דָּמוּ וְאֵינוֹ גּוֹבֶה מִנְּכָסִים מְשׁוּעְבָּדִים? אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: וְלָאו הַיְינוּ דְּרַבִּי אַסִּי, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אַסִּי:
human_translation: The sale was certainly not a sale, the dinars similar to a loan with note, and can collect from liened property Or perhaps it is similar to a loan by oral and he cannot collect from liened property Abaye said: Is this not Rabbi Asi? Rabbi Asi says:
llm_translation: The sale of sureties is not considered a sale. This is like a loan documented with a promissory note, where the lender collects from encumbered properties, or perhaps it is like a loan based on verbal agreement, where the lender does not collect from encumbered properties? Abaye said: This is not the same as what Rabbi Assi said, as Rabbi Assi said:

hebrew_text: מוֹדֶה בִּשְׁטָר שֶׁכְּתָבוֹ – אֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ לְקַיְּימוֹ, וְגוֹבֶה מִנְּכָסִים מְשׁוּעְבָּדִים.
human_translation: admits that he wrote note, is not required to ratify it and he collect from liened property
llm_translation: He who admits in a document that he wrote - does not need to fulfill it, and collection from encumbered properties.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא: מִי דָּמֵי? הָתָם נִיתַּן לְהִכָּתֵב. הָכָא לֹא נִיתַּן לְהִכָּתֵב.
human_translation: Rava said to him: Are comparable? There, may be written, here, may not be written,
llm_translation: He said to him, Rava: Who is similar? There it was given to be written. Here it was not given to be written.

hebrew_text: יָתֵיב מָרִימָר וְקָאָמַר לְהָא שְׁמַעְתָּא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבִינָא לְמָרִימָר: אֶלָּא הָא דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן גְּזֵירָה שֶׁמָּא יִגְבֶּה מִזְּמַן רִאשׁוֹן, נֵימָא: לֹא נִיתַּן לִיכָּתֵב! אֲמַר לֵיהּ הָכִי הַשְׁתָּא. הָתָם נְהִי דְּלֹא נִיתַּן לִיכָּתֵב מִזְּמַן רִאשׁוֹן, אֲבָל נִיתַּן לִיכָּתֵב מִזְּמַן שֵׁנִי. הָכָא לֹא נִיתַּן לִיכָּתֵב כְּלָל.
human_translation: Mareimar sat and stated this halakha . Ravina said to Mareimar: But that which Rabbi Yoḥanan said decree lest he collect from the first date, let us say may not be written. said to him: How can be compared? There, granted, it may not be written from the first date, but it may be written from the second date. Here, it may not be written at all.
llm_translation: Sitting Marimar and saying to him. Said to him Ravina to Marimar: Rather this that said Rabbi Yochanan decree lest he become haughty from the first time, say: Not given to be written! Said to him thus now. There, yes that not given to be written from the first time, but given to be written from the second time. Here not given to be written at all.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא הָא דְּתַנְיָא: לְשֶׁבַח קַרְקָעוֹת כֵּיצַד? הֲרֵי שֶׁגָּזַל שָׂדֶה מֵחֲבֵירוֹ וּמְכָרָהּ לְאַחֵר וְהִשְׁבִּיחָהּ, וַהֲרֵי הִיא יוֹצְאָה מִתַּחַת יָדוֹ. כְּשֶׁהוּא גּוֹבֶה – גּוֹבֶה אֶת הַקֶּרֶן מִנְּכָסִים מְשׁוּעְבָּדִים, וְשֶׁבַח גּוֹבֶה מִנְּכָסִים בְּנֵי חוֹרִין. נֵימָא: לֹא נִיתַּן לִיכָּתֵב!
human_translation: But that which is taught What for enhancement of land? one robbed another of a field and sold it to another enhanced it, and it is appropriated from his possession. When collects he collects the principal, from liened property and he collects enhancement from unsold property. Let us say may not be written,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Rather, as it was taught: For the praise of the earth, how so? Behold, if one stole a field from his fellow and sold it to another, and he improved it, yet it is considered as having left his possession. When he collects – he collects the principal from encumbered property, and the interest he collects from free property. Let it be said: It should not be written down!

hebrew_text: הָכִי הַשְׁתָּא? הָתָם, אִי לְמַאן דְּאָמַר נִיחָא לֵיהּ דְּלָא נִיקְרְיֵיהּ גַּזְלָנָא, אִי לְמַאן דְּאָמַר נִיחָא לֵיהּ דְּלֵיקוּם בְּהֵימָנוּתֵיהּ, מְפַיֵּיס לֵיהּ לְמָרֵיהּ וּמוֹקֵים לֵיהּ לִשְׁטָרֵיהּ. הָכָא, לְאַבְרוֹחֵי מִינֵּיהּ קָמְכַוֵּין, שְׁטָרָא מְקַיֵּים לֵיהּ.
human_translation: How can be compared? There, either according to the one who says that it is preferable for not to be called a robber or according to the one who says that it is preferable for to maintain his reliability, will appease the owner of the field and ratify his document here, intends to remove ratify his document?
llm_translation: So what is the difference? There, whether according to the one who says it is preferable for him that he not be called a thief, or according to the one who says it is preferable for him that he be trusted in his faithfulness, he appeases his master and fulfills his obligations. Here, they arise to protest against him, and a document is established for him.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אֵין פּוֹסְקִין עַל הַפֵּירוֹת עַד שֶׁיֵּצֵא הַשַּׁעַר. יָצָא הַשַּׁעַר – פּוֹסְקִין, וְאַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵין לָזֶה יֵשׁ לָזֶה.
human_translation: One may not set for produce until the rate is publicized, the rate is publicized, may set even though this one, does not have that one, has
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: We do not conclude regarding the fruits until the gate is closed. Once the gate is closed, we conclude, even though there is no "this" and there is "this."

hebrew_text: הָיָה הוּא תְּחִילָּה לַקּוֹצְרִים, פּוֹסֵק עִמּוֹ עַל הַגָּדִישׁ, וְעַל הֶעָבִיט שֶׁל עֲנָבִים, וְעַל הַמַּעֲטָן שֶׁל זֵיתִים, וְעַל הַבֵּיצִים שֶׁל יוֹצֵר, וְעַל הַסִּיד מִשֶּׁשִּׁקְּעוֹ בַּכִּבְשָׁן.
human_translation: was first among the reapers, may set with for a stack or for basket of grapes or for a vat [ hama’atan ] of olives or for the clumps [ habeitzim ] by a potter, or for plaster after he has sunk it, in the kiln.
llm_translation: He was initially for the reapers, he stops with him on the stack, and on the cluster of grapes, and on the vat of olives, and on the eggs of a potter, and on the lime that he placed in the furnace.

hebrew_text: וּפוֹסֵק עִמּוֹ עַל הַזֶּבֶל כׇּל יְמוֹת הַשָּׁנָה. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: אֵין פּוֹסְקִין עַל הַזֶּבֶל אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן הָיְתָה לוֹ זֶבֶל בָּאַשְׁפָּה, וַחֲכָמִים מַתִּירִים.
human_translation: And he may set with for manure any the days of the year, Rabbi Yosei says: One may set of manure only if he had of manure in dunghill but the Rabbis permit it
llm_translation: And he may break with him on the dung all days of the year. Rabbi Yosei says: One may not break on the dung unless there was dung in the ash, and the sages permit.

hebrew_text: וּפוֹסֵק עִמּוֹ בְּשַׁעַר הַגָּבוֹהַּ. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁלֹּא פָּסַק עִמּוֹ בְּשַׁעַר הַגָּבוֹהַּ, יָכוֹל לוֹמַר: תֵּן לִי כָּזֶה, אוֹ תֵּן לִי אֶת מְעוֹתַי.
human_translation: And one may set with at the highest rate, Rabbi Yehuda says: Even if he did not set with him at the highest rate, may say Give me at this or give me my money.
llm_translation: And he concludes with him at the high gate. Rabbi Yehuda says: Even though he did not conclude with him at the high gate, he can say to him: Give me this or give me my wages.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רַבִּי אַסִּי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אֵין פּוֹסְקִין עַל הַשַּׁעַר שֶׁבַּשּׁוּק. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי זֵירָא לְרַבִּי אַסִּי: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אֲפִילּוּ כַּדּוֹרְמוּס הַזֶּה? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אֶלָּא בַּשּׁוּק שֶׁל עֲיָירוֹת, דְּלָא קְבִיעִי תַּרְעַיְיהוּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Asi says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: One may not set at the market rate Rabbi Zeira said to Rabbi Asi: Rabbi Yoḥanan state even with regard to this central market [ dormus ]? said to him: Rabbi Yoḥanan stated only with regard to the town markets, since their rates are not fixed,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemara said Rabbi Assi said Rabbi Yochanan: Not decide on the gate in the market. Said to him Rabbi Zeira to Rabbi Assi: Said Rabbi Yochanan even like this dormus? Said to him: Not said Rabbi Yochanan except in the market of towns, that their gates are not fixed.

hebrew_text: וּלְמַאן דִּסְלֵיק אַדַּעְתִּין מֵעִיקָּרָא דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אֲפִילּוּ כַּדּוֹרְמוּס הַזֶּה, אֶלָּא מַתְנִיתִין דְּקָתָנֵי: אֵין פּוֹסְקִין עַל הַפֵּירוֹת עַד שֶׁיֵּצֵא הַשַּׁעַר, יָצָא הַשַּׁעַר פּוֹסְקִין, הֵיכִי מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ? מַתְנִיתִין בְּחִיטֵּי דְּאַכְלַבֵּי וְאַרְבֵי, דִּמְשִׁוךְ תַּרְעַיְהוּ טְפֵי.
human_translation: And according to what we thought initially, that Rabbi Yoḥanan stated even with regard to this large market, but the mishna, which teaches: One may not set for produce until the rate is publicized. the rate is publicized, one may set how can you find these mishna about wheat warehouses and ships, as their rate lasts longer,
llm_translation: And for one who removes his mind from the beginning, as Rabbi Yochanan said, even like this Dormus, but the Mishnah teaches: We do not stop at the fruits until the gate is reached, once the gate is reached, we stop. How do you forget it? The Mishnah with wheat that is eaten by dogs and wolves, for they pull it with their mouths.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אֵין פּוֹסְקִין עַל הַפֵּירוֹת עַד שֶׁיֵּצֵא הַשַּׁעַר, יָצָא הַשַּׁעַר פּוֹסְקִין, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵין לָזֶה יֵשׁ לָזֶה. הָיוּ חֲדָשׁוֹת מֵאַרְבַּע וִישָׁנוֹת מִשָּׁלֹשׁ – אֵין פּוֹסְקִין עַד שֶׁיֵּצֵא הַשַּׁעַר לֶחָדָשׁ וְלַיָּשָׁן.
human_translation: The Sages taught: One may not set for produce until the rate is publicized. the rate is publicized, may set even though this one, does not have that one, has new was at four and the old at three, one may not set until the rate is publicized for the new and for the old
llm_translation: The sages taught: One does not make a ruling on fruits until the gate is closed. Once the gate is closed, one may make a ruling, even though there is some fresh and some old produce. If there are new fruits from the fourth year and old fruits from the third year - one does not make a ruling until the gate is closed for both the new and the old.

hebrew_text: הָיוּ לָקוֹטוֹת מֵאַרְבַּע, וּלְכׇל אָדָם מִשָּׁלֹשׁ – אֵין פּוֹסְקִין עַד שֶׁיֵּצֵא הַשַּׁעַר לַלּוֹקֵט וְלַמּוֹכֵר.
human_translation: if the gleaners at four and of every person at three may not set until the rate is publicized for a gleaner and for seller.
llm_translation: They were gathering from four, and for every person from three - they do not stop until the gate goes out to the gatherer and the seller.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: פּוֹסְקִין לַלָּקוֹטוֹת כְּשַׁעַר הַלָּקוֹטוֹת. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא לְרַב נַחְמָן: מַאי שְׁנָא לָקוֹט דְּאִי לֵית לֵיהּ יָזֵיף מִלָּקוֹט חַבְרֵיהּ, בַּעַל הַבַּיִת נָמֵי יְזֵיף מִלָּקוֹט! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: בַּעַל הַבַּיִת זִילָא בֵּיהּ מִילְּתָא לְמֵיזַף מִלָּקוֹט. אִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: מַאן דְּיָהֵיב זוּזֵי לְבַעַל הַבַּיִת – אַפֵּירֵי שַׁפִּירֵי יָהֵיב.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman said: One may set for gleaners at the gleaners’ rate. Rava said to Rav Naḥman: What is different a gleaner, As, if he has no he can borrow it from another gleaner, A homeowner as well borrow from a gleaner. said to him: degrading a homeowner to borrow from a gleaner. if you wish, say One who gives money to a homeowner gives for quality produce,
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said: We stop for the gleaners like the gate of the gleaners. Rava said to Rav Nachman: What difference does it make if one gleaner is not as diligent in gleaning as his fellow gleaners, the homeowner also is not as diligent in gleaning! He said to him: The homeowner should go and be diligent in order to encourage gleaning. If you wish, I can say: Whoever gives money to the homeowner – it is better to give it beautifully.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: אֵין לֹוִין עַל שַׁעַר שֶׁבַּשּׁוּק. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב יוֹסֵף בַּר חָמָא לְרַב שֵׁשֶׁת, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ רַב יוֹסֵי בַּר אַבָּא לְרַב שֵׁשֶׁת: וּמִי אָמַר רַב הוּנָא הָכִי? וְהָא בָּעֵי מִינֵּיהּ מֵרַב הוּנָא: הָנֵי בְּנֵי בֵּי רַב, דְּיָזְפִי בְּתִשְׁרִי וּפָרְעִי בְּטֵבֵת, שְׁרֵי אוֹ אֲסִיר? אֲמַר לְהוּ: הָא חִיטֵּי בְּהִינֵי וְהָא חִיטֵּי בְּשִׁילֵי, אִי בָּעֵי זָבְנִי וּפָרְעִי לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rav Sheshet says Rav Huna says: One may not borrow on the market rate, Rav Yosef bar Ḥama said to Rav Sheshet, and some say that Rav Yosei bar Abba to Rav Sheshet: And did Rav Huna say this? But asked Rav Huna: those students who borrow in Tishrei and pay in Tevet permitted or prohibited? said to them: There is wheat in Hini and there is wheat in Shili, and if want they can buy and pay
llm_translation: Rav Sheshet said in the name of Rav Huna: One may not lodge at the gate in the market. Rav Yosef bar Ḥama said to Rav Sheshet, and some say it was Rav Yosei bar Abba who said to Rav Sheshet: Did Rav Huna really say this? But he wanted to learn from Rav Huna: Those sons of the household of Rav, who gather in Tishrei and disperse in Tevet, are they permitted or forbidden? He said to them: These are wheat in the granary and these are wheat in the field; if he wants, he can buy and sell.

hebrew_text: מֵעִיקָּרָא סָבַר רַב הוּנָא אֵין לֹוִין, כֵּיוָן דְּשַׁמְעַהּ לְהָא דְּאָמַר רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר חִיָּיא אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: לֹוִין, אָמַר אִיהוּ נָמֵי: לֹוִין.
human_translation: Initially, Rav Huna thought one may not borrow but when he heard that Rabbi Shmuel bar Ḥiyya says Rabbi Elazar says: One may borrow he also said one may borrow
llm_translation: From the outset, Rav Huna thought they do not collect. Once he heard what Rabbi Shmuel bar Chiya said in the name of Rabbi Elazar: they do collect, he also said: they collect.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הַמּוֹלִיךְ חֲבִילָה מִמָּקוֹם לְמָקוֹם, מְצָאוֹ חֲבֵירוֹ וְאָמַר לוֹ: תְּנָהּ לִי וַאֲנִי אַעֲלֶה לְךָ כְּדֶרֶךְ שֶׁמַּעֲלִין לְךָ בְּאוֹתוֹ מָקוֹם.
human_translation: The Sages taught: one who transports a package from one place, to another place, another found him and said to him: Give me and I will pay you in the manner that they pay you in that place
llm_translation: The rabbis taught: One who carries a bundle from place to place, if he finds his friend and says to him: "Give it to me, and I will carry it for you as far as we ascend for you in that place."

hebrew_text: בִּרְשׁוּת מוֹכֵר – מוּתָּר, בִּרְשׁוּת לוֹקֵחַ – אָסוּר.
human_translation: in the possession of the seller, permitted, in the possession of the buyer, prohibited,
llm_translation: In the domain of the seller - permitted, in the domain of the buyer - prohibited.

hebrew_text: הַמּוֹלִיךְ פֵּירוֹת מִמָּקוֹם לְמָקוֹם, מְצָאוֹ חֲבֵירוֹ וְאָמַר לוֹ: תְּנֵם לִי וַאֲנִי אַעֲלֶה לְךָ פֵּירוֹת שֶׁיֵּשׁ לִי בְּאוֹתוֹ מָקוֹם, אִם יֵשׁ לוֹ פֵּירוֹת בְּאוֹתוֹ מָקוֹם – מוּתָּר, וְאִם לָאו – אָסוּר. וְהַחַמָּרִין מַעֲלִים בִּמְקוֹם הַיּוֹקֶר כְּבִמְקוֹם הַזּוֹל, וְאֵינָן חוֹשְׁשִׁין.
human_translation: one who transports produce from place to place, another finds him and says to him: Give to me and I will repay you with produce that I have in that place if he has produce in that place, permitted, but if not, prohibited. But donkey drivers set in a place expensive according to another place, inexpensive and need not be concerned,
llm_translation: One who leads fruits from place to place, if his fellow found him and said to him: "Give them to me, and I will bring you fruits that I have in that place," if he has fruits in that place - it is permitted, and if not - it is forbidden. And donkeys may ascend in a place of expense as in a place of cheapness, and they are not concerned.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא? רַב פָּפָּא אָמַר: נִיחָא לְהוּ דִּמְגַלּוּ לְהוּ תַּרְעָא. רַב אַחָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אִיקָא אָמַר: נִיחָא לְהוּ דְּמוֹזְלִי גַּבַּיְיהוּ.
human_translation: What is the reason Rav Pappa says: satisfactory to them the gates are opened for them, Rav Aḥa, son of Rav Ika, said: satisfactory to them because are reduced for them
llm_translation: What is the reason? Rav Papa said: It is preferable for them that the ox be revealed to them. Rav Acha, son of Rav Ika, said: It is preferable for them that they remove their backs.

hebrew_text: מַאי בֵּינַיְיהוּ? אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ תַּגָּרָא חַדְתָּא.
human_translation: What is between The between them a merchant new
llm_translation: What is the difference between them? There is a new roof between them.

hebrew_text: בְּסוּרָא אָזְלִי אַרְבָּעָה אַרְבְּעָה, בְּכַפְרִי אָזְלָן שִׁיתָּא שִׁיתָּא. יָהֵיב רַב זוּזֵי לְחַמָּרֵי וּ[מְ]קַבֵּיל עֲלֵיהּ אוּנְסָא דְאוֹרְחָא, וְשָׁקֵיל מִינַּיְיהוּ חַמְשָׁה. וְנִשְׁקוֹל שִׁיתָּא! אָדָם חָשׁוּב שָׁאנֵי.
human_translation: In Sura, four were going in Kafri they were going six Rav gave money to donkey drivers and accepted upon himself accident on the way, and he accepted five from them. he should have accepted six An important person is different,
llm_translation: In Sura, they went four by four, in Kapri they went six by six. Rav gave coins to the donkey drivers and accepted from them the customary fare, and took from them five. And he received six! A person of importance is different.

hebrew_text: בְּעָא מִינֵּיהּ רַבִּי אַסִּי מֵרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מַהוּ לַעֲשׂוֹת בִּגְרוּטָאוֹת כֵּן? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: בִּיקֵּשׁ רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל בְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי לַעֲשׂוֹת כֵּן בִּכְלֵי פִשְׁתָּן, וְלֹא הִנִּיחוֹ רַבִּי. אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: בִּיקֵּשׁ רַבִּי לַעֲשׂוֹת בִּגְרוּטָאוֹת כֵּן, וְלֹא הִנִּיחוֹ רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל בְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי.
human_translation: Rabbi Asi asked Rabbi Yoḥanan: What is doing so with scraps [ bigerutaot ]? said to him: Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yosei, wanted to do so with linen garments and Rabbi did not allow him There are who say Rabbi wanted to do so with scraps, and Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yosei, did not permit him
llm_translation: Requested text translation: Rabbi Assi asked Rabbi Yochanan: What is the ruling regarding handling fig cakes in this manner? He said to him: Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yose, sought to handle linen garments in this way, but Rabbi did not allow it. Some say: Rabbi sought to handle fig cakes in this way, but Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yose, did not allow it.

hebrew_text: פַּרְדֵּיסָא, רַב אָסַר וּשְׁמוּאֵל שָׁרֵי. רַב אָסַר, כֵּיוָן דִּלְקַמֵּיהּ שָׁוְיָא טְפֵי – מִתְחֲזֵי כִּי אֲגַר נְטַר לֵיהּ. וּשְׁמוּאֵל שָׁרֵי, כֵּיוָן דְּהָוֵי בֵּיהּ תִּיוְהָא – לָא מִיחֲזֵי כִּי אֲגַר נְטַר לֵיהּ.
human_translation: orchard, Rav prohibits and Shmuel permits Rav prohibits because in the future be worth more, it appears that is paying to for waiting And Shmuel permits there can be spoilage it does not appear that is paying to for waiting
llm_translation: The orchard: Rav prohibited, and Shmuel permitted. Rav prohibited, since when it is before him, it appears as though he is a hired watchman. And Shmuel permitted, since when there is a mark on it, it does not appear as though he is a hired watchman.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב שִׁימִי בַּר חִיָּיא: וּמוֹדֵי רַב בְּתוֹרֵי דִּנְפִישׁ פְּסֵידַיְיהוּ.
human_translation: Rav Shimi bar Ḥiyya said: Rav concedes in oxen as their loss is great.
llm_translation: Rav Shimi bar Ḥiyya said: And Rav concedes in matters where they incur a loss.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לְהוּ שְׁמוּאֵל לְהָנְהוּ דְּשָׁבְשִׁי שִׁבְשָׁא, הֲפוֹכוּ בְּאַרְעָא, כִּי הֵיכִי דִּקְנֵי לְכוּ גּוּפָא דְאַרְעָא, וְאִי לָא – הָוְיָא לְכוּ כְּהַלְוָאָה וְאָסוּר.
human_translation: Shmuel said to those who purchase branches of grapevines turn over the land so that you acquire the land itself for yourselves, And if not it will be like a loan for you and prohibited
llm_translation: Shmuel said to them of Shavshi Shavsha, turn it over in the land, so that you may acquire the ownership of the land, and if not, it will be like a loan and forbidden.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לְהוּ רָבָא לְהָנְהוּ דִּמְנַטְּרִי בָּאגֵי: פּוּקוּ הֲפוֹכוּ בְּבֵי דָרֵי, כִּי הֵיכִי דְּלָא תִּשְׁתַּלַּם שְׂכִירוּת דִּידְכוּ עַד הַהִיא שַׁעְתָּא, דִּשְׂכִירוּת אֵינָהּ מִשְׁתַּלֶּמֶת אֶלָּא בַּסּוֹף, וְהַהִיא שַׁעְתָּא אוֹזוֹלֵי דְּקָא מוֹזְלִי גַּבַּיְיכוּ.
human_translation: Rava said to those who guard fields [ bagei ] Go out turn over in the threshing floor, in order that the wages for your hire are not payable until that time. wage only at the end it is then that make a reduction for
llm_translation: Rava said to those who were guarding the fruits: Go out, turn over the barrels in the houses, so that your wages will not be absorbed until that hour, for wages are not absorbed except at the end, and at that hour the wine drips and flows into the barrels.

hebrew_text: אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ רַבָּנַן לְרָבָא: קָא אָכֵיל מָר רִבִּית, דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא שָׁקְלִי אַרְבְּעָה וּמְסַלְּקִי לְאָרִיסָא בְּנִיסָן, מָר נָטַר לְהוּ עַד אִיָּיר וְשָׁקֵיל שִׁיתָּא!
human_translation: The Rabbis said to Rava: The Master, consumes interest. Everyone receives four and remove the sharecropper in Nisan. the Master waits until Iyar and takes six
llm_translation: The sages said to Rava: He is eating bitter herbs, everyone should take four and give to the plowman in Nissan, the master guarded them until Iyar and took six!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לְהוּ: אַתּוּן קָא עָבְדִיתוּן שֶׁלֹּא כַּדִּין, אַרְעָא לְאָרִיס מִשְׁתַּעְבַּד – אִי אַתּוּן מְסַלְּקִיתוּ לְהוּ בְּנִיסָן, מַפְסֵידְתּוּ לְהוּ בְּכַמָּה. אֲנָא נָטַרְנָא לְהוּ עַד אִיָּיר, וּמַרְוַוחְנָא לְהוּ בְּכַמָּה.
human_translation: said to them: you are acting unlawfully, the land is liened to the sharecropper If you remove in Nisan you cause them to lose a great I wait for them until Iyyar, and I enable them to profit a great
llm_translation: He said to them: You are doing it not according to the law, the land belongs to the tenant. If you remove them in Nissan, you cause them a loss. I will wait for them until Iyar, and I will give them respite for a while.

hebrew_text: רַב מָרִי בַּר רָחֵל מַשְׁכֵּן לֵיהּ הָהוּא גּוֹי בֵּיתָא. הֲדַר זַבְּנֵהּ לְרָבָא. נְטַר תְּרֵיסַר יַרְחֵי שַׁתָּא, שְׁקַל אֲגַר בֵּיתָא אַמְטִי לֵיהּ לְרָבָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הַאי דְּלָא אַמְטַאי לְמָר אֲגַר בֵּיתָא עַד הָאִידָּנָא, דִּסְתַם מַשְׁכַּנְתָּא שַׁתָּא, אִי בָּעֵי גּוֹי לְסַלֹּקֵי לָא הֲוָה מָצֵי מְסַלֵּק לִי, הַשְׁתָּא לִשְׁקוֹל מָר אֲגַר בֵּיתָא.
human_translation: A certain gentile mortgaged a house to Rav Mari bar Raḥel Afterward, sold to Rava. waited twelve months the year took rent the house brought it to Rava, said to This that I did not bring the rental the house to the Master until now because unspecified mortgage one year. If gentile wanted to remove he could not remove me let the Master now take the rental the house
llm_translation: Rav Mari son of Rachel rented a house to that non-Jew. He then sold it to Rava. The non-Jew guarded it for twelve months, collected the rent of the house, and gave it to Rava. He said to him: This rent of the house that I have not given to the master until now, since the house was closed for a year, if the non-Jew wants to remove me, he would not have found me removing it, now I will give the rent of the house to the master.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִי הֲוָה יָדַעְנָא דַּהֲוָה מְמוּשְׁכַּן לֵיהּ לְמָר, לָא הֲוָה זָבֵינְנָא לֵיהּ. הַשְׁתָּא כְּדִינֵיהֶם עָבֵידְנָא לָךְ, כׇּל אֵימַת דְּלָא מְסַלְּקִי בְּזוּזֵי לָא שָׁקֵיל אֲגַר בֵּיתָא. אֲנָא נָמֵי לָא שָׁקֵילְנָא מִינָּךְ אֲגַר בֵּיתָא עַד דִּמְסַלֵּקְנָא לָךְ בְּזוּזֵי.
human_translation: said to him: Had I known that was mortgaged to the Master, I would not have purchased it Now, I will act toward you according to the law as long as does not remove by money, does not take a rental the house, I too will not take a rental the house from you until I remove you by money
llm_translation: He said to him: If we had known that he was drawing close to our master, we would not have sold him. Now, we will do as they do, whenever we do not remove the mezuzot, we do not take rent for the house. I, too, will not take rent from you until I remove the mezuzot for you.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא מִבַּרְנִישׁ לְרַב אָשֵׁי: חֲזִי מָר רַבָּנַן דְּקָא אָכְלִי רִבִּיתָא, דְּיָהֲבִי זוּזֵי אַחַמְרָא בְּתִשְׁרִי וּמְבַחֲרִי לֵהּ בְּטֵבֵת!
human_translation: Rava of Barnish said to Rav Ashi: The Master sees the Sages who consume interest, as they give money for wine in Tishrei, and they select in Tevet.
llm_translation: He said to him, Rava from Barnish to Rav Ashe: "See, Master, the Rabbis are eating a ribita, giving a zuz of wine in Tishrei and the best in Tevet to him!"

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִינְהוּ נָמֵי אַחַמְרָא קָא יָהֲבִי, אַחַלָּא לָא קָא יָהֲבִי – מֵעִיקָּרָא דְּחַמְרָא חַמְרָא, דְּחַלָּא חַלָּא, הָהִיא שַׁעְתָּא הוּא דְּקָמְבַחֲרִי.
human_translation: said to him: They too gave for wine, they did not give for vinegar. That which was wine at the outset is wine, that vinegar was vinegar It was at that time that they selected
llm_translation: He said to him: They are giving wine, they are not giving vinegar - from the beginning of the wine, it is wine, from the beginning of vinegar, it is vinegar, that is the time when one chooses.

hebrew_text: רָבִינָא הֲוָה יָהֵיב זוּזֵי לִבְנֵי אַקְרָא דְּשַׁנְווֹתָא וְשָׁפְכִי לֵיהּ טְפֵי כּוּפִיתָא. אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב אָשֵׁי, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מִי שְׁרֵי? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִין, אַחוֹלֵי הוּא דְּקָא מָחֲלִי גַּבָּךְ.
human_translation: Ravina would give money to the people of the fortress [ akra ] at Shanvata and they would pour an extra jug [ kufita ] for him came before Rav Ashi said to him: Is it permitted said to him: Yes, they forgo to your
llm_translation: Ravina was giving coins to the children of the village of Shantvata, and he poured out for them handfuls of small coins. He came before Rav Ashi, who said to him: "Who is permitted?" He said to him: "No one, it is sand that is rubbing against your cheek."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָא אַרְעָא לָאו דִּידְהוּ הִיא! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אַרְעָא לְטַסְקָא מְשַׁעְבְּדָא. וּמַלְכָּא אָמַר: מַאן דְּיָהֵיב טַסְקָא – לֵיכוֹל אַרְעָא.
human_translation: said to him: But the land is not theirs. said to him: The land is liened as taxes [ letaska ], and the king says: Whoever pays the tax may consume the land.
llm_translation: He said to him: This land is not theirs! He said to him: The land belongs to the tax collector. And the king said: Whoever gives tax, may he be able to have the land.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב פָּפָּא לְרָבָא: חֲזִי מָר הָנֵי רַבָּנַן דְּיָהֲבִי זוּזֵי אַכְּרָגָא דְּאִינָשֵׁי וּמְשַׁעְבְּדִי בְּהוּ טְפֵי! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הַשְׁתָּא אִיכּוֹ שְׁכֵיבִי לָא אֲמַרִי לְכוּ הָא מִילְּתָא. הָכִי אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: מוּהְרְקַיְיהוּ דְּהָנֵי בְּטֻפְסָא דְמַלְכָּא מַנַּח, וּמַלְכָּא אָמַר: מַאן דְּלָא יָהֵיב כְּרָגָא לִשְׁתַּעְבַּיד לְמַאן דְּיָהֵיב כְּרָגָא!
human_translation: Rav Pappa said to Rava: the Master see these Sages who pay money for the tax [ akarga ] on people and make them work more said to him: Now, if I were dead I could not say this matter to you, this is what Rav Sheshet said: The document [ moharkayyhu ] of these lies in the treasury of the king, and the king said: The one who does not pay the head tax shall serve the one who does pay the head tax,
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Papa to Rava: "See, master, those scholars who give coins to the innkeeper and serve them with wine! He said to him: "Now, if they would lie down, they would not say to you this matter." So said Rav Sheshet: "They have already been freed from the obligation of the king's tax, and the king said: 'Whoever does not give coins to serve should serve the one who gives coins!'"

hebrew_text: רַב סְעוּרָם אֲחוּהּ דְּרָבָא הֲוָה תָּקֵיף אִינָשֵׁי דְּלָא מְעַלּוּ וּמְעַיֵּיל לְהוּ בְּגוּהַרְקָא דְּרָבָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא: שַׁפִּיר קָא עָבְדַתְּ, דִּתְנֵינָא: רְאִית[וֹ] שֶׁאֵינוֹ נוֹהֵג כַּשּׁוּרָה, מִנַּיִן שֶׁאַתָּה רַשַּׁאי לְהִשְׁתַּעְבֵּד בּוֹ – תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״לְעוֹלָם בָּהֶם תַּעֲבֹדוּ וּבְאַחֵיכֶם״. יָכוֹל אֲפִילּוּ נוֹהֵג כַּשּׁוּרָה – תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וּבְאַחֵיכֶם בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל אִישׁ בְּאָחִיו וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: Rav Se’oram, the brother of Rava, would forcefully people who were not properly and carry Rava’s sedan chair. Rava said to him: You acted correctly, as we learn: If you see who does not behave properly, from where that you are permitted to have him work The verse states: “Of them you may take your slaves forever; and over your brothers” might even if acts properly. the verse states “And over your brothers the children of Israel one over another,
llm_translation: Rav Se'uram, the brother of Rava, was strict with people who did not act properly, and he would bring them to Rava's bakery. Rava said to him: "You have done well, as we were taught: 'If you see that someone does not behave properly, from where do you have permission to engage with him? - The Torah says: "You shall surely rebuke your fellow, and do not bear sin because of him."' You might think that even if he behaves properly - the Torah says: "And your brothers, the children of Israel, each man in his brother's care, etc."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חָמָא: הַאי מַאן דְּיָהֵיב זוּזֵי לְחַבְרֵיהּ לְמִיזְבַּן לֵיהּ חַמְרָא וּפְשַׁע וְלָא זְבַין לֵיהּ – מְשַׁלֵּם לֵיהּ כִּדְקָא אָזֵיל אַפַּרְווֹתָא דְזוּלְשְׁפָט.
human_translation: Rav Ḥama said: one who gave money to another to purchase wine for him, and was negligent and did not purchase for him, must pay according to the going in the port of Zolshefat,
llm_translation: Rav Ḥama said: One who gives money to his friend to buy wine, and he buys vinegar instead, he must pay him as he goes to the market of Zulshafat.
