hebrew_text: אָמַר אַמֵּימָר אַמְרִיתָא לִשְׁמַעְתָּא קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב זְבִיד מִנְּהַרְדְּעָא, אָמַר: כִּי קָאָמַר רַב חָמָא, הָנֵי מִילֵּי בְּ״יַיִן״ סְתָם, אֲבָל בְּ״יַיִן זֶה״ – לָא, מִי יֵימַר דִּמְזַבְּנִי לֵיהּ נִיהֲלֵיהּ?
human_translation: Ameimar said: I said this halakha before Rav Zevid of Neharde’a, he said: When Rav Ḥama said that statement in wine without specification But if this wine not who says that would have sold it to him?
llm_translation: אָמַר - said אַמֵּימָר - Amemar (name) אַמְרִיתָא - statement לִשְׁמַעְתָּא - for hearing קַמֵּיהּ - before him דְּרַב זְבִיד - Rav Zevid (name) מִנְּהַרְדְּעָא - from Nehardea (place) אָמַר - said כִּי - when קָאָמַר - said רַב חָמָא - Rav Hama (name) הָנֵי - those מִילֵּי - words בְּ״יַיִן״ - in wine סְתָם - generally אֲבָל - but בְּ״יַיִן זֶה״ - in this wine לָא - not מִי - who יֵימַר - will say דִּמְזַבְּנִי - that I will buy לֵיהּ - it נִיהֲלֵיהּ - and drink it

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ ״יַיִן״ סְתָם נָמֵי לָא, מַאי טַעְמָא – אַסְמַכְתָּא הִיא, וְאַסְמַכְתָּא לָא קָנְיָא.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: Even without specification, also not What is the reason is a transaction with inconclusive consent [ asmakhta ], and an asmakhta does not effect acquisition,
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said: Even "wine" in general is not considered a valid acquisition. What is the reason? It is merely a support, and a support does not effect acquisition.

hebrew_text: וּלְרַב אָשֵׁי מַאי שְׁנָא מֵהָא דִּתְנַן: ״אִם אוֹבֵיר וְלָא אֶעֱבֵיד אֲשַׁלֵּם בְּמֵיטְבָא״, הָתָם בְּיָדוֹ,
human_translation: And to Rav Ashi, what is different from that which we learned If I let lie fallow and do not cultivate I will pay with the best There, in his power,
llm_translation: And for Rav Ashi, what is different from what we learned: "If I transgress and do not fulfill, I will pay with the best," there it is in his hand,

hebrew_text: הָכָא לָאו בְּיָדוֹ.
human_translation: here, not in his power
llm_translation: Here, it is not in his hand.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: הָנֵי בֵּי תְלָתָא דְּיָהֲבִי זוּזֵי לְחַד לְמִזְבַּן לְהוּ מִידֵּי וּזְבַן לְחַד מִינַּיְיהוּ – זְבַן לְכוּלְּהוּ. וְלָא אֲמַרַן אֶלָּא דְּלָא צָר וַחֲתֵים אִינִישׁ אִינִישׁ לְחוֹדֵיהּ. אֲבָל צָר וַחֲתֵים אִינִישׁ אִינִישׁ לְחוֹדֵיהּ, לְמַאן דִּזְבַן – זְבַן, וּלְמַאן דְּלָא זְבַן – לָא זְבַן.
human_translation: Rava said: these three who gave money to one to purchase an item for them and purchased for one of them, has purchased for all of them. And we said only did not wrap up and seal each person’s separately But he wrapped up and sealed each person’s separately he purchased for the one for whom he purchased and he did not purchase for those for whom he did not purchase
llm_translation: Rava said: Those three individuals who contribute money for one altar, each one intending to purchase a separate sacrifice – if they all buy together, they all acquire a share in all the sacrifices. And we only said this when each one did not specify his portion. But if each one specified his portion, whoever buys – buys, and whoever does not buy – does not buy.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פַּפִּי מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרָבָא: הַאי סִיטוּמְתָּא – קָנְיָא. לְמַאי הִלְכְתָא? רַב חֲבִיבָא אֲמַר: לְמִקְנֵיא מַמָּשׁ.
human_translation: Rav Pappi said in the name of Rava: this a marker [ situmta ], effects acquisition With regard to what halakha Rav Ḥaviva said: to actually effect acquisition,
llm_translation: Rav Pappi said in the name of Rava: This sityumta - a reed. For what halakha? Rav Chaviva said: For actual acquisition.

hebrew_text: רַבָּנַן אָמְרִי: לְקַבּוֹלֵי עֲלֵיהּ מִי שֶׁפָּרַע.
human_translation: the Rabbis said: to accept upon himself He Who exacted payment
llm_translation: The sages said: To receive upon it one who pays.

hebrew_text: וְהִלְכְתָא לְקַבּוֹלֵי עֲלֵיהּ ״מִי שֶׁפָּרַע״. וּבְאַתְרָא דִּנְהִיגוּ לְמִקְנֵי מַמָּשׁ – קָנוּ.
human_translation: And the halakha to accept upon himself He Who exacted payment. in a place where the custom is that it actually effects acquisition it effects acquisition
llm_translation: The halakha is in accordance with those who hold "mi sheparah." And in the place where they are accustomed to acquire with actual money - they acquired.

hebrew_text: הָיָה הוּא תְּחִלָּה לַקּוֹצְרִים. אָמַר רַב: מְחוּסָּר שְׁתַּיִם – פּוֹסֵק. שָׁלֹשׁ – אֵינוֹ פּוֹסֵק. וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: בִּידֵי אָדָם – אֲפִילּוּ מֵאָה פּוֹסֵק. בִּידֵי שָׁמַיִם – אֲפִילּוּ אַחַת אֵינוֹ פּוֹסֵק.
human_translation: was first among the reapers, Rav says: two lacking, he may set three he may not set And Shmuel says: by human hands, even one hundred he may set by the hand of Heaven, even one he may not set
llm_translation: He was initially for the reapers. Rav said: If it is lacking two - he stops. If it is lacking three - he does not stop. And Shmuel said: In the hands of man - even a hundred he stops. In the hands of Heaven - not even one he stops.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: פּוֹסֵק עִמּוֹ עַל הַגָּדִישׁ, וְהָא מְחוּסָּר מִשְׁדֵּא בְּחַמָּה לְמֵיבַשׁ וּלְמֵידַשׁ וּמִידְרֵא! כְּגוֹן דִּשְׁדָא בְּחַמָּה וִיבַשׁ.
human_translation: We learned that he may set on a stack But lacking: Placing it in the sun to dry, and threshing, and winnowing. where he placed it in the sun and it dried.
llm_translation: We learned in the Mishnah: One may cut it with him on the threshing floor, and this is lacking from the barley due to the heat, to dry and to thresh, and immediately! For example, it is dry due to the heat and it dries up.

hebrew_text: וְלִשְׁמוּאֵל, דְּאָמַר: בִּידֵי שָׁמַיִם אֲפִילּוּ אַחַת אֵינוֹ פּוֹסֵק, וְהָא מְחוּסָּר מִידְרֵא, דְּבִידֵי שָׁמַיִם הִיא – אֶפְשָׁר בְּנָפְווֹתָא.
human_translation: And according to Shmuel, who says: by the hand of Heaven even one he may not set is lacking winnowing, which is by the hand of Heaven, It is possible with sieves
llm_translation: To Samuel, who said: "By the hands of Heaven, even one does not cease, and this is lacking from the beginning, for it is by the hands of Heaven – it is possible in the case of a miscarriage."

hebrew_text: וְעַל הֶעָבִיט שֶׁל עֲנָבִים. וְהָא מְחוּסָּר מִכְמַר, וְעַיּוֹלֵי לְבֵי מַעְצַרְתָּא, לְמֵידַשׁ וּלְמִנְגַּד! כִּדְתָנֵי רַבִּי חִיָּיא: עַל הַכּוֹמֶר שֶׁל זֵיתִים, הָכָא נָמֵי עַל הַכּוֹמֶר שֶׁל עֲנָבִים.
human_translation: for basket of grapes. But lacking: Warming bringing to the winepress, treading and drawing as Rabbi Ḥiyya teaches, for a stack [ hakomer ] of olives, here also, for a stack of grapes.
llm_translation: Regarding the grape cluster. And this is lacking from vinegar, and the attendants of the Ma'atzarta, to sanctify and to oppose! As Rabbi Chiya taught: concerning the olive press, here it is stated concerning the grape cluster.

hebrew_text: וְהָא מְחוּסְּרֵי תְּלָת! בְּאַתְרָא דְּהָהוּא דְּזָבֵין הוּא דְּנָגֵיד.
human_translation: But three lacking. a place where the one who purchases the one who draws
llm_translation: And this is lacking three! In the place where those who sell are, he who is in charge.

hebrew_text: וְעַל הַמַּעֲטָן שֶׁל זֵיתִים. וְהָא מְחוּסָּר מִכְמַר וְעַיּוֹלֵי לְבֵי דַפֵּי לְמֵידַשׁ וּלְמִנְגַּד! תָּנֵי רַבִּי חִיָּיא: עַל כּוֹמֶר שֶׁל זֵיתִים. הָא אִיכָּא תְּלָת! בְּאַתְרָא דְּהָהוּא דְּזָבֵין הָהוּא (מְנַגֵּיד).
human_translation: for a vat of olives. But lacking: Warming bringing to the olive press, pressing and drawing Rabbi Ḥiyya teaches For a stack of olives But there are three a place where the one who purchases the one who draws
llm_translation: And on the small basket of olives. And this is lacking from vinegar and the leaves of the fig tree for the altar and for against! Rabbi Chiya taught: On the heap of olives. There are three! In the place where that one sells, that one (declares).

hebrew_text: וְעַל הַבֵּיצִים שֶׁל יוֹצֵר. אַמַּאי? וְהָא מְחוּסָּר לָפוֹפֵי וְיַבּוֹשֵׁי, עַיּוֹלֵי לְאַתּוּנָא לְמִשְׂרַף וּלְמִיפַּק! כְּגוֹן דִּמְלָפְפָה וִיבִישׁוּ. וְהָא אִיכָּא תְּלָת! בְּאַתְרָא דְּהָהוּא דְּזָבֵין הוּא דְּמַפֵּיק.
human_translation: for the clumps by a potter. Why But lacking: Rolling drying putting into the kiln, burning and removing where they were rolled and dried. But there are three a place where the one who purchases the one who removes
llm_translation: Regarding the eggs of a hen. Why? Because they are lacking in puffiness and dryness, they are suitable for a furnace and for baking! For example, if they were roasted and dried. And there are three! In the place where they are laid, that is where they are produced.

hebrew_text: וְעַל הַסִּיד מִשֶּׁיְּשַׁקְּעֶנּוּ בַּכִּבְשָׁן. וְהָא מְחוּסָּר מִקְלֵה וְאַפּוֹקֵי וּמֵידַק! בְּאַתְרָא דְּהָהוּא דְּזָבֵין הָהוּא דָּיֵיק. וְלִשְׁמוּאֵל דְּאָמַר: בִּידֵי אָדָם אֲפִילּוּ מֵאָה פּוֹסֵק, לְמָה לִי מִשֶּׁיְּשַׁקְּעֶנּוּ בַּכִּבְשָׁן? אֵימָא ״מִשֶּׁרָאוּי לְשַׁקְּעוֹ בַּכִּבְשָׁן״.
human_translation: for plaster after he has sunk it in the kiln. But lacking: Burning and removing and grinding a place where the one who purchases the one who grinds And of Shmuel, who says by human hands even one hundred one may set why do I after he has sunk it in the kiln? Say: When it is fit to be sunk in the kiln.
llm_translation: On the plaster, from when one immerses it in the lime. And this is lacking a stick, a poker, and a sieve! In the place where those who sell are, there is one who is precise. And to Shmuel who said: "In the hands of a person, even a hundred decisions, why do I need from when one immerses it in the lime? Say, "When it is fitting to immerse it in the lime."

hebrew_text: וְעַל הַבֵּיצִים שֶׁל יוֹצֵר. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אֵין פּוֹסְקִים עַל הַבֵּיצִים שֶׁל יוֹצֵר עַד שֶׁיֵּעָשׂוּ, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי: בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים – בְּעָפָר לָבָן, אֲבָל בְּעָפָר שָׁחוֹר, כְּגוֹן כְּפַר חֲנַנְיָא וְחַבְרוֹתֶיהָ, כְּפַר שִׁיחִין וְחַבְרוֹתֶיהָ – פּוֹסְקִין, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵין לְזֶה יֵשׁ לְזֶה.
human_translation: for the clumps by a potter. The Sages taught: may not set for the clumps of a potter until they are formed; the statement of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yosei says: In what is this statement said? with regard to white earth but with regard to black earth, such as Kefar Ḥananya and its environs, Kefar Shiḥin and its environs, may set even if this one does not that one does have
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And regarding the eggs of a hen that is forming an egg. The Rabbis taught: One does not render a decision concerning the eggs of a hen that is forming until they are made, the words of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yosei said: In what case are these matters spoken of? - In white dust, but in black dust, such as the village of Hananya and its surroundings, the village of Shihin and its surroundings - one renders a decision, even though one does not have this, one has that.

hebrew_text: אַמֵּימָר יָהֵיב זוּזֵי מִכִּי מְעַיְּילִי עַפְרָא. כְּמַאן? אִי כְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר, הָאָמַר: עַד שֶׁיֵּעָשׂוּ. אִי כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי, הָאָמַר: אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵין לְזֶה יֵשׁ לְזֶה! לְעוֹלָם כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי, וּבְאַתְרֵיהּ דְּאַמֵּימָר עֲשִׁיק עַפְרָא: אִי דִּמְעַיְּילִי עַפְרָא סָמְכָא דַּעְתֵּיהּ וְיָהֵיב לְהוּ זוּזֵי, וְאִי לָא – לָא סָמְכָא דַּעְתֵּיהּ.
human_translation: Ameimar gave money from the clay was brought into In accordance with whose If in accordance with Rabbi Meir, doesn’t say until they are formed, if in accordance with Rabbi Yosei, doesn’t say even though this one does not have that one have Actually, in accordance with Rabbi Yosei, in Ameimar’s locale earth was scarce, if the clay was brought into he relied on this and gave the money, but if not, he did not rely
llm_translation: Ammemar gave money for the purchase of land. According to whom? If according to Rabbi Meir, who said: "Until they are made." If according to Rabbi Yosei, who said: "Even though this one has no right, that one has a right!" Indeed, it is ruled according to Rabbi Yosei, and in the place of Ammemar, he would press the land: If the land is suitable, he would rely on his judgment and give them the money, and if not - he would not rely on his judgment.

hebrew_text: וּפוֹסֵק עִמּוֹ עַל הַזֶּבֶל כׇּל יְמוֹת הַשָּׁנָה. חֲכָמִים הַיְינוּ תַּנָּא קַמָּא? אָמַר רָבָא:
human_translation: one may set with him for manure any the days of the year, the Rabbis is the first tanna , Rava said:
llm_translation: And he (the Kohen) concludes with him (the Metzora) regarding the dung all the days of the year. The Sages, is that the first Tanna? Rava said:

hebrew_text: יְמוֹת הַגְּשָׁמִים – אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ.
human_translation: between them the rainy season.
llm_translation: The days of rain - there is a difference between them.

hebrew_text: וּפוֹסֵק עִמּוֹ כְּשַׁעַר הַגָּבוֹהַּ.
human_translation: One may set at the highest rate,
llm_translation: And he concludes with him like the gate of the high.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא גַּבְרָא דִּיהַיב זוּזֵי לִנְדוּנְיָא דְּבֵי חֲמוּהּ, לְסוֹף זַל נְדוּנְיָא. אֲתוֹ לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב פָּפָּא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִי פְּסַקְתְּ (עִמּוֹ) כְּשַׁעַר הַגָּבוֹהַּ – שְׁקֹל כִּהַשְׁתָּא. וְאִי לָא – שְׁקֹל כִּי מֵעִיקָּרָא.
human_translation: a certain man who gave money for dowry [ linduneya ] of his father-in-law, Ultimately, the dowry became less expensive, came before Rav Pappa said to If you set with at the highest rate, take at the present But if not, take at initially.
llm_translation: That man who gave money to the collectors of the house of his father-in-law, at the end the collectors came. They came before Rav Papa. He said to them: If you have settled with him like the gate of the high wall - take like the current price. But if not - take like the original amount.

hebrew_text: אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ רַבָּנַן לְרַב פָּפָּא: וְאִי לָא פְּסַק – שָׁקֵיל כְּמֵעִיקָּרָא? מָעוֹת נִינְהוּ, וּמָעוֹת לָא קָנוּ! אֲמַר לְהוּ: אֲנָא נָמֵי לְקַבּוֹלֵי עֲלֵיהּ ״מִי שֶׁפָּרַע״ קָא אָמֵינָא. אִי פְּסַק כְּשַׁעַר הַגָּבוֹהַּ, מוֹכֵר קָא הָדַר בֵּיהּ, מְקַבֵּל עֲלֵיהּ מוֹכֵר ״מִי שֶׁפָּרַע״. אִי לָא פְּסַק – לוֹקֵחַ קָא הָדַר בֵּיהּ, מְקַבֵּל עֲלֵיהּ לוֹקֵחַ ״מִי שֶׁפָּרַע״.
human_translation: The Sages said to Rav Pappa: And if he did not set must he take at initially? This is money, and money does not effect acquisition. said to them: I also I said with regard to accepting upon himself He Who exacted payment. If set at the highest rate the seller retracted, the seller accepts upon himself He Who exacted payment. if did not set buyer, retracted, the buyer accepts upon himself He Who exacted payment.
llm_translation: The sages said to Rav Papa: If he did not finalize - should he take it back like the original? They are coins, and coins were not acquired! He said to them: I too agree with the one who says "one who pays." If he finalized it like a high gate, he is a seller who returns it, and the buyer accepts from him "one who pays." If he did not finalize - he is a buyer who returns it, and the seller accepts from him "one who pays."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבִינָא לְרַב פָּפָּא: וּמִמַּאי דְּרַבָּנַן הִיא דִּפְלִיגִי עֲלֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן דְּאָמְרִי מָעוֹת לָא קָנוּ, וַאֲפִילּוּ הָכִי: אִי פְּסַק כְּשַׁעַר הַגָּבוֹהַּ – שָׁקֵיל כִּדְהַשְׁתָּא, אִי לָא פְּסַק – שָׁקֵיל כִּדְמֵעִיקָּרָא,
human_translation: Ravina said to Rav Pappa: From where that is the Rabbis who disagree with Rabbi Shimon and say money does not effect acquisition? And even so, if he set at the highest rate, he takes at the current if he did not set he takes at initially.
llm_translation: Ravina said to Rav Papa: And from what do the Rabbis argue with regard to the opinion of Rabbi Shimon who said: "Coins do not acquire"? And even so: If it stopped at the height of the wall - he acquires like now, and if it did not stop - he acquires like originally.

hebrew_text: דִּלְמָא רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן הִיא, דְּאָמַר מָעוֹת קוֹנוֹת: וְכִי פְּסַק כְּשַׁעַר הַגָּבוֹהַּ – שָׁקֵיל כִּי הַשְׁתָּא, אִי לָא פְּסַק – שָׁקֵיל כְּמֵעִיקָּרָא, מִשּׁוּם דְּקָנֵי לְהוּ זוּזֵי. אֲבָל לְרַבָּנַן, בֵּין פְּסַק בֵּין לָא פְּסַק – שָׁקֵיל כִּי הַשְׁתָּא, דְּדַעְתֵּיהּ דְּאִינִישׁ אַתַּרְעָא זִילָא!
human_translation: Perhaps is Rabbi Shimon, who says money effects acquisition, and if he set at the highest rate, he takes at the current if he did not set he takes at initially, since money effects acquisition. But according to the Rabbis, whether he set or did not set he takes at the current because a person’s intention at the least expensive price.
llm_translation: Perhaps it is Rabbi Shimon, for he said: "Money acquires." And if he stopped like the high gate - he takes now, if he did not stop - he takes like the original, because he acquires for them the right to move. But according to the Rabbis, whether he stopped or did not stop - he takes now, for the mind of a person is not settled!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֵימוֹר דְּאָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בְּחַד תַּרְעָא, בִּתְרֵי תַּרְעֵי מִי אָמַר? דְּאִי לָא תֵּימָא הָכִי, ״מִי שֶׁפָּרַע״ בְּלוֹקֵחַ – לְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן לֵית לֵיהּ!
human_translation: said to him: Say that Rabbi Shimon said where one price, Did he say where two prices? As, if you do not say so, He Who exacted payment, will not to the buyer according to Rabbi Shimon.
llm_translation: He said to him: Say that which Rabbi Shimon said in one Tare'a, in two Tare'ei who said? For if you do not say so, "Whoever pays" in the buyer - to Rabbi Shimon it does not apply!

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא: הָכִי נָמֵי, וְהָתַנְיָא: מִכׇּל מָקוֹם כָּךְ הֲלָכָה, אֲבָל אָמְרוּ חֲכָמִים ״מִי שֶׁפָּרַע״ כּוּ׳.
human_translation: And if you would say: Indeed, isn’t it taught in any case, that is halakha But said He Who exacted payment
llm_translation: And if you will say: thus indeed, and it was taught: from every place so is the halakha, but the sages said, "one who damages" etc.

hebrew_text: מַאי מִכׇּל מָקוֹם? לָאו דְּלָא שְׁנָא לוֹקֵחַ וְלָא שְׁנָא מוֹכֵר מְקַבֵּל עֲלֵיהּ ״מִי שֶׁפָּרַע״? אֶלָּא כִּי קָאָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן: בְּחַד תַּרְעָא, בִּתְרֵי תַּרְעֵי לָא אָמַר.
human_translation: What In any case? not there is no difference the buyer and there is no difference the seller accepts upon himself He Who exacted payment? Rather, when Rabbi Shimon is saying where one price, where two prices he did not say
llm_translation: What is meant by "from any place"? It is not that it is different for a buyer and not different for a seller, that he accepts "one who pays." Rather, Rabbi Shimon said: In one fold, he did not say in two folds.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אַחָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרָבָא לְרַב אָשֵׁי: וְתִיפּוֹק לֵיהּ דְּשָׁלִיחַ שַׁוְּיֵיהּ מֵעִיקָּרָא! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: בְּתַגָּרָא דְּזָבֵין וּמְזַבֵּין.
human_translation: Rav Aḥa, son of Rava, said to Rav Ashi: But let derive initially made an agent, said to him: a merchant who buys and sells
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Acha, son of Rava, said to Rav Ashi: And let him go out, for his messenger was appointed from the outset! He said to him: In the case of buying and selling.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ מַלְוֶה אָדָם אֶת אֲרִיסָיו חִטִּין בְּחִטִּין לְזֶרַע, אֲבָל לֹא לֶאֱכוֹל. שֶׁהָיָה רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל מַלְוֶה אֶת אֲרִיסָיו חִטִּין בְּחִטִּין לְזֶרַע, בְּיוֹקֶר וְהוּזְלוּ, אוֹ בְּזוֹל וְהוּקְרוּ – נוֹטֵל מֵהֶן כְּשַׁעַר הַזּוֹל. וְלֹא מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהֲלָכָה כֵּן, אֶלָּא שֶׁרָצָה לְהַחְמִיר עַל עַצְמוֹ.
human_translation: A person may lend wheat to his sharecroppers for wheat, of seeding, But he may not to eat As Rabban Gamliel would lend wheat to his sharecroppers for wheat, of seeding, at a high price and the price fell, or at an inexpensive price and the price rose, he would take from them at the inexpensive price. But not because this is halakha ; rather, he wanted to be stringent with himself.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: A person may lend wheat to his sharecropper for planting, but not for eating. Rabban Gamliel used to lend wheat to his sharecropper for planting, whether it was expensive or cheap, and whether it was abundant or scarce – he would take from them at the market price. And not because the halakha is so, but because he wanted to be stringent upon himself.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: מַלְוֶה אָדָם אֶת אֲרִיסָיו חִטִּים בְּחִטִּים לְזֶרַע. בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים – שֶׁלֹּא יָרַד, אֲבָל יָרַד אָסוּר. מַאי שְׁנָא תַּנָּא דִּידַן דְּלָא קָא מְפַלֵּיג בֵּין יָרַד וּבֵין לֹא יָרַד, וּמַאי שְׁנָא תַּנָּא בָּרָא דְּקָא מְפַלֵּיג בֵּין יָרַד וּבֵין לֹא יָרַד?
human_translation: The Sages taught A person may lend wheat to his sharecroppers for wheat, of seeding. In what is this statement said? when has not gone down but gone down prohibited. What is different the tanna of our who does not differentiate between went down or did not go down, and what is different the tanna of the baraita , who does differentiate between he went down or he did not go down?
llm_translation: The Sages taught: One may lend his tenant wheat with wheat for seeding. Under what circumstances are these matters stated? - That he did not descend, but if he descended, it is prohibited. What is the difference between our Mishna that does not differentiate between whether he descended or did not descend, and the Mishna of Bara that differentiates between whether he descended or did not descend?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא, רַבִּי אִידִי אַסְבְּרַהּ נִיהֲלִי: בְּאַתְרָא דְּתַנָּא דִּידַן, אֲרִיסָא יָהֵיב בִּיזְרָא, בֵּין יָרַד וּבֵין לֹא יָרַד – כַּמָּה דְּלָא יָהֵיב בִּיזְרָא מָצֵי מְסַלֵּיק לֵיהּ, וְכִי קָא נָחֵית – לִבְצִיר מֵהָכִי קָא נָחֵית.
human_translation: Rava said: Rabbi Idi explained to me: In the locale of the tanna of our the sharecropper provide the seeds, whether he went down or did not go down, as long as has not put the seeds can remove him and when goes down he goes down for less than this,
llm_translation: Rava said, Rabbi Idi reasoned: In the place of our Mishnah, a sharecropper gives produce, whether he descended or did not descend - just as he did not give produce, he may retract, and when he descends - he descends to harvest.

hebrew_text: בְּאַתְרָא דְּתַנָּא בָּרָא, מָרֵי אַרְעָא יָהֵיב בִּיזְרָא, אִי לֹא יָרַד דְּמָצֵי מְסַלֵּיק לֵיהּ, כִּי קָא נָחֵית – לִבְצִיר מֵהָכִי קָא נָחֵית, אִי יָרַד דְּלָא מָצֵי מְסַלֵּיק לֵיהּ – אָסוּר.
human_translation: in the locale of the tanna of the baraita , the landowner provide the seeds, if he not gone down can remove him, when he goes down he goes down for less than this. if he went down, can no longer remove him, prohibited,
llm_translation: In the place where it was taught in Bara, the master of the land gave a coin. If he did not descend and find it, he removes it. For when he descends - he descends to harvest. If he did not descend and did not find it, he is forbidden.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן, אוֹמֵר אָדָם לַחֲבֵירוֹ:
human_translation: The Sages taught: A person may say to another:
llm_translation: The Sages taught: A person says to his fellow:

hebrew_text: הַלְוֵינִי כּוֹר חִטִּין וְקוֹצֵץ לוֹ דָּמִים, הוּזְלוּ – נוֹתֵן לוֹ חִטִּים, הוּקְרוּ – נוֹתֵן דְּמֵיהֶם.
human_translation: Lend me a kor of wheat, and set a price for him, depreciates gives wheat appreciates, gives value of
llm_translation: Levite, measures wheat and reaps for him blood, they were stolen - gives him wheat, they were uprooted - gives their blood.

hebrew_text: וַהֲלֹא קָצַץ! אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: הָכִי קָאָמַר. אִם לֹא קָצַץ – הוּזְלוּ – נוֹטֵל חִטָּיו. הוּקְרוּ – נוֹתֵן דְּמֵיהֶם.
human_translation: But he fixed Rav Sheshet said: This is saying: If did not set depreciates takes his wheat, appreciates gives value of
llm_translation: And did he not cut off! Rav Sheshet said: This is what he meant. If he did not cut off – they should be removed – he takes their wheat. If they were uprooted – he gives them their value.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ לֹא יֹאמַר אָדָם לַחֲבֵירוֹ: הַלְוֵינִי כּוֹר חִטִּין וַאֲנִי אֶתֵּן לָךְ לַגּוֹרֶן. אֲבָל אוֹמֵר לוֹ: הַלְוֵינִי עַד שֶׁיָּבֹא בְּנִי אוֹ עַד שֶׁאֶמְצָא מַפְתֵּחַ. וְהִלֵּל אוֹסֵר. וְכֵן הָיָה הִלֵּל אוֹמֵר: לֹא תַּלְוֶה אִשָּׁה כִּכָּר לַחֲבֶרְתָּהּ עַד שֶׁתַּעֲשֶׂיהָ דָּמִים, שֶׁמָּא יוּקְרוּ חִטִּין, וְנִמְצְאוּ בָּאוֹת לִידֵי רִבִּית.
human_translation: A person may not say to another: Lend me a kor of wheat and I will give to you at the granary, But he may say to him: Lend me until my son comes or until I find key, And Hillel prohibits And Hillel would similarly say: A woman may not lend a loaf to another unless she establishes its monetary lest the wheat appreciate and they will have come to interest.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One may not say to his fellow, "Lend me a measure of wheat, and I will give it back to you at the granary." But he may say to him, "Lend me the wheat until my son comes, or until I find the key." Hillel prohibits even this type of loan. And so Hillel used to say: One should not lend a woman a measure of wheat until she turns it into blood, lest the wheat become expensive, and they end up falling into the hands of usury.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: יֵשׁ לוֹ סְאָה – לֹוֶה סְאָה. סָאתַיִם – לֹוֶה סָאתַיִם. רַבִּי יִצְחָק אוֹמֵר: אֲפִילּוּ יֵשׁ לוֹ סְאָה – לֹוֶה עָלֶיהָ כַּמָּה כּוֹרִין.
human_translation: Rav Huna said: has a se’a may borrow a se’a two se’a may borrow two se’a . Rabbi Yitzḥak says: Even if he has se’a , may borrow several kor upon it.
llm_translation: Gemara: Rav Huna said: If he has a se'ah - he borrows a se'ah. Two se'ahs - he borrows two se'ahs. Rabbi Yitzchak says: Even if he has a se'ah - he borrows on it as many korin.

hebrew_text: תָּנֵי רַבִּי חִיָּיא לְסַיּוֹעֵיהּ לְרַבִּי יִצְחָק: טִיפַּת יַיִן אֵין לוֹ, טִיפַּת שֶׁמֶן אֵין לוֹ. הָא יֵשׁ לוֹ – לֹוֶה עָלֶיהָ כַּמָּה טִיפִּין.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya teaches in support of Rabbi Yitzḥak’s does not have a drop of wine he does not have a drop of oil, Consequently, he does have may borrow many drops upon it,
llm_translation: It was taught by Rabbi Chiya to assist Rabbi Yitzchak: A drop of wine he does not have, a drop of oil he does not have. If he has - he should lend it with interest.

hebrew_text: וְהִלֵּל אוֹסֵר. אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הֲלָכָה כְּדִבְרֵי הִלֵּל. וְלֵית הִלְכְתָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ.
human_translation: And Hillel prohibits Rav Naḥman says Shmuel says: halakha in accordance with the statement of Hillel. But the halakha is not, in accordance with
llm_translation: Hillel prohibits. Rav Nachman said in the name of Shmuel: The halakha follows the words of Hillel. And the halakha does not follow his colleagues.

hebrew_text: וְכֵן הָיָה הִלֵּל אוֹמֵר: לֹא תַּלְוֶה אִשָּׁה [וְכוּ׳]. אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: זוֹ דִּבְרֵי הִלֵּל, אֲבָל חֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: לֹוִים סְתָם וּפוֹרְעִים סְתָם.
human_translation: And Hillel would similarly say: A woman may not lend Rav Yehuda says Shmuel says: This the statement of Hillel, but the Rabbis say one may borrow without specification and repay without specification.
llm_translation: And so Hillel would say: "Do not lend a woman etc.." Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: This is the statement of Hillel, but the Sages say: Lend to trustworthy individuals and collect from trustworthy individuals.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: בְּנֵי חֲבוּרָה הַמַּקְפִּידִין זֶה עַל זֶה, עוֹבְרִין מִשּׁוּם מִדָּה וּמִשּׁוּם מִשְׁקָל וּמִשּׁוּם מִנְיָן, וּמִשּׁוּם לֹוִין וּפוֹרְעִין בְּיוֹם טוֹב, וּכְדִבְרֵי הִלֵּל אַף מִשּׁוּם רִבִּית.
human_translation: And Rav Yehuda says Shmuel says: members of a group who are particular with each other they transgress with regard to measure, and with regard to weight, and with regard to of counting, And they transgress with regard to lending and repaying on a Festival, and according to the statement of Hillel, also with regard to interest.
llm_translation: And said Rav Yehudah said Shmuel: Sons of the group who are meticulous with each other, they transgress due to measurement, due to weight, due to counting, and due to lending and repaying on a festival day, and according to the words of Hillel even due to interest.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים מוּתָּרִים לִלְווֹת זֶה מִזֶּה בְּרִבִּית. מַאי טַעְמָא – מִידָּע יָדְעִי דְּרִבִּית אֲסוּרָה, וּמַתָּנָה הוּא דְּיָהֲבִי אַהֲדָדֵי. אֲמַר לֵיהּ שְׁמוּאֵל לַאֲבוּהּ בַּר אִיהִי: הַלְוֵינִי מֵאָה פִּלְפְּלִין בְּמֵאָה וְעֶשְׂרִין פִּלְפְּלִין, וַאֲרִיךְ.
human_translation: And Rav Yehuda says Shmuel says: permitted Torah scholars to borrow from one another with interest. What is the reason they are aware that interest is prohibited, and is a gift that they give one another. Shmuel said to Avuh bar Ihi: Lend me one hundred peppers for 120 peppers And fitting
llm_translation: And Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: Torah scholars are permitted to borrow from one another with interest. What is the reason? - Because they know that interest is prohibited, and it is a gift that they give to each other. Shmuel said to Avuh bar Ihi: Lend me one hundred pepper grains for one hundred and twenty pepper grains, and it is permissible.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: מוּתָּר לוֹ לָאָדָם לְהַלְווֹת בָּנָיו וּבְנֵי בֵיתוֹ בְּרִבִּית, כְּדֵי לְהַטְעִימָן טַעַם רִבִּית. וְלָאו מִילְּתָא הִיא, מִשּׁוּם דְּאָתֵי לְמִיסְרַךְ.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says Rav says: It is permitted for a person to lend to his sons and the members of his household with interest, in order to have them taste the taste of interest But is not correct, because may become corrupted
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: It is permitted for a person to lend to his sons and the members of his household with interest, in order to accustom them to the taste of interest. And this is not a matter, because it leads to harmony.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אוֹמֵר אָדָם לַחֲבֵירוֹ: נַכֵּשׁ עִמִּי וַאֲנַכֵּשׁ עִמָּךְ, עֲדוֹר עִמִּי וְאֶעֱדוֹר עִמָּךְ. וְלֹא יֹאמַר לוֹ: נַכֵּשׁ עִמִּי וְאֶעֱדוֹר עִמָּךְ, עֲדוֹר עִמִּי וַאֲנַכֵּשׁ עִמָּךְ.
human_translation: A person may say to another: Weed with me and I will weed with you Till with me and I will till with you But he may not say to him: Weed with me and I will till with you Till with me and I will weed with you,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One says to his fellow, "Let us plow together, and I will plow with you; let us sow together, and I will sow with you." And one should not say to him, "Let us plow together, and I will sow with you; let us sow together, and I will plow with you."

hebrew_text: כׇּל יְמֵי גְּרִיד – אֶחָד. כׇּל יְמֵי רְבִיעָה – אַחַת. לֹא יֹאמַר לוֹ: חֲרוֹשׁ עִמִּי בִּגְרִיד וַאֲנִי אֶחְרוֹשׁ עִמְּךָ בָּרְבִיעָה.
human_translation: All dry days one all rainy days one he may not say to him: Plow with me in the dry and I will plow with you in the rainy
llm_translation: All the days of Gerid - one. All the days of Reviah - one. One should not say to him: "Plow with me in Gerid, and I will plow with you in Reviah."

hebrew_text: רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: יֵשׁ רִבִּית מוּקְדֶּמֶת וְיֵשׁ רִבִּית מְאוּחֶרֶת. כֵּיצַד? נָתַן עֵינָיו לִלְווֹת הֵימֶנּוּ, וְהוּא מְשַׁלֵּחַ לוֹ וְאוֹמֵר: בִּשְׁבִיל שֶׁתַּלְוֵנִי – זוֹ הִיא רִבִּית מוּקְדֶּמֶת. לָוָה הֵימֶנּוּ וְהֶחְזִיר לוֹ אֶת מְעוֹתָיו, וְהוּא מְשַׁלֵּחַ לוֹ וְאוֹמֵר: בִּשְׁבִיל מְעוֹתֶיךָ שֶׁהָיוּ בְּטֵילוֹת אֶצְלִי – זוֹ הִיא רִבִּית מְאוּחֶרֶת.
human_translation: Rabban Gamliel says: There is pre interest, and there is interest later, How so? had hopes of borrowing from him and he sends him and says: in order that you will lend to me, this is pre interest. borrowed from him and returned his money, and he sends to him and says: for your money, which was idle with me, this is interest later.
llm_translation: Rabban Gamliel says: There is early interest and there is late interest. How so? He gave his eyes to lend to him, and he sends it to him and says: "Because you lent to me - this is early interest." He borrowed from him and returned his money to him, and he sends it to him and says: "Because your money was idle with me - this is late interest."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: יֵשׁ רִבִּית דְּבָרִים. לֹא יֹאמַר לוֹ ״דַּע כִּי בָּא אִישׁ פְּלוֹנִי מִמָּקוֹם פְּלוֹנִי״.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: there is verbal interest. may not say to know that so-and-so has come from such and such a place,
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: There is interest in words. One should not say to him, "Know that a certain man has come from a certain place."

hebrew_text: וְאֵלּוּ עוֹבְרִין בְּלֹא תַעֲשֶׂה: הַמַּלְוֶה וְהַלֹּוֶה וְהֶעָרֵב וְהָעֵדִים. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אַף הַסּוֹפֵר. עוֹבְרִים מִשּׁוּם ״לֹא תִתֵּן״, וּמִשּׁוּם ״אַל תִּקַּח מֵאִתּוֹ״, וּמִשּׁוּם ״לֹא תִהְיֶה לוֹ כְּנוֹשֶׁה״, וּמִשּׁוּם ״לֹא תְשִׂימוּן עָלָיו נֶשֶׁךְ״, וּמִשּׁוּם ״וְלִפְנֵי עִוֵּר לֹא תִתֵּן מִכְשׁוֹל וְיָרֵאתָ מֵּאֱלֹהֶיךָ אֲנִי ה׳״.
human_translation: And these violate a prohibition The lender, and the borrower, and the guarantor, and the witnesses. And the Rabbis say: Also the scribe violate “You shall not give and of: “Do not take from him and of: “Do not be to him as a creditor” and of “Do not place interest upon him” and of: “And you shall not place a stumbling block before the blind, and you shall fear your God; I am the Lord”
llm_translation: And these are the ones who transgress the negative commandments: the lender, the borrower, the guarantor, and the witnesses. And the sages say: Also the scribe. They transgress because of "do not give," and because of "do not take from him," and because of "do not be to him as a creditor," and because of "do not place interest upon him," and because of "and before a blind person do not place a stumbling block, and you shall fear your God, I am the Lord."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹחַי אוֹמֵר: מִנַּיִן לַנּוֹשֶׁה בַּחֲבֵירוֹ מָנֶה, וְאֵינוֹ רָגִיל לְהַקְדִּים לוֹ שָׁלוֹם, שֶׁאָסוּר לְהַקְדִּים לוֹ שָׁלוֹם – תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״נֶשֶׁךְ כׇּל דָּבָר אֲשֶׁר יִשָּׁךְ״ – אֲפִילּוּ דִּיבּוּר אָסוּר.
human_translation: It is taught Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai says: From where with regard to one who is owed one hundred dinars by another, and is not accustomed to greeting that it is prohibited to greeting him The verse states: “Interest of any matter [ davar ] that is lent with interest” even speech [ dibbur ] prohibited
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Gemara, Tanya, Rabbi Shimon ben Yochai says: From where do we derive that one may count interest to his fellow, and he is not accustomed to greet him first with peace, that it is forbidden to greet him with peace? The Torah teaches: 'Interest on anything that he lends' - even verbal communication is forbidden."

hebrew_text: וְאֵלּוּ עוֹבְרִין, אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: מַלְוֶה עוֹבֵר בְּכוּלָּן. לֹוֶה עוֹבֵר מִשּׁוּם ״לֹא תַשִּׁיךְ לְאָחִיךָ״. ״וּלְאָחִיךָ לֹא תַשִּׁיךְ״, ״וְלִפְנֵי עִוֵּר לֹא תִתֵּן מִכְשׁוֹל״. עָרֵב וְהָעֵדִים אֵין עוֹבְרִין אֶלָּא מִשּׁוּם ״לֹא תְשִׂימוּן עָלָיו נֶשֶׁךְ״.
human_translation: And these violate Abaye says: lender violates all of them, borrower violates of: “You shall not lend to your brother with interest” to your brother you shall not lend with interest” “And you shall not place a stumbling block before the blind” guarantor and the witness violate only: “Do not place interest upon him”
llm_translation: And these are the ones who pass through, Abaye said: The lender passes through all of them. The borrower passes through violating the prohibition of "You shall not charge interest to your brother." "And to your brother you shall not charge interest," "And you shall not place a stumbling block before the blind." A guarantor and witnesses only pass through violating the prohibition of "You shall not set up a stumbling block before him."

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: מַלְוֵי רִבִּית יוֹתֵר מִמַּה שֶּׁמַּרְוִיחִים – מַפְסִידִים. וְלֹא עוֹד אֶלָּא שֶׁמְּשִׂימִים מֹשֶׁה רַבֵּינוּ חָכָם וְתוֹרָתוֹ אֱמֶת. וְאוֹמְרִין: אִילּוּ הָיָה יוֹדֵעַ מֹשֶׁה רַבֵּינוּ שֶׁיִּהְיֶה רֶיוַח בַּדָּבָר לֹא הָיָה כּוֹתְבוֹ.
human_translation: It is taught Rabbi Shimon says: Those who lend interest lose more than they gain, Moreover, as they cause Moses our teacher a scholar and his Torah true. And they say: Had Moses our teacher known that there was a profit in the matter, he would not have written it
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Shimon says: If one lends with interest more than what is customary - they incur a loss. And not only that, but they attribute falsehood to Moses our teacher, who was wise and his Torah true. And they say: If Moses our teacher had known that there would be profit in the matter, he would not have written it.

hebrew_text: כִּי אֲתָא רַב דִּימִי אָמַר: מִנַּיִן לַנּוֹשֶׁה בַּחֲבֵירוֹ מָנֶה, וְיוֹדֵעַ שֶׁאֵין לוֹ, שֶׁאָסוּר לַעֲבוֹר לְפָנָיו – תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״לֹא תִהְיֶה לוֹ כְּנֹשֶׁה״.
human_translation: When Rav Dimi came said: From where one who is owed one hundred dinars by another and knows that does not have that prohibited to pass before The verse states: “Do not be to him as a creditor”
llm_translation: When Rav Dimi came, he said: From where do we derive that one may lend to his fellow and knows that he does not have, that it is forbidden to pass before him? The Talmud teaches: "You shall not be to him as a creditor."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אַמֵּי וְרַבִּי אַסִּי דְאָמְרִי תַּרְוַיְיהוּ כְּאִילּוּ דָּנוֹ בִּשְׁנֵי דִּינִין, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״הִרְכַּבְתָּ אֱנוֹשׁ לְרֹאשֵׁנוּ בָּאנוּ בָאֵשׁ וּבַמַּיִם״.
human_translation: Rabbi Ami and Rabbi Asi both say as though he sentences him to two of punishments, as it is stated: “You have caused men to ride over our heads; we went through fire and through water”
llm_translation: Rabbi Ammi and Rabbi Assi who both say: as if he judged two cases, as it is said: "You have brought man over our heads; we came into fire and water."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: כָּל מִי שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ מָעוֹת וּמַלְוֶה אוֹתָן שֶׁלֹּא בְּעֵדִים – עוֹבֵר מִשּׁוּם ״וְלִפְנֵי עִוֵּר לֹא תִתֵּן מִכְשֹׁל״. וְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אָמַר: גּוֹרֵם קְלָלָה לְעַצְמוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״תֵּאָלַמְנָה שִׂפְתֵי שָׁקֶר הַדּוֹבְרוֹת עַל צַדִּיק עָתָק״.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says Rav says: Whoever has money and lends it not in witnesses violates “And you shall not place a stumbling block before the blind” And Reish Lakish says: He brings a curse upon himself, as it is stated: “Let the lying lips be dumb, which speak arrogantly against the righteous,
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: Anyone who has money and lends it without witnesses transgresses the verse "Do not place a stumbling block before the blind." Reish Lakish said: He brings a curse upon himself, as it is stated: "The lips of falsehood shall be dumb, which speak insolently against the righteous."

hebrew_text: אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ רַבָּנַן לְרַב אָשֵׁי: קָא מְקַיֵּים רָבִינָא כֹּל מָה דַּאֲמוּר רַבָּנַן. שְׁלַח לֵיהּ בַּהֲדֵי פַּנְיָא דְּמַעֲלֵי שַׁבְּתָא: לִישַׁדַּר לִי מָר עַשְׂרָה זוּזֵי דְּאִתְרְמִי לִי קַטִּינָא דְּאַרְעָא לְמִזְבַּן. שְׁלַח לֵיהּ: נַיְתֵי מָר סָהֲדֵי וְנִכְתֹּב כְּתָבָא. שְׁלַח לֵיהּ: אֲפִילּוּ אֲנָא נָמֵי? שְׁלַח לֵיהּ: כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן מָר דִּטְרִיד בְּגִירְסֵיהּ מִשְׁתְּלֵי וְגוֹרֵם קְלָלָה לְעַצְמוֹ.
human_translation: The Sages said to Rav Ashi: Ravina fulfills all that the Sages say. sent to him close to sunset on the eve of Shabbat, Let the Master send me ten dinars as I have happened upon a small piece of land for an acquisition sent to him: Let the Master bring witnesses and we will write a written sent to him: Even I, as well? sent to him: All the more so the Master, who is occupied with his studies to forget, bring a curse upon myself.
llm_translation: The sages said to Rav Ashi: Ravina is fulfilling everything that the sages have said. He sent with him on the eve of Shabbat: "Go and rent for me ten coins' worth of land to buy a small plot." He sent to him: "Come, witness and write a document." He sent to him: "Even if I myself were to do it?" He sent to him: "All the more so, master, that one who troubles himself with his studies causes a curse upon himself."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: שְׁלֹשָׁה צוֹעֲקִין וְאֵינָן נַעֲנִין, וְאֵלּוּ הֵן: מִי שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ מָעוֹת וּמַלְוֶה אוֹתָן שֶׁלֹּא בְּעֵדִים, וְהַקּוֹנֶה אָדוֹן לְעַצְמוֹ, וּמִי שֶׁאִשְׁתּוֹ מוֹשֶׁלֶת עָלָיו.
human_translation: The Sages taught three cry and are not answered, And they are: One who has money and lends it not in witnesses, and one who acquires a master for himself, and one whose wife rules over him.
llm_translation: The sages taught: Three cry out and are not answered, and they are: one who has money and lends it without witnesses, one who acquires a master for himself, and one whose wife rules over him.

hebrew_text: קוֹנָה אָדוֹן לְעַצְמוֹ מַאי הִיא? אִיכָּא דְאָמְרִי: תּוֹלֶה נְכָסָיו בְּגוֹי. אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: הַכּוֹתֵב נְכָסָיו לְבָנָיו בְּחַיָּיו. אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: דְּבִישׁ לֵיהּ בְּהָא מָתָא וְלָא אָזֵיל לְמָתָא אַחֲרִיתִי.
human_translation: acquires a master for himself, what is it? There are who say attributes his property to a gentile. there are who say who writes his property to his children in his lifetime, there are who say that who has bad in this town but does not go to a different town.
llm_translation: Acquiring a master for oneself, what is it? There are those who say: He hangs his possessions among the nations. There are those who say: He writes his possessions to his sons during his lifetime. There are those who say: He is embarrassed by this city and does not go to another city.

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ אֵיזֶהוּ נֶשֶׁךְ
llm_translation: We will return to you, which is a bite.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַשּׂוֹכֵר אֶת הָאוּמָּנִין וְהִטְעוּ זֶה אֶת זֶה – אֵין לָהֶם זֶה עַל זֶה אֶלָּא תַּרְעוֹמֶת. שָׂכַר אֶת הַחַמָּר וְאֶת הַקַּדָּר לְהָבִיא פְּרִיָיפָרִין וַחֲלִילִים לַכַּלָּה אוֹ לַמֵּת, וּפוֹעֲלִין לְהַעֲלוֹת פִּשְׁתָּנוֹ מִן הַמִּשְׁרָה, וְכׇל דָּבָר שֶׁאָבֵד וְחָזְרוּ בָּהֶן, מָקוֹם שֶׁאֵין שָׁם אָדָם – שׂוֹכֵר עֲלֵיהֶן אוֹ מַטְעָן.
human_translation: one who hires artisans and they deceived one another, they have nothing but a grievance against one another, hired a donkey driver or a potter to bring posts [ piryafarin ] or flutes of a bride or the dead, or laborers to bring up his flax from the retting tub, and any matter that loss and reneged, a place where there is no person he may hire at or deceive them
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who hires laborers and they deceive one another - they have no claim against each other except for damages. If one hires a donkey and a pot to bring fruits and flutes to a bride or to a deceased, and workers to remove flax from the vat, and anything that was lost and they found, in a place where there is no one - he may hire them or plant them.

hebrew_text: הַשּׂוֹכֵר אֶת הָאוּמָּנִין וְחָזְרוּ בָּהֶן – יָדָם עַל הַתַּחְתּוֹנָה.
human_translation: one who hires artisans and they reneged they are at a disadvantage.
llm_translation: The one who hires laborers and they return to him - their hand is on the lower part.

hebrew_text: אִם בַּעַל הַבַּיִת חוֹזֵר בּוֹ – יָדוֹ עַל הַתַּחְתּוֹנָה. כׇּל הַמְשַׁנֶּה – יָדוֹ עַל הַתַּחְתּוֹנָה, וְכׇל הַחוֹזֵר בּוֹ – יָדוֹ עַל הַתַּחְתּוֹנָה.
human_translation: if the employer reneges, he is at a disadvantage. whoever changes is at a disadvantage, and whoever reneges is at a disadvantage.
llm_translation: If the homeowner changes his mind - his hand is on the lower part. Anyone who repeats - his hand is on the lower part, and anyone who returns to it - his hand is on the lower part.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ ״חָזְרוּ זֶה בָּזֶה״ לָא קָתָנֵי, אֶלָּא ״הִטְעוּ זֶה אֶת זֶה״, דְּאַטְעוֹ פּוֹעֲלִים אַהֲדָדֵי. הֵיכִי דָּמֵי? דַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ בַּעַל הַבַּיִת: זִיל, אֲוגַר לִי פּוֹעֲלִים, וַאֲזַל אִיהוּ וְאַטְעִינְהוּ.
human_translation: does not teach: They reneged with one another, Rather, they deceived one another, that the laborers deceived one another. What are the circumstances? the employer said to Go hire laborers for me, and went and deceived
llm_translation: The text states: "Gemara: 'Chazru zeh bazeh' is not taught, rather 'Hitzu zeh et zeh,' that they misled one another. How is it similar? For the owner of the house said to him: 'Go, hire workers for me,' and he went and hired them."

hebrew_text: הֵיכִי דָּמֵי? אִי דַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ בַּעַל הַבַּיִת בְּאַרְבְּעָה, וַאֲזַיל אִיהוּ אֲמַר לְהוּ בִּתְלָתָא – תַּרְעוֹמֶת מַאי עֲבִידְתֵּיהּ? סְבוּר וְקַבֵּיל. אִי דַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ בַּעַל הַבַּיִת בִּתְלָתָא, וַאֲזַיל אִיהוּ אֲמַר לְהוּ בְּאַרְבְּעָה – הֵיכִי דָמֵי? אִי דַּאֲמַר לְהוּ: ״שְׂכַרְכֶם עָלַי״ – נִתֵּיב לְהוּ מִדִּידֵיהּ,
human_translation: What are the circumstances If the employer said to him: at four and he went and told them for three what is the relevance of grievance? they knew and accepted If the employer said to him for three and went and told them for four, what are the circumstances? If told them monetary value upon me, let give them from his own
llm_translation: "How is it comparable? If he said to him 'four,' and he goes and says to them 'three' - what is the status of his act? He thought and accepted. If he said to him 'three,' and he goes and says to them 'four' - how is it comparable? If he said to them: 'Your wage upon me' - he should pay them from his own."

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא: הַשּׂוֹכֵר אֶת הַפּוֹעֵל לַעֲשׂוֹת בְּשֶׁלּוֹ וְהֶרְאָהוּ בְּשֶׁל חֲבֵירוֹ – נוֹתֵן לוֹ שְׂכָרוֹ מִשָּׁלֵם, וְחוֹזֵר וְנוֹטֵל מִבַּעַל הַבַּיִת מַה שֶּׁהֶהֱנָהוּ.
human_translation: as it is taught one who hires a laborer to perform in his own and showed belonging to another must give his full wages; and goes back and takes from the owner the benefit received from
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: One who hires a laborer to work for him and shows him the produce of his fellow - he pays him his wages from his own funds, and then goes back and takes from the owner of the house what he showed him.

hebrew_text: לָא צְרִיכָא, דַּאֲמַר לְהוּ שְׂכַרְכֶם עַל בַּעַל הַבַּיִת.
human_translation: No, necessary where said to them: your wages upon the employer,
llm_translation: Not necessary, for he said to them, "Your wage is upon the owner of the house."

hebrew_text: וְלִחְזֵי פּוֹעֲלִים הֵיכִי מִיתַּגְרִי? לָא צְרִיכָא, דְּאִיכָּא דְּמִתְּגַר בְּאַרְבְּעָה וְאִיכָּא דְּמִתְּגַר בִּתְלָתָא, דְּאָמְרוּ לֵיהּ: אִי לָאו דַּאֲמַרְתְּ לַן בְּאַרְבְּעָה – טָרְחִינַן וּמִתַּגְרִינַן בְּאַרְבְּעָה.
human_translation: But let us see how much laborers are hired for No, necessary where there are who hire for four and there are who hire for three. that say to Had you not told us for four made an effort and and we hired ourselves for four
llm_translation: To see how workers engage, how do they argue? It is unnecessary, for there are some who argue with four and some who argue with three, as they said to him: If you did not say to us with four - we would exert ourselves and argue with four.

hebrew_text: אִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: הָכָא בְּבַעַל הַבַּיִת עָסְקִינַן, דְּאָמְרוּ לֵיהּ: אִי לָאו דַּאֲמַרְתְּ לַן בְּאַרְבְּעָה, הֲוָה זִילָא בַּן מִילְּתָא לְאִתְּגוֹרֵי.
human_translation: If you wish, say here we are dealing with a homeowner, that say to Had you not told us for four, it would have been demeaning for us to be hired,
llm_translation: If you wish, say: Here we are dealing with a homeowner, for they said to him: If you did not tell us in four days, go and find a different place to live.

hebrew_text: אִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: לְעוֹלָם בְּפוֹעֲלִים עָסְקִינַן, דְּאָמְרִי לֵיהּ: כֵּיוָן דַּאֲמַרְתְּ לַן בְּאַרְבְּעָה – טָרְחִינַן וְעָבְדִינַן לָךְ עֲבִידְתָּא שַׁפִּירְתָּא. וְלִחְזֵי עֲבִידְתַּיְיהוּ? בְּרִיפְקָא. רִיפְקָא נָמֵי מִידָּע יְדִיעַ? דִּמְלֵי מַיָּא וְלָא יְדִיעַ.
human_translation: If you wish, say actually, we are dealing with laborers, that they say to Since you spoke to us of four, we made an effort to do higher-quality work for you. And let us see their work. to tilling tilling as well, know that filled with water, and does not know
llm_translation: If you wish, I will say: We are dealing with workers, as they say to him: Since you said to us in four - we will strive and do for you a good deed. And to see their work? In a river. Is a river also a place of knowledge? Because it is full of water and not of knowledge.

hebrew_text: אִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: לְעוֹלָם דַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ בַּעַל הַבַּיִת בְּאַרְבְּעָה, וַאֲזַל אִיהוּ אֲמַר לְהוּ בִּתְלָתָא, וּדְקָאָמְרַתְּ סְבוּר וְקַבֵּיל, דְּאָמְרִי לֵיהּ לֵית לָךָ ״אַל תִּמְנַע טוֹב מִבְּעָלָיו״?
human_translation: If you wish, say actually, an employer who said to for four, and he went and told them for three. And that which you said: they knew and accepted as they say to Don’t you have “Do not withhold good from him to whom it is due,
llm_translation: If you wish, say: Always that he said to him the homeowner in four, and he went and said to them in three, and you say, "He thinks and accepts," for they say to him, "Do not withhold good from its owner."

hebrew_text: פְּשִׁיטָא אִי אֲמַר לֵיהּ בַּעַל הַבַּיִת בִּתְלָתָא, וַאֲזַל אִיהוּ אֲמַר לְהוּ בְּאַרְבְּעָה, וְאָמְרִי לֵיהּ כְּמוֹ שֶׁאָמַר בַּעַל הַבַּיִת – דַּעְתַּיְיהוּ אַעִילּוּיָא.
human_translation: obvious if the employer said to for three and went and said to them for four, and they said to him: as the employer says, their minds on additional
llm_translation: The text reads: "Peshita, if he said to him three, and he went and said to them four, and they said to him as the owner of the house said - his opinion is preferable."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אִי אֲמַר לֵיהּ בַּעַל הַבַּיִת בְּאַרְבְּעָה, וַאֲזַל אִיהוּ אֲמַר לְהוּ בִּתְלָתָא, וְאָמְרִי: כְּמָה שֶׁאָמַר בַּעַל הַבַּיִת, מַאי? אַדִּיבּוּרָא דִּידֵיהּ קָא סָמְכִי, דְּאָמְרִי לֵיהּ מְהֵימְנַתְּ לַן דְּהָכִי אָמַר בַּעַל הַבַּיִת, אוֹ דִלְמָא אַדִּיבּוּרָא דְּבַעַל הַבַּיִת קָא סָמְכִי?
human_translation: But if the employer said for four and went and told them for three, and they said to him: as the employer said, what rely on his statement, as they are saying to him: We trust you that the employer said that Or perhaps they rely on the employer’s statement,
llm_translation: Rather, if he said to him "four," and he went and said to them "three," and they said: How much did the owner of the house say? What is it? His own statement he is relying on, for they said to him, "We trust that this is what the owner of the house said," or perhaps he is relying on the statement of the owner of the house?

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: ״הָבֵא לִי גִּיטִּי״.
human_translation: Come hear Bring my bill of divorce for me.
llm_translation: Come and hear: "Bring me my bill of divorce."

hebrew_text: וְאִשְׁתְּךָ אָמְרָה ״הִתְקַבֵּל לִי גִּיטִּי״, וְהוּא אוֹמֵר: ״הֵילָךְ כְּמָה שֶׁאָמְרָה״. אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר אֲבוּהּ אָמַר רַב: אֲפִילּוּ הִגִּיעַ גֵּט לְיָדָהּ – אֵינָהּ מְגוֹרֶשֶׁת.
human_translation: But Your wife said Receive my bill of divorce for me. And said: Take it in the manner said. Rav Naḥman says Rabba bar Avuh says Rav says: Even the bill of divorce reaches her possession, she is not divorced.
llm_translation: Your wife said, "Accept my divorce document," and he says, "Go according to what she said." Rav Nachman said in the name of Rabba bar Avuh said Rav: Even if the divorce document reached her hand, she is not divorced.

hebrew_text: שָׁמְעַתְּ מִינַּהּ אַדִּיבּוּרָא דִּידֵיהּ קָא סָמֵיךְ. דְּאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ דְּאַדִּיבּוּרָא דִּידַהּ קָא סָמֵיךְ – מִכִּי מָטֵי גִּיטָּא לִידַהּ מִיהָא תִּיגָּרַשׁ. אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי:
human_translation: learn from this relies on statement. As, if it enters your mind that relies on her statement, she should at least be divorced when the bill of divorce reaches her possession, Rav Ashi said:
llm_translation: You have heard that her speech is consistent. For if it were your opinion that her speech is consistent - when the bill of divorce reaches her from him, she will be divorced. Rav Ashi said:

hebrew_text: הָכִי הַשְׁתָּא?! בִּשְׁלָמָא אִי אִיתְּמַר אִיפְּכָא, ״הִתְקַבֵּל לִי גִּיטִּי״ וְאִשְׁתְּךָ אָמְרָה, ״הָבֵא לִי גִּיטִּי״, וְהוּא אוֹמֵר: ״הֵילָךְ כְּמוֹ שֶׁאָמְרָה״. וְאָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר אֲבוּהּ אָמַר רַב: מִשֶּׁיַּגִּיעַ גֵּט לְיָדוֹ – מְגוֹרֶשֶׁת, אַלְמָא דְּאַדִּיבּוּרָא דִּידַהּ קָא סְמִיךְ.
human_translation: How can be compared? Granted, if the opposite was stated, Receive my bill of divorce for me, Your wife said: Bring me my bill of divorce, and said: Here you are, as she said; and Rav Naḥman says Rabba bar Avuh says Rav says: From when the bill of divorce reaches possession, she is divorced, Apparently, relies upon her statement
llm_translation: So now?! If it is said that it is reversed, "My divorce is accepted by me," and his wife said, "Bring me my divorce," and he says, "Go as she said." And Rav Nachman said that Rabba bar Avuh said that Rav said: Once the divorce reaches his hand - she is divorced, indicating that her speech is relied upon.

hebrew_text: אִי נָמֵי: מִשֶּׁהִגִּיעַ גֵּט לְיָדָהּ מְגוֹרֶשֶׁת – אַלְמָא דְּאַדִּיבּוּרָא דִּידֵיהּ קָא סָמֵיךְ. אֶלָּא הָתָם – מִשּׁוּם דְּעָקַר שָׁלִיחַ לִשְׁלִיחוּתֵיהּ לִגְמָרֵי, דְּאָמַר לֵיהּ: ״שָׁלִיחַ לְִקַבָּלָה הָוֵינָא, לְהוֹלָכָה לָא הָוֵינָא״.
human_translation: Alternatively, From when the bill of divorce reaches her possession, she is divorced, evidently, relies on statement, But there, due to that the agent negates his agency entirely, as he said to I am an agent for receipt, I am not to be for delivery.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Iy nama: mi'shehigia get le'yadah megureshet - alma de'adivura di'deiha ka sameich. Ela hatam - mi'shum de'akar shaliach lishlichutai le'gamrei, de'amar lei: 'Shaliach le'kabbalah hava'ina, le'holakha la hava'ina'." English translation: "It is not so: when a divorce document reaches her hand, she is considered divorced - this proves that her consent is relied upon. Rather, there - because he uprooted the agent's agency completely, for he said to her: 'I was an agent for receiving, not for delivering.'"

hebrew_text: אִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: הַאי תַּנָּא ״חָזְרוּ״ נָמֵי ״הִטְעוּ״ קָרֵי לֵיהּ, דְּתַנְיָא: הַשּׂוֹכֵר אֶת הָאוּמָּנִין וְהִטְעוּ אֶת בַּעַל הַבַּיִת, אוֹ בַּעַל הַבַּיִת הִטְעָה אוֹתָן – אֵין לָהֶם זֶה עַל זֶה אֶלָּא תַּרְעוֹמֶת.
human_translation: If you wish, say this tanna also calls reneged, deceived. As it is taught one who hires artisans and they deceived the employer, or the employer deceived them, they have nothing but a grievance against one another,
llm_translation: If you wish, say: This Tanna, when he teaches "they returned" he also reads "they misled," as it was taught: One who hires workers and misleads the homeowner, or the homeowner misleads them - they have no claim against each other except for wages.

hebrew_text: בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים? שֶׁלֹּא הָלְכוּ. אֲבָל הָלְכוּ חַמָּרִים וְלֹא מָצְאוּ תְּבוּאָה, פּוֹעֲלִין וּמָצְאוּ שָׂדֶה כְּשֶׁהִיא לַחָה – נוֹתֵן לָהֶן שְׂכָרָן מִשָּׁלֵם, אֲבָל אֵינוֹ דּוֹמֶה הַבָּא טָעוּן לַבָּא רֵיקָן, עוֹשֶׂה מְלָאכָה לְיוֹשֵׁב וּבָטֵל.
human_translation: In what is this statement said? When they did not go But donkey drivers went and could not find produce laborers and found that the field was moist must give them their full wages But who comes loaded cannot be compared to one who comes empty, who performs work to one who sits idle.
llm_translation: In what case are these matters said? That they did not go. But if they went with donkeys and did not find produce, they work and find a field when it is moist - he gives them their wages from what he collects. But one who comes empty-handed is not like one who comes loaded, he does work for the resident and is exempt.

hebrew_text: בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים? שֶׁלֹּא הִתְחִילוּ בִּמְלָאכָה, אֲבָל הִתְחִילוּ בִּמְלָאכָה – שָׁמִין לָהֶן מַה שֶּׁעָשׂוּ. כֵּיצַד? קִבְּלוּ קָמָה לִקְצוֹר בִּשְׁנֵי סְלָעִים, קָצְרוּ חֶצְיָהּ וְהִנִּיחוּ חֶצְיָהּ. בֶּגֶד לֶאֱרוֹג בִּשְׁנֵי סְלָעִים, אָרְגוּ חֶצְיוֹ וְהִנִּיחוּ חֶצְיוֹ – שָׁמִין לָהֶן אֶת מַה שֶּׁעָשׂוּ.
human_translation: In what is this statement, said? When they had not started the work But they had started the work, appraises for them that which they have done, How so? they received standing grain to reap for two sela they reaped half of it and left half of it, a garment to weave at two sela , they weaved half of it and left half of it, appraises for them that which they have done.
llm_translation: In what case are these words spoken? If they did not begin with work, but they began with work - we listen to what they did. How so? They received a standing grain to harvest in two rocks, they harvested half of it and left half of it. A garment to weave in two rocks, they wove half of it and left half of it - we listen to what they did.

hebrew_text: הָיָה יָפֶה שִׁשָּׁה דִּינָרִים – נוֹתֵן לָהֶן סֶלַע, אוֹ יִגְמְרוּ מְלַאכְתָּן וְיִטְּלוּ שְׁנֵי סְלָעִים. וְאִם סֶלַע – נוֹתֵן לָהֶם סֶלַע.
human_translation: If was worth six dinars, he gives them a sela , or they finish their work and take two sela . And if a sela , he gives them a sela .
llm_translation: He was beautiful six dinars - he gives them a sela, or they finish their work and take two sela. And if a sela - he gives them a sela.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי דּוֹסָא אוֹמֵר: שָׁמִין לָהֶן מַה שֶּׁעָתִיד לְהֵעָשׂוֹת, הָיָה יָפֶה שִׁשָּׁה דִּינָרִים – נוֹתֵן לָהֶם שֶׁקֶל, אוֹ יִגְמְרוּ מְלַאכְתָּן וְיִטְּלוּ שְׁנֵי סְלָעִים. וְאִם סֶלַע – נוֹתֵן לָהֶם סֶלַע.
human_translation: Rabbi Dosa says: appraises for them that which must be done. was worth six dinars, he gives a shekel, or they finish their work and take two sela . And if a sela , he gives them a sela .
llm_translation: Rabbi Dosa says: "We listen to them regarding what is destined to be done. If six dinars would have been beautiful - he gives them a shekel, or they should finish their work and take two stones. And if a stone - he gives them a stone."

hebrew_text: בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים? בְּדָבָר שֶׁאֵין אָבוּד, אֲבָל בְּדָבָר הָאָבוּד – שׂוֹכֵר עֲלֵיהֶן אוֹ מַטְעָן. כֵּיצַד מַטְעָן? אוֹמֵר לָהֶן: סֶלַע קָצַצְתִּי לָכֶם – בֹּאוּ וּטְלוּ שְׁתַּיִם. וְעַד כַּמָּה שׂוֹכֵר עֲלֵיהֶן? עַד אַרְבָּעִים וַחֲמִשִּׁים זוּז.
human_translation: In what is this statement said, with regard to a matter that not loss but with regard to a matter that loss may hire at or deceive How does he deceive them? he say to them: I fixed a sela for you; come and take two. And up to what may he hire at their up to forty or fifty dinars.
llm_translation: In what case are these things said? In a matter where there is no loss, but in a matter of loss - one may rent them out or load them. How does one load them? He says to them: "I have cut a rock for you - come and carry two." And how much can one rent them out for? Up to forty or fifty zuz.

hebrew_text: בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים? בִּזְמַן שֶׁאֵין שָׁם פּוֹעֲלִים לִשְׂכּוֹר. אֲבָל יֵשׁ שָׁם פּוֹעֲלִים לִשְׂכּוֹר, וְאָמַר: ״צֵא וּשְׂכוֹר מֵאֵלּוּ״ – אֵין לוֹ עֲלֵיהֶן אֶלָּא תַּרְעוֹמֶת.
human_translation: In what is this statement said, When there are no laborers there, to hire. But if there are laborers there to hire, and said Go and hire from these, has nothing but a grievance against them.
llm_translation: In what case are these matters said? When there are no workers available to hire. But if there are workers available to hire, and one said, "Go and hire from these" - he has no claim against them except for damages.

hebrew_text: תָּנֵי תַּנָּא קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב: נוֹתֵן לָהֶם שְׂכָרָן מִשָּׁלֵם. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: חֲבִיבִי אָמַר, אִילּוּ אֲנָא הֲוַאי – לָא הֲוָה יָהֵיבְנָא לָהֶן אֶלָּא כְּפוֹעֵל בָּטֵל, וְאַתְּ אָמְרַתְּ נוֹתֵן לָהֶם שְׂכָרָן מִשָּׁלֵם! וְהָא עֲלַהּ קָתָנֵי: אֵינוֹ דּוֹמֶה הַבָּא טָעוּן לְהַבָּא רֵיקָן, עוֹשֶׂה מְלָאכָה לְיוֹשֵׁב וּבָטֵל! לָא סַיְּימוּהָ קַמֵּיהּ.
human_translation: A tanna taught before Rav: must give them their full wages. said to him: My uncle [ ḥavivi ], said: If I were I would give them only of an idle laborer, and you said he gives them their full wages? But teaches concerning this who comes loaded cannot be compared to one who comes empty, who performs work to one who sits idle. before Rav did not conclude it,
llm_translation: The Tanna taught before Rav: "He gives them their wages, he pays." He said to him: "My dear, he said, if I were there, I would not have given them anything except as a worker who is idle, and you say, 'He gives them their wages, he pays!' But it has been raised as an objection: One who comes loaded should not leave empty-handed, he should do work for the resident and be idle! They did not conclude the matter before him.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: סַיְּימוּהָ קַמֵּיהּ, וְהָכִי קָאָמַר. חֲבִיבִי אֲמַר: אִי הֲוַאי אֲנָא – לָא הֲוָה יָהֵיבְנָא לֵיהּ כְּלָל, וְאַתְּ אָמְרַתְּ כְּפוֹעֵל בָּטֵל! אֶלָּא קַשְׁיָא הָךְ.
human_translation: There are who say concluded it before him, and this is what is saying: My uncle said: If I were I would not give them anything, and you said of an idle laborer? But this difficult.
llm_translation: There are some who say: They completed it before him, and this is what he said. My dear one said: If I were there, I would not have given it to him at all, and you say it is as effective as annulling a worker! Rather, the difficulty remains.

hebrew_text: לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא דְּסַיְּירַהּ לְאַרְעֵיהּ מִדְּאוּרְתָּא, הָא דְּלָא סַיְּירַהּ לְאַרְעֵיהּ מֵאוּרְתָּא.
human_translation: not difficult, this who surveyed his land the night before, that who did not survey his land the night before.
llm_translation: Not difficult: this that he patrols his land from outside, this that he does not patrol his land from inside.

hebrew_text: כִּי הָא דְּאָמַר רָבָא: הַאי מַאן דַּאֲגַר אֲגִירֵי לְרִפְקָא וַאֲתָא מִטְרָא וּמַלְיַיהּ מַיָּא, אִי סַיְּירַהּ לְאַרְעֵיהּ מֵאוּרְתָּא –
human_translation: is like that which Rava said: one who hires laborers to till, and rain fell and filled water, if he surveyed his land the night before
llm_translation: This is what Rava said: One who hires workers to harvest a field, and rain comes and fills it with water, if he surveyed it from the city of Urta -

hebrew_text: פְּסֵידָא דְפוֹעֲלִים, לָא סַיְּירַהּ לְאַרְעֵיהּ מֵאוּרְתָּא – פְּסֵידָא דְּבַעַל הַבַּיִת וְיָהֵיב לְהוּ כְּפוֹעֵל בָּטֵל.
human_translation: the laborers’ loss, he did not survey his land the night before, the employer’s loss, and he gives them of an idle laborer.
llm_translation: The loss of workers, does not inspect his land from the light - the loss of a homeowner and gives them as idle workers.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רָבָא: הַאי מַאן דְּאוֹגַיר אֲגִירֵי לְדַוְולָא, וַאֲתָא מִטְרָא – פְּסֵידָא דְפוֹעֲלִים. אֲתָא נַהֲרָא – פְּסֵידָא דְּבַעַל הַבַּיִת, וְיָהֵיב לְהוּ כְּפוֹעֵל בָּטֵל.
human_translation: And Rava said: this one who hires laborers to draw water and rain fell, the laborers’ loss. the river comes the employer’s loss, And he gives them of an idle laborer.
llm_translation: And Rava said: One who hires laborers to thresh grain, and then rain comes - it is a loss of the workers' labor. If a river comes - it is a loss of the homeowner's produce, and he gives them their wages as if they were idle.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רָבָא: הַאי מַאן דְּאוֹגַיר אֲגִירֵי לְדַוְולָא, וּפְסַק נַהֲרָא בְּפַלְגָא דְיוֹמָא, אִי לָא עֲבִיד דְּפָסֵיק – פְּסֵידָא דְפוֹעֲלִים. עֲבִיד דְּפָסֵיק – אִי בְּנֵי מָתָא, פְּסֵידָא דְפוֹעֲלִים. לָאו בְּנֵי מָתָא – פְּסֵידָא דְּבַעַל הַבַּיִת.
human_translation: And Rava says: this one who hires laborers to draw water and the river stopped midday, If it is not prone to stopping, the laborers’ loss, it is prone to stopping, If of that city the laborers’ loss; not of that city the employer’s loss.
llm_translation: And Rava said: One who hires laborers to thresh grain, and the river ceases flowing in the middle of the day, if he does not stop - it is a loss of the workers. If he stops - if they are local workers, it is a loss of the employer. If they are not local workers - it is a loss of the homeowner.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רָבָא: הַאי מַאן דַּאֲגַר אֲגִירֵי לַעֲבִידְתָּא, וּשְׁלִים עֲבִידְתָּא בְּפַלְגָא דְיוֹמָא, אִי אִית לֵיהּ עֲבִידְתָּא דְּנִיחָא מִינַּהּ – יָהֵיב לְהוּ, אִי נָמֵי דִּכְוָתַהּ – מְפַקֵּד לְהוּ, (דקשה) [דְּקַשְׁיָא] מִינַּהּ – לָא מְפַקֵּד לְהוּ, וְנוֹתֵן לָהֶם שְׂכָרָן מִשָּׁלֵם.
human_translation: And Rava says: this one who hires laborers to task and the task is completed by midday, if he has task that is easier than he give it to them. Alternatively, similar to he assign it to them. more difficult than it, he may not assign to them, and he gives them their full wages.
llm_translation: And Rava said: One who hires workers for a task, and completes the task in half a day, if the task is to his liking - he pays them, and if it is not to his liking - he dismisses them. If it is difficult for him - he does not dismiss them, and he gives them their wages from his own pocket.

hebrew_text: אַמַּאי? וְלִיתֵּיב לְהוּ כְּפוֹעֵל בָּטֵל! כִּי קָאָמַר רָבָא, בְּאַכְלוֹשֵׁי דְמָחוֹזָא, דְּאִי לָא עָבְדִי – חָלְשִׁי.
human_translation: Why Let him pay them as an idle laborer. When Rava said to workers [ be’akhlushei ] of Meḥoza, who become weak if they do not work.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Why? And to sit for them as an idle worker! For Rava said, in the palm groves of Mahoza, if one does not work - he will become weak."

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: שָׁמִין לָהֶם אֶת מַה שֶּׁעָשׂוּ, כֵּיצַד? הָיָה יָפֶה שִׁשָּׁה דִּינָרִים – נוֹתֵן לָהֶם סֶלַע. קָא סָבְרִי רַבָּנַן: יַד פּוֹעֵל עַל הָעֶלְיוֹנָה.
human_translation: The Master said appraises for them that which they have done. How so? If was worth six dinars, he gives them a sela , The Rabbis hold the laborer is at an advantage,
llm_translation: Master said: We evaluate them based on what they did, how so? If it was worth six dinars - he gives them a sela. The Rabbis thought: A worker's hand is on the uppermost.

hebrew_text: אוֹ יִגְמְרוּ מְלַאכְתָּן וְיִטְּלוּ שְׁנֵי סְלָעִים. פְּשִׁיטָא! לָא צְרִיכָא: דְּאִיַּיקַּר עֲבִידְתָּא וְאִימְּרוּ פּוֹעֲלִים וַאֲזַל בַּעַל הַבַּיִת וּפַיְּיסִינְהוּ. מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא, מָצוּ אָמְרִי לֵיהּ: כִּי מְפַיְּיסִינַן – אַדַּעְתָּא דְּטָפֵית לַן אַאַגְרָא, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן דְּאָמַר לְהוּ: אַדַּעְתָּא דְּטָרַחְנָא לְכוּ בַּאֲכִילָה וּשְׁתִיָּה.
human_translation: Or they finish their work and take two sela . obvious No, necessary where the price of labor increased and the laborers rebelled and the employer went and appeased them Lest you say they can say to him: When we were appeased, with the intent that you would increase our wage, teaches us that say to them: with the intent that I would trouble myself for you with food and drink,
llm_translation: Or they should finish their work and take two rocks. Obvious! Not necessary: for if the work is precious and the workers say, and the homeowner goes and appeases them. What is the reason that you might say, they found and said to him: when we appease - you know that we have incurred expenses, he heard us saying to them: you know that we have exerted ourselves for you in food and drink.

hebrew_text: סֶלַע נוֹתֵן לָהֶם סֶלַע. פְּשִׁיטָא! לָא צְרִיכָא – דְּזַל עֲבִידְתָּא מֵעִיקָּרָא, וְאַגְרִינְהוּ בִּטְפֵי זוּזָא, וּלְסוֹף אִיַּיקַּר עֲבִידְתָּא וְקָם בִּטְפֵי זוּזָא.
human_translation: a sela , he gives them a sela . obvious? No, necessary where labor was inexpensive at the outset and he hired them for one dinar more and ultimately the price of labor increased and stands at one more dinar.
llm_translation: Rock gives them rock. Obviously! Not necessary - for this is like a primary work, and you hire them with small coins, and in the end, the primary work is done and you receive large coins.

hebrew_text: מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא אָמְרִי לֵיהּ: טְפֵי זוּזָא אֲמַרְתְּ לַן – טְפֵי זוּזָא הַב לַן, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן דַּאֲמַר לְהוּ, כִּי אֲמַרִי לְכוּ טְפֵי זוּזָא: דְּלָא הֲוָה קִים לְכוּ, הַשְׁתָּא קִים לְכוּ.
human_translation: Lest you say they say to him: offered us a dinar above give us one more dinar teaches us that he say to them: When I said to you one more dinar, that it was not clear with regard to you Now it is clear with regard to you,
llm_translation: What is the reasoning for saying to him: "You have said to us a small amount of money" - you have said to us a small amount of money, you are informing us that he said to them, "When I said to you a small amount of money: that it was not established for you, now it is established for you."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי דּוֹסָא אוֹמֵר: שָׁמִין לָהֶן אֶת מַה שֶּׁעָתִיד לְהֵיעָשׂוֹת, הָיָה יָפֶה שִׁשָּׁה דִּינָרִים נוֹתֵן לָהֶם שֶׁקֶל. קָסָבַר יַד פּוֹעֵל עַל הַתַּחְתּוֹנָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Dosa says: appraises for them that which must be done. was worth six dinars, he gives a shekel, holds laborer is at a disadvantage,
llm_translation: Rabbi Dosa says: "They hear what is destined to be done." It was beautiful to give them a shekel for six dinars. He holds that the hand of the worker is on the lower one.

hebrew_text: אוֹ יִגְמְרוּ מְלַאכְתָּן וְיִטְּלוּ שְׁנֵי סְלָעִים. פְּשִׁיטָא! לָא צְרִיכָא דְּזַל עֲבִידְתָּא וְאִימַּר בַּעַל הַבַּיִת, וַאֲזוּל פּוֹעֲלִים וּפַיְּיסוּהּ. מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא, מָצֵי אֲמַר לְהוּ: אַדַּעְתָּא דְּבָצְרִיתוּ לִי מֵאַגְרַיי. קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן דְּאָמְרִי לֵיהּ: אַדַּעְתָּא דְּעָבְדִינַן לָךְ עֲבִידְתָּא שַׁפִּירְתָּא.
human_translation: Or they finish their work and take two sela . obvious? No, necessary where labor decreased and the employer rebelled, and laborers went and appeased him Lest you say can say to them: with the intent that you would decrease your wages for me, teaches us that say to him: with the intent that we will do improved work for you.
llm_translation: Or they should finish their work and take two rocks. Obviously! It is not necessary to go and say to the homeowner, and then the workers go and appease him. What might you say, that he could say to them: "Know that you have saved me from my troubles." We learn that they said to him: "Know that we are doing your work beautifully."

hebrew_text: סֶלַע נוֹתֵן לָהֶם סֶלַע. פְּשִׁיטָא! אָמַר רַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב נָתָן: לָא צְרִיכָא דְּאוֹזִילוּ אִינְהוּ גַּבֵּיהּ זוּזָא מֵעִיקָּרָא, וּלְסוֹף זַל עֲבִידְתָּא.
human_translation: a sela , he gives them a sela . obvious? Rav Huna, son of Rav Natan, said: No, necessary where they reduced for him by a dinar at the outset, and ultimately labor decreased,
llm_translation: Rock gives them rock. Obviously! Rav Huna, son of Rav Natan, said: It is not necessary that they went down and took the coin from the beginning, but in the end, the matter will be done.

hebrew_text: מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: בְּצִיר זוּזָא אַמְרִיתוּ לִי – בְּצִיר זוּזָא יָהֵיבְנָא לְכוּ, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן דְּאָמְרִי לֵיהּ: כִּי אֲמַרְנָא לָךְ בִּבְצִיר זוּזָא – דְּלָא הֲוָה קִים לָךְ, הַשְׁתָּא קִים לָךְ.
human_translation: Lest you say You said to me a dinar less a dinar less I will give you. teaches us that say to him: When we said to you a dinar less, it was not clear that you now it is clear that you
llm_translation: What is the reason? In the matter of the zuzim coins you said to me - in the matter of the zuzim coins I will give you, it is evident to us that they said to him: "When we said to you regarding the zuzim coins - that they were not established for you, now they are established for you."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי דּוֹסָא. וּמִי אָמַר רַב הָכִי? וְהָאָמַר רַב: פּוֹעֵל יָכוֹל לַחֲזוֹר בּוֹ אֲפִילּוּ בַּחֲצִי הַיּוֹם! וְכִי תֵּימָא שָׁאנֵי לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי דּוֹסָא בֵּין שְׂכִירוּת לְקַבְּלָנוּת, וּמִי שָׁאנֵי לֵיהּ? וְהָתַנְיָא: הַשּׂוֹכֵר אֶת הַפּוֹעֵל, וְלַחֲצִי הַיּוֹם שָׁמַע שֶׁמֵּת לוֹ מֵת, אוֹ שֶׁאֲחָזַתּוּ חַמָּה, אִם שָׂכִיר הוּא –
human_translation: Rav said: halakha in accordance with Rabbi Dosa. And did Rav say that? But doesn’t Rav say a laborer can renege from even at midday? And if you would say there is a difference for Rabbi Dosa between hired and contracted is there a difference for him? But isn’t it taught one who hires a laborer, and at midday heard that of his died or if was gripped with fever if he is a hired laborer,
llm_translation: Rav said: The halakha is according to Rabbi Dosa. Did Rav really say this? But Rav said: A worker can retract even halfway through the day! If you say that he differs with Rabbi Dosa regarding hiring versus contracting, who does he differ with? But it was taught: If one hires a worker, and halfway through the day the worker hears that his relative has died, or if anger overcomes him, if he is a hired worker –

hebrew_text: נוֹתֵן לוֹ שְׂכָרוֹ, אִם קַבְּלָן הוּא – נוֹתֵן לוֹ קַבְּלָנוּתוֹ.
human_translation: he gives him his wage; if he is a contractor, he gives him his contracted
llm_translation: He gives him his wage, if he is a receiver - he gives him his receiver-ship.

hebrew_text: מַנִּי? אִילֵּימָא רַבָּנַן, מַאי אִירְיָא שָׁמַע שֶׁמֵּת לוֹ מֵת אוֹ שֶׁאֲחָזַתּוּ חַמָּה דַּאֲנִיס, כִּי לָא אֲנִיס נָמֵי – הָא אֲמַרוּ רַבָּנַן יַד פּוֹעֵל עַל הָעֶלְיוֹנָה! אֶלָּא לָאו רַבִּי דּוֹסָא הִיא, וּשְׁמַע מִינַּהּ לָא שָׁאנֵי לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי דּוֹסָא בֵּין שְׂכִירוּת לְקַבְּלָנוּת.
human_translation: Whose If we say the Rabbis, why specifically heard that of his died, or if was gripped with fever, where he was circumstances beyond his control? When not circumstances beyond his control also the Rabbis said the laborer is at an advantage. Rather, is it not is Rabbi Dosa? And learn from it Rabbi Dosa not differentiate between hired and contracted
llm_translation: Who is the author of this teaching? If you say it is the Rabbis, what is the case of one who heard that his relative died, and then he died, or that the sun shone on him and he died, for if the sun did not shine on him directly – the Rabbis have said: "The hand of the worker is upon the higher one!" Rather, it is not in accordance with Rabbi Dosa, and learn from it that it does not matter to Rabbi Dosa whether it is through hiring or through acceptance.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: בְּדָבָר הָאָבוּד, וְדִבְרֵי הַכֹּל.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: with regard to a matter that involves financial loss everyone agrees
llm_translation: Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: In the matter of lost property, and the words of everyone.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: כׇּל הַמְשַׁנֶּה יָדוֹ עַל הַתַּחְתּוֹנָה, וְכׇל הַחוֹזֵר בּוֹ יָדוֹ עַל הַתַּחְתּוֹנָה. בִּשְׁלָמָא כׇּל הַמְשַׁנֶּה יָדוֹ עַל הַתַּחְתּוֹנָה, דִּסְתַם לַן תַּנָּא כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה. אֶלָּא כׇּל הַחוֹזֵר בּוֹ יָדוֹ עַל הַתַּחְתּוֹנָה לְאֵתוֹיֵי מַאי? לָאו לְאֵתוֹיֵי פּוֹעֵל וּכְרַבִּי דּוֹסָא?
human_translation: We learned Whoever changes is at a disadvantage, and whoever reneges is at a disadvantage. Granted, Whoever changes is at a disadvantage, as the tanna taught us an unattributed in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda, But Whoever reneges is at a disadvantage, what to add? not to add laborer, and in accordance with Rabbi Dosa,
llm_translation: We learned in a Mishnah: Anyone who repeats his hand on the lower part, and anyone who returns it, his hand, on the lower part. Granted, anyone who repeats his hand on the lower part, for a Mishnah taught us like Rabbi Yehuda. But anyone who returns it, his hand, on the lower part, for what purpose? Is it not for the purpose of performing an action, and like Rabbi Dosa?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא רַבִּי דּוֹסָא תַּרְתֵּי קָאָמַר, וְרַב סָבַר לַהּ כְּווֹתֵיהּ בַּחֲדָא וּפָלֵיג עֲלֵיהּ בַּחֲדָא.
human_translation: Rather, Rabbi Dosa is saying two and Rav holds in accordance with his in one and disagrees with his in one
llm_translation: Rather, Rabbi Dosa said two things, and Rav holds like him in one and disagrees with him in one.

hebrew_text: אִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: ״כָּל הַחוֹזֵר בּוֹ יָדוֹ עַל הַתַּחְתּוֹנָה״, לְכִדְתַנְיָא: כׇּל הַחוֹזֵר בּוֹ כֵּיצַד? הֲרֵי שֶׁמָּכַר שָׂדֶה לַחֲבֵירוֹ בְּאֶלֶף זוּז, וְנָתַן לוֹ מָעוֹת מֵהֶן מָאתַיִם זוּז. בִּזְמַן שֶׁהַמּוֹכֵר חוֹזֵר בּוֹ – יַד לוֹקֵחַ עַל הָעֶלְיוֹנָה.
human_translation: If you wish, say Whoever reneges is at a disadvantage, to that which is taught Whoever reneges how so? If one sold a field to another for one thousand dinars, and gave him two hundred dinars when the seller reneges on the buyer is at an advantage.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: If you will say: "Anyone who retracts his hand on the lower part," it is in accordance with what was taught: How does one retract his hand? If he sold a field to his fellow for a thousand zuz, and he gave him money from them two hundred zuz. At the time when the seller retracts - the buyer takes possession of the upper part.

hebrew_text: רָצָה – אוֹמֵר לוֹ: ״תֵּן לִי מְעוֹתַי״, אוֹ: ״תֵּן לִי קַרְקַע כְּנֶגֶד מְעוֹתַי״. מֵהֵיכָן מַגְבֵּיהוּ? מִן הָעִידִּית. וּבִזְמַן שֶׁלּוֹקֵחַ חוֹזֵר בּוֹ – יַד מוֹכֵר עַל הָעֶלְיוֹנָה, רָצָה אוֹמֵר לוֹ: ״הֵילָךְ מְעוֹתֶיךָ״, רָצָה אוֹמֵר ״הֵילָךְ קַרְקַע כְּנֶגֶד מְעוֹתֶיךָ״. מֵהֵיכָן מַגְבֵּיהוּ? מִן הַזִּיבּוּרִית.
human_translation: desires, he say to him: Give me my money or give me land corresponding to my money. From which does give From superior-quality And when the buyer reneges, the seller is at an advantage: he desires, says to him: Take your money, he desires, he says to him: Take land corresponding to your money From which does give from inferior-quality
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Ratsah - omer lo: 'ten li me'otai', o: 'ten li karka k'neged me'otai'. Meheichan magbihu? Min ha'idit. U'vizman she'loke'ach chozer bo - yad mocher al ha'elyonah, ratsah omer lo: 'heilech me'otaich', ratsah omer 'heilech karka k'neged me'otaich'. Meheichan magbihu? Min hazibburit."

hebrew_text: רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: מְלַמְּדִין אוֹתָן שֶׁלֹּא יַחְזְרוּ. כֵּיצַד? כּוֹתֵב לוֹ: ״אֲנִי פְּלוֹנִי בֶּן פְּלוֹנִי מָכַרְתִּי שָׂדֶה פְּלוֹנִית לִפְלוֹנִי בְּאֶלֶף זוּז, וְנָתַן לִי מֵהֶם מָאתַיִם זוּז, וַהֲרֵינִי נוֹשֶׁה בּוֹ שְׁמוֹנֶה מֵאוֹת זוּז״, קָנָה וּמַחֲזִיר לוֹ אֶת הַשְּׁאָר, אֲפִילּוּ לְאַחַר כַּמָּה שָׁנִים.
human_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: We teach them not to renege, How so? writes him I, so-and-so, son of so-and-so, sold such and such a field to so-and-so for one thousand dinars, and of them he gave me two hundred dinars. And now he owes me eight hundred dinars. acquires and returns the remaining to even after several years.
llm_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: We teach them so they will not retract. How so? He writes to him: "I, so-and-so son of so-and-so, sold a field of so-and-so to so-and-so for a thousand zuz, and he gave me two hundred zuz from them, and I am now acquiring from him eight hundred zuz," he acquires and returns to him the rest, even after many years.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: מֵהֵיכָן מַגְבֵּיהוּ? מִן הָעִידִּית. קָא סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ מֵעִידִּית דִּנְכָסָיו. וְלֹא יְהֵא אֶלָּא בַּעַל חוֹב! וּתְנַן: בַּעַל חוֹב דִּינוֹ בְּבֵינוֹנִית. וְעוֹד: הָא אַרְעָא דְּיָהֵיב זוּזֵי?
human_translation: The Master said From which does give From superior-quality enter your mind from superior-quality of property. But is only creditor, we learned a creditor has the right to intermediate-quality And furthermore, this land, for which paid money.
llm_translation: Master said: From where does he collect it? From the promissory note. Your mind is departing from the promissory note of his assets. And it should only be a debtor! And we learned: A debtor, his judgment is in the intermediate court. And furthermore: The land that he gives as collateral?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: מֵעִידִּית שֶׁבָּהּ, וּמִזִּיבּוּרִית שֶׁבָּהּ.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: from superior-quality that is in from inferior-quality that is in it.
llm_translation: Rabbi Nachman bar Yitzchak said: From the testimony within it, and from the explanation within it.

hebrew_text: רַב אַחָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אִיקָא אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא מֵעִידִּית דִּנְכָסָיו, סְתַם מַאן דְּזָבֵין אַרְעָא בְּאַלְפָּא זוּזֵי – אוֹזוֹלֵי מוֹזֵיל וּמְזַבֵּין נְכָסָיו, וְהָוֵה לֵיהּ כְּנִיזָּק. וּתְנַן: הַנִּיזָּקִין שָׁמִין לָהֶן בְּעִידִּית.
