human_translation: Rav Aḥa, son of Rav Ika, said: You even say from superior-quality of property, Ordinarily, one buys land for one thousand dinars will significantly reduce his possessions and sell and he will be like an injured and we learned appraises superior-quality for payment to injured
llm_translation: Rav Acha son of Rav Ika said: Even if the witnesses testify about his property, whoever buys land for a thousand zuz - he goes and sells and transfers his property, and it becomes like a possession. And we learned: The injured parties can rely on their testimony.

hebrew_text: רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: מְלַמְּדִין אוֹתָן שֶׁלֹּא יַחְזְרוּ. כֵּיצַד? כּוֹתֵב לוֹ: ״אֲנִי פְּלוֹנִי בֶּן פְּלוֹנִי כּוּ׳״. טַעְמָא דִּכְתַב לֵיהּ הָכִי, הָא לָא כְּתַב הָכִי – לָא קָנֵי?
human_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: We teach them not to renege. How so? He writes for him: I, so-and-so, son of so-and-so, The reason is that wrote this for if not for this does not acquire
llm_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: They teach them so that they will not forget. How so? He writes to him: "I, so-and-so son of so-and-so, say..." The reason he wrote it this way is that if he did not write it this way, it is not valid.

hebrew_text: וְהָתַנְיָא: הַנּוֹתֵן עֵרָבוֹן לַחֲבֵירוֹ וְאָמַר לוֹ ״אִם אֲנִי חוֹזֵר בִּי, עֶרְבוֹנִי מָחוּל לָךְ״, וְהַלָּה אוֹמֵר: ״אִם אֲנִי חוֹזֵר בִּי, אֶכְפּוֹל לָךְ עֶרְבוֹנְךָ״ – נִתְקַיְּימוּ הַתְּנָאִין, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יוֹסֵי.
human_translation: But isn’t it taught one who gives a down payment to another, and says to him: If I renege, my down payment is forfeited to you, and the other says to him: If I renege, I will double your down payment for you, the conditions are in effect; the statement of Rabbi Yosei.
llm_translation: And it was taught in a Baraita: One who gives a pledge to his fellow and says to him, "If I retract, my pledge is annulled for you," and the other says, "If I retract, I will forfeit your pledge" - the stipulations are upheld, the words of Rabbi Yosei.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי לְטַעְמֵיהּ דְּאָמַר: אַסְמַכְתָּא קָנְיָא.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei to his reasoning, as he says: A transaction with inconclusive consent [ asmakhta ] effects acquisition.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei according to his reasoning said: "A support acquires."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: דַּיּוֹ שֶׁיִּקְנֶה כְּנֶגֶד עֶרְבוֹנוֹ. אָמַר רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל: בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים – בִּזְמַן שֶׁאָמַר לוֹ ״עֶרְבוֹנִי יִקּוֹן״. אֲבָל מָכַר לוֹ שָׂדֶה בְּאֶלֶף זוּז וְנָתַן לוֹ מֵהֶם חֲמֵשׁ מֵאוֹת זוּז – קָנָה, וּמַחְזִיר לוֹ אֶת הַשְּׁאָר אֲפִילּוּ לְאַחַר כַּמָּה שָׁנִים!
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: It is sufficient that effects acquisition commensurate with his down payment. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel said: In what is this statement said? when said to My down payment will effect acquisition But one sold a field for one thousand dinars, and paid him five hundred dinars of acquired and he returns the rest to even after several years
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: Sufficient that he acquires against his pledge. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel said: In what case are these words said? - When he said to him, "My pledge shall stand." But if he sold him a field for a thousand zuz and he gave him only five hundred zuz from them - he has acquired, and he must return to him the rest even after many years!

hebrew_text: לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא דְּקָא עָיֵיל וְנָפֵיק אַזּוּזֵי, הָא דְּלָא קָא עָיֵיל וְנָפֵיק אַזּוּזֵי.
human_translation: This not difficult. This where goes in and goes out for money, That where he does not go in and go out for money.
llm_translation: Not difficult: this one that goes in and comes out with coins, this one that does not go in and comes out with coins.

hebrew_text: דְּאָמַר רָבָא: הַאי מַאן דְּזַבֵּין מִידֵּי לְחַבְרֵיהּ וְקָא עָיֵיל וְנָפֵיק אַזּוּזֵי – לָא קָנֵי. לָא קָא עָיֵיל וְנָפֵיק אַזּוּזֵי – קָנֵי.
human_translation: as Rava says: one who sells to another and goes in and goes out for money, has not acquired If he does not go in and go out for money, has acquired
llm_translation: Rava said: One who sells an item to his friend and it the item is coming and going being passed back and forth and money is exchanged - he does not acquire ownership. If it is not coming and going being passed back and forth and money is exchanged - he acquires ownership.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רָבָא: הַאי מַאן דְּאוֹזְפֵיהּ מְאָה זוּזֵי לְחַבְרֵיהּ וּפַרְעֵיהּ זוּזָא זוּזָא – פֵּרָעוֹן הָוֵי, אֶלָּא דְּאִית לֵיהּ תַּרְעוֹמֶת גַּבֵּיהּ. דְּאָמַר לֵיהּ: אַפְסַדְתִּינְהוּ מִינַּאי.
human_translation: And Rava says: one who lent one hundred dinars to another and paid it back one dinar at a time, this is repayment. But has a grievance against him as he say to him: You have caused me to lose
llm_translation: And Rava said: One who lends one hundred coins to his friend, and his friend repays him coin by coin - this is considered interest, unless he has a mortar in his possession. For he said to him: "I have caused you a loss from my own."

hebrew_text: הָהוּא גַּבְרָא דְּזַבֵּין לֵיהּ חֲמָרָא לְחַבְרֵיהּ וּפָשׁ לֵיהּ חַד זוּזָא, וְקָא עָיֵיל וְנָפֵיק אַזּוּזָא. יָתֵיב רַב אָשֵׁי וְקָא מְעַיֵּין בַּהּ: כִּי הַאי גַוְונָא מַאי: קָנֵי אוֹ לָא קָנֵי? אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב מָרְדֳּכַי לְרַב אָשֵׁי: הָכִי אָמַר אֲבִימִי מֵהַגְרוֹנְיָא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרָבָא: זוּזָא כְּזוּזֵי דָּמֵי, וְלָא קָנֵי.
human_translation: a certain man who sold his donkey to another, and one dinar was still owed to him, and went in and went out for his dinar. Rav Ashi sat and examined this a case like this, what he acquired or he not acquired Rav Mordekhai said to Rav Ashi: This is what Avimi of Hagronya said in the name of Rava: One dinar is considered like dinars, and he has not acquired
llm_translation: That man who was selling wine to his friends and a coin fell from him, and he went and found a zuz. Rav Ashi was sitting and examining it: What is the law in this case? Did he acquire it or not acquire it? Rav Mordechai said to Rav Ashi: Abimi from Hagrauni said in the name of Rava: A zuz is like a zuz, and he did not acquire it.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אַחָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יוֹסֵף לְרַב אָשֵׁי: וְהָא אָמְרִינַן מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרָבָא קָנֵי! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: תִּתַּרְגַּם שְׁמַעְתָּיךָ בְּמוֹכֵר שָׂדֵהוּ
human_translation: Rav Aḥa, son of Rav Yosef, said to Rav Ashi: But we say in the name of Rava he has acquired said to him, Interpret your halakha with regard to sells his field
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Ahah son of Rav Yosef said to Rav Ashi: But don't we say that Rava acquires through his name! He said to him: Translate your statement in the case of one who sells his field.

hebrew_text: מִפְּנֵי רָעָתָהּ.
human_translation: due to its poor
llm_translation: Because of her evil.

hebrew_text: פְּשִׁיטָא: בָּעֵי לְזַבּוֹנֵי בִּמְאָה וְלָא אַשְׁכַּח, וְזַבֵּין בְּמָאתַיִם, וְקָא עָיֵיל וְנָפֵיק אַזּוּזֵי – לָא קָנֵי. אֶלָּא אִי בָּעֵי לְזַבּוֹנֵי בִּמְאָה וְלָא אַשְׁכַּח, וְאִי טָרַח הֲוָה מַשְׁכַּח, וְלָא טְרַח וְזַבֵּין בְּמָאתַיִם, וְקָא עָיֵיל וְנָפֵיק אַזּוּזֵי – מַאי: כְּמוֹכֵר שָׂדֵהוּ מִפְּנֵי רָעָתָהּ דָּמֵי, אוֹ לָא? תֵּיקוּ.
human_translation: obvious wants to sell for one hundred but does not find and sells for two hundred, and goes in and goes out for money, has not acquired But if he wants to sell for one hundred and does not find and if he troubled he would find and he did not trouble and sells for two hundred, and goes in and goes out for money, what considered like one who sells a field due to its poor or not? shall stand
llm_translation: The straightforward ruling is: if one wants to redeem with a hundred and does not find, and sells for two hundred, and then goes and takes out the coins - he does not acquire. Rather, if one wants to redeem with a hundred and does not find, or if he made an effort and forgot, and did not make an effort and sells for two hundred, and then goes and takes out the coins - what is the law? Like one who sells his field because of its poor quality, does he pay the value or not? This matter remains unresolved.

hebrew_text: שָׂכַר אֶת הַחַמָּר וְאֶת הַקַּדָּר וְכוּ׳ שׂוֹכֵר עֲלֵיהֶן אוֹ מַטְעָן. עַד כַּמָּה שׂוֹכֵר עֲלֵיהֶן? אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: עַד כְּדֵי שְׂכָרָן.
human_translation: one hired a donkey driver or a potter he may hire at or deceive them Up to what may he hire at their Rav Naḥman said: Up to their wages,
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "He hired the donkey and the pot, etc., whether he hires them or loads them. How much does he hire them for? Rav Nachman said: Up to their hire."

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ רָבָא לְרַב נַחְמָן: עַד אַרְבָּעִים וַחֲמִשִּׁים זוּז! אָמַר לֵיהּ: כִּי תַּנְיָא הָהִיא – שֶׁבָּאתָה חֲבִילָה לְיָדוֹ.
human_translation: Rava raised an objection to Rav Naḥman: up to forty or fifty dinars. said to him: When that is taught where the bundle has come into his possession,
llm_translation: He raised an objection to Rav Nachman: "Up to forty-five zuz!" He said to him: "For it was taught in that Baraita - 'When you brought a bundle into his hand.'"

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַשּׂוֹכֵר אֶת הַחֲמוֹר לְהוֹלִיכוֹ בָּהָר וְהוֹלִיכוֹ בַּבִּקְעָה, בַּבִּקְעָה וְהוֹלִיכוֹ בָּהָר, אֲפִילּוּ זוֹ עֶשֶׂר מִילִין וְזוֹ עֶשֶׂר מִילִין, וּמֵתָה – חַיָּיב. הַשּׂוֹכֵר אֶת הַחֲמוֹר לְהוֹלִיכָהּ בָּהָר וְהוֹלִיכָה בַּבִּקְעָה, אִם הֶחְלִיקָה – פָּטוּר, וְאִם הוּחֲמָה – חַיָּיב. לְהוֹלִיכָהּ בַּבִּקְעָה וְהוֹלִיכָה בָּהָר, אִם הֶחְלִיקָה – חַיָּיב, וְאִם הוּחַמָּה – פָּטוּר, אִם מֵחֲמַת הַמַּעֲלָה – חַיָּיב.
human_translation: one who rents a donkey to lead it on a mountain but he led it in a valley, in a valley but he led it on a mountain, even this is ten mil and that one is ten mil , and dies, liable. one who rents a donkey to lead it on a mountain but he led it in a valley, if it slipped exempt, but if it heatstroke liable, to lead it in a valley but he led it on a mountain, if it slipped liable, but if it heatstroke exempt. If due to the ascent, liable.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who rents a donkey to lead it up a mountain and leads it down into a valley, or leads it down into a valley and then up a mountain, even if one is ten mil and the other is ten mil, and it dies – he is liable. One who rents a donkey to lead it up a mountain and leads it down into a valley, if it slipped – he is exempt, but if it became heated – he is liable. If he leads it down into a valley and then up a mountain, if it slipped – he is liable, but if it became heated – he is exempt. If it is due to the ascent – he is liable.

hebrew_text: הַשּׂוֹכֵר אֶת הַחֲמוֹר וְהִבְרִיקָה אוֹ שֶׁנַּעֲשֵׂית אַנְגַּרְיָא – אוֹמֵר לוֹ: הֲרֵי שֶׁלְּךָ לְפָנֶיךָ. מֵתָה אוֹ נִשְׁבְּרָה – חַיָּיב לְהַעֲמִיד [לוֹ] חֲמוֹר.
human_translation: one who rents a donkey and it became ill or was seized for public service [ angarya ], say to That which is yours is before you, died or broke, is obligated to provide donkey.
llm_translation: The one who rents the donkey and it became injured or it was stolen - he says to him: "Here is yours before you." If it dies or is broken - he is obligated to provide him with a donkey.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאי שְׁנָא רֵישָׁא דְּלָא קָא מְפַלֵּיג, וּמַאי שְׁנָא סֵיפָא דְּקָא מְפַלֵּיג?
human_translation: What is different the first clause, where does not distinguish and what is different latter clause, where he does distinguish
llm_translation: Gemara: What is different about the beginning that he does not argue, and what is different about the end that he argues?

hebrew_text: אָמְרִי דְּבֵי רַבִּי יַנַּאי: רֵישָׁא שֶׁמֵּתָה מֵחֲמַת אֲוִיר, דְּאָמְרִינַן אַוֵּירָא דְהַר קַטְלַהּ, וְאָמְרִינַן אַוֵּירָא דְבִקְעָה קַטְלַהּ. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר חֲנִינָא אָמַר: כְּגוֹן שֶׁמֵּתָה מֵחֲמַת אוּבְצָנָא. רַבָּה אָמַר: כְּגוֹן שֶׁהִכִּישָׁהּ נָחָשׁ.
human_translation: from the school of Rabbi Yannai said: The first clause where it died on account of the air, as we say the air of the mountains killed it and we say the air of the valley killed it. Rabbi Yosei bar Ḥanina said: where it died on account of exhaustion [ uvtzena ], Rabba said: where a snake bit it,
llm_translation: The House of Rabbi Yannai said: Initially, she died due to the heat of the air, as we say, "The air of the mountain killed her," and we say, "The air of the valley killed her." Rabbi Yosei bar Hanina said: For example, she died due to the heat of the oven. Rabbah said: For example, a snake bit her.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הָא מַנִּי רַבִּי מֵאִיר הִיא, דְּאָמַר: כׇּל הַמַּעֲבִיר עַל דַּעַת שֶׁל בַּעַל הַבַּיִת,
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba Rabbi Yoḥanan said: whose is this It is Rabbi Meir, who says: Anyone who diverges from the intention of the employer
llm_translation: Rabbi Chiya bar Abba said Rabbi Yochanan: This is the teaching of Rabbi Meir, as he said: "Anyone who overrides the will of the homeowner,

hebrew_text: נִקְרָא גַּזְלָן.
human_translation: is called a robber.
llm_translation: He is called a gazlan.

hebrew_text: הֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר? אִילֵימָא רַבִּי מֵאִיר דְּצַבָּע, דִּתְנַן: הַנּוֹתֵן צֶמֶר לַצַבָּע לִצְבּוֹעַ לוֹ אָדוֹם וּצְבָעוֹ שָׁחוֹר, שָׁחוֹר וּצְבָעוֹ אָדוֹם, רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: נוֹתֵן לוֹ דְּמֵי צַמְרוֹ.
human_translation: Which Rabbi Meir’s If we say Rabbi Meir’s to a dyer, As we learned one who gives wool to a dyer to dye red for him, and he dyed it black, black and he dyed it red, Rabbi Meir says: gives the value of his wool.
llm_translation: Be Rabbi Meir? Perhaps Rabbi Meir of dye, as we learned: One who gives wool to a dyer to dye it red, and its color turns out black, or black and its color turns out red, Rabbi Meir says: he should pay him the value of his wool.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אִם הַשֶּׁבַח יָתֵר עַל הַיְּצִיאָה – נוֹתֵן לוֹ אֶת הַיְּצִיאָה, וְאִם הַיְּצִיאָה יְתֵירָה עַל הַשֶּׁבַח – נוֹתֵן לוֹ אֶת הַשֶּׁבַח.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: If the enhancement exceeds the expenses, gives the expenses. And if the expenses exceed the enhancement, he gives him the enhancement.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: If the praise is greater than the departure - give him the departure, and if the departure is greater than the praise - give him the praise.

hebrew_text: מִמַּאי: דִּלְמָא שָׁאנֵי הָתָם דְּקַנְיֵאּ בְּשִׁינּוּי מַעֲשֶׂה?
human_translation: From where Perhaps it is different there, as acquired by means of physical change
llm_translation: From what: perhaps it is different there, since it involves a change of action?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא הָא רַבִּי מֵאִיר דְּמִגְבַּת פּוּרִים, דְּתַנְיָא: מִגְבַּת פּוּרִים – לְפוּרִים. מִגְבַּת הָעִיר – לְאוֹתָהּ הָעִיר, וְאֵין מְדַקְדְּקִין בַּדָּבָר. אֲבָל לוֹקְחִין אֶת הָעֲגָלִים וְשׁוֹחֲטִין וְאוֹכְלִים אוֹתָן, וְהַמּוֹתָר יִפּוֹל לְכִיס שֶׁל צְדָקָה.
human_translation: Rather, Rabbi Meir of Purim collection. As it is taught Purim collection, for Purim; the city collection, for that city. And one does not scrutinize the matter but they acquire the calves and slaughter and eat them, and the remainder goes to the charity fund
llm_translation: Rather, this is what Rabbi Meir says regarding the collection of Purim funds, as it was taught: "Collection of Purim funds - for Purim. Collection of the city - for that city, and we do not scrutinize the matter. But one may take the calves, slaughter them, and eat them, and the surplus may fall into the charity purse."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: מִגְבַּת פּוּרִים לְפוּרִים, וְאֵין הֶעָנִי רַשַּׁאי לִיקַּח מֵהֶן רְצוּעָה לְסַנְדָּלוֹ, אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן הִתְנָה בְּמַעֲמַד אַנְשֵׁי הָעִיר, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יַעֲקֹב שֶׁאָמַר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי מֵאִיר. וְרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל מֵיקֵל.
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says Purim collection is for Purim and not permitted for a poor person to purchase a strap for his sandal from it unless he stipulated in the presence of the people of the city the statement of Rabbi Ya’akov, who said in the name of Rabbi Meir. But Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel is lenient.
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: From the collection of Purim to Purim, and the poor person is not permitted to take from them a strap for his sandal, unless he was appointed by the leaders of the city, the words of Rabbi Yaakov who said in the name of Rabbi Meir. And Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel is lenient.

hebrew_text: דִּלְמָא הָתָם נָמֵי, דְּאַדַּעְתָּא דְפוּרִים הוּא דְּיָהֵיב לֵיהּ, אַדַּעְתָּא דְּמִידֵּי אַחֲרִינָא לָא יָהֵיב לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Perhaps there too, with the intent for Purim that he gave him he did not give him with the intent for anything else.
llm_translation: Perhaps there, it is possible, that the knowledge of Purim is what he gave him, the knowledge of others he did not give him.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא הָא רַבִּי מֵאִיר, דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי מֵאִיר: הַנּוֹתֵן דִּינָר לְעָנִי לִיקַּח לוֹ חָלוּק – לֹא יִקַּח בּוֹ טַלִּית, טַלִּית – לֹא יִקַּח בּוֹ חָלוּק, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁמַּעֲבִיר עַל דַּעְתּוֹ שֶׁל בַּעַל הַבַּיִת.
human_translation: Rather, this Rabbi Meir, as it is taught Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says in the name of Rabbi Meir: one who gives a dinar to a poor person to purchase a robe for himself, he may not purchase a cloak with it; a cloak, he may not purchase a robe with it, because diverges from the intent of the homeowner,
llm_translation: Rather, this is what Rabbi Meir said, as it was taught: Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says in the name of Rabbi Meir: One who gives a dinar to a poor person to buy for himself a cloak - he should not buy with it a tunic, a tunic - he should not buy with it a cloak, because he goes against the intention of the homeowner.

hebrew_text: וְדִלְמָא שָׁאנֵי הָתָם דְּאָתוּ לְמִחְשְׁדֵיהּ, דְּאָמְרִי אִינָשֵׁי, אֲמַר פְּלָנְיָא: זָבֵנְינָא לֵיהּ לְבוּשָׁא לִפְלוֹנִי עַנְיָא, וְלָא זְבַן לֵיהּ. אִי נָמֵי, זָבֵנְינָא לֵיהּ גְּלִימָא וְלָא זְבַן לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Perhaps it is different there, as they will come to suspect for people say so-and-so said: I am purchasing clothing for such and such a poor person, but he did not purchase it. Alternatively, I am purchasing him a cloak, but he did not purchase it for him,
llm_translation: And perhaps it is different there because they came to suspect him, as people say, so-and-so said: "We bought a garment for so-and-so for one hundred, and he did not buy it." If so, we bought him a cloak and he did not buy it.

hebrew_text: אִם כֵּן, לִיתְנֵי: ״מִפְּנֵי הַחֲשָׁד״, מַאי: ״מִפְּנֵי שֶׁמַּעֲבִיר עַל דַּעְתּוֹ שֶׁל בַּעַל הַבַּיִת״ – שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ מִשּׁוּם דשַׁנִּי הוּא, וְכׇל הַמַּעֲבִיר עַל דַּעַת שֶׁל בַּעַל הַבַּיִת נִקְרָא גַּזְלָן.
human_translation: If so, let teach: Because of suspicion. What Because he diverges from the intent of the homeowner? Conclude from it that because he changed and anyone who diverges from the intention of the employer is called a robber.
llm_translation: If so, let it teach: "Because of suspicion," what is meant by: "Because he disregards the opinion of the homeowner" – learn from it that he is called a thief, and anyone who disregards the opinion of the homeowner is called a thief.

hebrew_text: הַשּׂוֹכֵר אֶת הַחֲמוֹר וְהִבְרִיקָה, מַאי ״וְהִבְרִיקָה״? הָכָא תַּרְגִּימוּ ״נְהוֹרִיתָא״. רָבָא אָמַר: אַבְזְקָת.
human_translation: one who rents a donkey and it became ill [ vehivrika ], What vehivrika ? Here, they interpreted light in the eye, Rava said worm rot [ avzeket ],
llm_translation: The one who rents the donkey and it broke, what is "and it broke"? Here, interpret it as "it stumbled." Rava said: a stumble.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא דַּאֲמַר לְהוּ: אַבְזְקָת בְּמֵילָתָא דְּמַלְכָּא, אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: בְּמַאי? בְּטַלֵּי כְסַף, אוֹ בְּטַלֵּי דְהַב? אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: בְּטַלֵּי כְסַף אֲמַר, וְקַטְלוּהּ. אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: בְּטַלֵּי דְהַב אֲמַר, וְשַׁבְקוּהּ.
human_translation: a certain who said to worm rot on the king’s clothing. They said to him: On what On silver, items or on gold, items? There are who say he said on silver items, and they killed him. There are who say he said on gold items, and they let him be.
llm_translation: That one who said to them: the ring of the king's word, they said to him: with what? With silver or with gold? There are some who say: with silver he said, and they killed him. There are some who say: with gold he said, and they left him.

hebrew_text: אוֹ שֶׁנַּעֲשֵׂית אַנְגַּרְיָא, אוֹמֵר לוֹ: הֲרֵי שֶׁלְּךָ לְפָנֶיךָ. אָמַר רַב: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא בְּאַנְגַּרְיָא חוֹזֶרֶת. אֲבָל אַנְגַּרְיָא שֶׁאֵינָהּ חוֹזֶרֶת, חַיָּיב לְהַעֲמִיד לוֹ חֲמוֹר.
human_translation: Or was seized for public service, say to That which is yours is before you. Rav says: They taught only with regard to temporary public service, But permanent public service, obligated to provide donkey.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Or she'ne'aseit angaryah, omer lo: harei shelkha lefaneikha. Amar Rav: lo shanu ela be'angaryah chozeret. Aval angaryah she'einah chozeret, chayav leha'amid lo chamor. English translation: Or if she became an angaryah, he says to her: "Here is what is yours before you." Rav said: They only taught this regarding a returning angaryah. But an angaryah that does not return, he is obligated to provide her with a donkey.

hebrew_text: וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: בֵּין אַנְגַּרְיָא חוֹזֶרֶת בֵּין אַנְגַּרְיָא שֶׁאֵינָהּ חוֹזֶרֶת, אִם בְּדֶרֶךְ הֲלִיכָה נִיטְּלָה – אוֹמֵר לוֹ: הֲרֵי שֶׁלְּךָ לְפָנֶיךָ. וְאִם לָאו בְּדֶרֶךְ הֲלִיכָתָהּ נִיטְּלָה – חַיָּיב לְהַעֲמִיד לוֹ חֲמוֹר.
human_translation: And Shmuel said: Whether a permanent public service or a temporary public service, if it was seized which it walking, say to That which is yours is before you. But if it was seized not in which it walking, obligated to provide donkey.
llm_translation: Samuel said: Whether the Angaria is returning or not returning, if she took it on the way of walking - he says to him: "Here is yours before you." And if not, if she took it on the way of her walking - he is obligated to stand a donkey for him.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: הַשּׂוֹכֵר אֶת הַחֲמוֹר וְהִבְרִיקָה אוֹ שֶׁנִּשְׁתַּטְּתָה, אוֹמֵר לוֹ: הֲרֵי שֶׁלְּךָ לְפָנֶיךָ. מֵתָה אוֹ שֶׁנַּעֲשֵׂית אַנְגַּרְיָא – חַיָּיב לְהַעֲמִיד לוֹ חֲמוֹר.
human_translation: raises an objection one who rents a donkey and it became ill or went mad, say to That which is yours is before you. If it died or was seized for public service, obligated to provide donkey.
llm_translation: Challenger: One who rents a donkey and it broke, or if it got lost, he says to him: "Here is yours before you." If it died or if it became lame - he is obligated to provide him with a donkey.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְרַב לָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן בְּאַנְגַּרְיָא חוֹזֶרֶת, כָּאן בְּאַנְגַּרְיָא שֶׁאֵינָהּ חוֹזֶרֶת. אֶלָּא לִשְׁמוּאֵל קַשְׁיָא!
human_translation: Granted, according to Rav not difficult, here, to permanent public service, there, to temporary public service. But according to Shmuel difficult.
llm_translation: In truth, for Rav it is not difficult: here in Angarya it returns, here in Angarya it does not return. Rather, for Shmuel it is difficult!

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא לִשְׁמוּאֵל נָמֵי לָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן שֶׁבְּדֶרֶךְ הֲלִיכָתָהּ נִיטְּלָה, כָּאן שֶׁלֹּא בְּדֶרֶךְ הֲלִיכָתָהּ נִיטְּלָה.
human_translation: And if you would say according to Shmuel too, not difficult, here, where it was seized which it walking, and there, where it was seized not which it walking
llm_translation: And if you say it is according to Shmuel, indeed it is not difficult: here where it was removed in the way of its going, here where it was not removed in the way of its going.

hebrew_text: הָא מִדְּקָתָנֵי סֵיפָא: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: אִם בְּדֶרֶךְ הֲלִיכָתָהּ נִיטְּלָה, אוֹמֵר לוֹ: הֲרֵי שֶׁלְּךָ לְפָנֶיךָ, וְאִם לָאו – חַיָּיב לְהַעֲמִיד לוֹ חֲמוֹר. מִכְּלָל דִּלְתַנָּא קַמָּא לָא שָׁאנֵי לֵיהּ!
human_translation: from that teaches in the latter clause Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: If it was seized which it walking say to That which is yours is before you, but if not obligated to provide donkey, by inference according to the first tanna is no difference
llm_translation: The Gemara continues: Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: If she removed it in the normal manner of walking, he says to her: "It is yours before you," and if not, he is obligated to provide her with a donkey. From the fact that the first Tanna did not teach this, it is evident!

hebrew_text: אָמַר לְךָ שְׁמוּאֵל: לָאו מִי אִיכָּא רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר דְּקָאֵי כְּווֹתִי? אֲנָא דַּאֲמַרִי כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר. אִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא כּוּלָּהּ רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר הִיא, וְחַסּוֹרֵי מִיחַסְּרָא וְהָכִי קָתָנֵי: הַשּׂוֹכֵר אֶת הַחֲמוֹר וְהִבְרִיקָה אוֹ נִשְׁתַּטֵּית, אוֹמֵר לוֹ: הֲרֵי שֶׁלְּךָ לְפָנֶיךָ. מֵתָה אוֹ שֶׁנַּעֲשֵׂית אַנְגַּרְיָא – חַיָּיב לְהַעֲמִיד לוֹ חֲמוֹר. בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים – שֶׁלֹּא בְּדֶרֶךְ הֲלִיכָתָהּ נִיטְּלָה, אֲבָל נִיטְּלָה בְּדֶרֶךְ הֲלִיכָתָהּ – אוֹמֵר לוֹ: הֲרֵי שֶׁלְּךָ לְפָנֶיךָ.
human_translation: Shmuel say to you: Isn’t there Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar, who holds in accordance with my I spoke in accordance with Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar. If you wish, say entire is Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar, and is incomplete, and this is what it is teaching: one who rents a donkey and it became ill or went mad, say to That which is yours is before you. it died or was seized for public service, obligated to provide donkey. In what is this statement said? When it is seized not which it walking but it was seized which it walking, say to That which is yours is before you.
llm_translation: He said to you, Samuel: Is it not so that Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar is standing like my equal? I, who say like Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar. If you wish, say that it is all Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar, and the lacking is from the lacking, and so it is taught: "One who rents a donkey and it is stolen or dies, he says to him: 'Here it is before you.' If it dies or becomes lame – he is obligated to provide him with a donkey. In what case are these matters said – that it was not taken on its proper path, but if it was taken on its proper path – he says to him: 'Here it is before you.'"

hebrew_text: דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר. שֶׁהָיָה רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: אִם בְּדֶרֶךְ הִילּוּכָהּ נִיטְּלָה – אוֹמֵר לוֹ: הֲרֵי שֶׁלְּךָ לְפָנֶיךָ, וְאִם לֹא – חַיָּיב לְהַעֲמִיד לוֹ חֲמוֹר.
human_translation: the statement of Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar, as Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar would say: If was seized which it walking, say to That which is yours is before you, but if not, obligated to provide donkey.
llm_translation: Words of Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar. Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar would say: If its removal is in the manner of its walking - he says to him: "It is yours before you," and if not - he is obligated to stand a donkey for him.

hebrew_text: וּמִי מָצֵית מוֹקְמַתְּ לַהּ כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר? וְהָא קָתָנֵי רֵישָׁא: הַשּׂוֹכֵר אֶת הַחֲמוֹר וְהִבְרִיקָה אוֹ שֶׁנִּשְׁתַּטְּתָה, אוֹמֵר לוֹ: הֲרֵי שֶׁלְּךָ לְפָנֶיךָ. וְאִילּוּ רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר אָמַר: הַשּׂוֹכֵר אֶת הַחֲמוֹר לִרְכּוֹב עָלֶיהָ וְהִבְרִיקָה אוֹ שֶׁנִּשְׁתַּטְּתָה – חַיָּיב לְהַעֲמִיד לוֹ חֲמוֹר!
human_translation: And can you establish in accordance with Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar? But the first clause teaches: one who rents a donkey and it became ill or went mad, say to That which is yours is before you. And yet Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar said one who rents a donkey to ride on it, and it becomes ill or goes mad, obligated to provide donkey.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And who established for her like Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar? But isn't it taught in the beginning: If one rents a donkey and it breaks or becomes lost, he says to him: 'Here is yours before you.' But if Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar said: If one rents a donkey to ride on it and it breaks or becomes lost - he is obligated to provide him with a donkey!"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר רַב הוּנָא: לִרְכּוֹב עָלֶיהָ שָׁאנֵי. אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: וּכְלֵי זְכוּכִית – כְּלִרְכּוֹב עָלֶיהָ דָּמֵי.
human_translation: Rabba bar Rav Huna said to ride on is different, Rav Pappa said: And glass vessels is considered like riding on it,
llm_translation: Rabba bar Rav Huna said: "To ride on it is different." Rav Papa said: "And glass vessels - the value of riding on them."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר רַב הוּנָא אָמַר רַב: הַשּׂוֹכֵר אֶת הַחֲמוֹר לִרְכּוֹב עָלֶיהָ וּמֵתָה לוֹ בַּחֲצִי הַדֶּרֶךְ, נוֹתֵן לוֹ שְׂכָרוֹ שֶׁל חֲצִי הַדֶּרֶךְ, וְאֵין לוֹ עָלָיו אֶלָּא תַּרְעוֹמֶת.
human_translation: Rabba bar Rav Huna says Rav says: one who rents a donkey to ride on it and it died halfway through the journey, gives his fee for half of the journey, but has nothing but a grievance against
llm_translation: Rabba bar Rav Huna said in the name of Rav: One who rents a donkey to ride on it, and it dies for him halfway on the journey, he gives him half of the journey's payment, and he has nothing upon him except for the saddlecloth.

hebrew_text: הֵיכִי דָמֵי? אִי דִּשְׁכִיחַ לְאֹגוֹרֵי – תַּרְעוֹמֶת מַאי עֲבִידְתֵּיהּ? אִי דְּלָא שְׁכִיחַ לְאֹגוֹרֵי – אַגְרָא בָּעֵי לְמִיתַּב לֵיהּ!
human_translation: What are the circumstances? If where are available for rent, what purpose of grievance? If where are not available for rent, required to give his fee?
llm_translation: "How are the prices determined? If it is common for the merchants - what does the auctioneer do? If it is not common for the merchants - he needs to sit and wait for them!"

hebrew_text: לְעוֹלָם דְּלָא שְׁכִיחַ לְאֹגוֹרֵי, וּמִשּׁוּם דְּאָמַר לֵיהּ: אִילּוּ בָּעֵית לְמֵיתֵי עַד הָכָא – לָאו אַגְרָא בָּעֵית לְמִיתַּב?
human_translation: Actually, where are not available for rent, and due to that say to him: Had you wanted to come to here, wouldn’t you have had to pay a fee?
llm_translation: Forever not common to farmers, and because he said to him: If you wanted to kill until here - isn't it a wage you wanted to receive?

hebrew_text: הֵיכִי דָּמֵי? אִי דַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ: ״חֲמוֹר סְתָם״ – הָא חַיָּיב לְהַעֲמִיד לוֹ חֲמוֹר אַחֵר. אִי דַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ: ״חֲמוֹר זֶה״, אִם יֵשׁ בְּדָמֶיהָ לִיקַּח יִקַּח!
human_translation: What are the circumstances? If where said to him: an unspecified donkey, obligated to provide him with another donkey. If where he said to him: this donkey, if there is money its to purchase let purchase
llm_translation: "How is it similar? If he says to him, 'A random donkey,' then he is obligated to provide him with another donkey. If he says to him, 'This specific donkey,' if there is money in its value, he shall take it!"

hebrew_text: לָא צְרִיכָא: בְּשֶׁאֵין בְּדָמֶיהָ לִיקַּח. אִם יֵשׁ בְּדָמֶיהָ לִשְׂכּוֹר – יִשְׂכּוֹר, רַב לְטַעְמֵיהּ, דְּאָמַר רַב: לָא מְכַלֵּינַן קַרְנָא.
human_translation: No, necessary where there is not money from to purchase if there is money from to hire let him rent Rav to his reasoning, as Rav said: One may not fully deplete the principal
llm_translation: Not needed: when there is no value in it. If there is value in it, one may rent it. Rav according to his reasoning, for Rav said: We do not diminish the value of a horn.

hebrew_text: דְּאִתְּמַר: הַשּׂוֹכֵר אֶת הַחֲמוֹר וּמֵתָה לוֹ בַּחֲצִי הַדֶּרֶךְ. אָמַר רַב: אִם יֵשׁ בְּדָמֶיהָ לִיקַּח – יִקַּח, לִשְׂכּוֹר – אַל יִשְׂכּוֹר. וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: אַף לִשְׂכּוֹר – יִשְׂכּוֹר.
human_translation: as it was stated one who rents a donkey and it died halfway through the journey, Rav says: If there is money from to purchase may purchase to rent he may not rent Shmuel says: Even there is to rent he may rent
llm_translation: It was stated: One who rents a donkey and it dies for him halfway on the journey. Rav said: If its value is to be taken, let him take it; if to rent, he should not rent it. And Shmuel said: Even to rent, he should rent it.

hebrew_text: בְּמַאי קָמִיפַּלְגִי? רַב סָבַר: לָא מְכַלֵּינַן קַרְנָא. וּשְׁמוּאֵל סָבַר: מְכַלֵּינַן קַרְנָא.
human_translation: With regard to what do they disagree? Rav holds one may not fully deplete the principal, And Shmuel holds one may fully deplete the principal.
llm_translation: With what do they disagree? Rav holds: we do not remove the horn. And Shmuel holds: we remove the horn.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי, יָבֵשׁ הָאִילָן אוֹ נִקְצַץ – שְׁנֵיהֶם אֲסוּרִין בּוֹ. כֵּיצַד יַעֲשֶׂה? יִלָּקַח בּוֹ קַרְקַע, וְהוּא אוֹכֵל פֵּירוֹת. וְהָא הָכָא, כֵּיוָן דְּכִי מָטֵי יוֹבֵל קָא הָדְרָא אַרְעָא לְמָרַהּ, וְקָא כָלְיָא קַרְנָא!
human_translation: raises an objection the tree dried up or was cut down, it is prohibited for both What should be done? Land should be purchased with and enjoys the profits And here, once Jubilee arrives, land will return to its owner. And the principal is fully depleted,
llm_translation: The opponent raises an objection: If a tree is dried up or cut down - both are prohibited regarding it. How should one act? He should take soil from it, and it will continue to produce fruit. But here, since the Jubilee year has arrived, the land has returned to its owner, and the horns have been removed!

hebrew_text: הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן – דְּזַבֵּין לֵיהּ לְשִׁתִּין שְׁנִין. דְּאָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא אָמַר רַב קַטִּינָא: מִנַּיִן לַמּוֹכֵר שָׂדֵהוּ לְשִׁשִּׁים שָׁנָה שֶׁאֵינָהּ חוֹזֶרֶת בַּיּוֹבֵל – שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְהָאָרֶץ לֹא תִמָּכֵר לִצְמִיתוּת״. מִי שֶׁאֵין שָׁם יוֹבֵל – נִצְמֶתֶת, יֵשׁ שָׁם יוֹבֵל – אֵינָהּ נִצְמֶתֶת. יָצְתָה זוֹ, שֶׁאַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵין שָׁם יוֹבֵל – אֵינָהּ נִצְמֶתֶת.
human_translation: With what are we dealing here? where he purchased for sixty years. As Rav Ḥisda says Rav Ketina says: From where to one who sells his field for sixty years that it does not return in Jubilee As it is stated: “And the land shall not be sold in perpetuity” which, there no Jubilee would be in perpetuity, there is a Jubilee is not in perpetuity. excludes this as even though there is no Jubilee it is not in perpetuity.
llm_translation: Here we are dealing with what? - that they sell it for sixty years. For Rav Hisda said in the name of Rav Katina: From where do we derive that one who sells his field for sixty years that does not return in the Jubilee year - as it is stated: "And the land shall not be sold in perpetuity." If there is no Jubilee there - it is destroyed, if there is a Jubilee there - it is not destroyed. This one has emerged, that even though there is no Jubilee there - it is not destroyed.

hebrew_text: סוֹף סוֹף, לְכִי מָטוּ שִׁיתִּין שְׁנִין – קָא הָדְרָא אַרְעָא לְמָרַהּ, וְקָא כָלְיָא קַרְנָא! אֶלָּא, הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן – בִּזְמַן שֶׁאֵין הַיּוֹבֵל נוֹהֵג. הָכִי נָמֵי מִסְתַּבְּרָא, דְּאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ בִּזְמַן שֶׁהַיּוֹבֵל נוֹהֵג וּמְכַלֵּינַן קַרְנָא, נִצְלְחֵיהּ לְצִיבֵי וְנִשְׁקְלֵיהּ!
human_translation: Ultimately, when sixty years arrives, the land will return to its owner, and the principal will be fully depleted. Rather, with what are we dealing here? with when the Jubilee are not in effect, This too stands to reason, as, if it enters your mind when the Jubilee are in effect and the principal may be fully depleted, Let cut into branches and take it
llm_translation: At the end, go and plant two years - the land will return to its owner, and the horn will be completed! Rather, what are we dealing with here - when the Jubilee year is not in effect. This is logical, for if it were to enter your mind that when the Jubilee year is in effect and we nullify the horn, it would be successful for the creditors and detrimental for the debtors!

hebrew_text: אִי מִשּׁוּם הָא – לָא קַשְׁיָא: זִמְנִין דְּשָׁלְמוּ שְׁנֵי מַשְׁכַּנְתָּא מִקַּמֵּי יוֹבֵל. אִי נָמֵי דְּמָטוּ לֵיהּ זוּזֵי וּפָרֵיק לַהּ אַרְבַּע וְחָמֵשׁ שְׁנִין מִקַּמֵּי יוֹבֵל.
human_translation: If due to that not difficult. times that the years to the collateral are completed before Jubilee Alternatively, that money comes into and he redeems four five years before Jubilee
llm_translation: If due to this - not difficult: sometimes they paid two Tabernacles before the Jubilee. If they reached it, they would remove it and pay four or five years before the Jubilee.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הַשּׂוֹכֵר אֶת הַסְּפִינָה וְטָבְעָה לָהּ בַּחֲצִי הַדֶּרֶךְ, רַבִּי נָתָן אוֹמֵר: אִם נָתַן – לֹא יִטּוֹל, וְאִם לֹא נָתַן – לֹא יִתֵּן.
human_translation: The Sages taught: one who rents a boat, and it sunk halfway through the journey, Rabbi Natan says: If gave he does not receive but if he has not given he does not give
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: One who rents a ship and it sinks halfway through the journey, Rabbi Natan says: If he paid, he shall not take it, and if he did not pay, he shall not give it.

hebrew_text: הֵיכִי דָמֵי? אִילֵּימָא בִּסְפִינָה זוֹ וְיַיִן סְתָם, אִם נָתַן אַמַּאי לֹא יִטּוֹל? נֵימָא לֵיהּ: הַב לִי סְפִינְתָּא, דַּאֲנָא מַיְיתֵינָא חַמְרָא. אֶלָּא בִּסְפִינָה סְתָם וְיַיִן זֶה, אִם לֹא נָתַן אַמַּאי לֹא יִתֵּן?
human_translation: What are the circumstances If we say this boat and unspecified wine, if he gave why should he not receive Let him say to Give me the boat that I can transport wine, Rather, an unspecified boat, and this wine. if he did not give why should he not give
llm_translation: How are they similar? If we say it is with this ship and ordinary wine, if one gives, why should he not take? Alternatively, say to him: "Bring me a ship, for I am bringing wine." Rather, with this ordinary ship and this wine, if one does not give, why should he give?

hebrew_text: נֵימָא לֵיהּ: הַב לִי הָהוּא חַמְרָא וַאֲנָא מַיְיתֵינָא סְפִינְתָּא.
human_translation: Let say to him: Give me that wine and I will bring a boat.
llm_translation: He said to him: "Bring me that wine, and I will bring you the ship."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: לָא מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ אֶלָּא בִּסְפִינָה זוֹ וְיַיִן זֶה. אֲבָל בִּסְפִינָה סְתָם וְיַיִן סְתָם – חוֹלְקִין.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: You find only in this boat and that wine. But an unspecified boat and unspecified wine, they divide
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: You only forget her with this ship and this wine. But with a random ship and random wine - they divide.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הַשּׂוֹכֵר אֶת הַסְּפִינָה וּפְרָקָהּ לָהּ בַּחֲצִי הַדֶּרֶךְ – נוֹתֵן לוֹ שְׂכָרוֹ שֶׁל חֲצִי הַדֶּרֶךְ, וְאֵין לוֹ עָלָיו אֶלָּא תַּרְעוֹמֶת. הֵיכִי דָּמֵי? אִילֵּימָא דְּקָא מַשְׁכַּח לְאֹגוֹרַהּ – אַמַּאי אִית לֵיהּ תַּרְעוֹמֶת? וְאִי דְּלָא קָא מַשְׁכַּח לְאֹגוֹרַהּ – כּוּלֵּיהּ אַגְרַהּ בָּעֵי שַׁלּוֹמֵי!
human_translation: The Sages taught: one who rents a boat and unloads it [ uferakah ] halfway through the journey, gives his fee for half the journey, and has nothing but a grievance against him. What are the circumstances? If we say that can find to rent out why does he have a grievance? And if it where he cannot find to rent it out, should be required to pay the full fee,
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: One who rents a ship and breaks it halfway through the journey - he gives him the payment for half the journey, and he only has to pay him the damages. How so? If you say that he forgot his purse - why does he have to pay damages? And if he did not forget his purse - he needs to pay the full fare!

hebrew_text: לְעוֹלָם דְּקָא מַשְׁכַּח לְאֹגוֹרַהּ, אֶלָּא אַמַּאי אִית לֵיהּ תַּרְעוֹמֶת – מִשּׁוּם רַפְסְתָא דִסְפִינְתָּא. אִי הָכִי, טַעַנְתָּא מְעַלַּיְיתָא הִוא וּמָמוֹנָא אִית לֵיהּ גַּבֵּיהּ.
human_translation: Actually, where can find to rent out But why does he have grievance? Because of the wear and tear on the boat If so, that is a proper claim, and has monetary restitution from him.
llm_translation: Forever, as he finds to his granary, but why is there a mound - because of the ballast of the ship. If so, it is a higher load and there is money in it.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מַאי פְּרָקָהּ – דְּפַרְקֵהּ לְטוּעְנֵיהּ בְּגַוַּיהּ. אֶלָּא מַאי תַּרְעוֹמֶת – מִשּׁוּם שִׁינּוּי דַּעְתָּא. אִי נָמֵי לְאַשְׁלָא יַתִּירָא.
human_translation: Rather, what is perakah ? that unloaded his own cargo into But what is grievance? due to the change from intention, Alternatively, of the extra rope
llm_translation: Rather, what is the reason for its division? - To attach it to its body. Rather, what is the reason for its expanse? - Because of a change of mind. If so, it is not necessary to be concerned.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הַשּׂוֹכֵר אֶת הַחֲמוֹר לִרְכּוֹב עָלֶיהָ – שׂוֹכֵר מַנִּיחַ עָלֶיהָ כְּסוּתוֹ וּלְגִנוֹתוֹ וּמְזוֹנוֹת שֶׁל אוֹתָהּ הַדֶּרֶךְ, מִכָּאן וְאֵילָךְ – חַמָּר מְעַכֵּב עָלָיו. חַמָּר מַנִּיחַ עָלָיו שְׂעוֹרִים וְתֶבֶן וּמְזוֹנוֹתָיו שֶׁל אוֹתוֹ הַיּוֹם, מִכָּאן וְאֵילָךְ – שׂוֹכֵר מְעַכֵּב עָלָיו.
human_translation: The Sages taught one who rents a donkey to ride on it, renter place on it his garment, his water jug, and food for that journey. Beyond those donkey driver, prevent him donkey driver place on it barley and hay and his own food for that day Beyond those renter prevent him
llm_translation: The Sages taught: One who rents a donkey to ride upon it - the renter places upon it his garment, and his shield, and the provisions for that journey. From here and onwards - the donkey delays him. The donkey places upon it barley and straw, and its provisions for that day. From here and onwards - the renter delays him.

hebrew_text: הֵיכִי דָמֵי? אִי דִּשְׁכִיחַ לְמִזְבַּן – חַמָּר נָמֵי לִיעַכֵּב, וְאִי דְּלָא שְׁכִיחַ לְמִזְבַּן – שׂוֹכֵר נָמֵי לָא לִיעַכֵּב!
human_translation: What are the circumstances? If where is available for purchase, the donkey driver also to prevent and if where is not available for purchase, renter also not to prevent
llm_translation: "How are the prices determined? If it is found near the altar - the price of wine is higher, and if it is not found near the altar - the price of wine is not higher!"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: לָא צְרִיכָא דִּשְׁכִיחַ לְמִטְרַח וּלְמִזְבַּן מֵאַוּוֹנָא לְאַוּוֹנָא, חַמָּר דַּרְכֵּיהּ לְמִטְרַח וּלְמִזְבַּן. שׂוֹכֵר לָאו דַּרְכֵּיהּ לְמִטְרַח וּלְמִזְבַּן.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: No, necessary where is available goes to the trouble to purchase from station [ me’avna ] to station. the manner of a donkey driver to go to trouble to purchase not the manner of renter to go to the trouble to purchase
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: It is not necessary for one to engage in plowing and sowing from one corner to another, as the donkey's way is to plow and sow. One who rents a donkey does not engage in plowing and sowing.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הַשּׂוֹכֵר אֶת הַחֲמוֹר לִרְכּוֹב עָלֶיהָ אִישׁ – לֹא תִּרְכַּב עָלֶיהָ אִשָּׁה. אִשָּׁה – רוֹכֵב עָלֶיהָ אִישׁ. וְאִשָּׁה, בֵּין גְּדוֹלָה וּבֵין קְטַנָּה, אֲפִילּוּ מְעוּבֶּרֶת, וַאֲפִילּוּ מְנִיקָה.
human_translation: The Sages taught: one who rents a donkey with a man will ride upon it, a woman may not ride upon it. with a woman a man ride upon it. And with a woman whether an adult woman or a minor girl. even a pregnant and even a nursing woman
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: One who rents a donkey to ride upon it, a man - may not ride upon it, a woman. A woman - a man may ride upon it. And a woman, whether she is an adult or a minor, even if she is pregnant, and even if she is nursing.

hebrew_text: הַשְׁתָּא מְנִיקָה אָמְרַתְּ, מְעוּבֶּרֶת מִיבַּעְיָא? אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: מְעוּבֶּרֶת וְהִיא מְנִיקָה קָאָמַר.
human_translation: Now you said a nursing woman is it necessary a pregnant woman Rav Pappa said: spoke a pregnant woman who is nursing,
llm_translation: The Gemara asks: "Is a pregnant woman considered to be in need of nursing?" Rav Papa said: "She is considered to be in need of nursing even though she is pregnant."

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ בִּינִיתָא אַכְּרֵסַהּ תָּקְלָה. לְמַאי נָפְקָא מִינַּהּ? לְמִקָּח וּמִמְכָּר.
human_translation: Abaye said: You learn from that the weight of a fish [ binita ] is in its belly, What is the difference with regard to buying and selling,
llm_translation: Abaye said: Hear from it, in the middle, a beam, it is light. What is derived from it? For buying and selling.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַשּׂוֹכֵר אֶת הַפָּרָה לַחֲרוֹשׁ בָּהָר וְחָרַשׁ בַּבִּקְעָה, אִם נִשְׁבַּר הַקַּנְקַן – פָּטוּר. בַּבִּקְעָה וְחָרַשׁ בָּהָר, אִם נִשְׁבַּר הַקַּנְקַן – חַיָּיב. לָדוּשׁ בְּקִטְנִית וְדָשׁ בִּתְבוּאָה – פָּטוּר, לָדוּשׁ בִּתְבוּאָה וְדָשׁ בְּקִטְנִית – חַיָּיב, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהַקִּטְנִית מַחְלֶקֶת.
human_translation: one who rents a cow to plow on the mountain but he plowed in the valley, if the plowshare, breaks, exempt, in the valley but he plowed on the mountain, if the plowshare breaks liable. to thresh legumes but it threshed grain, exempt. to thresh grain but it threshed legumes he is liable, because legumes are slippery.
llm_translation: It was taught: If one hires out a cow to plow on a hill and plows in a valley, if the yoke breaks - he is exempt. If he plows in a valley and plows on a hill, if the yoke breaks - he is liable. If he threshes with a small sifter and then with a large one - he is exempt. If he threshes with a large sifter and then with a small one - he is liable, because the small sifter divides.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ הֵיכָא דְּלָא שַׁנִּי בָּהּ, מַאן מְשַׁלֵּם? אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: דְּנָקֵיט פְּרָשָׁא מְשַׁלֵּם. רַב שִׁישָׁא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אִידִי אָמַר: דְּנָקֵיט מָנָא מְשַׁלֵּם. וְהִלְכְתָא: דְּנָקֵיט מָנָא מְשַׁלֵּם. וְאִי דּוּכְתָּא דְּמַחְזְקִי (גּוּנְדְּרֵי) – [גְּרוּנְדֵּי] תַּרְוַיְיהוּ מְשַׁלְּמִין.
human_translation: where did not diverge from who pays? Rav Pappa said: who holds the goad [ parasha ] pays, Rav Sheisha, son of Rav Idi, said: who holds the vessel, pays. And the halakha who holds the vessel pays. And if it was a place rocks are commonly they both pay,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemara: Heikha de'lo shanni bah, man meshalem? Amar Rav Papa: Denaqet prasha meshalem. Rav Shisha brei d'Rav Idi amar: Denaqet mana meshalem. Vehilkheta: Denaqet mana meshalem. Vi'iduchta d'machzeki (gundrei) – gerundei tarvayehu meshalmin. English translation: Gemara: Where it was not changed, who pays? Rav Papa said: One who takes possession pays. Rav Shisha, son of Rav Idi, said: One who takes a pledge pays. And the law is: One who takes a pledge pays. And if they are stubborn – they both pay.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הַמּוֹכֵר פָּרָה לַחֲבֵירוֹ, וְאָמַר לוֹ: פָּרָה זוֹ נַגְחָנִית הִיא, נַשְׁכָנִית הִיא, בַּעֲטָנִית הִיא, רַבְצָנִית הִיא, וְהָיָה בָּהּ מוּם אֶחָד וּסְנָפוֹ בֵּין הַמּוּמִין – הֲרֵי זֶה מִקַּח טָעוּת. מוּם זֶה וּמוּם אַחֵר – אֵין זֶה מִקַּח טָעוּת.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says, one who sells a cow to another and says to him: this cow it is accustomed to goring, it is accustomed to biting, it is a kicker, it lies down but it had one defect and he inserted it among the defects this is a mistaken transaction, this defect, and other defects, this is not a mistaken transaction.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: One who sells a cow to his fellow, and says to him: "This cow is goring, biting, stubborn, and kicking, and it has one blemish with a white hair among the blemishes - this is a mistaken transaction. If it has this blemish and another blemish - this is not a mistaken transaction.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: הַמּוֹכֵר שִׁפְחָה לַחֲבֵירוֹ, וְאָמַר לוֹ: שִׁפְחָה זוֹ שׁוֹטָה הִיא, נִיכְפֵּית הִיא, מְשׁוּעְמֶמֶת הִיא, וְהָיָה בָּהּ מוּם אֶחָד וּסְנָפוֹ בֵּין הַמּוּמִין – הֲרֵי זֶה מִקַּח טָעוּת. מוּם זֶה וּמוּם אַחֵר – אֵין זֶה מִקַּח טָעוּת.
human_translation: this is also taught one who sells a maidservant to another and says to him: This maidservant is an imbecile, she is epileptic, she is crazy [ meshuamemet ]; but she had one defect and he inserted it among the defects, this is a mistaken transaction. this defect, and other defects, this is not a mistaken transaction.
llm_translation: It was taught in a baraita: If one sells a maidservant to his fellow, and he says to him: "This maidservant is insane, she is afflicted, she is melancholic, and she has one blemish and a tuft of hair among the blemishes - this is a mistaken transaction. If it is one blemish and another blemish - this is not a mistaken transaction.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אַחָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרָבָא לְרַב אָשֵׁי: הָיוּ בָּהּ כׇּל הַמּוּמִין הַלָּלוּ, מַהוּ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב מָרְדֳּכַי לְרַב אָשֵׁי, הָכִי אָמְרִינַן מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרָבָא: הָיוּ בָּהּ כׇּל הַמּוּמִין הַלָּלוּ – אֵין זֶה מִקַּח טָעוּת.
human_translation: Rav Aḥa, son of Rava, said to Rav Ashi: had all of these defects, what is Rav Mordekhai said to Rav Ashi: We say this in the name of Rava: had all of these defects, it is not a mistaken transaction,
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Ahah son of Rava said to Rav Ashi: If all these blemishes were in it, what is the ruling? Rav Mordechai said to Rav Ashi, thus we say in the name of Rava: If all these blemishes were in it - this is not a mistaken acquisition.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַשּׂוֹכֵר אֶת הַחֲמוֹר לְהָבִיא עָלֶיהָ חִטִּין, וְהֵבִיא עָלֶיהָ שְׂעוֹרִין – חַיָּיב. תְּבוּאָה, וְהֵבִיא עָלֶיהָ תֶּבֶן – חַיָּיב, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהַנֶּפַח קָשֶׁה כְּמַשּׂאוֹי. לְהָבִיא לֶתֶךְ חִטִּין, וְהֵבִיא לֶתֶךְ שְׂעוֹרִין – פָּטוּר. וְאִם מוֹסִיף עַל מַשָּׂאוֹ חַיָּיב. וְכַמָּה יוֹסִיף עַל מַשָּׂאוֹ וִיהֵא חַיָּיב? סוֹמְכוֹס אוֹמֵר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי מֵאִיר: סְאָה לְגָמָל, שְׁלֹשָׁה קַבִּין לַחֲמוֹר.
human_translation: one who rents a donkey to bring wheat on it, and he brought upon it barley, liable. grain, and he brought straw upon it, liable, because the volume is as difficult as the load to bring a letekh , of wheat, but he brought a letekh of barley, exempt, And who adds to a load liable. And how much he add to the load for him to be liable? Sumakhos says in the name of Rabbi Meir: A se’a on a camel three kav on a donkey.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who rents a donkey to transport wheat, and he transports barley on it - is liable. If he transports straw, and he transports bricks on it - he is liable, because the breath is as difficult as the load. If he transports a load of wheat, and he transports a load of barley - he is exempt. But if he adds to its load, he is liable. How much must he add to its load to be liable? Somaḥos says in the name of Rabbi Meir: A se'ah for a camel, three kav for a donkey.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אִיתְּמַר. אַבָּיֵי אָמַר: ״קָשֶׁה כְּמַשּׂאוֹי״ תְּנַן. רָבָא אָמַר: ״קָשֶׁה לְמַשּׂאוֹי״ תְּנַן. אַבָּיֵי אָמַר: ״קָשֶׁה כְּמַשּׂאוֹי״ תְּנַן, נִפְחָא כִּי תִקְלָא, וְאִי מוֹסִיף שְׁלֹשָׁה קַבִּין – חַיָּיב. רָבָא אָמַר: ״קָשֶׁה לְמַשּׂאוֹי״ תְּנַן, תִּקְלָא כִּי תִקְלָא וְנִפְחָא הָוֵי תּוֹסֶפֶת.
human_translation: It was stated Abaye said we learned Difficult as the load. Rava said we learned: Difficult for the load. Abaye said we learned: Difficult as the load, volume is like weight, and if one adds three kav he is liable. Rava said we learned: Difficult for the load, weight is like weight, volume is an addition.
llm_translation: The text states: "It was stated: Abaye said, 'Difficult like its lifting.' We learned: Rava said, 'Difficult for its lifting.' Abaye said, 'Difficult like its lifting' we learned, if it is light as a barleycorn, and if one adds three kav - he is liable. Rava said, 'Difficult for its lifting' we learned, whether it is light as a barleycorn or heavy, there is an addition."

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: לְהָבִיא לֶתֶךְ חִטִּין, וְהֵבִיא לֶתֶךְ שְׂעוֹרִין – פָּטוּר. וְאִם הוֹסִיף עַל מַשָּׂאוֹ – חַיָּיב. מַאי לָאו שְׁלֹשֶׁת קַבִּין?! לֹא, סְאָה. וְהָא עֲלַהּ קָתָנֵי: וְכַמָּה יוֹסִיף עַל מַשָּׂאוֹ וִיהֵא חַיָּיב? סוֹמְכוֹס אוֹמֵר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי מֵאִיר: סְאָה לְגָמָל, שְׁלֹשָׁה קַבִּין לַחֲמוֹר!
human_translation: We learned to bring a letekh of wheat, but he brought a letekh of barley, exempt. And who adds to a load liable. What, is it not three kav , No, se’a . But was taught concerning this How much he add to the load for him to be liable? Sumakhos says in the name of Rabbi Meir: A se’a on a camel three kav on a donkey.
llm_translation: We learned: If one brought a measure of wheat, and then brought a measure of barley - he is exempt. But if he added to his load - he is liable. What, is it not three kavim?! No, a se'ah. But isn't it taught: How much must one add to his load to be liable? Some say in the name of Rabbi Meir: A se'ah for a camel, three kavim for a donkey!

hebrew_text: הָכִי קָאָמַר: הֵיכָא דְּלָא שַׁנִּי חִטִּין וְהֵבִיא חִטִּין, שְׂעוֹרִין וְהֵבִיא שְׂעוֹרִין, כַּמָּה יוֹסִיף עַל מַשָּׂאוֹ וִיהֵא חַיָּיב? סוֹמְכוֹס אוֹמֵר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי מֵאִיר: סְאָה לְגָמָל שְׁלֹשָׁה קַבִּין לַחֲמוֹר.
human_translation: this is saying: where did not diverge from wheat and he brought wheat, barley and he brought barley, how much he add to the load for him to be liable? Sumakhos says in the name of Rabbi Meir: A se’a on a camel three kav on a donkey.
llm_translation: So it is stated: Where one did not change wheat and brought wheat, barley and brought barley, how much must he add to his load to be liable? Somaḵos says in the name of Rabbi Meir: A se'ah for a camel, three kavim for a donkey.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: לְהָבִיא לֶתֶךְ חִטִּין וְהֵבִיא
human_translation: Come hear to bring a letekh , of wheat, but he brought
llm_translation: Come and hear: to bring a measure of wheat and bring

hebrew_text: שֵׁשׁ עֶשְׂרֵה שְׂעוֹרִים – חַיָּיב. הָא שְׁלֹשֶׁת קַבִּין – פָּטוּר! תַּרְגְּמַהּ אַבָּיֵי: בִּמְחִיקָתָא.
human_translation: sixteen barley, liable. three kav , exempt. Abaye interpreted to smoothed-over
llm_translation: Six barley grains - obligated. But three kavim - exempt! Abbaye interpreted: in the pouch.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: קַב לְכַתָּף, אַדְרִיב לַעֲרֵיבָה. כּוֹר לִסְפִינָה, שְׁלֹשֶׁת כּוֹרִים לְבוּרְנִי גְּדוֹלָה.
human_translation: The Sages taught: A kav for a porter, An adriv , for a small boat [ areiva ]; a kor for boat; three kor for a large ship [ burnei ].
llm_translation: The sages taught: A kab for the shoulder, a drav for the evening meal. A kor for a ship, three kor for a large cistern.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: קַב לְכַתָּף. אִם אִיתָא דְּלָא מָצֵי בֵּיהּ בַּר דַּעַת הוּא, לִשְׁדְּיֵהּ! אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: בְּשֶׁחֲבָטוֹ לְאַלְתַּר. רָבָא אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא בְּשֶׁלֹּא חֲבָטוֹ לְאַלְתַּר, לָא צְרִיכָא אֶלָּא לְאַגְרָא יַתִּירָא. רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: הוּא סָבוּר חוּלְשָׁא הוּא דְּנָקֵיט לֵיהּ.
human_translation: The Master said: A kav for a porter. If it is so, that he cannot withstand this is a sensible person; let him throw it off Abaye said: to where knocked him down immediately, Rava said: Even if you say where it did not knock him down immediately not it is necessary only to the extra pay Rav Ashi said: he thought it was weakness that seized him
llm_translation: Master said: A kab to the shoulder. If it comes that it cannot be found in it, it is a son of a mind, let him leave it! Abaye said: with his belt immediately. Rava said: Even if you say with his belt immediately, it is necessary only for the extra. Rav Ashe said: He thought it is a weak one that he takes it.

hebrew_text: כּוֹר לִסְפִינָה, שְׁלֹשֶׁת כּוֹרִין לְבוּרְנִי גְּדוֹלָה. אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ סְתָם סְפִינוֹת בַּת תְּלָתִין כּוֹרִין. לְמַאי נָפְקָא מִינַּהּ? לְמִקָּח וּמִמְכָּר.
human_translation: A kor for boat; three kor for a large ship. Rav Pappa said: Learn from here unspecified boats bear thirty kor , What is the difference of buying and selling,
llm_translation: A hole for a ship, three holes for a large cistern. Rav Papa said: Learn from it, the standard size of ships is thirty kor. What is derived from it? For buying and selling.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ כׇּל הָאוּמָּנִין – שׁוֹמְרֵי שָׂכָר הֵן. וְכוּלָּן שֶׁאָמְרוּ: טוֹל אֶת שֶׁלְּךָ וְהָבֵא מָעוֹת – שׁוֹמֵר חִנָּם. שְׁמוֹר לִי וְאֶשְׁמוֹר לָךְ – שׁוֹמֵר שָׂכָר. שְׁמוֹר לִי, וְאָמַר לוֹ: הַנַּח לְפָנַי – שׁוֹמֵר חִנָּם.
human_translation: All artisans are paid bailees And all those who said take yours, and bring money an unpaid bailee. Safeguard for me and I will safeguard for you, paid bailee, Safeguard for me, and says to him: Place it before me, an unpaid bailee.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: All craftsmen - are considered hired laborers. And all of them who said: "Take yours and bring money" - are considered hired laborers. "Guard for me and I will guard for you" - is considered a hired laborer. "Guard for me," and he said to him: "Leave it before me" - is considered a hired laborer.

hebrew_text: הִלְוָהוּ עַל הַמַּשְׁכּוֹן – שׁוֹמֵר שָׂכָר. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: הִלְוָהוּ מָעוֹת – שׁוֹמֵר חִנָּם, הִלְוָהוּ פֵּירוֹת – שׁוֹמֵר שָׂכָר. אַבָּא שָׁאוּל אוֹמֵר: רַשַּׁאי אָדָם לְהַשְׂכִּיר מַשְׁכּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עָנִי לִהְיוֹת פּוֹסֵק וְהוֹלֵךְ עָלָיו, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהוּא כְּמֵשִׁיב אֲבֵידָה.
human_translation: One who lent to on collateral a paid bailee Rabbi Yehuda says: One who lent money an unpaid bailee one who lent produce a paid bailee. Abba Shaul says: permitted a person to rent out a poor person’s collateral so that by setting for it progressively because this is like returning a lost item.
llm_translation: Borrowing on the dwelling - he is a paid guardian. Rabbi Yehuda says: Borrowing money - he is a free guardian, borrowing produce - he is a paid guardian. Abba Sha'ul says: A person is allowed to rent his dwelling to a poor person to be a tenant and walk upon it, because he is like one who returns a lost object.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ לֵימָא מַתְנִיתִין דְּלָא כְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר? דְּתַנְיָא: שׂוֹכֵר כֵּיצַד מְשַׁלֵּם? רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: כְּשׁוֹמֵר חִנָּם. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: כְּשׁוֹמֵר שָׂכָר.
human_translation: Let us say that the mishna is not in accordance with Rabbi Meir, as it is taught a renter, how does he pay Rabbi Meir says: like an unpaid bailee, Rabbi Yehuda says: like a paid bailee,
llm_translation: Gemara: Let us say a Mishnah that does not follow the opinion of Rabbi Meir? For it was taught: "One who rents, how does he pay?" Rabbi Meir says: "Like one who watches for free." Rabbi Yehuda says: "Like one who watches for payment."

hebrew_text: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא רַבִּי מֵאִיר, בְּהַהִיא הֲנָאָה דְּקָא שָׁבֵיק כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא וְאָגַיר לֵיהּ לְדִידֵיהּ – הָוֵי עִילָּוֵיהּ שׁוֹמֵר שָׂכָר. אִי הָכִי, שׂוֹכֵר נָמֵי בְּהַהִיא הֲנָאָה דְּקָא שָׁבֵיק כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא וּמוֹגַר לֵיהּ לְדִידֵיהּ – הָוֵי עִילָּוֵיהּ שׁוֹמֵר שָׂכָר.
human_translation: You even say Rabbi Meir, through that benefit that leaves everyone else and hires him, he becomes a paid bailee over If so, a renter as well, through that benefit that leaves everyone else and rents to him, he become a paid bailee over
llm_translation: Even if you say it is Rabbi Meir, in that case where he left everyone and attached it to himself - he is considered a guardian for it. If not, he is also considered a renter in that case where he left everyone and rented it to himself - he is considered a guardian for it.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא רַבִּי מֵאִיר, בְּהַהִיא הֲנָאָה דְּקָא יָהֵיב לֵיהּ טְפֵי פּוּרְתָּא – הָוֵי עִילָּוֵיהּ שׁוֹמֵר שָׂכָר.
human_translation: Rather, you even say Rabbi Meir: Through that benefit that that gives him a little more he becomes a paid bailee.
llm_translation: Rather: Even if you say it is Rabbi Meir, in that pleasure that he gave him a little bit of bread - consider him as a hired worker.

hebrew_text: שׂוֹכֵר נָמֵי! מִי לָא עָסְקִינַן דְּקָא מְשַׁוֵּי לֵיהּ טְפֵי פּוּרְתָּא. אֶלָּא אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא רַבִּי מֵאִיר, בְּהַהִיא הֲנָאָה דְּתָפֵישׂ לֵיהּ אַאַגְרֵיהּ, דְּלָא בָּעֵי לְמֵיעַל וּלְמִיפַּק אַזּוּזֵי – הָוֵי עֲלֵיהּ שׁוֹמֵר שָׂכָר.
human_translation: a renter as well, are we not dealing with a case where gives him a little more value Rather, you even say Rabbi Meir Through that benefit that he holds so that he is not required to go in and go out for money, he becomes a paid bailee over
llm_translation: The renter is trustworthy! Who are we dealing with that he is changing the price of the wool? Rather, even if you were to say it is Rabbi Meir, in that case where he takes his wage, as he does not want to increase or decrease the price - he is considered a trustworthy guardian over it.

hebrew_text: אִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא, כִּדְמַחְלֵיף רַבָּה בַּר אֲבוּהּ וְתָנֵי: שׂוֹכֵר כֵּיצַד מְשַׁלֵּם? רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: כְּשׁוֹמֵר שָׂכָר, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: כְּשׁוֹמֵר חִנָּם.
human_translation: If you wish, say as Rabba bar Avuh reversed and teaches a renter, how does he pay? Rabbi Meir says: Like a paid bailee; Rabbi Yehuda says: Like an unpaid bailee.
llm_translation: If you ask, say, as Rabba bar Avuh taught: How does one pay a hired worker? Rabbi Meir says: When he guards for pay, Rabbi Yehuda says: When he guards for free.

hebrew_text: וְכוּלָּן שֶׁאָמְרוּ: ״טוֹל אֶת שֶׁלְּךָ וְהָבֵא מָעוֹת״ – שׁוֹמֵר חִנָּם. תְּנַן הָתָם: אָמַר לוֹ שׁוֹאֵל ״שַׁלַּח״, וְשִׁלְּחָהּ וּמֵתָה – חַיָּיב, וְכֵן בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁמַּחְזִירָהּ.
human_translation: And all those who said Take yours, and bring money an unpaid bailee. We learned there borrower said to Send and he sent it and it died liable, and similarly when he returns it.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And all of them that said: "Take yours and bring money" - he is a watchman for free. We learned there: He said to him, "Send," and he sent her and she died - he is liable, and so too when he returns her.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַפְרָם בַּר פָּפָּא אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא שֶׁהֶחְזִירָהּ בְּתוֹךְ יְמֵי שְׁאֵילָתָהּ. אֲבָל לְאַחַר יְמֵי שְׁאֵילָתָהּ – פָּטוּר. מֵתִיב רַב נַחְמָן בַּר פָּפָּא: וְכוּלָּן שֶׁאָמְרוּ ״טוֹל אֶת שֶׁלְּךָ וְהָבֵא מָעוֹת״ – שׁוֹמֵר חִנָּם.
human_translation: Rafram bar Pappa said Rav Ḥisda said: They taught only when returned it during the period of its loan, But after the period of its loan, exempt, Rav Naḥman bar Pappa raises an objection And all those who said: Take yours and bring money, an unpaid bailee.
llm_translation: Rafraam son of Papa said, Rav Chisda said: They only taught that she must return it within the days of her questioning. But after the days of her questioning - she is exempt. Rav Nachman son of Papa objected: But all those who said "Take what is yours and leave money" - are considered to be guarding it for free.

hebrew_text: הָא ״גְּמַרְתִּיו״ – שׁוֹמֵר שָׂכָר. לָא, הָא ״הָבֵא מָעוֹת וְטוֹל אֶת שֶׁלְּךָ״ – שׁוֹמֵר שָׂכָר.
human_translation: I completed it, a paid bailee, No, Give money and take yours, a paid bailee.
llm_translation: The one who says "I have completed it" - retains reward. No, the one who says "Bring money and take yours" - retains reward.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל ״גְּמַרְתִּיו״ מַאי שׁוֹמֵר חִנָּם? אִי הָכִי, אַדְּתָנֵי ״וְכוּלָּן שֶׁאָמְרוּ טוֹל אֶת שֶׁלְּךָ וְהָבֵא מָעוֹת – שׁוֹמֵר חִנָּם״, נַשְׁמְעִינַן ״גְּמַרְתִּיו״, וְכׇל שֶׁכֵּן ״טוֹל אֶת שֶׁלְּךָ״!
human_translation: But I completed it, what an unpaid bailee? If so, rather than teaching And all those who say: Take yours and bring money, an unpaid bailee, let it teach us I completed it, and all the more so Take yours.
llm_translation: "But 'gemartiv,' what is the meaning of 'keeping for free'? If so, it was taught: 'And all those who said, 'Take what is yours and bring money' - this is keeping for free.' We hear 'gemartiv,' all the more so 'take what is yours'!"

hebrew_text: ״טוֹל אֶת שֶׁלְּךָ״ אִצְטְרִיכָא לֵיהּ. סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא: שׁוֹמֵר חִנָּם נָמֵי לָא הָוֵי, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: take yours must enter your mind to say he is not even an unpaid bailee teaches us
llm_translation: "Take your own" is necessary for it. As your mind came up with: 'A watchman for free is not reliable,' it is implied to us.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי, אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר פָּפָּא: אַף אֲנַן נָמֵי תְּנֵינָא, וְכוּלָּן שֶׁאָמְרוּ ״טוֹל אֶת שֶׁלְּךָ וְהָבֵא מָעוֹת״ – שׁוֹמֵר חִנָּם, מַאי לָאו הוּא הַדִּין ״גְּמַרְתִּיו״. לֹא, ״טוֹל אֶת שֶׁלְּךָ״ שָׁאנֵי.
human_translation: There are who say Rav Naḥman bar Pappa said: We, too, learn And all those who say: Take yours and bring money, an unpaid bailee. What, is it not the same is true I have completed it? No, take yours is different,
llm_translation: There are some who say, Rav Nachman bar Papa said: We also learned, and all of them who said "Take what is yours and bring money" - he keeps it for free, what is it not the same as "I have completed it." No, "Take what is yours" is different.

hebrew_text: הוּנָא מָר בַּר מָרִימָר קַמֵּיהּ דְּרָבִינָא רָמֵי מַתְנִיתִין אַהֲדָדֵי וּמְשַׁנֵּי. תְּנַן: וְכוּלָּן שֶׁאָמְרוּ ״טוֹל אֶת שֶׁלְּךָ וְהָבֵא מָעוֹת״ – שׁוֹמֵר חִנָּם. וְהוּא הַדִּין לִ״גְמַרְתִּיו״. וּרְמִינְהוּ: אָמַר לוֹ שׁוֹאֵל ״שַׁלַּח״, וְשִׁלְּחָהּ וּמֵתָה – חַיָּיב. וְכֵן בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁמַּחְזִירָהּ. וּמְשַׁנֵּי, אָמַר רַפְרָם בַּר פָּפָּא אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא שֶׁהֶחְזִיר בְּתוֹךְ יְמֵי שְׁאֵילָתָהּ, אֲבָל לְאַחַר יְמֵי שְׁאֵילָתָהּ, פָּטוּר.
human_translation: Huna Mar bar Mareimar raised a contradiction between the mishnayot before Ravina and resolved We learned And all those who say: Take yours and bring money, an unpaid bailee. And the same is true for I completed it. And raises a contradiction borrower said to Send and he sent it and it died liable, and similarly when he returns it. And resolves this Rafram bar Pappa said Rav Ḥisda said: They taught only when he returned it during the period of its loan. But after the period of its loan, he is exempt.
llm_translation: Huna the son of Mar bar Marimar stood before Ravina, they raised a contradiction: We learned: "And all those who said, 'Take yours and bring money' - he is a watchman for free. And the same applies to his 'completion.'" And they raised a dilemma: If he said to him, "Send her," and he sent her and she died - he is liable. And the same applies when he returns her. And they taught: Rafpam the son of Papa said in the name of Rav Hisda: They only taught this when he returned her within the days of her request, but after the days of her request, he is exempt.

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: פָּטוּר מִשּׁוֹאֵל וְחַיָּיב כְּשׁוֹמֵר שָׂכָר, אוֹ דִּלְמָא שׁוֹמֵר שָׂכָר נָמֵי לָא הָוֵי? אָמַר אַמֵּימָר: מִסְתַּבְּרָא פָּטוּר מִשּׁוֹאֵל וְחַיָּיב כְּשׁוֹמֵר שָׂכָר, הוֹאִיל וְנֶהֱנֶה מְהַנֶּה הָוֵה.
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before exempt from a borrower, but liable as a paid bailee, or perhaps he is also not a paid bailee? Ameimar said: It stands to reason exempt as a borrower but liable as a paid bailee. since had benefit, he provide benefit
llm_translation: The question was asked: Is one exempt from liability as a borrower but obligated as a paid watchman, or perhaps a paid watchman is also not considered a watchman? Amemar said: It makes sense that one is exempt from liability as a borrower but obligated as a paid watchman, since he benefits from the benefit.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּאַמֵּימָר: הַלּוֹקֵחַ כֵּלִים מִבֵּית הָאוּמָּן לְשַׁגְּרָן לְבֵית חָמִיו, וְאָמַר לוֹ: אִם מְקַבְּלִין אוֹתָן מִמֶּנִּי – אֲנִי נוֹתֵן לְךָ דְּמֵיהֶן, וְאִם לָאו – אֲנִי נוֹתֵן לְךָ לְפִי טוֹבַת הֲנָאָה שֶׁבָּהֶן, וְנֶאֶנְסוּ בַּהֲלִיכָה – חַיָּיב,
human_translation: It is taught in accordance with Ameimar: one who takes vessels from an artisan’s house to send them to his father-in-law’s house, and said to If they accept them from me I will give you the money for them, and if not, I will give you in accordance with the financial advantage from them, and an accident happened on their way liable.
llm_translation: It was taught in the school of Rabbi Amemar: One who takes vessels from a craftsman's house to rent them to his fellow, and he says to him: "If they are accepted from me, I will give you their value, but if not, I will give you according to the benefit derived from them," and they were tested in practice - he is liable.

hebrew_text: בַּחֲזִירָה – פָּטוּר, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהוּא כְּנוֹשֵׂא שָׂכָר.
human_translation: on the way back exempt, because he is like a paid bailee,
llm_translation: In the pig - exempt, because it is like carrying reward.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא גַּבְרָא דְּזַבֵּין לֵיהּ חֲמָרָא לְחַבְרֵיהּ, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: קָא מַמְטֵינָא לַיהּ לְדוּכְתָּא פְּלוֹנִי, אִי מִזְדַּבְּנָא – מוּטָב, וְאִי לָא – מַהְדַּרְנָא לַיהּ נִהֲלָיךְ. אֲזַל וְלָא אִזְדַּבְּנָא, וּבַהֲדֵי דְּקָא אָתֵא אִתְּנִיס. אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב נַחְמָן, חַיְּיבֵיהּ.
human_translation: a certain man who sold a donkey to another. said to him: I will bring it to such and such a place; if it is sold, good; and if not, I will return it to you. He went and it was not sold, and on his way an accident. came before Rav Naḥman, deemed liable
llm_translation: That man who was selling wine to his friends, he said to him: "I am sending you to a certain place, if we profit - good, and if not - we will walk away." He went and did not profit, and as he was coming back, he met him. He came before Rav Nachman, and he was liable.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ רַבָּה לְרַב נַחְמָן: נֶאֶנְסוּ, בַּהֲלִיכָה – חַיָּיב, וּבַחֲזָרָה – פָּטוּר, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהוּא כְּנוֹשֵׂא שָׂכָר!
human_translation: Rabba raised an objection to Rav Naḥman an accident happened to on their way liable; on the way back exempt, because he is like a paid bailee.
llm_translation: Rabah raised an objection to Rav Nachman: If they were forced, in walking - liable, and in returning - exempt, because it is like one who carries wages!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: חֲזָרָה דְּהַאי – הֲלִיכָה הִיא. מַאי טַעְמָא? סְבָרָה הוּא: בַּחֲזִירָתוֹ, אִילּוּ אַשְׁכַּח לְזַבּוֹנֵיהּ מִי לָא זַבְּנֵהּ?
human_translation: said to the way back of this is like the way What is the reason is logical reasoning: on his way back, if he found to sell wouldn’t he have sold it?
llm_translation: He said to him: The return of this - is it a walk. What is the reason? He thought: in its return, if he forgets his purchase, who will purchase it?

hebrew_text: ״שְׁמוֹר לִי וְאֶשְׁמוֹר לָךְ״ – שׁוֹמֵר שָׂכָר. וְאַמַּאי? שְׁמִירָה בִּבְעָלִים הִיא! אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: דַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ ״שְׁמוֹר לִי הַיּוֹם וְאֶשְׁמוֹר לְךָ לְמָחָר״.
human_translation: Safeguard for me and I will safeguard for you, paid bailee. But why It is safeguarding with the owners. Rav Pappa said: he said to him: Safeguard for me today and I will safeguard for you tomorrow.
llm_translation: "Guard for me, and I will guard for you" - one who guards receives reward. And why? Because guarding is in the hands of the owners! Rav Papa said: This is as he said to him, "Guard for me today, and I will guard for you tomorrow."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״שְׁמוֹר לִי וְאֶשְׁמוֹר לָךְ״, ״הַשְׁאִילֵנִי וְאַשְׁאִילֶךָ״, ״שְׁמוֹר לִי וְאַשְׁאִילֶךָ״, ״הַשְׁאִילֵנִי וְאֶשְׁמוֹר לָךְ״ – כּוּלָּן נַעֲשׂוּ שׁוֹמְרֵי שָׂכָר זֶה לָזֶה. וְאַמַּאי, שְׁמִירָה בִּבְעָלִים הִיא! אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: דַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ, ״שְׁמוֹר לִי הַיּוֹם וְאֶשְׁמוֹר לְךָ לְמָחָר״.
human_translation: The Sages taught Safeguard for me and I will safeguard for you, Lend to me and I will lend to you, Safeguard for me and I will lend to you, Lend to me and I will safeguard for you, they all become paid bailees for each other. Why Is safeguarding with the owners? Rav Pappa said: where he said to him: Safeguard for me today and I will safeguard for you tomorrow.
llm_translation: The sages taught: "Watch for me and I will watch for you," "Lend to me and I will lend to you," "Watch for me and I will lend to you," "Lend to me and I will watch for you" - all of these are made as guardians for one another. And why is that? Because watching is the responsibility of the owners! Rav Papa said: This is as if one said to him, "Watch for me today and I will watch for you tomorrow."

hebrew_text: הָנְהוּ אַהֲלוֹיֵי דְּכֹל יוֹמָא הֲוָה אָפֵי לְה[וּ] חַד מִינַּיְיהוּ. הָהוּא יוֹמָא אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ לְחַד מִינַּיְיהוּ: זִיל אֲפִי לַן. אֲמַר לְהוּ: נְטַרוּ לִי גְּלִימַאי. אַדַּאֲתָא פְּשַׁעוּ בֵּהּ (וְאִגְּנוּב) [וְאִגְּנִיב] אֲתוֹ. לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב פָּפָּא, חַיְּיבִינְהוּ.
human_translation: certain ice plant dealers [ ahaluyei ], every day one would bake One day said to one of them: Go bake for us. He said to them: Safeguard my cloak for me. Before he came they were negligent with it and it was stolen. They came before Rav Pappa, deemed them liable
llm_translation: Behold, those guests who every day would bake for him one of their types. That day they said to one of them: "Go bake for us." He said to them: "Watch my clothes." He came and sinned with it (and stole) it. Before Rav Papa, they are liable.

hebrew_text: אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ רַבָּנַן לְרַב פָּפָּא: אַמַּאי? פְּשִׁיעָה בִּבְעָלִים הִיא! אִכְּסִיף. לְסוֹף אִיגַּלַּאי מִילְּתָא דְּהָהוּא שַׁעְתָּא שִׁכְרָא הֲוָה קָא שָׁתֵי.
human_translation: The Rabbis said to Rav Pappa: Why This is negligence with the owners, was embarrassed Ultimately, it was discovered that at that time, was drinking beer
llm_translation: The sages said to Rav Papa: Why? It is a breach of trust with the owners! He was silent. In the end, the matter of that hour was revealed - he was drinking alcohol.

hebrew_text: הָנִיחָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר פְּשִׁיעָה בִּבְעָלִים פָּטוּר – מִשּׁוּם הָכִי אִכְּסִיף, אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר חַיָּיב – אַמַּאי אִכְּסִיף? אֶלָּא הָהוּא יוֹמָא לָאו דִּידֵיהּ הֲוָה, וַאֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ לְדִידֵיהּ: זִיל אֲפִי לַן אַתְּ, וַאֲמַר לְהוּ: בְּהָהוּא אַגְרָא דְּקָא אָפֵינָא לְכוּ נְטוּרוּ גְּלִימַאי.
human_translation: This works out well according to the one who says negligence with the owners exempt; due to that was embarrassed. But according to the one who says liable why was embarrassed? Rather, That day was not his and they said to him: You go bake for us, and he said to them: As payment for baking for you safeguard my cloak.
llm_translation: He left it for the one who says that throwing is exempt in the case of owners - for this reason he was silent, but for the one who says it is liable - why was he silent? Rather, on that day it was not his own, and they said to him: "Go bake for us," and he said to them: "In that field where I am baking for you, spread out my garments."

hebrew_text: עַד דַּאֲתָא – אִגְּנִיב. אֲתוֹ לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב פָּפָּא חַיְּיבִינְהוּ. אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ רַבָּנַן לְרַב פָּפָּא: הָא שְׁמִירָה בִּבְעָלִים הִיא! אִכְּסִיף. לְסוֹף אִיגַּלַּאי מִילְּתָא דְּהַהִיא שַׁעְתָּא שִׁכְרָא הֲוָה שָׁתֵי.
human_translation: Before he came it was stolen. They came before Rav Pappa, deemed them liable The Sages said to Rav Pappa: This is safeguarding with the owners. was embarrassed. Ultimately it was discovered that at that time was drinking beer
llm_translation: Until he came - he stole. They came before Rav Papa, they held him liable. The Rabbis said to Rav Papa: "This is guarding by the owners!" He was silent. In the end, the matter of that hour was revealed, he was drinking wine.

hebrew_text: הָנְהוּ בֵּי תְרֵי דַּהֲווֹ קָא מְסַגּוּ בְּאוֹרְחָא, חַד אֲרִיךְ וְחַד גּוּצָא. אֲרִיכָא רְכִיב חֲמָרָא וַהֲוָה לֵיהּ סְדִינָא, גּוּצָא מִיכַּסֵּי סַרְבָּלָא וְקָא מְסַגֵּי בְּכַרְעֵיהּ. כִּי מְטוֹ לְנַהֲרָא, שַׁקְלֵיהּ לְסַרְבָּלֵיהּ וְאוֹתְבֵיהּ עִילָּוֵי חֲמָרָא, וְשַׁקְלֵיהּ לִסְדִינֵיהּ דְּהָהוּא וְאִיכַּסִּי בֵּיהּ. שַׁטְפוּהּ מַיָּא לִסְדִינֵיהּ.
human_translation: these two who were going on the way, one tall and one short. The tall one was riding on a donkey and he had a sheet. The short one was covered with cloak [ sarbela ] and was walking on foot. When reached a river, he took his cloak and placed it on the donkey and he took that sheet and covered himself with it, the water washed away his sheet.
llm_translation: Those two individuals were traveling on the road, one long and one short. The long one rode on a donkey and had a saddle, while the short one covered himself with a cloak and walked on his feet. When they reached a river, he took off his cloak, spread it on the ground, placed the donkey's saddle on it, and then spread his own cloak on top of that. He poured water on his cloak.

hebrew_text: אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרָבָא, חַיְּיבֵיהּ. אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ רַבָּנַן לְרָבָא: אַמַּאי? שְׁאֵלָה בִּבְעָלִים הִיא! אִכְּסִיף. לְסוֹף אִיגַּלַּאי מִילְּתָא דִּבְלָא דַּעְתֵּיהּ שַׁקְלֵיהּ, וּבְלָא דַּעְתֵּיהּ אוֹתְבֵיהּ.
human_translation: came before Rava, deemed The Rabbis said to Rava: Why This is borrowing with the owners was embarrassed. Ultimately, it was discovered that took without knowledge and placed it without his knowledge,
llm_translation: He came before Rava, they found him liable. The Rabbis said to Rava: Why? It is a question of owners! He became embarrassed. In the end, when the matter was revealed to him without his knowledge, he took it, and without his knowledge, he wrote it down.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא גַּבְרָא דְּאוֹגַר לֵיהּ חֲמָרָא לְחַבְרֵיהּ, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: חֲזִי, לָא תֵּיזוֹל בְּאוֹרְחָא דִּנְהַר פְּקוֹד דְּאִיכָּא מַיָּא, זִיל בְּאוֹרְחָא דְנַרֶשׁ דְּלֵיכָּא מַיָּא. אָזֵיל בְּאוֹרְחָא דִּנְהַר פְּקוֹד וּמִית חַמְרָא. כִּי אֲתָא, אָמַר: אִין, בְּאוֹרְחָא דִּנְהַר פְּקוֹד אֲזַלִי, וּמִיהוּ לֵיכָּא מַיָּא.
human_translation: a certain man who rented a donkey to another. said to Look, do not go on the path of Nehar Pekod, where there is water go on the path of Neresh, where there is no water. went on the path of Nehar Pekod and the donkey died. When he came he said: Yes, I went on the path of Nehar Pekod; but there was no water
llm_translation: That man who stored wine for his friends, said to him: See, do not go on the path of the riverbank where there is water, go on the path of the plowed field where there is no water. He went on the path of the riverbank and the wine died. When he came, he said: No, go on the path of the riverbank, but there is no water there.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא: מָה לֵיהּ לְשַׁקֵּר, אִי בָּעֵי אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֲנָא בְּאוֹרְחָא דְנַרֶשׁ אֲזַלִי. אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: ״מָה לִי לְשַׁקֵּר״ בִּמְקוֹם עֵדִים – לָא אָמְרִינַן.
human_translation: Rava said: Why should he lie? if wanted he told I went on the path of Neresh, Abaye said to We do not say Why would I lie, in a place witnesses.
llm_translation: He said to him, Rava: What does he have to lie? If he wants, he can say to him: I went on the path of Nares. Abaye said to him: "What do I have to lie" in a place of witnesses - we do not say.

hebrew_text: ״שְׁמוֹר לִי״, וְאָמַר לוֹ ״הַנַּח לְפָנַי״ – שׁוֹמֵר חִנָּם. אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: אָמַר לוֹ הַנַּח לְפָנֶיךָ – אֵינוֹ לֹא שׁוֹמֵר חִנָּם וְלֹא שׁוֹמֵר שָׂכָר. אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: הַנַּח סְתָמָא, מַאי? תָּא שְׁמַע: שְׁמוֹר לִי וְאָמַר לוֹ הַנַּח לְפָנַי – שׁוֹמֵר חִנָּם. הָא סְתָמָא – וְלֹא כְּלוּם.
human_translation: Safeguard for me, and says to him: Place before me, an unpaid bailee. Rav Huna said: said to him: Place before yourself, he is neither an unpaid bailee nor a paid bailee, A dilemma was raised before Place without specifying what Come hear: Safeguard for me, and says to him: Place before me, an unpaid bailee. an unspecified nothing.
llm_translation: "Guard for me," and he said to him, "Leave it before me" - he guards for free. Rav Huna said: If he said to him, "Leave it before you," he is neither guarding for free nor guarding for payment. They asked: If he left it without specifying, what is the law? Come and hear: "Guard for me," and he said to him, "Leave it before me" - he guards for free. This is without any payment - and not for nothing.

hebrew_text: אַדְּרַבָּה, מִדְּאָמַר רַב הוּנָא: ״הַנַּח לְפָנֶיךָ״ – הוּא דְּאֵינוֹ לֹא שׁוֹמֵר חִנָּם וְלֹא שׁוֹמֵר שָׂכָר, הָא סְתָמָא שׁוֹמֵר חִנָּם הָוֵי! אֶלָּא מֵהָא לֵיכָּא לְמִשְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: On the contrary, from which Rav Huna says: Place in front of yourself, that he is neither an unpaid bailee nor a paid bailee. Place without specifying he is an unpaid bailee. Rather, no to be learned from this
llm_translation: The Great Rav Huna said: "Leave it before you" - this means that one does not guard it for free nor does one guard it for payment, rather, it is assumed that one guards it for free! Instead, from here we can infer.

hebrew_text: לֵימָא כְּתַנָּאֵי: אִם הִכְנִיס בִּרְשׁוּת בַּעַל חָצֵר – חַיָּיב. רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: בְּכוּלָּם אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב עַד שֶׁיְּקַבֵּל עָלָיו בַּעַל הַבַּיִת לִשְׁמוֹר.
