human_translation: Let us say is the subject of tanna’im , If one brought with the permission of the owner of the courtyard liable. Rabbi says: In all he is liable only if the owner accepts upon himself to safeguard
llm_translation: Let us say like the Tannaim: If one placed an object in the domain of the householder of the courtyard - he is liable. Rabbi says: In all cases, he is not liable until the householder accepts upon himself to guard the object.

hebrew_text: מִמַּאי? דִּלְמָא עַד כָּאן לָא קָאָמְרִי רַבָּנַן הָתָם אֶלָּא בְּחָצֵר דְּבַת נַטּוֹרֵי הִיא, וְכִי קָאָמַר לֵיהּ ״עַיֵּיל״ – ״עַיֵּיל דְּאִינְטַר לָךְ״ קָאָמַר לֵיהּ. אֲבָל הָכָא, שׁוּקָא לָאו בַּר נַטּוֹרֵי הוּא, ״אַנַּח וְתִיב נְטַר לָךְ״ קָאָמַר לֵיהּ.
human_translation: From where Perhaps the Rabbis there say only in a courtyard, can be safeguarded, and when said to him: Place saying to him Place that I can safeguard it for you. But here, a market, cannot be safeguarded, saying to him: Place and sit safeguard it yourself.
llm_translation: From what? Perhaps until here not saying sages there rather in courtyard of Bat Natorei it is, and when saying to him "Ayil" - "Ayil that you are not entering" saying to him. But here, market not in Bat Natorei it is, "We and you guard for you" saying to him.

hebrew_text: אִי נָמֵי: עַד כָּאן לָא קָאָמַר רַבִּי הָתָם אֶלָּא בַּחֲצֵירוֹ, דִּלְעַיּוֹלֵי רְשׁוּתָא קָא בָעֵי לְמִשְׁקַל מִינֵּיהּ וְכִי יָהֵיב לֵיהּ רְשׁוּתָא לְעַיּוֹלֵי – ״תִּיב וְנַטַּר לָךְ״ קָאָמַר לֵיהּ. אֲבָל הָכָא – ״הַנַּח וַאֲנָא מְנַטַּרְנָא״ קָאָמַר לֵיהּ. דְּאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ ״הַנַּח וְתִיב וְנַטַּר״ קָאָמַר לֵיהּ, אִי לְאוֹתֹבֵה, רְשׁוּתָא בָּעֵי לְמִשְׁקַל מִינֵּיהּ?
human_translation: Alternatively, Rabbi says only there, in his courtyard, as he requires permission from to enter, and when gave him permission to enter, he said to him Sit and safeguard it. But here, saying to him: Place and I will safeguard for you. As if it enters your mind saying to him: Place and sit and safeguard it does require permission from him to put down
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Iy namei: ad kan lo ka'amar Rabbi hatam ela bachatzeiro, dil'ayolei reshuta ka ba'ei le'mishkal mineih u'chi yahev lei reshuta le'ayolei - 'tiv ve'natar lakh' ka'amar lei. Aval hacha - 'hanach va'ana menatarna' ka'amar lei. De'i salka datakh 'hanach ve'tiv ve'natar' ka'amar lei, iy le'otoveh, reshuta ba'ei le'mishkal mineih?" English translation: "If you say: until here Rabbi did not say except in the courtyard, for he needs permission to carry his belongings, and if he gives him permission to carry - he says to him, 'Place and guard for yourself.' But here - he says, 'Leave it and I will guard it.' For if your intention is 'leave and place and guard,' if not, does he need permission to carry his belongings?"

hebrew_text: הִלְוָהוּ עַל הַמַּשְׁכּוֹן – שׁוֹמֵר שָׂכָר. לֵימָא מַתְנִיתִין דְּלָא כְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר? דְּתַנְיָא: הַמַּלְוֶה אֶת חֲבֵירוֹ עַל הַמַּשְׁכּוֹן וְאָבַד הַמַּשְׁכּוֹן – יִשָּׁבַע וְיִטּוֹל מְעוֹתָיו, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר.
human_translation: One who lent to on collateral a paid bailee Let us say that the mishna is not in accordance with Rabbi Eliezer. As it is taught one who lends to another on collateral and the collateral was lost, takes an oath and he take his money the statement of Rabbi Eliezer,
llm_translation: Borrowing on the collateral - he is considered a paid guardian. Let us say the Mishnah that does not follow Rabbi Eliezer? For it was taught: One who lends to his fellow on collateral, and the collateral is lost - he must swear and take his money, the words of Rabbi Eliezer.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: יָכוֹל לוֹמַר לוֹ: כְּלוּם הִלְוִיתַנִי אֶלָּא עַל הַמַּשְׁכּוֹן? אָבַד הַמַּשְׁכּוֹן – אָבְדוּ מְעוֹתֶיךָ. אֲבָל הִלְוָהוּ אֶלֶף זוּז בִּשְׁטָר וְהִנִּיחַ לוֹ מַשְׁכּוֹן עֲלֵיהֶם, דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל: אָבַד הַמַּשְׁכּוֹן – אָבְדוּ מְעוֹתָיו.
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva says say to him: Didn’t you lend to me only on the collateral? the collateral is lost, your money is lost. But he lent him one thousand dinars by means of note and left him collateral against everyone agrees the collateral is lost, his money is lost.
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: Can one say to him, "I only lent to you on the collateral?" If the collateral is lost - your money is lost. But if he lent him a thousand zuz with a promissory note and left him collateral upon them, everyone agrees: if the collateral is lost - his money is lost.

hebrew_text: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר, וְלָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן – שֶׁמִּשְׁכְּנוֹ בִּשְׁעַת הַלְוָאָתוֹ, כָּאן – שֶׁמִּשְׁכְּנוֹ שֶׁלֹּא בִּשְׁעַת הַלְוָאָתוֹ.
human_translation: Even you say Rabbi Eliezer, not difficult. Here, where took his collateral at the time of his loan, there, where took his collateral not at the time of his loan,
llm_translation: Even if you say it is Rabbi Eliezer, and it is not difficult: here - where he dwells at the time of his borrowing, here - where he dwells not at the time of his borrowing.

hebrew_text: וְהָא אִידֵּי וְאִידֵּי,
human_translation: But don’t this and that,
llm_translation: And this is the statement of both, and both.

hebrew_text: הִלְוָהוּ עַל הַמַּשְׁכּוֹן קָתָנֵי! אֶלָּא לָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן – שֶׁהִלְוָהוּ מָעוֹת, כָּאן – שֶׁהִלְוָהוּ פֵּירוֹת.
human_translation: teach One who lent to another on collateral, Rather, not difficult. Here, where he lent him money, there, where he lent him produce.
llm_translation: Borrowing on the Mishkan is small! Rather not difficult: here - that he borrowed money, here - that he borrowed produce.

hebrew_text: וְהָא מִדְּקָתָנֵי סֵיפָא, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: הִלְוָהוּ מָעוֹת – שׁוֹמֵר חִנָּם, הִלְוָהוּ פֵּירוֹת – שׁוֹמֵר שָׂכָר. מִכְלָל דִּלְתַנָּא קַמָּא לָא שָׁנֵי לֵיהּ!
human_translation: But from that the latter clause teaches Rabbi Yehuda says: One who lent money an unpaid bailee, one who lent produce a paid bailee, by inference the first tanna there is no difference
llm_translation: The Gemara raises an objection from the latter clause: Rabbi Yehuda says: If one lends him money, he watches over it for free; if one lends him produce, he watches over it for payment. Is it not inferred that the first Tanna does not disagree with him!

hebrew_text: כּוּלַּהּ רַבִּי יְהוּדָה הִיא, וְחַסּוֹרֵי מִיחַסְּרָא וְהָכִי קָתָנֵי: הִלְוָהוּ עַל הַמַּשְׁכּוֹן – שׁוֹמֵר שָׂכָר, בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים – שֶׁהִלְוָהוּ פֵּירוֹת, אֲבָל הִלְוָהוּ מָעוֹת – שׁוֹמֵר חִנָּם. שֶׁרַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: הִלְוָהוּ מָעוֹת – שׁוֹמֵר חִנָּם, הִלְוָהוּ פֵּירוֹת – שׁוֹמֵר שָׂכָר.
human_translation: The entire is Rabbi Yehuda, and is incomplete and this is what it is teaching: One who lent to on collateral is a paid bailee. In what is this statement said? When he lent him produce. But he lent him money, an unpaid bailee. As Rabbi Yehuda says: One who lent money an unpaid bailee one who lent produce a paid bailee.
llm_translation: The entirety is Rabbi Yehuda, and lacking from lacking, and thus it teaches: If one lends him on collateral - he keeps the profit, in what case are these matters said - that if he lent him produce, but if he lent him money - he keeps it for free. For Rabbi Yehuda says: If he lent him money - he keeps it for free, if he lent him produce - he keeps the profit.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, קָמָה לַהּ מַתְנִיתִין דְּלָא כְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא. אֶלָּא מְחַוַּורְתָּא מַתְנִיתִין דְּלָא כְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר.
human_translation: If that is so, the mishna is established not in accordance with Rabbi Akiva. Rather, it is clear the mishna is not in accordance with Rabbi Eliezer.
llm_translation: Thus, the Mishnah arose against him not like Rabbi Akiva. Rather, the Mishnah of Mechavarta arose against him not like Rabbi Eliezer.

hebrew_text: לֵימָא בִּדְלָא שָׁוֵי מַשְׁכּוֹן שִׁיעוּר זוּזֵי, וּבְדִשְׁמוּאֵל קָא מִיפַּלְגִי. דְּאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הַאי מַאן דְּאוֹזְפֵיהּ אַלְפָּא זוּזֵי לְחַבְרֵיהּ וְאַנַּח לֵיהּ קַתָּא דְמַגְּלָא עִילָּוַיְיהוּ, אֲבַד קַתָּא דְמַגְּלָא – אֲבַדוּ אַלְפָּא זוּזֵי.
human_translation: Let us say in where collateral is not equal the monetary value and they disagree with regard to of Shmuel. As Shmuel says: one who lends one thousand dinars to another and puts before for the handle of a sickle, the sickle is lost, the thousand dinars are lost.
llm_translation: Let us say, in a case where one places a security deposit of a specific amount, and in the opinion of Shmuel, he is mistaken. For Shmuel said: One who lends a thousand coins to his friend and we lose the chest containing them, if the chest is lost - the thousand coins are lost.

hebrew_text: אִי בִּדְלָא שָׁוֵי מַשְׁכּוֹן שִׁיעוּר זוּזֵי – דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לֵית לְהוּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל, וְהָכָא בִּדְשָׁוֵי שִׁיעוּר זוּזֵי, וְקָא מִיפַּלְגִי בִּדְרַבִּי יִצְחָק.
human_translation: If where collateral is not equal the amount of money everyone holds not of Shmuel. But here to where equal the amount of the money and they disagree with regard to of Rabbi Yitzḥak.
llm_translation: If not for the fact that the measure of the space is not equal to the measure of the coins - for everyone in the world does not have the name of Shmuel, and here, in the case where the measure of the space is equal to the measure of the coins, and he is in disagreement with Rabbi Yitzchak.

hebrew_text: דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: מִנַּיִן לְבַעַל חוֹב שֶׁקּוֹנֶה מַשְׁכּוֹן, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וּלְךָ תִּהְיֶה צְדָקָה״. אִם אֵינוֹ קוֹנֶה מַשְׁכּוֹן, צְדָקָה מְנָא לֵיהּ? מִכָּאן לְבַעַל חוֹב שֶׁקּוֹנֶה מַשְׁכּוֹן.
human_translation: As Rabbi Yitzḥak says: From where that a creditor acquires collateral as it is stated: and it shall be a righteousness for you If does not acquire the collateral, from where is the righteousness From here that a creditor acquires the collateral.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Rabbi Yitzchak said: From where do we derive that a creditor who acquires collateral, as it is stated: "And righteousness will be credited to you"? If he does not acquire collateral, where will righteousness come to him from? From here we learn that a creditor who acquires collateral.

hebrew_text: וְתִסְבְּרָא? אֵימוֹר דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק בְּמִשְׁכְּנוֹ שֶׁלֹּא בִּשְׁעַת הַלְוָאָתוֹ, אֲבָל מִשְׁכְּנוֹ בִּשְׁעַת הַלְוָאָתוֹ – מִי אָמַר?
human_translation: And you understand say that Rabbi Yitzḥak stated where took his collateral not at the time of his loan But did say took his collateral at the time of his loan?
llm_translation: And was it created? The statement of Rabbi Yitzchak who said in his dwelling that it was not at the time of its erection, but in his dwelling at the time of its erection - who said?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מִשְׁכְּנוֹ שֶׁלֹּא בִּשְׁעַת הַלְוָאָתוֹ – כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא אִית לְהוּ דְּרַבִּי יִצְחָק. וְהָכָא בְּמִשְׁכְּנוֹ בִּשְׁעַת הַלְוָאָתוֹ, וּבְשׁוֹמֵר אֲבֵידָה קָא מִיפַּלְגִי. דְּאִיתְּמַר: שׁוֹמֵר אֲבֵידָה, רַבָּה אָמַר: כְּשׁוֹמֵר חִנָּם, רַב יוֹסֵף אָמַר: כְּשׁוֹמֵר שָׂכָר.
human_translation: Rather, he took his collateral not at the time of his loan, everyone holds of Rabbi Yitzḥak. And here where he took his collateral at the time of his loan, and disagree with regard to a bailee of a lost item. As it was stated the bailee for a lost item. Rabba said: like an unpaid bailee. Rav Yosef said: like a paid bailee.
llm_translation: Rather, his neighbor when not at the time of his borrowing - everyone in the world has Rabbi Yitzchak. And here in his neighbor at the time of his borrowing, and regarding a lost item they argue. For it was stated: regarding a lost item, Rabah said: like one who guards for free, Rav Yosef said: like one who guards for payment.

hebrew_text: לֵימָא דְּרַב יוֹסֵף תַּנָּאֵי הִיא? לָא, בְּשׁוֹמֵר אֲבֵידָה – דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא אִית לְהוּ דְּרַב יוֹסֵף, וְהָכָא
human_translation: Let us say of Rav Yosef is tanna’im . No, with regard to a bailee for a lost item everyone holds of Rav Yosef, And here,
llm_translation: Let us say that Rav Yosef taught it? No, in the case of a lost item - everyone in the world has a Rav Yosef, but here

hebrew_text: בְּמִלְוֶה צָרִיךְ לְמַשְׁכּוֹן קָמִיפַּלְגִי. מָר סָבַר: מִצְוָה קָא עָבֵיד שֶׁהִלְוָהוּ, וְהָוֵי שׁוֹמֵר שָׂכָר. וּמָר סָבַר: לָאו מִצְוָה קָא עָבֵיד, שֶׁלַּהֲנָאָתוֹ מִתְכַּוֵּין, וְהָוֵי שׁוֹמֵר חִנָּם.
human_translation: they disagree with regard to a lender who needs the collateral, Sage, holds that he is performing a mitzva that he lent to him, and he is a paid bailee. And Sage, holds he is not performing a mitzva, as his intention is for his own benefit. And he is an unpaid bailee
llm_translation: In a loan, one must establish a collateral. Master holds: he is performing a commandment by lending, and he shall be a paid guardian. And Master holds: he is not performing a commandment, for he intends for his own benefit, and he shall be an unpaid guardian.

hebrew_text: אַבָּא שָׁאוּל אוֹמֵר: מוּתָּר לָאָדָם לְהַשְׂכִּיר מַשְׁכּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עָנִי לִהְיוֹת פּוֹחֵת וְהוֹלֵךְ. אָמַר רַב חָנָן בַּר אַמֵּי אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הֲלָכָה כְּאַבָּא שָׁאוּל. וְאַף אַבָּא שָׁאוּל לָא אָמַר אֶלָּא בְּמָרָא וּפָסָל וְקַרְדּוֹם, הוֹאִיל וּנְפִישׁ אַגְרַיְיהוּ וְזוּטַר פְּחָתַיְיהוּ.
human_translation: Abba Shaul says: permitted a person to rent out a poor person’s collateral so that he shall progressively reduce Rav Ḥanan bar Ami says Shmuel says: halakha in accordance with Abba Shaul, but even Abba Shaul said only with regard to a hoe, a chisel, and an ax, since the remuneration these is great and their depreciation is small.
llm_translation: Abba Sha'ul says: It is permitted for a person to rent the dwelling of a poor person in order to become poorer and poorer. Rav Hanan bar Ammi said in the name of Shmuel: The halakha is in accordance with Abba Sha'ul. And Abba Sha'ul only said this regarding a mirror, a bed, and a pillow, since their value increases while their usefulness decreases.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַמַּעֲבִיר חָבִית מִמָּקוֹם לְמָקוֹם וּשְׁבָרָהּ, בֵּין שׁוֹמֵר חִנָּם בֵּין שׁוֹמֵר שָׂכָר – יִשָּׁבַע. רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: זֶה וְזֶה יִשָּׁבַע, וְתָמֵיהַּ אֲנִי אִם יְכוֹלִין זֶה וָזֶה לִישָּׁבַע.
human_translation: one who was transporting a barrel from one place to another and he broke it, whether an unpaid bailee or a paid bailee, he takes an oath Rabbi Eliezer says: this and that take an oath but I wonder whether this and that can take an oath.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who transfers a barrel from one place to another and it breaks, whether the watcher is unpaid or paid - he must swear. Rabbi Eliezer says: Both the watcher and the owner must swear, and I am amazed if both are able to swear.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הַמַּעֲבִיר חָבִית לַחֲבֵירוֹ מִמָּקוֹם לְמָקוֹם וּשְׁבָרָהּ, בֵּין שׁוֹמֵר חִנָּם בֵּין שׁוֹמֵר שָׂכָר – יִשָּׁבַע, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: שׁוֹמֵר חִנָּם – יִשָּׁבַע, נוֹשֵׂא שָׂכָר – יְשַׁלֵּם. רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: זֶה וְזֶה יִשָּׁבַע, וְתָמֵיהַּ אֲנִי אִם יְכוֹלִין זֶה וָזֶה לִישָּׁבַע.
human_translation: The Sages taught: one who was transporting a barrel for another from one place to another and he broke it, whether an unpaid bailee or a paid bailee, he takes an oath the statement of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda says: An unpaid bailee takes an oath a paid bailee pays. Rabbi Eliezer says: This and that take an oath, and I wonder whether this one and that one can take an oath.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: One who transfers a barrel to his fellow from place to place and it broke, whether he was watching it for free or whether he was watching it for pay - he must swear, the words of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda says: One who watches for free - must swear, one who receives payment - must pay. Rabbi Eliezer says: Both must swear, and I am amazed if both are able to swear.

hebrew_text: לְמֵימְרָא דְּסָבַר רַבִּי מֵאִיר נִתְקַל לָאו פּוֹשֵׁעַ הוּא? וְהָתַנְיָא: נִשְׁבְּרָה כַּדּוֹ וְלֹא סִילְּקָהּ נָפְלָה גְּמַלּוֹ וְלֹא הֶעֱמִידָהּ, רַבִּי מֵאִיר מְחַיֵּיב בְּהֶיזֵּיקָן, וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: פָּטוּר מִדִּינֵי אָדָם וְחַיָּיב בְּדִינֵי שָׁמַיִם. וְקַיְימָא לַן דִּבְנִתְקַל פּוֹשֵׁעַ פְּלִיגִי!
human_translation: to say Rabbi Meir holds one who stumbles is not negligent, But isn’t it taught one’s pitcher broke and he did not remove it his camel fell and he did not stand it up, Rabbi Meir renders him liable for the damage they And the Rabbis say exempt according to human laws but liable according to the laws of Heaven. And we maintain that they disagree with regard to one who stumbles is negligent.
llm_translation: In the matter where Rabbi Meir holds, did he encounter a transgressor? And it was taught: If a jug broke and she did not remove it, a camel fell and she did not support it, Rabbi Meir obligates in their damage, and the Sages say: He is exempt from the laws of man and liable in the laws of Heaven. And our conclusion is that in the case of encountering a transgressor, we disagree!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: תִּבְרַהּ, מִי שֶׁשָּׁנָה זוֹ לֹא שָׁנָה זוֹ. וַאֲתָא רַבִּי יְהוּדָה לְמֵימַר: שׁוֹמֵר חִנָּם – יִשָּׁבַע, נוֹשֵׂא שָׂכָר – יְשַׁלֵּם. הַאי כִּי דִינֵיהּ וְהַאי כִּי דִינֵיהּ. וַאֲתָא רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר לְמֵימַר: אִין, גְּמָרָא כְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר. וּמִיהוּ תָּמֵיהַּ אֲנִי אִם יְכוֹלִין זֶה וָזֶה לִישָּׁבַע.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: Break who taught this did not teach that, And Rabbi Yehuda came to say An unpaid bailee takes an oath a paid bailee pays, this one in accordance with his law and that one in accordance with his law, And Rabbi Eliezer came to say: Yes, a tradition is in accordance with Rabbi Meir, but I wonder whether this and that can take an oath.
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: "Tivrah, one who changes this, did not change this." Rabbi Yehuda came to say: "One who guards for free - should swear, one who takes payment - should pay. This one for its judgment and this one for its judgment." Rabbi Eliezer came to say: "No, the Gemara is like Rabbi Meir. But I am amazed if both can swear."

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא שׁוֹמֵר חִנָּם מִשְׁתְּבַע דְּלָא פְּשַׁע בַּהּ: אֶלָּא שׁוֹמֵר שָׂכָר אַמַּאי מִשְׁתְּבַע? כִּי לָא פְּשַׁע נָמֵי שַׁלּוֹמֵי בָּעֵי. וַאֲפִילּוּ שׁוֹמֵר חִנָּם נָמֵי, הָתִינַח בִּמְקוֹם מִדְרוֹן. שֶׁלֹּא בִּמְקוֹם מִדְרוֹן, מִי מָצֵי מִשְׁתְּבַע דְּלָא פְּשַׁע בַּהּ!
human_translation: Granted, an unpaid bailee takes an oath that he was not negligent with regard to but why does a paid bailee take an oath? if he was not negligent he is still required to pay, And even an unpaid bailee, works out well on an inclined plane [ midron ], not on an inclined plane how can he take an oath he was not negligent
llm_translation: In truth, one who guards for free, why does he take an oath that he did not commit a transgression? Rather, one who guards for payment, why does he take an oath? Because he did not commit a transgression, he seeks peace. And even one who guards for free, seeks to be established in a place of honor. If not in a place of honor, who can take an oath that he did not commit a transgression!

hebrew_text: וַאֲפִילּוּ בִּמְקוֹם מִדְרוֹן נָמֵי – הֲתִינַח הֵיכָא דְּלֵיכָּא רְאָיָה, אֲבָל הֵיכָא דְּאִיכָּא רְאָיָה – נַיְתֵי רְאָיָה וְנִפְּטַר. דְּתַנְיָא, אִיסִי בֶּן יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: ״אֵין רֹאֶה שְׁבֻעַת ה׳ תִּהְיֶה בֵּין שְׁנֵיהֶם״, הָא יֵשׁ רוֹאֶה – יָבִיא רְאָיָה וְיִפָּטֵר.
human_translation: And even on an inclined plane, works out well where there is no evidence, But where there is evidence, let him bring evidence and be exempt. As it is taught Isi ben Yehuda says, without an eyewitness, an oath of the Lord shall be between them” there is an eyewitness, him bring evidence and be exempt.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Even in a place where the south is favorable - should he establish himself where there is no visibility, but where there is visibility - he should establish himself and be exempt. As it was taught: Issi ben Yehuda says, "One who does not see the new moon of God's week between them," if there is one who sees, he should bring testimony and be exempt.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: שְׁבוּעָה זוֹ תַּקָּנַת חֲכָמִים הִיא, שֶׁאִם אִי אַתָּה אוֹמֵר כֵּן – אֵין לְךָ אָדָם הַמַּעֲבִיר חָבִית לַחֲבֵירוֹ מִמָּקוֹם לְמָקוֹם.
human_translation: And Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba Rabbi Yoḥanan says: this oath is a decree of the Sages that if you do not say so, you will have no person who will transport a barrel for another from one place to another,
llm_translation: Rabbi Chiya bar Abba said Rabbi Yochanan: This oath is an enactment of the sages, that if you do not say so - you have no person who can transfer a barrel from one place to another.

hebrew_text: הֵיכִי מִשְׁתְּבַע? אָמַר רָבָא: שְׁבוּעָה שֶׁלֹּא בְּכַוּוֹנָה שְׁבַרְתִּיהָ. וַאֲתָא רַבִּי יְהוּדָה לְמֵימַר: שׁוֹמֵר חִנָּם יִשָּׁבַע, נוֹשֵׂא שָׂכָר יְשַׁלֵּם, הַאי כְּדִינֵיהּ וְהַאי כְּדִינֵיהּ. וַאֲתָא רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר לְמֵימַר: אִין, גְּמָרָא כְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר, וּמִיהוּ, תָּמֵיהַּ אֲנִי אִם יְכוֹלִים זֶה וָזֶה לִישָּׁבַע.
human_translation: How does he take an oath? Rava said an oath that I broke it unintentionally. And Rabbi Yehuda came to say: An unpaid bailee takes an oath, a paid bailee pays, this one in accordance with his law and that one in accordance with his law. And Rabbi Elazar came to say: Yes, a tradition in accordance with Rabbi Meir. But I wonder whether this and that can take an oath.
llm_translation: How does one take an oath? Rava said: A false oath taken unintentionally. Rabbi Yehuda came and said: One who watches for free should swear, one who takes payment should pay, this one according to his law, and that one according to his law. Rabbi Elazar came and said: No, the Gemara is like Rabbi Meir, but I am amazed if both can swear.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא שׁוֹמֵר חִנָּם – מִשְׁתְּבַע שֶׁלֹּא פָּשַׁע בָּהּ. אֶלָּא שׁוֹמֵר שָׂכָר, אַמַּאי מִשְׁתְּבַע? כִּי לָא פְּשַׁע נָמֵי בָּעֵי שַׁלּוֹמֵי. וַאֲפִילּוּ שׁוֹמֵר חִנָּם נָמֵי, הָא תִּינַח בִּמְקוֹם מִדְרוֹן. שֶׁלֹּא בִּמְקוֹם מִדְרוֹן, מִי מָצֵי מִשְׁתְּבַע שֶׁלֹּא פָּשַׁע?
human_translation: Granted, an unpaid bailee takes an oath that he was not negligent with regard to but why does a paid bailee take an oath? if he was not negligent, he is still required to pay. And even an unpaid bailee, this works out well on an inclined plane, not on an inclined plane how can he take an oath he was not negligent with it?
llm_translation: In truth, one who guards for free - he is committed not to transgress with it. But one who guards for payment, why is he committed? Because he seeks peace. And even one who guards for free, he too should be placed in a secure location. If not in a secure location, who can find one committed not to transgress?

hebrew_text: וַאֲפִילּוּ בִּמְקוֹם מִדְרוֹן נָמֵי, הָא תִּינַח הֵיכָא דְּלֵיכָּא רְאָיָה, הֵיכָא דְּאִיכָּא רְאָיָה – נַיְתֵי רְאָיָה וְיִפָּטֵר. דְּתַנְיָא, אִיסִי בֶּן יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: ״אֵין רֹאֶה שְׁבֻעַת ה׳ תִּהְיֶה בֵּין שְׁנֵיהֶם״ הָא יֵשׁ רוֹאֶה – יָבִיא רְאָיָה וְיִפָּטֵר.
human_translation: And even on an inclined plane, this works out well where there is no evidence. But where there is evidence, let him bring evidence and be exempt. As it is taught Isi ben Yehuda says, without an eyewitness, an oath of the Lord shall be between them” there is an eyewitness, him bring evidence and be exempt.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Even in a place where the south wind blows, here where there is no visibility, where there is visibility - he should come, see, and be exempt. As it was taught: Issi ben Yehuda says, "One who does not see the new moon of God's week between them." If there is one who sees, he should bring visibility and be exempt.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא גַּבְרָא דַּהֲוָה קָא מְעַבַּר חָבִיתָא דְחַמְרָא בְּרִיסְתְּקָא דְמָחוֹזָא, וְתַבְרַהּ בְּזִיזָא דְמָחוֹזָא. אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרָבָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: רִיסְתְּקָא דְמָחוֹזָא שְׁכִיחִי בַּהּ אִינָשֵׁי, זִיל, אַיְיתִי רְאָיָה וְאִיפְּטַר. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב יוֹסֵף בְּרֵיהּ: כְּמַאן כְּאִיסִי? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִין כְּאִיסִי, וּסְבִירָא לַן כְּווֹתֵיהּ.
human_translation: a certain man who transported a barrel of wine in the market [ beristeka ] of Meḥoza and broke it on one of the protrusions in Meḥoza. came before Rava, said to him: the market of Meḥoza, people are generally found there. Go bring evidence and be exempt. Rav Yosef, son, said to him: In accordance with whose In accordance with Isi said to him: Yes, in accordance with Isi, and we hold in accordance with his
llm_translation: That man who was passing a barrel of wine on the bridge of Mahoza, and it broke in the bridge of Mahoza. He came before Rava. He said to him: The bridge of Mahoza is frequented by people, go, bring witnesses and you will be acquitted. Rav Yosef his son said to him: Like whom do you compare yourself? He said to him: I do not compare myself, and we hold according to his opinion.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא גַּבְרָא דַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ לְחַבְרֵיהּ: זִיל זְבֵין לִי אַרְבַּע מְאָה דַּנֵּי חַמְרָא. אֲזַל זְבַן לֵיהּ. לְסוֹף אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: זְבִינֵי לָךְ אַרְבַּע מְאָה דַּנֵּי חַמְרָא וּתְקִיפוּ לְהוּ.
human_translation: a certain man who said to another: Go buy for me four hundred pitchers of wine. went and bought for him. Ultimately, he came before and said to him: I bought four hundred pitchers of wine for you, but they fermented.
llm_translation: That man who said to his friends: "Go buy for me four hundred barrels of wine." They went and bought for him. In the end, he came before him, and said to him: "I bought for you four hundred barrels of wine, and they are strong for them."

hebrew_text: אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרָבָא, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אַרְבַּע מְאָה דַּנֵּי חַמְרָא תְּקִיפִי קָלָא אִית לַהּ לְמִילְּתָא, זִיל אַיְיתִי רְאָיָה דְּמֵעִיקָּרָא כִּי מְזַבְּנַתְּ לְהוּ חַמְרָא מְעַלְּיָא הֲוָה, וְאִיפְּטַר. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב יוֹסֵף בְּרֵיהּ: כְּמַאן כְּאִיסִי? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִין כְּאִיסִי, וּסְבִירָא לַן כְּווֹתֵיהּ.
human_translation: came before Rava, said to four hundred pitchers of wine fermented, this matter publicity, go bring proof that initially, when you purchased the wine was good, and you will be exempt. Rav Yosef, son, said to him: In accordance with whose According to Isi said to him: Yes, in accordance with Isi, and we hold in accordance with his
llm_translation: He came before Rava, he said to him: Four hundred barrels of wine, a strong voice there is to it for the matter, go bring a proof from the beginning when the wine was being sold at a higher price, and it deteriorated. Rav Yosef his son said to him: Like whom is he similar? He said to him: He is not similar to anyone, and we hold according to his words.

hebrew_text: אַתְקֵין רַב חִיָּיא בַּר יוֹסֵף בְּסִיכְרָא: הָנֵי דְּדָרוּ בְּאַגְרָא וְאִיתְּבַר – נְשַׁלֵּם פַּלְגָא. מַאי טַעְמָא – נְפִישׁ לְחַד וְזוּטַר לִתְרֵי, קָרוֹב לְאוֹנֶס וְקָרוֹב לִפְשִׁיעָה. בְּדִיגְלָא – מְשַׁלֵּם כּוּלַּהּ.
human_translation: Rav Ḥiyya bar Yosef issued a decree in Sikhra, those who carry on a pole [ be’agra ] and breaks, they must pay half. What is the reason? much for one and little for two. close to an accident and close to negligence, with a digla , he pays in full,
llm_translation: Rav Chiya bar Yosef established in Sikra: Those who dwell in a valley and are attacked - half payment is made. What is the reason? - It is more severe for one and less severe for two, close to compulsion and close to negligence. In a garment - full payment is made.

hebrew_text: רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָן תְּבַרוּ לֵיהּ הָנְהוּ שָׁקוֹלָאֵי חָבִיתָא דְחַמְרָא, שְׁקַל לִגְלִימַיְיהוּ. אֲתוֹ אֲמַרוּ לְרַב. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הַב לְהוּ גְּלִימַיְיהוּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ דִּינָא הָכִי? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִין, ״לְמַעַן תֵּלֵךְ בְּדֶרֶךְ טוֹבִים״. יְהַיב לְהוּ גְּלִימַיְיהוּ. אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: עַנְיֵי אֲנַן, וְטָרְחִינַן כּוּלֵּהּ יוֹמָא, וְכָפֵינַן, וְלֵית לַן מִידֵּי. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: זִיל הַב אַגְרַיְיהוּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ דִּינָא הָכִי? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִין, ״וְאׇרְחוֹת צַדִּיקִים תִּשְׁמֹר״.
human_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥanan: Certain porters broke his barrel of wine He took their cloaks They came and told Rav. said Give them their cloaks. said to him: this the halakha ? said to him: Yes, “That you may walk in the way of good men” gave them their cloaks. said to We are poor people and we toiled all day and we are hungry and we have nothing. said to Go give their wages. said to him: this the halakha ? said to him: Yes, “And keep the paths of the righteous”
llm_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥanan, they threw at him the skins of wine flasks, he took off his cloak. They came and told Rav. He said to him: Bring back their cloaks to them. He said to him: Is this the law? He said to him: Yes, "so you may walk in the way of the good." He gave back their cloaks to them. They said to him: We are poor, and we toiled the whole day, and we borrowed, and we have nothing. He said to them: Go, take your wages. He said to him: Is this the law? He said to him: Yes, "and the paths of the righteous you shall keep."

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ הַשּׂוֹכֵר אֶת הָאוּמָּנִין
llm_translation: The employer shall return to you the craftsmen.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַשּׂוֹכֵר אֶת הַפּוֹעֲלִים וְאָמַר לָהֶם לְהַשְׁכִּים וּלְהַעֲרִיב, מָקוֹם שֶׁנָּהֲגוּ שֶׁלֹּא לְהַשְׁכִּים וְשֶׁלֹּא לְהַעֲרִיב – אֵינוֹ רַשַּׁאי לְכוֹפָן. מָקוֹם שֶׁנָּהֲגוּ לָזוּן – יָזוּן, לְסַפֵּק בִּמְתִיקָה – יְסַפֵּק, הַכֹּל כְּמִנְהַג הַמְּדִינָה.
human_translation: one who hires laborers and tells them to rise early and to continue late, a locale where are not accustomed to rising early or to continuing late, not permitted to compel them a locale where are accustomed to feeding must feed to providing with sweet he must provide Everything is in accordance with the regional custom
llm_translation: It was taught: If the employer hired workers and instructed them to start early and to finish late, in a place where it is customary not to start early and not to finish late, he is not permitted to compel them. In a place where it is customary to provide food, he shall provide food; to provide sweet drink, he shall provide sweet drink. Everything follows the custom of the land.

hebrew_text: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן מַתְיָא שֶׁאָמַר לִבְנוֹ: צֵא שְׂכוֹר לָנוּ פּוֹעֲלִין. הָלַךְ וּפָסַק לָהֶם מְזוֹנוֹת.
human_translation: an incident involving Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Matya, who said to his son: Go out hire laborers for us. went, and pledged sustenance for them
llm_translation: The story of Rabbi Yochanan ben Matya who said to his son: "Go out and hire workers for us." He went and provided them with sustenance.

hebrew_text: וּכְשֶׁבָּא אֵצֶל אָבִיו, אָמַר לוֹ: בְּנִי, אֲפִילּוּ אִם אַתָּה עוֹשֶׂה לָהֶם כִּסְעוּדַת שְׁלֹמֹה בִּשְׁעָתוֹ – לֹא יָצָאתָ יְדֵי חוֹבָתְךָ עִמָּהֶן, שֶׁהֵן בְּנֵי אַבְרָהָם יִצְחָק וְיַעֲקֹב. אֶלָּא עַד שֶׁלֹּא יַתְחִילוּ בִּמְלָאכָה צֵא וֶאֱמוֹר לָהֶם: עַל מְנָת שֶׁאֵין לָכֶם עָלַי אֶלָּא פַּת וְקִטְנִית בִּלְבָד. רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: לֹא הָיָה צָרִיךְ לוֹמַר, הַכֹּל כְּמִנְהַג הַמְּדִינָה.
human_translation: And when he came to his father said to him: My son, even if you were to prepare a feast for them like that of Solomon in his time, you would not have fulfilled your obligation to them, as they are the descendants of Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob. Rather, before they begin in labor, go out and say to them: on the condition that you have from me only bread and legumes, Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: did not need to state everything is in accordance with the regional custom.
llm_translation: When he came to his father, he said to him: "My son, even if you were to provide for them the feast of Solomon in his time - you would not have fulfilled your obligation with them, for they are the descendants of Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob. Rather, until they begin work, go out and say to them: 'You are entitled to nothing from me except a loaf of bread and a small fish only.' Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: He did not need to say, 'Everything according to the custom of the land.'

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ פְּשִׁיטָא! לָא צְרִיכָא דִּטְפָא לְהוּ אַאַגְרַיְיהוּ. מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא, אֲמַר לְהוּ: הָא דִּטְפַאי לְכוּ אַאַגְרַיְיכוּ אַדַּעְתָּא דְּמַקְדְּמִיתוּ וּמְחַשְּׁכִיתוּ בַּהֲדַאי, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן דַּאֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: הַאי דִּטְפֵת לַן – אַדַּעְתָּא דְּעָבְדִינַן לָךְ עֲבִידְתָּא שַׁפִּירְתָּא.
human_translation: obvious? No, necessary where increased their wages Lest you say say to that I increased your wages with the understanding that you would rise early and continue late for me, teaches us that say to that you increased our with the understanding that we perform quality work for you,
llm_translation: Gemara: It is obvious! There is no need to add to them. What is the reason? He said to them: This that I added to you is knowledge that you have forgotten and obscured in this matter, and you are now hearing that they said to him: This that we added to you - knowledge that we are doing for you a good service.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ:
human_translation: Reish Lakish says:
llm_translation: Said Reish Lakish:

hebrew_text: פּוֹעֵל בִּכְנִיסָתוֹ מִשֶּׁלּוֹ, בִּיצִיאָתוֹ מִשֶּׁל בַּעַל הַבַּיִת, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״תִּזְרַח הַשֶּׁמֶשׁ יֵאָסֵפוּן וְאֶל מְעוֹנֹתָם יִרְבָּצוּן. יֵצֵא אָדָם לְפׇעֳלוֹ וְלַעֲבֹדָתוֹ עֲדֵי עָרֶב״.
human_translation: A laborer’s entrance at his own his departure at employer’s as it is stated: “The sun rises; they slink away and couch in their dens; man goes forth to his work and to his labor until the evening”
llm_translation: He who works upon entering, his is from his, upon exiting, his is from the master of the house, as it is stated: "The sun rises, they gather themselves, and in their dens they lie down. Man goes out to his work and to his labor until evening."

hebrew_text: וְלִיחְזֵי הֵיכִי נְהִיגִי – בְּעִיר חֲדָשָׁה. וְנִיחְזֵי מֵהֵיכָא קָא אָתוּ – בְּנָקוֹטָאֵי. אִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: דְּאָמַר לְהוּ – דְּאָגְרִיתוּ לִי כְּפוֹעֵל דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא.
human_translation: But Let us see how are accustomed with regard to a new city, let us see from which city came, of an eclectic If you wish, say that said to I am hiring you as a laborer by Torah law.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And to Yeḥezki, how do they conduct themselves? - In a new city. And from where do they come? - From the villages. If you will say: for he said to them, 'You have worked for me like the laborer of the Torah.'" English translation:

hebrew_text: דָּרֵשׁ רַבִּי זֵירָא וְאָמְרִי לַהּ, תָּנֵי רַב יוֹסֵף: מַאי דִּכְתִיב ״תָּשֶׁת חֹשֶׁךְ וִיהִי לָיְלָה בּוֹ תִרְמֹשׂ כׇּל חַיְתוֹ יָעַר״. ״תָּשֶׁת חֹשֶׁךְ וִיהִי לָיְלָה״ – זֶה הָעוֹלָם הַזֶּה שֶׁדּוֹמֶה לְלַיְלָה. ״בּוֹ תִרְמֹשׂ כׇּל חַיְתוֹ יָעַר״ – אֵלּוּ רְשָׁעִים שֶׁבּוֹ, שֶׁדּוֹמִין לְחַיָּה שֶׁבַּיַּעַר.
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira interpreted homiletically, and some say Rav Yosef taught What which is written: “You make darkness and it is night, in which all the beasts of the forest creep forth” “You make darkness and it is night”; this this world, which resembles nighttime. “In which all the beasts of the forest creep forth”; these are the wicked in who resemble a beast of the forest,
llm_translation: Rabbi Zeira expounded and said to them, Rav Yosef taught: What is the meaning of the verse, "You make darkness, and it is night, in which all the beasts of the forest creep about"? "You make darkness, and it is night" – this refers to this world that is similar to night. "In it all the beasts of the forest creep about" – these are the wicked in it, who are likened to a beast in the forest.

hebrew_text: ״תִּזְרַח הַשֶּׁמֶשׁ יֵאָסֵפוּן וְאֶל מְעוֹנֹתָם יִרְבָּצוּן״. ״תִּזְרַח הַשֶּׁמֶשׁ״ – לַצַּדִּיקִים, ״יֵאָסֵפוּן״ – רְשָׁעִים לְגֵיהִנָּם, ״וְאֶל מְעוֹנֹתָם יִרְבָּצוּן״ – אֵין לָךְ כׇּל צַדִּיק וְצַדִּיק שֶׁאֵין לוֹ מָדוֹר לְפִי כְבוֹדוֹ. ״יֵצֵא אָדָם לְפׇעֳלוֹ״ – יֵצְאוּ צַדִּיקִים לְקַבֵּל שְׂכָרָן, ״וְלַעֲבֹדָתוֹ עֲדֵי עָרֶב״ – בְּמִי שֶׁהִשְׁלִים עֲבוֹדָתוֹ עֲדֵי עָרֶב.
human_translation: “The sun rises; they slink away and couch in their dens” “The sun rises” for the righteous, “they slink away,” the wicked to Gehenna. “And couch in their dens,” You will not have a single righteous person who will not have his residence befitting his dignity. “Man goes forth to his work,” the righteous go forth to receive their reward. “And to his labor until the evening” to one who has completed his labor by the evening,
llm_translation: "Tizrah hashemesh ye'asefun ve'al me'onotam yirbatzun." "Tizrah hashemesh" - for the righteous, "ye'asefun" - the wicked to their Gehinnom, "ve'al me'onotam yirbatzun" - there is no righteous person without a dwelling according to his honor. "Yetze adam le'po'alo" - the righteous go out to receive their reward, "ve'la'avodato adei erev" - those who completed their work until evening.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אַשְׁכַּח לְהָהוּא פַּרְהַגְוָנָא דְּקָא תָפֵיס גַּנָּבֵי, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הֵיכִי יָכְלַתְּ לְהוּ, לָאו כְּחֵיוָתָא מְתִילִי, דִּכְתִיב: ״בּוֹ תִרְמֹשׂ כׇּל חַיְתוֹ יָעַר״? אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי מֵהַאי קְרָא קָאָמַר לֵיהּ: ״יֶאֱרֹב בַּמִּסְתָּר כְּאַרְיֵה בְסֻכֹּה״. דִּלְמָא שָׁקְלַתְּ צַדִּיקֵי וְשָׁבְקַתְּ רַשִּׁיעֵי?
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, found a certain officer [ parhagavna ] whose arrest thieves. He said to How are you able them? Aren’t they likened to beasts, as it is written: in which all the beasts of the forest creep forth” There are who say that he said to him from this verse: “He lies in wait in a secret place as a lion in his lair, perhaps you apprehend the righteous and leave the wicked
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, found that certain highwaymen were capturing thieves. He said to them: How were you able to do this? Is it not because you are as strong as it is written: "With it he will crush all the beasts of the forest"? Some say that he said to them based on this verse: "He lurks in a hiding place like a lion in his lair." Perhaps you have taken the righteous and left the wicked?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: וּמַאי אֶעֱבֵיד? הַרְמָנָא דְמַלְכָּא הוּא. אֲמַר: תָּא אַגְמְרָךְ הֵיכִי תַּעֲבֵיד. עוּל בְּאַרְבַּע שָׁעֵי לְחָנוּתָא, כִּי חָזֵית אִינִישׁ דְּקָא שָׁתֵי חַמְרָא וְקָא נָקֵיט כָּסָא בִּידֵיהּ וְקָא מְנַמְנֵם, שְׁאוֹל עִילָּוֵיהּ.
human_translation: said to him: But what should I do? It is the king’s edict [ harmana ] said Come I will instruct you how you should do At the fourth hour enter the tavern. When you see someone drinking wine, holding cup in his hand, and dozing, inquire about his
llm_translation: He said to him: And what should I do? It is the decree of the king. He said: Come, I will teach you what to do. Go to the inn at the fourth hour, for you will see a person who is drinking wine and taking a cup in his hand and nodding off, his table before him.

hebrew_text: אִי צוּרְבָּא מֵרַבָּנַן הוּא וְנָיֵים – אקַדּוֹמֵי קַדֵּים לְגִרְסֵיהּ. אִי פּוֹעֵל הוּא – קָדֵים קָא עָבֵיד עֲבִידְתֵּיהּ, וְאִי עֲבִידְתֵּיהּ בְּלֵילְיָא – רַדּוֹדֵי רַדֵּיד. וְאִי לָא – גַּנָּבָא הוּא וְתִפְסֵיהּ.
human_translation: If he is a Torah scholar and is dozing, early for his studies. If he is laborer, early performed his work. And if his work is at night he draws And if none he is a thief, and arrest him,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: If he is a scholar, he is like a plastered cistern, which does not lose a drop. If he is a worker, he is like a cistern that loses its water. If he does his work at night, he is like a leaking cistern. If not, he is a thief and his theft will be discovered.

hebrew_text: אִישְׁתְּמַע מִילְּתָא בֵּי מַלְכָּא, אֲמַרוּ: קַרְיָינָא דְאִיגַּרְתָּא אִיהוּ לֶיהֱוֵי פַּרְוַנְקָא. אַתְיוּהּ לְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, וְקָא תָפֵיס גַּנָּבֵי וְאָזֵיל. שְׁלַח לֵיהּ רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן קׇרְחָה חוֹמֶץ בֶּן יַיִן! עַד מָתַי אַתָּה מוֹסֵר עַמּוֹ שֶׁל אֱלֹהֵינוּ לַהֲרִיגָה?
human_translation: matter was heard the king’s palace. said: Let the reader of the letter be its messenger [ parvanka ], They brought Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, and he proceeded to arrest thieves. Rabbi Yehoshua ben Korḥa sent vinegar, son of wine, Until when will you inform on the nation of our God to execution
llm_translation: The text: A man concealed a matter in the king's palace, they said: The scroll of the Torah should be his advocate. He came to Rabbi Elazar son of Rabbi Shimon, and he was catching thieves and going. Rabbi Yehoshua ben Korcha sent him vinegar son of wine! Until when will you deliver the people of our God to death?

hebrew_text: שְׁלַח לֵיהּ: קוֹצִים אֲנִי מְכַלֶּה מִן הַכֶּרֶם. שְׁלַח לֵיהּ: יָבֹא בַּעַל הַכֶּרֶם וִיכַלֶּה אֶת קוֹצָיו. יוֹמָא חַד פְּגַע בֵּיהּ הָהוּא כּוֹבֵס, קַרְיֵיהּ ״חוֹמֶץ בֶּן יַיִן״. אָמַר: מִדַּחֲצִיף כּוּלֵּי הַאי – שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ רַשִּׁיעָא הוּא. אֲמַר לְהוּ: תִּפְסוּהּ. תַּפְסוּהּ.
human_translation: sent him: I am eradicating thorns from the vineyard, sent to him: Let the Owner of the vineyard, come and eradicate His thorns. One day, a certain laundryman met and called him vinegar, son of wine. said: From that acted so insolently conclude he is a wicked person. He told Arrest They arrested him
llm_translation: Send to him: "I am removing thorns from the vineyard." Send to him: "Let the owner of the vineyard come and remove his thorns." One day, that launderer encountered him, calling him "sour wine." He said: "From the sharp-tongued, all this – hear from it that he is a wicked person." He said to them: "Seize him." They seized him.

hebrew_text: לְבָתַר דְּנָח דַּעְתֵּיהּ, אֲזַל בָּתְרֵיהּ לְפָרוֹקֵיהּ וְלָא מָצֵי. קָרֵי עֲלֵיהּ: ״שֹׁמֵר פִּיו וּלְשׁוֹנוֹ שֹׁמֵר מִצָּרוֹת נַפְשׁוֹ״. זַקְפוּהּ. קָם תּוּתֵי זְקִיפָא וְקָא בָכֵי. אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: רַבִּי, אַל יֵרַע בְּעֵינֶיךָ שֶׁהוּא וּבְנוֹ בָּעֲלוּ נַעֲרָה מְאוֹרָסָה בְּיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים.
human_translation: After his mind settled, He went after to ransom him but he was unable He read about him: “Whoever keeps his mouth and his tongue, keeps his soul from troubles” they hanged stood beneath the gallows and wept. said to him: Our teacher, let it not be bad in your eyes that he and his son engaged in intercourse with a betrothed young woman on Yom Kippur.
llm_translation: After the mind of Nah, his daughter went after him to his orchard and did not find him. It is called upon him: "He who guards his mouth and his tongue guards his soul from troubles." They lifted him. The elders of the city stood up and wept. They said to him: Rabbi, do not let it be evil in your eyes that he and his son married a betrothed maiden on Yom Kippur.

hebrew_text: הִנִּיחַ יָדוֹ עַל בְּנֵי מֵעָיו אָמַר: שִׂישׂוּ בְּנֵי מֵעַי, שִׂישׂוּ! וּמָה סְפֵיקוֹת שֶׁלָּכֶם כָּךְ, וַדָּאוֹת שֶׁלָּכֶם – עַל אַחַת כַּמָּה וְכַמָּה. מוּבְטָח אֲנִי בָּכֶם, שֶׁאֵין רִמָּה וְתוֹלֵעָה שׁוֹלֶטֶת בָּכֶם.
human_translation: placed his hand upon his innards, said: Rejoice, my innards, rejoice! If your suspicions are so all the more so your certainties I am assured about you, that worm and maggot will not affect you,
llm_translation: He placed his hand on his stomach and said: "Rejoice, my intestines, rejoice! And if your doubts are so, and your certainties are so - how much more so. I am confident in you, that no maggot or worm has dominion over you."

hebrew_text: וַאֲפִילּוּ הָכִי לָא מְיַיתְּבָא דַּעְתֵּיהּ. אַשְׁקְיוּהּ סַמָּא דְשִׁינְתָּא וְעַיְּילוּהּ לְבֵיתָא דְשֵׁישָׁא וּקְרַעוּ לִכְרֵיסֵיהּ. הֲווֹ מַפְּקִי מִינֵּיהּ דִּיקּוּלֵי דִּיקּוּלֵי דְּתַרְבָּא וּמוֹתְבִי בְּשִׁמְשָׁא בְּתַמּוּז וְאָב וְלָא מַסְרְחִי.
human_translation: Nevertheless, his mind was not calmed. to give him a sedative to drink, and they brought him into a house of marble, and cut his belly. They removed baskets baskets of fat from it, placed them in the sun in of Tammuz and Av, and did not putrefy.
llm_translation: And even so, his mind was not settled. They gave him a drink of hot wine, brought him to the house of marble, and tore his garments. They removed from him the bandages of bandages of Tarba and he died in the heat of Tamuz, Av, and did not decompose.

hebrew_text: כֹּל תַּרְבָּא נָמֵי לָא (סריח) [מַסְרַח]! כֹּל תַּרְבָּא (לָא סְרִיחַ), [כִּי אִית בֵּהּ] שֻׁרְיָקֵי סֻמָּקֵי מַסְרַח. הָכָא, אַף עַל גַּב דְּאִכָּא שֻׁרְיָקֵי סֻמָּקֵי – לָא מַסְרַח. קָרֵי אַנַּפְשֵׁהּ: ״אַף בְּשָׂרִי יִשְׁכֹּן לָבֶטַח״.
human_translation: all fat does not putrefy. all fat does not putrefy, red veins do putrefy. Here, although there were red veins they did not putrefy, read about himself: my flesh also dwells in safety”
llm_translation: All increase not putrefied! All increase not putrefied, for it contains ox bile and gall bladder. Here, even though it contains ox bile and gall bladder – it is not putrefied. It calls out for itself: "Even my flesh shall dwell securely."

hebrew_text: וְאַף רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל בְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי מְטָא
human_translation: And a similar incident also occurred to Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yosei,
llm_translation: And even Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yosei, came.

hebrew_text: כִּי הַאי מַעֲשֶׂה לִידֵיהּ. פְּגַע בֵּיהּ אֵלִיָּהוּ,
human_translation: Elijah encountered him
llm_translation: For this deed to her hands. Eliyahu encountered her,

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: עַד מָתַי אַתָּה מוֹסֵר עַמּוֹ שֶׁל אֱלֹהֵינוּ לַהֲרִיגָה? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מַאי אֶעֱבֵיד? הַרְמָנָא דְמַלְכָּא הוּא! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֲבוּךְ עֲרַק לְאַסְיָא, אַתְּ עֲרוֹק לְלוּדְקִיָּא.
human_translation: said to him: Until when you inform on the nation of our God to execution? said to What should I do? It is the king’s edict said to him: your father fled to Asia. You flee to Laodicea
llm_translation: He said to him: Until when are you delivering the people of our God to be killed? He said to him: What can I do? He is the king's decree! He said to him: Your father fled to Asya, you flee to Ludkiya.

hebrew_text: כִּי הֲווֹ מִקַּלְעִי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל בְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי וְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בַּהֲדֵי הֲדָדֵי, הֲוָה עָיֵיל בַּקְרָא דְתוֹרֵי בֵּינַיְיהוּ וְלָא הֲוָה נָגְעָה בְּהוּ.
human_translation: When Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yosei, and Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, would meet each other, a pair of oxen to enter between them, without touching them,
llm_translation: When Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yosei, and Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, were sitting together, they were engaging in the study of Torah, and they did not touch upon it.

hebrew_text: אֲמַרָה לְהוּ הָהִיא מַטְרוֹנִיתָא: בְּנֵיכֶם אֵינָם שֶׁלָּכֶם. אֲמַרוּ לַהּ: שֶׁלָּהֶן גָּדוֹל מִשֶּׁלָּנוּ. כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן. אִיכָּא דְאָמְרִי, הָכִי אֲמַרוּ לַהּ: ״כִּי כָאִישׁ גְּבוּרָתוֹ״. אִיכָּא דְאָמְרִי הָכִי, אֲמַרוּ לַהּ: ״אַהֲבָה דּוֹחֶקֶת אֶת הַבָּשָׂר״.
human_translation: A certain noblewoman [ matronita ] said to them: Your children are not your own, They said to her: Theirs, are larger than ours. All the more so There are who say this is what they said to her: “For as the man is, so is his strength” There are who say this is what they said to her: Love compresses the flesh.
llm_translation: She said to them, that matron: "Your children are not yours." They said to her: "Theirs is greater than ours." All the more so. There are those who say, thus they said to her: "For like a man's strength." There are those who say thus, they said to her: "Love crushes the flesh."

hebrew_text: וּלְמָה לְהוּ לְאַהְדּוֹרֵי לַהּ? וְהָא כְּתִיב: ״אַל תַּעַן כְּסִיל כְּאִוַּלְתּוֹ״! שֶׁלֹּא לְהוֹצִיא לַעַז עַל בְּנֵיהֶם.
human_translation: And why did they respond to her it is written: “Answer not a fool according to his folly, in order not to cast aspersions on their children.
llm_translation: And why should they be punished for this? But isn't it written: "Do not answer a fool according to his folly"! This is so as not to provoke the wicked against their children.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אֵיבְרֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל [בְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי] כְּחֵמֶת בַּת תֵּשַׁע קַבִּין. אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: אֵיבְרֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן כְּחֵמֶת בַּת חֲמֵשֶׁת קַבִּין, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ בַּת שְׁלֹשֶׁת קַבִּין. דְּרַב פָּפָּא גּוּפֵיהּ כִּי דְקוּרֵי דְּהַרְפְּנָאֵי.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said: organ of Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yosei, of a jug of nine kav . Rav Pappa said: organ of Rabbi Yoḥanan of a jug of five kav , and some say of three kav . Rav Pappa himself like the baskets [ dikurei ] in Harpanya.
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yochanan: The limbs of Rabbi Yishmael son of Rabbi Yosei are like the womb of a woman of nine kav. Rav Papa said: The limbs of Rabbi Yochanan are like the womb of a woman of five kav, and some say three kav. Rav Papa himself was as thin as a Harpanaean cucumber.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אֲנָא אִשְׁתַּיַּירִי מִשַּׁפִּירֵי יְרוּשָׁלַיִם הַאי מַאן דְּבָעֵי מִחְזֵי שׁוּפְרֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, נַיְיתֵי כָּסָא דְכַסְפָּא מִבֵּי סִלְקֵי, וּנְמַלְּיֵיהּ פַּרְצִידַיָּא דְּרוּמָּנָא סוּמָּקָא, וְנַהְדַּר לֵיהּ כְּלִילָא דְּוַורְדָּא סוּמָּקָא לְפוּמֵּיהּ, וְנוֹתְבֵיהּ בֵּין שִׁמְשָׁא לְטוּלָּא, (הָהוּא) [הָנְהוּ] זַהֲרוּרֵי מֵעֵין שׁוּפְרֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said: I remain of the beautiful of Jerusalem. One who wishes to see the beauty of Rabbi Yoḥanan should bring silver goblet from the smithy and fill it red pomegranate seeds [ partzidaya ] and place a diadem of red roses upon lip and position it between the sunlight and shade. That luster a semblance of Rabbi Yoḥanan’s beauty.
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yohanan: I, my wife, from the beauties of Jerusalem, this one, whoever wants to see the beauty of Rabbi Yohanan, should take a silver chair from the house of Silkei, and fill it with the purple wool of a worm, and place upon it a golden crown, and place it between the sun and the shade, those shining like the beauty of Rabbi Yohanan.

hebrew_text: אִינִי? וְהָאָמַר מָר: שׁוּפְרֵיהּ דְּרַב כָּהֲנָא מֵעֵין שׁוּפְרֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי אֲבָהוּ, שׁוּפְרֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי אֲבָהוּ מֵעֵין שׁוּפְרֵיהּ דְּיַעֲקֹב אָבִינוּ, שׁוּפְרֵיהּ דְּיַעֲקֹב אָבִינוּ מֵעֵין שׁוּפְרֵיהּ דְּאָדָם הָרִאשׁוֹן! וְאִילּוּ רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן לָא קָא חָשֵׁיב לֵיהּ! שָׁאנֵי רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, דְּהַדְרַת פָּנִים לָא הַוְיָא לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Is that so? But doesn’t the Master say: The beauty of Rav Kahana a semblance of the beauty of Rabbi Abbahu; the beauty of Rabbi Abbahu a semblance of the beauty of Jacob, our forefather; the beauty of Jacob, our forefather, a semblance of the beauty of Adam the first And yet Rabbi Yoḥanan is not included Rabbi Yoḥanan different as he did not have a beauty of countenance,
llm_translation: I? But didn't Mar say: The beauty of Rav Kahana is like the beauty of Rabbi Avahu, the beauty of Rabbi Avahu is like the beauty of our forefather Jacob, and the beauty of our forefather Jacob is like the beauty of Adam the first man! And if not for Rabbi Yochanan, he would not be considered! Rabbi Yochanan is different, for he does not have a pleasant countenance.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן הֲוָה אָזֵיל וְיָתֵיב אַשַּׁעֲרֵי טְבִילָה, אֲמַר: כִּי סָלְקָן בְּנוֹת יִשְׂרָאֵל מִטְּבִילַת מִצְוָה לִפְגְּעוּ בִּי, כִּי הֵיכִי דְּלֶהֱווֹ לְהוּ בְּנֵי שַׁפִּירֵי כְּווֹתִי, גְּמִירִי אוֹרָיְיתָא כְּווֹתִי.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan would go and sit by the entrance to the ritual bath. He said When Jewish women come up from immersion of a mitzva, they should encounter me so that they have beautiful children like me, learned in Torah like me.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan used to go and sit at the gates of the ritual bath. He said: "When the daughters of Israel come up from the immersion of a mitzvah to meet me, so that they may beget sons as beautiful as I am, they learn Torah as beautiful as I am."

hebrew_text: אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ רַבָּנַן: לָא מִסְתְּפֵי מָר מֵעֵינָא בִּישָׁא? אֲמַר לְהוּ: אֲנָא מִזַּרְעָא דְּיוֹסֵף קָאָתֵינָא, דְּלָא שָׁלְטָא בֵּיהּ עֵינָא בִּישָׁא. דִּכְתִיב: ״בֵּן פֹּרָת יוֹסֵף בֵּן פֹּרָת עֲלֵי עָיִן״, וְאָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: אַל תִּקְרֵי ״עֲלֵי עָיִן״ אֶלָּא ״עוֹלֵי עָיִן״.
human_translation: The Rabbis said to Isn’t the Master worried about the evil eye said to them: I come from the offspring of Joseph, over whom the evil eye does not have dominion, as it is written: “Joseph is a fruitful vine, a fruitful vine by a fountain [ alei ayin ]” and Rabbi Abbahu says: Do not read “By a fountain [ alei ayin ]”; rather, Those who rise above eye [ olei ayin ].
llm_translation: The sages said to him: Is the master not afraid of the evil eye? He said to them: I am from the seed of Joseph, and the evil eye has no power over the seed of Joseph. As it is written: "Joseph is a fruitful bough, a fruitful bough by a well." And Rabbi Abbahu said: Do not read it as "by a well" (עֲלֵי עָיִן) but rather as "ascendants of the eye" (עוֹלֵי עָיִן).

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר חֲנִינָא אֲמַר מֵהָכָא: ״וְיִדְגּוּ לָרֹב בְּקֶרֶב הָאָרֶץ״, מָה דָּגִים שֶׁבַּיָּם מַיִם מְכַסִּים אוֹתָם וְאֵין הָעַיִן שׁוֹלֶטֶת בָּהֶן – אַף זַרְעוֹ שֶׁל יוֹסֵף אֵין הָעַיִן שׁוֹלֶטֶת בָּהֶן.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei bar Ḥanina said from here: “And let them grow [ veyidgu ] into a multitude in the midst of the earth” Just as fish [ dagim ] in the sea, the water covers them and the eye has no dominion over them, so too, the offspring of Joseph, the eye has no dominion over them.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei bar Chanina said from here: "And let them multiply abundantly in the midst of the earth." Just as fish in the sea, the water covers them and the eye does not have dominion over them - so too, the seed of Joseph, the eye does not have dominion over them.

hebrew_text: יוֹמָא חַד הֲוָה קָא סָחֵי רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בְּיַרְדְּנָא. חַזְיֵיהּ רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ וּשְׁוַור לְיַרְדְּנָא אַבָּתְרֵיהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ חֵילָךְ לְאוֹרָיְיתָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ שׁוּפְרָךְ לְנָשֵׁי. אֲמַר לֵיהּ אִי הָדְרַתְּ בָּךְ יָהֵיבְנָא לָךְ אֲחוֹתִי, דְּשַׁפִּירָא מִינַּאי. קַבֵּיל עֲלֵיהּ. בָּעֵי לְמִיהְדַּר לְאֵתוֹיֵי מָאנֵיהּ וְלָא מָצֵי הָדַר.
human_translation: One day, Rabbi Yoḥanan was bathing in the Jordan Reish Lakish saw him and jumped into the Jordan, pursuing him. said to Your strength for Torah said to him: Your beauty for women. said to him: If you return I will give you my sister who is more beautiful than I am. accepted upon himself wanted to jump back to bring his clothes, but he was unable to return,
llm_translation: One day, Rabbi Yochanan was conversing in Yardenah. Reish Lakish saw him and turned away to Yardenah after him. He said to him, "Your strength is for Torah." He said to him, "Your beauty is for women." He said to him, "If you would return to your former ways, I will give you my sister, who is more beautiful than I." He accepted her. He wanted to return to his former occupation, but he did not find a way to return.

hebrew_text: אַקְרְיֵיהּ וְאַתְנְיֵיהּ וְשַׁוְּיֵיהּ גַּבְרָא רַבָּא. יוֹמָא חַד הֲווֹ מִפַּלְגִי בֵּי מִדְרְשָׁא: הַסַּיִיף וְהַסַּכִּין וְהַפִּגְיוֹן וְהָרוֹמַח וּמַגַּל יָד וּמַגַּל קָצִיר מֵאֵימָתַי מְקַבְּלִין טוּמְאָה – מִשְּׁעַת גְּמַר מְלַאכְתָּן.
human_translation: taught Bible, and taught him Mishna, and turned him into a great man. One day of the study hall were engaging in a dispute the sword, the knife, the dagger [ vehapigyon ], the spear, a hand sickle, and a harvest sickle, from when are they susceptible to ritual impurity? from the time of the completion of their manufacture,
llm_translation: He would read it, teach it, and repeat it, the great man. One day they were debating in the study hall: The sword, the knife, the dagger, the spear, the hand sickle, and the sickle for harvesting - from when do they become susceptible to impurity? - From the time they finish their work.

hebrew_text: וּמֵאֵימָתַי גְּמַר מְלַאכְתָּן? רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אוֹמֵר: מִשֶּׁיְּצָרְפֵם בַּכִּבְשָׁן. רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אָמַר: מִשֶּׁיְּצַחְצְחֵן בְּמַיִם. אֲמַר לֵיהּ לִסְטָאָה בְּלִסְטְיוּתֵיהּ יָדַע. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: וּמַאי אַהֲנֵית לִי? הָתָם ״רַבִּי״ קָרוּ לִי, הָכָא ״רַבִּי״ קָרוּ לִי! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אַהֲנַאי לָךְ דַּאֲקָרְבִינָּךְ תַּחַת כַּנְפֵי הַשְּׁכִינָה.
human_translation: And when is the completion of their manufacture? Rabbi Yoḥanan says: from when one fires in the furnace. Reish Lakish said: from when one scours them in water, said to A bandit knows about his banditry, said to What benefit did you provide me There, they called me: Leader here, they call me: Leader said to him: I provided benefit to you, as I brought you close under the wings of the Divine Presence.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: From when do they complete their work? Rabbi Yochanan says: When they are scorched in the furnace. Reish Lakish says: When they are rinsed in water. He said to him: To a thorn in its thorniness you are likened. He said to him: What benefit is it to me? There, they called me "Rabbi," here they call me "Rabbi"! He said to him: I am pleased with you, for you are drawing near under the wings of the Divine Presence.

hebrew_text: חֲלַשׁ דַּעְתֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, חֲלַשׁ רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ. אֲתַאי אֲחָתֵיהּ קָא בָכְיָא. אֲמַרָה לֵיהּ: עֲשֵׂה בִּשְׁבִיל בָּנַי! אֲמַר לַהּ: ״עׇזְבָה יְתֹמֶיךָ אֲנִי אֲחַיֶּה״. עֲשֵׂה בִּשְׁבִיל אַלְמְנוּתִי! אֲמַר לַהּ: ״וְאַלְמְנוֹתֶיךָ עָלַי תִּבְטָחוּ״.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan was offended, Reish Lakish, fell ill. sister, came crying She said to him: Do for the sake of my children, said to her “Leave your fatherless children, I will rear them” Do for the sake of my widowhood. He said to her “And let your widows trust in Me.”
llm_translation: Weak was the mind of Rabbi Yochanan, weak was the head of Reish Lakish. One of his sisters came and cried. She said to him: "Do it for the sake of my sons!" He said to her: "Leave your orphans, I will live." Do it for the sake of my widowhood! He said to her: "And your widows shall trust in me."

hebrew_text: נָח נַפְשֵׁיהּ דְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן לָקִישׁ, וַהֲוָה קָא מִצְטַעַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בָּתְרֵיהּ טוּבָא. אֲמַרוּ רַבָּנַן: מַאן לֵיזִיל לְיַתֹּבֵיהּ לְדַעְתֵּיהּ? נֵיזִיל רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן פְּדָת, דִּמְחַדְּדָין שְׁמַעְתָּתֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish, died. Rabbi Yoḥanan was sorely pained over him. The Rabbis said: Who will go to calm mind Let Rabbi Elazar ben Pedat go, as his statements are sharp,
llm_translation: The soul of Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish rested, and Rabbi Yochanan was greatly distressed. The sages said: Who will go to inform him of his death? Rabbi Elazar ben Pedat went, and they heard his wailing.

hebrew_text: אֲזַל יְתֵיב קַמֵּיהּ. כֹּל מִילְּתָא דַּהֲוָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אֲמַר לֵיהּ: תַּנְיָא דִּמְסַיְּיעָא לָךְ. אֲמַר: אַתְּ כְּבַר לְקִישָׁא?! בַּר לְקִישָׁא, כִּי הֲוָה אָמֵינָא מִילְּתָא, הֲוָה מַקְשֵׁי לִי עֶשְׂרִין וְאַרְבַּע קוּשְׁיָיתָא, וּמְפָרְקִינָא לֵיהּ עֶשְׂרִין וְאַרְבְּעָה פֵּרוּקֵי, וּמִמֵּילָא רָוְוחָא שְׁמַעְתָּא. וְאַתְּ אָמְרַתְּ: ״תַּנְיָא דִּמְסַיַּיע לָךְ״, אַטּוּ לָא יָדַעְנָא דְּשַׁפִּיר קָאָמֵינָא?
human_translation: went and sat before every matter that Rabbi Yoḥanan would say, say to him: is taught that supports your said Are you to the son of Lakish? the son of Lakish, when I would state a matter, he would raise twenty-four difficulties against me and I would answer him with twenty-four answers, and the halakha by itself would become broadened And you say is taught that supports your Do I not know that what I say is good?
llm_translation: He went and sat before him. Every matter that Rabbi Yochanan would say, he would say to him: "A teaching that supports you." He said: "Are you Bar Kappara?! Bar Kappara, when I would say a matter, he would present to me twenty-four difficulties, and I would resolve for him twenty-four solutions, and from the exchange, the matter would become clear. And you say: 'A teaching that supports you,' do I not know that I am speaking correctly?"

hebrew_text: הֲוָה קָא אָזֵיל וְקָרַע מָאנֵיהּ וְקָא בָכֵי וְאָמַר: ״הֵיכָא אַתְּ בַּר לָקִישָׁא, הֵיכָא אַתְּ בַּר לָקִישָׁא״! וַהֲוָה קָא צָוַח עַד דְּשָׁף דַּעְתֵּיהּ מִינֵּיהּ. בְּעוֹ רַבָּנַן רַחֲמֵי עֲלֵיהּ וְנָח נַפְשֵׁיהּ.
human_translation: went around, rending his clothing, weeping and saying: Where are you, son of Lakish? Where are you, son of Lakish? screamed until his mind was taken from him, The Rabbis requested mercy on him and died.
llm_translation: He was going and tearing his garments and crying, and he said: "Where are you, son of Lakish, where are you, son of Lakish!" And he was screaming until his mind departed from him. The sages prayed for mercy upon him, and his soul departed.

hebrew_text: וַאֲפִילּוּ הָכִי לָא סְמַךְ רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אַדַּעְתֵּיהּ, קַבֵּיל עֲלֵיהּ יִסּוּרֵי. בְּאוּרְתָּא הֲווֹ מָיְיכִי לֵיהּ שִׁיתִּין נַמְטֵי, לְצַפְרָא נָגְדִי מִתּוּתֵיהּ שִׁיתִּין מְשִׁיכְלֵי דְּמָא וְכִיבָא.
human_translation: And even so Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, did not rely on his opinion, He accepted afflictions upon himself At night would spread out sixty felt for him. In the morning, they would remove sixty basins of blood and pus from underneath him.
llm_translation: And even so, Rabbi Elazar son of Rabbi Shimon did not rely on her knowledge, he accepted upon himself afflictions. In the evening, they would bring him sixty trays of bloodletting leeches, opposite him sixty cups of fat and milk.

hebrew_text: לִמְחַר עֲבַדָה לֵיהּ דְּבֵיתְהוּ שִׁיתִּין מִינֵי לַפְדָּא וְאָכֵיל לְהוּ וּבָרֵי. וְלָא הֲוָת שָׁבְקָא לֵיהּ דְּבֵיתְהוּ לְמִיפַּק לְבֵי מִדְרְשָׁא כִּי הֵיכִי דְּלָא לִדְחֲקוּהוּ רַבָּנַן.
human_translation: The following day, his wife would prepare for him sixty types of relish [ lifda ] and he would eat them and become healthy. His wife, would not allow him to go to the study hall, so that the Rabbis would not push him
llm_translation: Tomorrow, he made for him of his household six types of bread and fed him and his sons. And he did not leave him of his household to go out to the study hall, so that the Rabbis would not pressure him.

hebrew_text: בְּאוּרְתָּא אֲמַר לְהוּ: אַחַיי וְרֵעַי, בּוֹאוּ! בְּצַפְרָא אֲמַר לְהוּ: זִילוּ מִפְּנֵי בִּיטּוּל תּוֹרָה. יוֹמָא חַד שְׁמַעָה דְּבֵיתְהוּ, אֲמַרָה לֵיהּ: אַתְּ קָא מַיְיתֵית לְהוּ עִילָּוָיךְ! כִּלִּיתָ מָמוֹן שֶׁל בֵּית אַבָּא. אִימְּרַדָה, אֲזַלָה לְבֵית נָשָׁא.
human_translation: In the evening, he say to My brothers and my friends, come! In the morning he say to them: Go due to dereliction Torah One day his wife heard him She said to him: You are bringing upon yourself. You have diminished the money of father’s home She rebelled went to her father’s home,
llm_translation: In the city of Ur, he said to them: "My brothers and friends, come!" In the town of Zafra, he said to them: "Go away because of neglect of Torah." One day, the wife of one of them heard, and said to him: "You are bringing your enemies upon us! You have exhausted the wealth of the house of Abba." She rebelled and went to her father's house.

hebrew_text: סְלִיקוּ וַאֲתוֹ הָנָךְ [שִׁיתִּין] סָפוֹנָאֵי, עֲיַילוּ לֵיהּ שִׁיתִּין עַבְדֵי כִּי נְקִיטִי שִׁיתִּין אַרְנָקֵי, וַעֲבַדוּ לֵיהּ שִׁיתִּין מִינֵי לַפְדָּא וְאָכֵיל לְהוּ.
human_translation: these sixty sailors came and entered They brought him sixty servants, bearing sixty purses, and prepared him sixty types of relish and he ate them.
llm_translation: Ascend and come here, I have placed the sponges, bring him six sponges when he takes six sponges of money, and they brought him six types of fine linen and he ate them.

hebrew_text: יוֹמָא חַד, אֲמַרָה לַהּ לְבַרְתַּהּ: זִילִי בְּקַי בַּאֲבוּךְ מַאי קָא עָבֵיד הָאִידָּנָא? אָתְיָא, אֲמַר לַהּ: זִילִי אֱמַרִי לְאִימִּיךְ: שֶׁלָּנוּ, גָּדוֹל מִשֶּׁלָּהֶם. קָרֵי אַנַּפְשֵׁיהּ: ״הָיְתָה כׇּאֳנִיּוֹת סוֹחֵר מִמֶּרְחָק תָּבִיא לַחְמָהּ״. אֲכַל וּשְׁתִי וּבְרִי נְפַק לְבֵי מִדְרְשָׁא.
human_translation: One day, said to her daughter: Go check on your father what he is doing now. came said to her: Go tell your mother ours is greater than theirs, He read about himself: “She is like the merchant-ships; she brings her food from afar” ate and drank and became healthy and went out to the study hall.
llm_translation: One day, she said to her daughter: "Go check on your father, what is he doing now?" She went and told him: "Tell your mother: 'Our portion is greater than theirs.'" He called out to himself: "She was like merchant ships; she brings her food from afar." He ate, drank, and went out to the study hall.

hebrew_text: אַיְיתוֹ לְקַמֵּיהּ שִׁיתִּין מִינֵי דְּמָא – טַהֲרִינְהוּ. הֲוָה קָא מְרַנְּנִי רַבָּנַן וְאָמְרִי: סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ לֵית בְּהוּ חַד סָפֵק?! אָמַר לְהוּ: אִם כְּמוֹתִי הוּא – יִהְיוּ כּוּלָּם זְכָרִים, וְאִם לָאו – תְּהֵא נְקֵבָה אַחַת בֵּינֵיהֶם. הָיוּ כּוּלָּם זְכָרִים. וְאַסִּיקוּ לְהוּ ״רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר״ עַל שְׁמֵיהּ.
human_translation: brought sixty samples of blood before him He deemed them ritually pure, The Rabbis were murmuring about and saying: enter your mind there is not one uncertain among them? said to them: If is my let all be males. And if not, let there be one female among them. all were males, and were called Elazar in his name.
llm_translation: They brought before him six types of blood - they declared them pure. The Rabbis were murmuring and saying: "Is it possible that you have no doubt?!" He said to them: "If it is like me - let them all be males, and if not - let there be one female among them." They were all males. And they appointed him as "Rabbi Elazar" in his name.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, אָמַר רַבִּי: כַּמָּה פְּרִיָּה וּרְבִיָּה בִּיטְּלָה רְשָׁעָה זוֹ מִיִּשְׂרָאֵל.
human_translation: It is taught Rabbi said How much procreation this evil woman prevented from the Jewish people.
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi said, "How much fruitfulness and multiplication has this wicked one annulled from Israel."

hebrew_text: כִּי הֲוָה קָא נָיְחָא נַפְשֵׁיהּ, אֲמַר לַהּ לִדְבֵיתְהוּ: יָדַעְנָא בִּדְרַבָּנַן דִּרְתִיחִי עֲלַי, וְלָא מִיעַסְקִי בִּי שַׁפִּיר. אַוגְנְיַן בְּעִילִּיתַאי וְלָא תִּדְחֲלִין מִינַּאי. אָמַר רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי: אִישְׁתַּעְיָא לִי אִימֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹנָתָן, דְּאִישְׁתַּעְיָא לַהּ דְּבֵיתְהוּ דְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן: לָא פָּחוֹת מִתַּמְנֵי סְרֵי, וְלָא טְפֵי מֵעֶשְׂרִין וּתְרֵין שְׁנִין אַוגְנֵיתֵיהּ בְּעִילִּיתָא.
human_translation: As was dying, he said to his wife: I know that the Rabbis are angry at me and they will not properly tend to my lay me in my attic and do not be afraid of me, Rabbi Shmuel bar Naḥmani said: Rabbi Yonatan’s mother told me that the wife of Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, told her: I laid him in the attic no less than eighteen and no more than twenty-two years.
llm_translation: When he was comforting himself, he said to his household: "I know from the Rabbis that they are talking about me, but they are not engaging with me properly. They are whispering in their chambers and not fearing me. Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachmani said: I am amazed at the mother of Rabbi Yonatan, who is amazed at the wife of Rabbi Elazar, the son of Rabbi Shimon. She did not grind less than eight measures, and not more than twenty-two, of wheat in her millstone."

hebrew_text: כִּי הֲוָה סָלְיקָנָא מְעַיְּנָנָא לֵיהּ בְּמַזְיֵיהּ, כִּי הֲוָה מִשְׁתַּמְטָא בִּינִיתָא מִינֵּיהּ הֲוָה אָתֵי דְּמָא. יוֹמָא חַד חֲזַאי רִיחְשָׁא דְּקָא נָפֵיק מֵאוּנֵּיהּ, חֲלַשׁ דַּעְתַּאי. אִיתְחֲזִי לִי בְּחֶלְמָא אֲמַר לִי: לָא מִידֵּי הוּא, יוֹמָא חַד שָׁמְעִי בְּזִלוּתָא דְּצוּרְבָּא מֵרַבָּנַן וְלָא מַחַאי כִּדְבָעֵי לִי.
human_translation: When I would go up I would check his hair, when a hair would fall out from blood would come One day I saw a worm emerging from his ear, I became distressed appeared to me in a dream said to me: It is no matter one day I heard a Torah scholar being insulted and I did not protest as I should have.
llm_translation: When I would ascend to visit him in his illness, when he would recover a little from his illness, blood would come. One day I saw the smell of his excrement coming out from him, my mind weakened. I dreamt a dream, he said to me: It is not from me. One day I heard the disrespect of the students towards their teacher, and it did not please me as the words of my father.

hebrew_text: כִּי הֲווֹ אָתוּ בֵּי תְרֵי לְדִינָא, הֲווֹ קָיְימִי אַבָּבָא, אָמַר מָר מִילְּתֵיהּ וּמַר מִילְּתֵיהּ נָפֵיק קָלָא מֵעִילִּיתֵיהּ, וְאָמַר: אִישׁ פְּלוֹנִי אַתָּה חַיָּיב, אִישׁ פְּלוֹנִי אַתָּה זַכַּאי. יוֹמָא חַד הֲוָה קָא מִינַּצְיָא דְּבֵיתְהוּ בַּהֲדֵי שִׁבָבְתָּא, אֲמַרָה לַהּ: תְּהֵא כְּבַעֲלַהּ שֶׁלֹּא נִיתַּן לִקְבוּרָה. אָמְרִי רַבָּנַן: כּוּלֵּי הַאי וַדַּאי לָאו אוֹרַח אַרְעָא.
human_translation: when two would come for adjudication of they would stand by the doorway One would state his matter, and the other his matter. A voice would issue forth from his attic, saying: So-and-so, you are guilty; so-and-so, you are innocent. One day, the wife of was quarreling with a neighbor. said to her should be like her husband, who was not buried. the Rabbis said: This much, certainly not proper conduct,
llm_translation: When they came to the court for judgment, they found the father of the court sitting. The Master stated his words, and the other Master responded with his words, a voice emerged from above. And he said: "You are liable, so-and-so, you are deserving, so-and-so." One day, the wife of one of them found a pearl in her basket of dates. She said to him: "May your master not be buried." The Sages said: "Certainly, this is not the way of the land."

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹחַאי אִיתְחֲזַאי לְהוּ בְּחֶלְמָא, אֲמַר לְהוּ: פְּרֵידָה אַחַת יֵשׁ לִי בֵּינֵיכֶם, וְאִי אַתֶּם רוֹצִים לַהֲבִיאָהּ אֶצְלִי? אֲזוּל רַבָּנַן לְאִעֲסוֹקֵי בֵּיהּ, לָא שְׁבַקוּ בְּנֵי עַכְבְּרַיָּא, דְּכֹל שְׁנֵי דַּהֲוָה נָיֵים רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בְּעִילִּיתֵיהּ לָא סְלִיק חַיָּה רָעָה לְמָתַיְיהוּ.
human_translation: There are who say Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai, appeared to them in a dream and said to them: I have a single fledgling among you, and you do not wish to bring it to me the Sages went to tend to The residents of Akhbaria, did not allow as all the years that Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, had been resting in his attic, no wild beast had entered their town.
llm_translation: There is one who said, Rabbi Shimon ben Yochai was seen in a dream, he said to them: "I have one grapevine between you, and if you do not want to bring it to me? The Rabbis went to deal with it, they did not leave the mice, for every two that were sleeping, Rabbi Elazar son of Rabbi Shimon in his chamber, a wild animal did not come up to harm them."

hebrew_text: יוֹמָא חַד מַעֲלֵי יוֹמָא דְכִיפּוּרֵי הֲוָה, הֲווֹ טְרִידִי. שַׁדַּרוּ רַבָּנַן לִבְנֵי בֵירֵי וְאַסְּקוּהוּ לְעַרְסֵיהּ וְאַמְטְיוּהּ לִמְעָרְתָּא דַאֲבוּהּ. אַשְׁכְּחוּהָ לְעַכְנָא דְּהָדְרָא לַהּ לִמְעָרְתָּא. אֲמַרוּ לַהּ: עַכְנָא עַכְנָא! פִּתְחִי פִּיךְ וְיִכָּנֵס בֵּן אֵצֶל אָבִיו. פְּתַחָ[ה] לְהוּ.
human_translation: One day, was Yom Kippur eve, was preoccupied The Rabbis sent to the residents of of Biri and they removed his bier and brought it to his father’s cave. They found a serpent [ le’akhna ] that encircled the cave, They said to it: Serpent, serpent! Open your mouth to allow a son to enter next to his father. It opened for them
llm_translation: One day before the Day of Atonement, they were troubled. The Rabbis sent to the sons of Beirei and they took him to his father's threshing floor and they placed him in a pit. They found a ladder leading to the pit. They said to him: "Ladder, ladder! Open your mouth and let the son enter beside his father." The ladder opened for them.

hebrew_text: שָׁלַח רַבִּי לְדַבֵּר בְּאִשְׁתּוֹ, שְׁלַחָה לֵיהּ: כְּלִי שֶׁנִּשְׁתַּמֵּשׁ בּוֹ קוֹדֶשׁ יִשְׁתַּמֵּשׁ בּוֹ חוֹל? תַּמָּן אָמְרִין: בַּאֲתַר דְּמָרֵי בֵיתָא תְּלָא זְיָינֵיהּ, כּוּלְבָּא רָעֲיָא קוּלְּתֵיהּ תְּלָא. שְׁלַח לַהּ: נְהִי דִּבְתוֹרָה גָּדוֹל מִמֶּנִּי, אֲבָל בְּמַעֲשִׂים טוֹבִים מִי גָּדוֹל מִמֶּנִּי? שְׁלַחָה לֵיהּ: בְּתוֹרָה מִיהָא גָּדוֹל מִמְּךָ לָא יָדְעָנָא, בְּמַעֲשִׂים יָדְעָנָא, דְּהָא קַבֵּיל עֲלֵיהּ יִסּוּרֵי.
human_translation: Rabbi sent to speak with the wife of She sent to him a vessel used by sacred, be used by profane? There, they say In the location the master of the house hangs his sword, the contemptible shepherd hang his basket [ kultei ]? sent to her: Granted that in Torah he was greater than I, but was greater than I in pious deeds? She sent to him: Whether greater than you in Torah I do not know; I do know in deeds, as he accepted afflictions upon himself.
llm_translation: Rabbi sent to speak with his wife, she sent to him: A vessel that was used for holy purposes, can it be used for mundane purposes? There they said: In the place of the masters of the house, they hang their keys, all the dogs in the city bark at them. He sent to her: Granted, in Torah knowledge you are greater than me, but in good deeds, who is greater than me? She sent to him: In Torah knowledge, I may be greater than you, but in good deeds, I know, for I have accepted upon myself afflictions.

hebrew_text: בְּתוֹרָה מַאי הִיא? דְּכִי הֲווֹ יָתְבִי רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן קׇרְחָה אַסַּפְסַלֵּי, יָתְבִי קַמַּיְיהוּ רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן וְרַבִּי אַאַרְעָא.
human_translation: With regard to Torah what is When Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel and Rabbi Yehoshua ben Korḥa, were sitting on benches [ asafselei ] Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, and Rabbi would sit before them on the ground
llm_translation: In the Torah, what is it? For it happened that Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel and Rabbi Yehoshua ben Korḥa were sitting, the sculptors. Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, was sitting before them, and Rabbi A'ar'a.

hebrew_text: מַקְשׁוּ וּמְפָרְקוּ. אָמְרִי: מִימֵיהֶן אָנוּ שׁוֹתִים וְהֵם יוֹשְׁבִים עַל גַּבֵּי קַרְקַע?! עֲבַדוּ לְהוּ סַפְסַלֵּי אַסְּקִינְהוּ.
human_translation: raise difficulties and answer said: From their waters we drink, and they are sitting on the ground? Benches were prepared for and they were promoted
llm_translation: They asked and they answered. They said: "We drink from our own days, and they sit on the ground?!" They made for them benches and they sat them on them.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָהֶן רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל: פְּרֵידָה אַחַת יֵשׁ לִי בֵּינֵיכֶם, וְאַתֶּם מְבַקְּשִׁים לְאַבְּדָהּ הֵימֶנִי? אֲחֲתוּהּ לְרַבִּי. אָמַר לָהֶן רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן קׇרְחָה: מִי שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ אָב יִחְיֶה, וּמִי שֶׁאֵין לוֹ אָב יָמוּת? אֲחֲתוּהּ נָמֵי לְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן. חֲלַשׁ דַּעְתֵּיהּ, אָמַר: קָא חָשְׁבִיתוּ לֵיהּ כְּווֹתִי?
human_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel said to I have a single fledgling among you, and you are seeking to take it from me? They demoted Rabbi Rabbi Yehoshua ben Korḥa said to one who has a father live, while one, who does not have a father die? also demoted Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, He became offended said You are equating to me,
llm_translation: He said to them, Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel: I have one question among you, and you seek to destroy it from me? It is a decree for Rabbi. Rabbi Yehoshua ben Korcha said to them: One who has a father will live, and one who does not have a father will die? It is also a decree for Rabbi Elazar ben Rabbi Shimon. Her mind weakened, she said: Did they think of him as my husband?

hebrew_text: עַד הָהוּא יוֹמָא כִּי הֲוָה אָמַר רַבִּי מִילְּתָא הֲוָה מְסַיַּיע לֵיהּ רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן: מִכָּאן וְאֵילָךְ כִּי הֲוָה אָמַר רַבִּי ״יֵשׁ לִי לְהָשִׁיב״, אָמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן: כָּךְ וְכָךְ יֵשׁ לְךָ לְהָשִׁיב, זוֹ הִיא תְּשׁוּבָתְךָ. הַשְׁתָּא הִיקַּפְתָּנוּ תְּשׁוּבוֹת חֲבִילוֹת שֶׁאֵין בָּהֶן מַמָּשׁ.
human_translation: until that day, when Rabbi would state a matter Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, would support him From this forward, when Rabbi would say: I have to respond, Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, would saying to him: Such and such is what you have to respond, this is the refutation of your Now you have surrounded us with bundles of refutations that have no substance,
llm_translation: Until that day when Rabbi Elazar son of Rabbi Shimon would say a certain matter, Rabbi Elazar would assist him. From here and onwards, when Rabbi would say, "I have a response," Rabbi Elazar son of Rabbi Shimon would say to him, "This and this you have to respond, this is your response." Now you have surrounded us with bundles of responses that have no substance.

hebrew_text: חֲלַשׁ דַּעְתֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי. אֲתָא אֲמַר לֵיהּ לַאֲבוּהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: בְּנֵי, אַל יֵרַע לָךְ, שֶׁהוּא אֲרִי בֶּן אֲרִי וְאַתָּה אֲרִי בֶּן שׁוּעָל.
human_translation: Rabbi became offended. He came told his father said My son, do not let offend as he is a lion, son of a lion, and you are a lion, son of a fox.
llm_translation: Feeble the mind of Rabbi. Came said to him to his father. Said to him: my son, do not be evil to you, for he is a lion, son of a lion, and you are a lion, son of a fox.

hebrew_text: הַיְינוּ דְּאָמַר רַבִּי: שְׁלֹשָׁה עִנְוְותָנִין הֵן, וְאֵלּוּ הֵן: אַבָּא,
human_translation: This is which Rabbi said: There are three modest and they are: Father,
llm_translation: That is what Rabbi said: There are three humble traits, and they are: Abba,

hebrew_text: וּבְנֵי בְתִירָה, וְיוֹנָתָן בֶּן שָׁאוּל. רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל – הָא דַּאֲמַרַן: בְּנֵי בְתִירָה, דְּאָמַר מָר הוֹשִׁיבוּהוּ בָּרֹאשׁ וּמִינּוּהוּ לְנָשִׂיא עֲלֵיהֶן. יוֹנָתָן בֶּן שָׁאוּל, דְּקָאָמַר לֵיהּ לְדָוִד: ״וְאַתָּה תִּמְלֹךְ עַל יִשְׂרָאֵל וַאֲנִי אֶהְיֶה לְּךָ לְמִשְׁנֶה״.
human_translation: the sons of Beteira; and Jonathan, son of Saul. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel is that we said, The sons of Beteira As the Master said: seated him at the head and appointed him Nasi over them Jonathan, son of Saul, as he said to David: “And you shall be king over Israel, and I shall be second to you”
llm_translation: Sons of Bitirah, and Jonathan son of Saul. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel - this that we said: Sons of Bitirah, as Mar said, they would appoint him at the head and remove him as a leader over them. Jonathan son of Saul, as he said to David: "And you shall reign over Israel, and I will be to you as second-in-command."

hebrew_text: מִמַּאי? דִּלְמָא יוֹנָתָן בֶּן שָׁאוּל דַּחֲזָא דִּגְרִיר עָלְמָא בָּתַר דָּוִד, בְּנֵי בְתִירָה נָמֵי דַּחֲזוֹ לְהִלֵּל דַּעֲדִיף מִינַּיְיהוּ, אֶלָּא רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל וַדַּאי עִנְוְותָן הֲוָה.
human_translation: From where Perhaps Jonathan, son of Saul, because he saw that the world, drawn after David, sons of Beteira also, saw that Hillel was greater than they, But Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel certainly was modest
llm_translation: From where? Perhaps Jonathan son of Saul, who saw that the world inclined after David, the sons of Betira also saw that Hillel was superior to both of them. Rather, Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel and certainly their humility was present.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי, חֲבִיבִין יִסּוּרִין. קַבֵּל עֲלֵיהּ תְּלֵיסַר שְׁנֵי: שֵׁית בִּצְמִירְתָּא, וּשְׁבַע (בְּצַפְרִנָא) [בְּצַפְדִּינָא], וְאָמְרִי לַהּ: שִׁבְעָה בִּצְמִירְתָּא, וְשֵׁית (בְּצַפְרִנָא).
human_translation: Rabbi said Afflictions are precious. He accepted thirteen years upon himself; six of stones in the kidneys and seven of scurvy [ bitzfarna ]. And some say seven of stones in the kidneys and six of scurvy.
llm_translation: Rabbi said, "Afflictions are beloved." Accept upon it thirteen years: six with wool, and seven (with linen), and some say: seven with wool, and six (with linen).

hebrew_text: אַהוּרְיָירֵיהּ דְּבֵי רַבִּי הֲוָה עַתִּיר מִשַּׁבּוּר מַלְכָּא. כַּד הֲוָה רָמֵי כִּיסְתָּא לְחֵיוָתָא הֲוָה אָזֵיל קָלָא בִּתְלָתָא מִילֵּי. הֲוָה מְכַוֵּין דְּרָמֵי בְּהַהִיא שַׁעְתָּא דְּעָיֵיל רַבִּי לְבֵית הַכִּסֵּא, וַאֲפִילּוּ הָכִי (מ)עָבַר לֵיהּ קָלֵיהּ לְקָלַיְיהוּ וְשָׁמְעוּ לֵיהּ נָחוֹתֵי יַמָּא.
human_translation: The stableman [ ahuriyareih ] of the house of Rabbi was wealthier than King Shapur When would place fodder before the livestock, the sound would travel of three mil . He would calculate that place at that time when Rabbi entered the latrine, But even so, voice overcame the sound of and sailors heard it
