llm_translation: The courtyard of the house of Rabbi was spacious. When he would throw a purse of coins to the animals, it would go a distance of three mil. He would aim to throw it at the moment when Rabbi would enter the bathroom, and even so, his aim was accurate, and the coins would reach him as he sat in the bathroom, and the waves of the sea would be heard.

hebrew_text: וַאֲפִילּוּ הָכִי, יִסּוּרֵי דְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן עֲדִיפִי מִדְּרַבִּי. דְּאִילּוּ רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן מֵאַהֲבָה בָּאוּ וּמֵאַהֲבָה הָלְכוּ. דְּרַבִּי, עַל יְדֵי מַעֲשֶׂה בָּאוּ וְעַל יְדֵי מַעֲשֶׂה הָלְכוּ.
human_translation: But even so, the afflictions of Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, greater than of Rabbi that whereas Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, came out of love, and left out of love, of Rabbi came due to an incident and left due to incident.
llm_translation: Even so, the afflictions of Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, are preferable to those of Rabbi. For if Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, came out of love, they came out of love, and they went out of love. But Rabbi, they came out through action, and through action they went out.

hebrew_text: עַל יְדֵי מַעֲשֶׂה בָּאוּ מַאי הִיא – דְּהָהוּא עִגְלָא דַּהֲווֹ קָא מַמְטוּ לֵיהּ לִשְׁחִיטָה. אֲזַל תַּלְיֵאּ לְרֵישֵׁיהּ בְּכַנְפֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי וְקָא בָכֵי. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: זִיל, לְכָךְ נוֹצַרְתָּ. אָמְרִי הוֹאִיל וְלָא קָא מְרַחֵם – לֵיתוֹ עֲלֵיהּ יִסּוּרִין.
human_translation: came due to an incident. What was that that a certain calf that was being led to slaughter. went and hung its head on the corner of Rabbi and was weeping. said to it: Go, you were created for this said Since he was not compassionate let afflictions come upon him.
llm_translation: Through the incident they came, what is it? - That calf that they were leading to slaughter. It went and hung onto the corners of Rabbi's garment and was crying. He said to it: "Go, for this purpose were you created." They said: Since it did not show mercy, suffering came upon it.

hebrew_text: וְעַל יְדֵי מַעֲשֶׂה הָלְכוּ, יוֹמָא חַד הֲוָה קָא כָנְשָׁא אַמְּתֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי בֵּיתָא, הֲוָה שָׁדְיָא בְּנֵי כַּרְכּוּשְׁתָּא וְקָא כָנְשָׁא לְהוּ. אֲמַר לַהּ: שִׁבְקִינְהוּ, כְּתִיב: ״וְרַחֲמָיו עַל כׇּל מַעֲשָׂיו״, אֲמַרוּ: הוֹאִיל וּמְרַחֵם – נְרַחֵם עֲלֵיהּ.
human_translation: And left due to incident. One day, the maidservant of Rabbi was sweeping house. There were young weasels [ karkushta ] lying and she was sweeping them said to her: Let them be, it is written: and His mercies are over all His works” They said Since he was compassionate, we shall be compassionate on him,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And through the incident they went, one day, the maidservant of Rabbi Beita was sweeping, the sons of the craftsmen were throwing pebbles at her. He said to her: Leave them, it is written: "And His mercies are upon all His works," they said: Since He is merciful, we should be merciful towards her. English translation: And through the incident they went, one day, the maidservant of Rabbi Beita was sweeping, the sons of the craftsmen were throwing pebbles at her. He said to her: Leave them, it is written: "And His mercies are upon all His works," they said: Since He is merciful, we should be merciful towards her.

hebrew_text: כּוּלְּהוּ שְׁנֵי יִסּוּרֵי דְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר לָא שָׁכֵיב אִינִישׁ בְּלָא זִמְנֵיהּ. כּוּלְּהוּ שְׁנֵי יִסּוּרֵי דְּרַבִּי לָא אִיצְטְרִיךְ עָלְמָא לְמִיטְרָא. דְּאָמַר רַבָּה בַּר רַב שֵׁילָא: קְשֵׁי יוֹמָא דְמִיטְרָא כְּיוֹמָא דְּדִינָא. וְאָמַר אַמֵּימָר: אִי לָאו צְרִיךְ לְעָלְמָא – בָּעוּ רַבָּנַן רַחֲמֵי עֲלֵיהּ וּמְבַטְּלִי לֵיהּ. אֲפִילּוּ הָכִי, כִּי הֲווֹ עָקְרִי פּוּגְלָא מִמֵּשָׁרָא הֲוָה קָיְימָא בֵּירָא מַלְיָא מַיָּא.
human_translation: all the years of the suffering of Rabbi Elazar, no one died prematurely, all the years of the suffering of Rabbi the world did not require rain, As Rabba bar Rav Sheila said: A day of rain is as difficult as a day of judgment, And Ameimar said: Were not that needed by people, the Sages would pray for mercy and annul it, even so, when a radish was uprooted from its row there remained a hole filled with water,
llm_translation: All the two afflictions of Rabbi Elazar did not cause a person to die before their time. All the two afflictions of Rabbi did not require the world to pray for mercy. For Rabba bar Rav Shila said: The difficulty of a day of rain is like the difficulty of judgment day. And Amemar said: If it is not necessary for the world, the Rabbis sought mercy for it and annulled it. Even so, when the dried figs were uprooted from the table, there was a full cup of water in the house.

hebrew_text: אִיקְּלַע רַבִּי לְאַתְרֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, אָמַר לָהֶם: יֵשׁ לוֹ בֵּן לְאוֹתוֹ צַדִּיק? אָמְרוּ לוֹ: יֵשׁ לוֹ בֵּן. וְכׇל זוֹנָה שֶׁנִּשְׂכֶּרֶת בִּשְׁנַיִם שׂוֹכַרְתּוֹ בִּשְׁמֹנָה. אַתְיֵיהּ, אַסְמְכֵיהּ בְּרַבִּי וְאַשְׁלְמֵיהּ לְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אִיסִי בֶּן לָקוֹנְיָא אֲחוּהָ דְּאִמֵּיהּ.
human_translation: Rabbi arrived at the place of Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon. He said to Does that righteous person have a son? They said to him: He has a son and any prostitute who hires herself for two hires him for eight, He brought him ordained him as a rabbi, and gave him over to Rabbi Shimon ben Isi ben Lakonya, brother of mother,
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar son of Rabbi Shimon encountered Rabbi Elazar son of Rabbi Shimon, he said to them: Does that righteous one have a son? They said to him: He has a son. And any prostitute who hires herself out for two, hires him out for eight. He came, he leaned on Rabbi, and he paid it to Rabbi Shimon son of Issi son of Laqonya, the brother of his mother.

hebrew_text: כֹּל יוֹמָא הֲוָה אָמַר: לְקִרְיָיתִי אֲנָא אָזֵיל. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: חַכִּים עָבְדוּ יָתָךְ, וְגוּלְּתָא דְּדַהֲבָא פָּרְסוּ עֲלָךְ, וְרַבִּי קָרוּ לָךְ, וְאַתְּ אָמְרַתְּ לְקִרְיָיתִי אֲנָא אָזֵיל! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מוֹמֵי עֲזוּבָה דָּא. כִּי גְדַל אֲתָא יְתֵיב בִּמְתִיבְתָּא דְרַבִּי. שַׁמְעֵיהּ לְקָלֵיהּ, אָמַר: הָא קָלָא דָּמֵי לְקָלֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן. אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: בְּרֵיהּ הוּא.
human_translation: Each day, would say: I am going back to my town, said to him: You have been made wise, and a golden cloak has been spread over you and you are called Rabbi, and you say: I am going back to my town? said to him: I vow [ momei ] this abandoned, When matured he came and sat in the academy of Rabbi heard his voice and said: This voice is similar to the voice of Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon. said to him: It is his son.
llm_translation: Every day he used to say: "I am going to my city." They said to him: "Wise men have made you, and a golden candelabrum has been spread over you, and Rabbi has called you, and you say, 'I am going to my city!' He said to them: "This is an abandoned blemish." When he grew up, he sat in the assembly of Rabbi. They heard his voice, and he said: "This voice is similar to the voice of Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon." They said to him: "He is his son."

hebrew_text: קָרֵי עֲלֵיהּ: ״פְּרִי צַדִּיק עֵץ חַיִּים וְלֹקֵחַ נְפָשׁוֹת חָכָם״. ״פְּרִי צַדִּיק עֵץ חַיִּים״ – זֶה רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן. ״וְלֹקֵחַ נְפָשׁוֹת חָכָם״ – זֶה רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אִיסִי בֶּן לָקוֹנְיָא.
human_translation: read about him: “The fruit of the righteous is a tree of life; and he that is wise wins souls” “the fruit of the righteous,” this Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, “And he that is wise wins souls,” this Rabbi Shimon ben Isi ben Lakonya,
llm_translation: He reads upon it: "The fruit of the righteous is a tree of life, and he who captures souls is wise." "The fruit of the righteous is a tree of life" – this is Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon. "And he who captures souls is wise" – this is Rabbi Shimon, son of Issi, son of Laqonya.

hebrew_text: כִּי נָח נַפְשֵׁיהּ (אמטוהו) [אַמְטְיוּהּ] לִמְעָרְתָּא דַאֲבוּהּ. הֲוָה הָדְרָא לַהּ עַכְנָא לִמְעָרְתָּא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: עַכְנָא עַכְנָא! פְּתַח פִּיךָ וְיִכָּנֵס בֵּן אֵצֶל אָבִיו. לָא פְּתַחָא לְהוּ. כִּסְבוּרִים הָעָם לוֹמַר שֶׁזֶּה גָּדוֹל מִזֶּה.
human_translation: When died, he was brought to his father’s cave A serpent encircled the cave, said to it: Serpent, serpent! Open your mouth, so that a son may enter next to his father. did not open for them. The people thought that this greater than that
llm_translation: When his soul was about to depart, he said to his father-in-law, "Bring me to the cave." He brought him to the cave. He said to him, "Cave, cave! Open your mouth and let the son enter beside his father." It did not open for them. People thought that he was greater than him.

hebrew_text: יָצְתָה בַּת קוֹל וְאָמְרָה: לֹא מִפְּנֵי שֶׁזֶּה גָּדוֹל מִזֶּה, אֶלָּא זֶה הָיָה בְּצַעַר מְעָרָה, וְזֶה לֹא הָיָה בְּצַעַר מְעָרָה.
human_translation: A Divine Voice emerged and said: not because this one is greater than that one; rather, this one, experienced the suffering of the cave, while that one, did not experience suffering of the cave.
llm_translation: A voice came forth and said: "Not because this one is greater than that one, but rather this one was in the narrowness of the cave, and that one was not in the narrowness of the cave."

hebrew_text: אִיקְּלַע רַבִּי לְאַתְרֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי טַרְפוֹן, אֲמַר לְהוּ: יֵשׁ לוֹ בֵּן לְאוֹתוֹ צַדִּיק שֶׁהָיָה מְקַפֵּחַ אֶת בָּנָיו? אָמְרוּ לוֹ: בֵּן אֵין לוֹ, בֵּן בַּת יֵשׁ לוֹ, וְכׇל זוֹנָה שֶׁנִּשְׂכֶּרֶת בִּשְׁנַיִם שׂוֹכַרְתּוֹ בִּשְׁמֹנָה.
human_translation: Rabbi arrived at the place of Rabbi Tarfon. He said to Does that righteous person, who would take an oath by the life of his children, have a son? They said to him: He does not have a son, he has a son his daughter, and every prostitute hired for two hires him for eight.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yikla came to the place of Rabbi Tarfon, he said to them: Does that righteous man have a son who was rebelling against his sons? They said to him: He does not have a son, he has a daughter, and any prostitute who hires herself out for two, hires him out for eight.

hebrew_text: אַתְיוּהּ לְקַמֵּיהּ, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִי הָדְרַתְּ בָּךְ – יָהֵיבְנָא לָךְ בַּרְתַּאי. הֲדַר בֵּיהּ. אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: נַסְבַהּ וְגָירְשַׁהּ. אִיכָּא דְאָמְרִי: לָא נַסְבַהּ כְּלָל, כְּדֵי שֶׁלֹּא יֹאמְרוּ בִּשְׁבִיל זוֹ חָזַר זֶה.
human_translation: brought before said to him: If you repent I will give you my daughter He repented There are who say he married and divorced her. There are who say he did not marry her at all, so that it would not be said for the sake of that this repented.
llm_translation: He came before him, he said to him: If you repent - I will give you my daughter. He repented. Some say: He married her and divorced her. Some say: He did not marry her at all, so that people would not say he changed his mind because of her.

hebrew_text: וּלְמָה לֵיהּ כּוּלֵּי הַאי, דְּאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ אָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ אָמַר רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹנָתָן: כׇּל הַמְלַמֵּד אֶת בֶּן חֲבֵירוֹ תּוֹרָה זוֹכֶה וְיוֹשֵׁב בִּישִׁיבָה שֶׁל מַעְלָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אִם תָּשׁוּב וַאֲשִׁיבְךָ לְפָנַי תַּעֲמֹד״.
human_translation: And why so much that Rav Yehuda says Rav says, and some say Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba says Rabbi Yoḥanan says, and some say Rabbi Shmuel bar Naḥmani says Rabbi Yonatan says: Anyone who teaches Torah to the son of another merits to sit in the heavenly academy, as it is stated: If you return, and I bring you back, you shall stand before Me”
llm_translation: And why is it so? For Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav, and some say in the name of Rabbi Chiya bar Abba said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan, and some say in the name of Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachmani said in the name of Rabbi Yonatan: Anyone who teaches his friend's son Torah, merits and sits in the Yeshiva above, as it is said: "If you return, I will restore you, that you may stand before Me."

hebrew_text: וְכׇל הַמְלַמֵּד אֶת בֶּן עַם הָאָרֶץ תּוֹרָה – אֲפִילּוּ הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא גּוֹזֵר גְּזֵירָה, מְבַטְּלָהּ בִּשְׁבִילוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְאִם תּוֹצִיא יָקָר מִזּוֹלֵל כְּפִי תִהְיֶה״.
human_translation: And anyone who teaches Torah to the son of an ignoramus even if the Holy One, Blessed be He, issue decree, He nullify it for his sake, as it is stated “And if you bring forth the precious out of the worthless, you shall be as My mouth,”
llm_translation: "And all who teaches a son of the people of the land Torah - even if the Holy One, blessed be He, decrees a decree, he nullifies it for him, as it is said: 'And if you bring out the precious from the vile, you shall be as My mouth.'"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי פַּרְנָךְ אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: כׇּל שֶׁהוּא תַּלְמִיד חָכָם, וּבְנוֹ תַּלְמִיד חָכָם וּבֶן בְּנוֹ תַּלְמִיד חָכָם – שׁוּב אֵין תּוֹרָה פּוֹסֶקֶת מִזַּרְעוֹ לְעוֹלָם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַאֲנִי זֹאת בְּרִיתִי וְגוֹ׳ לֹא יָמוּשׁוּ מִפִּיךָ וּמִפִּי זַרְעֲךָ וּמִפִּי זֶרַע זַרְעֲךָ אָמַר ה׳ מֵעַתָּה וְעַד עוֹלָם״.
human_translation: Rabbi Parnakh says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: anyone who is a Torah scholar, and whose son a Torah scholar, and whose grandson a Torah scholar, the Torah will never again cease from his descendants, as it is stated: “And as for Me, this is My covenant… shall not depart out of your mouth, nor out of the mouth of your seed, nor out of the mouth of your seed’s seed, says the Lord, from now and forever”
llm_translation: Rabbi Parnach said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: Any person who is a Torah scholar, and his son is a Torah scholar, and his grandson is a Torah scholar - the Torah will never cease from his descendants, as it is stated: "But this is the covenant that I will make with the house of Israel after those days, says the Lord: I will put my law within them, and I will write it on their hearts. And I will be their God, and they shall be my people."

hebrew_text: מַאי ״אָמַר ה׳״? אָמַר הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא: אֲנִי עָרֵב לְךָ בְּדָבָר זֶה. מַאי ״מֵעַתָּה וְעַד עוֹלָם״? אָמַר רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה: מִכָּאן וְאֵילָךְ תּוֹרָה מְחַזֶּרֶת עַל אַכְסַנְיָא שֶׁלָּהּ.
human_translation: What “says the Lord”? the Holy One, Blessed be He, said: I am your guarantor in this matter. What “from now and forever”? Rabbi Yirmeya says: from this forward, the Torah returns to its lodging,
llm_translation: What is "God said"? The Holy One, blessed be He, said: "I guarantee you in this matter." What is "from now and forever"? Rabbi Yirmeya said: "From here on, the Torah continually revolves around its inn."

hebrew_text: רַב יוֹסֵף יְתֵיב אַרְבְּעִין תַּעֲנִיָּתָא, וְאַקְרְיוּהּ ״לֹא יָמוּשׁוּ מִפִּיךָ״. יְתֵיב אַרְבָּעִים תַּעֲנִיָּתָא אַחֲרִינֵי, וְאַקְרְיוּהוּ ״לֹא יָמוּשׁוּ מִפִּיךָ וּמִפִּי זַרְעֲךָ״. יְתֵיב (מְאָה) [אַרְבְּעִין] תַּעֲנִיָּתָא אַחְרָינְיָאתָא, וְאַקְרְיוּהּ ״לֹא יָמוּשׁוּ מִפִּיךָ וּמִפִּי זַרְעֲךָ וּמִפִּי זֶרַע זַרְעֲךָ״. אָמַר: מִכָּאן וְאֵילָךְ לָא צְרִיכְנָא – תּוֹרָה מְחַזֶּרֶת עַל אַכְסַנְיָא שֶׁלָּהּ.
human_translation: Rav Yosef fasted forty fasts and he was read shall not depart out of your mouth.” He fasted an additional forty fasts and he was read: “Shall not depart out of your mouth, nor out of the mouth of your seed.” He fasted an additional one hundred fasts. he came and was read “Shall not depart out of your mouth, nor out of the mouth of your seed, nor out of the mouth of your seed’s seed.” He said: From this forward I do not need Torah return to its lodging.
llm_translation: Rav Yosef sat forty fasts, and they read to him, "They shall not depart from your mouth." He sat another forty fasts, and they read to him, "They shall not depart from your mouth and from the mouth of your offspring." He sat another forty fasts, and they read to him, "They shall not depart from your mouth and from the mouth of your offspring and from the mouth of the offspring of your offspring." He said: From here and onwards, it is not necessary - the Torah guarantees its support.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי זֵירָא כִּי סְלֵיק לְאַרְעָא דְיִשְׂרָאֵל יָתֵיב מְאָה תַּעֲנִיָּתָא דְּלִשְׁתַּכַּח תַּלְמוּדָא בַּבְלָאָה מִינֵּיהּ, כִּי הֵיכִי דְּלָא נִטְרְדֵיהּ. יְתֵיב מְאָה אַחְרָנְיָתָא דְּלָא לִשְׁכּוֹב רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בִּשְׁנֵיהּ, וְנָפְלִין עִילָּוֵיהּ מִילֵּי דְצִבּוּרָא. וִיתֵיב מְאָה אַחֲרִינֵי, דְּלָא נִשְׁלוֹט בֵּיהּ נוּרָא דְגֵיהִנָּם.
human_translation: When Rabbi Zeira ascended to Eretz Yisrael, he fasted one hundred fasts so that he forget the Babylonian Gemara, so that it would not hinder him He fasted an additional one hundred that Rabbi Elazar, not die during his lifetime, communal matters upon him. fasted an additional one hundred so that the fire of Gehenna not affect him.
llm_translation: Rabbi Zeira, when he ascended to the Land of Israel, sat through one hundred fasts to forget the Babylonian Talmud, so that he would not be troubled by it. He then sat through one hundred more fasts to forget Rabbi Elazar's teachings, and his wounds were healed from the public's criticisms. He then sat through one hundred more, so that the fire of Gehenna would not have dominion over him.

hebrew_text: כֹּל תְּלָתִין יוֹמֵי הֲוָה בָּדֵיק נַפְשֵׁיהּ: שְׁגַר תַּנּוּרָא סְלֵיק וִיתֵיב בְּגַוֵּיהּ וְלָא הֲוָה שָׁלְטָא בֵּיהּ נוּרָא. יוֹמָא חַד יְהַבוּ בֵּיהּ רַבָּנַן עֵינָא וְאִיחֲרַכוּ שָׁקֵיהּ, וּקְרוֹ לֵיהּ ״קָטִין חֲרִיךְ שָׁקֵיהּ״.
human_translation: Every thirty days, he would examine himself ignite an oven, climb in, and sit inside it, and the fire would not affect him. One day, the Sages gave him the eye, and his legs became singed And they referred to him short one with singed legs.
llm_translation: All thirty days he was examining himself: he removed the oven grate and sat in its place, but the light did not have dominion over him. One day the Rabbis gave him a mirror, and he saw his reflection, and they called him "a small pot with a black rim."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: מַאי דִּכְתִיב ״מִי הָאִישׁ הֶחָכָם וְיָבֵן אֶת זֹאת וַאֲשֶׁר דִּבֶּר פִּי ה׳ אֵלָיו וְיַגִּדָהּ עַל מָה אָבְדָה הָאָרֶץ״, דָּבָר זֶה
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says Rav says: What which is written: “Who is the wise man, that he may understand this? And who is he to whom the mouth of the Lord has spoken, that he may declare it? Why has the land been lost This matter,
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: What is the meaning of what is written, "Who is the wise man, that may understand this? And who is he to whom the mouth of the Lord has spoken, that he may declare it? Why is the land perished and laid waste like a wilderness, that none passes through?" This matter...

hebrew_text: אָמְרוּ חֲכָמִים וְלֹא פֵּירְשׁוּהוּ, אָמְרוּ נְבִיאִים וְלֹא פֵּירְשׁוּהוּ, עַד שֶׁפֵּירְשׁוֹ הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא בְּעַצְמוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיֹּאמֶר ה׳ עַל עׇזְבָם אֶת תּוֹרָתִי אֲשֶׁר נָתַתִּי לִפְנֵיהֶם״. אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: שֶׁלֹּא בֵּרְכוּ בַּתּוֹרָה תְּחִילָּה.
human_translation: was stated by the Sages, and they not explain it. was stated by the prophets, and they not explain it, until the Holy One, Blessed be He, Himself explained it, as it is stated “And the Lord says: Because they have forsaken My Torah which I set before them” Rav Yehuda says Rav says: that they did not recite a blessing on the Torah prior
llm_translation: The sages said and did not explain it, the prophets said and did not explain it, until the Holy One, blessed be He, Himself explained it, as it is stated: "And the Lord said, 'Because they have forsaken My Torah that I set before them.'" Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: They did not recite a blessing over the Torah first.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חָמָא: מַאי דִּכְתִיב ״בְּלֵב נָבוֹן תָּנוּחַ חׇכְמָה וּבְקֶרֶב כְּסִילִים תִּוָּדֵעַ״, ״בְּלֵב נָבוֹן תָּנוּחַ חׇכְמָה״ – זֶה תַּלְמִיד חָכָם בֶּן תַּלְמִיד חָכָם, ״וּבְקֶרֶב כְּסִילִים תִּוָּדֵעַ״ – זֶה תַּלְמִיד חָכָם בֶּן עַם הָאָרֶץ. אָמַר עוּלָּא: הַיְינוּ דְּאָמְרִי אִינָשֵׁי: אִסְתֵּירָא בְּלָגִינָא קִישׁ קִישׁ קָרְיָא.
human_translation: Rav Ḥama says: What which is written: “In the heart of him that has discernment wisdom rests; but in the inward part of fools it makes itself known” “In the heart of him who has discernment wisdom rests”; this a Torah scholar, son of a Torah scholar. “But in the inward part of fools it makes itself known”; this a Torah scholar, son of an ignoramus, Ulla said: This that people say: coin in barrel calls: Kish , kish ,
llm_translation: Rav Ḥama said: What is the meaning of what is written, "In the heart of the wise, rest wisdom, and in the midst of fools, it is known"? "In the heart of the wise, rest wisdom" – this refers to a Torah scholar, son of a Torah scholar. "And in the midst of fools, it is known" – this refers to a Torah scholar, son of an am ha'aretz. Ulla said: This is what people say: "A hidden thing in a pail, it makes noise, noise, and is revealed."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה לְרַבִּי זֵירָא: מַאי דִּכְתִיב ״קָטֹן וְגָדוֹל שָׁם הוּא וְעֶבֶד חׇפְשִׁי מֵאֲדֹנָיו״? אַטּוּ לָא יָדְעִינַן דְּקָטֹן וְגָדוֹל שָׁם הוּא? אֶלָּא כׇּל הַמַּקְטִין עַצְמוֹ עַל דִּבְרֵי תוֹרָה בָּעוֹלָם הַזֶּה – נַעֲשָׂה גָּדוֹל לָעוֹלָם הַבָּא, וְכׇל הַמֵּשִׂים עַצְמוֹ כְּעֶבֶד עַל דִּבְרֵי תוֹרָה בָּעוֹלָם הַזֶּה – נַעֲשֶׂה חׇפְשִׁי לָעוֹלָם הַבָּא.
human_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya said to Rabbi Zeira: What which is written “The humble and great are there; and the servant is free from his master” Is that to say we do not know that the humble and the great are there Rather, Anyone who humbles himself over matters of Torah in this world becomes great in the World-to-Come; and anyone who establishes himself as a servant over matters of Torah in this world becomes free in the World-to-Come.
llm_translation: He said to him, Rabbi Yirmeya to Rabbi Zeira: What is the meaning of what is written, "small and great are there, and a free servant from his master"? Do we not know that there are small and great there? Rather, anyone who makes himself small for the sake of Torah in this world, will become great in the World to Come, and anyone who makes himself like a servant for the sake of Torah in this world, will become free in the World to Come.

hebrew_text: רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ הֲוָה מְצַיֵּין מְעָרָתָא דְּרַבָּנַן, כִּי מְטָא לִמְעָרְתֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי חִיָּיא אִיעֲלַמָא מִינֵּיהּ. חֲלַשׁ דַּעְתֵּיהּ. אֲמַר: רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם! לֹא פִּלְפַּלְתִּי תּוֹרָה כְּמוֹתוֹ? יָצְתָה בַּת קוֹל וְאָמְרָה לוֹ: תּוֹרָה כְּמוֹתוֹ פִּלְפַּלְתָּ, תּוֹרָה כְּמוֹתוֹ לֹא רִיבַּצְתָּ.
human_translation: Reish Lakish was demarcating caves of the Sages. When he arrived at the cave of Rabbi Ḥiyya, eluded him. became distressed, He said: Master of the Universe! Did I not analyze the Torah like A Divine Voice emerged and said to him: You did analyze the Torah like him, you did not disseminate Torah like him.
llm_translation: Reish Lakish was marking the caves of the Sages, when he came to the cave of Rabbi Chiya. He forgot his learning. He said: Master of the Universe! Have I not reviewed the Torah like His? A Bat Kol (heavenly voice) emerged and said to him: You have reviewed the Torah like His, but you have not toiled in the Torah like His.

hebrew_text: כִּי הֲווֹ מִינְּצוּ רַבִּי חֲנִינָא וְרַבִּי חִיָּיא, אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי חֲנִינָא לְרַבִּי חִיָּיא: בַּהֲדֵי דִּידִי קָא מִינְּצֵית? חַס וְחָלִילָה, אִי מִשְׁתַּכְחָא תּוֹרָה מִיִּשְׂרָאֵל – מַהְדַּרְנָא לַהּ מִפִּילְפּוּלַי. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי חִיָּיא לְרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: בַּהֲדֵי דִּידִי קָא מִינְּצֵית? דַּעֲבַדִי לְתוֹרָה דְּלֹא תִּשְׁתַּכַּח מִיִּשְׂרָאֵל.
human_translation: When Rabbi Ḥanina and Rabbi Ḥiyya would debate Rabbi Ḥanina say to Rabbi Ḥiyya: you can debate with me? Heaven forbid! If the Torah were forgotten from the Jewish people, I restore it with my analysis Rabbi Ḥiyya said to Rabbi Ḥanina: you can debate with me? as I am acting the Torah not be forgotten by the Jewish people.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: When Rabbi Chanina and Rabbi Chiya were sitting together, Rabbi Chanina said to Rabbi Chiya: "Have you found fault with us?" Heaven forbid! If the Torah were to be forgotten from Israel, we would restore it from our wisdom. Rabbi Chiya said to Rabbi Chanina: "Have you found fault with us?" We have practiced Torah so that it should not be forgotten from Israel.

hebrew_text: מַאי עָבֵידְנָא – אָזֵילְנָא וְשָׁדֵינָא כִּיתָּנָא וְגָדֵילְנָא נִישְׁבֵּי, וְצָיֵידְנָא טְבֵי וּמַאֲכֵילְנָא בִּשְׂרַיְיהוּ לְיַתְמֵי, וְאָרֵיכְנָא מְגִילָּתָא וְכָתֵבְנָא חֲמִשָּׁה חוּמְשֵׁי, וְסָלֵיקְנָא לְמָתָא וּמַקְרֵינָא חַמְשָׁה יָנוֹקֵי בְּחַמְשָׁה חוּמְשֵׁי, וּמַתְנֵינָא שִׁיתָּא יָנוֹקֵי שִׁיתָּא סִדְרֵי, וְאָמַרְנָא לְהוּ: עַד דְּהָדַרְנָא וְאָתֵינָא אַקְרוֹ אַהֲדָדֵי וְאַתְנוֹ אַהֲדָדֵי וַעֲבַדִי לַהּ לְתוֹרָה דְּלֹא תִּשְׁתַּכַּח מִיִּשְׂרָאֵל.
human_translation: What do I do I go and sow flax and twine nets and I hunt deer and feed their meat to orphans. I prepare parchment and I write the five books I go to a city and teach five children the five books, and I teach six children the six orders and I say to them: Until I return and come read each other and teach each other I act the Torah will not be forgotten by the Jewish people.
llm_translation: "What are we to do? - We go out and harvest flax, spin it, weave it, and make garments for the poor. We hunt deer, and feed their meat to orphans. We write a scroll of the Torah and give it to five students. We go to a city, and call five young children, and teach them five portions. And we teach six young children six orders. And we say to them: Until we return and come, read to one another, and teach one another, and do it for the Torah so that it will not be forgotten from Israel."

hebrew_text: הַיְינוּ דְּאָמַר רַבִּי: כַּמָּה גְּדוֹלִים מַעֲשֵׂי חִיָּיא! אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל בְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי: אֲפִילּוּ מִמָּר? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִין. אֲפִילּוּ מֵאַבָּא? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: חַס וְחָלִילָה! לֹא תְּהֵא כְּזֹאת בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל.
human_translation: this is what Rabbi said: How great are the deeds of Ḥiyya! Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yosei, said to even greater than the Master’s, said to him: Yes. even than father, said to him: Heaven forbid! Such shall not be among the Jewish people,
llm_translation: That is what Rabbi said: How great are the deeds of Ḥiyya! Rabbi Yishmael son of Rabbi Yose said to him: Even from a non-Jew? He said to him: No. Even from an idol worshipper? He said to him: God forbid! May it not be so in Israel.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא: אֶמֶשׁ נִרְאָה לִי רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא. אָמַרְתִּי לוֹ: אֵצֶל מִי אַתָּה תָּקוּעַ? אָמַר לִי: אֵצֶל רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן. וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אֵצֶל מִי? אֵצֶל רַבִּי יַנַּאי. וְרַבִּי יַנַּאי אֵצֶל מִי? אֵצֶל רַבִּי חֲנִינָא. וְרַבִּי חֲנִינָא אֵצֶל מִי? אֵצֶל רַבִּי חִיָּיא. אָמַרְתִּי לוֹ: וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אֵצֶל רַבִּי חִיָּיא לֹא? אָמַר לִי: בַּאֲתַר דְּזִקּוּקִין דְּנוּרָא וּבָעוֹרִין דְּאֶשָּׁא – מַאן מְעַיֵּיל בַּר נַפָּחָא לְתַמָּן?!
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira said: Last night, Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, appeared to me I said to him: Near whom are you placed He said to me: Near Rabbi Yoḥanan. And Rabbi Yoḥanan is near whom? Near Rabbi Yannai. And Rabbi Yannai is near whom? Near Rabbi Ḥanina. And Rabbi Ḥanina is near whom? Near Rabbi Ḥiyya. I said to But isn’t Rabbi Yoḥanan near Rabbi Ḥiyya? He said to me: In a place of fiery sparks and burning fires, who can bring son of Nappaḥa, there?
llm_translation: Rabbi Zeira said: Last night I saw Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Chanina. I said to him: With whom are you staying? He said to me: I am staying with Rabbi Yochanan. And Rabbi Yochanan, with whom is he staying? He is staying with Rabbi Yannai. And Rabbi Yannai, with whom is he staying? He is staying with Rabbi Chanina. And Rabbi Chanina, with whom is he staying? He is staying with Rabbi Chiya. I said to him: And Rabbi Yochanan, is he not staying with Rabbi Chiya? He said to me: In a place of refined gold and fine leather – who would bring a bar of lead there?!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חֲבִיבָא: אִשְׁתַּעִי לִי רַב חֲבִיבָא בַּר סוּרְמָקֵי, חֲזֵי לֵיהּ הָהוּא מֵרַבָּנַן דַּהֲוָה שְׁכִיחַ אֵלִיָּהוּ גַּבֵּיהּ, דִּלְצַפְרָא הֲווֹ שַׁפִּירָן עֵינֵיהּ, וּלְאוּרְתָּא דָּמְיָין כִּדְמִיקַּלְיָן בְּנוּרָא. אֲמַרִי לֵיהּ: מַאי הַאי? וַאֲמַר לִי: דַּאֲמַרִי לֵיהּ לְאֵלִיָּהוּ: אַחְוִי לִי רַבָּנַן כִּי סָלְקִי לִמְתִיבְתָּא דְּרָקִיעַ. אָמַר לִי: בְּכוּלְּהוּ מָצֵית אִסְתַּכּוֹלֵי בְּהוּ, לְבַר מִגּוּהַרְקָא דְּרַבִּי חִיָּיא דְּלָא תִּסְתַּכֵּל בֵּיהּ. מַאי סִימָנַיְיהוּ? בְּכוּלְּהוּ אָזְלִי מַלְאֲכֵי כִּי סָלְקִי וְנָחֲתִי, לְבַר מִגּוּהַרְקָא דְּרַבִּי חִיָּיא דְּמִנַּפְשֵׁיהּ סָלֵיק וּנְחֵית.
human_translation: Rav Ḥaviva said: Rav Ḥaviva bar Surmakei told me: I saw one of the Sages whom Elijah would visit, his eyes beautiful in the morning, but appeared to be charred by fire in the evening. I said to him: What is this And he said to me: I said to Elijah: Show me the Sages upon their ascension to the heavenly academy. said to me: You may gaze at all of them except for the chariot [ miguharka ] of Rabbi Ḥiyya, upon whom you may not gaze. What are the signs Angels accompany all as they ascend and descend, except for the chariot of Rabbi Ḥiyya, which ascends and descends of its own accord,
llm_translation: Rav Ḥaviva said: Inquire for me about Rav Ḥaviva bar Surmakai, see that certain Rabbi who was frequently visited by Elijah the prophet, for his eyes were beautiful like the light of a candle. They said to him: What is this? And he said to me: They said to Elijah: "Accompany us, Rabbi, when you ascend to the heavenly academy." He said to me: In all of them I found reason to be concerned, except for the son of the baker of Rabbi Ḥiyya, for he did not look at me. What are their characteristics? All of them went to greet me when I ascended and descended, except for the son of the baker of Rabbi Ḥiyya, who went up and came down of his own accord.

hebrew_text: לָא מְצַאי לְאוֹקְמָא אַנַּפְשַׁאי, אִסְתַּכַּלִי בָּהּ: אֲתוֹ תְּרֵי בּוּטִיטֵי דְנוּרָא וּמַחְיוּהּו לְהָהוּא גַּבְרָא וְסַמּוֹנְהוּ לְעֵינֵיהּ. לִמְחַר אֲזַלִי אִשְׁתַּטַּחִי אַמְּעָרְתֵּיהּ, אָמֵינָא: מַתְנְיָיתָא דְּמָר מַתְנֵינָא, וְאִתַּסַּאי.
human_translation: I was unable to restrain myself, I gazed upon Two fiery flames came and struck that man, and blinded his eyes. The next day, I went and prostrated on cave I said: I study the baraitot of the Master, And was healed,
llm_translation: I did not find a remedy for my soul, look into it: two clay figures of wax and shape them into that man, and place them before her eyes. The next day, go and examine her womb, I say: the teaching of the master we teach, and rely on it.

hebrew_text: אֵלִיָּהוּ הֲוָה שְׁכִיחַ בִּמְתִיבְתָּא דְּרַבִּי, יוֹמָא חַד רֵישׁ יַרְחָא הֲוָה, נְגַהּ לֵיהּ וְלָא אֲתָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מַאי טַעְמָא נְגַהּ לֵיהּ לְמָר? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אַדְּאוֹקֵימְנָא לְאַבְרָהָם וּמָשֵׁינָא יְדֵיהּ וּמְצַלֵּי וּמַגְנֵינָא לֵיהּ, וְכֵן לְיִצְחָק וְכֵן לְיַעֲקֹב. וְלוֹקְמִינְהוּ בַּהֲדֵי הֲדָדֵי! סָבַרי: תָּקְפִי בְּרַחֲמֵי וּמַיְיתִי לֵיהּ לְמָשִׁיחַ בְּלָא זִמְנֵיהּ.
human_translation: Elijah was found in the academy of Rabbi One day it was a New Moon, was delayed and did not come said to What is the reason the Master was delayed? said to him: I to wake up Abraham, wash his hands, and pray, and lay him down And similarly, for Isaac, and similarly for Jacob And let wake them together. I maintain they generate powerful prayers and bring the Messiah prematurely.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Elijah was often found in the study hall of Rabbi, one day the first of the month was, he appeared to him and did not come. He said to him: Why did the Master appear to him? He said to him: I am busy with Abraham, changing his hands and praying and protecting him, and so with Isaac and so with Jacob. And let them come together! They thought: Let him come with mercy and bring the Messiah before his time.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: וְיֵשׁ דּוּגְמָתָן בָּעוֹלָם הַזֶּה? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִיכָּא רַבִּי חִיָּיא וּבָנָיו. גְּזַר רַבִּי תַּעֲנִיתָא, אַחְתִינְהוּ לְרַבִּי חִיָּיא וּבָנָיו. אֲמַר ״מַשִּׁיב הָרוּחַ״ – וּנְשַׁבָה זִיקָא. אֲמַר ״מוֹרִיד הַגֶּשֶׁם״ – וַאֲתָא מִיטְרָא, כִּי מְטָא לְמֵימַר ״מְחַיֵּה הַמֵּתִים״ – רְגַשׁ עָלְמָא.
human_translation: said to And is there anyone in this world comparable to them said to him: There are Rabbi Ḥiyya and his sons. Rabbi decreed a fast, brought Rabbi Ḥiyya and his sons down recited Who makes the wind blow, and the wind blew. recited Who makes the rain fall, and rain fell. When he was about to say Who revives the dead, the world trembled.
llm_translation: He said to him: Is there an example like them in this world? He said to him: There is Rabbi Chiya and his sons. Rabbi Taanita decreed, one of them for Rabbi Chiya and his sons. He said, "He who makes the wind blow" - and the damage was removed. He said, "He who brings down the rain" - and rain came, for when he came to say, "He who revives the dead" - the world trembled.

hebrew_text: אָמְרִי בִּרְקִיעָא: מַאן גַּלִּי רָזַיָּא בְּעָלְמָא? אָמְרִי: אֵלִיָּהוּ. אַתְיוּהּ לְאֵלִיָּהוּ מַחְיוּהּ שִׁתִּין פּוּלְסֵי דְנוּרָא. אֲתָא אִידְּמִי לְהוּ כְּדוּבָּא דְנוּרָא, עָל בֵּינַיְיהוּ וְטַרְדִינְהוּ.
human_translation: They said in heaven: Who is the revealer of secrets in the world? They said Elijah. Elijah was brought he was beaten with sixty fiery lashes. came disguised as a bear of fire. He came among and distracted them
llm_translation: They said in the firmament: Who reveals the secrets of the world? They said: Elijah. They brought to Elijah sixty pairs of candles. A fire descended among them like a bear of fire, separating and consuming them.

hebrew_text: שְׁמוּאֵל יַרְחִינָאָה אָסְיֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי הֲוָה. חֲלַשׁ רַבִּי בְּעֵינֵיהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֶימְלֵי לָךְ סַמָּא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָא יָכֵילְנָא. אֶשְׁטַר לָךְ מִשְׁטָר. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָא יָכֵילְנָא. הֲוָה מוֹתֵיב לֵיהּ בְּגוּבְתָּא דְסַמָּנֵי תּוּתֵי בֵּי סַדְיֵיהּ, וְאִיתַּסִּי.
human_translation: Shmuel Yarḥina’a was the physician of Rabbi Rabbi felt a pain in his eye. said to him: I will place a medication in said to him: I cannot said to him: I will apply a salve said to him: I cannot placed in a tube of herbs beneath his pillow, and was healed.
llm_translation: Samuel Yarchina'ah, the son of Rabbi Hava, was weak in her eyes. He said to her: "Apply kohl for yourself." She said to him: "We are not able." He handed her a mirror. She said to him: "We are not able." He sat her in the shade of the sycamore trees in her field, and he applied it.

hebrew_text: הֲוָה קָא מִצְטַעַר, רַבִּי לְמִסְמְכֵיהּ וְלָא הֲוָה מִסְתַּיְּיעָא מִילְּתָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָא לִצְטַעַר מָר, לְדִידִי חֲזֵי לִי סִיפְרָא דְּאָדָם הָרִאשׁוֹן, וּכְתִיב בֵּיהּ: שְׁמוּאֵל יַרְחִינָאָה
human_translation: Rabbi made efforts to ordain but was unsuccessful, said to him: The Master should not be upset I myself saw the book of Adam the first and it is written in it Shmuel Yarḥina’a
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "He was suffering, Rabbi to his colleagues, and the matter was not resolved. He said to them: 'Master, do not suffer, in my opinion, look at the book of Adam the first, and it is written in it: 'Shmuel Yarchinaha.'"

hebrew_text: חַכִּים יִתְקְרֵי, וְרַבִּי לָא יִתְקְרֵי. וְאַסּוּ דְּרַבִּי עַל יָדוֹ תְּהֵא. רַבִּי וְרַבִּי נָתָן – סוֹף מִשְׁנָה. רַב אָשֵׁי וְרָבִינָא – סוֹף הוֹרָאָה.
human_translation: shall be called a wise [ ḥakim ] but he shall not be called rabbi, and Rabbi convalescence shall be through him. Rabbi and Rabbi Natan the end of the Mishna, Rav Ashi and Ravina the end of instruction,
llm_translation: The wise one is called, but the Rabbi is not called. And the halacha should be in accordance with Rabbi. Rabbi and Rabbi Natan - the end of Mishnah. Rav Ashe and Ravina - the end of teaching.

hebrew_text: וְסִימָנָךְ: ״עַד אָבוֹא אֶל מִקְדְּשֵׁי אֵל אָבִינָה לְאַחֲרִיתָם״.
human_translation: And your mnemonic “Until I entered into the sanctuary [ mikdashei ] of God, and considered [ avina ] their end”
llm_translation: And your sign: "Until I come to the holy places of El, I will understand their end."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב כָּהֲנָא, אִישְׁתַּעִי לִי רַב חָמָא בַּר בְּרַתֵּיה דְּחַסָּא: רַבָּה בַּר נַחְמָנִי אַגַּב שְׁמָדָא נָח נַפְשֵׁיהּ. אֲכַלוּ בֵּיהּ קוּרְצָא בֵּי מַלְכָּא, אֲמַרוּ: אִיכָּא חַד גַּבְרָא בִּיהוּדָאֵי דְּקָא מְבַטֵּל תְּרֵיסַר אַלְפֵי גַּבְרֵי מִיִּשְׂרָאֵל יַרְחָא בְּקַיְיטָא וְיַרְחָא בְּסִתְוָא מִכְּרָגָא דְּמַלְכָּא.
human_translation: Rav Kahana said: Rav Ḥama, son of the daughter of Ḥasa, told me Rabba bar Naḥmani died due to persecution. accused him [ akhalu beih kurtza ] in the king’s palace, said: There is one man from the Jews who exempts twelve thousand Jewish men from the king’s head tax one month in the summer and one month in the winter.
llm_translation: Rav Kahana said, "Istai to me Rav Ḥama bar Bratei d'Ḥassa: Rabba bar Naḥmani died due to a decree of the government." They ate a dish in the king's palace, and they said, "There is one man among the Jews who annuls thirteen thousand men of Israel every month, in the morning and in the evening, from the king's table."

hebrew_text: שַׁדַּרוּ פְּרֵיסְתְּקָא דְמַלְכָּא בָּתְרֵיהּ וְלָא אַשְׁכְּחֵיהּ. עֲרַק וַאֲזַל מִפּוּמְבְּדִיתָא לְאַקְרָא, מֵאַקְרָא לְאַגְמָא, וּמֵאַגְמָא לְשִׁחִין, וּמִשִּׁחִין לִצְרִיפָא, וּמִצְּרִיפָא לְעֵינָא דְמַיִם, וּמֵעֵינָא דְמַיִם לְפוּמְבְּדִיתָא. בְּפוּמְבְּדִיתָא אַשְׁכְּחֵיהּ. אִיקְּלַע פְּרֵיסְתְּקָא דְמַלְכָּא לְהָהוּא אוּשְׁפִּיזָא דְּרַבָּה. קָרִיבוּ תַּכָּא קַמֵּיהּ וְאַשְׁקוּהוּ תְּרֵי כָּסֵי, וְדַלְיוּהּ לְתַכָּא מִקַּמֵּיהּ הֲדַר פַּרְצוּפֵיהּ לַאֲחוֹרֵיהּ.
human_translation: They sent a messenger [ peristaka ] of the king after him, but he not find him. fled and went from Pumbedita to Akra, from Akra to Agma, from Agma to Shiḥin, from Shiḥin to Tzerifa, from Tzerifa to Eina Demayim, and from Eina Demayim to Pumbedita. he was found in Pumbedita, the king’s messenger arrived at that same inn where Rabba placed a tray before and gave him two cups to drink. They removed the tray from before him and his face was turned backward.
llm_translation: They sent the daughter of the king to him, but he did not find her. He went from Pumbedita to Akra, from Akra to Agma, from Agma to Shichin, from Shichin to Tzirifa, from Tzirifa to the spring of water, and from the spring of water back to Pumbedita. In Pumbedita he found her. The daughter of the king arrived at that inn of Rabba. They brought a cup before him and gave him two cups, and they poured out the cup before him. He turned his face away from them.

hebrew_text: אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: מַאי נַעֲבֵיד לֵיהּ? גַּבְרָא דְמַלְכָּא הוּא! אֲמַר לְהוּ: קָרִיבוּ תַּכָּא לְקַמֵּיהּ, וְאַשְׁקוּהּ חַד כָּסָא, וְדַלְיוּהּ לְתַכָּא מִקַּמֵּיהּ וְלִתַּסֵּי. עֲבַדוּ לֵיהּ הָכִי וְאִתַּסִּי. אֲמַר: מִידָּע יָדַעְנָא דְּגַבְרָא דְּקָא בָעֵינָא הָכָא הוּא. בְּחֵישׁ אַבָּתְרֵיהּ וְאַשְׁכְּחֵיהּ. אֲמַר: אָזֵלְינָא מֵהָא, אִי מִקְטָל קָטְלוּ לְהָהוּא גַּבְרָא – לָא מְגַלֵּינָא, וְאִי נַגֹּידֵי מְנַגְּדִין לֵיהּ – מְגַלֵּינָא.
human_translation: said to What should we do with him? He is the king’s man, said to them: Place a tray before him and give him one cup to drink, and remove the tray from before him and he will be healed. They did this, and he was healed. said: I am certain that the man I seek is here, He searched for and found said I will leave this if they will kill that man, I will not disclose But if they will beat him, I will disclose
llm_translation: They said to him: What should we do to him? He is a man of the king! He said to them: Bring a cup before him, and pour him a cup of wine, and remove the cup from before him and let him drink. They did so and he drank. He said: I know for certain that this man is the one I seek. He hurried after him and found him. He said: If we kill him, we will not be safe, and if we inform against him, we will be safe.

hebrew_text: אַתְיוּהּ לְקַמֵּיהּ, עַיְּילֵיהּ לְאִדְּרוֹנָא וְטַרְקֵיהּ לְבָבָא בְּאַנְפֵּיהּ. בְּעָא רַחֲמֵי, פְּרַק אֲשִׁיתָא עֲרַק וַאֲזַל לְאַגְמָא. הֲוָה יָתֵיב אַגִּירְדָּא דְּדִקּוּלָא וְקָא גָרֵיס. קָא מִיפַּלְגִי בִּמְתִיבְתָּא דִרְקִיעָא: אִם בַּהֶרֶת קוֹדֶמֶת לְשֵׂעָר לָבָן – טָמֵא, וְאִם שֵׂעָר לָבָן קוֹדֵם לַבַּהֶרֶת – טָהוֹר.
human_translation: they brought before They took him into vestibule [ le’idrona ] and closed the door before him. prayed for mercy, the wall crumbled. He fled and went to a swamp. He was sitting on the stump of a palm and studying in the heavenly academy were disagreeing if snow-white leprous sore [ baheret ] preceded the white hair ritually impure, but if the white hair preceded the baheret , pure.
llm_translation: He came before him, he took him to the chamber and his beard to the gate with his fingers. He asked for mercy, he broke a clod and went to the marsh. He was sitting on a beam of a palm tree and was sawing. He was disputing in the question of the firmament: If leprosy precedes white hair - impure, and if white hair precedes leprosy - pure.

hebrew_text: סָפֵק – הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא אוֹמֵר: טָהוֹר, וְכוּלְּהוּ מְתִיבְתָּא דִרְקִיעָא אָמְרִי: טָמֵא. וְאָמְרִי: מַאן נוֹכַח? נוֹכַח רַבָּה בַּר נַחְמָנִי. דְּאָמַר רַבָּה בַּר נַחְמָנִי: אֲנִי יָחִיד בִּנְגָעִים, אֲנִי יָחִיד בְּאֹהָלוֹת.
human_translation: uncertainty The Holy One, Blessed be He, says: pure, but every the heavenly academy says: impure. And they said: Who can arbitrate Rabba bar Naḥmani arbitrate, as Rabba bar Naḥmani said: I am preeminent in leprosy I am preeminent in tents.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Safek - hakadosh baruch hu omer: tahor, vekullehu metivta dirki'a amri: tamei. Ve'amri: man nochach? Nochach Rabbah bar Nachmani. De'amar Rabbah bar Nachmani: ani yachid binegaim, ani yachid be'ohalot. English translation: Doubt - the Holy One, blessed be He, says: pure, and all the chambers of the firmament say: impure. And they say: Who opposes? Opposes Rabbah bar Nachmani. For Rabbah bar Nachmani said: I am unique in matters of afflictions, I am unique in tents.

hebrew_text: שַׁדַּרוּ שְׁלִיחָא בָּתְרֵיהּ. לָא הֲוָה מָצֵי מַלְאַךְ הַמָּוֶת לְמִקְרַב לֵיהּ, מִדְּלָא הֲוָה קָא פָסֵיק פּוּמֵּיהּ מִגִּרְסֵיהּ. אַדְּהָכִי נְשַׁב זִיקָא וַאֲוַושׁ בֵּינֵי קְנֵי, סְבַר גּוּנְדָּא דְפָרָשֵׁי הוּא. אֲמַר: תִּינַח נַפְשֵׁיהּ דְּהָהוּא גַּבְרָא, וְלָא יִמְּסַר בִּידָא דְמַלְכוּתָא.
human_translation: They sent a messenger after him the Angel of Death was unable to approach as his mouth did not cease from his study. In the meantime, a wind blew and howled between the branches. thought an infantry battalion [ gunda ] He said: Let that man, die and not be given over to the hands of the government.
llm_translation: They sent a messenger after him. The Angel of Death could not approach him, as he did not interrupt his learning. Meanwhile, a crack in the wall occurred, and he was distracted between the beams, thinking it was time to leave. He said: "Let the soul of that man be taken, and not be delivered into the hands of the kingdom."

hebrew_text: כִּי הֲוָה קָא נָיְחָא נַפְשֵׁיהּ, אֲמַר: טָהוֹר, טָהוֹר. יָצָאת בַּת קוֹל וְאָמְרָה: אַשְׁרֶיךָ רַבָּה בַּר נַחְמָנִי שֶׁגּוּפְךָ טָהוֹר, וְיָצָאתָה נִשְׁמָתְךָ בְּטָהוֹר. נְפַל פִּתְקָא מֵרְקִיעָא בְּפוּמְבְּדִיתָא: רַבָּה בַּר נַחְמָנִי נִתְבַּקֵּשׁ בִּיְשִׁיבָה שֶׁל מַעְלָה. נְפַקוּ אַבָּיֵי וְרָבָא וְכוּלְּהוּ רַבָּנַן לְאִיעֲסוֹקֵי בֵּיהּ. לָא הֲווֹ יָדְעִי דּוּכְתֵּיהּ. אֲזַלוּ לְאַגְמָא חֲזוֹ צִפְּרֵי דִּמְטַלְּלִי וְקָיְימִי, אָמְרִי: שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ הָתָם הוּא.
human_translation: As he was dying, he said pure; pure. A Divine Voice emerged and said: Happy are you, Rabba bar Naḥmani, as your body is pure and your soul left with Pure. A note [ pitka ] fell from heaven in Pumbedita. Rabba bar Naḥmani was summoned to the heavenly academy, Abaye and Rava and all of the Rabbis went out to tend to his they did not know the location of his They went to the swamp saw birds forming a shade and hovering said: conclude from this he is there.
llm_translation: When he was feeling relieved, he said: Pure, pure. A heavenly voice came out and said: "Rabbi Nahman's son, fortunate are you, for your body is pure, and your soul departed in purity." A note fell from the sky into the study hall: "Rabbi Nahman's son is sought in the heavenly academy." Abaye, Rava, and all the sages went to engage with it. They did not know where it went. They went to the marsh, saw the birds flying and standing, and said: "Learn from this, as it is there."

hebrew_text: סַפְדוּהּ תְּלָתָא יוֹמֵי וּתְלָתָא לֵילָוָתָא. נְפַל פִּתְקָא: כׇּל הַפּוֹרֵשׁ יְהֵא בְּנִידּוּי. סַפְדוּהּ שִׁבְעָה יוֹמֵי. נְפַל פִּתְקָא: לְכוּ לְבֵיתְכֶם לְשָׁלוֹם.
human_translation: lamented him for three days and three nights. A note fell Anyone who removes himself shall be ostracized. they lamented him seven days. note fell Go to your homes in peace.
llm_translation: Mourn for him three days and three nights. A document fell: Anyone who separates shall be under a ban. Mourn for him seven days. A document fell: Go to your homes in peace.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא יוֹמָא דְּנָח נַפְשֵׁיהּ דַּלְיֵיהּ זַעְפָּא וּדְרִי לְהָהוּא טַיָּיעָא כִּי רְכִיב גַּמְלָא מֵהַאי גִּיסָא דִּנְהַר פָּפָּא וְשַׁדְיֵיהּ בְּהָךְ גִּיסָא. אֲמַר: מַאי הַאי? אָמְרִי לֵיהּ: נָח נַפְשֵׁיהּ דְּרַבָּה בַּר נַחְמָנִי. אָמַר לְפָנָיו: רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם! כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא דִּידָךְ הוּא, וְרַבָּה בַּר נַחְמָנִי דִּידָךְ, אַתְּ דְּרַבָּה וְרַבָּה דִּידָךְ – אַמַּאי קָא מַחְרְבַתְּ לֵיהּ לְעָלְמָא? נָח זַעְפָּא.
human_translation: that day when died, a hurricane lifted a certain Arab [ taya’a ] while he was riding camel. from one side of the Pappa River and threw him onto the other side. He said: What is this? said to him: Rabba bar Naḥmani has died. He said before Master of the Universe! The entire world is Yours and Rabba bar Naḥmani is Yours. You are to Rabba and Rabba is to You, why are You destroying the world The storm subsided.
llm_translation: That day that Nach went to cool off and rest in that valley, for he was riding a camel from this side of the river Pappa, and he placed it in that valley. He said: What is this? They said to him: Nach, the soul of Rabba bar Nachmani. He said before Him: Master of the universe! All the world is Yours, and Rabba bar Nachmani is Yours, and You are Rabba and Rabba is Yours - why are You destroying him from the world? Nach was angry.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן חֲלַפְתָּא בַּעַל בָּשָׂר הֲוָה. יוֹמָא חַד הֲוָה חַמִּימָא לֵיהּ, הֲוָה סָלֵיק וְיָתֵיב אַשִּׁינָּא דְטוּרָא. אֲמַר לַהּ לִבְרַתֵּיהּ: בִּתִּי, הָנִיפִי עָלַי בִּמְנִיפָא, וַאֲנִי אֶתֵּן לִיךְ כִּכָּרִין דְּנֵרְדְּ. אַדְּהָכִי נְשַׁבָא זִיקָא, אֲמַר: כַּמָּה כַּכְּרִין דְּנֵרְדְּ לְמָרֵי דֵּיכִי.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Ḥalafta was obese. One day he was hot went and sat on a mountain boulder He said to his daughter: My daughter, fan me with a fan, and I will give you packages of spikenard. In the meantime, wind blew. He said: How many packages of spikenard to the overseers of this
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Chalfta was a butcher. One day, it was hot for him, so he went up and sat in the shade of a fig tree. He said to his daughter: "My daughter, bring me some watermelon." And I will give you a denar of silver. Meanwhile, the sun set, he said: "How many denarii of silver for the master of the fig tree?"

hebrew_text: הַכֹּל כְּמִנְהַג הַמְּדִינָה וְכוּ׳. הַכֹּל לְאֵתוֹיֵי מַאי? לְאֵתוֹיֵי בְּאַתְרָא דִּנְהִיגִי מִכְרַךְ רִיפְתָּא וּמִשְׁתֵּה אַנְפָּקָא. דְּאִי אָמַר לְהוּ קַדִּימוּ וְאַיְיתֵי לְכוּ, אָמְרוּ לֵיהּ: לָא כֹּל כְּמִינָךְ.
human_translation: all in accordance with the regional custom. What is added All? to include a place where it is customary eat bread and drink a quarter- [ anpaka ] of wine. As, if say to them: Arise early and I will bring you they may say to him: It is not in your power
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Everything according to the custom of the land, etc. Everything for what purpose? For the purpose of the conduct of the market, the sale of bread, and the serving of wine. For if one says to them, "Go ahead and bring it," they say to him: "Not everything is according to your custom." English translation:

hebrew_text: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּרַבָּן יוֹחָנָן בֶּן מַתְיָא שֶׁאָמַר לִבְנוֹ צֵא וּשְׂכוֹר וְכוּ׳. מַעֲשֶׂה לִסְתּוֹר! חַסּוֹרֵי מְחַסְּרָא וְהָכִי קָתָנֵי: וְאִם פָּסַק לָהֶם מְזוֹנוֹת
human_translation: an incident involving Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Matya, who said to his son: Go out and hire incident, to contradict is incomplete and this is teaching: but if
llm_translation: The story of Rabban Yochanan ben Matyah, who said to his son, "Go out and hire, etc." A story to conceal! The needy are in need, and thus it is taught: "And if their sustenance ceases for them."

hebrew_text: רִיבָּה לָהֶן. וּמַעֲשֶׂה נָמֵי בְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן מַתְיָא שֶׁאָמַר לִבְנוֹ צֵא שְׂכוֹר לָנוּ פּוֹעֲלִים, הָלַךְ וּפָסַק לָהֶן מְזוֹנוֹת. וּכְשֶׁבָּא אֵצֶל אָבִיו, אָמַר לוֹ: בְּנִי, אֲפִילּוּ אַתָּה עוֹשֶׂה לָהֶן כִּסְעוּדַת שְׁלֹמֹה בִּשְׁעָתוֹ, לֹא יָצָאתָ יְדֵי חוֹבָתְךָ עִמָּהֶן, שֶׁהֵן בְּנֵי אַבְרָהָם יִצְחָק וְיַעֲקֹב.
human_translation: he has increased them, And also incident involving Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Matya, who said to his son: Go out hire laborers for us. went, and pledged sustenance for them And when he came to his father said to him: My son, even if you were to prepare a feast for them like that of Solomon in his time, you would not have fulfilled your obligation to them, as they are the descendants of Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob.
llm_translation: Dispute for them. And there was an incident with Rabbi Yochanan ben Matya, who said to his son, "Go hire workers for us." He went and provided them with sustenance. And when he came to his father, he said to him, "My son, even if you were to provide for them the feast of Solomon in his time, you would not have fulfilled your obligation with them, for they are the descendants of Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob."

hebrew_text: לְמֵימְרָא דִּסְעוּדְתָּא דְּאַבְרָהָם אָבִינוּ עֲדִיפָא מִדִּשְׁלֹמֹה? וְהָכְתִיב: ״וַיְהִי לֶחֶם שְׁלֹמֹה לְיוֹם אֶחָד שְׁלֹשִׁים כֹּר סֹלֶת וְשִׁשִּׁים כֹּר קָמַח. עֲשָׂרָה בָּקָר בְּרִאִים וַעֲשָׂרָה בָּקָר רְעִי וּמֵאָה צֹאן לְבַד מֵאַיָּל וּצְבִי וְיַחְמוּר וּבַרְבֻּרִים אֲבוּסִים״! וְאָמַר גּוּרְיוֹן בֶּן אֲסִטְיוֹן מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב: הַלָּלוּ לַעֲמִילָן שֶׁל טַבָּחִים. וְרַבִּי יִצְחָק אָמַר: הַלָּלוּ לְצִיקֵי קְדֵירָה.
human_translation: to say that the feast of Abraham, our forefather, was superior to that of Solomon? But isn’t it written: “And Solomon’s provision for one day was thirty measures of fine flour, and sixty measures of meal; ten fat oxen, and twenty oxen out of the pastures, and a hundred sheep, beside harts, and gazelles, and roebucks, and fatted fowl” And Guryon ben Asteyon says in the name of Rav: These were for the bakers’ well-worked dough [ la’amilan ] And Rabbi Yitzḥak says: These for pudding, in a pot.
llm_translation: In the matter of the meal of our father Abraham, is it superior to that of Solomon? And it is written: "Solomon's provision for one day was thirty cors of fine flour, and sixty cors of meal, ten fat oxen, and twenty oxen out of the pastures, and a hundred sheep, besides harts, and gazelles, and roebucks, and fatted fowl." And Gurion the son of Astiyo, in the name of Rav, said: These are the provisions of the butchers. And Rabbi Yitzchak said: These are the delicacies of the pot.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: אֶלֶף נָשִׁים הָיוּ לִשְׁלֹמֹה, כׇּל אַחַת וְאַחַת עָשְׂתָה לוֹ בְּבֵיתָה כָּךְ. מַאי טַעְמָא – זוֹ סְבוּרָה שֶׁמָּא אֶצְלִי סוֹעֵד הַיּוֹם, וְזוֹ סְבוּרָה שֶׁמָּא אֶצְלִי סוֹעֵד הַיּוֹם. וְאִילּוּ גַּבֵּי אַבְרָהָם כְּתִיב: ״וְאֶל הַבָּקָר רָץ אַבְרָהָם וַיִּקַּח בֶּן בָּקָר רַךְ וָטוֹב״. וְאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: ״בֶּן בָּקָר״ – אֶחָד, ״רַךְ״ – שְׁנַיִם, ״וְטוֹב״ – שְׁלֹשָׁה!
human_translation: And Rabbi Yitzḥak says: Solomon had one thousand wives, each one of whom would prepare for him at her home such What is the reason This reasoned: Perhaps he will feast with me today, and that reasoned: Perhaps he will feast with me today. But with regard to Abraham, it is written: “And Abraham ran to the herd, and fetched a calf tender and good” and Rav Yehuda says Rav says, “A calf” one; “tender” two; “and good” three
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yitzchak said: Solomon had a thousand wives, each one would do for him in her house thus. What is the reason? This one thinks perhaps I have a son today, and that one thinks perhaps I have a son today. And regarding Abraham, it is written: "And Abraham ran to the herd and took a tender and good calf." And Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: "A calf" - one, "tender" - two, "and good" - three!

hebrew_text: הָתָם תְּלָתָא תּוֹרֵי לִתְלָתָא גַּבְרֵי, הָכָא לְכׇל יִשְׂרָאֵל וִיהוּדָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״יְהוּדָה וְיִשְׂרָאֵל רַבִּים כַּחוֹל אֲשֶׁר עַל הַיָּם״.
human_translation: There, three oxen for three people, here, for the entire Israel and Judah, as it is stated: “Judah and Israel were many, as the sand which is by the sea
llm_translation: There, three rows to three men, here, to all Israel and Judah, as it is said: "Judah and Israel are many as the sand which is by the sea."

hebrew_text: מַאי ״בַּרְבּוּרִים אֲבוּסִים״? אָמַר רַב: שֶׁאוֹבְסִים אוֹתָן בְּעַל כׇּרְחָן. וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: שֶׁאֲבוּסִים וְעוֹמְדִים מֵאֲלֵיהֶם. וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: מְבִיאִין תּוֹר מִמַּרְעִיתוֹ בִּדְלָא אֲנִיס, וְתַרְנְגוֹלֶת מֵאַשְׁפָּתָהּ בִּדְלָא אֲנִיסָא.
human_translation: What “fatted fowl [ avusim ]”? Rav says: that they are fed [ ovsim ] by force. Shmuel says: that they were fattened [ avusim ] and maintained on their own accord, Rabbi Yoḥanan says: they would bring from his herd an ox that had never been forced and a hen from its coop that had never been forced
llm_translation: What is "Barburim Avusim"? Rav said: that they force them against their will. And Shmuel said: that they are forced and standing against them. And Rabbi Yochanan said: they bring the ox from its pen without being forced, and the hen from its coop without being forced.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מוּבְחָר שֶׁבַּבְּהֵמוֹת – שׁוֹר, מוּבְחָר שֶׁבָּעוֹפוֹת – תַּרְנְגוֹלֶת. אָמַר אַמֵּימָר: זָגְתָּא אוּכַּמְתָּא בֵּי בַטְנִיתָא דְּמִשְׁתַּכְחָא בֵּינֵי עַצְרֵי, דְּלָא מָצְיָא פָּסְיָא קַנְיָא.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says: The choicest of cattle ox. The choicest of fowl hen. Ameimar says: a fattened, black hen [ zagta ] that is found among vats, which cannot take a step a reed,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: The choicest of domestic animals - an ox, the choicest of birds - a hen. Amemar said: If you have found a piece of fat in the stomach of an animal that is located between the ribs, it is not considered a blemish.

hebrew_text: ״וְאֶל הַבָּקָר רָץ אַבְרָהָם״, אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: ״בֶּן בָּקָר״ – אֶחָד, ״רַךְ״ – שְׁנַיִם, ״וְטוֹב״ – שְׁלֹשָׁה. וְאֵימָא חַד, כִּדְאָמְרִי אִינָשֵׁי: רַכִּיךְ וְטָב!
human_translation: “And Abraham ran to the herd, Rav Yehuda says Rav says: “A calf” one; “tender” two; “and good” three But say one as people say tender and good?
llm_translation: "And to the cattle ran Abraham," Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: "Ben Bakar" - one, "Rach" - two, "and good" - three. But say one, as people say: soft and good!

hebrew_text: אִם כֵּן, לִכְתּוֹב ״רַךְ טוֹב״, מַאי ״וָטוֹב״ – שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ לִדְרָשָׁה. אֵימָא תְּרֵי! מִדְּ״טוֹב״ לִדְרָשָׁה, ״רַךְ״ נָמֵי לִדְרָשָׁה.
human_translation: If so, let write: Tender, good. What “and good,” Conclude from this for an exposition say two From “good” for an exposition, “tender” also for an exposition
llm_translation: If so, to write "soft good," what is "and good" - learn from it for interpretation. Say two! From "good" for interpretation, "soft" also for interpretation.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רַבָּה בַּר עוּלָּא, וְאִיתֵּימָא רַב הוֹשַׁעְיָא, וְאִיתֵּימָא רַב נָתָן בְּרַבִּי הוֹשַׁעְיָא: ״וַיִּתֵּן אֶל הַנַּעַר וַיְמַהֵר לַעֲשׂוֹת אֹתוֹ״, כֹּל חַד וְחַד יַהֲבֵיהּ לְנַעַר חַד. ״וַיִּקַּח חֶמְאָה וְחָלָב וּבֶן הַבָּקָר אֲשֶׁר עָשָׂה וַיִּתֵּן לִפְנֵיהֶם״, דְּקַמָּא קַמָּא דִּמְטָיא, אַיְיתִי לְקַמַּיְיהוּ.
human_translation: Rabba bar Ulla raises an objection, and some say Rav Hoshaya, and some say Rav Natan, son of Rabbi Hoshaya, “And he gave it to the servant; and he hastened to prepare it” gave each and every to one servant, “And he took curd, and milk, and the calf which he had dressed, and set it before them” that as each calf arrived he brought it before them,
llm_translation: Rabba bar Ulla raises an objection, and some say it was Rav Hoshaya, and some say it was Rav Natan, son of Rabbi Hoshaya: "And he gave it to the lad and hurried to do it," each and every one gave it to one lad. "And he took butter and milk and the calf that he had made and set it before them," as soon as the first portion was brought, he brought it before them.

hebrew_text: וּלְמָה לִי תְּלָתָא? תִּסְגֵּי בְּחַד. אָמַר רַב חָנָן בַּר רָבָא: כְּדֵי לְהַאֲכִילָן שָׁלֹשׁ לְשׁוֹנוֹת בְּחַרְדָּל. אָמַר רַבִּי תַּנְחוּם בַּר חֲנִילַאי: לְעוֹלָם אַל יְשַׁנֶּה אָדָם מִן הַמִּנְהָג, שֶׁהֲרֵי מֹשֶׁה עָלָה לַמָּרוֹם וְלֹא אָכַל לֶחֶם, מַלְאֲכֵי הַשָּׁרֵת יָרְדוּ לְמַטָּה וְאָכְלוּ לֶחֶם. וְאָכְלוּ סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ?! אֶלָּא אֵימָא: נִרְאוּ כְּמִי שֶׁאָכְלוּ וְשָׁתוּ.
human_translation: And why do I three One should be sufficient Rav Ḥanan bar Rava said: in order to feed three tongues with mustard, Rabbi Tanḥum bar Ḥanilai says: A person should never deviate from the custom, as Moses ascended to on high and did not eat bread the ministering angels descended down and they ate bread. And they ate enter your mind Rather, say they appeared as though they ate and drank.
llm_translation: "Why do I need three? Let it be with one." Rav Hanan bar Rava said: "In order to feed them three types of mustard." Rabbi Tanchum bar Chanilai said: "A person should never deviate from custom, for behold, Moses ascended on high and did not eat bread, while the ministering angels descended below and ate bread. Did your mind not consider this?! Rather say: They appeared as if they ate and drank."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: כׇּל מַה שֶּׁעָשָׂה אַבְרָהָם לְמַלְאֲכֵי הַשָּׁרֵת בְּעַצְמוֹ – עָשָׂה הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא לְבָנָיו בְּעַצְמוֹ. וְכׇל מַה שֶּׁעָשָׂה אַבְרָהָם עַל יְדֵי שָׁלִיחַ – עָשָׂה הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא לְבָנָיו עַל יְדֵי שָׁלִיחַ.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says Rav says: Every action that Abraham performed himself for the ministering angels, the Holy One, Blessed be He, performed Himself for descendants. And every action that Abraham performed through a messenger, the Holy One, Blessed be He, performed for his descendants through a messenger.
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: Whatever Abraham did for the ministering angels himself, the Holy One, blessed be He, did for His children Himself. And whatever Abraham did through a messenger, the Holy One, blessed be He, did for His children through a messenger.

hebrew_text: ״וְאֶל הַבָּקָר רָץ אַבְרָהָם״, ״וְרוּחַ נָסַע מֵאֵת ה׳״. ״וַיִּקַּח חֶמְאָה וְחָלָב״, ״הִנְנִי מַמְטִיר לָכֶם לֶחֶם מִן הַשָּׁמָיִם״.
human_translation: “And Abraham ran to the herd” “And there went forth a wind from the Lord, “And he took curd and milk” “Behold, I will cause to rain bread from heaven for you”
llm_translation: "And to the cattle ran Avraham," "And a wind traveled from Hashem." "And he took butter and milk," "Behold, I am causing bread to rain down for you from heaven."

hebrew_text: ״וְהוּא עֹמֵד עֲלֵיהֶם תַּחַת הָעֵץ״, ״הִנְנִי עֹמֵד לְפָנֶיךָ שָּׁם עַל הַצּוּר [וְגוֹ׳]״. ״וְאַבְרָהָם הֹלֵךְ עִמָּם לְשַׁלְּחָם״, ״וַה׳ הֹלֵךְ לִפְנֵיהֶם יוֹמָם״.
human_translation: “And he stood by them under the tree, “Behold, I will stand before you there upon the rock “And Abraham went with them to bring them on the way” “And the Lord went before them by day”
llm_translation: "And he stood over them under the tree," "Here I am standing before you there on the rock etc.," "And Abraham went with them to send them," "And the Lord went before them by day."

hebrew_text: ״יֻקַּח נָא מְעַט מַיִם״, ״וְהִכִּיתָ בַצּוּר וְיָצְאוּ מִמֶּנּוּ מַיִם וְשָׁתָה הָעָם״.
human_translation: “Let now a little water be fetched” “And you shall strike the rock, and there shall come water out of it, that the people may drink”
llm_translation: "Please take a little water," "and you shall strike the rock, and water will come out of it, and the people will drink."

hebrew_text: וּפְלִיגָא דְּרַבִּי חָמָא בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי חָמָא בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא, וְכֵן תָּנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: בִּשְׂכַר שְׁלֹשָׁה – זָכוּ לִשְׁלֹשָׁה. בִּשְׂכַר ״חֶמְאָה וְחָלָב״ – זָכוּ לַמָּן; בִּשְׂכַר ״וְהוּא עֹמֵד עֲלֵיהֶם״ – זָכוּ לְעַמּוּד הֶעָנָן; בִּשְׂכַר ״יֻקַּח נָא מְעַט מַיִם״ – זָכוּ לִבְאֵרָהּ שֶׁל מִרְיָם.
human_translation: And disagrees that of Rabbi Ḥama, son of Rabbi Ḥanina. As Rabbi Ḥama, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, says, and likewise the school of Rabbi Yishmael taught: In reward for three merited three In reward for curd and milk, merited the manna; in reward for: “And he stood [ omed ] by them,” merited the pillar [ amud ] of cloud; in reward for “Let now a little water be fetched,” merited the well of Miriam.
llm_translation: Disagreement of Rabbi Ḥama son of Rabbi Ḥanina. For Rabbi Ḥama son of Rabbi Ḥanina said, and so too was taught in the school of Rabbi Yishmael: In reward for three things, they merited three things. In reward for "butter and milk," they merited the manna; in reward for "and He stood over them," they merited the pillar of cloud; in reward for "please take a little water," they merited Miriam's well.

hebrew_text: ״יֻקַּח נָא מְעַט מַיִם וְרַחֲצוּ רַגְלֵיכֶם״, אָמַר רַבִּי יַנַּאי בְּרַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל, אָמְרוּ לוֹ: וְכִי בְּעַרְבִיִּים חֲשַׁדְתָּנוּ, שֶׁהֵם מִשְׁתַּחֲוִים לַאֲבַק רַגְלֵיהֶם, כְּבָר יָצָא מִמֶּנּוּ יִשְׁמָעֵאל.
human_translation: “Let now a little water be fetched and wash your feet” Rabbi Yannai, son of Rabbi Yishmael, said said to Are you suspicious that we are Arabs who bow to the dust of their feet? Yishmael has already issued from him,
llm_translation: "Please take a little water and wash your feet," Rabbi Yannai son of Rabbi Yishmael said. They said to him: Did you suspect us of being idolaters, who bow down to the dust on their feet, for Yishmael has already left us."

hebrew_text: ״וַיֵּרָא אֵלָיו ה׳ בְּאֵלֹנֵי מַמְרֵא וְהוּא יֹשֵׁב פֶּתַח הָאֹהֶל כְּחֹם הַיּוֹם״. מַאי ״כְּחוֹם הַיּוֹם״? אָמַר רַבִּי חָמָא בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: אוֹתוֹ הַיּוֹם יוֹם שְׁלִישִׁי שֶׁל מִילָה שֶׁל אַבְרָהָם הָיָה, וּבָא הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא לִשְׁאוֹל בְּאַבְרָהָם, הוֹצִיא הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא חַמָּה מִנַּרְתִּיקָהּ כְּדֵי שֶׁלֹּא יַטְרִיחַ אוֹתוֹ צַדִּיק בְּאוֹרְחִים.
human_translation: “And the Lord appeared to him by the terebinths of Mamre, as he sat in the tent door in the heat of the day” What “the heat of the day”? Rabbi Ḥama, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, says: That day was the third day after Abraham’s circumcision, and the Holy One, Blessed be He, came to inquire of Abraham. The Holy One, Blessed be He, removed the sun from its sheath in order not to bother that righteous one with guests,
llm_translation: "And Hashem appeared to him in the plains of Mamre, while he was sitting at the entrance of the tent in the heat of the day." What is meant by "in the heat of the day"? Rabbi Chama son of Rabbi Chanina said: That day was the third day from the circumcision of Abraham, and the Holy One, blessed be He, came to inquire after Abraham. The Holy One, blessed be He, brought forth the sun from its sheath so that the righteous one would not be troubled by wayfarers.

hebrew_text: שַׁדְּרֵיהּ לֶאֱלִיעֶזֶר לְמִיפַּק לְבָרָא. נְפַק וְלָא אַשְׁכַּח, אָמַר: לָא מְהֵימְנָא לָךְ. הַיְינוּ דְּאָמְרִי תַּמָּן: לֵית הֵימָנוּתָא בְּעַבְדֵי. נְפַק אִיהוּ חַזְיֵיהּ לְהַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא דְּקָאֵי אַבָּבָא. הַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב: ״אַל נָא תַעֲבֹר מֵעַל עַבְדֶּךָ״.
human_translation: He sent Eliezer to go outside went out but did not find said to him: I do not believe you. This that there, say: Slaves do not have any credibility. himself went out and saw the Holy One, Blessed be He, standing at the entrance This is as it is written: do not leave Your servant”
llm_translation: He sent to Eliezer to bring a son. He went and did not find, he said: I do not trust you. That is what they say there: There is no trust in servants. He went, he saw him standing at the gate of the Holy One, blessed be He. That is what is written: "Please do not pass by your servant."

hebrew_text: כֵּיוָן דַּחֲזָא דְּקָא אָסַר וְשָׁרֵי, אֲמַר: לָאו אוֹרַח אַרְעָא לְמֵיקַם הָכָא. הַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיִּשָּׂא עֵינָיו וַיַּרְא וְהִנֵּה שְׁלֹשָׁה אֲנָשִׁים נִצָּבִים עָלָיו וַיַּרְא וַיָּרׇץ לִקְרָאתָם״. מֵעִיקָּרָא אֲתוֹ קָמוּ עֲלֵיהּ, כִּי חַזְיוּהּ דַּהֲוָה לֵיהּ צַעֲרָא, אֲמַרוּ: לָאו אוֹרַח אַרְעָא לְמֵיקַם הָכָא.
human_translation: Once saw tying and untying said: not proper conduct to stand here, This is as it is written: “And he lifted up his eyes and looked, and, behold, three men stood over him; and when he saw them, he ran to meet them” Initially, they came and stood over him. Upon seeing that he was in pain, they said: not proper conduct to stand here.
llm_translation: Since he saw that he was both forbidden and permitted, he said: "This is not the way of the land to establish here." That is as it is written: "And he lifted his eyes and saw, and behold, three men were standing over him, and he saw and ran to meet them." Initially they came towards him, for they saw that he was in distress, they said: "This is not the way of the land to establish here."

hebrew_text: מַאן נִינְהוּ שְׁלֹשָׁה אֲנָשִׁים – מִיכָאֵל וְגַבְרִיאֵל וּרְפָאֵל. מִיכָאֵל שֶׁבָּא לְבַשֵּׂר אֶת שָׂרָה, רְפָאֵל שֶׁבָּא לְרַפֵּא אֶת אַבְרָהָם, גַּבְרִיאֵל אֲזַל לְמֶהְפְּכַיהּ לִסְדוֹם. וְהָא כְּתִיב: ״וַיָּבֹאוּ שְׁנֵי הַמַּלְאָכִים סְדֹמָה בָּעֶרֶב״! דַּאֲזַל מִיכָאֵל בַּהֲדֵיהּ לְשֵׁזְבֵיהּ לְלוֹט. דַּיְקָא נָמֵי, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיַּהֲפֹךְ אֶת הֶעָרִים הָאֵל״, וְלָא כְּתִיב ״וַיַּהַפְכוּ״ – שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: Who are these three men? Michael, Gabriel, and Raphael: Michael, who came to announce Sarah Raphael, who came to heal Abraham Gabriel, went to overturn Sodom. But it is written: “And the two angels came to Sodom in the evening” that Michael went along with to save Lot. is also precise, as it is written: “And he overturned those cities” and it is not written: They overturned Conclude from it
llm_translation: Who are these three men? - Michael, Gabriel, and Raphael. Michael came to announce to Sarah, Raphael came to heal Abraham, and Gabriel went to overturn Sodom. And it is written: "And the two angels came to Sodom in the evening!" For Michael went ahead to save Lot. It is specifically stated, as it is written: "And He overturned those cities," and it does not say "they overturned" - learn from this.

hebrew_text: מַאי שְׁנָא לְגַבֵּי אַבְרָהָם, דִּכְתִיב: ״כֵּן תַּעֲשֶׂה כַּאֲשֶׁר דִּבַּרְתָּ״, וּמַאי שְׁנָא לְגַבֵּי לוֹט, דִּכְתִיב:
human_translation: What is different with regard to Abraham, as it is written: “So do, as you have said” and what is different with regard to Lot, as it is written:
llm_translation: What is different regarding Abraham, as it is written: "So shall you do as you have spoken," and what is different regarding Lot, as it is written:

hebrew_text: ״וַיִּפְצַר בָּם מְאֹד״? אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: מִכָּאן שֶׁמְּסָרְבִין לְקָטָן, וְאֵין מְסָרְבִין לַגָּדוֹל.
human_translation: “And he urged them greatly” Rabbi Elazar says: From here that one may decline a lesser man, but one may not decline a great man.
llm_translation: "And He urged them greatly"? Rabbi Elazar said: From here we learn that one may insist with a minor, but one may not insist with an adult.

hebrew_text: כְּתִיב: ״וְאֶקְחָה פַת לֶחֶם״, וּכְתִיב: ״וְאֶל הַבָּקָר רָץ אַבְרָהָם״, אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: מִכָּאן שֶׁצַּדִּיקִים אוֹמְרִים מְעַט וְעוֹשִׂים הַרְבֵּה, רְשָׁעִים אוֹמְרִים הַרְבֵּה, וַאֲפִילּוּ מְעַט אֵינָם עוֹשִׂים.
human_translation: It is written: “And I will fetch a morsel of bread, and it is written: “And Abraham ran to the herd, Rabbi Elazar said: From here that righteous say little and do much, wicked say much and do not do even a little.
llm_translation: It is written: "And I will take a morsel of bread," and it is written: "And Abraham ran to the cattle." Rabbi Elazar said: From here righteous individuals say little and do much, wicked individuals say much, and even that little they do not do.

hebrew_text: מְנָלַן, מֵעֶפְרוֹן. מֵעִיקָּרָא כְּתִיב: ״אֶרֶץ אַרְבַּע מֵאוֹת שֶׁקֶל כֶּסֶף״, וּלְבַסּוֹף כְּתִיב: ״וַיִּשְׁמַע אַבְרָהָם אֶל עֶפְרוֹן וַיִּשְׁקֹל אַבְרָהָם לְעֶפְרֹן אֶת הַכֶּסֶף אֲשֶׁר דִּבֶּר בְּאׇזְנֵי בְנֵי חֵת אַרְבַּע מֵאוֹת שֶׁקֶל כֶּסֶף עֹבֵר לַסֹּחֵר״, דְּלָא שְׁקַל מִינֵּיהּ אֶלָּא קִנְטְרֵי, דְּאִיכָּא דּוּכְתָּא דְּקָרֵי לֵיהּ לְתִיקְלָא ״קִנְטֵירָא״.
human_translation: From where do we from Ephron. Initially, it is written “A piece of land worth four hundred shekels of silver, ultimately it is written: “And Abraham listened to Ephron; and Abraham weighed to Ephron the silver, which he had named in the hearing of the children of Heth, four hundred shekels of silver, current money with the merchant” that he took from him only centenaria [ kantarei ], as there is a place where they call a shekel a centenarius.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: From where do we derive the value of the cave of Machpelah? From Ephron. Initially it is written: "Four hundred shekels of silver, the land," and ultimately it is written: "And Abraham listened to Ephron, and Abraham weighed out to Ephron the silver that he had spoken of in the hearing of the sons of Heth, four hundred shekels of silver, accepted by the merchant," indicating that he did not weigh out from it except the coins, for there is a place where it is called "coins."

hebrew_text: כְּתִיב ״קֶמַח״ וּכְתִיב ״סֹלֶת״. אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: מִכָּאן שֶׁהָאִשָּׁה צָרָה עֵינֶיהָ בְּאוֹרְחִים יוֹתֵר מִן הָאִישׁ.
human_translation: It is written: “Flour,” and it is written: “Fine flour.” Rabbi Yitzḥak says: From here that a woman is more stingy with guests than a man.
llm_translation: It is written "kemach" and it is written "solet." Rabbi Yitzchak said: From here we learn that a woman is more particular about the ways of the household than a man.

hebrew_text: כְּתִיב ״לוּשִׁי וַעֲשִׂי עֻגוֹת״, וּכְתִיב ״וַיִּקַּח חֶמְאָה וְחָלָב וּבֶן הַבָּקָר״, וְאִילּוּ לֶחֶם לָא אַיְיתִי לְקַמַּיְיהוּ!
human_translation: It is written: “Knead it, and make cakes” it is written: “And he took curd, and milk, and the calf and yet he did not bring bread before them
llm_translation: It is written, "Lushi and make cakes," and it is written, "And he took curds and milk and the calf," but bread he did not bring before them!

hebrew_text: אָמַר אֶפְרַיִם מִקְשָׁאָה תַּלְמִידוֹ שֶׁל רַבִּי מֵאִיר מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר: אַבְרָהָם אָבִינוּ אוֹכֵל חוּלִּין בְּטׇהֳרָה הָיָה, וְשָׂרָה אִמֵּנוּ אוֹתוֹ הַיּוֹם פֵּירְסָה נִדָּה.
human_translation: Efrayim Miksha’a, disciple of Rabbi Meir, says in the name of Rabbi Meir: Abraham, our forefather, would eat non-sacred food in ritual purity, And Sarah, our foremother, menstruated that day,
llm_translation: Ephraim said: The student of Rabbi Meir from his name Rabbi Meir: "Our father Abraham ate non-sacred food in purity, and our mother Sarah today separated herself as a menstruant."

hebrew_text: ״וַיֹּאמְרוּ אֵלָיו אַיֵּה שָׂרָה אִשְׁתֶּךָ וַיֹּאמֶר הִנֵּה בָאֹהֶל״, לְהוֹדִיעַ שֶׁשָּׂרָה אִמֵּנוּ צְנוּעָה הָיְתָה. אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב וְאִיתֵּימָא רַבִּי יִצְחָק: יוֹדְעִים הָיוּ מַלְאֲכֵי הַשָּׁרֵת שֶׁשָּׂרָה אִמֵּנוּ בָּאֹהֶל הָיְתָה, אֶלָּא מַאי ״בָּאֹהֶל״ – כְּדֵי לְחַבְּבָהּ עַל בַּעְלָהּ.
human_translation: “And they said to him: Where is Sarah your wife? And he said: Behold, in the tent” to inform that Sarah, our foremother, was a modest woman, Rav Yehuda says Rav says, and some say Rabbi Yitzḥak The ministering angels, knew that Sarah, our foremother, was inside the tent. Rather, what In the tent? in order to endear her to her husband,
llm_translation: "And they said to him, 'Where is Sarah your wife?' And he said, 'Behold, in the tent.'" (Genesis 18:9) To inform that Sarah our matriarch was modest. Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav, and some say it was Rabbi Yitzchak: The ministering angels knew that Sarah our matriarch was in the tent, but why 'in the tent'? - To praise her in front of her husband."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא אָמַר: כְּדֵי לְשַׁגֵּר לָהּ כּוֹס שֶׁל בְּרָכָה. תָּנֵי מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי יוֹסֵי: לָמָּה נָקוּד עַל אַיּוֹ שֶׁבְּ״אֵלָיו״ – לִימְּדָה תּוֹרָה דֶּרֶךְ אֶרֶץ, שֶׁיִּשְׁאַל אָדָם בָּאַכְסַנְיָא שֶׁלּוֹ. וְהָאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: אֵין שׁוֹאֲלִין בִּשְׁלוֹם אִשָּׁה כְּלָל! עַל יְדֵי בַּעְלָהּ שָׁאנֵי.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, says: in order to send her cup of blessing. It is taught in the name of Rabbi Yosei: Why are there dots upon the letters alef , yod , vav in “to him [ eilav ]”? The Torah is teaching the proper etiquette, that a person should inquire of his hostess But doesn’t Shmuel say: One may not inquire about the welfare of a woman at all, by means of her husband is different.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Chanina, said: In order to send her a cup of blessing. It was taught in the name of Rabbi Yosei: Why is there a dot on the letter "ayin" in the word "aleha"? - The Torah taught proper behavior, that a person should ask for his host's permission. And Shmuel said: One should not inquire about a woman's well-being at all! Through her husband, ask.

hebrew_text: ״אַחֲרֵי בְלֹתִי הָיְתָה לִּי עֶדְנָה״, אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: אַחַר שֶׁנִּתְבַּלָּה הַבָּשָׂר וְרַבּוּ הַקְּמָטִין – נִתְעַדֵּן הַבָּשָׂר וְנִתְפַּשְּׁטוּ הַקְּמָטִין, וְחָזַר הַיּוֹפִי לִמְקוֹמוֹ.
human_translation: After I am waxed old [ veloti ] shall I have pleasure [ edna ]” Rav Ḥisda says: After the skin had worn out [ nitballa ] and become full of wrinkles, the skin once again became soft [ nitadden ] and her wrinkles smoothed out, and beauty returned to its place.
llm_translation: "After Bilhah, I had another child," Rav Ḥisdah said: After the flesh became worn out and the wrinkles increased, the flesh became adorned and the wrinkles smoothed out, and beauty returned to its place."

hebrew_text: כְּתִיב ״וַאדֹנִי זָקֵן״, וּכְתִיב ״וַאֲנִי זָקַנְתִּי״ – דְּלָא מוֹתֵיב הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא כִּדְקָאָמְרָה אִיהִי.
human_translation: It is written “And my lord is old” and it is written: and I am old?” the Holy One, Blessed be He, did not repeat that said,
llm_translation: It is written, "And my master is old," and it is written, "And I have become old" - for the Holy One, blessed be He, does not contradict Himself, as it is said.

hebrew_text: תָּנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: גָּדוֹל שָׁלוֹם, שֶׁאֲפִילּוּ הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא שִׁינָּה בּוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַתִּצְחַק שָׂרָה בְּקִרְבָּהּ וְגוֹ׳ וַאדֹנִי זָקֵן״, וּכְתִיב: ״וַיֹּאמֶר ה׳ אֶל אַבְרָהָם וְגוֹ׳ וַאֲנִי זָקַנְתִּי״.
human_translation: The school of Rabbi Yishmael taught: Peace is great that even the Holy One, Blessed be He, altered as it is stated: “And Sarah laughed within herself, and my lord is old,” and it is written: “And the Lord said to Abraham: and I am old?”
llm_translation: Mishnah of the School of Rabbi Ishmael: Great is peace, for even the Holy One, blessed be He, changed it for him, as it is said: "And Sarah laughed within herself, etc." and it is written: "And the Lord said to Abraham, etc." and "I am old."

hebrew_text: ״וַתֹּאמֶר מִי מִלֵּל לְאַבְרָהָם הֵנִיקָה בָנִים שָׂרָה״, כַּמָּה בָּנִים הֵנִיקָה שָׂרָה? אָמַר רַבִּי לֵוִי: אוֹתוֹ הַיּוֹם שֶׁגָּמַל אַבְרָהָם אֶת יִצְחָק בְּנוֹ עָשָׂה סְעוּדָה גְּדוֹלָה. הָיוּ כׇּל אוּמּוֹת הָעוֹלָם מְרַנְּנִים וְאוֹמְרִים: רְאִיתֶם זָקֵן וּזְקֵנָה שֶׁהֵבִיאוּ אֲסוּפִי מִן הַשּׁוּק וְאוֹמְרִים: בְּנֵינוּ הוּא, וְלֹא עוֹד אֶלָּא שֶׁעוֹשִׂין מִשְׁתֶּה גָּדוֹל לְהַעֲמִיד דִּבְרֵיהֶם!
human_translation: “And she said: Who would have said to Abraham that Sarah should nurse children?” How many children did Sarah nurse? Rabbi Levi says: That day when Abraham weaned his son Isaac, he prepared a great feast. All of the nations of the world were gossiping and saying See old man and old woman who brought a foundling from the market and are saying: He is our son, and moreover they are making a great feast to bolster their claim.
llm_translation: "And she said, 'Who would have said to Abraham that Sarah would nurse children?' How many children did Sarah nurse? Rabbi Levi said: On that day that Abraham weaned his son Isaac, he made a great feast. All the nations of the world were murmuring and saying: 'Have you seen an old man and an old woman who brought a child from the market and are saying, "He is our son"? And not only that, but they are making a great feast to establish their words!"

hebrew_text: מָה עָשָׂה אַבְרָהָם אָבִינוּ – הָלַךְ וְזִימֵּן כׇּל גְּדוֹלֵי הַדּוֹר, וְשָׂרָה אִמֵּנוּ זִימְּנָה אֶת נְשׁוֹתֵיהֶם. וְכׇל אַחַת וְאַחַת הֵבִיאָה בְּנָהּ עִמָּהּ, וּמְנִיקָתָהּ לֹא הֵבִיאָה, וְנַעֲשָׂה נֵס בְּשָׂרָה אִמֵּנוּ וְנִפְתְּחוּ דַּדֶּיהָ כִּשְׁנֵי מַעֲיָינוֹת, וְהֵנִיקָה אֶת כּוּלָּן. וַעֲדַיִין הָיוּ מְרַנְּנִים וְאוֹמְרִים: ״אִם שָׂרָה הֲבַת תִּשְׁעִים שָׁנָה תֵּלֵד, אַבְרָהָם בֶּן מֵאָה שָׁנָה יוֹלִיד״? מִיָּד נֶהְפַּךְ קְלַסְתֵּר פָּנִים שֶׁל יִצְחָק וְנִדְמָה לְאַבְרָהָם, פָּתְחוּ כּוּלָּם וְאָמְרוּ: ״אַבְרָהָם הוֹלִיד אֶת יִצְחָק״.
human_translation: What did Abraham, our forefather, do? He went and invited all of the great of generation, and Sarah, our foremother, invited their wives. Each and every one brought her child with her but did not bring her wet nurse. And a miracle occurred to Sarah, our foremother, and her breasts were opened like two springs, and she nursed all And still were gossiping and saying if Sarah, ninety years of age, can give birth, can Abraham, one hundred years of age, father Immediately, the countenance of Isaac’s face transformed and appeared of Abraham. Everyone exclaimed and said: “Abraham fathered Isaac”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: What did our father Abraham do? - He went and invited all the great men of the generation, and our mother Sarah invited their wives. And each and every one brought their son with them, but their wet nurses they did not bring. And a miracle occurred with our mother Sarah, and her breasts opened like two fountains, and she nursed them all. And they were still murmuring and saying: "If Sarah, who is ninety years old, will give birth, will Abraham, who is one hundred years old, father a child?" Immediately the facial features of Isaac changed to resemble Abraham, they all opened their mouths and said: "Abraham fathered Isaac."

hebrew_text: עַד אַבְרָהָם לֹא הָיָה זִקְנָה. מַאן דַּהֲוָה בָּעֵי (לְמִשְׁתַּעֵי) [לְאִישְׁתַּעוֹיֵי] בַּהֲדֵי אַבְרָהָם – מִשְׁתַּעֵי בַּהֲדֵי יִצְחָק. בַּהֲדֵי יִצְחָק מִשְׁתַּעֵי בַּהֲדֵי אַבְרָהָם. אֲתָא אַבְרָהָם בְּעָא רַחֲמֵי וַהֲוָה זִקְנָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְאַבְרָהָם זָקֵן בָּא בַּיָּמִים״.
human_translation: Until Abraham, there was no aging, one who wanted to speak to Abraham speak to Isaac, to Isaac speak to Abraham, Abraham came and prayed for mercy, and aging was as it is stated: “And Abraham was old, well stricken in age”
llm_translation: Until Abraham, there was no old age. Whoever wants to grow old with Abraham - grows old with Isaac. Whoever grows old with Isaac - grows old with Abraham. Abraham prayed for mercy and grew old, as it is said: "And Abraham was old, advanced in days."

hebrew_text: עַד יַעֲקֹב לָא הֲוָה חוּלְשָׁא. אֲתָא יַעֲקֹב בְּעָא רַחֲמֵי וַהֲוָה חוּלְשָׁא, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיֹּאמֶר לְיוֹסֵף הִנֵּה אָבִיךָ חֹלֶה״. עַד דַּאֲתָא אֱלִישָׁע לָא הֲוָה דְּחָלֵישׁ וְאִתְּפַח. אֲתָא אֱלִישָׁע בְּעָא רַחֲמֵי וְאִתְּפַח, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וֶאֱלִישָׁע חָלָה אֶת חׇלְיוֹ אֲשֶׁר יָמוּת בּוֹ״ – מִכְּלָל דְּחָלָה חֹלִי אַחֲרִיתִי.
