hebrew_text: דְּאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: וּבִמְנָאֲפִים – עַד שֶׁיִּרְאוּ כְּדֶרֶךְ הַמְנָאֲפִים. וּבְכִלְאַיִם – עַד שֶׁיַּכְנִיס כְּמִכְחוֹל בַּשְּׁפוֹפֶרֶת.
human_translation: As Shmuel says: With regard to adulterers, from when they appear as in the manner of adulterers, But of diverse kinds, that he inserted like a brush into a tube.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "d'amr Shmuel: u'vimna'afim - ad sheyir'u kederech hamna'afim. uvekil'ayim - ad sheyachnis kemichchol bashpofe'ret." English translation: "For Samuel said: And in cases of suspected adultery - until they appear like actual adulterers. And in cases of mixed species - until it enters like a needle in a sieve."

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רַב אַחָדְבוּי בַּר אַמֵּי: אִילּוּ נֶאֱמַר ״בְּהֶמְתְּךָ לֹא תַרְבִּיעַ״ הָיִיתִי אוֹמֵר, לֹא יֶאֱחוֹז אָדָם הַבְּהֵמָה בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁעוֹלֶה עָלֶיהָ זָכָר, תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״כִּלְאַיִם״.
human_translation: Rav Aḥadvoi bar Ami raises an objection Had stated “You shall not let your cattle copulate,” I would have said a person may not hold the animal when a male mounts it. the verse states: with a diverse kind”
llm_translation: The Gemara raises an objection: Rav Ahadboi bar Ammi asked: If it were stated, "You shall not mate your animal," I would say that a person should not hold the animal at the time when the male mounts it. The Torah teaches otherwise: "Different kinds."

hebrew_text: לָאו מִכְּלָל דְּכִלְאַיִם אֲחִיזָה נָמֵי לָא? מַאי ״אֲחִיזָה״ – הַכְנָסָה, וְאַמַּאי קָרֵי לַהּ ״אֲחִיזָה״ – לִישָּׁנָא מְעַלְּיָא.
human_translation: not by inference that with regard to diverse kinds, holding is also not What Holding? the insertion and why does call it holding? a euphemism.
llm_translation: Not from the principle of both hands, is holding considered? What is "holding" - bringing in, and why is it called "holding" - to elevate.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: מִין בְּמִינוֹ, מוּתָּר לְהַכְנִיס כְּמִכְחוֹל בַּשְּׁפוֹפֶרֶת, וַאֲפִילּוּ מִשּׁוּם פְּרִיצוּתָא לֵיכָּא. מַאי טַעְמָא – בַּעֲבִידְתֵּיהּ טְרִיד. מֵתִיב רַב אַחָדְבוּי בַּר אַמֵּי:
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says: species with of its species, permitted to insert like a brush into a tube, and there is not even due to licentiousness What is the reason occupied with his work, Rav Aḥadvoi bar Ami raises an objection
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said: A species with its own kind, it is permitted to insert it like a needle into a sifter, and even due to promiscuity it is not prohibited. What is the reason? - It is engaged in its natural behavior. Rav Achadboi bar Ammi objected:

hebrew_text: אִלּוּ נֶאֱמַר ״בְּהֶמְתְּךָ לֹא תַרְבִּיעַ״ הָיִיתִי אוֹמֵר: לֹא יֶאֱחוֹז אָדָם אֶת הַבְּהֵמָה כְּדֵי שֶׁיַּעֲלֶה עָלֶיהָ זָכָר, תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״כִּלְאַיִם״. כִּלְאַיִם הוּא דְּאָסוּר, הָא מִין בְּמִינוֹ – שְׁרֵי.
human_translation: Had stated: “You shall not let your cattle copulate,” I would have said a person may not hold the animal when a male mounts it. the verse states: “With a diverse kind” it is diverse kinds that is prohibited, species with of its species is permitted.
llm_translation: If it were stated, "With your animal you shall not mate," I would say: A person should not hold onto the animal in order for a male to mount it. The Torah teaches us: "Different kinds." Different kinds are prohibited, but a species with its own kind is permitted.

hebrew_text: וּמִין בְּמִינוֹ נָמֵי: אֲחִיזָה אִין, הַכְנָסָה – לָא! מַאי ״אֲחִיזָה״ – הַכְנָסָה, וְאַמַּאי קָרֵי לֵיהּ ״אֲחִיזָה״ – לִישָּׁנָא מְעַלְּיָא.
human_translation: And even species with of its species, holding, yes, inserting, no, What is holding inserting. And why does call it holding? a euphemism.
llm_translation: Species with its own species is prohibited. Grasping - no, insertion - yes! What is "grasping"? - Insertion. And why is it called "grasping"? - Due to its higher level.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: הָא מִילְּתָא בְּעוֹ מִינַּאי דְּבֵי רַב נְחֶמְיָה רֵישׁ גָּלוּתָא: מַהוּ לְהַכְנִיס מִין וּמִינוֹ וְשֶׁאֵינוֹ מִינוֹ לַדִּיר? כֵּיוָן דְּאִיכָּא מִינֵיהּ – בָּתַר מִינֵיהּ גְּרִיר. אוֹ דִלְמָא אֲפִילּוּ הָכִי לָא? וּפְשַׁטִי לְהוּ לְאִיסּוּרָא דְּלָא כְּהִלְכְתָא, מִשּׁוּם פְּרִיצוּתָא דְּעַבְדֵי.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: This matter was asked of me of the house Rav Neḥemya, the Exilarch: What is bringing into pen species of its species and of a species different from it? since there is its species, it will be drawn after its species, or perhaps not even this And I resolved for them that a prohibition, not in accordance with the halakha . due to the immorality of the slaves.
llm_translation: Rav Ashe said: The matter is with the heretics of the house of Rav Nechemyah, head of the exile: What is the law regarding bringing in a species and its kind, and one that is not its kind, into a dwelling? Once there is its kind present, its kind drags after it. Or perhaps even so, not? And they have interpreted it as a prohibition not according to the law, because of the brazenness of their actions.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הָיָה עוֹשֶׂה בְּיָדָיו אֲבָל לֹא בְּרַגְלָיו, בְּרַגְלָיו אֲבָל לֹא בְּיָדָיו, אֲפִילּוּ בִּכְתֵיפוֹ – הֲרֵי זֶה אוֹכֵל. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: עַד שֶׁיַּעֲשֶׂה בְּיָדָיו וּבְרַגְלָיו.
human_translation: was performing with his hands but not with his feet, with his feet but not with his hands, even with his shoulder, this one may eat Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says: unless he performs with his hands and with his feet.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: If one performs the act with his hands but not with his feet, with his feet but not with his hands, even with his shoulder - he is liable. Rabbi Yosei, the son of Rabbi Yehuda, says: One is not liable until he performs the act with his hands and with his feet.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאי טַעְמָא? ״כִּי תָבֹא בְּכֶרֶם רֵעֶךָ״, בְּכֹל מַאי דְּעָבֵיד.
human_translation: What is the reason “When you come into your neighbor’s vineyard” to any he performs.
llm_translation: Gemara: What is the reason? "When you enter your neighbor's vineyard," with regard to anything that he does.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: עַד שֶׁיַּעֲשֶׂה בְּיָדָיו וּבְרַגְלָיו. מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה? כִּי שׁוֹר, מָה שׁוֹר עַד שֶׁיַּעֲשֶׂה בְּיָדָיו וּבְרַגְלָיו – אַף פּוֹעֵל עַד שֶׁיַּעֲשֶׂה בְּיָדָיו וּבְרַגְלָיו.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says: unless he performs with his hands and with his feet. What is the reasoning of Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda? like ox; just as an ox unless it is performing with its hands and with its feet, so too a laborer unless he is performing with his hands and with his feet.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says: Until he does with his hands and with his feet. What is the reason for Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda? Just as an ox, what is an ox until he does with his hands and with his feet - so too a worker until he does with his hands and with his feet.

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי רַבָּה בַּר רַב הוּנָא: דָּשׁ בַּאֲווֹזִין וְתַרְנְגוֹלִים, לְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה מַהוּ? בְּכׇל כֹּחוֹ בָּעֵינַן – וְהָא אִיכָּא, אוֹ דִלְמָא בְּיָדָיו וּבְרַגְלָיו בָּעֵינַן – וְהָא לֵיכָּא. תֵּיקוּ.
human_translation: Rabba bar Rav Huna raised a dilemma: threshed with geese and chickens, what is according to Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda? we require with all its force, and is here, or perhaps we require with its hands and with its feet, and this not shall stand
llm_translation: The question of Rabba, son of Rav Huna: Regarding threshing with goats and chickens, according to Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, what is the law? Do we require all his strength - but there is a case, or perhaps we require it to be done with his hands and feet - but there is no case. This matter shall remain unresolved.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר אֲבוּהּ: פּוֹעֲלִים, עַד שֶׁלֹּא הִילְּכוּ שְׁתִי וָעֵרֶב בַּגַּת – אוֹכְלִין עֲנָבִים וְאֵין שׁוֹתִין יַיִן. מִשֶּׁהִילְּכוּ שְׁתִי וָעֵרֶב בַּגַּת – אוֹכְלִין עֲנָבִים וְשׁוֹתִין יַיִן.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman says Rabba bar Avuh says: laborers until they have walked lengthwise and crosswise in the winepress, they may eat grapes, they may not drink wine, Once they have walked lengthwise and crosswise in the winepress, they may eat grapes and drink wine.
llm_translation: Rav Nahman said, Rabba bar Avuh said: Workers, until they do not walk two and a half miles in the winepress - they eat grapes and do not drink wine. Once they walk two and a half miles in the winepress - they eat grapes and drink wine.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הָיָה עוֹשֶׂה בִּתְאֵנִים – לֹא יֹאכַל בַּעֲנָבִים. בַּעֲנָבִים – לֹא יֹאכַל בִּתְאֵנִים. אֲבָל מוֹנֵעַ אֶת עַצְמוֹ עַד שֶׁמַּגִּיעַ לִמְקוֹם יָפוֹת וְאוֹכֵל.
human_translation: was performing with figs he may not eat grapes; with grapes he may not eat figs, But may hold himself back until he reaches a place of good and eat
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who was eating figs may not eat grapes. If one was eating grapes, they may not eat figs. However, one restrains oneself until reaching a beautiful place and then eats.

hebrew_text: וְכוּלָּן לֹא אָמְרוּ אֶלָּא בִּשְׁעַת מְלָאכָה, אֲבָל מִשּׁוּם הָשֵׁב אֲבֵידָה לַבְּעָלִים אָמְרוּ: פּוֹעֲלִין אוֹכְלִין בַּהֲלִיכָתָן מֵאוֹמָן לְאוֹמָן, וּבַחֲזִירָתָן מִן הַגַּת, וּבַחֲמוֹר כְּשֶׁהִיא פּוֹרֶקֶת.
human_translation: And all of these said only at the time of work. But due to restore lost property to its owners, they said laborers may eat as they walk from row to row, and upon their return from the winepress. And with regard to a donkey, when it is being unloaded.
llm_translation: And all of them did not say except at the time of work, but due to the principle of returning a lost item to its owner they said: Workers eat while on their way from one craftsman to another, and on their return from the winepress, and on a donkey when it is unburdened.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: עוֹשֶׂה בְּגֶפֶן זֶה, מַהוּ שֶׁיֹּאכַל בְּגֶפֶן אַחֵר? מִמִּין שֶׁאַתָּה נוֹתֵן לְכֵלָיו שֶׁל בַּעַל הַבַּיִת בָּעֵינַן – וְהָא אִיכָּא, אוֹ דִלְמָא מִמַּה שֶׁאַתָּה נוֹתֵן לְכֵלָיו שֶׁל בַּעַל הַבַּיִת בָּעֵינַן – וְהָא לֵיכָּא?
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before performing on this vine, what is that he may eat from another vine? we require from the type that you are placing into the homeowner’s vessels, and is here, or perhaps we require from that which you are placing into the homeowner’s vessels, and not here?
llm_translation: The Gemara raises a question: If one makes wine with this vine, what about eating grapes from another vine? Do we require it to be of the same species that you give to the animals of the homeowner? But is there a distinction, or perhaps we require it to be from that which you give to the animals of the homeowner? And is there not a distinction?

hebrew_text: וְאִם תִּמְצֵי לוֹמַר עוֹשֶׂה בְּגֶפֶן זֶה לֹא יֹאכַל בְּגֶפֶן אַחֵר, שׁוֹר בִּמְחוּבָּר הֵיכִי אָכֵיל? אָמַר רַב שִׁישָׁא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אִידִי: בִּשְׁרָכָא.
human_translation: And if you say performing on this vine may not eat from another vine, an ox with attached how can eat? Rav Sheisha, son of Rav Idi, said: of long branches
llm_translation: "And if you might say, 'He who does with this vine, he shall not eat of another vine,' how can one eat a connected ox? Rav Shisha, son of Rav Idi, said: 'With its flesh.'"

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: הָיָה עוֹשֶׂה בִּתְאֵנִים – לֹא יֹאכַל בַּעֲנָבִים. הָא תְּאֵנִים וּתְאֵנִים דּוּמְיָא דִּתְאֵנִים וַעֲנָבִים – אוֹכֵל. וְאִי אָמְרַתְּ: עוֹשֶׂה בְּגֶפֶן זֶה אֵינוֹ אוֹכֵל בְּגֶפֶן אַחֵר, הֵיכִי מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ? אָמַר רַב שִׁישָׁא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אִידִי: בְּמוּדְלֵית.
human_translation: Come hear was performing with figs he may not eat grapes. figs and figs, similar to figs and grapes he may eat. Now, if you say performing on this vine may not eat from another vine, how can you find these Rav Sheisha, son of Rav Idi, said: with regard to a hanging
llm_translation: Come and hear: One who is engaged in figs - may not eat grapes. But figs and figs are similar to figs and grapes - he may eat. And if you say: one who is engaged in one vineyard may not eat from another vineyard, how do you find it? Rav Shisha, son of Rav Idi, said: with a modality.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: אֲבָל מוֹנֵעַ אֶת עַצְמוֹ עַד שֶׁמַּגִּיעַ לִמְקוֹם הַיָּפוֹת, וְאוֹכֵל. וְאִי אָמְרַתְּ עוֹשֶׂה בְּגֶפֶן זֶה אוֹכֵל בְּגֶפֶן אַחֵר, נֵיזִיל וְנֵיתֵי וְנֵיכוֹל! הָתָם מִשּׁוּם בִּיטּוּל מְלָאכָה לָא קָא מִיבַּעְיָא לַן, כִּי קָא מִבַּעְיָא לַן הֵיכָא דְּאִיכָּא אִשְׁתּוֹ וּבָנָיו, מַאי?
human_translation: Come hear But may hold himself back until he reaches a place of good and eat. And if you say performing on this vine may eat from another vine, let him go and bring and eat. There, due to neglect of work We do not raise the dilemma When dilemma was raised before us, where his wife and children are What
llm_translation: Come and hear: But one restrains himself until he reaches a beautiful place, and eats. And if you say, "He makes with this vine, he eats with another vine, let us go and bring and eat!" There, because of the prohibition of labor, we do not require it, but where there is a wife and children, what is the law?

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: וְכוּלָּם לֹא אָמְרוּ אֶלָּא בִּשְׁעַת מְלָאכָה, אֲבָל מִפְּנֵי הָשֵׁב אֲבֵידָה לַבְּעָלִים אָמְרוּ: פּוֹעֲלִים אוֹכְלִים בַּהֲלִיכָתָן מֵאוֹמָן לְאוֹמָן וּבַחֲזִירָתָן מִן הַגַּת.
human_translation: Come hear And all of these they said only at the time of work. But due to restore lost property to its owners, said laborers may eat as they walk from row to row, and upon their return from the winepress.
llm_translation: Come and hear: And all of them did not say except during work, but due to the Sabbath they said: Workers may eat while walking from one craftsman to another, and during their return from the winepress.

hebrew_text: סַבְרוּהָ מְהַלֵּךְ כְּעוֹשֶׂה מַעֲשֶׂה דָּמֵי, וּמִשּׁוּם הָשֵׁב אֲבֵידָה לִבְעָלִים הוּא דְּאָכֵיל, מִדְּאוֹרָיְיתָא לָא אָכֵיל. אַלְמָא עוֹשֶׂה בְּגֶפֶן זֶה אֵינוֹ אוֹכֵל בְּגֶפֶן אַחֵר.
human_translation: assumed walking is considered like performing labor, And it is due to restore lost property to its owner that he may eat, by Torah law he may not eat. Apparently, one who performing on this vine may not eat from another vine,
llm_translation: They thought he walks like one who does a deed of blood, and because he returns a lost item to its owner, he is considered as if he ate from the Torah he does not eat. This implies that one who does a deed with this vine does not eat from another vine.

hebrew_text: לָא, לְעוֹלָם אֵימָא לָךְ: עוֹשֶׂה בְּגֶפֶן זֶה אוֹכֵל בְּגֶפֶן אַחֵר, וּמְהַלֵּךְ לָאו כְּעוֹשֶׂה מַעֲשֶׂה דָּמֵי.
human_translation: No; actually, I say to you one who performing on this vine may eat from another vine, walking is not considered like performing labor.
llm_translation: Not, forever I will say to you: doing with vine this eating with vine other, and walking not like doing act similar.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי סַבְרוּהָ מְהַלֵּךְ לָאו כְּעוֹשֶׂה מַעֲשֶׂה דָּמֵי. וְהַיְינוּ טַעְמָא דְּמִדְּאוֹרָיְיתָא לָא אָכֵיל – מִשּׁוּם דְּלָאו כְּעוֹשֶׂה מַעֲשֶׂה דָּמֵי, הָא עוֹשֶׂה מַעֲשֶׂה – אָכֵיל מִדְּאוֹרָיְיתָא, אַלְמָא עוֹשֶׂה בְּגֶפֶן זֶה אוֹכֵל בְּגֶפֶן אַחֵר!
human_translation: There are who say assumed walking is not like performing labor, and this is the reason that he may not eat by Torah law: Because he is not like performing labor. This performing labor, he may eat by Torah law. Apparently, that one who performing on this vine may eat from another vine.
llm_translation: There are those who say: One who thinks, it is not like one who does, similar to the act of doing. And this is the reason why one who does not eat from the Torah, because it is not like the act of doing, but one who does the act - eats from the Torah. Therefore, one who does with this vine, can eat from another vine!

hebrew_text: לָא. לְעוֹלָם אֵימָא לָךְ: עוֹשֶׂה בְּגֶפֶן זֶה אֵינוֹ אוֹכֵל בְּגֶפֶן אַחֵר,
human_translation: No; actually I say to you one who performing on this vine may not eat from another vine,
llm_translation: Not. Always say to you: "One who works with this vine does not eat from another vine."

hebrew_text: וּמְהַלֵּךְ כְּעוֹשֶׂה מַעֲשֶׂה דָּמֵי.
human_translation: but walking is considered like performing labor.
llm_translation: And walks like one who does the work of Damai.

hebrew_text: וּבַחֲמוֹר כְּשֶׁהִיא פּוֹרֶקֶת. כְּשֶׁהִיא פּוֹרֶקֶת מֵהֵיכָן אָכְלָה! אֵימָא עַד שֶׁתְּהֵא פּוֹרֶקֶת. תְּנֵינָא לְהָא, דְּתָנוּ רַבָּנַן: חֲמוֹר וְגָמָל אוֹכְלִים מִמַּשּׂאוֹי שֶׁעַל גַּבֵּיהֶן, וּבִלְבַד שֶׁלֹּא יִטּוֹל בְּיָדוֹ וְיַאֲכִילֵם.
human_translation: And with regard to a donkey, when it is being unloaded. From where can it eat when it is being unloaded? say: until it is unloaded. We learn that which the Sages taught A donkey and a camel may eat from the load on their backs, provided that does not take in his hand and feed them.
llm_translation: And with a donkey when it is unloading. When it is unloading, from where did it eat! Say, until it unloads. We learned in a Mishnah, for the Rabbis taught: A donkey and a camel may eat from their burden on their backs, as long as one does not take it in his hand and feed them.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אוֹכֵל פּוֹעֵל קִישּׁוּת אֲפִילּוּ בְּדִינָר, כּוֹתֶבֶת וַאֲפִילּוּ בְּדִינָר. רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר חַסָּמָא אוֹמֵר: לֹא יֹאכַל פּוֹעֵל יָתֵר עַל שְׂכָרוֹ, וַחֲכָמִים מַתִּירִין. אֲבָל מְלַמְּדִין אֶת הָאָדָם שֶׁלֹּא יְהֵא רַעַבְתָן וִיהֵא סוֹתֵם אֶת הַפֶּתַח בְּפָנָיו.
human_translation: A laborer may eat cucumbers even to a dinar; dates, and even to a dinar. Rabbi Elazar Ḥisma says: A laborer may not eat more than his wages, but the Rabbis permit But one teaches a person not to be a glutton and thereby close the opening in his face.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One may eat, hire workers, or rent a donkey for a dinar, and may write a document, even for a dinar. Rabbi Elazar Chasama says: A worker should not eat more than his wage, but the Sages permit it. However, they instruct a person not to become hungry and to close the door in front of him.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ חֲכָמִים הַיְינוּ תַּנָּא קַמָּא? אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ אֲבָל מְלַמְּדִין: לְתַנָּא קַמָּא לֵית לֵיהּ ״מְלַמְּדִין״. לְרַבָּנַן אִית לְהוּ ״מְלַמְּדִין״.
human_translation: the Rabbis is the first tanna . between them But one teaches According to the first tanna , he does not one teaches According to the Rabbis, they do one teaches
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "Gemara: Are the Sages the same as the first Tanna? There is a difference between them, but they teach: The first Tanna does not have 'teach.' The Rabbis have 'teach.'"

hebrew_text: אִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ דְּרַב אַסִּי. דְּאָמַר רַב אַסִּי: אֲפִילּוּ לֹא שְׂכָרוֹ אֶלָּא לִבְצוֹר אֶשְׁכּוֹל אֶחָד – אוֹכְלוֹ. וְאָמַר רַב אַסִּי: אֲפִילּוּ לֹא בָּצַר אֶלָּא אֶשְׁכּוֹל אֶחָד – אוֹכְלוֹ.
human_translation: If you wish, say that between them by Rav Asi. As Rav Asi says: Even if he hired him to harvest only one cluster, may eat. And Rav Asi said: Even if he harvested only one cluster, he may eat it.
llm_translation: If you wish, say: Is there a difference between them according to Rav Assi? For Rav Assi said: Even if he only hired him to gather one cluster of grapes - he may eat it. And Rav Assi said: Even if he only gathered one cluster of grapes - he may eat it.

hebrew_text: וּצְרִיכָא, דְּאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן הָךְ קַמַּיְיתָא – מִשּׁוּם דְּלָא אִיכָּא לְמִיתַּב לְכֵלָיו שֶׁל בַּעַל הַבַּיִת. אֲבָל הֵיכָא דְּאִיכָּא לְמִיתַּב לְכֵלָיו שֶׁל בַּעַל הַבַּיִת – אֵימָא לִיתֵּב בְּרֵישָׁא, וַהֲדַר לֵיכוֹל.
human_translation: And necessary As, had he taught us this first one, because there is no to place in the homeowner’s vessels, But if there is to place in the homeowner’s vessels, say he should first place and then eat.
llm_translation: And it is necessary, for if we were to hear this before you - because there is no place for the husband's vessels to sit. But where there is a place for the husband's vessels to sit - say he should sit at the beginning, and then he can eat.

hebrew_text: וְאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן בְּהָא – דְּאֶפְשָׁר לְקַיּוֹמֵי לְבַסּוֹף, אֲבָל הָכָא דְּלָא אֶפְשָׁר לְקַיּוֹמֵי לְבַסּוֹף – אֵימָא לָא, צְרִיכָא.
human_translation: And had taught us this that ultimately it is possible to fulfill But where ultimately it is not possible to fulfill say not necessary.
llm_translation: And if we were to say regarding this - that it is possible to establish it ultimately, but here where it is not possible to establish it ultimately - say no, it is necessary.

hebrew_text: אִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ דְּרַב. דְּאָמַר רַב: מָצָאתִי מְגִילַּת סְתָרִים בֵּי רַבִּי חִיָּיא, וְכָתוּב בָּהּ: אִיסִי בֶּן יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: ״כִּי תָבֹא בְּכֶרֶם רֵעֶךָ״ – בְּבִיאַת כׇּל אָדָם הַכָּתוּב מְדַבֵּר.
human_translation: If you wish, say that the between by Rav. As Rav says: I found a concealed scroll, in Rabbi Ḥiyya’s house, and it was written in it: Isi ben Yehuda says “When you come into your neighbor’s vineyard the verse is speaking of the entry of any person
llm_translation: If you wish, say: Is there a difference between them regarding Rav? For Rav said: I found a scroll of hidden things in the house of Rabbi Chiya, and it is written in it: "Issi son of Yehuda says, 'When you enter your neighbor's vineyard' - the verse speaks of the arrival of any person.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב: לָא שְׁבַק אִיסִי חַיֵּי לְכׇל בְּרִיָּה.
human_translation: And Rav said Isi has not left any livelihood for any entity,
llm_translation: And Rav said: "Isi did not leave any living creature."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי, אַמְרִיתַהּ לִשְׁמַעְתָּא קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב כָּהֲנָא: דִּלְמָא בְּעוֹשִׂין בִּסְעוּדָּתָם, דְּעָבְדוּ וְאָכְלוּ? אָמַר לִי: אֲפִילּוּ הָכִי, נִיחָא לֵיהּ לְאִינִישׁ (לְאוֹגַר אָגוֹרֵי) [דְּנוֹגַר אֲגִירֵי] וְנִיקְטְפֵיהּ לְפַרְדֵּיסֵיהּ, וְלָא נֵיתוֹ כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא (וְאָכְלוּ לֵיהּ).
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: I stated halakha before Rav Kahana, perhaps who perform for their meal; that they perform and eat. said to me: Even so, a person prefers to hire to pluck his orchard, rather than everyone come and eat it,
llm_translation: Rav Ashe said, "I said it before Rav Kahana: Perhaps they were engaged in their meal, they made and ate?" He said to me: Even so, it is preferable for a person (to hire laborers) and have them gather it into his barn, rather than all the people of the world (and they eat it).

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: פּוֹעֵל מִשֶּׁלּוֹ הוּא אוֹכֵל, אוֹ מִשֶּׁל שָׁמַיִם הוּא אוֹכֵל?
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before a laborer he eat from his own or he eat from of Heaven?
llm_translation: He asked them: Does a worker eat from his own labor, or does he eat from the work of heaven?

hebrew_text: לְמַאי נָפְקָא מִינַּהּ? דְּאָמַר: תְּנוּ לְאִשְׁתִּי וּבָנַי. אִי אָמְרַתְּ: מִשֶּׁלּוֹ הוּא אוֹכֵל – יָהֲבִינַן לְהוּ, אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ: מִשֶּׁל שָׁמַיִם הוּא אוֹכֵל – לְדִידֵיהּ זַכִּי לֵיהּ רַחֲמָנָא, לְאִשְׁתּוֹ וּבָנָיו – לָא זַכִּי לְהוּ רַחֲמָנָא, מַאי?
human_translation: What is the difference where he says: give to my wife and children If you say he eats from his own we give them but if you say he eats from of Heaven, the Merciful One entitles himself but the Merciful One does not entitle his wife and children What,
llm_translation: For what purpose does it come out? Because he said: "Give to my wife and sons." If you say: "He is eating from his own," we should give it to him. But if you say: "He is eating from Heaven's," may the Merciful One have mercy on him, for his wife and sons - the Merciful One does not have mercy on them. What is the reason?

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: אוֹכֵל פּוֹעֵל קִישּׁוּת וַאֲפִילּוּ בְּדִינָר, כּוֹתֶבֶת וַאֲפִילּוּ בְּדִינָר. אִי אָמְרַתְּ מִשֶּׁלּוֹ הוּא אוֹכֵל – אֲגִיר בְּדַנְקָא אָכֵיל בְּזוּזָא?! וְאֶלָּא מַאי – מִשֶּׁל שָׁמַיִם הוּא אוֹכֵל, סוֹף סוֹף אֲגִיר בְּדַנְקָא אָכֵיל בְּזוּזָא! אֶלָּא מַאי אִית לָךְ לְמֵימַר – רַחֲמָנָא זַכִּי לֵיהּ, הָכָא נָמֵי רַחֲמָנָא זַכִּי לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Come hear A laborer may eat cucumbers, and even to a dinar; dates, and even to a dinar. If you say he eats from his own he was hired for one-sixth he may eat dinar? Rather, what he eats from of Heaven? Ultimately, he was hired for one-sixth and he may eat a dinar. Rather, what have you to say? That the Merciful One entitles him Here too, the Merciful One entitles him
llm_translation: Come and hear: One who eats the fruit of his labor, even with a dinar, writes, and even with a dinar. If you say, "Is it his own produce that he is eating - should he eat with a coin?!" Rather, what is meant is: he is eating from the produce of Heaven, ultimately he will eat with a coin! But what do you have to say? "May the Merciful One grant him merit, here too may the Merciful One grant him merit."

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע, רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר חַסָּמָא אוֹמֵר: לֹא יֹאכַל פּוֹעֵל יוֹתֵר עַל שְׂכָרוֹ, וַחֲכָמִים מַתִּירִין. מַאי לָאו בְּהָא קָמִיפַּלְגִי: דְּמָר סָבַר מִשֶּׁלּוֹ הוּא אוֹכֵל, וּמָר סָבַר מִשֶּׁל שָׁמַיִם הוּא אוֹכֵל.
human_translation: Come hear Rabbi Elazar Ḥisma says: A laborer may not eat more than his wages, but the Rabbis permit What, is it not disagree with regard to this: That Sage, holds he eats from his own and Sage, holds he eats from of Heaven?
llm_translation: Come and hear, Rabbi Elazar Chasama says: A laborer should not eat more than his wage, and the sages permit it. What is the reason they do not agree in this matter? Because one master holds that he eats from his own, and the other master holds that he eats from the heavens.

hebrew_text: לָא דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא מִשֶּׁלּוֹ הוּא אוֹכֵל, וְהָכָא ״בִּכְנַפְשְׁךָ״ קָמִיפַּלְגִי. מָר סָבַר: כְּנַפְשְׁךָ בִּדְבַר שֶׁמּוֹסֵר נַפְשׁוֹ עָלָיו,
human_translation: No; that everyone agrees he eats from his own and here they disagree with regard to at your own pleasure [ kenafshekha ]” Sage, holds that “at your own pleasure [ kenafshekha ],” to a matter for which he hands over his soul,
llm_translation: Not all the world eats from his own, and here "in your soul" he disagrees. The Master thought: "Like your soul" in a matter where one entrusts his soul upon him.

hebrew_text: וּמָר סָבַר כְּנַפְשְׁךָ: מָה נַפְשְׁךָ, אִם חָסַמְתָּ – פָּטוּר, אַף פּוֹעֵל אִם חָסַמְתָּ – פָּטוּר.
human_translation: And Sage, holds “ kenafshekha ” Just as your own person, if you muzzled exempt, so too, a laborer, if you muzzled exempt.
llm_translation: And Mar holds: "Like your own self." What is your own self? If you have sealed - exempt, so too a worker, if he has sealed - exempt.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: נָזִיר שֶׁאָמַר ״תְּנוּ לְאִשְׁתִּי וּבָנַי״ – אֵין שׁוֹמְעִין לוֹ. וְאִי אָמְרַתְּ מִשֶּׁלּוֹ הוּא אוֹכֵל – אַמַּאי אֵין שׁוֹמְעִין לוֹ? הָתָם, מִשּׁוּם ״לָךְ לָךְ״ אָמְרִין נְזִירָא: ״סְחוֹר סְחוֹר לְכַרְמָא לָא תִּקְרַב״.
human_translation: Come hear a nazirite who says: Give to my wife and my children, they do not listen to him. But if you say eats from his own why they not listen to him? There, due to Go, go, we say to a nazirite, go round, go round; do not approach a vineyard.
llm_translation: Come and hear: A Nazirite who said, "Give to my wife and children" - they do not listen to him. And if you say that he is eating from his own vow, why do they not listen to him? There, because of "for you, for you" they say to the Nazirite: "Do not come close to the vineyard to prune."

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: פּוֹעֵל שֶׁאָמַר ״תְּנוּ לְאִשְׁתִּי וּבָנַי״ – אֵין שׁוֹמְעִין לוֹ. וְאִי אָמְרַתְּ מִשֶּׁלּוֹ הוּא אוֹכֵל – אַמַּאי אֵין שׁוֹמְעִין לוֹ? מַאי פּוֹעֵל – נָזִיר. וְהָתַנְיָא ״נָזִיר״, וְהָתַנְיָא ״פּוֹעֵל״! מִידֵּי גַּבֵּי הֲדָדֵי תַּנְיָין?
human_translation: Come hear a laborer who said: Give to my wife and my children, they do not listen to him. But if you say he eats from his own why they not listen to him? what a laborer? a nazirite But isn’t it taught a nazirite, and isn’t it taught a laborer? Were taught alongside one another,
llm_translation: Come and hear: A worker who said, "Give to my wife and children" - they do not listen to him. And if you say it is his own money he is consuming - why do they not listen to him? What is the case of a worker? A Nazirite. And it was taught, "Nazirite," and it was taught, "worker"! From whose statements are these teachings?

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: מִנַּיִן לְפוֹעֵל שֶׁאָמַר ״תְּנוּ לְאִשְׁתִּי וּבָנַי״ שֶׁאֵין שׁוֹמְעִין לוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְאֶל כֶּלְיְךָ לֹא תִתֵּן״. וְכִי תֵּימָא: הָכִי נָמֵי נָזִיר, אִי הָכִי מִשּׁוּם ״אֶל כֶּלְיְךָ לֹא תִּתֵּן״, מִשּׁוּם ״לָךְ לָךְ״ אָמְרִין נְזִירָא הוּא!
human_translation: Come hear From where to a laborer who said: Give to my wife and my children, that they do not listen to him? As it is stated: “But you shall not put any in your vessel” And if you would say so too, a nazirite, if so, due to “But you shall not put any in your vessel”; it is due to Go, go, we say to a nazirite,
llm_translation: Come and hear: From where do we derive that a worker who says, "Give to my wife and children," and they do not listen to him, as it is stated: "And to your vessels you shall not give"? And if you would say: Is this not the case of a Nazirite? If so, is it because of "And to your vessels you shall not give," or is it because of "yours, yours" that we say he is a Nazirite!

hebrew_text: אִין הָכִי נָמֵי, וְאַיְּידֵי דְּקָתָנֵי לַהּ בִּלְשׁוֹן פּוֹעֵל – קָא נָסֵיב לֵהּ קְרָא דְּפוֹעֵל.
human_translation: Yes, it is indeed so. and since teaches by language a laborer, it cites the verse with regard to a laborer.
llm_translation: Thus it is indeed stated, and since it was taught to him in the language of action - a verse of action was attached to it.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: הַשּׂוֹכֵר אֶת הַפּוֹעֵל לְקַצּוֹת בִּתְאֵנִים
human_translation: Come hear one who hires a laborer to prepare figs for drying,
llm_translation: Come and hear: One who hires a laborer to prune fig trees.

hebrew_text: הֲרֵי זֶה אוֹכֵל וּפָטוּר מִן הַמַּעֲשֵׂר. ״עַל מְנָת שֶׁאוֹכֵל אֲנִי וּבְנִי״, אוֹ ״שֶׁיֹּאכַל בְּנִי בִּשְׂכָרִי״ – הוּא אוֹכֵל וּפָטוּר, וּבְנוֹ אוֹכֵל וְחַיָּיב.
human_translation: this may eat and is exempt from tithe. On the condition that I and my sons may eat, or that my son may eat for my wages, he may eat and exempt and his son may eat but obligated
llm_translation: Behold, this one eats and exempt from tithe. "On the condition that I eat and my son," or "that my son eats at my expense" - he eats and is exempt, and his son eats and is obligated.

hebrew_text: וְאִי אָמְרַתְּ מִשֶּׁלּוֹ הוּא אוֹכֵל, בְּנוֹ אַמַּאי חַיָּיב? אָמַר רָבִינָא: מִשּׁוּם דְּמִיחֲזֵי כְּמִקָּח.
human_translation: And if you say he eats from his own why his son obligated? Ravina said: because it looks like a sale.
llm_translation: "And if you say, 'It is his own,' why is his son liable? Ravina said: Because it appears as a purchase."

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: הַשּׂוֹכֵר אֶת הַפּוֹעֵל לַעֲשׂוֹת בְּנֶטַע רְבָעִי שֶׁלּוֹ – הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ לֹא יֹאכֵלוּ. וְאִם לֹא הוֹדִיעָם – פּוֹדֶה וּמַאֲכִילָן.
human_translation: Come hear one who hires a laborer to perform with his fourth-year produce, may not eat And if he did not inform them redeem and feed them.
llm_translation: Come and hear: One who hires a laborer to plant his quarter of a field - these may not eat. And if he did not inform them - he redeems and feeds them.

hebrew_text: וְאִי אָמְרַתְּ מִשֶּׁל שָׁמַיִם הוּא אוֹכֵל – אַמַּאי פּוֹדֶה וּמַאֲכִילָן? אִיסּוּרָא לָא זַכִּי לְהוּ רַחֲמָנָא! הָתָם מִשּׁוּם דְּמִיחֲזֵי כְּמִקָּח טָעוּת.
human_translation: And if you say eats from of Heaven, why redeem and feed them? The Merciful One did not entitle them to a prohibition. There, because it looks like a mistaken transaction,
llm_translation: "And if you say that it is from Heaven, why does it redeem and feed them? The prohibition is not merited for them to have mercy! There, because it appears like a mistaken purchase."

hebrew_text: אֵימָא סֵיפָא: נִתְפָּרְסוּ עִגּוּלָיו, נִתְפַּתְּחוּ חָבִיּוֹתָיו – הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ לֹא יֹאכֵלוּ, וְאִם לֹא הוֹדִיעָן – מְעַשֵּׂר וּמַאֲכִילָן. וְאִי אָמְרַתְּ מִשֶּׁל שָׁמַיִם הוּא אוֹכֵל, אַמַּאי מְעַשֵּׂר וּמַאֲכִילָן? אִיסּוּרָא לָא זַכִּי לְהוּ רַחֲמָנָא!
human_translation: state the latter clause his cakes, broke apart his barrels opened these may not eat. And if did not inform them he must tithe and feed them. But if you say he eats from of Heaven, why must he tithe and feed them? The Merciful One did not entitle them to a prohibition.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Eima seifa: nitparsu igulav, nitpatkhu chaviyotav - harei elu lo yokhelu, ve'im lo hodi'an - me'aser u'ma'akhilan. Ve'i amarta mishel shamayim hu okhel, amai me'aser u'ma'akhilan? Isura la zaki lehu rachamana!" English translation: "Say the latter clause: if its tendrils have spread out, and its leaves have opened up - these may not be eaten, but if one did not inform them - he tithes and feeds them. And if you say it is a matter of Heaven's decree that it is eaten, why then tithe and feed them? The prohibition has not been granted to them by the Merciful One!"

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא: הָכָא נָמֵי מִשּׁוּם דְּמִיחֲזֵי כְּמִקָּח טָעוּת. בִּשְׁלָמָא נִתְפָּרְסוּ עִגּוּלָיו – מִיחֲזֵי כְּמִקָּח טָעוּת. אֶלָּא נִתְפַּתְּחוּ חָבִיּוֹתָיו, מַאי מִקָּח טָעוּת אִיכָּא? מִידָּע יָדַע דְּאִיטְּבִיל לְהוּ לְמַעֲשֵׂר!
human_translation: And if you would say: Here too, because it looks like a mistaken transaction, Granted, where his cakes broke apart, look like a mistaken transaction, But his barrels opened, what mistaken transaction is there They certainly know that had been rendered untithed produce with regard to tithes,
llm_translation: And if you will say: Here too, it is stated due to the fact that it appears like a mistaken acquisition. If his circles were spread out - it appears like a mistaken acquisition. But if his loops were opened, what mistaken acquisition is there? He immediately knew that he intended to give it for tithing!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: שֶׁנִּתְפַּתְּחוּ חָבִיּוֹתָיו לַבּוֹר. וְהָתַנְיָא: יַיִן מִשֶּׁיֵּרֵד לַבּוֹר!
human_translation: Rav Sheshet said: where his barrels opened into the pit But isn’t it taught wine from when it descends into the pit?
llm_translation: Rav Sheshet said: "His wine barrels opened into the pit." And it was taught: "Wine, when it descends into the pit!"

hebrew_text: כְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא דְּאָמַר מִשֶּׁיְּקַפֶּה, דַּאֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: לָא הֲוָה יָדְעִינַן. וְנֵימָא לְהוּ: אִיבְּעִי לְכוּ אַסּוֹקֵי אַדַּעְתַּיְיכוּ דִּלְמָא מְקַפֶּה! בְּאַתְרָא דְּהָהוּא גַּבְרָא דְּנָגֵיד אִיהוּ מְקַפֶּה!
human_translation: in accordance with Rabbi Akiva, who says from when floats that say to him: We did not know But let us say to them: It should have entered your minds perhaps floated. with regard to a place where that man who pulls is who floats
llm_translation: As Rabbi Akiva said, "When he was about to die, they said to him: 'We did not know.' And he said to them: 'If you had asked me, you would have known, perhaps he would have been spared!' In the place where that man, the leader, was being executed, he was spared!"

hebrew_text: וְהַשְׁתָּא דְּתָנֵי רַב זְבִיד בִּדְבֵי רַבִּי הוֹשַׁעְיָא: יַיִן מִשֶּׁיֵּרֵד לַבּוֹר וִיקַפֶּה, וְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: מִשֶּׁיְּשַׁלֶּה בֶּחָבִיּוֹת. אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא שֶׁלֹּא נִתְפַּתְּחוּ חָבִיּוֹתָיו לַבּוֹר, דַּאֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: לָא הֲוָה יָדְעִינַן דִּמְשַׁלֵּי.
human_translation: And now that Rav Zevid has taught from the school Rabbi Hoshaya: Wine from when it descends into the pit and floats. And Rabbi Akiva says: from when he drains from the barrels. you even say that the barrels were not opened into the pit, as say to him: We did not know that he had drained
llm_translation: At this time, as taught by Rav Zevid in the house of Rabbi Hoshaya: Wine, from when it descends into the pit and spoils, and Rabbi Akiva says: from when it is removed in barrels. Even if you say that his barrels did not open into the pit, for they said to him: we did not know that they were spoiling.

hebrew_text: וְנֵימָא לְהוּ: אִיבְּעִי לְכוּ אַסּוֹקֵי אַדַּעְתַּיְיכוּ דִּלְמָא מְשַׁלֵּי! בְּאַתְרָא דְּהָהוּא דְּשָׁרֵיק הָהוּא מְשַׁלֵּי.
human_translation: But let us say to them: It should have entered your minds perhaps been drained. to a place where that who plugs is who drains
llm_translation: And they said to them: If you wish, we will engage in discussion with you, so that perhaps you may concede! In the place where that one shouted, that one concedes.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: קוֹצֵץ אָדָם עַל יְדֵי עַצְמוֹ, עַל יְדֵי בְּנוֹ וּבִתּוֹ הַגְּדוֹלִים, עַל יְדֵי עַבְדּוֹ וְשִׁפְחָתוֹ הַגְּדוֹלִים, וְעַל יְדֵי אִשְׁתּוֹ – מִפְּנֵי שֶׁיֵּשׁ בָּהֶן דַּעַת. אֲבָל אֵינוֹ קוֹצֵץ לֹא עַל יְדֵי בְּנוֹ וּבִתּוֹ הַקְּטַנִּים, וְלֹא עַל יְדֵי עַבְדּוֹ וְשִׁפְחָתוֹ הַקְּטַנִּים, וְלֹא עַל יְדֵי בְּהֶמְתּוֹ – מִפְּנֵי שֶׁאֵין בָּהֶן דַּעַת.
human_translation: Come hear A man can stipulate on his own behalf on behalf of his adult son or daughter, on behalf of his adult slave or maidservant, or on behalf of his wife, because they have competence, But he cannot stipulate on behalf of his minor son or daughter, nor on behalf of his minor slave or maidservant, nor on behalf of his animal, as they do not competence.
llm_translation: Come and hear: A person may trim his hair by himself, or through his adult son or daughter, through his adult male or female slave, and through his wife - because they have understanding. But he may not trim hair neither through his minor son or daughter, nor through his minor male or female slave, nor through his animal - because they do not have understanding.

hebrew_text: קָא סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ בְּמַעֲלֶה לָהֶן מְזוֹנוֹת. אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא מִשֶּׁל שָׁמַיִם הוּא אוֹכֵל – מִשּׁוּם הָכִי אֵינוֹ קוֹצֵץ, אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ מִשֶּׁלּוֹ הוּא אוֹכֵל – קְטַנִּים נָמֵי נִקּוֹץ לְהוּ!
human_translation: enter your mind where provides with food, Granted, if you say eats from of Heaven, due to that he may not stipulate But if you say eats from his own let him to stipulate on behalf of minors as well.
llm_translation: Your mind has ascended to the heavens regarding their sustenance. If you say it is from Heaven's portion that he eats - for this reason he does not cut, but if you say it is from his own portion that he eats - even small ones are also cut for him!

hebrew_text: הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן – בְּשֶׁאֵין מַעֲלֶה לָהֶן מְזוֹנוֹת. אִי הָכִי, גְּדוֹלִים נָמֵי! גְּדוֹלִים יָדְעִי וְקָא מָחֲלִי.
human_translation: With what are we dealing here? in which does not provide with food. If so, adult too, Adults are aware and forgive
llm_translation: Here we are dealing with - when they do not provide them with sustenance. If so, even the great ones! The great ones know and are forgiving.

hebrew_text: וְהָא תָּנֵא רַבִּי הוֹשַׁעְיָא: קוֹצֵץ אָדָם עַל יְדֵי עַצְמוֹ וְעַל יְדֵי אִשְׁתּוֹ, אֲבָל לֹא עַל יְדֵי בְּהֶמְתּוֹ. וְעַל יְדֵי בְּנוֹ וּבִתּוֹ הַגְּדוֹלִים, אֲבָל לֹא עַל יְדֵי בְּנוֹ וּבִתּוֹ הַקְּטַנִּים. וְקוֹצֵץ עַל יְדֵי עַבְדּוֹ וְשִׁפְחָתוֹ הַכְּנַעֲנִים, בֵּין גְּדוֹלִים וּבֵין קְטַנִּים.
human_translation: But didn’t Rabbi Hoshaya teach A person can stipulate on his own behalf and on his wife’s behalf, but not on behalf of his animal; and on behalf of his adult son or daughter, but not on behalf of his minor son or daughter; and he can stipulate on behalf of his Canaanite slave or maidservant, whether they are adults or minors.
llm_translation: The Gemara teaches: Rabbi Hoshaya taught: A person may trim his nails on his own behalf and on behalf of his wife, but not on behalf of his animal. And he may trim the nails of his adult son and daughter, but not of his minor son and daughter. And he may trim the nails of his Canaanite slave and maidservant, whether they are adults or minors.

hebrew_text: מַאי לָאו, אִידֵּי וְאִידֵּי בְּמַעֲלֶה לָהֶן מְזוֹנוֹת, וּבְהָא קָא מִיפַּלְגִי: דְּמָר סָבַר מִשֶּׁלּוֹ הוּא אוֹכֵל, וּמָר סָבַר מִשֶּׁל שָׁמַיִם הוּא אוֹכֵל?! לָא, דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא מִשֶּׁלּוֹ הוּא אוֹכֵל, וְלָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן – בְּשֶׁאֵין מַעֲלֶה לָהֶן מְזוֹנוֹת, וּבָרַיְיתָא – בְּמַעֲלֶה לָהֶן מְזוֹנוֹת.
human_translation: What, is it not this and that, where provides with food, and they disagree with regard to this: That Sage, holds eats from his own and Sage, holds eats from of Heaven, No; everyone agrees eats from his own and not difficult. Here, where he does not provide with food, and baraita where he provides them with food.
llm_translation: What is the reason that both of them are sustained in the upper realms, and here they disagree: One Master holds that he eats from his own, and the other Master holds that he eats from Heaven's? No, everyone in the world eats from his own, and it is not difficult: here – where they are not sustained in the upper realms, and in the Baraita – where they are sustained in the upper realms.

hebrew_text: בְּמַאי אוֹקֵימְתַּהּ – בְּמַעֲלֶה לָהֶן מְזוֹנוֹת? אִי הָכִי קְטַנִּים נָמֵי נִקּוֹץ לְהוּ! צַעֲרַיְיהוּ דִּבְנוֹ וּבִתּוֹ הַקְּטַנִּים לָא זַכִּי לֵיהּ רַחֲמָנָא.
human_translation: To what did you interpret where he provides with food? If so, let him also stipulate minor The Merciful One does not entitle him to the suffering of his minor son and daughter.
llm_translation: With what is she established - with their sustenance? If so, even the young ones also suffer hunger! The distress of the son and his daughter, the young ones, does not merit mercy.

hebrew_text: בְּמַאי אוֹקֵימְתָּא לְמַתְנִיתִין – בְּשֶׁאֵין מַעֲלֶה לָהֶן מְזוֹנוֹת,
human_translation: To what did you interpret where he does not provide with food?
llm_translation: With what do you establish the Mishnah? - With the fact that one does not bring up provisions for them.

hebrew_text: הָנִיחָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר אֵין הָרַב יָכוֹל לוֹמַר לָעֶבֶד עֲשֵׂה עִמִּי וְאֵינִי זָנָךְ – שַׁפִּיר. אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר יָכוֹל הָרַב לוֹמַר לָעֶבֶד עֲשֵׂה עִמִּי וְאֵינִי זָנָךְ, מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר?
human_translation: This works out well according to the one who says a master cannot say to a slave: Work for me and I will not feed you, well. But according to the one who says a master can say to a slave: Work for me and I will not feed you, what can be said?
llm_translation: The one who said the master cannot tell the servant, "Do with me and I am not a prostitute" - it is proper. But the one who said the master can tell the servant, "Do with me and I am not a prostitute," what can be said in response?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אִידֵּי וְאִידֵּי בְּשֶׁאֵין מַעֲלֶה לָהֶן מְזוֹנוֹת, וּבְהָא פְּלִיגִי: דְּמָר סָבַר יָכוֹל, וּמַר סָבַר אֵין יָכוֹל. וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, דְּאָמַר: יָכוֹל הָרַב, שָׁבֵיק מַתְנִיתִין וְעָבֵיד כְּבָרַיְיתָא?!
human_translation: Rather, this and that when he does not provide with food, and disagree with regard to that As Sage, holds can and Sage, holds he cannot Rabbi Yoḥanan, who says a master can left the mishna and acted in accordance with the baraita .
llm_translation: Rather, both this and this when they do not provide sustenance, and in this they argue: for Mar holds it is possible, and Mar holds it is not possible. And Rabbi Yohanan, who said: The master can, he left the Mishnah and acted according to the accepted practice?!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא מִשֶּׁל שָׁמַיִם הוּא אוֹכֵל, וְלָא מָצֵי קָצֵיץ. וּמַאי ״קוֹצֵץ״ דְּאָמַר רַבִּי הוֹשַׁעְיָא – מְזוֹנוֹת.
human_translation: Rather, Everyone agrees eats from of Heaven, and he cannot stipulate And what is Stipulates, that Rabbi Hoshaya says food
llm_translation: Rather, the entirety of the world is from the hand of Heaven, it eats, and does not find satiation. And what is the meaning of "cutting" that Rabbi Hoshaya said? - sustenance.

hebrew_text: דִּכְווֹתֵיהּ גַּבֵּי בְּהֶמְתּוֹ תֶּבֶן נִקּוֹץ לַהּ! אֶלָּא בְּהָא קָמִיפַּלְגִי: דְּמָר סָבַר – מִשֶּׁלּוֹ הוּא אוֹכֵל, וּמָר סָבַר – מִשֶּׁל שָׁמַיִם הוּא אוֹכֵל.
human_translation: in the corresponding with regard to his animal, likewise he can stipulate straw for it Rather, they disagree with regard to this: That Sage, holds eats from his own and Sage, holds eats from of Heaven.
llm_translation: His animal's fodder straw is a thorn to it! Rather, in this case it is disputed: One Master holds - it eats from its own, and the other Master holds - it eats from Heaven's.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ קוֹצֵץ אָדָם עַל יְדֵי עַצְמוֹ, עַל יְדֵי בְּנוֹ וּבִתּוֹ הַגְּדוֹלִים, עַל יְדֵי עַבְדּוֹ וְשִׁפְחָתוֹ הַגְּדוֹלִים, עַל יְדֵי אִשְׁתּוֹ, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁיֵּשׁ בָּהֶן דַּעַת. אֲבָל אֵינוֹ קוֹצֵץ עַל יְדֵי בְּנוֹ וּבִתּוֹ הַקְּטַנִּים, וְלֹא עַל יְדֵי עַבְדּוֹ וְשִׁפְחָתוֹ הַקְּטַנִּים, וְלֹא עַל יְדֵי בְּהֶמְתּוֹ, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁאֵין בָּהֶן דַּעַת.
human_translation: A man can stipulate on his own behalf on behalf of his adult son or daughter, on behalf of his adult slave or maidservant, or on behalf of his wife, because they have competence, But he cannot stipulate on behalf of his minor son or daughter, nor on behalf of his minor slave or maidservant, nor on behalf of his animal, as they do not competence.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: A person may trim his hair by himself, by his adult son or daughter, by his adult male or female slave, or by his wife, because they have understanding. However, he may not trim his hair by his minor son or daughter, nor by his minor male or female slave, nor by his animal, because they do not have understanding.

hebrew_text: הַשּׂוֹכֵר אֶת הַפּוֹעֲלִים לַעֲשׂוֹת בְּנֶטַע רְבָעִי שֶׁלּוֹ – הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ לֹא יֹאכְלוּ. אִם לֹא הוֹדִיעָן – פּוֹדֶה וּמַאֲכִילָן. נִתְפָּרְסוּ עִגּוּלָיו, נִתְפַּתְּחוּ חָבִיּוֹתָיו – הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ לֹא יֹאכְלוּ. אִם לֹא הוֹדִיעָן – מְעַשֵּׂר וּמַאֲכִילָן.
human_translation: one who hires a laborer to perform with his fourth-year fruit, may not eat if he did not inform them redeem and feed them. his cakes broke apart his barrels opened these may not eat, if he did not inform them, he must tithe and feed them.
llm_translation: The one who hires laborers to work in his vineyard a quarter of his – these may not eat. If he did not inform them – he redeems and feeds them. If his clusters spread out, if his grapes split – these may not eat. If he did not inform them – he tithes and feeds them.

hebrew_text: שׁוֹמְרֵי פֵירוֹת אוֹכְלִין מֵהִלְכוֹת מְדִינָה, אֲבָל לֹא מִן הַתּוֹרָה.
human_translation: Watchmen of produce may eat by local regulations, but not by Torah law.
llm_translation: Guardians of fruits may eat from the pathways of the province, but not from the Torah.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ שׁוֹמְרֵי פֵירוֹת. אָמַר רַב: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא שׁוֹמְרֵי גַנּוֹת וּפַרְדֵּסִין. אֲבָל שׁוֹמְרֵי גִיתּוֹת וַעֲרֵימוֹת – אוֹכְלִין מִן הַתּוֹרָה. קָסָבַר: מְשַׁמֵּר כְּעוֹשֶׂה מַעֲשֶׂה דָּמֵי.
human_translation: watchmen of produce. Rav says: They taught only watchmen of gardens and orchards, But watchmen of winepresses and piles may eat by Torah law, maintains who safeguards is considered like one who performs labor,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Gemara: Shomrei Peirot. Amar Rav: Lo Shanu Ela Shomrei Ganot u'Pardesin. Aval Shomrei Gitot va'Areimot - Ochlin min haTorah. Kasavar: Meshamer ke'Oseh Ma'aseh Damei." English translation: "The Gemara: Those who guard fruits. Rav said: They only specified those who guard gardens and orchards. But those who guard winepresses and piles of grain - they eat from the Torah. He holds: One who guards is like one who acts."

hebrew_text: וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא שׁוֹמְרֵי גִיתּוֹת וַעֲרֵימוֹת. אֲבָל שׁוֹמְרֵי גַנּוֹת וּפַרְדֵּסִים – אֵינָן אוֹכְלִים לֹא מִן הַתּוֹרָה וְלֹא מֵהִלְכוֹת מְדִינָה. קָא סָבַר מְשַׁמֵּר לָאו כְּעוֹשֶׂה מַעֲשֶׂה דָּמֵי.
human_translation: And Shmuel says taught only watchmen of winepresses and piles But watchmen of gardens and orchards may not eat, neither by Torah law nor by local regulations. holds one who safeguards is not considered like one who performs labor,
llm_translation: Samuel said: They only decreed regarding those who guard wine and oil pits. But those who guard gardens and orchards - they do not eat produce neither by Torah law nor by the laws of the land. He thought that guarding is not like doing physical work.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רַב אַחָא בַּר רַב הוּנָא: הַמְשַׁמֵּר אֶת הַפָּרָה – מְטַמֵּא בְּגָדִים. וְאִי אָמְרַתְּ מְשַׁמֵּר לָאו כְּעוֹשֶׂה מַעֲשֶׂה דָּמֵי – אַמַּאי מְטַמֵּא בְּגָדִים? אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר עוּלָּא: גְּזֵירָה שֶׁמָּא יָזִיז בָּהּ אֵבֶר.
human_translation: Rav Aḥa bar Rav Huna raises an objection One who safeguards the heifer renders garments impure, And if you say one who safeguards is not considered like one who performs labor, why render garments impure? Rabba bar Ulla said: decree, lest he move a limb
llm_translation: The Gemara raises an objection: Rav Ahah bar Rav Huna asked: One who guards the cow - he renders garments impure. And if you say, "guarding is not like doing the act itself" - why then does he render garments impure? Rabba bar Ulla said: It is a decree, lest a limb move in it.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רַב כָּהֲנָא: הַמְשַׁמֵּר אַרְבַּע וְחָמֵשׁ מִקְשָׁאוֹת – הֲרֵי זֶה לֹא יְמַלֵּא כְּרֵסוֹ מֵאֶחָד מֵהֶן, אֶלָּא מִכׇּל אֶחָד וְאֶחָד אוֹכֵל לְפִי חֶשְׁבּוֹן. וְאִי אָמְרַתְּ מְשַׁמֵּר לָאו כְּעוֹשֶׂה מַעֲשֶׂה דָּמֵי – אַמַּאי אוֹכֵל?
human_translation: Rav Kahana raises an objection: one who safeguards four or five cucumber fields, this one may not fill his stomach from one of them. Rather, from each and every one by a proportionate But if you say one who safeguards is not considered like one who performs labor, why eat
llm_translation: The Gemara raises an objection: Rav Kahana said: One who guards four or five cucumbers—behold, he may not fill his basket from any one of them, but rather he eats according to calculation from each and every one. And if you say that guarding is not like doing, why may he eat?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב שִׁימִי בַּר אָשֵׁי: בַּעֲקוּרִין שָׁנוּ. עֲקוּרִין – וַהֲלֹא נִגְמְרָה מְלַאכְתָּן לְמַעֲשֵׂר? שֶׁלֹּא נִיטַּל פֵּיקֶס שֶׁלָּהֶם.
human_translation: Rav Shimi bar Ashi said: They taught this with regard to uprooted Uprooted? But hasn’t their work been completed with regard to tithes, when their blossom had not been removed.
llm_translation: Rav Shimi bar Ashe said: In regards to Akurin they taught. Akurin - but hasn't their work of tithing been completed? For they did not take their portion.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: כְּווֹתֵיהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל מִסְתַּבְּרָא, דִּתְנַן, וְאֵלּוּ אוֹכְלִין מִן הַתּוֹרָה: הָעוֹשֶׂה בִּמְחוּבָּר לַקַּרְקַע בִּשְׁעַת גְּמַר מְלָאכָה, וּבְתָלוּשׁ כּוּ׳. מִכְּלָל דְּאִיכָּא דְּלָא קָא אָכֵיל מִן הַתּוֹרָה אֶלָּא מֵהִלְכוֹת מְדִינָה.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: It stands to reason in accordance with Shmuel, as we learned And these may eat by Torah law: who performs with attached to the ground at the time of the completion of work, and with detached by inference that there is one who does not eat by Torah law but by local regulations.
llm_translation: Rav Ashe said: The reasoning of Shmuel is plausible, as we learned: "And these are the ones who may eat from the Torah: one who finishes a task connected to the ground at the time of completing work, and one who is hanging." From the inference that there are those who do not eat from the Torah except from the laws of the land.

hebrew_text: אֵימָא סֵיפָא: וְאֵלּוּ שֶׁאֵינָן אוֹכְלִין. מַאי אֵינָן אוֹכְלִין? אִילֵּימָא שֶׁאֵין אוֹכְלִין מִן הַתּוֹרָה אֶלָּא מֵהִלְכוֹת מְדִינָה – הַיְינוּ רֵישָׁא, אֶלָּא לָאו שֶׁאֵין אוֹכְלִין לֹא מִן הַתּוֹרָה וְלֹא מֵהִלְכוֹת מְדִינָה. וּמַאי נִיהוּ – עוֹשֶׂה בִּמְחוּבָּר לַקַּרְקַע בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁאֵין גְּמַר מְלָאכָה, וְכׇל שֶׁכֵּן שׁוֹמְרֵי גַנּוֹת וּפַרְדֵּסוֹת.
human_translation: say the latter clause And these may not eat. What is May not eat? If we say that they may not eat by Torah law but by local regulations, this is the first clause. Rather, is it not they may not eat neither by Torah law nor by local regulations? And who are one who performs with attached to the ground at a time when it not the completion of work, and all the more so watchmen of gardens and orchards,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Eima seifa: ve'elu she'einan okhlin. Mai einan okhlin? Ileima she'einan okhlin min haTorah ela me'hilkhote medinah – hainu reishah, ela lav she'einan okhlin lo min haTorah velo me'hilkhote medinah. Umai nihu – oseh bimchubar laqarqa be'sha'ah she'ein gemar melakha, ve'khol sheken shomrei gannot u'pardesot."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אַרְבָּעָה שׁוֹמְרִים הֵן: שׁוֹמֵר חִנָּם וְהַשּׁוֹאֵל, נוֹשֵׂא שָׂכָר וְהַשּׂוֹכֵר. שׁוֹמֵר חִנָּם נִשְׁבָּע עַל הַכֹּל, וְהַשּׁוֹאֵל מְשַׁלֵּם אֶת הַכֹּל.
human_translation: There are four bailees, An unpaid bailee, and the borrower a paid bailee, and a renter, An unpaid bailee takes an oath over every The borrower pays every
llm_translation: It was taught: There are four types of watchmen: a gratuitous watchman, a borrower, a paid watchman, and a renter. A gratuitous watchman swears for everything, and a borrower pays for everything.

hebrew_text: וְנוֹשֵׂא שָׂכָר וְהַשּׂוֹכֵר נִשְׁבָּעִים עַל הַשְּׁבוּרָה וְעַל הַשְּׁבוּיָה וְעַל הַמֵּתָה, וּמְשַׁלְּמִין אֶת הָאֲבֵידָה וְאֶת הַגְּנֵיבָה.
human_translation: And a paid bailee and a renter take an oath over an injured over a captured and over a dead but they must pay loss or theft.
llm_translation: The one who carries wages and the employer are sworn regarding the deposit, the lost item, and the dead animal, and they pay for the lost item and the theft.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאן תְּנָא אַרְבָּעָה שׁוֹמְרִים? אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר אֲבוּהּ: רַבִּי מֵאִיר הִיא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא לְרַב נַחְמָן: מִי אִיכָּא דְּלֵית לֵיהּ אַרְבָּעָה שׁוֹמְרִין? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָכִי קָאָמֵינָא לָךְ, מַאן תָּנָא שׂוֹכֵר כְּנוֹשֵׂא שָׂכָר – רַבִּי מֵאִיר הִיא.
human_translation: Who is the tanna four bailees? Rav Naḥman said Rabba bar Avuh said: It is Rabbi Meir. Rava said to Rav Naḥman: Is there who does not four bailees? said to him: This is what I am saying to you, Who is the tanna a renter like a paid bailee? It is Rabbi Meir.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Who is the Tanna that holds four guardians? Rav Nachman said, Rabba bar Avuh said: It is Rabbi Meir. Rava said to Rav Nachman: Is there anyone who does not hold four guardians? He said to him: This is what I am saying to you, who is the Tanna that holds renting as equivalent to hiring? It is Rabbi Meir.

hebrew_text: וְהָא רַבִּי מֵאִיר אִיפְּכָא שָׁמְעִינַן לֵיהּ, דְּתַנְיָא: שׂוֹכֵר כֵּיצַד מְשַׁלֵּם? רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: כְּשׁוֹמֵר חִנָּם, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: כְּשׁוֹמֵר שָׂכָר! רַבָּה בַּר אֲבוּהּ אִיפְּכָא קָתָנֵי.
human_translation: But didn’t we hear Rabbi Meir the opposite, as it is taught a renter, how does he pay, Rabbi Meir says: as an unpaid bailee; Rabbi Yehuda says as a paid bailee. Rabba bar Avuh teaches opposite
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "And behold, Rabbi Meir contradicts him, as it was taught: 'One who rents, how does he pay?' Rabbi Meir says: 'When he watches for free.' Rabbi Yehuda says: 'When he watches for pay!' Rabbah bar Avuh contradicts the Mishnah."

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, אַרְבָּעָה? שְׁלֹשָׁה נִינְהוּ! אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: אַרְבָּעָה שׁוֹמְרִין, וְדִינֵיהֶם שְׁלֹשָׁה.
human_translation: If so, four They are three. Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said four bailees, whose halakhot are three.
llm_translation: So is it that there are four? They are three! Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: There are four guardians, yet their laws are three.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא רָעֲיָא דַּהֲוָה קָא רָעֵי חֵיוָתָא אַגּוּדָּא דִּנְהַר פָּפָּא. שְׂרִיג חֲדָא מִינַּיְיהוּ וּנְפַלַת לְמַיָּא. אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבָּה וּפַטְרֵיהּ. אָמַר: מַאי הֲוָה לֵיהּ לְמֶעְבַּד?
human_translation: a certain shepherd who was herding animals on the bank of the Pappa River, one of them slipped and fell into the water He came before Rabba, and exempted him stated What could he have done?
llm_translation: That shepherd who was shepherding a flock of sheep by the bank of the river Pappa. One sheep went from among them and fell into the water. He came before Rabah and he exempted him. He said: What could he have done?

hebrew_text: הָא נְטַר כִּדְנָטְרִי אִינָשֵׁי. אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה, עָל לְמָתָא בְּעִידָּנָא דְּעָיְילִי אִינָשֵׁי – הָכִי נָמֵי דְּפָטוּר?! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִין. גְּנָא פּוּרְתָּא בְּעִידָּנָא דְּגָנוּ אִינָשֵׁי – הָכִי נָמֵי דְּפָטוּר?! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִין.
human_translation: He safeguarded them that people safeguard, Abaye said to him: If that is so, he entered the city at a time when people enter, so too exempt? said to him: Yes. he slept a little at a time when people sleep, so too exempt? said to him: Yes.
llm_translation: Here is the English translation of the Talmudic text: "Here, a watchman like the watchmen of people. Abaye said to him: Rather, from now on, when people are in a time of danger - is it thus said that he is exempt?! He said to him: No. A watchman like the watchmen of grain - is it thus said that he is exempt?! He said to him: No."

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ: אֵלּוּ הֵם אוֹנָסִין שֶׁשּׁוֹמֵר שָׂכָר פָּטוּר עֲלֵיהֶן – כְּגוֹן: ״וַתִּפֹּל שְׁבָא וַתִּקָּחֵם וְאֶת הַנְּעָרִים הִכּוּ לְפִי חָרֶב״. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָתָם בְּחַזָּנֵי מָתָא.
human_translation: raised an objection to him These are circumstances beyond one’s control for which a paid bailee is exempt: For example, And the Sabeans made a raid and took them away, and they have slain the servants with the edge of the sword” said to him: There to city watchmen,
llm_translation: He raised an objection against him: These are the cases of ones who keep the reward and are exempt from them - for example: "And Sheba fell, and they took them, and the young men they struck down with the edge of the sword." He said to him: There, it was with the watchmen of the city.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ: עַד מָתַי שׁוֹמֵר שָׂכָר חַיָּיב לִשְׁמוֹר – עַד כְּדֵי ״הָיִיתִי בַיּוֹם אֲכָלַנִי חֹרֶב וְקֶרַח בַּלַּיְלָה״. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָתָם נָמֵי בְּחַזָּנֵי מָתָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אַטּוּ יַעֲקֹב אָבִינוּ חַזַּן מָתָא הֲוָה! דַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ לְלָבָן: נְטַרִי לָךְ נְטִירוּתָא יַתִּירְתָּא כְּחַזָּנֵי מָתָא.
human_translation: raised an objection to To what extent is a paid bailee obligated to safeguard? to the extent “Thus I was: In the day the drought consumed me, and the frost by night” said to him: There too, of city watchmen, said to him: Is that to say Jacob, our forefather, was a city watchman? that said to Laban: I safeguarded for you an extra safeguarding, like city watchmen.
llm_translation: He raised an objection to it: Until when is a watchman obligated to watch? Until the time of "I was consumed by heat in the day and frost at night." He said to him: There, too, it was in the vision of a dream. He said to him: Was our forefather Jacob then a dream interpreter? For he said to Laban: "I have been with you for twenty years; your ewes and female goats have not miscarried, nor have I eaten the rams of your flocks."

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ: רוֹעֶה שֶׁהָיָה רוֹעֶה וְהִנִּיחַ עֶדְרוֹ וּבָא לָעִיר, בָּא זְאֵב וְטָרַף, וּבָא אֲרִי וְדָרַס – אֵין אוֹמְרִים: אִילּוּ הָיָה שָׁם הָיָה מַצִּיל. אֶלָּא אוֹמְדִין אוֹתוֹ: אִם יָכוֹל לְהַצִּיל – חַיָּיב, אִם לָאו – פָּטוּר.
human_translation: raised an objection to a shepherd who was herding and he left his flock and came to the town, a wolf came and tore or a lion came and trampled we do not say had he been there he would have rescued Rather, estimates him: If he could rescued liable, If not, exempt
llm_translation: He raised an objection against him: A shepherd who was shepherding and left his flock and came to the city, a wolf came and tore the sheep, and a lion came and trampled them - they do not say: If only he had been there, he would have saved them. Rather, they assess him: If he was able to save - he is liable, if not - he is exempt.

hebrew_text: מַאי לָאו דְּעָל בְּעִידָּנָא דְּעָיְילִי אִינָשֵׁי? לָא, דְּעָל בְּעִידָּנָא דְּלָא עָיְילִי אִינָשֵׁי. אִי הָכִי, אַמַּאי פָּטוּר? תְּחִילָּתוֹ בִּפְשִׁיעָה וְסוֹפוֹ בְּאוֹנֶס, חַיָּיב!
human_translation: What, is not when enters at a time when people enter? No, of one who enters at a time when people do not enter. If so, why is he exempt initially through negligence and ultimately by accident, liable
llm_translation: What is the reason that one who goes by the testimony of those who are able to ascend does not ascend? Because he goes by the testimony of those who are not able to ascend. If so, why is he exempt? His beginning is through willful sin and his end is through compulsion, he is liable!

hebrew_text: דִּשְׁמַע קָל אַרְיָה וְעָל. אִי הָכִי, אוֹמְדִין אוֹתוֹ? מַאי הֲוָה לֵיהּ לְמֶעְבַּד?! הָיָה לוֹ לְקַדֵּם בְּרוֹעִים וּבְמַקְלוֹת.
human_translation: who heard the sound of a lion and entered If so, estimates him? What could he have done He should have faced with shepherds and with sticks
llm_translation: Hear a lion roar and ascend. If so, do we establish it? What could he have done?! He should have preceded with shepherds and staffs.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, מַאי אִירְיָא שׁוֹמֵר שָׂכָר? אֲפִילּוּ שׁוֹמֵר חִנָּם נָמֵי, דְּהָא מָר הוּא דְּאָמַר: שׁוֹמֵר חִנָּם שֶׁהָיָה לוֹ לְקַדֵּם בְּרוֹעִים וּבְמַקְלוֹת וְלֹא קִידֵּם – חַיָּיב. שׁוֹמֵר חִנָּם בְּחִנָּם, שׁוֹמֵר שָׂכָר בְּשָׂכָר.
human_translation: If so, why specifically a paid bailee? even an unpaid bailee, as wasn’t it Master, who said an unpaid bailee who had of facing with shepherds and with sticks and did not face liable, An unpaid bailee free of charge, a paid bailee for payment.
llm_translation: If so, what is the meaning of "Shomer Sachar"? Even one who guards for free, it is also stated, as the Master said: One who guards for free, who had the opportunity to precede with warning signs and staffs but did not precede - is liable. One who guards for free with payment, one who guards for payment with payment.

hebrew_text: וְעַד כַּמָּה? עַד כְּדֵי דְמֵיהֶן. וְהֵיכָן מָצִינוּ בְּשׁוֹמֵר שָׂכָר שֶׁחַיָּיב בָּאוֹנָסִין? דַּהֲדַר שָׁקֵיל דְּמֵיהֶן מִבַּעַל הַבַּיִת.
human_translation: And up to how much Up to of the value But where have we found with regard to a paid bailee that he is liable for circumstances beyond his control? that he may return and take the money from the owner.
llm_translation: "And until when? Until the amount of their blood. And where do we find in Shomer Sachar who is liable for onsin? He then takes their blood from the homeowner."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב פָּפָּא לְאַבָּיֵי: אִי הָכִי, מַאי אַהֲנִי לֵיהּ מִינַּהּ? נָפְקָא מִינַּהּ לְכוּשְׁרָא דְחֵיוָתָא. אִי נָמֵי לְטִרְחָא יַתִּירְתָּא.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said to Abaye: If so, what benefit does from this? difference the fitness of the animals. Alternatively, to the additional effort
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Papa to Abbaye: If so, what benefit does he have from it? It benefits the validity of the living. Alternatively, it is an additional effort.

hebrew_text: רַב חִסְדָּא וְרַבָּה בַּר רַב הוּנָא לָא סְבִירָא לְהוּ הָא דְּרַבָּה, דְּאָמְרִי: לְהָכִי יְהַבִי לָךְ אַגְרָא, לְנַטּוֹרֵי לִי נְטִירוּתָא יַתִּירְתָּא.
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda and Rabba bar Rav Huna do not hold in accordance with this of Rabba, as they say for this I gave you a wage, so that you should safeguard for me an additional safeguarding,
llm_translation: Rav Chisda and Rabbah bar Rav Huna do not agree with Rabbah, for they say: "Therefore, give you a reward, for you have given me an extra protection."

hebrew_text: בַּר אַדָּא סָבוֹלָאָה (הָוֵי) [הֲוָה] קָא מְעַבַּר חֵיוָתָא אַגַּמְלָא דְנַרֶשׁ. דְּחַפָה חֲדָא לַחֲבֶרְתַּהּ וּשְׁדָיתַהּ בְּמַיָּא. אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב פָּפָּא, חַיְּיבֵיהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מַאי הֲוָה לִי לְמֶעְבַּד? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִבְּעִי לָךְ לְעַבּוֹרֵי חֲדָא חֲדָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: יָדְעַתְּ בֵּיהּ בְּבַר אֲחָתָיךְ דְּמָצֵי (ל)מְעַבַּר חֲדָא חֲדָא? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: כְּבָר צְוַוחוּ קַמָּאֵי דְקַמָּךְ וְלָא אִיכָּא דְּאַשְׁגַּח בְּהוּ.
human_translation: Bar Adda the porter was transporting animals across the narrow bridge of Neresh one pushed another and cast it into the water, came before Rav Pappa, deemed him liable. said to him: What should I have done? said to him: You should have transported them one by one. said to him: Do you know of the son of your sister who can transport one by one? said to him: The very earliest before you already shouted but none paid attention to them.
llm_translation: Son of Adda Sabulaa (was) was passing by a caravan of merchants. One barrel pushed its companion and threw it into the water. He came before Rav Papa, liable. He said to him: What was it for me to do? He said to him: You should have passed them one by one. He said to him: Did you know in your brother's son that it is possible to pass them one by one? He said to him: They have already shouted before you and there is no one to pay attention to them.

hebrew_text: אַיְבוּ אַפְקֵיד כִּיתָּנָא בֵּי רוּנְיָא. אֲזַל שַׁבּוּ שַׁמְטֵיהּ מִינֵּיהּ. לְסוֹף הוּכַּר הַגַּנָּב. אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב נַחְמָן, חַיְּיבֵיהּ. לֵימָא פְּלִיגָא דְּרַב הוּנָא בַּר אָבִין?
human_translation: Aivu deposited flax house of Ronya. Shabbu went and snatched from him. Eventually the thief was identified came before Rav Naḥman, rendered liable. Shall we say disagrees of Rav Huna bar Avin?
llm_translation: I will appoint a guardian for the basket in the house of Runya. He went and removed his produce. In the end, the thief was recognized. He came before Rav Nachman, he is liable. Shall we say this is a dispute of Rav Huna the son of Avin?

hebrew_text: דִּשְׁלַח רַב הוּנָא בַּר אָבִין: נִגְנְבָה בְּאוֹנֶס וְאַחַר כָּךְ הוּכַּר הַגַּנָּב, אִם שׁוֹמֵר חִנָּם הוּא – רָצָה נִשְׁבָּע, רָצָה עוֹשֶׂה עִמּוֹ דִּין. אִם שׁוֹמֵר שָׂכָר הוּא – עוֹשֶׂה עִמּוֹ דִּין וְאֵינוֹ נִשְׁבָּע.
human_translation: As Rav Huna bar Avin sent was stolen in a circumstance beyond his control, and the thief was subsequently identified if is an unpaid bailee, he wishes, he takes an oath he wishes, he enters into judgment with If he is a paid bailee, he enters into judgment with and does not take an oath.
llm_translation: Rav Huna bar Avin sent: If stolen by force and afterwards the thief was recognized, if he keeps gratuitously - he wants to swear, he wants to make judgment with him. If he keeps for hire - he makes judgment with him and does not swear.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: הָתָם גַּבְרֵי דְּפַרְמוּסְקָא הֲווֹ קָיְימִי, דְּאִי רְמָא קָלָא הֲווֹ אָתוּ וּמַצְּלִין לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rava said: there, men from the government were standing there, that if he had raised his voice they would have come and rescued him.
llm_translation: Rava said: There, the men of Parmuska were standing, for if he would have raised his voice, they would have come and saved him.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ זְאֵב אֶחָד – אֵינוֹ אוֹנֶס. שְׁנֵי זְאֵבִים – אוֹנֶס. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: בִּשְׁעַת מִשְׁלַחַת זְאֵבִים, אַף זְאֵב אֶחָד אוֹנֶס.
human_translation: One wolf is not a circumstance beyond one’s control, two wolves a circumstance beyond one’s control. Rabbi Yehuda says: At a time of wolf attacks, even one wolf is a circumstance beyond one’s control.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One wolf - not considered oness. Two wolves - considered oness. Rabbi Yehuda says: At the time of sending out wolves, even one wolf is considered oness.

hebrew_text: שְׁנֵי כְלָבִים – אֵינוֹ אוֹנֶס. יָדוּעַ הַבַּבְלִי אוֹמֵר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי מֵאִיר: מֵרוּחַ אַחַת – אֵינוֹ אוֹנֶס, מִשְׁתֵּי רוּחוֹת – אוֹנֶס. הַלִּסְטִים – הֲרֵי זֶה אוֹנֶס. הָאֲרִי הַדּוֹב וְהַנָּמֵר וְהַבַּרְדְּלָס וְהַנָּחָשׁ – הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ אוֹנֶס.
human_translation: two dogs is not a circumstance beyond one’s control. Yadua the Babylonian says in the name of Rabbi Meir: from one direction it is not a circumstance beyond one’s control, from two directions, a circumstance beyond one’s control, bandits this is a circumstance beyond one’s control. a lion, a bear, a leopard, a cheetah, and a snake, these are a circumstance beyond one’s control.
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "Two dogs - not considered a case of force. It is known that the Babylonian says in the name of Rabbi Meir: From one spirit - not a case of force, from two spirits - a case of force. The listim - this is considered a case of force. The lion, bear, leopard, and serpent - these are considered a case of force."

hebrew_text: אֵימָתַי – בִּזְמַן שֶׁבָּאוּ מֵאֲלֵיהֶן. אֲבָל הוֹלִיכָן לִמְקוֹם גְּדוּדֵי חַיָּה וְלִסְטִים – אֵינוֹ אוֹנֶס.
human_translation: When when came of their own accord But led to a place of groups of beasts or bandits, is not a circumstance beyond one’s control,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "When - at the time they came from their mothers. But if one leads them to a place of predatory animals and robbers - it is not considered coercion."

hebrew_text: מֵתָה כְּדַרְכָּהּ – הֲרֵי זֶה אוֹנֶס. סִגְּפָהּ וָמֵתָה – אֵינוֹ אוֹנֶס. עָלְתָה לְרָאשֵׁי צוּקִין וְנָפְלָה – הֲרֵי זֶה אוֹנֶס. הֶעֱלָהּ לְרָאשֵׁי צוּקִין וְנָפְלָה וָמֵתָה – אֵינוֹ אוֹנֶס.
human_translation: died in its normal manner, this is a circumstance beyond one’s control; he afflicted it and it died, is not a circumstance beyond one’s control. ascended to the top of a cliff and fell this is a circumstance beyond one’s control. brought it up to the top of a cliff and it fell and died, not a circumstance beyond one’s control.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Meitah k'darkah - harei zeh ones. Siggfah vameitah - einu ones. Alatah l'rashei tzukin venafelah - harei zeh ones. He'elah l'rashei tzukin venafelah vameitah - einu ones." English translation: "If she died in her normal way - this is considered an accident. If she was pushed and died - it is not considered an accident. If she went up to the tops of cliffs and fell - this is considered an accident. If she went up to the tops of cliffs, fell, and died - it is not considered an accident."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ וְהָתַנְיָא: זְאֵב אֶחָד – אוֹנֶס! אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: הָהִיא בִּשְׁעַת מִשְׁלַחַת זְאֵבִים, וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה הִיא.
human_translation: But isn’t it taught one wolf is a circumstance beyond one’s control? Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: That of a time of wolf attacks, and it is Rabbi Yehuda
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Gemara: And it was taught in a baraita: One wolf - it is considered an accident! Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: That incident occurred at the time of sending out the wolves, and it was Rabbi Yehuda."

hebrew_text: הַלִּסְטִים – הֲרֵי זֶה אוֹנֶס. אַמַּאי? לוֹקֵי גַּבְרָא לַהֲדֵי גַּבְרָא! אָמַר רַב: בְּלִסְטִים מְזוּיָּין.
human_translation: bandits came, this is a circumstance beyond one’s control. Why? Let one man stand against another man. Rav said: to armed bandits,
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "Lists - this is considered coercion. Why? One man forces another man! Rav said: With lists, it is evident."

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: לִסְטִים מְזוּיָּין וְרוֹעֶה מְזוּיָּין, מַהוּ? מִי אָמְרִינַן אוֹקֵי גַּבְרָא לַהֲדֵי גַּבְרָא, אוֹ דִלְמָא: הַאי מָסַר נַפְשֵׁיהּ, וְהַאי לָא מָסַר נַפְשֵׁיהּ? מִסְתַּבְּרָא דְּהַאי מָסַר נַפְשֵׁיהּ, וְהַאי לָא מָסַר נַפְשֵׁיהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי לְרָבָא: אַשְׁכְּחֵיהּ רוֹעֶה, וַאֲמַר לֵיהּ: גַּנָּבָא סַרְיָא! בְּדוּכְתָּא פְּלָנְיָא יְתִיבִינַן,
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before an armed bandit and an armed shepherd, what is Do we say, let one man stand against another man, or perhaps this risk his life and that is not risk his life? It stands to reason that this one risk his life and that one not risk his life. Abaye said to Rava: shepherd found and said to him: You dirty thief! In such and such a place we sit;
llm_translation: The Gemara asks: With regard to stolen flax and stolen cattle, what is the law? Do we say that one can be established as a thief in order to make him liable for theft of the other, or perhaps this one has endangered his life, while the other has not endangered his life? It stands to reason that this one has endangered his life, while the other has not endangered his life. Abaye said to Rava: I found the shepherd, and he said to him: The thief is sitting in such and such a valley.

hebrew_text: כָּךְ וְכָךְ גַּבְרֵי אִיכָּא בַּהֲדַן, כָּךְ וְכָךְ כַּלְבֵי אִיכָּא בַּהֲדַן, כָּךְ וְכָךְ זוּקָתָא פְּסִיקָא לַן. וַאֲזַל וּשְׁקַל מִינֵּיהּ, מַאי? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הֲרֵי הוֹלִיכָן לִמְקוֹם גְּדוּדֵי חַיָּה וְלִסְטִים.
human_translation: such and such men with us; such and such dogs with us, such and such slings [ zukata ] with us. went and took from him, what said to he has taken them to a place of groups of beasts and bandits,
llm_translation: Thus and thus, the men of Ikka in Hadan, thus and thus, the dogs of Ikka in Hadan, thus and thus, the weasel has cut off our sustenance. He went and took from them, what? He said to him: "Behold, I am leading them to a place of wild beasts and thorns."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ מַתְנֶה שׁוֹמֵר חִנָּם לִהְיוֹת פָּטוּר מִשְּׁבוּעָה, וְהַשּׁוֹאֵל לִהְיוֹת פָּטוּר מִלְּשַׁלֵּם, נוֹשֵׂא שָׂכָר וְהַשּׂוֹכֵר לִהְיוֹת פְּטוּרִין מִשְּׁבוּעָה וּמִלְּשַׁלֵּם. כׇּל הַמַּתְנֶה עַל מַה שֶּׁכָּתוּב בַּתּוֹרָה – תְּנָאוֹ בָּטֵל,
human_translation: an unpaid bailee may stipulate that be exempt from an oath and a borrower that be exempt from to pay, a paid bailee or a renter that be exempt from an oath and from to pay, anyone who stipulates counter to that which is written in the Torah, his stipulation is void.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who lends his watchman for free is exempt from taking an oath, and the borrower is exempt from paying. One who hires a watchman, and the one who is hired, are exempt from taking an oath and from paying. Anyone who stipulates concerning that which is written in the Torah - his stipulation is void.

hebrew_text: וְכׇל תְּנַאי שֶׁיֵּשׁ מַעֲשֶׂה בִּתְחִילָּתוֹ – תְּנָאוֹ בָּטֵל. וְכׇל שֶׁאֶפְשָׁר לוֹ לְקַיְּימוֹ בְּסוֹפוֹ, וְהִתְנָה עִמּוֹ מִתְּחִילָּתוֹ – תְּנָאוֹ קַיָּים.
human_translation: And any condition that is preceded by an action, the condition is void And that one can ultimately fulfill, but he stipulated with him initially, his condition is valid.
llm_translation: And every Tanna that has an action at its beginning - his teaching is nullified. And every one that it is possible for him to fulfill it at its end, and he stipulated with him from the beginning - his teaching is upheld.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אַמַּאי? מַתְנֶה עַל מַה שֶּׁכָּתוּב בַּתּוֹרָה הוּא, וְכׇל הַמַּתְנֶה עַל מַה שֶּׁכָּתוּב בַּתּוֹרָה תְּנָאוֹ בָּטֵל!
human_translation: Why is stipulates counter to that which is written in the Torah, and anyone who stipulates counter to that which is written in the Torah, his condition is void.
llm_translation: Gemara: Why? Because he stipulated on that which is written in the Torah, and anyone who stipulates on that which is written in the Torah, his stipulation is nullified!

hebrew_text: הָא מַנִּי – רַבִּי יְהוּדָה הִיא, דְּאָמַר: בְּדָבָר שֶׁבְּמָמוֹן – תְּנָאוֹ קַיָּים. דְּתַנְיָא: הָאוֹמֵר לְאִשָּׁה ״הֲרֵי אַתְּ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת לִי עַל מְנָת שֶׁאֵין לִיךְ עָלַי שְׁאֵר כְּסוּת וְעוֹנָה״ – הֲרֵי זוֹ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת, וּתְנָאוֹ בָּטֵל, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: בְּדָבָר שֶׁבְּמָמוֹן – תְּנָאוֹ קַיָּים.
human_translation: whose is this It is Rabbi Yehuda, who says to monetary matters, his condition is valid. As it is taught one who says to a woman: You are hereby betrothed to me on the condition that you have no against me food, clothing, and conjugal rights, she is betrothed but his condition is void; the statement of Rabbi Meir. And Rabbi Yehuda said: With regard to monetary matters, his condition is valid.
llm_translation: The Mishna - Rabbi Yehuda it is, as he said: In matters of money - the stipulation holds. As it was taught: One who says to a woman, "Behold, you are consecrated to me on the condition that you have no claim upon me for maintenance and conjugal rights" - she is consecrated, and the stipulation is nullified, the words of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda says: In matters of money - the stipulation holds.

hebrew_text: וּמִי מָצֵית מוֹקְמַתְּ לַהּ כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה? אֵימָא סֵיפָא: כׇּל הַמַּתְנֶה עַל מַה שֶּׁכָּתוּב בַּתּוֹרָה – תְּנָאוֹ בָּטֵל, אֲתָאן לְרַבִּי מֵאִיר! הָא לָא קַשְׁיָא: לְעוֹלָם רַבִּי יְהוּדָה הִיא, וְסֵיפָא – בְּדָבָר שֶׁאֵינוֹ שֶׁל מָמוֹן.
human_translation: But can you establish in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda? Say the latter clause Anyone who stipulates counter to that which is written in the Torah, his condition is void. we arrive at Rabbi Meir. This not difficult, actually is Rabbi Yehuda, and the latter clause to non-monetary matters.
llm_translation: And who established for her like Rabbi Yehuda? Say the latter clause: Anyone who stipulates on something that is written in the Torah - his stipulation is nullified. They came to Rabbi Meir! This is not difficult: Indeed, it is Rabbi Yehuda, and the latter clause - in a matter that is not related to money.

hebrew_text: אֵימָא סֵיפָא: כׇּל תְּנַאי שֶׁיֵּשׁ בּוֹ מַעֲשֶׂה בִּתְחִילָּתוֹ – תְּנָאוֹ בָּטֵל, מַאן שָׁמְעַתְּ לֵיהּ דְּאִית לֵיהּ הָא סְבָרָא – רַבִּי מֵאִיר, דְּתַנְיָא: אַבָּא חֲלַפְתָּא אִישׁ כְּפַר חֲנַנְיָא אָמַר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי מֵאִיר: תְּנַאי קוֹדֵם לַמַּעֲשֶׂה – הֲרֵי זֶה תְּנַאי, מַעֲשֶׂה קוֹדֵם לַתְּנַאי – אֵינוֹ תְּנַאי.
human_translation: say the latter clause And any condition that is preceded by an action, the condition is void. Who have you heard who accepts this reasoning? Rabbi Meir, as it is taught Abba Ḥalafta, from village of Ḥananya, said in the name of Rabbi Meir: a condition before the action, this is condition, the action before the condition, it is not condition.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Eima seifa: kol tena'i sheyesh bo ma'aseh bitkhilato - tenao batel, man shome'at lei de'it lei ha sevara - Rabbi Meir, detanya: Abba Chalapta ish kefar Chananya amar mishum Rabbi Meir: tena'i kodem lama'aseh - harei zeh tena'i, ma'aseh kodem latena'i - einu tena'i. English translation: Say the latter clause: any Mishnaic dispute that has a practical application at its outset - its dispute is nullified. Who is the one who heard that there is a logical reasoning? - Rabbi Meir, as it was taught: Abba Chalapta, a man of Kfar Chananya, said in the name of Rabbi Meir: if a Mishnaic dispute precedes the practical application - this is a Mishnaic dispute, but if the practical application precedes the Mishnaic dispute - it is not a Mishnaic dispute.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא כּוּלַּהּ רַבִּי מֵאִיר הִיא, וְשָׁאנֵי הָכָא, דְּמֵעִיקָּרָא לָא שַׁעְבֵּד נַפְשֵׁיהּ.
human_translation: Rather, entire is Rabbi Meir. here it is different, as at the outset he did not obligate himself
llm_translation: Rather, the entirety is Rabbi Meir's, and the difference here is that initially he did not act for himself.

hebrew_text: תָּנָא: וּמַתְנֶה שׁוֹמֵר שָׂכָר לִהְיוֹת כְּשׁוֹאֵל. בְּמַאי? בִּדְבָרִים?! אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: בְּשֶׁקָּנוּ מִיָּדוֹ.
human_translation: taught A paid bailee can stipulate to be like a borrower, By what by speech Shmuel said: where performed acquisition with
llm_translation: Mishna: And one who appoints a watchman has the status of a borrower. With what is this analogous? With words?! Shmuel said: With the object that he acquired from him.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא בְּשֶׁלֹּא קָנוּ מִיָּדוֹ, בְּהָהִיא הֲנָאָה דְּקָא נָפֵיק לֵיהּ קָלָא דְּאִינִישׁ מְהֵימְנָא הוּא – גָּמַיר וּמְשַׁעְבֵּד נַפְשֵׁיהּ.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan said: You even say where did not perform acquisition with by that benefit that a rumor goes out about him that he is trustworthy person, he obligate himself,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: Even if you say that he did not acquire it from his hand, in that benefit that comes to him, the voice of a trustworthy person is heard - he acquires and benefits himself.
