hebrew_text: וְכׇל שֶׁאֶפְשָׁר לוֹ לְקַיְּימוֹ בְּסוֹפוֹ וְכוּ׳. אָמַר רַב טַבְלָא אָמַר רַב: זוֹ דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן תֵּימָא. אֲבָל חֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאִי אֶפְשָׁר לוֹ לְקַיְּימוֹ בְּסוֹפוֹ וְהִתְנָה עָלָיו מִתְּחִילָּתוֹ – תְּנָאוֹ קַיָּים.
human_translation: any that ultimately can be fulfilled, Rav Tavla says Rav says: This is the statement of Rabbi Yehuda ben Teima, but the Rabbis say: Even though one cannot ultimately fulfill and he stipulated with regard to it initially, his condition is valid.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And all that it is possible for him to fulfill in the end, etc. Rav Tabla said in the name of Rav: This is the statement of Rabbi Yehuda ben Tema. But the sages say: Even though it is impossible for him to fulfill it in the end, and he accepted upon himself from the beginning - his vow is valid.

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא: ״הֲרֵי זֶה גִּיטִּךְ עַל מְנָת שֶׁתַּעֲלִי לָרָקִיעַ, עַל מְנָת שֶׁתֵּרְדִי לַתְּהוֹם, עַל מְנָת שֶׁתִּבְלְעִי קָנֶה שֶׁל מֵאָה אַמָּה, עַל מְנָת שֶׁתַּעַבְרִי אֶת הַיָּם הַגָּדוֹל בְּרַגְלַיִךְ״, נִתְקַיֵּים הַתְּנַאי – הֲרֵי זֶה גֵּט, לֹא נִתְקַיֵּים הַתְּנַאי – אֵינוֹ גֵּט.
human_translation: As it is taught This is your bill of divorce on the condition that you ascend to the skies, on the condition that you descend to the depths; on the condition that you swallow a reed of one hundred cubits on the condition that you cross the Great Sea by foot, the condition was fulfilled is this bill of divorce, the condition was not fulfilled not bill of divorce.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: It was taught in a Baraita: "Behold, this is your bill of divorce on the condition that you ascend to the sky, on the condition that you descend to the depths, on the condition that you swallow a reed measuring one hundred cubits, on the condition that you pass through the great sea on your feet." If the condition is fulfilled, it is a valid divorce; if the condition is not fulfilled, it is not a valid divorce.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן תֵּימָא אוֹמֵר: כָּזֶה – גֵּט. כְּלָל אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן תֵּימָא: כֹּל שֶׁאִי אֶפְשָׁר לוֹ לְקַיְּימוֹ בְּסוֹפוֹ, וְהִתְנָה עָלָיו מִתְּחִילָּתוֹ – אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא כְּמַפְלִיגָהּ וְכָשֵׁר.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda ben Teima says: such as this is bill of divorce. Rabbi Yehuda ben Teima stated a principle: any that one cannot ultimately fulfill, and he stipulated initially, he is as only exaggerating, and valid.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda ben Tema says: "Like this - a get." Rabbi Yehuda ben Tema said a general principle: Anything that is impossible for him to fulfill in the end, and he accepted it upon himself from the beginning - it is nothing but like a conditional transaction and valid.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר רַב: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן תֵּימָא. אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: מַתְנִיתִין נָמֵי דַּיְקָא, דְּקָתָנֵי: כׇּל שֶׁאֶפְשָׁר לוֹ לְקַיְּימוֹ בְּסוֹפוֹ וְהִתְנָה עָלָיו מִתְּחִילָּתוֹ – תְּנָאוֹ קַיָּים, הָא אִי אֶפְשָׁר לוֹ לְקַיְּימוֹ – תְּנָאוֹ בָּטֵל. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman says Rav says: halakha in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda ben Teima. Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: The mishna is also precisely as it teaches: any that ultimately he can fulfill, and he stipulated with regard to it initially, his condition is valid. he cannot fulfill it, his condition is void. learn from this
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said in the name of Rav: The halacha is according to Rabbi Yehuda ben Teima. Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: The Mishnah supports this, as it teaches: "Anything that one can fulfill in the end, and he accepted upon himself from the beginning - his stipulation is valid. But if he cannot fulfill it in the end, his stipulation is nullified." Learn from this.

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ הַשּׂוֹכֵר אֶת הַפּוֹעֲלִים.
llm_translation: The employer shall return to you the workers.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַשּׁוֹאֵל אֶת הַפָּרָה וְשָׁאַל בְּעָלֶיהָ עִמָּהּ, אוֹ שָׂכַר בְּעָלֶיהָ עִמָּהּ, שָׁאַל הַבְּעָלִים אוֹ שְׂכָרָן וְאַחַר כָּךְ שָׁאַל אֶת הַפָּרָה וָמֵתָה – פָּטוּר, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אִם בְּעָלָיו עִמּוֹ לֹא יְשַׁלֵּם״.
human_translation: one who borrowed a cow and borrowed its owner with it, or hired its owner with it, borrowed the owner or hired him and afterward borrowed the cow; died, exempt as it is stated: “If its owner is with him, he does not pay”
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who borrows a cow and asks its owner to accompany it, or hires the cow with its owner accompanying it, if the owners asked or hired them and only afterwards the cow died - he is exempt, as it is stated: "If its owner was with him, he shall not pay."

hebrew_text: אֲבָל שָׁאַל אֶת הַפָּרָה וְאַחַר כָּךְ שָׁאַל אֶת הַבְּעָלִים, אוֹ שְׂכָרָן, וָמֵתָה – חַיָּיב, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״בְּעָלָיו אֵין עִמּוֹ שַׁלֵּם יְשַׁלֵּם״.
human_translation: But borrowed the cow and afterward borrowed the owner or hired him, and died, liable as it is stated: “If its owner is not with him, he shall pay”
llm_translation: But he asked about the cow and afterwards asked about the owners, or the renters, and it died - he is liable, as it is stated: "He shall surely make restitution; if it be torn in pieces."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מִדְּקָתָנֵי סֵיפָא: וְאַחַר כָּךְ שָׁאַל אֶת הַפָּרָה, מִכְּלָל דְּרֵישָׁא דְּקָתָנֵי ״עִמָּהּ״ – עִמָּהּ מַמָּשׁ. עִמָּהּ מַמָּשׁ, מִי מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ פָּרָה בִּמְשִׁיכָה, וּבְעָלִים בַּאֲמִירָה?
human_translation: From that the latter clause teaches: And afterward borrowed the cow, it may be inferred that the first clause teaches: with it, Literally with it, Can you find literally with it? cow through pulling and owner through verbal
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Gemara from the end of the Mishnah: And afterwards he asked about the cow, from the inference of the beginning of the Mishnah where it is taught 'with her' - with her literally. With her literally, who remembers the cow in its dragging, and the owners in its declaration?"

hebrew_text: אִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: כְּגוֹן דְּקַיְימָא פָּרָה בַּחֲצֵרוֹ דְּשׁוֹאֵל, דְּלָא מְחַסְּרָא מְשִׁיכָה. אִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: דַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ ״אַתְּ גּוּפָךְ לֹא תִּשָּׁאֵל עַד שְׁעַת מְשִׁיכַת פָּרָתְךָ״.
human_translation: If you wish, say such as where cow is standing in the borrower’s courtyard, so it does not lack, pulling. if you wish, say where says to him: You, yourself, will not be lent until moment of pulling of your cow.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: If you wish, say: For example, when he stands a cow in his courtyard and asks, for he does not diminish pulling. If you wish, say: For he said to him, "You yourself should not ask until the time of pulling your cow."

hebrew_text: תְּנַן הָתָם, אַרְבָּעָה שׁוֹמְרִים הֵם: שׁוֹמֵר חִנָּם וְהַשּׁוֹאֵל, נוֹשֵׂא שָׂכָר וְהַשּׂוֹכֵר.
human_translation: We learned there There are four bailees: An unpaid bailee, and the borrower, a paid bailee, and the renter.
llm_translation: We learned there, four guardians they are: the unpaid guardian, the borrower, the paid guardian, and the renter.

hebrew_text: שׁוֹמֵר חִנָּם נִשְׁבָּע עַל הַכֹּל, וְהַשּׁוֹאֵל מְשַׁלֵּם אֶת הַכֹּל, נוֹשֵׂא שָׂכָר וְהַשּׂוֹכֵר – נִשְׁבָּעִין עַל הַשְּׁבוּרָה וְעַל הַשְּׁבוּיָה וְעַל הַמֵּתָה, וּמְשַׁלְּמִים אֶת הָאֲבֵידָה וְאֶת הַגְּנֵיבָה.
human_translation: An unpaid bailee takes an oath over every And the borrower pays every a paid bailee and a renter take an oath over an injured over a captured and over a dead but they must pay loss or theft.
llm_translation: One who guards for free swears on everything, and the one who borrows pays for everything, the one who carries out a service and the one who hires - they swear on breakage, loss, theft, and death, and they pay for lost items and theft.

hebrew_text: מְנָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי? דְּתָנוּ רַבָּנַן: פָּרָשָׁה רִאשׁוֹנָה נֶאֶמְרָה בְּשׁוֹמֵר חִנָּם, שְׁנִיָּה – בְּשׁוֹמֵר שָׂכָר, שְׁלִישִׁית – בְּשׁוֹאֵל.
human_translation: From where are these matters As the Sages taught first passage is stated about an unpaid bailee; second about a paid bailee; third about a borrower.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: "What are these matters?" For the Rabbis taught: The first clause was stated regarding a gratuitous bailee, the second regarding a paid bailee, the third regarding a borrower.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא שְׁלִישִׁית בְּשׁוֹאֵל – מְפוֹרָשׁ: ״וְכִי יִשְׁאַל אִישׁ מֵעִם רֵעֵהוּ וְנִשְׁבַּר אוֹ מֵת בְּעָלָיו אֵין עִמּוֹ שַׁלֵּם יְשַׁלֵּם״. אֶלָּא רִאשׁוֹנָה בְּשׁוֹמֵר חִנָּם, שְׁנִיָּה בְּשׁוֹמֵר שָׂכָר – אֵיפוֹךְ אֲנָא!
human_translation: Granted, third about a borrower, explicitly “And when a man borrows from another, and it is injured or dies, if its owner is not with him, he shall pay” But first about an unpaid bailee second is about a paid bailee, I could reverse,
llm_translation: In truth, the third case in the Mishnah is explicit: "And if a man asks something of his neighbor and it is broken or dies while its owner is not with him, he shall surely make restitution." Rather, the first case is regarding one who watches for free, the second case is regarding one who watches for payment - the opposite is true!

hebrew_text: מִסְתַּבְּרָא שְׁנִיָּה בְּשׁוֹמֵר שָׂכָר, שֶׁכֵּן חַיָּיב בִּגְנֵיבָה וַאֲבֵידָה. אַדְּרַבָּה: רִאשׁוֹנָה בְּשׁוֹמֵר שָׂכָר, שֶׁכֵּן מְשַׁלֵּם תַּשְׁלוּמֵי כֶפֶל בְּטוֹעֵן טַעֲנַת גַּנָּב!
human_translation: it stands to reason second about a paid bailee, as liable in theft or loss On the contrary, first about a paid bailee, as pays double payment in stating the claim a thief
llm_translation: The second one is in charge of watching wages, for he is liable for theft and loss. On the contrary, the first one is in charge of watching deposits, for he pays double payment when he denies the claim of theft!

hebrew_text: אֲפִילּוּ הָכִי, קַרְנָא בְּלָא שְׁבוּעָה עֲדִיפָא מִכְּפֵילָא בִּשְׁבוּעָה.
human_translation: Even so, the principal without an oath, is a greater than the double payment, when oath
llm_translation: Even so, a horn without a pledge is preferable to a pledge with a horn.

hebrew_text: תִּדַּע, דְּהָא שׁוֹאֵל כׇּל הֲנָאָה שֶׁלּוֹ וְאֵינוֹ מְשַׁלֵּם אֶלָּא קֶרֶן.
human_translation: Know as a borrower All benefit is his, And he pays only principal
llm_translation: You should know, that one who borrows any item and does not pay except the principal.

hebrew_text: וְהַשּׁוֹאֵל כׇּל הֲנָאָה שֶׁלּוֹ? וְהָא בָּעֲיָא מְזוֹנֵי! דְּקַיְימָא בַּאֲגַם. וְהָא בָּעֲיָא נְטִירָה! בְּנָטַר מָתָא. וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: לָא תֵּימָא ״כׇּל הֲנָאָה שֶׁלּוֹ״, אֶלָּא אֵימָא ״רוֹב הֲנָאָה שֶׁלּוֹ״. וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: בִּשְׁאֵילַת כֵּלִים.
human_translation: But the borrower all benefit is his? But doesn’t require food, when is standing in a marsh, But doesn’t require safeguarding? when a city guard And if you wish, say: Do not say all benefit is his, rather say: Most of the benefit is his, And if you wish, say with regard to borrowing vessels,
llm_translation: The one who asks, "Is all his pleasure?" But he asks for sustenance! For he is standing by the marsh. But he asks for a basket! In the basket is a dead body. And if you wish, say: Do not say "all his pleasure," but say "most of his pleasure." And if you wish, say: Inquiring about utensils.

hebrew_text: נוֹשֵׂא שָׂכָר וְהַשּׂוֹכֵר נִשְׁבָּעִין עַל הַשְּׁבוּרָה וְעַל הַשְּׁבוּיָה וְעַל הַמֵּתָה, וּמְשַׁלְּמִין אֶת הָאֲבֵידָה וְאֶת הַגְּנֵיבָה.
human_translation: a paid bailee and a renter take an oath over an injured over a captured and over a dead but they must pay loss or theft.
llm_translation: The one who hires and the one who is hired are both sworn regarding breakage, loss, and death, and they pay for lost items and stolen items.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא גְּנֵיבָה, דִּכְתִיב: ״אִם גָּנוֹב יִגָּנֵב מֵעִמּוֹ יְשַׁלֵּם לִבְעָלָיו״, אֶלָּא אֲבֵידָה מְנָא לַן? דְּתַנְיָא: ״אִם גָּנֵב יִגָּנֵב״ – אֵין לִי אֶלָּא גְּנֵיבָה, אֲבֵידָה מִנַּיִן? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״אִם גָּנוֹב יִגָּנֵב״, מִכׇּל מָקוֹם.
human_translation: Granted, theft, as it is written: “If it is stolen from him, he must pay its owner” But loss, from where do we As it is taught “If it is stolen [ ganov yigganev ],” I have only stolen; from where lost? The verse states: “ ganov yigganev ,” in any case,
llm_translation: In truth, regarding theft, as it is written: "If a thief is found breaking in and is struck so that he dies, there shall be no bloodguilt for him," but how do we know about lost property? For it was taught: "If a thief is found breaking in" - I have only theft, but where do we derive lost property? The Talmud teaches: "If a thief is found breaking in," from any case.

hebrew_text: הָנִיחָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר: לָא אָמְרִינַן דִּבְּרָה תוֹרָה כִּלְשׁוֹן בְּנֵי אָדָם. אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר: אָמְרִינַן דִּבְּרָה תוֹרָה כִלְשׁוֹן בְּנֵי אָדָם, מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר?
human_translation: This works out well according to the one who says: We do not say the Torah spoke in the language of people, But according to the one who says: We do say the Torah spoke in the language of people, what can be said?
llm_translation: The Talmudic text translates as follows: "He left it for the one who said: We do not say that the Torah spoke in the language of people. Rather, for the one who said: We say that the Torah spoke in the language of people, what can be said?"

hebrew_text: אָמְרִי בְּמַעְרְבָא: קַל וָחוֹמֶר; וּמָה גְּנֵיבָה שֶׁקְּרוֹבָה לְאוֹנֶס – מְשַׁלֵּם, אֲבֵידָה שֶׁקְּרוֹבָה לִפְשִׁיעָה – לֹא כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן!
human_translation: They say in the West, an a fortiori If theft, which is near to circumstances beyond his control, pays loss, which is near to negligence, not all the more so
llm_translation: They said in the West: a fortiori argument; and just as theft that is close to rape - one must pay, a lost object that is close to robbery - all the more so!

hebrew_text: וְאִידַּךְ, מִילְּתָא דְּאָתְיָא בְּקַל וְחוֹמֶר טָרַח וְכָתַב לַהּ קְרָא.

hebrew_text: הִלְכָּךְ ״אִם בְּעָלָיו עִמּוֹ״ אַשּׁוֹמֵר חִנָּם לָא כְּתִיב, וּפְשִׁיעָה נָמֵי בְּשׁוֹמֵר שָׂכָר וּבְשׁוֹאֵל לָא כְּתִיב. הִלְכָּךְ, בְּשׁוֹמֵר שָׂכָר וּבְשׁוֹאֵל לְחִיּוּב אָתְיָא בְּקַל וָחוֹמֶר מִשּׁוֹמֵר חִנָּם.
human_translation: Accordingly, “If its owner is with him, is not written in reference to an unpaid bailee, And in addition, negligence, is not written in reference to a paid bailee or a borrower. Accordingly, liability of a paid bailee and of a borrower is derived via an a fortiori
llm_translation: Therefore, "if his owner is with him," the case of a guardian for free service is not written, and the case of negligence is similar in the case of a guardian for payment and in the case of a borrower is not written. Therefore, the liability comes for a guardian for payment and for a borrower through a fortiori reasoning from a guardian for free service.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל בִּבְעָלִים לִפְטוּר אַף בְּשׁוֹמֵר שָׂכָר וּבְשׁוֹאֵל – לָא. מַאי טַעְמָא: כִּי כְּתִיב ״אִם בְּעָלָיו עִמּוֹ לֹא יְשַׁלֵּם״ אַשּׁוֹאֵל וְאַשּׁוֹמֵר שָׂכָר – אַהָנָךְ חִיּוּבֵי דִּכְתִיב בְּהוּ בְּהֶדְיָא הוּא דְּמִיכְּתִב.
human_translation: But not even a paid bailee and a borrower are exempt with owner What is the reason When it is written: “If its owner is with him, he does not pay,” in reference to a borrower and to a paid bailee. it is written in reference to those liabilities that are written explicitly with regard to them.
llm_translation: But in the case of bailees, even in the case of a paid watchman and a borrower - no. What is the reason? For it is written, "If the owner is with him, he shall not pay." A borrower and a paid watchman - their obligations are dependent on whether the owner is with them.

hebrew_text: מַאן דְּאָמַר פָּטוּר, קָסָבַר: מִקְרָא נִדְרָשׁ לְפָנָיו וְלִפְנֵי פָנָיו, וְכִי כְּתִיב ״אִם בְּעָלָיו עִמּוֹ״ – אַשּׁוֹמֵר חִנָּם נָמֵי כְּתִיב.
human_translation: the one who says exempt holds the verse: is expounded preceding it, and preceding the one preceding it, And when it is written: “If its owner is with him, is written also in reference to an unpaid bailee,
llm_translation: One who says exempt, he holds: Scripture interpreted before Him and before His face, and is it written "if his owner is with him" - a free watcher is written.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: הַשּׁוֹאֵל הַפָּרָה וְשָׁאַל בְּעָלֶיהָ עִמָּהּ, הַשּׁוֹאֵל הַפָּרָה וְשָׂכַר בְּעָלֶיהָ עִמָּהּ, שָׁאַל בְּעָלֶיהָ אוֹ שְׂכָרָן וְאַחַר כָּךְ שָׁאַל הַפָּרָה וּמֵתָה – פָּטוּר. וְאִילּוּ שׁוֹמֵר חִנָּם לָא קָתָנֵי!
human_translation: We learned one who borrowed a cow and he borrowed its owner with it; one who borrowed a cow and he hired its owner with it; one borrowed the owner or hired him and afterward borrowed the cow; died, exempt. whereas it does not teach an unpaid bailee,
llm_translation: We learned in the Mishnah: If one inquires about a cow and asks its owner while she is with her, inquires about a cow and hires her owner while she is with her, asks her owner or hires them, and then inquires about the cow and she dies - he is exempt. But if he watches her for free, it is not taught!

hebrew_text: וּלְטַעְמָיךְ: שׁוֹמֵר שָׂכָר מִי קָתָנֵי?
human_translation: But according to your reasoning, does it teach a paid bailee?
llm_translation: And according to your reasoning: "Who is considered a 'Shomer Sachar'?"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא תַּנָּא, מִילְּתָא
human_translation: Rather, tanna the matter
llm_translation: Rather, it was taught: the matter.

hebrew_text: דִּכְתִיבָא בְּהֶדְיָא – קָתָנֵי, דְּאָתְיָא מִדְּרָשָׁא – לָא קָתָנֵי.
human_translation: that is explicitly written he teaches, that are derived through interpretation he does not teach.
llm_translation: In the written Torah - it is taught, that which comes from the Midrash - is not taught.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: שְׁאָלָהּ וְשָׁאַל בְּעָלֶיהָ עִמָּהּ, שְׂכָרָהּ וְשָׂכַר בְּעָלֶיהָ עִמָּהּ, שְׁאָלָהּ וְשָׂכַר בְּעָלֶיהָ עִמָּהּ, שְׂכָרָהּ וְשָׁאַל בְּעָלֶיהָ עִמָּהּ, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁהַבְּעָלִים עוֹשִׂין מְלָאכָה בְּמָקוֹם אַחֵר, וָמֵתָה – פָּטוּר.
human_translation: Come hear one borrowed and borrowed its owner with it, rented it and hired its owner with it, borrowed it and hired its owner with it, rented it and borrowed its owner with it; although the owner performed work in another place, and it dies, exempt.
llm_translation: Come and hear: If she asked her husband and he asked with her, her reward and his reward with her, she asked and he received reward with her, her reward and he asked with her, even though the husbands were working elsewhere, and she died - he is exempt.

hebrew_text: סַבְרוּהָ הָא מַנִּי – רַבִּי יְהוּדָה הִיא, דְּאָמַר: שׂוֹכֵר כְּשׁוֹמֵר שָׂכָר דָּמֵי! וְהָא הַאי תַּנָּא קָתָנֵי מִילְּתָא דְּאָתְיָא מִדְּרָשָׁא, וְאִילּוּ שׁוֹמֵר חִנָּם לָא קָתָנֵי!
human_translation: assumed that this whose is Rabbi Yehuda, who says one who rents like a paid bailee. Doesn’t this tanna teach a matter that is derived through interpretation, while he does not teach an unpaid bailee?
llm_translation: They thought it is Rabbi Yehuda, as he said: "One who hires is like a watchman for the wages." But this Mishnah teaches a matter that comes from the exposition, and if it were about a watchman who guards for free, it would not have been taught!

hebrew_text: הָא מַנִּי – רַבִּי מֵאִיר הִיא, דְּאָמַר: שׂוֹכֵר כְּשׁוֹמֵר חִנָּם דָּמֵי, וְתַנָּא שׁוֹמֵר חִנָּם, וְהוּא הַדִּין לְשׁוֹמֵר שָׂכָר.
human_translation: whose this is Rabbi Meir, who says one who rents is like an unpaid bailee. And, teaches an unpaid bailee, and the same is true for a paid bailee.
llm_translation: The text reads: "Ha mani - Rabbi Meir hi, de'amar: socher k'shomer chinam damei, ve'tana shomer chinam, ve'hu hadin leshomer sakhar." Translation: "This is a dispute - it is Rabbi Meir, who says: one who rents is like a watchman for free, and it was taught: a watchman for free, and the same applies to a watchman for pay."

hebrew_text: אִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא כִּדְמַחְלֵיף רַבָּה בַּר אֲבוּהּ וְתָנֵי: שׂוֹכֵר כֵּיצַד מְשַׁלֵּם? רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: כְּשׁוֹמֵר שָׂכָר, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: כְּשׁוֹמֵר חִנָּם.
human_translation: If you wish, say As Rabba bar Avuh reversed and taught: How does one who rents pay Rabbi Meir says: Like a paid bailee. Rabbi Yehuda says: Like an unpaid bailee.
llm_translation: If you wish, say: When did Rabba bar Avuh teach: How does one pay a hired worker? Rabbi Meir says: When he guards for pay, Rabbi Yehuda says: When he guards for free.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב הַמְנוּנָא: לְעוֹלָם הוּא חַיָּיב עַד שֶׁתְּהֵא פָּרָה וְחוֹרֵשׁ בָּהּ, חֲמוֹר וּמְחַמֵּר אַחֲרֶיהָ, וְעַד שֶׁיְּהוּ בְּעָלִים מִשְּׁעַת שְׁאֵילָה עַד שְׁעַת שְׁבוּרָה וּמֵתָה. אַלְמָא קָסָבַר ״בְּעָלָיו עִמּוֹ״ – אַכּוּלַּהּ מִילְּתָא מַשְׁמַע.
human_translation: Rav Hamnuna says is always liable, unless is a cow and plows with it a donkey and drives it behind it And unless the owner from time of the borrowing until time when it is injured or dies. Evidently, holds “Its owner is with him” teaches for the entire matter.
llm_translation: Rav Hamnuna said: Always he is liable until there is a cow and one plows with it, a donkey and one loads it, and until there are owners from the time of borrowing until the time of breaking and it dies. This implies that he holds "its owners are with it" – the matter is clear.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רָבָא: שְׁאָלָהּ וְשָׁאַל בְּעָלֶיהָ עִמָּהּ, שְׂכָרָהּ וְשָׂכַר בְּעָלֶיהָ עִמָּהּ, שְׂכָרָהּ וְשָׁאַל בְּעָלֶיהָ עִמָּהּ, שְׁאָלָהּ וְשָׂכַר בְּעָלֶיהָ עִמָּהּ, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁהַבְּעָלִים עוֹשִׂין מְלָאכָה בְּמָקוֹם אַחֵר וָמֵתָה – פָּטוּר. מַאי לָאו ״בִּמְלָאכָה אַחֶרֶת״?
human_translation: Rava raises an objection one borrowed and borrowed its owner with it, rented it and hired its owner with it, rented it and borrowed its owner with it, borrowed it and hired its owner with it; although the owner performed work in another place, and it died, exempt. What, is it not with different work
llm_translation: The Gemara raises an objection: If she asked and her husband asked with her, her wage and her husband's wage with her, her wage and her husband asked with her, she asked and her husband's wage with her, even though the owners were working in another place and she died - he is exempt. What is the reason? Is it not because it was not "in another work"?

hebrew_text: לָא, בְּאוֹתָהּ מְלָאכָה. אֶלָּא, מַאי ״מָקוֹם אַחֵר״? דְּקָא מְרַפֵּי וְאָזֵיל קַמַּהּ.
human_translation: No, with same work But, what in another place? where loosens while walking ahead
llm_translation: Not in that work. Rather, what is "another place"? For he is delaying and then going to stand.

hebrew_text: וְהָא מִדְּסֵיפָא ״עַל גַּבָּהּ״ הָוֵי, רֵישָׁא בִּמְלָאכָה אַחֶרֶת, דְּקָתָנֵי סֵיפָא: שְׁאָלָהּ וְאַחַר כָּךְ שָׁאַל בְּעָלֶיהָ, שְׂכָרָהּ וְאַחַר כָּךְ שָׂכַר בְּעָלֶיהָ עִמָּהּ, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁהַבְּעָלִים חוֹרְשִׁין עַל גַּבָּהּ וָמֵתָה – חַיָּיב!
human_translation: But from the latter clause alongside it, the first clause, with different work. As the latter clause teaches: he borrowed it and afterward borrowed its owner, rented it and afterward hired its owner with it, although the owner was plowing alongside it and it died, liable.
llm_translation: And this is the case from the latter clause "on top of it" it is, the former clause in another work, as it teaches in the latter clause: he asked her, and afterwards her husband asked, her wage, and afterwards her husband's wage with her, even though the owners were plowing on top of it and she died - they are liable!

hebrew_text: אָמְרִי: רֵישָׁא וְסֵיפָא בְּאוֹתָהּ מְלָאכָה, וְרֵישָׁא רְבוּתָא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן, וְסֵיפָא רְבוּתָא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן. רֵישָׁא רְבוּתָא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן, דְּאַף עַל גַּב דְּלָאו עַל גַּבָּהּ אֶלָּא בְּאוֹתָהּ מְלָאכָה, כֵּיוָן דַּהֲווֹ בְּעָלִים בִּשְׁעַת שְׁאֵילָה – פָּטוּר. וְסֵיפָא רְבוּתָא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן, דְּאַף עַל גַּב דְּעַל גַּבָּהּ, כֵּיוָן דְּלָא הֲווֹ בְּעָלִים בִּשְׁעַת שְׁאֵילָה – חַיָּיב.
human_translation: say: the first clause and the latter clause with the same work And the first clause teaches us a novelty and the latter clause teaches us a novelty. The first clause teaches us the novelty that although was not alongside but with the same work, since owner was at time of the borrowing, exempt. The latter clause teaches us the novelty that although was alongside since owner was not at time of the borrowing, liable.
llm_translation: They said: the beginning and the end in that work, and the beginning implies to us a leniency, and the end implies to us a leniency. The beginning implies to us a leniency, for even though it is not on top of it but rather in that work, since they were owners at the time of borrowing - exempt. And the end implies to us a leniency, for even though it is on top of it, since they were not owners at the time of borrowing - liable.

hebrew_text: הַאי מַאי?! אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא רֵישָׁא בִּמְלָאכָה אַחֶרֶת, וְסֵיפָא בְּאוֹתָהּ מְלָאכָה – הַיְינוּ רְבוּתָא.
human_translation: What is this? Granted, if you say the first clause in different work and the latter clause in same work this is the novelty
llm_translation: This what?! If you say in the beginning regarding a different work, and in the end regarding the same work - that is a contradiction.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ רֵישָׁא וְסֵיפָא בְּאוֹתָהּ מְלָאכָה, מַאי רְבוּתָא? אִידֵּי וְאִידֵּי בְּאוֹתָהּ מְלָאכָה הָוֵי!
human_translation: But if you say the first clause and the latter clause in same work what is the novelty this and that in same work
llm_translation: Rather, if you say the beginning and the end are in the same work, what is the excess? Both this and this in the same work it is!

hebrew_text: וְעוֹד, תַּנְיָא: מִמַּשְׁמַע שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר ״אִם בְּעָלָיו עִמּוֹ לֹא יְשַׁלֵּם״ אֵינִי יוֹדֵעַ שֶׁאִם בְּעָלָיו אֵין עִמּוֹ שַׁלֵּם יְשַׁלֵּם? אֶלָּא מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״בְּעָלָיו אֵין עִמּוֹ״ – לוֹמַר לָךְ: הָיָה עִמּוֹ בִּשְׁעַת שְׁאֵילָה – אֵין צָרִיךְ לִהְיוֹת עִמּוֹ בִּשְׁעַת שְׁבוּרָה וּמֵתָה, הָיָה עִמּוֹ בִּשְׁעַת שְׁבוּרָה וּמֵתָה – צָרִיךְ לִהְיוֹת עִמּוֹ בִּשְׁעַת שְׁאֵילָה.
human_translation: And furthermore, it is taught From the implication of that which is stated: “If its owner is with him, he does not pay” do I not know that “if its owner is not with him, he shall pay” Rather, what the verse states: “Its owner is not with him”? to tell you: he was with him, at time of borrowing, he does not need to be with him at time when injured or dies was with him at time when injured or dies, he need to have been with him at time of borrowing
llm_translation: And furthermore, it was taught in a Baraita: From what is implied when it is stated, "If his owner is with him, he shall not make restitution," I do not know that if his owner is not with him, he shall make restitution. Rather, what is the Talmud teaching us by stating, "his owner is not with him"? – To tell you: If he was with him at the time of borrowing, he does not need to be with him at the time of breaking and dying; if he was with him at the time of breaking and dying, he needs to be with him at the time of borrowing.

hebrew_text: וְתַנְיָא אִידַּךְ: מִמַּשְׁמַע שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר ״בְּעָלָיו אֵין עִמּוֹ שַׁלֵּם יְשַׁלֵּם״ אֵינִי יוֹדֵעַ שֶׁאִם בְּעָלָיו עִמּוֹ לֹא יְשַׁלֵּם? אֶלָּא מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״אִם בְּעָלָיו עִמּוֹ״? לוֹמַר לְךָ: כֵּיוָן שֶׁיָּצְאָה מֵרְשׁוּת מַשְׁאִיל שָׁעָה אַחַת בִּבְעָלִים וָמֵתָה – פָּטוּר. תְּיוּבְתָּא דְּרַב הַמְנוּנָא. תְּיוּבְתָּא.
human_translation: And it is taught another From the implication of that which is stated: “If its owner is not with him, he shall pay,” do I not know that “if its owner is with him, he does not pay”? Rather, what the verse states: “If its owner is with him”? to tell you: Once has left the domain of the lender, with owner one moment, and it dies, exempt. The refutation of Rav Hamnuna is a conclusive refutation.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And it was taught in another Baraita: From the implication of what is stated, "if his owner is not with him, he shall surely make it good," I do not know if his owner is with him, will he not make it good? Rather, what is the Talmud coming to say with "if his owner is with him"? It is coming to tell you: Once she has left the domain of the lender for even a moment in the possession of the owners and died – he is exempt. This is the opinion of Rav Hamnuna. This is the opinion.

hebrew_text: אַבָּיֵי סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי יֹאשִׁיָּה, וּמְתָרֵץ לִקְרָאֵי כְּרַבִּי יֹאשִׁיָּה. רָבָא סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי יוֹנָתָן, וּמְתָרֵץ לִקְרָאֵי כְּרַבִּי יוֹנָתָן.
human_translation: Abaye holds in accordance with Rabbi Yoshiya, and he explains the verses in accordance with Rabbi Yoshiya. Rava holds in accordance with Rabbi Yonatan, and he explains the verses in accordance with Rabbi Yonatan.
llm_translation: Abaye thought like Rabbi Yoshiyah, and he resolves the verses like Rabbi Yoshiyah. Rava thought like Rabbi Yonatan, and he resolves the verses like Rabbi Yonatan.

hebrew_text: אַבָּיֵי סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי יֹאשִׁיָּה וּמְתָרֵץ לִקְרָאֵי כְּרַבִּי יֹאשִׁיָּה: ״בְּעָלָיו אֵין עִמּוֹ שַׁלֵּם יְשַׁלֵּם״, טַעְמָא דְּלֵיתֵיהּ בְּתַרְוַיְיהוּ, הָא אִיתֵיהּ בַּחֲדָא וְלֵיתֵיהּ בַּחֲדָא – פָּטוּר.
human_translation: Abaye holds in accordance with Rabbi Yoshiya, and he explains the verses in accordance with Rabbi Yoshiya, “If its owner is not with him, he shall pay,” the reason that was not at either he at one but not at one, exempt.
llm_translation: Abaye holds like Rabbi Yoshiyah and resolves the verses like Rabbi Yoshiyah: "His owner is not with him, he shall surely make restitution." The reason that applies when neither of them is present is because if one is present and the other is not present - he is exempt.

hebrew_text: וְהָא כְּתִיב: ״אִם בְּעָלָיו עִמּוֹ לֹא יְשַׁלֵּם״, טַעְמָא דְּאִיתֵיהּ בְּתַרְוַיְיהוּ, הָא אִי אִיתֵיהּ בַּחֲדָא וְלֵיתֵיהּ בַּחֲדָא – מִחַיַּיב.
human_translation: But isn’t it written: “If its owner is with him, he does not pay”? the reason that was at both if he was at one but not at one, liable.
llm_translation: And this, as it is written: "If its owner is with him, he shall not make restitution," the reason being that it is with both of them. But if it is with one and not with the other - he is liable.

hebrew_text: לוֹמַר לָךְ: הָיָה עִמּוֹ בִּשְׁעַת שְׁאֵילָה – אֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ לִהְיוֹת עִמּוֹ בִּשְׁעַת שְׁבוּרָה וּמֵתָה, הָיָה עִמּוֹ בִּשְׁעַת שְׁבוּרָה וּמֵתָה – צָרִיךְ לִהְיוֹת עִמּוֹ בִּשְׁעַת שְׁאֵילָה.
human_translation: to tell you: he was with him, at time of borrowing, he does not need to be with him at time when injured or dies was with him at time when injured or dies, he need to have been with him at time of borrowing
llm_translation: To say to you: If he was with him at the time of borrowing - he does not need to be with him at the time of breaking and dying, if he was with him at the time of breaking and dying - he needs to be with him at the time of borrowing.

hebrew_text: רָבָא סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי יוֹנָתָן וּמְתָרֵץ לִקְרָאֵי כְּרַבִּי יוֹנָתָן, דְּתַנְיָא: ״אִם בְּעָלָיו עִמּוֹ לֹא יְשַׁלֵּם״. מַשְׁמַע דְּאִיתֵיהּ בְּתַרְוַיְיהוּ, וּמַשְׁמַע נָמֵי דְּכִי אִיתֵיהּ בַּחֲדָא וְלֵיתֵיהּ בַּחֲדָא – פָּטוּר.
human_translation: Rava holds in accordance with Rabbi Yonatan, and he explains the verses in accordance with Rabbi Yonatan, as it is taught “If its owner is with him, he does not pay” teaches which was at both and it also teaches which was at one but not at one; exempt.
llm_translation: Rava holds like Rabbi Yonatan and resolves the verses like Rabbi Yonatan, as it was taught: "If its owner is with him, he shall not make restitution." It is understood that it applies in both scenarios, and it is also understood that when it applies in one case and not in the other, he is exempt.

hebrew_text: וּכְתִיב: ״בְּעָלָיו אֵין עִמּוֹ שַׁלֵּם יְשַׁלֵּם״ – מַשְׁמַע דְּלֵיתֵיהּ בְּתַרְוַיְיהוּ, מַשְׁמַע נָמֵי דְּכִי אִיתֵיהּ בַּחֲדָא וְלֵיתֵיהּ בַּחֲדָא – חַיָּיב.
human_translation: But it is written: “If its owner is not with him, he shall pay.” teaches which was not at either and it also teaches which he was at one but not at one; liable.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And it is written: "With its owner it is not complete, he shall surely make restitution" - this implies that if it is not with both of them, it is also understood that if it is with one and not with the other - he is liable.

hebrew_text: לוֹמַר לָךְ: הָיָה עִמּוֹ בִּשְׁעַת שְׁאֵלָה – אֵין צָרִיךְ לִהְיוֹת עִמּוֹ בִּשְׁעַת שְׁבוּרָה וּמֵתָה, הָיָה עִמּוֹ בִּשְׁעַת שְׁבוּרָה וּמֵתָה – צָרִיךְ לִהְיוֹת עִמּוֹ בִּשְׁעַת שְׁאֵלָה.
human_translation: to tell you was with at time of borrowing, he does not need to be with him at time when injured or dies was with him at time when injured or dies, he need to have been with him at time of borrowing
llm_translation: To say to you: was with him at time of asking - not necessary to be with him at time of breaking and dying, was with him at time of breaking and dying - necessary to be with him at time of asking.

hebrew_text: אֵיפוֹךְ אֲנָא! מִסְתַּבְּרָא שְׁאֵלָה עֲדִיפָא, מִשּׁוּם דְּקָא מַיְיתֵי לַהּ לִרְשׁוּתֵיהּ.
human_translation: I could reverse It is reasonable borrowing is greater as brings into his domain.
llm_translation: Opposite I! Inquiry preferable, because it comes to him to his domain.

hebrew_text: אַדְּרַבָּה, שְׁבוּרָה וּמֵתָה עֲדִיפָא, שֶׁכֵּן חַיָּיב בָּאוֹנָסִין!
human_translation: On the contrary, injured or dies is greater that when is liable for accidents
llm_translation: אַדְּרַבָּה, - Adbarah, שְׁבוּרָה - Shevurah וּמֵתָה - umeitah עֲדִיפָא - adifa, שֶׁכֵּן - sheken חַיָּיב - chayav בָּאוֹנָסִין - ba'onsin!

hebrew_text: אִי לָא שְׁאֵלָה, שְׁבוּרָה וּמֵתָה מַאי עָבֵיד? וְאִי לָאו שְׁבוּרָה וּמֵתָה, שְׁאֵלָה מַאי עָבֵיד? אֲפִילּוּ הָכִי שְׁאֵלָה עֲדִיפָא, שֶׁכֵּן חַיָּיב בִּמְזוֹנוֹתֶיהָ.
human_translation: Were it not for borrowing, what caused injured or dies? But were it not for injured or dies, what caused borrowing? Even so, borrowing is greater as is obligated to sustenance
llm_translation: If she did not ask, she is broken and dead, what should she do? And if she is not broken and dead, what should she ask? Even so, asking is preferable, for thus she is obligated in her sustenance.

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר, אָמַר קְרָא: ״וְכִי יִשְׁאַל אִישׁ מֵעִם רֵעֵהוּ״, וְלֹא רֵעֵהוּ עִמּוֹ – ״שַׁלֵּם יְשַׁלֵּם״, הָא רֵעֵהוּ עִמּוֹ – פָּטוּר.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said The verse states: “And when a man borrows from another… but other was not with him, “He shall pay.” other person with him, exempt.
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said, the verse says: "And if a man borrows from his neighbor," and not his neighbor with him - "he shall surely make restitution," if his neighbor is with him - he is exempt.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי: ״בְּעָלָיו אֵין עִמּוֹ״, וְ״אִם בְּעָלָיו עִמּוֹ״ לְמָה לִי? אִי לָאו הָנָךְ, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: הַאי אוֹרְחֵיהּ דִּקְרָא הוּא.
human_translation: If so, why do I “Its owner is not with him,” and “If its owner is with him”? If it were not for these I would say this is the manner of the verse,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "If so: 'his owner is not with him,' and 'if his owner is with him,' why do I need it? If not, this one, I would say: this is the way of the verse."

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי רָמֵי בַּר חָמָא שְׁאָלָהּ לְרִבְעָהּ, מַהוּ? כִּדְשָׁיְילִי אִינָשֵׁי בָּעֵינַן וּלְהָכִי לָא שָׁיְילִי אִינָשֵׁי, אוֹ דִלְמָא טַעְמָא מַאי – מִשּׁוּם הֲנָאָה, וְהַאי נָמֵי הָא אִית לֵיהּ הֲנָאָה.
human_translation: Rami bar Ḥama raises a dilemma: borrowed to engage in bestiality with it, what is do we require similar to that which people borrow and people do not borrow for this Or perhaps, what is the reason due to benefit and this too, has benefit
llm_translation: Ba'ei Ramei bar Ḥama asked her question to her friend: What? Like the people of Shaili, we require and thus we do not require, or perhaps there is a reason - for pleasure, and this one has pleasure.

hebrew_text: שְׁאָלָהּ לֵירָאוֹת בָּהּ, מַהוּ? מָמוֹנָא בָּעֵינַן וְהָאִיכָּא, אוֹ דִלְמָא מָמוֹנָא דְּאִית לֵיהּ הֲנָאָה מִינֵּיהּ בָּעֵינַן וְלֵיכָּא?
human_translation: one borrowed to be seen with it, what is do we require of monetary worth, and Or, perhaps we require of monetary worth from which he derives benefit, and
llm_translation: Question: To be concerned about it, what? Money we require and is there, or perhaps money that he has benefit from we require and there is not?

hebrew_text: שְׁאָלָהּ לַעֲשׂוֹת בָּהּ פָּחוֹת מִפְּרוּטָה, מַהוּ? מָמוֹנָא בָּעֵינַן וְאִיכָּא, אוֹ דִלְמָא כׇּל פָּחוֹת מִפְּרוּטָה – לֹא כְּלוּם הִיא.
human_translation: one borrowed to perform with it less than one peruta , what is Do we require of monetary worth, and Or, perhaps any less than one peruta is nothing,
llm_translation: Question: If one asks to do less than its specified amount, what is the ruling? Do we require the full amount of money, and it is available, or perhaps any amount less than its specified amount is considered as nothing.

hebrew_text: שָׁאַל שְׁתֵּי פָּרוֹת לַעֲשׂוֹת בָּהֶן פְּרוּטָה, מַהוּ? מִי אָמְרִינַן: זִיל בָּתַר שׁוֹאֵל וּמַשְׁאִיל, וְאִיכָּא? אוֹ דִּלְמָא: זִיל בָּתַר פָּרוֹת וְכֹל חֲדָא וַחֲדָא לֵיכָּא מָמוֹנָא?
human_translation: one borrowed two cows to perform with them one peruta what is do we say: Follow borrower and lender, and there is Or, perhaps we follow cows, and each one does not monetary worth
llm_translation: He asked two cows to make a profit from them, what? Do we say: Go after lending and borrowing, and is there? Or perhaps: Go after cows and each one has its own money?

hebrew_text: שָׁאַל מִשּׁוּתָּפִין וְנִשְׁאַל לוֹ אֶחָד מֵהֶן, מַהוּ? כּוּלּוֹ בְּעָלָיו בָּעֵינַן – וְהָא לֵיכָּא, אוֹ דִלְמָא מֵהָהוּא פַּלְגָא דִּידֵיהּ מִיהָא מִיפְּטַר?
human_translation: one borrowed from partners, and one of those were borrowed by him, what is do we require all of owners and Or, perhaps in any event, should be exempt for that half
llm_translation: He asked his partners, and one of them asked him, what? We require all of it in his possession - but isn't it possible that he can exempt himself from that portion?

hebrew_text: שׁוּתָּפִין שֶׁשָּׁאֲלוּ וְנִשְׁאַל לְאֶחָד מֵהֶן, מַהוּ? כּוּלּוֹ שׁוֹאֵל בָּעֵינַן, וְלֵיכָּא? אוֹ דִלְמָא בְּהָהִיא פַּלְגָא דְּשַׁיְילֵיהּ מִיהַת מִיפְּטַר?
human_translation: partners who borrowed and were borrowed by one of them, what is do we require all the borrowers, and Or, perhaps in any event, should be exempt for the half that had borrowed.
llm_translation: Partners who asked and were asked by one of them, what? All of them ask in our eyes, and there is none? Or perhaps in that half that he asked from him he is exempt?

hebrew_text: שָׁאַל מֵהָאִשָּׁה וְנִשְׁאַל בַּעְלָהּ, אִשָּׁה שֶׁשָּׁאֲלָה וְנִשְׁאַל לַבַּעַל, מַהוּ? קִנְיַן פֵּירוֹת כְּקִנְיַן גּוּף דָּמֵי, אוֹ לָא?
human_translation: one borrowed from a woman, and her husband were borrowed a woman borrowed and were borrowed by husband, what is ownership of profits is tantamount to ownership of the itself or not.
llm_translation: He asked from the woman and her husband was asked, a woman who asked and her husband was asked, what is the law? Acquisition of produce is like acquisition of the body itself, or not?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבִינָא לְרַב אָשֵׁי: הָאוֹמֵר לִשְׁלוּחוֹ צֵא וְהִשָּׁאֵל לִי עִם פָּרָתִי, מַהוּ? ״בְּעָלָיו״ מַמָּשׁ בָּעֵינַן וְלֵיכָּא, אוֹ דִלְמָא שְׁלוּחוֹ שֶׁל אָדָם כְּמוֹתוֹ, וְאִיכָּא?
human_translation: Ravina said to Rav Ashi: one who says to his agent: Go and lend your on my behalf with my cow what is I require actual owner and Or perhaps, a person’s agent is like himself, and
llm_translation: Ravina said to Rav Ashi: One who says to his messenger, "Go and borrow for me with my cow," what is the ruling? Do we require the actual owner himself, and there is no valid borrowing, or perhaps the messenger of a person is like himself, and it is valid?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אַחָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אַוְיָא לְרַב אָשֵׁי: בַּעַל – פְּלוּגְתָּא דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן וְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ, שָׁלִיחַ – פְּלוּגְתָּא דְּרַבִּי יוֹנָתָן וְרַבִּי יֹאשִׁיָּה.
human_translation: Rav Aḥa, son of Rav Avya, said to Rav Ashi: a husband a dispute between Rabbi Yoḥanan and Reish Lakish. an agent a dispute between Rabbi Yonatan and Rabbi Yoshiya.
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Acha son of Rav Avya said to Rav Ashi: The husband - the dispute of Rabbi Yochanan and Reish Lakish, the messenger - the dispute of Rabbi Yonatan and Rabbi Yoshiyah.

hebrew_text: בַּעַל – פְּלוּגְתָּא דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן וְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ. דְּאִיתְּמַר: הַמּוֹכֵר שָׂדֵהוּ לַחֲבֵירוֹ לְפֵירוֹת, רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אוֹמֵר: מֵבִיא וְקוֹרֵא, רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אוֹמֵר: מֵבִיא וְאֵינוֹ קוֹרֵא,
human_translation: a husband a dispute between Rabbi Yoḥanan and Reish Lakish As it was stated: one who sells his field to another, for its produce, Rabbi Yoḥanan says: brings and recites Reish Lakish says: brings but does not recite
llm_translation: Owner of the dispute of Rabbi Yochanan and Reish Lakish. It was stated: One who sells his field to his friend for produce, Rabbi Yochanan says: He brings and reads, Reish Lakish says: He brings and does not read.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אוֹמֵר מֵבִיא וְקוֹרֵא: קִנְיַן פֵּירוֹת כְּקִנְיַן הַגּוּף דָּמֵי. וְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אוֹמֵר מֵבִיא וְאֵינוֹ קוֹרֵא: קִנְיַן פֵּירוֹת לָאו כְּקִנְיַן הַגּוּף דָּמֵי.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says brings and recites ownership its produce is tantamount to ownership of the itself. And Reish Lakish says brings but does not recite ownership of its produce is not tantamount to ownership of the itself.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan says: One brings and reads. Acquiring produce is like acquiring the body itself. And Reish Lakish says: One brings but does not read. Acquiring produce is not like acquiring the body itself.

hebrew_text: שָׁלִיחַ – פְּלוּגְתָּא דְּרַבִּי יוֹנָתָן וְרַבִּי יֹאשִׁיָּה. דְּתַנְיָא: הָאוֹמֵר לְאַפּוֹטְרוֹפּוֹס: כׇּל נְדָרִים שֶׁתְּהֵא אִשְׁתִּי נוֹדֶרֶת מִכָּאן עַד שֶׁאָבֹא מִמָּקוֹם פְּלוֹנִי – הָפֵר לָהּ, וְהֵפֵיר לָהּ, יָכוֹל יְהוּ מוּפָרִין, תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״אִישָׁהּ יְקִימֶנּוּ וְאִישָׁהּ יְפֵרֶנּוּ״, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יֹאשִׁיָּה. רַבִּי יוֹנָתָן אוֹמֵר: מָצִינוּ בְּכׇל מָקוֹם שֶׁשְּׁלוּחוֹ שֶׁל אָדָם כְּמוֹתוֹ.
human_translation: an agent a dispute between Rabbi Yonatan and Rabbi Yoshiya, as it is taught one who says to a steward All vows that my wife will vow from now until I come from such and such a place, nullify for her and annulled for her, might they would be nullified. the verse states “Her husband sustains it and her husband nullifies it” the statement of Rabbi Yoshiya. Rabbi Yonatan says: We have found everywhere a person’s agent is like himself.
llm_translation: Messenger - dispute of Rabbi Yonatan and Rabbi Yoshiyah. As it was taught: One who says to his agent: "All vows that my wife makes from here until I come from such and such a place" - he annuls them for her, and he nullifies them for her, one might think they are completely annulled. The Talmud teaches us: "Her husband shall establish it, and her husband shall annul it," the words of Rabbi Yoshiyah. Rabbi Yonatan says: We find in every place that a person's agent is like himself.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב עִילִישׁ לְרָבָא: הָאוֹמֵר לְעַבְדּוֹ צֵא וְהִשָּׁאֵל עִם פָּרָתִי, מַהוּ? תִּיבְּעֵי לְמַאן דְּאָמַר שְׁלוּחוֹ שֶׁל אָדָם כְּמוֹתוֹ, תִּיבְּעֵי לְמַאן דְּאָמַר שְׁלוּחוֹ שֶׁל אָדָם אֵינוֹ כְּמוֹתוֹ.
human_translation: Rav Ilish said to Rava: one who says to his slave: Go and lend your with my cow what is Let the dilemma be raised according to the one who says a person’s agent is like himself, let the dilemma be raised according to the one who says a person’s agent is not like himself.
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Eilish to Rava: One who says to his servant, "Go out and inquire with my cow," what is the ruling? It should be asked according to the one who says, "The emissary of a person is like himself," it should be asked according to the one who says, "The emissary of a person is not like himself."

hebrew_text: תִּיבְּעֵי לְמַאן דְּאָמַר שְׁלוּחוֹ שֶׁל אָדָם כְּמוֹתוֹ, הָנֵי מִילֵּי שָׁלִיחַ – דְּבַר מִצְוָה הוּא. אֲבָל עֶבֶד, דְּלָאו בַּר מִצְוָה – לָא. אוֹ דִלְמָא אֲפִילּוּ לְמַאן דְּאָמַר אֵין שְׁלוּחוֹ שֶׁל אָדָם כְּמוֹתוֹ, הָנֵי מִילֵּי שָׁלִיחַ. אֲבָל עֶבֶד, יַד עֶבֶד כְּיַד רַבּוֹ דָּמְיָא.
human_translation: Let the dilemma be raised according to the one who says a person’s agent is like himself, this matter an agent, is obligated in mitzvot, but a slave, who is not obligated in mitzvot, not Or perhaps, even according to the one who says a person’s agent is not like himself, that matter an agent, But a slave, possession of a slave is like possession of his master,
llm_translation: He inquires according to the one who says the emissary of a person is like himself, these matters of emissary - it is a matter of commandment. But a slave, who is not a son of commandment - no. Or perhaps even according to the one who says the emissary of a person is not like himself, these matters of emissary. But a slave, the hand of a slave is like the hand of his master.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מִסְתַּבְּרָא יַד עֶבֶד כְּיַד רַבּוֹ דָּמְיָא.
human_translation: said to It stands to reason possession of a slave is like possession of his master,
llm_translation: He said to him: It is logical that the hand of a slave is like the hand of his master.

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי רָמֵי בַּר חָמָא: בַּעַל בְּנִכְסֵי אִשְׁתּוֹ
human_translation: Rami bar Ḥama raises a dilemma: a husband with regard to his wife’s property?
llm_translation: Ba'ei Ramei bar Ḥama inquired: A husband who is in the property of his wife.

hebrew_text: שׁוֹאֵל הָוֵי, אוֹ שׂוֹכֵר הָוֵי?
human_translation: Is he a borrower or is he a renter?
llm_translation: One who borrows, should he be a borrower, or one who rents, should he be a renter?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא, לְפוּם חוּרְפָּא שַׁבֶּשְׁתָּא – מָה נַפְשָׁךְ, אִי שׁוֹאֵל הָוֵי – שְׁאָלָהּ בִּבְעָלִים הִיא, אִי שׂוֹכֵר הָוֵי – שְׂכִירוּת בִּבְעָלִים הִיא.
human_translation: Rava said Commensurate to the sharpness the error, whichever way you If he is a borrower, is borrowing with the owner, if he is a renter, is renting with the owner,
llm_translation: Rava said, according to the disgrace of the host - "What is your soul, if you ask, be an asker - it is a question of the owners, if you rent, be a renter - renting is a matter of the owners."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא כִּי קָמִיבַּעְיָא לֵיהּ לְרָמִי בַּר חָמָא: דַּאֲגַר מִינַּהּ פָּרָה וַהֲדַר נַסְבַהּ, שׁוֹאֵל הָוֵי אוֹ שׂוֹכֵר הָוֵי?
human_translation: Rather, when Rami bar Ḥama raised the dilemma, which one rented a cow from and subsequently married her. he is a borrower or he is a renter.
llm_translation: Rather, when Ba'aya sought to raise an objection to Rami bar Hama: If one rented a cow from her owner and then it gave birth, is he considered a borrower or a renter?

hebrew_text: שׁוֹאֵל הָוֵי וְאָתְיָא שְׁאֵלָה בִּבְעָלִים מַפְקְעָא שְׂכִירוּת שֶׁלֹּא בִּבְעָלִים, אוֹ דִלְמָא שׂוֹכֵר הָוֵי וּשְׂכִירוּת כִּדְקָיְימָא קָיְימָא?
human_translation: he is a borrower, and borrowing with owner comes displaces renting that without the owner. Or perhaps he is a renter, and renting stands as it was,
llm_translation: One who asks, should he come and ask a question about renting from owners, is it considered a rental without owners, or perhaps he is considered a renter and the rental is established as such?

hebrew_text: וּמַאי שְׁנָא: דְּאִי שׁוֹאֵל הָוֵי, דְּאָתֵי שְׁאֵלָה בִּבְעָלִים מַפְקְעָא שְׂכִירוּת שֶׁלֹּא בִּבְעָלִים. אִי שׂוֹכֵר נָמֵי הָוֵי, תֵּיתֵי שְׂכִירוּת בִּבְעָלִים (תַּיפֵּוק) [תַּפְקַע] שְׂכִירוּת שֶׁלֹּא בִּבְעָלִים!
human_translation: But what is different that if he is a borrower that borrowing with the owner comes displaces renting that without the owner? also if he is a renter, let renting with the owner come displace renting that without the owner.
llm_translation: And what is the difference: for if one borrows, it is, for he comes to borrow without the owners' permission, but the rental is not with the owners. If one rents, it is also, he gives the rental to the owners, so that the rental is not without the owners!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא כִּי קָא מִיבַּעְיָא לְרָמֵי בַּר חָמָא: כְּגוֹן דַּאֲגַרָא אִיהִי פָּרָה מֵעָלְמָא, וַהֲדַר נַסְבַהּ,
human_translation: Rather, when Rami bar Ḥama raised the dilemma, where rented a cow from world and subsequently married her.
llm_translation: Rather, when Rav Hamma sought to raise an objection: For example, if a hired laborer is there, a cow from the world, and then it conceived.

hebrew_text: וְאַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבָּנַן, דְּאָמְרִי: שׁוֹאֵל מְשַׁלֵּם לַשּׂוֹכֵר, לָא תִּיבְּעֵי לָךְ – דְּוַדַּאי שְׁאֵילָה בִּבְעָלִים הִיא.
human_translation: And according to of the Rabbis, who say borrower pays the renter, do not raise the dilemma, as it is certainly borrowing owner
llm_translation: In the matter of the sages, who say: "One who borrows and pays back to the lender, does not require your consent" - for sure, borrowing is with the owner.

hebrew_text: כִּי תִּיבְּעֵי לָךְ, אַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי, דְּאָמַר: תַּחְזוֹר פָּרָה לַבְּעָלִים הָרִאשׁוֹנִים, מַאי – שׁוֹאֵל הָוֵי, אוֹ שׂוֹכֵר הָוֵי?
human_translation: When should you raise the dilemma? according to of Rabbi Yosei, who says cow must be returned to its original owner. what is he a borrower or is he a renter?
llm_translation: When you are in doubt, according to the opinion of Rabbi Yosei, who said: "Should the cow return to its original owners, what is the law - should it be considered a borrower or a renter?"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: בַּעַל לָא שׁוֹאֵל הָוֵי וְלָא שׂוֹכֵר הָוֵי, אֶלָּא לוֹקֵחַ הָוֵי – מִדְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: בְּאוּשָׁא הִתְקִינוּ: הָאִשָּׁה שֶׁמָּכְרָה בְּנִכְסֵי מְלוֹג בְּחַיֵּי בַּעְלָהּ, וָמֵתָה – הַבַּעַל מוֹצִיא מִיַּד הַלָּקוֹחוֹת.
human_translation: Rava said: A husband is not a borrower nor is he a renter. Rather, he is a buyer from of Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, as Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, said: In Usha instituted: a woman who sold her usufruct property during her husband’s lifetime and died, the husband can appropriate from the buyers,
llm_translation: Rava said: One should not be a borrower or a lender, but rather a buyer - following the teaching of Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Chanina. For Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Chanina said: In Ousha they instituted: If a woman sold her property for the sustenance of her husband, and then she died, the husband must return it to the buyers immediately.

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי רָמֵי בַּר חָמָא: בַּעַל בְּנִכְסֵי אִשְׁתּוֹ, מִי מָעַל?
human_translation: Rami bar Ḥama raises a dilemma: a husband to his wife’s property who misused
llm_translation: Ba'ei Ramei bar Ḥama asked: A husband with his wife's property, who transgresses?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: מַאן לִימְעוֹל? לִימְעוֹל בַּעַל, דְּהֶיתֵּרָא נִיחָא לֵיהּ דְּלִיקְנֵי, אִיסּוּרָא לָא נִיחָא לֵיהּ דְּלִיקְנֵי.
human_translation: Rava said: Who could have misused Should husband have misused as is satisfactory for him to acquire permitted is not satisfactory for him to acquire prohibited
llm_translation: Rava said: Who is fit to circumcise? One who is fit to circumcise, for it is more pleasing to him to perform the act, but the prohibition is not more pleasing to him than to perform it.

hebrew_text: תִּימְעוֹל אִיהִי, דְּהֶיתֵּרָא נָמֵי לָא נִיחָא לַהּ דְּלִיקְנֵי.
human_translation: Should she have misused as also permitted is not satisfactory to her that acquire
llm_translation: Tim'ol ihi, dehetira namei la lo nih'a lah de'liknei.

hebrew_text: נִימְעֲלוּ בֵּית דִּין, כִּי עֲבַדוּ רַבָּנַן תַּקַּנְתָּא וַאֲמַרוּ: בַּעַל לוֹקֵחַ הָוֵי – לְהֶיתֵּרָא, לְאִיסּוּרָא לָא עֲבֻיד רַבָּנַן תַּקַּנְתָּא.
human_translation: Should the court have misused when the Sages instituted the ordinance, and they said a husband is a buyer with regard to permitted with regard to the Sages did not institute the ordinance.
llm_translation: The court was dismayed, for the Rabbis enacted a decree and said: "A husband who divorces should be - for leniency, for stringency the Rabbis did not enact a decree."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: בַּעַל מָעַל לִכְשֶׁיּוֹצִיא, מִידֵּי דְּהָוֵה אַמּוֹצִיא מְעוֹת הֶקְדֵּשׁ לְחוּלִּין.
human_translation: Rather, Rava said: husband misused when he spends just as it is in one who spends consecrated coins for a non-sacred
llm_translation: Rava said: When a Ba'al Ma'al transgresses, immediately he causes the money of the holy to become mundane.

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: כָּחַשׁ בָּשָׂר מֵחֲמַת מְלָאכָה, מַאי?
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before flesh was weakened due to labor what
llm_translation: The question was asked to them: If one denies eating meat due to work, what is the ruling?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ הָהוּא מֵרַבָּנַן וְרַב חִלְקִיָּה בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אַוְיָא שְׁמֵיהּ: מִכְּלָל דְּכִי מֵתָה מֵחֲמַת מְלָאכָה מְחַיֵּיב? נֵימָא: לָאו לְאוֹקֹמַהּ בְּכִילְּתָא שְׁאֵילְתַהּ!
human_translation: One of the Sages, and Rav Ḥilkiya, son of Rav Avya, is his name, said to By inference that when died due to labor is liable. Let say: I did not borrow it to stow it in a canopy
llm_translation: He said to him that certain Rabbi and Rav Chilkiyah son of Rav Avya, his name: From the principle that if one dies due to the exertion of work, he is liable? Let us say: No, it is not due to the exertion of work that she asked him!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: לָא מִיבַּעְיָא כָּחַשׁ בָּשָׂר מֵחֲמַת מְלָאכָה דְּפָטוּר, אֶלָּא אֲפִילּוּ מֵתָה מֵחֲמַת מְלָאכָה נָמֵי פָּטוּר. דַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָאו לְאוֹקֹמַהּ בְּכִילְּתָא שְׁאֵילְתַהּ.
human_translation: Rather, Rava said: It is not necessary its flesh was weakened due to labor that exempt Rather, even died due to labor, also exempt, as can say to I did not borrow it to stow it in a canopy,
llm_translation: Rather, Rava said: It is not necessary to suspect that the animal's flesh became invalid due to labor, as it would still be exempt. Rather, even if it died due to labor, it is also exempt. For he said to him: "It is not for the purpose of establishing it as a question that you asked."

hebrew_text: הָהוּא גַּבְרָא דִּשְׁאֵיל נַרְגָּא מֵחַבְרֵיהּ, אִיתְּבַר. אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרָבָא, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: זִיל אַיְיתִי סָהֲדִי דְּלָאו שַׁנֵּית בֵּיהּ, וְאִיפְּטַר.
human_translation: A certain man borrowed an ax from another it broke. came before Rava said to him: Go, bring witnesses that you did not deviate its and will be exempt
llm_translation: That man who borrowed a saw from his friend, it broke. He came before Rava, he said to him: "Go, bring me witnesses that you did not sharpen it, and you will be exempt."

hebrew_text: וְאִי לֵיכָּא סָהֲדִי מַאי? תָּא שְׁמַע: דְּהָהוּא גַּבְרָא דִּשְׁאֵיל נַרְגָּא מֵחַבְרֵיהּ וְאִיתְּבַר, אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: זִיל שַׁלֵּים לֵיהּ נַרְגָּא מְעַלְּיָא.
human_translation: And if there are no witnesses, what Come hear which a certain man borrowed an ax from another and it broke. came before Rav said to him: Go pay him a proper ax.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And if there are no witnesses, what is to be done? Come and hear: There was a certain man who borrowed a saw from his friend and it broke. He came before Rav and said to him: Go and pay for the saw to him above.

hebrew_text: אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ רַב כָּהֲנָא וְרַב אַסִּי לְרַב:
human_translation: Rav Kahana and Rav Asi said to Rav:
llm_translation: They said to him, Rav Kahana and Rav Assi said to Rav:

hebrew_text: דִּינָא הָכִי וּשְׁתֵיק רַב.
human_translation: Is this the halakha ? And Rav was silent;
llm_translation: The law is thus, and Rav remained silent.

hebrew_text: וְהִלְכְתָא כְּרַב כָּהֲנָא וְרַב אַסִּי, דְּמַהְדַּר לֵיהּ תַּבְרֵיהּ וּמְמַלֵּי לֵיהּ דְּמֵי מָנָא.
human_translation: And the halakha in accordance with Rav Kahana and Rav Asi, that he returns to him the broken and makes up the tool’s value
llm_translation: The halakha is according to Rav Kahana and Rav Assi, for he reviews his teaching and speaks to him as if from a distance.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא גַּבְרָא דִּשְׁאֵיל דַּוְולָא מֵחַבְרֵיהּ, אִיתְּבַר. אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב פָּפָּא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אַיְיתִי סָהֲדִי דְּלָא שַׁנֵּית בֵּיהּ, וְאִיפְּטַר.
human_translation: A certain man borrowed a pail from another it broke. He came before Rav Pappa said to him: Bring witnesses that you did not deviate its and will be exempt
llm_translation: That man who borrowed a sickle from his friend, it broke. He came before Rav Papa. He said to him: I brought witnesses that I did not change it, and I am exempt.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא גַּבְרָא דִּשְׁאֵיל שׁוּנָרָא מֵחַבְרֵיהּ, חֲבוּר עֲלֵיהּ עַכְבְּרֵי וְקַטְלוּהּ. יָתֵיב רַב אָשֵׁי וְקָמִיבַּעְיָא לֵיהּ: כִּי הַאי גַוְונָא מַאי? כִּי מֵתָה מֵחֲמַת מְלָאכָה דָּמֵי, אוֹ לָא? אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב מָרְדֳּכַי לְרַב אָשֵׁי הָכִי אָמַר אֲבִימִי מֵהַגְרוֹנְיָא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרָבָא: גַּבְרָא דִּנְשֵׁי קַטְלוּהּ – לָא דִּינָא וְלָא דַּיָּינָא.
human_translation: A certain man borrowed a cat from another The mice banded together against it and killed it. Rav Ashi sat and raised a dilemma: a case like this, what comparable to died due to labor, or not? Rav Mordekhai said to Rav Ashi: Avimi of Hagronya said this in the name of Rava: a man who women killed, there is neither judgment nor a judge,
llm_translation: The man who borrowed a saw from his friend, mice chewed on it and destroyed it. Rav Ashi sat and deliberated: What is the law in this case? Is he liable for payment due to the damage caused by work animals, or not? Rav Mordechai said to Rav Ashi as follows: Abimi from Hagronya in the name of Rava said: If a man's wife killed him - it is neither a legal nor a monetary matter.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: אֲכַל עַכְבְּרֵי טוּבָא וַחֲבִיל וּמִית. יָתֵיב רַב אָשֵׁי וְקָא מְעַיֵּין בַּהּ: כְּהַאי גַּוְונָא מַאי? אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב מָרְדֳּכַי לְרַב אָשֵׁי: הָכִי אָמַר אֲבִימִי מֵהַגְרוֹנְיָא: גַּבְרָא דִּנְשֵׁי קַטְלוּהּ – לָא דִּינָא וְלָא דַּיָּינָא.
human_translation: There are who say ate many mice, and was harmed and died. Rav Ashi sat and deliberated: a case like this, what Rav Mordekhai said to Rav Ashi: Avimi of Hagronya said this: a man that women killed him there is neither judgment nor judge,
llm_translation: There are those who say: one who eats the flesh of a mouse or a weasel will die. Rav Ashe was sitting and examining this matter: What is the reason for this? Rav Mordechai said to Rav Ashe: Abimi from Hagronya said as follows: If a man kills a woman - it is neither judgment nor justice.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: הַאי מַאן דְּבָעֵי לְמִישְׁאַל מִידֵּי מֵחַבְרֵיהּ וְלִיפְּטַר, נֵימָא לֵיהּ: אַשְׁקְיַין מַיָּא, דְּהָוֵי שְׁאֵילָה בִּבְעָלִים.
human_translation: Rava says: one who wants to borrow something from another and be exempt let him say to Pour me water. as it is borrowing owner
llm_translation: Rava said: One who wishes to exempt himself from the obligation of his companions, let him say to him: "Give me water," which is considered a request from the owner.

hebrew_text: וְאִי פִּקֵּחַ הוּא, נֵימָא לֵיהּ: שְׁאֵיל בְּרֵישָׁא וַהֲדַר אַשְׁקְיָיךְ.
human_translation: And if is perspicacious let him say to him: Borrow first and then I will pour for you.
llm_translation: If he is intelligent, say to him: Ask at the beginning and then drink.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: מַקְרֵי דַרְדְּקֵי, שַׁתָּלָא, טַבָּחָא, וְאוּמָּנָא, סַפַּר מָתָא – כּוּלְּהוֹן בְּעִידָּן עֲבִידְתַּיְיהוּ כִּשְׁאֵילָה בִּבְעָלִים דָּמוּ.
human_translation: Rava says: A teacher of children, the gardener, the butcher, and the bloodletter, a scribe of the city, all of them, at time of their work, is comparable to borrowing owner
llm_translation: Rava said: The markets of Dardakei, Shatala, Tabbacha, and Ummana, the town of Safar Mata - all of them during their time function like borrowing from owners.

hebrew_text: אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ רַבָּנַן לְרָבָא: שְׁאִיל לַן מָר. אִקְּפִיד. אֲמַר לְהוּ: לְאַפְקוֹעֵי מָמוֹנַאי קָא בָעֵיתוּ?! אַדְּרַבָּה, אַתּוּן שְׁאִילְתּוּן לִי. דְּאִילּוּ אֲנָא מָצֵי אִישְׁתְּמוֹטֵי לְכוּ מִמַּסֶּכְתָּא לְמַסֶּכְתָּא, אַתּוּן לָא מָצֵיתוּ לְאִישְׁתְּמוֹטֵי.
human_translation: The Rabbis said to Rava: Master, are lent to us was angered said to them: Do you want to take my money away On the contrary, you are lent to me, that Whereas I am able to deflect you from tractate to tractate you are not able to deflect me
llm_translation: The sages said to Rava: Ask our master. He became angry. He said to them: Are you seeking to extract my money?! By the great Rabbi, you ask me. For even if I were to find a way to travel from tractate to tractate, you would not find a way to travel.

hebrew_text: וְלָא הִיא, אִיהוּ שְׁאִיל לְהוּ בְּיוֹמָא דְכַלָּה. אִינְהוּ שְׁאִילוּ לֵיהּ בִּשְׁאָר יוֹמֵי.
human_translation: But is not so During the days of the kalla , he is lent to them. During the rest of the days they are lent to him,
llm_translation: "And not this, he asked him on the day of the wedding. They asked him on other days."

hebrew_text: מָרִימָר בַּר חֲנִינָא אוֹגַר כּוּדַנְיָיתָא בֵּי חוֹזָאֵי, נְפַק לְדַלּוֹיֵי טְעוּנַהּ בַּהֲדַיְיהוּ, פְּשַׁעוּ בַּהּ וּמִית. אֲתוֹ לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרָבָא, חַיְּיבִינְהוּ. אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ רַבָּנַן לְרָבָא: פְּשִׁיעָה בִּבְעָלִים הִיא! אִיכְּסִיף. לְסוֹף אִיגַּלַּאי מִילְּתָא דִּלְמֵיסַר טְעוּנַהּ הוּא דִּנְפַק.
human_translation: Mareimar bar Ḥanina rented out a mule Bei Ḥozai. He went out to raise up a load together with those they were negligent with and it died. They came before Rava he deemed them liable The Sages said to Rava: is negligence with owner, was embarrassed Ultimately it was revealed that had gone out to supervise the loading
llm_translation: Marimar son of Hanina, a merchant from Kudna'itha of the house of Hozai, went out to transport his merchandise with them, they transgressed with it and died. He came before Rava, they are liable. The sages said to Rava: It is a transgression against the owners! He remained silent. In the end, the matter was revealed that it was the merchandise that was taken out.

hebrew_text: הָנִיחָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר פְּשִׁיעָה בִּבְעָלִים פָּטוּר, מִשּׁוּם הָכִי אִיכְּסִיף. אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר חַיָּיב, אַמַּאי אִיכְּסִיף?
human_translation: This works out well according to the one who says that negligence with owner, exempt; for that was embarrassed But according to the one who says liable, why was he embarrassed;
llm_translation: He left it for the one who said that a breach in the owners' property exempts the one who caused the damage, therefore he added. But for the one who said the owner is liable, why did he add?

hebrew_text: לָא מִיפְשָׁע פְּשַׁעוּ בָּהּ, אֶלָּא אִיגְּנוֹבֵי אִיגְּנוּב, וּמֵתָה כְּדַרְכָּהּ בֵּי גַנָּב הָוֵי. וַאֲתוֹ לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרָבָא וְחַיְּיבִינְהוּ. אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ רַבָּנַן לְרָבָא: גְּנֵיבָה בִּבְעָלִים הִיא. אִכְּסִיף. לְסוֹף אִיגַּלַּאי מִילְּתָא דִּלְמֵיסַר טְעוּנַהּ הוּא דִּנְפַק.
human_translation: were not negligent with it. Rather, it was stolen and it died naturally in the house of the thief. And came before Rava and he deemed them liable. The Sages said to Rava: theft with the owner, was embarrassed Ultimately it was revealed that had gone out to supervise the loading
llm_translation: He did not commit a transgression with it, rather he stole stolen goods, and she died in her own way, for the house of a thief is considered. And they came before Rava and he obligated them. The sages said to Rava: Theft is with the owners. He remained silent. In the end, the matter was revealed that perhaps it is a case of negligence that emerged.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַשּׁוֹאֵל אֶת הַפָּרָה, שְׁאָלָהּ חֲצִי יוֹם וּשְׂכָרָהּ חֲצִי יוֹם. שְׁאָלָהּ הַיּוֹם וּשְׂכָרָהּ לְמָחָר. שָׂכַר אַחַת וְשָׁאַל אַחַת, וּמֵתָה. הַמַּשְׁאִיל אוֹמֵר: שְׁאוּלָה מֵתָה, בְּיוֹם שֶׁהָיְתָה שְׁאוּלָה מֵתָה,
human_translation: one who borrowed a cow. He borrowed it half day and rented it half day; he borrowed it today and rented it tomorrow; he rented one and borrowed one And died the lender says: borrowed died; It died on the day that it was borrowed;
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who borrows a cow, may ask for it half a day and its hire is half a day. If he asks for it today, its hire is for tomorrow. He asked for it once and hired it once, and it died. The lender says: "It died on the day that it was to die."

hebrew_text: בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁהָיְתָה שְׁאוּלָה מֵתָה. וְהַלָּה אוֹמֵר: אֵינִי יוֹדֵעַ – חַיָּיב.
human_translation: It died during the period in which it was borrowed, and the other says: I do not know liable
llm_translation: In the hour that Shaul died. And Hala says: "I do not know" - guilty.

hebrew_text: הַשּׂוֹכֵר אוֹמֵר: שְׂכוּרָה מֵתָה, בְּיוֹם שֶׁהָיְתָה שְׂכוּרָה מֵתָה, בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁהָיְתָה שְׂכוּרָה מֵתָה. וְהַלָּה אוֹמֵר: אֵינִי יוֹדֵעַ – פָּטוּר.
human_translation: the renter says: rented died; It died on the day that it was rented; It died during the period in which it was rented, and the other says: I do not know exempt.
llm_translation: The renter says: "The rental died, on the day that the rental died, at the hour that the rental died." And the lessor says: "I do not know" - he is exempt.

hebrew_text: זֶה אוֹמֵר: שְׁאוּלָה, וְזֶה אוֹמֵר: שְׂכוּרָה – יִשָּׁבַע הַשּׂוֹכֵר שֶׁשְּׂכוּרָה מֵתָה.
human_translation: this says borrowed and that says rented the renter takes an oath that the rented died,
llm_translation: This one says: "She'ulah," and this one says: "Sekhurah" - the renter must swear that Sekhurah has died.

hebrew_text: זֶה אוֹמֵר: אֵינִי יוֹדֵעַ, וְזֶה אוֹמֵר: אֵינִי יוֹדֵעַ – יַחְלוֹקוּ.
human_translation: this says: I do not know and that says: I do not know they divide
llm_translation: This one says: I do not know, and this one says: I do not know - they shall divide.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ שָׁמְעַתְּ מִינַּהּ: מָנֶה לִי בְּיָדְךָ, וְהַלָּה אוֹמֵר: אֵינִי יוֹדֵעַ – חַיָּיב.
human_translation: Conclude from I one hundred dinars in your possession, and the other one says: I do not know liable
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemara, she heard from her: "Appoint for me in your hand," and he says: "I do not know" - liable.

hebrew_text: לֵימָא תִּהְוֵי תְּיוּבְתָּא דְּרַב נַחְמָן, דְּאִיתְּמַר: ״מָנֶה לִי בְּיָדְךָ״, וְהַלָּה אוֹמֵר: אֵינִי יוֹדֵעַ. רַב הוּנָא וְרַב יְהוּדָה אָמְרִי: חַיָּיב. רַב נַחְמָן וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמְרִי: פָּטוּר!
human_translation: Let us say that it is a conclusive refutation of Rav Naḥman. As it was stated I one hundred dinars in your possession, and the other says: I do not know, Rav Huna and Rav Yehuda say: liable Rav Naḥman and Rabbi Yoḥanan say: exempt
llm_translation: Let it be the response of Rav Nachman, for it was stated: "Appoint for me in your hand," and the other one says: "I do not know." Rav Huna and Rav Yehuda say: He is liable. Rav Nachman and Rabbi Yochanan say: He is exempt!

hebrew_text: כִּדְאָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: כְּגוֹן שֶׁיֵּשׁ עֵסֶק שְׁבוּעָה בֵּינֵיהֶן. הָכָא נָמֵי – כְּגוֹן שֶׁיֵּשׁ עֵסֶק שְׁבוּעָה בֵּינֵיהֶן.
human_translation: as Rav Naḥman says where there is a matter of an oath between them, here too, where there is a matter of an oath between them.
llm_translation: As Rav Nachman said: For example, if there is a partnership between them. Here it is stated - for example, if there is a partnership between them.

hebrew_text: הֵיכִי דָּמֵי עֵסֶק שְׁבוּעָה? כִּדְרָבָא,
human_translation: What are the circumstances a matter of an oath? in accordance with of Rava,
llm_translation: "How are the laws of an oath similar to a business transaction? Like Ravah,"

hebrew_text: דְּאָמַר רָבָא: ״מָנֶה לִי בְּיָדְךָ״, וְהַלָּה אוֹמֵר: אֵין לְךָ בְּיָדִי אֶלָּא חֲמִשִּׁים, וְהַשְּׁאָר אֵינִי יוֹדֵעַ. מִתּוֹךְ שֶׁאֵינוֹ יָכוֹל לִישָּׁבַע – מְשַׁלֵּם.
human_translation: as Rava says: I one hundred dinars in your possession, and the other says: You have in my possession only fifty and the rest, I do not know. Since he cannot take an oath he must pay.
llm_translation: Rava said: "Appoint for me in your hand," and the borrower says: "You only have fifty in my hand, and the rest I do not know." Since he cannot swear, he must pay.

hebrew_text: מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ רֵישָׁא בִּשְׁתַּיִם וְסֵיפָא בְּשָׁלֹשׁ.
human_translation: You find it the first clause, where two and the latter clause, where three
llm_translation: She finds the beginning in two and the end in three.

hebrew_text: רֵישָׁא בִּשְׁתַּיִם – דַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ: שְׁתֵּי פָרוֹת מָסַרְתִּי לָךְ, פַּלְגֵיהּ דְּיוֹמָא בִּשְׁאֵילָה, וּפַלְגֵיהּ דְּיוֹמָא בִּשְׂכִירוּת. אִי נָמֵי: חַד יוֹמָא בִּשְׁאֵילָה, וְחַד יוֹמָא בִּשְׂכִירוּת, וּמֵתוּ תַּרְוַיְיהוּ בְּעִידָּן שְׁאֵילָה.
human_translation: the first clause where two that said to I delivered two cows to you half day through borrowing and half day through renting, alternatively, one day through borrowing and one day through renting. And both died during a period of borrowing,
llm_translation: Beginning with two - for he said to him: Two cows I entrusted to you, half of the day for borrowing, and half of the day for renting. Alternatively: One day for borrowing, and one day for renting, and both of them died during the borrowing period.

hebrew_text: וַאֲמַר לֵיהּ שׁוֹאֵל: חֲדָא – אִין, בְּעִידָּן שְׁאֵילָה מֵתָה, וְאִידַּךְ – לָא יָדַעְנָא אִי בְּעִידָּן שְׁאֵילָה מֵתָה וְאִי בְּעִידָּן שְׂכִירוּת מֵתָה, דְּמִתּוֹךְ שֶׁאֵינוֹ יָכוֹל לִישָּׁבַע – מְשַׁלֵּם.
human_translation: And the borrower said to him: one yes, it died during a period of borrowing. other one, I do not know whether it died during a period of borrowing or if it died during a period of renting. since he is unable to take an oath, he must pay
llm_translation: He said to him: One - no, at a time when borrowing is common, and the other - we do not know whether it is at a time when borrowing is common or at a time when hiring is common, because since he cannot swear, he pays.

hebrew_text: וְסֵיפָא בְּשָׁלֹשׁ – דַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ: שָׁלֹשׁ פָּרוֹת נָתַתִּי לָךְ, שְׁתַּיִם בִּשְׁאֵילָה וְאַחַת בִּשְׂכִירוּת, וָמֵתוּ הָנֵי תַּרְתֵּי דִּשְׁאֵילָה, וַאֲמַר לֵיהּ שׁוֹאֵל: אִין, חֲדָא דִּשְׁאֵילָה מֵתָה, אִידַּךְ – לָא יָדַעְנָא אִי דִּשְׁאֵילָה מֵתָה וּדְקָיְימָא דִּשְׂכִירוּת הִיא, אִי דִּשְׂכִירוּת מֵתָה וְהָא דְּקָיְימָא דִּשְׁאֵילָה הִיא, וּמִתּוֹךְ שֶׁאֵינוֹ יָכוֹל לִישָּׁבַע – מְשַׁלֵּם.
human_translation: And the latter clause where three that said to I gave three cows to you; two through borrowing and one through renting. And those two that borrowed died. And the borrower said to him: Yes, one that borrowed died. the other I do not know if borrowed died, and that is alive is that rented, or that rented died, and this that is alive is that borrowed. since he is unable to take an oath, he must pay
llm_translation: The end of the Mishnah: For he said to him: "I gave you three cows, two on loan and one for rent, and those two cows that were on loan died. And he said to him, the borrower: 'No, one of the cows on loan died, the other one we do not know if it died, and the one that remains is the rented one. If the rented one died, then the one that remains is the one on loan. And since he cannot swear, he must pay."

hebrew_text: וּלְרָמֵי בַּר חָמָא, דְּאָמַר: אַרְבָּעָה שׁוֹמְרִים צְרִיכִין כְּפִירָה בְּמִקְצָת וְהוֹדָאָה בְּמִקְצָת, מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ רֵישָׁא בְּשָׁלֹשׁ וְסֵיפָא בְּאַרְבַּע.
human_translation: And in accordance with Rami bar Ḥama, who says: four bailees they need a denial of part and an admission of part you find the first clause, where three and the latter clause, where four
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And for Ramei bar Hama, who said: Four guardians require covering partially and acknowledgment partially, the beginning in three and the end in four.

hebrew_text: רֵישָׁא בְּשָׁלֹשׁ – דַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ: שָׁלֹשׁ פָּרוֹת נָתַתִּי לְךָ, פַּלְגֵיהּ דְּיוֹמָא בִּשְׁאֵלָה וּפַלְגֵיהּ דְּיוֹמָא בִּשְׂכִירוּת, אִי נָמֵי חַד יוֹמָא בִּשְׁאֵלָה וְחַד יוֹמָא בִּשְׂכִירוּת, וּמֵתוּ תְּלָת כּוּלְּהוּ בְּעִידָּן שְׁאֵילָה,
human_translation: the first clause where three that said to I gave three cows to you half of the day through borrowing and half of the day through renting, alternatively, one day through borrowing and one day through renting. And all three of them died during a period of borrowing,
llm_translation: The beginning in three - for he said to him: "Three cows I have given you, half of the day in borrowing and half of the day in renting, or alternatively, one day in borrowing and one day in renting, and all three of them died during the time of borrowing."

hebrew_text: וַאֲמַר לֵיהּ שׁוֹאֵל: חֲדָא – לֹא הָיוּ דְבָרִים מֵעוֹלָם. וַחֲדָא – אִין, בְּעִידָּן שְׁאֵילָה מֵתָה, וְאִידַּךְ – לָא יָדַעְנָא אִי בְּעִידָּן שְׁאֵילָה מֵתָה וְאִי בְּעִידָּן שְׂכִירוּת מֵתָה, דְּמִתּוֹךְ שֶׁאֵינוֹ יָכוֹל לִישָּׁבַע – מְשַׁלֵּם.
human_translation: And the borrower said to him: one matter never occurred, And, one yes, it died during a period of borrowing. other one, I do not know whether it died during a period of borrowing or if it died during a period of renting. since he is unable to take an oath, he must pay
llm_translation: And he said to him: One - they were never words. And one - no, at a time when borrowing is dead, and the other - we do not know whether it is at a time when borrowing is dead or at a time when renting is dead, because since he cannot swear, he pays.

hebrew_text: סֵיפָא בְּאַרְבַּע – דַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ: אַרְבַּע פָּרוֹת נָתַתִּי לְךָ, שָׁלֹשׁ בִּשְׁאֵלָה, חֲדָא בִּשְׂכִירוּת, וּמֵתוּ הָנָךְ שָׁלֹשׁ דִּשְׁאֵלָה. וַאֲמַר לֵיהּ
human_translation: the latter clause where four that said to I gave four cows to you, three through borrowing one through renting. And those three that borrowed died. And said to him,
llm_translation: The latter part in four - for he said to him: Four cows I have given you, three as a gift, one as a rental, and they died there, the three as a gift. And he said to him:

hebrew_text: שׁוֹאֵל: חֲדָא – לֹא הָיוּ דְבָרִים מֵעוֹלָם. וַחֲדָא – אִין, דִּשְׁאֵלָה מֵתָה, וְאִידַּךְ – לָא יָדַעְנָא אִי דִּשְׂכִירוּת מֵתָה וּדְקָיְימָא דִּשְׁאֵלָה, אוֹ דִּשְׁאֵלָה מֵתָה וּדְקָיְימָא דִּשְׂכִירוּת, דְּמִתּוֹךְ שֶׁאֵינוֹ יָכוֹל לִישָּׁבַע – מְשַׁלֵּם.
human_translation: borrower one matter never occurred, And one yes, that borrowed died; but the other I do not know whether rented died, and that is alive that borrowed, or that borrowed died, and that is alive is that rented. since he is unable to take an oath, he must pay
llm_translation: Inquirer: One - they were never words. And one - no, if she asked and died, and the other - we do not know whether the betrothal died and the marriage remained, or whether the betrothal died and the marriage died, for since he cannot swear - he pays.

hebrew_text: זֶה אוֹמֵר שְׁאוּלָה, וְזֶה אוֹמֵר שְׂכוּרָה – יִשָּׁבַע הַשּׂוֹכֵר שֶׁשְּׂכוּרָה מֵתָה.
human_translation: This says borrowed And that says rented the renter takes an oath that the rented died
llm_translation: This one says "She'ulah," and this one says "Sekhurah" - the renter must swear that the renter died.

hebrew_text: וְאַמַּאי? מַה שֶּׁטְּעָנוֹ – לֹא הוֹדָה לוֹ, וּמַה שֶּׁהוֹדָה לוֹ – לֹא טְעָנוֹ! אָמַר עוּלָּא: עַל יְדֵי גִּלְגּוּל.
human_translation: But why That which claimed from him, he did not admit to and that which admitted to, had not claimed from him. Ulla said: by extending
llm_translation: And why? What he claimed - he did not admit, and what he admitted - he did not claim! Ulla said: Through reincarnation.

hebrew_text: דַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִישְׁתְּבַע לִי אֵיזוֹ מִיהַת דִּכְדַרְכָּהּ מֵתָה, וּמִיגּוֹ דְּמִישְׁתְּבַע דִּכְדַרְכָּהּ מֵתָה, מִישְׁתְּבַע נָמֵי דִּשְׂכוּרָה מֵתָה.
human_translation: where said to him: Take an oath to me, in any event, that died naturally, And since is made to take an oath that died naturally, he also be made to take an oath that rented died.
llm_translation: He said to him: "Demand from me which one of her (wives) died in the normal way, and from the one who demands (to know) which one of her (wives) died in the normal way, let him also demand (to know) which one of her (wives) died through miscarriage."

hebrew_text: זֶה אוֹמֵר אֵינִי יוֹדֵעַ וְזֶה אוֹמֵר כּוּ׳. הָא מַנִּי – סוֹמְכוֹס הִיא, דְּאָמַר: מָמוֹן הַמּוּטָּל בְּסָפֵק – חוֹלְקִין.
human_translation: this says: I do not know and that says: whose is this? is Sumakhos, who says: property of uncertain ownership, divide
llm_translation: This one says, "I do not know," and this one says, "thus." The one who says, "Count it" – it is a presumption, as it is said: Money that is in doubt – they divide.

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי רַבִּי אַבָּא בַּר מֶמֶל: שְׁאָלָהּ בִּבְעָלִים, שְׂכָרָהּ שֶׁלֹּא בִּבְעָלִים, מַהוּ?
human_translation: Rabbi Abba bar Memel raises a dilemma: borrowed with owner, he rented without owner, what is
llm_translation: The question of Rabbi Abba bar Memel: If one asks about her in the presence of her owners, and her wage is not in the presence of her owners, what is the ruling?

hebrew_text: מִי אָמְרִינַן שְׁאֵילָה לְחוֹדַהּ קָיְימָא וּשְׂכִירוּת לְחוֹדַהּ קָיְימָא, אוֹ דִלְמָא שְׂכִירוּת בִּשְׁאֵלָה מֵישָׁךְ שָׁיְיכִי, דְּהָא מִיחַיַּיב בִּגְנֵיבָה וַאֲבֵידָה?
human_translation: Do we say: borrowing stands by itself and renting stands by itself, Or, perhaps renting is related to borrowing because liable for theft and loss,
llm_translation: We say, is borrowing for a deposit established and renting for a deposit established, or perhaps renting in the form of borrowing is considered a form of lending, for he would then be liable for theft and loss?

hebrew_text: אִם תִּמְצָא לוֹמַר שְׂכִירָה בִּשְׁאֵלָה מֵישָׁךְ שָׁיְיכִי, שְׂכָרָהּ בִּבְעָלִים שְׁאָלָהּ שֶׁלֹּא בִּבְעָלִים, מַהוּ?
human_translation: If you say renting is related to borrowing one rented with owner, he borrowed it without owner, what is
llm_translation: If you find to say rental in borrowing from you is relevant, her rental in owners she asked not in owners, what is it?

hebrew_text: שְׁאֵלָה בִּשְׂכִירוּת וַדַּאי לָא שָׁיְיכָא, אוֹ דִלְמָא כֵּיוָן דְּשָׁיְיכָא בְּמִקְצָת, כְּמַאן דְּשָׁיְיכָא בְּכוּלַּהּ דָּמֵי?
human_translation: borrowing is certainly not related to renting, Or perhaps, since partially related it is considered as though it were related entirely to it
llm_translation: Question regarding renting and certainly not applicable, or perhaps since it is applicable in part, is it considered as if it is applicable in its entirety?

hebrew_text: אִם תִּמְצָא לוֹמַר לָא אָמְרִינַן כֵּיוָן דְּשָׁיְיכָא בְּמִקְצָת כְּמַאן דְּשָׁיְיכָא בְּכוּלַּהּ דָּמֵי: שְׁאָלָהּ בִּבְעָלִים וּשְׂכָרָהּ שֶׁלֹּא בִּבְעָלִים, וְחָזַר וּשְׁאָלָהּ, מַהוּ?
human_translation: If you say: we do not say that since partially related it is considered as though it were entirely related to it one borrowed with owner, and he rented it without owner, and then he borrowed it what is
llm_translation: If you find to say "we did not say," since it is applicable in part, it is like one that is applicable in its entirety. Her question is regarding ownership and its rental without ownership, and she returned and asked, what is the ruling?

hebrew_text: הֲדַר אָתְיָא לַהּ שְׁאֵלָה לְדוּכְתַּהּ, אוֹ דִלְמָא אִפְּסִיקָא לַהּ שְׂכִירוּת בֵּינֵי וּבֵינֵי?
human_translation: borrowing returns to its place, Or, perhaps, renting an interruption in the middle
llm_translation: The Gemara raises a question: "Will she come back to him for her dowry, or perhaps the rental agreement between them has been terminated?"

hebrew_text: שְׂכָרָהּ בִּבְעָלִים וּשְׁאָלָהּ וְחָזַר וּשְׂכָרָהּ, מַהוּ? מִי אָמְרִינַן אָתְיָא לַהּ שְׂכִירוּת לְדוּכְתַּהּ, אוֹ דִלְמָא אִפְּסִיקָא לַהּ שְׁאֵלָה בֵּינֵי וּבֵינֵי?
human_translation: one rented with owner. And he borrowed it And then, he rented it, What is Do we say renting returns to its place, Or, perhaps borrowing an interruption in the middle
llm_translation: Her wage with the owners, and she asked, and she returned, and her wage, what? Do we say that the hiring came to her advantage, or perhaps the questioning interrupted between them?

hebrew_text: תֵּיקוּ.
