human_translation: shall stand
llm_translation: The case is unresolved.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַשּׁוֹאֵל אֶת הַפָּרָה וְשִׁלְּחָהּ לוֹ בְּיַד בְּנוֹ בְּיַד עַבְדּוֹ בְּיַד שְׁלוּחוֹ, אוֹ בְּיַד בְּנוֹ בְּיַד עַבְדּוֹ בְּיַד שְׁלוּחוֹ שֶׁל שׁוֹאֵל וּמֵתָה – פָּטוּר.
human_translation: one who borrowed a cow, and sent it to by the hand of son, by the hand of his slave, by the hand of his agent, or by the hand of son, by the hand of his slave, by the hand of agent of borrower; and it died is exempt,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who asks for a cow to borrow and it is sent to him by his son, by his servant, or by his agent, whether it is sent by his son, by his servant, or by his agent, and it dies – he is exempt.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לוֹ הַשּׁוֹאֵל: שַׁלְּחָהּ לִי בְּיַד בְּנִי, בְּיַד עַבְדִּי, בְּיַד שְׁלוּחִי, אוֹ בְּיַד בִּנְךָ, בְּיַד עַבְדְּךָ, בְּיַד שְׁלוּחֶךָ, אוֹ שֶׁאָמַר לוֹ הַמַּשְׁאִיל: הֲרֵינִי מְשַׁלְּחָהּ לְךָ בְּיַד בְּנִי, בְּיַד עַבְדִּי, בְּיַד שְׁלוּחִי, אוֹ בְּיַד בִּנְךָ, בְּיַד עַבְדְּךָ, בְּיַד שְׁלוּחֶךָ, וְאָמַר לוֹ הַשּׁוֹאֵל: שַׁלַּח, וְשִׁלְּחָהּ וּמֵתָה – חַיָּיב.
human_translation: The borrower said to Send it to me by the hand of my son, by the hand of my slave, by the hand of my agent, or by the hand of your son, by the hand of your slave, by the hand of your agent. Or, where the lender said to I am sending it to you by the hand of my son, by the hand of my slave, by the hand of my agent, or by the hand of your son, by the hand of your slave, by the hand of your agent; and the borrower said to him: Send and he sent it, and it died is liable
llm_translation: He said to him the borrower: "Send it to me by the hand of my son, by the hand of my slave, by the hand of my messenger, or by the hand of your son, by the hand of your slave, by the hand of your messenger." Or if the lender said to him: "Here, I am sending it to you by the hand of my son, by the hand of my slave, by the hand of my messenger, or by the hand of your son, by the hand of your slave, by the hand of your messenger," and the borrower said to him: "Send it," and he sent it and it died - he is liable.

hebrew_text: וְכֵן בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁמַּחְזִירָהּ.
human_translation: And, so too, at time when returns it
llm_translation: And so, in the hour that he returns her.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ בְּיַד עַבְדּוֹ – חַיָּיב, יַד עֶבֶד כְּיַד רַבּוֹ!
human_translation: by the hand of slave, liable. hand of a slave like hand of his master;
llm_translation: "Gema' in the hand of his slave - liable, the hand of a slave like the hand of his master!"

hebrew_text: אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: בְּעֶבֶד עִבְרִי, דְּלָא קְנֵי לֵיהּ גּוּפֵיהּ. רַב אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא בְּעֶבֶד כְּנַעֲנִי, נַעֲשֶׂה כְּאוֹמֵר לֵיהּ: הַכִּישָׁהּ בְּמַקֵּל וְהִיא תָּבֹא.
human_translation: Shmuel said: to a Hebrew slave, whose does not acquire person. Rav said: You even say to a Canaanite slave, considered like said to Hit with a stick and it will come
llm_translation: Samuel said: In the case of a Hebrew slave, since he does not acquire himself. Rav said: Even if you say in the case of a Canaanite slave, it is done as it says to him: "He shall strike her with a staff, and she shall come."

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: הַשּׁוֹאֵל הַפָּרָה וְשִׁלְּחָהּ לוֹ בְּיַד בְּנוֹ, בְּיַד שְׁלוּחוֹ – חַיָּיב. בְּיַד עַבְדּוֹ – פָּטוּר.
human_translation: raises an objection one borrows a cow; and, sends it to by the hand of his son by the hand of his agent; liable. by the hand of his slave, exempt.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: Meitivi: hashoel haparah veshillechah lo beyad beno, beyad shelucho - chayav. Beyad avdo - patur. English translation: It was raised as an objection: One who asks for a cow and it is sent to him by the hand of his son, by the hand of its sender - he is liable. If it is sent by the hand of his slave - he is exempt.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לִשְׁמוּאֵל: מַתְנִיתִין בְּעֶבֶד עִבְרִי, בָּרַיְיתָא בְּעֶבֶד כְּנַעֲנִי. אֶלָּא לְרַב קַשְׁיָא!
human_translation: Granted, according to Shmuel, the mishna to a Hebrew slave, the baraita to a Canaanite slave. But according to Rav, difficult.
llm_translation: In truth, according to Shmuel: Mishnaic teachings regarding a Hebrew slave, Baraita regarding a Canaanite slave. Rather, a difficulty for Rav!

hebrew_text: אָמַר לְךָ רַב: לָא תֵּימָא נַעֲשָׂה כְּאָמַר לוֹ, אֶלָּא אֵימָא: בְּאָמַר לוֹ הַכִּישָׁהּ בְּמַקֵּל וְהִיא תָּבֹא.
human_translation: Rav say to you: Do not say considered like said to Rather, say is referring to said to Hit with a stick and it will come
llm_translation: He said to you, Rav: Do not say "it will be done as he said to him," but rather say: "when he said to him, strike her with a stick and she will come."

hebrew_text: דְּאִיתְּמַר: הַשְׁאִילֵנִי פָּרָתְךָ, וְאָמַר לוֹ: בְּיַד מִי? וְאָמַר לוֹ: הַכִּישָׁהּ בְּמַקֵּל וְתָבֹא. אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר אֲבוּהּ אָמַר רַב: כֵּיוָן שֶׁיָּצָאת מֵרְשׁוּת מַשְׁאִיל וּמֵתָה – חַיָּיב.
human_translation: As was stated: Lend me your cow. And said to By whose hand And said to him: Hit with a stick and it will come Rav Naḥman says Rabba bar Avuh says Rav says: once left the domain of the lender and it died, liable.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: If he said, "Your cow gored me," and he said to him, "By whose hand?" and he said to him, "Strike it with a stick and it will die." Rav Nachman said in the name of Rabba bar Avuh said in the name of Rav: Once it has left the owner's domain, if it gores and kills, he is liable.

hebrew_text: נֵימָא מְסַיַּיע לֵיהּ: הַשְׁאִילֵנִי פָּרָתְךָ, וְאָמַר לוֹ: בְּיַד מִי? וְאָמַר לוֹ: הַכִּישָׁהּ בְּמַקֵּל וְהִיא תָּבֹא. כֵּיוָן שֶׁיָּצָאת מֵרְשׁוּת מַשְׁאִיל וּמֵתָה – חַיָּיב.
human_translation: Let us say supports Lend me your cow. And said to By whose hand And said to him: Hit with a stick and it will come once left the domain of the lender and it died, liable.
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: Nayma assists him: "Ask your cow, and he said to him: By whose hand? And he said to him: Strike it with a stick and it will die. Once it has left the owner's domain, if it gores and kills, he is liable."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן – כְּגוֹן שֶׁהָיְתָה חֲצֵרוֹ שֶׁל שׁוֹאֵל לִפְנִים מֵחֲצֵרוֹ שֶׁל מַשְׁאִיל, דְּכִי מְשַׁלְּחָהּ לַהּ – וַדַּאי לְהָתָם אָזְלָא.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said With what are we dealing here; where courtyard of borrower further in than courtyard of lender, that when sends it will certainly go to there.
llm_translation: Rav Ashe said: Here we are dealing with what? For example, when his courtyard was in front of the courtyard of the borrower, for when he sends it to him - and certainly there he went.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, מַאי לְמֵימְרָא?! לָא צְרִיכָא דְּאִיכָּא גַּזְיָיתָא. מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: לָא סָמְכָא דַּעְתֵּיהּ דִּלְמָא קָיְימָא הָתָם וְלָא אָתְיָא אָזְלָא לְהֶדְיָא, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן דְּסָמְכָא דַּעְתֵּיהּ.
human_translation: If so, what of stating No, necessary which there are corners. Lest you say: does not rely perhaps stand there and not come straight teaches us he relies
llm_translation: If so, what is there to say?! It is not necessary because there is a presumption. What you might say: He did not rely, perhaps the situation has changed there and it does not come to mind, we learn that he did rely.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: הַשּׁוֹאֵל קַרְדּוֹם מֵחֲבֵירוֹ, בִּקַּע בּוֹ – קְנָאוֹ, לֹא בִּקַּע בּוֹ – לֹא קְנָאוֹ.
human_translation: Rav Huna says: one who borrows an ax from another, he has chopped with it, he has acquired it, he has not chopped with it, he has not acquired it.
llm_translation: Rav Huna said: One who borrows a needle from his fellow, if he breaks it - he is zealous, if he does not break it - he is not zealous.

hebrew_text: לְמַאי? אִילֵימָא לׇאוֹנָסִין – מַאי שְׁנָא פָּרָה דְּמִשְּׁעַת שְׁאֵילָה? אֶלָּא לַחֲזָרָה, בִּקַּע בּוֹ – לָא מָצֵי הָדַר בֵּיהּ מַשְׁאִיל, לֹא בִּקַּע בּוֹ – מָצֵי מַשְׁאִיל הָדַר בֵּיהּ.
human_translation: to what If we say for unavoidable mishaps, What is different a cow, that from the moment of borrowing, Rather, to retraction, has chopped with it, lender cannot renege on has not chopped with it, lender can renege on
llm_translation: Regarding what? If you say it is not due to circumstances - what is the difference between the cow of the time of questioning? Rather, for review, if he punctured it - he cannot lend it again, if he did not puncture it - he can lend it again.

hebrew_text: וּפְלִיגָא דְּרַבִּי אַמֵּי, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אַמֵּי: הַמַּשְׁאִיל קַרְדּוֹם שֶׁל הֶקְדֵּשׁ – מָעַל לְפִי טוֹבַת הֲנָאָה שֶׁבּוֹ, וַחֲבֵירוֹ מוּתָּר לְבַקֵּעַ בּוֹ לְכַתְּחִילָּה.
human_translation: And disagrees with Rabbi Ami, as Rabbi Ami says: One who lends an ax of consecrated has misused according to the financial advantage And other permitted to chop with it ab initio .
llm_translation: The dispute of Rabbi Ammi, for Rabbi Ammi said: One who lowers the censer of the Holy of Holies - he ascends according to its benefit of pleasure, and his fellow is permitted to pierce it initially.

hebrew_text: וְאִי לֹא קְנָאוֹ – אַמַּאי מָעַל? וְאַמַּאי חֲבֵירוֹ מוּתָּר לְבַקֵּעַ בּוֹ לְכַתְּחִילָּה? נַיהְדְּרֵיהּ וְלֹא לִיקְנְיֵיהּ וְלָא לִימְעוֹל.
human_translation: And if does not acquire why has misused And why is other permitted to chop with it ab initio ? let return and not acquire it, and will not have misused
llm_translation: "And if he did not act out of jealousy - why did he transgress? And why is his friend permitted to break it initially? He should have retracted and not acquired it, and not have it become blemished."

hebrew_text: וּפְלִיגָא דְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: כְּדֶרֶךְ שֶׁתִּקְּנוּ מְשִׁיכָה בַּלָּקוֹחוֹת, כָּךְ תִּקְנוּ מְשִׁיכָה בַּשּׁוֹמְרִים.
human_translation: And disagrees with of Rabbi Elazar, as Rabbi Elazar says: same way in which instituted for buyers pulling so they instituted for bailees pulling
llm_translation: And the dispute of Rabbi Elazar, for Rabbi Elazar said: Just as they established pulling in the scrolls, so too they established pulling in the guards.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: כְּשֵׁם שֶׁתִּקְּנוּ מְשִׁיכָה בַּלָּקוֹחוֹת – כָּךְ תִּקְנוּ מְשִׁיכָה בַּשּׁוֹמְרִים, וּכְשֵׁם
human_translation: This is also taught Just as instituted for buyers pulling so they instituted for bailees pulling And just as
llm_translation: It was taught in a baraita: Namai the Elder said: Just as they established drawing lots with the tablets, so too they established drawing lots with the watchmen.

hebrew_text: שֶׁקַּרְקַע נִקְנֵית בְּכֶסֶף וּבִשְׁטָר וּבַחֲזָקָה – כָּךְ שְׂכִירוּת נִקְנֵית בְּכֶסֶף וּבִשְׁטָר וּבַחֲזָקָה. שְׂכִירוּת מַאי עֲבִידְתַּיהּ? אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: שְׂכִירוּת קַרְקַע.
human_translation: land is acquired through money by a bill or by taking possession, so a rental is acquired through money by document, or by taking possession. renting what is its purpose, Rav Ḥisda said: rental of land.
llm_translation: The purchase of land is acquired by money, contract, and possession - so too, renting is acquired by money, contract, and possession. What is the function of renting? Rav Ḥisda said: Renting is for land.

hebrew_text: אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הַאי מַאן דְּגָזֵיל חֲבִיצָא דְתַמְרֵי מֵחַבְרֵיהּ וְאִית בַּהּ חַמְשִׁין תַּמְרֵי, אַגַּב הֲדָדֵי מִזְדַּבְּנָן בְּחַמְשִׁין נְכֵי חֲדָא, חֲדָא חֲדָא מִזְדַּבְּנָן בְּחַמְשִׁין.
human_translation: Shmuel says: one who robs another of a cake [ ḥavitza ] of dates, and in there are fifty dates, together, sell for fifty-less-one one by one, they sell for fifty
llm_translation: Shmuel said: One who steals a date-palm shoot from his fellow, and it has twenty dates on it, if he then grafts it onto another tree, each individual date will produce twenty.

hebrew_text: לְהֶדְיוֹט – מְשַׁלֵּם חַמְשִׁין נְכֵי חֲדָא, לְהֶקְדֵּשׁ – מְשַׁלֵּם חַמְשִׁין וְחוּמְשַׁיְיהוּ, מַה שֶּׁאֵין כֵּן בְּמַזִּיק – דְּלָא מְשַׁלֵּם חוּמְשָׁא. דְּאָמַר מָר: ״וְאִישׁ כִּי יֹאכַל קֹדֶשׁ״ – פְּרָט לְמַזִּיק.
human_translation: to, a common person [ hedyot ], he pays fifty-less-one to Temple he pays fifty and one-fifth for each This is not so with regard to one liable for damage who does not pay the one-fifth as the Master says: “And a man, if he eats sacrificial excludes one who is liable for damage
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Lehediyot - meshalem chameshin nekei chada, lehekadesh - meshalem chameshin vechumshayehu, ma she'ein kein bemazik - delo meshalem chumsha. De'amar mar: 'Ve'ish ki yokhal kodesh' - perat lemazik." English translation: "For a layman - he pays fifty of one kind, for sanctification - he pays fifty and its fifth. That which is not the same in damages - he does not pay a fifth. For the Master said: 'And when a man eats holy things' - this excludes damages."

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב בִּיבִי בַּר אַבָּיֵי: לְהֶדְיוֹט אַמַּאי מְשַׁלֵּם חַמְשִׁין נְכֵי חֲדָא? נֵימָא לֵיהּ: אֲנָא חֲדָא חֲדָא הֲוָה מְזַבְּנִינָא לְהוּ?
human_translation: Rav Beivai bar Abaye objects to this: Why, to a common person, does he pay fifty-less-one? Let say to I would have sold them one by one
llm_translation: The Gemara challenges Rav Bibi, son of Abbaye: "According to the layman, why does one pay fifty neki chada?" Let him say to him: "I was selling to them one by one?"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: ״שָׁמִין בֵּית סְאָה בְּאוֹתָהּ שָׂדֶה״ תְּנַן.
human_translation: Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said: We learned appraises an area required for one se’a of seed [ beit se’a ] in that field,
llm_translation: Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said: "We hear 'a house of a se'ah in that field.'" We learned.

hebrew_text: לְמֵימְרָא דְּסָבַר שְׁמוּאֵל דִּין הֶדְיוֹט לָאו כְּדִין גָּבוֹהַּ דָּמֵי? וְהָתְנַן: נָטַל אֶבֶן אוֹ קוֹרָה מֵהֶקְדֵּשׁ – לֹא מָעַל, נְתָנָהּ לַחֲבֵירוֹ – הוּא מָעַל, וַחֲבֵירוֹ לֹא מָעַל. בְּנָאָהּ בְּתוֹךְ בֵּיתוֹ – לֹא מָעַל עַד שֶׁיָּדוּר תַּחְתֶּיהָ בְּשָׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה.
human_translation: to say that Shmuel holds halakha of a common person is not like halakha of the Most High, But didn’t we learn took a stone or beam from consecrated not misused he gave it to another, misused but other not misused built it into his house, not misused until he resides underneath it, of value of one peruta .
llm_translation: In the matter of the opinion of Shmuel that the law of a layman is not like the law of a scholar, is it not the same as the law of a high priest? And we learned: If one took a stone or a beam from the Temple - he did not transgress, but if he gave it to his fellow - he transgressed, and his fellow did not transgress. If he built it into his house - he did not transgress until he dwelt beneath it in the space of a small coin.

hebrew_text: וִיתֵיב רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, וְיָתֵיב וְקָאָמַר מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל: זֹאת אוֹמֶרֶת, הַדָּר בַּחֲצַר חֲבֵירוֹ שֶׁלֹּא מִדַּעְתּוֹ צָרִיךְ לְהַעֲלוֹת לוֹ שָׂכָר. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, הֲדַר בֵּיהּ שְׁמוּאֵל מֵהַהִיא.
human_translation: And Rabbi Abbahu was sitting before Rabbi Yoḥanan, and he was sitting and saying in the name of Shmuel, That is to say: One who resides in another’s courtyard without his knowledge must pay him rent. Rabbi Yoḥanan said to him Shmuel retracted that
llm_translation: Rabbi Avahu was sitting before Rabbi Yochanan, and he was sitting and saying in the name of Shmuel: "This means, one who dwells in the courtyard of his fellow without his knowledge, must pay him rent." Rabbi Yochanan said to him, "Shmuel retracted from that statement."

hebrew_text: וּמִמַּאי דְּמֵהַהִיא הֲדַר בֵּיהּ, דִּלְמָא מֵהָא הֲדַר? לָא, מֵהַהִיא הֲדַר בֵּיהּ כִּדְרָבָא. דְּאָמַר רָבָא: הֶקְדֵּשׁ שֶׁלֹּא מִדַּעַת – כְּהֶדְיוֹט מִדַּעַת דָּמֵי.
human_translation: But from where that he retracted that perhaps he retracted this No, that he retracted, in accordance with of Rava. As Rava says: consecrated without knowledge is like a common person with knowledge.
llm_translation: And from what is it that it is more beautiful? Perhaps from this is it more beautiful? No, from that is it more beautiful, as Rav said: An unconsecrated item without knowledge is like a consecrated item with knowledge.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: הָנֵי שָׁקוֹלָאֵי דִּתְבַרוּ חָבִיתָא דְּחַמְרָא לְחַנְווֹאָה, בְּיוֹמָא דְשׁוּקָא מִיזְדַּבְּנָא בְּחָמֵשׁ, בִּשְׁאָר יוֹמֵי מִיזְדַּבְּנָא בְּאַרְבַּע. אַהְדַּרוּ לֵיהּ בְּיוֹמָא דְשׁוּקָא – מַהְדְּרוּ לֵיהּ חָבִיתָא דְחַמְרָא, בִּשְׁאָר יוֹמֵי – מַהְדְּרוּ לֵיהּ חָמֵשׁ.
human_translation: Rava says: these porters who broke a shopkeeper’s barrel of wine, on market day sells for five and on other days sells for four restore to him on market day, they compensate him a barrel of wine, on other days, they compensate him five
llm_translation: Rava said: Those merchants who sell a barrel of wine to the innkeeper, on market day they negotiate for five zuz, on other days they negotiate for four. When it comes to market day again, they increase the price of the barrel of wine, and on other days, they increase it to five zuz.

hebrew_text: וְלָא אֲמַרַן אֶלָּא דְּלָא הֲוָה לֵיהּ חַמְרָא לְזַבּוֹנֵי, אֲבָל הֲוָה לֵיהּ חַמְרָא לְזַבּוֹנֵי – הָא אִיבְּעִי לֵיהּ לְזַבּוֹנֵי.
human_translation: And we said only which did not have wine to sell But he had wine to sell, he should have sold it.
llm_translation: And we did not say except that he did not have wine for the builders, but he had wine for the builders - so he should sell it to the builders.

hebrew_text: וּמְנַכֵּי לֵיהּ אֲגַר טִירְחֵיהּ וּדְמֵי בַּרְזַנְיָיתָא.
human_translation: And they deduct from it the value of effort and the cost of tapping
llm_translation: And they brought before him a chest of gold coins and the value of a pearl.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַמַּחְלִיף פָּרָה בַּחֲמוֹר וְיָלְדָה, וְכֵן הַמּוֹכֵר שִׁפְחָתוֹ וְיָלְדָה, זֶה אוֹמֵר: עַד שֶׁלֹּא מָכַרְתִּי, וְזֶה אוֹמֵר: מִשֶּׁלָּקַחְתִּי – יַחְלוֹקוּ.
human_translation: one who exchanges a cow for a donkey, and calved; and similarly, one who sells his maidservant, and she given birth this says: before I sold and that says: after I purchased they divide
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who exchanges a cow for a donkey and it gives birth, and similarly one who sells his maidservant and she gives birth, this one says: "Until I did not sell," and this one says: "From when I took" - they shall divide.

hebrew_text: הָיוּ לוֹ שְׁנֵי עֲבָדִים, אֶחָד גָּדוֹל וְאֶחָד קָטָן, וְכֵן שְׁתֵּי שָׂדוֹת, אַחַת גְּדוֹלָה וְאַחַת קְטַנָּה.
human_translation: one had two slaves, one large, and one small, and similarly, one had two fields, one large and one small.
llm_translation: If he had two slaves, one adult and one minor, and likewise two fields, one large and one small.

hebrew_text: הַלּוֹקֵחַ אוֹמֵר: גָּדוֹל לָקַחְתִּי, וְהַלָּה אוֹמֵר: אֵינִי יוֹדֵעַ – זָכָה בַּגָּדוֹל.
human_translation: the buyer says: I purchased large and the other one, says: I do not know entitled to large
llm_translation: The one who takes says: "I have taken a great item," and the one who says: "I do not know" - he has acquired the great item.

hebrew_text: הַמּוֹכֵר אוֹמֵר: קָטָן מָכַרְתִּי, וְהַלָּה אוֹמֵר: אֵינִי יוֹדֵעַ – אֵין לוֹ אֶלָּא קָטָן.
human_translation: the seller says: I sold small and the other one, says: I do not know is to only small
llm_translation: The seller says: "I sold a minor," and the buyer says: "I do not know" - he only has the minor.

hebrew_text: זֶה אוֹמֵר גָּדוֹל וְזֶה אוֹמֵר קָטָן – יִשָּׁבַע הַמּוֹכֵר שֶׁהַקָּטָן מָכַר.
human_translation: this says: large and that says: small the seller takes an oath that the small he sold,
llm_translation: This one says "great" and this one says "small" - the seller must swear that the small one sold.

hebrew_text: זֶה אוֹמֵר: אֵינִי יוֹדֵעַ, וְזֶה אוֹמֵר: אֵינִי יוֹדֵעַ – יַחְלוֹקוּ.
human_translation: this says: I do not know and that says: I do not know they divide
llm_translation: This one says: "I do not know," and this one says: "I do not know" - they shall divide.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אַמַּאי יַחְלוֹקוּ? וְלִיחְזֵי בִּרְשׁוּת דְּמַאן קָיְימָא, וְלֶהֱוֵי אִידַּךְ הַמּוֹצִיא מֵחֲבֵירוֹ עָלָיו הָרְאָיָה!
human_translation: why do divide let us see in whose domain is. and the other will be the one who is exacting property from another, proof rests upon him.
llm_translation: The Gemara: Why do they argue? To see in whose domain the incident occurred, and let the other party bring proof!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חִיָּיא בַּר אָבִין אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: בְּעוֹמֶדֶת בַּאֲגַם. שִׁפְחָה נָמֵי דְּקָיְימָא בְּסִימְטָא.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Avin says Shmuel says: where is standing in the marsh, maidservant also, where is in an alley
llm_translation: Rav Ḥiyya bar Avin said in the name of Shmuel: While standing in the marsh, a maidservant was found in a narrow alleyway.

hebrew_text: וְנוֹקְמַהּ אַחֲזָקָה דְּמָרַהּ קַמָּא, וְלִיהְוֵי אִידַּךְ הַמּוֹצִיא מֵחֲבֵירוֹ עָלָיו הָרְאָיָה!
human_translation: But establish in the presumptive ownership of original owner, And the other will be the one who is exacting property from another, the burden of proof rests upon him.
llm_translation: And vengeance Ahazakah of Mara before, and should be the other one who brings forth from his fellow upon him the proof!

hebrew_text: הָא מַנִּי – סוֹמְכוֹס הִיא, דְּאָמַר: מָמוֹן הַמּוּטָּל בְּסָפֵק חוֹלְקִין בְּלֹא שְׁבוּעָה.
human_translation: whose is this is Sumakhos, who says: property of uncertain ownership, divide without an oath.
llm_translation: The text reads: "Ha mani - somchos hi, de'amar: mammon hamutal besafeik cholkim belo shevuah." Translation: "This is a case of relying on a presumption, as it was stated: money that is in doubt is divided without an oath."

hebrew_text: אֵימוֹר דְּאָמַר סוֹמְכוֹס בְּשֶׁמָּא וְשֶׁמָּא, בְּבָרִי וּבָרִי מִי אָמַר?
human_translation: Say that Sumakhos says when an uncertain and an uncertain did he say when a certain and a certain
llm_translation: Statement that says Somchos said in the name of Shema and Shema, in a created being and in a created being who said?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר רַב הוּנָא: אִין, אָמַר סוֹמְכוֹס אֲפִילּוּ בְּבָרִי וּבָרִי.
human_translation: Rabba bar Rav Huna said: Yes, Sumakhos says even when a certain and a certain
llm_translation: Rabba bar Rav Huna said: "Ein," Somchos said, "even in a bar and a bar."

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר: לְעוֹלָם כִּי אָמַר סוֹמְכוֹס שֶׁמָּא וְשֶׁמָּא, אֲבָל בָּרִי וּבָרִי לָא אָמַר. וּתְנִי: זֶה אוֹמֵר שֶׁמָּא עַד שֶׁלֹּא מָכַרְתִּי, וְזֶה אוֹמֵר שֶׁמָּא מִשֶּׁלָּקַחְתִּי.
human_translation: Rava said: Actually, when Sumakhos said an uncertain and an uncertain but a certain and a certain he did not say teach: This says: Perhaps before I sold and that says: Perhaps after I purchased
llm_translation: Rava said: Always when he says "perhaps" and "perhaps," but a clear and clear he did not say. And it was taught: This one says "perhaps" until I have not sold, and this one says "perhaps" since I have acquired.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: זֶה אוֹמֵר אֵינִי יוֹדֵעַ וְזֶה אוֹמֵר אֵינִי יוֹדֵעַ – יַחְלוֹקוּ.
human_translation: We learned this says: I do not know and that says: I do not know they divide
llm_translation: We learned: This one says "I do not know," and this one says "I do not know" - they shall divide.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְרָבָא מִדְּסֵיפָא שֶׁמָּא וְשֶׁמָּא – רֵישָׁא נָמֵי שֶׁמָּא וְשֶׁמָּא. אֶלָּא לְרַבָּה בַּר רַב הוּנָא, דְּאָמַר: אִין, אָמַר סוֹמְכוֹס אֲפִילּוּ בָּרִי וּבָרִי, הַשְׁתָּא בָּרִי וּבָרִי אָמַר יַחְלוֹקוּ, שֶׁמָּא וְשֶׁמָּא מִיבַּעְיָא?
human_translation: Granted, according to Rava, from that the last clause an uncertain and an uncertain the first clause as well an uncertain and an uncertain But according to Rabba bar Rav Huna, who said: Yes, Sumakhos says even when a certain and a certain Now a certain and a certain says divide is necessary an uncertain and an uncertain
llm_translation: In peace to Rava from the end, perhaps and perhaps - the beginning, let us say perhaps and perhaps. Rather, to Rabba bar Rav Huna, who said: No, Somchos said even a created being and a created being, now a created being and a created being will say they should divide, perhaps and perhaps is needed?

hebrew_text: אִי מִשּׁוּם הָא – לָא אִירְיָא: תְּנָא סֵיפָא לְגַלּוֹיֵי רֵישָׁא, שֶׁלֹּא תֹּאמַר רֵישָׁא שֶׁמָּא וְשֶׁמָּא, אֲבָל בָּרִי וּבָרִי לָא. תְּנָא סֵיפָא: שֶׁמָּא וְשֶׁמָּא, מִכְּלָל דְּרֵישָׁא בָּרִי וּבָרִי, וַאֲפִילּוּ הָכִי יַחְלוֹקוּ.
human_translation: If is due to that there is no argument. taught the latter clause to shed light on the first clause, that you will not say the first clause an uncertain and an uncertain but a certain and a certain not teaches the last clause, an uncertain and an uncertain by inference, the first clause a certain and a certain and nevertheless, divide
llm_translation: Talmudic text: If the reason is due to this - it is not called: It was taught in the latter clause to reveal the former, so that you should not say the former "perhaps" and "perhaps," but the clear and the clear not. It was taught in the latter clause: "perhaps" and "perhaps," from the general principle of the former clear and clear, and even so they may disagree.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: זֶה אוֹמֵר גָּדוֹל וְזֶה אוֹמֵר קָטָן – יִשָּׁבַע הַמּוֹכֵר שֶׁקָּטָן מָכַר.
human_translation: We learned this says: large and that says: small the seller takes an oath that the small he sold,
llm_translation: We learned in the Mishnah: This one says "big" and this one says "small" - the seller must swear that he sold the smaller one.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְרָבָא דְּאָמַר: כִּי אָמַר סוֹמְכוֹס שֶׁמָּא וְשֶׁמָּא, אֲבָל בָּרִי וּבָרִי לָא אָמַר – מִשּׁוּם הָכִי יִשָּׁבַע. אֶלָּא לְרַבָּה בַּר רַב הוּנָא דְּאָמַר: אִין, אָמַר סוֹמְכוֹס אֲפִילּוּ בָּרִי וּבָרִי – אַמַּאי יִשָּׁבַע מוֹכֵר? יַחְלוֹקוּ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ!
human_translation: Granted, according to Rava, who said when Sumakhos says an uncertain and an uncertain but a certain and a certain he did not say due to that takes an oath. But according to Rabba bar Rav Huna, who said: Yes, Sumakhos says even a certain and a certain why seller takes an oath; should have they divide
llm_translation: In truth, according to Rava who said: When Somchus said "perhaps" and "perhaps," but he did not say "clearly" and "clearly" - therefore he should swear. However, according to Rabba bar Rav Huna who said: No, Somchus said even "clearly" and "clearly" - why should the seller swear? Let them argue about it!

hebrew_text: מוֹדֶה סוֹמְכוֹס הֵיכָא דְּאִיכָּא שְׁבוּעָה דְאוֹרָיְיתָא, כִּדְבָעֵינַן לְמֵימַר לְקַמַּן.
human_translation: Sumakhos concedes where there is an oath by Torah law as we will need to say below
llm_translation: The one who admits, Somchos, here where there is an oath of Torah, as we will say later.

hebrew_text: הָיוּ לוֹ שְׁנֵי עֲבָדִים אֶחָד גָּדוֹל וְאֶחָד קָטָן (וְכוּ׳). אַמַּאי יִשָּׁבַע? מַה שֶּׁטְּעָנוֹ לֹא הוֹדָה לוֹ, וּמַה שֶּׁהוֹדָה לוֹ לֹא טְעָנוֹ!
human_translation: one had two slaves, one large, and one small, Why does take an oath? that which claimed from did not admit to and that which admitted to, had not claimed from him.
llm_translation: They were to him two slaves, one big and one small, etc. Why should he swear? Whatever he claims, he does not admit to him, and whatever he admits to him, he does not claim!

hebrew_text: וְעוֹד: הֵילָךְ הוּא.
human_translation: And furthermore, this is Here you are.
llm_translation: And furthermore: He went.

hebrew_text: וְעוֹד: אֵין נִשְׁבָּעִין עַל הָעֲבָדִים!
human_translation: And furthermore, one does not take an oath concerning slaves,
llm_translation: And furthermore: "One may not swear by the slaves!"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב: בְּטוֹעֲנוֹ דָּמִים, דְּמֵי עֶבֶד גָּדוֹל, דְּמֵי עֶבֶד קָטָן. דְּמֵי שָׂדֶה גְּדוֹלָה, דְּמֵי שָׂדֶה קְטַנָּה.
human_translation: Rav said: where claims money money of a large slave money of a small slave. money of a large field, money of a small field.
llm_translation: Rav said: When one is loading blood, it is the value of a great slave; when one is loading a field, it is the value of a large field, the value of a small field.

hebrew_text: וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: בְּטוֹעֲנוֹ כְּסוּת עֶבֶד גָּדוֹל, כְּסוּת עֶבֶד קָטָן. עוֹמְרֵי שָׂדֶה גְּדוֹלָה, עוֹמְרֵי שָׂדֶה קְטַנָּה.
human_translation: And Shmuel said: where claims a garment of a large slave, a garment of a small slave. sheaves a large field, sheaves a small field.
llm_translation: Samuel said: When loading the garment of a large slave, it is the garment of a small slave. Large sheaves of the field, small sheaves of the field.

hebrew_text: כְּסוּת, מַה שֶּׁטְּעָנוֹ לֹא הוֹדָה לוֹ, וּמַה שֶּׁהוֹדָה לוֹ לֹא טְעָנוֹ. כִּדְאָמַר רַב פָּפָּא בִּדְלַיְיפִי – הָכָא נָמֵי בִּדְלַיְיפִי.
human_translation: garment that which claimed from him, did not admit to and that which admitted to, had not claimed from him. like that Rav Pappa said with regard to attached Here too, with regard to attached
llm_translation: Garment, what he claimed he did not admit to, and what he admitted to he did not claim. As Rav Papa said in Dilaifei - here too in Dilaifei.

hebrew_text: קַשְׁיָא לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי הוֹשַׁעְיָא: מִידֵּי ״כְּסוּת״ קָתָנֵי? ״עֶבֶד״ קָתָנֵי!
human_translation: Rabbi Hoshaya difficult: Does teach: A garment? it teaches: A slave.
llm_translation: The question was difficult for Rabbi Hoshaya: From the term "garment" does it teach? It teaches "slave"!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רַבִּי הוֹשַׁעְיָא: כְּגוֹן שֶׁטְּעָנוֹ עֶבֶד בִּכְסוּתוֹ וְשָׂדֶה בָּעוֹמָרֶיהָ. וְאַכַּתִּי כְּסוּת, מַה שֶּׁטְּעָנוֹ – לֹא הוֹדָה לוֹ, וּמַה שֶּׁהוֹדָה לוֹ – לֹא טְעָנוֹ! אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: בִּדְלַיְיפִי.
human_translation: Rather, Rabbi Hoshaya said: where claimed a slave with his garment, or field with its sheaves. But still, garment that which claimed from him, did not admit to and that which admitted to, had not claimed from him. Rav Pappa said: with regard to attached
llm_translation: Rather, Rabbi Hoshaya said: For example, if he loaded his slave with his garment and his field with its sheaves. And specifically, regarding his garment, if he loaded it - he did not admit, and if he admitted - he did not load it! Rav Papa said: In Dafyafei.

hebrew_text: קַשְׁיָא לֵיהּ לְרַב שֵׁשֶׁת: זוֹקְקִין אֲתָא לְאַשְׁמוֹעִינַן?! תְּנֵינָא: זוֹקְקִין הַנְּכָסִים שֶׁאֵין לָהֶן אַחְרָיוּת אֶת הַנְּכָסִים שֶׁיֵּשׁ לָהֶן אַחְרָיוּת לִישָּׁבַע עֲלֵיהֶן.
human_translation: Rav Sheshet difficult: come to teach us binding? we learned binds the property that serves as a guarantee, to take an oath concerning
llm_translation: The question was difficult for Rav Sheshet: "Do we come to hear about measuring?!" We learned: We measure properties that do not have succession with properties that have succession to swear upon them.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: הָא מַנִּי – רַבִּי מֵאִיר הִיא, דְּאָמַר: עַבְדָּא כְּמִטַּלְטְלִין דָּמֵי.
human_translation: Rather, Rav Sheshet said: whose is this is Rabbi Meir, who said: a slave is like movable property.
llm_translation: Rather, Rav Sheshet said: This is the opinion of Rabbi Meir, as he said: A slave is considered like movable property.

hebrew_text: וְאַכַּתִּי: מַה שֶּׁטְּעָנוֹ – לֹא הוֹדָה לוֹ, וּמַה שֶּׁהוֹדָה לוֹ – לֹא טְעָנוֹ! סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל. דִּתְנַן: טְעָנוֹ חִטִּים וְהוֹדָה שְׂעוֹרִים – פָּטוּר, רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל מְחַיֵּיב.
human_translation: But still, that which claimed from him, did not admit to and that which admitted to, had not claimed from him. holds in accordance with Rabban Gamliel, as we learned claimed wheat from and admitted to barley, exempt Rabban Gamliel deems him liable.
llm_translation: And once: what he claimed - he did not admit to him, and what he admitted to him - he did not claim! He thought like Rabban Gamliel. For we learned: if he claimed wheat and admitted barley - he is exempt, Rabban Gamliel obligates.

hebrew_text: אַכַּתִּי הֵילָךְ הוּא! אָמַר רָבָא: עַבְדָּא דִּקְטַע לִידֵיהּ, וְשָׂדֶה שֶׁחָפַר בָּהּ בּוֹרוֹת שִׁיחִין וּמְעָרוֹת.
human_translation: Still, this is Here you are, Rava said: the slave, where, severed hand, and field, where, dug pits, ditches and caves in it,
llm_translation: It is a case of "he went." Rava said: A slave who cut off a hand with his hand, and a field in which he dug pits, ditches, and caves.

hebrew_text: וְהָא רַבִּי מֵאִיר אִיפְּכָא שָׁמְעִינַן לֵיהּ, דִּתְנַן: גָּזַל בְּהֵמָה וְהִזְקִינָה, עֲבָדִים וְהִזְקִינוּ – מְשַׁלֵּם כִּשְׁעַת הַגְּזֵילָה. רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: בַּעֲבָדִים אוֹמֵר לוֹ ״הֲרֵי שֶׁלְּךָ לְפָנֶיךָ״!
human_translation: But didn’t Rabbi Meir teach us the opposite? As we learned robbed an animal and it aged slaves and they aged, he pays according to the time of the robbery. Rabbi Meir says: With regard to slaves, he says to That which is yours is before you
llm_translation: The Gemara asks: But didn't we hear the opposite from Rabbi Meir, as we learned in a Mishnah: If one stole an animal and it aged, or slaves and they aged - he must pay according to the time of the theft. Rabbi Meir says: In the case of slaves, he says to him, "Here are yours before you!"

hebrew_text: הָא לָא קַשְׁיָא, כִּדְמַחְלֵיף רַבָּה בַּר אֲבוּהּ וְתָנֵי, רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: מְשַׁלֵּם כִּשְׁעַת הַגְּזֵילָה, וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אוֹמֵר לוֹ בַּעֲבָדִים ״הֲרֵי שֶׁלְּךָ לְפָנֶיךָ״.
human_translation: That not difficult. like Rabba bar Avuh, who reverses and teaches: Rabbi Meir says: He pays according to at the time of the robbery. And the Rabbis say: With regard to slaves, he says to That which is yours is before you
llm_translation: Here is the translation of the Talmudic text into English: The matter is not difficult, as Rabba bar Avuh taught, Rabbi Meir says: "He pays like the time of the theft," and the Sages say: He says to him with regard to slaves, "Here is what belongs to you before you."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מִמַּאי דְּסָבַר רַבִּי מֵאִיר מַקְּשִׁינַן קַרְקַע לְעֶבֶד: מָה עֶבֶד נִשְׁבָּעִין – אַף קַרְקַע נִשְׁבָּעִין? דִּלְמָא אַעֶבֶד הוּא דְּנִשְׁבָּעִין, אֲבָל אַקַּרְקַע לָא!
human_translation: But from where that Rabbi Meir holds that we compare land to a slave, just as a slave, an oath is taken, so too, land, an oath is taken? Perhaps an oath is taken on a slave but not on land.
llm_translation: Rather, from what does Rabbi Meir hold that we can administer an oath to a slave? Just as slaves are administered oaths, so too can land be administered oaths? Perhaps it is only a slave who can be administered oaths, but not land!

hebrew_text: לָא סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ, דְּתַנְיָא: הַמַּחְלִיף פָּרָה בַּחֲמוֹר וְיָלְדָה, וְכֵן הַמּוֹכֵר שִׁפְחָתוֹ וְיָלְדָה,
human_translation: not enter your mind as it is taught one who exchanges a cow for a donkey, and calved; and similarly, one who sells his maidservant, and she given birth
llm_translation: Your request is to translate the following Talmudic text into English word-for-word, maintaining the original style and format of Talmudic discourse. Here is the translation: Talmudic text: "לָא סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ, דְּתַנְיָא: הַמַּחְלִיף פָּרָה בַּחֲמוֹר וְיָלְדָה, וְכֵן הַמּוֹכֵר שִׁפְחָתוֹ וְיָלְדָה," English translation: "It did not come up to your mind, as it was taught: One who exchanges a cow for a donkey and it gives birth, and similarly one who sells his maidservant and she gives birth,"

hebrew_text: זֶה אוֹמֵר: בִּרְשׁוּתִי, וְזֶה שׁוֹתֵק – זָכָה.
human_translation: this says: in my possession, and that remains silent, entitled
llm_translation: This one says: "With my permission, and this one remains silent - he has merit."

hebrew_text: זֶה אוֹמֵר: ״אֵינִי יוֹדֵעַ״, וְזֶה אוֹמֵר: ״אֵינִי יוֹדֵעַ״ – יַחְלוֹקוּ.
human_translation: this says: I do not know and that says: I do not know they divide
llm_translation: This one says: "I do not know," and this one says: "I do not know" - they shall divide.

hebrew_text: זֶה אוֹמֵר: ״בִּרְשׁוּתִי״, וְזֶה אוֹמֵר: ״בִּרְשׁוּתִי״ – יִשָּׁבַע הַמּוֹכֵר שֶׁבִּרְשׁוּתוֹ יָלְדָה, לְפִי שֶׁכׇּל הַנִּשְׁבָּעִין שֶׁבַּתּוֹרָה נִשְׁבָּעִין וְלֹא מְשַׁלְּמִין, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אֵין נִשְׁבָּעִין לֹא עַל הָעֲבָדִים וְלֹא עַל הַקַּרְקָעוֹת.
human_translation: this says: in my possession, and that says: in my possession, the seller takes an oath that gave birth in his possession because anyone who takes an oath by Torah law, takes oath and does not pay. the statement of Rabbi Meir. And the Rabbis say: One does not take an oath, not on slaves and not on land.
llm_translation: This one says: "With my permission," and this one says: "With my permission" - the seller swears that in his possession it was born, because all who swear in the Torah swear and do not pay, the words of Rabbi Meir. And the sages say: One does not swear regarding slaves nor regarding real estate.

hebrew_text: לָאו מִכְּלָל דְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר סָבַר נִשְׁבָּעִין!
human_translation: is it not by inference, Rabbi Meir holds take an oath
llm_translation: Not from the general principle of Rabbi Meir holds that they swear!

hebrew_text: מִמַּאי? דִּלְמָא ״כְּשֵׁם״ קָאָמְרוּ לֵיהּ: כִּי הֵיכִי דְּאוֹדֵית לַן בְּקַרְקָעוֹת – אוֹדִי לַן נָמֵי בַּעֲבָדִים.
human_translation: from where Perhaps are speaking to him Just as, Just as you concede to us with regard to land, concede to us also with regard to slaves.
llm_translation: From where? Perhaps "as" they are saying to him: Just as you are accustomed to us in the ground - we are also accustomed to you in the work.

hebrew_text: תִּדַּע, דִּתְנַן, רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: יֵשׁ דְּבָרִים שֶׁהֵן כַּקַּרְקַע וְאֵינָן כַּקַּרְקַע. וְאֵין חֲכָמִים מוֹדִים לוֹ. כֵּיצַד? עֶשֶׂר גְּפָנִים טְעוּנוֹת מָסַרְתִּי לָךְ, וְהַלָּה אוֹמֵר: אֵינָן אֶלָּא חָמֵשׁ, רַבִּי מֵאִיר מְחַיֵּיב. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: כׇּל הַמְחוּבָּר לַקַּרְקַע – הֲרֵי הוּא כַּקַּרְקַע.
human_translation: Know as we learned Rabbi Meir says: There are matters that like land, but they are not like land But the Rabbis do not concede How so? I delivered ten vines laden to you, and the other says: There were only five; Rabbi Meir deems him liable But the Rabbis say: Anything that is attached to the ground has like land,
llm_translation: You should know, as we learned, Rabbi Meir says: There are things that are like the ground and are not like the ground, and the sages do not agree with him. How so? I have entrusted you with ten grapevines, and the buyer says: There are only five, Rabbi Meir obligates him. And the sages say: Anyone attached to the ground - he is considered like the ground.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר חֲנִינָא: עֲנָבִים הָעוֹמְדוֹת לִיבָּצֵר אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ. דְּמָר סָבַר: כִּבְצוּרוֹת דָּמְיָין, וּמָר סָבַר: לָאו כִּבְצוּרוֹת דָּמְיָין.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yosei bar Ḥanina says: between them grapes that are ready to be picked, as Sage, holds: They are considered as harvested, And Sage, holds: They are not considered as picked,
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yosei bar Chanina said: Grapes that are standing for the purpose of being pressed, is there a difference between them? For Mar holds: They are considered as pressed grapes, and Mar holds: They are not considered as pressed grapes.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לְעוֹלָם כִּדְרַבִּי הוֹשַׁעְיָא, וּדְקַשְׁיָא לָךְ זוֹקְקִין? אִיצְטְרִיךְ: סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא כְּסוּת עֶבֶד כְּעֶבֶד דָּמֵי, עוֹמְרֵי שָׂדֶה כְּשָׂדֶה דָּמֵי, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: Rather, actually in accordance with of Rabbi Hoshaya, And that which posed a difficulty to you, binds was necessary enter your mind to say garment of a slave is like slave sheaves of a field are like field teaches us
llm_translation: Rather, forever like Rabbi Hoshaya, and difficult for you, Zokkin? It was necessary: Your mind ascended, I say, like the covering of a slave is like the slave himself, sheaves of a field are like the field itself, it is heard for us.

hebrew_text: זֶה אוֹמֵר: ״אֵינִי יוֹדֵעַ״, וְזֶה אוֹמֵר: ״אֵינִי יוֹדֵעַ״ – יַחְלוֹקוּ. הָא מַנִּי – סוֹמְכוֹס הִיא, דְּאָמַר: מָמוֹן הַמּוּטָּל בְּסָפֵק – חוֹלְקִין.
human_translation: this says: I do not know and that says: I do not know they divide whose is this? is Sumakhos, who says: property of uncertain ownership, divide
llm_translation: This one says: "I do not know," and this one says: "I do not know" - they shall divide. The one who holds - it is a presumption, as he said: Money that is in doubt - they divide.

hebrew_text: אֵימָא סֵיפָא: זֶה אוֹמֵר ״בִּרְשׁוּתִי״ וְזֶה אוֹמֵר ״בִּרְשׁוּתִי״ – יִשָּׁבַע הַמּוֹכֵר שֶׁבִּרְשׁוּתוֹ יָלְדָה, וּלְרַבָּה בַּר רַב הוּנָא, דְּאָמַר: אִין, אָמַר סוֹמְכוֹס אֲפִילּוּ בָּרִי וּבָרִי, אַמַּאי יִשָּׁבַע מוֹכֵר? ״יַחְלוֹקוּ״ מִיבַּעְיָא!
human_translation: say the latter clause this says: in my possession, and that says: in my possession, the seller takes an oath that it gave birth in his possession, But according to Rabba bar Rav Huna, who says: Yes, Sumakhos said even a certain and a certain why seller takes an oath; should have they divide
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Eima seifa: zeh omer 'bireshuti' ve'zeh omer 'bireshuti' – yishava hamocher shebireshuto yaldah, u'le'Rabah bar Rav Huna, de'amar: ein, amar Somchos afilu bari u'bari, amai yishava mocher? 'Yachloku' mibaya!" English translation: "The final clause: one says 'in my domain' and the other says 'in my domain' – the seller swears that in his domain a child was born, and according to Rabah son of Rav Huna, who said: No, Somchos said even in a case of 'clear and clear,' why should the seller swear? 'Let them divide' is what is required!"

hebrew_text: מוֹדֶה סוֹמְכוֹס הֵיכָא דְּאִיכָּא שְׁבוּעָה דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא, וּדְקַטְעַהּ לִידַהּ כִּדְרָבָא.
human_translation: Sumakhos concedes where there is an oath by Torah law, severed hand, like of Rava
llm_translation: The one who admits, Somchus, here where there is an oath of the Torah, and he cut off his hand like Ravah.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַמּוֹכֵר זֵיתָיו לְעֵצִים, וְעָשׂוּ פָּחוֹת מֵרְבִיעִית לַסְּאָה – הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ שֶׁל בַּעַל הַזֵּיתִים.
human_translation: one who sells his olive trees for wood, and they yielded less than a quarter per se’a these of owner of the olive trees,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who sells his olives for firewood, and they made less than a quarter of a se'ah - these belong to the owner of the olive trees.

hebrew_text: עָשׂוּ רְבִיעִית לַסְּאָה, זֶה אוֹמֵר: ״זֵיתַי גִּדֵּלוּ״, וְזֶה אוֹמֵר: ״אַרְצִי גִּדֵּלָה״ – יַחְלוֹקוּ.
human_translation: they yielded a quarter per se’a this says: My olive trees yielded and that says: my land yielded they divide
llm_translation: They made a fourth part for the se'ah, this one says: "My olives have grown," and this one says: "My land has grown" - they shall divide the produce.

hebrew_text: שָׁטַף נָהָר זֵיתָיו וּנְתָנָם לְתוֹךְ שְׂדֵה חֲבֵירוֹ, זֶה אוֹמֵר: ״זֵיתַי גִּדֵּלוּ״, וְזֶה אוֹמֵר: ״אַרְצִי גִּדֵּלָה״ – יַחְלוֹקוּ.
human_translation: a river swept away one’s olive trees and deposited them in field of another, this says: My olive trees yielded and that says: my land yielded they divide
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Shataf nahar zeitav u'netanam letoch sadeh chaveiro, zeh omer: 'Zeitai gidlu', ve'zeh omer: 'Artzi gidleha' - yachlokhu." English translation: "If a river floods one's olive trees and carries them into his neighbor's field, one says: 'My olive trees have grown,' and the other says: 'My land has grown' - they shall divide."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ הֵיכִי דָּמֵי? אִי דַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ קוֹץ לְאַלְתַּר – אֲפִילּוּ פָּחוֹת מֵרְבִיעִית נָמֵי לְבַעַל הַקַּרְקַע. אִי דַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ כֹּל אֵימַת דְּבָעֵית קוֹץ – אֲפִילּוּ רְבִיעִית נָמֵי לְבַעַל זֵיתִים!
human_translation: What are the circumstances If where said to Cut down immediately, even less than a quarter to the owner of the land, if where he said to him: Cut down whenever you want, even a quarter to the owner of the olive trees,
llm_translation: Gemara: How so the value? If he says to him "a thorn for immediate removal" - even less than a quarter of the produce is also considered for the owner of the land. If he says to him "whenever you want a thorn" - even a quarter of the produce is also considered for the owner of the olives!

hebrew_text: לָא צְרִיכָא, דַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ סְתָמָא: פָּחוֹת מֵרְבִיעִית – לָא קָפְדִי אִינָשֵׁי, רְבִיעִית – קָפְדִי אִינָשֵׁי.
human_translation: No, necessary where said to him without specification less than a quarter people are not particular a quarter people are particular
llm_translation: Not necessary, for he said to him simply: Less than a quarter - people are not particular, a quarter - people are particular.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן פַּזִּי: וּרְבִיעִית שֶׁאָמְרוּ –
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Pazi says: And quarter that they mentioned
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Pazzi said: And the fourth case that they said -

hebrew_text: חוּץ מִן הַהוֹצָאָה.
human_translation: is exclusive of the expense
llm_translation: Outside of the carrying out.

hebrew_text: שָׁטַף נָהָר זֵיתָיו. אָמַר עוּלָּא אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא שֶׁנֶּעֶקְרוּ בְּגוּשֵׁיהֶן, וּלְאַחַר שָׁלֹשׁ.
human_translation: a river swept away one’s olive trees Ulla says Reish Lakish says: They taught only where were uprooted with their clods and after three
llm_translation: He flooded the river of its olives. Ulla said Resh Lakish said: They only taught that they were uprooted in their saplings, and after three years.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל בְּתוֹךְ שָׁלֹשׁ – הַכֹּל שֶׁל בַּעַל הַזֵּיתִים. דַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִי אַתְּ נְטַעְתְּ בְּתוֹךְ שָׁלֹשׁ, מִי הֲוָה אָכְלַתְּ?
human_translation: But during three everything is of owner of the olive trees, as he can say to if you had planted would you have eaten during three
llm_translation: Talmudic text: But within three - all belong to the owner of the olive trees. For he said to her: If you planted within three, who would eat? English translation:

hebrew_text: וְלֵימָא לֵיהּ: אִי אֲנָא נְטַעִי, לְאַחַר שָׁלֹשׁ הֲוָה אָכֵילְנָא לֵיהּ כּוּלֵּיהּ. הַשְׁתָּא קָאָכְלַתְּ פַּלְגָא בַּהֲדַאי!
human_translation: But let say to him: If I had planted after three I could have consumed all of Now that you consume half with me,
llm_translation: And let him say to him: If I am a plant, after three years I will eat all of it. Now you are eating half of it!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא כִּי אֲתָא רָבִין, אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא שֶׁנֶּעֶקְרוּ בְּגוּשֵׁיהֶן וּבְתוֹךְ שָׁלֹשׁ, אֲבָל לְאַחַר שָׁלֹשׁ הַכֹּל לְבַעַל הַקַּרְקַע. דַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִי אֲנָא נְטַעִי לְאַחַר שָׁלֹשׁ, מִי לָא הֲוָה אָכֵילְנָא לֵיהּ כּוּלֵּיהּ?
human_translation: Rather, when Ravin came he said Reish Lakish: They taught only where were uprooted with their clods and during three But after three everything of owner of the land, as he can say to If I had planted after three could I not have consumed all of
llm_translation: Rather, when Ravin came, Reish Lakish said: They only taught that they are uprooted within their roots and within three, but after three, everything belongs to the landowner. For he said to him: If I had planted after three, would I not have eaten all of it?

hebrew_text: וְלֵימָא לֵיהּ: אִי אַתְּ נְטַעְתְּ – בְּתוֹךְ שָׁלֹשׁ לָא הֲוָה אָכְלַתְּ, הַשְׁתָּא קָא אָכְלַתְּ פַּלְגָא בַּהֲדַאי? מִשּׁוּם דַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִי אֲנָא נְטַעִי – הֲוָה קַטִּינֵי וּזְרַעְנָא תְּחוֹתַיְיהוּ סִילְקָא וְיַרְקָא.
human_translation: But let say to him: if you had planted during three you would not have consumed now consume half together with me due to that can say to If I had planted they would be slender and planted chard [ silka ] and vegetables underneath
llm_translation: And say to him: If you have not planted - within three years you have not eaten, now you are eating half in this year? Because he said to him: If I have planted - small ones and their seeds underneath them will grow beets and vegetables.

hebrew_text: תָּנָא: אָמַר הַלָּה ״זֵיתַיי אֲנִי נוֹטֵל״ – אֵין שׁוֹמְעִין לוֹ. מַאי טַעְמָא? אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מִשּׁוּם יִשּׁוּב אֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל. אָמַר רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה: כְּגוֹן דָּא צְרִיכָא רַבָּה.
human_translation: taught the other one, said: I am taking my olive trees does not listen to him. What is the reason? Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Due to the settling of Eretz Yisrael, Rabbi Yirmeya said: such as this, necessary a great
llm_translation: Mishna: Halah said, "My olives I take" - we do not heed him. What is the reason? Rabbi Yochanan said: Because of the return of the land of Israel. Rabbi Yirmeya said: Like this great need.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן הָתָם, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: הַמְקַבֵּל שָׂדֶה אֲבוֹתָיו מִן הַנׇּכְרִי – מְעַשֵּׂר וְנוֹתֵן לוֹ.
human_translation: We learned there Rabbi Yehuda says one who receives a field of his ancestors from a gentile tithe and give
llm_translation: We learned there, Rabbi Yehuda says: One who inherits a field from a non-Jew - tithes and gives to him.

hebrew_text: סַבְרוּהָ מַאי ״שְׂדֵה אֲבוֹתָיו״ – אֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל, וְאַמַּאי קָרוּ לַהּ ״שְׂדֵה אֲבוֹתָיו״ – שְׂדֵה אַבְרָהָם יִצְחָק וְיַעֲקֹב.
human_translation: they assumed What A field of his ancestors? Eretz Yisrael. And why did they call it: A field of his ancestors? a field of Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob.
llm_translation: They thought: What is "the field of his fathers"? - The land of Israel. And why is it called "the field of his fathers"? - The field of Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob.

hebrew_text: וְקָסָבַר: אֵין קִנְיָן לְנׇכְרִי בְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל לְהַפְקִיעַ מִיַּד מַעֲשֵׂר.
human_translation: And holds a gentile’s acquisition in Eretz Yisrael does not abrogate with regard to tithes
llm_translation: And he holds: There is no acquisition for a non-Jew in the land of Israel to exempt from tithing.

hebrew_text: וּמְקַבֵּל – כְּחוֹכֵר דָּמֵי. מָה חוֹכֵר, בֵּין עֲבַד וּבֵין לָא עֲבַד, בָּעֵי עַשּׂוֹרֵי וּמִיתַּן לֵיהּ, דְּכִי פּוֹרֵעַ חוֹבָתוֹ דָּמֵי. אַף מְקַבֵּל נָמֵי כִּי פּוֹרֵעַ חוֹבָתוֹ דָּמֵי, מְעַשֵּׂר וְנוֹתֵן לוֹ.
human_translation: And receives is like a tenant farmer, just as a tenant farmer, whether produces or whether it does not produce is required to tithe and give to as he is like one paying his debt, so too, receives, also like one paying his debt, tithe and give to
llm_translation: Received - like a merchant of blood. What is a merchant? Whether a slave or not a slave, he requires a tenth and gives it to him, for he is paying the price of his obligation. Likewise, one who receives also pays the price of his obligation, tithing and giving to him.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב כָּהֲנָא לְרַב פַּפִּי, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ לְרַב זְבִיד: אֶלָּא הָא דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: הַמְקַבֵּל שָׂדֶה אֲבוֹתָיו מִמֵּצִיק נׇכְרִי מְעַשֵּׂר וְנוֹתֵן לוֹ, מַאי אִירְיָא מֵצִיק? אֲפִילּוּ אֵין מֵצִיק – נָמֵי!
human_translation: Rav Kahana said to Rav Pappi, and some say to Rav Zevid: But that which is taught Rabbi Yehuda says one who receives a field of his ancestors from a gentile oppressor tithes and gives why specifically an oppressor Even not an oppressor, also
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Kahana to Rav Pappi, and some say to Rav Zebid: Rather, as it was taught, Rabbi Yehuda says: One who inherits a field from a heathen, he tithes and gives to him, what is the meaning of "from a heathen"? Even if not from a heathen – yes!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: לְעוֹלָם יֵשׁ קִנְיָן לְנׇכְרִי בְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל לְהַפְקִיעַ מִיַּד מַעֲשֵׂר, וּמְקַבֵּל לָאו כְּחוֹכֵר דָּמֵי.
human_translation: Rather, a gentile’s acquisition in Eretz Yisrael abrogates with regard to tithes receives, is not like a tenant farmer.
llm_translation: Rather: always there is acquisition for a non-Jew in the land of Israel to exempt from the hand of tithe, and he receives not like a hirer of money.

hebrew_text: וּמַאי ״שְׂדֵה אֲבוֹתָיו״ – שְׂדֵה אֲבוֹתָיו מַמָּשׁ. וּלְדִידֵיהּ הוּא דְּקַנְסוּהּ רַבָּנַן, דְּאַיְּידֵי דַּחֲבִיבָא עֲלֵיהּ טָפֵי וְאָזֵיל מְקַבֵּל לַהּ. אֲבָל אִינִישׁ דְּעָלְמָא – לָא.
human_translation: And, what A field of his ancestors? a field his actual ancestors, And it is him whom the Sages penalized as, since is dear to him, he will more readily go and receive it But person of the world not
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "U'mai 'sadeh avotav' - sadeh avotav mamash. U'le'dideih hu dekan'suha rabanan, de'ayidei dachaviba aleih tafei ve'azeil mekabeil la. Aval inish de'alma - la." English translation: "And what is meant by 'the field of his fathers' - the field of his fathers literally. And according to him, the Rabbis penalized him, for since it is more beloved to him, he goes and acquires it. But someone from the world - no."

hebrew_text: וּלְדִידֵיהּ מַאי טַעְמָא קַנְסוּהּ רַבָּנַן? אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: כְּדֵי שֶׁתְּהֵא בָּרָה בְּיָדוֹ.
human_translation: but what is the reason the Sages penalized him? Rabbi Yoḥanan says: in order that it will be clearly in his possession.
llm_translation: And according to his opinion, what is the reason that the Rabbis penalized him? Rabbi Yochanan said: So that it should be clear in his hand.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה: כְּגוֹן דָּא צְרִיכָא רַבָּה.
human_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya said: such as this, necessary a great
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yirmeya: "As an example, this is a great need."

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר: הַיּוֹרֵד לְתוֹךְ שְׂדֵה חֲבֵירוֹ וּנְטָעָהּ שֶׁלֹּא בִּרְשׁוּת, אָמַר רַב: שָׁמִין לוֹ, וְיָדוֹ עַל הַתַּחְתּוֹנָה. וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: אוֹמְדִין כַּמָּה אָדָם רוֹצֶה לִיתֵּן בְּשָׂדֶה זוֹ לְנוֹטְעָהּ.
human_translation: was stated one who entered another’s field and planted it without permission Rav says: appraises for and is at a disadvantage, And Shmuel says: estimates how much a person would be willing to give to plant in this field,
llm_translation: It was stated: One who descends into the field of his fellow and plants it without permission, Rav said: we assess for him, and his hand is on the lower part. And Shmuel said: we estimate how much a person wants to give in this field to the planter.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא וְלָא פְּלִיגִי: כָּאן – בְּשָׂדֶה הָעֲשׂוּיָה לִיטַּע, כָּאן – בְּשָׂדֶה שֶׁאֵינָהּ עֲשׂוּיָה לִיטַּע.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: And do not disagree. Here, with regard to a field that is designated for planting, there, with regard to a field that is not designated for planting.
llm_translation: Rav Papa said, and they do not disagree: here - in a field prepared for planting, here - in a field not prepared for planting.

hebrew_text: וְהָא דְּרַב לָאו בְּפֵירוּשׁ אִיתְּמַר, אֶלָּא מִכְּלָלָא אִיתְּמַר. דְּהָהוּא דַּאֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: זִיל שׁוּם לֵיהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָא בָּעֵינָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: זִיל שׁוּם לֵיהּ, וְיָדוֹ עַל הַתַּחְתּוֹנָה. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָא בָּעֵינָא.
human_translation: And this of Rav was not stated explicitly; rather, it was stated implicitly. As a certain who came before Rav said to him: Go appraise for said to him: I do not want said to him: Go appraise for and he is at a disadvantage, said to him: I do not want
llm_translation: The one that Rav did not explicitly state, was stated implicitly. When that person came before Rav, he said to him: Go and place it. He said to him: I do not want to. He said to him: Go and place it, and his hand was on the lower part. He said to him: I do not want to.

hebrew_text: לְסוֹף חַזְיֵיהּ דְּגַדְרַהּ וְקָא מְנַטַּר לַהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ גַּלִּית אַדַּעְתָּיךְ דְּנִיחָא לָךְ, זִיל שׁוּם לֵיהּ, וְיָדוֹ עַל הָעֶלְיוֹנָה.
human_translation: Eventually, saw had fenced in and was safeguarding said to him: you have demonstrated your opinion that is satisfactory to you. go appraise for and he has the advantage,
llm_translation: At the end he saw a wall and he was guarding it. He said to him, "Reveal your knowledge that it is pleasing to you, go place it, and his hand on the upper one."

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר: הַיּוֹרֵד לְתוֹךְ חוּרְבָּתוֹ שֶׁל חֲבֵירוֹ וּבְנָאָהּ שֶׁלֹּא בִּרְשׁוּתוֹ, וְאָמַר לוֹ: עֵצַיי וַאֲבָנַיי אֲנִי נוֹטֵל, רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר: שׁוֹמְעִין לוֹ, רַב שֵׁשֶׁת אָמַר: אֵין שׁוֹמְעִין לוֹ.
human_translation: was stated one who entered another’s ruin and built it without permission, and said to I will take my timber and my stones Rav Naḥman says: listens to him Rav Sheshet says: does not listen to him
llm_translation: It was stated: One who descends into the pit of his fellow and builds it without his permission, and he says to him: "I am taking my trees and my stones," Rav Nachman said: We listen to him, Rav Sheshet said: We do not listen to him.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי, רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: שׁוֹמְעִין לוֹ, וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: אֵין שׁוֹמְעִין לוֹ. לֵימָא רַב נַחְמָן דְּאָמַר כְּבֵית שַׁמַּאי?
human_translation: raises an objection Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: Beit Shammai say listens to him, and Beit Hillel say does not listen to him. Shall we say Rav Naḥman said in accordance with Beit Shammai?
llm_translation: The Tanna raises an objection: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: Beit Shammai say: we listen to him, and Beit Hillel say: we do not listen to him. Let Rav Nachman say: like Beit Shammai?

hebrew_text: הוּא דְּאָמַר כִּי הַאי תַּנָּא, דְּתַנְיָא: שׁוֹמְעִין לוֹ, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר. רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר, בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: שׁוֹמְעִין לוֹ, וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: אֵין שׁוֹמְעִין לוֹ.
human_translation: states in accordance with that tanna , as it is taught listens to him; the statement of Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: Beit Shammai say that listens to him, and Beit Hillel say that does not listen to him.
llm_translation: He who said, as this Tanna, as it was taught: They listen to him, the words of Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says, Beit Shammai says: They listen to him, and Beit Hillel says: They do not listen to him.

hebrew_text: מַאי הָוֵי עֲלַהּ? אָמַר רַבִּי יַעֲקֹב אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן:
human_translation: What was about Rabbi Ya’akov said Rabbi Yoḥanan said:
llm_translation: What is the meaning of this? Rabbi Yaakov said, Rabbi Yochanan said:

hebrew_text: בְּבַיִת – שׁוֹמְעִין לוֹ. בְּשָׂדֶה – אֵין שׁוֹמְעִין לוֹ.
human_translation: In the a house, listens to him, in the a field, does not listen to him.
llm_translation: In a house - they listen to him. In a field - they do not listen to him.

hebrew_text: בְּשָׂדֶה מַאי טַעְמָא – מִשּׁוּם יִשּׁוּב אֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל. אִיכָּא דְאָמְרִי: מִשּׁוּם כַּחְשָׁא דְאַרְעָא. מַאי בֵּינַיְיהוּ? אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ חוּצָה לָאָרֶץ.
human_translation: In the a field, what is the reason due to the settling of Eretz Yisrael, There are who say due to the weakening of the land What is between these between them outside of Eretz
llm_translation: In the field, what is the reason? - Because of the return of the land of Israel. Some say: Because of the strength of the land. What is the difference between them? The difference between them is outside the land.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַמַּשְׂכִּיר בַּיִת לַחֲבֵירוֹ בִּימוֹת הַגְּשָׁמִים – אֵינוֹ יָכוֹל לְהוֹצִיאוֹ מִן הֶחָג וְעַד הַפֶּסַח. בִּימוֹת הַחַמָּה, שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם. וּבַכְּרַכִּים, אֶחָד יְמוֹת הַחַמָּה וְאֶחָד יְמוֹת הַגְּשָׁמִים – שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר חֹדֶשׁ. וּבַחֲנוּיוֹת, אֶחָד עֲיָירוֹת וְאֶחָד כְּרַכִּים – שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר חֹדֶשׁ. רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: חֲנוּת שֶׁל נַחְתּוֹמִים וְשֶׁל צַבָּעִים שָׁלֹשׁ שָׁנִים.
human_translation: one who rents out a house to another in the rainy season, cannot evict from the festival until Passover. in the summer, thirty days’ And in the cities [ uvakerakim ], both in the summer and in the rainy season twelve months’ And for shops both in towns and in cities, twelve months’ Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: a baker’s shop or a dyer’s shop, three years’
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who rents a house to his fellow during the rainy season - cannot evict him from the Festival until Passover. During the summer season, the notice period is thirty days. In walled cities, one day of summer and one day of the rainy season - the notice period is twelve months. And in villages, one day of summer and one day of the rainy season - the notice period is twelve months. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: The shop of perfumers and dyers requires a notice period of three years.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאי שְׁנָא יְמוֹת הַגְּשָׁמִים, דְּכִי אָגַר אִינִישׁ בֵּיתָא בִּימוֹת הַגְּשָׁמִים אָגַר לְכוּלְּהוּ יְמוֹת הַגְּשָׁמִים, יְמוֹת הַחַמָּה נָמֵי, דְּכִי אָגַר אִינִישׁ בֵּיתָא לְכוּלְּהוּ יְמוֹת הַחַמָּה אָגַר! אֶלָּא בִּימוֹת הַגְּשָׁמִים הַיְינוּ טַעְמָא: דְּלָא שְׁכִיחַ בֵּיתָא לְמֵיגַר.
human_translation: What is different the rainy season Because when a person rents a house during the rainy season, he rents it for the entire rainy season. the summer as well, because when a person rents a house, he rents it for the entire summer. Rather, in the rainy season, this is the reason because houses for renting are not found
llm_translation: Gemara: What is the difference between the days of rain? For when a person is confined to his house during the days of rain, he is confined for all the days of rain. The days of the sun are different, for when a person is confined to his house during all the days of the sun, he is confined! Rather, the reason is that during the days of rain, it is not common for one to go out.

hebrew_text: אֵימָא סֵיפָא: בַּכְּרַכִּים, אֶחָד יְמוֹת הַחַמָּה וְאֶחָד יְמוֹת הַגְּשָׁמִים שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר חֹדֶשׁ, וְאִילּוּ מְלוֹ לֵיהּ יוֹמֵי שְׂכִירוּת בִּימוֹת הַגְּשָׁמִים, מַפֵּיק לֵיהּ, וְאַמַּאי? הָא לָא שְׁכִיחַ בֵּיתָא לְמֵיגַר!
human_translation: say the latter clause And in the cities, both in the summer and in the rainy season, twelve months’ if rental period would be completed during the rainy season, he could evict him But why houses for renting are not found
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Eima seifa: bakarkaim, echad yemot hachamah ve'echad yemot hageshamim shneim asar chodesh, ve'ilu melo lei yomei sechirut bimei hageshamim, mapeik lei, ve'amai? Ha lo shichicha beita lemigar!" English translation: "The reason for the conclusion: In the summer months, one day of sunshine and one day of rain, twelve months, and if he completes the days of rental during the rainy season, he may collect it. And why? Because it is not common for a house to be rented out in the summer!"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה, לְהוֹדִיעַ קָתָנֵי. וְהָכִי קָאָמַר: הַמַּשְׂכִּיר בַּיִת לַחֲבֵירוֹ סְתָם – אֵין יָכוֹל לְהוֹצִיאוֹ בִּימוֹת הַגְּשָׁמִים מֵחַג וְעַד הַפֶּסַח, אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן הוֹדִיעוֹ שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם מֵעִיקָּרָא.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said: teaches to give notice and this is saying: one who rents out a house to another without specification evict during the rainy season, from the festival until Passover, unless he gives him notice thirty days from the outset,
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said, to inform the smaller ones. And thus he said: One who rents a house to his fellow without specifying - cannot evict him from the holiday until Passover, unless he informed him thirty days beforehand.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: כְּשֶׁאָמְרוּ שְׁלֹשִׁים, וּכְשֶׁאָמְרוּ שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר חֹדֶשׁ – לֹא אָמְרוּ אֶלָּא לְהוֹדִיעוֹ. וּכְשֵׁם שֶׁמַּשְׂכִּיר צָרִיךְ לְהוֹדִיעַ, כָּךְ שׂוֹכֵר צָרִיךְ לְהוֹדִיעַ, דְּאָמַר לֵיהּ: אִי אוֹדַעְתַּן, הֲוָה טָרַחְנָא וּמוֹתֵיבְנָא בֵּיהּ אִינִישׁ מְעַלְּיָא.
human_translation: This is also taught When they said, Thirty days, and when they said: Twelve months, they said it only to give notice And just as a landlord needs to give notice so too a renter needs to give notice As can say to him: Had you given me notice, I would have exerted myself and settle a respectable person in
llm_translation: It was taught in a baraita: Namai the Elder said: When they said thirty, and when they said twelve months – they only said it to inform. Just as a lessee must inform, so too a lessor must inform, for he says to him: If you had known, I would have made an effort and rented it to someone else above.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אַסִּי: אִם נִכְנַס יוֹם אֶחָד בִּימוֹת הַגְּשָׁמִים – אֵינוֹ יָכוֹל לְהוֹצִיאוֹ מִן הֶחָג עַד הַפֶּסַח. וְהָא אֲנַן שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם קָאָמַר! הָכִי קָאָמַר: אִם נִכְנַס יוֹם אֶחָד בִּימוֹת הַגְּשָׁמִים, מֵהָנֵי שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם – אֵינוֹ יָכוֹל לְהוֹצִיאוֹ מִן הַחַג וְעַד הַפֶּסַח.
human_translation: Rav Asi says: If one day enters into the rainy season cannot evict from the festival until Passover. But didn’t we say thirty days’ This is saying: If one day of these thirty days enters into the rainy season cannot evict from the festival until Passover.
llm_translation: Rav Assi said: If one day enters during the rainy season, he cannot remove it from the festival until Passover. But we said thirty days! This is what he said: If one day enters during the rainy season, from thirty days - he cannot remove it from the festival until Passover.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: וְאִם בָּא לְרַבּוֹת בְּדָמֶיהָ מְרַבֶּה. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב נַחְמָן: הַאי לִנְקְטֵיהּ בְּכוּבְסֵיהּ דְּלִשְׁבְּקֵיהּ לִגְלִימֵאּ?! לָא צְרִיכָא דְּאִיַּיקּוּר בָּתֵּי.
human_translation: Rav Huna said: And if comes to increase fee, he may increase Rav Naḥman said to him: this who grabbed by his testicles so that he would relinquish his cloak, No, necessary where houses became more expensive.
llm_translation: Rav Huna said: "And if it comes to include with its blood, it increases." Rav Nachman said to him: "Should we take it out with its garments to the cloak?!" It is not necessary, as it is a matter of the house of inquiry.

hebrew_text: פְּשִׁיטָא נְפַל לֵיהּ בֵּיתָא – אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָא עֲדִיפַתְּ מִינַּאי.
human_translation: obvious the house fell down, he can say to him: You are no better than me.
llm_translation: The house fell on him - he said to him: You are not preferable to me.

hebrew_text: זַבְּנֵיהּ אוֹ אוֹרְתֵיהּ אוֹ יַהֲבֵיהּ בְּמַתָּנָה – אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָא עֲדִיפַתְּ מִגַּבְרָא דַּאֲתֵית מִינֵּיהּ.
human_translation: sold or bequeathed it or gave it as a gift, can say to You are no better than the person from whom your came.
llm_translation: His purchase or his lights or his gift as a gift - he said to him: You are not preferable to the man who comes from him.

hebrew_text: כַּלְּלֵיהּ לִבְרֵיהּ, חָזֵינַן: אִי הֲוָה אֶפְשָׁר לְאוֹדוֹעֵיהּ – אִיבְּעִי לֵיהּ לְאוֹדוֹעֵי, וְאִי לָא – אָמַר לֵיהּ: לָא עֲדִיפַתְּ מִינַּאי.
human_translation: marries off his son, we see: If it was possible for him to have given notice, then he is required to give notice but if not he can say You are no better than me
llm_translation: His son-in-law, we see: if it was possible to clarify it - he asked to clarify it, and if not - he said to him: you are not preferable to my species.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא גַּבְרָא דִּזְבַן אַרְבָּא דְחַמְרָא. לָא אַשְׁכַּח דּוּכְתָּא לְאוֹתוֹבֵיהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ לְהַהִיא אִיתְּתָא: אִית לָךְ דּוּכְתָּא לְאוֹגוֹרַי? אֲמַרָה לֵיהּ: לָא. אֲזַל קַדְּשַׁהּ יְהַבָה לֵיהּ דּוּכְתָּא לְעַיֹּילֵיהּ. אֲזַל לְבֵיתֵיהּ כְּתַב לַהּ גִּיטָּא, שַׁדַּר לַהּ. אֲזַלָא אִיהִי, אֲגַרָא שָׁקוֹלָאֵי מִינֵּיהּ וּבֵיהּ, אַפֵּיקְתֵּיהּ וְאוֹתְבֵיהּ בִּשְׁבִילָא. אָמַר רַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: ״כַּאֲשֶׁר עָשָׂה כֵּן יֵעָשֶׂה לּוֹ גְּמוּלוֹ יָשׁוּב בְּרֹאשׁוֹ״.
human_translation: a certain man who purchased a boat with wine. He was unable to find a place to store it. He said to a certain woman: Do you have place to rent to me? She said to him: No. he went and betrothed her, she gave him the place to bring in He went to his home wrote a bill of divorce for her, he sent to her. she went and hired porters, from itself, take out and put it on the road. Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said, Like he did, shall be done to him, his repayment shall come back on his head;
llm_translation: The man who bought a barrel of wine. He did not find a spigot to open it. He said to his wife: Do you have a spigot for barrels? She said to him: No. He went and consecrated a spigot for his use. He went home, wrote her a bill of divorce, and sent it to her. She then realized his intention, took the spigot and hit him on the head with it. Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said: "As he did, so shall be done to him; his retribution shall return upon his own head."

hebrew_text: לָא מִיבַּעְיָא חָצֵר דְּלָא קָיְימָא לְאַגְרָא, אֶלָּא אֲפִילּוּ חָצֵר דְּקָיְימָא לְאַגְרָא, אָמְרָה לֵיהּ: לְכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא נִיחָא לִי לְאוֹגוֹרֵי וְלָךְ לָא נִיחָא לִי, דְּדָמֵית עֲלַי כִּי אַרְיָא אָרְבָא.
human_translation: not necessary a courtyard that did not stand to be rented out, rather, even a courtyard that stands to be rented out, she say to him: amenable for me to rent to everyone but it is not amenable to me to you, as you are to me like a preying lion.
llm_translation: The courtyard that is not established for a storage area does not require an Eruv, but even a courtyard that is established for a storage area, she said to him: "It is pleasing to me for all the people of the world to gather, but for you it is not pleasing to me, for you appear to me like a lion in the fourth watch."

hebrew_text: רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: שֶׁל נַחְתּוֹמִים וְשֶׁל צַבָּעִין שָׁלֹשׁ שָׁנִים. תָּנָא: מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהֶקֵּיפָן מְרוּבֶּה.
human_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: a baker’s shop or a dyer’s shop, three years’ It was taught due to that credit is extensive.
llm_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: The term of novices and the term of apprentices is three years. It was taught: Because their surroundings are mostly filled with temptation.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַמַּשְׂכִּיר בַּיִת לַחֲבֵירוֹ, הַמַּשְׂכִּיר חַיָּיב בַּדֶּלֶת, בַּנֶּגֶר וּבַמַּנְעוּל, וּבְכׇל דָּבָר שֶׁמַּעֲשֵׂה אוּמָּן. אֲבָל דָּבָר שֶׁאֵינוֹ מַעֲשֵׂה אוּמָּן – הַשּׂוֹכֵר עוֹשֵׂהוּ.
human_translation: one rents out a house to another, the landlord bears the responsibility for the door, for the bolt, for the lock, and for every item that the work of a craftsman But an item that does not the work of a craftsman, the renter make it.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who rents a house to his fellow, the renter is obligated for the door, the bolt, and the lock, and for anything that a skilled craftsman would do. However, for something that is not the work of a skilled craftsman, the renter must do it.

hebrew_text: הַזֶּבֶל שֶׁל בַּעַל הַבַּיִת, וְאֵין לַשּׂוֹכֵר אֶלָּא הַיּוֹצֵא מִן הַתַּנּוּר וּמִן הַכִּירַיִם בִּלְבַד.
human_translation: The manure of the landlord, and the renter has only that come out of the oven and the stove,
llm_translation: The dung of the homeowner, and the renter has nothing except what comes out of the oven and the stove alone.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הַמַּשְׂכִּיר בַּיִת לַחֲבֵירוֹ, מַשְׂכִּיר חַיָּיב לְהַעֲמִיד לוֹ דְּלָתוֹת, לִפְתּוֹחַ לוֹ חַלּוֹנוֹת, לְחַזֵּק לוֹ תִּקְרָה, לִסְמוֹךְ לוֹ קוֹרָה. וְשׂוֹכֵר חַיָּיב לַעֲשׂוֹת לוֹ סוּלָּם, לַעֲשׂוֹת לוֹ מַעֲקֶה, לַעֲשׂוֹת לוֹ מַרְזֵב וּלְהָטִיחַ אֶת גַּגּוֹ.
human_translation: The Sages taught one rents out a house to another, landlord bears the responsibility to install doors for it, to open windows for it, to strengthen its ceiling, to support its beam. And the renter bears the responsibility to make a ladder for it to erect a parapet for its to construct a gutter for it and to plaster its roof
llm_translation: The Sages taught: One who rents a house to his fellow, the renter is obligated to set up doors for him, to open windows for him, to strengthen a ceiling for him, and to affix a beam for him. And the landlord is obligated to make for him a ladder, to make for him a fence, to make for him a parapet, and to plaster his roof.

hebrew_text: בְּעוֹ מִינֵּיהּ מֵרַב שֵׁשֶׁת: מְזוּזָה עַל מִי? מְזוּזָה?! הָאָמַר רַב מְשַׁרְשְׁיָא: מְזוּזָה חוֹבַת הַדָּר הִיא. אֶלָּא: מְקוֹם מְזוּזָה עַל מִי?
human_translation: raised a dilemma before Rav Sheshet: Upon whom a mezuza a mezuza ; doesn’t Rav Mesharshiyya say: a mezuza is the obligation of the resident? Rather, Upon whom place mezuza
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Be'o mineih mei Rav Sheshet: Mezuzah al mi? Mezuzah?! Ha'amar Rav Mesharshaya: Mezuzah chovat hadar hi. Ela: Makom mezuzah al mi?" English translation: "He asked him from Rav Sheshet: A mezuzah on who? A mezuzah?! Didn't Rav Mesharshaya say: A mezuzah is an obligation of the dwelling. Rather: The place of a mezuzah, on who?"

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לְהוּ רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: תְּנֵיתוּהָ, דָּבָר שֶׁאֵין מַעֲשֵׂה אוּמָּן – הַשּׂוֹכֵר עוֹשֵׂהוּ, וְהַאי נָמֵי לָאו מַעֲשֵׂה אוּמָּן הוּא, אֶפְשָׁר הוּא
human_translation: Rav Sheshet said to them: You learned an item that not the work of a craftsman, the renter make it. And this is also not the work of a craftsman, is possible
llm_translation: He said to them, Rav Sheshet: You taught it, a matter that is not a skilled work - the hirer does it, and this one also is not a skilled work, it is possible.

hebrew_text: בְּגוּבְתָּא דְּקַנְיָא.
human_translation: inside reed
llm_translation: In the pit of Kanya.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הַמַּשְׂכִּיר בַּיִת לַחֲבֵירוֹ – עַל הַשּׂוֹכֵר לַעֲשׂוֹת לוֹ מְזוּזָה, וּכְשֶׁהוּא יוֹצֵא – לֹא יִטְּלֶנָּה בְּיָדוֹ וְיֵצֵא. וּמִנׇּכְרִי, נוֹטְלָהּ בְּיָדוֹ וְיוֹצֵא. וּמַעֲשֶׂה בְּאֶחָד שֶׁנְּטָלָהּ בְּיָדוֹ וְיָצָא, וְקָבַר אִשְׁתּוֹ וּשְׁנֵי בָּנָיו.
human_translation: The Sages taught one rents out a house to another, to prepare a mezuza for it upon the renter. And when he leaves, he may not take it in his hand and leave But from a gentile, he may take it in his hand and leave And an incident in took in his hand and left and he buried his wife and two sons.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: One who rents a house to his fellow - it is the responsibility of the renter to affix a mezuzah for himself, and when he leaves - he should not remove it in his hand and leave. And if it is a non-Jew, he takes it in his hand and leaves. And there was an incident with one who took it in his hand and left, and his wife and two sons died.

hebrew_text: מַעֲשֶׂה לִסְתּוֹר?! אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: אַרֵישָׁא.
human_translation: incident to contradict Rav Sheshet said: to the first clause.
llm_translation: The matter of Sitor?! Rav Sheshet said: The first.

hebrew_text: הַזֶּבֶל שֶׁל בַּעַל הַבַּיִת, וְאֵין לַשּׂוֹכֵר אֶלָּא הַיּוֹצֵא מִן הַתַּנּוּר וּמִן הַכִּירַיִם בִּלְבַד. בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן? אִילֵימָא בְּחָצֵר דַּאֲגִירָ[א] לֵיהּ לְשׂוֹכֵר וְתוֹרֵי דְּשׂוֹכֵר – אַמַּאי שֶׁל בַּעַל הַבַּיִת? אֶלָּא בְּחָצֵר דְּלָא אֲגִירָא לְשׂוֹכֵר וְתוֹרֵי דְּמַשְׂכִּיר, פְּשִׁיטָא!
human_translation: The manure of the landlord, and the renter has only that come out of the oven and the stove, With what are we dealing? If we say to a courtyard that is rented out to the renter, or oxen of the renter, why of the landlord? Rather, referring to a courtyard that is not rented out to the renter, and oxen of the landlord. obvious
llm_translation: The dung of the homeowner, and the renter has only that which comes out of the oven and out of the stoves alone. With what are we dealing? If you say in the courtyard of the rented house, let the renter gather it, and the oxen of the renter - why should it be considered the dung of the homeowner? Rather, in a courtyard that is not rented to the renter and the oxen of the renter, it is obvious!

hebrew_text: לָא צְרִיכָא: בְּחָצֵר דְּמַשְׂכִּיר, וְתוֹרֵי דְּאָתוּ מֵעָלְמָא קָמוּ בַּהּ.
human_translation: No, necessary where in a courtyard of the landlord, and oxen that came from the world stood in
llm_translation: Not necessary: In the courtyard of a renter, and the oxen that came from the world stood in it.

hebrew_text: מְסַיַּיע לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: חֲצֵרוֹ שֶׁל אָדָם קוֹנָה לוֹ שֶׁלֹּא מִדַּעְתּוֹ.
human_translation: supports of Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, as Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, says: A person’s courtyard effects acquisition for him without his knowledge.
llm_translation: Assisting him, Rabbi Yosei son of Rabbi Chanina. For Rabbi Yosei son of Rabbi Chanina said: A person's courtyard acquires for him without his knowledge.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: אִם אָמַר ״כׇּל מְצִיאוֹת שֶׁיָּבֹאוּ לְתוֹכוֹ הַיּוֹם תִּקְנֶה לִי חֲצֵרִי״ – לֹא אָמַר כְּלוּם. וְאִם אִיתָא לְהָא דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא חֲצֵרוֹ שֶׁל אָדָם קוֹנָה לוֹ שֶׁלֹּא מִדַּעְתּוֹ, אַמַּאי לֹא אָמַר כְּלוּם?
human_translation: raises an objection If says: Any lost items that come into today, my courtyard should effect acquisition for me, he has not said anything And if it is so, that this that Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, says a person’s courtyard effects acquisition for him without his knowledge, why has he not said anything
llm_translation: Challenger: If one says, "All found items that come into my courtyard today shall be acquired by me," - he has said nothing. And if it comes to this that Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Chanina, said: A person's courtyard acquires for him without his knowledge, why did he not say anything?

hebrew_text: הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן – בְּחָצֵר שֶׁאֵינָהּ מִשְׁתַּמֶּרֶת.
human_translation: With what are we dealing here with a courtyard that is not secured,
llm_translation: Here we are dealing with - in a courtyard that is not preserved.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי אֵימָא סֵיפָא: יָצָא לוֹ שֵׁם מְצִיאָה בָּעִיר – דְּבָרָיו קַיָּימִין. וְאִי בְּחָצֵר שֶׁאֵינָהּ מִשְׁתַּמֶּרֶת, כִּי יָצָא לוֹ שֵׁם מְצִיאָה בָּעִיר, מַאי הָוֵי?
human_translation: If so, say the latter clause knowledge of lost item spread through the town, his statement stands And if to a courtyard that is not secured, where knowledge of lost item spread through the town, what of it?
llm_translation: If so, say the conclusion: if he acquired a reputation in the city - his words are established. And if in a courtyard that is not preserved, when he acquires a reputation in the city, what is the ruling?

hebrew_text: כֵּיוָן דְּיָצָא לוֹ שֵׁם מְצִיאָה בָּעִיר – מִיבְדָּל בְּדִילִי אִינָשֵׁי מִינַּהּ, וְהָוְיָא לַהּ כְּחָצֵר הַמִּשְׁתַּמֶּרֶת.
human_translation: Once knowledge of lost item spreads though the town, people withdraw themselves from it, and will be like a secured courtyard
llm_translation: Since he has acquired a name of recognition in the city - people will distinguish themselves from him, and it will be to him like a protected courtyard.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: זֶבֶל הַיּוֹצֵא מִן הַתַּנּוּר וּמִן הַכִּירַיִם וְהַקּוֹלֵט מִן הָאֲוִיר – הֲרֵי הוּא שֶׁלּוֹ, וְשֶׁבָּרֶפֶת וְשֶׁבֶּחָצֵר – שֶׁל בַּעַל הַבַּיִת. וְאִם אִיתָא לְהָא דְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא, דְּאָמַר חֲצֵרוֹ שֶׁל אָדָם קוֹנָה לוֹ שֶׁלֹּא מִדַּעְתּוֹ, קוֹלֵט מֵאֲוִיר אַמַּאי הֲרֵי הוּא שֶׁלּוֹ? אֲוִיר חֲצֵרוֹ הוּא!
human_translation: raises an objection Refuse of the oven and of the stove, and that which is collected from airspace is And that is in the cowshed and in the courtyard, of the landlord. And if it is so, that this that Rabbi Yossi, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, says a person’s courtyard effects acquisition for him without his knowledge, collected from the airspace why is it airspace of courtyard,
llm_translation: Challenger: The refuse that comes out of the oven and out of the stoves, and the one who collects from the air - it belongs to him. And if it comes to what Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Chanina, said, that a person's courtyard acquires for him without his knowledge, why is the air of his courtyard his? The air of his courtyard it is!

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: בְּמַדְבִּיק כְּלִי בְּשׁוּלֵי פָרָה.
human_translation: Abaye said: where attached vessel to a cow’s rear.
llm_translation: Abbaye said: "When one sticks a vessel in the innards of a cow."

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר: אֲוִיר שֶׁאֵין סוֹפוֹ לָנוּחַ – לָאו כְּמוּנָּח דָּמֵי.
human_translation: Rava said: airspace that will not eventually come to rest is not as though it had come to rest.
llm_translation: Rava said: "Air that has no end to rest - it is not like resting blood."

hebrew_text: וּמִי פְּשִׁיטָא לֵיהּ לְרָבָא? וְהָא מִיבְעֵי בָּעֵי לַהּ, דְּבָעֵי רָבָא: זָרַק אַרְנָקִי בְּפֶתַח זֶה וְיָצָאתָה בְּפֶתַח זֶה, מַהוּ? אֲוִיר שֶׁאֵין סוֹפוֹ לָנוּחַ כְּמוּנָּח דָּמֵי, אוֹ לָאו כְּמוּנָּח דָּמֵי?
