human_translation: And is obvious to Rava? But didn’t he raise it as a dilemma? As Rava raised a dilemma: cast a purse through this doorway and exited through that doorway, what is airspace that will not eventually come to rest as though it had come to rest, or not as though it had come to rest?
llm_translation: And is it obvious to Rav? But he requires it, for Rav requires it: If one threw a purse in this entrance and it came out in that entrance, what is the ruling? Is it considered an airspace that has no resting place like the resting place of blood, or not like the resting place of blood?

hebrew_text: הָתָם לָא מַיפְסֵק וְלָא מִידֵּי, הָכָא מַיפְסֵק כְּלִי.
human_translation: There, nothing at all interposes Here, vessel interposes,
llm_translation: There, not interrupted and not interrupted, here interrupted vessel.

hebrew_text: וְשֶׁבָּרֶפֶת וְשֶׁבֶּחָצֵר, הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ שֶׁל בַּעַל הַבַּיִת. תַּרְתֵּי?
human_translation: And that is in the cowshed and in the courtyard of the landlord. two
llm_translation: And in the rampart and in the courtyard, behold these belong to the homeowner. Two?

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי, הָכִי קָאָמַר: וְשֶׁבָּרֶפֶת שֶׁבֶּחָצֵר – הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ שֶׁל בַּעַל הַבַּיִת. אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי, זֹאת אוֹמֶרֶת: הַמַּשְׂכִּיר חֲצֵירוֹ סְתָם – לֹא הִשְׂכִּיר רֶפֶת שֶׁבָּהּ.
human_translation: Abaye said this is saying: And that is in the cowshed that is in the courtyard of the landlord. Rav Ashi said: That is to say one who rents out his courtyard without specification has not rented out a cowshed that is in it.
llm_translation: Abaye said, thus he said: "And the courtyard that is half-burned - these are the property of the homeowner." Rav Ashi said, this means: "One who rents his courtyard implicitly - did not rent the half-burned portion within it."

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: יוֹנֵי שׁוֹבָךְ וְיוֹנֵי עֲלִיָּיה חַיָּיבוֹת בְּשִׁילּוּחַ, וַאֲסוּרוֹת בְּגָזֵל מִפְּנֵי דַּרְכֵי שָׁלוֹם.
human_translation: raises an objection Doves of a dovecote and doves of an attic are subject to the obligation of dispatching they are subject to the prohibition of robbery, due to ways of peace.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: It was raised: Doves of the dove-cote and doves of the upper story are obligated in sending away the mother bird, and prohibited in theft, because of ways of peace.

hebrew_text: וְאִם אִיתָא לְהָא דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: חֲצֵרוֹ שֶׁל אָדָם קוֹנָה לוֹ שֶׁלֹּא מִדַּעְתּוֹ. קְרִי כָּאן ״כִּי יִקָּרֵא״ – פְּרָט לִמְזוּמָּן!
human_translation: And if it is so, that this that Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, says a person’s courtyard effects acquisition for him without his knowledge, apply here “If it happened excludes readily accessible,
llm_translation: And if it comes to this which Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Chanina said: A person's courtyard acquires for him without his knowledge. It reads here "when he is called" - excluding a designated one!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: בֵּיצָה בִּיצִיאַת רוּבָּהּ הוּא דְּאִיחַיַּיבָה לַהּ בְּשִׁילּוּחַ, וּמִיקְנָא לָא קַנְיָא עַד דְּנָפְלָה לַחֲצֵרוֹ, וְכִי קָתָנֵי ״חַיָּיבוֹת בְּשִׁילּוּחַ״ – מִקַּמֵּי דְּתִיפּוֹל לַחֲצֵירוֹ.
human_translation: Rava said: from the emergence of the majority of an egg that becomes subject to the obligation of dispatching And does not acquire until it falls into his courtyard. And when teaches subject to the obligation of dispatching before falls into his courtyard.
llm_translation: Rava said: With regard to an egg, its exiting is what obligates it in sending away the mother bird, and one does not acquire the egg until it falls into his courtyard. And when it teaches "obligated in sending away" – it means before it falls into his courtyard.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, אַמַּאי אֲסוּרוֹת מִשּׁוּם גָּזֵל! אַאִמָּן.
human_translation: If that is so, why they are forbidden due to robbery? to their mother,
llm_translation: If so, why are they forbidden due to theft? Indeed.

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: לְעוֹלָם אַבֵּיצִים, וּמִדְּנָפֵיק רוּבַּהּ דַּעְתֵּיהּ עִילָּוַהּ.
human_translation: And if you wish, say Actually, to eggs, and once majority emerges, mind is upon
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: Always eggs, and from the outset, his mind was superior.

hebrew_text: וְהַשְׁתָּא דְּאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: אָסוּר לִזְכּוֹת בַּבֵּיצִים כׇּל זְמַן שֶׁהָאֵם רוֹבֶצֶת עֲלֵיהֶם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״שַׁלֵּחַ תְּשַׁלַּח אֶת הָאֵם״ וַהֲדַר ״אֶת הַבָּנִים תִּקַּח לָךְ״. אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא דִּנְפַלָה לַהּ לַחֲצֵרוֹ, כֹּל הֵיכָא דְּאִיהוּ מָצֵי זָכֵי לֵיהּ – חֲצֵרוֹ זָכְיָא לֵיהּ, וְכֹל הֵיכָא דְּאִיהוּ לָא מָצֵי זָכֵי לֵיהּ – חֲצֵרוֹ נָמֵי לָא זָכְיָא לֵיהּ.
human_translation: And now that Rav Yehuda says Rav says: It is prohibited to acquire the eggs as long as the mother bird is upon them, as it is stated: “Send away the mother” and then: take the young for yourself” even you say that fell into his courtyard, any case is able to acquire his courtyard can effect acquisition for him, but any case he is unable to acquire his courtyard cannot effect acquisition for him either.
llm_translation: At this time, when Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: It is forbidden to take the eggs as long as the mother is sitting on them, as it is stated: "You shall surely send away the mother, and the children you may take for yourself." Even if it fell for her in his courtyard, wherever he can acquire it - his courtyard acquires it for him, and wherever he cannot acquire it - his courtyard also does not acquire it for him.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי: אֲסוּרוֹת בְּגָזֵל מִפְּנֵי דַּרְכֵי שָׁלוֹם? אִי דְּשַׁלְּחַהּ – גָּזֵל מְעַלְּיָא הוּא, אִי דְּלָא שַׁלְּחַהּ – הָא בָּעֵי שַׁלּוֹחַהּ!
human_translation: If that is so, They are subject to the prohibition of robbery, due to the ways of peace? If one dispatched full-fledged robbery, if one did not dispatch doesn’t he need to dispatch her
llm_translation: So is it forbidden to steal due to ways of peace? If one sent it - it is considered stolen property, but if one did not send it - it requires sending it!

hebrew_text: בְּקָטָן דְּלָאו בַּר שִׁילּוּחַ הוּא. קָטָן בַּר דַּרְכֵי שָׁלוֹם הוּא? הָכִי קָאָמַר: אָבִיו שֶׁל קָטָן חַיָּיב לְהַחְזִיר לוֹ מִפְּנֵי דַּרְכֵי שָׁלוֹם.
human_translation: to a minor, who is not subject to dispatching a minor subject to the ways of peace? This is saying: father of a minor is obligated to return to due to ways of peace.
llm_translation: In a minor who is not of age, is he not a son of Shiluch? Is a minor a son of ways of peace? Thus he says: The father of a minor is obligated to return to him due to ways of peace.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַמַּשְׂכִּיר בַּיִת לַחֲבֵירוֹ לְשָׁנָה, נִתְעַבְּרָה הַשָּׁנָה – נִתְעַבְּרָה לַשּׂוֹכֵר. הִשְׂכִּיר לוֹ לָחֳדָשִׁים, נִתְעַבְּרָה הַשָּׁנָה – נִתְעַבְּרָה לַמַּשְׂכִּיר.
human_translation: one who rents out a house to another for a year the year was intercalated, it was intercalated to the renter. rented out to for months, the year was intercalated, it was intercalated to the landlord.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who rents a house to his fellow for a year, if the year is intercalated, it is intercalated for the renter. If he rented it to him for months, if the year is intercalated, it is intercalated for the landlord.

hebrew_text: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּצִיפּוֹרִי בְּאֶחָד שֶׁשָּׂכַר מֶרְחָץ מֵחֲבֵירוֹ בִּשְׁנֵים עָשָׂר זָהָב לְשָׁנָה, מִדִּינַר זָהָב לְחֹדֶשׁ,
human_translation: An incident in Tzippori involving one who rented a bathhouse from another Twelve gold per year, a gold dinar per month,
llm_translation: The story of Tzipori: There was one who rented a bathhouse from his fellow for twelve gold coins per year, a dinar of gold per month.

hebrew_text: וּבָא מַעֲשֶׂה לִפְנֵי רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל וְלִפְנֵי רַבִּי יוֹסֵי, וְאָמְרוּ: יַחְלוֹקוּ אֶת חֹדֶשׁ הָעִיבּוּר.
human_translation: And incident came before Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel and before Rabbi Yosei, and they said: should divide the intercalary month
llm_translation: And came a case before Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel and before Rabbi Yosei, and they said: Let them argue about the intercalation month.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַעֲשֶׂה לִסְתּוֹר?! חַסּוֹרֵי מְחַסְּרָא וְהָכִי קָתָנֵי: וְאִם אָמַר לוֹ בִּשְׁנֵים עָשָׂר זְהוּבִים לְשָׁנָה מִדִּינַר זָהָב לְחֹדֶשׁ – יַחְלוֹקוּ. וּמַעֲשֶׂה נָמֵי בְּצִיפּוֹרִי בְּאֶחָד שֶׁשָּׂכַר מֶרְחָץ מֵחֲבֵירוֹ בִּשְׁנֵים עָשָׂר זְהוּבִים לְשָׁנָה מִדִּינַר זָהָב לְחֹדֶשׁ, וּבָא מַעֲשֶׂה לִפְנֵי רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל וְלִפְנֵי רַבִּי יוֹסֵי, וְאָמְרוּ: יַחְלוֹקוּ אֶת חֹדֶשׁ הָעִיבּוּר.
human_translation: an incident to contradict is incomplete and this it is teaching: But if said to Twelve gold per year, a gold dinar per month, should be divided And in addition, an incident in Tzippori involving one who rented a bathhouse from another, Twelve gold per year, a gold dinar per month, And incident came before Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel and before Rabbi Yosei, and they said: should divide the intercalary month
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Is it possible to hide a deed?! The lacking ones are lacking, and thus it was taught: "And if he said to him, 'With twelve gold coins for a year from a gold dinar for a month' – they shall divide." And there was a case in Tzipori where one rented a bathhouse from his fellow for twelve gold coins for a year from a gold dinar for a month, and the matter came before Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel and before Rabbi Yosei, and they said: "They shall divide the intercalated month."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב: אִי הֲוַאי הָתָם, הֲוָה יָהֵיבְנָא לֵיהּ כּוּלֵּיהּ לְמַשְׂכִּיר.
human_translation: Rav said: If I had been there, I would have given the entire to the landlord
llm_translation: Rav said: If he were there, I would have given him all of it to rent.

hebrew_text: מַאי קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן? ״תְּפוֹס לָשׁוֹן אַחֲרוֹן״!
human_translation: What is teaching us? attend the last statement?
llm_translation: What is it teaching us? "Grasp the last language"!

hebrew_text: הָא אָמַר רַב חֲדָא זִימְנָא. דְּאָמַר רַב הוּנָא, אָמְרִי בֵּי רַב: ״אִסְתֵּירָא מְאָה מָעֵי״ – מְאָה מָעֵי. ״מְאָה מָעֵי אִסְתֵּירָא״ – אִסְתֵּירָא.
human_translation: didn’t Rav say one time as Rav Huna said They say the study hall of Rav An asteira , one hundred coins, one hundred coins, One hundred coins, an asteira , an asteira .
llm_translation: Here is the English translation of the provided Talmudic text: Talmudic text: "Ha amar Rav Ḥada zimna, de'amar Rav Huna, amrei bei Rav: 'Istera me'ah ma'ei' – me'ah ma'ei. 'Me'ah ma'ei istera' – istera." English translation: "This is what Rav Ḥada once said, as Rav Huna said, the students of Rav would say: 'A hundred concealments' – a hundred concealments. 'A hundred concealments are a concealment' – a concealment."

hebrew_text: אִי מֵהָתָם, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: פָּרוֹשֵׁי קָא מְפָרֵשׁ, קָמַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: If from there, I would say is explaining teaches us
llm_translation: From there, I would say: He is explaining explicitly, and he is teaching us.

hebrew_text: וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: בְּבָא בְּאֶמְצַע חֹדֶשׁ עָסְקִינַן. אֲבָל בָּא בִּתְחִלַּת חֹדֶשׁ – כּוּלֵּיהּ לְמַשְׂכִּיר, בָּא בְּסוֹף חֹדֶשׁ – כּוּלֵּיהּ לְשׂוֹכֵר.
human_translation: And Shmuel said we are dealing with where came in the middle of the month. But he came at the beginning of the month, the entire to the landlord, he came at the end of the month, the entire to the renter.
llm_translation: Samuel said: When he comes in the middle of the month, we are dealing. But when he comes at the beginning of the month - all for the tenant, when he comes at the end of the month - all for the landlord.

hebrew_text: מִי אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל לָא אָמְרִינַן ״תְּפוֹס לָשׁוֹן אַחֲרוֹן״? וְהָא רַב וּשְׁמוּאֵל דְּאָמְרִי תַּרְוַיְיהוּ: כּוֹר בִּשְׁלֹשִׁים אֲנִי מוֹכֵר לָךְ – יָכוֹל לַחֲזוֹר בּוֹ אֲפִילּוּ בִּסְאָה אַחֲרוֹנָה! כּוֹר בִּשְׁלֹשִׁים, סְאָה בְּסֶלַע אֲנִי מוֹכֵר לָךְ – רִאשׁוֹן רִאשׁוֹן קָנָה.
human_translation: Did Shmuel say we do not say attend the last statement? But don’t Rav and Shmuel both say: I am selling you a kor for thirty he can renege on even while last se’a I am selling you a kor for thirty a se’a per sela , acquires one by one,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Who said, "Shmuel did not say 'acquire the last language'"? But Rav and Shmuel both said: "I am selling you a kor for thirty - you can retract even with the last sela! A kor for thirty, a se'ah for a sela I am selling you - he acquires each one separately."

hebrew_text: הָתָם טַעְמָא מַאי – מִשּׁוּם דְּתָפֵיס, הָכָא נָמֵי קָא תָפֵיס.
human_translation: There, what is the reason due to has taken hold Here too, is holding
llm_translation: There, what is the reason? - Because he grasps. Here too, he grasps.

hebrew_text: וְרַב נַחְמָן אָמַר: קַרְקַע בְּחֶזְקַת בְּעָלֶיהָ קַיֶּימֶת. מַאי קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן – ״תְּפוֹס לָשׁוֹן אַחֲרוֹן״, הַיְינוּ דְּרַב? אַף עַל גַּב דְּאָפֵיךְ מֵיפָךְ.
human_translation: And Rav Naḥman said: land is in its owner’s possession, What is teaching us? attend the last statement? this is of Rav. even where is reversed.
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said: The ground in the possession of its owner is established. What is he teaching us? "He grasps the last language," meaning like Rav? Even though he is more lenient than he.

hebrew_text: בְּעוֹ מִינֵּיהּ מֵרַבִּי יַנַּאי: שׂוֹכֵר אָמַר נָתַתִּי, וּמַשְׂכִּיר אָמַר לֹא נָטַלְתִּי – עַל מִי לְהָבִיא רְאָיָה?
human_translation: raised a dilemma before Rabbi Yannai: a renter says I gave and landlord says: I did not take upon whom is the burden of proof?
llm_translation: He sought from Rabbi Yannai: The renter said, "I have given," and the landlord said, "I have not taken" - upon whom to bring proof?

hebrew_text: אֵימַת? אִי בְּתוֹךְ זְמַנּוֹ – תְּנֵינָא, אִי לְאַחַר זְמַנּוֹ – תְּנֵינָא. דִּתְנַן: מֵת הָאָב בְּתוֹךְ שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם – בְּחֶזְקַת שֶׁלֹּא נִפְדָּה עַד שֶׁיָּבִיא רְאָיָה שֶׁנִּפְדָּה. לְאַחַר שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם – בְּחֶזְקַת שֶׁנִּפְדָּה, עַד שֶׁיֹּאמְרוּ לוֹ שֶׁלֹּא נִפְדָּה.
human_translation: When If during his period, we learned if after his period, we learned As we learned the father died within thirty days has the presumptive status of being unredeemed, until he brings a proof that he was redeemed. after thirty days, has the presumptive status of having been redeemed, until tell him that he was not redeemed.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: When? If within his time - we learned, if after his time - we learned. As we learned: If the father dies within thirty days - it is presumed that he did not redeem his son until proof is brought that he did redeem him. After thirty days - it is presumed that he did redeem him, until they say to him that he did not redeem him.

hebrew_text: לָא צְרִיכָא: בְּיוֹמָא דְּמִשְׁלַם זִמְנֵיהּ. מִי עֲבִיד אִינִישׁ דְּפָרַע בְּיוֹמָא דְּמִשְׁלַם זִמְנֵיהּ, אוֹ לָא?
human_translation: No, necessary on the day on which his period is completed. whether a person is apt to pay on the day on which period is completed, or not.
llm_translation: Not necessary: on the day that he fulfills his time. Does anyone do that which Pharaoh did on the day that he fulfilled his time, or not?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לְהוּ רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, תְּנֵיתוּהָ:
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said to them: you have learned
llm_translation: He said to them, Rabbi Yochanan, "You should teach it."

hebrew_text: שָׂכִיר בִּזְמַנּוֹ, נִשְׁבָּע וְנוֹטֵל.
human_translation: a hired laborer at time, takes an oath and takes
llm_translation: Hired worker in his time, swears and takes.

hebrew_text: שָׂכִיר הוּא דִּרְמוֹ רַבָּנַן שְׁבוּעָה עֲלֵיהּ, מִשּׁוּם דְּבַעַל הַבַּיִת טָרוּד בְּפוֹעֲלָיו. אֲבָל הָכָא, שׂוֹכֵר מְהֵימַן בִּשְׁבוּעָה.
human_translation: a hired laborer that the Sages imposed an oath upon him, due to the fact that the employer is busy with his workers But here, renter is deemed credible that he already paid the rent, that an oath.
llm_translation: A hired worker is like a Rabbi who takes an oath regarding him, because the master of the house is troubled by his actions. But here, one hires on trust with an oath.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: הַאי מַאן דְּאוֹגַר לֵיהּ בֵּיתָא לְחַבְרֵיהּ לַעֲשַׂר שְׁנִין, וּכְתַב לֵיהּ שְׁטָרָא, וַאֲמַר לֵיהּ: נְקִיטַתְּ חֲמֵשׁ שְׁנִין – מְהֵימַן. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אַחָא מִדִּפְתִּי לְרָבִינָא: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה, אוֹזְפֵיהּ מְאָה זוּזֵי בִּשְׁטָרָא, וַאֲמַר לֵיהּ: פְּרַעְתִּיךָ פַּלְגָא – הָכִי נָמֵי דִּמְהֵימַן?
human_translation: Rava says Rav Naḥman says: one who rented out a house to another for ten years and had written him document and said to You have taken five years he is deemed credible. Rav Aḥa of Difti said to Ravina: If that is so, one lent a hundred dinars with note, and said to him: I have repaid you half so too should he be deemed credible?
llm_translation: Rava said, Rav Nachman said: One who stores a house for his friend for ten years, and writes a document for him, and says to him: "Take five years - believe him." Rav Acha said to Ravina: Rather, from now on, add one hundred coins to the document, and say to him: "I have paid you half" - this is indeed considered trustworthy.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָכִי הַשְׁתָּא?! הָתָם – שְׁטַר לְגוּבְיָינָא קָאֵי, אִם אִיתָא דְּפַרְעֵיהּ – אִיבְּעִי לֵיהּ לְמִכְתַּבא אַגַּבֵּיהּ, אִי נָמֵי מִיכְתַּב עֲלֵיהּ תְּבָרָא. אֲבָל הָכָא, אָמַר לֵיהּ: הַאי דִּכְתַיבִי לָךְ שְׁטָרָא – כִּי הֵיכִי דְּלָא תַּחְזֵק עֲלֵיהּ.
human_translation: said to him: How can be compared? There, note exists to collect if it is so that repaid should have written on alternatively, he could have written a receipt But here, say that I wrote the document for your was in order that you would not establish a presumptive ownership of
llm_translation: He said to him: Is it so now?! There - a document for collection stands, if his debtor comes, he should demand payment from him, if not, he should write a document against him, so that it will be established upon him. But here, he said to him: This document that I am writing for you - so that you will not rely on it.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: שׁוֹאֵל אָדָם בְּטוּבוֹ לְעוֹלָם.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman says: A person may borrow in its good forever,
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said: A person should always ask in his own language.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב מָרִי בְּרַהּ דְּבַת שְׁמוּאֵל, וְהוּא (דִּקְנֵי) [דִּקְנוֹ] מִינֵּיהּ.
human_translation: Rav Mari, son of the daughter of Shmuel, said: And that is he performed an act of acquisition with
llm_translation: Rav Mari, son of Raha of the house of Shmuel, said, "And he (acquired) from her."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב מָרִי בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אָשֵׁי: וּמַהְדַּר לֵיהּ קַתֵּיהּ.
human_translation: Rav Mari, son of Rav Ashi, said: And must return its handle, to
llm_translation: Rav Mari, son of Rav Ashe, said: "And he returned to his place."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: הַאי מַאן דַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ לְחַבְרֵיהּ: ״אוֹשְׁלַן מָרָא לְמִירְפַּק בֵּיהּ הַאי פַּרְדֵּיסָא״ – רָפֵיק בֵּיהּ הָהוּא פַּרְדֵּיסָא. ״פַּרְדֵּיסָא״ – רָפֵיק בֵּיהּ כֹּל פַּרְדֵּיסָא דְּבָעֵי. ״פַּרְדֵּיסֵי״ – רָפֵיק וְאָזֵיל כֹּל פַּרְדֵּיסֵי דְּאִית לֵיהּ, וּמַהְדַּר לֵיהּ קַתֵּיהּ.
human_translation: Rava says: one who says to another: Lend me a hoe to dig up this orchard, he may dig up that orchard an orchard, he may dig up any orchard that he desires. orchards, he may dig up all the orchards he has, And he must return its handle, to
llm_translation: Rava said: Whoever said to his friends, "Let us go out and stroll in this orchard," he should stroll in that orchard. "Orchard" - he should stroll in any orchard he desires. "Orchards" - he should stroll and visit all the orchards available to him, and then return to his own.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא, הַאי מַאן דְּאָמַר לֵיהּ לְחַבְרֵיהּ: ״אוֹשְׁלַן הַאי גַּרְגּוּתָא״ וְנָפְלָה – לָא בָּנֵי לַהּ. ״גַּרְגּוּתָא״ וְנָפְלָה – בָּנֵי לַהּ. ״בֵּי גַרְגּוּתָא״ – כָּרֵי וְאָזֵיל כַּמָּה גַּרְגּוּתֵי בְּאַרְעֵיהּ עַד דְּמִתְרְמֵי לֵיהּ, וְצָרִיךְ לְמִיקְנֵי מִינֵּיהּ.
human_translation: Rav Pappa says: one who says to another: Lend me this well and fell down, may not rebuild it a well, and fell down, may rebuild a place for a well, he may continually dig wells in land until he happens upon But he needs to perform an act of acquisition with
llm_translation: Rav Papa said, "Whoever says to his friends, 'Let us hang this beam,' and it falls - he is not liable. 'This beam' and it falls - he is liable. 'The house of the beam' - he measures and goes around how many beams are in its land until he estimates it, and he must acquire it from him."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַמַּשְׂכִּיר בַּיִת לַחֲבֵירוֹ וְנָפַל – חַיָּיב לְהַעֲמִיד לוֹ בַּיִת. הָיָה קָטָן – לֹא יַעֲשֶׂנּוּ גָּדוֹל, גָּדוֹל – לֹא יַעֲשֶׂנּוּ קָטָן. אֶחָד – לֹא יַעֲשֶׂנּוּ שְׁנַיִם, שְׁנַיִם – לֹא יַעֲשֶׂנּוּ אֶחָד. לֹא יִפְחוֹת מִן הַחַלּוֹנוֹת וְלֹא יוֹסִיף עֲלֵיהֶם, אֶלָּא מִדַּעַת שְׁנֵיהֶם.
human_translation: one who rented out a house to another, and fell, obligated to provide house. was small, may not construct a large was large, may not construct a small one he may not construct two and two he may not construct one. He may not reduce of windows, nor add to them, except with the agreement both of them.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who rents a house to his fellow, and it collapses - he is obligated to rebuild the house for him. If it was small - he may not make it large, if it was large - he may not make it small. If it had one room - he may not make it two, if it had two rooms - he may not make it one. He may not decrease from the windows nor add to them, except by mutual agreement.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ הֵיכִי דָּמֵי? אִי דַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ: ״בַּיִת זֶה״, נְפַל אֲזַל לֵיהּ. אִי דַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ: ״בַּיִת סְתָם״, אֶחָד אַמַּאי לֹא יַעֲשֶׂנּוּ שְׁנַיִם, קָטָן אַמַּאי לֹא יַעֲשֶׂנּוּ גָּדוֹל!
human_translation: What are the circumstances If where said to this house it has fallen, it has gone If where said to him: a house without specification, one why may not construct two small, why may not construct a large
llm_translation: Gemara: How so the value? If he said to him: "this house," he goes to it. If he said to him: "a random house," one why not make it two, a small one why not make it big!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: דַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ ״בַּיִת שֶׁאֲנִי מַשְׂכִּיר לְךָ מִדַּת אׇרְכּוֹ כָּךְ וְכָךְ״.
human_translation: Reish Lakish said: where he said to him: house that I am renting to you, the measurement of its length is such and such,
llm_translation: Reish Lakish said: For he said to him, "The house that I am renting to you, its measurement is such and such."

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי מַאי לְמֵימְרָא?
human_translation: If that is so, what of stating
llm_translation: If so, what is there to say?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא כִּי אֲתָא רָבִין אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ, דְּאָמַר לֵיהּ: ״בֵּית כָּזֶה אֲנִי מַשְׂכִּיר לָךְ״. וְאַכַּתִּי מַאי לְמֵימְרָא? לָא צְרִיכָא: דְּקָאֵי אַגּוּדָּא דְנַהְרָא. מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: מַאי ״כָּזֶה״ – דְּקָאֵי אַגּוּדָּא דְנַהְרָא, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: Rather, when Ravin came, Reish Lakish said: where he said: I am renting to you a house like this. But still, what of stating No, necessary where was standing on the bank of a river. Lest you say what like this, that stands on the bank of a river, teaches us
llm_translation: Rather, when Ravin came, Reish Lakish said, as he said to him: "I am renting you a house." And what is there to say? It is not necessary: that it stands by the bank of the river. Lest you say: What is "like this" - that it stands by the bank of the river, it is evident to us.

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ הַשּׁוֹאֵל
llm_translation: The inquirer will return to you.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַמְקַבֵּל שָׂדֶה מֵחֲבֵירוֹ, מָקוֹם שֶׁנָּהֲגוּ לִקְצוֹר – יִקְצוֹר, לַעֲקוֹר – יַעֲקוֹר, לַחְרוֹשׁ אַחֲרָיו – יַחְרוֹשׁ, הַכֹּל כְּמִנְהַג הַמְּדִינָה. כְּשֵׁם שֶׁחוֹלְקִין בַּתְּבוּאָה, כָּךְ חוֹלְקִין בַּתֶּבֶן וּבַקַּשׁ. כְּשֵׁם שֶׁחוֹלְקִין בַּיַּיִן, כָּךְ חוֹלְקִין
human_translation: one who receives a field from another a location where were accustomed to cut must cut to uproot must uproot to plow after must plow All in accordance with regional custom. Just as divide the produce, so they divide the stubble and the straw. Just as divide the wine, so they divide
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: One who receives a field from his fellow, in a place where they are accustomed to reap - he shall reap; to uproot - he shall uproot; to plow after him - he shall plow. Everything is according to the custom of the province. Just as they divide in produce, so they divide in straw and chaff. Just as they divide in wine, so they divide...

hebrew_text: בַּזְּמוֹרוֹת וּבַקָּנִים, וּשְׁנֵיהֶם מְסַפְּקִין אֶת הַקָּנִים.
human_translation: the branches and the poles. And the two of them, supply the poles.
llm_translation: In the palm trees and in the reeds, and both of them support the reeds.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנָא: מְקוֹם שֶׁנָּהֲגוּ לִקְצוֹר – אֵינוֹ רַשַּׁאי לַעֲקוֹר, לַעֲקוֹר – אֵינוֹ רַשַּׁאי לִקְצוֹר, וּשְׁנֵיהֶם מְעַכְּבִין זֶה עַל זֶה.
human_translation: It was taught a location where were accustomed to cut is not permitted to uproot to uproot he is not permitted to cut And the two of them, prevent the other
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Gemara: Tanah: makom she'nahagu liktzor - einu rasha'i la'akor, la'akor - einu rasha'i liktzor, u'shneihem me'akvin zeh al zeh." English translation: "Gemara: It was taught: A place where they are accustomed to cut - one is not permitted to uproot, to uproot - one is not permitted to cut, and both of them prevent one another."

hebrew_text: לִקְצוֹר אֵינוֹ רַשַּׁאי לַעֲקוֹר, הַאי אָמַר: בָּעֵינָא דְּתִתַּבַּן לִי אַרְעַאי, וְהַאי אָמַר: לָא מָצֵינָא. לַעֲקוֹר אֵינוֹ רַשַּׁאי לִקְצוֹר, הַאי אָמַר: בָּעֵינָא דְּתִינַּקַּר אַרְעַאי, וְהַאי אָמַר: בָּעֵינָא תִּיבְנָא.
human_translation: were accustomed to cut is not permitted to uproot this say: I want my land to be fertilized with stubble, And that say: I cannot to uproot is not permitted to cut this say: I want my land to be cleared And that say: I want the stubble.
llm_translation: To harvest one is not permitted to uproot, this one said: I want my land to be built, and this one said: I did not find. To uproot one is not permitted to harvest, this one said: I want my land to be plowed, and this one said: I want it to be sown.

hebrew_text: וּשְׁנֵיהֶם מְעַכְּבִין זֶה עַל זֶה, לְמָה לִי? מַה טַּעַם קָאָמַר: מַה טַּעַם לִקְצוֹר אֵינוֹ רַשַּׁאי לַעֲקוֹר, לַעֲקוֹר אֵינוֹ רַשַּׁאי לִקְצוֹר – מִשּׁוּם דִּשְׁנֵיהֶם מְעַכְּבִין זֶה עַל זֶה.
human_translation: And the two of them, prevent the other Why do I is saying what reason What is the reason to cut is not permitted to uproot to uproot he is not permitted to cut because the two of them prevent the other
llm_translation: Both of them prevent one another, why do I need it? What is the reason he said: What is the reason that one who is permitted to cut is not permitted to uproot, and one who is permitted to uproot is not permitted to cut? Because both of them prevent one another.

hebrew_text: לַחְרוֹשׁ אַחֲרָיו – יַחְרֹשׁ. פְּשִׁיטָא! לָא צְרִיכָא: בְּאַתְרָא דְּלָא מְנַכְּשִׁי – וַאֲזַל אִיהוּ וְנַכֵּישׁ. מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הַאי דְּנַכֵּישְׁנָא אַדַּעְתָּא דְּלָא כָּרֵיבְנָא לַהּ, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן דְּאִיבְּעִי לֵיהּ לְפָרוֹשֵׁי לֵיהּ.
human_translation: to plow after must plow obvious No, necessary for a place where not weed and went and weeded Lest you say say to I weeded with the intention of not plowing it teaches us that should have specified to
llm_translation: To plow after him - he shall plow. It is obvious! It is not necessary: in a place where he does not plow - and then he goes and plows. What is the concern: you might say: he tells him: this one who plows, you know that I do not want him to plow, it is evident to us that he intends to plow for himself.

hebrew_text: הַכֹּל כְּמִנְהַג הַמְּדִינָה. ״הַכֹּל״ לְאֵתוֹיֵי מַאי? לְאֵתוֹיֵי הָא דְּתָנוּ רַבָּנַן: מָקוֹם שֶׁנָּהֲגוּ לְהַשְׂכִּיר אִילָנוֹת עַל גַּבֵּי קַרְקַע – מַשְׂכִּירִין, מָקוֹם שֶׁאֵין נָהֲגוּ לְהַשְׂכִּיר – אֵין מַשְׂכִּירִין.
human_translation: All in accordance with regional custom. What is added all? to add that which the Sages taught: a location where were accustomed to rent out the trees together with the land rented out. a location where were not accustomed to rent out not rented out.
llm_translation: All according to the custom of the land. "All" - to include what? To include that which the Rabbis taught: In a place where it is customary to rent out trees on the ground - they rent them out, in a place where it is not customary - they do not rent them out.

hebrew_text: מָקוֹם שֶׁנָּהֲגוּ לְהַשְׂכִּיר מַשְׂכִּירִין – פְּשִׁיטָא! לָא צְרִיכָא, דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא יָהֲבִי בְּתִילְתָּא, וַאֲזַל אִיהוּ וְיַהֲבֵיהּ בְּרִיבְעָא. מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא, דַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ: הַאי דִּבְצַרִי לָךְ, אַדַּעְתָּא דְּלָא יָהֵיבְנָא לָךְ בָּאִילָנוֹת, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן דְּאִיבְּעִי לֵיהּ לְפָרוֹשֵׁי לֵיהּ.
human_translation: a location where were accustomed to rent out the trees together with the land rented out. obvious? No, necessary where everyone gives for one-third and he, went and gave it for one-quarter. Lest you say that say to him: This that I reduced for you, with the intention that I would not give you of the trees teaches us that should have specified to him
llm_translation: Place where accustomed to rent renters - obvious! Not necessary, since everyone gives in the beginning, and he goes and gives in the end. What do you say, that he said to him: "This fortress for you, know that I will not give you in the trees," we hear that he wants to separate from him.

hebrew_text: מָקוֹם שֶׁנָּהֲגוּ שֶׁלֹּא לְהַשְׂכִּיר – אֵין מַשְׂכִּירִין. פְּשִׁיטָא! לָא צְרִיכָא, דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא מְקַבְּלִי בְּרִיבְעָא, וַאֲזַל אִיהוּ וְקַיבְּלַהּ בְּתִילְתָּא. מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הַאי דִּטְפַאי לָךְ אַדַּעְתָּא דִּיהַבְתְּ לִי בְּאִילָנוֹת, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן דְּאִיבְּעִי לֵיהּ לְפָרוֹשֵׁי לֵיהּ.
human_translation: a location where were not accustomed to rent out not rented out. obvious? No, necessary where all receive for one-quarter and went and received for one-third Lest you say say to him: This that I added to your with the intention that you give me from the trees, teaches us that should have specified to him
llm_translation: Place where accustomed not to rent - not rent. Obvious! Not necessary, since everyone accepts in a quarter, and he goes and accepts in a third. What if you say to him: This gift to you, know that you gave me in the trees, it is heard to us that he wants to separate from her.

hebrew_text: כְּשֵׁם שֶׁחוֹלְקִין בִּתְבוּאָה – כָּךְ חוֹלְקִין בְּתֶבֶן וּבְקַשׁ. אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: בְּבָבֶל נְהִיגוּ דְּלָא יָהֲבִי תִּיבְנָא לַאֲרִיסָא. לְמַאי נָפְקָא מִינַּהּ? דְּאִי אִיכָּא אִינִישׁ דְּיָהֵיב – עַיִן יָפָה הוּא וְלָא גָּמְרִינַן מִינֵּיהּ.
human_translation: Just as divide the produce, so they divide the stubble and the straw. Rav Yosef said In Babylonia are accustomed not to give stubble to the sharecropper. What is the difference that if there is a person who gives it is a generous disposition, but we do not learn from his
llm_translation: As they divide in produce - so they divide in straw and chaff. Rav Yosef said: In Babylonia, they are accustomed not to give a pledge to the tenant. What is the reason for this? Because if there is someone who gives, he is a good person, and we do not finish with him.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: בּוּכְרָא וְטָפְתָא וְאַרְכַּבְתָּא וּקְנֵי דְחִיזְרָא – דְּבַעַל הַבַּיִת, וְחִזְרָא גּוּפֵיהּ דַּאֲרִיסָא. כְּלָלָא דְמִילְּתָא: כֹּל עִיקַּר בְּלָמָא – דְּבַעַל הַבַּיִת, נְטִירוּתָא יַתִּירְתָּא – דַּאֲרִיסָא. וְאָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: מָרָא וּזְבִילָא וְדַוְולָא וְזַרְנוּקָא – דְּבַעַל הַבַּיִת, אֲרִיסָא עָבֵיד בֵּי יְאוֹרֵי.
human_translation: Rav Yosef says: The first, second, and third and the poles to a thorn of the owner but the fashioning of the thorn itself of the sharecropper. The principle of the matter main the boundary of the owner additional protection of the sharecropper. Rav Yosef says: The hoe and the shovel and the bucket and the irrigation device by the owner the sharecropper make the irrigation channels.
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: Bukhra, Taftha, Arkavta, and Keni deHizra - are the husband of the house, and Hizra itself is the body of the plow. The general principle is: all the main work is done by the husband of the house, the extra plowing is done by the plow itself. And Rav Yosef said: Mara, Zevila, Davvla, and Zarnuka - are the husband of the house, the plow does the work in the riverbed.

hebrew_text: כְּשֵׁם שֶׁחוֹלְקִין בַּיַּיִן – כָּךְ חוֹלְקִין בַּזְּמוֹרוֹת וּבַקָּנִים. קָנִים מַאי עֲבִידְתַּיְיהוּ? אָמְרִי דְּבֵי רַבִּי יַנַּאי: קָנִים הַמּוּחְלָקִין, שֶׁבָּהֶן מַעֲמִידִין אֶת הַגְּפָנִים.
human_translation: Just as divide the wine, so they divide the branches and the poles. What purpose poles They said the school of Rabbi Yannai: poles that were divided with which they support the vines.
llm_translation: As they divide in wine, so they divide in palm branches and reeds. What is the purpose of the reeds? The House of Rabbi Yannai said: Reeds that are divided, in which they support the vines.

hebrew_text: וּשְׁנֵיהֶם מְסַפְּקִין אֶת הַקָּנִים. לְמָה לִי? מָה טַעַם קָאָמַר: מָה טַעַם שְׁנֵיהֶם חוֹלְקִין בַּקָּנִים – מִשּׁוּם דִּשְׁנֵיהֶם מְסַפְּקִין אֶת הַקָּנִים.
human_translation: And the two of them, supply the poles. Why do I is saying what reason What is the reason the two of them divide the poles? because the two of them supply the poles.
llm_translation: And both of them are disputing the reeds. Why do I need it? What is the reason he said: What is the reason both of them are dividing the reeds - because both of them are disputing the reeds.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַמְקַבֵּל שָׂדֶה מֵחֲבֵירוֹ וְהִיא בֵּית הַשְּׁלָחִין, אוֹ בֵּית הָאִילָן, יָבַשׁ הַמַּעְיָן וְנִקְצַץ הָאִילָן – אֵינוֹ מְנַכֶּה לוֹ מִן חֲכוֹרוֹ. אִם אָמַר לוֹ: ״חֲכוֹר לִי שָׂדֶה בֵּית הַשְּׁלָחִין זוֹ״ אוֹ ״שְׂדֵה בֵּית הָאִילָן זֶה״, יָבַשׁ הַמַּעְיָן וְנִקְצַץ הָאִילָן – מְנַכֶּה לוֹ מֵחֲכוֹרוֹ.
human_translation: one who receives a field from another and it is an irrigated or a field with trees, the spring dried up or the trees were cut down, not subtract from he his tenancy, if said to Lease me this irrigated field, or this field with trees, the spring dried up or the trees were cut down, he subtract from he his tenancy.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who receives a field from his fellow, and it contains a bathroom or a tree, if the spring dries up or the tree is cut down, he is not compensated from the seller. However, if he said to him, "Sell me the field of this bathroom" or "the field of this tree," and the spring dries up or the tree is cut down, he is compensated by the seller.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ הֵיכִי דָמֵי? אִילֵּימָא דִּיבַשׁ נַהֲרָא רַבָּה, אַמַּאי אֵינוֹ מְנַכֶּה לוֹ מִן חֲכוֹרוֹ? נֵימָא לֵיהּ: מַכַּת מְדִינָה הִיא! אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: דִּיבַשׁ נַהֲרָא זוּטָא, דְּאָמַר לֵיהּ:
human_translation: What are the circumstances If we say that the large river dried up, why not subtract from he his tenancy? Let say is a regional disaster. Rav Pappa said: where a small river dried up, as say to him:
llm_translation: Gemara: How are the blood considered? If you say that the river dried up, why does he not heal from his wound? Say to him: It is a blow of a province! Rav Papa said: The river dried up a little, as it says to him:

hebrew_text: אִיבְּעִי לָךְ לְאֵתוֹיֵי בְּדַוְולָא.
human_translation: You should have brought in a bucket.
llm_translation: The question was asked to you to come with a proof.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: הָנֵי תַּרְתֵּי מַתְנְיָתָא קַמָּיָיתָא – מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ בֵּין בְּחַכְרָנוּתָא בֵּין בְּקַבְּלָנוּתָא. מִכָּאן וְאֵילָךְ: דְּאִיתַהּ בְּקַבְּלָנוּתָא – לֵיתַהּ בְּחַכְרָנוּתָא, וּדְאִיתַהּ בְּחַכְרָנוּתָא – לֵיתַהּ בְּקַבְּלָנוּתָא.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: these first two mishnayot , you find concerning both tenancy, as well as a contractor, From this forward, which is of a contractor is not to tenancy, and which is to tenancy is not to a contractor.
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: These two Mishnayot are contradictory - one mentions it in terms of "chakranuta" and the other in terms of "kablanuta." From here and onwards: if it is in terms of "kablanuta" - it is not in terms of "chakranuta," and if it is in terms of "chakranuta" - it is not in terms of "kablanuta."

hebrew_text: אִם אָמַר לוֹ חֲכוֹר לִי שְׂדֵה בֵּית הַשְּׁלָחִין זֶה [וְכוּ׳]. וְאַמַּאי? לֵימָא לֵיהּ: שְׁמָא בְּעָלְמָא אֲמַרִי לָךְ, מִי לָא תַּנְיָא: הָאוֹמֵר לַחֲבֵירוֹ ״בֵּית כּוֹר עָפָר אֲנִי מוֹכֵר לָךְ״, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵין בּוֹ אֶלָּא לֶתֶךְ – הִגִּיעוֹ שֶׁלֹּא מָכַר לוֹ אֶלָּא שְׁמָא, וְהוּא דְּמִתְקְרֵי ״בֵּית כּוֹר״.
human_translation: If said to Lease me this irrigated field, But why Let say to him: I told you only the name, Isn’t it taught one who says to another: I am selling you a beit kor of dirt, although contains only a half- kor , it has come to him, as sold him only the name, And is where is called a beit kor .
llm_translation: If he said to him, "Dig for me a field in Beit HaShelachin," and why? Let him say to him: Perhaps in general you said to him, "Who will not teach you: One who says to his friend, 'I am selling you a field of dust,' even though it only has a furrow - if he did not sell him anything except a name, and it is called 'a field of dust.'"

hebrew_text: ״כַּרְמָא אֲנִי מוֹכֵר לָךְ״, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵין בּוֹ גְּפָנִים – הִגִּיעוֹ, שֶׁלֹּא מָכַר לוֹ אֶלָּא שְׁמָא, וְהוּא דְּמִתְקְרֵי ״כַּרְמָא״. ״פַּרְדֵּס אֲנִי מוֹכֵר לָךְ״, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵין בּוֹ רִמּוֹנִים – הִגִּיעוֹ, שֶׁלֹּא מָכַר לוֹ אֶלָּא שְׁמָא, וְהוּא דְּמִתְקְרֵי ״פַּרְדֵּסָא״. אַלְמָא אָמַר לֵיהּ: שְׁמָא בְּעָלְמָא אֲמַרִי לָךְ. הָכִי נָמֵי נֵימָא לֵיהּ: שְׁמָא בְּעָלְמָא אֲמַרִי לָךְ!
human_translation: I am selling you a vineyard, although it does not have vines, it has come to him, as sold him only the name; and is where it is called a vineyard. I am selling you an orchard, even though it does not have pomegranates, it has come to him, as he sold him only the name; and is where it is called an orchard. Apparently, say to him: I told you only the name. So too let say to him: I told you only the name.
llm_translation: "‘I am selling you a vineyard,’ even though it has no grapevines – it has arrived, that he only sold him the name, and it is called ‘vineyard.’ ‘I am selling you an orchard,’ even though it has no pomegranates – it has arrived, that he only sold him the name, and it is called ‘orchard.’ Clearly he said to him: 'I only said the name to you.' So too, they say to him: 'I only said the name to you!'"

hebrew_text: אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל, לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא דַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ מַחְכִּיר לְחוֹכֵר, הָא דַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ חוֹכֵר לְמַחְכִּיר. אֲמַר לֵיהּ מַחְכִּיר לְחוֹכֵר – שְׁמָא בְּעָלְמָא אֲמַר לֵיהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ חוֹכֵר לְמַחְכִּיר – קְפֵידָא.
human_translation: Shmuel said: not difficult; this where the owner of the land said to the tenant farmer that the tenant farmer said to the owner of the land the owner of the land said to the tenant farmer, he told him only the name, the tenant farmer said to the owner of the land, particular
llm_translation: Samuel said, it is not difficult: this one who said to the seller to the buyer, this one who said to the buyer to the seller. He said to him, the seller to the buyer - perhaps he said it casually. He said to him, the buyer to the seller - it is a matter of strictness.

hebrew_text: רָבִינָא אָמַר: אִידֵּי וְאִידִי, דַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ מַחְכִּיר לְחוֹכֵר. מִדְּקָאָמַר ״זֶה״, מִכְּלַל דְּקָאֵי בְּגַוַּהּ עָסְקִינַן. בֵּית הַשְּׁלָחִין לְמָה לֵיהּ לְמֵימַר? דְּקָאָמַר לֵיהּ: בֵּית הַשְּׁלָחִין כִּדְקָיְימָא הַשְׁתָּא.
human_translation: Ravina said: this and that where the owner of the land told the tenant farmer since said: This by inference we are dealing with who is standing inside it. Why, does need to state an irrigated field? said to him an irrigated as it currently stands.
llm_translation: Ravina said: Both this and that, for he said to him, "Recognize for the one who recognizes." Since he said "this," we are dealing with a case where he is engaged in his field. Why did he need to say "Beit HaShelachin"? Because he said to him: Beit HaShelachin is as it stands now.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַמְקַבֵּל שָׂדֶה מֵחֲבֵירוֹ וְהוֹבִירָהּ – שָׁמִין אוֹתָהּ כַּמָּה רְאוּיָה לַעֲשׂוֹת, וְנוֹתֵן לוֹ. שֶׁכָּךְ כּוֹתֵב לוֹ: ״אִם אוֹבִיר וְלָא אֶעֱבֵיד אֲשַׁלֵּם בְּמֵיטְבָא״.
human_translation: one who receives a field from another and lets it lie fallow appraises it how much it was able to produce and he gives to that this writes to If I let lie fallow and do not cultivate I will pay with best
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who receives a field from his fellow and improves it - we assess how much it is fitting to do, and he reimburses him. This is how he writes to him: "If I improve and do not work, I will pay with the best."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ רַבִּי מֵאִיר הָיָה דּוֹרֵשׁ לְשׁוֹן הֶדְיוֹט. דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: ״אִם אוֹבִיר וְלָא אֶעֱבֵיד אֲשַׁלֵּם בְּמֵיטְבָא״.
human_translation: Rabbi Meir would expound common language As it is taught Rabbi Meir says If I let lie fallow and do not cultivate I will pay with best
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemara, Rabbi Meir hayah doresh leshon hediot. D'tanya, Rabbi Meir omer: "Im ovir v'lo e'avid ashalem b'meitva." English translation: The Gemara: Rabbi Meir used to expound in the language of the common people. As it was taught: Rabbi Meir says, "If I transgress and do not repent, I will pay with the best."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה הָיָה דּוֹרֵשׁ לְשׁוֹן הֶדְיוֹט. דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אָדָם מֵבִיא קׇרְבַּן עָשִׁיר עַל אִשְׁתּוֹ, וְכֵן כׇּל קׇרְבָּן וְקׇרְבָּן שֶׁהִיא חַיֶּיבֶת, שֶׁכָּךְ כּוֹתֵב לָהּ אַחְרָיוּת: דְּאִית לִיךְ עֲלַי מִן קַדְמַת דְּנָא.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda would expound common language, as it is taught Rabbi Yehuda says: a person brings the offering of the rich on behalf of his wife. Similarly, every offering that she is obligated because this he writes to her upon myself obligations that you have, from beforehand.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda would expound in the vernacular. As it was taught: Rabbi Yehuda says, "A person brings a rich offering for his wife, and so too with every offering that she is obligated in, for this is how it is written for her lineage: 'For you have preference over me from the beginning of my youth.'"

hebrew_text: הִלֵּל הַזָּקֵן הָיָה דּוֹרֵשׁ לְשׁוֹן הֶדְיוֹט, דְּתַנְיָא: אַנְשֵׁי אֲלֶכְּסַנְדְּרִיָּא הָיוּ מְקַדְּשִׁין אֶת נְשׁוֹתֵיהֶם, וּבִשְׁעַת כְּנִיסָתָן לַחוּפָּה בָּאִין אֲחֵרִים וְחוֹטְפִים אוֹתָם מֵהֶן, וּבִקְּשׁוּ חֲכָמִים לַעֲשׂוֹת בְּנֵיהֶם מַמְזֵרִים.
human_translation: Hillel the Elder would expound common language as it is taught The inhabitants of Alexandria would betroth their wives and at the time of their entry to the wedding canopy, others come and snatch from their The Sages sought to establish the children mamzerim .
llm_translation: Hillel the Elder used to interpret in the vernacular language, as it was taught: The men of Alexandria would betroth their wives, and when they would enter the bridal chamber, others would come and snatch them away from them, and the Sages sought to make their sons mamzerim.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָהֶן הִלֵּל הַזָּקֵן: הָבִיאוּ לִי כְּתוּבַּת אִמְּכֶם. הֵבִיאוּ לוֹ כְּתוּבַּת אִמָּן, וּמָצָא שֶׁכָּתוּב בָּהֶן: לִכְשֶׁתִּכָּנְסִי לַחוּפָּה הֱוַי לִי לְאִינְתּוּ. וְלֹא עָשׂוּ בְּנֵיהֶם מַמְזֵרִים.
human_translation: Hillel the Elder said to Bring me your mother’s marriage contract They brought him their mother’s marriage contract, and he found that was written in it: When you will enter the wedding canopy, be for me a wife. and did not cause their children mamzerim
llm_translation: He said to them, Hillel the Elder: Bring me the marriage contract of your mother. They brought him the marriage contract of their mother, and he found written in it: When you enter the wedding canopy, be to me as my wife. And their children did not become mamzerim.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן קׇרְחָה הָיָה דּוֹרֵשׁ לְשׁוֹן הֶדְיוֹט. דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן קׇרְחָה אוֹמֵר: הַמַּלְוֶה אֶת חֲבֵירוֹ לֹא יְמַשְׁכְּנֶנּוּ יוֹתֵר מֵחוֹבוֹ, שֶׁכָּךְ כּוֹתֵב לוֹ תַּשְׁלוּמְתָּא דְּאִית לְךָ עָלַי כֹּל קֳבֵל דֵּיכִי.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Korḥa would expound common language. As it is taught Rabbi Yehoshua ben Korḥa says: who lends another may not take more collateral from him than his debt, as this writes to The payment which you have upon me corresponds to the entire this
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Korcha would expound in the language of the common people. As it was taught: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Korcha says: One who lends to his fellow should not draw him more than his debt, for thus is written for him the payment that you have upon me, receive your due.

hebrew_text: טַעְמָא דִּכְתַב לֵיהּ הָכִי, הָא אִי לָא כְּתַב לֵיהּ הָכִי – לָא קַנְיֵהּ. וְהָא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מִשְׁכְּנוֹ וְהֵשִׁיב לוֹ הַמַּשְׁכּוֹן, וָמֵת – שׁוֹמְטוֹ מֵעַל גַּבֵּי בָּנָיו.
human_translation: The reason that he wrote this to him. But if did not write this to not acquire But doesn’t Rabbi Yoḥanan say: took collateral and returned the collateral to him and died, removes from children.
llm_translation: Reason for which he wrote to him thus, this if not wrote to him thus - not acquire. And this said Rabbi Yochanan: If he drew and returned to him the drawn object, and he died - exempt from his sons.

hebrew_text: אַהֲנַי כְּתִיבָה לְגֵירָעוֹן.
human_translation: writing is effective for depreciation.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: "אַהֲנַי כְּתִיבָה לְגֵירָעוֹן." Translation: "It is written, 'Ahanai' for 'Geiraon.'"

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הָיָה דּוֹרֵשׁ לְשׁוֹן הֶדְיוֹט. דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: מָקוֹם שֶׁנָּהֲגוּ לַעֲשׂוֹת כְּתוּבָּה מִלְוָה – גּוֹבֶה מִלְוָה. לִכְפּוֹל – גּוֹבֶה מֶחֱצָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei would expound common language, as it is taught Rabbi Yosei says: In a location where they were accustomed to formulate a marriage contract a loan, collects a loan. to double collects half
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei would expound in the language of the common people. As it was taught: Rabbi Yosei says, "In a place where it is customary to lend with a written document, one must collect the full amount. In a case of halving, one must collect half."

hebrew_text: נְהַרְבְּלָאֵי גָּבוּ תִּילְתָּא, מָרִימָר מַגְבֵּי נָמֵי שְׁבָחָא.
human_translation: Neharbela collected, one-third Mareimar collect even the added value
llm_translation: The river Bela'i of Gabu, third, Marimar lifts up the praises of the Name.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבִינָא לְמָרִימָר, וְהָתַנְיָא: לִכְפּוֹל גּוֹבֶה מֶחֱצָה! לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא (דִּקְנֵי) [דִּקְנוֹ] מִינֵּיהּ, הָא דְּלָא (קָנֵי) [קְנוֹ] מִינֵּיהּ.
human_translation: Ravina said to Mareimar: But isn’t it taught to double collects half? not difficult; this performed acquisition with that did not perform acquisition with
llm_translation: Ravina said to Marimar, and it was taught: To decrease the height by half! It is not difficult: this one acquires from his own, this one does not acquire from his own.

hebrew_text: רָבִינָא מַשְׁבַּח וְכָתֵיב לִבְרַתֵּיהּ. אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: נִקְנֵי מִינֵּיהּ דְּמָר. אֲמַר לְהוּ: אִי מִקְנֵא – לָא מִיכְפַּל, אִי מִיכְפַּל – לָא מִיקְנֵא.
human_translation: Ravina wrote an enhancement for his daughter said to Let us perform acquisition with the Master, said to them: If perform acquisition, I not double if double I not perform acquisition.
llm_translation: Ravina praised and it is written in his daughter's favor. They said to him: Acquire a son-in-law for your daughter from a master. He said to them: If he acquires her - it is not esteemed, if he is esteemed - he does not acquire her.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא גַּבְרָא דַּאֲמַר לְהוּ: הַבוּ לָהּ אַרְבַּע מְאָה זוּזֵי לִבְרַתִּי בִּכְתוּבְּתַהּ. שְׁלַח רַב אַחָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אַוְיָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב אָשֵׁי: אַרְבַּע מְאָה דְּאִינּוּן תַּמְנֵי מְאָה, אוֹ אַרְבַּע מְאָה זוּזֵי דְּאִינּוּן מָאתַן? אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: חָזֵינַן, אִי אֲמַר ״הַבוּ לַהּ״ – אַרְבַּע מְאָה זוּזֵי דְּאִינּוּן תַּמְנֵי מְאָה, אִי אֲמַר ״כְּתוֹבוּ לַהּ״ – אַרְבַּע מְאָה זוּזֵי דְּאִינּוּן מָאתַן.
human_translation: a certain man who said to Give four hundred dinars to my daughter in her marriage contract. Rav Aḥa, son of Rav Avya, sent before Rav Ashi: four hundred which are eight hundred, or four hundred dinars which are two hundred Rav Ashi said: We examine If he said: Give her, four hundred dinars, which are eight hundred. if he said: Write for her, four hundred dinars, which are two hundred
llm_translation: That man who said to them: "Give her four hundred zuz for my daughter in her marriage contract." Rav Acha, the son of Rav Avya, sent to Rav Ashi: "Four hundred, are they one hundred, or four hundred zuz?" Rav Ashi said: "We have seen, if he said 'give her' - four hundred zuz, which are one hundred, if he said 'write for her' - four hundred zuz, which are two hundred."

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי, אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: חָזֵינַן אִי אֲמַר ״לִכְתוּבְּתַהּ״ – אַרְבַּע מְאָה זוּזֵי דְּאִינּוּן תַּמְנֵי מְאָה, וְאִי אֲמַר ״בִּכְתוּבְּתַהּ״ – אַרְבַּע מְאָה זוּזֵי דְּאִינּוּן מָאתַן.
human_translation: There are who say Rav Ashi said: We examine If he said: For her marriage contract [ likhtubatah ], four hundred dinars, which are eight hundred, But if he said: In her marriage contract [ bikhtubatah ], four hundred dinars, which are two hundred
llm_translation: There are those who say, Rav Ashe said: We see, if one says "likhtuvta" - four hundred zuz that are not two hundred, and if one says "bikhtuvta" - four hundred zuz that are not one hundred.

hebrew_text: וְלָא הִיא, לָא שְׁנָא דְּאָמַר ״לִכְתוּבְּתַהּ״ וְלָא שְׁנָא דְּאָמַר ״בִּכְתוּבְּתַהּ״ – אַרְבַּע מְאָה זוּזֵי דְּאִינּוּן מָאתַן, עַד דְּאָמַר ״הַבוּ לַהּ״ סְתָמָא.
human_translation: And is not so. is no difference whether he said: For her marriage contract, and is no difference whether he said: In her marriage contract. four hundred dinars, which are two hundred unless he said: Give her, without specification,
llm_translation: "And not this, it is not different that it says 'to be written' and not different that it says 'in its writing' - four hundred coins that are not theirs, until it says 'give it to her' implicitly."

hebrew_text: הָהוּא גַּבְרָא דְּקַבֵּל אַרְעָא מֵחַבְרֵיהּ, אֲמַר: אִי מוֹבַרְנָא לַהּ – יָהֵיבְנָא לָךְ אַלְפָּא זוּזֵי. אוֹבַיר תִּילְתָּא. אָמְרִי נְהַרְדָּעֵי: דִּינָא הוּא דְּיָהֵיב לֵיהּ תְּלָת מְאָה וּתְלָתִין וּתְלָתָא וְתִילְתָּא. רָבָא אָמַר: אַסְמַכְתָּא הִיא, וְאַסְמַכְתָּא לָא קָנְיָא.
human_translation: a certain man who received land from another He said: If I let it lie fallow, I will give you one thousand dinars. He let one-third lie fallow. of Neharde’a said: The halakha that he gives him 333⅓ Rava said: is a transaction with inconclusive consent [ asmakhta ]. And an asmakhta does not effect acquisition,
llm_translation: That man who received land from his friends, said: If I am proven to be the owner - I will give you a thousand coins. He plowed a third. The Nehardeans said: It is a valid judgment for him to give him three hundred and thirty-three and a third. Rava said: It is a mere support, and a mere support does not acquire.

hebrew_text: וּלְרָבָא, מַאי שְׁנָא מֵהָא דִּתְנַן: ״אִם אוֹבִיר וְלָא אֶעֱבֵיד אֲשַׁלֵּם בְּמֵיטְבָא״? הָתָם לָא קָא גָזֵים, הָכָא כֵּיוָן דְּקָאָמַר מִילְּתָא יַתִּירְתָּא – גּוּזְמָא בְּעָלְמָא הוּא דְּקָגָזֵים.
human_translation: And according to Rava, what is different from that which we learned If I let lie fallow and do not cultivate I will pay with best There he did not exaggerate, here, since he said something extra, he is merely exaggerating.
llm_translation: For Rava, what is different from what we learned: "If I transgress and do not fulfill, I will pay with the best"? There, he is not deceiving, but here, since he is saying an extra matter - deception is merely deception.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא גַּבְרָא דְּקַבֵּיל אַרְעָא לְשׁוּמְשְׁמֵי, זַרְעַהּ חִיטֵּי. עֲבַדָא חִיטֵּי כְּשׁוּמְשְׁמֵי. סְבַר רַב כָּהֲנָא לְמֵימַר מְנַכֵּי לֵיהּ כַּחְשָׁא דְאַרְעָא.
human_translation: a certain man who received land for sesame, he planted it wheat produced wheat similar to sesame. Rav Kahana thought to say deduct the deterioration of the land from
llm_translation: That man who received a field to cultivate, its seed was wheat. He cultivated wheat like the field. Rav Kahana thought to say, "He should plant it as the custom of the field."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אָשֵׁי לְרַב כָּהֲנָא, אָמְרִי אִינָשֵׁי: (כָּחֲשָׁא) [תִּכְחוֹשׁ] אַרְעָא, וְלָא לִכְחוֹשׁ מָרַהּ.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said to Rav Kahana: People say the land be weakened, but not weaken its owner.
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said to Rav Kahana, people say: "The land deceives, but the owner does not deceive."

hebrew_text: הָהוּא גַּבְרָא דְּקַבֵּיל אַרְעָא לְשׁוּמְשְׁמֵי, זַרְעָא חִיטֵּי, עֲבַדָא חִיטֵּי טְפֵי מִן שׁוּמְשְׁמֵי. סְבַר רָבִינָא לְמֵימַר יָהֵיב לֵיהּ שְׁבָחָא דְּבֵינֵי בֵּינֵי. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אַחָא מִדִּפְתִּי לְרָבִינָא: אַטּוּ הוּא אַשְׁבַּח, אַרְעָא לָא אַשְׁבַּחָה?!
human_translation: a certain man who received land for sesame he planted wheat. produced more wheat than sesame. Ravina thought to say give the added value between this, and that, Rav Aḥa of Difti said to Ravina: Is that to say enhanced the land did not enhance
llm_translation: That man who received a field to cultivate, he sowed wheat, the field produced wheat in abundance. Ravina thought to say: He should receive praise for what he did. Rav Acha said to him: If so, should we praise the field itself?!

hebrew_text: אָמְרִי נְהַרְדָּעֵי: הַאי עִיסְקָא פַּלְגָא מִלְוָה וּפַלְגָא פִּקָּדוֹן, עֲבוּד רַבָּנַן מִילְּתָא דְּנִיחָא לֵיהּ לְלֹוֶה וְנִיחָא לֵיהּ לְמַלְוֶה.
human_translation: of Neharde’a said: this joint venture a half-loan and half-deposit, Sages formulated enactment that satisfactory for the borrower, and satisfactory for the lender,
llm_translation: The scholars of Nehardea said: This matter of half loan and half deposit, the Rabbis have left it to the discretion of the lender and to the discretion of the borrower.

hebrew_text: הַשְׁתָּא דְּאָמְרִינַן פַּלְגָא מִלְוָה, אִי בָּעֵי לְמִשְׁתֵּי בֵּיהּ שִׁכְרָא – שַׁפִּיר דָּמֵי. רָבָא אָמַר: לְהָכִי קָרוּ לֵיהּ ״עִיסְקָא״, דַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ: כִּי יָהֲבִינָא לָךְ לְאִיעֲסוֹקֵי בֵּיהּ, וְלָא לְמִשְׁתֵּי בֵּיהּ שִׁכְרָא.
human_translation: Now that we have said half a loan, If wants to drink alcohol with it, well Rava said: for this it is called a joint venture, as say to When I gave to you to use it and not to drink alcohol with it.
llm_translation: The matter that we say: half loan, if he wants to drink beer - it is good that the money. Rava said: therefore they called it "business," for he said to him: when I gave it to you for business, not for drinking beer.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אִידִי בַּר אָבִין: וְאִם מֵת – נַעֲשֶׂה מִטַּלְטְלִין אֵצֶל בָּנָיו. רָבָא אָמַר: לְהָכִי קָרוּ לֵיהּ עִיסְקָא, דְּאִם מֵת לֹא יֵעָשֶׂה מִטַּלְטְלִין אֵצֶל בָּנָיו.
human_translation: Rav Idi bar Avin said: And if died, becomes movable property in his children. Rava said: for this it is called a joint venture, so that if he died it does not become movable property in his children,
llm_translation: Rav Idi bar Avin said: And if he dies - it becomes like a revolving door by his sons. Rava said: Therefore they called it a business, for if he dies, it will not become like a revolving door by his sons.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: חֲדָא עִיסְקָא וּתְרֵי שְׁטָרֵי – פְּסֵידָא דְמַלְוֶה.
human_translation: Rava says: one joint venture and two documents, the detriment of the lender.
llm_translation: Rava said: One document and two promissory notes - the lender's loss.

hebrew_text: תְּרֵי עִיסְקֵי וְחַד שְׁטָרָא – פְּסֵידָא דְּלֹוֶה.
human_translation: two joint ventures and one document, the detriment of the borrower.
llm_translation: Two businesses and one document - a loss for the borrower.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רָבָא: הַאי מַאן דְּקַבֵּיל עִיסְקָא מִן חַבְרֵיהּ וּפְסֵיד, טְרַח וּמַלְּיֵיהּ וְלָא אוֹדְעֵיהּ, לָא מָצֵי אֲמַר לֵיהּ: דְּרִי מֵהַיְאךְ פְּסֵידָא בַּהֲדַאי. מִשּׁוּם דַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ: לְהָכִי טְרַחְתְּ (לְמַלָּיוֹתֵיהּ) [וּמַלֵּיתֵיהּ] – כִּי הֵיכִי דְּלָא לִיקְרוֹ לָךְ ״מַפְסֵיד עִיסְקֵי״.
human_translation: And Rava says: This one, who receives a joint venture from another, and lost made the effort replace but did not inform may not say to Bear this loss together with me. because say to him: for this that you made the effort to replace so that you should not be called a loser of ventures.
llm_translation: And Rava said: One who receives a business matter from his colleagues and incurs a loss, he exerts effort and speaks about it, but does not inform them, he cannot say to them: Investigate how I incurred this loss. Because he said to them: Thus you have exerted effort (to fill) and you have spoken - so that they will not call you "causing financial losses."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רָבָא: הָנֵי בֵּי תְרֵי דְּעָבְדִי עִיסְקָא בַּהֲדֵי הֲדָדֵי וּרְוַוח, וַאֲמַר לֵיהּ חַד לְחַבְרֵיהּ: תָּא לִיפְלוֹג, אִי אֲמַר לֵיהּ אִידַּךְ: נַרְוַוח טְפֵי – דִּינָא הוּא דִּמְעַכֵּב. וְאִי אָמַר לֵיהּ: הַב לִי פַּלְגָא דְּרַוְוחָא – אָמַר לֵיהּ: רַוְוחָא – לְקַרְנָא מִשְׁתַּעְבֵּד.
human_translation: And Rava said: these two who engaged a joint venture together, and profited and one said to the other: Come, let divide If the other said to him: Let profit more, the halakha is that prevents And if, said to give me half the profits, say to him: The profit liened to the principal,
llm_translation: And Rava said: Those two individuals who were engaged in a matter together with each other, and one of them said to his companion: Come, let us argue. If the other said to him: We will delay a little - it is the law that delays. And if he said to him: Bring me a portion of the wind - he said to him: The wind serves the horn.

hebrew_text: וְאִי אָמַר לֵיהּ: הַב לִי פַּלְגָא רַוְוחָא וּפַלְגָא קַרְנָא – אָמַר לֵיהּ: עִיסְקָא לַהֲדָדֵי מְשׁוּעְבַּד. וְאִי אָמַר לֵיהּ: נִפְלוֹג רַוְוחָא וְנִפְלוֹג קַרְנָא, וְאִי מָטֵי לָךְ פְּסֵידָא דָּרֵינָא בַּהֲדָךְ – אָמַר לֵיהּ: לָא מַזָּלָא דְּבֵי תְרֵי עָדִיף.
human_translation: And if says to Give me half the profits and half the principal, say to him: The the joint venture liened to both And if says to Let us divide the profits and divide the principal, and if you suffer a loss I will bear with you, say to him: No, the luck of two better.
llm_translation: If he says to him, "Bring me half a log of water and half a log of wine," he says to him, "It is a matter for Hadadei to deal with." And if he says to him, "Let the winds split and the horns split, and if the loss of your property will come upon you," he says to him, "The house of two is not preferable."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַמְקַבֵּל שָׂדֶה מֵחֲבֵירוֹ וְלֹא רָצָה לְנַכֵּשׁ, וְאָמַר לוֹ: מָה אִיכְפַּת לְךָ? הוֹאִיל וַאֲנִי נוֹתֵן לְךָ אֶת חֲכִירָךְ – אֵין שׁוֹמְעִין לוֹ. מִפְּנֵי שֶׁיָּכוֹל לוֹמַר לוֹ: לְמָחָר אַתָּה יוֹצֵא מִמֶּנָּה וּמַעֲלֵת לְפָנַי עֲשָׂבִים.
human_translation: one who received a field from another and did not want to weed and said to What do you care since I give you your tenancy, they do not listen to him. because can say to him: Tomorrow you depart from and it grow weeds for me,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who receives a field from his fellow and does not want to weed it, and he says to him: "Why do you care? Since I am giving you your rent," we do not heed him. Because he can say to him: "Tomorrow you will leave it, and weeds will grow before me."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אִי אָמַר לֵיהּ: לְבָתַר הָכִי כָּרֵיבְנָא לַהּ – אָמַר לֵיהּ: חִטֵּי מְעַלְּיָיתָא בָּעֵינָא. וְאִי אָמַר לֵיהּ: זָבֵינְנָא לָךְ חִטֵּי מִשּׁוּקָא – אָמַר לֵיהּ: חִטֵּי דְּאַרְעַאי בָּעֵינָא. וְאִי אָמַר לֵיהּ מְנַכֵּישְׁנָא לָךְ שִׁיעוּר מְנָתָיךְ – אָמַר לֵיהּ: קָא מַנְסְבַתְּ שֵׁם רַע לְאַרְעַאי.
human_translation: If said to Afterward, I will plow say to him: I want superior wheat, And if he says to I will buy wheat for you from the market, say to him: I want wheat from my land. And if he says to I will weed for you measure of your portion, say to him: You are giving a bad name to my land,
llm_translation: Gemara: If he said to her, "Afterwards I will bring you close," he said to her, "I want fine wheat." And if he said to her, "We will buy for you wheat from the market," he said to her, "I want wheat from my own field." And if he said to her, "I will measure out for you your portion," he said to her, "You are causing a bad reputation for my field."

hebrew_text: וְהָתְנַן: מִפְּנֵי שֶׁמַּעֲלֵת לְפָנַי עֲשָׂבִים! אֶלָּא מִשּׁוּם דְּאָמַר לֵיהּ: בִּזְרָא דִּנְפַל – נְפַל.
human_translation: But didn’t we learn Because it will grow weeds for me, Rather, because say to him: The seed that fell has fallen.
llm_translation: And we learned in a Mishnah: "Because you are raising weeds before me!" Rather, it is because he said to him: "With the seed that falls - it falls."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַמְקַבֵּל שָׂדֶה מֵחֲבֵירוֹ וְלֹא עָשְׂתָה, אִם יֵשׁ בָּהּ כְּדֵי לְהַעֲמִיד כְּרִי – חַיָּיב לִטַּפֵּל בָּהּ. אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: מַאי קִצְבָה בִּכְרִי? אֶלָּא אִם יֵשׁ בָּהּ כְּדֵי נְפִילָה.
human_translation: one who receives a field from another and it did not produce if it has to form a pile obligated to take care of it Rabbi Yehuda says: What fixed a pile? Rather, whether it has equivalent to dropping
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who receives a field from his fellow and did not cultivate it, if it contains enough to plant a kor of seed - he is obligated to fertilize it. Rabbi Yehuda said: What is the measure of a kor in a field? Rather, if it contains enough for sowing.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הַמְקַבֵּל שָׂדֶה מֵחֲבֵירוֹ וְלֹא עָשְׂתָה, אִם יֵשׁ בָּהּ כְּדֵי לְהַעֲמִיד כְּרִי – חַיָּיב לִטַּפֵּל בָּהּ. שֶׁכָּךְ כּוֹתֵב לוֹ: אֲנָא אֵוקֹים וְאֵנוּר וְאֶזְרַע וְאֶחְצוֹד וַאֲעַמַּר וְאֵדוּשׁ וְאֶידְרֵי וְאוֹקֵים כַּרְיָא קׇדָמָךְ, וְתֵיתֵי אַנְתְּ וְתִיטּוֹל פַּלְגָא, וַאֲנָא בְּעַמְלִי וּבְנַפְקוּת יְדַי פַּלְגָא.
human_translation: The Sages taught: one who receives a field from another and it did not produce if it has to form a pile obligated to take care of it because this he writes to him I will stand and plow and plant and reap and bind and thresh and winnow and establish a pile before you, and you will come and take half, and I, for my work and expenses, half.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: One who receives a field from his fellow and did not work it, if it has enough to produce a kor of grain - he is obligated to tithe it. For thus he writes to him: "I will plow, and sow, and plant, and prune, and gather, and thresh, and winnow, and select, and I will plow a kor of grain before you, and you shall take half, and I will take half with my toil and the work of my hands half."

hebrew_text: וְכַמָּה כְּדֵי לְהַעֲמִיד בָּהּ כְּרִי? אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: כְּדֵי שֶׁתַּעֲמוֹד בּוֹ הָרַחַת. אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: רַחַת הַיּוֹצֵא מֵהַאי גִּיסָא לְהַאי גִּיסָא, מַאי?
human_translation: And how much to form a pile? Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, said: for the winnowing shovel to stand in it. A dilemma was raised before a winnowing shovel that protrudes from this side to that side, what
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And how much is the amount needed to establish it as a beam? Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Chanina, said: The amount that a beam can support. They asked him: The support from this beam to that beam, what is it?" English translation: "And how much is the amount needed to establish it as a beam? Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Chanina, said: The amount that a beam can support. They asked him: The support from this beam to that beam, what is it?"

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ, לְדִידִי מִפָּרְשָׁא לִי מִינֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: כֹּל שֶׁאֵין כּוֹנֵס שֶׁלּוֹ רוֹאֶה פְּנֵי הַחַמָּה. אִיתְּמַר: לֵוִי אָמַר שָׁלֹשׁ סְאִין, דְּבֵי רַבִּי יַנַּאי אָמְרִי סָאתַיִם. אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: סָאתַיִם שֶׁאָמְרוּ חוּץ מִן הַהוֹצָאָה.
human_translation: Come hear Rabbi Abbahu said: was explained to me by Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina: Any which the blade of cannot see the face of the sun was stated Levi says: three se’a of the school of Rabbi Yannai say: Two se’a . Reish Lakish says: The two se’a which they spoke without the expenses.
llm_translation: Come and hear: Rabbi Avahu said, according to my understanding, I have a tradition from the teachings of Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Chanina: Anyone whose storage is not sealed, his face sees the sun. It was stated: Levi said three se'ah, the school of Rabbi Yannai said two se'ah. Reish Lakish said: Two se'ah, which they said, excluding the expenditure.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן הָתָם: פָּרִיצֵי זֵיתִים וַעֲנָבִים, בֵּית שַׁמַּאי מְטַמְּאִין, וּבֵית הִלֵּל מְטַהֲרִין.
human_translation: We learned there unruly olives and grapes, Beit Shammai susceptible to ritual impurity, and Beit Hillel not susceptible to ritual impurity
llm_translation: We learned there: Split olives and grapes, Beit Shammai deem impure, and Beit Hillel deem pure.

hebrew_text: מַאי פָּרִיצֵי זֵיתִים? אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: רִשְׁעֵי זֵיתִים. אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: וּמַאי קְרָאָה – ״[וּבְנֵי] פָּרִיצֵי עַמְּךָ יִנַּשְּׂאוּ לְהַעֲמִיד חֲזוֹן וְנִכְשָׁלוּ״. רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק אָמַר: מֵהָכָא – ״וְהוֹלִיד בֵּן פָּרִיץ שֹׁפֵךְ דָּם״.
human_translation: What unruly [ peritzei ] olives? Rav Huna said: Wicked olives, Rav Yosef said: And what is the verse “Also the children of the wicked [ peritzei ] among your people shall raise themselves up to establish the vision but they shall stumble” Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said from here: “If he beget a son that is a robber [ paritz ], a shedder of blood”
llm_translation: What are the "paritzei zitim" (פָּרִיצֵי זֵיתִים)? Rav Huna said: The wicked of the olives. Rav Yosef said: And what is the verse? "And the sons of the breakers of your people shall rise up to establish a vision, but they shall stumble." Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: From here - "And the son of a paritz is a shedder of blood."

hebrew_text: וְכַמָּה פָּרִיצֵי זֵיתִים? רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אָמַר: אַרְבַּעַת קַבִּין לַקּוֹרָה. דְּבֵי רַבִּי יַנַּאי אָמְרִי: סָאתַיִם לַקּוֹרָה.
human_translation: And how much unruly olives? Rabbi Elazar says: four kav from beam The school of Rabbi Yannai say: two se’a from beam.
llm_translation: "And how much olive oil do the olives need to be crushed? Rabbi Elazar said: Four kavim for the beam. The school of Rabbi Yannai said: Two se'ah for the beam."

hebrew_text: וְלָא פְּלִיגִי: הָא בְּאַתְרָא דִּמְעַיְּילִי כּוֹרָא בְּאוֹלָלָא, הָא בְּאַתְרָא דִּמְעַיְּילִי תְּלָתָא כּוֹרִין בְּאוֹלָלָא.
human_translation: And do not disagree This to a place where kor brought into the press, that to a place where three kor brought into the baskets of the press.
llm_translation: And they do not argue: this one in a place where they carry a beam on the shoulder, this one in a place where they carry three beams on the shoulder.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן:
human_translation: The Sages taught:
llm_translation: The sages taught:

hebrew_text: עָלוּ בְּאִילָן שֶׁכּוֹחוֹ רַע, וּבְסוֹכָה שֶׁכּוֹחָהּ רַע – טָמֵא.
human_translation: climbed a tree that has little strength, or a branch that has little strength, rendered ritually impure.
llm_translation: They ascended to a tree whose strength is bad, and to a booth whose strength is bad - impure.

hebrew_text: הֵיכִי דָּמֵי אִילָן שֶׁכּוֹחוֹ רַע? אָמְרִי דְּבֵי רַבִּי יַנַּאי: כֹּל שֶׁאֵין בְּעִיקָּרוֹ לָחוֹק רוֹבַע. הֵיכִי דָּמֵי סוֹכָה שֶׁכּוֹחָהּ רַע? אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: כֹּל שֶׁנֶּחְבֵּאת בְּחֶזְיוֹנָהּ.
human_translation: What are the circumstances tree that has little strength, the school of Rabbi Yannai say: any whose trunk is not that hollow out a quarter What are the circumstances a branch that has little strength? Reish Lakish said: any which be hidden, in fist.
llm_translation: "How are the characteristics of a tree whose strength is bad? The House of Rabbi Yannai said: Anything whose main purpose is not for making a quarter. How are the characteristics of a booth whose strength is bad? Reish Lakish said: Anything that is hidden in its appearance."

hebrew_text: תְּנַן הָתָם: הַמְהַלֵּךְ בְּבֵית הַפְּרָס, עַל גַּבֵּי אֲבָנִים שֶׁיָּכוֹל לְהָסִיט, עַל הָאָדָם וְעַל הַבְּהֵמָה שֶׁכּוֹחָן רַע – טָמֵא.
human_translation: We learned elsewhere who walks in an area in which uncertainty exists concerning the location of a grave or corpse [ beit haperas ], over stones that he can move on a person or on an animal that had little strength, impure,
llm_translation: We learned there: One who walks in the Persian market, on stones that he can move, on a person and on an animal that have a bad odor - they are unclean.

hebrew_text: הֵיכִי דָּמֵי אָדָם שֶׁכּוֹחוֹ רַע? אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: כֹּל שֶׁרוֹכְבוֹ וְאַרְכֻבּוֹתָיו נוֹקְשׁוֹת. הֵיכִי דָּמֵי בְּהֵמָה שֶׁכּוֹחָהּ רַע? אָמְרִי דְּבֵי רַבִּי יַנַּאי: כֹּל שֶׁרוֹכְבָהּ [וּ]מְטִילָה גְּלָלִים.
human_translation: What are the circumstances a person that has little strength? Reish Lakish said: Any whose knees knock when rides upon him. What are the circumstances an animal that has little strength? the school of Rabbi Yannai say: Any that releases excrement when rides upon it.
llm_translation: How are the characteristics of a person whose strength is evil? Reish Lakish said: Everyone whose riding and saddlebags stumble. How are the characteristics of an animal whose strength is evil? The school of Rabbi Yannai said: Everyone whose riding and casting stones.

hebrew_text: אָמְרִי דְּבֵי רַבִּי יַנַּאי: לִתְפִלָּה וְלִתְפִילִּין אַרְבָּעָה קַבִּין.
human_translation: the school of Rabbi Yannai state: With regard to prayer and with regard to phylacteries, four kav .
llm_translation: The House of Rabbi Yannai said: For prayer and for phylacteries, four cubits.

hebrew_text: לִתְפִלָּה מַאי הִיא? דְּתַנְיָא: הַנּוֹשֵׂא מַשּׂאוֹי עַל כְּתֵיפוֹ וְהִגִּיעַ זְמַן תְּפִלָּה, פָּחוֹת מֵאַרְבָּעָה קַבִּין – מַפְשִׁילָין לַאֲחוֹרָיו וּמִתְפַּלֵּל. אַרְבָּעָה קַבִּין – מַנִּיחַ עַל גַּבֵּי קַרְקַע וּמִתְפַּלֵּל.
human_translation: What is with regard to prayer? as it is taught one who carries a load on his shoulder and the time for prayer arrives, less than four kav , lowers it behind him and prays, four kav , he places it on the ground and prays.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Regarding prayer, what is it? For it was taught: One who is carrying a burden on his shoulder and the time for prayer arrives, if it is less than four kav - he should place it behind him and pray. If it is four kav - he should place it on the ground and pray.

hebrew_text: לִתְפִילִּין מַאי – הִיא דְּתַנְיָא: הָיָה נוֹשֵׂא מַשּׂאוֹי עַל רֹאשׁוֹ וּתְפִילִּין בְּרֹאשׁוֹ, אִם הָיוּ תְּפִילִּין רוֹצְצוֹת – אָסוּר, וְאִם לָאו – מוּתָּר. בְּאֵיזוֹ מַשּׂאוֹי אָמְרוּ – בְּמַשּׂאוֹי שֶׁל אַרְבַּעַת קַבִּין.
human_translation: What is with regard to phylacteries? as it is taught was carrying a load on his head and phylacteries on his head, if the phylacteries were being crushed forbidden but if not permitted. to which load state to a load of four kav .
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Regarding tefillin, what is it? It was taught: If one was carrying a burden on his head and tefillin on his head, if the tefillin were pressing down - it is forbidden, but if not - it is permitted. In what kind of burden did they say? In a burden of four kavim. English translation:

hebrew_text: תָּנֵי רַבִּי חִיָּיא: הַמּוֹצִיא זֶבֶל עַל רֹאשׁוֹ וּתְפִילִּין בְּרֹאשׁוֹ – הֲרֵי זֶה לֹא יְסַלְּקֵם לִצְדָדִין, וְלֹא יִקְשְׁרֵם בְּמׇתְנָיו, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהוּא נוֹהֵג בָּהֶן מִנְהַג בִּזָּיוֹן. אֲבָל קוֹשְׁרָם עַל זְרוֹעוֹ בִּמְקוֹם תְּפִילִּין.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya teaches: who removes garbage on his head and phylacteries on his head, he not move to the side and not tie to his loins because he treats them in a manner degradation. But tie them on his arm in the location the phylacteries
llm_translation: It was taught by Rabbi Chiya: One who places dung on his head and tefillin on his head - he should not remove them to the side, nor should he tie them on his waist, because he treats them disrespectfully. But he may tie them on his arm in place of tefillin.

hebrew_text: מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי שֵׁילָא אָמְרוּ: אֲפִילּוּ מִטְפַּחַת שֶׁלָּהֶן אָסוּר לְהַנִּיחַ עַל הָרֹאשׁ שֶׁיֵּשׁ בּוֹ תְּפִילִּין. וְכַמָּה? אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: אֲפִילּוּ רִבְעָא דְּרִבְעָא דְּפוּמְבְּדִיתָא.
human_translation: said in the name of the school of Sheila: forbidden to place on the head that has phylacteries on it even the scarf they And how much Abaye said: Even one-quarter of one-quarter of Pumbedita
llm_translation: From the statement of Rabbi Sheilah they said: Even their handbreadth it is forbidden to place on the head that has tefillin. And how much? Abaye said: Even a quarter of a quarter of a thumb's width.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: מַאי קִצְבָה בִּכְרִי? אֶלָּא: אִם יֵשׁ בּוֹ כְּדֵי נְפִילָה. וְכַמָּה כְּדֵי נְפִילָה? רַבִּי אַמֵּי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אַרְבַּעה סְאִין לְכוֹר. רַבִּי אַמֵּי דִּילֵיהּ אָמַר: שְׁמוֹנַת סְאִין לְכוֹר. אֲמַר לֵיהּ הָהוּא סָבָא לְרַב חָמָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַבָּה בַּר אֲבוּהּ: אַסְבְּרַהּ לָךְ, בִּשְׁנֵי דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן הֲוָה שַׁמִּינָא אַרְעָא, בִּשְׁנֵי דְּרַבִּי אַמֵּי הֲוָה כְּחִישָׁא אַרְעָא.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: What fixed a pile? Rather, whether it has equivalent to dropping And how much equivalent to  dropping Rabbi Ami says Rabbi Yoḥanan Four se’a for a kor . Rabbi Ami himself, says eight se’a for a kor . A certain elder said to Rav Ḥama, son of Rabba bar Avuh: I will explain it to you: In the years of Rabbi Yoḥanan the land was fat, in the years of Rabbi Ami the land was lean,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda said: What is the measure of a hole in a beam? Rather, if it is the size of a nafilah. And how much is the size of a nafilah? Rabbi Ammi said Rabbi Yochanan: Four se'ahs for a kor. Rabbi Ammi his son said: Eight se'ahs for a kor. That elder said to Rav Chama, son of Rabba bar Avuh: I will explain it to you, during the time of Rabbi Yochanan the land was fertile, during the time of Rabbi Ammi the land was barren.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן הָתָם: הָרוּחַ שֶׁפִּיזְּרָה אֶת הָעוֹמָרִין, אוֹמְדִים אוֹתָהּ כַּמָּה לֶקֶט רְאוּיָה לַעֲשׂוֹת וְנוֹתֵן לַעֲנִיִּים. רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: נוֹתֵן לַעֲנִיִּים כְּדֵי נְפִילָה.
human_translation: We learned elsewhere the wind scattered the sheaves evaluates how many gleanings fit to produce, and gives to the poor. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: He gives to the poor equivalent to  dropping
llm_translation: We learned there: The wind that scattered the sheaves, they estimate how much is a suitable amount to gather and give to the poor. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: One should give to the poor enough for a fall.

hebrew_text: וְכַמָּה כְּדֵי נְפִילָה? כִּי אֲתָא רַב דִּימִי, אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר וְאִיתֵּימָא רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אַרְבַּעַת קַבִּין לְכוֹר. בָּעֵי רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה: לְכוֹר זֶרַע, אוֹ לְכוֹר תְּבוּאָה? לְמַפּוֹלֶת יָד, אוֹ לְמַפּוֹלֶת שְׁווֹרִים?
human_translation: And how much equivalent to dropping  When Rav Dimi came he said Rabbi Elazar and some say Rabbi Yoḥanan: Four kav for a kor . Rabbi Yirmeya raised a dilemma: for a kor of seed or for a kor of produce? to sowing hand or to sowing oxen?
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And how much is the amount for a miscarriage? For Rav Dimi came and said in the name of Rabbi Elazar, and some say in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: Four kav for a pit. Rabbi Yirmeya asked: For a pit of seed, or for a pit of produce? For a hand's depth, or for a pit of oxen?"

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע, דְּכִי אֲתָא רָבִין, אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבוּהּ אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר, וְאָמְרִי לָהּ אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אַרְבַּעַת קַבִּין לְכוֹר זֶרַע. וַעֲדַיִין תִּבְּעֵי לָךְ: לְמַפּוֹלֶת יָד אוֹ לְמַפּוֹלֶת שְׁווֹרִים? תֵּיקוּ.
human_translation: Come hear, as when Ravin came he Rabbi Avuh said Rabbi Elazar said, and some say Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Four kav for a kor of seed. And still raise a dilemma for you: to sowing hand or to sowing oxen? shall stand
llm_translation: Come and hear, for when Ravin came, Rabbi Avuh said in the name of Rabbi Elazar, and some say Rabbi Yochanan said: Four kavim for a kor of seed. And still you ask: for a handbreadth of a fall or for a handbreadth of oxen? This remains unresolved.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַמְקַבֵּל שָׂדֶה מֵחֲבֵירוֹ וַאֲכָלָהּ חָגָב, אוֹ נִשְׁדְּפָה. אִם מַכַּת מְדִינָה הִיא – מְנַכֶּה לוֹ מִן חֲכוֹרוֹ. אִם אֵינָהּ מַכַּת מְדִינָה – אֵין מְנַכֶּה לוֹ מִן חֲכוֹרוֹ. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אִם קִיבְּלָהּ הֵימֶנּוּ בְּמָעוֹת, בֵּין כָּךְ וּבֵין כָּךְ אֵינוֹ מְנַכֶּה לוֹ מֵחֲכוֹרוֹ.
human_translation: one who receives a field from another and grasshoppers consumed it or was wind blasted, if it is a regional disaster subtracts from he his tenancy. If it not a regional disaster, not subtract from he his tenancy. Rabbi Yehuda says: If received it from for money, whether this whether that he does not subtract his tenancy.
llm_translation: It was taught: One who receives a field from his fellow and locusts consumed it, or it was washed away. If it is a blow of the province - he is compensated from his neighbor. If it is not a blow of the province - he is not compensated from his neighbor. Rabbi Yehuda says: If she received it from him in coins, in any case, he is not compensated from his neighbor.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ הֵיכִי דָמֵי מַכַּת מְדִינָה? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: כְּגוֹן דְּאִישְׁתְּדוּף רוּבָּא דְבָאגָא. עוּלָּא אָמַר: כְּגוֹן שֶׁנִּשְׁתַּדְּפוּ אַרְבַּע שָׂדוֹת מֵאַרְבַּע רוּחוֹתֶיהָ.
human_translation: What are the circumstances a regional disaster? Rav Yehuda said: for example, most of valley was wind blasted, Ulla said: for example, four fields were wind blasted on its four sides,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemara, how are the laws of a city's punishment similar to a case of a fugitive slave? Rav Yehudah said: For example, when the majority of the city is enticed. Ulla said: For example, when four fields are enticed from its four corners.

hebrew_text: אָמַר עוּלָּא, בָּעוּ בְּמַעְרְבָא: נִשְׁדַּף תֶּלֶם אֶחָד עַל פְּנֵי כּוּלָּהּ, מַאי? נִשְׁתַּיֵּיר תֶּלֶם אֶחָד עַל פְּנֵי כּוּלָּהּ, מַהוּ? אִפְּסִיקא בְּיָרָא, מַאי? אַסְפַּסְתָּא,
human_translation: Ulla said: They raise dilemma in the West, one furrow was wind blasted along its entire length, what one furrow remained along its entire length, what is a fallow divided what fodder
llm_translation: Ula said, in the West they asked: If one radish is pushed onto the face of a whole radish, what is the ruling? If one radish remains on the face of a whole radish, what is the ruling? If it is cut with a knife, what is the ruling? A gathering.

hebrew_text: מַאי? זֶרַע אַחֵר, מַאי? חִיטֵּי לְגַבֵּי (שְׂעוֹרִים) [שְׂעָרֵי] כְּזֶרַע אַחֵר דָּמֵי, אוֹ לָא? כָּל הָעוֹלָם כּוּלּוֹ בְּשִׁדָּפוֹן, וְשֶׁלּוֹ בְּיֵרָקוֹן, אִי נָמֵי: כָּל הָעוֹלָם כּוּלּוֹ בְּיֵרָקוֹן, וְשֶׁלּוֹ בְּשִׁדָּפוֹן, מַאי? תֵּיקוּ.
human_translation: what a different seed, what wheat, in relation to barley, like a different seed or not? the entire world, by windblasts and his by mildew; alternatively, the entire world by mildew, and his with windblasts, what shall stand
llm_translation: What? Another seed, what? Wheat against (barley) barley like another seed similar, or not? The whole world entirely in a cooking pot, and his in a green pot, alternatively: the whole world entirely in a green pot, and his in a cooking pot, what? Teiku.
