hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: זִרְעַהּ חִיטֵּי, וַאֲזַל הוּא וְזַרְעַהּ שְׂעָרֵי, וְאִשְׁתְּדוּף רוּבָּא דְבָאגָא, וְאִשְׁתְּדוּף נָמֵי הָנָךְ שְׂעָרֵי דִּילֵיהּ, מַאי? מִי אָמְרִינַן דְּאָמַר לֵיהּ: אִילּוּ זְרַעְתַּהּ חִיטֵּי הֲוָה נָמֵי מִשְׁתַּדְפָא, אוֹ דִלְמָא מָצֵי אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִילּוּ זְרַעְתַּהּ חִיטֵּי הֲוָה מִקַּיַּים בִּי ״וְתִגְזַר אֹמֶר וְיָקׇם לָךְ״?
human_translation: said to Plant wheat, and he went and planted it barley, and most of the valley was wind blasted, and these barley of his were also wind blasted, what Do we say that say to him: if I had planted it wheat would likewise have been wind blasted, or perhaps can say to him: Had you planted it wheat, would have been fulfilled for me: “And you shall decree a matter and it will be established for you,
llm_translation: He said to him: If she planted wheat, and he went and planted barley, and the majority of the field was sown with barley, and the majority of the hairs of her head were sown with barley, what is the law? Do we say that if she had planted wheat, the majority would have been barley, or perhaps we say to him: If she had planted wheat, it would have been fulfilled in you, "and it shall be established for you"?

hebrew_text: מִסְתַּבְּרָא דְּאָמַר לֵיהּ: אִי זְרַעְתַּהּ חִיטֵּי הֲוָה מִקַּיַּים בִּי ״וְתִגְזַר אֹמֶר וְיָקׇם לָךְ וְעַל דְּרָכֶיךָ נָגַהּ אוֹר״.
human_translation: stands to reason that say to him: Had you planted it wheat would have fulfilled for me: “And you shall decree a matter and it will be established for you, and the light shall shine upon your ways.”
llm_translation: The text reads: "Mistabera d'amar lei: I zera'tah ḥittei hava mikayyam bi 've'tigzar omer ve'yakom lakh ve'al darkheikha nagah or."

hebrew_text: נִשְׁתַּדְפוּ כׇּל שְׂדוֹתָיו שֶׁל מַחְכִּיר, וְאִשְׁתְּדוּף נָמֵי הָא בַּהֲדַיְיהוּ, וְלָא אִשְׁתְּדוּף רוּבָּא דְבָאגָא, מַאי? מִי אָמְרִינַן כֵּיוָן דְּלָא אִשְׁתְּדוּף רוּבָּא דְבָאגָא – לָא מְנַכֵּי לֵיהּ, אוֹ דִלְמָא כֵּיוָן דְּאִשְׁתְּדוּף כּוּלְּהוּ אַרְעָתֵיהּ, מָצֵי אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הַאי מִשּׁוּם לַתָּךְ דִּידָךְ הוּא, דְּהָא (מִשְׁתַּדְפוּ) [נִשְׁתַּדְפוּ] כָּל שְׂדוֹתֶיךָ.
human_translation: all the fields of the owner of the land were wind blasted and this was also wind blasted with them, but the majority of the valley was not wind blasted, what Do we say since the majority of the valley was not wind blasted not subtract for the owner or perhaps since all the lands were wind blasted can say to This due to your fortune, as all your fields were wind blasted?
llm_translation: The fields of Machkir were set on fire, and the fields of Nahmei in Bahadaihu were set on fire, but the majority of Bagai's field was not set on fire. Why? Do we say that since the majority of Bagai's field was not set on fire, he is not considered a victim, or perhaps since all his land was set on fire, one can say to him: "This is due to your negligence, for your fields were set on fire."

hebrew_text: מִסְתַּבְּרָא דְּאָמַר לֵיהּ: אִי מִשּׁוּם לַתַּאי דִּידִי – הֲוָה מִשְׁתַּיַּיר לִי פּוּרְתָּא, כְּדִכְתִיב: ״כִּי נִשְׁאַרְנוּ מְעַט מֵהַרְבֵּה״.
human_translation: stands to reason that say to If due to my fortune, a little would have been left for me, as it is written: “For we are left but a few from many”
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: "Mistabera d'amar lei: I mi'shum latai didi - hava mishtayyar li purta, k'dichtiv: 'Ki nish'arnu me'at meharbeh.'" English translation: It is logical that he said to him: If it is for my benefit - a little will remain for me, as it is written: "For we are left but a few of many."

hebrew_text: נִשְׁתַּדְפוּ כׇּל שְׂדוֹתָיו שֶׁל חוֹכֵר וְאִשְׁתְּדוּף רוּבָּא דְבָאגָא, וְאִשְׁתְּדוּף נָמֵי הָא בַּהֲדַיְיהוּ, מַאי? מִי אָמְרִינַן כֵּיוָן דְּאִשְׁתְּדוּף רוּבָּא דְבָאגָא מְנַכֵּי לֵיהּ, אוֹ דִלְמָא כֵּיוָן דְּאִשְׁתְּדוּף כּוּלְּהוּ אַרְעָתֵיהּ, מָצֵי אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מִשּׁוּם לַתָּךְ דִּידָךְ הוּא, דְּהָא (מִשְׁתַּדְפוּ) [נִשְׁתַּדְפוּ] כָּל שְׂדוֹתֶיךָ. מִסְתַּבְּרָא דְּאָמַר לֵיהּ: מִשּׁוּם לַתָּאךְ הוּא.
human_translation: all the fields of the tenant farmer were wind blasted and most of the valley was wind blasted and this was also wind blasted with them, what Do we say since most of the valley was wind blasted subtracts for the owner or perhaps, since all lands were wind blasted, can say to the due to your fortune, as all your fields were wind blasted. It stands to reason that can say to him: due to your fortune.
llm_translation: The fields of the farmer were set on fire, and the majority of the valley of Bagai was set on fire, and the people of that place were set on fire with them. What? Do we say that since the majority of the valley of Bagai was set on fire, he is exempt from paying damages, or perhaps since all his land was set on fire, he should be liable to pay him: "It is due to your negligence, for your fields were set on fire." It is reasonable to say to him: "It is due to your negligence."

hebrew_text: אַמַּאי? הָכָא נָמֵי נֵימָא לֵיהּ: אִי מִשּׁוּם לַתַּאי דִּידִי הוּא – הֲוָה מִשְׁ[תַּ]יַּיר לִי פּוּרְתָּא, דַּהֲוָה מִקַּיַּים בִּי ״כִּי נִשְׁאַרְנוּ מְעַט מֵהַרְבֵּה״. מִשּׁוּם דַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִי הֲוָה חֲזֵית לְאִישְׁתַּיּוֹרֵי לָךְ מִידֵּי – הֲוָה מִשְׁתַּיַּיר לָךְ מִדְּנַפְשָׁךְ.
human_translation: Why Here too, let us say to If due to my fortune, a little would have been left for me, as would have been fulfilled for me: “For we are left but a few from many.” because say to Had you been worthy of something being left for you, would have been left from your own
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Why? Here it is stated clearly to him: If it is because of my own benefit – I would have refrained from a loaf, for it would have been fulfilled in me "for we are left but a few of many." Because he said to him: If you had seen your wife's ornaments in your hands – you would have refrained from your own soul. English translation:

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: הָיְתָה שְׁנַת שִׁדָּפוֹן וְיֵרָקוֹן, אוֹ שְׁבִיעִית, אוֹ שֶׁהָיוּ שָׁנִים כִּשְׁנֵי אֵלִיָּהוּ – אֵינוֹ עוֹלֶה לוֹ מִן הַמִּנְיָן.
human_translation: raises an objection was a year of wind-blasted or mildew or Sabbatical or years were like the years of Elijah do not count of his tally
llm_translation: Challenger: If it was a year of blight and mildew, or the seventh year, or if there were years like the years of Elijah - it does not count towards the count.

hebrew_text: קָתָנֵי: שִׁדָּפוֹן וְיֵרָקוֹן דּוּמְיָא דְּשָׁנִים כִּשְׁנֵי אֵלִיָּהוּ, מָה שְׁנֵי אֵלִיָּהוּ – דְּלָא הֲוַי תְּבוּאָה כְּלָל, אַף הָכָא נָמֵי – דְּלָא הֲוַי תְּבוּאָה כְּלָל. אֲבָל דְּאִיכָּא תְּבוּאָה – סָלְקָא לֵיהּ, וְלָא קָאָמְרִינַן מַכַּת מְדִינָה הִיא!
human_translation: teaches windblasts and mildew similar to the years like the years of Elijah. Just as the years of Elijah when there was no produce at all, so too, here, when there was no produce at all. But there was produce, counts his and we do not say that it is a regional disaster.
llm_translation: It was taught: Shiddafon and Yerakon are similar to the two Eliyahus, just as the two Eliyahus – who do not have any produce at all, so too here – they do not have any produce at all. But if there is produce – may it be removed from him, and we do not say, "It is a blow of a province!"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: שָׁאנֵי הָתָם, דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״בְּמִסְפַּר שְׁנֵי תְבוּאֹת יִמְכׇּר לָךְ״, שָׁנִים שֶׁיֵּשׁ בָּהֶן תְּבוּאָה בָּעוֹלָם.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: There, is different, as the verse states “According to the numbers of years of the crops he shall sell to you” years in which there is produce in the world.
llm_translation: Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: It is different there, as the verse states: "With the number of years of produce he shall sell to you," referring to years that contain produce in the world.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אָשֵׁי לְרַב כָּהֲנָא: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה שְׁבִיעִית תַּעֲלֶה לוֹ מִן הַמִּנְיָן, דְּהָא אִיכָּא תְּבוּאָה בְּחוּצָה לָאָרֶץ! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: שְׁבִיעִית אַפְקַעְתָּא דְמַלְכָּא הִיא.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said to Rav Kahana: If that is so, Sabbatical should count for him of his tally as there is produce outside of Eretz said to him: Sabbatical is an abrogation of the King,
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Ashe to Rav Kahana: Rather, from now on, the seventh year will be included in the count, for there is produce in the outskirts of the land! He said to him: The seventh year is the king's decree.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ מָר זוּטְרָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב מָרִי לְרָבִינָא: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה, שְׁבִיעִית לֹא תַּעֲלֶה לוֹ מִן הַגֵּירוּעַ! אַלְּמָה תְּנַן: נוֹתֵן סֶלַע וּפוּנְדְּיוֹן לְשָׁנָה! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: שָׁאנֵי הָתָם דְּחַזְיָא לְמִישְׁטַחא בַּהּ פֵּירֵי.
human_translation: Mar Zutra, son of Rav Mari, said to Ravina: If that is so, Sabbatical should not count for him for the deduction Why did we learn gives a sela and a pundeyon for year said to him: There it is different, as it is suitable for laying out produce on it.
llm_translation: He said to him, Master Zutra, son of Rav Mari, to Ravina: Rather, from now on, the seventh year shall not ascend to him from the produce! Why do we learn: He gives a rock and a pumpkin for the year! He said to him: It is different there because it is fit for fattening with its fruits.

hebrew_text: אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: לֹא שָׁנוּ, אֶלָּא שֶׁזְּרָעָהּ וְצִמְּחָה וַאֲכָלָהּ חָגָב. אֲבָל לֹא זְרָעָהּ כְּלָל – לָא, דְּאָמַר לֵיהּ: אִילּוּ זְרַעְתַּהּ הֲוָה מִקַּיַּים בִּי ״לֹא יֵבֹשׁוּ בְּעֵת רָעָה וּבִימֵי רְעָבוֹן יִשְׂבָּעוּ״.
human_translation: Shmuel said: They taught only if planted and sprouted and grasshoppers consumed it, but he did not plant it at all, not because say to him: Had you planted it, would have been fulfilled for me: “They will not be shamed in the time of evil, and in the days of famine they shall be satisfied”
llm_translation: Samuel said: Not they changed, but that sowed and grew and ate it locust. But not sowed at all - no, for said to him: If sowed would have fulfilled in me "They shall not be ashamed in the time of evil, and in the days of famine they shall be satisfied."

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: רוֹעֶה שֶׁהָיָה רוֹעֶה וְהִנִּיחַ עֶדְרוֹ וּבָא לָעִיר, וּבָא זְאֵב וְטָרַף, וּבָא אֲרִי וְדָרַס – אֵין אוֹמְרִים: אִילּוּ הָיָה שָׁם הָיָה מַצִּיל, אֶלָּא אוֹמְדִין אוֹתוֹ אִם יָכוֹל לְהַצִּיל – חַיָּיב, וְאִם לָאו – פָּטוּר. וְאַמַּאי? נֵימָא לֵיהּ: אִי הֲוֵית הָתָם הֲוָה מִקַּיַּים בִּי ״גַּם אֶת הָאֲרִי גַּם הַדּוֹב הִכָּה עַבְדֶּךָ״!
human_translation: Rav Sheshet raises an objection a shepherd who was herding and he left his flock and came to the town, and a wolf came and tore or a lion came and trampled we do not say had he been there he would have rescued Rather, estimates him: If he could rescued liable, If not, exempt why Let say to him: Had you been there, would have been fulfilled for me: “Your servant smote both the lion and the bear”
llm_translation: The Gemara raises an objection: Rav Sheshet raises a case of a shepherd who was shepherding and left his flock and entered the city, and a wolf came and tore the flock, and a lion came and trampled them - they do not say: if only he had been there, he would have saved them, rather they assess him - if he is able to save them, he is liable, and if not - he is exempt. And why is this so? Let him say to him: if you were there, would you have fulfilled in me "both the lion and the bear have struck your servant"!

hebrew_text: מִשּׁוּם דַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִי הֲוֵית חֲזֵית לְאִיתְרְחוֹשֵׁי לָךְ נִיסָּא, הֲוָה (אִיתְרְחִישׁ) [מִיתְרְחִישׁ] לָךְ נִיסָּא כְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא בֶּן דּוֹסָא דְּמֵתְיָין עִיזֵּי דּוּבֵּי בְּקַרְנַיְיהוּ. וְנֵימָא לֵיהּ: נְהִי דִּלְנִיסָּא רַבָּה לָא הֲוָה חֲזֵינָא – לְנִיסָּא זוּטָא
human_translation: because say to If you were worthy of a miracle occurring to you, a miracle would have occurred to you as Rabbi Ḥanina ben Dosa, when goats brought bears on their horns And let say to him: Granted that I was not worthy of a great miracle, of a small miracle
llm_translation: Due to the fact that he said to him: If you had seen the miracles for yourself, you would have believed like Rabbi Chanina ben Dosa, who would make the goats' horns into torches. And it is said to him: Even if we had not seen many miracles, we would have believed - for this small miracle.

hebrew_text: חֲזֵינָא? קַשְׁיָא.
human_translation: I was worthy. difficult.
llm_translation: We see? A question.

hebrew_text: תָּנֵי חֲדָא: פַּעַם רִאשׁוֹנָה וּשְׁנִיָּה זוֹרְעָהּ, וּשְׁלִישִׁית אֵינוֹ זוֹרְעָהּ. וְתַנְיָא אִידַּךְ: שְׁלִישִׁית זוֹרְעָהּ, רְבִיעִית אֵינוֹ זוֹרְעָהּ. לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא כְּרַבִּי, הָא כְּרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל.
human_translation: is taught one the first and second time he plants but the third he is not plant it And is taught another third plant it fourth he is not plant it not difficult, this in accordance with Rabbi that in accordance with Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel.
llm_translation: It was taught: The first and second time one sows it, but the third time one does not sow it. And it was taught in another Baraita: The third time one sows it, but the fourth time one does not sow it. There is no difficulty: this one is according to Rabbi, and that one is according to Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel.

hebrew_text: הָא כְּרַבִּי, דְּאָמַר: בִּתְרֵי זִימְנֵי הָוְיָ[א] חֲזָקָה. הָא כְּרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל, דְּאָמַר: בִּתְלָת זִימְנֵי הָוְיָ[א] חֲזָקָה.
human_translation: This in accordance with Rabbi who says presumptive status is by two occasions, that in accordance with Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, who says presumptive status is by three occasions.
llm_translation: Here is the English translation of the provided Talmudic text: "This one, like Rabbi, who said: 'With two times, it is established.' And this one, like Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, who said: 'With three times, it is established.'"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא שֶׁזְּרָעָהּ וְצִמְּחָה וַאֲכָלָהּ חָגָב. אֲבָל זְרָעָהּ וְלֹא צִמְּחָה – מָצֵי אֲמַר לֵיהּ בַּעַל הַקַּרְקַע: כׇּל יְמֵי זֶרַע זְרַעא לַהּ וֶאֱזִיל. וְעַד אֵימַת? אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: עַד דְּאָתוּ אֲרִיסֵי מִדַּבְרָא וְקָיְימָא כִּימָה אַרֵישַׁיְיהוּ.
human_translation: Reish Lakish said: They taught only if he planted and it sprouted and locusts consumed but he planted it and did not sprout the landowner can say to him: continue planting it all the days planting. And until when Rav Pappa said: Until that the sharecroppers come from the field and Pleiades stationed over their heads,
llm_translation: Reish Lakish said: They only taught this law when it was planted, sprouted, and the locust consumed it. But if it was planted and did not sprout, the owner of the land may say to him: "All the days of sowing are for you, and I will go." Until when? Rav Papa said: Until the renters come from the wilderness and establish themselves like the stars of the sky.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר, וְכֵן הָיָה רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן מְנַסְיָא אוֹמֵר כִּדְבָרָיו: חֲצִי תִשְׁרֵי, מְרַחְשְׁוָן, וַחֲצִי כִסְלֵיו – זֶרַע.
human_translation: raises an objection Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says in the name of Rabbi Meir, and similarly, Rabbi Shimon ben Menasya would say in accordance with his statement: half of Tishrei, Marḥeshvan, and half of Kislev planting.
llm_translation: Challenger: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel in the name of Rabbi Meir says, and so too was Rabbi Shimon ben Menasya saying in accordance with his words: "Half of Tishrei, Mar Cheshvan, and half of Kislev - seed."

hebrew_text: חֲצִי כִסְלֵיו, טֵבֵת, וַחֲצִי שְׁבָט – חוֹרֶף. חֲצִי שְׁבָט, אֲדָר, וַחֲצִי נִיסָן – קוֹר. חֲצִי נִיסָן, אִיָּיר, וַחֲצִי סִיוָן – קָצִיר. חֲצִי סִיוָן, תַּמּוּז, וַחֲצִי אָב – קַיִץ. חֲצִי אָב, אֱלוּל, וַחֲצִי תִּשְׁרֵי – חוֹם.
human_translation: half of Kislev, Tevet, and half of Shevat the winter half of Shevat, Adar, and half of cold; half of Nisan, Iyar, and half of Sivan harvest half of Sivan, Tammuz, and half of Av summer half of Av, Elul, and half of Tishrei heat.
llm_translation: Half of Kislev, Tevet, and half of Shevat - winter. Half of Shevat, Adar, and half of Nissan - cold. Half of Nissan, Iyyar, and half of Sivan - harvest. Half of Sivan, Tammuz, and half of Av - summer. Half of Av, Elul, and half of Tishrei - heat.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה מוֹנֶה מִתִּשְׁרִי, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן מוֹנֶה מִמְּרַחְשְׁוָן.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda counts from Tishrei Rabbi Shimon counts from Marḥeshvan,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehudah counts from Tishri, Rabbi Shimon counts from Marḥeshvan.

hebrew_text: מַאן מֵיקֵל בְּכוּלְּהוּ – רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, וְכוּלֵּי הַאי לָא קָאָמַר! לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא דְּקַבְּלַהּ מִינֵּיהּ בְּחָרְפֵי, הָא דְּקַבְּלֵהּ מִינֵּיהּ בְּאַפְלֵי.
human_translation: Who lenient of all of them Rabbi Shimon, and did not say that far not difficult, this who accepted from of early that who accepted from of late
llm_translation: One who is lenient in all matters - Rabbi Shimon, and all the others do not say this! It is not difficult: this one who accepts it from him in disgrace, this one who accepts it from him in darkness.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אִם קִבְּלָה מִמֶּנּוּ בְּמָעוֹת. הָהוּא גַּבְרָא דְּקַבֵּיל אַרְעָא לְמִיזְרַעה בַּהּו תּוּמֵי אַגּוּדָּא דִּנְהַר מַלְכָּא סָבָא בְּזוּזֵי. אִיסְתְּכַר נְהַר מַלְכָּא סָבָא. אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרָבָא, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: נְהַר מַלְכָּא סָבָא לָא עֲבִיד דְּמִיסְתְּכַר, מַכַּת מְדִינָה הִיא, זִיל נַכֵּי לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: If received it from for money, a certain man who received land to plant garlic on it on the bank of the river Malka Sava for money. the river Malka Sava became dammed up. came before Rava, said to The river Malka Sava does not usually dam up. it is a regional disaster; go subtract to
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: If she accepted from him in coins. That man who received a field to sow in it seeds from the officials of the king for money. The river of the king came. He came before Rava, he said to him: The river of the king did not come to be sold, it is a border of a province, go and hit him.

hebrew_text: אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ רַבָּנַן לְרָבָא: הָא אֲנַן תְּנַן, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אִם קִבְּלָה הֵימֶנּוּ בְּמָעוֹת – בֵּין כָּךְ וּבֵין כָּךְ אֵינוֹ מְנַכָּה לוֹ מִן חֲכוֹרוֹ! אֲמַר לְהוּ: לֵית דְּחָשׁ לַהּ לִדְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה.
human_translation: The Rabbis said to Rava: Didn’t we learn If received it from for money, whether this whether that he does not subtract his tenancy. said to them: There is no who is concerned for of Rabbi Yehuda
llm_translation: The sages said to Rava: "We have learned: Rabbi Yehuda says, if she accepted from him in coins, he cannot retract regardless." He said to them: "There is no concern for Rabbi Yehuda."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַמְקַבֵּל שָׂדֶה מֵחֲבֵירוֹ בַּעֲשָׂרָה כּוֹר חִטִּים לְשָׁנָה וְלָקְתָה – נוֹתֵן לוֹ מִתּוֹכָהּ. הָיוּ חִטֶּיהָ יָפוֹת, לֹא יֹאמַר לוֹ: הֲרֵינִי לוֹקֵחַ מִן הַשּׁוּק, אֶלָּא נוֹתֵן לוֹ מִתּוֹכָהּ.
human_translation: one who receives a field from another for ten kor of wheat per year, and was blighted gives from it were good wheat, may not say to I will buy from the market; rather, gives him from inside
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who receives a field from his fellow for ten kors of wheat for a year and it produced a stalk - he gives it to him from within it. If its wheat was beautiful, he should not say to him, "I will buy from the market for him," rather he gives it to him from within it.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ הָהוּא גַּבְרָא דְּקַבֵּיל אַרְעָא לְאַסְפַּסְתָּא בְּכוֹרֵי דִשְׂעָרֵי, עֲבַדָא אַסְפַּסְתָּא, וְחַרְשַׁהּ וְזַרְעַהּ שְׂעָרֵי, וּלְקוֹ הָנֵי שְׂעָרֵי. שַׁלְחַהּ רַב חֲבִיבָא מִסּוּרָא דִפְרָת לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרָבִינָא, כִּי הַאי גַּוְנָא מַאי: כִּי ״לָקְתָה נוֹתֵן לוֹ מִתּוֹכָהּ״ דָּמֵי, אוֹ לָא?
human_translation: a certain man who received land to hay for kor of barley. produced hay, plowed and sowed it barley, and that barley was blighted. Rav Ḥaviva from Sura in the Euphrates sent before Ravina: What a case of this kind? considered similar to was blighted, he gives him from inside or not?
llm_translation: The man who received a plot of land to gather the first fruits of the hair, did the gathering, and plowed and sowed the hair, and these hairs grew. Rav Ḥaviva of Sura sent him from the marketplace of Pumbedita before Ravina, for what is the law in this case: "If he has gathered, he gives him from its midst" or not?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מִי דָּמֵי? הָתָם לָא עֲבַדָא אַרְעָא שְׁלִיחוּתָא דְּמָרַהּ, הָכָא עֲבַדָא אַרְעָא שְׁלִיחוּתָא דְּמָרַהּ.
human_translation: said to him: Is it comparable? There, the land did not perform its owner’s mission, here, the land did perform its owner’s mission,
llm_translation: He said to him: Who is similar? There, he did not do the will of his master's messenger, here, he did the will of his master's messenger.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא גַּבְרָא דְּקַבֵּל פַּרְדֵּס מֵחַבְרֵיהּ בַּעֲשַׂר דַּנֵּי חַמְרָא, תְּקֵיף הָהוּא חַמְרָא. סְבַר רַב כָּהֲנָא לְמֵימַר: הַיְינוּ מַתְנִיתִין – לָקְתָה נוֹתֵן לוֹ מִתּוֹכָהּ. אָמַר לֵיהּ רַב אָשֵׁי: מִי דָּמֵי? הָתָם לָא עֲבַדָא אַרְעָא שְׁלִיחוּתָא, הָכָא עֲבַדָא אַרְעָא שְׁלִיחוּתָא.
human_translation: a certain man who received an orchard from another for ten barrels of wine, that wine turned sour. Rav Kahana thought to say this is the mishna was blighted he give him from inside Rav Ashi said to him: Is it comparable? There, the land did not perform mission, here, the land perform mission,
llm_translation: That man who received a vineyard from his friends for ten barrels of wine, that vineyard was strong. Rav Kahana thought to say: This is the Mishnah - he gives him the produce from within it. Rav Ashi said to him: Who is similar? There, the land did not do the work of the agent, here the land does the work of the agent.

hebrew_text: וּמוֹדֶה רַב אָשֵׁי בְּעִינְּבֵי דִּכְדוּם וּבְשָׂדֶה שֶׁלָּקְתָה בָּעוֹמָרֶיהָ.
human_translation: And Rav Ashi concedes with regard to grapes that shrunk and with regard to a field whose sheaves were blighted
llm_translation: And Rab Ashi agrees with the statement regarding the Ininvei of Kedum and in the field where she gathered her sheaves.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַמְקַבֵּל שָׂדֶה מֵחֲבֵירוֹ לְזׇרְעָהּ שְׂעוֹרִים – לֹא יִזְרָעֶנָּה חִטִּים. חִטִּים – יִזְרָעֶנָּה שְׂעוֹרִים, רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹסֵר. תְּבוּאָה – לֹא יִזְרָעֶנָּה קִטְנִית. קִטְנִית – יִזְרָעֶנָּה תְּבוּאָה, וְרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹסֵר.
human_translation: one who receives a field from another to plant it barley, not plant it wheat, wheat, plant it barley Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel forbids it with grain not plant it legumes, legumes plant it grain, but Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel forbids
llm_translation: It was taught: One who receives a field from his fellow for planting barley - he may not plant it with wheat. Wheat - he may plant it with barley. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel prohibits. Regarding produce - one may not plant it with legumes. Legumes - one may plant it with produce, and Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel prohibits.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל, דִּכְתִיב: ״שְׁאֵרִית יִשְׂרָאֵל לֹא יַעֲשׂוּ עַוְלָה וְלֹא יְדַבְּרוּ כָזָב וְלֹא יִמָּצֵא בְּפִיהֶם לְשׁוֹן תַּרְמִית״.
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: What is the reason of Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel? as it is written: “The remnant of Israel shall not do iniquity, nor speak lies, neither shall a deceitful tongue be found in their mouth”
llm_translation: Gemara said, Rav Ḥisda: What is the reason for Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, as it is written: "The remnant of Israel shall not do iniquity, nor speak lies, neither shall a deceitful tongue be found in their mouth."

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: מִגְבַּת פּוּרִים לְפוּרִים, וְאֵין מְדַקְדְּקִין בַּדָּבָר. וְאֵין הֶעָנִי רַשַּׁאי לִיקַּח מֵהֶן רְצוּעָה לְסַנְדָּלוֹ, אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן הִתְנָה בְּמַעֲמַד אַנְשֵׁי הָעִיר, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יַעֲקֹב שֶׁאָמַר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי מֵאִיר. רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל
human_translation: raises an objection Purim collection is for Purim but one does not scrutinize the matter And not permitted for a poor person to purchase a strap for his sandal from it unless he stipulated in the presence of the people of the city the statement of Rabbi Ya’akov, who said in the name of Rabbi Meir. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel
llm_translation: Challenger: From Purim to Purim, and we do not scrutinize the matter. And the poor person is not permitted to take from them a strap for his sandal, unless he was appointed by the leaders of the city, the words of Rabbi Yaakov who said in the name of Rabbi Meir. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel.

hebrew_text: מֵיקֵל,
human_translation: lenient,
llm_translation: From the beginning,

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי, טַעְמָא דְּרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן כִּדְמָר. דְּאָמַר מָר: הַאי מַאן דְּנִיחָא לֵיהּ דְּתִתְבַּיַּר אַרְעֵיהּ – לִיזְרְעַהּ שַׁתָּא חִטֵּי וְשַׁתָּא שְׂעָרֵי, שַׁתָּא שְׁתִי וְשַׁתָּא עֵרֶב.
human_translation: Abaye said: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel’s reason as by the Master, as the Master says: One whom it is preferable to his land lay fallow should plant wheat year and barley year. year lengthwise and year crosswise.
llm_translation: Abaye said, the reason of Rabban Shimon is like that of Mar. For Mar said: One who is pleased with his portion, his land will produce barley and barley, half wheat and half barley, half flax and half barley.

hebrew_text: וְלָא אֲמַרַן אֶלָּא דְּלָא כָּרֵיב וְתָנֵי, אֲבָל כָּרֵיב וְתָנֵי – לֵית לַן בַּהּ.
human_translation: And we said only where not plow and repeat but plows and repeats we have no with it.
llm_translation: And we did not say except that he did not read and teach, but if he read and taught - we do not have a problem with it.

hebrew_text: תְּבוּאָה לֹא יִזְרָעֶנָּה קִטְנִית [וְכוּ׳]. מַתְנֵי לֵיהּ רַב יְהוּדָה לְרָבִין: תְּבוּאָה – יִזְרָעֶנָּה קִטְנִית. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: וְהָא אֲנַן תְּנַן: תְּבוּאָה – לֹא יִזְרָעֶנָּה קִטְנִית! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָא קַשְׁיָא, הָא לַן וְהָא לְהוּ.
human_translation: grain may not plant it legumes. Rav Yehuda taught Ravin grain plant it legumes. said to him: But didn’t we learn grain may not plant it legumes? said to him: not difficult, this is for us, and that is for them,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Tevo'ah lo yizra'enah kitnit ve'chul. Matnei lei Rav Yehudah le'Ravin: Tevo'ah – yizra'enah kitnit. Amar lei: Ve'ha anan tenan: Tevo'ah – lo yizra'enah kitnit! Amar lei: La kashya, ha lan ve'ha lehu." English translation: "A field that has not been sown with a kitnit crop. Rav Yehudah taught Ravin: 'A field – sow it with a kitnit crop.' He said to him: 'But didn't we learn: A field – do not sow it with a kitnit crop!' He said to him: 'There is no contradiction, here it is for us and there it is for them.'"

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב יְהוּדָה לְרָבִין בַּר רַב נַחְמָן: רָבִין אֲחִי, הָנֵי תַּחְלֵי דְּבֵי כִתָּנָא אֵין בָּהֶן מִשּׁוּם גָּזֵל. עוֹמְדוֹת עַל גְּבוּלִין – יֵשׁ בָּהֶן מִשּׁוּם גָּזֵל.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said to Ravin bar Rav Naḥman: Ravin my brother, those cress among flax are not subject to robbery, stand on the boundary they are subject to robbery,
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Yehudah to Ravin bar Rav Nachman: Ravin my brother, those first ones of the house of the Tanna do not have any aspect of theft. If they are standing on borders - they have an aspect of theft.

hebrew_text: וְאִם הוּקְשׁוּ לְזֶרַע – אֲפִילּוּ דְּבֵי כִתָּנָא נָמֵי יֵשׁ בָּהֶם מִשּׁוּם גָּזֵל. מַאי טַעְמָא? מַאי דְּאַפְסֵיד – אַפְסֵיד.
human_translation: And if hardened with seed even among the flax, they are subject to robbery. What is the reason? that to which caused a loss, caused the loss.
llm_translation: "And if they were difficult for the seed - even the schools of the Tannaim agree that there is in them an element of theft. What is the reason? What causes loss - causes loss."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב יְהוּדָה לְרָבִין בַּר רַב נַחְמָן: רָבִין אַחִי, הָנֵי דִּילִי – דִּילָךְ, וְדִילָךְ – דִּילִי. נְהוּג בְּנֵי מִצְרָא: אִילָן הַנּוֹטֶה לְכָאן – לְכָאן, וְהַנּוֹטֶה לְכָאן – לְכָאן.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said to Ravin bar Rav Naḥman: Ravin my brother, these mine are yours, and yours are mine. is customary those border a tree that tilts to here, to here, and one that tilts to there, to there,
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Yehudah to Ravin bar Rav Nachman: Ravin my brother, yours is yours, and mine is mine. The people of Egypt have a custom: a tree that leans this way - this way, and a tree that leans that way - that way.

hebrew_text: דְּאִיתְּמַר: אִילָן הָעוֹמֵד עַל הַמֶּיצֶר, אָמַר רַב: הַנּוֹטֶה לְכָאן – לְכָאן. וְהַנּוֹטֶה לְכָאן – לְכָאן, וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: חוֹלְקִין.
human_translation: As was stated a tree that stands on the border Rav says: That tilts to here, to here, and that tilts to there to there. And Shmuel says: divide
llm_translation: Talmudic text: If a tree is standing on the border, Rav said: If it leans this way – this way. And if it leans that way – that way. But Shmuel said: They divide.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: אִילָן הָעוֹמֵד עַל הַמֶּיצֶר – יַחְלוֹקוּ. תְּיוּבְתָּא דְּרַב! תַּרְגְּמָא שְׁמוּאֵל אַלִּיבָּא דְּרַב, בִּמְמַלֵּא כָּל הַמֶּיצֶר כּוּלּוֹ.
human_translation: raises an objection a tree that stands on the border they divide a conclusive refutation of Rav. Shmuel interpreted in accordance with of Rav where fills the entire boundary,
llm_translation: The question was raised: a tree standing on the border - they shall divide. A contradiction to the opinion of Rav! The translation of Shmuel is: the entire border is filled completely.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, מַאי לְמֵימְרָא? לָא צְרִיכָא דִּתְלֵי טוּנֵיהּ לְחַד גִּיסָא. וְאַכַּתִּי מַאי לְמֵימְרָא? מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: דְּאָמַר לֵיהּ פְּלוֹג הָכִי, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן דְּאָמַר לֵיהּ: מַאי חָזֵית דְּפָלְגַתְּ הָכִי – פְּלוֹג הָכִי.
human_translation: If so, what of stating No, necessary where its boughs hang to one side. But still, what of stating lest you say that say to divide in this teaches us that say to him: What did you see to divide in this divide in that
llm_translation: If so, what is there to say? It is not necessary that his two straps be tied to one side. And if so, what is there to say? What you might say: that he said to him, "Split it this way," we can infer that he said to him, "What did you see that you split it this way? Split it this way."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב יְהוּדָה לְרָבִין בַּר רַב נַחְמָן: רָבִין אֲחִי, לָא תִּזְבֹּין אַרְעָא דִּסְמִיכָא לְמָתָא, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ אָמַר רַב הוּנָא אָמַר רַב: אָסוּר לוֹ לְאָדָם שֶׁיַּעֲמוֹד עַל שְׂדֵה חֲבֵירוֹ בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁעוֹמֶדֶת בְּקָמוֹתֶיהָ.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said to Ravin bar Rav Naḥman: Ravin my brother, do not buy land that is near a town, as Rabbi Abbahu says Rav Huna says Rav says: prohibited for a person to stand by another’s field when its ripe grain is standing,
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Yehudah to Ravin bar Rav Nachman: Ravin my brother, do not sow a field adjacent to a city, for Rabbi Abahu said in the name of Rav Huna who said in the name of Rav: It is forbidden for a person to stand in his neighbor's field when it is in its standing position.

hebrew_text: אִינִי? וְהָא אַשְׁכְּחִינְהוּ רַבִּי אַבָּא לְתַלְמִידֵיהּ דְּרַב, אֲמַר לְהוּ: מַאי אָמַר רַב בְּהָנֵי קְרָאֵי ״בָּרוּךְ אַתָּה בָּעִיר וּבָרוּךְ אַתָּה בַּשָּׂדֶה״, ״בָּרוּךְ אַתָּה בְּבֹאֶךָ וּבָרוּךְ אַתָּה בְּצֵאתֶךָ״?
human_translation: Is that so? But when Rabbi Abba encountered Rav’s students said to them: What does Rav say with regard to these verses “Blessed shall you be in the city, and blessed shall you be in the field” “Blessed shall you be when you enter, and blessed shall you be when you exit”
llm_translation: I am not? But behold, Rabbi Abba found them, to his students of Rav, he said to them: What did Rav say regarding the blessings of "Blessed are you in the city, and blessed are you in the field," "Blessed are you when you come in, and blessed are you when you go out"?

hebrew_text: וַאֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ, הָכִי אָמַר רַב: ״בָּרוּךְ אַתָּה בָּעִיר״ – שֶׁיְּהֵא בֵּיתְךָ סָמוּךְ לְבֵית הַכְּנֶסֶת. ״בָּרוּךְ אַתָּה בַּשָּׂדֶה״ – שֶׁיְּהוּ נְכָסֶיךָ קְרוֹבִים לָעִיר. ״בָּרוּךְ אַתָּה בְּבֹאֶךָ״ – שֶׁלֹּא תִּמְצָא אִשְׁתְּךָ סְפֵק נִדָּה בִּשְׁעַת בִּיאָתְךָ מִן הַדֶּרֶךְ. ״בָּרוּךְ אַתָּה בְּצֵאתֶךָ״ – שֶׁיְּהוּ צֶאֱצָאֵי מֵעֶיךָ כְּמוֹתְךָ.
human_translation: And they said to him: This Rav said: “Blessed shall you be in the city” that your house should be adjacent to a synagogue, “Blessed shall you be in the field” that your property should be near the city. “Blessed shall you be when you enter” that you will not find your wife uncertain woman when you come in from a journey, “Blessed shall you be when you go out” that those who emerge from you, should be like you.
llm_translation: And they said to him, thus said Rav: "Blessed are you in the city" - that your house should be close to the synagogue. "Blessed are you in the field" - that your possessions should be close to the city. "Blessed are you when you enter" - that you should not find your wife in a state of doubt of menstruation at the time of your arrival. "Blessed are you when you leave" - that your offspring should be like you.

hebrew_text: וַאֲמַר לְהוּ: רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן לָא אָמַר הָכִי, אֶלָּא: ״בָּרוּךְ אַתָּה בָּעִיר״ – שֶׁיְּהֵא בֵּית הַכִּסֵּא סָמוּךְ לְשׁוּלְחָנְךָ, אֲבָל בֵּית הַכְּנֶסֶת לָא. וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן לְטַעְמֵיהּ, דְּאָמַר: שְׂכַר פְּסִיעוֹת יֵשׁ.
human_translation: And said to them: Rabbi Yoḥanan did not say this, but “Blessed shall you be in the city,” that there should be a bathroom near your table, but not a synagogue. And Rabbi Yoḥanan to his reasoning as he says: There is a reward steps
llm_translation: He said to them: Rabbi Yochanan did not say this, but rather: "Blessed are you in the city" - that the bathroom should be adjacent to your table, but not the synagogue. And Rabbi Yochanan according to his reasoning, for he said: there is reward for footsteps.

hebrew_text: ״בָּרוּךְ אַתָּה בַּשָּׂדֶה״ – שֶׁיְּהוּ נְכָסֶיךָ מְשׁוּלָּשִׁין: שְׁלִישׁ בִּתְבוּאָה, שְׁלִישׁ בְּזֵיתִים, וּשְׁלִישׁ בִּגְפָנִים. ״בָּרוּךְ אַתָּה בְּבֹאֶךָ וּבָרוּךְ אַתָּה בְּצֵאתֶךָ״ – שֶׁתְּהֵא יְצִיאָתְךָ מִן הָעוֹלָם כְּבִיאָתְךָ לְעוֹלָם. מָה בִּיאָתְךָ לְעוֹלָם בְּלֹא חֵטְא, אַף יְצִיאָתְךָ מִן הָעוֹלָם בְּלֹא חֵטְא.
human_translation: “Blessed shall you be in the field” that your property should be thirds: One-third in grain, one-third in olives, and one-third in grapevines. “Blessed shall you be when you enter and blessed shall you be when you exit” that your exit from the world should be like your entry into the world: Just as your entry into the world without sin, so too your exit from the world without sin.
llm_translation: "Blessed are you in the field" - that your possessions should be diversified: a third in produce, a third in olives, and a third in vineyards. "Blessed are you when you come in, and blessed are you when you go out" - that your departure from the world should be like your arrival into the world. Just as your arrival into the world is without sin, so too your departure from the world should be without sin.

hebrew_text: לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא דִּמְהַדַּר לֵיהּ שׁוּרָא וְרִתְקָא, הָא דְּלָא מְהַדַּר לֵיהּ שׁוּרָא וְרִתְקָא.
human_translation: not difficult. This a wall and partition [ ritka ] that surround That where a wall and partition do not surround it.
llm_translation: Not difficult: This one who arranges the ox and the donkey, this one who does not arrange the ox and the donkey.

hebrew_text: ״וְהֵסִיר ה׳ מִמְּךָ כׇּל חֹלִי״, אָמַר רַב: זוֹ [הָ]עַיִן. רַב לְטַעְמֵיהּ. דְּרַב סָלֵיק לְבֵי קִבְרֵי, עֲבַד מַאי דַּעֲבַד, אֲמַר: תִּשְׁעִין וְתִשְׁעָה בְּעַיִן רָעָה, וְאֶחָד בְּדֶרֶךְ אֶרֶץ.
human_translation: “And the Lord will take away from you all sickness” Rav says: This eye. Rav to his reasoning, as Rav went to a graveyard, did what did, said: Ninety-nine by the evil eye, and one by natural means.
llm_translation: "And the Lord will remove from you all sickness," Rav said: This is referring to the eye. Rav according to his reasoning. For Rav went out to the cemetery, did what he did, and said: Ninety-nine ills come through an evil eye, and one through proper conduct."

hebrew_text: וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: זֶה הָרוּחַ. שְׁמוּאֵל לְטַעְמֵיהּ, דְּאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הַכֹּל בָּרוּחַ. וְלִשְׁמוּאֵל: הָא אִיכָּא הֲרוּגֵי מַלְכוּת! הָנָךְ נָמֵי, אִי לָאו זִיקָא, עָבְדִי לְהוּ סַמָּא וְחָיֵי.
human_translation: And Shmuel says: This the wind. Shmuel to his reasoning, as Shmuel says: Every to the wind But according to Shmuel, aren’t there executed by the monarchy these too, were it not the wind, they would prepare a medicine for and live,
llm_translation: Samuel said: This is the spirit. Samuel according to his reasoning, for Samuel said: Everything is by the spirit. And to Samuel: Is there not the slain of the kingdom! You, stand up, if it is not a demon, bring him some garlic and let him live.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי חֲנִינָא אָמַר: זוֹ צִינָּה, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא: הַכֹּל בִּידֵי שָׁמַיִם, חוּץ מִצִּנִּים פַּחִים. שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״צִנִּים פַּחִים בְּדֶרֶךְ עִקֵּשׁ שׁוֹמֵר נַפְשׁוֹ יִרְחַק מֵהֶם״.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥanina says: This the cold, as Rabbi Ḥanina says: All at the hands of Heaven, except for cold heat, as it is stated: “Cold and heat are on the path of the perverse; he who guards his soul shall keep far from them”
llm_translation: Rabbi Chanina said: This is a lizard, as Rabbi Chanina said: Everything is in the hands of Heaven, except for colds and fevers. As it is stated: "Colds and fevers on a crooked path, one who guards his soul will distance himself from them."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר חֲנִינָא אָמַר: זוֹ צוֹאָה. דְּאָמַר מָר: צוֹאַת הַחוֹטֶם, וְצוֹאַת הָאוֹזֶן – רוּבָּן קָשֶׁה, וּמִיעוּטָן יָפֶה.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei bar Ḥanina says: This excrement, as the Master says: excrement of the nose, , and excrement of the ear, much of it harmful, but a bit of it beneficial.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei bar Chanina said: This is a discharge. As Mar said: The discharge of the nose and the discharge of the ear - their majority is impure, and their minority is pure.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אָמַר: זוֹ מָרָה. תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: ״מַחֲלָה״ – זוֹ מָרָה, וְלָמָּה נִקְרָא שְׁמָהּ ״מַחֲלָה״ – שֶׁהִיא מַחֲלָה כׇּל גּוּפוֹ שֶׁל אָדָם. דָּבָר אַחֵר: ״מַחֲלָה״, שֶׁשְּׁמוֹנִים וּשְׁלֹשָׁה חֳלָאִים תְּלוּיִן בַּמָּרָה. וְכוּלָּן, פַּת שַׁחֲרִית בְּמֶלַח וְקִיתוֹן שֶׁל מַיִם מְבַטַּלְתָּן.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar says: This the gall bladder. This is also taught “Sickness,” this the gall bladder. And why called sickness? because it makes a person’s entire body ill. Alternatively, sickness because eighty-three diseases, are dependent on the gall bladder. And all of them, bread the morning with salt and a large jug of water negates their
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: This is marah. It was also taught likewise: "Machalah" - this is marah. And why is it called by the name "machalah"? Because it is a sickness of the entire body of a person. Another explanation: "Machalah," for there are eighty-three illnesses dependent on the marah. And all of them, a piece of barley bread in salt and a cup of water nullifies them.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: שְׁלֹשָׁה עָשָׂר דְּבָרִים נֶאֶמְרוּ בְּפַת שַׁחֲרִית: מַצֶּלֶת מִן הַחַמָּה, וּמִן הַצִּנָּה, וּמִן הַזִּיקִין, וּמִן הַמַּזִּיקִין, וּמַחְכִּימַת פֶּתִי, וְזוֹכֶה בַּדִּין, לִלְמוֹד תּוֹרָה וּלְלַמֵּד, וּדְבָרָיו נִשְׁמָעִין, וְתַלְמוּדוֹ מִתְקַיֵּים בְּיָדוֹ,
human_translation: The Sages taught thirteen matters were stated with regard to bread the morning: protects from the heat, and from the cold, and from the winds, and from the harmful spirits; and it makes the simple wise, and victorious in judgment, to learn Torah and to teach and his statements are heard, and his study will remain in his possession.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: Thirteen matters were stated in the morning prayer: removing the shadow from the sun, and from the moon, and from the planets, and from the constellations, and the wisdom of the simple, and acquiring a legal decision, to study Torah and to teach, and his words are heard, and his learning is established in his hand.

hebrew_text: וְאֵין בְּשָׂרוֹ מַעֲלֶה הֶבֶל, וְנִזְקָק לְאִשְׁתּוֹ, וְאֵינוֹ מִתְאַוֶּה לְאִשָּׁה אַחֶרֶת, וְהוֹרֶגֶת כִּינָּה שֶׁבִּבְנֵי מֵעַיִם. וְיֵשׁ אוֹמְרִים: אַף מוֹצִיאָ[ה] אֶת הַקִּנְאָה וּמַכְנֶיסֶ[ת] אֶת הָאַהֲבָה.
human_translation: his flesh does not generate sweat, and he engages in intercourse with his wife and he does not lust for another woman, and kills louse in intestines. And some say even removes jealousy and brings in love.
llm_translation: His flesh does not bring up vanity, and he is attached to his wife, and he does not desire another woman, and he kills jealousy among the sons of Ma'ayim. And some say: He also removes jealousy and brings in love.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבָּה לְרָבָא בַּר מָרִי: מְנָא הָא מִילְּתָא דְאָמְרִי אִינָשֵׁי: שִׁיתִּין רָהֹיטֵי רְהוּט וְלָא מְטוֹ לְגַבְרָא דְּמִצַּפְרָא כְּרַךְ. וַאֲמַרוּ רַבָּנַן: הַשְׁכֵּם וֶאֱכוֹל, בְּקַיִץ מִפְּנֵי הַחַמָּה וּבַחוֹרֶף מִפְּנֵי הַצִּינָּה.
human_translation: Rabba said to Rava bar Mari: From where is this matter that people say Sixty runners ran but could not catch the man who ate in the morning, and the Sages said: Arise early and eat, in the summer due to the sun and in the winter due to the cold,
llm_translation: Rabba said to Rava bar Mari: From where is the matter that people say: "Sixty runners run and do not reach the level of the one who anticipates the morning light"? And the Rabbis said: "Rise early and eat, in the summer because of the heat, and in the winter because of the cold."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ, דִּכְתִיב: ״לֹא יִרְעָבוּ וְלֹא יִצְמָאוּ וְלֹא יַכֵּם שָׁרָב וָשָׁמֶשׁ״, לֹא יַכֵּם שָׁרָב וָשָׁמֶשׁ – כֵּיוָן דְּלָא יִרְעָבוּ וְלֹא יִצְמָאוּ.
human_translation: said to him: as it is written: “They shall not hunger nor thirst, neither shall the heat nor sun smite them” the heat and the sun not smite them? Since they shall not hunger nor thirst,
llm_translation: He said to him, as it is written: "They shall not hunger nor thirst, neither shall the heat nor sun smite them." "Neither shall the heat nor sun smite them" - since they shall not hunger nor thirst.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אַתְּ אָמְרַתְּ לִי מֵהָתָם, וַאֲנָא אָמֵינָא לָךְ מֵהָכָא: ״וַעֲבַדְתֶּם אֵת ה׳ אֱלֹהֵיכֶם וּבֵרַךְ אֶת לַחְמְךָ וְאֶת מֵימֶיךָ״. ״וַעֲבַדְתֶּם אֵת ה׳ אֱלֹהֵיכֶם״ – זוֹ קְרִיאַת שְׁמַע וּתְפִלָּה. ״וּבֵרַךְ אֶת לַחְמְךָ וְאֶת מֵימֶיךָ״ – זוֹ פַּת בַּמֶּלַח וְקִיתוֹן שֶׁל מַיִם, מִכָּאן וְאֵילָךְ: ״וַהֲסִרֹתִי מַחֲלָה מִקִּרְבֶּךָ״.
human_translation: said to him: You said to me from there, but I say to you from here, “And you shall serve the Lord your God, and He will bless your bread and your water” “And you shall serve the Lord your God,” this recitation of Shema and prayer, “And He will bless your bread and your water,” this bread with salt and a large jug of water From that onward, “And I will take sickness away from your midst,”
llm_translation: He said to him: You say to me from there, and I believe you from here: "And you shall serve the Lord your God and bless your bread and your water." "And you shall serve the Lord your God" - this is the recitation of the Shema and prayer. "And bless your bread and your water" - this is bread with salt and a jug of water, from here and onwards: "And I will remove sickness from your midst."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב יְהוּדָה לְרַב אַדָּא מָשׁוֹחָאָה: לָא תְּזַלְזֵל בְּמִשְׁחֲתָא, דְּכֹל פּוּרְתָּא וּפוּרְתָּא חֲזִי לְכוּרְכְּמָא רִישְׁקָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב יְהוּדָה לְרַב אַדָּא מָשׁוֹחָאָה: אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת דְּאַנִּיגְרָא – זַלְזֵל בְּהוּ. דְּאַנַּהֲרָא לָא תִּמְשְׁחִנְהוּ כְּלָל.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said to Rav Adda the surveyor Do not treat measuring lightly as each little bit suitable for cultivated [ rishka ] saffron, Rav Yehuda said to Rav Adda the surveyor: four cubits channel, may treat them lightly, to a river, not measure them at all,
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Yehudah to Rav Adda Mashocha'ah: Do not belittle the oil, for every drop and drop sees the top of the flask. He said to him, Rav Yehudah to Rav Adda Mashocha'ah: Four cubits of a river - belittle it. Do not anoint it at all.

hebrew_text: רַב יְהוּדָה לְטַעְמֵיהּ, דְּאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת דְּאַנִּיגְרָא – לִבְנֵי אנִיגְרָא. דְּאַנַּהֲרָא – דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda to his reasoning, as Rav Yehuda says: four cubits to a channel to the residents of the channel, to a river to everyone.
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah according to his reasoning, as Rav Yehudah said: Four cubits of Anigra - for the sons of Anigra. Of Anahara - for everyone in the world.

hebrew_text: מַכְרִיז רַבִּי אַמֵּי: מְלֵא כַּתְפֵי נַגָּדֵי בִּתְרֵי עֶבְרֵי נַהֲרָא – קוּצוּ. רַב נָתָן בַּר הוֹשַׁעְיָא קַץ שִׁיתְּסַר אַמְּתָא. אֲתוֹ עֲלֵיהּ בְּנֵי מַשְׁרוֹנְיָא, דַּפְנוּהּ. הוּא סָבַר כִּרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים, וְלָא הִיא: הָתָם בָּעֵינַן כּוּלֵּי הַאי, הָכָא מִשּׁוּם אַמְתּוֹחֵי (אַשְׁלֵיהֶן) [אַשְׁלַיְהוּ] הוּא, כִּמְלֵא כַּתְפֵי נַגָּדֵי סַגִּי.
human_translation: Rabbi Ami announce: Cut down full shoulders the pullers on both sides the river Rav Natan bar Hoshaya cut down sixteen cubits the residents of Mashronya came upon him and beat him He holds like a public domain, But is not so, there, we require that much here, is to the stretching of the ropes full shoulders of the pullers is sufficient
llm_translation: Announced Rabbi Ammi: Fill the shoulders opposite two sides of the river - cut. Rav Natan bar Hoshaya cut sixteen cubits. The people of Mashronya came upon it, they overturned it. He thought it was a public domain, but it was not. There we require the fullness of this, here because of their shoulders, it is like filling the shoulders opposite a sack.

hebrew_text: רַבָּה בַּר רַב הוּנָא הֲוָה לֵיהּ הָהוּא אִבָּא אַגּוּדָּא דְנַהֲרָא, אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: נִיקּוֹץ מָר! אֲמַר לְהוּ: קוּצוּ עִילָּאֵי וְתַתָּאֵי, וַהֲדַר נִיקּוֹץ אֲנָא. הֵיכִי עָבֵיד הָכִי? וְהָכְתִיב: ״הִתְקוֹשְׁשׁוּ וָקוֹשּׁוּ״, וְאָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: קְשׁוֹט עַצְמְךָ וְאַחַר כָּךְ קְשׁוֹט אֲחֵרִים!
human_translation: Rabba bar Rav Huna had a certain forest on the bank of a river. They said to him: Let the Master cut down said to them: those above and below cut down and then I will cut down How can he do so, But isn’t it written: “Gather yourselves together, and gather [ hitkosheshu vakoshu ]” and Reish Lakish says Adorn [ keshot ] yourself and afterward adorn others.
llm_translation: Rabba bar Rav Huna had a certain father-in-law who lived by the river. They said to him: "Master, get up!" He said to them: "First wake up the upper and lower worlds, and then I will get up." How did he do this? And it is written: "Strengthen yourselves and strengthen others." And Reish Lakish said: "First adorn yourself, and only then adorn others!"

hebrew_text: הָתָם אִבָּא דְּבֵי פַרְזַק רוּפִילָא הֲוָה, וְאָמַר: אִי קָיְיצוּ – קָיֵיצְנָא, וְאִי לָא קָיְיצוּ – אַמַּאי אִיקּוֹץ. דְּאִי מִמַּתְחִי לְהוּ – אַשְׁלַיְיהוּ מִסְתַּגִּי לְהוּ,
human_translation: There was the forest of the house of Parzak, the general, and said: If cut down, I will cut down and if not cut down, why should I cut down Since if stretch their ropes they can go
llm_translation: There, Abba of the house of Parzak was a physician, and he said: If they have vomited - we shall cause vomiting, and if they have not vomited - why should we cause vomiting? For if they are able to expel on their own - let them expel on their own.

hebrew_text: וְאִי לָא – לָא מִיסְתַּגֵּי לְהוּ.
human_translation: and if not, they will be unable to walk,
llm_translation: And if not - not will be reconciled to them.

hebrew_text: רַבָּה בַּר רַב נַחְמָן הֲוָה קָא אָזֵיל בְּאַרְבָּא, חֲזָא הָהוּא אִבָּא דְּקָאֵי אַגּוּדָּא דְנַהְרָא. אֲמַר לְהוּ: דְּמַאן? אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: דְּרַבָּה בַּר רַב הוּנָא. אָמַר: ״וְיַד הַשָּׂרִים וְהַסְּגָנִים הָיְתָה בַּמַּעַל הַזֶּה רִאשׁוֹנָה״. אֲמַר לְהוּ: קוּצוּ. קַצּוּ.
human_translation: Rabba bar Rav Naḥman was going on a boat saw a certain forest that located on the riverbank, He said to To whom They said to him: to Rabba bar Rav Huna. said: “And the hand of the princes and the rulers has been first in this faithlessness” said to them: Cut down, cut down
llm_translation: Rabba bar Rav Nachman was going in Arbba, he saw that man, the father who was standing by the bank of the river. He said to them: Who is he? They said to him: Rabba bar Rav Huna. He said: "And the hand of the officers and the governors was first in this matter." He said to them: Cut it. Cut it.

hebrew_text: אֲתָא רַבָּה בַּר רַב הוּנָא אַשְׁכְּחֵיהּ דְּקַיִיץ, אֲמַר: מַאן קַצְיֵיהּ – תִּקּוֹץ עַנְפֵיהּ. אָמְרִי כּוּלְּהוּ שְׁנֵי דְּרַבָּה בַּר רַב הוּנָא, לָא אִקַּיַּים לֵיהּ זַרְעָא לְרַבָּה בַּר רַב נַחְמָן.
human_translation: Rabba bar Rav Huna arrived found that cut down. pronounced who cut down should his branches cut down. said: all the years that Rabba bar Rav Huna the seed of Rabba bar Rav Naḥman did not last,
llm_translation: Rabah bar Rav Huna came and found a thornbush, he said: "Whoever cut it - let his branches be cut." They all said about Rabah bar Rav Huna, that he did not fulfill the seed of Rabah bar Rav Nachman.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: הַכֹּל לְאִיגְלֵי גַפָּא, וַאֲפִילּוּ מִיַּתְמֵי – אֲבָל רַבָּנַן לָא. מַאי טַעְמָא? רַבָּנַן לָא צְרִיכִי נְטִירוּתָא. לְכַרְיָא דְפַתְיָא – וַאֲפִילּוּ מֵרַבָּנַן.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says: All for the construction of the wall, and even from orphans, but not the Torah scholars. What is the reason The Torah scholars do not require protection, for the digging of a well even from the Torah scholars.
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said: Everything is subject to the law of the edge of the roof, even a utensil. But the Rabbis do not agree. What is the reason? The Rabbis do not require a safeguard. For the roof of a bakery - even according to the Rabbis.

hebrew_text: וְלָא אֲמַרַן אֶלָּא דְּלָא נָפְקִי בְּכָלוֹזָא. אֲבָל לְכָלוֹזָא – לָא, דְּרַבָּנַן לָאו בְּנֵי מִיפַּק בְּכָלוֹזָא נִינְהוּ.
human_translation: And we said only if not go out in a crowd But in a crowd, not as Torah scholars are not who go out in a crowd
llm_translation: And we did not say except that it did not come out in a basket. But in a basket - no, for the Rabbis are not the sons of those who come out in a basket.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: לְכַרְיָא דְנַהְרָא – תַּתָּאֵי מְסַיְּיעִי עִילָּאֵי, עִילָּאֵי לָא מְסַיְּיעִי תַּתָּאֵי. וְחִילּוּפָא בְּמַיָּא דְמִיטְרָא.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says: With regard to the digging of a river, the lower ones, assist the upper ones the upper ones do not assist the lower ones, And the opposite with regard to rainwater.
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said: In the case of the riverbank - the lower ones assist the upper ones, but the upper ones do not assist the lower ones. And the exchange is in the water of the Mitra.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: חָמֵשׁ גַּנּוֹת הַמִּסְתַּפְּקוֹת מַיִם מִמַּעְיָן אֶחָד, וְנִתְקַלְקֵל הַמַּעְיָין – כּוּלָּם מְתַקְּנוֹת עִם הָעֶלְיוֹנָה. נִמְצֵאת הַתַּחְתּוֹנָה מְתַקֶּנֶת עִם כּוּלָּן וּמְתַקֶּנֶת לְעַצְמָהּ. וְכֵן חָמֵשׁ חֲצֵרוֹת שֶׁהָיוּ מְקַלְּחוֹת מַיִם לְבִיב אֶחָד, וְנִתְקַלְקֵל הַבִּיב – כּוּלָּן מְתַקְּנוֹת עִם הַתַּחְתּוֹנָה, נִמְצֵאת הָעֶלְיוֹנָה מְתַקֶּנֶת עִם כּוּלָּן וּמְתַקֶּנֶת לְעַצְמָהּ.
human_translation: This is also taught five gardens that draw water from one spring and the spring became damaged, all fix with the upper result the lower fixes with all of them and fixes it for himself And similarly, five courtyards that would run off water into a single sewer and the sewer became damaged, all fix with the lower result the upper fixes with all of them and fixes it for himself
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: Five gardens that receive water from one spring, and the spring becomes polluted - all of them are fixed with the uppermost one. If the lower one is found to be fixed, it fixes all of them and fixes itself. Similarly, five courtyards that were washing with water from one cistern, and the cistern becomes polluted - all of them are fixed with the lower one. If the uppermost one is found to be fixed, it fixes all of them and fixes itself.

hebrew_text: אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הַאי מַאן דְּאַחְזֵיק בְּרַקְתָּא דְנַהְרָא – חֲצִיפָא הָוֵי, סַלּוֹקֵי לָא מְסַלְּקִינַן לֵיהּ. וְהָאִידָּנָא דְּקָא כָּתְבִי פָּרְסָאֵי: קְנֵי לָךְ עַד מְלֵי צַוְּארֵי סוּסְיָא מַיָּא – סַלּוֹקֵי נָמֵי מְסַלְּקִינַן לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Shmuel says: One who takes possession of a riverbank is impudent. removing we do not remove him, And nowadays, when the Persians write Acquire for yourself up to the water reaches a horse’s neck, we even remove him
llm_translation: Samuel said: One who holds onto the reins of a river - he is a thief, we do not remove the locks for him. And now that they have written in Persian: "Buy for yourself until the necks of the horses are filled with water" - we indeed remove the locks for him.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: הַאי מַאן דְּאַחְזֵיק בֵּינֵי אַחֵי וּבֵינֵי שׁוּתָּפֵי, חֲצִיפָא הָוֵי. סַלּוֹקֵי לָא מְסַלְּקִינַן לֵיהּ. וְרַב נַחְמָן אָמַר: נָמֵי מְסַלְּקִינַן. וְאִי מִשּׁוּם דִּינָא דְּבַר מִצְרָא – לָא מְסַלְּקִינַן לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says Rav says: One who takes possession between brothers or between partners is impudent. removing we do not remove him, And Rav Naḥman said: We even remove And if due to the halakha of one borders we do not remove him.
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: One who holds between brothers and partners, is considered a thief. We do not remove him. And Rav Nachman said: Indeed, we do remove him. And if it is because of the law of Egypt - we do not remove him.

hebrew_text: נְהַרְדָּעֵי אָמְרִי: אֲפִילּוּ מִשּׁוּם דִּינָא דְּבַר מִצְרָא – מְסַלְּקִינַן לֵיהּ, מִשּׁוּם שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְעָשִׂיתָ הַיָּשָׁר וְהַטּוֹב בְּעֵינֵי ה׳״.
human_translation: of Neharde’a say: Even due to the halakha of one borders we remove him, as it is stated: “And you shall do that which is right and good in the eyes of the Lord”
llm_translation: The people of Nehardea said: Even for the sake of the law of Egypt - we remove it from him, because it is said: "And you shall do what is right and good in the eyes of the Lord."

hebrew_text: אֲתָא אִימְּלִיךְ בֵּיהּ, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֵיזִיל אֶיזְבּוֹן? וַאֲמַר לֵיהּ: זִיל זְבוֹן. צְרִיךְ לְמִיקְנֵא מִינֵּיהּ, אוֹ לָא? רָבִינָא אָמַר: לָא צְרִיךְ לְמִיקְנֵא מִינֵּיהּ, נְהַרְדָּעֵי אָמְרִי: צְרִיךְ לְמִיקְנֵא מִינֵּיהּ. וְהִלְכְתָא: צְרִיךְ לְמִיקְנֵא מִינֵּיהּ.
human_translation: came to consult with said to him: I go acquire and said to him, go acquire necessary to acquisition with him Or not Ravina said: not necessary to acquisition with him, of Neharde’a say: necessary to acquisition with him. And the halakha necessary to acquisition with him.
llm_translation: He came and lodged with him, he said to him: Shall I go to the market? And he said to him: Go to the market. Does he need to acquire from him or not? Ravina said: He does not need to acquire from him, the Nehardeans say: He needs to acquire from him. And the halakha is: He needs to acquire from him.

hebrew_text: הַשְׁתָּא דְּאָמְרַתְּ צְרִיךְ לְמִיקְנֵא מִינֵּיהּ, אִי לָא קְנוֹ מִינֵּיהּ – אִיַּיקּוּר וְזוּל בִּרְשׁוּתֵיהּ.
human_translation: Now that you have said necessary to acquisition with if he did not acquisition with him increased or decreased in the domain of
llm_translation: The matter of which you said, one must acquire from him, if he did not acquire from him - it is a case of acquisition and removal in his possession.

hebrew_text: זְבַן בִּמְאָה וְשָׁוֵי מָאתַן, (חָזֵינָא) [חָזֵינַן]: אִי לְכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא קָא מוֹזֵילא וּמְזַבֵּין – יָהֵיב לֵיהּ מְאָה וְשָׁקֵיל לֵיהּ. וְאִי לָא – יָהֵיב לֵיהּ מָאתַן וְשָׁקֵיל לֵיהּ.
human_translation: bought for one hundred and was worth two hundred we determine If he sells to everyone cheap gives one hundred and takes it, But if not gives two hundred and takes it.
llm_translation: He buys for a hundred and sells for two hundred, we see: if to all the world he is giving and selling - he gives it for a hundred and takes it. And if not - he gives it for two hundred and takes it.

hebrew_text: זְבַן בְּמָאתַן וְשָׁוְיָא מְאָה, סְבוּר מִינָּה, מָצֵי אָמַר לֵיהּ: לְתַקּוֹנֵי שַׁדַּרְתָּיךָ וְלָא לְעַוּוֹתֵי. אֲמַר לֵיהּ מָר קַשִּׁישָׁא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב חִסְדָּא לְרַב אָשֵׁי: הָכִי אָמְרִי נְהַרְדָּעֵי מִשּׁוּם דְּרַב נַחְמָן: אֵין אוֹנָאָה לְקַרְקָעוֹת.
human_translation: he bought for two hundred and worth one hundred understood can say to I sent you for my benefit, but not to my detriment. Mar the Elder, son of Rav Ḥisda, said to Rav Ashi: This of Neharde’a say in the name of Rav Naḥman: There is no exploitation with regard to real estate,
llm_translation: He bought for a hundred and it turned out to be worth a hundred, he thought it was from its kind, he found and said to him: "I bought it for the purpose of fixing you, not to deceive you." Mar Kashisha, son of Rav Hisda, said to Rav Ashi: "So say the Nehardeans in the name of Rav Nahman: 'There is no ona'ah with regard to land.'"

hebrew_text: זַבֵּין לֵיהּ גְּרִיוָא דְּאַרְעָא בְּמִיצְעָא נִכְסֵיהּ, חָזֵינַן אִי עִידִּית הִיא, אִי זִיבּוּרִית הִיא – זְבִינֵיהּ זְבִינֵי.
human_translation: sold to a beit se’a of land in the middle of his property we see Whether is superior-quality or whether is inferior-quality his sale sale,
llm_translation: They sell him a pit of land in the middle of his property, we see if it is a witness, if it is a ziburit - sell it.

hebrew_text: וְאִי לָא, אִיעָרוֹמֵי קָא מַעֲרֵים.
human_translation: But if not employ an artifice.
llm_translation: And if not, the naked ones are causing delay.

hebrew_text: מַתָּנָה לֵית בָּהּ מִשּׁוּם דִּינָא דְּבַר מִצְרָא. אָמַר אַמֵּימָר: אִי כְּתַב לֵיהּ אַחְרָיוּת – אִית בָּהּ מִשּׁוּם דִּינָא דְּבַר מִצְרָא.
human_translation: a gift, it is not subject to the halakha of one borders Ameimar said: If he wrote guarantee to it is subject to the halakha of one borders
llm_translation: Gift, there is not in it because of the law of Egypt. Amar Ameimar: If he wrote after it - there is in it because of the law of Egypt.

hebrew_text: מָכַר כׇּל נְכָסָיו לְאֶחָד – לֵית בַּהּ מִשּׁוּם דִּינָא דְּבַר מִצְרָא. לִבְעָלִים הָרִאשׁוֹנִים – לֵית בַּהּ מִשּׁוּם דִּינָא דְּבַר מִצְרָא. זְבַן מִגּוֹי וְזַבֵּין לְגוֹי – לֵית בַּהּ מִשּׁוּם דִּינָא דְּבַר מִצְרָא.
human_translation: sold all his property to a single this is not subject to the halakha of one borders to the previous owners, this is not subject to the halakha of one borders bought from a gentile or sold to a gentile, this is not subject to the halakha of one borders
llm_translation: He sold all his possessions to one - there is no issue of the law of Egypt in it. To the original owners - there is no issue of the law of Egypt in it. He buys from a gentile and sells to a gentile - there is no issue of the law of Egypt in it.

hebrew_text: זְבַן מִגּוֹי – דַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֲרִי אַבְרַחִי לָךְ מִמִּצְרָךְ. זַבֵּין לְגוֹי – גּוֹי וַדַּאי לָאו בַּר ״וְעָשִׂיתָ הַיָּשָׁר וְהַטּוֹב״ הוּא. שַׁמּוֹתֵי וַדַּאי מְשַׁמְּתִינַן לֵיהּ, עַד דִּמְקַבֵּל עֲלֵיהּ כֹּל אוּנְסֵי דְּאָתֵי לֵיהּ מֵחֲמָתֵיהּ.
human_translation: bought from a gentile as he say to I have chased away a lion for you from the border; sold to a gentile, gentile is certainly not bound “And you shall do that which is right and good in the eyes of the Lord” we certainly excommunicate until he accepts upon himself all accidents that befall on account.
llm_translation: Purchase from a non-Jew - for he said to him: "I will surely go with you from your Egypt." Selling to a non-Jew - a non-Jew is certainly not a son of "And you shall do what is right and good." We certainly apply his name to him, until he accepts upon himself all the troubles that come to him because of her.

hebrew_text: מַשְׁכַּנְתָּא לֵית בַּהּ מִשּׁוּם דִּינָא דְּבַר מִצְרָא. דְּאָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: אֲמַרוּ לִי סָבֵי דְּמָתָא מַחְסֵיָא: מַאי ״מַשְׁכַּנְתָּא״ – דִּשְׁכוּנָה גַּבֵּיהּ. מַאי נָפְקָא מִינַּהּ – לְדִינָא דְּבַר מִצְרָא.
human_translation: a mortgage this is not subject to the halakha of one borders as Rav Ashi said: The elders of Mata Meḥasya said to me: What mortgage [ mashkanta ]? that resides [ shekhuna ] with What difference does it make with regard to the halakha of one borders
llm_translation: The Tabernacle does not have in it the law of Egypt. For Rav Ashe said: The elders of the town of Machseya told me: What is "מַשְׁכַּנְתָּא" - that its dwelling is within it. What is derived from it - for the law of Egypt.

hebrew_text: לִמְכּוֹר בְּרָחוֹק וְלִגְאוֹל בְּקָרוֹב, בְּרַע וְלִגְאוֹל בְּיָפֶה – לֵית בַּהּ מִשּׁוּם דִּינָא דְּבַר מִצְרָא.
human_translation: to sell a distant and to redeem, a close a bad to redeem a good this is not subject to the halakha of one borders
llm_translation: To sell in a distant place and to redeem nearby, in a bad state and to redeem in a good state - there is no issue of the law of Egypt in it.

hebrew_text: לִכְרָגָא וְלִמְזוֹנֵי וְלִקְבוּרָה – לֵית בַּהּ מִשּׁוּם דִּינָא דְּבַר מִצְרָא. דְּאָמְרִי נְהַרְדְּעָאֵי: לִכְרָגָא, לִמְזוֹנֵי וְלִקְבוּרָה מְזַבְּנִינַן בְּלָא אַכְרַזְתָּא. לְאִשָּׁה וּלְיַתְמֵי וּלְשׁוּתָּפֵי – לֵית בַּהּ מִשּׁוּם דִּינָא דְּבַר מִצְרָא.
human_translation: for taxes, for sustenance, or for burial this is not subject to the halakha of one borders because Neharde’a said: For taxes, for sustenance, and for burial we sell without a proclamation, to a woman, or to orphans, or to partners, this is not subject to the halakha of one borders
llm_translation: To the grave, to sustenance, and to burial - there is no obligation of a proclamation. For the Nehardeans say: To the grave, to sustenance, and to burial we transact without a proclamation. For a woman, orphans, and partners - there is no obligation of a proclamation.

hebrew_text: שְׁכֵינֵי הָעִיר וּשְׁכֵינֵי שָׂדֶה – שְׁכֵינֵי הָעִיר קוֹדְמִין.
human_translation: neighbors of the city, and neighbors of the field, neighbors of the city precedence.
llm_translation: The residents of the city and the residents of the field - the residents of the city take precedence.

hebrew_text: שָׁכֵן וְתַלְמִיד חָכָם – תַּלְמִיד חָכָם קוֹדֵם. קָרוֹב וְתַלְמִיד חָכָם – תַּלְמִיד חָכָם קוֹדֵם. אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: שָׁכֵן וְקָרוֹב מַאי? תָּא שְׁמַע: ״טוֹב שָׁכֵן קָרוֹב מֵאָח רָחוֹק״.
human_translation: neighbor and a Torah scholar, the Torah scholar precedence. a relative and a Torah scholar, the Torah scholar precedence. A dilemma was raised before a neighbor and a relative, what Come hear “Better a neighbor who is near than a brother who is far”
llm_translation: Neighbor and Torah scholar - Torah scholar precedes. Relative and Torah scholar - Torah scholar precedes. They asked: What is the case of a neighbor and a relative? Come and hear: "Better a neighbor nearby than a brother far away."

hebrew_text: הָנֵי זוּזֵי טָבֵי וְהָנֵי זוּזֵי תְּקוּלֵי – לֵית בֵּיהּ מִשּׁוּם דִּינָא דְּבַר מִצְרָא. הָנֵי צַיְירִי וְהָנֵי שְׁרוּ – לֵית בֵּיהּ מִשּׁוּם דִּינָא דְּבַר מִצְרָא.
human_translation: these good dinars, and those weighed dinars, this is not subject to the halakha of one borders these wrapped up and those loose, this is not subject to the halakha of one borders
llm_translation: These are the coins of Tavei and these are the coins of Tekulei - there is no legal significance in them. These are the coins of Zayiri and these are the coins of Shru - there is no legal significance in them.

hebrew_text: אָמַר: אֵיזִיל וְאֶטְרַח וְאַיְיתֵי זוּזֵי – לָא נָטְרִינַן לֵיהּ. אָמַר: אֵיזִיל אַיְיתֵי זוּזֵי, חָזֵינַן: אִי גַּבְרָא דַּאֲמִיד הוּא דְּאָזֵיל וּמַיְיתֵי זוּזֵי – נָטְרִינַן לֵיהּ, וְאִי לָא – לָא נָטְרִינַן לֵיהּ.
human_translation: said: I will go and expend effort and bring money, we do not wait for him, he said: I will go bring money, we see If he is a person who is assessed who can go and bring money we wait for him, but if not, we do not wait for him.
llm_translation: He said: "I will go and exert effort and bring money - we do not rely on it." He said: "If I go and bring money, we see: if it is a trustworthy person who goes and brings money - we rely on him, and if not - we do not rely on him."

hebrew_text: אַרְעָא דְּחַד וּבָתֵּי דְּחַד – מָרֵי אַרְעָא מְעַכֵּב אַמָּרֵי בָּתֵּי, מָרֵי בָּתֵּי לָא מְעַכֵּב אַמָּרֵי דְּאַרְעָא. אַרְעָא דְּחַד וְדִיקְלֵי דְּחַד – מָרֵי דְּאַרְעָא מָצֵי מְעַכֵּב אַמָּרֵי דִּקְלֵי, מָרֵי דִּיקְלֵי לָא מָצֵי מְעַכֵּב אַמָּרֵי דְּאַרְעָא.
human_translation: land to one and the houses to one, the owner of the land prevents the owner of the houses the owner of the houses does not prevent the owner of the land land to one and palm trees to one, the owner of the land can prevent the owner of the palm trees the owner of the palm trees cannot prevent the owner of the land
llm_translation: The land of one and the trees of one - the owners of the land delay, the owners of the trees do not delay, they say it is because of the land. The land of one and the palm trees of one - the owners of the land find delay, they say it is because of the palm trees, the owners of the palm trees do not find delay, they say it is because of the land.

hebrew_text: אַרְעָא לְבָתֵּי וְאַרְעָא לְזַרְעָא – יִשּׁוּב עֲדִיף, וְלֵית בַּהּ מִשּׁוּם דִּינָא דְּבַר מִצְרָא.
human_translation: land for houses and the land for planting, the settling preferable, and this is not subject to the halakha of one borders
llm_translation: Land for the daughter and land for the seed - returning is preferable, and there is no in it because of the law of Egypt.

hebrew_text: אַפְסֵיק מְשׁוּנִּיתָא אוֹ רִיכְבָּא דְּדִיקְלָא, (חָזֵינָא) [חָזֵינַן]: אִם יָכוֹל לְהַכְנִיס בָּהּ אֲפִילּוּ תֶּלֶם אֶחָד – אִית בַּהּ מִשּׁוּם דִּינָא דְּבַר מִצְרָא, וְאִי לָא – לֵית בַּהּ מִשּׁוּם דִּינָא דְּבַר מִצְרָא.
human_translation: a jagged edge of rock or a row of palm trees served as a barrier we see If can insert even a single furrow there this is subject to the halakha of one borders But if not this is not subject to the halakha of one borders
llm_translation: Talmudic text: If it is possible to insert even one chip into it - it contains the law of a utensil of a palm tree, and if not - it does not contain the law of a utensil of a palm tree.

hebrew_text: הָנֵי אַרְבָּעָה בְּנֵי מִצְרָנֵי, דְּקָדֵים חַד מִינַּיְיהוּ וְזָבֵין – זְבִינֵיהּ זְבִינֵי. וְאִי כּוּלְּהוּ אָתוּ בַּהֲדֵי הֲדָדֵי – פָּלְגוּ לַהּ בְּקַרְנְזִיל.
human_translation: those four bordering neighbors one of them preceded and purchased his purchase purchase And if they all came simultaneously they divide with diagonal
llm_translation: These are the four sons of Mitzranai, one of them was more diligent and they would slaughter - his slaughtering was slaughtering. And if all of them came together - they divided it with him in Karnzil.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַמְקַבֵּל שָׂדֶה מֵחֲבֵירוֹ לְשָׁנִים מוּעָטוֹת – לֹא יִזְרָעֶנָּה פִּשְׁתָּן, וְאֵין לוֹ בְּקוֹרוֹת שִׁקְמָה. קִיבְּלָהּ הֵימֶנּוּ לְשֶׁבַע שָׁנִים – שָׁנָה רִאשׁוֹנָה יִזְרָעֶנָּה פִּשְׁתָּן, וְיֵשׁ לוֹ בְּקוֹרוֹת שִׁקְמָה.
human_translation: who receives a field from another for a few years, may not plant flax in it, and he does not have to beams sycamore he received from him for seven years, the first year he plant flax in it, and he does have to beams sycamore
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who receives a field from his fellow for a few years - he shall not sow flax in it, and he does not have the right to plant sycamore trees. If he received it from him for seven years - in the first year he may sow flax in it, and he has the right to plant sycamore trees.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: בְּקוֹרוֹת שִׁקְמָה – אֵין לוֹ, בִּשְׁבַח שִׁקְמָה – יֵשׁ לוֹ. וְרָבָא אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ בִּשְׁבַח שִׁקְמָה נָמֵי אֵין לוֹ.
human_translation: Abaye says: he does not have to beams sycamore he does have to the enhancement of the sycamore And Rava says: He does not even have to the enhancement of the sycamore
llm_translation: Gemara said Abaye: in a grove of sycamores - he does not have, in praise of sycamores - he has. And Rava said: even in praise of sycamores also he does not have.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: הַמְקַבֵּל שָׂדֶה מֵחֲבֵירוֹ וְהִגִּיעַ זְמַנּוֹ לָצֵאת – שָׁמִין לוֹ. מַאי לָאו: שָׁמִין לוֹ בִּשְׁבַח שִׁקְמָה? לָא, שָׁמִין לוֹ יַרְקָא וְסִילְקָא.
human_translation: raises an objection one who receives a field from another and his time to leave arrives, appraises for him. What, is it not appraises for him the enhancement of the sycamore No, appraises for him the vegetables and beets
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: It was asked: One who receives a field from his fellow, and its time to produce has arrived - we estimate for him. What is the reason? Is it not that we estimate for him in praise of the barley? No, we estimate for him in praise of the vegetables and legumes.

hebrew_text: יַרְקָא וְסִילְקָא – נַעֲקוֹר וְנִשְׁקוֹל! בִּדְלָא מְטָא יוֹמָא דְשׁוּקָא.
human_translation: vegetables and beets, let him uproot and take where the market day has not arrived,
llm_translation: Yarka and Silka - pierce and remove! If not, on the day of the market.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: הַמְקַבֵּל שָׂדֶה מֵחֲבֵירוֹ וְהִגִּיעַ שְׁבִיעִית, שָׁמִין לוֹ. שְׁבִיעִית מִי קָא מַפְקְעָא אַרְעָא? אֶלָּא אֵימָא: הַמְקַבֵּל שָׂדֶה מֵחֲבֵירוֹ וְהִגִּיעַ יוֹבֵל, שָׁמִין לוֹ.
human_translation: Come hear who receives a field from another and the Sabbatical arrived, appraises for him. Does Sabbatical release land Rather, say who receives a field from another and the Jubilee arrived, appraises for him.
llm_translation: Come and hear: One who receives a field from his fellow and the Sabbatical year arrives, we estimate for him. Who is it that is exempt from the Sabbatical year? Rather say: One who receives a field from his fellow and the Jubilee year arrives, we estimate for him.

hebrew_text: וְאַכַּתִּי, יוֹבֵל מִי מַפְקְעָא קַבְּלָנוּת? ״לִצְמִיתֻת״ אָמַר רַחֲמָנָא! אֶלָּא אֵימָא: הַלּוֹקֵחַ שָׂדֶה מֵחֲבֵירוֹ וְהִגִּיעַ יוֹבֵל – שָׁמִין לוֹ.
human_translation: But still, does Jubilee release a contractor? The Merciful One states: “Permanently” Rather, say one who purchases a field from another and the Jubilee arrives, appraises for him.
llm_translation: And when, Jubilee who from releases we receive? "To destruction" said the Merciful One! Rather say: One who acquires a field from his fellow and the Jubilee arrived – we listen to him.

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא הָכִי נָמֵי, שָׁמִין לוֹ בְּיַרְקָא וְסִילְקָא? סִילְקָא וְיַרְקָא בְּיוֹבֵל הֶפְקֵירָא הוּא! אֶלָּא לָאו, שְׁבַח שִׁקְמָה!
human_translation: And if you would say so too appraises for him with regard to vegetables and beets, vegetables and beets in the Jubilee are ownerless. Rather, not the enhancement of the sycamore that occurred
llm_translation: And if you will say so, do we listen to him in regards to vegetables and legumes? Legumes and vegetables are in the Jubilee year, for it is ownerless! Rather, no, praise the almond tree!

hebrew_text: תַּרְגְּמַהּ אַבָּיֵי אַלִּיבָּא דְּרָבָא: שָׁאנֵי הָתָם, דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״וְיָצָא מִמְכַּר בַּיִת״. מִמְכָּר – חוֹזֵר, שֶׁבַח – אֵינוֹ חוֹזֵר. וְנִגְמַר מִינֵּיהּ? הָתָם זְבִינֵי מְעַלְּיָא הוּא, וְיוֹבֵל אַפְקַעְתָּא דְּמַלְכָּא הִיא.
human_translation: Abaye interpreted in accordance with of Rava: There it is different, as the verse states: “Then the house that was sold shall go out sold returns enhancement not return, let us derive from it there, a full-fledged sale, and the Jubilee is a release of the King,
llm_translation: Translate the following text into English word-for-word, maintaining the original style and format of Talmudic discourse. Talmudic text: Targemah Abbayei Alibba deRava: Sha'anei hatam, de'amar kra: "ve-yatza mimkar bayit." Mimkar - chozer, shevach - einu chozer. Ve-nigmar mineih? Hatam zevinei me'alleiya hu, ve-yovel apka'ta de-malka hi. English translation: Interpret Abbayei in the house of Rava: It is different there, as the verse says: "and he shall go out in the sale of a house." Sale - returns, praise - does not return. And is its type completed? There, it is the merchandise of the upper market, and the produce of the king's storehouse.

hebrew_text: רַב פָּפָּא קַבֵּיל אַרְעָא לְאַסְפַּסְתָּא. קְדַחוּ בַּהּ תָּאלֵי. כִּי קָא מִסְתַּלַּק, אֲמַר לְהוּ: הַבוּ לִי שְׁבָחָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב שִׁישָׁא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אִידִי לְרַב פָּפָּא: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה, דִּיקְלָא וַאֲלֵים, הָכִי נָמֵי דְּבָעֵי מָר שְׁבָחֵיהּ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָתָם לָאו אַדַּעְתָּא דְּהָכִי נָחֵית, אֲנָא הָכָא אַדַּעְתָּא דְּהָכִי נְחֵיתְנָא.
human_translation: Rav Pappa received land for hay. palm trees sprouted in When he left he said to Give me the enhancement Rav Sheisha, son of Rav Idi, said to Rav Pappa: If that is so, a palm tree and it grew thick, so too would the Master, want enhancement? said to him: There, did not descend with that in mind, Here, I did descend with this in mind,
llm_translation: Rav Papa received land for a gathering. They dug in it furrows. When he was departing, he said to them: Give me praise. Rav Shisha, son of Rav Idi, said to Rav Papa: Rather, from now on, palm trees and date palms, is this what the Master seeks praise for? He said to him: There, you did not know that this is what I sought, but here, you know that this is what I seek.

hebrew_text: כְּמַאן? כְּאַבַּיֵּי, דְּאָמַר: בִּשְׁבַח שִׁקְמָה יֵשׁ לוֹ. אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא כְּרָבָא, הָתָם לֵית לֵיהּ פְּסֵידָא. הָכָא אִיכָּא פְּסֵידָא.
human_translation: In accordance with whose in accordance with Abaye, who says he does have to the enhancement of the sycamore? You even say in accordance with Rava, there no loss here there is a loss,
llm_translation: As whom? As Abbaye, who said: In praise of the sycamore tree he has. Even if you say as Rava, there is no loss there. Here there is a loss.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לֵיהּ: מַאי פְּסֵדָיךְ יְדָא דְּאַסְפַּסְתָּא, שְׁקוֹל יְדָא דְאַסְפַּסְתָּא וְזִיל! אָמַר לֵיהּ: אֲנָא כּוּרְכְּמָא רִישְׁקָא רַבַּאי. אָמַר לֵיהּ: גַּלֵּית אַדַּעְתָּךְ דִּלְמִשְׁקַל וְאִסְתַּלּוֹקֵי עֲבַדְתְּ – שְׁקֹל כּוּרְכְּמָא רִישְׁקָא וְזִיל, אֵין לְךָ אֶלָּא דְּמֵי עֵצִים בִּלְבַד.
human_translation: said to Rav Pappa: What loss have I caused you? a handful of hay. Take a handful of hay and go. said to him: I grew garden saffron said to him: you revealed your intention that you acted to take and leave. Take garden saffron and leave, you have only the value of wood alone.
llm_translation: He said to him: What is your loss, hand of the collector, weigh the hand of the collector and go! He said to him: I am like a head of cabbage. He said to him: Reveal your knowledge, perhaps you have weighed and found wanting - weigh the head of cabbage and go, you have nothing but the value of wood alone.

hebrew_text: רַב בִּיבִי בַּר אַבָּיֵי קַבֵּיל אַרְעָא וְאַהְדַּר לֵיהּ מְשׁוּנִּיתָא, קְדַחוּ בֵּיהּ זַרְדָּתָא. כִּי קָא מִיסְתַּלַּק אֲמַר לְהוּ: הַבוּ לִי שְׁבָחַאי. אָמַר רַב פַּפֵּי: מִשּׁוּם דְּאָתֵיתוּ מִמּוּלָאֵי אָמְרִיתוּ מִילֵּי מוּלְיָיתָא?! אֲפִילּוּ רַב פָּפָּא לָא אֲמַר אֶלָּא דְּאִית לֵיהּ פְּסֵידָא, הָכָא מַאי פְּסֵידָא אִית לָךְ.
human_translation: Rav Beivai bar Abaye received land and surrounded it a fence of earth. trees sprouted in it. When he left he said to Give me my enhancement Rav Pappi said: because you come from unfortunate people you say unfortunate words? Even Rav Pappa said only when has a loss, Here, what loss do you have?
llm_translation: Rav Bibi son of Abbaye received a measure and returned it altered, they found a worm in it. When he was departing, he said to them: "Give me my praise." Rav Pappa said: Because they came from the east, you spoke eastern words?! Even Rav Papa did not say except that there is a loss to him, what loss do you have here.

hebrew_text: רַב יוֹסֵף הֲוָה לֵיהּ הָהוּא שַׁתָּלָא, שְׁכֵיב וּשְׁבַק חַמְשָׁה חַתְנָווֹתָא. אֲמַר עַד הָאִידָּנָא חַד, הַשְׁתָּא חַמְשָׁה. עַד הָאִידָּנָא לָא הֲווֹ סָמְכוּ אַהֲדָדֵי וְלָא מַפְסְדוּ לִי, הַשְׁתָּא חַמְשָׁה סָמְכוּ אַהֲדָדֵי וּמַפְסְדוּ לִי. אֲמַר לְהוּ: אִי שָׁקְלִיתוּ שְׁבָחַיְיכוּ וּמִסְתַּלְּקִיתוּ – מוּטָב, וְאִי לָא – מְסַלֵּיקְנָא לְכוּ בְּלָא שְׁבָחָא.
human_translation: Rav Yosef had a certain planter He died and left five sons-in-law. said: Until now one now five. Until now they did not rely on each other and did not cause me a loss, now five they will rely on each other and cause me a loss. said to them: If you take your enhancement and remove well, but if not, I will remove you without the enhancement.
llm_translation: Rav Yosef had a certain plant, he would lie down and leave it for five hours. He said until now one, now five. Until now they did not rely on each other and did not cause me loss, now they rely on each other and cause me loss. He said to them: If you have taken my praises and departed - good, and if not - I will dismiss you without praise.

hebrew_text: דְּאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה, וְאִיתֵּימָא רַב הוּנָא, וְאִיתֵּימָא רַב נַחְמָן: הַאי שַׁתָּלָא דִּשְׁכֵיב – יוֹרְשִׁין דִּילֵיהּ (מִסְתַּלְּקִין) [מְסַלְּקִינַן] לְהוּ בְּלָא שְׁבָחָא. וְלָאו מִילְּתָא הִיא.
human_translation: As Rav Yehuda says, and some say Rav Huna, and some say Rav Naḥman: this planter who died, his heirs may be removed without enhancement. But this is not correct,
llm_translation: The text reads: "For Rav Yehudah said, and some say it was Rav Huna, and some say it was Rav Nachman: This hanging branch - its heirs (are) removed to be without praise. And this is not a matter."

hebrew_text: הָהוּא שַׁתָּלָא דַּאֲמַר לְהוּ: אִי מַפְסֵדְינָא מִסְתַּלַּקְנָא. אַפְסֵיד. אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: מִסְתַּלַּק בְּלָא שְׁבָחָא. רַב כָּהֲנָא אָמַר: מִסְתַּלַּק וְשָׁקֵיל שְׁבָחָא. וּמוֹדֶה רַב כָּהֲנָא דְּאִי אָמַר אִי [מַ]פְסֵידְנָא מִסְתַּלַּקְנָא בְּלָא שְׁבָחָא, מִסְתַּלַּק בְּלָא שְׁבָחָא. רָבָא אָמַר: אַסְמַכְתָּא הִיא, וְאַסְמַכְתָּא לָא קָנְיָא.
human_translation: a certain planter who said to If I cause a loss I will leave caused a loss Rav Yehuda said: He leaves without the enhancement, Rav Kahana said: He leaves and takes the enhancement And Rav Kahana concedes that if he said: If I cause a loss I will leave without the enhancement, he leaves without the enhancement. Rava said: is a transaction with inconclusive intent [ asmakhta ], and an asmakhta does not effect acquisition
llm_translation: That palm tree, he said to them: If we are losing, let us uproot. We will lose. Rav Yehudah said: Uprooting without praise. Rav Kahana said: Uprooting and taking praise. And Rav Kahana admits that if he said if we are losing, let us uproot without praise, he uproots without praise. Rava said: It is a support, and a support does not acquire.

hebrew_text: וּלְרָבָא מַאי שְׁנָא מֵהָא דִּתְנַן: אִם אוֹבִיר וְלָא אַעֲבֵיד אֲשַׁלֵּם בְּמֵיטְבָא! הָתָם מַאי דְּאַפְסֵיד – מְשַׁלֵּם, הָכָא מַאי דְּאַפְסֵיד – מְנַכֵּינַן לֵיהּ וְאִידַּךְ יָהֲבִינַן לֵיהּ.
human_translation: And according to Rava, what is different from that which we learned If I let lie fallow and do not cultivate I will pay with the best There, he pays the loss he caused, here, we deduct from him the loss that he caused, and we give him the other
llm_translation: And for Rava, what is different from what we learned: "If one transgresses and does not repent, he shall pay with the best!" There, what is the loss - he pays, here, what is the loss - we remove from him, and the other we give to him.
