hebrew_text: רוּנְיָא שַׁתָּלָא דְרָבִינָא הֲוָה אַפְסֵיד. סַלְּקֵיהּ אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרָבָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ חֲזִי מָר מַאי קָא עָבֵיד לִי! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: שַׁפִּיר עֲבַיד. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָא לֹא הִתְרָה בִּי! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָא (צְרִיכָא לְהַתְרוֹת) [צְרִיכַתְּ לְאַתְרוֹיֵי]. רָבָא לְטַעְמֵיהּ, דְּאָמַר רָבָא: מַקְרֵי דַרְדְּקֵי שַׁתָּלָא טַבָּחָא וְאוּמָּנָא
human_translation: Runya was the planter of Ravina. caused a loss, removed him came before Rava said to him: the Master see what has done to me. said to him: did well, said to him: But did not warn me said to him: is not necessary to provide a warning. Rava to his reasoning, as Rava said: a teacher of children, a planter, a ritual slaughterer, and a bloodletter,
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "Runya, the son of Ravina, was negligent. He went and stood before Rava. Rava said to him, 'See, sir, what are you doing to me!' He said to him, 'I am doing well.' He said to him, 'But did you not permit me?' He said to him, 'You need to be permitted.' Rava according to his reasoning, for Rava said: 'The paths of a negligent person lead to the slaughterhouse and the craftsman.'"

hebrew_text: וְסָפַר מָתָא – כּוּלָּן כְּמוּתְרִין וְעוֹמְדִין דָּמֵי. כְּלָלָא דְּמִילְּתָא: כֹּל פְּסֵידָא דְּלָא הָדַר – כְּמוּתְרִין וְעוֹמְדִין דָּמֵי.
human_translation: and a town scribe all of these are considered forewarned. The principle of matter any loss that is not recoverable they are considered forewarned.
llm_translation: "And he will count the money - all are considered like leftovers and stand in place. General principle: any loss that cannot be rectified - is considered like leftovers and stands in place."

hebrew_text: הָהוּא שַׁתָּלָא, דַּאֲמַר לְהוּ: הַבוּ לִי שְׁבָחַאי דְּבָעֵינָא לְמִיסַּק לְאַרְעָא דְיִשְׂרָאֵל. אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב פָּפָּא בַּר שְׁמוּאֵל. אֲמַר לְהוּ: הַבוּ לֵיהּ שְׁבָחֵיהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא: אִיהוּ אַשְׁבַּח, אַרְעָא לָא אַשְׁבַּח! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֲנָא פַּלְגָא דִּשְׁבָחָא קָאָמֵינָא לָךְ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: עַד הָאִידָּנָא הֲוָה שָׁקֵיל בַּעַל הַבַּיִת פַּלְגָא וְשַׁתָּלָא פַּלְגָא. הַשְׁתָּא בָּעֵי לְמִיתַּב מְנָתָא לַאֲרִיסָא! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: רִיבְעָא דִשְׁבָחָא קָאָמֵינָא.
human_translation: a certain planter who said to Give me my enhancement because I wish to ascend to Eretz Yisrael. came before Rav Pappa bar Shmuel, said to him: Give the value of his enhancement. Rava said to he enhance the land did not enhance it? said to I am telling you half the enhancement. said to him: Until now the owner of the land would take half and the planter half, Now also needs to give a portion to the sharecropper, said to him: I am telling you one-quarter of the enhancement,
llm_translation: That one planted, for he said to them: "Give me my praises that I may go down to the land of Israel." He came before Rav Papa son of Shmuel. He said to them: "Give him his praises." Rava said to him: "He may praise, but the land will not praise!" He said to him: "I am half of the praise standing for you." He said to him: "Until now, the homeowner took half and the planter took half. Now, do you want to sit on the land alone?" He said to him: "I am standing on a quarter of the praise."

hebrew_text: סְבַר רַב אָשֵׁי לְמֵימַר ״רִיבְעָא״ דְּהוּא דַּנְקָא. דְּאָמַר רַב מִנְיוֹמֵי בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב נְחוּמִי: בְּאַתְרָא דְּשָׁקֵיל שַׁתָּלָא פַּלְגָא וַאֲרִיסָא תִּילְתָּא, הַאי שַׁתָּלָא דְּבָעֵי לְאִסְתַּלּוֹקֵי – יָהֲבִינַן לֵיהּ שְׁבָחָא וּמְסַלְּקִינַן לֵיהּ כִּי הֵיכִי דְּלָא נִמְטְיֵיהּ הֶפְסֵד לְבַעַל הַבַּיִת.
human_translation: Rav Ashi thought to say one-quarter that is one-sixth, As Rav Minyumi, son of Rav Naḥumi, said: In a location where the planter takes half and the sharecropper one-third, with regard to a planter who wants to leave, we give him the enhancement and remove him so that the homeowner should suffer no loss.
llm_translation: Rav Ashi thought to say, "Rib'aa" is the one who is called Danqa. For Rav heard from his son, Rav Nachumi: In a place where one plants half a row of cabbage and half a row of beets, this cabbage, which requires to be uprooted, we give it praise and remove it so that the homeowner does not incur a loss.

hebrew_text: אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא רִיבְעָא דְּהוּא דַּנְקָא – שַׁפִּיר, אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ רִיבְעָא מַמָּשׁ, קָא מָטֵי לֵיהּ פְּסֵידָא לְבַעַל הַבַּיִת פַּלְגָא דַּנְקָא!
human_translation: Granted, if you say one-quarter that is one-sixth, well but if you say an actual quarter, the homeowner suffers the loss of half of one-sixth.
llm_translation: If you say "a quarter of a log" - that's fine, but if you say "a literal quarter," it causes a loss to the homeowner, a half of a log!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אַחָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יוֹסֵף לְרַב אָשֵׁי, וְלֵימָא לֵיהּ: אַנְתְּ מְנָתָא דִּילָךְ – הַב לֵיהּ לַאֲרִיסָא, וַאֲנָא מְנָתָא דִּילִי מַאי דְּבָעֵינָא עָבֵידְנָא בֵּיהּ. אָמַר: כִּי מָטֵית לִשְׁחִיטַת קֳדָשִׁים, תָּא וְאַקְשִׁי לִי.
human_translation: Rav Aḥa, son of Rav Yosef, said to Rav Ashi: Let say to You give your portion to the sharecropper, and I will do what I wish with my portion. said When you reach The slaughter of sacrificial come and ask to me.
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Acha, son of Rav Yosef, said to Rav Ashi, and let him say to him: "You have your portion - give it to the plowman, and I will do what I need with my portion." He said: "When you go to slaughter holy offerings, come and ask me."

hebrew_text: גּוּפָא, אָמַר רַב מִנְיוֹמֵי בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב נְחוּמִי: בְּאַתְרָא דְּשָׁקֵיל שַׁתָּלָא פַּלְגָא וַאֲרִיסָא תִּילְתָּא, הַאי שַׁתָּלָא דְּבָעֵי אִיסְתַּלּוֹקֵי – יָהֲבִינַן לֵיהּ שְׁבָחֵיהּ וּמְסַלְּקִינַן לֵיהּ כִּי הֵיכִי דְּלָא לִיפְסוֹד בַּעַל הַבַּיִת. אָמַר רַב מִנְיוֹמֵי בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב נְחוּמִי: קוֹפָא סָבָא – פַּלְגָא. שַׁטְפַהּ נַהֲרָא – רִיבְעָא.
human_translation: the itself, Rav Minyumi, son of Rav Naḥumi, said: In a location where the planter takes half and the sharecropper one-third, a planter who wants to leave, we give him the enhancement and remove him so that the homeowner should suffer no loss. Rav Minyumi, son of Rav Naḥumi, said: an old vine half. a river flooded one-quarter.
llm_translation: The body, Rav Minyumei, son of Rav Nachumi, said: In a place where one plants half a furrow and a third, this furrow that requires irrigation - we give it praise and remove it so that the homeowner will not be disappointed. Rav Minyumei, son of Rav Nachumi, said: A small cup is half. If a river overflows - it is a quarter.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא גַּבְרָא דְּמַשְׁכֵּין פַּרְדֵּיסָא לְחַבְרֵיהּ לַעֲשַׂר שְׁנִין, וְקַשׁ לַחֲמֵשׁ שְׁנִין. אַבָּיֵי אָמַר: פֵּירָא הָוֵי. רָבָא אָמַר: קַרְנָא הָוֵי, וְיִלָּקַח בּוֹ קַרְקַע, וְהוּא אוֹכֵל פֵּירוֹת.
human_translation: a certain man who mortgaged an orchard to another, for ten years But aged after five years Abaye said: is produce Rava said: is principal but land purchased with and consumes the produce
llm_translation: That man who planted a vineyard for his friends for ten years, and it was difficult for five years. Abbaye said: It was a wild grapevine. Rava said: It was a horned vine, and let the ground be taken from it, and it will produce its fruit.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: יָבַשׁ הָאִילָן אוֹ נִקְצַץ, שְׁנֵיהֶם אֲסוּרִים בּוֹ. כֵּיצַד יַעֲשׂוּ? יִמָּכְרוּ לְעֵצִים, וְיִלָּקַח בָּהֶן קַרְקַע, וְהוּא אוֹכֵל פֵּירוֹת. מַאי לָאו, יָבַשׁ דּוּמְיָא דְּנִקְצַץ: מָה נִקְצַץ בִּזְמַנּוֹ, אַף יָבַשׁ בִּזְמַנּוֹ, וְקָתָנֵי: יִלָּקַח בָּהֶן קַרְקַע וְהוּא אוֹכֵל פֵּירוֹת. אַלְמָא קַרְנָא הָוֵי!
human_translation: raises an objection the tree dried up or was chopped down, forbidden both it How they proceed? is sold for wood, and land should be purchased with and he, consumes the produce What, is it not a dry similar that was chopped down, just as was chopped down at its time, so too, dried at its time? And teaches land should be purchased with and consumes the produce. Apparently, is principal,
llm_translation: Challenger: A tree that dried up or was cut down, both are prohibited with it. How should they act? They should be sold for wood, and with them, land should be acquired, and he eats its fruits. What is the reason? Dried up is similar to cut down: just as cut down at its time, so too dried up at its time. And it teaches: land should be acquired with them, and he eats its fruits. It is evident that it is considered like a horn!

hebrew_text: לָא: נִקְצַץ דּוּמְיָא דְּיָבַשׁ, מָה יָבַשׁ בְּלֹא זְמַנּוֹ – אַף נִקְצַץ בְּלֹא זְמַנּוֹ.
human_translation: No, chopped-down similar to dry Just as dried up before its time, so too, was chopped down before its time.
llm_translation: Not yet translated.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: נָפְלוּ לָהּ גְּפָנִים וְזֵיתִים זְקֵנִים –
human_translation: Come hear old vines and olive bequeathed to her
llm_translation: Come and hear: "Old grapevines and olive trees fell for her -"

hebrew_text: יִמָּכְרוּ לְעֵצִים, וְיִלָּקַח בָּהֶן קַרְקַע, וְהוּא אוֹכֵל פֵּירוֹת. אֵימָא: וְהִזְקִינוּ.
human_translation: are sold as wood and land is acquired with them, and consumes the produce, say: And they grew old,
llm_translation: They shall be sold for wood, and with them land shall be acquired, and he eats its fruits. Perhaps: And they shall grow old.

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: לָאו מִי אוֹקֵימְנָא לְהַהִיא כְּגוֹן שֶׁנָּפְלוּ לָהּ בְּשָׂדֶה אַחֶרֶת, דְּקָא כָלְיָא קַרְנָא.
human_translation: And if you wish, say: Did we not establish that where were bequeathed to her in a different field that would consume the principal
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: Have we not established for that case, for example, where they fell to her in another field, that the horn is uprooted.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא שְׁטָרָא דַּהֲוָה כְּתִיב בֵּיהּ שְׁנִין סְתָמָא. מַלְוֶה אָמַר: שָׁלֹשׁ. לֹוֶה אָמַר: שְׁתַּיִם. קְדֵים מַלְוֶה וְאַכְלִינְהוּ לְפֵירֵי. מִי נֶאֱמָן? רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר: קַרְקַע בְּחֶזְקַת בְּעָלֶיהָ קָיְימָא. רַב כָּהֲנָא אָמַר: פֵּירוֹת בְּחֶזְקַת אוֹכְלֵיהֶן קָיְימִי.
human_translation: a certain document in which it was written an unspecified years. creditor said three the debtor said two creditor arose and consumed the produce Which deemed credible Rav Yehuda said: land remains in its owner’s possession. Rav Kahana said: produce remains in the possession of consumed it,
llm_translation: That document that was written in it two years blank. The lender said: three. The borrower said: two. The lender preceded and consumed them as produce. Who is trustworthy? Rav Yehudah said: The ground is in the possession of its owner. Rav Kahana said: The fruits are in the possession of their consumers.

hebrew_text: וְהִלְכְתָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּרַב כָּהֲנָא, דְּאָמַר: פֵּירוֹת בְּחֶזְקַת אוֹכְלֵיהֶן קָיְימִי. וְהָא קַיְימָא לַן דְּהִלְכְתָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּרַב נַחְמָן, דְּאָמַר: קַרְקַע בְּחֶזְקַת בְּעָלֶיהָ עוֹמֶדֶת!
human_translation: And the halakha in accordance with of Rav Kahana, who said produce remains in the possession of consumed it. But don’t we maintain that the halakha in accordance with of Rav Naḥman, who said land remains in its owner’s possession,
llm_translation: The halakha follows the opinion of Rav Kahana, who said: "Fruits are assumed to be in the possession of their eaters." But we have a tradition that the halakha follows the opinion of Rav Nachman, who said: "The ground is assumed to be in the possession of its owners!"

hebrew_text: הָתָם – מִילְּתָא דְּלָא עֲבִידָא לְאִיגַּלּוֹיֵי הִיא. הָכָא – מִילְּתָא דַּעֲבִידָא לְאִיגַּלּוֹיֵי הִיא, וְאַטְרוֹחֵי בֵּי דִינָא תְּרֵי זִמְנֵי לָא מַטְרְחִינַן.
human_translation: There it is a matter that will not be revealed here it is a matter that will be revealed, and we do not trouble the court twice.
llm_translation: There - a matter that is not done for its own sake. Here - a matter that is done for its own sake, and the sages of the court do not need to deliberate twice.

hebrew_text: מַלְוֶה אוֹמֵר חָמֵשׁ, לֹוֶה אוֹמֵר שָׁלֹשׁ. אָמַר לֵיהּ: אַיְיתִי לִי שְׁטָרָךְ! אָמַר לֵיהּ: שְׁטָרָא אִירְכַס לִי. אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: מַלְוֶה נֶאֱמָן, מִגּוֹ דְּאִי בָּעֵי אָמַר לְקוּחָה הִיא בְּיָדִי.
human_translation: creditor says five debtor says three. said to Give me your document said to him: I lost the document. Rav Yehuda said: creditor is deemed credible since he could have made a more advantageous claim [ miggo ]. if wants say: purchased by me.
llm_translation: The lender says five, the borrower says three. He said to him: Bring me your document! He said to him: The document has been torn. Rav Yehudah said: The lender is trustworthy, for if he wanted, he could have said, "It is in my possession for collection."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב פָּפָּא לְרַב אָשֵׁי: רַב זְבִיד וְרַב עַוִּירָא לָא סְבִירָא לְהוּ הָא דְּרַב יְהוּדָה. מַאי טַעְמָא: הַאי שְׁטָרָא כֵּיוָן דִּלְגוּבְיָינָא קָאֵי – מִיזְהָר זְהִיר בֵּיהּ, וּמִיכְבָּשׁ הוּא דְּכַבְשֵׁיהּ לִשְׁטָרֵיהּ, סָבַר: אוֹכְלַהּ תַּרְתֵּין שְׁנִין יַתִּירְתָּא.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said to Rav Ashi: Rav Zevid and Rav Avira do not hold this of Rav Yehuda. What is the reason Since this document stands for collecting careful with regard to it. he is hiding his document, thinks: I will consume two extra years.
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Papa to Rav Ashi: Rav Zebid and Rav Avira do not agree with Rav Yehuda. What is the reason? This document, since it stands out, one should be cautious with it, and he who is cautious with his document, he thinks: it can consume two years' worth in one year.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבִינָא לְרַב אָשֵׁי: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה, הַאי מַשְׁכַּנְתָּא דְסוּרָא דְּכָתְבִי הָכִי: ״בְּמִישְׁלַם שְׁנַיָּא אִלֵּין תִּיפּוֹק אַרְעָא דָּא בְּלָא כְּסַף״. הֵיכָא דְּכַבְשֵׁיהּ לִשְׁטַר מַשְׁכַּנְתָּא וְאָמַר: לְקוּחָה הִיא בְּיָדִי, הָכִי נָמֵי דִּמְהֵימַן? וְכִי מְתַקְּנִי רַבָּנַן מִילְּתָא דְּאָתֵי בַּהּ [לִידֵי] פְּסֵידָא? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָתָם תַּקִּינוּ לֵיה רַבָּנַן דְּמָרֵי אַרְעָא יָהֵיב טַסְקָא וְכָרֵי כַּרְיָא.
human_translation: Ravina said to Rav Ashi: If that is so, this mortgage according to Sura, which they write this: Upon the completion of these years this land shall leave without money where hid the mortgage document and said purchased by me, so too that he is deemed credible? Would the Sages institute a matter that cause a loss? said to him: There, the Sages instituted for that the landowner, pays the taxes and digs the trenches
llm_translation: Ravina said to Rav Ashi: Rather, from now on, this document of Sura that was written thus: "With a complete purchase, these lands will come out without money." Where he sold it to transfer ownership of the property and said: "It is in my possession," is it really trustworthy? Do the Rabbis establish a matter that could lead to a loss? He said to him: There, the Rabbis established that the masters of the land give a guarantee and sign a document.

hebrew_text: אַרְעָא דְּלֵית לַהּ כַּרְיָא וְלָא יָהֵיב טַסְקָא, מַאי? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִיבְּעִי לֵיהּ לְמַחוֹיֵי! לָא (אִימְּחָא) [מַחִי], מַאי? אִיהוּ הוּא דְּאַפְסֵיד אַנַּפְשֵׁיהּ.
human_translation: land that has no trenches and does not pay taxes, what said to him: He should have protested did not protest, what he caused his own loss
llm_translation: The land that does not have a garden and does not give a basket, what? He said to him: Seek to sell it! Not (sell), sell, what? He is the one who causes himself loss.

hebrew_text: אָרִיס אוֹמֵר: לְמֶחֱצָה יָרַדְתִּי, וּבַעַל הַבַּיִת אוֹמֵר: לִשְׁלִישׁ הוֹרַדְתִּיו, מִי נֶאֱמָן? רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר: בַּעַל הַבַּיִת נֶאֱמָן. רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר: הַכֹּל כְּמִנְהַג הַמְּדִינָה.
human_translation: a sharecropper says: I descended for half and the homeowner says: I sent him down for one-third who is deemed credible Rav Yehuda says: The homeowner is deemed credible Rav Naḥman says: All in accordance with the regional custom.
llm_translation: Aris says: "I descended halfway." And the homeowner says: "I descended a third of the way." Who is trustworthy? Rav Yehudah says: The homeowner is trustworthy. Rav Nachman says: Everything follows the custom of the land.

hebrew_text: סְבוּר מִינַּהּ לָא פְּלִיגִי: הָא בְּאַתְרָא דְּשָׁקֵיל אֲרִיסָא פַּלְגָא, הָא בְּאַתְרָא דְּשָׁקֵיל אֲרִיסָא תִּילְתָּא.
human_translation: understood from do not disagree, This with regard to a location where the sharecropper takes half, that with regard to a location where the sharecropper takes one-third,
llm_translation: The opinion of the one does not differ: here in the place where he took a third of the field, here in the place where he took a third of the field.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לְהוּ רַב מָרִי בְּרַהּ דְּבַת שְׁמוּאֵל: הָכִי אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: אֲפִילּוּ בְּאַתְרָא דְּשָׁקֵיל אֲרִיסָא פַּלְגָא פְּלִיגִי, רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר: בַּעַל הַבַּיִת נֶאֱמָן, דְּאִי בָּעֵי אָמַר: שְׂכִירִי וּלְקִיטִי הוּא.
human_translation: Rav Mari, son of the daughter of Shmuel, said to them: This Abaye said: even disagree with regard to a location where the sharecropper takes half. Rav Yehuda said the homeowner is deemed credible as if he wants say: my hired worker, or my gleaner,
llm_translation: He said to them, Rav Mari son of Samuel: thus said Abbaye: even in a place where one takes a half share, Rav Yehudah said: the owner of the house is trusted, for if he wanted to say: he is a hired laborer and a gatherer.

hebrew_text: יְתוֹמִים אוֹמְרִים: אָנוּ הִשְׁבַּחְנוּ, וּבַעַל חוֹב אוֹמֵר: אֲבִיכֶם הִשְׁבִּיחַ, עַל מִי לְהָבִיא רְאָיָה?
human_translation: the orphans say: We enhanced and the creditor says: Your father enhanced it, upon whom to bring proof
llm_translation: Orphans say: "We have praised," and the creditor says: "Your fathers have praised, upon whom to bring proof?"

hebrew_text: סָבַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא לְמֵימַר: אַרְעָא בְּחֶזְקַת יַתְמֵי קָיְימָא, וְעַל בַּעַל חוֹב לְהָבִיא רְאָיָה. אֲמַר לְהוּ הַהוּא סָבָא, הָכִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: עַל הַיְּתוֹמִים לְהָבִיא רְאָיָה. מַאי טַעְמָא? אַרְעָא, כֵּיוָן דִּלְגוּבְיָינָא קָיְימָא – כְּמַאן דְּגַבְיָא דָּמְיָא, וְעַל הַיְּתוֹמִין לְהָבִיא רְאָיָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥanina thought to say land remains in the orphans’ possession, and upon the creditor to bring proof. A certain elder said to them: This Rabbi Yoḥanan says: upon the orphans to bring proof. What is the reason Since land stands for collection, considered as though it has been collected upon the orphans to bring proof.
llm_translation: Rabbi Chanina thought to say: Land in the possession of orphans is established, and it is upon the creditor to bring proof. That elder said to them: So said Rabbi Yochanan: It is upon the orphans to bring proof. What is the reason? Land, since it is established in their possession - it is like one who brings a claim, and it is upon the orphans to bring proof.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי, אַף אֲנַן נָמֵי תְּנֵינָא: סָפֵק זֶה קָדַם וְסָפֵק זֶה קָדַם – קוֹצֵץ וְאֵינוֹ נוֹתֵן דָּמִים.
human_translation: Abaye said: We learn as well, uncertain this first that first, cuts it down and do not give money
llm_translation: Abaye said, "We also learned: If doubt precedes this and doubt precedes that - one may cut and not draw blood."

hebrew_text: אַלְמָא כֵּיוָן דִּלְמִיקָּץ קָיְימָא, אָמְרִינַן לֵיהּ: אַיְיתִי רְאָיָה וּשְׁקוֹל. הָכִי נָמֵי, הַאי שְׁטָרָא כֵּיוָן דִּלְגוּבְיָינָא קָיְימָא – כְּמַאן דְּגַבְיָא דָּמְיָא, וְעַל הַיְּתוֹמִים לְהָבִיא רְאָיָה.
human_translation: Apparently, since standing to be chopped down, we say to bring proof and take So too, this document since it ready for collection, considered as though it has been collected and upon the orphans to bring proof.
llm_translation: The Gemara asks: Since when the witness is found to be contradicting himself, we say to him: "Bring proof and weigh it." This is what is meant: This document, since it is standing among us, is like one who brings blood, and regarding orphans, one must bring proof.

hebrew_text: אַיְיתוֹ יַתְמֵי רְאָיָה דְּאִינְהוּ אַשְׁבַּחוּ, סָבַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא לְמֵימַר: כִּי מְסַלְּקִינַן לְהוּ – בְּאַרְעָא מְסַלְּקִינַן לְהוּ.
human_translation: the orphans brought proof that they enhanced Rabbi Ḥanina thought to say: When we remove them, we remove them by the land
llm_translation: Bring the witnesses of those who praise, Rabbi Chanina thought to say: "When we remove them - in the land we remove them."

hebrew_text: וְלָא הִיא, בִּדְמֵי מְסַלְּקִינַן לְהוּ, מִדְּרַב נַחְמָן. דְּאָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: שְׁלֹשָׁה שָׁמִין לָהֶם אֶת הַשֶּׁבַח, וּמַעֲלִין אוֹתָן בְּדָמִים, וְאֵלּוּ הֵן: בְּכוֹר לְפָשׁוּט,
human_translation: But is not we remove them with money, from of Rav Naḥman. As Rav Naḥman says Shmuel says: three appraises the enhanced for and they are paid in money And these are they: firstborn to an ordinary,
llm_translation: And not it, in bloods we remove to him, from Rav Nachman. For Rav Nachman said in the name of Shmuel: Three who deserve praise, and we elevate them with blood, and these are they: the firstborn for simplicity,

hebrew_text: וּבַעַל חוֹב וּכְתוּבַּת אִשָּׁה לִיתוֹמִים, וּבַעַל חוֹב לְלָקוֹחוֹת.
human_translation: And a creditor or a marriage contract to orphans, And a creditor to purchasers,
llm_translation: And a creditor and a written woman for orphans, and a creditor for purchases.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבִינָא לְרַב אָשֵׁי: לְמֵימְרָא דְּסָבַר שְׁמוּאֵל בַּעַל חוֹב לְלָקוֹחוֹת? וּמַאי אִית לֵיהּ שְׁבָחָא לְלוֹקֵחַ? וְהָאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל בַּעַל חוֹב גּוֹבֶה אֶת הַשֶּׁבַח! וְכִי תֵּימָא, לָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן – בְּשֶׁבַח הַמַּגִּיעַ לִכְתֵפַיִם, כָּאן – בְּשֶׁבַח שֶׁאֵין מַגִּיעַ לַכְּתֵפַיִם. וְהָא מַעֲשִׂים בְּכׇל יוֹם, וְקָא מַגְבֵּי שְׁמוּאֵל אֲפִילּוּ בְּשֶׁבַח הַמַּגִּיעַ לִכְתֵפַיִם!
human_translation: Ravina said to Rav Ashi: to say that Shmuel maintains a creditor to the buyers? And what enhancement is there to a buyer But doesn’t Shmuel say: A creditor collects the enhancement, And if you would say not difficult, here to enhancement that reaches the shoulders, there to enhancement that does not reach the shoulders, But aren’t there incidents every day Shmuel would collect even enhancement that reaches the shoulders?
llm_translation: Ravina said to Rav Ashi: Does Shmuel hold that the seller is obligated to provide receipts? And what praise does the buyer have? But Shmuel said, the seller is obligated to give praise! And if you say, it is not difficult: here – in praise that reaches the shoulders, here – in praise that does not reach the shoulders. And this is done every day, and Shmuel even praises in praise that reaches the shoulders!

hebrew_text: לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא דְּמַסֵּיק בֵּיהּ כְּשִׁיעוּר אַרְעָא וּשְׁבָחָא, הָא דְּלָא מַסֵּיק בֵּיהּ שִׁיעוּר אַרְעָא וּשְׁבָחָא.
human_translation: not difficult; this where owed him the amount the land and the enhancement that where he did not owe him the amount the land and the enhancement.
llm_translation: Not difficult: this that establishes in it like the measure of land and praise, this that does not establish in it the measure of land and praise.

hebrew_text: וְכִי לָא מַסֵּיק שִׁיעוּר אַרְעָא וּשְׁבָחָא, דְּיָהֵיב לֵיהּ זוּזֵי לְלוֹקֵחַ וּמְסַלֵּק לֵיהּ, הָנִיחָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר: אִי אִית לֵיהּ זוּזֵי לְלוֹקֵחַ לָא מָצֵי מְסַלֵּק לֵיהּ לְבַעַל חוֹב – שַׁפִּיר. אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר: אִית לֵיהּ זוּזֵי לְלוֹקֵחַ מָצֵי מְסַלֵּק לֵיהּ לְבַעַל חוֹב, וְנֵימָא לֵיהּ: אִי הֲווֹ לִי זוּזֵי – הֲוָה מְסַלֵּיקְנָא לָךְ מִכּוּלַּאּ אַרְעָא, הַשְׁתָּא דְּלֵית לִי זוּזֵי – הַב לִי גְּרִיוָא דְּאַרְעָא בְּאַרְעַאי שִׁיעוּר שְׁבָחַאי!
human_translation: And if did not owe the amount of the land and the enhancement, that gives the buyer money and removes him. This works out well according to the one who says if the buyer has money he cannot remove the creditor well. But according to the one who says the buyer has money he may remove the creditor let him say to him If I had money I would remove you from the entire land; now that I do not have money give me a plot of earth in my land amount of my enhancement.
llm_translation: And if he did not establish the measure of land and praise, that he gives him money to buy and takes it from him, it is left to the one who says: If he has money to buy, he cannot take it from him to pay off a debt - that is reasonable. But to the one who says: If he has money to buy, he can take it from him to pay off a debt, and it can be said to him: If I had money - I would take it from you for all the land, now that I do not have money - come and take my share of the land in my measure of land and my praise!

hebrew_text: הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן – כְּגוֹן דְּשַׁוְּיַאּ נִיהֲלֵיהּ אַפּוֹתֵיקֵי, דַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ: לֹא יְהֵא לְךָ פֵּרָעוֹן אֶלָּא מִזּוֹ.
human_translation: Here we are dealing with where set aside designated repayment [ apoteiki ] for as he said to him: You shall be able to collect from only this
llm_translation: Here we are dealing with what? - For example, when he appointed overseers, for he said to him: "You shall have no authority except from this."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַמְקַבֵּל שָׂדֶה מֵחֲבֵירוֹ לְשָׁבוּעַ אֶחָד בִּשְׁבַע מֵאוֹת זוּז, הַשְּׁבִיעִית מִן הַמִּנְיָן. קִבְּלָהּ הֵימֶנּוּ שֶׁבַע שָׁנִים בִּשְׁבַע מֵאוֹת זוּז – אֵין הַשְּׁבִיעִית מִן הַמִּנְיָן.
human_translation: who receives a field from another for one cycle for seven hundred dinars, the Sabbatical in the tally, received it from him seven years for seven hundred dinars, the Sabbatical not in the number,
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: One who receives a field from his fellow for one week for seven hundred zuz, the seventh year is not included in the count. If he received it from him for seven years for seven hundred zuz, the seventh year is included in the count.

hebrew_text: שְׂכִיר יוֹם – גּוֹבֶה כׇּל הַלַּיְלָה. שְׂכִיר לַיְלָה – גּוֹבֶה כׇּל הַיּוֹם. שְׂכִיר שָׁעוֹת – גּוֹבֶה כׇּל הַלַּיְלָה וְכׇל הַיּוֹם. שְׂכִיר שַׁבָּת, שְׂכִיר חֹדֶשׁ, שְׂכִיר שָׁנָה, שְׂכִיר שָׁבוּעַ, יָצָא בַּיּוֹם – גּוֹבֶה כׇּל הַיּוֹם, יָצָא בַּלַּיְלָה – גּוֹבֶה כׇּל הַלַּיְלָה וְכׇל הַיּוֹם.
human_translation: A day laborer collects all night A night laborer collects all the day, an hourly laborer collects all night and all day. a weekly laborer, a monthly laborer, a yearly laborer, a laborer cycle left in the day, he collects all day; left at night, he collects all night and all day.
llm_translation: Hired for a day - obligated all night. Hired for a night - obligated all day. Hired by the hour - obligated all night and all day. Hired for the Sabbath, hired for a month, hired for a year, hired for a week, if one goes out by day - obligated all day, if one goes out by night - obligated all night and all day.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: מִנַּיִן לִשְׂכִיר יוֹם שֶׁגּוֹבֶה כׇּל הַלַּיְלָה? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״לֹא תָלִין פְּעֻלַּת שָׂכִיר אִתְּךָ עַד בֹּקֶר״. וּמִנַּיִן לִשְׂכִיר לַיְלָה שֶׁגּוֹבֶה כׇּל הַיּוֹם – שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״בְּיוֹמוֹ תִתֵּן שְׂכָרוֹ״.
human_translation: The Sages taught: From where concerning a day laborer that collects all night? The verse states: “The wages of a hired laborer shall not remain with you all night until the morning” And from where concerning a night laborer that collects all day? As it is stated: “On the same day you shall give him his wages”
llm_translation: The sages taught: From where do we derive that a hired laborer may demand payment for the entire night? The verse teaches: "You shall not delay the wages of a hired laborer with you until morning." And from where do we derive that a hired laborer may demand payment for the entire day? As it is stated: "You shall give him his wages on the same day."

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא אִיפְּכָא! שְׂכִירוּת אֵינָהּ מִשְׁתַּלֶּמֶת אֶלָּא בַּסּוֹף.
human_translation: But say the opposite, The obligation to pay wage only at the end
llm_translation: And why not reverse it! Rental is only appropriate at the end.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: מִמַּשְׁמַע שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר ״לֹא תָלִין פְּעֻלַּת שָׂכִיר אִתְּךָ״, אֵינִי יוֹדֵעַ שֶׁ״עַד בֹּקֶר״? מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״עַד בֹּקֶר״ – מְלַמֵּד שֶׁאֵינוֹ עוֹבֵר אֶלָּא עַד בֹּקֶר רִאשׁוֹן בִּלְבַד.
human_translation: The Sages taught: From the indication that is stated “The wages of a hired laborer shall not remain with you all night [ lo talin ],” do I not know that “Until the morning,” Why the verse state: “Until the morning”? teaches that he transgresses only until the first morning alone,
llm_translation: The Sages taught: From where do we derive that it is stated "You shall not delay the wages of a hired worker with you," I do not know that it means "until morning"? What is the teaching when it says "until morning" – it teaches that one may not transgress except until the first morning only.

hebrew_text: מִכָּאן וְאֵילָךְ, מַאי? אָמַר רַב: עוֹבֵר מִשּׁוּם ״בַּל תְּשַׁהֶא״. אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: מַאי קְרָאָה – ״אַל תֹּאמַר לְרֵעֲךָ לֵךְ וָשׁוּב וּמָחָר אֶתֵּן וְיֵשׁ אִתָּךְ״.
human_translation: From that forward, what Rav said: violates of: Do not delay, Rav Yosef said: What is the verse “Do not say to your neighbor: Go and come again, and tomorrow I will give, when you have it with you”
llm_translation: From here and onwards, what is it? Rav said: One transgresses due to "Do not delay." Rav Yosef said: What is the verse? "Do not say to your neighbor, 'Go and come back, and tomorrow I will give,' when you have it with you."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הָאוֹמֵר לַחֲבֵירוֹ צֵא שְׂכוֹר לִי פּוֹעֲלִים – שְׁנֵיהֶן אֵין עוֹבְרִין מִשּׁוּם ״בַּל תָּלִין״. זֶה, לְפִי שֶׁלֹּא שְׂכָרָן,
human_translation: The Sages taught: who says to another: Go out hire workers for me, both of them do not violate the prohibition of delaying This because he did not hire them
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: One who says to his fellow, "Go out and hire workers for me," neither of them transgresses the prohibition of "Do not delay." This is because he did not hire them.

hebrew_text: וְזֶה, לְפִי שֶׁאֵין פְּעוּלָּתוֹ אֶצְלוֹ. הֵיכִי דָמֵי? אִי דַּאֲמַר לְהוּ שְׂכַרְכֶם עָלַי – שְׂכָרוֹ עָלָיו הוּא, דְּתַנְיָא: הַשּׂוֹכֵר אֶת הַפּוֹעֵל לַעֲשׂוֹת בְּשֶׁלּוֹ וְהֶרְאָהוּ בְּשֶׁל חֲבֵירוֹ – נוֹתֵן לוֹ שְׂכָרוֹ מִשָּׁלֵם, וְחוֹזֵר וְנוֹטֵל מִבַּעַל הַבַּיִת מַה שֶּׁהֶהֱנָה אוֹתוֹ!
human_translation: And that because his work is not for him. What are the circumstances If said to them: Your wages upon me, his wages are upon him, As it is taught one who hires a laborer to perform in his own and showed belonging to another must give his full wages; and goes back and takes from the owner the benefit received from
llm_translation: And this, because his work is not with him. How so? If he said to them, "Your wage is upon me," his wage is upon him, as it is taught: One who hires a laborer to work with his own materials and instructs him in the work of his fellow, he pays him his wage, and then goes back and takes from the owner of the house what he gave him!

hebrew_text: לָא צְרִיכָא, דַּאֲמַר לְהוּ: שְׂכַרְכֶם עַל בַּעַל הַבַּיִת.
human_translation: No, necessary where said to them: your wages upon the employer,
llm_translation: Not necessary, for he said to them: "Your wage is upon the owner of the house."

hebrew_text: יְהוּדָה בַּר מָרִימָר אֲמַר לֵיהּ לְשַׁמָּעֵיהּ: זִיל אֱגוֹר לִי פּוֹעֲלִים, וְאֵימָא לְהוּ: שְׂכַרְכֶם עַל בַּעַל הַבַּיִת, מָרִימָר וּמַר זוּטְרָא אָגְרִי לַהֲדָדֵי.
human_translation: Yehuda bar Mareimar say to his attendant: Go hire workers for me and say to them: Your wages are upon the employer. Mareimar and Mar Zutra would hire for each other
llm_translation: Judah son of Marimar said to his attendant: "Go hire workers for me, and say to them: 'Your wages are upon the master of the house.'" Marimar and Master Zutra the scribe hired workers for Hadadei.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר רַב הוּנָא: הָנֵי שׁוּקָאֵי דְּסוּרָא לָא עָבְרִי מִשּׁוּם ״בַּל תָּלִין״, מִידָּע יָדְעִי דְּעַל יוֹמָא דְשׁוּקָא סְמִיכִי, אֲבָל מִשּׁוּם ״בַּל תְּשַׁהֶא״ וַדַּאי עוֹבֵר.
human_translation: Rabba bar Rav Huna said: Those marketplace workers of Sura do not violate the prohibition of delaying knows that they rely on the market day But certainly violates the prohibition of: Do not delay,
llm_translation: Rabba bar Rav Huna said: Those marketplaces of Sura do not transgress due to "Bal Tashchit," for I know that on the day of the market, they are adjacent. However, they certainly transgress due to "Bal Teshuah."

hebrew_text: שְׂכִיר שָׁעוֹת גּוֹבֶה כׇּל הַלַּיְלָה וְכׇל הַיּוֹם. אָמַר רַב: שְׂכִיר שָׁעוֹת דְּיוֹם – גּוֹבֶה כׇּל הַיּוֹם, שְׂכִיר שָׁעוֹת דְּלַיְלָה – גּוֹבֶה כׇּל הַלַּיְלָה. וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: שְׂכִיר שָׁעוֹת דְּיוֹם – גּוֹבֶה כׇּל הַיּוֹם, וּשְׂכִיר שָׁעוֹת דְּלַיְלָה – גּוֹבֶה כׇּל הַלַּיְלָה וְכׇל הַיּוֹם.
human_translation: an hourly laborer collects all night and all day. Rav says: An hourly laborer by day collects all day, an hourly laborer by night collects all night. And Shmuel says: An hourly laborer by day collects all day, but an hourly laborer by night collects all night and all day.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: A hired laborer for hours, collects throughout the night and all day. Rav said: A hired laborer for daytime hours - collects all day, a hired laborer for nighttime hours - collects all night. And Shmuel said: A hired laborer for daytime hours - collects all day, and a hired laborer for nighttime hours - collects all night and all day.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: שְׂכִיר שָׁעוֹת גּוֹבֶה כׇּל הַלַּיְלָה וְכׇל הַיּוֹם, תְּיוּבְתָּא דְּרַב! אָמַר לְךָ רַב: לִצְדָדִין קָתָנֵי. שְׂכִיר שָׁעוֹת דְּיוֹם – גּוֹבֶה כׇּל הַיּוֹם, שְׂכִיר שָׁעוֹת דְּלַיְלָה – גּוֹבֶה כׇּל הַלַּיְלָה.
human_translation: We learned An hourly laborer collects all night and all day. a conclusive refutation of Rav. Rav said to you he teaches disjunctively An hourly laborer by day collects all day, an hourly laborer by night collects all night.
llm_translation: We learned in the Mishnah: A hired laborer for hours is paid for the entire night and the entire day, Rav, you have a refutation! Rav said to you: The Mishnah is speaking about small towns. A hired laborer for daytime hours - is paid for the entire day, a hired laborer for nighttime hours - is paid for the entire night.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: הָיָה שְׂכִיר שַׁבָּת, שְׂכִיר חֹדֶשׁ, שְׂכִיר שָׁנָה, שְׂכִיר שָׁבוּעַ, יוֹצֵא בַּיּוֹם – גּוֹבֶה כׇּל הַיּוֹם. יוֹצֵא בַּלַּיְלָה – גּוֹבֶה כׇּל הַלַּיְלָה וְכׇל הַיּוֹם.
human_translation: We learned he was a weekly laborer, a monthly laborer, a yearly laborer, a laborer cycle left in the day, he collects all day; left at night, he collects all night and all day.
llm_translation: We learned in the Mishnah: If one was hired for the Sabbath, hired for the month, hired for the year, hired for the week, if he leaves during the day - he receives his full wage for the entire day. If he leaves at night - he receives his full wage for the entire night and the entire day.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לְךָ רַב: תַּנָּאֵי הִיא, דְּתַנְיָא: שְׂכִיר שָׁעוֹת דְּיוֹם – גּוֹבֶה כׇּל הַיּוֹם, שְׂכִיר שָׁעוֹת דְּלַיְלָה – גּוֹבֶה כׇּל הַלַּיְלָה, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: שְׂכִיר שָׁעוֹת דְּיוֹם – גּוֹבֶה כׇּל הַיּוֹם, שְׂכִיר שָׁעוֹת דְּלַיְלָה – גּוֹבֶה כׇּל הַלַּיְלָה וְכׇל הַיּוֹם.
human_translation: Rav said to you is tanna’im , as it is taught An hourly laborer by day collects all day, an hourly laborer by night collects all night; the statement of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Shimon says: An hourly laborer by day collects all day, an hourly laborer by night collects all night and all day.
llm_translation: He said to you, Rav: It is a teaching, as it was taught: A hired laborer for daytime hours - collects for the entire day, a hired laborer for nighttime hours - collects for the entire night, the words of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Shimon says: A hired laborer for daytime hours - collects for the entire day, a hired laborer for nighttime hours - collects for the entire night and for the entire day.

hebrew_text: מִכָּאן אָמְרוּ: כׇּל הַכּוֹבֵשׁ שְׂכַר שָׂכִיר, עוֹבֵר בַּחֲמִשָּׁה שֵׁמוֹת הַלָּלוּ וַעֲשֵׂה. מִשּׁוּם ״בַּל תַּעֲשֹׁק אֶת רֵעֲךָ״, וּמִשּׁוּם ״בַּל תִּגְזֹל״, וּמִשּׁוּם ״בַּל תַּעֲשֹׁק שָׂכִיר עָנִי״, וּמִשּׁוּם ״בַּל תָּלִין״, וּמִשּׁוּם ״בְּיוֹמוֹ תִּתֵּן שְׂכָרוֹ״, וּמִשּׁוּם ״לֹא תָבֹא עָלָיו הַשֶּׁמֶשׁ״.
human_translation: From here stated: Anyone who withholds the wages of a hired laborer violates these five prohibitions and positive mitzva. violates of: “Do not oppress your neighbor” and of: “Do not steal” and prohibition of: “You should not oppress a hired laborer who is poor” and the prohibition of delaying and of: “On the same day you shall give him his wages” and of: “The sun shall not set upon him”
llm_translation: From here they said: Anyone who withholds the wages of a hired worker transgresses these five names and does. Because of "You shall not oppress your neighbor," and because of "You shall not steal," and because of "You shall not oppress a hired worker who is poor," and because of "You shall not delay," and because of "You shall give his wages on the same day," and because of "The sun shall not come upon him."

hebrew_text: הָנֵי דְּאִיכָּא בִּימָמָא – לֵיכָּא בְּלֵילְיָא, דְּאִיכָּא בְּלֵילְיָא – לֵיכָּא בִּימָמָא? אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: שֵׁם שְׂכִירוּת בְּעָלְמָא.
human_translation: those that are by day are not by night, that are by night are not by day. Rav Ḥisda said: merely the general concept wages
llm_translation: These that there are in the day - are not in the night, those that are in the night - are not in the day? Rav Ḥisdah said: The name of temporary hire in the world.

hebrew_text: אֵיזֶה הוּא עוֹשֶׁק וְאֵיזֶהוּ גָּזֵל? אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: ״לֵךְ וָשׁוּב״, ״לֵךְ וָשׁוּב״ – זֶה הוּא עוֹשֶׁק. ״יֵשׁ לְךָ בְּיָדִי וְאֵינִי נוֹתֵן לְךָ״ – זֶה הוּא גָּזֵל.
human_translation: What is oppression and what is stealing, Rav Ḥisda said: Go and return, go and return this is oppression. You have in my possession but I will not give to you, this is stealing.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: What is oppression and what is robbery? Rav Ḥisda said: "Go and return," "Go and return" - this is oppression. "You have in my possession and I do not give to you" - this is robbery.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: אֵיזֶהוּ עוֹשֶׁק שֶׁחִיְּיבָה עָלָיו תּוֹרָה קׇרְבָּן – דּוּמְיָא דְּפִקָּדוֹן, דְּקָא כָפַר לֵיהּ מָמוֹנָא! אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: ״נְתַתִּיו לָךְ״ – זֶהוּ עוֹשֶׁק, ״יֵשׁ לְךָ בְּיָדִי וְאֵינִי נוֹתֵן לָךְ״ – זֶה הוּא גָּזֵל.
human_translation: Rav Sheshet objects to this What is oppression for which the Torah obligated him an offering? similar to a deposit, where he denies the money. Rather, Rav Sheshet said I gave it to you, this is oppression. You have in my possession but I am not giving to you, this is stealing.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Rav Sheshet objects to her: What is the oppression for which the Torah obligates a sacrifice? - It is similar to a deposit, for it atones for him with money! Rather, Rav Sheshet said: "I have given it to you" - this is oppression, "you have it in my possession and I do not give it to you" - this is theft.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ אַבָּיֵי: אֵיזֶה הוּא גָּזֵל שֶׁחִיְּיבָה עָלָיו תּוֹרָה קׇרְבָּן, דּוּמְיָא דְּפִקָּדוֹן בָּעֵינַן, דְּקָא כָפַר לֵיהּ מָמוֹנָא! אֶלָּא אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: ״לֹא שְׂכַרְתִּיךָ מֵעוֹלָם״ – זֶה הוּא עוֹשֶׁק, ״נְתַתִּיו לָךְ״ – זֶה הוּא גָּזֵל.
human_translation: Abaye objects to this: What is stealing for which the Torah obligated him an offering? We require similar to a deposit, where he denies the money. Rather, Abaye said: I never hired you, this is oppression; I gave it to you, this is stealing.
llm_translation: Abbaye objects to this: Which is the theft that the Torah obligates a sacrifice for? It is similar to a deposit, for it atones for him with money! Rather, Abbaye said: "I have not hired you from the beginning" - this is oppression, "I have given it to you" - this is theft.

hebrew_text: וּלְרַב שֵׁשֶׁת, מַאי שְׁנָא עוֹשֶׁק דְּקַשְׁיָא לֵיהּ, וּמַאי שְׁנָא גָּזֵל דְּלָא קַשְׁיָא לֵיהּ? אָמַר לָךְ: גָּזֵל – דְּגַזְלֵיהּ וַהֲדַר כַּפְרֵיהּ.
human_translation: And according to Rav Sheshet, what is different oppression that he raised a difficulty and what is different stealing that he did not raise a difficulty, said to you: Stealing that stole from him and later denied
llm_translation: For Rav Sheshet, what is the difference that extortion is difficult for him, and what is the difference that theft is not difficult for him? He said to you: Theft - because he steals and then makes restitution.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, אֲפִילּוּ עוֹשֶׁק נָמֵי דַּהֲדַר כַּפְרֵיהּ! הָכִי הַשְׁתָּא: בִּשְׁלָמָא הָתָם כְּתִיב: ״אוֹ בְגָזֵל״ – מִכְּלָל דְּאוֹדִי לֵיהּ מֵעִיקָּרָא. אֲבָל גַּבֵּי עוֹשֶׁק מִי כְּתִיב ״אוֹ בְעוֹשֶׁק״? ״אוֹ עָשַׁק״ כְּתִיב, שֶׁעֲשָׁקוֹ כְּבָר.
human_translation: If so, even oppression as well, that and later denied it. How can be compared? Granted, there it is written: or of robbery” by inference that he admitted to him at the outset. But with regard to oppression is it written: Or by oppression? It is written: “Or he oppressed,” that he had already oppressed him.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: If so, even if he oppresses the other's property, his atonement is effective! Thus now: Granted there it is written, "or through theft" - this includes it from the outset. But regarding oppression, where is it written "or through oppression"? "Or he oppressed" is written, indicating that he already oppressed. English translation:

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר: זֶה הוּא עוֹשֶׁק זֶהוּ גָּזֵל. וְלָמָּה חִלְּקָן הַכָּתוּב – לַעֲבוֹר עָלָיו בִּשְׁנֵי לָאוִין.
human_translation: Rava said: oppression is the same as stealing, And why, did the verse divide them so that he will violate two prohibitions,
llm_translation: Rava said: This is oppression, this is robbery. And why did the Scripture differentiate between them? To make him liable for two prohibitions.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אֶחָד שְׂכַר אָדָם וְאֶחָד שְׂכַר בְּהֵמָה וְאֶחָד שְׂכַר כֵּלִים – יֵשׁ בּוֹ מִשּׁוּם ״בְּיוֹמוֹ תִּתֵּן שְׂכָרוֹ״, וְיֵשׁ בּוֹ מִשּׁוּם ״לֹא תָלִין פְּעֻלַּת שָׂכִיר אִתְּךָ עַד בֹּקֶר״. אֵימָתַי – בִּזְמַן שֶׁתְּבָעוֹ. לֹא תְּבָעוֹ – אֵינוֹ עוֹבֵר עָלָיו. הִמְחָהוּ אֵצֶל חֶנְוָנִי אוֹ אֵצֶל שׁוּלְחָנִי – אֵינוֹ עוֹבֵר עָלָיו.
human_translation: Whether a person’s wages or the renting of an animal or the renting of utensils, subject to of: “On the same day you shall give him his wages” and subject to of: “The wages of a hired laborer shall not remain with you all night until the morning” When when claimed him. did not claim him does not transgress If transferred his with a storekeeper or with a money changer he does not transgress
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who hires a person, and one who hires an animal, and one who hires utensils - in it there is the law of "You shall pay his wages on the same day," and in it there is the law of "You shall not delay the wages of a hired worker with you until morning." When is this applicable? When he demands it. If he does not demand it, he does not transgress the law. If he pays him in the presence of witnesses or in the presence of a merchant, he does not transgress the law.

hebrew_text: שָׂכִיר בִּזְמַנּוֹ – נִשְׁבָּע וְנוֹטֵל. עָבַר זְמַנּוֹ – אֵינוֹ נִשְׁבָּע וְנוֹטֵל. אִם יֵשׁ עֵדִים שֶׁתְּבָעוֹ בִּזְמַנּוֹ – הֲרֵי זֶה נִשְׁבָּע וְנוֹטֵל.
human_translation: a hired laborer at time takes an oath and takes the time had passed, not take an oath and take If there are witnesses that he claimed him at time, he takes an oath and takes
llm_translation: A hired worker in his time - he swears and takes. If his time has passed - he does not swear and does not take. If there are witnesses who testify against him in his time - behold, he swears and takes.

hebrew_text: גֵּר תּוֹשָׁב יֵשׁ בּוֹ מִשּׁוּם ״בְּיוֹמוֹ תִּתֵּן שְׂכָרוֹ״, וְאֵין בּוֹ מִשּׁוּם ״לֹא תָלִין פְּעוּלַּת שָׂכִיר אִתְּךָ עַד בֹּקֶר״.
human_translation: a gentile who resides in Eretz Yisrael and observes the seven Noahide mitzvot [ ger toshav ] is subject to of: “On the same day you shall give him his wages,” but is not subject to of: “The wages of a hired laborer shall not remain with you all night until the morning.”
llm_translation: A resident alien has in him the law of "you shall give his wages on his day," and does not have in him the law of "you shall not delay the wages of a hired worker with you until morning."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַנִּי מַתְנִיתִין? לָא תַּנָּא קַמָּא דְּ״מֵאַחֶיךָ״, וְלָא רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה. מַאי הִיא, דְּתַנְיָא:
human_translation: Whose the mishna? not the first tanna of “From your brothers” and not Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda. What is As it is taught
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemar mani matnitin? La tana kama d'me'achecha, v'lo Rabbi Yosei bar Rabbi Yehuda. Mai hi, d'tanya: English translation: What is the final ruling of the Mishnah? It was not taught in the first part "from your brothers," and not Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda. What is it that was taught:

hebrew_text: ״מֵאַחֶיךָ״ – פְּרָט לַאֲחֵרִים. ״גֵּרְךָ״ – זֶה גֵּר צֶדֶק. ״בִּשְׁעָרֶיךָ״ – זֶה אוֹכֵל נְבֵילוֹת.
human_translation: “from your brothers” to exclude others, “your stranger,” this a righteous convert. “within your gates,” this eats unslaughtered animal carcasses
llm_translation: "From your brothers" - excluding others. "Your stranger" - this is a righteous convert. "Within your gates" - this refers to one who eats from carcasses.

hebrew_text: אֵין לִי אֶלָּא שְׂכַר אָדָם, מִנַּיִן לְרַבּוֹת בְּהֵמָה וְכֵלִים? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״בְּאַרְצְךָ״ – כׇּל שֶׁבְּאַרְצְךָ. וְכוּלָּן עוֹבְרִים בְּכׇל הַשֵּׁמוֹת הַלָּלוּ.
human_translation: I have only the hire of people. From where to include animals and utensils The verse states: “In your land,” all that is in your land. And all of transgress all of these prohibitions
llm_translation: I have only the reward of a person, how can I include animals and utensils? The Talmud teaches: "In your land" - everything in your land. And all of them pass through all these names.

hebrew_text: מִכָּאן אָמְרוּ: אֶחָד שְׂכַר אָדָם וְאֶחָד שְׂכַר בְּהֵמָה וְאֶחָד שְׂכַר כֵּלִים – יֵשׁ בּוֹ מִשּׁוּם ״בְּיוֹמוֹ תִתֵּן שְׂכָרוֹ״, וְיֵשׁ בָּהֶן מִשּׁוּם ״בַּל תָּלִין פְּעֻלַּת שָׂכִיר״. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: גֵּר תּוֹשָׁב יֵשׁ בּוֹ מִשּׁוּם ״בְּיוֹמוֹ תִּתֵּן שְׂכָרוֹ״, וְאֵין בּוֹ מִשּׁוּם ״לֹא תָלִין״. בְּהֵמָה וְכֵלִים אֵין בָּהֶן אֶלָּא מִשּׁוּם ״בַּל תַּעֲשֹׁק״ בִּלְבַד.
human_translation: From here stated: Whether the hire of a person or the rental of an animal or the rental of utensils, subject to of: “On the same day you shall give him his wages” and they are subject to the prohibition of delaying hired laborer Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says: a ger toshav is subject to of: “On the same day you shall give him his wages,” but is not subject to the prohibition of delaying an animal or vessels is included only in of: “Do not oppress” alone.
llm_translation: From here they said: One who hires a person and one who hires an animal and one who hires utensils - there is in it the law of "You shall give his wages on the same day," and there is in them the law of "You shall not delay the wages of a hired worker." Rabbi Yosei, the son of Rabbi Yehuda, says: A resident alien has in it the law of "You shall give his wages on the same day," and does not have in it the law of "You shall not delay." Regarding an animal and utensils, there is in them only the law of "You shall not oppress."

hebrew_text: מַנִּי? אִי תַּנָּא קַמָּא דְּ״מֵאַחֶיךָ״ – קַשְׁיָא גֵּר תּוֹשָׁב. אִי רַבִּי יוֹסֵי – קַשְׁיָא בְּהֵמָה וְכֵלִים!
human_translation: whose If the first tanna of “From your brothers,” a ger toshav difficult, If Rabbi Yosei, animals and vessels difficult,
llm_translation: Who is the Tanna? If it is the first Tanna who says, "From your brother" - the case of a resident alien is difficult. If it is Rabbi Yosei - the case of an animal and vessels is difficult!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: הַאי תַּנָּא – תַּנָּא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל הוּא, דְּתָנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: אֶחָד שְׂכַר אָדָם, וְאֶחָד שְׂכַר בְּהֵמָה וְאֶחָד שְׂכַר כֵּלִים – יֵשׁ בּוֹ מִשּׁוּם ״בְּיוֹמוֹ תִתֵּן שְׂכָרוֹ״ וּמִשּׁוּם ״לֹא תָלִין״. גֵּר תּוֹשָׁב – יֵשׁ בּוֹ מִשּׁוּם ״בְּיוֹמוֹ תִתֵּן שְׂכָרוֹ״, וְאֵין בּוֹ מִשּׁוּם ״בַּל תָּלִין״.
human_translation: Rava said: This tanna is a tanna from the school of Rabbi Yishmael, as the school of Rabbi Yishmael taught: Whether the hire of a person, the rental of an animal, or the rental of vessels, subject to of: “On the same day you shall give him his wages,” and the prohibition of delaying A ger toshav subject to of: “On the same day you shall give him his wages,” but is not subject to the prohibition of delaying
llm_translation: Rava said: This Mishnah was taught by the school of Rabbi Yishmael, as it was taught by the school of Rabbi Yishmael: One who hires a person, one who hires an animal, and one who hires utensils - in all of these cases there is an obligation of "you shall pay his wages on the same day" and there is an obligation of "you shall not delay." A resident alien - in his case there is an obligation of "you shall pay his wages on the same day," and there is no obligation of "you shall not delay."

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּתַנָּא קַמָּא ״דְּמֵאַחֶיךָ״ – גָּמַר ״שָׂכִיר״ ״שָׂכִיר״. וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה לָא גָּמַר ״שָׂכִיר״ ״שָׂכִיר״.
human_translation: What is the reason of the first tanna of “From your brothers”? derives a hired laborer,” hired laborer And Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, does not derive “Hired laborer” “hired laborer.”
llm_translation: What is the reason that the first Tanna taught "from your brother" - he completed "a hired worker," "a hired worker." But Rabbi Yosei, the son of Rabbi Yehuda, did not complete "a hired worker," "a hired worker."

hebrew_text: נְהִי דְּלָא גָּמַר ״שָׂכִיר״ ״שָׂכִיר״, בְּהֵמָה וְכֵלִים מִשּׁוּם ״בְּיוֹמוֹ תִתֵּן שְׂכָרוֹ״ נָמֵי נִיחַיַּיב? תָּנֵי רַבִּי חֲנַנְיָא, אָמַר קְרָא: ״וְלֹא תָבֹא עָלָיו הַשֶּׁמֶשׁ כִּי עָנִי הוּא״ – מִי שֶׁהֵן בָּאִין לִידֵי עֲנִיּוּת וַעֲשִׁירוּת, יָצְאוּ בְּהֵמָה וְכֵלִים שֶׁאֵינָן בָּאִין לִידֵי עֲנִיּוּת וַעֲשִׁירוּת.
human_translation: Although not derive “Hired laborer” “hired laborer,” should also be liable animals or vessels due to of: “On the same day you shall give him his wages.” Rabbi Ḥananya teaches the verse states: and the sun shall not set upon him, for he is poor” one who enter into poverty and wealth, excludes animals and vessels, which cannot enter into poverty and wealth.
llm_translation: Let it be that he did not complete "hirer" "hirer", an animal and vessels because of "on his day you shall give his wages" is he liable? Rabbi Hananya taught, the verse says: "And the sun shall not come upon him, for he is poor" - those that are subject to poverty and wealth, animals and vessels that are not subject to poverty and wealth are exempt.

hebrew_text: וְתַנָּא קַמָּא, הַאי ״כִּי עָנִי הוּא״ מַאי עָבֵיד לֵיהּ? הַהוּא מִיבְּעֵי: לְהַקְדִּים עָנִי לְעָשִׁיר. וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה: הָהוּא ״מִלֹּא תַעֲשֹׁק שָׂכִיר עָנִי וְאֶבְיוֹן״ נָפְקָא.
human_translation: And the first tanna , this “For he is poor,” what do with it? That necessary to give precedence to a poor person over a wealthy person And Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, that is derived from: “You shall not oppress a hired laborer who is poor and needy”
llm_translation: And it was taught in the first Tanna: This "for he is poor," what does it do for him? That one requires: To prioritize the poor over the rich. And Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, derived from that: "You shall not oppress a hired worker who is poor and needy."

hebrew_text: וְתַנָּא קַמָּא: חַד לְהַקְדִּים עָנִי לְעָשִׁיר, וְחַד לְהַקְדִּים עָנִי לְאֶבְיוֹן.
human_translation: But the first tanna one to give a poor person precedence over a wealthy person, one to give a poor person precedence over a destitute person,
llm_translation: And it was taught in a Baraita: One should give precedence to a poor person over a rich person, and one should give precedence to a poor person over a pauper.

hebrew_text: וּצְרִיכָא, דְּאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן אֶבְיוֹן – מִשּׁוּם דְּלָא כְּסִיף לְמִתְבְּעֵיהּ. אֲבָל עָשִׁיר, דִּכְסִיף לְמִתְבְּעֵיהּ – אֵימָא לָא. וְאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן עָשִׁיר – מִשּׁוּם דְּלָא צְרִיךְ לֵיהּ, אֲבָל אֶבְיוֹן דִּצְרִיךְ לֵיהּ – אֵימָא לָא, צְרִיכָא.
human_translation: And necessary, as had taught us destitute because not ashamed to demand But a wealthy person, who is ashamed to demand say not And had taught us a wealthy person because does not need but a destitute person, who does need it say not necessary
llm_translation: And it is necessary, for if we were to hear a case involving a poor person - because he does not have money to litigate. But a wealthy person, who has money to litigate - we might say no. And if we were to hear a case involving a wealthy person - because he does not need it, but a poor person who needs it - we might say no, it is necessary.

hebrew_text: וְתַנָּא דִּידַן: מָה נַפְשָׁךְ? אִי יָלֵיף ״שָׂכִיר״ ״שָׂכִיר״ – אֲפִילּוּ גֵּר תּוֹשָׁב נָמֵי, אִי לָא יָלֵיף ״שָׂכִיר״ ״שָׂכִיר״ – בְּהֵמָה וְכֵלִים מְנָא לֵיהּ?
human_translation: And the tanna of our whichever way you If he derives “Hired laborer” “hired laborer,” even a ger toshav If not derive “Hired laborer” “hired laborer,” from where does he to animals and vessels?
llm_translation: Our Mishnah teaches: What is your opinion? If one repeats "sakir, sakir" - even a resident alien, but if one does not repeat "sakir, sakir" - how does he reckon with animals and utensils?

hebrew_text: לְעוֹלָם לָא יָלֵיף ״שָׂכִיר״ ״שָׂכִיר״, וְשָׁאנֵי הָתָם דְּאָמַר קְרָא ״וְלֹא תָלִין פְּעֻלַּת שָׂכִיר אִתְּךָ עַד בֹּקֶר״: כֹּל שֶׁפְּעוּלָּתוֹ אִתְּךָ. אִי הָכִי, אֲפִילּוּ גֵּר תּוֹשָׁב נָמֵי! אָמַר קְרָא ״רֵעֲךָ״ – רֵעֲךָ, וְלֹא גֵּר תּוֹשָׁב.
human_translation: Actually, not derive “Hired laborer” “hired laborer,” and there it is different, as the verse states: “The wages of [ pe’ulat ] a hired laborer shall not remain with you all night until the morning” any where its work [ pe’ulato ] is with you, If so, even a ger toshav the verse states: “Your neighbor,” your neighbor and not a ger toshav ,
llm_translation: Forever not will mix "hired worker" "hired worker", and different there that said scripture "and not shall lodge the wages of a hired worker with you until morning": all that his wage with you. If so, even a resident alien also! Said scripture "your neighbor" – your neighbor, and not a resident alien.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, אֲפִילּוּ בְּהֵמָה וְכֵלִים נָמֵי! הָא כְּתִיב ״אִתְּךָ״. מָה רָאִיתָ לְרַבּוֹת בְּהֵמָה וְכֵלִים וּלְהוֹצִיא גֵּר תּוֹשָׁב? מִסְתַּבְּרָא בְּהֵמָה וְכֵלִים הֲוָה לֵיהּ לְרַבּוֹת – שֶׁכֵּן יֶשְׁנָן בִּכְלַל מָמוֹן רֵעֲךָ, גֵּר תּוֹשָׁב אֵינוֹ בִּכְלַל מָמוֹן רֵעֲךָ.
human_translation: If so, even animals and utensils written: “With you,” What did you see to include animals and utensils, and to exclude a ger toshav ? It stands to reason he should include animals and utensils, as they are included in your neighbor’s money, a ger toshav is not included in your neighbor’s money.
llm_translation: If so, even an animal and vessels likewise! It is written "with you." What did you see to include an animal and vessels and to exclude a resident alien? It makes sense that an animal and vessels would be included - because they are considered part of your neighbor's property, but a resident alien is not considered part of your neighbor's property.

hebrew_text: וְתַנָּא קַמָּא דְּ״מֵאַחֶיךָ״ [וְר׳ יוֹסֵי בְּר׳ יְהוּדָה], הַאי ״רֵעֲךָ״ מַאי עָבְדִי לֵיהּ? הַהוּא מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְכִדְתַנְיָא: ״רֵעֲךָ״ וְלֹא גּוֹי. גּוֹי מֵ״אַחֶיךָ״ נָפְקָא!
human_translation: And the first tanna of “From your brothers,” what does he do with this “Your neighbor”? That is necessary for him for that which is taught “Your neighbor,” and not a gentile. a gentile derived from: “Your brothers,”
llm_translation: The first Tanna and Rabbi Yosei son of Rabbi Yehuda taught: What does the term "your neighbor" do for it? That one comes to exclude a non-Jew. A non-Jew is excluded from "your brother"!

hebrew_text: חַד לְמִשְׁרֵא עוֹשְׁקוֹ, וְחַד לְמִשְׁרֵא גְּזֵלוֹ, וְקָא סָבַר גֶּזֶל גּוֹי מוּתָּר. וּצְרִיכִי: דְּאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן גְּזֵלוֹ – מִשּׁוּם דְּלָא טָרַח בֵּיהּ, אֲבָל עוֹשְׁקוֹ, דְּטָרַח בֵּיהּ – אֵימָא לָא. וְאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן עוֹשְׁקוֹ – מִשּׁוּם דְּלָא אֲתָא לִידֵיהּ, אֲבָל גְּזֵלוֹ, דַּאֲתָא לִידֵיהּ – אֵימָא לָא. צְרִיכָא.
human_translation: One to permit oppresses him, and one to permit stealing from him, and necessary. Because had taught us stealing from him, because did not toil for him, but oppresses him, where he toiled for him, say not And had taught us oppresses him because not reached his hand, but stealing from him, that reached his hand, say not necessary.
llm_translation: One for his creditor he oppresses, and one for his creditor he robs, and he holds that the robbery of a non-Jew is permissible. And it is necessary: for if we were to hear that his robbery is permissible - because he did not exert himself in it, but his oppression, in which he exerted himself - we might say no. And if we were to hear that his oppression is permissible - because it does not come into his hands, but his robbery, which comes into his hands - we might say no. It is necessary.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, הַאי ״לֹא תָלִין פְּעֻלַּת שָׂכִיר אִתְּךָ עַד בֹּקֶר״ מַאי עָבֵיד לֵיהּ? מִיבַּעְיָא לֵיהּ לְכִדְרַב אַסִּי. דְּאָמַר רַב אַסִּי: אֲפִילּוּ לֹא שְׂכָרוֹ אֶלָּא לִבְצוֹר לוֹ אֶשְׁכּוֹל אֶחָד שֶׁל עֲנָבִים – עוֹבֵר מִשּׁוּם ״בַּל תָּלִין״.
human_translation: And what Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, do with this “The wages of a hired laborer shall not remain with you all night until the morning”? is necessary for him for that which Rav Asi as Rav Asi says: Even hired to harvest only one cluster of grapes for him, violates the prohibition of delaying
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei son of Rabbi Yehuda said: "Regarding the verse 'You shall not delay the wages of a hired worker with you until morning,' what does one do with it? He brings it as a proof according to Rav Assi, for Rav Assi said: Even if he hired him only to gather for him one cluster of grapes, he transgresses the prohibition of 'You shall not delay.'"

hebrew_text: וְאִידַּךְ: מִ״וְאֵלָיו הוּא נֹשֵׂא אֶת נַפְשׁוֹ״ נָפְקָא, דָּבָר הַמּוֹסֵר נַפְשׁוֹ עָלָיו.
human_translation: And the other derives from “For he sets his soul upon it” something for which he gives his soul.
llm_translation: And the other: "But his own soul to him is lifted up." It emerges, a matter that one who commits his soul upon him.

hebrew_text: וְאִידַּךְ: הַהוּא מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְכִדְתַנְיָא: ״וְאֵלָיו הוּא נֹשֵׂא אֶת נַפְשׁוֹ״, מִפְּנֵי מָה עָלָה זֶה בַּכֶּבֶשׁ וְנִתְלָה בָּאִילָן וּמָסַר אֶת עַצְמוֹ לְמִיתָה – לֹא עַל שְׂכָרוֹ?
human_translation: And the other That necessary for that which is taught “for he sets his soul upon it” For what this ascend on ramp or suspend from a tree and risk death to himself? not for his wages?
llm_translation: And the other one: that one asks according to the teaching: "And he shall lift up his soul unto him," for what reason did this one ascend the ramp and hang himself on the tree and deliver himself to death - not for his reward?

hebrew_text: דָּבָר אַחֵר: ״וְאֵלָיו הוּא נֹשֵׂא אֶת נַפְשׁוֹ״, כָּל הַכּוֹבֵשׁ שְׂכַר שָׂכִיר – כְּאִילּוּ נוֹטֵל נַפְשׁוֹ מִמֶּנּוּ. רַב הוּנָא וְרַב חִסְדָּא, חַד אָמַר: נַפְשׁוֹ שֶׁל גַּזְלָן, וְחַד אָמַר: נַפְשׁוֹ שֶׁל נִגְזָל.
human_translation: Alternatively, “for he sets his soul upon it” one who withholds the wages of a hired laborer, as though he takes his soul from him. Rav Huna and Rav Ḥisda One says the soul of the robber, and one says the soul of the robbery victim,
llm_translation: Another explanation: "And upon him he bears his soul," anyone who withholds the wages of a hired worker, it is as though he takes his soul from him. Rav Huna and Rav Hisda, one said: the soul of the robber, and one said: the soul of the robbed.

hebrew_text: מַאן דְּאָמַר נַפְשׁוֹ שֶׁל גַּזְלָן, דִּכְתִיב: ״אַל תִּגְזׇל דַּל כִּי דַל הוּא וְאַל תְּדַכֵּא עָנִי בַשָּׁעַר״, וּכְתִיב: ״כִּי ה׳ יָרִיב רִיבָם וְקָבַע אֶת קֹבְעֵיהֶם נָפֶשׁ״. וּמַאן דְּאָמַר נַפְשׁוֹ שֶׁל נִגְזָל, דִּכְתִיב: ״כֵּן אׇרְחוֹת כׇּל בּוֹצֵעַ בָּצַע אֶת נֶפֶשׁ בְּעָלָיו יִקָּח״.
human_translation: The one who says the soul of the robber as it is written: “Do not rob from the weak because he is weak, nor crush the poor in the gate” and is written “For the Lord will plead their cause, and spoil the soul of those who spoil them” And the one who says the soul of the robbery victim as it is written: “So are the ways of everyone who is greedy for gain; it takes away the life of its owners”
llm_translation: The one who says the soul of a thief, as it is written: "Do not rob the poor because he is poor, and do not crush the afflicted at the gate," and it is written: "For the Lord will plead their cause and despoil the soul of those who despoil them." And the one who says the soul of the robbed, as it is written: "So are the ways of everyone who is greedy for gain; it takes the life of its possessors."

hebrew_text: וְאִידַּךְ נָמֵי, הָכְתִיב ״אֶת נֶפֶשׁ בְּעָלָיו יִקָּח״! בְּעָלָיו דְּהַשְׁתָּא. וְאִידַּךְ נָמֵי, הָכְתִיב: ״וְקָבַע אֶת קֹבְעֵיהֶם נָפֶשׁ״! מָה טַעַם קָאָמַר: מָה טַעַם ״קָבַע אֶת קֹבְעֵיהֶם״ – מִשּׁוּם דְּנָטְלוּ נָפֶשׁ.
human_translation: And the other too, isn’t it written: “It takes away the life of its owners”? its current owner, And the other too, isn’t it written: “And spoil the soul of those who spoil them”? What is the reason, What is the reason spoil those who spoil them? Because they took soul,
llm_translation: And the other one says, it is written "He shall surely take the soul with its owner"! Its owner of now. And the other one says, it is written: "And he shall establish their life"! What is the reason he says: What is the reason "he shall establish their life" – because they took a soul.

hebrew_text: אֵימָתַי – בִּזְמַן שֶׁתְּבָעוֹ, לֹא תְּבָעוֹ – אֵינוֹ עוֹבֵר עָלָיו. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״לֹא תָלִין פְּעֻלַּת שָׂכִיר״ יָכוֹל אֲפִילּוּ לֹא תְּבָעוֹ – תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״אִתְּךָ״, לְדַעְתְּךָ.
human_translation: When when claimed him. did not claim him, does not transgress The Sages taught: “The wages of a hired laborer shall not remain might even did not claim him. The verse states “with you,” with your knowledge
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "When - at the time that he demands, if he does not demand - he does not transgress. The Rabbis taught: 'Do not delay the wages of a hired worker,' one might think even if he does not demand - the Torah teaches: 'with you,' according to your understanding." English translation: "When - at the time that he demands, if he does not demand - he does not transgress. The Rabbis taught: 'Do not delay the wages of a hired worker,' one might think even if he does not demand - the Torah teaches: 'with you,' according to your understanding."

hebrew_text: יָכוֹל אֲפִילּוּ אֵין לוֹ – תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״אִתְּךָ״. שֶׁיֵּשׁ אִתְּךָ. יָכוֹל אֲפִילּוּ הִמְחָהוּ אֵצֶל חֶנְוָנִי וְאֵצֶל שׁוּלְחָנִי, תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״אִתְּךָ״ וְלֹא שֶׁהִמְחָהוּ אֵצֶל חֶנְוָנִי וְאֵצֶל שׁוּלְחָנִי.
human_translation: might even does not have the verse states “with you,” that there is with you. might even transferred to a storekeeper or to a money changer, the verse states “with you,” but not if transferred it to a storekeeper or to a money changer,
llm_translation: I can even if he does not - Talmud to say: "with you." That there is with you. I can even if he has sold it to Chenvani and to Shulchani, Talmud to say: "with you" and not that he has sold it to Chenvani and to Shulchani.

hebrew_text: הִמְחָהוּ אֵצֶל חֶנְוָנִי וְאֵצֶל שׁוּלְחָנִי – אֵינוֹ עוֹבֵר. אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: חוֹזֵר, אוֹ אֵינוֹ חוֹזֵר? רַב שֵׁשֶׁת אָמַר: אֵינוֹ חוֹזֵר, וְרַבָּה אָמַר: חוֹזֵר.
human_translation: If transferred his with a storekeeper or with a money changer he does not transgress A dilemma was raised before return or not return, Rav Sheshet says he may not return, and Rabba says he may return.
llm_translation: He erases by Chenvani and by Shulchani - he does not transgress. They asked him: Does he return, or does he not return? Rav Sheshet said: He does not return, and Rabbah said: He returns.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה: מְנָא אָמֵינָא לַהּ – מִדְּקָתָנֵי: אֵינוֹ עוֹבֵר עָלָיו, מִעְבָּר הוּא דְּלָא עָבַר, הָא מִיהְדָּר הָדַר. וְרַב שֵׁשֶׁת אָמַר: מַאי אֵינוֹ עוֹבֵר – אֵינוֹ בְּתוֹרַת לַעֲבוֹר.
human_translation: Rabba said: From where do I state From that teaches: He does not transgress He does not transgress but may return And Rav Sheshet said: What not transgress is not in the category of transgressing,
llm_translation: Rabba said: From where do I say this to her - from the fact that it does not pass over him, it is a transgression that he did not transgress, but he returned and transgressed. And Rav Sheshet said: What is "it does not pass over" - it is not in the Torah to pass over.

hebrew_text: בְּעוֹ מִינֵּיהּ מֵרַב שֵׁשֶׁת: קַבְּלָנוּת, עוֹבֵר עָלָיו מִשּׁוּם ״בַּל תָּלִין״, אוֹ אֵין עוֹבֵר מִשּׁוּם ״בַּל תָּלִין״?
human_translation: inquired of Rav Sheshet: a contractor, violate of delaying or not violate of delaying
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Be'o mineih mei Rav Sheshet: kabbalanut, over alav mishum 'bal talin', o ein over mishum 'bal talin'?" English translation: "With regard to his utensils from Rav Sheshet: if he accepts them, does he transgress the prohibition of 'do not delay,' or does he not transgress the prohibition of 'do not delay'?"

hebrew_text: אוּמָּן קוֹנֶה בִּשְׁבַח כְּלִי, וְהַלְוָאָה הִיא? אוֹ אֵין אוּמָּן קוֹנֶה בִּשְׁבַח כְּלִי, וּשְׂכִירוּת הִיא?
human_translation: a craftsman, acquire through enhancement of the vessel? And is a loan Or a craftsman does not acquire through enhancement of the vessel,and is a wage,
llm_translation: Artisan acquires in praise vessel, and loan it is? Or not artisan acquires in praise vessel, and rental it is?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לְהוּ רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: עוֹבֵר! וְהָתַנְיָא: אֵינוֹ עוֹבֵר! הָתָם שֶׁהִמְחָהוּ אֵצֶל חֶנְוָנִי וְאֵצֶל שׁוּלְחָנִי.
human_translation: Rav Sheshet said to them: violate But isn’t it taught does not violate There where transferred to a storekeeper or to a money changer.
llm_translation: He said to them, Rav Sheshet: "He passes!" And it was taught: "He does not pass!" There, because he erased it by Chenvani and by Shulchani.

hebrew_text: נֵימָא מְסַיְּיעָא לֵיהּ: הַנּוֹתֵן טַלִּיתוֹ לְאוּמָּן, גְּמָרָהּ וְהוֹדִיעוֹ, אֲפִילּוּ מִכָּאן וְעַד עֲשָׂרָה יָמִים, אֵינוֹ עוֹבֵר מִשּׁוּם ״בַּל תָּלִין״. נְתָנָהּ לוֹ בַּחֲצִי הַיּוֹם – מִשֶּׁשָּׁקְעָה עָלָיו חַמָּה עוֹבֵר מִשּׁוּם ״בַּל תָּלִין״.
human_translation: Let us say supports one who gave his garment to a craftsman, concluded and notified even from now until ten days he does not violate prohibition of delaying gave to him at midday, once the sun has set owner does violate prohibition of delaying
llm_translation: The Gemara supports him: One who gives his cloak to a craftsman to finish it and inform him, even from here until ten days, he does not transgress the prohibition of "do not leave overnight." If he gave it to him in the middle of the day - if the sun sets upon it, he transgresses the prohibition of "do not leave overnight."

hebrew_text: וְאִי אָמְרַתְּ אוּמָּן קוֹנֶה בִּשְׁבַח כְּלִי – אַמַּאי עוֹבֵר?
human_translation: And if it enters your mind a craftsman acquires through enhancement of the vessel, why does violate
llm_translation: And if you say, "An expert acquires through praise a vessel" - why does he transgress?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב מָרִי בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב כָּהֲנָא: בִּגְרָדָא דְּסַרְבָּלָא. לְמַאי יַהֲבֵהּ נִיהֲלֵיהּ – לְרַכּוֹכֵי, הַיְינוּ שְׁבָחֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rav Mari, son of Rav Kahana, said: with regard to the laundering of a thick garment, where there is no enhancement to what did give it to to soften that is its enhancement,
llm_translation: Rav Mari, son of Rav Kahana, said: In the granary of Sarbalah. For what purpose was it given to him? For the merchants, that is its praise.

hebrew_text: לָא צְרִיכָא, דְּקָא אַגְרֵיהּ (מִינֵּיהּ) לְבַטּוֹשֵׁי בִּטְשָׁא וּבִטְשָׁא בְּמָעֲתָא.
human_translation: No, necessary where hired for treading, a ma’a for each tread.
llm_translation: Not necessary, for he is buying (from him) for the purpose of planting flax and planting flax in a field.

hebrew_text: שָׂכִיר בִּזְמַנּוֹ נִשְׁבָּע וְנוֹטֵל וְכוּ׳. שָׂכִיר אַמַּאי תַּקִּינוּ לֵיה רַבָּנַן (לְמִשְׁתְּבַע) [דְּמִשְׁתְּבַע] וְשָׁקֵיל?
human_translation: a hired laborer at time takes an oath and receives Why the Sages institute a hired laborer, to take an oath and receive
llm_translation: Hired worker in his time swears and takes, etc. Hired worker, why did the Rabbis institute for him to swear and take?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הֲלָכוֹת גְּדוֹלוֹת שָׁנוּ כָּאן. הָנֵי הִלְכְתָא נִינְהוּ? הָנֵי תַּקָּנוֹת נִינְהוּ! אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: תַּקָּנוֹת גְּדוֹלוֹת שָׁנוּ כָּאן. ״גְּדוֹלוֹת״, מִכְּלָל דְּאִיכָּא קְטַנּוֹת?
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says Shmuel says: They taught great halakhot here. Are these halakhot ? They are ordinances Rather, Rav Yehuda says Shmuel says: They taught great ordinances here. great by inference that there are minor
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: Major halakhot were stated here. Are these major halakhot? These are enactments! Rather, Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: Major enactments were stated here. "Major," does this include minor ones?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: תַּקָּנוֹת קְבוּעוֹת שָׁנוּ כָּאן. שְׁבוּעָה דְּבַעַל הַבַּיִת הִיא, וְעַקְרוּהָ רַבָּנַן לִשְׁבוּעָה דְּבַעַל הַבַּיִת וְשַׁדְיוּהָ אַשָּׂכִיר, מִשּׁוּם כְּדֵי חַיָּיו דְּשָׂכִיר. וּמִשּׁוּם כְּדֵי חַיָּיו דְּשָׂכִיר (מַפְסֵדְנָא) [מַפְסְדִינַן] לֵיהּ לְבַעַל הַבַּיִת?
human_translation: Rather, Rav Naḥman says Shmuel says: They taught fixed ordinances here oath is of the employer, but the Sages transferred the oath of the employer and imposed it upon the hired laborer due to the livelihood of the hired laborer. And due to the livelihood of the hired laborer we cause the employer lose out?
llm_translation: Rather, said Rav Nachman in the name of Shmuel: Fixed enactments were established here. The oath of a homeowner it is, and the Rabbis established it for the oath of a homeowner, and they released it to the tenant, for the tenant's livelihood. And due to the tenant's livelihood, do we cause a loss to the homeowner?

hebrew_text: בַּעַל הַבַּיִת גּוּפֵיהּ נִיחָא לֵיהּ דְּמִשְׁתְּבַע שָׂכִיר וְשָׁקֵיל, כִּי הֵיכִי דְּלִיתַּגְרוּ לֵיהּ פּוֹעֲלִים. שָׂכִיר גּוּפֵיהּ נִיחָא לֵיהּ דְּמִשְׁתְּבַע בַּעַל הַבַּיִת וְנִפְקַע, כִּי הֵיכִי דְּלִיגְרוּהּ בַּעַל הַבַּיִת? עַל כֻּרְחֵיהּ אָגַר. שָׂכִיר נָמֵי בְּעַל כֻּרְחֵיהּ (אִיתְּגַר)!
human_translation: preferable for the employer himself that the hired laborer should take an oath and receive so that laborers will hire themselves out to him preferable for the hired laborer himself that the employer should take an oath and be exempt so that he should be hired? employer must perforce hire. A hired laborer, too, must perforce be hired out.
llm_translation: The master of the house, his body is pleased when he hires and takes, so that the workers do not rebel against him. The hired worker, his body is pleased when he makes an agreement with the master of the house and leaves, so that the master of the house does not dismiss him. Against his will, he receives wages. The hired worker is also against the will of the master of the house (he is hired)!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא בַּעַל הַבַּיִת טָרוּד בְּפוֹעֲלִים הוּא. אִי הָכִי נִיתֵּב לֵיהּ בְּלָא שְׁבוּעָה! כְּדֵי לְהָפִיס דַּעְתּוֹ שֶׁל בַּעַל הַבַּיִת.
human_translation: Rather, the employer is preoccupied with laborers, If so, should give without an oath, in order to alleviate the concerns of the employer,
llm_translation: Rather, the homeowner is troubled with tasks. If so, he should be established without an oath! In order to appease the mind of the homeowner.

hebrew_text: וְנִיתֵּב לֵיהּ בְּעֵדִים? טְרִיחָא לְהוּ מִילְּתָא. וְנִיתֵּב לֵיהּ מֵעִיקָּרָא? שְׁנֵיהֶם רוֹצִים בְּהַקָּפָה.
human_translation: But have give him in witnesses The matter an inconvenience to them But have give him at the outset, Both of them want of credit,
llm_translation: And he will be established with witnesses? It is necessary for them for the matter. And he will be established from the beginning? Both of them desire a compromise.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, אֲפִילּוּ קָצַץ נָמֵי! אַלְּמָה תַּנְיָא, אוּמָּן אוֹמֵר: שְׁתַּיִם קָצַצְתָּ לִי, וְהַלָּה אוֹמֵר: לֹא קָצַצְתִּי לְךָ אֶלָּא אַחַת – הַמּוֹצִיא מֵחֲבֵירוֹ עָלָיו הָרְאָיָה. קְצִיצָה וַדַּאי מִידְכָּר דְּכִירִי לַהּ אִינָשֵׁי.
human_translation: If so, even a fixed as well, Why did we learn the craftsman says: You fixed two for me and the other, says: I fixed only one for you, the burden of proof rests upon the claimant. The fixing certainly people remember,
llm_translation: If so, even if he cut his bread! Why is it taught, Uman says: "You cut two for me," and Hala says: "I did not cut for you except one" - the one who brings evidence against his fellow, the burden of proof is upon him. Cutting is certainly a familiar act for people.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, אֲפִילּוּ עָבַר זְמַנּוֹ נָמֵי, אַלְּמָה תְּנַן: עָבַר זְמַנּוֹ – אֵינוֹ נִשְׁבָּע וְנוֹטֵל? חֲזָקָה: אֵין בַּעַל הַבַּיִת עוֹבֵר מִשּׁוּם ״בַּל תָּלִין״.
human_translation: If so, even his time had passed Why did we learn the time had passed not take an oath and receive a presumption an employer does not violate of delaying
llm_translation: If so, even if his time has passed, why do we learn: if his time has passed - he does not swear and take? Strong: the homeowner does not transgress because of "do not delay."

hebrew_text: וְהָא אָמְרַתְּ בַּעַל הַבַּיִת טָרוּד בְּפוֹעֲלָיו הוּא! הָנֵי מִילֵּי – מִקַּמֵּי דְּלִימְטְיֵיהּ זְמַן חִיּוּבֵיהּ,
human_translation: But didn’t you say the employer is preoccupied with his laborers? This statement before the time of his obligation arrives,
llm_translation: And this, you say, the master of the house is troubled in his actions! These words - before he fulfills his obligations,

hebrew_text: אֲבָל מְטָא זְמַן חִיּוּבֵיהּ – רָמֵי אַנַּפְשֵׁיהּ וּמִידְּכַר.
human_translation: but the time of his obligation arrives, he applies himself and remembers
llm_translation: But when the time of its obligation arrives - he throws himself and immediately remembers.

hebrew_text: וְכִי שָׂכִיר עוֹבֵר מִשּׁוּם ״בַּל תִּגְזֹל״? הָתָם תְּרֵי חֲזָקֵי, הָכָא חֲדָא חֲזָקָה. גַּבֵּי בַּעַל הַבַּיִת אִיכָּא תְּרֵי חֲזָקֵי: חֲדָא דְּאֵין בַּעַל הַבַּיִת עוֹבֵר מִשּׁוּם ״בַּל תָּלִין״, וַחֲדָא דְּאֵין שָׂכִיר מְשַׁהֶא שְׂכָרוֹ. וְהָכָא חֲדָא חֲזָקָה.
human_translation: But is the hired laborer violating prohibition of stealing? There, two presumptions, here, one presumption. Concerning an employer there are two presumptions: One that the employer does not violate prohibition of delaying and one that a hired laborer does not delay his wages. But here, one presumption,
llm_translation: And when a hired worker transgresses due to "Do not steal"? There, two presumptions; here, one presumption. Regarding the homeowner, there are two presumptions: one that the homeowner does not transgress due to "Do not delay payment," and one that the worker does not delay his wage. And here, one presumption.

hebrew_text: אִם יֵשׁ עֵדִים שֶׁתְּבָעוֹ – הֲרֵי זֶה נִשְׁבָּע וְנוֹטֵל. וְהָא (קָתָבְעוֹ לְקַמַּן) [קָא תָבַע לֵיהּ קַמַּן]? אָמַר רַבִּי אַסִּי: שֶׁתְּבָעוֹ בִּזְמַנּוֹ. וְדִלְמָא לְבָתַר הָכִי פְּרַע? אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: שֶׁתְּבָעוֹ כָּל זְמַנּוֹ.
human_translation: If there are witnesses that he claimed him, he takes an oath and receives But he is claiming him in front of us? Rabbi Asi said: that claimed him at its time. perhaps paid afterward. Abaye said: that he claimed him the entire time,
llm_translation: If there are witnesses that he summoned - he takes an oath and collects. But didn't he summon him later? Rabbi Assi said: He summoned him in his time. And perhaps he retracted afterwards? Abaye said: He summoned him at all times.

hebrew_text: וּלְעוֹלָם לָא פָּרַע לֵיהּ?! אָמַר רַב חָמָא בַּר עוּקְבָא: כְּנֶגֶד אוֹתוֹ הַיּוֹם שֶׁל תְּבִיעָה.
human_translation: And always did not pay Rav Ḥama bar Ukva said: corresponding to that day of claim
llm_translation: And forever not he paid him?! Said Rav Ḥama son of Uqva: Corresponding to that day of claim.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַמַּלְוֶה אֶת חֲבֵירוֹ – לֹא יְמַשְׁכְּנֶנּוּ אֶלָּא בְּבֵית דִּין. וְלֹא יִכָּנֵס לְבֵיתוֹ לִיטּוֹל מַשְׁכּוֹנוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״בַּחוּץ תַּעֲמֹד״. הָיוּ לוֹ שְׁנֵי כֵלִים – נוֹטֵל אֶחָד וּמַנִּיחַ אֶחָד.
human_translation: who lends another may take collateral from him only by means of the court, And he may not enter house to take his collateral, as it is stated: You shall stand outside, had two utensils takes one and leaves one
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who lends to his fellow - he may only collect from him through a court. And he may not enter his house to take his collateral, as it is stated: "You shall stand outside." If he has two vessels - he takes one and leaves one.

hebrew_text: וּמַחְזִיר אֶת הַכַּר בַּלַּיְלָה וְאֶת הַמַּחְרֵישָׁה בַּיּוֹם. וְאִם מֵת – אֵינוֹ מַחְזִיר לְיוֹרְשָׁיו. רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: אַף לְעַצְמוֹ אֵינוֹ מַחְזִיר אֶלָּא עַד שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם, וּמִשְּׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם וּלְהַלָּן מוֹכְרָן בְּבֵית דִּין.
human_translation: And must return a pillow at night, and a plow, by day. If died, not return to heirs. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: Even to himself return only until thirty days and from thirty days onward, sell them in court,
llm_translation: He returns the plow at night and the hoe during the day. And if he dies - he does not return them to his heirs. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: He does not even return them to himself except for thirty days, and after thirty days, he sells them in court.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: שְׁלִיחַ בֵּית דִּין מְנַתַּח נַתּוֹחֵי – אִין, אֲבָל מַשְׁכּוֹנֵי – לָא. וְהָתְנַן: הַמַּלְוֶה אֶת חֲבֵירוֹ לֹא יְמַשְׁכְּנֶנּוּ אֶלָּא בְּבֵית דִּין, מִכְּלָל דִּבְבֵית דִּין מְמַשְׁכְּנִין!
human_translation: Shmuel says: An agent the court may seize but not take collateral. But didn’t we learn who lends another may take collateral from him only by means of the court, by inference that by means of the court take collateral?
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemara said Shmuel: An agent of the court may cut off the debtor's produce - yes, but to collect from the collateral - no. And we learned in a Mishnah: One who lends to his fellow should not collect from him except through the court, which implies that through the court they do collect!

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָךְ שְׁמוּאֵל: אֵימָא, לֹא יְנַתְּחֶנּוּ אֶלָּא בְּבֵית דִּין. הָכִי נָמֵי מִסְתַּבְּרָא, דְּקָתָנֵי סֵיפָא: לֹא יִכָּנֵס לְבֵיתוֹ לִיטּוֹל מַשְׁכּוֹנוֹ. מַנִּי? אִילֵּימָא בַּעַל חוֹב – מֵרֵישָׁא שָׁמְעַתְּ מִינַּהּ! אֶלָּא לָאו, שְׁלִיחַ בֵּית דִּין!
human_translation: Shmuel said to you: Say He may seize it only by means of the court. So, too, it is reasonable as the latter clause teaches: he may not enter house to take his collateral. Who is If we say the creditor, concluded from the first clause Rather, is it not to the court agent?
llm_translation: He said to you, Samuel: Why? He shall not be dismembered except in a court. So it is reasoned, as the latter clause teaches: He shall not enter his house to take his collateral. What is the reason? If you say it is because of a creditor - you heard it from the beginning! Rather, it is because he is an agent of the court!
