hebrew_text: אִי מִשּׁוּם הָא – לָא אִירְיָא. הָכִי קָאָמַר: הַמַּלְוֶה אֶת חֲבֵירוֹ לֹא יְמַשְׁכְּנֶנּוּ אֶלָּא בְּבֵית דִּין, מִכְּלָל דִּבְבֵית דִּין מְמַשְׁכְּנִים, וּבַעַל חוֹב אֲפִילּוּ נַתּוֹחֵי נָמֵי לָא, שֶׁלֹּא יִכָּנֵס לְבֵיתוֹ לִיטּוֹל מַשְׁכּוֹנוֹ.
human_translation: If is due to that there is no argument, this is saying: who lends another may take collateral from him only by means of the court, by inference that take collateral by means of the court. But creditor not even seize that not enter house to take his collateral.
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "If it is done due to the pledge - it is not called a loan." This is what he is saying: One who lends to his fellow should not take collateral from him except through a court, as it is inferred that they take collateral through a court. And a creditor, even if he is from the nobles of the nations, should not enter his house to take his collateral.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רַב יוֹסֵף: ״לָא יַחֲבֹל רֵיחַיִם וָרָכֶב״, הָא דְּבָרִים אֲחֵרִים – חֲבֹל. ״לֹא תַחֲבֹל בֶּגֶד אַלְמָנָה״, הָא שֶׁל אֲחֵרִים – תַּחְבֹּל, מַאן? אִי נֵימָא בַּעַל חוֹב, הָא כְּתִיב: ״לֹא תָבֹא אֶל בֵּיתוֹ לַעֲבֹט עֲבֹטוֹ״, אֶלָּא לָאו שְׁלִיחַ בֵּית דִּין!
human_translation: Rav Yosef raises an objection “He may not take the lower or upper millstone as collateral” But other items taken as collateral. “You may not take a widow’s garment as collateral” but belongs to others you may take as collateral. Who If we say the creditor is written: “You shall not go into his house to take his collateral” Rather, is it not the agent of the court,
llm_translation: Rav Yosef raises an objection: "Do not destroy fruit trees and crops," - this refers to other matters - destroy. "Do not destroy the garment of a widow," - this refers to someone else - you shall destroy. Who? If we say it is a debtor, it is written: "Do not enter his house to take his pledge," except for a messenger of the court!

hebrew_text: תַּרְגְּמַהּ רַב פָּפָּא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב נַחְמָן קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב יוֹסֵף, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ רַב פָּפָּא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יוֹסֵף קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב יוֹסֵף: לְעוֹלָם בְּבַעַל חוֹב, וְלַעֲבוֹר עָלָיו בִּשְׁנֵי לָאוִין.
human_translation: Rav Pappa, son of Rav Naḥman, interpreted before Rav Yosef; and some say Rav Pappa, son of Rav Yosef, before Rav Yosef: Actually, to a creditor, and so that he will violate two prohibitions
llm_translation: Rav Papa, son of Rav Nachman, translated it before Rav Yosef, and some say that Rav Papa, son of Rav Yosef, translated it before Rav Yosef: Always with a creditor, and to transgress upon him with two prohibitions.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: מִמַּשְׁמַע שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר ״בַּחוּץ תַּעֲמֹד״ אֵינִי יוֹדֵעַ שֶׁ״הָאִישׁ אֲשֶׁר אַתָּה נוֹשֶׁה בוֹ יוֹצִיא״! אֶלָּא מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״וְהָאִישׁ״ – לְרַבּוֹת שְׁלִיחַ בֵּית דִּין. מַאי לָאו: שְׁלִיחַ בֵּית דִּין כְּלֹוֶה?
human_translation: Come hear From the implication of that is stated: “You shall stand outside,” do I not know that: “And the man to whom you lend shall bring forth outside” Rather, why the verse state “And the man to include the agent of the court. What, is it not the agent of the court as the debtor
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Come and hear: From what is heard, as it is said, "He shall stand outside," I do not know that "the man whom you are indebted to shall bring out"! Rather, what is the teaching to say "and the man" - to include the agent of the court. What is the reason that the agent of the court is not like a borrower?

hebrew_text: לָא, שְׁלִיחַ בֵּית דִּין כְּמַלְוֶה.
human_translation: No, the agent the court like creditor,
llm_translation: Not, messenger of court as lender.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: ״אִם חָבֹל תַּחְבֹּל שַׂלְמַת רֵעֶךָ״ – בִּשְׁלִיחַ בֵּית דִּין הַכָּתוּב מְדַבֵּר. אַתָּה אוֹמֵר בִּשְׁלִיחַ בֵּית דִּין הַכָּתוּב מְדַבֵּר, אוֹ אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא בְּבַעַל חוֹב? כְּשֶׁהוּא אוֹמֵר ״לֹא תָבֹא אֶל בֵּיתוֹ לַעֲבֹט עֲבֹטוֹ״ – הֲרֵי בַּעַל חוֹב אָמוּר, הָא מָה אֲנִי מְקַיֵּים ״אִם חָבֹל תַּחְבֹּל שַׂלְמַת רֵעֶךָ״ – בִּשְׁלִיחַ בֵּית דִּין הַכָּתוּב מְדַבֵּר!
human_translation: Come hear “If you take as collateral your neighbor’s garment, The verse is speaking of an agent of the court. you say the verse is speaking of an agent of the court, or it is only to a creditor? When it says: “You shall not go into his house to take his collateral” a creditor is thereby stated. How do I realize “If you take as collateral your neighbor’s garment”? The verse is speaking of an agent of the court.
llm_translation: Come and hear: "If you take a pledge from your neighbor" - this is speaking of the court's agent. You might say it is speaking of the court's agent, or perhaps only of a creditor? When it says, "You shall not go into his house to take his pledge" - this is clearly referring to a creditor. How then do I fulfill "If you take a pledge from your neighbor" - this is speaking of the court's agent!

hebrew_text: תַּנָּאֵי הִיא, דְּתַנְיָא: שְׁלִיחַ בֵּית דִּין שֶׁבָּא לְמַשְׁכְּנוֹ – לֹא יִכָּנֵס לְבֵיתוֹ לְמַשְׁכְּנוֹ, אֶלָּא עוֹמֵד מִבַּחוּץ, וְהַלָּה מוֹצִיא לוֹ מַשְׁכּוֹן, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר ״בַּחוּץ תַּעֲמֹד וְהָאִישׁ״.
human_translation: is tanna’im , as it is taught An agent of the court who comes to take collateral not enter his house to take the collateral from him. Rather, stands outside and the other, brings out collateral to him, as it is stated: “You shall stand outside, and the man
llm_translation: It is taught in a Baraita: If a messenger of the court comes to take possession – he should not enter his house to take possession, rather he stands outside, and the owner brings out the possession to him, as it is stated, "Stand outside, and the man."

hebrew_text: וְתַנְיָא אִידַּךְ: בַּעַל חוֹב שֶׁבָּא לְמַשְׁכְּנוֹ – לֹא יִכָּנֵס לְבֵיתוֹ לְמַשְׁכְּנוֹ, אֶלָּא עוֹמֵד בַּחוּץ, וְהַלָּה נִכְנָס וּמוֹצִיא לוֹ מַשְׁכּוֹנוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״בַּחוּץ תַּעֲמֹד״. וּשְׁלִיחַ בֵּית דִּין שֶׁבָּא לְמַשְׁכְּנוֹ – הֲרֵי זֶה נִכְנָס לְבֵיתוֹ וּמְמַשְׁכְּנוֹ.
human_translation: And it is taught another A creditor who comes to take collateral from may not enter his house to take his collateral. Rather, stands outside, and the other, enters and brings out the collateral to him, as it is stated: “You shall stand outside, But an agent of the court who comes to take collateral from this may enter his house and take his collateral.
llm_translation: And it was taught in another Baraita: A creditor who comes to collect his debt - he may not enter his house to collect his debt, rather he stands outside, and the borrower enters and brings out his debt to him, as it is stated: "You shall stand outside." And a messenger of the court who comes to collect his debt - he may enter his house and collect his debt.

hebrew_text: וְלֹא יְמַשְׁכְּנֶנּוּ דְּבָרִים שֶׁעוֹשִׂין בָּהֶן אוֹכֶל נֶפֶשׁ. וְנוֹתֵן מִטָּה וּמִטָּה וּמַצָּע – לְעָשִׁיר. מִטָּה וּמִטָּה וּמַפָּץ – לְעָנִי. לוֹ – אֲבָל לֹא לְאִשְׁתּוֹ, וְלֹא לְבָנָיו וְלִבְנוֹתָיו.
human_translation: not take collateral from items that use in the preparation of food, And gives, a bed, and bed, and blankets, for a wealthy person; a bed, and bed, and a mat, for a poor person. for but not for his wife, and not for his sons or for his daughters,
llm_translation: And not draw him out words that they do with them food soul. And gives bed and bed and pillow - to the rich. Bed and bed and mat - to the poor. To him - but not to his wife, and not to his sons and daughters.

hebrew_text: כְּדֶרֶךְ שֶׁמְּסַדְּרִין לְבַעַל חוֹב – כָּךְ מְסַדְּרִין בַּעֲרָכִין. כְּלַפֵּי לְיָיא?! עִיקַּר סִידּוּר – בַּעֲרָכִין כְּתִיב! אֶלָּא אֵימָא: כְּדֶרֶךְ שֶׁמְּסַדְּרִין בַּעֲרָכִין – כָּךְ מְסַדְּרִין בְּבַעַל חוֹב.
human_translation: In the manner that arrangements are made for a debtor so arrangements are made for valuations. Isn’t it the opposite? primary arrangements is stated with regard to valuations, Rather, say in the manner that arrangements are made for valuations so arrangements are made for a debtor.
llm_translation: As they arrange for a creditor - so they arrange in assessments. According to what criterion?! The main arrangement - in assessments it is written! Rather say: As they arrange in assessments - so they arrange for a creditor.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: נוֹתֵן מִטָּה וּמִטָּה וּמַצָּע לְעָשִׁיר, מִטָּה וּמִטָּה וּמַפָּץ לְעָנִי. לְמַאן? אִילֵימָא לְאִשְׁתּוֹ וּלְבָנָיו וְלִבְנוֹתָיו – הָא אָמְרַתְּ, לוֹ, אֲבָל לֹא לְאִשְׁתּוֹ וּלְבָנָיו וְלִבְנוֹתָיו! אֶלָּא אִידֵּי וְאִידֵּי לְדִידֵיהּ.
human_translation: The Master said gives a bed, and bed, and blankets, for a wealthy person; a bed, and bed, and a mat, for a poor person. For whom If we say for his wife, for his sons, or for his daughters, didn’t you say for him, but not for his wife, for his sons, or for his daughters? Rather, this and that are for him.
llm_translation: Master said: One gives a bed and a bed and a pillow to a rich person, a bed and a bed and a mat to a poor person. For whom? If you say for his wife and his sons and his daughters - didn't you say, for him, but not for his wife and his sons and his daughters! Rather, for him and for his own.

hebrew_text: תַּרְתֵּי לְמָה לִי? חֲדָא דְּאָכֵיל עֲלַהּ וַחֲדָא דְּזָג עֲלַהּ, כְּדִשְׁמוּאֵל. דְּאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: כֹּל מִילֵּי יָדַעְנָא אָסוּתַיְיהוּ, לְבַר מֵהָנֵי תְּלָת: מַאן דְּאָכֵיל אֲהִינָא מְרִירָא אַלִּיבָּא רֵיקָנָא, מַאן דְּאָסַר מִיתְנָא דְּכִיתָּנָא רַטִּיבָא אַחַרְצֵיהּ, וּמַאן דְּאָכֵיל נַהֲמָא וְלָא מְסַגֵּי אַרְבְּעָה גַּרְמִידֵי.
human_translation: Why does two One for eat on it and one for sleep on it, in accordance Shmuel. As Shmuel, said: all items I know their cure, apart from these three: One who eats a bitter date [ ahina ] on an empty stomach, one who girds a wet linen belt around his loins, and one who eats bread and does not walk four cubits
llm_translation: Two reasons why do I need them? One who eats its leaf and one who grazes on it, as Samuel said. For Samuel said: I know all the reasons for three things: One who eats bitter food on an empty stomach, one who drinks water after eating moist dates, and one who eats bread without drinking water afterwards.

hebrew_text: תָּנֵי תַּנָּא קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב נַחְמָן: כְּדֶרֶךְ שֶׁמְּסַדְּרִין בַּעֲרָכִין – כָּךְ מְסַדְּרִין בְּבַעַל חוֹב. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הַשְׁתָּא זַבּוֹנֵי מְזַבְּנִינַן לֵיהּ, סַדּוֹרֵי מְסַדְּרִינַן לֵיהּ?! וּמִי מְזַבְּנִינַן לֵיהּ? וְהָתְנַן: מַחְזִיר אֶת הַכַּר בַּלַּיְלָה, וְאֶת הַמַּחְרֵישָׁה בַּיּוֹם!
human_translation: A tanna taught before Rav Naḥman: In the manner in which arrangements are made for valuations, so arrangements are made for a debtor. said to him: Now we sell we arrange for him And do we sell it? But didn’t we learn he returns a pillow at night and a plow by day,
llm_translation: The Tanna taught before Rav Nachman: Just as they arrange in the markets, so too they arrange in Baal Hov. He said to him: Now, we are arranging for him sellers, are we arranging for him arrangers?! And who are we selling to him? And we learned: One returns the loaf at night, and the silence during the day!

hebrew_text: תַּנָּא כְּרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל תַּנָּא קַמֵּיהּ, וְהָכִי קָאָמַר לֵיהּ: הַשְׁתָּא לְרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל זַבּוֹנֵי מְזַבְּנִינַן לֵיהּ, סַדּוֹרֵי מְסַדְּרִינַן לֵיהּ? דִּתְנַן, רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: אַף לְעַצְמוֹ אֵינוֹ מַחְזִיר אֶלָּא עַד שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם, מִכָּאן וְאֵילָךְ מוֹכְרָן בְּבֵית דִּין.
human_translation: The tanna taught before him in accordance with Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, and this is what was saying to him: Now, according to Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel we sell we make arrangements for him As we learned Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: Even to himself return only until thirty days and from that point onward, sell them in court,
llm_translation: We learned: Like Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, a teaching was taught before him, and thus he said to him: "Now, for Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, do we appoint appraisers to appraise for him, and do we arrange rows for him?" For we learned: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: "Even for himself, he does not return a lost item except for thirty days, from here on they are sold in court."

hebrew_text: וּמִמַּאי דְּכִי קָאָמַר רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל זַבּוֹנֵי – לִגְמָרֵי קָאָמַר? דִּלְמָא הָכִי קָאָמַר: עַד שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם [מַ]הְדַּר לֵיהּ בְּעֵינֵיהּ, מִכָּאן וְאֵילָךְ מַיהְדַּר לֵיהּ לְמַאי דַּחֲזֵי לֵיהּ, וּמְזַבְּנִינַן מַאי דְּלָא חֲזֵי לֵיהּ?
human_translation: And from where that when Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel said sells was saying a complete Perhaps this is saying: Until thirty days, returns to as is; from that onward, returns to him that which is fit for him, and we sell what is not fit for him.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And from what does Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel say "zabonei" - does he say it completely? Perhaps he says it like this: until thirty days, he beautifies it in her eyes, from here on he beautifies it for what she sees, and we sell what she does not see?

hebrew_text: אִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ אִית לֵיהּ לְרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל הַאי סְבָרָא, לֵיכָּא מִידֵּי דְּלָא חֲזֵי לֵיהּ. דְּאָמַר אַבָּיֵי: רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל, וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, וְרַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל, וְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא – כּוּלְּהוּ סְבִירָא לְהוּ: כׇּל יִשְׂרָאֵל בְּנֵי מְלָכִים הֵן.
human_translation: If it enters your mind Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel maintains this reasoning, there is nothing that is unfit for him. As Abaye said: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel and Rabbi Shimon and Rabbi Yishmael and Rabbi Akiva all hold all Israel are the children of kings.
llm_translation: If it enters your mind that Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel holds this opinion, it is not in accordance with what he sees. For Abaye said: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, and Rabbi Shimon, and Rabbi Yishmael, and Rabbi Akiva - all of them hold the opinion: "All of Israel are sons of kings."

hebrew_text: רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל, דִּתְנַן: לֹא אֶת הַלּוּף וְלָא אֶת הַחַרְדָּל. רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל מַתִּיר בַּלּוּף, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהוּא מַאֲכָל לְעוֹרְבִין.
human_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel as we learned not arum or mustard In arum, Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel permits because it is food for ravens,
llm_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, as we have learned: not the leek and not the mustard. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel permits the leek, because it is food for crows.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, דִּתְנַן: בְּנֵי מְלָכִים סָכִין שֶׁמֶן וֶורֶד עַל גַּבֵּי מַכּוֹתֵיהֶן בְּשַׁבָּת, שֶׁכֵּן דַּרְכָּן לָסוּךְ בַּחוֹל. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: כׇּל יִשְׂרָאֵל בְּנֵי מְלָכִים הֵן.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon as we learned Princes may smear rose oil on their wounds on Shabbat, that it is the usual manner to smear during the week Rabbi Shimon says: All of the Jewish people are princes,
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon, as we learned: The sons of kings may anoint oil and rosewater on their wounds on Shabbat, for it is their way to anoint on a weekday. Rabbi Shimon says: All of Israel are sons of kings.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל וְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, דְּתַנְיָא: הֲרֵי שֶׁהָיוּ נוֹשִׁין בּוֹ אֶלֶף זוּז וְלָבוּשׁ אִיצְטְלָא בַּת מֵאָה מָנֶה – מַפְשִׁיטִין אוֹתָהּ מִמֶּנּוּ וּמַלְבִּישִׁים אוֹתוֹ אִיצְטְלָא הָרְאוּיָה לוֹ. וְתָנָא מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל, וְתָנָא מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: כׇּל יִשְׂרָאֵל רְאוּיִן לְאוֹתָהּ אִיצְטְלָא.
human_translation: Rabbi Yishmael and Rabbi Akiva as it is taught were claiming one thousand dinars and wearing a cloak [ itztela ] worth ten thousand dinars, strips it from him and dresses him a cloak appropriate for him, And taught in the name of Rabbi Yishmael, and taught in the name of Rabbi Akiva: All of the Jewish people are fit for that cloak.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yishmael and Rabbi Akiva, as it was taught: If they were marrying her with a thousand zuz and she was dressed in a hundred mana garment - they remove it from him and dress him with a garment suitable for him. And it was taught in the name of Rabbi Yishmael, and it was taught in the name of Rabbi Akiva: All of Israel are suitable for that garment.

hebrew_text: וּלְמַאי דִּסְלֵיק אַדַּעְתִּין מֵעִיקָּרָא, דְּיָהֵיב לֵיהּ מַאי דַּחֲזֵי לֵיהּ, וּמְזַבְּנִינַן מַאי דְּלָא חֲזֵי לֵיהּ? בִּשְׁלָמָא כַּר וָכֶסֶת חֲזֵי לֵיהּ דְּבֵינֵי בֵּינֵי. אֶלָּא מַחְרֵישָׁה לְמַאי חַזְיָא? אָמַר רָבָא בַּר רַבָּה: מַחְרֵישָׁה דְּכַסְפָּא.
human_translation: And with regard to what entered our minds initially, that returns to him that which is fit for him and we sell what is not fit for him, Granted, between fit for him But for what is a plow fit? Rava bar Rabba said: a silver plow,
llm_translation: And for what does one remove the knowledge from the beginning, that he gives him what he sees, and we sell what he does not see? Regarding a pillow and a cushion, he sees what is between them. But why does he remain silent? Rava bar Rabbah said: He remains silent about money.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב חַגָּא: וְלֵימָא לֵיהּ, לָאו עֲלַי קָרְמֵית? אָמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי:
human_translation: Rav Ḥagga objects to this Let say to Your are not cast upon me. Abaye said to him:
llm_translation: Rav Ḥaga pushed back against her: And let him say to her, is it not about the crimson thread? Abaye said to her:

hebrew_text: אִיבְרָא עֲלֵיהּ קָרְמֵי, מִשּׁוּם שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וּלְךָ תִּהְיֶה צְדָקָה״.
human_translation: Indeed, cast upon him, because it is stated “And it shall be righteousness to you”
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "Ivra alei karme, mi'shum shene'emar: 'u'l'kha tihyeh tzedakah'."

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: מַהוּ שֶׁיְּסַדְּרוּ בְּבַעַל חוֹב? מִי גָמַר ״מִיכָה״ ״מִיכָה״ מֵעֲרָכִין, אוֹ לָא?
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before What is making arrangements for the debtor whether or not derived from “poor” “poor” valuations
llm_translation: He asked them: What is the law regarding one who arranges with a creditor? Who completed "Micah" "Micah" from the array, or not?

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע, דִּשְׁלַח רָבִין בְּאִגַּרְתֵּיהּ: דָּבָר זֶה שָׁאַלְתִּי לְכׇל רַבּוֹתַי, וְלֹא אָמְרוּ לִי דָּבָר. בְּרַם כָּךְ הָיְתָה שְׁאֵלָה: הָאוֹמֵר ״הֲרֵי עָלַי מָנֶה לְבֶדֶק הַבַּיִת״, מַהוּ שֶׁיְּסַדְּרוּ?
human_translation: Come hear as Ravin sent in his letter I asked all my teachers this matter, but they did not tell me anything. But there was this question one who says: It upon me one hundred dinars for the Temple maintenance, what is they make arrangements
llm_translation: Come and hear, for Ravin sent in his letter: "This matter I asked of all my teachers, and they did not say anything to me. However, this was the question: One who says, 'I undertake to inspect the house,' how should they arrange it?"

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יַעֲקֹב מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּבַר פַּדָּא, וְרַבִּי יִרְמְיָה מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּאִילְפָא אָמְרִי: קַל וָחוֹמֶר מִבַּעַל חוֹב. וּמָה בַּעַל חוֹב שֶׁמַּחְזִירִין – אֵין מְסַדְּרִין, הֶקְדֵּשׁ שֶׁאֵין מַחְזִירִין – אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁאֵין מְסַדְּרִין! וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: ״נֶדֶר בְּעֶרְכְּךָ״ כְּתִיב, מָה עֲרָכִין מְסַדְּרִין – אַף הֶקְדֵּשׁ מְסַדְּרִין.
human_translation: Rabbi Ya’akov in the name of bar Padda, and Rabbi Yirmeya in the name of Ilfa, say: a fortiori from a debtor: And if a debtor, to returns not make arrangements consecration, where not return is it not logical that not make arrangements And Rabbi Yoḥanan says: is written: a vow according to your valuation” just as make arrangements valuations, so too make arrangements consecration.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yaakov from the name of Dvar Pada, and Rabbi Yirmeya from the name of Ilfa said: A fortiori reasoning from a creditor. And just as a creditor who restores - they do not arrange, consecrated property that does not restore - is it not logical that they do not arrange! And Rabbi Yochanan said: "A vow according to your valuation" is written, just as valuations they arrange - so too consecrated property they arrange.

hebrew_text: וְאִידַּךְ: הַהוּא לְנִידּוֹן בִּכְבוֹדוֹ הוּא דַּאֲתָא. מָה עֲרָכִין נִידּוֹן בִּכְבוֹדוֹ – אַף הֶקְדֵּשׁ נִידּוֹן בִּכְבוֹדוֹ.
human_translation: And the other that comes to judged by its significance. just as valuations judged by their significance, so too consecrated judged by its significance.
llm_translation: And the other opinion: That one who comes to be judged for his honor, he is the one who comes. Just as we judge him for his honor - so too the Holy One is judged for His honor.

hebrew_text: וִיסַדְּרוּ בְּבַעַל חוֹב קַל וָחוֹמֶר מֵעֲרָכִין: וּמָה עֲרָכִין שֶׁאֵין מַחְזִירִין – מְסַדְּרִין, בַּעַל חוֹב שֶׁמַּחְזִירִין – אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁמְּסַדְּרִין? אָמַר קְרָא: ״וְאִם מָךְ הוּא מֵעֶרְכֶּךָ״ – ״הוּא״ וְלֹא בַּעַל חוֹב.
human_translation: But they should make arrangements for a debtor a fortiori from valuations, And if valuations that not return make arrangements a debtor, that return is it not logical that make arrangements The verse states: “But if he is too poor for your valuation “he” but not a debtor.
llm_translation: They established in Baal Hov Kal v'Chomer from Erachin: And what is Erachin that does not return - they establish, Baal Hov that returns - is it not the law that they establish? The verse says: "And if it is a blemish in your valuation" - "it" and not Baal Hov.

hebrew_text: וְאִידַּךְ: הַאי, עַד שֶׁיְּהֵא בְּמָכוּתוֹ מִתְּחִילָּתוֹ וְעַד סוֹפוֹ.
human_translation: And the other unless remains in his poverty from the beginning to the end.
llm_translation: And the other opinion: this, until he is in his full strength from the beginning to the end.

hebrew_text: וְיַחְזִירוּ בְּהֶקְדֵּשׁ קַל וָחוֹמֶר מִבַּעַל חוֹב: וּמָה בַּעַל חוֹב שֶׁאֵין מְסַדְּרִין – מַחְזִירִין, הֶקְדֵּשׁ שֶׁמְּסַדְּרִין – אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁמַּחְזִירִין? אָמַר קְרָא: ״וְשָׁכַב בְּשַׂלְמָתוֹ וּבֵרְכֶךָּ״, יָצָא הֶקְדֵּשׁ, שֶׁאֵין צָרִיךְ בְּרָכָה.
human_translation: And they should return in consecration an a fortiori from a debtor: And if a debtor, where not make arrangements returns consecration, where make arrangements is it not logical that return The verse states and he will sleep in his garment and he will bless you” excluding consecration, where no need a blessing,
llm_translation: They shall return with the holy - a fortiori from a creditor: And just as a creditor, where we do not arrange - we return, the holy, where we arrange - is it not logical that we do not return? The verse says: "And you shall lie down in your peace, and no one shall make you afraid." This excludes the holy, which does not require a blessing.

hebrew_text: וְלָא? וְהָכְתִיב: ״וְאָכַלְתָּ וְשָׂבָעְתָּ וּבֵרַכְתָּ וְגוֹ׳״! אֶלָּא אָמַר קְרָא: ״וּלְךָ תִּהְיֶה צְדָקָה״, מִי שֶׁצָּרִיךְ צְדָקָה, יָצָא הֶקְדֵּשׁ שֶׁאֵין צָרִיךְ צְדָקָה.
human_translation: And not But isn’t it written: “And you shall eat and be satisfied, and bless Rather, the verse states “And it shall be righteousness [ tzedaka ] for you” one who requires charity [ tzedaka ], excluding consecrated which not require charity.
llm_translation: And not? And it is written: "And you shall eat and be satisfied, and bless, etc."! Rather, the verse says: "And righteousness shall be yours," one who needs righteousness, the consecrated item has fulfilled the requirement of righteousness.

hebrew_text: אַשְׁכְּחֵיהּ רַבָּה בַּר אֲבוּהּ לְאֵלִיָּהוּ דְּקָאֵי בְּבֵית הַקְּבָרוֹת שֶׁל גּוֹיִם, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מַהוּ שֶׁיְּסַדְּרוּ בְּבַעַל חוֹב? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: גָּמַר ״מִיכָה״ ״מִיכָה״ מֵעֲרָכִין. גַּבֵּי עֲרָכִין כְּתִיב ״וְאִם מָךְ הוּא מֵעֶרְכֶּךָ״, גַּבֵּי בַּעַל חוֹב כְּתִיב ״וְכִי יָמוּךְ אָחִיךָ״.
human_translation: Rabba bar Avuh found Elijah standing in a graveyard of gentiles. said to him: What is making arrangements for the debtor? said to him: derived from “poor” “poor” valuations. valuations, is written: “But if he is too poor [ makh ] for your valuation” with regard to a creditor, is written: “But if your brother be poor [ yamukh ]”
llm_translation: Rabah bar Avuh found Elijah standing in a non-Jewish cemetery. He said to him: What is the law regarding a creditor? He replied to him: They conclude with "Micah, Micah." Concerning conclusions, it is written, "And if you are faint-hearted in the day of distress," and concerning a creditor, it is written, "If your brother becomes impoverished."

hebrew_text: מִנַּיִן לְעָרוֹם שֶׁלֹּא יִתְרוֹם? דִּכְתִיב: ״וְלֹא יִרְאֶה בְךָ עֶרְוַת דָּבָר״.
human_translation: From where to a naked person that he may not separate teruma ? As it is written: “And He see no unseemly thing in you”
llm_translation: From where do we derive that an 'arum' should not be raised? As it is written: "And there shall not be seen with you the nakedness of a thing."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָאו כֹּהֵן הוּא מָר? מַאי טַעְמָא קָאֵי מָר בְּבֵית הַקְּבָרוֹת! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָא מַתְנֵי מָר טְהָרוֹת? דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹחַי אוֹמֵר: קִבְרֵיהֶן שֶׁל נׇכְרִים אֵין מְטַמְּאִין, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְאַתֵּן צֹאנִי צֹאן מַרְעִיתִי אָדָם אַתֶּם״. אַתֶּם קְרוּיִין ״אָדָם״, וְאֵין נׇכְרִים קְרוּיִין ״אָדָם״.
human_translation: said to him: Is not the Master a priest? What is the reason the Master standing in a cemetery? said to him: Has the Master not studied Teharot ? As it is taught Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai says the graves of gentiles do not render impure, as it is stated: “And you, My sheep, the sheep of My pasture, are man” you, are called “man,” but gentiles are not called “man.”
llm_translation: He said to him: Is the master not a Kohen? What is the reason the master is standing in a cemetery? He said to him: Does the master not teach about purity? As it was taught: Rabbi Shimon ben Yochai says: The graves of non-Jews do not impart impurity, as it is stated: "But you, My flock, the flock of My pasture, are men." You are called "men," but non-Jews are not called "men."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: בְּאַרְבְּעָה לָא מָצֵינָא, בְּשִׁיתָּא מָצֵינָא? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: וְאַמַּאי? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: דְּחִיקָא לִי מִילְּתָא. דַּבְרֵיהּ וְעַיְּילֵיהּ לְגַן עֵדֶן. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: פְּשׁוֹט גְּלִימָךְ, סְפִי שְׁקוֹל מֵהָנֵי טַרְפֵי. סְפָא שְׁקַל.
human_translation: said to him: I cannot in four can I in six? said to him: Why said to him: The matter pressing for me, led him and brought him into the Garden of Eden said to him: Remove your cloak, gather up take of these leaves gathered up took
llm_translation: He said to him: "In four places we do not find it, in six places we find it?" He said to him: "And why?" He said to him: "Because the matter is pressing for me." His words and his deeds lead him to the Garden of Eden. He said to him: "Spread out your cloak, gather up from these torn pieces." He gathered up.

hebrew_text: כִּי הֲוָה נָפֵיק, שְׁמַע דְּקָאָמַר: מַאן קָא אָכֵיל לְעָלְמֵיהּ כְּרַבָּה בַּר אֲבוּהּ. נְפַץ שְׁדָנְהוּ. אֲפִילּוּ הָכִי אַתְיֵיהּ לִגְלִימֵיהּ, סְחַט גְּלִימָא רֵיחָא. זַבְּנֵיהּ בִּתְרֵיסַר אַלְפֵי דִּינָרֵי, פַּלְגִינְהוּ לְחַתְנָווֹתֵיהּ.
human_translation: When was exiting, heard that declared: Who consumes his World like Rabba bar Avuh, He spread threw away Even so, brought his cloak the cloak absorbed scent sold it for twelve thousand dinars. divided among his sons-in-law.
llm_translation: When he would go out, hear that which he said: Who eats for his entire life like Rabba bar Avuhah. He broke his teeth. Even so, when he came to his cloak, he rubbed the cloak and smelled it. He bought for him twelve thousand dinars, he divided them for his daughters-in-law.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״וְאִם אִישׁ עָנִי הוּא לֹא תִשְׁכַּב בַּעֲבֹטוֹ״, הָא עָשִׁיר – שְׁכַיב. מַאי קָאָמַר? אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: הָכִי קָאָמַר: ״וְאִם אִישׁ עָנִי הוּא״ – לֹא תִשְׁכַּב וַעֲבוֹטוֹ אֶצְלְךָ. הָא עָשִׁיר – שְׁכַב וַעֲבוֹטוֹ אֶצְלְךָ.
human_translation: The Sages taught “If he be a poor man, you shall not sleep with his collateral” but wealthy, lie down. What is saying? Rav Sheshet said this is saying: And if he be a poor man, you shall not sleep while his collateral is with you; But a wealthy lie down while his collateral is with you.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: "And if a man is poor, do not sleep in his pledge," if he is rich - he may sleep. What is it saying? Rav Sheshet said: This is what it is saying: "And if a man is poor" - do not sleep with his pledge by you. If he is rich - he may sleep with his pledge by you.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הַמַּלְוֶה אֶת חֲבֵירוֹ אֵינוֹ רַשַּׁאי לְמַשְׁכְּנוֹ, וְאֵינוֹ חַיָּיב לְהַחְזִיר לוֹ, וְעוֹבֵר בְּכׇל הַשֵּׁמוֹת הַלָּלוּ. מַאי קָאָמַר? אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: הָכִי קָאָמַר, הַמַּלְוֶה אֶת חֲבֵירוֹ אֵינוֹ רַשַּׁאי לְמַשְׁכְּנוֹ, וְאִם מִשְׁכְּנוֹ – חַיָּיב לְהַחְזִיר לוֹ. וְעוֹבֵר בְּכׇל הַשֵּׁמוֹת הַלָּלוּ – אַסֵּיפָא.
human_translation: The Sages taught: who lends another is not permitted to take collateral from him, and is not obligated to return to him, and transgresses all of these labels [ shemot ] What is saying? Rav Sheshet said: This is saying: who lends another is not permitted to take collateral from him, and if take collateral from him, obligated to return to him. And transgresses all of these labels to the latter clause,
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: One who lends to his fellow is not permitted to seize collateral from him, and he is not obligated to return it to him, and he transgresses with all these names. What is it saying? Rav Sheshet said: This is what it is saying, one who lends to his fellow is not permitted to seize collateral from him, and if he seizes it, he is obligated to return it to him. And he transgresses with all these names - the conclusion.

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר: הָכִי קָאָמַר: הַמַּלְוֶה אֶת חֲבֵירוֹ אֵינוֹ רַשַּׁאי לְמַשְׁכְּנוֹ, וְאִם מִשְׁכְּנוֹ – חַיָּיב לְהַחְזִיר לוֹ. בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים – שֶׁמִּשְׁכְּנוֹ שֶׁלֹּא בִּשְׁעַת הַלְוָאָתוֹ, אֲבָל מִשְׁכְּנוֹ בִּשְׁעַת הַלְוָאָתוֹ – אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב לְהַחְזִיר לוֹ. וְעוֹבֵר בְּכׇל הַשֵּׁמוֹת הַלָּלוּ – אַרֵישָׁא.
human_translation: Rava said: This is saying: who lends another is not permitted to take collateral from him, and if take collateral from him, obligated to return to him. In what is this statement said? where he took collateral from him when not at the time of the loan, But took collateral from him at the time of the loan, he is not obligated to return to him. And transgresses of all these labels to the first clause
llm_translation: Rava said: Thus he said: One who lends to his fellow is not permitted to take collateral, but if he took collateral, he is obligated to return it. In what case are these matters said? When he took collateral not at the time of the loan, but if he took collateral at the time of the loan, he is not obligated to return it. And one who transgresses in all these names mentioned – is considered a wicked person.

hebrew_text: תָּנֵי רַב שֵׁיזְבִי קַמֵּיהּ דְּרָבָא: ״עַד בֹּא הַשֶּׁמֶשׁ תְּשִׁיבֶנּוּ לוֹ״ – זוֹ כְּסוּת לַיְלָה, ״הָשֵׁב תָּשִׁיב לוֹ אֶת הַעֲבוֹט כְּבוֹא הַשֶּׁמֶשׁ״ – זוֹ כְּסוּת יוֹם. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: דִּימָמָא בְּלֵילְיָא לְמָה לִי, וּדְלֵילְיָא בִּימָמָא לְמָה לִי?
human_translation: Rav Sheizevi taught before Rava: you shall restore it to him until the sun goes down” this a garment night “You shall restore to him the collateral when the sun goes down” this a garment day. said to him: in the day, why do I at night, and at night, why do I in the day?
llm_translation: The text states: Rabbi Sheizbi taught before Rava: "Until the sun comes, you shall return it to him" - this refers to nighttime clothing, "Return you shall return to him the garment at sunset" - this refers to daytime clothing. He said to him: "Why do I need a cloak at night, and why do I need a torch in the day?"

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִיסְמְיַיהּ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָא, הָכִי קָאָמַר: ״עַד בֹּא הַשֶּׁמֶשׁ תְּשִׁיבֶנּוּ לוֹ״ – זוֹ כְּסוּת יוֹם שֶׁנִּיתְּנָה לַחֲבוֹל בַּלַּיְלָה, ״הָשֵׁב תָּשִׁיב לוֹ אֶת הַעֲבוֹט כְּבוֹא הַשֶּׁמֶשׁ״ – זוֹ כְּסוּת לַיְלָה שֶׁנִּיתְּנָה לַחֲבוֹל בַּיּוֹם.
human_translation: said to him: I erase it, said to him: No, this is saying: “You shall restore it to him until when the sun goes down,” this a garment day, which may be taken as collateral by night “You shall restore to him the collateral when the sun goes down,” this a garment night, which may be taken as collateral by day.
llm_translation: He said to him: "Is his garment woolen?" He said to him: "No, this is what he meant: 'Until the sun comes, you shall return it to him' - this refers to the daytime garment given to the borrower at night, 'You shall surely return it to him at sunset' - this refers to the nighttime garment given to the borrower during the day."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מִשְׁכְּנוֹ וּמֵת, שׁוֹמְטוֹ מֵעַל גַּבֵּי בָנָיו. מֵיתִיבִי, אָמַר רַבִּי מֵאִיר: וְכִי מֵאַחַר שֶׁמְּמַשְׁכְּנִין לָמָּה מַחְזִירִין? לָמָּה מַחְזִירִין?! רַחֲמָנָא אָמַר אַהְדַּר! אֶלָּא: מֵאַחַר שֶׁמַּחְזִירִין,
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said: took collateral from him, and died, take from children raises an objection Rabbi Meir said: But since takes collateral, why does return Why does return The Merciful One states return Rather, Since return
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: If one has moved his dwelling and died, his sons are exempt from returning to the original location. It was asked: Rabbi Meir said: And why, after they have moved, should they return? Why should they return?! The Merciful One said and then retracted! Rather, they are exempt after they have returned.

hebrew_text: לָמָּה חוֹזְרִין וּמְמַשְׁכְּנִין? שֶׁלֹּא תְּהֵא שְׁבִיעִית מְשַׁמַּטְתּוֹ, וְלֹא יֵעָשֶׂה מִטַּלְטְלִין אֵצֶל בָּנָיו.
human_translation: why go back and take the collateral that the Sabbatical should not cancel it. And should not become movable property of his children,
llm_translation: Why do they go back and draw out the produce? So that the seventh year should not cause its value to decrease, and one should not make his children dependent on others.

hebrew_text: טַעְמָא דַּהֲדַר וּמַשְׁכְּנֵיהּ, הָא לָא הֲדַר וּמַשְׁכְּנֵיהּ – לָא!
human_translation: reason that goes back and takes it as collateral; but not go back and take it as collateral, not
llm_translation: The reason for his return and dwelling, this is not a return and dwelling - no!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אַדָּא בַּר מַתְנָא: וְלָאו תָּרוֹצֵי קָא מְתָרְצַתְּ לַהּ? תָּרֵיץ הָכִי: וְכִי מֵאַחַר שֶׁמַּחְזִירִין לָמָּה מְמַשְׁכְּנִין מֵעִיקָּרָא – שֶׁלֹּא תְּהֵא שְׁבִיעִית מְשַׁמַּטְתּוֹ, וְלֹא יֵעָשֶׂה מִטַּלְטְלִין אֵצֶל בָּנָיו.
human_translation: Rav Adda bar Mattana said: And did you not resolve Answer this And since return why take collateral at the outset? that the Sabbatical should not cancel and should not become movable property of his children.
llm_translation: Rav Adda bar Matna said: And is it not that you are trying to reconcile it? Reconcile it thus: Since they return it, why do they draw from the outset - so that the seventh year will not weaken it, and he will not make it a burden for his children.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״לֹא תָבֹא אֶל בֵּיתוֹ לַעֲבֹט עֲבֹטוֹ״. לְבֵיתוֹ אִי אַתָּה נִכְנָס, אֲבָל אַתָּה נִכְנָס לְבֵיתוֹ שֶׁל עָרֵב. וְכֵן הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״לְקַח בִּגְדוֹ כִּי עָרַב זָר וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: The Sages taught: you shall not go into his house to take his collateral” you may not enter his house, but you enter the house of a guarantor And similarly it states: “Take his garment that is a surety for a stranger”
llm_translation: The sages taught: "Do not enter his house to take his pledge." You do not enter his house, but you enter the house of his guarantor. And so it says: "Take his garment as a pledge, for he is a stranger."

hebrew_text: וְאוֹמֵר: ״בְּנִי אִם עָרַבְתָּ לְרֵעֶךָ תָּקַעְתָּ לַזָּר כַּפֶּיךָ. נוֹקַשְׁתָּ בְאִמְרֵי פִיךָ נִלְכַּדְתָּ בְּאִמְרֵי פִיךָ. עֲשֵׂה זֹאת אֵפוֹא בְּנִי וְהִנָּצֵל כִּי בָאתָ בְכַף רֵעֶךָ לֵךְ הִתְרַפֵּס וּרְהַב רֵעֶיךָ״.
human_translation: And it states “My son, if you are a guarantor for your neighbor, if you have struck your hands for a stranger, you are ensnared by the words of your mouth; you are caught by the words of your mouth. Do this, now, my son, and deliver yourself, when you have come into the hand of your friend; go humble yourself and strengthen your friend”
llm_translation: And he says: "My son, if you have become surety for your friend, if you have struck hands in pledge for a stranger, you have been trapped by the words of your mouth, caught by the words of your mouth. Do this now, my son, and deliver yourself, since you have come into the hand of your friend: Go, humble yourself, and urge your plea with your friend."

hebrew_text: אִם מָמוֹן יֵשׁ לוֹ בְּיָדֶךָ – הַתֵּר לוֹ פִּיסַּת יָד, וְאִם לָאו – הַרְבֵּה עָלָיו רֵעִים.
human_translation: If he has money in your hand, Release for him the palm of your hand [ hatter lo pissat yad ] And if not gather together many neighbors his
llm_translation: If money there is in your hand - permit to him a handbreadth, and if not - increase upon him friends.

hebrew_text: לְצַד שֵׁנִי – לְבֵיתוֹ אִי אַתָּה נִכְנָס, אֲבָל אַתָּה נִכְנָס לִשְׂכַר כַּתָּף, לִשְׂכַר חַמָּר, לִשְׂכַר פּוּנְדָּק, לִשְׂכַר דְּיוֹקְנָאוֹת. יָכוֹל אֲפִילּוּ זְקָפָן עָלָיו בְּמִלְוֶה? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״מַשַּׁאת מְאוּמָה״.
human_translation: in a different direction, You may not enter his house but you may enter for a porter’s wages, for a donkey driver’s wages, for an innkeeper’s payment, for the wages for drawings [ diyokanaot ] might even establishes it as a loan for the verse states: “Any manner
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Le'tzad sheini - le'veito, i atah nichnas, aval atah nichnas lis'char katef, lis'char chamar, lis'char pundak, lis'char deyoknaot. Yachol afilu zekafan alav be'milveh? Talmud lomar: 'mash'at me'umah'." English translation: "To the second side - to his house, if you enter, but you enter to hire a shoulder, to hire a donkey, to hire a boat, to hire pack animals. Can even a creditor seize it from him as collateral? The Talmud teaches: 'a pledge for a loan.'"

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אַלְמָנָה, בֵּין שֶׁהִיא עֲנִיָּיה בֵּין שֶׁהִיא עֲשִׁירָה – אֵין מְמַשְׁכְּנִין אוֹתָהּ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְלֹא תַחֲבֹל בֶּגֶד אַלְמָנָה״.
human_translation: a widow, whether she is poor whether she is wealthy, may not take collateral from her, as it is stated: “And you may not take the garment of a widow as collateral”
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: A widow, whether she is poor or whether she is wealthy - one does not marry her off, as it is stated: "And you shall not take a widow's garment as security" (Deuteronomy 24:17).

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אַלְמָנָה, בֵּין שֶׁהִיא עֲנִיָּיה בֵּין שֶׁהִיא עֲשִׁירָה – אֵין מְמַשְׁכְּנִין אוֹתָהּ, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה.
human_translation: The Sages taught: a widow, whether she is poor whether she is wealthy, may not take collateral from her. the statement of Rabbi Yehuda.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: A widow, whether she is poor or whether she is rich - they do not marry her off, these are the words of Rabbi Yehuda.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: עֲשִׁירָה – מְמַשְׁכְּנִין אוֹתָהּ, עֲנִיָּיה – אֵין מְמַשְׁכְּנִין אוֹתָהּ. שֶׁאַתָּה חַיָּיב לְהַחֲזִיר לַהּ, וְאַתָּה מַשִּׂיאָהּ שֵׁם רַע בִּשְׁכֵנוֹתֶיהָ.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: a wealthy take collateral from her. a poor not take collateral from her, you obligated to return to her, And you give her a bad name among her neighbors,
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: A rich person - they draw her close, a poor person - they do not draw her close. Because you are obligated to return her, and you cause a bad name for her among her neighbors.

hebrew_text: לְמֵימְרָא דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה לָא דָּרֵישׁ טַעְמָא דִקְרָא, וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן דָּרֵישׁ טַעְמָא דִקְרָא? וְהָא אִיפְּכָא שָׁמְעִינַן לְהוּ.
human_translation: to say that Rabbi Yehuda does not interpret the rationale in the verse Rabbi Shimon does interpret the rationale in the verse? But heard them the reverse
llm_translation: In the matter of Rabbi Yehuda, he does not expound the reason of the verse, and Rabbi Shimon expounds the reason of the verse? But, indeed, we have heard the opposite.

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא: ״וְלֹא יַרְבֶּה לּוֹ נָשִׁים״, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: מַרְבֶּה הוּא, וּבִלְבַד שֶׁלֹּא יְהוּ מְסִירוֹת אֶת לִבּוֹ. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: אֲפִילּוּ אַחַת וְהִיא מְסִירָה אֶת לִבּוֹ, הֲרֵי זֶה לֹא יִשָּׂאֶנָּה. אִם כֵּן, מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״וְלֹא יַרְבֶּה לּוֹ נָשִׁים״ – אֲפִילּוּ כַּאֲבִיגַיִל!
human_translation: As it is taught “And he should not multiply wives for himself, Rabbi Yehuda says: He accumulate many for himself, provided that they are not turn his heart Rabbi Shimon says: Even one who turns his heart away, he should not marry her. If so, why is it stated: “He shall not multiply wives for himself”? even like Abigail,
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: "And he shall not multiply wives for himself." Rabbi Yehuda says: He may multiply them, as long as they do not turn his heart away. Rabbi Shimon says: Even if he marries only one woman who turns his heart away, he should not marry her. If so, what is the meaning of the verse "And he shall not multiply wives for himself" - even like Abigail!

hebrew_text: לְעוֹלָם רַבִּי יְהוּדָה לָא דָּרֵישׁ טַעְמָא דִקְרָא, וְשָׁאנֵי הָכָא, דִּמְפָרֵשׁ קְרָא ״וְלֹא יַרְבֶּה לּוֹ נָשִׁים וְלֹא יָסוּר״. מַאי טַעְמָא ״לֹא יַרְבֶּה לוֹ נָשִׁים״ – מִשּׁוּם דְּ״לֹא יָסוּר״.
human_translation: Actually, Rabbi Yehuda does not interpret the rationale of the verse, and is different here, as the verse specifies “And he should not multiply wives for himself, that not turn away.” What is the reason he may not multiply wives for himself? because that will not turn away.
llm_translation: Forever Rabbi Yehuda does not expound the reason of the verse, and it is different here, as the verse explains "and he shall not multiply wives for himself, so that his heart not turn away." What is the reason "he shall not multiply wives for himself" - because of "so that his heart not turn away."

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן מִכְּדֵי בְּעָלְמָא דָּרְשִׁינַן טַעְמָא דִקְרָא, לִכְתּוֹב רַחֲמָנָא ״לֹא יַרְבֶּה״, וְלָא בָּעֵינַן ״לֹא יָסוּר״! וַאֲנָא יָדַעְנָא: מַאי טַעְמָא ״לֹא יַרְבֶּה״ – מִשּׁוּם דְּ״לֹא יָסוּר״. ״לֹא יָסוּר״ דִּכְתַב רַחֲמָנָא לְמָה לִי? אֲפִילּוּ אַחַת וּמְסִירָה אֶת לִבּוֹ – הֲרֵי זֶה לֹא יִשָּׂאֶנָּה.
human_translation: And Rabbi Shimon Since we generally interpret the rationale in the verse, Let the Merciful One state: “He may not multiply,” and we do not need not turn away,” and I know What is the reason he may not accumulate because not turn away. why do I not turn away” that the Merciful One writes? Even one turns his heart away, he may not marry her.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And Rabbi Shimon, from the world, we learn the reason of the verse, to write, "Hashem will not increase," and we do not need "He will not remove"! And I know: What is the reason "He will not increase" - because of "He will not remove." "He will not remove" that Hashem wrote, why do I need it? Even if he removes one and changes his heart - this one will not bear it. English translation: And Rabbi Shimon, from the world, we learn the reason for the verse, to write, "Hashem will not increase," and we do not need "He will not remove"! And I know: What is the reason "He will not increase" - because of "He will not remove." "He will not remove" that Hashem wrote, why do I need it? Even if he removes one and changes his heart - this one will not bear it.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַחוֹבֵל אֶת הָרֵיחַיִם – עוֹבֵר מִשּׁוּם לֹא תַעֲשֶׂה, וְחַיָּיב מִשּׁוּם שְׁנֵי כֵּלִים, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״לֹא יַחֲבֹל רֵיחַיִם וָרָכֶב״. וְלֹא רֵיחַיִם וָרֶכֶב בִּלְבַד אָמְרוּ, אֶלָּא כׇּל דָּבָר שֶׁעוֹשִׂין בּוֹ אוֹכֶל נֶפֶשׁ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כִּי נֶפֶשׁ הוּא חֹבֵל״.
human_translation: who takes a millstone as collateral violates a prohibition, and liable for two vessels, as it is stated: “He shall not take the lower or upper millstone as collateral” Not only say the lower or upper millstone but anything that use in the preparation of food [ okhel nefesh ], as it is stated: “For he takes a man’s life [ nefesh ] as collateral”
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who plasters the openings of the nostrils transgresses the prohibition of "you shall not do," and is liable due to the requirement of two utensils, as it is stated: "He shall not plaster the openings of his nostrils." And they did not say "nostrils and riding" alone, but rather any item that is used for the purpose of consuming food, as it is stated: "For it is a life that plasters."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: חָבַל רֵיחַיִם – לוֹקֶה שְׁתַּיִם: מִשּׁוּם ״רֵיחַיִם״, וּמִשּׁוּם ״כִּי נֶפֶשׁ הוּא חֹבֵל״. רֵיחַיִם וָרֶכֶב – לוֹקֶה שָׁלֹשׁ: מִשּׁוּם ״רֵיחַיִם״, ״וָרֶכֶב״, וּמִשּׁוּם ״כִּי נֶפֶשׁ הוּא חֹבֵל״.
human_translation: Rav Huna says: took a lower millstone as collateral is flogged two due to lower millstone and due to: “For he takes a man’s life as collateral,” the lower and upper millstone, is flogged three due to a lower millstone and an upper millstone and due to “For he takes a man’s life as collateral.”
llm_translation: Gemara: Rav Huna said: One who destroys fragrant herbs - liable twice: due to "fragrant herbs," and due to "for he is destroying a soul." Fragrant herbs and spices - liable three times: due to "fragrant herbs," "and spices," and due to "for he is destroying a soul."

hebrew_text: וְרַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר: חָבַל רֵיחַיִם – לוֹקֶה אַחַת, וְרֶכֶב – לוֹקֶה אַחַת, רֵיחַיִם וָרֶכֶב – לוֹקֶה שְׁתַּיִם. ״כִּי נֶפֶשׁ הוּא חֹבֵל״ –
human_translation: And Rav Yehuda says: took a lower millstone as collateral he is flogged one an upper millstone he is flogged one the lower and upper millstones he is flogged two “For he takes a man’s life as collateral,”
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said: If one steals fragrances, he incurs one penalty; if he steals chariots, he incurs one penalty; if he steals both fragrances and chariots, he incurs two penalties. "For it is a soul that steals" -

hebrew_text: לִשְׁאָר דְּבָרִים הוּא דַּאֲתָא.
human_translation: it comes to about against other items
llm_translation: Regarding other matters, this is what he came.

hebrew_text: לֵימָא אַבָּיֵי וְרָבָא, בִּפְלוּגְתָּא דְּרַב הוּנָא וְרַב יְהוּדָה קָמִיפַּלְגִי?
human_translation: Shall we say Abaye and Rava, disagree with regard to dispute between Rav Huna and Rav Yehuda
llm_translation: Let Abaye and Rava say, in the dispute of Rav Huna and Rav Yehuda, do they disagree?

hebrew_text: דְּאָמַר רָבָא: אָכַל נָא – לוֹקֶה שְׁתַּיִם: מִשּׁוּם ״נָא״, וּמִשּׁוּם ״כִּי אִם צְלִי אֵשׁ״. מְבוּשָּׁל – לוֹקֶה שְׁתַּיִם: מִשּׁוּם ״מְבוּשָּׁל״, וּמִשּׁוּם ״כִּי אִם צְלִי אֵשׁ״. נָא וּמְבוּשָּׁל – לוֹקֶה שָׁלֹשׁ: מִשּׁוּם ״נָא״, וּמִשּׁוּם ״מְבוּשָּׁל״, וּמִשּׁוּם ״לֹא תֹּאכְלֶנּוּ כִּי אִם צְלִי אֵשׁ״.
human_translation: As Rava says: ate raw, is flogged two due to raw,” and due to “But roasted with fire.” cooked, is flogged two due to cooked and due to “But roasted with fire.” raw and cooked is flogged three due to raw, and due to cooked, and due to “Do not eat of it…but roasted with fire.”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Rava said: If one ate it raw - he receives two lashes: because of "na," and because of "only roasted with fire." If it is cooked - he receives two lashes: because of "cooked," and because of "only roasted with fire." If it is both raw and cooked - he receives three lashes: because of "na," and because of "cooked," and because of "you shall not eat it except roasted with fire."

hebrew_text: אַבָּיֵי אָמַר: אֵין לוֹקִין עַל לָאו שֶׁבִּכְלָלוֹת. לֵימָא אַבָּיֵי דְּאָמַר כְּרַב יְהוּדָה, וְרָבָא דְּאָמַר כְּרַב הוּנָא?
human_translation: Abaye says: is not flogged for a general prohibition. Shall we say that Abaye states in accordance with Rav Yehuda, and Rava states in accordance with Rav Huna?
llm_translation: Abbaye said: One does not receive lashes for a negative commandment that includes positive commandments. Let us say Abbaye meant as Rav Yehudah said, and Rava meant as Rav Huna said?

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָךְ רָבָא: אֲנָא דַּאֲמַרִי אֲפִילּוּ כְּרַב יְהוּדָה, עַד כָּאן לָא קָאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה הָתָם, אֶלָּא דְּ״כִי נֶפֶשׁ הוּא חֹבֵל״ לָא מַשְׁמַע רֵיחַיִם וָרֶכֶב, הִלְכָּךְ לִשְׁאָר דְּבָרִים הוּא דַּאֲתָא.
human_translation: Rava said to you: I state even in accordance with Rav Yehuda, Rav Yehuda states only there, because “For he takes a man’s life as collateral” does not indicate the lower and upper millstones. therefore it comes to about against other items
llm_translation: Rava said to you: I, who say even like Rav Yehudah, until here Rav Yehudah did not say there, rather "for it is a matter of life" does not imply pleasant smells and carriages, therefore he came for other matters.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל הָכָא ״כִּי אִם צְלִי אֵשׁ״ לְמַאי אֲתָא? שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ לְלָאו.
human_translation: But here, “but roasted with fire” comes for what learn from to prohibition
llm_translation: Here is the English translation of the Talmudic text: "But here, 'as a burning fire' - for what purpose does it come? Learn from it for something else."

hebrew_text: וְאַבָּיֵי אָמַר לָךְ: אֲנָא דַּאֲמַרִי אֲפִילּוּ לְרַב הוּנָא: עַד כָּאן לָא קָאָמַר רַב הוּנָא הָתָם, אֶלָּא דְּ״כִי נֶפֶשׁ הוּא חֹבֵל״
human_translation: And Abaye said to you: I state even in accordance with Rav Huna. Rav Huna states only there, because “For he takes a man’s life as collateral”
llm_translation: And Abbaye said to you: I that said even to Rav Huna: until here not said Rav Huna there, but "for a soul it is a debtor."

hebrew_text: יַתִּירָא הוּא, כֵּיוָן דְּיַתִּירָא הוּא – שִׁדְיֵיהּ אַרֵיחַיִם וָרָכֶב.
human_translation: is superfluous Since it is superfluous, apply it upon the lower and upper millstones.
llm_translation: Yatira hu, keivah deyatira hu - shidyeih areichayim varachav.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל הָכָא, ״כִּי אִם צְלִי אֵשׁ״ לָאו יַתִּירָא הוּא, דְּמִבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְכִדְתַנְיָא: בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁיֶּשְׁנוֹ בְּקוּם אֱכוֹל צָלִי, יֶשְׁנוֹ – בְּבַל תֹּאכַל נָא. בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁאֵינוֹ בְּקוּם אֱכוֹל צָלִי – אֵינוֹ בְּבַל תֹּאכַל נָא.
human_translation: But here, “but roasted with fire” is not superfluous, as he requires it for that which is taught At the time when one is included in to arise eat roasted he is included in not to eat raw, at a time when one is not included in to arise eat the roasted he is not in not to eat raw
llm_translation: Talmudic text: However, here, "but roasted with fire" is not an addition, for it is necessary according to the teaching: "When one is accustomed to eat roasted meat while standing, he should eat it while standing; if he is accustomed to eat it while sitting, do not eat it while standing. When he is not accustomed to eat roasted meat while standing, he should not eat it while standing."

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוּדָה: חָבַל זוּג שֶׁל סַפָּרִים וְצֶמֶד שֶׁל פָּרוֹת – חַיָּיב שְׁתַּיִם. זֶה בְּעַצְמוֹ וְזֶה בְּעַצְמוֹ – אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב אֶלָּא אַחַת.
human_translation: is taught in accordance with of Rav Yehuda: took as collateral barbers’ scissors [ zog ] or a pair of cows, liable two this by itself or that by itself, liable only one
llm_translation: It was taught in the school of Rav Yehudah: A pair of straps of scrolls and a pair of oxen - one is liable for two. This one by itself and that one by itself - one is liable only for one.

hebrew_text: וְתַנְיָא אִידַּךְ: חָבַל זוּג שֶׁל סַפָּרִים וְצֶמֶד שֶׁל פָּרוֹת, יָכוֹל לֹא יְהֵא חַיָּיב אֶלָּא אַחַת – תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״לֹא יַחֲבֹל רֵיחַיִם וָרָכֶב״. מָה רֵיחַיִם וָרֶכֶב שֶׁהֵן מְיוּחָדִין שְׁנֵי כֵּלִים וְעוֹשִׂין מְלָאכָה אַחַת, וְחַיָּיב עַל זֶה בִּפְנֵי עַצְמוֹ וְעַל זֶה בִּפְנֵי עַצְמוֹ – אַף כׇּל דְּבָרִים שֶׁהֵן שְׁנֵי כֵּלִים מְיוּחָדִים וְעוֹשִׂין מְלָאכָה אַחַת – חַיָּיב עַל זֶה בִּפְנֵי עַצְמוֹ וְעַל זֶה בִּפְנֵי עַצְמוֹ.
human_translation: And is taught another took as collateral barbers’ scissors or a pair of cows, might liable only one the verse states: “He may not take as collateral the lower or upper millstone,” just as the lower and upper millstones are unique two vessels and perform one task liable separately for this and separately for that, so too, all items that are two individual vessels, and perform one task, liable separately for this and separately for that.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And it was taught in another Baraita: A pair of books and a pair of oxen, can one not be liable except for one? The Torah says, "He shall not plow with an ox and a donkey together." Just as plowing with an ox and a donkey, which are distinct vessels and perform one task, one is liable for each one separately - so too, for all things that are distinct vessels and perform one task, one is liable for each one separately.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא גַּבְרָא דַּחֲבַל סַכִּינָא דְּאַשְׁכַּבְתָּא מֵחַבְרֵיהּ. אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּאַבָּיֵי, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: זִיל אַהְדְּרֵיהּ, דְּהָוֵי לֵיהּ כְּלִי שֶׁעוֹשִׂים בּוֹ אוֹכֶל נֶפֶשׁ, וְתָא קוּם בְּדִינָא עֲלֵהּ. רָבָא אָמַר: לָא צְרִיךְ לְמֵיקַם בְּדִינָא עֲלֵהּ, וְיָכוֹל לִטְעוֹן עַד כְּדֵי דְּמֵיהֶן.
human_translation: a certain man who took as collateral a slaughtering knife from another. He came before Abaye said to him: Go return it, as it is a vessel used in the preparation of food, and go stand in judgment, concerning Rava said: not have to stand in judgment for this. he can claim up to its value.
llm_translation: That man who damaged a knife of a butcher from his friends. He came before Abbaye, he said to him: Go return it, for it is a vessel that is used for preparing food, and come stand in judgment regarding it. Rava said: It is not necessary to stand in judgment regarding it, and he can argue until their value.

hebrew_text: וְאַבָּיֵי לֵית לֵיהּ הָהִיא סְבָרָא: מַאי שְׁנָא מֵהָנְהוּ עִיזֵּי דְּאָכְלִי חוּשְׁלָא בִּנְהַרְדְּעָא, וַאֲתָא מָרָא דְחוּשְׁלָא וּתְפַס לְהוּ וְקָא טָעֵין טוּבָא. וַאֲמַר אֲבוּהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל יָכוֹל לִטְעוֹן עַד כְּדֵי דְּמֵיהֶן!
human_translation: And does Abaye not accept that reasoning, what is different from those goats that ate peeled barley [ ḥushla ] in Neharde’a, and the owner of the peeled barley came and seized claimed a large and Shmuel’s father, said he can claim up to their value?
llm_translation: And Abbaye does not agree with that reasoning: What is the difference between those goats that ate the herbs in Nehardea, and the master goat that ate the herbs and got better? And the father of Shmuel said: He can continue to graze until they are worth their value!

hebrew_text: הָתָם לָאו מִידֵּי (דַּעֲבִדָא) [דַּעֲבִיד] לְאוֹשׁוֹלֵי וּלְאוֹגוֹרֵי הוּא. הָכָא מִידֵּי דַּעֲבִיד לְאוֹשׁוֹלֵי וּלְאוֹגוֹרֵי הוּא. דִּשְׁלַח רַב הוּנָא בַּר אָבִין: דְּבָרִים הָעֲשׂוּיִין לְהַשְׁאִיל וּלְהַשְׂכִּיר, וְאָמַר לְקוּחִין הֵן בְּיָדִי – אֵינוֹ נֶאֱמָן.
human_translation: There, is an item that not usually lent or rented. here, an item that usually lent or rented. As Rav Huna bar Avin sent items that are usually lent or rented, and says: They were acquired by me, he is not deemed credible
llm_translation: There, it is not from the category of (that which) is done for borrowing and for renting. Here, it is from the category of that which is done for borrowing and for renting. Rav Huna the son of Avin sent (a message): Things that are customary for borrowing and for renting, and he said, "If they are in my possession as purchases, he is not believed."

hebrew_text: וְרָבָא לֵית לֵיהּ הַאי סְבָרָא? וְהָא רָבָא אַפֵּיק זוּגָא דְסַרְבָּלָא וְסִפְרָא דְאַגָּדְתָּא מִיַּתְמֵי בִּדְבָרִים הָעֲשׂוּיִין לְהַשְׁאִיל וּלְהַשְׂכִּיר! אָמַר לָךְ רָבָא: הַאי נָמֵי, כֵּיוָן דְּמִיפַּגְמָא – קָפְדִי אִינָשֵׁי וְלָא מוֹשְׁלִי.
human_translation: And does Rava not accept this reasoning? But didn’t Rava remove scissors for wool and a scroll of aggada from orphans as items that are usually lent or rented? Rava said to you: this too, since be damaged, people are particular and do not lend
llm_translation: Rava does not hold this opinion? But Rava brought a pair of shoes of Sarbalah and a book of Aggadata to engage in matters that are suitable for borrowing and renting! Rava said to you: This is true, since people are particular and not rulers once they become accustomed.

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ הַמְקַבֵּל
llm_translation: We will return to you, the receiver.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַבַּיִת וְהָעֲלִיָּיה שֶׁל שְׁנַיִם, שֶׁנָּפְלוּ – שְׁנֵיהֶם חוֹלְקִין בָּעֵצִים וּבָאֲבָנִים וּבֶעָפָר. וְרוֹאִין אֵלּוּ אֲבָנִים הָעֲשׂוּיוֹת לְהִשְׁתַּבֵּר. אִם הָיָה אֶחָד מֵהֶן מַכִּיר מִקְצָת אֲבָנָיו – נוֹטְלָן, וְעוֹלוֹת לוֹ מִן הַחֶשְׁבּוֹן.
human_translation: the house and the upper story belonging to two that collapsed, the two of them divide the timber and the stones and the earth And considers which stones were likely to break, If one of them recognized some of his stones take them and they count toward his amount
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: If the house and the upper story of two individuals collapsed, both of them share in the wood, stones, and dust. They inspect these stones that are fit for rebuilding. If one of them recognizes some of his stones, he takes them and they are deducted from his share.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מִדְּקָתָנֵי רוֹאִין – מִכְּלָל דְּאִיכָּא לְמֵיקַם עֲלַיְיהוּ, אִי בְּחַבְסָא נְפִיל, אִי בְּחַבְטָא נְפִיל.
human_translation: From that teaches considers by inference which it is possible to establish with regard to Whether it fell with pressure [ ḥavasa ], whether it fell with a blow,
llm_translation: "Gema' from the fact that they see - from the inference that there is a place for them to stand on, whether they fall into a pit or whether they fall into a ditch."

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, רֵישָׁא אַמַּאי חוֹלְקִין? נֶחְזֵי אִי בְּחַבְטָא נְפִיל – עִלָּיָיתָא אִיתְּבוּר, אִי בְּחַבְסָא נְפִיל – תַּתָּיָיתָא אִיתְּבוּר!
human_translation: If that is so, why, the first clause divide Let us see: If fell with a blow, the upper broke, if it fell with pressure, the lower broke,
llm_translation: So, the beginning: Why do they divide? Look, if with a ring it falls - the upper part is buried, if with a signet ring it falls - the lower part is buried!

hebrew_text: לָא צְרִיכָא, דִּנְפִיל בְּלֵילְיָא. וְלֶחְזִינְהוּ בְּצַפְרָא? דְּפַנִּינְהוּ. וְלִיחְזֵי מַאן פַּנִּינְהוּ וּלְשַׁיְילֵיהּ? דְּפַנִּינְהוּ בְּנֵי רְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים, וַאֲזַלוּ לְעָלְמָא.
human_translation: No, necessary when collapsed at night, But let them see in the morning where they had cleared But let them see who cleared them and let them ask them where the general public cleared them and left,
llm_translation: Not necessary, for he fell at night. And to see them in the morning? For we have turned them. And to see who turned them and to ask him? For the sons of the public domain turned them, and they went away.

hebrew_text: וְלִיחְזֵי בִּרְשׁוּתָ[א] דְּמַאן יָתְבָן, וְלִיהְוֵי אִידַּךְ הַמּוֹצִיא מֵחֲבֵירוֹ עָלָיו הָרְאָיָה! לָא צְרִיכָא, דְּיָיתְבָן בְּחָצֵר דְּתַרְוַיְיהוּ, אִי נָמֵי בִּרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים. וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: שׁוּתָּפִין בְּכִי הַאי גַּוְונָא לָא קָפְדִי אַהֲדָדֵי.
human_translation: But let them see in whose domain are situated. And the burden of proof rests upon the claimant, No, necessary where are situated in a courtyard that both of them, alternatively, into the public domain. And if you wish, say partners in cases like this are not particular with each other
llm_translation: To see within the domain of whom he is sitting, and let it be the other's responsibility to prove it! It is unnecessary, for he may be sitting in a shared courtyard, or even in a public domain. And if you wish, I will say: Partners in a case like this do not need to be overly concerned with each other.

hebrew_text: אִם הָיָה אֶחָד מֵהֶן מַכִּיר כּוּ׳. וְהַלָּה מָה טוֹעֵן? אִי דְּקָאָמַר אִין – פְּשִׁיטָא! וְאִי לָא אָמַר אִין, לָמָּה נוֹטֵל?! אֶלָּא דְּאָמַר לֵיהּ אֵינִי יוֹדֵעַ.
human_translation: If one of them recognized And the other, what he claim? If he says: Yes, obvious, And if he does not say yes, why take Rather, that says to him: I don’t know
llm_translation: If one of them recognizes, and the other one what does he argue? If he says "no" - it is obvious! And if he does not say "no," why does he take it? Rather, he said to him, "I do not know."

hebrew_text: לֵימָא תִּהְוֵי תְּיוּבְתָּא דְּרַב נַחְמָן, דְּאִיתְּמַר: מָנֶה לִי בְּיָדְךָ, וְהַלָּה אוֹמֵר: אֵינִי יוֹדֵעַ. רַב הוּנָא וְרַב יְהוּדָה אָמְרִי: חַיָּיב. רַב נַחְמָן וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמְרִי: פָּטוּר.
human_translation: Shall we say that it is a conclusive refutation of Rav Naḥman? it was stated I one hundred dinars in your possession, and the other says: I don’t know, Rav Huna and Rav Yehuda say: liable Rav Naḥman and Rabbi Yoḥanan say: exempt
llm_translation: Let it be the response of Rav Nachman, for it was stated: "Count for me in your hand," and the other says: "I do not know." Rav Huna and Rav Yehuda said: liable. Rav Nachman and Rabbi Yochanan said: exempt.

hebrew_text: כִּדְאָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: כְּגוֹן שֶׁיֵּשׁ עֵסֶק שְׁבוּעָה בֵּינֵיהֶן. הָכָא נָמֵי: כְּגוֹן שֶׁיֵּשׁ עֵסֶק שְׁבוּעָה בֵּינֵיהֶן.
human_translation: as Rav Naḥman says where there is a matter of an oath between them, here too, where there is a matter of an oath between them.
llm_translation: As Rav Nachman said: For example, when there is a business partnership between them. Here it is stated: For example, when there is a business partnership between them.

hebrew_text: הֵיכִי דָּמֵי עֵסֶק שְׁבוּעָה? כִּדְרָבָא. דְּאָמַר רָבָא: מָנֶה לִי בְּיָדְךָ, וְהַלָּה אוֹמֵר: אֵין לְךָ בְּיָדִי אֶלָּא חֲמִשִּׁים, וְהַשְּׁאָר אֵינִי יוֹדֵעַ. מִתּוֹךְ שֶׁאֵינוֹ יָכוֹל לִישָּׁבַע – יְשַׁלֵּם.
human_translation: What are the circumstances a matter of an oath? in accordance with of Rava, as Rava says: I one hundred dinars in your possession, and the other says: You have in my possession only fifty and the rest, I don’t know. Since he cannot take an oath he must pay.
llm_translation: "How are the laws of an oath like? Like Rava. For Rava said: 'Give me in your hand,' and the other says: 'You only have fifty in my hand, and I do not know the rest.' Since he cannot swear, he must pay."

hebrew_text: וְעוֹלוֹת לוֹ מִן הַחֶשְׁבּוֹן. סָבַר רָבָא לְמֵימַר לְפִי חֶשְׁבּוֹן שְׁבוּרוֹת. אַלְמָא כֵּיוָן דְּאָמַר אֵינִי יוֹדֵעַ, רִיעַ טְפֵי.
human_translation: and they count toward his amount Rava thought to say toward amount broken Apparently, since he said: I don’t know, is worse.
llm_translation: And offerings for him from the treasury. Rava thought to say according to the broken treasury. This implies that since he said, "I do not know," he is a bad friend.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: אַדְּרַבָּה, הָא רִיעַ טְפֵי. מִדְּהָנֵי יָדַע, טְפֵי לָא יָדַע – תּוּ לֵית לֵיהּ, וְאִידַּךְ כּוּלְּהוּ דְּהַיְאךְ נִינְהוּ!
human_translation: Abaye said to him: On the contrary, this one, is worse because since he knows these he does not know more he has no more and all the others are of the other
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye: Adrabah, ha ri'a tefei. Mid'hanei yada, tefei lo yada - tu leit lei, ve'idach kullehu dehaich ninehu!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: לְפִי חֶשְׁבּוֹן שְׁלֵימוֹת. אִי הָכִי מַאי קָמְהַנֵּי לֵיהּ? לְמַלְבְּנָא רַוְוחָא. אִי נָמֵי טִינָא דִּמְעַבְּדָא.
human_translation: Rather, Abaye said toward amount unbroken If so, what did gain to a wide brick mold. Alternatively, clay processed
llm_translation: Rather, Abaye said: According to the full calculation. If so, what benefit does he derive from it? For the construction of a wall. Alternatively, for the mortar used.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַבַּיִת וְהָעֲלִיָּיה. נִפְחֲתָה הָעֲלִיָּיה, וְאֵין בַּעַל הַבַּיִת רוֹצֶה לְתַקֵּן – הֲרֵי בַּעַל הָעֲלִיָּיה יוֹרֵד וְדָר לְמַטָּה, עַד שֶׁיְּתַקֵּן לוֹ אֶת הָעֲלִיָּיה.
human_translation: a house and an upper story the upper story was broken, and the owner of the house does not want to repair the resident of the upper story can go down and live below until the repairs the upper story for him.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: "The house and the upper story. If the upper story collapses, and the owner of the house does not want to repair it - the owner of the upper story descends and lives below until he repairs the upper story."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: הַתַּחְתּוֹן נוֹתֵן אֶת הַתִּקְרָה, וְהָעֶלְיוֹן אֶת הַמַּעֲזִיבָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: the lower provides the ceiling and the upper the plaster.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: The lower one gives the ceiling, and the upper one gives the foundation.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ נִפְחֲתָה בְּכַמָּה? רַב אָמַר: בְּרוּבָּהּ, וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: בְּאַרְבָּעָה.
human_translation: was broken, to what extent Rav says: Most of it and Shmuel says: of four
llm_translation: The Talmudic text translates as follows: "Gemara: How much does it diminish by? Rav said: By a quarter, and Shmuel said: By four."

hebrew_text: רַב אָמַר: בְּרוּבָּהּ, אֲבָל בְּאַרְבָּעָה – לֹא: אָדָם דָּר חֶצְיוֹ לְמַטָּה וְחֶצְיוֹ לְמַעְלָה. וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר, בְּאַרְבָּעָה: אֵין אָדָם דָּר חֶצְיוֹ לְמַטָּה וְחֶצְיוֹ לְמַעְלָה.
human_translation: Rav says: Most of it but of four not a person reside partially below and partially above. And Shmuel says of four a person cannot reside partially below and partially above.
llm_translation: Rav said: In a balcony, but in a sukkah - no: a person may not reside with half below and half above. And Shmuel said, in a sukkah: a person may not reside with half below and half above.

hebrew_text: הֵיכִי דָמֵי? אִי דְּאָמַר עֲלִיָּיה זוֹ – אֲזַדָא! אֶלָּא דַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ עֲלִיָּיה סְתָם – לוֹגַר לֵיהּ אַחֲרִיתִי.
human_translation: What are the circumstances If said this upper story lost Rather, said to him an upper story without specifying must rent him a different
llm_translation: "How are the cases similar? If he said about this one - it is established! Rather, if he said about this one in general - he should have said to him the end."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא, לָא צְרִיכָא דַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ: עֲלִיָּיה זוֹ שֶׁאֲנִי מַשְׂכִּיר לָךְ, כִּי סָלְקָא – סְלֵיק בַּהֲדַהּ, וְכִי נָחֲיתָ[א] – חוּת בַּהֲדַהּ. אִי הָכִי, מַאי לְמֵימְרָא?
human_translation: Rava says: No, necessary where said to him: This upper story that I am renting to you, when it is up, up there in it, and when it descends, descend with it If so, what of stating
llm_translation: Rava said, it is not necessary for him to say to her: "This is the rent that I am renting to you," for when he ascends - ascend with her, and when he descends - descend with her. If so, what is there to say?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי, דַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ: ״עֲלִיָּיה זוֹ שֶׁעַל גַּבֵּי בַּיִת זֶה אֲנִי מַשְׂכִּיר לָךְ״, דְּהָא שַׁעְבֵּיד בַּיִת לַעֲלִיָּיה.
human_translation: Rather, Rav Ashi said: where said to him: I am renting to you this upper story, which is on top of this house. As rendered the house as liened with regard to the upper story,
llm_translation: Rather, Rav Ashi said, for he said to him: "This upper story that is on top of this house, I am renting to you," for he made the house into an upper story.

hebrew_text: וְכִי הָא דְּאָמַר רָבִין בַּר רַב אַדָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּאֶחָד שֶׁאָמַר לַחֲבֵירוֹ ״דָּלִית שֶׁעַל גַּבֵּי פַּרְסֵק זֶה אֲנִי מוֹכֵר לָךְ״, וְנֶעֱקַר הַפַּרְסֵק. וּבָא מַעֲשֶׂה לִפְנֵי רַבִּי חִיָּיא, וְאָמַר: חַיָּיב אַתָּה לְהַעֲמִיד לוֹ פַּרְסֵק כׇּל זְמַן שֶׁהַדָּלִית קַיֶּימֶת.
human_translation: And in accordance with that Ravin bar Rav Adda said Rabbi Yitzḥak said: an incident involving one who said to another: I am selling to you vine that is on top of peach tree [ parsek ], and the peach tree was uprooted. And incident came before Rabbi Ḥiyya, and he said: You are obligated to erect for him a peach tree as long as the vine exists.
llm_translation: And when Ravin son of Rav Adda said in the name of Rabbi Yitzchak: There was an incident with one person who said to his fellow, "I am selling you this basket of peaches that are on top of this wall," and the wall collapsed. The case came before Rabbi Chiya, and he said: "You are obligated to provide him with peaches as long as the basket remains intact."

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי רַבִּי אַבָּא בַּר מֶמֶל:
human_translation: Rabbi Abba bar Memel raised a dilemma:
llm_translation: The request of Rabbi Abba bar Memel:

hebrew_text: כְּשֶׁהוּא דָּר, לְבַדּוֹ הוּא דָּר כִּדְמֵעִיקָּרָא, אוֹ דִלְמָא שְׁנֵיהֶם דָּרִין, דַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ: אַדַּעְתָּא לְאַפֹּקִינַן לָא אֹגַרִי לָךְ.
human_translation: when he resides he reside alone as at the outset Or perhaps they both reside as say to him: I did not rent with the intention of being removed
llm_translation: When he lives, he lives alone, as at the outset, or perhaps both of them live, for he said to him: "I do not know how to cook for you."

hebrew_text: אִם תִּמְצָא לוֹמַר שְׁנֵיהֶם דָּרִין בּוֹ, כְּשֶׁהוּא מִשְׁתַּמֵּשׁ – דֶּרֶךְ פְּתָחִים מִשְׁתַּמֵּשׁ, אוֹ דֶּרֶךְ גַּגִּין מִשְׁתַּמֵּשׁ? מִי אָמַר כִּדְמֵעִיקָּרָא: מָה מֵעִיקָּרָא, דֶּרֶךְ גַּגִּין – הַשְׁתָּא נָמֵי דֶּרֶךְ גַּגִּין. אוֹ דִלְמָא מָצֵי אֲמַר לֵיהּ: עֲלִיָּיה – קַבֵּילִי עֲלַאי, עֲלִיָּיה וִירִידָה – לָא קַבֵּילִי עֲלַאי.
human_translation: If you say they both reside there, when uses use way of entrances, or use way of roofs? Can say: as at the outset; just as at the outset way of roofs, now too, way of roofs? Or perhaps can say to him: I accepted upon myself an ascent I did not accept upon myself an ascent and a descent,
llm_translation: If you find to say both of them live in it, when he uses - the way of openings he uses, or the way of roofs he uses? Who said like the original: what from the original, the way of roofs - the same as the way of roofs. Or perhaps he can say to him: go up - receive me above, going up and down - do not receive me above.

hebrew_text: אִם תִּמְצָא לוֹמַר, מָצֵי אֲמַר לֵיהּ: עֲלִיָּיה וִירִידָה לָא קַבֵּילִי עֲלַאי. שְׁתֵּי עֲלִיּוֹת זוֹ עַל גַּב זוֹ, מַהוּ? אִיפְּחִית עֶלְיוֹנָה, נָחֵית וְדָר בְּתַחְתּוֹנָה. אִיפְּחִית תַּחְתּוֹנָה, מַהוּ לְמִיסְלַק לִגְמָרֵי בְּעֶלְיוֹנָה?
human_translation: If you say can say to I did not accept upon myself an ascent and a descent, two upper stories, this on top of that what is If the higher was broken, descend and reside in the lower the lower was broken, what is to ascend full in the higher
llm_translation: If you find to say, "Matsay" he said to him: "Aliyah and Yeridah I did not accept upon myself. Two Aliyot, one on top of the other, what? If you nullified the upper one, descend and reside in the lower one. If you nullified the lower one, what to completely remove from the upper one?

hebrew_text: מִי אָמְרִינַן דַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ: שֵׁם עֲלִיָּיה קַבֵּילְיתְּ עֲלָךְ? אוֹ דִלְמָא: חַד עֲלִיָּיה – קַבֵּיל עֲלֵיהּ, שְׁתֵּי עֲלִיּוֹת – לָא קַבֵּיל עֲלֵיהּ? תֵּיקוּ.
human_translation: Do we say that say to You accepted upon yourself the term: An upper story, Or perhaps accepted upon himself one ascent, he did not accept upon himself two ascents. shall stand
llm_translation: Who said that he said to him: "Did you accept the name Aliyah upon yourself?" Or perhaps: "If one Aliyah - accept upon it, two Aliyahs - do not accept upon it?" This remains unresolved.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: הַתַּחְתּוֹן נוֹתֵן אֶת הַתִּקְרָה כּוּ׳. מַאי ״תִּקְרָה״? רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר חֲנִינָא אָמַר: קִינִּים וּסְנָאִין. וְ[יוּ]סְטִינִי אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן לָקִישׁ: לְווֹחִים. וְלָא פְּלִיגִי: מָר כִּי אַתְרֵיהּ וּמָר כִּי אַתְרֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: The lower provides the ceiling What ceiling Rabbi Yosei bar Ḥanina says: Mats and beams. And Setini says Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish Wide wooden planks. And do not disagree Sage in accordance with his locale and Sage in accordance with his locale,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: The lower one places the "tikrah" like so. What is "tikrah"? Rabbi Yosei bar Hanina says: reeds and boards. And Yusitini says Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish: planks. And they do not disagree: one master in his place and one master in his place.

hebrew_text: הָנְהוּ בֵּי תְרֵי דַּהֲווֹ דָּיְירִי, חַד עִילַּאי וְחַד תַּתַּאי. אִיפְּחִית מַעֲזִיבָה. כִּי מָשֵׁי מַיָּא, עִילַּאי אָזְלִי וּמַזְּקִי לְתַתַּאי. מִי מְתַקֵּן? רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר: הָעֶלְיוֹן מְתַקֵּן, וְרַבִּי אִלְעַי מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי חִיָּיא בְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי אָמַר: הַתַּחְתּוֹן מְתַקֵּן. וְסִימָן: ״וְיוֹסֵף הוּרַד מִצְרָיְמָה״.
human_translation: these two who were residing one upper and one lower plaster broke, when the upper wash water, run and damage to the lower Who repair Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba says: The upper repairs and Rabbi Elai says in the name of Rabbi Ḥiyya, son of Rabbi Yosei: The lower repairs And a mnemonic “And Joseph was brought down to Egypt”
llm_translation: Those two were neighbors, one above and one below. If the upper one pours out water, the upper one goes down and damages the lower one. Who fixes it? Rabbi Chiya bar Abba said: The upper one fixes it, and Rabbi Ilai in the name of Rabbi Chiya bar Yosei said: The lower one fixes it. And the sign is: "And Joseph was brought down to Egypt."

hebrew_text: לֵימָא רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא וְרַבִּי אִלְעַי בִּפְלוּגְתָּא דְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי וְרַבָּנַן קָמִיפַּלְגִי? לְמַאן דְּאָמַר הָעֶלְיוֹן מְתַקֵּן, קָסָבַר עַל הַמַּזִּיק לְהַרְחִיק אֶת עַצְמוֹ מִן הַנִּיזָּק. וּמַאן דְּאָמַר תַּחְתּוֹן מְתַקֵּן, קָסָבַר עַל הַנִּיזָּק לְהַרְחִיק אֶת עַצְמוֹ מִן הַמַּזִּיק.
human_translation: Shall we say Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba and Rabbi Elai disagree with regard to the dispute Rabbi Yosei and the Rabbis According to the one who says the upper repairs he holds on the one responsible for the damage to distance himself from the damaged. And the one who says the lower repairs he holds on the damaged to distance himself from the one responsible for the damage.
llm_translation: Let us say, Rabbi Chiya bar Abba and Rabbi Ilai in the dispute of Rabbi Yosei and the Rabbis, who do they follow? According to the one who says the upper one is effective, he holds that one should write against the one causing damage to distance oneself from the one causing harm. And according to the one who says the lower one is effective, he holds that one should write against the one causing harm to distance oneself from the one causing damage.

hebrew_text: וְתִיסְבְּרָא רַבִּי יוֹסֵי וְרַבָּנַן לְעִנְיַן נְזָקִין פְּלִיגִי? וְהָא אִיפְּכָא שָׁמְעִינַן לְהוּ, דִּתְנַן: מַרְחִיקִין אֶת הָאִילָן מִן הַבּוֹר עֶשְׂרִים וְחָמֵשׁ אַמָּה, וּבֶחָרוּב וּבַשִּׁקְמָה חֲמִשִּׁים אַמָּה, בֵּין מִלְּמַעְלָה בֵּין מִן הַצַּד. אִם הַבּוֹר קָדַם – קוֹצֵץ וְנוֹתֵן דָּמִים. אִם הָאִילָן קָדַם – לֹא יָקוֹץ. סָפֵק זֶה קָדַם סָפֵק זֶה קָדַם – לֹא יָקוֹץ.
human_translation: And you understand Rabbi Yosei and the Rabbis disagree with regard to damages? But haven’t we heard them the opposite? As we learned One must distance a tree twenty-five cubits from a pit, and of a carob or sycamore fifty cubits. whether is above or to the side If the pit preceded may cut down and pay monetary If the tree preceded he may not cut down. uncertain this preceded uncertain that preceded he may not cut down
llm_translation: And was created Rabbi Yosei and the Rabbis regarding the matter of damages they dispute? But this is what we heard for them, as we learned: One must distance a tree from a pit twenty-five cubits, and from a carob tree and a sycamore tree fifty cubits, whether from above or from the side. If the pit came first - one cuts and pays damages. If the tree came first - one does not cut. If there is doubt which came first - if there is doubt which came first - one does not cut.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁהַבּוֹר קוֹדֶמֶת לָאִילָן – לֹא יָקוֹץ, שֶׁזֶּה חוֹפֵר בְּתוֹךְ שֶׁלּוֹ, וְזֶה נוֹטֵעַ בְּתוֹךְ שֶׁלּוֹ. אַלְמָא, רַבִּי יוֹסֵי סָבַר עַל הַנִּיזָּק לְהַרְחִיק אֶת עַצְמוֹ, וְרַבָּנַן סָבְרִי עַל הַמַּזִּיק לְהַרְחִיק אֶת עַצְמוֹ!
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: Even if the pit preceded the tree, he may not cut down. As this one digs in his own and that one plants in his own Apparently, Rabbi Yosei holds on the damaged to distance himself and the Rabbis hold on the one responsible for the damage to distance himself
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: Even though the pit precedes the tree, it does not uproot, for this one digs within its own domain, and this one plants within its own domain. This implies that Rabbi Yosei holds that one should distance oneself from potential harm, while the Rabbis hold that one should distance oneself from the one causing harm!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אִי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר פְּלִיגִי, בִּפְלוּגְתָּא דְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי וְרַבָּנַן דְּהָתָם קָמִיפַּלְגִי.
human_translation: Rather, if it can be said disagree they disagree in the dispute between Rabbi Yosei and the Rabbis there,
llm_translation: Rather, if there is to say they argue, in the dispute of Rabbi Yosei and the Rabbis, there they argue.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי וְרַבָּנַן דְּהָכָא, בְּמַאי פְּלִיגִי? בְּחוֹזֶק תִּקְרָה קָמִיפַּלְגִי. רַבָּנַן סָבְרִי: מַעֲזִיבָה אַחְזוֹקֵי תִּקְרָה הוּא, וְאַחְזוֹקֵי תִּקְרָה (עַל הַ)תַּחְתּוֹן בָּעֵי (לְ)אַחְזוֹקֵי. וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי סָבַר: מַעֲזִיבָה אַשְׁווֹיֵי גּוּמּוֹת הוּא, וְאַשְׁווֹיֵי גּוּמּוֹת (עַל הָעֶלְיוֹן לְאַשְׁווֹיֵי).
human_translation: And with regard to what do Rabbi Yosei and the Rabbis of here disagree? They disagree with regard to the strength of a ceiling. The Rabbis hold plaster is strengthen the ceiling, and strengthening the ceiling of the lower required to strengthen And Rabbi Yosei holds plaster is level out holes, and leveling out holes of the upper to level out.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei and the Rabbis here, with what do they argue? With the presumption of a firmly established roof they argue. The Rabbis hold: abandoning the supports of the roof is it, and the supports of the roof require support below. Rabbi Yosei holds: the supports are equal to the beams, and the beams require support above.

hebrew_text: אִינִי? וְהָאָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: כִּי הֲוֵינָא בֵּי רַב כָּהֲנָא, הֲוָה אָמְרִינַן: מוֹדֶה רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּגִירֵי דִּילֵיהּ!
human_translation: Is that so? But didn’t Rav Ashi say: When I was in the school of Rav Kahana we would say Rabbi Yosei concedes of his arrows.
llm_translation: I? But didn't Rav Ashe say: When I was in the study hall of Rav Kahana, we used to say: Rabbi Yosei concedes in matters concerning his purse!

hebrew_text: דְּפָסְקִי מַיָּא וַהֲדַר נָפְלִי.
human_translation: which the water stops and subsequently falls
llm_translation: When the water ceases, then they fall.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַבַּיִת וְהָעֲלִיָּיה שֶׁל שְׁנַיִם שֶׁנָּפְלוּ, אָמַר בַּעַל הָעֲלִיָּיה לְבַעַל הַבַּיִת לִבְנוֹת וְהוּא אֵינוֹ רוֹצֶה לִבְנוֹת – הֲרֵי בַּעַל הָעֲלִיָּיה בּוֹנֶה אֶת הַבַּיִת וְדָר בְּתוֹכָהּ, עַד שֶׁיִּתֵּן לוֹ אֶת יְצִיאוֹתָיו.
human_translation: the house and the upper story belonging to two that collapsed, the owner of the upper story told the owner of the house to build and he does not want to build the owner of the upper story build the house and reside in it, until gives him his expenses
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: If the house and the upper story of two individuals collapsed, the owner of the upper story says to the owner of the house, "Let us rebuild," but the owner of the house does not want to rebuild, the owner of the upper story may rebuild the house and dwell in it until he gives him his exits.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אַף זֶה דָּר בְּתוֹךְ שֶׁל חֲבֵירוֹ, צָרִיךְ לְהַעֲלוֹת לוֹ שָׂכָר. אֶלָּא בַּעַל הָעֲלִיָּיה בּוֹנֶה אֶת הַבַּיִת וְאֶת הָעֲלִיָּיה, [וּ]מְקָרֶה אֶת הָעֶלְיוֹנָה, וְיוֹשֵׁב בַּבַּיִת עַד שֶׁיִּתֵּן לוֹ אֶת יְצִיאוֹתָיו.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: This too, residing inside of the other, must pay him rent. Rather, the owner of the upper story builds the house and the upper story, roofs the upper and he sit in the house, until gives him his expenses
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: Even one who lives within his fellow's property, must pay him rent. Rather, the owner of the upper story builds the house and the upper story, and rents out the upper story, and resides in the house until he gives him his exits.
