hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה מְקוֹמוֹת שָׁנָה לָנוּ רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אָסוּר לְאָדָם שֶׁיֵּהָנֶה מִמָּמוֹן חֲבֵירוֹ. חֲדָא – הָא דִּתְנַן.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says: In three places Rabbi Yehuda taught us forbidden for a person to derive benefit from the property of another One that which we learn
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemara amar Rabbi Yochanan: bishloshah mekomot shanah lanu Rabbi Yehuda asur le'adam sheyehaneh mimamon chaveiro. Chadah - ha ditanan. English translation: Gemara said Rabbi Yochanan: In three places Rabbi Yehuda taught us that it is forbidden for a person to benefit from the money of his fellow. One of them - as we learned.

hebrew_text: אִידַּךְ מָה הִיא, דִּתְנַן: הַנּוֹתֵן צֶמֶר לַצַבָּע לִצְבּוֹעַ לוֹ אָדוֹם וּצְבָעוֹ שָׁחוֹר, שָׁחוֹר וּצְבָעוֹ אָדוֹם, רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: נוֹתֵן לוֹ דְּמֵי צַמְרוֹ. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אִם הַשֶּׁבַח יוֹתֵר עַל הַהוֹצָאָה – נוֹתֵן לוֹ הַיְּצִיאָה, וְאִם הַהוֹצָאָה יְתֵירָה עַל הַשֶּׁבַח – נוֹתֵן לוֹ אֶת הַשֶּׁבַח.
human_translation: What is another As we learned one gives wool to a dyer to dye red for him and he dyed it black, black and he dyed it red, Rabbi Meir says: gives the value of his wool. Rabbi Yehuda says: If the enhancement exceeds the expenses, gives the expenses. And if the expenses exceed the enhancement, he gives him the enhancement.
llm_translation: The other one, what is it? As we learned in a Mishnah: One who gives wool to a dyer to dye it red, and its color turns out black, or black and its color turns out red, Rabbi Meir says: he gives him the value of his wool. Rabbi Yehuda says: If the praise exceeds the expense - he gives him the expense, and if the expense exceeds the praise - he gives him the praise.

hebrew_text: וְאִידַּךְ מַאי הִיא, דִּתְנַן: מִי שֶׁפָּרַע מִקְצָת חוֹבוֹ וְהִשְׁלִישׁ אֶת שְׁטָרוֹ וְאָמַר לוֹ: ״אִם אֵין אֲנִי נוֹתֵן לְךָ מִכָּאן וְעַד זְמַן פְּלוֹנִי – תֵּן לוֹ שְׁטָרוֹ״. הִגִּיעַ זְמַן וְלֹא נָתַן, רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: יִתֵּן, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: לֹא יִתֵּן.
human_translation: And what is the other, As we learned who repaid part of his debt, and he deposited note with a third party and said to If I do not give you from now until such and such a time, give his note, time arrived and has not given Rabbi Yosei says: shall give Rabbi Yehuda says: shall not give
llm_translation: The other one, what is it? As we learned in a Mishnah: One who partially pays off his debt and tears up the promissory note, saying to him, "If I do not give you from now until such and such a time - give him his promissory note." The time arrived and he did not give it. Rabbi Yosei says: He should give it, Rabbi Yehuda says: He should not give it.

hebrew_text: אַמַּאי? דִּלְמָא עַד כָּאן לָא קָאָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה הָכָא, אֶלָּא מִשּׁוּם דְּאִיכָּא שַׁחְרוּרִיתָא.
human_translation: Why Perhaps Rabbi Yehuda saying only here, only because there is blackening
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Ammay? Dilmah ad kan lo ka'amar Rabbi Yehuda haka, ela mishum de'ika shachrurita." English translation: "Why? Perhaps Rabbi Yehuda did not say this here, but because there is freedom."

hebrew_text: אִי נָמֵי לִצְבּוֹעַ לוֹ אָדוֹם וּצְבָעוֹ שָׁחוֹר – מִשּׁוּם דְּקָא מְשַׁנֶּה, וְהָתְנַן: כׇּל הַמְשַׁנֶּה יָדוֹ עַל הַתַּחְתּוֹנָה.
human_translation: Alternatively, to dye for him red and he dyed it black, due to is changing and didn’t we learn whoever changes is at a disadvantage?
llm_translation: If one said to dye it red and its color turned black - because it is changing, and we learned: "Anyone who changes his mind, his hand is on the lower part."

hebrew_text: וּמִי שֶׁפָּרַע מִקְצָת חוֹבוֹ נָמֵי הָוֵי אַסְמַכְתָּא, וְשָׁמְעִינַן לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה דְּאָמַר לָא קָנֵי.
human_translation: And one who repaid part of his debt, too, is a transaction with inconclusive intent [ asmakhta ], and we heard Rabbi Yehuda who says an asmakhta does not effect acquisition.
llm_translation: And one who partially pays off his debt, it is as if he has not paid at all, and we have heard this in the name of Rabbi Yehuda who said: "It does not acquire."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אַחָא בַּר אַדָּא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּעוּלָּא: תַּחְתּוֹן הַבָּא לְשַׁנּוֹת, בִּגְוִיל – שׁוֹמְעִין לוֹ, בְּגָזִית – אֵין שׁוֹמְעִין לוֹ.
human_translation: Rav Aḥa bar Adda says in the name of Ulla: lower who comes to change with untrimmed stones listens to him with hewn stones, does not listen to him,
llm_translation: Said Rav Acha bar Adda in the name of Ulah: "Regarding one who comes to change his lower garment, if with a belt - we listen to him, if with a knife - we do not listen to him."

hebrew_text: בִּכְפִיסִין – שׁוֹמְעִין לוֹ. בִּלְבֵנִים – אֵין שׁוֹמְעִין לוֹ. לְסַכֵּךְ בַּאֲרָזִים – שׁוֹמְעִין לוֹ. בְּשִׁקְמִים – אֵין שׁוֹמְעִין לוֹ.
human_translation: with girders, listens to him, with bricks, does not listen to him. to roof with cedar wood, listens to him, with sycamore does not listen to him.
llm_translation: In baskets - we listen to him. In stones - we do not listen to him. To cover with cedar branches - we listen to him. In sycamore trees - we do not listen to him.

hebrew_text: לְמַעֵט בְּחַלּוֹנוֹת – שׁוֹמְעִין לוֹ. לְהַרְבּוֹת בְּחַלּוֹנוֹת – אֵין שׁוֹמְעִין לוֹ. לְהַגְבִּיהַּ – אֵין שׁוֹמְעִין לוֹ. לְמַעֵט – שׁוֹמְעִין לוֹ.
human_translation: to reduce of windows, listens to him, to increase of windows, does not listen to him. to heighten does not listen to him, to reduce listens to him.
llm_translation: To lessen in windows - they listen to him. To increase in windows - they do not listen to him. To raise it - they do not listen to him. To lessen - they listen to him.

hebrew_text: עֶלְיוֹן שֶׁבָּא לְשַׁנּוֹת, בְּגָזִית – שׁוֹמְעִין לוֹ, בִּגְוִיל – אֵין שׁוֹמְעִין לוֹ.
human_translation: upper who comes to change with hewn stones listens to him, with untrimmed stones, does not listen to him,
llm_translation: The Supreme One who came to change, with a knife - we listen to him, with a reed - we do not listen to him.

hebrew_text: בִּכְפִיסִין אֵין שׁוֹמְעִין לוֹ, בִּלְבֵנִים שׁוֹמְעִין לוֹ. בַּאֲרָזִים אֵין שׁוֹמְעִין לוֹ, בְּשִׁקְמָה שׁוֹמְעִין לוֹ. לְרַבּוֹת בְּחַלּוֹנוֹת שׁוֹמְעִין לוֹ, לְמַעֵט בְּחַלּוֹנוֹת אֵין שׁוֹמְעִין לוֹ. לְהַגְבִּיהַּ אֵין שׁוֹמְעִין לוֹ, לְמַעֵט שׁוֹמְעִין לוֹ.
human_translation: with girders does not listen to him, with bricks, listens to him. with cedar wood, does not listen to him, with sycamore listens to him. to increase of windows, listens to him, to reduce the of windows, does not listen to him. to heighten does not listen to him, to reduce listens to him.
llm_translation: In baskets, one does not listen to it; in bricks, one listens to it. In cedars, one does not listen to it; in sycamores, one listens to it. To include in windows, one listens to it; to exclude in windows, one does not listen to it. To raise it, one does not listen to it; to lower it, one listens to it.

hebrew_text: אֵין לוֹ לָזֶה וְלֹא לָזֶה, מַאי? תַּנְיָא: אֵין לוֹ לֹא לָזֶה וְלֹא לָזֶה – אֵין לוֹ לְבַעַל עֲלִיָּיה בַּקַּרְקַע כְּלוּם.
human_translation: neither this one nor that one has what is taught neither this one nor that one has the owner of upper story does not have any to the land,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: He has neither this nor that, what is it? It was taught: He has neither this nor that - he has no right to cohabit with her on the ground at all.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי נָתָן אוֹמֵר: תַּחְתּוֹן נוֹטֵל שְׁנֵי חֲלָקִים וְהָעֶלְיוֹן שְׁלִישׁ. וַאֲחֵרִים אוֹמְרִים: תַּחְתּוֹן נוֹטֵל שְׁלֹשָׁה חֲלָקִים וְהָעֶלְיוֹן נוֹטֵל רְבִיעַ. אָמַר רַבָּה: נְקוֹט דְּרַבִּי נָתָן בִּידָךְ, דְּדַיָּינָא הוּא וְנָחֵית לְעוּמְקָא דְּדִינָא, קָא סָבַר: כַּמָּה מַפְסֵיד עֲלִיָּיה בַּבַּיִת – תִּילְתָּא, הִלְכָּךְ אִית לֵיהּ תִּילְתָּא.
human_translation: is taught Rabbi Natan says: lower takes two shares and the upper one-third. And others say: lower takes three shares, and the upper takes one-quarter. Rabba says: Take of Rabbi Natan in your hand, because he is a judge, and he descends to the depths of the law. He maintains: How much upper story depreciate of the house? One-third. Therefore he has one-third,
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Nathan says: The lower one takes two shares and the upper one takes a third. And others say: The lower one takes three shares and the upper one takes a quarter. Rabbah said: Take Rabbi Nathan's view in your hand, for he is a skilled judge and reaches the depth of judgment. He thought: How much does one lose in the house - a third, therefore he has a third.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ וְכֵן בֵּית הַבַּד שֶׁהוּא בָּנוּי בַּסֶּלַע וְגִינָּה אַחַת עַל גַּבָּיו, וְנִפְחַת – הֲרֵי בַּעַל הַגִּינָּה יוֹרֵד וְזוֹרֵעַ לְמַטָּה עַד שֶׁיַּעֲשֶׂה לְבֵית בַּדּוֹ כִּיפִּין.
human_translation: And likewise, an olive press that is built in a rock, and one garden, on top of it, and broke, the owner of the garden descend and sow below until constructs for his olive press arches
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: And similarly, a house of linen that is built on a rock and has a garden on its roof, and it collapses - the owner of the garden descends and plants downwards until he makes the house of linen like caves.

hebrew_text: הַכּוֹתֶל וְהָאִילָן שֶׁנָּפְלוּ לִרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים וְהִזִּיקוּ – פָּטוּר מִלְּשַׁלֵּם. נָתְנוּ לוֹ זְמַן לָקוֹץ אֶת הָאִילָן וְלִסְתּוֹר אֶת הַכּוֹתֶל, וְנָפְלוּ בְּתוֹךְ הַזְּמַן – פָּטוּר, לְאַחַר הַזְּמַן – חַיָּיב.
human_translation: a wall or a tree that fell into the public domain and caused damage, exempt from to pay, they gave him time to cut down the tree or to dismantle the wall, and they fell during the time, exempt, after the time liable
llm_translation: The wall and the tree that fell into the public domain and caused damage - exempt from paying. They gave him time to uproot the tree and to repair the wall, and they fell within the time - exempt, after the time - liable.

hebrew_text: מִי שֶׁהָיָה כּוֹתְלוֹ סָמוּךְ לְגִינַּת חֲבֵירוֹ וְנָפַל, וְאָמַר לוֹ: פַּנֵּה אֲבָנֶיךָ, וְאָמַר לוֹ:
human_translation: one whose wall was adjacent to another’s garden, and fell, and said to him: Clear your stones, and said to him:
llm_translation: One whose wall was adjacent to his neighbor's garden and it fell, and he said to him: "Rebuild your stones," and he said to him:

hebrew_text: הִגִּיעוּךָ – אֵין שׁוֹמְעִין לוֹ. מִשֶּׁקִּבֵּל עָלָיו אָמַר לוֹ: הֵילָךְ אֶת יְצִיאוֹתֶיךָ, וַאֲנִי אֶטּוֹל אֶת שֶׁלִּי – אֵין שׁוֹמְעִין לוֹ.
human_translation: They are yours, does not listen to him, after accepted upon himself, said to him: Here you are, your expenditures and I will take mine; does not listen to him,
llm_translation: They reached you - they do not listen to him. From when he accepted upon himself, he said to him: "Go with your exits, and I will take mine" - they do not listen to him.

hebrew_text: הַשּׂוֹכֵר אֶת הַפּוֹעֵל לַעֲשׂוֹת עִמּוֹ בַּתֶּבֶן וּבַקַּשׁ, וְאָמַר לוֹ: תֵּן לִי שְׂכָרִי. וְאָמַר לוֹ: טוֹל מַה שֶּׁעָשִׂית בִּשְׂכָרְךָ – אֵין שׁוֹמְעִין לוֹ. מִשֶּׁקִּבֵּל עָלָיו וְאָמַר לוֹ: הֵילָךְ שְׂכָרְךָ וַאֲנִי אֶטּוֹל אֶת שֶׁלִּי – אֵין שׁוֹמְעִין לוֹ.
human_translation: one who hires a laborer to do with him with hay or with straw, and said to Give me my wages, and said to him: Take what you have worked with as your wages, does not listen to him. after accepted upon himself and said to him: Here you are, your wages and I will take mine; does not listen to him,
llm_translation: The one who hires a laborer to work with him in straw and in stubble, and said to him: "Give me my wages." And he said to him: "Take what you have done for your wages" - we do not listen to him. Once he receives it and says to him: "Go take your wages, and I will take mine" - we do not listen to him.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ נִפְחֲתָה, רַב אָמַר בְּרוּבָּהּ, וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר בְּאַרְבַּע. רַב אָמַר: בְּרוּבָּהּ, אֲבָל בְּאַרְבַּע – אָדָם זוֹרֵעַ חֶצְיוֹ לְמַטָּה וְחֶצְיוֹ לְמַעְלָה. וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: בְּאַרְבַּע – אֵין אָדָם זוֹרֵעַ חֶצְיוֹ לְמַטָּה וְחֶצְיוֹ לְמַעְלָה.
human_translation: was broken, Rav says: Most of it and Shmuel says: of four Rav says: Most of it but of four a person sow partially below, and partially above. And Shmuel says: of four a person cannot sow partially below, and partially above.
llm_translation: Gemara: If it was diminished, Rav said by a quarter, and Shmuel said by a fourth. Rav said: by a quarter, but by a fourth - a person sows half downwards and half upwards. And Shmuel said: by a fourth - a person does not sow half downwards and half upwards.

hebrew_text: וּצְרִיכָא: דְּאִי אַשְׁמוֹעִינַן דִּירָה, בְּהָא קָאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל מִשּׁוּם דְּלָא עֲבִידִי אִינָשֵׁי דְּדָיְירִי פּוּרְתָּא הָכָא וּפוּרְתָּא הָכָא, אֲבָל לְעִנְיַן זְרִיעָה – עֲבִידִי אִינָשֵׁי דְּזָרְעִי הָכָא פּוּרְתָּא וְהָכָא פּוּרְתָּא, אֵימָא מוֹדֶה לֵיהּ לְרַב. וְאִי אִיתְּמַר בְּהָךְ, בְּהָךְ קָאָמַר רַב, אֲבָל בְּהָא – אֵימָא מוֹדֶה לֵיהּ לִשְׁמוּאֵל, צְרִיכָא.
human_translation: And necessary As had taught us only a residence, in this Shmuel is saying because people do not tend to live a little here and a little there, but with regard to sowing, people tend to sow a little here and a little there. say concedes to Rav And if was stated with regard to this with regard to this Rav is saying but with regard to that say concedes to Shmuel. necessary
llm_translation: The matter requires clarification: for if we were to hear that with regard to a dwelling, in this case Shmuel is saying that since people do not make dwellings of half here and half there, but with regard to planting – people do plant half here and half there, let him concede to Rav. And if it was stated in this case, in this case Rav is saying, but in that case – let him concede to Shmuel. This requires clarification.

hebrew_text: נָתְנוּ לוֹ זְמַן. וְכַמָּה זְמַן בֵּית דִּין? אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם.
human_translation: they gave him time And how much time a court Rabbi Yoḥanan says: thirty days.
llm_translation: They gave him time. And how much time does the court give? Rabbi Yochanan said: Thirty days.

hebrew_text: מִי שֶׁהָיָה כּוֹתְלוֹ כּוּ׳. הָא מִדְּקָתָנֵי סֵיפָא: ״הֵילָךְ יְצִיאוֹתֶיךָ״, מִכְּלָל דְּפַנִּינְהוּ עָסְקִינַן. טַעְמָא דְּפַנִּינְהוּ, הָא לָא פַּנִּינְהוּ – לָא.
human_translation: one whose wall But from the fact that the last clause teaches Here you are, your expenditures, by inference we are dealing with where cleared reason that cleared them but he did not clear them not
llm_translation: One whose wall is like a wall. Here, the end of the Mishnah is expounded: "Your goings out," indicating that we are dealing with walls. The reason for dealing with walls is this: if it is a wall, then it is a wall; if it is not a wall, then it is not.

hebrew_text: אַמַּאי: וְתִקְנֶה לֵיהּ שָׂדֵהוּ, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: חֲצֵירוֹ שֶׁל אָדָם קוֹנָה לוֹ שֶׁלֹּא מִדַּעְתּוֹ!
human_translation: Why But shouldn’t field effect acquisition his As Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, says: The courtyard of a person effects acquisition for him without his knowledge.
llm_translation: Question: And should he acquire his field, as Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Chanina, said: "One's courtyard acquires for him without his knowledge!"

hebrew_text: הָנֵי מִילֵּי הֵיכָא דְּקָא מִיכַּוֵּין לְאַקְנוֹיֵי לֵיהּ. אֲבָל הָכָא – אִישְׁתְּמוֹטֵי הוּא דְּקָא מִישְׁתְּמִיט לֵיהּ.
human_translation: This statement where intends to transfer them to him, but here, is evade
llm_translation: These matters, where they are being prepared for him. But here - it is being prepared for him.

hebrew_text: הַשּׂוֹכֵר לַעֲשׂוֹת עִמּוֹ בְּתֶבֶן כּוּ׳. וּצְרִיכָא,
human_translation: one who hires to do with him with hay, And necessary
llm_translation: The one who hires to do with him in straw, etc. And it is necessary.

hebrew_text: דְּאִי אַשְׁמוֹעִינַן לְהָךְ קַמַּיְיתָא, דְּכִי קָאָמַר לֵיהּ ״הִגִּיעוּךְ״ – אֵין שׁוֹמְעִין לוֹ, מִשּׁוּם דְּלֵית לֵיהּ אַגְרָא גַּבֵּיהּ. אֲבָל הָכָא, דְּאִית לֵיהּ אַגְרָא גַּבֵּיהּ – אֵימָא שׁוֹמְעִין לוֹ, דְּאָמְרִי אִינָשֵׁי: ״מִמָּרֵי רַשְׁוָתָיךְ פָּארֵי אִפְּרַע״.
human_translation: As had it taught us with regard to this first that when says to They are yours, does not listen to him, because he does not have a wage by him, But here, which does have a wage by say listens to him, as people say from your debtor, repaid bran [ parei ],
llm_translation: If we were to hear that case, where he said to her "you have reached," we do not listen to him, because he does not have a reward for himself. But here, where he has a reward for himself, we say we listen to him, as people say: "From the rebels of your authority, you shall bring forth beauty."

hebrew_text: וְאִי אַשְׁמוֹעִינַן הָכָא – הָכָא שֶׁמִּשֶּׁקִּבֵּל עָלָיו אֵין שׁוֹמְעִין לוֹ, מִשּׁוּם דְּאִית לֵיהּ אַגְרָא גַּבֵּיהּ. אֲבָל הָכָא, דְּלֵית לֵיהּ אַגְרָא גַּבֵּיהּ – אֵימָא שׁוֹמְעִין לוֹ, צְרִיכָא.
human_translation: And had it taught us here here that after has accepted upon himself, does not listen to because has a wage by him, But here, where does not have a wage by say listens to him necessary
llm_translation: And if we were to hear a case here - here, if he accepted upon himself, we do not listen to him, because he has a wage for himself. But here, where he does not have a wage for himself - say we listen to him, it is necessary.

hebrew_text: אֵין שׁוֹמְעִין לוֹ. וְהָתַנְיָא: שׁוֹמְעִין לוֹ! אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: לָא קַשְׁיָא. כָּאן בְּשֶׁלּוֹ, כָּאן בְּשֶׁל חֲבֵירוֹ.
human_translation: does not listen to him. But isn’t it taught does listen to him? Rav Naḥman said: not difficult. here, with regard to own there, with regard to of another,
llm_translation: We do not listen to him. And it was taught: we listen to him! Rav Nachman said: it is not difficult. Here it is regarding his own, here it is regarding his fellow's.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא לְרַב נַחְמָן: בְּשֶׁלּוֹ מַאי טַעְמָא – דַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ: אַגְרָא עֲלָךְ, בְּשֶׁל חֲבֵירוֹ נָמֵי שְׂכָרוֹ עָלָיו. דְּתַנְיָא: הַשּׂוֹכֵר אֶת הַפּוֹעֵל לַעֲשׂוֹת בְּשֶׁלּוֹ, וְהֶרְאָהוּ בְּשֶׁל חֲבֵירוֹ – נוֹתֵן לוֹ שְׂכָרוֹ מִשָּׁלֵם, וְחוֹזֵר וְנוֹטֵל מִבַּעַל הַבַּיִת מַה שֶּׁהֶהֱנָה אוֹתוֹ!
human_translation: Rava said to Rav Naḥman: In his own what is the reason As say to wage is on you. with of his friend, his earnings is also on as it is taught one who hires a laborer to perform in his own and showed belonging to another must give his full wages, and goes back and takes from the owner the benefit received from
llm_translation: He said to him, Rava to Rav Nachman: With his what reason - that he said to him: "The reward is upon you, for the reward of his fellow is also upon him." As it was taught: One who hires a laborer to work for him, and he shows him the work of his fellow - he pays him his wages from his own pocket, and then goes back and takes from the owner of the house what he benefited from him!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן, לָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן בְּשֶׁלּוֹ, כָּאן בְּשֶׁל הֶפְקֵר.
human_translation: Rather, Rav Naḥman said not difficult. here, with regard to own there, with regard to ownerless
llm_translation: Rather, said Rav Nachman, it is not difficult: here regarding his own, here regarding hefker.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ רָבָא לְרַב נַחְמָן: מְצִיאַת פּוֹעֵל לְעַצְמוֹ, אֵימָתַי? בִּזְמַן שֶׁאָמַר לוֹ בַּעַל הַבַּיִת נַכֵּשׁ עִמִּי הַיּוֹם, אוֹ עֲדוֹר עִמִּי הַיּוֹם. אֲבָל אִם אָמַר לוֹ: עֲשֵׂה עִמִּי מְלָאכָה הַיּוֹם – מְצִיאָתוֹ לְבַעַל הַבַּיִת!
human_translation: Rava raised an objection to Rav Naḥman: The found item of laborer to himself. When When the employer told him Weed with me today, or Hoe with me today. But if says to Work with me today, his found item to the employer,
llm_translation: Rava raised an objection to Rav Nachman: "The finding of a worker for himself, when? When the homeowner said to him, 'Dig with me today,' or 'Plow with me today.' But if he said to him, 'Do work for me today,' the finding is for the homeowner!"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן, לָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן – בְּהַגְבָּהָה, כָּאן – בְּהַבָּטָה.
human_translation: Rather, Rav Naḥman said: not difficult. here, with regard to lift there, with regard to viewing,
llm_translation: Rather, Rav Nachman said, it is not difficult: here - in arrogance, here - in gazing.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה: הַבָּטָה בְּהֶפְקֵר – תַּנָּאֵי הִיא. דִּתְנַן: שׁוֹמְרֵי סְפִיחֵי שְׁבִיעִית נוֹטְלִין שְׂכָרָן מִתְּרוּמַת הַלִּשְׁכָּה. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: הָרוֹצֶה מִתְנַדֵּב הוּא וְשׁוֹמֵר חִנָּם. אָמְרוּ לוֹ: אַתָּה אוֹמֵר כֵּן? אֵין בָּאִין מִשֶּׁל צִבּוּר.
human_translation: Rabba says: in ownerless viewing is tanna’im . As we learned watchmen of sefiḥim , of the Sabbatical take their wages from collection of the chamber, Rabbi Yosei says: One who desires volunteer and an unpaid bailee. said to him: you say so? do not come from communal
llm_translation: Rabba said: "Looking after ownerless produce - it is a dispute of Tannaim. For it was taught: The guardians of the seventh-year produce take their wages from the Temple treasury. Rabbi Yosei says: One who wishes to volunteer may do so, and the guardian may take for free." They said to him: "Do you say so? They do not come from communal funds."

hebrew_text: מַאי לָאו בְּהָא קָמִיפַּלְגִי: דְּתַנָּא קַמָּא סָבַר הַבָּטָה בְּהֶפְקֵר קָנֵי, וְאִי יָהֲיבִי לֵיהּ אַגְרָא – אִין, וְאִי לָא – לָא. וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי סָבַר הַבָּטָה בְּהֶפְקֵר לָא קָנֵי, וְכִי אָזְלִי צִבּוּר וּמַיְיתִי – הַשְׁתָּא הוּא דְּקָא זָכֵי בֵּיהּ.
human_translation: What, is it not with regard to this that they disagree: The first tanna holds in ownerless viewing effects acquisition And if he is given a wage yes, But if not not And, Rabbi Yosei holds in ownerless viewing does not effect acquisition and when community goes and brings it is now, that they acquire it.
llm_translation: What is the reason he does not agree with this? For it was taught: The first Tanna holds that with regard to a lost object that is ownerless, one acquires it by picking it up, and if he gives it as a gift - no, and if not - no. And Rabbi Yosei holds that with regard to a lost object that is ownerless, one does not acquire it by picking it up, and if the public go and take it - it is now that he acquires it.

hebrew_text: וּמָה ״אַתָּה אוֹמֵר״? הָכִי קָאָמְרִי לֵיהּ: מִדְּבָרֶיךָ לִדְבָרֵינוּ – אֵין עוֹמֶר וּשְׁתֵּי לֶחֶם בָּאִין מִשֶּׁל צִבּוּר.
human_translation: And what, you say This is what they were saying to him: from your statement to our statement omer offering and the two loaves do not come from communal
llm_translation: "And what does 'you say' mean? This is what they are saying to him: From your words to our words - the Omer and the two loaves come from communal property."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: לָא, דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא הַבָּטָה בְּהֶפְקֵר קָנֵי, וְהָכָא חָיְישִׁינַן שֶׁמָּא לֹא יִמְסְרֵם יָפֶה יָפֶה קָמִיפַּלְגִי. דְּרַבָּנַן סָבְרִי: יָהֲבִינַן לֵיהּ אַגְרָא, וְאִי לָא, חָיְישִׁינַן שֶׁמָּא לֹא יִמְסְרֵם יָפֶה יָפֶה.
human_translation: Rava said: No; that everyone in ownerless viewing effects acquisition, and here they disagree we are concerned perhaps he will not give over wholeheartedly As the Rabbis hold we give a wage, and if not we are concerned perhaps he will not give over wholeheartedly
llm_translation: Rava said: No, in general, one acquires through hefker. And here we are concerned lest they will not deliver them nicely, and they will fall apart. The Rabbis hold: We should give him a reward, and if not, we are concerned lest they will not deliver them nicely.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי סָבַר לָא חָיְישִׁינַן שֶׁמָּא לֹא יִמְסְרֵם יָפֶה יָפֶה, וּמָה ״אַתָּה אוֹמֵר״? הָכִי קָאָמְרִי לֵיהּ: מִדְּבָרֶיךָ לִדְבָרֵינוּ, דְּחָיְישִׁינַן שֶׁמָּא לֹא יִמְסְרֵם יָפֶה יָפֶה: אֵין עוֹמֶר וּשְׁתֵּי [הַ]לֶּחֶם בָּאִין מִשֶּׁל צִבּוּר.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei holds we are not concerned perhaps he will not hand over wholeheartedly And what you say This is what they were saying to him: from your statement to our statement that we are concerned perhaps he will not give over wholeheartedly, omer offering and two loaves do not come from communal
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei holds that we are not concerned that they may not be delivered very well, and what is "you say"? This is what they are saying to him: From your words to our words, we are concerned that they may not be delivered very well: The Omer and the two loaves come from communal property.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְאָמְרִי, רָבָא אָמַר: דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא הַבָּטָה בְּהֶפְקֵר לָא קָנֵי, וְהָכָא בְּחָיְישִׁינַן לְבַעֲלֵי זְרוֹעוֹת קָמִיפַּלְגִי. דְּתַנָּא קַמָּא סָבַר דְּתַקִּינוּ רַבָּנַן לְמִיתַּב לֵיהּ אַרְבַּע זוּזֵי, כִּי הֵיכִי דְּלִישְׁמְעוּ בַּעֲלֵי זְרוֹעוֹת וְלִיפְרְשׁוּ מִינַּיְיהוּ. וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי סָבַר: לָא תַּקִּינוּ.
human_translation: There are who say Rava said: that everyone in ownerless viewing does not effect acquisition and here, they disagree with regard to we are concerned about violent people As the first tanna holds that the Sages instituted to give him four dinars, so that violent people should hear and keep away from And Rabbi Yosei holds did not institute
llm_translation: There are some who say, Rava said: With regard to all the world, looking at something that is ownerless does not acquire it, and here we are concerned about the owners of the arms who might separate from them. For it was taught in the first clause that the Sages thought to establish that he should pay him four zuz, so that the owners of the arms would hear and separate from them. And Rabbi Yosei holds: They did not establish it.

hebrew_text: וּמָה ״אַתָּה אוֹמֵר״? הָכִי קָאָמְרִי לֵיהּ: מִדְּבָרֶיךָ לִדְבָרֵינוּ, אֵין [תְּמִידִין וּמוּסָפִין] בָּאִין מִשֶּׁל צִבּוּר. וְכֵן כִּי אֲתָא רָבִין, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: חוֹשְׁשִׁין לְבַעֲלֵי זְרוֹעוֹת אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ.
human_translation: And what you say This is what they were saying to him: from your statement to our statement do not come from communal And likewise, when Ravin came Rabbi Yoḥanan says: we are concerned about violent people is between
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And what does 'you say' mean? This is what they are saying to him: From your words to our words, the daily offerings and additional offerings do not come from communal funds. And similarly, when Ravin came, Rabbi Yochanan said: There is concern for those with short arms between them."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַמּוֹצִיא זֶבֶל לִרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים, הַמּוֹצִיא – מוֹצִיא, וְהַמְזַבֵּל – מְזַבֵּל. אֵין שׁוֹרִין טִיט בִּרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים, וְאֵין לוֹבְנִים לְבֵנִים. אֲבָל גּוֹבְלִין טִיט בִּרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים, אֲבָל לֹא לְבֵנִים.
human_translation: one who takes manure out to the public domain, who takes it out takes it out, and who fertilize fertilize one may not soak clay in the public domain and one may not mold bricks But one may knead clay in the public domain, but not bricks.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who removes dung to a public domain, the one who removes - removes, and the one who spreads - spreads. We do not plaster with mud in a public domain, and we do not whitewash with lime. But we may plaster with mud in a public domain, but not with lime.

hebrew_text: הַבּוֹנֶה בִּרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים, הַמֵּבִיא אֲבָנִים – מֵבִיא, וְהַבּוֹנֶה – בּוֹנֶה. וְאִם הִזִּיק – מְשַׁלֵּם מַה שֶּׁהִזִּיק. רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: אַף מְתַקֵּן הוּא אֶת מְלַאכְתּוֹ לִפְנֵי שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם.
human_translation: one who builds in the public domain, who brings stones brings and who builds builds And cause damage he pay what he damaged. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: even prepare his work thirty days beforehand;
llm_translation: One who builds in a public domain, one who brings stones - brings, and one who builds - builds. And if he causes damage - he pays for the damage he caused. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: He must also complete his work within thirty days.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ לֵימָא מַתְנִיתִין דְּלָא כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה. דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: בִּשְׁעַת הוֹצָאַת זְבָלִים אָדָם מוֹצִיא זִבְלוֹ לִרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים וְצוֹבְרוֹ כׇּל שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם, כְּדֵי שֶׁיְּהֵא נִישּׁוֹף בְּרַגְלֵי אָדָם וּבְרַגְלֵי בְּהֵמָה, שֶׁעַל מְנָת כֵּן הִנְחִיל יְהוֹשֻׁעַ לְיִשְׂרָאֵל אֶת הָאָרֶץ.
human_translation: Let us say that the mishna is not in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda? As it is taught Rabbi Yehuda says: When it is time manure taken out, a person take his manure out into the public domain and pile it all thirty days, so that it will be trodden on by the feet of people and by the feet of animals, since on this condition Joshua bequeathed Eretz to the Jewish people.
llm_translation: Gemara: Let us say a Mishnah that is not like Rabbi Yehudah. As it was taught: Rabbi Yehudah says: At the time of removing dung, a person should take out his dung to a public domain and gather it for thirty days, so that it will be trampled by the feet of people and animals, as a result of which Joshua bequeathed the land to the Israelites.

hebrew_text: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא רַבִּי יְהוּדָה, מוֹדֶה רַבִּי יְהוּדָה שֶׁאִם הִזִּיק – חַיָּיב לְשַׁלֵּם. וְהָתְנַן: מוֹדֶה רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בְּנֵר חֲנוּכָּה שֶׁהוּא פָּטוּר, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהוּא עוֹשֶׂה בִּרְשׁוּת. מַאי לָאו: רְשׁוּת דְּבֵית דִּין? לָא, רְשׁוּת דְּמִצְוָה.
human_translation: You even say Rabbi Yehuda, Rabbi Yehuda concedes that if caused damage, liable to pay. But didn’t we learn Rabbi Yehuda concedes with regard to a Hanukkah lamp that he is exempt, because he acts with permission? What, is not permission of the court No, permission of a mitzva.
llm_translation: Even if you say it is Rabbi Yehuda, Rabbi Yehuda admits that if he caused damage - he is obligated to pay. And we learned in a Mishnah: Rabbi Yehuda admits regarding the Hanukkah lamp that one is exempt, because he is doing it with permission. What is the reason? Is it not permission of the court? No, it is permission of a mitzvah.

hebrew_text: וְהָתַנְיָא: כׇּל אֵלּוּ שֶׁאָמְרוּ מוּתָּרִין לְקַלְקֵל בִּרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים, אִם הִזִּיק – חַיָּיב לְשַׁלֵּם, וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה פּוֹטֵר. אֶלָּא מְחַוַּורְתָּא מַתְנִיתִין דְּלָא כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה.
human_translation: But isn’t it taught all these which said it is permitted to place obstacles in the public domain, if they caused damage, are liable to pay, and Rabbi Yehuda exempts Rather, it is clear the mishna is not in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And it was taught: All those who said are permitted to damage in a public domain, if he caused damage - he is liable to pay, and Rabbi Yehuda exempts. Rather, Mechavvarta Mishna that is not like Rabbi Yehuda.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה, וְרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל, וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן – כּוּלְּהוּ סְבִירָא לְהוּ: כׇּל מָקוֹם שֶׁנָּתְנוּ לוֹ חֲכָמִים רְשׁוּת וְהִזִּיק – פָּטוּר. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה – הָא דַּאֲמַרַן. רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל, דִּתְנַן: רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: אַף מְתַקֵּן הוּא אֶת מְלַאכְתּוֹ לִפְנֵי שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם.
human_translation: Abaye said: Rabbi Yehuda and Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel and Rabbi Shimon all hold wherever the Sages gave permission and he causes damage, exempt Rabbi Yehuda that which we said. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel as we learned Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: even prepare his work thirty days beforehand.
llm_translation: Abaye said: Rabbi Yehudah, and Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, and Rabbi Shimon - all of them hold the opinion: in any place where the sages granted permission and it caused damage - he is exempt. Rabbi Yehudah - this is what we said. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, as we learned: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: He may even repair his work within thirty days.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, דִּתְנַן: הָיָה מַעֲמִידוֹ בַּעֲלִיָּיה – צָרִיךְ שֶׁיְּהֵא תַּחְתָּיו מַעֲזִיבָה שְׁלֹשָׁה טְפָחִים, וּבַכִּירָה – טֶפַח. וְאִם הִזִּיק – מְשַׁלֵּם מַה שֶּׁהִזִּיק. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: לֹא אָמְרוּ כׇּל הַשִּׁעוּרִים הַלָּלוּ אֶלָּא שֶׁאִם הִזִּיק פָּטוּר מִלְּשַׁלֵּם.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon as we learned one was setting up in the upper story, there must be a plaster floor beneath it, three handbreadths And of a stove handbreadth And if causes damage he pays which he damaged. Rabbi Shimon says: said all of these measurements only that if he causes damage he is exempt from paying,
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon, as we learned: If one establishes it in a private domain - it is necessary that there be beneath it an abandonment of three handbreadths, and in a courtyard - a handbreadth. And if it caused damage - he pays for the damage he caused. Rabbi Shimon says: They only stated these measurements to teach that if it caused damage, one is exempt from paying.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הַחַצָּב שֶׁמָּסַר לַסַּתָּת – הַסַּתָּת חַיָּיב. הַסַּתָּת שֶׁמָּסַר לַחַמָּר – הַחַמָּר חַיָּיב. הַחַמָּר שֶׁמָּסַר לַכַּתָּף – הַכַּתָּף חַיָּיב. הַכַּתָּף שֶׁמָּסַר לַבַּנַּאי – הַבַּנַּאי חַיָּיב. הַבַּנַּאי שֶׁמָּסַר לָאַדְרִיכָל – אַדְרִיכָל חַיָּיב. וְאִם הִנִּיחַ אֶבֶן עַל הַדִּימוֹס וְהִזִּיקָה – כּוּלָּן חַיָּיבִין לְשַׁלֵּם.
human_translation: The Sages taught: the stonecutter delivered to the chiseler, the chiseler liable the chiseler delivered to the donkey driver the donkey driver liable. the donkey driver delivered to a porter the porter liable. the porter delivered to the builder, the builder liable. the builder delivered to the master builder [ adrikhal ], the master builder liable. And if he placed a stone upon the row [ dimos ] and caused damage, they are all liable to pay.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: If the hewer handed over to the carrier - the carrier is liable. If the carrier handed over to the donkey - the donkey is liable. If the donkey handed over to the shoulder - the shoulder is liable. If the shoulder handed over to the builder - the builder is liable. If the builder handed over to the contractor - the contractor is liable. And if he placed a stone on the bloodletting cup and it caused damage - all of them are liable to pay.

hebrew_text: וְהָתַנְיָא: אַחֲרוֹן חַיָּיב וְכוּלָּן פְּטוּרִים! לָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן בִּשְׂכִירוּת, כָּאן בְּקַבְּלָנוּת.
human_translation: But isn’t it taught last one, liable, and all of them are exempt? not difficult, here, with regard to hiring, there, with regard to contracting,
llm_translation: The Talmudic text translates as follows: "And it was taught: The last one is liable, and all the others are exempt! It is not difficult: here in renting, here in receiving."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ שְׁתֵּי גַּנּוֹת זוֹ עַל גַּב זוֹ, וְהַיָּרָק בֵּינְתַיִם. רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: שֶׁל עֶלְיוֹן. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: שֶׁל תַּחְתּוֹן. אָמַר רַבִּי מֵאִיר: אִם יִרְצֶה הָעֶלְיוֹן לִיקַּח אֶת עֲפָרוֹ, אֵין כָּאן יָרָק. אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: אִם יִרְצֶה הַתַּחְתּוֹן לְמַלֹּאות אֶת גִּנָּתוֹ, אֵין כָּאן יָרָק.
human_translation: two gardens one above the other, and vegetables in-between, Rabbi Meir says: to upper Rabbi Yehuda says: to lower Rabbi Meir said If the upper want to take his dirt no vegetables here, Rabbi Yehuda said: If the lower want to fill his garden no vegetables here,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: "Two gardens, one above the other, with the vegetable patch in between. Rabbi Meir says: the upper one. Rabbi Yehuda says: the lower one." Rabbi Meir said: "If the owner of the upper garden wishes to take his soil, there is no vegetable patch here." Rabbi Yehuda said: "If the owner of the lower garden wishes to fill his garden, there is no vegetable patch here."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי מֵאִיר: מֵאַחַר שֶׁשְּׁנֵיהֶן יְכוֹלִין לְמַחוֹת זֶה עַל זֶה, רוֹאִין מֵהֵיכָן יָרָק זֶה חַי. אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן: כׇּל שֶׁהָעֶלְיוֹן יָכוֹל לִפְשׁוֹט אֶת יָדוֹ וְלִיטּוֹל – הֲרֵי הוּא שֶׁלּוֹ, וְהַשְּׁאָר שֶׁל תַּחְתּוֹן.
human_translation: Rabbi Meir said: Since the two of them can object to each other, considers from where this vegetable lives Rabbi Shimon said: Any that the upper can stretch out his hand and take, those are his, and the rest to lower
llm_translation: Rabbi Meir said: After both of them are able to strike one another, they see from where this green herb is alive. Rabbi Shimon said: Whoever is able to extend his hand and take, it belongs to him, and the rest belongs to the one below.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רָבָא: בְּעִיקָּרוֹ, כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְּלִיגִי דְּעֶלְיוֹן הָוֵי. כִּי פְּלִיגִי בְּנוֹפוֹ. רַבִּי מֵאִיר סָבַר: שְׁדִי נוֹפוֹ בָּתַר עִיקָּרוֹ. וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה סָבַר: לָא אָמְרִינַן שְׁדִי נוֹפוֹ בָּתַר עִיקָּרוֹ.
human_translation: Rava says: With regard to the root everyone agrees it is of upper When they disagree, with regard to its leaves, Rabbi Meir holds: Cast its leaves after its root, And Rabbi Yehuda holds: We do not say: Cast its leaves after its root.
llm_translation: Gemara said Rava: In its essence, everyone agrees that the upper one is. When do they disagree? In its branch. Rabbi Meir holds: First is the branch, and Rabbi Yehuda holds: We do not say first is the branch.

hebrew_text: וְאַזְדָּא לְטַעְמַיְיהוּ, דְּתַנְיָא: הַיּוֹצֵא מִן הַגֶּזַע וּמִן הַשׇּׁרָשִׁין – הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ שֶׁל בַּעַל הַקַּרְקַע, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: מִן הַגֶּזַע – שֶׁל בַּעַל הָאִילָן, וּמִן הַשׇּׁרָשִׁין – שֶׁל בַּעַל הַקַּרְקַע.
human_translation: And they follow their reasoning, as it is taught That which sprouts from the trunk and from the roots, these to the owner of the land. the statement of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda says: from the trunk to the owner of the tree, and from the roots to the owner of the land.
llm_translation: And it was established according to their reasoning, as it was taught: "One who removes from the trunk and from the roots - these belong to the owner of the land," the words of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda says: "From the trunk - belonging to the owner of the tree, and from the roots - belonging to the owner of the land."

hebrew_text: וּתְנַן נָמֵי גַּבֵּי עָרְלָה כִּי הַאי גַוְונָא: אִילָן הַיּוֹצֵא מִן הַגֶּזַע וּמִן הַשָּׁרָשִׁין – חַיָּיב בְּעָרְלָה, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: מִן הַגֶּזַע – פָּטוּר, מִן הַשָּׁרָשִׁין – חַיָּיב.
human_translation: And we also learned a case like this with regard to the fruit of a tree during the first three years after its planting [ orla ]: a tree that sprouts from the trunk and from the roots obligated in orla , the statement of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda says: from the trunk, exempt, from the roots, obligated.
llm_translation: We learned in a Mishnah regarding the case of the foreskin, for this is the scenario: a tree that emerges from the trunk and from the roots - it is obligated in foreskin, the words of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda says: from the trunk - exempt, from the roots - obligated.

hebrew_text: וּצְרִיכִי, דְּאִי אַשְׁמוֹעִינַן קַמַּיְיתָא: בְּהָא קָאָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה מִשּׁוּם דְּמָמוֹנָא, אֲבָל גַּבֵּי עָרְלָה דְּאִיסּוּרָא – אֵימָא מוֹדֵי לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי מֵאִיר. וְאִי אִיתְּמַר בְּהָא: בְּהָא קָאָמַר רַבִּי מֵאִיר, אֲבָל בְּהַהִיא – אֵימָא מוֹדֵי לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, צְרִיכִי.
human_translation: And are necessary As had taught us first with regard to this Rabbi Yehuda said due to that monetary matters, but with regard to orla , which is a prohibition, say he concedes to Rabbi Meir. And if it was stated with regard to this with regard to this Rabbi Meir said but with regard to that say he concedes to Rabbi Yehuda. necessary
llm_translation: And it is necessary, for if we were to hear a contradiction: in this case Rabbi Yehuda said in the name of Mamona, but regarding the prohibition of orlah - say that Rabbi Meir agrees with him. And if it was stated in this case: in this case Rabbi Meir said, but in that case - say that Rabbi Yehuda agrees with him, it is necessary.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן: כֹּל שֶׁהָעֶלְיוֹן יָכוֹל לִפְשׁוֹט [וְכוּ׳]. אָמְרִי דְּבֵי רַבִּי יַנַּאי: וּבִלְבַד שֶׁלֹּא יֵאָנֵס.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon said: Any that the upper can stretch out the school of Rabbi Yannai they say: And provided that he does not force
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon said: Anyone that the Supreme One can enable to interpret etc.. The school of Rabbi Yannai said: But only if he does not become forgetful.

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי רַב עָנָן, וְאִיתֵּימָא רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה: מַגִּיעַ לְנוֹפוֹ וְאֵין מַגִּיעַ לְעִיקָּרוֹ, מַגִּיעַ לְעִיקָּרוֹ וְאֵין מַגִּיעַ לְנוֹפוֹ, מַאי? תֵּיקוּ.
human_translation: Rav Anan, and some say Rabbi Yirmeya, raised a dilemma: reach its leaves, but cannot reach its roots, reach its roots but cannot reach its leaves, what shall stand
llm_translation: Inquires Rav Anan, and it was stated: Rabbi Yirmeya: If it reaches its tip but does not reach its base, if it reaches its base but does not reach its tip, what is the ruling? This matter shall remain unresolved.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אֶפְרַיִם סָפְרָא תַּלְמִידוֹ שֶׁל רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ מִשּׁוּם רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן. אַמְרוּהָ קַמֵּיהּ דְּשַׁבּוּר מַלְכָּא, אֲמַר לְהוּ: אָפְרִין נִמְטְיֵיהּ לְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן.
human_translation: Efrayim the scribe, a student of Reish Lakish, says in the name of Reish Lakish: halakha in accordance with Rabbi Shimon. They stated before King Shapur, he said to them: Let us offer praise [ apiryon ] to Rabbi Shimon.
llm_translation: Ephraim said, the scribe, disciple of Reish Lakish, in the name of Reish Lakish: The halakha is according to Rabbi Shimon. They said it before King Shapur, he said to them: Ephraim has handed it over to Rabbi Shimon.

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ הַבַּיִת וְהָעֲלִיָּיה וּסְלִיקָא לַהּ מַסֶּכֶת בָּבָא מְצִיעָא
llm_translation: We will return to you, the house and the upper room, and we will ascend with her to the tractate of Bava Metzia.
